newe 〈◊〉 conteyned tytle therof ¶ 〈…〉 token haue set byble first often tymes ye shall fynde romayne letter texte sygaifieth moche romayne letter doth abounde comon translacyon latyn founde eyther hebrue greke whiche wordes sentence haue added onely manifest vnto also satisfye content tyme hath myssed soche sentence bybles newe testamentes set ouer ye fynde sygne • betekeneth diucrsyte difference readyng bytwene hebrues chaldee place diuersites readyng purposed haue set forth particulerly vnto moche long tedious volume great houge alredye haue therfore tyme lefte trustynge hereafter set forth lytell volume selues haue also ye maye se added many handes mergent volume also texte vpon whiche purposed haue made ende byble table selues certayne godly annotacions moche yet hath bene sufficient tyme ministred kynges honourable counsell ouersyght correccyon sayde annotacyons wyll therfore omyt tyll theyr connentente leasure doyng nomore beseke gentle reader whē thou comest soche place hande doth stande byble thou canst attayne meanynge true knowledge sentence rashly presume make priu • te interpretacion therof submyt thy selfe iudgement godly learned christ iesus whiche christ iesu honour prayse euer amen ¶ fyrste booke moses called hebrue bereschith latyn genesis ¶ creacyon worlde ¶ worde thynges create god man creacion rule sustenaunce capitvlo begynnynge psal cii • ere x b eccl 18 • esd vi c • eb c xi god created heuen earth earth voyde▪ emptye darkenesse vpon face depe spiryte god moued vpon face water god sayde let made lyght lyght made god saw lyght good god made diuision bytwene lyght darkenesse god called lyght daye darkenesse called nyght euenynge mornyng made one daye god sayd let firmament myddes water let make diuision bytwene water water god made firmament set diuisyon bytwene water whiche vnder firmament bytwene water aboue firmament done god called firmament heuen euenyng also mornyng made second day god sayd • rouer 8 • ob xxvi c let water vnder heuen gathered togyther one place drye lande maye sene came passe god called drye lande earth gatherynge togyther water called see god saw good god sayd let earth brynge forth grene herbe may engendre seede fruytful tree yeldyng fruyte kynd whose seede may itselfe vpon earth done earth brought forth grene herbe makynge seede kynde tree yeldyng fruyte whose seede selfe kynd god sawe good euenyng also mornyng made thyrde day god sayd psal 136 4 eid 6 let made lyghtes firmament heuen let make dyfference bytwene day night let sygnes appoynted season dayes yeres let lyghtes firmament heuen maye gyue lyght vpon earth done god made iere xxxi • two great lyghtes greater lyght rule day lesse lyght rule nyght made sterres also god set firmament heuen myght gyue lyght vpon earth▪ myght rule daye nyght make difference bytwene lyght darkenesse god sawe good euenynge also mornynge made fourth daye god sayde 4 esd 6 let water brynge forth mouynge creature hath lyfe foule maye flee vpō earth face firmament heuen god created great whale euery lyuynge mouyng creature water brought forth theyr kynde euery fethered foule theyr kynde god sawe good god blessed sayeng▪ growe increase fyll water see let fethered foules multiplyed earth euenyng also mornynge made fyfth day god sayd let earth brynge forth liuynge creature kynde catell worme beaste earth kynde came passe god made beast earthe kynde catel theyr kynde euery thynge crepeth vpon earth kynde god sawe good god sayde let v make man ymage lykenes let haue rule ouer fysshe see ouer foule ayre ouer catell ouer earth ouer al thyng crepeth vpon earth god created man owne ymage ymage god created hym male female created god blessed god sayde vnto growe increace replenysshe earth subdue haue dominyon ouer fysshe see ouer foule ayre ouer euery liuynge thyng moueth vpon earth god sayde beholde haue gyuen euery herbe bearyng seede vpper face al earth euery tree whiche fruyte tree beareth seed may meat vnto euery beast earth euery byrde ayre euery suche thynge crepeth vpō earth wherin lyuyng soule haue gyuen grenesse herbe meate done sapi u eccle 17 mat xix mar x sapi ix psal 18 b god saweeccl 39 • mar vii • timo 4 euery thyng made beholde excedynge good euenynge also mornynge made syxte daye▪ ¶ halowyng sabboth chapitre afore repeted foure cloudes paradise settynge paradise tree knowledge forbydden creacion eua institution mariage capi ii heuen also earth finysshed hoost seuenth daye god ended worke made exodi xx b • bre iii • • seuenth day rested worke whiche made god blessed seuenth day sayntified bycause rested worke whiche god created make generacions henens earth created daye lorde god made earth heuens euery plant felde earth euery herbe feld grew lorde god caused rayne vpō earth neyther man tyll ground went vp myst exth watred hoole face grounde lorde god also shope man euen dust grounde brethed nosethyrls breth lyfe adam made lyuyng soule moreouer lorde god planted garden eden east put man whome made also grounde made lorde god growe euery tree pleasaunt syght cōmodious meate proue 3 c reue ii b tree lyfe tree knowledge good euyl myddes garden eden went forth ryuer water garden thence deuyded became foure heades name one eccl 24 c pison cōpasseth hole lande hauilah golde golde lande good also bidelliū stoone onichinus name seconde ryuer gihon cōpasseth hole lande ethiopis name thyrde ryuer hydekel goeth towarde east syde assyria fourth ryuer euphrates lord god toke adam put hym garden eden myght dresse kepe lorde god cōmaunded adam sayenge eatynge thou shalte eate euery tree garden tree knowledge good euyl thou shalt eate day soeuer thou eatest therof thou shalte dye death agayne lorde god sayde good adam shulde alone wyll make hym helpe whiche maye present hym grounde shope lorde god euery beast felde euery foule ayre brought vnto man myght se wold call lykewyse man selfe named euery lyuynge thynge euen name therof man hym selfe therfore named name vnto catell foule ayre euery beast felde man founde helpe myght present hym lorde god also caused slomber fall vpon adam slepte toke one rybbes closed vp fleshe steade therof ryb lorde god taken man eccl xvii cor xi • made woman brought vnto man man sayde nowe boone bone flesshe flesshe shall called woman bycause taken man cause shall man leaue father mother shall ioyned wyfe mat xix • mark x • ephe v g cor vi • shall become one flesshe bothe naked man say wyfe ashamed ¶ serpent deceyueth woman serpent cursed punishment man woman adam driuen paradise chryste sauyour promysed capi iii serpent sotyller beastes felde whiche lorde god made sayde vnto woman yea hath god sayde ye shall eate euery tree garden woman sayde vnto serpent eate fruyte tree garden fruyt tree myddes garden god hath sayd ye shal eate ney ther shall ye touche leest haply ye dye ii cor xi 〈◊〉 serpent sayde vnto woman ye shal dye death god doth knowe daye ye eate therof youre eye shall opened ye shall euen goddes knowynge good euyll eccle 25 • woman seynge tree good eate delectable eye tree pleasant get wysdome toke fruyte therof dyd eate gaue vnto husband beyng whiche dyd eate also eye bothe opened knewe naked sowed fygge leaues gyther made selues apron herde voyce lorde god walkynge garden coole daye adam wyfe hyd selues face lorde god among tree garden lorde god called adam sayd vnto hym arte thou whiche sayd herde thy voyce garden afrayde bycause naked hyd selfe sayde tolde thou wast naked hast thou eaten tree whiche commaūded thou shuldest eate adam sayde woman whome thou gauest gaue tree dyd eate lorde god sayd womā hast thou done woman sayd yonder serpent begyled dyd eate lorde god sayd vnto serpent bycause thou hast done thou arte cursed aboue al cattel aboue euery beast felde upon thy belly shalte thou goo dust shalt thou eate dayes thy lyfe wyll also put enmytye bytwene woman bytwene thy seed seede collo ii c shall treade downe thy heade thou shalte treade vpon hele vnto womā sayd multiplyeng wyl multiplie thy sorowe thy conceyuyng sorowe shalte thou brynge forth chyldren thy lust shal perteyne thy husbande shall haue rule unto adam sayde bycause thou hast herkened vnto voyce thy wyfe haste eaten tree cōmaunded sayenge thou shalte eate cursed ground thy sake sorow shalt thou eate dayes thy lyfe thorne also thystle shall cause growe vnto thou shalt eate herbe felde sweate thy face shalte thou eate breade tyll thou turned agayne grounde thou taken moche thou iob 34 arte dust dust shalte thou turned agayne adam called wyues name eua bycause mother lyuyng unto adam also wyfe dyd lorde god make letherne garmentes clothed lorde god sayd beholde yonder man hath ben euen one v myght knowe good euyll nowe lest haply put forth hande take also tree lyfe eate lyue euer lorde god sent hym forth garden eden dresse ground taken droue man east syde garden eden set cherub glysterynge flambe shakyng swerde kepe way tree lyfe ❧ ❀ ❧ ¶ coin hylleth ryghtious brother abel cain dispayreth generation enoch mathusaell tuhall lamrech seth enos capi iiii adam knewe eua wyfe conceyuynge bare cain sayenge haue gotten man lorde procedynge forth brought forth brother abel abell shepherde cain tyller grounde processe dayes came passe cain brought fruyte grounde oblacyon vnto lorde abell also brought fyrstlynges shepe fat therof lorde respecte vnto iob 34 abell oblacyō vnto cain offerynge respect cause cain exceadynge wrothe countenaunce abated lorde sayde vnto cain arte thou wrothe thy countenaunce abated yf thou well shall promocyon yf thou doest well lyeth thy syn dores unto also perteyneth lust therof thou shalt haue dominyō ouer cain spake vnto abell brother let v go forth fortuned sapi x 1 iohū 3 hebre xii • mat • 3 iuo • • felde cain rose vp agaynst abel brother slue hym lorde sayd vnto cain abell thy brother whiche sayde wote brother keper sayd hast thou done voyce thy brother blood cryeth vnto grounde nowe arte thou cursed vpon earth whiche hath opened mouth receyue thy brother bloode thy hande thou tyl grounde shal procede yelde vnto strength fugitiue vagabounde shalte thou earth cain sayde vnto lorde iob xv • iniquite may forgyuen beholde thou hast cast day vpper face earth thy face shall hyd fugitiue also vagabounde shall earth shall come passe euery one fyndeth shal slee lorde sayd vnto hym shall yea euer sleeth cain shall auenged seuen folde lorde set marke vpon cain lest man fyndyng hym shulde kyll hym cain wente face lorde dwelte lande nod eastwarde eden cain also knewe wyfe whiche conceyued bare enoch buyldyng cytie called name cytie name sonne enoch unto enoch borne irad irad begat mehuiaell mehuiaell begat methuschael methuschaell begat lamech lamech toke vnto hym two wyues name one ada name zylla ada begat iaball whiche father suche dwell tentes haue catel brother name iuball father handle harpe organe zylla also begat thuball cain whiche wrought connyngly euery crafte brasse yron sister thubal cain naema lamech sayd vnto wyues ada zylla heare voyce ye wyues lamech herken vnto speche yf haue sleyne man woundynge myselfe yonge man myne owne punishment yf cain shall auenged seuenfolde truely lamech seuentye tymes seuen tymes adam knewe wyfe agayne bare sonne called name seth god sayde hath appoynted another seed steade abell whome cain slewe vnto seth also borne sonne called nam▪ enos▪ began make inuocacyon name lorde ¶ genealogy adam father vnto noe capi v boke generacions adam daye god▪created man lykenesse god made hym male female created blessed called theyr name adam daye theyr creacion adam lyued hundred thyrtye yeares begat sonne owne lykenesse ymage called name seth dayes adam begotten para seth eyght hundred yeares begat sonnes doughters al dayes adam lyued nyne ijū dred thyrty yeares dyed seth lyued hundred fyue yeares begat enos seth lyued begat enos eyght hundred yeares seuen yeares begat sonnes doughters dayes seth nyne hundred twelue yeares dyed enos lyued nyntye yeres begat kenan enos lyued begat kenan eyght hundred fyftene yeres begat sonnes doughters dayes enos nyne hundred fyue yeres dyed kenan lyued seuentye yeares begat mahelael kenan lyued begat mahelael eyght hundred yeares fortye yeares begat sonnes doughters dayes kenan nyne hundred yeares ten yeares dyed mahelael lyued syxtye yeares fyue yeres begat iared agayne mahelael lyued begat iared eyght hundred thyrtye yeres begat sonnes doughters dayes mahelael eyght hundred nynetye fyue yeres dyed iared lyued hundred sixtie two yeares begat enoch iared lyued begat enoch eyght hundred yeres begat son called nyme noah sayeng shal cōforte v worke frō sorowe handes earth whiche god cursed lamech lyued begat noah fyue hundred yeres nynety fyue yeres begat sonnes doughters dayes lamech man began multiplyed vpper face earth doughters borne vnto sonnes god also sawe doughters men fayre toke wyues al chosen lorde sayde spiryte shall waye stryue man bycause flesshe dayes shalbe peter fylled crueltye god loked vpon earth beholde corrupt flesshe corrupte way vpon earth god sayde vnto noah ende flesshe come earth fylled crueltye frō face beholde wyl destroye earth make arke pyne tree habitacyons shalte thou make arke shalte pytch within without pytch fassiō shalt thou make length arke shalbe thre hūdred cubites bredth fyftye cubites heyght thirtye cubites wyndowe shalte breth lyfe vnder heuen euery thing erth shal dye also wyll make gene ix b • vii couenaūt thou shalt come arke thou thy sonnes thy wyfe thy •• e wyues wt euery lyuynge thyng flesshe payre euery one shalt yu brynge arke kepe alyue shalbe male female fethred foules also theyr kynde catel ther kynde euery worme erth kynd two euery one shall come vnto thou mayst kepe alyue take thou meate eaten thou shalte laye vp maye meate noah therfore dyd accordynge vnto god cōmmaunded hym euen dyd ¶ entraunce noe hym arke rysinge floude wherthrow althynges dyd perysshe capi vii lorde sayd vnto noah come thou thy house arke haue sene ii peter ii • ryghteous generacyon euery leui xi cleane beast thou shalte take seuen seuen male female vnclene catel two male female foules also ayre seuen seuen male female kepe seed alyue vpō face al hoole earth yet seuen dayes wyl rayne vpon earth fortye dayes fortye nyghtes al substaūce haue made wyll destroye vpper face earth noah therfore dyd accordyng vnto god cōmaunded hym noah sixe hundred yeares mat▪ 24 • luke xvii • froude water vpon erth noah came sonnes wyfe sonnes wyues hym vnto arke bicause water floude cleane catell vncleane catell flyeng foules euery suche crepeth vpon earth came two two vnto noah arke male female god commaunded noah fortuned also seuen dayes water floud vpon earth sixe hundred yeare no lyfe second moneth seuenth daye moneth day foūtaynes great depe broken vp wyndowes heuen opened rayne vpon earth fortye dayes fortye nyghtes selfe day entred noah sem ham iapheth sonnes noah noah wyfe thre wyues sonnes wt arke euery beast kynde catell theyr kynde yea euery worme crepeth vpon earth kynde euery byrde kynde euery flienge fethred foule came vnto noah arke two two al flesshe wherin breth lyfe entrynge came male female flesshe god cōmaūded hym lorde shut hym rounde aboute sapi x • floude came fortye dayes vpon earth water increaced bare vp arke whiche lyfte vp aboue earth water also preuayled increased excedyngly vpō erth arke floted vpper face water water preuayled excedyngly 〈2 page missing〉 tongue countrees theyr nacions unto sem also father chyldrem eber elder brother iayheth chyldren borne chyldren sem elam assur arphachsad lud aram chyldren aram hus hull gether masi para arphachsad begat selah selah begat eber unto eber also borne two sonnes name one peleg dayes earth deuyded brother name iaketan iaketan begat almodad saleph hazermaueth ierah hodoran uzall dickla obal also abimael scheba ophir hauila iobab chyldren iaketan theyr dwellynge mesa thou goest vnto sephar mounteyne east chyldrē sem theyr kynreds tongue theyr landes nacions kynreddes chyldrē noah theyr generacions theyr people nacyons deuided earth floude ¶ buyldynge babell confusyon tongue generacion sem son noe vntyl abram goeth lot vnto haran capi xi al hole earth one language lyke speche heppened went forth frō east found playne lande sinhar abode sayde euery one • neyghbour come let v prepare bryck burne fyre brycke stone slyme stead morter sayd go let v buylde v citie towet whose toppe maye reache vnto heuen let v make v name leest haply scatred abrode vpper face hoole earth lorde came downe se citye tower whiche chyldren men buylded lorde sayde beholde people one haue al one lauguage gyn neyther wyll restrayned whatsoeuer haue ymagyned come let v go downe confounde theyr language euery one perceyue neyghbours speche lorde scatred frō place vpper face earth lefte buyld citye therfore name called geneti x b confusyon babel bycause lorde dyd confounde language earth thence dyd lorde scater abrode vpon face earth generacions sem sem hūdred yere old begat arphachsad two yeare floude sem lyued begat arphachsad fyue hundred yeares begat sonnes doughters arphachsad lyued fyue thyrtye yeres begat selah arphachsad lyued begat selah foure hundred thre yeares begat sonnes doughters selah lyued thyrtye yeares begat eber selah lyued begat eber foure hundred thre yeares gat sonnes doughters eber lyued foure thyrtye yeares begat peleg eber lyued begat peleg foure hundred thyrtye yeres begat sonnes doughters peleg lyued thyrtye yeares begat reu peleg lyued begat reu two hundred nyne yeres begat sonnes doughters reu lyued two thirtye yeares begat serug reu lyued begat serug two hundred seuen yeares begat sonnes doughters serug lyued thyrtye yeares begat nahor serug lyued wyfe sarai name nahors wyfe milca doughter haran father milca father iisea hebre x •• sarai baren chylde terah toke abram iosue 24 • ii esd ix b sonne lot sonne haran sonnes son sara doughter lawe son abrams wyfe departed togyther ur caldees myght go lande chanaan came vnto charan dwelte dayes terah two hundred fyue yeares terah dyed charan ¶ abram blessed god goeth lot vnto lunbe canaan whiche god promysed gyue vnto hym seede abram goeth egypt causeth sarai wyfe call selfe syster pharao plaged capi xii lorde sayd vnto abram • de vii hebru xi c get thy countrey thy nacyon frome thy father house▪ vnto laude wyll shewe wyll make great people wyll gene 18 r xxii r actes iii blesse make thy name great thou mayste blessynge wyll also blesse blesse curse suche curseth shall kynreddes earth blessed abram departed euen lorde spake vnto hym lot wente hym abram seuentye fyue yeres olde departed charan abram toke sarai wyfe lot brother sonne theyr gene • ii xiiii c substaunce possessyon soules begotten charan departed myght come lande canaan lande canaan came abram passed thorowe lande vnto place sichem vnto playn moreh cananite lande lorde appearyng vnto abram sayd unto thy gene xiii xv xvii v deut 34 v seed wyll gyue land buylded aulter vnto lorde euen appered vnto hym remouyng thence vnto mountayne eastwarde beehel pytched tente hauynge bethell west syde hal east buyldynge aulter vnto lorde dyd call name lorde abram wente forth goyng departynge towarde south derth lande therfore wente abram downe egypte myght soiourne fore derthe lande happened come nere entre egypt sayde vnto sarai wyfe beholde knowe thou arte fayre woman loke vpon therfore shall come passe egyptyans se shall saye wyfe shall kyll shall saue alyue saye pray giue xx thou arte syster may fare well thy sake soule may lyue thorowe thyne occasyon happened abram come egypte egyptian behelde womā fayre prynces also pharao sawe commended pharao womā taken pharaos house entreated abrā well sake shepe ox ass men seruauntes mayde seruaū te ass camel lorde smote pharao house great plage bycause sarai abrams wyfe pharao callyng abram sayde hast thou done vnto dyddest thou tell thy wyfe saydest thou syster toke wyfe nowe therfore beholde thy wyfe take goo thy waye pharao gaue men commaundement concernynge hym conuayed hym forthe wyfe ¶ abram lot departe egypte abram deuydeth land castell lot brother sonne agayne promysed vnto •• lande canaan capi xiii abrā gat hym vp egipte wyfe gene xii • lot hym towarde south abram ryche cattell syluer golde wente forthe iourney southe towarde bethell vnto place tente ben begynnyng bytwene bethel hat euen vnto place gene xii c aulter whiche made fyrst abram called name lorde lot also whiche wente abram shepe cattell tentes lande able receyue myghte dwell togyther gene 36 substaunce theyr ryches great coulde dwell togyther fell stryfe bytwene heerdmen abrams cattel heerdmen lot cattell moreouer gene xii • cananites pheresytes dwelled tyme lande sayde abram vnto lot let stryfe praye bytwene eccle 25 • bytwene heerdmen thyne brother al hiere xi hole lande departe pray fro thou wylte take lefte hande wyll go ryght yf thou departe right hande wyll go lefte lot lyftynge vp eye behelde countrey iordane whiche plenteous countrey water euery lorde destroyed sodome gomorra euen garden lorde lyke lande egypte thou comest vnto zoar lot chose playne countrey iordane toke iourney east departed one brother abrā dwelled lande canaan lot abode cyties playne tented vntyll sodome eze x • • men sodome wycked excedynge synners lorde lorde sayde vnto abram lot departed hym lyfte vp thyne eye nowe loke place thou arte northwarde soutwarde eastwarde westwarde al gene xii b 17 b • 26 actes vii lande thou seest wyll gyue vnto thy seed euer wyll make thy seede dust earth yf man nombre dust earth thy feed also shall nombred aryse walke aboute lande length bredth therof wyll gyue vnto abram remouynge tent came dwelled valeyes mamre namely ebron buylded aulter lorde ¶ lot taken prysoner victory abram sodomities lot delyurred abram melchisedech offereth gyf te vnto abram abram payeth tythes melchisedech capi xiiii chaunsed dayes amraphaell kyng synhar aryoch kyng ellasar kedorlaomor kyng elam thydeall kynge nacyons made war wt bera kynge sodome birsa kyng gomorra sineab kyng adama semeabar kyng zeboim kyng bela zoar ioyned togyther vale siddim salte see twelue yere subiecte kynge kedorlaomor xiii yere rebelled xiiii yere came kedorlaomor kynges hym smote gyauntes astaroth karnaim susyms ham emyms playne kariathim horyms moun taynes seir vnto playne pharam whiche bordreth vpon wyldernesse returnynge came en mispat kades smote countrey amalechytes also amorites dwelt hazezon thamar wente kynge sodome kyng gomorra kyng adama kynge zeboiim kynge bala whiche zoar warred vale syddym saye kedorlaomor kynge elam thydeall kynge nacions amraphaell kynge synhar arioch kynge ellasar foure kynges agaynst fyue vale syddym full slyme pyttes kynge sodome gomorra fled fell remayned fled mountayne takyng goodes sodome gomorra theyr vytayles wente theyr waye caryed awaye lot also abrams brother sonne good dwelled sodome departed came one escaped tolde abram hebrewe whiche dwelled valeyes gene x •• mamre amoryte brother escholl brother aner confederate abram abram herde brother taken harnessed fresshe yonge men borne owne house thre hundred eyghtene folowed vntyll dan set aray vpon nyght seruauntes smote pursued vnto hoba whiche lyeth lefte hande damascos recouered goodes also brought agayne brother lot goodes woman also people returned agayne slaughter kedorlaomor kynges hym came kynge sodome forth mete hym playne valcy whiche kynges dale hebr▪ v ••• ▪ melchisedech kynge salem brought forthe breade wyne preest hyghest god blessed hym sayde blessed abram vnto hyghe god possessoure heuen earth blessed hyghe god whiche hath delyuered thyne enemyes thy hand gaue hym tythes kyng sodome sayd vnto abram gyue soules take goodes thy selfe abram answered kynge sodome haue lyfte vp hande vnto lorde hyghe god possessoure heuen earth wyll take thyne moche threde shoo latchet leest thou shuldest say haue made abram ryche saue onely whiche yonge men haue eaten partes men whiche wente aner eschol mamre whiche shall take theyr partes ¶ abram promysed isaac agayne lande lanaā •• pro •• ysed fayth abram bondage delyueraunce chyldren israell capi xv thynges done word lorde came vnto abram visyon sayenge feare abram thy defence thy rewarde shall excedynge great abram sayde lorde god wylte thou gyue goo chyldlesse chylde stewadshyp house eleazer damasco abraham sayd se hast thou gyuen seed lo lad borne house myne heyre beholde worde lorde came vnto hym sayeng shall thyne heyre one shall come oute thyne owne body shal thyne heyre brought hym sayde loke vp vnto heuen tel iere 33 rom 4 sterres yf thou able nombre hesayd vnto hym rom 4 • euen shall thy seed abraham iacob ii gala iii byleued lorde counted hym ryghteousnesse agayne sayde vnto hym lorde brought ur caldees giue land thou myghtest possesse sayde lorde god wherby shall knowe shal possesse answered hym take heyfer thre yere olde goote thre yere olde thre yere olde ram turtyll doue also yong pygeon toke therfore vnto hym deuyded myddes layde euery pece one agaynst foules deuyded byrdes fell carkases abram droue away son downe fell slombre vpon abrā lo darke great feare fell vpon hym sayde vnto abram knowe suertye thy actes vii seed shal straunger lande perteyneth vnto shall serue shal entreate euyll erodi xii f iudith v b gala iii foure hundred yeres yet stā dyng nacyon shall serue wyl iudge afterwarde shall come great substance thou shalte go vnto thy father peace shalte buryed good olde age fourth genus cyon shal returne hyther agayne wyckednesse amorites yet full came passe sonne wente downe darke cloude beholde smokynge furnace fyre brande goynge bytwene sayde peces daye lorde made couenaunt abram sayengegene 24 unto thy seed haue gyuen lande ryuer egypte euen vnto great ryuer ryuer euphrates kenytes kenizites cadmonites hethites pherezites gyauntes amorites also canaanite gergesytes iebusytes ¶ agar conceyueth she▪ fletth satai conforted angell beareth ismaell capi xvi sarai abrams wyfe bare hym chyldrē hande mayde egyptian agar name sarai sayde vnto abram beholde lorde hath restrayned bere pray go vnto mayde peraduenture may edified abram obeyed voyce sarai sarai abrams wyfe toke agar mayd egyptian abram dwelled x yere lande canaan gaue husbande abram wyfe whiche gone vnto agar conceyued sawe conceyued maystresse despysed eye sarai sayd vnto abram thou doest wronge▪ haue gyuen mayde thy bosome whiche seynge hath cōceyued despysed eye lorde iudge bytwene abrā sayd sarai beholde thy mayde thy hande pleaseth sarai fared foule fled face angell lorde founde besyde fountayne water wyldernesse euen well way sur sayd agar sarais mayde whence camest thou whyther goest thou sayd fle frō face maystres sarai▪ angel lorde sayd vnto returne thy maystres agayn • submyt thy selfe vnto handes agayne angell lorde sayde vnto encreasyng wyll encreace thy seed shall nombred multitude▪ lordes angel sayd vnto se 〈…〉 arte chylde shalt beare sonne shalte call name ismaell lorde hath herde thy tribulacion also wyll wylde man hande wyll agaynste euery man euery man hande agaynste hym shall dwell presence al brother called name lorde spake vnto thou god lokest sayde haue sene backe partes hym seeth wherfore wel called well hym lyueth seeth bytwene cades bared agar bare abram son abram called sonnes name whiche agar bare vnto hym ismael abram lxxxvi yere olde agar bare hym ismael abram called abraham sarai named sara lande canaan fyfth tyme promysed circumsision isaac promysed abraham prayeth ismael capi xvii abram nynetie yere olde ix lorde appeared abram sayde vnto hym almyghtye god walke gene v gene vi c thou perfyte wyll make bonde bytwene wyll multiplye excedyngly abram fell face god talked hym sayenge beholde testament thou shalt father many eccle 44 c nacyons neyther shall thy name called abrā thy name shall abraham rom iiii c father many nacyons haue made wyll make growe excedyngly wyl make nacions yea kynges shall sprynge moreouer wyll make bonde actes vii b bytwene thy seede theyr generacions euerlastynge testament may god vnto thy seede wyl gyue vnto thy seed • eue xiii land wherin thou art straunger euen al lande canaan euerlastyng possessyon wyll theyr god god sayd agayne vnto abraham thou therfore shalte kepe testament bothe thou thy seed theyr generacyons testament whiche ye shall kepe bytwene thy seed euery manchylde among shalbe circumcised ye shall circumcise flesshe foreskyn shall rom 4 b token bonde bytwene euery man chylde viii dayes gent xxi luke ii leui xii e olde shall circumcised among suche gene 〈…〉 borne home bought money straunger whiche thy seede borne thy house also bought money must nedes circumcised testament shall flesshe euerlastynge bonde vncircumcised man chylde whose flesshe foreskyn circumcised soule shall perysshe people bycause hath broken testament god sayde vnto abraham sarai thy wyfe shalte thou call sarai sara shall name wyll blesse haue gyuen sonne wyl blesse people also yea kynges people shall sprynge abraham fell vpon face laughed sayd herte shall chylde borne vnto hym hundred yere olde shal sara nynetie yere olde bere abrahā sayd vnto god ismael myght lyue thy syght unto god sayde sara thy wyfe shall gene 18 b bere sonne dede thou shalte call name isaac wyll make bonde hym esai 24 b euerlastyng bonde seed hym cōcernyng ismael also haue herde haue blessed hym wyll make hym encreace wyll multiplye hym excedyngly twelue gene 25 b prynces shall begette wyll make great nacyon hym bonde wyll make isaac whiche sara shall bere vnto euen tyme twelue moneth lefte talkyng hym departed vp abrahā abraham toke ismaell sonne suche borne house bought money many menchyldrē amōg men abraham house circumcised flesshe theyr foreskyn euen selfe day god sayd vnto hym abraham also hym selfe nyntie yere olde ix flesshe foreskyn circumcised ismael son xiii yere olde whē circumcised flesshe foreskyn selfe day abraham circumcised ismael son men house borne house bought wt meney straungers circūcised wthim ¶ appeared thre men vnto abraham isaac promised sara laugheth destruction sodomite declared vnto abraham abraham prayeth capi xviii lorde appeared vnto hym playne mamre sat tent dore heate daye lyfte vp eye loked lo thre men stode hym sawe ran mete tent dore fel ground sayde lorde beseche yf haue founde fauoure thy syght go pray thy seruaunt let lytell water fet wasshe feete refresshe selues vnder tree wyl fet iudi xix morsel breade comforte hertes withal shall ye go youre wayes euen therfore ye come seruaunte sayde euen thou hast sayde abraham wente pace tent vnto sara sayde make redy thre peckes fyne meale kneade make cake abraham runnynge vnto beastes set calfe tendre good gaue vnto yonge man hasted make redy toke butter mylke calfe whiche prepared set stode hym selfe vnder tree tobi xii▪ iudi xiii▪ dyd cate sayd vnto hym sara thy wyfe answered beholde tent sayd returnyng wyl come agayne vnto accordynge tyme lyfe lo rom ix b sara thy wyfe shall haue son herde sara tent dore behynde hym abraham sara bothe olde wel stryken age ceased sara maner woman therfore sara laughed within selfe sayeng nowe wared olde shal gyue selfe 〈◊〉 eccl 25 lust lorde olde also god sayd vnto abraham wherfore laughed sara sayenge shall suretye bere chylde olde thyng wonderfull god accordyng tyme 4 iiiii c rom ix b appoynted wyl returne vnto euen accordynge tyme lyfe sara shall haue son sara denyed sayeng laughed afrayde sayd thou laughed thē men rysyng vp loked toward sodom abraham went bryng thē way lorde sayd shal hyde abraham thynge whiche seyng abraham shall eccle xliiii gene 17 great myghty people al nacyons earth shall blessed hym knowe hym wyll cōmaunde chyldren housholde hym kepe way lorde ryght conscience lorde may bryng vpon abraham hath spoken vnto hym lorde sayd ezec xvi c crye sodome gomorra great theyr synne excedyng greuous wyll go downe nowe se whyther haue done al togyther accordyng crye whiche come vnto yf may knowe men departed thence went sodome warde abrahā stode yet lorde abraham drewe nere sayd wylte thou also destroy ryghteous wycked peraduenture l ryghteous within cytie wylte thou destroy spare place sake l ryghteous therin farre thou shuldest sayeng slee ryghteous wycked righteous shulde wycked farre shall iudge worlde accordyng ryght lorde sayd yf fynde sodome l righteous within cytie wyll spare place theyr sake abrahā answering sayd beholde take vpon speake vn lorde gene ii b whiche dust asshes peraduenture shall lacke fyue fyftie ryghteous wylte thou destroy cytie lacke fyue sayd yf fynde xl fyue wyll destroy proceded speake vnto hym agayn saynge peraduenture shalbe fourtye found • answered wyll fourtyes sake sayd agayn let lorde angry speake peraduēture shal thyrtie founde sayde wyll nothyng yf fynde thyrtie sayd agayne se take vpon speake also vnto lorde peraduenture shal twentye founde answered wyl destroy twentyes sake sayde let lorde angrye wyl speake yet one peraduenture shal ten founde answered wyl destroy ten sake lorde went way soone lefte cōmonyng abraham abraham also returned vnto place ¶ lot receyueth angel house fylthy iustes sodomite theyr su • uercyon lot delyuered citie zoar lot wyfe turned pyller salt lot dronkers incest doughters capi xix came ii angel sodome euen lot sat gate sodome lot seyng rose vp mete bowed hym selfe grounde face sayd lordes turne pray seruauntes house tary nyght wasshe feete ye shall ryse vp early go wayes whiche sayde nay wyll byde streetes nyght maner dyd euen gene 23 compell violently turnyng vnto hym entred house 〈…〉 made feast dyd bake swete 〈…〉 dyd luk xxiii c eate went totobi xii rest men cytie euen men sodome compassed house rounde aboute olde yonge people quarter callynge vnto lot sayde vnto hym men whiche came nyght brynge vnto v may knowe lot went dores vnto shut dore hym sayde nay goddes sake brother wyckedly beholde haue two doughters whiche haue knowen man wyll brynge nowe vnto semeth good eye onely vnto men nothynge therfore came vnder shadow rose sayd stande asyde sayd came one soiourne wyl nowe e • od ii b • •• vii iudge wyl nowe deale worse preased sore vpon man euen lot came breake vp dore men put forth theyr hande pulled lot house shut dore men dore house smote blyndnesse sapi xix c 4 reg 6 bothe smal great faynted coulde fynde dore men sayde vnto lot thou haue yet sonne lawe sonnes doughters euer thou hast cytie bryng place wyll destroy place bycause crye great gene 18 • face god lorde hath sent v destroy lot went spake vnto sonnes lawe whiche maryed boughters sayeng stande vp get place lorde wyl ouet throwe cytie semed though mocked vnto sonnes law mornyng arose angell caused lot spede hym sayenge stand vp take thy wyfe thy ii daughter hand lest peraduēture thou peryshe syn cyte prolōged tyme men caught bothe hym wyfe two daughter handes lorde beyng mercyfull vnto hym brought hym forth set hym without cytie fortuned brought sayd saue thy lyfe loke behynde neyther tary thou playn countrey saue thy selfe mountayne leest thou perysshe lot sayd vnto pray lorde beholde thy set •• •• hath founde grace thy syght thou hast magnified thy mercye thou hast shewed vnto sauynge lyfe beholde saued moūtayn leest haply mysfortune fall vpon dye beholde cytie flee vnto euen yonder lytell one oh let saued lytell one soule shall lyue sayd hym se haue receyued thy request concernynge thynge wyl ouerthrow cytie thou hast spoken haste saued nothyng tyll thou come thyther therfore name cytie called zoar son nowe rysen vpon earth lot entred zoer lorde rayned vpon esai xiii iere l f ez • xvi • sodome gomorra▪ brymstone fyre lorde heuen ouerthrew cyties region dwelled cyties grewe vpon earth lotte wyfe loked behynd turned pyller salte abrahā rysyng vp early got hym place stode presence god lokynge towarde sodome gomorra towarde lande countrey loked beholde smoke countrey arose smoke fornace happened god destroyed cyties regiō thought vpon abraham sent lot ii pet •• sapi • amos 4▪ luke 〈◊〉 iudi • • myddes ouerthr • wyng ouerthrew cyties lot dwelled lot departed zoar dwelled moū tayne ii daughter wt hym feared tary zoar dwelled caue ii daughter elder sayd vnto yonger father olde mā earth come vnto v maner al worlde come wyl make father dronken wyne lye wt may saue seed father made theyr father dronken wyne nyght elder daughter wente lay wt father ꝑceyued neyther lay downe whē rose vp morowe happened elder sayde vnto yonger beholde yesternyght laye father let v make hym dronke wyne nyght also come thou lye wt may rayse vp seed father made theyr father dronke wyne nyght also yonger arose lay hym perceyued neyther whē lay downe neyther rose vp thus bothe doughters lot wt chylde theyr father elder bare son called name moab father moabytes vnto daye yonger bare son also called name ben ammy father chyldren ammon vnto daye ¶ abraham went straunger lande gerar • yngeo gerar taketh away wyfe capi xx abraham departed thence toward south coūtre dwelled bytwene cades sur soiourned gerar abraham sayde sara wyfe geue xii xxvi • syster abimalech kyng gerar sent fet sara awaye god came abimalech dreame nyght sayd hym se thou shalt dye woman sake whiche thou haste taken away man wyfe abimalech yet come nye sayde lorde wylte thou sley ryghtwyse people sayd vntome syster yea▪ sayd selfe my▪ brother pure herte innocent handes haue done this▪ god sayde vnto hym dreame wote well thou dyde •• ▪ 〈◊〉 purenesse thy herte kepte also thou shuldest syn agaynst therfore suffred touche nowe therfore delyuer man wyfe agayne prophete shal pray thou mayst lyue yf thou delyuer agayne sure yu shalte dye death bothe thou thou hast kyngdome great synne • thou hast done dedes vnto ought done abimelech sayde vnto abraham sa • pest thou thou hast done thyng abrahā answered sayd surely feare god place shall sl • e wyues sake yet verye dede syster doughter father though doughter mother became wyfe god caused wandre father house sayde vnto kyndnesse shalte thou shewe vnto place come thou say brother toke abimelech shepe ox men seruauntes woman seruauntes gaue vnto abraham delyuered hym sara wyfe agayne abimelech sayde beholde lande lyeth dwell pleaseth best vnto sara sayde se haue gyuen thy brother thousande peces syluer beholde shalbe coueryng thyne eye vnto thus withall reproued abraham prayed vnto god god healed abimelech wyfe maydens bare chyldren lorde closed al matryces house abimelech bycause sara abraham wyfe hebron lande canaan abraham came mourne sara wepe abraham stode vp syght coorse spake sonnes heth sayenge straunger foryner amonge gyue possession burye •• maye bury corse syght chyldren heth answered people land chyldren heth comoned sayeng yf mynde shal bury deed syght heare speake ephron sonne zoar may gyue double caue hath ende felde asmoch money worth shal gyue presence possessyon burye ephrō mesopotamia vnto citye nahor made camel lye downe without citye wels syde water euen aboute tyme woman come drawe water sayde lorde god mayster abraham besech sende good spede day shewe mercy vnto mayster abraham lo stande well water doughters men citye come drawe water nowe damsell whome saye holde downe thy pytcher praye maye drynke yf say also drynke wyl gyue thy camel drynke thou haste ordeyned thy seruant isaac yea therby shall knowe thou hast shewed mercy mayster came passe lefte speakyng beholde rebecca came doughter bethuel sonne mylca wyfe nahor abraham brother pytcher vpon shoulder damsell fayre loke vpon yet mayde vnknowen man went downe well fylled pytcher came vp seruant rennynge vnto sayde let sup lytle water thy pytcher sayde drynke lorde hasted let downe pytcher vpon arme gaue hym drynke gynē hym drynke sayd wyll drawe water thy camel also vntyll haue dronke ynough powred pytcher trough hastely ran agayne vnto wel fet water drewe camel man wondred helde peace wete whether lorde made iourney prosperous fortuned camel lefte drynkynge man toke golden earynge halfe sicle weyght two bracelettes handes ten sicles weyght gold sayd whose doughter arte thou tell pray rowme thy father house v lodge answered hym doughter bathu ell son milca whiche bare vnto nahor sayd moreouer vnto hym haue litter prauonder ynough also rowme lodge man bowed hymselfe worshypped lorde sayde blessed lorde god mayster abrahā ceaseth deale mercyfully truely wt mayster hath brought way maisters brother house damsel ran tolde mother house thynges rebecca brother called laban ran vnto man euen wel soone sene thy earynges bracelettees systers handes herde wordes rebecca syster sayenge thus sayde man vnto went vnto man loo stoode camel wel syde said come thou blessed lorde wherfore stādest thou wtout haue dressed house made rowme camel man came house vnbryd led camel laban brought lytter prauonder camel water washe fete mennꝭ fete hym set meate hym eate▪ sayde wyll eate vntyll haue sayde myne erande sayd say sayd abraham seruaunt god hath blessed mayster measure become great hath gyuen hym shepe ox syluer golde menseruantes mayde seruantes camel ass gene xx •• sara maysters wyfe bare sonne olde vnto hym hath gyuen al hath mayster made swere sayenge thou shalte take wyfe sonne amonge doughters cananytes whose land dwel thou shalte go vnto father house kynred take wyfe vnto sonne sayde vnto mayster peraduenture wyfe wyll folow answered lorde whome walke wyll sende angell prospere thy iourney thou shalte take wyfe sonne kynred father house shalte thou gyltlesse curse thou commest kynred yf gyue one thou shalte gyltlesse curse came daye vnto well sayde lorde god mayster abraham yf thou makest iourney whiche go prosperous beholde stande wel water vyrgyn cōmeth forth drawe water saye gyue praye lytle water thy pytcher drynke saye drynke thou wyll also drawe thy camel wyfe whome lorde hath prepared maysters sonne made ende speakynge myne herte beholde rebecca came forth pitcher sholder went downe vnto well drewe water sayde gyue drynke pray made haste toke downe pitcher sayde drynke wyll gyue thy camel drynke also dranke gaue camel lorde blessed lorde god mayster abraham brought ryght waye take maysters brother doughter vnto sonne nowe also yf ye wyll deale mercyfully truely mayster tell yf tell also maye turne ryght hande lefte wordes worshypped lorde flatte vpon earth seruaunt toke forth iewelles syluer iewelles golde rayment gaue rebecca vn brother mother gaue gyftes dyd eate drynke bothe men hym taryed nyght rose vp thou arte oure syster growe thousande thousandes gene xxii • thy seede possesse gace theyr enemyes rebecca arose damsel sat vp vpō camel went theyr way man seruant toke rebecca went waye isaac vnto seruant man com meth walkynge agaynst v felde seruant sayde mayster therfore toke cloke put seruaunt tolde isaac thynges done isaac brought mother saras tent toke rebecca became wyfe loued isaac receyued conforte mother ¶ abraham toke kethura wyfe abraham dyeth genealogie death ismaell byrth iacob esau esau selleth byrthryght capi xxv abraham proceded toke hym wyfe called kethura bare hym son abrahā begat isaac isaac forty yere olde toke rebecca wyfe doughter bathuell sirian mesopotamia syster laban sirien isaac made intercession vnto lorde wyfe bicause bareyn lorde intreated hym seed al country thy seed shall nacyons earth blessed bycause abraham harkened vn voyce kepte myne ordinaunces cōmaundementes statute lawes isaac dwelled gerar men place asked hym wyfe sayd gene 〈…〉 rebecca wyfe abimelech called isaac sayde suertye thy wyfe saydest thou syster whome isaac answered thought myght peraduenture haue dyed sake abimelech sayde haste thou done vnto v one people myght lyghtly haue lyne thy wyfe shuldest thou haue brought synne vpon v abime lech charged people sayenge toucheth man wyfe shall dye death isaac sowed lande found yeare c busshels lorde blessed man waxed mygh tye went forth grewe tyll excedynge great possessyō shepe ox myghtye housholde therfore philistians enuy hym philistine stopped fylled vp erth welles whiche father seruauntes dygged father abraham tyme abimelech sayd vnto isaac get v thou arte myghtier thē great deale therfore isaac departed thence abode valley g •• ar dwelt isaac returnynge dygged agayne well water whiche dygged dayes abraham father whiche philistyans stopped death abrahā gaue name father gaue isaac seruantes dygged valley founde well lyuynge water heerdmen gerar dyd stryue isaac herdmen sayeng water oures called well conten▪ cyon eseck bycause stroue hym dygged another well stroue also called name enmyt • sitena departed thence digged another wel stxoue therfore called iargen • rehoboth sayeng lorde hath nowe made v rowme maye increase vpon earth went vp thence beer seba lorde appeared vnto hym nyght sayd god abraham thy father feare wyll blesse multiylye thy seed seruaunt abraham sake buylded aulter called vpon name lorde pytched tente isaac seruantes dygged well came abimelech vnto hym gerar ahusath frende phicell cheyf captayn • worke isaac sayde vnto wherfore come ye seynge ye hate haue put awaye whiche answered seynge sawe gene xxi c lorde sayd let othe bytwyxte v euē bytwyxt v let v make bonde thou shuldest v hurte haue touched haue done vnto nothynge good sent awaye peace thou arte nowe blessed lorde made feast dyd cate drynke rose vp tymes mornynge sware one another isaac sent awaye departed hym peace day happened isaac seruauntes came tolde hym wel whiche dygged sayd vnto haue found water called oth seba name citye called beer seba vnto day esau xl yeare olde toke wyfe called iudith doughter bery hethyte basmath doughter elon hethyte also whiche disobedient vnto isaac rebecca ¶ iacob stealeth blyssynge esau mother counsell isaac sad esau comforted hatred esau toward • iacob capi xxvii came passe isaac waxed olde eye dym soo coulde se called esau eldest sonne sayde vnto hym son whiche sayde hym sayde beholde nowe olde knowe daye death nowe therfore take thy weapens thy quyuer thy bowe get feldes thou mayst take venyson make meate suche loue bryng may eate soule maye blesse dye rebecca herde isaac spake esau sonne esau wente feelde catche uenyson brynge ✚ rebecca sayd vnto iacob son sayenge beholde haue herde thy father talkynge esau thy brother sayeng bryng venyson make meate maye eate blesse lorde afore death nowe therfore son heare voyce whiche commaunde get flocke brynge thence two good kyddes maye make meate thy father suche loueth thou shalte brynge thy father •• aye eate maye blesse death sayd iacob rebecca mother beholde esau brother rough man smothe father shall peraduenture fele shall seme vnto hym though went aboute begyle hym shal brynge curse vpon blessynge mother sayde vnto hym upō thy curse son onely heare voyce go fetche iacob went fet brought mother mother made meate knewe father loued rebecca fet goodlye raymente eldest sonne esau whiche house put vpon iacob yongest sonne put kyd skynnes vpon handes vpon smothe necke put meate bread whiche prepared hande son iacob wher • came father sayde father answered art thou sonne iacob sayd vnto father esau thy eldest son haue done accordynge thou baddest vp syt eate venyson thy soule maye blesse isaac sayde vnto sonne howe commeth thou haste founde quyckly sonne answered lorde thy god brought hande sayd isaac vnto iacob come nere • et fele sonne whether thou sonne esau went iacob isaac father felte hym sayd voyce iacobs voyce handes handes esau knewe hym bycause handes rough brother esau handes blessed hym asked hym arte thou sonne esau sayd sayde brynge let eate sonnꝭ venyson soule may blesse brought hym eate brought hym wyne also dranke father isaac sayde vnto hym come nere kysse son went vnto hym kyssed hym smelled sauour rayment ec • le ili b hebru xi blessed hym sayd se smell sonne smell felde whiche lorde hath blessed god gyue dewe heuen fatnesse earth plentye corne wyne people thy seruauntes nacyons bowe vnto lorde ouer thy brother thy mother chyldren stoupe vnto cursed curseth blessed blesseth happened soone isaac made ende blessynge iacob scarce goone presence isaac father came esau brother frō huntynge made also meate brought vnto father sayde vnto father let father aryse eate sonnes venysō thy soule may blesse father isaac sayd vnto hym arte thou answered thy eldest son esau isaac greatly astonyed measure sayd hath hunted venyson brought haue eaten thou camest haue blessed hym shall blessed esau herde wordes father cryed greatly bytterly aboue measure sayde vnto father blesse also father answered thy brother came subtilte hath taken awaye thy blessyng sayd agayne maye well called iacob hath vndermyned nowe two tymes fyrst toke away byrthryght se hath taken away blessyng also sayde haste thou kepte neuer blessynge isaac answered sayde vnto esau holde haue made hym thy lorde mother chyldren haue made seruauntes moreouer corne wyne haue stablysshed hym vnto nowe sonne esau sayde vnto father haste thou one blessynge father blesse also father lyfted vp esau voyce hebre xiie wept isaac father answered sayd vnto hym behold thy owellynge place shall fatnesse earth dew heuen frō aboue ⊢ thy swerde shalt thou lyue shalte thy brother seruaunt wyll come passe thou shalte get maystryē thou shalt loose yocke thy necke esau eb • e hated iacob bycause blessynge father blessed hym esau sayde herte dayes father sorowe hande wyll sley brother iacob wordes esau eldest son tolde rebecca sent called iacob yongest sonne sayd vnto hym beholde thy brother esau threatneth kyll nowe therfore sonne heare voyce make redy flee laban brother haran tarye hym whyle gene 33 •• vntyll thy brother fearsnesse swaged vntyll thy brother wrathe turne away frō get thynges whiche thou hast done hym wyll sende fet away thence shulde desolate bothe one daye rebecca spake isaac wery lyfe feare doughters heth yf iacob take wyfe donghters heth suche one doughters land good shal lyfe ¶ iacob sent mesopotamia laban wyfe esau maryeth ismaclite iacob dreameth chryst pro mysed iacob voweth capi xxviii isaac called iacob gene 27 •• blessed hym charged hym sarde vnto hym se thou take wyfe doughters canaan aryse get mesopotamia house bethuel thy motherz father take wyfe doughters labā thy mother brother god almyghtye blesse make increase multiplye thou mayst nombre people gyue blessyng abraham thy seede thou mayste possesse lande wherin thou arte straunger whiche god gaue vnto abraham thus isaac sent forth iacob went mesopotamia vnto laban sonne bethuel sirien brother rebecca iacob esau mother esau sawe isaac blessed iacob sent hym osec 〈◊〉 mesopotamia fet hym wyfe thence blessed hym gaue hym charge sayenge thou shalte take wyfe doughters canaan iacob obeyed father mother gone vnto mesopotamia esau seynge also doughters canaan pleased isaac father went vnto ismaell toke vnto wyues mahala doughter ismaell abraham sonne syster nabaioth wyfe iacob departed beer seba come vnto haran came vnto place chaunce taryed nyght bycause sonne downe toke stoone place put vnder heed layde hym downe place slepe dreamed beholde stode ladder vpon earth top reached vp heuen se angel god went vp downe vpon yea god stode nygh sayde lorde god abraham thy father god isaac lande whiche thou slepest vpon wyll gyue thy seed thy seed shal dust earth thou shalte spreade abrode west east north south thorowe thy seed shal al kynreds earth blessed se wyll kepe place whether thou goest wyll brynge agayne lande neyther wyl leaue vntyll haue made good haue promysed iacob awaked slepe sayd surely lorde place aware afrayed sayde howe fearfull place none euen house god gate heuen iacob stoode vp early mornynge toke stoone layde vnder heade pytched vp ende gene 31 b powred oyle top called name place house god bethell name citye called lu tyme iacob vowed vowe sayenge yf god wyll wyll kepe iourney whiche go wyll gyue breade eate clothes put come agayne vnto father house safetie shall lorde god stone whiche haue set vp ende shall goddes house thou shalte gyue wyll gyue tenth vnto ¶ iacob cometh laban serueth seuen yere rahel lea brought bed steade rahel maryeth bothe lea conceyueth capi xxix iacob lyfte vp fete came east countrey loked aboute beholde well felde thre flockes shepe laye therby well flockes watered great stone vpon wel mouth thyther al flockes brought rolled stone welles mouth watred shepe put stone agayne vpon welles mouth place iacob sayd vnto brother whence ye sayde haran sayde vnto knowe ye laban son nahor sayde knowe hym sayde vnto agayne good health sayd good health beholde doughter rahell commeth shepe sayde lo yet hye daye neyther tyme cattell shulde gathered togyther water ye shepe go fede sayd may vntyll flockes brought togyther tyll roll stoone welles mouth water shepe whyle yet talked rahell came wt father shepe kepte soone iacob saw rahel doughter laban mother brother shepe laban mother brother went rowled stone welles mouth watered flocke labā mother brother iacob kyssed rahell lyfte vp voyce wepte iacob tolde rahel father brother rebecca sonne therfore ran tolde father happened laban herde tel iacob systers son ran mete hym inbraced hym kyssed hym brought hym house tolde laban matter whome laban sayde well thou arte bone flesshe abode hym space moneth laban sayde vnto iacob though thou brother shuldest yu therfore serue nought tell shall thy wage laban two doughters eldest called lea yongest rahel lea tender eyed rahell bewtyfull well fauoured iacob loued rahell sayde wyll serue seuen yeare rahel thy yongest doughter laban answered better gyue another man byde iacob serued gene xii b seuen yeares rahell semed vnto hym fewe dayes loue iacob sayde vnto laban gyue wyfe maye lye dayes fulfylled laban gathered togyther men place made feast euen come toke lea doughter brought hym went gene xxi • vnto laban gaue vnto doughter lea zilpha mayde seruaunt vvhome vvhen lacob came accordynge custome whē mornyng come beholde lea sayde laban wherfore hast thou played thus dyd serue rahell wherfore hast thou begyled labā answered laban bycause afrayde thought thou woldest haue taken awaye thy doughters vvhere thou layest thefte charge euer thou fyndest thy godꝭ let hym dye brethrē seke thyne take iacob wyst rahell stolen thy housholde stuffe put thy brother myne may iudge bytwene v bothe beholde xx yere haue ben thy shepe thy gootes haue ben bareyne rammes thy flocke haue eaten soeuer torne beastes brought vnto made good selfe hande dydest thou requyre euen stollen day nyght daye hete consumed frost nyght slepe departed fro myne eye thus haue ben xx yere thy house serued gene 29 •• xiiii yeres thy ii doughters vi iosua 24 seit felde edom cōmaunded sayenge thus shall ye speake lorde esau thy seruaunt iacob sayth thus haue soiourned ben straunger laban vnto tyme haue ox ass shepe men seruauntes woman seruauntes haue sent shewe lorde may fynde grace thy syght messenger came agayne iacob sayenge came vnto thy brother esau cometh agaynste hathe foure hundred men hym iacob greatly afrayde wyst whiche way turne hym selfe deuyded people hym shepe ox camel two companyes sayde esau come one parte smyte shall saue selfe iacob sayd agayne god father abraham god father isaac lorde whiche saydest vnto gene 13 b returne vnto thy countrey thy kynred wyll well worthy least mercyes truthe whiche thou hast shewed vnto thy seruaunte staffe came ouer iordan nowe haue gotten two droues delyuer handes brother esau feare hym leest wyl come smyte mother chyldren thou saydest wyll surely good make thy seede sande see nombred multitude taryed nyght toke whiche came hande present esau brother two hundred gootes xx gootes ii hundred shepe xx rammes thyrtye mylche camel theyr coltes xl kyne x bulles xx ass x fooles delyuered hande seruaūtes euery droue selues sayd vnto seruauntes go forthe put space bytwene droue droue commaunded formost sayenge esau brother mete aske sayenge whose arte thou whyther goest thou whose go thou shalte saye thy seruaunt iacobs present sent vnto lord esau beholde hym selfe cometh v cōmaunded seconde thyrde folowed droues sayenge manerse ye speake vnto esau ye mete hym say moreouer thy seruaunt iacob also cometh v sayd wyll pea wrath present goeth afterwarde wyll se hym selfe yf peraduenture wyl receyue grace went present hym taryed nyght company rose vp nyght toke two wyues ii maydens xi sonnes went ouer foorde iabok toke sent ouer ryuer sent ouer taryed behynde hym selfe alone see xii v wrastled man hym vn breakyng day saw coulde preuayle agaynst hym smote hym vnder thye synowe iacobs thye shranke wrastled wt hym sayd let go day breaketh whiche answered wyll let go excepte thou blesse sayd vnto hym thy name answered iacob sayde thou shalte called iacob gene 35 v israel prynce hast thou wrastled god man hast preuayled iacob asked hym sayenge tell thy name obeysaunce sayde droue whiche met answered may fynde grace syght lorde esau sayd haue ynough brother kepe thou hast vnto thy selfe iacob answered oh nay yf haue foūde grace thy syght receyue present hande haue sene thy face hester • v though sene face god thou hast good wyll towarde oh take blessynge brought god hath mercy gyuynge thynges haue ynough compelled hym toke sayd let v take iourney go wyll go iacob answered hym lorde thou knowest chyldren tendre ewe kyne yong vnder myne hande yf men shulde ouerdryue euen one daye shepe wyll dye oh let lorde go seruaunte wyl dryue fayre softly accordynge cattell goeth chyldren able endure vntyl come lorde vnto seir esau sayde let yet leaue folke answered nedeth one thynge onely haue nede let fynde grace syght lorde esau went waye agayne sonnes iacob capi xxxiiii dina doughter lea gene 〈…〉 whiche bare vnto iacob went se doughters lande whome sichem son hemor heuite lorde countrey saw toke lay ii reg 〈◊〉 ▪ forced harte lay vnto dina doughter iacob loued damsell spake kyndly vnto sichem spake vnto father hemor sayenge get mayden vnto wyfe iacob herde defyled dina doughter sonnes beynge theyr cattel felde helde peace vntyll come hemor father sichem wente vnto iacob common sonnꝭ iacob commyng felde herde greued lytell wrothe bycause wrought folye israell layne iacobs doughter whiche thynge ought done hemor cōmoned sayenge soule son sichem longeth youre doughter gyue hym wyfe make maryage v gyue doughters vnto v take doughters vnto ye shall dwell v lande shall dwell busynes haue possessyons therein sichem sayde vnto father brother let fynde grace youre eye soeuer ye apoynt wyl gyue aske frely bothe dowrye gyftes wyll gyue accordynge ye say vnto ye gyue damsell wyfe sonnes iacob answered sichem hemor father talkyng among selues deceytefully bycause defyled dina theyr syster sayde vnto thing shuld gyue syster one vncircumcised shame vnto v wyll consente vnto ye wyll men chyldren amonge circumcysed thē wyl gyue doughters take doughters v wyll dwell one people yf ye wyl herken vnto v circūcised wyll take doughter go wayes theyr wordes pleased hemor sichem sonne yonge man deferred thynge bycause lust iacobs doughter also moost set father house hemor sichem sonne wente vnto gate theyr cytie cōmoned mē theyʒ cytie sayeng men vnfayned towarde v dwell lande theyr ocupacyon therin lande wine ynoughe wyll take theyr doughters wyues gyue doughters onely herein wyll consent vnto v dwell v one people yf men chyldren among v circumcised shall theyr goodes theyr substaunce theyr cattel yf consent vn wyll dwell v vnto hemor sichem sonne herkened went gate cytie men chyldren circumcised euer wente gate cytie happened thyrde daye paynefull two sonnes iacob symeon leui dinas brother toke eyther gene • lix iudi ix swerde wente cytie boldly siewe male slewe also hemor sichem sonne edge swerde toke dina sichems house went theyr way sonnes iacob comyng vpon deed spoyled cytie bycause defyled theyr syster toke theyr sheepe ox theyr ass soeuer cytie also feldes theyr goodes theyr chyldren theyr wyues toke captyue made hauocke house iacob sayd symeon leui ye haue troubled made stynke inhabytours ¶ wyues esau iacob esau ryche genealogic esau capi xxxvi generacyons esau edom esau toke wyues doughters canaan ada doughter elon hethite ahalibama doughter ana doughter zibeō heuyte basmath ismaels gene 28 • doughter syster nebaioth ada bare vnto esau eliphas basmath bare reguel ahalibama bare iesu iaelam korah sonnes esau whiche borne hym lande canaan esau toke wyues sonnes doughters soules house goodes cat • ell substaunce got lande canaan wente countrey away face brother iacob theyr gene 13 • ryches moche coulde dwell togyther lande wherin straungers coulde teceyue bycause theyr possessyon thus dwelte esau moūt seir esau edom generacyons esau father edomytes mount seir name esau sonnes 1 para • • eliphas son ada wyfe esau reguel son basmath wyfe esau sonnes eliphas theman omar zepho iaethom kenas thimna concubyne elyphas esau sonne bare vnto eliphas amalech sonnes ada esau wyfe sonnes regueli nahath serah samma misa sonnes basmath esau wyfe sonnes ahalibama doughter ana doughter zebion esau wyfe bare vnto esau ieus iealam korah duke sonnes esau chylden para▪ 〈◊〉 eliphas fyrst sonne esau duke theman duke omar duke zepho duke kenas duke korah duke gaethā duke amalech duke came eliphas lande edom sonnes ada also chyldren reguell esau sonne duke nahath duke serah duke samma duke misa duke came reguel lande edom sonnes basmath esau wyfe child aha libama esau wyfe duke ieus duke gaelan duke korah duke came ahalibama doughter ana esau wyfe chyldren esau duke esau edom chyldren seir horite inhabitoure lande lothan soball zibeon ana dison eser disan also duke horites chyldren seir lande edom chyldren lothan hori hemam lothans syster called thymna chyldrē •• • aluan manahath eball sepho onā chyldren zibeon aia ana ana founde mule wyldernes fed father zibeons ass chyldren ana dison ahalibama doughter ana chyldren dison hemdan esban iethran cheran chyldren ezar bylhan seauā akan chyldren disan also uz aran duke came hori duke lothan duke soball duke zibeon duke ana duke dison duke ezer duke disan duke came hory theyr duke doms lande seir kynges reygned lande edom reygned kynge vpon chyldren israel bela sonne beor reygned edomea name cytie dinhaba bela dyed iobab sonne serah bozra reygned steade iobab also deade husam lande themany reygned steade death husam hadad sonne bedad whiche slewe madianites felde moabites reygned steade name cytie auith hadad deade samla masteka reygned steade samla deade saul ryuer rehoboth reygned steade saul dead baal hanan sonne achbor reygned steade death baal hanan son achbor hadad reygned steade
