theman duke myhzar duke magdyel duke iram duke edomea accordyng theyr habitacions lande theyr possessyons esau father edomytes ¶ ioseph • cuseth brother ioseph dreameth solde ismaelites iacob bewaleth ioseph capi xxxvii iacob dwelte land wherin father straunger euen lande canaan generacions iacob ioseph xvii yere olde kepte sheepe brother lad sonnes bilha son̄es zilpha father wyues brought vnto theyr father euyll sayeng israel loued ioseph chyldren bycause begat hym olde age made hym cote many coloures brother sawe theyr father loued hym brother hated hym coulde speake peaceably vnto hym moreouer whē ioseph 〈◊〉 x • ii • dreamed dreame tolde brother hated hym yet ✚ sayd vnto heare pray dreame whiche haue dreamed beholde byndyng sheues myddes felde lo shefe arose stode vp ryght youres stode rounde aboute made obeysaunce shefe brother sayde shalte thou kynge dede shalte thou dede haue dominion ouer v hated hym yet bycause dreames wordes dreamed yet another dreame tolde brother sayeng beholde haue one dreame thought sonne moone xi sterres made obeysaūce tolde vnto father brother father rebuked hym sayd vnto hym dreame thou hast dreamed shall thy mother thy brothren come fall grounde brother hated hym father noted sayenge brother also went kepe theyr father shepe siehem israel sayde vnto ioseph thy brother kepe shepe sichem come wyll sende answered 1 reg 3 • sayde vnto hym go se whyther wel thy brother shepe bryng worde agayne sent hym vale hebron wente sichem certayn man founde hum beholde wandrynge way felde man asked hym sekest thou answered seke brother tell praye kepe shepe man sayde departed hence herde saye let v go vnto dothan thus wente ioseph brother founde dothan sawe hym farre came toke counsell agaynst hym slee hym one sayd beholde met x • • • 〈◊〉 • luke 〈◊〉 • dreamer cometh come nowe therfore let v slee hym cast hym pyt wyll say wycked beast hath deuoured hym shal se wyl come dreames ruben herde ryd hym theyr handes sayde wyll kyll hym ruben sayd moreouer vnto shede gene x ••• • bloode cast hym pyt wyldernesse laye hande vpon hym sayde namely myght ryd hym theyr handes delyuer hym father agayne ⊢ happened ioseph come vnto brethrē stryped hym cote partie coloured cote vpon hym toke hym cast 〈◊〉 emptye pyt wherin water sat downe eate breade lyfte vp theyr eye loked aboute came company ismaelites gilead theyr camel laden spycery baulme myrre goynge downe cary egypte iuda sayd vnto brother auayleth yf slee brother kepe blood secret come let v • ctes v •• • gene 45 • sell hym ismaelites let hand vpon hym brother flesshe brother content madianites marchaunt men passed drewe lyfte ioseph oute pyt solde hym vnto ismaelytes xx peces syluer brought ioseph egypte ruben came agayne vnto pyt founde ioseph rent clothes wente agayne vnto brother sayenge lad yonder whyther shall go toke iosephs coote kylled goote dypped coote bloode sent partye coloured coote brought vnto theyr father sayd haue founde se whyther thy sonnes coote knewe sayenge sonnes coote wycked beast hath gene 44 f dououred hym ioseph rent peces iacob rent clothes put sacke cloth aboute loynes sorowed sonne longe season sonnes doughters rose vp comforte hym neuerthelesse wolde comforted sayde wyll go downe graue vnto sonne mournyng thus father wepte hym madianytes gene • 9 psal • nn • sap • x • solde hym egipte vnto potiphar lord pharaos chefe stewarde ¶ mariage iuda et onon sela iuda lay doughter thamar byrth tharez zarah capi xxxviii fortuned tyme iudas wente downe brother gat hym man called hira odollam sawe doughter man called para ii sua canaanite toke went conceyued bare son called name er conceyued agayne bare sonne called hym onan conceyued agayne bare yet sonne called se • chesyb bare hym iudas gaue et eldest son wyfe whose name thamar er iudas eldest sonne wycked syght lorde lorde slew hym iudas sayd vnto onan go thy brother wyfe marye thou mayst styrre vp seed dnto thy brother onan perceyued seed shulde therfore went brother wyfe spylled grounde gaue seed vnto brother thynge whiche dyd dyspleased lorde wherfore slewe hym also sayd iudas thamar doughter lawe remayne wydowe thy father house tyll sela sonne growne sayd leest peraduenture dye also brother dyd thamar wente dwelte father house processe tyme doughter sua iudas wyfe dyed iudas lefte mournyng went vnto shepe sherers thymnath frende hira odollam one tolde thamar sayenge beholde thy father law goeth vp thymnath gene ii 〈…〉 shere shepe put wydowes garmentes couered cloke dysgysed selfe sat downe comon place whiche hye wayes syde tymnath bycause sawe sela growne gyuen vnto hym wyfe iuda sawe thought ben hore bycause couered face turned vnto way sayd come praye let lye knewe doughter lawe answered wylte thou gyue lye sayd wyll sende kyd flocke sayde gyue pledge tyll thou sende sayd pledge shall gyue answered thy sygnet thy bracelet thy staffe thy hande gaue lay chyld hym gat vp went put mantell put wydowes rayment iudas sent kyd frende odollam receyue pledge agayn wyues hand founde asked men place say eng hore sat openly waye syde answered hore came therfore iuda agayne sayd vnto hym fynde also men place sayd hore iuda sayde let take leest shamed beholde sent kyd thou hast founde came passe thre monethes one tolde iuda sayeng thamar thy doughter lawe hath played hore playenge hore become great chylde iuda sayd bryng forth may brente brought forth sente father lawe sayenge man vnto thynges perteyne chylde sayde also loke whose seale bracelet staffe iuda knewe sayd hath ben ryghteous bycause gaue sela sonne laye fortuned tyme come shulde delyuered beholde two twynnes wombe fortuned traueled one put hande mydwyfe toke bounde redde threde sayeng come fyrst chaunsed plucked hande backe agayne beholde brother came sayde wherfore hast thou rent rent vpon called name pharez afterward came brother reed threde aboute hande name colled zarah ¶ god prospereth ioseph pharaos wyfe tempteth ioseph accused • ast prison god hath mercy vpon hym capi xxxix ioseph brought vnto egypte putiphar gene 37 g lorde pharaos cheyfe steward egyptian bought hym ismaelites whiche brought hym thyther god ioseph came luckye man continuyng house mayster egyptiā mayster sawe god hym god made dyd prosper hande ioseph founde grace maysters syght serued hym made hym rular house put hande fortuned tyme made ruler ouer house oueral lorde gene 31 blessed egyptian house iosephs sake blessyng lorde vpon house felde therfore lefte iosephs hande loked vpon nothynge wt hym saue onely bread whiche dyd eate ioseph • • eg 16 goodly person welfauoured fortuned maysters wyfe cast eye vpon ioseph sayde come lye refused sayde maysters wyfe behold mayster woteth hath house hath cōmytted hath hand man greater house thē neyther hath kepte thynge onely bycause thou arte wyfe howe great wyckednesse synne agaynst god maner spake ioseph daye daye harkened vnto slepe nere company fortuned certayne conuement day ioseph entred house busynesse man householde house caught garment saynge come slepe wt lefte garment hande fled gat hym chaunsed sawe lefte garment hande fled regarded called vnto men house tolde sayenge se hath brought hebrew vnto v v shame came haue slepte began crye lowde voyce herde lyfte vp voyce cryed lefte garment wt fled away gat hym layed vp garment vntyl lorde came home tolde hym wordꝭ saynge hebrues seruant thou hast brought vnto v came shame soone lyfte vp voyce cryed lefte garment fled mayster beynge lyght credence herde wordes wyfe whiche tolde hym saynge maner dyd thy seruant waxed wroth mayster toke ioseph put hym psal 〈…〉 prysō euen place kingꝭ prysoners laye bounde continued pryson god ioseph shewed hym mercye got hym fauour syght lorde pryson keper pryson commytted iosephs hande prysoners pryson house whatsoeuer done dyd keper prysō loked vnto nothynge vnder hande seynge god hym whatsoeuer dyd god made prosper ¶ ioseph expoundeth dreames two prisoner capi xl chaunced butler kynge egypte baker offended theyr lorde kynge egypt pharao angrye agaynst two offycers agaynst cheyf butler cheyf baker put ward cheyf stewardes house euen prysō place ioseph bounde cheyf stewarde gaue ioseph charge serued cōtynued season warde dreamed eyther one nyght bothe butler baker kyng egypt bound prisō house eyther dreame eche mannes dreame sondrye interpretacyon ioseph came vnto mornynge loked vpon beholde sad asked pharaos offycers wt hym maysters ward sayenge wherfore lokeye sadly daye answered hym haue dreamed dreame haue man declare ioseph sayde vnto interpretynges belonge god yet tell cheyf butler tolde dreame ioseph sayde vnto hym dreame thought stode vyne vyne thre braunches though budded blossom shot forth grape thereof waxed type pharaos cup hande toke grape wrong pharaos cup delyuered pharaos cup hande ioseph sayde vnto hym interpretacion thre braunces thre dayes within thre dayes shall pharao lyfte vp thyne heade restore vnto thyne offyce agayne thou shalte delyuer pharaos cuppe hande olde maner wherin thou waste wont gyue hym drynke yf thou thynke thou arte good case shewe mercy praye vnto make mencyon pharao brynge house stollen lande hebrues also haue done thynge wherfore shulde haue put dungeon cheyfe baker sawe interpretacion good sayde vnto ioseph thought also dreame thre wyker baskettes head vppermost basket maner baken meates pharao byrdes dyd eate basket vpon heade ioseph answered sayde interpretacion therof thre baskettes thre dayes daye thre dayes shall pharao take thy heade shall hange tree byrdes shall eate thy flesshe came passe thyrde daye pharaos met 14 • byrth daye made feast vnto seruantꝭ lyfted vp head cheyf butler cheyfe baker amonge seruantes restored cheyfe butler vnto butlershyp agayne also reached cup pharaos hand hanged cheyfe baker euen ioseph interpretated vnto neyther dyd cheyfe butler remembre ioseph forgat hym ¶ pharaos dreames expounded ioseph made ruler ouer egypte hath two sonnes manasses ephraim derth begynneth egypte capi xli fortuned two yeares pharao dreamed beholde stode ryuers syde came ryuer seuē goodly kyne fat flesshed fed medowe seuen kyne came vp ryuer euyll fauoured leane flesshed stoode kyne vpō brynke ryuer euyll fauoured leane flesshed kyne dyd eate vp seuen well fauoured fat kyne pharao awoke slepte agayne dreamed seconde tyme beholde seuen eares corne grewe vpon one stalke rancke goodly agayne seuen thyn eares blasted east wynde sprange vp seuen thyn eares deuoured seuen rancke full care pharao awaked se dreame mornyng came spiryte troubled sent called sothesayers egypte al wyse men therof pharao tolde dreame none among coulde interpretate vnto pharao spake cheyfe butler vnto pharao sayenge remembre fautes daye pharao beyng angrye seruauntes put warde cheyfe stewardes house bothe cheyf baker dreamed v one nyght eche mannes dreame sondrye interpretacyon v yonge man hebrew borne seruaunt vnto cheyf stewarde whome tolde declared oure dreames v accordynge eyther dreames declared vnto v euen came passe restored myne offyce agayne hanged hym pharao sent therfore called ioseph brought hym hastely psal 〈◊〉 pryson shaued hym selfe chaunged rayment came pharao pharao sayde vnto ioseph haue sene dreame man interpretate haue herde say soone thou hearest dreame yu canste interpretate ioseph answered pharao sayde god shal gyue pharao answere peace pharao sayde vnto ioseph dreamed thought stode ryuer syde came ryuer seuen fat flesshed well fauoured kyne fed medowe seuen kyne came vp poore euyll fauoured leane flesshed suche neuer sawe lande egypte euyll fauoured seuen leane euyl fauoured kyne dyd eate vp fyrst seuen fat kyne whē eaten vp man coulde perceyue eaten styll euyl fauoured begynnynge awoke sawe agayne dreame behold seuen eares sprange one stalke full fayre seuen eares agayne wythered thyn blasted east wynd sprange vp thyn eares deuoured seuen good eares haue tolde vnto sothsayers man coulde tell meaneth ioseph answered pharao bothe pharaos dreames one god hath shewed pharao aboute seuen good kyne seuen yeares seuen good eares seuen yeares also one dreame lykewyse seuen thyn euyll fauoured kyne came seuen yeres seuen emptye blasted eares shall seuen yeares hunger whiche haue sayd vnto pharao god aboute sheweth vnto pharao beholde come seuen yeare great plenteousnesse throughe lande egypte agayne shall aryse seuen yeares hunger al plenteousnesse shalbe forgotten lande egypte hūger shal cōsume lande neyther shall plenteousnes knowen lande reason hunger shall come shalbe excedynge great cōcernyng dreame doubled vnto pharao seconde tyme behold thynge certaynly prepared god god wyll shortly brynge passe nowe therfore let pharao prouyde man vnderstandynge wysdome set hym ouer lande egypte let pharao also make officer ouer land take vp fyfthe parte lande egypte seuen plenteous yeres let gather foode good yeres come lay vp corne vnder hande pharao may fode cityes let kepe maye foode store lande agaynst seuen yeres hūger shall come lande egypt lande perysshe thorow hunger sayenge pleased pharao seruantes sayde pharao vnto seruauntes shall fynde suche man whome spiryte god pharao sayd vnto ioseph moche god hath shewed man vnderstandynge wysdome lyke vnto thou therfore shalte psal • lilib • math ii f dani ii g actes vii b ouer house accordynge thy worde shall people ruled onely kynges seate wyll aboue pharao sayd agayne vnto ioseph beholde haue set ouer lande egypte toke rynge hande put vpon iosephs hand arayed cloth raynes put golden cheyne aboute necke set vpon best charet saue one cryed hym bowe line pharao made hym ruler oueral lande egypt pharao sayd vnto ioseph pharao without shal man lyfte vp hande foote lande egypte called iosephs name zaphnath paena gaue hym wyfe asnath doughter putiphar preest went ioseph abrode lande egypte thyrtye yeare olde stode pharao kynge egypte ioseph departynge frō presence pharao wente thorowe lande egypte seuen plenteous yeares made sheues gathered vp fode seuen plenteous yeares whiche lande egypte layed vp cityes foode feldes grew rounde aboute euery citie layde vp ioseph layde vp corne stoore lyke vnto sande see multitude measure vntyll lefte nombrynge without nombre vnto ioseph borne two sonnes yeres hunger came asnath doughter putiphar preest bare vnto hym ioseph called name fyrste son gene 46 c manasse god sayd hath made forget al labour al father house holde name seconde called ephraim god sayde hath caused growe land trouble whē seuen yeres plenteousnesse land egypt ended came seuen yeres actes vii b derth accordyng ioseph sayde derth landes lande egypte yet foode lande egypt also began hunger people cryed pharao breade pharao sayde vnto egyptian god vnto ioseph sayeth derth thorowout al lande ioseph opened barnes wherin corne solde vnto egypcians hunger waxed sore lande egypte countryes came egypte ioseph bye corne bycause hunger sore landes ¶ iosephs brother come egypte corne knoweth tryeth simeon put pryson returne theyr father askynge ben iamin denyeth capi xlii iacob seynge corne egypt sayd vnto sonnes gape ye one vpō another sayd beholde haue herde corne egypt actes vii b get downe thyther bye v corne thence may lyue dye went iosephs ten brother downe bye corne egyptian ben iamyn iosephs brother wolde iacob sende wt brother sayde leest mysfortune happen sonnꝭ israell came bye corne amonge came derth lande canaan ioseph gouerner lande solde people land brother came fell flat grounde hym ioseph saw brother knewe made hym selfe straunge vnto spake roughly vnto sayeng whence come ye answered lande canaan bye bytayle ioseph knewe brother knew hym ioseph remembred gene 37 b dreames whiche dreamed sayd vnto ye spyes se lande weake youre commynge sayde nay lorde bye vytayle thy seruauntes come one man sonnes meane truely thy seruauntes spyes sayde vnto agayne naye euen se lande weake cōmynge sayde thy seruauntes xii brother sonnes one man lande canaan beholde yongest daye father one man woteth ioseph sayd vnto spake vnto sayeng ye spyes hereby ye shall proued lyfe pharao ye shall go hence excepte yongest brother come hyther sende one may fet brother ye shalbe kept pryson wordes may proued whyther trueth el lyfe pharao ye spyes put warde thredayes ioseph sayd vnto thyrde day lyue feare god yf ye meane hurte let one brother boūd house pryson go ye bryng necessarie foode householdes brynge yongest brother vnto wordes maye tried ye dye dyd one sayde another haue verely synned agaynst brother sawe anguyshe soule besought v wolde heare therfore trouble come vpon v ruben answered sayenge sayde vnto ye shulde gene 37 syn agaynst lad ye wolde heare se bloode requyred aware ioseph vnderstode spake vnto interpreter turned wepte gene 4 • ▪ •• v 〈◊〉 turned agayne comoned toke simeon amonge bounde hym theyr eye ioseph commauuded fyll theyr sackes corne put euery man money sacke gyue vytayle • spende waye thus dyd vnto laded theyr ass wt corne departed thence one ope ned sacke gyue asse prauonder iune spied money sackes mouth sayd vnto brother money restored agayne lo euen sacke theyr hert fayled astonyed sayde one another hathe god delte thus v came vnto iacob theyr father vnto land canaan tolde happened sayenge man euen lorde lande spake roughly v commyttynge v prison toke v spyes coūtrey sayd vnto hym meane truly spyes xii brother sonnes father one away yongest daye wt father land canaan man lorde coūtrey sayd agayn vnto v hereby shall knowe yf ye meane truly leaue one brethrē take fode necessary housholdes get away brynge yongest brother vnto maye knowe ye spyes meane truly wyll delyuer brother ye shall occupye lande fortuned emptyed theyr sackes beholde euery man bundell money sacke whē bothe theyr father sawe bundels money afrayd iacob theyr father sayde vnto haue ye robbed chyldren ioseph awaye symeon awaye ye take ben iamin awaye thynges agaynst ruben sayde vnto father slee two sonnes yf brynge hym agayne deliuer hym hande wyl brynge hym agayne sayde sonne shall go downe brother deade lefte alone yf mysfortune happen vnto waye whiche ye goo ye shall gene 46 〈◊〉 brynge gray head sorowe vnto graue ¶ bryngynge ben iamin brother returned ioseph gyftes symeon • yuered ou • pryson ioseph goeth asyde wepeth feast togyther capi xliii derth great lande fortuned eaten vp corne brought lande egypte theyr father sayde vnto go agayn bye v lytle foode iuda answered hym sayde man dyd testifye vnto v saynge gene x • ii loke ye se face excepte brother yf thou wylte sende brother v wyll go downe bye foode yf thou wylte sende hym wyll go downe man sayd vnto v loke ye se face excepte brother israel sayd wherfore delte ye cruelly tell man ye yet brother answered man asked v straytly kynred saynge father yet alyue haue ye another brother tolde hym accordynge wordꝭ coulde knowe wolde saye brynge youre brother downe sayd iuda vnto israell father sende lad may ryse go may lyue dye thou also chyldrē wyl surety hym handꝭ shalt thou requyre hym yf brynge hym agayne set hym thyne eye gene 44 • let bere blame euer truly excepte made taryeng ben twyse come agayn theyr father israell sayd vnto yf must nedes nowe thus take best fruytes land vessel brynge man present curtesie bawlme curtesye hony spyces myrre nuttes almondes take double money hande money brought agayne sackes take agayne seest peraduenture ouersyght take also youre brother aryse goo agayne man god almyghtye gyue mercye syght man maye delyuer brother ben iamin shalbe robbed chylde haue ben thus • oke present twyse moche money theyr hande ben iamin rose vp went downe egypte stode ioseph ioseph sawe ben iamin sayde rular house brynge men home sley make redye men shall dyne noone man dyd ioseph bad brought iosephs house men brought iosephs house afrayde sayd bycause money came sackes mouthes fyrst tyme brought maye pycke quarell v laye thyng charge brynge v bōdage ass also therfore came mā rular ouer iosephs house cō moned hym doore house sayde oh syr came downe hyther fyrst tyme bye food came iune hapned opened oure sackes beholde euery mannes gene 〈◊〉 • money mouthe sacke wt full weyght haue brought agayne hand money haue brought also oure handes bye foode tell put money oure sackes sayde peace vnto feare god god father hath gyuen treasure sackes money brought simeon man led iosephs house gaue water wasshe theyr fete gaue theyr ass prauender made redye theyr present agaynste ioseph came noone herde saye shulde eate breade whē ioseph came home brought present house hym theyr handes fell flat grounde hym welcomed courteously sayenge father olde man whiche ye tolde good health yet aly • e answered thy seruant father good health yet alyue bowed downe theyr heades made obeysauuce lyftynge vp eye behelde brother ben iamin mo thers sonne sayd gene xli • • youre yonger brother whome ye sayde vnto sayde god mercy full vnto sonne ioseph made haste gene xlii • •• v • herte dyd melte vpon brother sought wepe entred chambre wepte wasshed face came refrayned hym selfe sayde set bread table prepared hym hym selfe selues egyptian dyd eate hym selues bycause egiptians may eate breade hebrues abhominaciō vnto egyptian sat hym eldest accordyng vnto age yongest accordynge vnto youth men meruayled among selues brought rewardes vnto thē frō hym ben iamins parte fyue • yue moche chyldren para 7 b viii ben iamin bela becher asbell gera naeman ehi ro mupim hupim arde child rahel bare vnto iacob xiiii soules al togyther chyldren dan husim chyldren nephtalt iahezeell guni iezer
