sonꝭ ioseph whiche borne hym egypt two soules soulꝭ house iacob whiche came egypte lxx sent iuda hym vnto ioseph directe face vnto gosan came lande gosan ioseph made redye charet went vp mete israell father vnto gosan presēted hym selfe vnto hym fell necke wepte vpon necke good whyle israell sayde vnto ioseph nowe cōtent dye moch haue sene bycause thou arte yet alyue ioseph sayde vnto brother vnto father house wyl go vp shewe pharao tell hym brother father house whiche lande canaan come vnto shephectdes men cattell haue brought theyr shepe theyr ox haue yf chaunce pharao call aske occupacyon ye shall answere thy seruauntes haue ben men occupyed aboute cattell chyldhode vnto tyme father ye may dwell land gosan euery shepeherde abhominacion vnto egyptian ¶ iacob • broughe pharao hym • gyuen lande gosan maheth son swere buryall capi xlvii ioseph came therfore tolde pharao sayde father brother theyr shepe theyr ox haue come lande canaan beholde lande gosan ioseph toke hymnoost brother euen fyue men presented vnto pharao pharao sayde vnto brother occupacyon answered pharao shepheerdes thy seruauntes bothe also father sayde moreouer vnto pharao gen • 〈◊〉 soiourne lande come thy seruauntes haue pasture theyr shepe sore famyn lande canaan nowe therfore let thy seruaūtes dwell lande gosan pharao sayde vnto ioseph thy father thy brother come vnto lande egypte best place lande make bothe thy father thy brother dwell euen lande gosan let dwell moreouer yf thou knowe men actiuyte amonge make th • ruler ouer cattell ioseph brought iacob father set hym pharao iacob blessyd pharao pharao sayde vnto iacob howe olde arte thou iacob sayde vnto pharao dayes pylgrimage hundred xxx yeares fewe euyll haue dayes lyfe ben haue attayned vnto yeares life father dayes theyr pylgrimages iacob blessed pharao went hym ioseph prepared dwellynges father brother gaue possession lande egypte best lande euen lande rameses pharao cōmaunded ioseph made prouisyon father brother al father housholde breade euen yonge chyldren fed breade lande derthe exceadynge sore lande egypte lande canaan famysshed reason derthe ioseph brought togyther money founde lande egypte canaan corne whiche bought layde vp money pharaos house money fayled lande egypte canaan egyptian came vnto ioseph sayde gyue v breade wherfore suffrest thou v dye money spente sayde ioseph brynge cattell wyll gyue cattel yf ye without money brought theyr cattell vnto ioseph ioseph gaue breade horse shepe ox ass fed bread theyr cattell yeare yere ended came vnto hym nexte yere sayd vnto hym wyl hyde lorde howe money spente lorde also cattell beastes neyther ought lefte syght lorde euen body oure landes wherfore lettest thou v dye thyne eye lande go nought bye v oure landes breade bothe landes wyll bonde pharao onely gyue v seede maye lyue dye lande go waste ioseph boughte lande egypt pharao egyptian solde euery man lande bycause derth sore vpon land became pharaos appoynted people vnto cityes one syde egypte vnto onely lande preestes bought preestes ordinaunce pharao shulde care whiche apointed vnto pharao gyuen wherfore sold theyr landes ioseph sayde vnto folke beholde haue bought day lande pharao take seede sow lande encrease ye shall gyue fyfth pharao iiii partes shall owne seede felde housholdes youre chyldren eate answered thou hast saued lyues let v fynde grace syght lorde wyll pharaos seruauntes ioseph made lawe ouer lande egypte vnto day pharao shulde haue fyfte parte excepte lande preestes onely pharaos israel dwelte egypte euen countrey gosan theyr possessyons therin grewe multiplied excedynglye moreouer iacob lyued lande egypte xvii yeres hole age iacob hūdred xlvii yere tyme drewe nye israel must dye sent sonne ioseph sayd hym haue founde grace thy syght oh put thy hande nowe vnder thye deale mercyfully truely thou bury egypte wyll lye father thou shalte carye egypte bury theyr butyal answered wyll thou hast sayde sayd gene 25 • swere vnto sware vnto hym israel worshypped towarde beddes heade ¶ iacob lyeth speke despreth ephraim manasses sonnes blesseth capi xlviii dedes happened messenger sayde vnto ioseph thy father sycke toke hym two sonnes manasses ephraim sayde vnto iacob beholde thy sonne ioseph cometh vnto israel toke strength vnto hym sat vp bed iacob sayd vnto ioseph god almyghty appeared vnto gene 〈◊〉 lu lande canaan blessed sayde vnto beholde wyl make growe wyl multiplye wyll make great gene 46 • nombre people wyll gyue lande vnto thy seede vnto euerlastynge possessyon nowe thy two sonnes manasses ephraim borne vnto lande egypte came egypte myne euen ruben symeō myne chyldren thou hast gotten shalbe thyne owne shall called name theyr brother theyr enheritaūce whē came sopotamia rahell gene 35▪ • ▪ dyed vpon hand lande canaan way felde brede come ephrat buried way ephrat bethleem israel behelde iosephs sonnes sayd ioseph sayde vnto father sonnes god hath gyuen sayd oh bryng let blesse eye israel dym age coulde well se broughte hym kyssed enbraced thē israel sayde vnto ioseph thought haue sene thy face yet loo • god hath shewed also thy seede ioseph toke awaye lap worshypped grounde hym toke ioseph bothe ephraim ryght hande towarde israel lefte hande manasses lefte hand towarde israel ryght hande brought vnto hym israel stretched right hande layde vpon ephraims heade whiche yonger lefte hande vpon manasses heade gydynge handes wysely manasses elder blessed ioseph sayd god father abraham isaac dyd walke god hath fed lyfe long vnto daye angell whiche hath delyuered euyl blesse laddes let name named name father abraham isaac maye grow multitude myddes earth ioseth saw father layd right hande vpon heade ephraim displeased hym lyft vp father hande haue remoued ephraims heade vnto manasses heade ioseph sayde vnto father father eldest put thy ryghte hande vpon heade father wolde sayd knowe well sonne knowe well shall also people shall great yonger brother shall greater seede shall full people blessed daye sayde let israel blesse saye god make ephraim manasses set ephraim manasses israel sayd vnto ioseph beholde dye god shall bryng agayne vnto land father moreouer haue gyuen vnto porcyon iohe iiii lande aboue thy brother whiche gat hande amorite swerde bowe ¶ iacob blesseth owne sonnes sheweth come apoynteth wyll buryed dyeth capi xlix iacob called sonnes sayd come togyther may tel shall happen laste dayes gather togyther heare ye sonnes iacob herken vnto israel father ruben myn gene 29 f eldest sonne thou arte myght begynnynge strength noblenes dygnyte noblenesse power unstable water thou shalte cheyfest bycause thou wenteste vp thy father bed euen dydest thou defyle couche brother simeon leuy cruell instrumentes theyr habitacions theyr secretes come soule vnto theyr congregacyon honour coupled theyr gent 〈◊〉 wrath slue man theyr selfe wyll dygged downe wal cursed theyr wrath shamelesse theyr fearsnes cruell wyll deuyde iacob scatter israel iuda thou arte thy brother shal prayse thy hande shall p ••• 〈◊〉 necke thyne enemyes thy father chyldren shall stoupe iuda mich • 〈◊〉 lyon whelpe spoyle sonne thou arte come hye layde hym downe couched hym selfe lyon gene 〈◊〉 lyonesse wyl styrre hym vp sceptre shall departe iuda lawe gyuer bytwene feete vntyll sylo come vnto hym shall gatherynge people shal bynde foole vnto vyne ass colte vnto braunche wasshed garment wyne mantell bloode grape eye redder wyne teeth whytter mylke iosu • 〈◊〉 zebulon shall dwell besyde hauen see nye hauen shyppes border shalbe vnto sydon isachar strong asse couchyng hym downe bytwene two burden sawe rest good lande pleasaunt bowed shoulder beare became seruaunt vnto trybute iudic 〈◊〉 xiiii 〈◊〉 xvii 〈◊〉 dan shall iudge people tribe israel dan shall serpente waye edder path bytynge horse heles ryder fel backewarde thy saluacyon haue loked lorde gad hoost men shal euercome hym shall ouercome last asser brede shall fat shall gyue pleasure kynge neptalym swyfte hynde gyuynge goodly wordes flourysshynge chylde ioseph plenteous chylde well syde doughters ran vpon wall haue prouoked hym shotte hym dartes archer haue enuyed hym bowe abode fast armes handes made stronge handes myghtie god iacob hym shal come herde man stone israel thy father god hath helped almyghtye whiche hath blessed blessynges heuen aboue blessynges depe lyeth vnder blessynges brestes wombe blessynges thy father stronger blessynges myne elder vnto vtmoost hylles worlde shall heade ioseph top heade hym seperate brother ben iamin shall rauysshe wolfe mornynge shall deuoure pray nyght shal deuyde spoyle xii tribe israel theyr father spake vnto blessed euery one blessed seuerall blessynge charged sayde vnto shalbe gathered vnto gene 25 people bury father caue felde ephron hethyte double caue felde countrey mamre lande canaan felde abraham bought ephron hethite possessyon bury buried abraham sara wyfe buryed isaac rebecca wyfe buryed lea felde caue therin bought chyldrē heth iacob cōmaunded al wolde vnto sonnes plucked vp feete vnto bed dyed •••• vii c put vnto people ioseph fel vpon father face wepte vpon hym kyssed hym ¶ iacob buryed ioseph forgyueth brother iniurye dyd dyeth capi l ioseph cōmaunded seruaūtes phisicians enbawme father phisicians enbawmed israel xl dayes long long doth embawmyng last egyptian bewayled hym lxx dayes dayes wepyng ended ioseph spake vnto house pharao sayeng haue foūde fauour eye speake eares pharao sayeng father made swere sayde lo dye gene 47 g bury graue whiche haue made lande canaan therfore let go bury father wyll come agayne pharao sayde go bury thy father accordyng made swere ioseph went vp bury father hym went seruauntes pharao elder house al elder land egypte house ioseph brother father house theyr chyldren theyr shepe theyr cattell lefte behynde lande gosan went wt hym also charettes horseman excedynge great company came corne floore atad whiche beyonde iordane made great exceadyng sore lamentacyon eccle xxii mourned father seuen dayes inhabiters lande euen cananitꝭ saw mournyng corne floore atad sayde great mournyng vnto egyptyans wherfore name place called mournyng egyptian beyonde iordane sonnes dyd vnto hym accordynge cōmaūded sonnes caryed hym gene 49 c actes vii • lande canaan buryed hym double caue felde whiche caue gene 23 abraham bought felde also place bury ephron hethite mamre ioseph returned egypte agayne brethrē al went vp hym bury father soone buryed hym iosephs brother sawe theyr father dead sayd ioseph myght fortune hate v gene 37 • rewarde v agayne al euyl whiche dyd vnto hym dyd cōmaundement vnto ioseph sayng thy father charged v deth sayng wyse shal ye say vnto ioseph forgyue pray trespace thy brother theyr syn rewarded euyl pray forgyue trespace seruauntes thy father god ioseph wepte whē spake vnto hym brother came vnto hym fel flat face sayeng behold thy seruaūtes ioseph sayd gene 45 • feare god ye thought euyll agaynst god turned vnto good bryng passe day saue moche people alyue fere therfore wyl noryshe chyldren conforted spake kyndly vnto ioseph dwelt egypte father house ioseph lyued c x yere ioseph saw tobi 14 • iob xlii psal 117 • ephraims chyldrē euen vnto thyrd generacion vnto machir sonne manasses chyldren borne iosephs knee ioseph sayd vnto brother dye god wyll surely visite brynge land vnto land whiche sware vnto abraham isaac iacob ioseph toke othe chyldrē israel sayeng god wyl fayle visite ye shall carye hebre xi exod xiii iosu • 24 g bone hence ioseph dyed hundred x yere olde enbawmed hym spice puttyng hym chest egypte ¶ ende fyrst boke moses called hebrue bereschith latyn genesis ¶ seconde boke moses called hebrue uelle schemoth latyn exodus ¶ chyldren iacob nombred new pharao oppresseth acte godly mydwyuee capi name gene 46 b chyldren israel came egypte iacob euery man came housholde ruben symeon leui iuda isachar zabulon bentamin dan neptalt gad aser soules came loynes iacob ixx ioseph egypt alredy ioseph dyed brother generacion •• e vi c psol • iiii c chyldren israell grewe encreased multiplied wared exceadyng myghtye lande full rose vp newe kyng egypte whiche knewe ioseph sayd vnto folke beholde people chyldren israel greater myghtyer come let v playe wysely lest multiplye lest happen yf chaunce warre ioyne selues vnto oure enemyes fyght agaynste v get lande therfore dyd set taske maysters ouer kepe vnder burden bylte vnto pharao treasure •• tie phiton rameses vexed multiplied grewe abhorred chyldren israel egyptian helde chyldren israel bondage without mercye therfore theyr lyfe bytter vnto cruel bondage clay brycke al maner worke feldes seruyce dyd vnto full tyranny kynge egypte sayde vnto mydwyues ebrues woman whiche one name sepkora phua offyce mydwyfe woman hebrues se byrth tyme boy ye shall kyll yf doughter shall lyue withstandynge mydwyues feared god dyd kyng egypte cōmaunded saued menchyldren kynge egypte called mydwyues sayd vnto haue ye delte maner haue saued men chyldren mydwyues answered pharao hebrues woman woman egypt sturdy woman delyuered ere mydwyues come god therfore delte well mydwyues people multiplyed waxed myghty fortuned bycause mywyues feared god made house pharao charged people sayenge men chyldren borne cast ryuer saue mayde chyldren alyue ¶ moses burne cast flagges taken vp pharaos doughter kylleth egyptian fleeth maryeth wyfe israelite crye vnto lorde capi ii went man exo 〈…〉 pat 〈…〉 house leuy toke doughter leuy wyfe conceyued bare son sawe proper chylde acte • 〈…〉 hebr • 〈…〉 hyd hym thre monethes whē coulde longer hyde hym toke basket bulrusshes dawbed slyme pytche layd chylde therin put flagges ryuers brynke syster stode farre wete wolde come actes 〈…〉 ii reg 〈…〉 doughter pharao came downe da • l▪ 〈…〉 wasshe selfe ryuer maydens walked along ryuers syde sawe basket amonge flagges sente mayde fetche whē opened sawe chylde beholde babe wepte compassyon sayde one hebrues chyldren sayd syster vnto pharaos doughter shal go call vnto nurse hebrues woman nurse chylde pharaos doughter answered go mayd ran called chyldes mother pharaos doughter sayde take chylde awaye nurse wyl rewarde woman toke chylde nursed vp chylde grewe brought vnto pharaos doughter made son called name moses bycause sayd toke hym water happened dayes moses waxed great wente vnto brother loked theyr burden spyed egyptian smytyng hebrue one brother loked rounde aboute saw man slewe egyptian hyd hym sand whē gone another day beholde two hebrues stroue togyther sayde vnto hym dyd wronge wherfore smytest thou thy felowe answered made man auctoryte • de vii gene xix iudge vse speakest thou kyll thou kylledst egyptyan moses feared sayd suretye thyng knowen pharao herde wente aboute • ee moses moses fleynge face pharao dwelte lande midian sat downe welles syde preest midian vii doughters came drewe water fylled troghes water theyr father shepe shepherdes came droue awaye moses stode vp helped watered theyr shepe whē came raguel theyr father sayd happeneth ye come soone day answered man egypte delyuered v hande shepherdes drewe v water watered shepe sayde vnto doughters haue ye lefte man call hym may eate breade moses content dwell man gaue moses zephora doughter whiche bare sonne exod 18 called hym gerson sayde haue ben straunger straunge lande ❀ bare yet another sonne vvhome called elieser sayenge god father myn helper hath ryd handes pharao chaunced processe tyme kynge egypte dyed chyldren israell syghed reason bondage cryed theyr complaynte came vp vnto god bondage god herde theyr mone god remembred promyse abraham isaac iacob god loked vpon chyldren israel god respecte vnto ¶ moses hopeth shepe seeth god busshe sent chyldren israell pharao cyrauiit capi iii moses kepte shepe ••• e 18 iethro father lawe▪ preest midian droue flocke backesyde deserte came mountayne god horeb •••• 14 • ne vii angell lorde appeared vnto hym flambe fyre myddꝭ busshe loked behold busshe burned fyre bussh • consumed therfore moses sayde wyll go nowe se great syght cometh busshe burneth lorde sawe came se god called vnto hym myddes busshe sayd moses moses answered sayd iosu • v come hyther put thy shoe thy fete place whereon thou standest holy grounde sayd math 22 c • xii c luke xx e god thy father god abraham god isaac god iacob moses hyd face afrayed loke vpon god lorde sayde haue surely seue trouble people egypt exod xxii • eccle xxi haue herde theyr crye frō face theyr taske maysters knowe theyr sorowes come downe delyuer hande egyptyans brynge lande vnto good land large vnto lande floweth mylke hony euen vnto place cananites hethytes amorites pherezites heuites iebusites therfore complaynt chyldren israel come vnto haue also sene oppressyon wherwith egyptian oppresse come thou therfore wyll sende vnto pharao yu mayst brynge people chyldren israel egypt moses sayd vnto god go vnto pharao brynge chyldren israel egypte answered wyll shall token vnto haue sent yu hast brought people egypt ye shall serue god vpon mountayne moses sayde vnto god beholde come vnto chyldren israel shal say vnto god father hath sent vnto yf saye vnto name answere shall gyue god answered moses sayd shalte thou say vnto chyldren israel hath sent vnto god spake vnto moses thus shalte thou say vnto chyldren israel hebre xi • lorde god youre father god abraham god isaac god iacob hath sent vnto name euer memoryall generacyon generacyon go gather elder israel togyther thou shalte saye vnto lorde god father god abraham god isaac god iacob appeared vnto sayde visityng haue visited know whiche done egypte haue sayde wyll brynge tribulacyon egypte vnto lande cananytes hethyres amory • es▪ pherezites heuytes iebusytes euen vnto lande floweth mylke hony heare thy voyce go bothe thou elder israell shall go vnto kynge egypte saye vnto hym lorde god hebrues hath met v wyll go therfore thre dayes iourney wyldernes sacrifyce vnto lorde oure god sure kynge egypte wyll let go myghtye hande wyll stretche myne hande smyte egypte wonder whiche wyll myddes therof wyll let go exodi xi x • c wyll get people fauour syght egyptian ye go ye shal go emptie wyfe shall borowe neyghboures soiourneth house iewels syluer golde rayment ye shall put sonnes doughters shall • ob egyptian ¶ moses receyueth sygnes callynge goeth egypte wyfe zephora circumcised sonne aaron •••• moses capi iiii moses answered sayd se wyl byleue herkē vnto voyce wyll say lorde hath appeared vnto lorde sayd vnto hym whiche thyne hande answered rod sayde cast grounde cast grounde became serpente moses fled syght lorde sayd vnto moses put forth thyne hande take tayle therfore put forth hand caught became rod hande thynge sayth shall byleue lorde god theyr father god abraham god isaac god iacob hath appeared vnto lorde sayd forthermore vnto hym thrust thyne hande thy bosome thrust hande bosome toke agayne beholde hand leperous euen snowe sayde put thyne hande thy bosome agayne put hande bosome agayne plucked bosome beholde turned agayne flesshe therfore yf wyll byleue neyther heare voyce fyrst token yet wyl byleue voyce seconde tokē yf wyll byleue two sygnes neyther herken vnto thy voyce thou shalte take water ryuer powre vpon drye lande water whiche thou takest ryuer shall turne bloode vpon drye lande moses sayd vnto lorde oh lorde eloquent yesterday ere yesterday namely synce thou hast spokē vnto thy seruaunt slowe mouthed slowe tonged lorde sayde vnto hym hath made man mouth hath made dombe deafe seyng blynd haue lorde therfore math 〈…〉 wyll thy mouthe teache thou shalte say sayd oh lorde sende pray hande hym thou wylte sende lorde angry moses sayd know aaron thy brother leuyte speake lo cometh forth mete seeth wyll glad herte therfore thou shalte speake vnto hym put wordes mouth wyl thy mouth mouth wyll teache ye ought shall thy spokesman vnto people also shall thy mouth thou shalte god thou shalte take rod thy hande wherwith thou shalte myracles therfore moses wente returned iethro father lawe agayne sayde vnto hym wyl go nowe turne agayne vnto brother whiche egypte se whyther yet alyue iethro sayd moses go peace lorde sayde vnto moses midian go returne agayne egypte math 〈…〉 men deade whiche wente aboute kyll moses toke wyfe sonnes put asse went agayne egypte moses toke rod god hande lorde sayde vnto moses thou arte entred come egypte agayne se thou wondres pharao whiche haue put thy hande wyll holde exod • 〈…〉 herte shal let people go thou shalte say vnto pharao thus sayeth lorde israel myn eldest sonne haue sayde vnto thou shuldest let sonne go maye serue thou woldest let hym go beholde wyll exod 〈…〉 slee thyne eldest sonne chaunced waye inne lorde met hym wolde haue kylled hym zephora toke stone cut awaye foreskyn sonne fell feete sayde bloody husbande arte thou vnto let hym go sayde bloody husbande bycause circumcision sayde lorde vnto aaron go mete moses wyldernes went met hym mount god kyssed hym moses told aaron al wordes lorde sent hym token charged hym withal went moses aaron gathered elder chyldren israel aaron tolde al wordes lorde spoken vnto moses dyd myracles syght people people byleued herde lorde visited chyldren israel loked vpon theyr tribulacion bowed theyr head worshipped ¶ moses aaron go vnto pharao peple oppressed •• ye vpō moses aaron therfore capi v moses aaron went afterwarde tolde pharao thus sayth lorde god israel let people go may kepe holy day vnto wyldernes pharao sayd 〈◊〉 xxi • lorde shulde heare voyce let israel go knowe lorde neyther wyl let israel go sayd god hebrues hath met v therfore wyl go thre dayes iourney deserte sacrifice vnto lorde god leest happen vnto v eyther pestylence swerde sayd kynge egypte vnto wherfore ye moses aaron let people theyr workes get vnto laboure pharao sayd furthermore beholde moche people nowe land ye make leaue theyr worke pharao cōmaunded daye vnto taske maysters whiche among people vnto offycers sayeng ye shal gyue people strawe make brycke withall ye dyd tyme passed let go gather strawe selues nombre brycke whiche wonte make tyme passed lay vnto theyr charge also mynyshe nothyng therof ydle therfore crye sayeng wyll go sacrifice vnto god must haue worke layde vpon may laboure therin regarde vayne wordes went taske maysters people officer tolde people thus say pharao wyll gyue strawe go selues gather strawe ye fynde yet shall none laboure mynysshed people scatered abrode thorowe lande egypte gather stubble steade strawe taske maysters hasted forwarde sayenge fulfyll workes day day euen yf ye strawe offycers chyldren israel whiche pharaos taske maysters set ouer beaten sayd vnto wherfore haue ye fulfylled taske makynge brycke bothe yesterdaye daye well tyme passed offycers also chyldren israel came complayned vnto pharao sayeng wherfore dealest thou thus thy seruaū te strawe gyuen vnto thy seruauntes say vnto v make brycke thy seruauntes beaten thy people foule intreated sayde ydell ye ydell therfore ye say wyll go sacrifice vnto lorde go therfore nowe worke shal strawe gyuen yet shal ye delyuer hole tale brycke offycers chyldren israel dyd heuynes loke sayd ye shall mynysshe nothynge dayly makynge brycke met moses aaron whiche stode theyr waye came pharao sayd vnto lorde loke vnto iudge whiche hath made sauoure v stynke eye pharao eye seruauntes haue put swerde theyr hande • ee v moses returned vnto lorde sayde lorde wherfore hast thou delte cruelly people wherfore hast thou sent synce came pharao speake thy name hath fared foule folke yet thou hast delyuered thy people lorde sayde vnto moses nowe shalte thou se wyll vnto pharao myghtye hande shall let go exod 1 • • myghty hande shall dryue lande ¶ god promyseth delyueraunce lande canaan ge •• alogie ruben simeon le •• capi vi god spake vnto moses sayde vnto hym lorde appeared vnto abraham isaac iacob almyghtye god name iehouah knowen vnto moreouer •••• 17 • made apoyntment gyue lande canaan lande theyr pylgrymage wherin straungers haue also herde gronynge chyldrē israel egyptian kepe bondage haue remembred couenaū • wherfore saye vnto chyldren israel lorde wyll brynge burden egyptian wyl ryd theyr bondage wyll delyuer stretched arme great iudgementes wyll take people wyl god ye shal knowe lorde god brynge frō burden eypgtians wyll brynge vnto lande cōcernyng dyd lyft vp hande gyue vnto abraham isaac iacob wyll gyue vnto possessyon euen lorde moses tolde chyldren israel euen herkened vnto moses anguysshe spiryte cruell bondage lorde spake vnto moses sayenge go speake vnto pharao kyng egypt let chyldren israell go lande moses spake lorde sayenge beholde chyldren israell herken vnto howe shal pharao heare whiche vncircucised lyppes lorde spake vnto moses vnto aaron gaue charge vnto chyldren israell vnto pharao kynge egypte brynge chyldren israel lande egypte heedes theyr father house gene 46 • erodi nume 26 • • para v chyldren ruben eldest sonne israell hanoh pallu hezron charmi housholdes ruben chyldren simeon gemuel iamin ohad iachim zohar saul sonne cananites wyfe kynreddes symeon also 1 para 6 xxiii • nume 〈◊〉 ▪ • xxvi • name chyldren leui theyr generacyons gerson kahath merari leui lyued hundred xxxvii yeres sonnes gerson libui semei theyr kynreddes chyldren kahath amram iezear hebron usiel kahath lyued hundred xxxiii yere chyldren merari maheli musi kynreddes leui theyr generacyons •••• ii amram toke nume 26 • iochebed nece wyfe bare hym aaron moses maria amram lyued hundred xxxvii yere chyldren iezear korah nepheg sichri chyldren usiel misael elxapha • sithri aaron toke elizaba doughter aminadab syster naason wyfe whiche bare hym nadab abihu eleazar ithamar chyldren korah assir elkana ab • assaph kynreddes korahites eleazar aaron toke hym one doughters putuel wyfe whiche bare hym pinehas principall father leuites thorowe theyr kynreddes aaron moses lorde sayd bryng chyldren israel lande egypt accordyng theyr armyes moses aaron whiche spake pharao kynge egypte myght brynge chyldren israel egypte day lorde spake vnto moses lande egypte spake vnto hym sayenge lorde speake thou vnto pharao kyng egypte say vnto moses sayde lorde beholde exod▪ 〈◊〉 vncircumcised lyppes shall pharao gyue audience ¶ token knowe god rod moses turned serpent sorcerer euen water turned bloode capi vii lorde sayde vnto moses beholde haue made pharaos god aaron thy brother shall thy prophete thou shalte speake cōmaū ded aaron thy brother shall speake vnto pharao sende chyldren israel lande exod▪ 〈◊〉 wyl harden pharaos herte multiplie myracles wondres lande egypte pharao shall herken vnto maye set myne hande vpon egypte brynge myne armyes people chyldren israel lande egypt great iudgementes egyptyans shal know lorde whē stretch forth hande vpon egypt bryng chyldren israel amonge moses aaron dyd lorde cō maūded euen dyd moses lxxx yere olde aaron lxxxiii spake vnto pharao lorde spake vnto moses aaron saynge pharao speake vnto saynge shewe wonder thou shalt say vnto aarō take thy rod cast pharao may serpent thē went moses aaron vnto pharao dyd euen lorde cōmaunded aaron cast forth rod pharao seruauntes exod▪ 〈◊〉 turned serpent pharao called wyse men ii 〈◊〉 ▪ enchaūters wyse men egypte dyd lyke maner theyr sorcery cast downe euery man rod turned serpentꝭ aaron rod dyd eate vp theyr roddes hardened pharaos herte herkened vnto euen lorde sayd lorde also sayde vnto moses pharaos herte hardened refuseth let people go get vnto pharao mornynge lo wyll come vnto water thou shalte stande apon ryuers brynke agaynste come rod turned serpent shalt thou take thyne hande thou shalte saye vnto hym lorde god hebrues hath sent vnto saynge exods 8 let peple go may serue wyldernes behold hytherto thou woldest thus sayeth lorde thou shalte know lorde beholde wyll smyte rod myn hande water ryuer shal turne blode fysshe ryuer shall dye ryuer shal stynke shal greue egyptiās drynke water ryuer lorde spake vnto moses say vnto aaron take thy rod stretche thyn hande ouer water egypt ouer theyr streames ouer theyr ryuers pondes pole water haue maye bloode may blode thorowe lande egypte bothe vessel woode also stoone moses aaron dyd euen lorde cō maunded lyfte vp rod smote water riuer syght pharao syght seruauntes water ryuer turned bloode fysshe ryuer dyed psal 78 e •• 〈◊〉 • ryuer stank egyptian coude drynke water ryuer bloode thorowout lande egypt enchaū ters egypt dyd lykewyse theyr sorceryes hardened pharaos herte neyther dyd herken vnto •• od iiii 〈◊〉 vii lorde sayd pharao turned selfe went agayne house set herte vnto egiptians dygged round aboute ryuer water drynke coulde drynke water ryuer contynued weke lorde smyten ryuer ¶ plage frogges▪ moses prayeth pharao plage lyse capi viii lorde spake vnto moses go vnto pharao tell hym ▪ thus sayeth lorde •• od vii • 〈◊〉 ▪ x let people goo maye serue yf thou wyll let go beholde wyl smyte al thy border frogges ryuer shall serall frogges whiche shall go vp come thyne house thy preuy chambre thou slepest vpon thy bed house thy seruauntes vpon thy people thyne ouens vpon thy meates frogges shall come vpon thy people vpon thy seruauntes psal 78 • and▪ cv • lorde spake vnto moses saye vnto aaron stretche forth thyne hande thy rod ouer stremes ouer riuers ouer pondes thou mayest bryng vp frogges vpon lande egypt aarō stretched hande ouer water egypte frogges came vp couered lande egypte sorcerer dyd lykewyse wt theyr sorcery brought frogges vp vpon lande egypte pharao called moses aaron sayd 3 reg 13 • exodi • • x • actes viii • praye ye vnto lorde may take away frogges people wyll let people go may sacrifyce vnto lorde moses sayde vnto pharao reioyse thou ouer appoynte shall pray thy seruauntes thy people dryue awaye frogges thy house maye remayne ryuer onely sayde morowe sayde euen thou hast sayde thou mayst knowe none lyke vnto lorde god frogges shal departe thy house thy seruauntes thy people shall remayne ryuer onely moses aaron went pharao moses cryed vnto lorde vpon apoyntment frogges whiche made vnto pharao lorde dyd accordyng sayeng moses frogges dyed house courtes feldes gathered togy ther vpon heapes land stanke pharao sawe rest gyuen hym hardened herte herkened vnto lorde sayde lorde sayde vnto moses saye vnto aaron stretche thy rod smyte dust lande may turne lyse thorow lande egypte dyd aaron stretched hand rod smote dust earth whiche turned lyse man beast al dust lande turned lyse thorowout land egypt▪ enchaunters assayde lykewyse theyr enchauntmentes brynge forth lyse coulde lyse bothe vpon men beastes sayde enchaunters vnto pharao fyngre god pharaos herte remayned obstynate herkened vnto euen erodi 7 lorde sayde lorde sayd vnto moses ryse vp early mornynge stande pharao wyll come forthe vnto water thou shalt say vnto hym thus sayeth lorde let people go may serue el yf thou wylte let people go beholde wyll sende maner flees vpon thy seruaūtes thy people thy house house egyptian shall full flees groūd wheron lande gene 47 f gosan people wyll cause wonderfull daye shall flees wherby thou shalte knowe lorde myddes earth wyl put diuisiō bytwene people thyne euen morowe shall myracle done lorde dyd euen came noysome flees house pharao seruauntes house lande egypte lande corrupt flees pharao called moses aaron sayde go sacrifyce vnto god lande moses answered mete must offre vnto lorde god abhominacyon vnto egyptian yf sacrifice abhominacion vnto egyptian theyr eye shulde stoone v wyll go thre dayes iournay deserte sacrifyce vnto lorde god exodi lii f hath cōmaunded v pharao sayd wyll let go ye may sacrifice vnto lorde god wyldernesse go farre away praye moses sayd beholde wyll go pray vnto lorde flees maye departe pharao seruauntes people morowe let pharao hence forth deceyue wyl let people go sacrifyce vnto lorde moses went pharao prayed vnto lorde lorde dyd accordyng say enge moses flees departed pharao seruauntes people remayned one pharao hardened herte euen also dyd let people go ¶ moren beastes plage botch sore hortyble hayle thonder lyghtnynge capi ix lorde sayde vnto moses go vnto pharao thou shalte tell hym thus sayeth lorde god ebrues exodi 7 • let people go maye serue yf thou wylte let go wylte holde styll beholde hande lorde vpon thy flocke felde vpō horse ass camel ox shepe shalbe myghtye greate morray ne lorde shall wonderfully bytwene beastes israell beastes egypte shall nothynge dye perteyneth chyldren israell lorde appoynted tyme sayeng morowe lorde shall fynysh worde lande lorde dyd morowe cattell egypte dyed cattell chyldren israell dyed one pharao sent beholde one cattell israelite deade herte pharao hardened wold let people go lorde sayd vnto moses aarō take handꝭ ful asshes four nace moses shal sprynkel vp ayre syght pharao shall turne dust lande egypte maye swellynge soores blaynes man beest thorowout lande egypt toke asshes fournace stode pharao moses sprynkled vp ayre soores blaynes mē beastes sorceres coulde stand moses bycause blaynes bot ches vpon enchaunters vpon egiptians lorde hardened herte pharao herkened vnto exod • lorde sayd vnto moses lorde sayd vnto moses ryse vp early mornyng stande pharao thou shalt tell hym thus sayeth lorde god ebrues exodi • let people go maye serue el wyll tyme sende plage vpon thyne herte vpon thy seruauntes thy people thou mayst knowe none lyke earth wyl stretch hande may smyte thy people pestylence thou shalte petysshe earth verye dede rom • psal 4 cause haue kept shewe power myght declare name thorowout worlde yet thou exaltest thy selfe agaynste people thou wylt let thē go behold morowe tyme wyll sende downe myghtye great hayle euen one egypte synce grounded vnto tyme sende therfore nowe gather thy beastes thou hast felde vpon men beastes whiche founde felde brought home shall hayle fall shall dye many feared word lorde among seruaūtes pharao made theyr seruaū te theyr beastes flee house regarded worde lorde lefte seruaūtes beastes felde lorde sayde vnto moses stretch forth thy hande vnto heuen maye hayle lande egypt vpon men vpon beastes vpon al herbes felde thorowout lande egypt moses stretched rod vnto heuen lorde thondred hayled fyre ran longe vpon ground psal 78 c cv c lorde hayled lande egypt hayle fyre mengled hayle greuous suche noone thorowout lande egypt synce people inhabyted hayle smote thorowout lande egypt al felde man beast hayle smote herbes felde broke al tree felde onely lande gosan chyldren israel hayle pharao sent called moses aaron sayde vnto haue nowe synned lorde ryghteous people ☞ vngodly exodi 8 b praye ye vnto lorde moch shuld thonders god hayle wyl let go ye shall tarye longer moses sayd vnto assoone citie wyl sprede abrode handes vnto lorde thonder shal cease neyther shal hayle thou mayst knowe howe earth lordes knowe thou thy seruauntes yet feare ☞ face lorde god flaxe barly smytten barly shotte vp flax bolled wheate rye smyten late sowne moses went citye pharao spred abrode handes vnto lorde thonder hayle ceased neyther rayned vpon earth pharao sawe rayne hayle thonder ceased syn̄ed agayne hardened herte seruaūtes herte pharao hardened neyther wolde let chyldren israell go lorde sayde ☞ hande moses ¶ herte pharao hardened god greshoppers thycke darnesse capi x lorde sayde vnto moses go vnto pharao exod iiii haue hardened herte herte seruauntes myght put sygnes amongest thou tel audience thy sonne thy sonnes son thynges haue done egypt myracles haue done among ye may know howe lorde moses aaron came vnto pharao sayde vnto hym thus sayeth lorde god hebrues longe shal thou wylt submyt thy selfe vnto exodi 8 • • let people god maye serue dr el ❀ yf thou resyst wylte let people go beholde morowe wyl brynge greshoppers thy coostes shall couer face earth sene shal eate residewe whiche remayneth vnto escaped frō hayle shall eate euery grene tree beareth fruyte felde shal fyl thy house thy seruaūtes house house al egyptian suche maner neyther thy father thy father father haue sene synce tyme vpon earth vnto day turned himselfe aboute went pharao pharaos seruaūtes sayd vnto hym howe longe shall slaunder vnto v let men go may serue lorde theyr god knowest thou yet egypte destroyed moses aaron brought agayne vnto pharao sayde vnto go serue lorde god shal go moses answered wyll go younge olde yea sonnes doughters shepe ox must god muste holde feast vnto lorde sayde vnto let lorde let go chyldrē also take hede ye haue myscheyfe hande naye go men serue lorde desyre thrust thē pharaos presence lorde sayd vnto moses stretch thy hande ouer lande egypt greshoppers may come vpon lande egypte eate herbes lande hayle lefte behynde moses stretched forth rod ouer lande egypt lorde brought east wynde vpon lande daye nyght mornynge east wynde psal 〈◊〉 c sapi xvi b iohe • brought greshoppers greshop pers went vp ouer lande egypte remayned quarter egypt greuously greshoppers neyther shalbe couered face earth lande darke dyd eate herbes lande al fruytes tree whatsoeuer hayle lefte grene thynge lefte tree herbes felde thorow al land egypt therfore pharao called moses aaron haste sayde haue synned agaynst lorde god agaynst nowe forgyue synne onely exodi ix • praye vnto lorde god may take awaye frō ☞ death onely moses went pharao prayed vnto lorde lorde turned myghtye stronge west wynde toke awaye greshoppers cast redde see one greshopper al coost egypt lorde exodi 4 • hardened pharaos herte wolde let chyldren israell go lorde sayd vnto moses stretch thy hande vnto heuen may vpon lande egypt darkenesse whiche may felte moses stretched forth hande vnto heuen thycke sapi 17 darkenesse vpon lande egypte thre dayes longe man sawe another neyther rose vp place space thre dayes chyldrē israel lyght dwelled pharao called moses sayd go serue lorde onely let shepe ox abyde let youre chyldren go moses sayde thou muste gyue v also offeryngꝭ burntoffrynges sacrifyce vnto lorde god cattel also shal go v shal one hooffe lefte behynde therof muste take serue lorde god neyther knowe shall offre vnto lorde vntyll come thyther lorde hardened pharaos herte wolde let goo pharao sayde vnto hym get take hede thy selfe se face soeuer thou comest syght thou shalte dye moses sayde let thou hast sayde wyl se thy face ¶ lorde cōmaundeth robbe egyptian death fyrst begotten egypte capi xi lorde sayde vnto moses yet wyll brynge one plage vppon pharao vpon egypte wyll let go hence letteth goo shall vtterly dryue hence speake thou therfore care people euery mā borow nyghbour euery woman neyghbourresse exodi 〈◊〉 xii 〈◊〉 iewels syluer iewels golde lorde shal gyue people fauoure syght egyptian moreouer eccle 〈◊〉 moses greate lande egypte syght pharaos seruauntes syght people moses sayde thus sayth lorde exod • 〈◊〉 mydnyght wyll go myddes egypt al fyrst borne lande egypt shal dye euen fyrste borne pharao ☞ sytteth seate vnto fyrst borne mayde seruaunt behynde mylle fyrste gendred cattell shall greate crye thorowout lande egypte suche neuer none lyke shalbe amonge chyldren israell shal dogge moue tongue yet man beast ye maye knowe howe lorde ❀ great miracle putteth dyfference bytwene egyptian israel thy seruaūtes shal come downe vnto fall saye get al people vnder wyl departe went pharao angry countenaunce lorde sayde vnto moses pharao shal heare wōders may multiplyed lande egypte moses aaron dyd wondres ❀ token vvhiche vvritten pharao lorde hardened pharaos herte wolde let chyldren israell go lande capi xii ¶ passeouer eaten swete breade muste teache theyr chyldren passeouer signifyeth destruceyō fyrst begotten egypt robberye egyptian goynge israelite ✚ lorde spake vnto moses aarō land egipt sayng moneth shal vnto begynnynge monethes fyrst moneth yere shal vnto speake ye vnto congregacion israell sayenge tenth daye moneth euery man take vnto hym ☞ lambe accordynge house father lambe thorowout euery house yf housholde lytle ☞ lambe let hym take neyghbour whiche nexte vnto house accordynge nombre soules euery one accordynge carynge shall make youre counte lambe let lambe youres blemyshe male yere olde ye shall take among shepe amonge gootes ye shall kepe hym vntyll •• xiv • xiiii day moneth euery man multytude israell shal kyll hym euen shal take bloode stryke two syde postes vpper dorepost euen house shall eate hym shal eate fleshe nyght roost fyre vnleuended breade sowre herbꝭ shall eate se ye eate therof rawe soden water roost fyre head feete purtenaūce ther ye shall let nothynge remayne vnto mornynge remayneth vntyll morowe shall ye burne fyre maner shall ye eate loynes gyrded shoe fete staues handes ye shal eate hast lordꝭ passeouer ⊢ wyll passe thorowe lande egypt nyght wyll smyte fyrste borne lande egypt bothe man beast vpon al goddes egypt wyl lorde execution blode shal vnto token house wherin ye se bloode wyll passe ouer plage shall vpō dystroye smyte land egypte daye shall vnto remembraunce ye shal kepe hooly vnto lorde euen thorowout geueracyons shall ye kepe holy daye custome ☞ euer exod 23 b • xxxiiii c seuen dayes shal ye eate vnleuended breade fyrst daye ye shall put awaye leuen house whosoeuer eateth leuēded bread fyrst daye vntyl seuenth day soule shalbe plucked frō israel leui xxiii • nume 28 c fyrst day shalbe holy conuocacyon seuēth day shalbe holy cōuocacion vnto shall maner worke done thē saue onely euery man must eate onely may ye ye shall obserue vnleuended breade daye haue brought armyes land egypt therfore ye shall obserue day al chyldren custome euer leui 23 • nume 28 c fyrst moneth xiiii day moneth euen ye shall eate swete breade vnto xxi daye moneth euen agayne seuen dayes shall leuended bread foūde house whosoeuer eateth leuended bread soule shalbe roted frō multitude israel whyther straunger borne land ye shal eate nothyng leuended al habitacyons shal ye eate swete breade moses called elder israel sayde vnto chose take euery housholde shepe kyl passeouer take bunche ysop dyp blood basyn stryke vpper poste two syde postes blode basyn noone go dore house vntyl mornynge lorde wyl go aboute smyte egyptian seeth bloode vpō vpper dore post two syde postes wyl passe ouer dore wyll suffre dystroyer come youre house plage therfore shall ye obserue thynge ordynaunce bothe thy sonnes euer ye come land lorde wyll gyue accordynge hath promysed ye shal kepe seruyce iosu • 4 chyldren aske maner seruyce ye ye shal say sacryfyce lordꝭ passeouer passed ouer house chyldren israell egypte smote egyptian saued house people bowed selues worshypped chyldren israel went dyd lorde cōmaunded moses aaron euen dyd exodi • • psal 135 • sapi 18 c mydnyght lorde smote al fyrst borne lande egypt frō fyrst borne pharao sat seat vn fyrst borne captyue pryson al fyrste gendred cattell pharao arose nyght al seruauntes al egyptian sapi 18 • greate cryenge egypte house one dead called vnto moses aarō nyght saynge ryse vp get amonge people ye also chyldren israel go serue lorde ye haue sayde take shepe droues ye haue sayd departed ☞ gene 27 • blesse egyptian ferce vpon people myght sende lande hast sayde dye people toke theyr dough soured theyr vytayles bounde clothes vpon theyr shoulder chyldren israel dyd accordyng sayenge moses borowed egyptiansexodi iii g iewels syluer iewels golde rayment lorde gaue people fauour syght egyptian graunted suche thyngꝭ requyred robbed egyptian nume 33 chyldrē israell toke theyr iourney rameses suchoth nume xi • vi hundred thousande men foote besyde chyldren moch comen people went also shepe exon excedynge greate flocke baked swete cakꝭ dough whiche brought egypt sowred whē thrust egyptian coulde tarye prepare selues prouisyō meat dwellyng chyldren israel dwelled egypt gene xv c iudic v b actes vii gala iii c iiii hundred xxx yeres whē iiii hundred xxx yeres expyred euē selfe daye departed hostes lorde lande egypt nyght obserued lord brought lande egypte nyght lorde whiche al chyldrē israel must kepe thorowout theyr generacyons lorde sayd vnto moses aaron law passeouer shal straūger eate therof euery seruaūt bought money thou hast circumcysed hym shal eate therof straunger hyred seruaunt shall eate therof one house shall eaten thou shalt carye noone flesshe house iob xix g neyther shall ye breake • nu ix b bone therof multytude shall obserue yf straunger also dwel amonge wyll holde passeouer vnto lorde let cyrcumcyse male let hym come obserue shalbe one borne lande vncyrcumcysed shal eate ther one maner lawe shalbe vnto hym ☞ borne lande vnto straūger dwelleth amonge chyldren israel dyd lorde cōmaunded moses aaron euen dyd selfe daye dyd lorde brynge chyldren israel lande egypt theyr armyes ¶ fyrst • egotten must sanctifyed vnto lorde memory theyr delyueraunce • ntye • thorow wyldernes bone ioseph pyller cloude capi xiii lorde spake vnto moses sayenge exodi 〈…〉 nume 〈…〉 luke ii sayntifye vnto fyrst borne open maner matrix amonge chyldren israel well man beast myne moses sayde vnto people thynke day ye came egipt house bon dage thorowe myghtye hande lorde brought thence shal cor •• leuended bread eaten day come ye moneth ☞ corne begynneth rype exodi 〈…〉 〈…〉 xxxiii • lorde brought lande cananytes hethites amorites heuytes iebusites gene 〈…〉 exodi 〈…〉 whiche sware vnto thy father wolde gyue lande wherein mylke hony floweth y• shalt kepe seruice moneth seuen dayes thou shalt eate swete breade deutt 〈…〉 vii day feast lord swete breade shalbe eaten seuen dayes shal leuended breade sene yet leuen al thy quarter thou shalt shewe thy son day saynge doone bycause whiche lorde dyd vnto came egypt shalbe sygne vnto vpon thyne hande remembraunce bytwene thyne eye lordes lawe maye thy mouth psal 〈…〉 stronge hand lorde brought egypt kepe therfore ordynaunce season yere yere wyl come passe lorde shal brynge lande cananites whiche gene 〈…〉 sware vnto thy father shal gyue thou shalt appoynte vnto lorde openeth matryce ☞ euery thynge cast fyrst doth open matryce beast whiche thou hast yf male shalbe lordes euery fyrst gendred asse thou shalt redeme lambe yf thou redeme hym thou shalt breake necke fyrst borne amonge thy chyldren also shalte thou bye thy sonne asketh ☞ morowe sayenge thou shalte say vnto hym myghtye hande lorde brought v egypte house bondage ☞ whē pharao looth let v go lorde slewe fyrste borne lande egipt wel fyrst borne man beast therfore sacryfyce vnto lorde male open matryce fyrst borne chyldren redeme shalbe token vpon thyne hande remembraunce bytwene thyne eye lorde brought egypte thorowe myghtye hande came passe pharao let people go god caryed thē thorowe way lande philystynes whiche nye waye god sayde leest people haplye repente se warre turne agayne egypt god led peple aboute thorow way wyldernesse red see chyldren israel went vp harnessed lande egypte moses toke bone ioseph hym made chyldren israel swere sayeng • ene l • sue 24 g god wyll surely vyset ye shall take bone awaye hence • ume 33 b toke theyr iourney frō suchoth abode etham edge wyldernes • ume 14 c • orin x • sai ii ii b lorde wente daye pyller cloude leade waye nyght pyller fyre gyue thē lyght myght go bothe day nyght nehe ix pyller cloude departed daye pyller fyre nyght syght people ¶ pharaos herte hardeued foloweth israelite hoost capitaynes drowned israelite grudge go thorowe red see capi xiiii lorde spake vnto moses sayenge speake chyldrē israel turne remayne pi hiroth bytwene mygdol see ouer agaynst • ume 33 b baalzephon shall pytch see pharao wyl say chyldren israel tangled lande wyldernes hath shut wyll harden pharaos herte shall folowe wyl get honoure vpon pharao vpon hoost egyptian also shal know lorde dyd euen tolde kyng egypt people fled herte pharao seruauntes turned agaynst people sayde haue doone haue let israel go seruyce made redy charettes toke people hym toke vi hundred chosen charettes al charettes egipt cap taynes vpon euery one lord hardened herte pharao kynge egypt folowed chyldrē israell chyldren israell went psal 135 b hye hande egyptian folowed al horse charettes pharao horseman hoste oueroke abydynge see besyde pi hiroth baalzephon pharao drew nye chyldren israell lyfte vp theyr eye beholde egyptian folowed sore afrayed io •• e 24 • chyldren israell cryed vnto lorde sayd vnto moses bycause graues egypt hast thou therfore brought v awaye dye wyldernesse wherfore haste thou serued v thus carye v egipte dyd tel egypt saynge let v rest maye serue egyptian ben better v haue serued egiptians dye wyl dernesse moses sayde vnto people ii pat xx c feare ye stande styl beholde howe lorde shall saue daye ye haue sene egyptian daye shall se nomore euer lorde shal fyght ye shall holde peace lorde sayde vnto moses wherfore cryest thou vnto speake vnto chyldrē israel go forwarde lyfte thou vp thy rod stretch thy hande ouer see deuyde sondre let chyldren israel go drye groūde thorow myddest see beholde wyll harden herte egyptian maye folow wyl get honour vpon pharao vpon hoost vpon charettes vpon horseman egyptian shal knowe lorde haue gotten honoure vpon pharao vpon charettes vpon horseman angell god whiche went hoost israell remoued began go behynde clowden pyller face begā stande behynde came bytwene hoost egyptian hoost israel ☞ also darke clowde gaue lyght nyght al nyght longe one came moses stretched forth hande ouer see lorde caryed away see stronge east wynde nyght made see drye lande water deuyded chyldren israel went myddest see vpon drye groūde water walle vnto theyr ryght hande theyr lefte hande egiptians folowed went myddest see euen pharaos horse charettes horseman ✚ mornyng watche lorde iudi ix loked vnto hoost egyptian fyrie clowdy pyller troubled hoost egyptian toke charet wheles caryed away violently egyptian sayd let v f • e face israell lorde fyghteth thē agaynst egyptian lorde sayde vnto moses stretche thyne hande ouer see water may come agayne vpon egiptian vpon charettes vpon horseman moses stretched forth hand ouer see came agayne course early mornynge egyptian fled agaynst sapi • lorde ouerthrew egyptian myddest see water returned couered charettes horseman hoost pharao came see remayned one child israel walked vpon drye lande esai 〈◊〉 thorowe myddest see water walle vnto ryght hande lefte mar 4 thus lorde delyuered israell selfe daye hande egyptian israell sawe egyptyans dead vpon see syde israell sawe myghtye power lorde shewed vpon egyptian psal cv people feared lorde byleued lorde seruaunt moses ¶ moyses people woman synge prayer moyses bytter water swete god must herde come elim capi xv moses chyldren israel sange songe vnto lorde sayd erod xv c wyl syng vnto lorde ⊢ hath triumphed gloriously horse rode vpon hym hath ouerthrowne see psal 118 c esa • xii lorde strength prayse become saluacion god wyll gloryfy hym fahthers god wyll exalte hym lorde man war lorde name pharaos charettes hoost hath cast see chosen captaynes also drowned red see deepe water haue couered soncke botom stone thy ryghthand lorde become glorious power thy ryghthande lorde hath dasshed enemye thy greate glory thou hast ouerthrowne rose vp agaynst thou sentest forth thy wrath cōsumed euen stoble thorow wynd thy nose thrylles water gathered togyther floodes stode styl heape depe water cōgeled togyther ☞ herte see enemye sayd wyl folowe wyl ouertake thē wyl deuyde spoyle wyll satisfye lust vppon wyll drawe swerde myne hande shall destroye thou blewest thy wynde see couered thē sanke lead mighty water lyke vnto lorde amonge god lyke gloryus holynesse ☞ fearfull prayses shewynge wondres thou stretchedst thy ryght hand earth swalowed thou thy mercye hast caryed people whiche thou delyuereds • haste brought thy strength vnto thy holy habytacyon nacyons herde afrayed sorowe came vpon philistine duke edomytes amased myghtyest moabites tremblynge came vppon al inhabyters canaan waxed faynt herted let feare drede fal vpon greatnesse thyne arme let styl stone tyl thy peple passe thorow lorde whyle people passe thorowe whiche thou hast gotten thou shalt brynge plante mountayne thyne enherytaunce place lorde yu hast made twel saintuary lord thy handes haue prepared lorde shall raygne ☞ euer alway pharaos horse went charettes horseman see lorde brought water see vpon chyldrē israel went drye lande myddest see myr iam prophetesse syster aaron toke tymbrell hande woman came tymbrels daunses myr iam sange exod 〈◊〉 ▪ • synge ye vnto lorde hath tryumphed gloryously horse ryder hath ouer throwen see moses brought israel frō red see went wyldernesse sur went thre dayes longe wyldernes founde water came mara coulde drynke water mara bytter therfore name place called mara ❀ say bytternesse people murmu red agaynst moses sayenge shall drynke iudi v • eccle 38 • deute ••• cryed vnto lorde ☞ lorde shewed hym tree caste water water made swete made ordynaunce lawe proued hym sayde yf thou wylt herken vnto voyce lorde thy god wylt ryght syght wylt gyue eare vnto cōmaundementes kepe al ordynaunces wyll put noone dyseases vpon whiche brought vpon egyptian lorde healeth ¶ israelite come desert syn • ayneth qu • yls mauna •• dge capi ✚ xvi nume 33 • chyldren israell came elim xii welles water lxx palme tree abode water toke theyr iourney elim hole company chyldren israel came wyldernes sin bytwene elim sinay xv daye second moneth theyr departyng lande egypte hole multitude chyldren israel nume xi murmuryng agaynst moses aaron wyldernes chyldren israel sayd vnto wold god dyed hande lorde land egypt whē sat fleshe pottes whē dyd eate breade belyes ful ye haue brought v wyl dernes kyl hole multitude wt hongre fayde lorde vnto moses behold wyll • ayne sapi 16 psal 78 r ioh • vi breade heuen people shal go gather day day maye proue whyther wyll walke law syxt day shal prepare selues whiche wyl brynge let twyse moche gather dayly moses aaron sayd vnto chyldrē israel euen ye shal knowe lorde whiche brought lande egypte mornynge ye shall se ☞ glorye lorde bycause hath herde grudgynges agaynst lorde ye haue murmured agaynste v moses sayd euen shal lord nume xi gyue flessh eate mornyng breade ynoughe lorde hath herde murmurynges whiche ye murmure agaynst hym murmurynges agaynst v agaynst lorde moses spake vnto aaron say vnto companye chyldren israel come forthe lorde hath herde grudgynges aaron spake vnto hole multitude chyldren israel loked towarde wyldernesse beholde glorye lorde appeared clowde ⊢ lorde spake vnto moses sayenge haue herde murmuryng chyldrē israel tell therfore say euen • shall eate flesshe mornyng ye shall fylled breade ye shall knowe lorde god euē nume • • quay le came couered grounde lay mornyng dewe lay rounde aboute hoost whē dewe fallen beholde laye vpon grounde wyldernesse small rounde thyn hore frost grounde whē chyldren israel sawe sayd euery one neyghbour ❀ ☞ manna wyst moses sayde vnto breade whiche lorde hath gyuen eate worde lorde hath cōmaūded gather euery man hym selfe eate gomer full man accordynge nombre take euery mā tent chyldren israel dyd euen gathered lesse dyd meate gomer vnto hym thati • co •• •• gathered moch remayned nothyng oue • vnto hym gathered ly • ell lacke euery man gathered sufficient eatyng moses sayd vnto se man let ought remayne tyll mornyng notwithstandyng herkened vnto moses lefte vntyll mornynge waxed full wormes stanke moses angry gathered mornynges euery man eatynge assoone heate sonne came moult syxte daye gathered twyse moche breade gomers one man al ruler multitude came tolde moses sayd vnto whiche lorde hath sayd morowe rest holy sabboth vnto lorde bake whiche ye wyll bake sethe ye wyl sethe remayneth lay vp tyll mornyng layde vp tyll mornyng moses bad stanke neyther bred worme therin moses sayde eate day sabboth vnto lorde day ye shal fynde felde syxe dayes ye shall gather seuenth daye whiche sabboth shalbe none notwithstandyng wente people seuenth day gather founde none lorde sayd moses howe longe refuse ye kepe cōmaundementes lawes se lorde hath gyuē sabboth therfore gyueth syxte day bread ii dayes byde therfore euery mā hom • let mā go place seuenth day people rested seuenth day house israel called manna nume xi • lyke vnto coriander seed whyte tast lyke vnto wafer made hony moses sayd whiche lorde cōmaundeth fyll gomer may kept chyldren may se breade wherwith haue fed wyldernesse brought lande egypt moses spake vn aarō take cruse put hebru ix b gomer full manna therin laye vp lorde kepte chyldren lorde cōmaunded moses aaron layde vp testimonye kepte si esd • iudicū v iesue v chyldren israel dyd eate manna xl yere vntyt came vnto lande inhabited dyd eate māna euen vntyl came vnto border land canaan gomor tenth parte epha ¶ israelytes come raphidim grudge water gyuen rocke moses holdeth vp handes ouercome amelechites capi xvii company chyldren israel thorowout theyr armyes wente wyldernesse syn cōmaundement lorde pytched nume 33 raphidim water people drynke people chode moses sayde gyue v water drynke moses sayde vnto chyde ye wherfore ye tempt lorde people thyrsted water people murmured agaynst moses sayde nume xx wherfore hast thou thus brought v egypte kyll v chyldren cattell thyrste moses cryed vnto lorde saynge shall vnto people almost redy stone lorde sayde vnto moses go people take elder israel thy rod wherwith thon smotest ryuer take thy hande go beholde psal 78 b corin x deute ix b stande besyde rocke horeb thou shalte smyte rocke shal come water therof people may drynke nume xx moses dyd euen eye elder israel called name place • e • tacyon massa stryfe meriba bycause chydyng chyldren israel bycause tempted lorde sayenge lorde among v came amalech fought israel raphidim moses sayd vnto iosua chose v men go fyght amalech morowe wyll stande top hyll rod god shall hande iosua dyd moses bad hym fought amalech moses aaron hur went vp top hyll hapned iudi iiii c deut 25 • moses helde vp hande israel better whē let hande downe amalech better moses handes heuy therfor toke stone put vnder hym sat downe theron aarō hur stayed vp handes one one syde syde handꝭ remayned stedie vntyl goynge downe sonne iosua dyscomfyted amalech people edge swerde lorde sayd vnto moses wryte remembraunce boke commyt vnto eares iosua nume 24 • • regū 15 • wyll vtterly put remembraunce amalech vnder heuen moses made aulter called name ❀ ☞ lorde worketh myracles sayde hande seate god lorde wyll haue war amalech generacyon generacyon ¶ iethros counsell receyued moses capi xviii iethro preest median moses father lawe herde god done moses israel people lorde brought israel egypt exodi iii iiii f therfore toke ziphora moses wyfe sent backe ii sonnes whiche one called exodi ii • gerson sayd haue ben alyent straūge land name eliesar god father sayde helpe delyucred swerde pharao iethro moses father lawe came two sonnes wyfe vnto moses wyldernes abode mount god sayde vnto moses thy father lawe iethro come thy wyfe also two sonnes moses wente mete father lawe dyd obeysaunce kyssed hym eche asked healthe came tente moses tolde father lawe lorde done vnto pharao egyptian israel sake trauayle happened waye howe lorde delyuered iethro reioysed ouer goodnesse whiche lorde done israel bycause delyuered hande egyptian iethro sayde blessed lorde whiche hath deiyuered hande egyptian hande pharao hath also delyuered people captiuite egyptian nowe knowe lorde greater goddes ☞ thynge wherby delte cruellye selues perysshed iethro moses father lawe offred burnt offrynges sacrifice vnto god aaron elder israel came eate breade wt moses father lawe god chaunced morowe moses sat iudge people people stode aboute moses mornynge vnto euen moses father law sawe al dyd vnto people sayd thou doest vnto people syttest thou thy selfe alone al people stande aboute mornynge vnto euen moses sayd vnto father lawe bycause people cometh vnto seke counsel god haue matter come vnto iudge bytwene euery man neyghboure shewe ordinaunces god lawes moses father lawe sayd vnto hym well thou doest thou wetyest thy selfe people thynge weyght denis b thou arte able perfourme thy selfe alone heare nowe therfore voyce wyll gyue counsel god shall thou vnto people godwarde thou mayst bryng cause vnto god thou shalt teache ordinaunces lawes shewe waye wherin must walke worke must moreouer thou shalte seke amonge people men actiuite feare god true men hatyng couetousnes make heades ouer people captaynes ouer thousandes ouer hundred ouer fyftie ouer ten let iudge people ceasons euery deute c great matter happeneth let brynge vnto let iudge small cause selues shal easyer thy selfe shall beare thou shalt thynge god charge withall thou shalt able endure yet people shall come theyr place peace moses obeyed voyce father lawe dyd sayd chose actyue men israel made heades ouer people namely captaynes ouer thousandes ouer hundred ouer fyftie ouer ten iudged people al ceasons brought harde cause vnto moses iudged al small matter selues moses let father lawe departe went owne lande capi xix ¶ chyldren israell come mount smay people god ate holy royall preesthod toucheth hyll dyeth god appeareth vnto moses vpon mounte thondre lyghtnynge thyrde moneth chyldren israell goone lande egypte day came wyldernes smay nume 38 c departed raphidim come deserte smay pytched theyr tentes wyldernes israel abode mount exod 24 moses went vp vnto god lorde called hym mountayne saynge thus shalt thou saye vnto house iacob tell chyldrē israel ye haue sene dyd vnto egyptyans toke vp vpon egles wyngs haue brought vnto selfe nowe therfore deute 13 yf ye wyll heare voyce dede kepe myne appoyntment ye shal myne owne aboue nacyons earth myne ye shalbe vnto also kyngdome peter 2 b preestes holy people wordes whiche thou shalte saye vnto chyldren israel moses came called elder people layde theyr face wordes whiche lorde cōmaunded hym people answered togyther sayd exod 24 deut v xxvi lorde hath sayde wyll moses brought wordes peple vnto lorde lorde sayde vnto moses come vnto thycke clowe people may talkyng byleue euer moses shewed wordes people vnto lorde lorde sayde vnto moses go vnto people ☞ sanctifie daye morowe let wasshe theyr clothes redy agaynst thyrde daye thyrde daye lorde wyll come downe syghte people vpon mount smay thou shalt set markes rounde aboute people saye beware ye go vp mounte touche bordre euer toucheth hebre xii • mount shall surely dye shall hande touche el shalbe stoned shot thorowe whyther beast man shall lyue trompe bloweth longe may come vp mountayne moses went downe mount vnto people sanctified wasshed theyr clothes sayde vnto people redy agaynst thyrde day ☞ come wyues thyrde daye mornynge thonder lyghtnynge thycke clowde vpon mount voyce trompe excedyng lowde al people hoost afrayde moses broughte people tentes mete god deute 4 stode vnder hyll mounte synay togyther smoke bycause lorde descended downe vpon fyre smoke therof ascended vp smoke chymney al mount excedyng fearfull voyce trompe blewe waxed lowder lowder moses spake god answered hym voyce lorde came downe vpon mounte synay euen top hyll lorde called moses vp top hyll moses went vp lorde sayd vnto moses go downe charge people prease vp se lorde many perysshe let preestes also whiche come lorde sanctifie selues lest lorde destroy moses sayd vnto lorde people come vp mounte synay thou chargedst v sayeng set markes aboute hyll sanctifie lorde sayd vnto hym awaye get downe thou shalte come vp thou aaron let preestes people presume come vp vnto lord leest destroye moses wente downe vnto people tolde ¶ ten cōmaundementes gyuen aulter earth capi xx god spake wordes sayde lorde thy god whiche haue deute v • brought lande egypte house bondage thou shalt haue none goddes syght leuit 26 deute 4 c thou shalte make grauen ymage neyther similitude heuē aboue eyther earth bynethe water vnder earth thou shalte worshypnaum eradi 24 b neyther serue lorde thy god ☞ gelouse god ☞ visyte the☞ ☞ synne father vpon chyldren vnto thyrde fourth generacyon hate shewe mercye vnto thousandes loue kepe cōmaundementes thou shalte leutti xixb eccle 23 b take name lorde thy god vayne lorde wyll hold hym gyltlesse taketh name vayne exobi 23 b xxxiiii c xxxv ezech xx b remembre sabboth daye thou sanctify syxe dayes shalt thou labour thou haste seuenth day sabboth lorde thy god thou shalte maner worke thou thy son thy doughter thy man seruaunt thy mayde seruaunt thy cattell straunger within thy gate syxe dayes lorde made heuen earth see al gene ii • ☞ rested seuenth day wherfore lorde blessed sabboth day halowed ✚☞math • 5 • mat vii • honour thy father thy mother thy dayes may longe lande whiche lorde thy god gyueth math 〈◊〉 thou shalte kyll luke 18 • thou shalte breake wedlocke math v • thou shalte steale rom 〈◊〉 thou shalte beare false wytnesse agaynst thy neyghboure thou shalte couet rom 7 • thy neyghbours house neyther shalte thou couet thy neyghbours wyfe mā seruaunt mayde ore asse euer thy neyboure hath people sawe thonder lyghtnyng noyse trompe mountayne smokynge people sawe remoued stode farre sayd vnto moses deut 18 • hebre 〈◊〉 talke thou v wyl heare let god talke v leest dye moses sayde vnto people feare god come proue feare may ☞ face ye synne people stode farre moses wente thycke clowde god lorde sayd vnto moses thus thou shalte say vnto chyldren israel ye haue sene haue talked heuē ye shal make therfore goddes syluer neyther shall ye make goddes goldedeut 17 • iosue 8 • • math 4 • aulter earth thou shalte make vnto theron offer thy burnt offrynges thy peace offerynges thy shepe thyne ox place shall put remembraunce name ⊢ thyther wyll come vnto blesse yf thou wylt make aulter stone se yu make hewen stone el yf thou lyfte vp thy toule vpon thou hast poluted neyther shalte thou go vp steppe vnto myne aulter thy fylthynesse shewed theron ¶ temporall ciuile ordinaunces capi xxi lawes thou shalt set thou bye seruaunte hebrue vi yeres shal serue seuenth shal go fre payeng thyng yf came alone shal go alone yf came maryed wyfe shall go hym yf mayster haue gyuen hym wyfe haue borne hym sonnes doughters wyfe chyldren shal maysters shal go alone yf seruaunt saye loue mayster wyfe child wyl go free mayster shall bryng hym vnto iudges set hym dore dore post mayster shall bore eare thorowe nawle shall seruaunt euer yf man sell doughter seruaunt shall go men seruauntes also please mayster gyueth man wyfe thē shal let go fre sel vnto straūge nacyon shall haue power seynge despysed haue promysed vnto sonne wyfe shall deale men theyr doughters yf take hym wyfe yet fode rayment dutye maryage shall mynysshe yf thre vnto shall go free pay money leui 24 c nume 35 b math v c smyteth man dye shalbe slayne man lay awayte god delyuer hym hande wyll poynt place whyther shall flee man come presumptuously vpon neyghboure flee hym gyle thou shalte take hym fro myne 3 regū g aulter dye smyteth father mother let hym slayne deut 24 b stealeth man selleth hym yf proued vpon hym shall slayne leui xx b • ione xx c mat xv mat vii b curseth father mother shall put death men stryue togyther one smyteth neyghbour stone fyst dye lyeth bed yf ryse agayne walke without vpon staffe shall smote hym go quyte saue onely shall beate charge lesynge tyme shall pay healynge yf man smyte seruaunte mayde rod dye vnder hand shal auenged dede yf continue day two shall auenged money men stryue hurte woman chylde fruyte depart yet mysfortune foloweth shall mersed accordyng woman husbande wyll lay charge shal pay dayes men appoynte hym • uit 24 c deute 19 b yf mysfortune folowe shal pay lyfe lyfe • ath v • eye eye toth toth hande hande fote fote burnynge burnyng wounde woūde stripe stripe yf man smyte seruaunte mayde eye perysshe shall let goo free eye sake also yf smyte seruaūtes maydes toth shal let go fre tothe sake oxe goore man woman dye gene ix • oxe shall stoned flesshe shall eaten owner oxe shall go quyte oxe wont pusshe tyme past hath bene tolde mayster hath kepte hym hath kylled man woman oxe shall stoned owner shall dye also ☞ set hym summe money shal gyue delyueraunce lyfe soeuer put vnto hym whyther hath gored son hurt doughter shall serued maner yf seruaunte mayde oxe hath gored shall gyue vnto theyr mayster xxx ☞ sycles syluer oxe shall stoned man open well dyg pyt couer oxe asse fal therin owner pyt shal make good gyue money vnto theyr mayster dead beast shall one man oxe hurte dye shall sell lyue oxe deuyde money dead oxe also shall deuyde yf knowen oxe hath vsed pusshe tymes past mayster hath kepte hym shall paye oxe oxe deed shalbe owne ¶ suche lyke lawes chapiter aboue capi xxii man prou vii steale oxe shepe kyl sell shall restore v ox axe ii reg • ii b iiii shepe shepe founde breakynge vp smytten dye shall bloode shed hym yf son vp founde shall bloode shed hym thefe shall make restitucion haue wherwith shall solde thefte theft foūde hand alyue ther oxe asse shepe shal restore double man hurte felde vyneyarde put beast fede another man feld best owne felde best owne vyneyarde shal make restituciō fyre breake catche thornes stackes corne standyng corne felde consumed therwith kyndled fyre shall make restitucion man delyuer neyghboure money stuffe kepe stolne oute house thefe founde let hym pay double yf thefe founde good man house shall brought vnto iudges ❀ shall svvere whyther haue put hande vnto neyghboures good maner trespace whyther oxe asse shepe rayment maner lost thynge whiche chalengeth cause bothe partyes shall come iudges iudges condemne let hym pay double neyghbour man delyuer vnto neyghboure kepe asse oxe shepe soeuer beast dye hurte taken awaye man se shall ☞ othe lorde bytwene hath put hande vnto neyghboures good owner shall take othe shall make good yf stolne hym shal make restitucyon vnto owner therof torne wylde beastes let hym brynge recorde tearynge shall make good yf man borowe ought neyghboure hurte el dye owner therof shall make good yf owner therof shall make good namely yf hyred thing came hyre gene 34 • man entyse mayde betrouthed lye shal endote take wyfe yf father refuse gyue vnto hym shal pay money accordyng dowrie vyrgyns thou shalt suffre reg 38 wytche lyue soeuer lyeth beast shalbe slayne offreth vnto goddes saue vnto lorde onely let hym vtterly roted leui xix • uexe straunger neyther oppresse hym ye straungers lande egypte zacha vii c ye shall trouble wydowe fatherlesse chylde ye shall trouble crye vnto wyll surely heare theyr crye wyl wrath waxe hote wyll kyll swerde youre wyues shall wydowes chyldren fatherlesse ezec xxii c leui xxv f deut 23 thou lende money anye people poore thou shalt tiraunte vnto hym neyther shalte thou oppresse hym vsurye deut 24 b thou take thy neyghbours rayment pledge thou shalte delyuer vnto hym agayne son go downe couerynge onely euen rayment skyn wherin slepeth cryeth vnto wyll heare hym mercyfull ii reg 〈…〉 thou shalte ☞ rayle vpon goddꝭ actes 〈…〉 ▪ neyther blaspheme ruler thy people thy fruytes whyther drye moyst se thou kepe backe exodi▪ • ▪ thy fyrste borne sonne thou shalte gyue lykewyse also shalte thou thyne ox thy shepe senen dayes shall damme viii daye thou shalt gyue ye shall holy people vnto neyther shal ye eate fleshe torne beastes felde shall cast dogges ¶ set bicause men shulde rede chapiter throughoute two nexte also capi xxiii thou shalt accepte vayne tale neyther shalte thou put thyne hande wycked vnryghteous wytnesse thou shalte folowe multitude euyll neyther answere matter plee thou woldest folowe many turne syde trueth ❀ neyther shalte thou paynte poore man cause deut ii thou mete thyne enemyes oxe asse goynge astraye thou shalte brynge hym agayne luke ii thou se thyne enemyes asse synke vnder burden thou shalte passe let hym alone shalte helpe hym lyfte hym vp agayne thou shalte hynder ryght thy poore theyr sute kepe free false matter sus ••• innocent ryghteous se thou slee wyll iustifie wycked eccle▪ •• thou shalte take gyftes gyftes blynde seynge peruerte wordes ryghteous thou shalte oppresse straunger ye knowe herte straunger seynge ye straungers lande egypte leui xx 〈…〉 syxe yeres thou shalte thy lande gather fruytes therof seuenth yere thou shalte let rest lye styll poore thy people may eate leaue beastes felde shall eate lyke maner thou shalte also thy vineyarde thyne olyue tree exod▪ • syxe dayes thou shalte thy workes seuenth daye thou shalte rest thyne oxe thyne asse maye rest sonne thy mayde straunger maye refresshed thynges haue sayde vnto circumspecte make rehersall name straunge goddes ephe • neyther lette herde thy mouthe thre feastes thou shalt holde vnto yere • edi xii • • xiiii▪ c thou shalte kepe feast swete breade thou eate vnleuende bread seuen dayes longe commaunded tyme moneth corne begynneth rype moneth ye came egypte 〈…〉 di 34 〈…〉 ▪ tymes yere shall thy men chyldren appeare lorde god ☞ 〈…〉 34 thou shalte offre blood sacrifice vpon leuended breade neyther shal fat feast remayne vntyll mornynge exod 34 •• nt 26 fyrst fyrst fruytes thy lande thou shalte brynge house lorde thy god 〈…〉 14 c exod 34 thou shalte also ☞ sethe kyd mother mylke beholde sende angell kepe waye brynge place haue prepared beware hym heare voyce resyst hym wyll spare mysdedes name hym yf thou shalte herken vnto voyce speake wyll enemye vnto thyne enemyes aduersary vnto thyne aduersaryes myne exodi 13 angell shall go bryng amorites hethites pherezites cananites heuites iebusites shall destroy thou shalte worshyp theyr 〈…〉 25 goddes neyther serue neyther workes ouerthrowe breake downe ymages ye shal serue 〈…〉 7 b lord god shal blesse thy breade thy water wyll take syckenesse awaye myddes shall woman chyldelesse vnfruytefull thy lande nombre thy dayes wyll fulfyll wyll sende feare wyll trouble people whyther thou shalt go wyl make al thyne enemyes turne theyr backes vnto wyll sende hornettes whiche shall dryue heuytes cananytes hethytes neuertheles wyll cast one yere lest lande grow wyldernesse beastes felde multyply agaynst lytell lytell wyl dryue vntyl thou encreased enheryte lande wyl make thy costes red see vnto sell philistine deserte vnto ryuer wyll delyuer inhabiters lande thyne hande thou shaltexod 34 b deute 7 dryue thou shalt make none apoyntment theyr goddes neyther let dwel thy lande lest make synne agaynst yf thou serue theyr goddes wyll thy decay ¶ moses ascendeth vp mount wryteth wordes lorde bloole couertaunt elder israell iudge people capi xxiiii sayd vnto moses come vp vnto lorde thou aaron nadab abihu lxx elder israel ye shall worshp farre moses hym selfe alone shall go vnto lorde shal come nye neyther shal peple go vp hym moses came told people exod xix wordes lorde lawes people answered one voyce sayd wordes whiche lorde hath sayd wyll moses wrote wordes lorde rose vp early set vp exodi xx • aulter vnder hyll twelue stone accordynge xii tribe israel sent yong men chyldren israel whiche brought burntoffrynges offred peace offrynges ox vnto lorde moses toke halfe blood put basens halfe sprencled aulter tōke boke appoyntment red audience people sayde lorde hath sayde wyll obedyent moses toke peter • blood sprenkled people sayd beholde hebre ix c bloode appoyntment lorde hath made vpon wordes went moses aaron nadab abihu lxx elder israel vp ☞ sawe god israell vnder feete worke saphir stone heuen whē clere ☞ vpon noble chyldren israel set hande sawe god dyd eate drynke ✚ lorde sayd vnto moses come vp hyll wyll gyue table stone lawe cō maundementes whiche haue wrytten thou mayst teache moses rose vp mynyster iehosua moses went vp hyll god sayd vnto elder ta • ye vntyll come agayne vnto beholde aaron hur man haue matter let hym come moses went vp mounte cloude couered hyll glorye lorde abode vpon mounte sinay cloude couered vi dayes seuenth daye called vnto moses cloude facyon glorye lorde lyke consumynge fyre top hyll syght chyldren israel moses wente cloude got hym vp mountayn moses exod 34 mounte xl dayes xl nyghtes ¶ lorde sheweth moses facyon holy place thynges perteynyng therto capi xxv lorde spake vnto moses sayeng speake vnto chyldren israel brynge heaueoffrynge euery man gyueth wyllyngly herte ye shall take exodi 35 heueoffrynge ye shal take golde syluer brasse yelowe sylke purple scarlet whyte sylke gootes ram skynnes red skynnes taxus sethim wood oyle light spice anoyntyng oyle swete sence onix stone stone set ephod brest lap let make sanctuarie may dwell among accordyng shewe bothe facyon habitacion facyon ornamentes therof euen shall ye make shall make exodi 37 arke sethim wood ii cubites halfe longe cubite halfe brode cubit halfe hye thou shalt ouerlay wt pure golde within without shalte thou ouerlay shalt make hye vpon crowne golde rounde aboute thou shalte cast iiii rynges golde put iiii corner therof ii rynges shall one syde ii thou shalte make barres sethim wood couer wt golde put barres ryngꝭ along sydes arke bere withall barres shall rynges arke shal taken away thou shalte put arke wytnesse whiche shall gyue thou shalte make merciseate pure golde ii cubites halfe longe cubite halfe brode thou shalte make ii cherubins golde euen hole worke shalte thou make ii endes mercyseate one cherub shalte thou make ende cherub ende euen mercyseate shall ye make cherubyns ii endes therof cherubyns shall stretche theyr wynges abrode ouer hye couerynge mercyseate theyr wynges theyr face shall loke one euen mercyseatewarde shall face cherubyns thou shalte put ro •• heb •• mercyseate aboue vpon arke arke thou shalte put wytnesse whiche wyll gyue thence ☞ wyll testifie vnto wyll comon vpon mercyseate bytwene ii cherubyns whiche vpon arke wytnesse thynge whiche wyll gyue cōmaundement vnto chyldren israel exod▪ 〈…〉 thou shalte also make table sethim wood two cubites long one cubite brode cubite halfe hye thou shalte couer pure golde make therto crowne golde rounde aboute make vnto hoope foure fyngers brode rounde aboute make golden crowne also hoope rounde aboute make iiii rynges golde put ryngꝭ corner iiii fete therof euen ouer agaynst hoope shal rynges put barres bere table withall thou shalte make barres sethim wood ouerlay golde table may borne wt thou shalte make dysshes spones flat peces pottes powre withall euē fyne gold shalte thou make thou shalte set vpon table ☞ shewbreade alwaye exod▪ 〈…〉 thou shalt make candelstycke pure golde euen hole worke shall candelstycke made shafte braunches bolles knoppes floures procedyng therout syxe braunches also shall procede of▪ sydes thre braunches candelstycke one syde iii thre cuppes lyke vnto almondes knoppes floures one braunche thre cuppes lyke almondes braunche knoppes floures euen thorowout vi braūches procede candelstycke candelstycke selfe iiii cuppes lyke vnto almondes theyr knoppes floures shalbe knop vnder euery two braunches ❀ thre roumes sixe procede candelstycke knoppes braunches shal shal one worke euen pure golde thou shalte make vii lampes vii lampes therof shalte thou put hygh theron gyue lyght vnto othersyde ouer agaynste tongue snoffers therof shall pure golde hundred pounde weyght fyne gold shalt thou make wt apparel 〈…〉 8 • 〈◊〉 vii • loke therfore thou make faciō shewed mounte ¶ chapiter also descrybeth thynges perteynyng holy place capi xxvi tabernacle shalt thou make ten curtaynes whyte twyned silke yelow sylke purple scarlet thou shalt make picture brodered worke length one curtayne shall eyght thentye cubytes bredth one curtayne foure cubytes euery one curtaynes shall haue one measure fyue curtaynes shall coupled togyther one another fyue curtaynes shalbe coupled togyther one thou shalte make lowpes yelowe silke longe edge one curtayne whiche seluege couplyng curtayne lykewyse shalte thou make edge vtmoost curtayne coubled therwith syde fyftye lowpes shalt thou make one curtayne fyftye lowpes shalt thou make edge curtayne coubled therwith syde lowpes maye take holde one thou shalte make fyftye button golde couple curtaynes togyther button shall one habytacyon exodi 36 • thou shalte make xi curtaynes gotes heere coueryng vpon tabernacle lenght curtayne shalbe xxx cubites bredth foure shall xi one measure thou shalt couple fyue curtaynes selues syxe selues shalt double syxte fore front tabernacle thou shalt make fiftye lowpes edge vtmoost curtayne one syde euen edge couplynge courtayne fyftye lowpes edge curtayne must ioyned vnto thou shalt make fyftye button bra put lowpes couple coueryng togyther maye one remenaunte resteth curtaynes coueryng euen halfe curtayne resteth shalbe lefte backe sydes habytacyon cubyte one syde cubyte syde maye remayne length curtaynes coueryng maye remayne eyther syde habytacyon couer vpō tabernacle thou shalte make couerynge ram skynnes dyed red yet couerynge aboue taxus skynnes thou shalt make
