sicles sicle sanctu ary bothe full fyne floure myngled oyle meatofferynge golden spoone ten sicles full sence bullocke ram lambe one yere olde burntofferynge goote synne peaceofferyng two ox v rammes v gootes v lambes one yere olde offerynge ahira sonne enan dedicacyon aulter daye anoynted vnto whiche brought prynces israell xii charger syluer xii syluer bolles xii spoones golde euery charger conteynynge hundred xxx sycles syluer euery bolle lxx syluer vessell conteyned two thousande iiii▪ hundred sycles sycle sanctuary golden spones twelue full sence conteynynge ten sycles peace sycle sanctuary golde spones hundred xx sycles bullockes burntofferynge twelue rammes twelue lambes yere olde twelue meatofferyng gootes synne twelue ox peaceofferynge xxiiii rammes sixtye gootes lx lambes yere olde sixtye dedicacyō aulter anoynted moses gone tabernacle wytnesse speake hym herde voyce one speakynge vnto hym merciseate vpon arke wytnes bytwene two cherubyns talked hym ¶ ordre lampes forme candelstycke clensynge offerynge leuites capi viii lorde spake vnto moses sayenge speake vnto aaron saye vnto hym exodi 25 thou puttest lampes seuen lampes shall gyue lyght towarde forefront candelstycke aaron dyd euen lyghted lampes toward forefront candelstycke lorde commaunded moses worke candelstycke ☞ styffe golde bothe shafte floures therof accordyng vnto vision lorde shewed moses euen made candelstycke lorde spake vnto moses saynge take leuites amonge chyldren israell clense thus shalte thou vnto thou clensest sprynkle water purifyenge vpon let make rasure runne alonge vpon flesshe let wasshe theyr clothes make selues cleane let take bullocke meatofferynge euen fyne floure myngled oyle another bullocke shalte thou take synne thou doest brynge leuites tabernacle wytnes thou shalt gather hoole multytude chyldren israell togyther bryng leuites lorde chyldren israell shall put theyr handes vpon leuites aaron ☞ shall waue leuites lorde waueofferynge chyldren israell maye execute minystracion seruyce lorde liuytes shall put theyr handes vpon heades bullockes thou shalte offre one synne burntofferynge vnto lorde thou mayst make attonement leuites thou shalte set leuites aaron sonnes waue waueofferynge lorde thus thou shalt seperate leuites among chyldren israel leuites shal myn shall leuites go seruyce tabernacle wytnesse thou shalt clense waue gyuen delyuered vnto amonge chyldren israell open euery wombe euen fyrst borne chyldren israell haue taken vnto 〈…〉 fyrste borne chyldren israell myne bothe man beast synce daye smote euery fyrst borne lande egypt sanctifyed selfe haue taken leuytes fyrst borne chyldren israell haue gyuen leuytes gyfte vnto aaron sonnes amonge chyldren israell seruyce chyldren israell tabernacle wytnes make attonement chyldren israell plage among chyldren israell yf chyldren israel come nye vnto holy thynges moses aaron congregacyon chyldren israel dyd leuites accordynge vnto lorde cōmaunded moses concernynge leuytes euen dyd chyldren israel vnto leuites purifyed washed theyr clothes aaron waued lorde made attonement clen sed went leuytes theyr seruice tabernacle wytnesse aaron sonnes lorde commaunded moses concernyng leuites euen dyd vnto lorde spake vnto moses sayenge belongeth vnto leuytes num iiii • xxv yere vpwarde shall go wayte vpon seruyce tabernacle wytnesse age l yeare shall cease waytynge vpon seruyce therof shall serue ☞ shall minystre vnto theyr brother tabernanacle wytnesse wayte shall seruyce thus therfore shalte thou vnto leuytes theyr watche ¶ passeouer cloude capi ix lorde spake vnto moses wyldernesse sinay fyrste moneth seconde yere exod 12 ••• iti 23 nume 28 c deut 16 • come lande egypt sayenge let chyldren israell offce passeouer ceason euen xiiii daye moneth euen let kepe ceasō accordynge ceremonyes accordyng al maners therof moses spake vnto chyldren israell shulde offre passeouer offered passeouer xiiii daye fyrste moneth euen wyldernesse sinay accordynge lorde cōmaunded moses euen dyd chyldren israell certayne men defyled ☞ vpon soule man myght offre passeouer daye came moses aaron daye men sayd vnto hym defyled vpō soule mā wherfore kept backe maye offre offeryng vnto lorde due ceason amonge chyldren israell moses sayd vnto stande styl wyl heare lorde wyll cōmaunde concernynge lorde spake vnto moses saynge speake vn chyldren israell saye yf man amonge chyldren vncleane reason coorse waye far wyll offre passeouer vnto lorde xiiii daye seconde moneth euen let offre eate swete breade sowre herbes let leaue none vnto mornynge exodi 12 • iohn̄ xix f breake bone accordynge al ordinaūce passeouer let offre man cleane iourney yet neglygent offre passeouer soule shall peryshe people bycause brought offerynge lorde due ceason man shall beare synne yf straunger dwell amonge wyll offre passeouer vnto lorde accordynge ordynaunce passeouer maner therof shall offre thus ye shall haue one lawe bothe straunger hym borne home lande daye tabernacle reared vp exodi xl c 3 regū • • cloude couered habitacyon tabernacle wytnesse euen vpon habitacyon simylytude fyre vntyll mornynge alwaye cloude couered day simylytude fyre nyght cloude taken vp tabernacle chyldren israell iourneyed cloude abode chyldren israell pytched theyr tentes ☞ worde lorde chyldren israel iourneyed worde lorde pytched longe cloude abode vpon habitacion laye styll cloude taryed styll vpon habitacyon longe tyme chyldren israell kept watch lorde iourneyed chaūced cloude abode fewe dayes vpon habitacyō abode theyr tentes accordyng commaundement lorde iourneyed also cōmaundement lorde happened whē cloude abode vpon habitaciō euen vnto mornynge taken vp mornynge iourneyed whyther day nyght cloude taken vp iourneyed yf cloude taryed two dayes moneth longe ceason vpon habitacyon remayned theron chyldren israell abode styll iourneyed soone cloude taken vp iourneyed worde lorde rested tentes cōmaundement lorde iourneyed kepynge watche lorde commaundement lorde hande moses ¶ trompettes syluer israelytes departo frō sinay captaynes hoost nombred nobab refuseth go moses capi x lorde spake vnto moses sayenge make two trompettes syluer hoole pece shalte thou make thou mayst vse cal cō gregacion togyther hoost shal iourney therfore shall blowe wt multitude may resorte dore tabernacle wytnesse yf blowe one trompet prynces whiche heades ouer thousandes israell shall come vnto yf ye trompe hoostes lye east partes shall go forwarde yf ye trompe seconde tyme hooste lyeth south syde shall take theyr iourney shall trompe whē take theyr iourneyes congregacyon gathered togyther shall blowe onely trompe sonnes aaron preestꝭ shall blowe trompettes ye shall haue lawe euer youre generacyons yf ye go war youre lande agaynst enemyes vexe ye shal blowe trompettes ye shall remembred lorde god saued enemyes also daye gladnesse feast dayes begynnynge monethes ye shall blowe trompets ouer burnt sacrifyces peace offeryngꝭ maye remembraunce god lorde god came passe xx day second moneth seconde yeare cloude taken vp habitacyon wyt nesse chyldren israell toke theyr iourney deserte sinay cloude rested wyldernesse pharan first toke theyr iourney worde lorde hande moses fyrst place went standerde hoost iuda accordyng theyr armyes whose cap tayne nahasson sonne aminadab ouer hooste trybe chyldren isachar nathanael son zuar ouer hoost trybe chyldren zabulon eliab son helon habytacyon taken downe sonnes gerson • • went forth bearynge habitacyon hoost ruben went forth theyr standerd armyes whose captayne elizur sonne sedeur ouer hooste tribe chyldren simeon salamiell son suri sadai ouer hoost tribe child gad eliasaph sonne deguell cahathites also went forwarde bare sanctuary ☞ dyd set vp habytacyon agaynst came standerd hoost chyldren ephraym went forth accordynge theyr armyes whose captayne elisama son amiud ouer hooste trybe sonnes manasse gama liell son pedazur ouer hooste tribe sonnes ben iamin abidan sonne gedeoni standerde hooste chyldren dan came forth hauynge hoostes togyther thorowout theyr armyes whose captayne ahiezer sonne ammi sadat ouer hooste tribe chyldren asar pagyell sonne ocran ouer hoost trybe chyldren nephthali ahira sonne enan iourneyes chyldren israell thorowout theyr armyes thus hoostes remoued moses sayd vnto ☞ nobab son raguel madianyte moses father lawe go vnto place whiche lorde sayde wyll gyue come thou therfore v wyll good lorde hath promysed good vnto israell answered hym wyll go wyll departe myne owne lande kynred sayde oh nay leaue v thou knowest oure mansyons wyldernes thou hast ben v steade ☞ eye yf thou go v loke goodnesse lorde sheweth vnto v wyl shewe vnto departed mounte lorde thre dayes iourney arke testament lorde went thre dayes iourney serche restyng place thē lorde made shadowe thorowe cloude daye went tentes fortuned arke went forth moses sayd ryse vp lorde let thyne enemyes scartered let hate flee arke rested sayde returne lorde vnto many thousandes israell ¶ people murmureth desyre flesshe lothe manna wauerynge fayth moses lorde diuideth burden moses seuentie aun • yentes prophesy rayneth quayls flesshe rauen • t punysshed capi xi fortuned whē exodi 16 ❀ people dyd wyckedlye dyspleasure eares lorde lorde herde ☞ countenaūce prouoked wrath fyre lorde burnte amonge cōsumed vttermost hoost people cryed vnto moses moses made intercessyon vnto lorde fyre quēched name place called ☞ chabarah bicause fyre lord burnt among rascall peple among fel lustynge turned selues wepte euen dyd also chyldren israel sayde shall gyue v flesshe eate remembre fyshe dyd eate egypte nought cucumber melon lekes onyons garleke nowe soule dryed awaye se nothynge el saue manna manna exodi 16 g coriander seede se lyke bedellion people went aboute gathered grounde mylles bette morters baked pannes made cake tast lyke vnto tast oyle cake dewe fell downe vpō hoost nyght manna fell vpon moses herde people wepe thorowout theyr housholdes euery man dore tent ☞ face lorde prouoked vnto wrath excedyngly greued moses also moses sayd vnto lord wherfore hast thou delte cruelly thy sernaunt wherfore haue founde fauoure thy syght seynge thou puttest weyght people vpon haue conceyued al people haue begotten thou shuldest saye vnto carye thy bosome nurse beareth suckynge chylde vnto lande whiche thou swarest vnto theyr father wher shuld haue flesshe gyue vnto people wepe saynge gyue v flesh maye eate able beare people alone seynge heuy yf thou deale thus kyll praye yf haue founde fauoure thy syght se wretchednesse lorde sayd vnto moses • e •• 8 gather vnto lxx men elder israell thou knowest elder people offycers ouer thou shalte brynge vnto tabernacle wytnesse maye stande ☞ wyll come downe talke ☞ take spiryte vpon put vpon shall beare burden people leest thou constrayned beare alone saye vnto exodi 16 people halowed agaynst morowe ye shall eate flesshe wepynge eares lorde seynge ye sayd shall gyue v flesshe eate happye egypte therfore lorde wyll gyue fleshe ye shal eate ye shall eate one daye two fyue dayes neyther ten twenty dayes euē moneth longe vntyl come nose thyrls make parbrake bycause ye haue cast lorde asyde whiche amonge haue wepte hym sayenge came thus egypt moses sayde exod 12 syxe hundred thousand foreman people among whiche thou haste sayde wyll gyue flesshe maye eate moneth longe shall shepe ox slayne fynde eyther shal al fysshe see gathered togyther serue lorde sayd vnto moses shall esaie • • lix • lordes hande waxed shorte thou shalte se nowe whyther worde shall come passe vnto moses went tolde people sayenge lorde gathered lxx elder people set round aboute tabernacle lorde came downe cloude spake vnto hym toke spiryte vpon hym gaue vnto lxx elder fortuned spiryte rested vpon prophesyed dyd cease remayned two mē hoost name one eldad name medad spiryte rested vpon wrytten went ou • vnto tabernacle prophesyed hoost ran yonge man tolde moses sayd eldad medad pro phesye hooste iosua sonne nun seruaunt moses ❀ one yong men answered sayd mayster moses luke ix • ioh • l ii g forbyd moses sayde vnto hym enuyest thou sake 1 cori 14 • wolde god lordes people coulde prophesye lorde wolde put spiryte vpō moses gat hoost elder israell went forth wynde lorde exodi 16 brought quayles see let fall aboute hoost euen dayes iourney rounde aboute euery syde hoost ❀ dyd flye ayre two cubytes hye ouer earth people stode vp daye nyght morowe gathered quayles gathered lytle gathered ten homer full spred abrode rounde aboute hooste psal 78 whyle flesshe yet bytwene theyr teeth chewed vp beholde coūtenaunce lorde moued agaynst people lorde psal 78 slewe people wt excedyng great plage name plage called graues luste bycause buryed people lusted people toke theyr nume 33 • iourney graues lust vnto hazeroth bode hazeroth ¶ aaron mir iam grudge agaynst moses mir iam stryken leprosye healed prayer moses capi xii deut • 24 b mir iam aaron spake agaynst moses bycause woman iude taken taken wyfe one iude sayde hath lorde dede spoken thorow moses hath spoken also v lorde herde moses eccle 45 meke man aboue men earth lorde spake atonce vnto moses vnto aaron mir iam come ye thre vnto exodi 29 g tabernacle wytnesse came thre lorde came downe psal •• ix b pyller cloude stode exodi 29 • dore tabernacle called aaron mir iam went bothe sayde heare wordes yf prophet lordes amonge wyll knowen hym vision wyll speake vnto hym slepe seruaunt moses whiche faythfull myne house unto hym wyll speake exodi 33 b mouth mouth vision ryddels similitude doth se lorde wherfore ye afrayde speake agaynste seruaunt moses lorde moued vnto wrath agaynst went way cloude departed tabernacle beholde mir iam become ii pa 26 leperous snow aarō loked vpon mir iam behold leperous aaron sayde vnto moses beseche lorde put syn vpon v haue foolyshly cōmytted synned oh let one cōmeth mother wombe whose halfe flesh eaten awaye moses cryed vnto lorde sayenge heale god beseche lorde sayde vnto moses yf father ☞ spyt face shulde ashamed vii dayes let shutte hoost vii dayes let • receyued agayne mir iam shut hooste vii dayes people remoued tyl brought agayne num • • afterward people remoued frō hazeroth pitched wyldernes pharā ¶ certayne men sent searche land canaan capi xiii lorde spake vnto moses sayenge deui • • send men serch land canaā gyue vnto child israel euery trybe theyr father shall ye sende man let ruler amonge moses commaundement lorde sent forth wyldernesse pharan suche men al heades chyldren israell theyr name trybe ruben sāmua son zacur trybe symeon saphat son hori trybe iuda caleb sonne iephune trybe isachar igeall sonne ioseph trybe ephraim ☞ hosea son nun trybe ben iamin palthi sonne raphu trybe zabulon gadiell sonne sodi trybe ioseph namely tribe manasse gaddi son susi trybe dan amiell son gemali tribe aser sethur son michaell trybe nephthali nahebi sonne uaphsi trybe gad guell son machi name men moses sent spye land moses called name hosea son nun iosua moses sent forth spye lande canaan sayde vnto get vp waye southwarde ye maye go vp hye countrey se lande maner thynge people dwelleth therin whyther strong weyke eyther fewe many land dwel whyther good bad maner cityes dwell whyther dwel tentes walled townes maner lande whyther fat leane whyther tree therin good courage brynge fruyte lande aboute tyme grape fyrsie rype went vp searched lande wyldernesse zin vnto rehob men come hemath ascended vnto south came vnto hebron ahimā sesai thalmani sonnes enack hebron bylt seuen yeare ☞ zoan egypte came vnto ryuer escol cut downe braunche one clouster grape twayne bare vpon staffe brought also pomgarnates fygges place called ryuer escol bycause clouster grapꝭ chyldren israell cut downe thence turned backe agayne frō searchynge lande xl dayes went came moses aaron vnto multitude chyldren israell wyldernesse pharan cades brought word also vnto al congregacion shewed fruyte lande tolde hym sayde came lande whyther thou sendest v surely floweth mylke hony fruyte neuerthelesse people stronge dwell lande city walled excedynge greate moreouer sawe chyldren enacke amalechites dwell south countre hethites iebusites▪ amorytes dwell moūtaynes cananites dwell see coost iordan caleb stylled ❀ murmure vvas raysed vp people moses sayenge wyll go vp conquere able ouercome men went vp hym sayde able go vp agaynst people stronger brought vp euyll reporte lande whiche serched sayenge vnto chyldren israell lande haue gone thorowe search lande ☞ eateth vp inhabiters therof people sawe men greate stature sawe also gyauntes chyldren enacke whiche come gyauntes semed oure syght greshoppers dyd theyr syght ¶ people murmure agaynst god wold haue stoned caleb iosua searcher lande dye amalech kylleth israelytes capi xiiii al multitude people cried wepte thorowout nyght chyldren israel murmured agaynst moses aarō hole congregacyon sayde vnto wolde god hadde dyed lande egypte eyther dyed wyldernesse wherfore hath lorde brought v vnto lande fall vpon swerde wyues chyldren shulde praye better returne vnto egypt agayne sayd one another wyl make captayne returne vnto egypte agayne moses aaron fell theyr face congregacyon multytude chyldren israell iosua sonne nun caleb son iephune searched lande rent theyr clothes spake vnto company chyldren israell sayenge lande whiche walked thorowe serche good lande yf lorde haue lust v wyll brynge v lande gyue v whiche lande floweth mylke hony anywyse rebell ye agaynst lorde deute xx • neyther nede ye feare people lande ☞ breade v ☞ theyr ❀ shadowe departed lorde v feare therfore whiche multytude bad stone stoones glorye lorde appeared tebernacle wytnesse chyldren israell lorde sayde vnto moses howe longe people prouoke howe longe wyll byleue sygnes haue shewed amonge wyll smyte pestylence destroye wyll make greater nacyon myghtyer moses sayde vnto lorde egyptian shall heare thou broughtest people thy myght amonge wyl tolde inhabyters lande also haue herde lykewyse thou lorde arte amonge people thou lorde arte sene face face thy cloude standeth ouer exod 13 thou goest daye tyme pyller cloude pyller fyre nyght yf thou shalte kyll people one man nacyons whiche haue herde fame wyll saye lorde able brynge people lande whiche sware vnto hath slayne wyldernesse nowe beseche let power lord great accordynge thou haste spoken sayenge lorde longe angrye full mercye suffereth iniquyte syn ❀ ☞ leaueth man innocent visiteth vnryghteousnesse father vpon chyldren thyrde fourth generacyon mercyfull beseche vnto synne people accordynge vnto thy great mercye thou hast forgyuen people egypt euen vntyll lorde sayd haue forgyuen ☞ accordynge thy request ☞ truly lyue al earth shalbe ☞ fylled glorye lorde men whiche haue sene glorye myracles whiche dyd egypt wyldernesse haue tempted nowe x tymes wyl herken vnto voyce shall se lande whiche sware vnto theyr father neyther shall prouoked se seruaunt iosua 13 b caleb wt whome another maner spiryte bycause hath folowed vnto vttermoost hym wyll brynge lande hath walked seed shal enherite also amalechites cananites dwel playne coūtre morowe turne get wyldernes euen way red see lorde spake vnto moses aaron saynge longe doth cuyl multytude murmur agaynst haue herde murmurynges chyldren israel murmure agaynst tell therfore truly lyue sayeth lorde wyl vnto euen ye haue spoken eares carkasses shal lye wyldernesse tolde thorow nombres xx yere aboue whiche haue murmured agaynst shall come lande ouer whiche ☞ lyfted vp myne hand make dwel ther saue caleb son iephune iosua son nun chyldren ye sayd shulde praye wyl bryng shall knowe lande whiche ye haue refused carkasses shall lye wyldernesse chyldren shal wandre wyldernesse xl yeres suffre ☞ hooredome vntyll carkasses wasted wyldernesse nombre dayes whiche ye serched lande euen xl dayes ezech 4 b euery daye yere shal ye beare vnryghteousnesse euen xl yeare ❀ ye shall knowe dyspleasure lorde haue sayde wyll vnto euyll congregacyon gathered togyther agaynst wyldernes shalbe cōsumed shal dye men moses sent serche lande whiche came agayne made people murmure ☞ hym brought vp sclaunder vpon land euen men dyd bryng vp sclaunder vpon though ben euyl dyed great 1 corin •• plage lorde iosua son nun caleb son iephune whiche men went searche lande lyued styll moses tolde sayenges vnto chyldren israell people toke great sorowe rose vp early mornynge gat vp top mountayne sayenge deuit •• lo wyll go vp vnto place whiche lorde sayde vnto v haue synned moses sayde wherfore wyll ye go maner beyonde worde lorde wyll come well passe go vp therfore lorde amonge ye slayne enemyes amalechites cananites ye wyll fal vpon swerde ❀ bycause ye turned awaye lorde lorde wyll ❀ presumed obstinatly go vp hyl top neuerthelatter arke testament lorde moses departed hooste amalechites cananites whiche dwelt hyll came downe smote hewed euen vnto horma ¶ drynke offerynges enter lande punysshement hym synneth • arrogancye pryde capi xv lorde spake vnto moses sayenge speake vnto chyldren israell saye vnto leuiti • ▪ ye come lande youre habytacyons whiche gyue vnto wyll offre offerynge vnto lorde namely burntofferynge specyall sacrifice eyther vowe wyllyng mynde ☞ princypal feastes make swete sauour vn lorde ox flocke leuiti • ••• let hym offereth offeryng vnto lorde brynge also meatofferyng tenth deale floure myngled fourth parte hin oyle fourth parte hin wyne drynkofferyng offre burntofferynge offerynge lambe yf ram thou shalt offre meate offryng two tenth deales floure myngled thyrde parte hin oyle drynkoffryng thou shalt offre thyrd parte hin wyne swete sauoure vnto lorde thou offerest bullocke burntofferyng specyal vowe peace offeryng vnto lorde let hym bryng bullocke meatofferynge iii tenth deales floure myngled wt halfe hin oyle thou shalte bryng drynkeofferyng euen halfe hin wyne offryng swete sauour vnto lorde maner shall done oxe ram lambe kyd loke nombre thou makest suche nombre shalte thou make also accordyng nō bre suche offerynges thou shalte encrease meatofferynges drynkofferyngꝭ selues shall thyngꝭ maner offre offeryng swete sauoure vnto lorde yf straunger soiourne soeuer amonge generacyons wyll offre offerynge swete sauoure vnto lorde euen ye shall one ordynaunce shall bothe cōgregacion also straunger shalbe ordinaunce euer generacyons vnto straunger lorde one lawe one maner shal serue bothe straunger soiourneth lorde spake vnto moses saynge speake vnto chyldren israel saye vnto deuit • 8 c ye come lande whiche bryng ye wyl eate breade lande ye shall take vp heueofferynge vnto lorde ye shal take vp cake fyrst dow heueofferynge leuiti 25 b ye heueofferynge barne euen ye shall heue fyrst dow ye shal gyue vnto lorde heueofferyng generacions yf ye ouerse selues obserue commaundementes whiche lorde hathe spoken vnto moses euen lorde hath cōmaunded hande moses fyrst daye lorde cōmaunded moses hence forwarde among generacions happen ought cōmytted ygnorantly congregacyon multitude shal offre bullock burntofferyng swete sauour vnto lorde meatofferynge drynkofferyng therto accordyng maner goote synne preest shall make attonement multitude chyldren israell shall forgyuen ygnoraūce shal bryng theyr offeryng sacrifice vnto lorde theyr synofferyng lorde theyr ygnoraunce shalbe forgyuen vnto multitude chyldren israel vnto straunger dwelleth among seynge al people ignoraunceleuit iiii • yf one soule syn thorowe ignoraunce shall brynge goote yeare olde syn preest shall make atonement soule synned ygnoraūtly synofferynge lorde recōsyle hym may forgyuen hym bothe thou arte borne one chyldren israel straunger dwelleth amonge shall haue bothe one lawe doth synne thorowe ygnoraunce soule dothe ought presumptuously whyther israelite straū ger blasphemeth lord soule shalbe roted amonge people bycause hath despysed worde lorde hath broken cōmaundement soule therfore shall perysshe synne shall vpon hym whyle chyldren israel wyldernes founde mā ☞ gathered styckes vpon exodi 31 • sabboth daye founde hym gatheryng styckꝭ brought hym vnto moses aaron vnto congregacion leuit 24 b put hym warde seynge declared shulde done vnto hym lorde sayd vnto moses let man dye let multitude stone stone without hoost al multitude brought hym wt ▪ hoost stoned hym stone dyed lorde cōmaunded moses lorde spake vnto moses saynge speake vnto chyldren israell byd deut 22 • make gardes quarter theyr garmentꝭ thorowout theyr generacyons put vpon garde quarter ryband yelowe sylke garde shall vnto loke vpon ye may remembre al cōmaundementes lorde ❀ ye seke owne herte owne eye ye vse go hoorynge ye shall remembre rather al cōmaundementes holy vnto god lorde god brought lande egypte god lorde god ¶ rebellyon corah dathan abiram capi xvi e • cle 45 c corah sonne iezehar sonne cahath sonne leui dathan abiram son eliab ou son peleth sonne ruben rose vp moses men chyldren israel two hundred fyftie captaynꝭ multitude great famous men congregacyon gathered themselues togyther agaynst moses aaron sayde vnto ye make moche seynge multitude holy euery one lorde amonge heue ye selues vp aboue congregacyon lorde moses herde fell vpon face spake vnto corah vnto companye saynge morowe lorde wyll shewe holy ought approche nygh vnto hym hath chosen come hym ther fore take fyre pannes corah al company put fyre therin put sence lorde morowe man whome lorde dothe chose shalbe holy ye make moch ye chyldren leui moses sayd vnto corah nume 3 b ye chyldrē leui smal thyng vnto god israell hath seperated multitude israel brought hym self seruyce dwellyng place lorde stande multitude ministre vnto hym hathe taken hym thy brother sonnes leuy seke ye offyce preest also cause thou thy companye gathered togyther agaynst lorde aaron ye murmure agaynst hym moses sent called dathan abiram sonnes eliab whiche sayde wyll come vp small thynge thou hast brought v lande floweth mylke hony kyll v wyldernesse reygne ouer v also hast thou brought v vnto lande floweth mylke hony gyuen v enherytaunce feldes vyneyardes wylte thou pull eye men wyll come vp moses waxed angry sayd vnto lorde turne thou vnto theyr offerynge haue taken moche asse neyther haue hurte moses sayd vnto corah thou thy companye lorde bothe thou aaron morowe take euery mā sencer put sence ye maye offre lorde euery man two hundred fyftie take sencer thou also aaron euery one may haue sencer toke euerye man sencer put fyre layd sence theron stode dore tabernacle wytnesse moses aaron corah gathered congregacyon agaynst vnto dore tabernacle wytnesse glory lorde appeared vnto al congregacyon lorde spake vnto moses aaron sayenge seperate selues among congregacion may consume atonce fell vpon theyr face sayde num 〈◊〉 • moost myghtye god spirites flesshe yf one man hath synned wylte thou wrothe multitude lorde spake vnto moses saynge speake vnto congre gacyon say get away aboute dwellynge corah dathan abiram moses rose vp wente vnto dathan abiram elder israell folowed hym spake vnto congregacyon saynge departe tentes wycked men touche thynge theyrs lest ye perysshe theyr synnes gat dwellynge corah dathan abiram euery syde dathā abiram came stode dore theyr tentes theyr wyues theyr sonnes theyr lytell chyldren moses sayd hereby ye shall knowe lorde hath sent al workes haue done myne owne mynde men dye common deathe men ☞ visited visitacyon al men lorde hath sent yf lorde make newe thyng earth open mouth swalow vp withall haue go downe quycke hell ye shall vnderstand mē haue prouoked lorde fortuned soone made ende speakynge wordes deuit • num • psal • grounde cloue sondre vnder earth opened mouth swalowed vp theyr house men corah theyr goodes wente downe alyue vnto hel erth closed vpon peryshed among cōgregacion israel aboute fled crye sayde leest earthe swalowe v vp also came fyre lorde consumed two hundred fyftie men offered sence lorde spake vnto moses saynge speake vnto eleazar sonne aaron preest take vp sencers burnyng skatter fyre ☞ sencers synners halowed theyr deathes let make thyn beaten plate couerynge aulter offered lorde therfore halowed shall sygne vnto chyldren israel eleazar preest toke brasen sencers burnt offered bet thyn coueryng aulter remembraunce vnto chyldren israell straunger whiche seede aaron come nere offre sence lorde happen vn hym lyke vnto corah companye lorde sayde hym hande moses morowe multitude chyldren israell murmured agaynste moses aaron sayeng ye haue kylled people lorde fortuned whē multitude gathered agaynst moses aaron loked towarde tabernacle wytnesse beholde ❀ vvhen vvere entred cloude couered glorye lorde appeared moses aaron came tabernacle wytnesse lorde spake vnto moses sayenge get amonge congregacyon maye consume quyckely fell vpon theyr face moses sayd vnto aaron take sencer put fyre therin aulter powre sence go quyckely vnto cō gregacyon thou mayst opteyne forgyuenesse wrath gone lorde plage begon aaron toke moses cōmaunded ran myddes cōgregacion beholde plage begonne among people put sence made atonement people stode bitwene deade alyue plage ceased dyed plage xiiii thousande seuen hundred besyde dyed aboute busynesse corah aaron went agayne vnto moses dore tabernacle wytnesse plage ceased ¶ aaron rod buddith beareth blossom capi xvii lorde spake vnto moses sayenge speake vnto chyldren israel take euery prynce rod house theyr father euen xii roddes wryte euery man name vpō rod wryte aaron name vpon rod leui euery rod house theyr father put tabernacle wytnesse euen place mete man rod chose shall blossome wyl make cease grudgyngꝭ chyldren israel wherby grudge agaynst moses spake vnto chyldren israell prince gaue hym euery prince accordynge theyr father house rod euen • ii roddes rod aaron among roddꝭ moses put roddꝭ lorde tabernacle wytnes morow moses went tabernacle wytnesse beholde hebru ix • rod aaron house leui budded bare blossom almondes moses brought roddes lorde vnto al chyldren israel loked vpon toke euery man rod lorde sayde vnto moses brynge aaron rod agayne wytnesse kept token chyldrens rebellyō theyr murmurynge maye cease fro dye moses dyd lorde cōmaunded hym euen dyd chyldren israel spake vnto moses saynge beholde wasted away consumed al come nought soeuer cometh nygh dwellyng lord dyeth shall vtterly consume away ¶ offyce leuytes tythes fyrst fruytes must gyuen aaron herytage capi xviii lorde sayd vnto aaron thou thy sonnes thy father house ☞ shal beare faute whiche done amysse holy place thou thy sonnes shall beare faute whiche done amysse preesthode num iii •• thy brother tribe leui thy father housholde shalte thou take vnto maye ioyned vnto ministre vnto euen vnto thy sonnes tabernacle wytnesse shal wayte vpon vpon al tabernacle let come nygh vessel sanctuary aulter ye also dye shalbe wayte vpon tabernacle wytnesse al seruyce tabernacle let straunger come nygh vnto therfore shall ye kepe holy place aulter fal wrath vpon chyldren israel beholde haue taken brother leuites amonge chyldren israel gyft gyuen vnto lorde seruyce tabernacle wytnesse therfore shalte thou thy sonnes take hede vnto preestes offyce thyngꝭ perteyne vnto aulter within vayle se ye serue haue gyuen preestes offyce vnto gyfte therfore straunger cometh nye must flayne lorde spake vnto aaron beholde haue gyuen kepyng ☞ heue offerynges halowed thynges chyldren israel euen vnto haue gyuen anoyntyng thy sonnes dutye euer shall thyne holy fyre aulter theyr sacrifice theyr meatofferynges synofferynges trespaceofferynges whiche bryng vnto moost holy thyne thy sonnes holy place shalt thou eate male shall eate let holy vnto also thyne leui vii heueofferynges theyr gyftes thorowout waueofferynges chyldren israel haue gyuen vnto thy sonnes thy doughters dutye euer al cleane thy house shal eate fat oyle fat wyne corne whiche shall offre vnto lorde fyrst fruytes haue gyuen vnto soeuer fyrste rype theyr lande whiche brynge vnto lorde shall thyne cleane thyne house shall eate dedicate thyngꝭ israel shalbe thyn openeth matrice al flesshe men brynge vnto lorde whyther men beastes shalbe thyne neuerthelatter fyrst borne man shalt thou redeme fyrst borne vncleane beastes shalt thou redeme lykewyse redemed shalt thou redeme age moneth value money namelye fyue sycles sycle sanctuary sycle maketh twentye halfepence fyrst borne ox shepe gootes shalte thou redeme holy therfore thou shalt sprynkle theyr blood vpon aulter shalt burne theyr fat vpon sacrifice swete sauoure vnto lorde flesshe thyn leuit viii waue brest ryght shoulder thyn holy heueofferynges whiche chyldren israel offre vnto lorde haue gyuen thy sonnes thy doughters dutye euer let ☞ salted couenaunt euer lorde bothe vnto thy seede lorde spake vnto aaron deut 18 • eccle 〈…〉 thou shalt haue none enheritaunce theyr lande neyther shalte thou haue parte amonge thy parte thyne enherytaunce amonge chyldren israel beholde haue gyuen chyldren leui al tenth israel enheryte seruyce whiche serue tabernacle wytnesse neyther must chyldren israel hence forthecome nygh tabernacle wytnesse leest beare synne dye leuites shal seruyce tabernacle wytnesse ☞ beare theyr synne shalbe law euer generacions among chyldrē israel possesse none enheritaunce tythes chyldren israell whiche pay heueofferyng vnto lorde haue gyuen leuites enherite therfore haue sayd vnto among chyldren israel ye shall possesse none enheritaunce lorde spake vnto moses saynge speake vnto leuites say vnto ye take chyldren israel tithe whiche haue gyuen enheritaunce ye shall take heueofferyng lorde euen tenth parte tithe heueoffering shalbe rekened vnto euē though corne barne fulnesse wyne presse maner ye shall therfore seperate heueoffryng vnto lorde tythes whiche ye receyue chyldren israel ye shall gyue therof vnto lorde heueofferyng shall belonge aaron preest al gyftes ye shal take lordes heueoffrynges ☞ euen fat theyr halowed thynges therfore yu shalte say vnto ye haue taken awaye fat shall counted vnto leuites yf encrease corne floore encrease wyne presse ye shall eate place ye housholdes youre rewarde seruyce tabernacle wytnesse ye shall beare synne reason ye haue taken fat neyther shall ye vnhalowe holy thynges chyldren israel lest ye dye ¶ red howe lawe hym dyeth tabernacle hym toucheth vncleane thynge capi xix lorde spake vnto moses aaron saynge ordynaunce lawe lorde hath commaunded saynge speake vnto chyldrē israel bryng red kowe wt spot wherin blemysshe vpon neuer came yoke ye shal gyue vnto eleazar preest maye brynge hebre 13 c without hoost cause slayne face let eleazar preest take blood fynger sprynkle tabernacle wytnesse seuen tymes cause kowe burnt syght leuit iiii c skyn flesshe blood dunge shalbe burnt also let preest take cedar wood isope purple cloth cast vpon kowe burneth thē let preest wasshe clothes shall bathe flesh water come hoost preest shall vncleane vnto euen burneth shall wasshe clothes water bathe fleshe water vncleane vntyl euen man cleane shal take vp asshes kow put without hoost cleane place shall kepte multitude chyldren israel nume 3 b sprynklynge water attonement synne therfore gathereth asshes kowe shal wasshe clothes remayne vncleane vntyll euen shall vnto chyldren israell vnto straunger dwelleth amonge statute euer nume 31 • •• l • 34 〈◊〉 ii c toucheth deade body man shall vncleane seuen dayes shall puryfye hym selfe water thyrde daye seuenth day shal cleane yf purifie hym selfe thyrde day seuenth day shall cleane whosoeuer toucheth coorse man deade sprynkleth hym selfe defyleth dwellynge lorde soule shalbe roted israell bycause sprynklynge water sprynkled vpon hym shall therfore vncleane vncleannesse shall remayne vpon hym lawe man dyeth tent come tent tent shall vncleane seuen dayes vessel open haue lyd couerynge vpon shalbe vncleane soeuer toucheth one slayne swerde feldes deade persone bone deade man graue shall vncleane seuen dayes therfore vncleane person shal take burnt asshes synofferynge runnyng water shal put therto vessell let cleane persone psal li b take isope dyp water sprynkle vpon tente vpon al vessel soules therin vpon touched bone slayne person deade body graue cleane persone shall sprynkle vpon vncleane thyrde day seuenth day seuenth day shal purifie hym selfe wasshe clothes bathe hym selfe water shall cleane euen man vncleane sprynkleth hym selfe soule shalbe destroyed amonge congregacyon bycause hath defyled hooly place lorde sprynklynge water hath bene sprynkled vpō hym therfore shall remayn vncleane shal perpetuall lawe vnto sprynkleth sprynklyng water shall wasshe clothes toucheth sprynklyng water shall vncleane vntyll euen soeuer vncleane persone toucheth shalbe vncleane soule toucheth shal vncleane vntyll euen ¶ mir iam dyeth people murmure haue water euen rocke edom denyeth israelite passage thorowe realme death aaron whose rowme eleazar succedeth capi xx chyldren israel came hole multitude deserte nume 33 sin first moneth people abode cades dyed mir iam buryed water multitude ✚ gathered selues togyther agaynste moses aaron people chode moses spake saynge wolde god perysshed whē brother dyed lorde haue ye brought congregacyon lorde vnto wyldernesse bothe cattell shulde dye exod 17 • wherfore haue ye made v go egypte bryng v vngracyous place place seed fygges vynes pomegarnates neyther water drynke moses aaron wente congregacyon vnto dore tabernacle wytnesse fell vpon theyr face ❀ cryed vnto lorde fayde lorde god heare crye people open thy treasure euen fountayne lyuynge vvater may satisfyed theyr murmurynge may cease glorye lorde appeared vnto lorde spake vnto moses sayenge take rod gather thou thy brother aaron congregacyon togyther speake vnto rocke theyr eye shall gyue water thou shalte brynge water rocke gyue company drynke theyr beastes also exodi 17 c moses toke rod lorde cōmaunded hym moses aaron gathered cōgregacyon togyther rocke moses sayd vnto ye rebellyons must fetche water rocke moses lyft vp hande psal 74 b rod smote rocke two tymes water came aboundauntly multitude dranke theyr beastes also lorde spake vnto moses aaron bycause ye byleued sanctifie eye chyldren israel therfore ye shall brynge congregacyon lande whiche haue gyuen water stryfe bycause chyldren israel stroue lorde ☞ sanctified ⊢ moses iudges 〈◊〉 c sent messenger cades vnto kynge edom thus saythe thy brother israel thou knowest trauayle hath happened v father wente downe egypte haue dwelte egypte longe tyme egypcians vexed v father cryed vnto lorde herde oure voyce sente angell hath fet v egypte beholde cades euen vttermoost citie thy bordre wyll go thorowe thy countrey nume 2 • • wyll go thorowe feldes vyneyeardes neyther wyl drynke water fountaynꝭ wyll go kynges hye way neyther turne vnto ryght hande left vntyl past thy coūtrey edom answered hym thou shalt go lest come agaynst swerde chyldren israel sayde vnto hym wyl go beaten waye yf cattell drynke thy water wyll pay ❀ wyll onely without harme go thorow feete answered thou shalt go thorow edom came agaynst hym moche people myghty power thus edom denyed gyue israel passage thorowe countrey wherfore israel turned away hym chyldren israel departed cades came vnto mounte hor congregacyon lorde spake vnto moses aaron mounte hor harde coost lande edom sayenge aaron shall ☞ gathered vnto people shall come lande whiche haue gyuen vnto chyldren israell bycause ye disobeyed mouth water stryfe take aaron eleazar sonne brynge vp mount hor thou shalte stryppe aaron vestimentes put vpon eleazar sonne aaron shal gathered vnto people shall dye moses dyd lorde cōmaunded went vp mount hor syght multitude moses toke aarous clothes put vpon eleazar sonne deute • • xxxii aaron dyed top mounte moses eleazar came downe mount multitude sawe aaron dead mourned aaron thyrtie dayes thorowout housholdes israel ¶ israell • auques •• eth kynge arad fyrye serpentes stynge kynges sehon og ouercome battayle capi intercessyō lorde take away serpentes v moses made intercession people lorde sayd vnto moses ☞ ❀ make fyrie serpent set vp sygne many bytten maye loke vpon lyue iohn̄ •• b 4 reg 18 moses made serpent brasse set vp sygne serpentes bytten mā behelde serpent brasse healed nume 33 chyldrē israel departed thence pytched oboth departed oboth pitched heapes abarim euen wyldernesse whiche playne moab east syde remoued thence pytched vpon ryuer zarad departed thence pytched syde arnon wyldernes cometh coostes amorites arnon border moab bytwene moab amorites wherfore spoken ☞ boke warre lorde thynge dyd red see ryuers arnon heade ryuers gothe downe dwellyng ar stretcheth vnto border moab thence turneth vnto beer beer well wherof lorde spake vnto moses gather people togyther wyll gyue water israel sange songe aryse vp wel syng ye vnto hym prynces dygged wel captaynes people digged teacher theyr staues wyldernesse wente matana matana nahaliel nahaliel bamoth bamoth valey felde moab vnto toppe hyll appeareth iesimon israell sent messenger vnto sehon kynge amorytes saynge nume xx c deute ii xx b wyll go thorow thy lande wyll turne feldes vyneyeardꝭ neyther drynke water well wyll go alonge kynges hye way vntyll past thy countrey deut 29 b sehon wolde gyue israell lycence passe thorowe coūtrey gathered al peple togyther went agaynst israel wyldernes came iaheza fought agaynst israel deute • xxxi iosua 24 israell smote hym edge swerde conquered lande arnon vnto iabock vnto chyldren ammon bordre chyldren ammon deute ii stronge israell toke cyties dwelte cyties amorites hesbon townes long therto hesbon cytie sehon kyng amorites fought agaynst kyng moabites toke lande hande euen vnto arnon wherfore say prouerbe come hesbon let cytie sehon buylte repayred fyre gone hesbon flame cytie sehon hath consumed ar moab enheritours hye place arnon wo moab people ☞ chamos ye vndone hath put sonnes flyght doughters captiuite vnto sehon kyng amorites theyr empyre lost hesbon vnto dibon made wyldernes euen vnto nopha reacheth mediba thus israel dwelt land amorites moses sent serche iaezer toke townꝭ belongyng therto roted amorites therin deute iii xxix • turned wente vp towarde basan og kyng basan came agaynst people fyght adrei lorde sayde vnto moses feare hym haue delyuered hym thy hande people lande thou shalt hym yu dyddest vnto sehon kyng amoritꝭ dwelt hesbon smote therfore sonnes people vntyll nothyng left hym cōquered land ¶ kynge ba • ar sendeth balaam whose name hebrue wrytten b • leam balaams asse speaketh capi xxii chyldren israel departed pytched feldes moab syde iordane ouer agaynste iericho iosue ••• balac son ziphor law israel done amorites moabites sore afrayde people bycause many ❀ stode feare chyldren israel moab sayd vnto elder madian nowe shall company lycke vp rounde aboute v oxe lycketh vp grasse felde balac son ziphor kynge moabites tyme sent messenger therfore vnto deute 18 11 pete 〈◊〉 • balaam sonne beor pethor whiche ryuer land chyldren folke call hym sayeng beholde people come egypte beholde couer face earthe dwell ouer agaynst come nowe therfore curse people sake myghtye yf peraduenture myght able smyte dryue lande wote thou blessest blessed thou cursest cursed elder moab elder madian departed hauyng rewarde sothsaynge theyr hand came vnto balaam tolde hym wordes balac answered tary nyght wyll bryng worde euen lorde shall say vnto lordes moab abode balaam god came vnto balaam sayd men balaam sayde vnto god balac sonne ziphor kynge moab hath sent vnto sayeng beholde people come egypte couereth face earth come nowe therfore curse sake yf peraduenture may able ouercome battayle dryue god sayde vnto balaam go thou neyther curse people blessed balaam rose vp mornynge sayd vnto lordes balac get vnto lande lorde wyll suffre go lordes moab rose vp went vnto balac sayd balaam wolde come v balac sent agayne greater company lordes honourable came balaā tolde hym thus sayth balac sonne ziphor oh let nothynge let come vnto wyll greatly promote vnto great honour wyll soeuer thou sayest vnto come praye curse people sake balaam answered sayd vnto seruauntes balac num 24 • balac wolde gyue house full syluer golde go beyond worde lorde god lesse therfore tary ye nyght may wete lorde wyll say vnto god came vnto balaam nyght sayde vnto hym men come call ryse vp go loke saye vnto shalt thou balaam rose vp earlye sadled asse went lordes moab coūtenaunce god ☞ angrye bycause went angell lorde stode way agaynst rode vpō asse two seruauntꝭ hym asse saw angel lorde stande way hauyng swerd drawen hande asse turned syde way went felde balaā smote asse turne way angell lorde stoode path bytwene vyneyardes wall one syde asse sawe angel lorde wrenched vnto wall thrust balaams fote vnto wall smote agayne angell lorde went forther stode narowe place way turne eyther right hande lefte asse sawe angel lorde fell downe vnder balaam balaam wrothe smote asse staffe lord opened mouth asse sayd vnto balaam haue done vnto thou hast smyten nowe thre tymes balaam sayd vnto asse bycause thou hast mocked wolde also swerde hande euen nowe wolde kyll asse sayde vnto balaam thyne asse thou hast ryddē vpon synce thou wast borne vnto day euer wonte vnto sayd nay lorde opened eye balaam saw angell lorde standyng way hauynge swerde drawen hande bowed hymselfe therfore fell flat face angell lorde sayd vnto hym wherfore hast thou smyten thyne asse thre tymes beholde came aduersary bycause thou makest thy way contrary vnto asse sawe wente backe fro thre tymes el yf turned fro ❀ gyuynge place stode vvaye surely slayne saued alyue balaam sayde vnto angell lorde haue synned wyst thou stodest waye agaynst nowe therfore yf please wyll turne home agayne angell sayde vnto balaam go men say vnto shalte thou speake balaam went lordes balac balac herde balaam come went mete hym vnto citye moab whiche border arnon euen vttermost coost balac sayd vnto balaam dyd sende call wherfore camest thou vnto bycause able promote vnto honoure balaam made answere vnto balac lo come vnto nowe say thynge worde god nume 23 • putteth mouthe shall speake balaam went balac came ❀ vnto citye stretes balac offered ox shepe sent ❀ revvardes balaam lordes hym morow balac toke balaā brought hym vp hygh place baall thence myght se vttermost parte people ¶ balaam blesseth people capi xxiii balaam sayd vnto balac buylde seuen aulters prepare seuen ox seuen rammes balac dyd balaam sayde balac balaam offered euery aulter oxe ram balaam sayd vnto balac stande sacrifyce wyll go yf haplye lorde wyll mete whatsoeuer sheweth wyll tell went forth alone god met balaam balaam sayd vnto hym haue prepared seuen aulters haue offered vpon euery aulter ore ram lorde put sayenge balaams mouth sayd go agayne balac say wyse went agayne vnto hym loo stoode sacrifyce al lordes moab toke vp parable sayde num 22 • balac kynge moab hath fet mesopotamia mountaynes easte sayenge come curse iacob sake come defye israell howe shal curse hym whome god hath cursed shall defyle hym god hath defyled top rockes se hym hylles beholde hym lo people shall dwell selfe shall rekened among nation tell duste iacob nombre fourth parte israell praye god soule may dye death ryghtous laste ende may lyke balac sayde vnto balaam hast thou done vnto fette curse myne enemyes beholde thou hast blessed answered sayde muste kepe speake lord hath put mouth balac sayde vn hym come praye vnto another place whence thou mayst se thou shalt se vttermost parte shalt se curse place sake brought hym felde men myght se farof euen toppe hyll buylte seuen aulters offered oxe ram euery aulter sayde vnto balac stande thy sacryfyce whyle go yonder lord met balaā num 22 • put worde mouth sayde go agayne vnto balac saye thus came hym beholde stoode sacrifyce lordes moab hym balac sayde vnto hym hath lorde sayde toke vp parable answered ryse vp balac herken vnto thou son ziphor corin b x c god man shulde lye neyther sonne man shulde repent shulde say shulde speake make good beholde haue taken vpō blesse hath blessed power alter ❀ behelde vanyte iacob sawe trauayle▪ israell lorde god hym ❀ presence kynge amonge num 24 • god brought egypte hath strength vnycorne sorcery iacob southsayenge israel ❀ nowe tolde vnto iacob israell god hath wrought behold peple shall ryse vp lyonesse heue vp hymselfe lyon shal lye downe vntyll eate praye drynke bloode slayne balac sayde vnto balaam neyther curse blesse balaam answered sa • vnto balac tolde sayenge lorde speaketh must balac sayd vnto balaā come praye wyll brynge yet vnto another place yf peraduenture shal please god thou mayst thence curse sake balac brought balaam vnto top peor boweth toward wyldernesse iesymmon balaam sayde vnto balac make seuē aulters prepare seuen ox seuen rammes balac dyd balaam sayde offered oxe ram euery aulter ¶ balaam prophesyeth kyngdome israell comyng chryst balac angry balaam destru • cyon amelechires kenites capi xxiiii balaam sawe pleased lorde shulde blesse israell wente dyd twyse fette sothsayenge set face towarde wyldernesse balaam lyfte vp eye loked vpon israel lay accordynge trybes spiryte god came vpon hym num 24 • toke vp parable sayde balaam son beor hath sayde man whose eye open hathe sayde hath sayd heareth wordꝭ god seeth vision almyghtye falleth downe wt open eye goodly tentes iacob thyne habitacions israell euē valeys layde abrode garden ryuers syde tentes whiche lorde hath pytched cipers tree besyde water ❀ water droppeth pooket seede shalbe many water 1 reg • 5 b kynge shalbe hygher agag kyngdome shall exalted nume 23 god brought egypt strength vnycorne vnto hym shall eate nacyons enemyes gnawe theyr bone pearce thorow arowes ••• e x •• x b couched hym selfe ☞ laye downe lyon lyonesse shall styrre hym vp blessed blesseth cursed curseth balac wrothe balaam smote handes togyther balac sayd vnto balaam sent curse myne enemyes behold thou hast blessed iii tymes therfore get quyklye vnto thy place thought wolde promote vnto honoure lo lorde hath kepte backe worshyp balaā answered vnto balac tolde thy messenger whiche thou sendest vnto sayenge nume 22 yf balac wolde gyue housefull syluer golde passe worde lorde eyther good bad myne owne mynde lorde sayeth compelled speake nowe beholde go vnto people come therfore wyll aduertyse people shall thy folke latter dayes toke vp parable sayd balaam sonne beor hath sayde man whose eye open hath sayd hath sayde heareth worde god hath knowledge hygh beholdeth visyon almyghtye falleth open eye shall se hym shall beholde hym nygh math ii shall come sterre iacob ryse • epter israell shal 11 reg • smyte coostes moab shall destroye chyldren seth 11 reg 8 b edom shalbe possessed seir shall fall possessyon theyr enemyes israell shal manfully iacob shal come shal haue dominiō shall destroy remenaunt citye loked amalech toke vp parable sayde amalech fyrst nacions exod • 7 b 1 reg xv latter ende shall perysshe vtterly loked kenytes toke vp parable sayde stronge thy dwellynge place thou puttest thy nest rocke neuerthelesse kenyte shal roted vntyll assur take presoner toke vp parable sayd ala shall lyue god doeth shyppes also shal come coost italy subdue assur subdue eber hym selfe shall perysh last balaam rose vp went returned place balac also went waye ¶ people cōmy • teth fornicaryon doughters moab phentheo kylleth zam • • ozbi god cōmaundeth kyll madeanites capi xxv israell dwelte sittim people began commyt hooredome doughters moab whiche called people vnto sacrifice theyr goddes exodi 〈◊〉 ▪ • ▪ people dyd eate worshypped theyr goddes israell coupled hym selfe vnto ☞ baall peor indygnacion lorde prouoked agaynst israell lorde sayde vnto moses take prynces people hange vp lorde ☞ agaynst son wrath lordes countenaunce maye turned awaye israel moses sayd vnto iudges israel exodi▪ 〈◊〉 ▪ ❀ euery one sleye men ioyned vnto baall peor behold one chyldren israel came brought vnto brother madia •• tyshe woman euen syght moses syght multytude chyldren israell wepte dore • abernacle wytnes 1 •• ▪ 〈◊〉 ▪ whē phinehes sonne eleazar sonne aaron preest sawe rose vp myddes company toke weapon hande went man israell ☞ tent thrust thorowe bothe man israell also woman euen thorowe belly plage ceased chyldren israel 1 • ••• ▪ dyed plage xxiiii thousād lorde spake vnto moses sayenge 〈…〉 1 math▪ • ▪ phinehes sonne eleazar sonne aaron preest hath turned myne anger awaye chyldren israel whyle ielouse sake amonge consumed chyldren israell ielousye wherfore saye beholde 〈…〉 gyue vnto hym couenaunt peace shall haue seed hym euen couenaūt preestes offyce euer bycause ielouse goddes sake made atonement chyldren israell name israelite sleyne madianytysshe woman zamri son sal • lorde house kynred simeon name madianityshe famous congregacion num 16 a▪ stroue agaynst moses aaron companye corah stroue agaynst lorde nume▪ 16 • ▪ earth opened mouth swalowed vp corah also death multitude tyme fyre consumed two hundred fiftye men became sygne notwithstandynge chyldren corah dyed chyldren simeon theyr kynreds nemuell whome cōmeth kynred nemuelites iamin whome commeth kynred iaminytes iachin whome cōmeth kynred iachinites zareh commeth kynred zarehites saull commeth kynred saul • te kynredꝭ simeon euen xxii▪ thousande two hundred chyldren gad theyr kynreds zephon whome cōmeth kynred zephonites haggi whome cōmeth kynred haggites suni whome cōmeth kynred sun • te aseni commeth kynred asenites eri commeth kynred erites arod cō meth kynred arodites •• ell commeth kynred arielites kynreds chyldren gad • 〈◊〉 • iusua x • • many thou shalte gyue enheritaunce fewe lesse euery trybe shall enheritaunce gyuen accordynge nombre therof notwithstandynge lande shall deuyded lot accordyng name tribe theyr father shal enheryte accordyng lot shall possessyon therof deuyded bytwene many fewe nume • • nombres leuytes theyr kynreds gerson whome came kynred gersonites cahath whome came kynred cahathites merari whome came kynred merarites kynreds leuytes kynred libnites kynred hebronites kynred mahelites kynred musytes kynred karahites kahath begat amrā amrams wyfe called exod 〈◊〉 • iochebed doughter leui borne vnto leui egypt bare vnto amram aaron moses mir iam theyr syster vnto aaron borne nadab abihu eleazar ithamar n 〈◊〉 nadab abihu dyed offered straunge fyre lorde theyr nōbres xxiii thousande male moneth olde aboue nombred amonge chyldren israell bycause enheritaunce gyuen amonge chyldren israel nombres moses eleazar preest nombred chyldren israell playne moab fast iordane ouer agaynst iericho amonge man whome moses aaron nombred told chyldren israell wyldernesse sinay lorde sayde shall dye wyldernesse lefte man saue caleb sonne iephune iosua son nun ¶ lawe herytage doughters zelap lorde lorde spake vnto moses sayenge doughters zelaphead speake ryght thou shalte gyue possession enheryt among theyr father brethrē shalt turne enheritaunce theyr father vnto thou shalte speake vnto chyldren israell saynge yf man dye haue son ye shall turne enherytaunce vnto doughter haue doughter ye shal gyue enheritaunce vnto brother yf haue also brother ye shall gyue enheritaunce vnto father brother yf father haue brother ye shal gyue enheritaūce vnto nexte hym kynred shall possesse shalbe vnto chyldren israel ☞ law iudgement lord hath cōmaunded moses lorde sayde vnto moses deut iii 34 exodi 29 • offerynge whiche ye shall offer vnto lorde two lambes yeare olde without spot daye daye continuall burntofferynge one lambe shalt thou offer mornyng euen nume 15 • therto tenth parte epha floure meatoffering mingled beaten oyle conteynynge fourth parte hin dayly burntofferynge suche ordeyned mounte sinay swete sauour sacrifyce vnto lorde let drynkeofferynge fourth parte hin one lambe hooly place shalte thou cōmaunde wyne powred vnto lorde lambe thou shalte offer euen maner meatofferynge drynkofferynge mornynge sacrifyce shalte thou offre swete sauour vnto lorde sabboth day two lambes yeare olde pece without spot two tenthdeales floure meatofferynge myngled oyle drynofferynge therto burntofferynge sabboth must doone selfe sabboth besydes dayly burntofferynge drynkeofferyng bygynnyngꝭ monethes ye shall offer burntofferyng vnto lorde two yonge bullockꝭ ram vii lambes yeare olde without spot thre tenthdeales floure meatoffryng myngled oyle one bullocke two tenthdeales one bullocke thyrde parte hin wine vnto ram fourth parte hin vnto lambe burntofferynge moneth ☞ moneth thorowout monethes yeare one goote synofferynge vnto lorde shalbe offered dayly burntofferyng meate drynkofferynges longe leuiti 23 • xv daye vii moneth ☞ ye shall haue hooly conuocacion seruile worke ye shall kepe feast vnto lorde vii dayes longe ye shall offer burntofferyng sacrifyce swete sauour vnto lorde xiii bullockes two rammes xiiii lambꝭ yeare olde shalbe without blemysh theyr meatofferynge shall floure myngled wt oyle thre tenthdeales vnto euery one xiii bullockes two tenthdeales eyther rammes one tenthdeale vnto eche xiiii lambes one goote syn besyde dayly burntofferyng meat drynkeofferynge seconde daye ye shall offer xii yong bullockes two rammes xiiii yerelyng meat drynke offerynge fourth day ye shall offre x bullockes two rammes xiiii lambes yerelyngꝭ pure let theyr meat drynkofferynges vnto bullockes rammꝭ lambes accordynge nōbre maner goote syn besyde dayly burntofferynge meate drynkeofferyng fyfth day ye shal offer ix bullockes two rammꝭ xiiii lambꝭ one yeare olde pece without spot let theyr meate drynkeofferyngꝭ vnto bullockes rammes lambes accordynge nombre maner goote syn besyde dayly burntofferyng meat drynkofferyng syxte daye ye shall offre viii bullockes two rammes xiiii yerelyng lambes without spot let theyr meat drynkofferynges vnto bullockes rammꝭ lambes accordyng nōbre •• ter maner goote synne besyde dayly burntofferyng meate drynkeofferyngꝭ seuenth day ye shal offre vii bullockꝭ two rammꝭ xiiii lambes yerelynges pure let theyr meat drynkeofferyngꝭ vnto bullockes rammes lambes accordynge theyr nombre maner goote synne besyde dayly burntoffferyng meate drynkeofferynge eyght daye ye shall haue ☞ collection feast vnto ye shall seruyle worke therin ye shall offre burntofferyng sacrifyce swete sauour vnto lorde one ballocke one ram vii yerelynge lambes wtout spot let theyr meate drynkeofferynges vnto bullocke ram lambes accordyng theyr nō bre accordynge maner goote syn beside dayly burntofferynge meat drynkeofferyng thyngꝭ ye shal vnto lorde feastes besyde vowes frewylofferyngꝭ burntofferyngꝭ meatofferynges drynkeofferyngꝭ peaceofferynges moses tolde chyldren israell lorde commaunded hym ¶ vowes shall hepte capi xxx ann moses spake vnto heades trybes chyldren israel sayenge thynge whiche lorde hath cōmaunded deute 23 yf man vowe vowe vnto lorde swere othe bynde soule shall go backe worde shall fulfyll proceded mouth yf woman also vowe vowe vnto lorde bynde selfe beynge father house tyme youth father heare vowe bond hath made vpon soule holde peace therto vowes bondes whiche hath made vpon soule shall stande effecte yf father forbyd daye heareth noone vowes bondes whiche hath made vpon soule shalbe value lorde shal gyue bycause father forbad yf husbande vowed pronounced ought lyppes wherwith bonde soule husbande herde helde peace daye herde vowes bondꝭ wherwith bounde soule shall stande effecte yf husbande forbad daye herde made vowe whiche vpon none effecte released openynge lyppes wherwith bounde soule lorde shall forgyue euery vowe wedowe deuorsed haue ☞ bounde theyr soule withall shall stande effecte wt yf vowed husbandes house bounde soule othe husbande herde helde peace forbad vowes bondes wherwith bounde soule shall stande yf husbande dysanulled daye herde nothyng proceded lyppes vowes bondes wherwith bounde soule shal stande effecte husbande hath loosed lorde shal forgyue vowes othes bynde humble soule maye husbande stably breake yf husbande holde peace one day vnto another stablesheth vowes bondes vpō bycause helde peace daye herde yf breake ☞ hath herde shall beare synne hym selfe ordynaunces whiche lorde cōmaunded moses bytwene man wyfe bytwene father doughter beynge yet damsel father house ¶ madianites balaam sleyne praye equally deuyded present gyuen israell capi xxxi lorde spake vnto moses sayenge auenge chyldren israel madianites afterwarde shalt thou gathered vnto thy people moses spake vnto folke sayenge harnesse vnto war let go vpon madianites auenge lorde madianites let chosen thousand euery trybe israell trybes ye maye sende warre takē ☞ thousandꝭ israell xii thousande prepared vnto war euery trybe thousande moses sent warre euen thousande euery trybe phineas sonne eleazar preest ☞ holy vessel nume 25 trompettes blowe handenume • • warred agaynst madianites lorde cōmaunded moses slewe male slewe kynges madian amonge sleyne namely eui rekem zur hur reba fyue kynges madian balaā sonne beor whome slew swerde chyldren israell toke woman madian prysoners theyr chyldren spoyled theyr cattel theyr flockes theyr goodes burnt theyr cityes wherin dwelt theyr castels fyre toke spoyle coulde catche bothe men beastes brought captyues taken spoyle vnto moses eleazar preest vnto companye chyldren israell euen vnto hoost feldes meab iordan ouer agaynst ierico moses eleazar preest lordes congregacion went hoost agaynst moses angrie officer hoost captaynes ouer thousandes ouer hundredes came warre battayle moses sayde vnto haue ye saued woman alyue beholde num 25 caused chyldren israell thorow ☞ counsell ii pet ii balaam commyt trespace agaynst lorde busynesse peor folowed plage amonge congregacion lorde nowe therfore iudi xxi • sley men chyldren woman haue lyen men fleshlye woman chyldren haue lyen wt men kepe lyue selues ye shall remayne without hoost vii dayes haue kylled person num 〈◊〉 • haue touched deade bodye purify selues prysoners thyrde day seuenth sprynkle youre raymentes made skynnes worke gootes heere althynges made woode eleazar preest sayd vnto men war whiche came frome battayle ordynaunce lawe whiche lorde commaunded moses golde syluer brasse yron tyn leade ☞ maye abyde fyre ye shall make go thorowe fyre shall cleane neuerthelesse shall sprynkled sprynklynge water al suffereth fyre ye shal make go thorowe water washe clothes seuenth daye ye shall cleane afterwarde come hooste lorde spake vnto moses sayenge take somme praye taken woman cattell thou eleazar preest auncient father congregacyon deuyde two partes bytwene toke warre vpon went battayle congregacyon take porciō vnto lorde men warre whiche went battayle ☞ one soule fyue hundred bothe woman ox ass shepe ye shall take theyr halfe gyue vnto eleazar preest heueofferyng lord halfe chyldrē israell thou shalt take one porcyon fiftye woman ox ass shepe maner beastes gyue vnto leuites wayte vpon habitacyon lorde moses eleazar preest dyd lorde commaunded moses bootye pray men warre lordes parte xxx • soules moses gaue somme lordes heueofferyng vnto eleazar preest lorde cōmaunded moses halfe chyldren israel whiche moses seperated frome men war wete halfe perteyned ☞ vnto congregacyon iii hundred thousande xxxvii thousande fyue hundred shepe xxxvi thousande ox xxx thousande ass fyue hundred xvi thousande soules womē moses toke halfe perteyned vnto chyldrē israel one porcyon fyftie bothe woman cattel gaue vnto leuytes whiche wayted vpon habitacyon lorde lorde cōmaunded moses offycers thousandes hoost captaynes ouer thousandes captaynes ouer hundredes came forth sayde vnto moses thy seruauntes haue taken somme men warre whiche vnder oure auctoryte lacketh one man v haue therfore brought present vnto lorde soeuer man founde iewels golde cheynes bracelettes rynges earynges spangle make atonement soules lorde moses eleazar preest toke golde iewels maner facions golde heueofferyng heued vp lorde captaynes ouer thousandes hundredes xvi thousande vii hundred l sycles men war spoyled euery man hym selfe moses eleazar preest toke golde captaynꝭ ouer thousandes captaynes ouer hundredes brought tabernacle wytnesse memoryall chyldren israel lorde ¶ ruben god halfe trybe manasses promised possessyon beyonde iordayne eastwarde capi xxxii chyldren ruben chyldren gad excedynge great multitude cattell sawe lande iazer lande gilead apte place cattel chyldren ruben chyldrē gad came spake vnto moses eleazar preest vnto lordes congregacyon sayenge lande ataroth dibon iazer nem • ah hesbon elealeh sabam nebo beon whiche countrey lorde smote congregacyon israel lande mete cattell thy seruauntes haue cattell wherfore sayde yf haue founde grace thy syght let lande gyuen vnto thy seruauntes possesse brynge v ouer iordan moses sayde vnto chyldren gad ruben shall brother go warre ye shall syt wherfore dyscourage ye herte chyldren israel shulde go ouer lande whiche lorde hath gyuen nume 13 thus dyd father whē sent cades barne se lande went vp euen vnto ryuer escoll sawe lande discouraged hertes chyldren israel shulde go lande lorde hath gyuē lorde wroth tyme sware sayenge nume 14 • none men came egypte twentye yere olde aboue shall se lande whiche sware vnto abraham isaac iacob bycause haue hollye folowed saue caleb sonne iephune kenesite iosua sonne nun haue folowed lorde lorde angrie israel made wandre wyldernesse fourtye yere vntyll generacyon hadde done euyll syghte lorde consumed beholde ye rysen vp youre father steade encrease synfull men augmente fearse wrath lorde warde israel yf ye turne away frō hym wyll yet agayne leaue people wyldernesse ye shal destroy al folke wente neare hym sayde wyl buylde shepe foldes shepe cattell ❀ vvalled city chyldren oure selues wyll go redye armed chyldren israell vntyll haue brought vnto theyr place chyldren ❀ vvhat soeuer vve may haue shall dwell fenced city bycause inhabiters lande wyll returne vnto oure house vntyll chyldren israel haue enherited euery man enheritaunce neyther wyll enheryte yonder syde iordan forwarde bycause oure enheritaunce fallen v syde iordan eastwarde moses sayde vnto ye wyll thynge go harnessed lorde warre wyl go har nesse ouer iordane lorde vntyll haue cast enemyes vntyll lande subdued lorde ye shall returne without synne lorde israell land shal possessyon lorde yf ye wyll beholde ye haue synned agaynst lorde sure youre synne wyll fynde nowe therfore buylde city chyldren foldes shepe ye haue spoken chyldren gad chyldren ruben spake vnto moses sayenge thy seruauntes wyll lorde commaundeth oure chyldren oure wyues oure shepe oure cattell shall remayne heare cyties gylead iosua 4 • thy seruauntes wyll go harnessed warre vnto battayle lorde lorde sayth theyr sake moses cōmaunded eleazar preest iosua sonne nun auncient father trybes chyldren israell moses sayd vnto chyldren gad chyldren ruben wyl go ouer iordan al prepared fyght lorde lande subdued ye shall gyue lande gylead possesse yf wyll go ouer harnesse shall haue theyr possessyons among lande canaan chyldren gad chyldren ruben answered saynge lorde hath sayde vnto thy seruauntes wyll iosua 22 wyll go harnessed lorde lande canaan possessyons oure enherytaunce maye syde iordan moses gaue vnto chyldren gad chyldren ruben vnto halfe trybe manasse sonne ioseph kyngdome sehon kynge amorites kyngdom og kyng basan lande cityes therof coostes cityes countrey roūde aboute chyldren gad built dibon ataroth aroer atroth sophan ia • ser iegabea bethnimra betharan fenced city buylte foldes shepe chyldren ruben buylt hesbon eleale kiriathaim nebo baal meon ☞ turned theyr name sibama also gaue name vnto city whiche buylded chyldren machir sonne manasse wente gilead toke put amorites dwelte therin moses gaue gilead vnto machir sonne manasse dwelte therin deut 〈◊〉 • iahir sonne manasse wente toke smal townes therof called hauoth iair nobah went toke kenath townes longyng therto called nobah owne name ¶ ion • ney israell nombred commaunded kyll canaanite capi xxxiii iourneys chyldren isaell whiche went lande egypte theyr armyes vnder hande moses aaron moses wrote theyr goynge theyr iourneys ac cordynge cōmaundement lorde euen iourneys theyr goynge exodi ••• departed rahemses xv day fyrst moneth morowe exodi ••• passeouer chyldren israel wente hygh hand syght egyptian egyptian buryed theyr fyrstborne lorde smytten among vpon theyr god also lorde dyd execucyon chyldren israel remoued rahemses pytched socoth departed exodi ••• socoth pytched theyr tentes ethan whiche edge wyldernesse remoued ethan turned agayne vnto exodi 14 • pi hiroth whiche baal zephon pytched mig doll departed playne hiroth exodi 14 • went thorowe myddes see wyldernesse wente thre dayes iourney wyldernesse ethan pytched marah remoued marah came vnto exodi 16 • elim xii foūtaynes water lxx palme tree pytched remoued elim laye fast red see remoued red see laye wildernes sin toke theyr iourney exodi 〈◊〉 • wyldernesse sin set vp tentes daphka departed frome daphka laye
