commaundement lorde dyed euen fourtyeth yere chyldren israel come lande egypte fyrst daye fyfte moneth aaron hūdred xxiii yeare olde dyed mount hor▪ kyng erad canaanite whiche dwelte south lande canaan herde comyng chyldrē israel departed num xxi b mount hor pitched zalmona departed zalmona pytched phunon departed phunon pitched oboth departed oboth pyched iohabarim toward border moab departed frome nume 2 • • iehabarim pytched dibon gad▪ remoued dibon gad laye almon diblathaim remoued almon diblathaim pitched mountaynes abarim nabo departed mountaynes abarim pytched feldes moab fast iordan ouer agaynst iericho pytched iordane beth haiesmoth 〈◊〉 25 vnto playne sittim feldes moab lorde spake vnto moses feldes moab iordan ouer agaynst iericho saynge speake vnto chyldren israel say vnto deute 7 • ye come ouer iordan entre lande canaan ye shall dryue inhabyters lande destroy ❀ theyr pyctures breake asondre theyr image metal plucke downe al theyr aulters possesse lande dwell therin haue gyuen lande enioye ye shall deuyde enherytaunce lande lot amonge kynreddes num 26 • gyue moo enherytaunce fewer lesse enheritaunce enherytaunce shalbe tribe father euery man enherytaunce place lot falleth iudi e f yf ye wyll dryue inhabyters lande whiche ye let remayne shall ☞ pryckes eye dartes sydes shall vexe lande wherein ye dwell moreouer wyll come passe shall de vnto thought vnto ¶ coostes bordres lande promesse certayne men assygned deuyde lande capi xxxiiii lorde spake vnto moses sayenge cōmaunde chyldren israel saye vnto ye come land canaā lande shal fal vnto enherytaunce lande canaā coostes iosua • v youre south quarter shalbe frō wyldernesse sin alonge coost edō south quarter reache syde salt see eastward fet compasse south vp acra reache zinna go south cades barne go also hazat adar go along azmon fet compasse agayne azmon vnto ry uer egypte shall go see let west quarter great see let see west coost shall north quarter ye shal compasse border great see vnto mounte hor mounte hor ye shall describe border tyll come vnto hemath ende coost shalbe zedada coost shal reache ziphron go hazar enan shal north quarter ye shall compasse east quarter hazar enan sepham coost shall go downe sepham ribla east syde border shal descende go syde see cenereth castwarde go downe alonge iordane leaue salte see shall youre lande coostes therof round aboute moses cōmaunded chyldren israel saynge lande ye shal enheryte lot whiche lorde cōmaunded gyue vnto nyne trybes halfe nume 〈◊〉 • trybe chyldren ruben arcordyng housholdes theyr father trybe chyldren gad accordynge theyr father housholdes halfe trybe manasse haue receyued theyr enherytaunce two tribe halfe haue receyued theyr enheritaūce syde iordan ouer agaynst ierico eastwarde lorde spake moses sayenge name men whiche shal deuyde land vnto eleazar preest deuse 3 iosua 14 iosua sonne nun ye shall take also lorde euery trybe ye deuyde lande name men trybe iuda caleb sonne iephune trybe chyldren suncon semuel sonne amiud trybe ben iamin elidad sonne cisson trybe chyldren dan lorde bucki sonne iagli among chyldren ioseph trybe chyldrē manasse lorde haniel son ephod tribe chyldren ephraim lorde camuel son siph • trybe sonnes zabulon lorde elizaphan sonne pharnach trybe chyldren isachar lorde palthyel son asan trybe sonnes aser lorde ahihud sonne salomi trybe chyldrē nephthali lorde peda el sonne ammihud lorde cōmaunded deuyde enheritaunce vnto chyldrē israel lande canaan ¶ cityes suburbes gyuen leuites cityes refuge lawe manquellynge one man wytnesse shall man condempned capi xxxv lorde spake vnto moses feldes moab iordane ouer agaynst ierico sayenge cōmaunde chyldren israll gyue vnto leuytes enherytaunce theyr possessyon iosua 21 city dwell ye shall gyue also vnto city leuytes suburbes harde theyr city rounde aboute city shal haue dwell suburbes theyr cattell theyr possessyon maner beastes theyrs suburbes city ye shal gyue vnto leuytes shal reache wall citie outwarde thousande cubites rounde oboute ye shal measure citie east syde two thousande cubites south syde two thousand cubites west syde two thousande cubites north syde two thousand cubites also citie shalbe myddes shalbe suburbes theyr city among city whiche ye shall gyue vnto leuytes iosua xx▪ • shall syxe city refuge whiche ye shall appoynte intente whiche kylleth maye flee thyther ye shall adde xlii city mo city whiche ye shall gyue leuytes may xlviii wt theyr suburbꝭ cityes ye shal gyue shalbe possessyō chyldren israel haue many shall gyue many haue fewe ye shall take fewe euery one shall gyue cityes vnto leuites accordyng enheritaūce enheryteth lorde spake vnto moses saynge speake vnto chyldren israel say vnto deut 〈◊〉 iosua 〈◊〉 ye come ouer iordan lande canaan ye shall appoynte city city refuge sleeth ☞ soule vnwares may flee thyther city shall flee auenger blood whiche kylleth dye vntyl stande congregacyō iudgement syx free city whiche ye shall gyue ye shall gyue thre syde iordan thre lande canaan syxe free city shall refuge bothe chyldren israel straunger hym dwelleth amonge whiche kyl persone vnwares may flee thyther 〈◊〉 • ▪ yf man smyte instrument yron dye murtherer shall dye smyte hym throwyng stone man may dye yf dye smote hym murtherer let murtherer • leyn therfore yf smyte hym hande weapon wood man maye dye yf dye murtherer let murtherer sleyne therfore iustyce blood shall slee murtherer whē meteth hym may sley hym yf thruste hym deut • hate hurle hym layenge wayte dye smyte hym hande enuye dye smote hym shall dye murtherer iustyce blood shall sley murtherer soone fyndeth hym yf pusshed hym chaunce hate cast hym maner thyng laynge wayte cast maner stone hym man may dye sawe hym cast vpon hym dye enemy neyther sought hym harme cogregacyon shal iudge bytwene sleer executer blood suche case congregacyon shal delyuer sleer hande auenger blood congregacion shal restore hym agayne vnto cytie refuge whyther fled shall byde iosua xx b vnto death hye preest anoynted holy oyle yf sleer come without border preuyleged cytie whyther fled yf auenger blood fynde hym border fretowne sley murtherer shall gyltlesse bycause shulde haue bydden free towne vntyll death hye preest deathe hye preest returne agayne vnto lande possessyon cōmaundemē te shall lawe vnto youre generacyons dwellynges soeuer kylleth ☞ soule mansleer must sleyne hym selfe deuse 17 • • ud xix b thorowe wytnesses neyther shal one wytnes answere put mā death moreouer ye shall take none amendes lyfe murtherer whiche worthy dye shall put death also ye shall take money hym fled free citye shulde come agayne dwell lande death hyghe preest se ye polute lande whiche ye shall dwell blood ☞ defileth lande lande none otherwyse clensed blood shed therin bloode hym shedde blood defyle therfore lande whiche ye shall enhabyte myddes therof euen lorde dwell amonge chyldren israell ¶ ordre maryage doughters zelaphead one trybes may marrye another capi xxxvi auncyent father chyldren gilead son machir sonne manasse kynred chyldren ioseph came forth spake moses prynces auncyent father chyldren israell sayde 〈◊〉 26 • lorde cōmaunded lorde gyue land enheryte lot chyldren israell lorde cōmaunded god behalfe gyue enherytaunce nume 27 • zelaphead brother vnto doughters yf sonnes tribe israel toke wyues thē shal theyr enherytaunce taken enheritaūce father shall put vnto enherytaunce trybe receyued shall taken lot enherytaunce yere iubilye chyldren israell cōmeth shall theyr enherytaunce put vnto enherytaunce trybe receyued shall theyr enherytaunce taken away frō enherytaunce tribe oure father moses cōmaunded chyldren israell accordynge worde lorde sayenge chyldren trybe ioseph haue sayde well therfore doth lorde cōmaund doughters zelaphead saynge tobi • • 〈◊〉 • let wyues whome selues thynke best kynred trybe theyr father shall marrye shall enherytaunce chyldren israell remoue trybe trybe chyldren israel abyde euery man enheritaunce trybe father euery doughter possesseth enheritaunce tribe chyldren israel shall wyfe vnto one kynred trybe h • r father chyldren israel may enioy euery man enherytaunce father neyther ought enheryaunce go one trybe euery one tribe chyldren israell must abyde owne enherytaunce lorde commaunded moses euē dyd doughters zelaphead mahela thirza hagla milcha • maryed vnto theyr father brother sonnes kynred chyldren manasses sonne ioseph theyr enherytaunce remayned trybe kynred theyr father cōmaundements lawes lorde cōmaunded hande moses vnto chyldrē israel feldꝭ moab iordan ouer agaynst ierico ❧ ende fourth boke moses called hebrue uaiedabber latyn numeri ¶ fyfth boke moses called hebrue elle haddebarim latyn deuteronomium ¶ brefe rehersall thynges done capi primo wordes moses spake vnto israell syde iordan wyldernesse playne ouer agaynst red see bytwene pharan tophil laban hezeroth disahab eleuen dayes iourney horeb vnto cadꝭ barne mount seir fortuned fyrst day eleuenth moneth fourtyeth yere moses spake vnto chyldrē israel accordyng vnto lorde gyuen hym cōmaundement vnto smytten num xxi c sehon kyng amorites whiche dwelte hesbon og kynge basan whiche dwelte astaroth edrai syde iordane lande moab began moses declare lawe sayenge lorde god spake vnto v horeb sayenge ye haue dwelte longe ynough mounte departe therfore take iourney go vnto hyll amorites vnto al place nyghther vnto bothe vnto playne hylles dale south • ee syde lande canaan vnto libanon euen vnto great ryuer euphrates beholde haue set lande go gent xv xvii b possesse lande lorde sware vnto father abraham isaac iacob gyue vnto theyr seede spake vnto ceason sayenge able beare selfe alone lorde god hath multiplyed beholde ye day sterres heuen nombre lorde god father make thousande tymes many mo ye blesse hath promysed howe exodi 18 c selfe alone beare combraunce charge stryfe amonge brynge amonge men wysdome vnderstandyng experte accordynge trybes wyll make ruler ouer ye answered sayde thou hast spoken good v soo trybes toke captaynes men wysdome experte made ruler ouer captaynes ouer thousandes ouer hundredes ouer fyftye ouer ten offycers amonge trybes charged iudges tyme saynge heare cause brethrē iohn̄ vii • iudge ryghteously bytwene euery man brother straunger wt hym se ye knowe ☞ face iudgement leuiti • •• pro • ••• heare small well great afrayde man iudgemente goddes cause exodi ••• harde brynge vnto wyll heare cōmaunded ceason thynges whiche ye shulde whē departed horeb went thorowe great terrible wyldernesse ye haue sene alonge waye hyll amorites lorde god cōmaunded v came cades barne sayde vnto ye come vnto hyll amorytes whiche lorde oure god wyll gyue vnto v beholde lorde thy god hath set lande go vp conquere lorde god thy father hath sayde vnto deute x •• feare neyther discouraged ye came vnto euery one sayde num ••• wyll sende men v searche v oute lande brynge v worde agayne way must go vp vnto cityes shall come saynge pleased well toke xii men euery trybe one whiche departed went vp hye countrey came vnto ryuer escoll serched toke fruyte lande ❀ declare plenteusnesse therof theyr handes brought vnto v brought v worde agayn sayd good lande lorde god doth gyue v notwithstange ye wolde consente go vp dysobedient vnto mouth lorde god murmured tentes sayd bycause lorde hateth v therfore hath brought v lande egypte delyuer v hande amorites destroy v howe shall go vp brother haue dyscouraged herte sayeng nume 〈◊〉 people greater taller haue cyties great walled euen vp heuen ouer haue sene sonnes enakims sayde vnto drede afrayde lorde god goeth shall fyght accordynge dyd vnto egypte youre eye wyldernes also yu hast sene lorde thy god bare euen mā doth beare son waye whiche ye haue gone vntyll ye came vnto place yet thynge ye dyd byleue lorde god went waye serche place pytche youre tentes exodi 13 fyre nyght ye myght se way go cloude daye lorde herde voyce youre wordes wroth sware sayenge num 14 • xxvi g shall one men frowarde generacion se good lande whiche sware gyue vnto father saue caleb sonne iephune shall se iosua 14 • hym wyl gyue lande hath troden vpon chyldren bycause hath folowed lorde ❀ vvonderfull vvas indignacion agaynst people seyng nume x • c and▪ x xvic lorde angrye lykewyse sake sayenge thou also shalt go thyther iosua son nun whiche standeth shal go thyther bolden hym therfore shall cause israel enheryte lande nume 14 • moreouer chyldrē whiche ye sayd shulde pray sonnes whiche daye knowledge bytwene good euyll shall go thyther vnto wyll gyue shall enioy turne face take youre iourney wyldernesse euen way red see ye answered sayd vnto nume 1 • g haue synned agaynst lorde wyll go vp fyght accordynge lorde god cōmaunded v whē ye gyrde euery man weapon warre beholde ye redy go vp hyll lorde sayde vnto saye vnto go vp fyght among leest ye fall enemyes tolde therfore ye wolde heare dysobeyed mouth lorde wen • presumptuously vp hyll amorites dwelt hyl came agaynst chased bee vse smote scir euen vnto horma ye came agayne wepte lorde lorde wolde heare voyce gyue audience nume xx ye abode ☞ cades long ceason accordynge tyme ye remayned placꝭ • one frō tyme departed frō cades b •• ne vnto battayle agaynst kynges sehon og capi ii 〈…〉 xxi turned face toke iourney wyldernesse euen way red see lorde spake vnto compassed mounte seir longe tyme lorde spake vnto saynge ye haue compassed mountayne longe ynough turne northwarde warne thou people sayenge ye shall go thorow coost brother chyldren esau whiche dwell seir shall afrayde take ye good hede vnto selues therfore ye shall prouoke wyl gyue theyr lande moche fote bredth gente 36 b mala 1 bycause haue gyuen mounte seir vnto esau possesse ye shal bye meate money eate ye shall procure water money drynke lorde thy god hath blessed workes thy hande knewe thy entrynge great wyldernesse xl yeres lorde thy god hath bene thou hast lacked nothynge departed brother chyldrē esau dwelte seir playne way elath ez • gaber turned went way wyldernesse moab lorde sayd vnto iudi iii thou shalte fyght agaynst moabitꝭ neyther prouoke battayle wyll gyue theyr lande possesse bycause haue gyuen vnto chyldren loth possesse terrible people gene 14 • emims dwelte therin tymes past people great many tall enakims whiche also taken gyauntes enakims moabites call emyms horims dwelt seir tyme whose possessyon chyldren esau occupied destroyed dwelte theyr steade israel dyd vnto lande possessyon lorde gaue nowe ryse vp sayde get ouer ryuer zared went ouer ryuer zared space came cades barne vntyl come ouer ryuer zared xxxviii yeres vntyll al generacyon men warre wasted among hoost lorde sware vnto nume 14 •• xxvi g dede hande lorde agaynst destroy frō among hoost tyll cōsumed came passe men warre consumed dead among people lorde spake vnto sayenge thou shalte go thorowe ar coost moab day thou comest nygh vnto chyldren ammon thou shalte lay syege vnto moue war agaynst wyl gyue lande childrē ammon possessiō haue gyuen vnto chyldrē loth possesse also taken lande gyauntes gyauntes dwelte therin olde tyme ammonite call zanzumims nume 23 • people great many tall enakims lorde destroyed succeded enherytaunce dwelt theyr steade dyd chyldren gene 36 • esau whiche dwell seir destroyed horyms conquered theyr possessyon dwelte theyr steade vnto day auims dwelte hazatim euen vnto aza caphthorims whiche came caphthor destroyed dwelte thyr steade ryse ye vp therfore take iourney ouer ryuer arnon beholde num xxi • haue gyuen thy hande sehon amorite kyng hesbon lande go therfore conquete prouoke hym vattayle daye wyll begyn sende feare drede vpon nacyons vnder heuen whiche heare speake shall tremble quake sent messenger wyldernesse kedemoth vnto sehon kyng hesbon wordꝭ peace saynge num xxi • deute xx c wyll go thorowe thy lande wyll go along vy hye waye wyll neyther turne vnto ryght hande lefte thou shalte sell meate money eate gyue water money drynke graunt may go thorowe fote chyldren esau whiche dwel seir moabites whiche dwell ar dyd vnto vntyll come ouer iordan lande whiche lorde god gyueth v sehon kynge hesbon wolde let v passe hym lorde thy god hardened spirite made hert tough bycause wold delyuer hym thy hande come passe day lorde sayd vnto beholde haue begon set sehon land go conquere possesse lande num xxi c deute 29 b bothe sehon people came agaynst v fyght iaza lorde set v smote sonnes people toke cityes ceason slewe men woman chyldren ctiyes lette nothynge remayne saue cattell onely caught selues spoyle cyties whiche toke frō aroer brynke ryuer arnon citye ryuer vnto gilead one cytie strong v lorde god delyuered vnto v onely vnto lande chyldren ammon thou camest vnto euery place ryuer iabocke vnto cyties mountaynes vnto soeuer lorde god forbad v ¶ thynges chaunced victorye two kynges sehon og vnto institucyon iosua moses strade capi iii turned went vp way basan num 〈…〉 deut 〈…〉 og kyng basan came agaynst v al people battayle edrai lorde sayd vnto feare hym wyll delyuer hym people lande thy hande thou shalte vnto hym thou dydest vnto sehon kynge amorites whiche dwelte hesbon lorde god delyuered handes og also kyng basan folke smote hym vntyl none lefte hym alyue toke cyties ceason neyther cytie toke euen thre score cyties thorowout region argob kyngdom og basan cytyes also made stronge hye walles gate barres besyde vnwalled townes great meanye vtterly destroyed dyd vnto sehon kynge hesbon bryngyng nought cyties men woman chyldren cattell spoyle cyties caught selues thus toke ceason hande two kyngꝭ amorites lande syde iordan frō ryuer arnon vnto mounte hermon whiche hermon sidon call sirion amorites call senyr al cyties lay playne gilead basan vnto salecha adrat cyties kyngdome og basan onely og kyng basan remayned remenaunt gyauntꝭ whose bed bed yron yet rabah amonge chyldren ammon ix cubites doth lengthe therof conteyne foure cubites bredth cubite man conquered lande tyme aroer whiche ryuer arnon vnto halfe mount gilead nu 〈…〉 deu • 〈…〉 io 〈…〉 cyties therof gaue vnto rubenites gaddites rest gilead basan kyngdom og gaue vnto halfe tribe manasse euen regyon argob basan whiche called lande glauntes iair sonne manasse toke regyon argob vnto coostes gesuri maachati called owne name basan nauoth iair vnto day gaue gilead vnto machir vnto rubenites gaddites gaue halfe gilead vnto ryuer arnon halfe valey beyonde euen vnto ryuer iabocke border child ammon playne also ❀ vvyldernesse iordan coost therof ceneroth euen vnto see whiche playne euē salt see vnder springes hyll eastwarde nume 32 cōmaunded tyme sayenge lordē youre god hath gyuen lande enioye ye shall go harnessed youre brother chyldren israell mete warre wyues onely chyldren cattell wote ye haue moche cattell shal abyde cityes whiche haue gyuen vntyll lorde haue gyuen rest vnto youre brother well vnto vntyll also haue conquered lande whiche lorde god hath gyuen beyonde iordan shall ye returne agayne euery man vnto possession whiche haue gyuen num 〈◊〉 warned iosua tyme saynge thyne eye haue sene al lorde god hath done vnto two kynges euen shal vnto kyngdomes whyther thou goest ye shall feare lorde god shall fyght besought lorde tyme sayenge lorde god thou hast begonne shew thy seruaunt thy greatnesse thy myghtye hand el god heuen earth thy workꝭ thy power let go ouer se good lande beyonde iordan goodly ☞ moūtayne libanon 〈…〉 • • 〈…〉 iiii c lorde angrye wt sake wolde heare lorde sayd vnto content speake vnto matter nume 27 〈◊〉 deute 34 • get vp toppe hyll lyfte vp thyne eye westwarde northwarde southwarde eastwarde beholde thine eye thou shalt go ouer iordan charge iosua courage hym bolden hym • um 34 • shall go people shall deuyde vnto lande whiche yu shalt se abode valey ouer agaynst house peor ¶ exhortacyon gyue dilygent hede vnto lawe ymages may mayde worshyppe thre cityes refuge capi iiii nowe herken israell vnto ordinaunces lawes teach ye may lyue go conquere lande lorde god father gyueth deut xii iosua 23 • proue 30 ye shall put nothynge vnto worde whiche cōmaunde neyther ought therfrom ye maye kepe commaundementes lorde god cōmaunde eye haue sene lorde dyd vnto baall peor num • 5 • xxxi c men folowed baall peor lorde youre god hath destroyed amonge ye cleue vnto lorde youre god alyue euery one day beholde haue taught ordynaunces lawes suche lorde god cōmaunded ye shuld euen lande whyther ye go possesse kepe therfore wysdome vnderstandynge syght nacyons maye heare ordinaunces say surely wyse vnderstandynge people great nacyon nacyon greate goddes come nye vnto lorde oure god nye vnto v thynges psal 145 • ofte cal vnto yea nacion greate hath ordynaunces lawes ryghteous lawe whiche sette daye take hede thy selfe therfore kepe thy soule dilygently thou forget thynges whiche thyne eye haue sene departe thyne herte dayes thy lyfe deute vi teache thy sonnes thy sonnes sonnes specially daye thou stodest lorde thy god horeb lorde sayd vnto gather people gyther wyll make heare wordꝭ may lerne feare dayes shall lyue vpon earth ephe vi maye teache theyr chyldren ye came exod xix c stode also vnder hyll hyll burnte fyre euen vnto myddes heuen darkenesse clowdes myst lorde spake vnto myddest fyre ye herde voyce wordes erodi xx • iohn̄ • b sawe ymage saue ye herde voyce onely declared vnto couenaunt whiche commaunded euen x verse whiche wrote vpon two table stoone lorde cōmaunded ceason shuld teach ordinaunces lawes whiche ye ought lande whyther ye go possesse ☞ take therfore good hede vnto selues perteynynge vnto soules ye sawe maner ymage daye lorde spake vnto horeb myddes fyre leest ye mar youre selues make grauen ymage pycture maner figure lykenesse man woman lykenes maner beast earth lykenesse anye maner fethered foule flyeth ayre lykenes maner worme creyeth earth lykenesse maner fysh water beneth erth deute • 7 • sapi 14 iob xxxi • yea leest thou lyft vp thyne eye vnto heuen thou seyst sonne moone starres hoost heuen shuldest desceyued shuldest worshyp serue thynges whiche lorde gene b thy god hath made serue nacyons vnder hoole heuen lorde hath taken brought yron fournace euen egypt vnto hym people enherytaunce ye daye furthermore lorde angrye youre wordes sware shulde go ouer iordan shulde go vnto good lande whiche lorde thy god gyueth enherytaunce deute 34 b must dye lande shall go ouer iordan ye shall go ouer conquere good lande take hede vnto youreselues ye forget apoyntment • ord god whiche made ye make grauen image pycture lorde thy god hath forbydden hebru • 2 • lorde thy god consumyng fyre ielouse god yf thou doest beget chyldren chyldrens chyldren ye haue dwelt lande ye wyckedly make maner grauen iere xvi • ymage worke euyll syght lorde ☞ thy god prouoke hym anger call heuen earth recorde agaynst daye ye shal shortly peryshe lande whyther ye go ouer iordan possesse ye shal prolonge dayes therin shall vtterly destroyed lorde shall scatter amonge nacyons ye shal lefte fewe nombre amonge people whyther lord shall brynge ye shal serue goddes whiche worke mannes hande wood stoone whiche neyther se heare eate smell deuit 30 iere xxix • thou shalte seke lorde thy god shalte fynde hym yf thou seke thyne herte thy soule thou art tribulacyon al thynges spoken come vpon euen latter dayes thou shalte returne agayne lorde thy god obedyent vnto voyce lorde thy god merciful god wyl forsake neyther destroye leui 〈◊〉 ▪ • forget apoyntement thy father whiche sware vnto aske dayes past whiche synce daye god created man vpon earth aske one syde heuen vnto yf euer came passe great thyng whyther suche lyke thyng hath ben herde dyd euer nacyō heare voyce god speakynge myddes fyre thou hast herde yet lyued eyther whyther god assayed go take hym people amonge nacions thorow temptacyons sygnes wonder war myghtye hande psal ••• stretched arme thorow great vision accordynge vnto lorde god dyd vnto egypt eye nnto shewed thou myghtest knowe howe lorde god noone erodi ••• heuen made heare voyce myght nurtour vpon earth shewed greate fyre thou herdest wordes myddes fyre bycause loued thy father chose theyr seede brought ☞ syght myghtye power exodi •• egypte thrust nacyons greate myghtyer thou brynge gyue theyr lande enherytaunce come passe daye understande therfore daye turne thyne herte lorde god heuen aboue vpon erth beneth neyther thou shalte kepe therfore ordynaunces commaundementes whiche cōmaunde daye maye go well thy chyldren thou mayst prolonge thy dayes vppon earth whiche lorde thy god gyueth thy lyfe longe num • 〈◊〉 deut ••• moses seuered thre cityes syde iordan towarde sonne rysynge shulde flee thyther kylled neyghboure vnwares hated hym tyme past therfore shuld flee vnto one cite lyue namely bezer wyldernes euen playn countrey tribe ruben ramoth gylead trybe gad golan basan trybe manasse lawe whiche moses set chyldren israell wytnesses statute ordinaunces whiche moses tolde chyldren israell came egypte syde iordane valey ouer agaynst house peor lande sehon kynge amorytes whiche dwelte hesbon whome moses chyldren israell nume 2 • f smote come egypt conquered lande lande og kyng basan two kyngꝭ amorites syde iordan towarde sonne rysynge aroer whiche banke ryuer arnon vnto ☞ mounte sion whiche hermon playne syde iordane eastwarde euen vnto see whiche playne vnder sprynges hyll ¶ ten cōmaundementes capi v moses called israell sayd vnto heare israell ordynaunces lawes whiche speake youre eares daye ye maye lerne fulfyll dede lorde oure god made apoyntment v horeb lorde made bonde father v euē v alyue daye lorde talked ☞ face face mounte myddes fyre stoode bytwene lorde tyme shewed worde lorde ye afrayed syght fyre went vp mounte sayde exodi x • lorde thy god whiche brought lande egypt house bondage thou shalte haue noone goddes presence leuit 26 thou shalt make grauen ymage maner lykenesse heuen aboue earth beneth water beneth earth thou shalt neyther bow thy selfe vnto serue lorde thy god ielouse god visityng wyckednesse father vpō chyldren euen thyrde fourth generacion amonge hate shewe mercye vpon thousandꝭ among loue kepe cōmaundementꝭ exodi 19 • thou shalte take name lorde thy god vayne ❀ lorde wyl holde hym giltlesse taketh name vayne kepe sabboth daye thou sanctifye lorde thy god hath commaunded leuitt 23 syxe dayes thou shalte laboure thou hast exodi 13 b seuenth daye sabboth lorde thy god thou shalte worke thou thy sonne thy doughter thy seruaunt thy mayde thyne oxe thyne asse thy cattell straunger within thy gate thy seruaunt thy mayde maye reest well thou remembre thou wast seruaunt lande egypte howe lorde thy god brought thence thorowe psal 136 • myghtye hande stretched arme whiche cause lorde thy god commaunded kepe sabboth daye exodi xx b math xv ephe vi marke 7 b honoure thy father thy mother lorde thy god hath cōmaunded thy dayes maye prolonged maye go well lande lorde thy god gyueth thou shalte sley math v c luke 1 • rom 13 c thou shall breake wedlocke thou shalte steale thou shalte beare false wytnesse agaynst thy neyghboure rom 7 b thou shalte luste thy neyghbours wyfe thou shalt couet thy neyghbours house felde seruaunt mayde oxe asse ought thy neyghbour hath wordes lorde spake vnto multytude mount myddes fyre cloude darknesse great voyce added nomoreexod xxxi therto wrote two table stoone delyuered vnto fortuned ye herde voyce myddes darkenesse sawe hyll dyd burne wt fyre ye came vnto captaynes trybes youre elder ye sayde beholde lorde god hathe shewed v glorye greatnesse exodi xix haue herde voyce myddꝭ fyre haue sene daye god doeth talke man yet lyueth nowe therfore shulde dye great fyre shulde consume v yf heare voyce lorde god shall dye ☞ flesshe hath ben euer herde voyce lyuyng god speakyng myddes fyre haue done yet dyd lyue go thou heare lorde god sayeth tell thou vnto v lorde god sayeth vnto exodi xix wyll heare lorde herde voyce youre wordꝭ ye speake vnto lorde sayd vnto haue herde voyce wordꝭ people haue spoken vnto haue well sayde haue spoken iere 24 b xxxi▪ • oh suche herte wolde feare kepe cōmaundementes waye myght go well theyr chyldren euer go saye vnto get tentes agayne stande thou wyll tell cōmaundementes ordynaunces lawes thou shalt teache may lande whiche gyue possesse take hede therfore ye dede lorde god hath commaunded deute 17 turne asyde eyther ryght hande lefte walke wayes whiche lorde god hath commaunded ye maye lyue maye go well ye maye prolonge youre dayes lande whiche ye shall possesse ¶ lawe god may forgotten capi vi commaundementes ordinaunces lawes whiche lorde god commaunded teache ye myght lande ther ye go possesse namely thou myghtest • ut • x c feare lorde thy god kepe ordynaunces commaundementes whiche commaunde thou thy sonne thy sonnes sonne dayes thy lyfe thy dayes maye prolonged heare therfore israel take hede thou therafter maye go well ye maye encrease myghtely euen lorde god thy father hath promysed lande floweth mylke hony mark xii • heare israell lorde god lorde mat 22 b mark xii c luke x • thou shalt loue lorde thy god al thyne herte al thy soule thy myght deute xi c wordes whiche commaunde day shall thyne herte thou shalt shewe vnto thy chyldren shalte talke thou art home thyne house thou walkest waye thou lyest downe thou rysest vp thou shalt bynde sygne vpon thyne hande shall warnynges bytwene thyne eye thou shalte wryte vpon poostes thy house vpon thy gate lorde thy god hath brought lande whiche sware vnto thy father abrahā isaac iacob gyueth great goodly cityes whiche thou buyldest house ful maner goodes whiche thou fylledst welles dygged thou dyggest vyneyeardꝭ olyue tree whiche thou plantedst whē thou hast eaten arte ful beware leest thou forget lorde whiche brought lande egypt house bondage deute x • math 4 • luke ii ••• thou shalt feare lorde thy god serue hym ☞ sweare name se ye walke straunge goddes goddes nacions lorde thy god ielouse god amonge lest coūtenaunce lorde thy god moued wrath agaynst destroye earth math ii ••• ye shall tempte lorde youre god ye dyd ❀ temptacion kepe commaundementes lorde god wytnesses ordynaunces whiche hath cōmaunded thou shalte whiche ryght good syght lorde thou mayst prospere thou mayst go conquere good lande whiche lorde sware vnto thy father cast thyne enemyes lorde hath sayde deute • • thy son asketh tyme come sayenge meaneth wytnesses ordinaunces lawes lorde god hath cōmaunded thou shalte say vnto thy son pharaos bondman egypte lorde brought v egypt myghty hande lorde shewed sygnes wondres greate euyll vpon egypt▪ vpon pharao vpon housholde eye brought v thence brynge v gyue v lande whiche sware vnto father lorde hath cōmaunded v ordynaunces feare lorde god welth dayes lyfe come passe daye moreouer shall ryghtousnesse lorde god yf take hede kepe cōmaundementes hath cōmaunded v ¶ israelite may make couenaunt gentyles must destroy theyr idol idolatrer • must sleyne capi vii lorde thy god hath brought lande whyther thou goest possesse hath cast many nacions namely hethites gergesites amorites cananites pheresites heuytes iebusytes vii nacions greater myghtyer thou exod xiii c • xxxiiii b lorde thy god hath set thou shalt smyte vtterly destroye make couenaunte haue cōpassion thou shalte make maryages neyther gyue thy doughter vnto son take doughter vnto thy son wyll dysceyue thy son shulde feare shall serue straūge goddꝭ wyll wrath lorde waxe hoote agaynst destroye shortly thus ye shall deale wt exod 34 b nume 33 f ye shall ouerthrowe theyr aulters breake downe theyr pillers cut downe theyr groues burne theyr grauen ymages wt fyre deut 14 36 peter ii b thou arte holy nacyon vnto lorde thy god exodi xix lorde thy god hath chosen seuerall people vnto hym selfe aboue nacyons vpon earth bycause multitude aboue al nacions lord lust vnto chose seynge ye fewest nacions bycause lorde loued bycause wolde kepe • eue xxii c othe whiche sworne vnto youre father therfore hath lorde brought thorowe myghtye hande delyuered house bondage euen hande pharao kynge egypt understande therfore lorde thy god god true god exodi xx 34 whiche kepeth poyntment mercy vnto loue hym kepe cōmaūdementes euen thorowout thousande generacyons rewardeth hate ☞ hym face bryngeth nought doth defar tyme rewardeth hym hateth hym face kepe thou therfore cōmaundementes ordinaunces lawes cōmaund day thou exodi 23 yf ye herkē vnto lawes obserue lorde thy god also shal kepe poyntment mercy sware vnto thy father wyll loue blesse multiplye wyl also blesse fruyt thy wombe fruyte thy lande thy corne thy wyne thyne oyle encrease thyne ox flockꝭ thy shepe lande sware vnto thy father gyue thou shalt blessed aboue nacions shall neyther man woman vnfruytfull amonge thynge vnfruytfull amonge cattel moreouer lorde wyll exodi 23 take away frō maner infirmityes wyll put none euyll disease exodi ix egypte whiche thou knowest vpon wyll sende vpon hate thou shalt consume al nacions whiche lorde thy god shall delyuer thyne eye shall haue pitye vpon neyther shalte thou serue theyr goddes shalbe thy decaye thou saye thyne herte nacions • howe cast deute xx • iosua • thou shalt feare remēbre lorde thy god dyd vnto pharao vnto al egypt great temptacions thyne eye sawe sygnes wondres myghtye hande stretched arme thorowe lorde thy god brought euen shall lorde thy god nacyons thouarte afrayde exodi 23 • iosua 24 • moreouer lorde thy god wyll sende hornettes amonge vntyll lefte hyde selues frō destroyed thou shalte feare lorde thy god amonge myghty god terrible lorde thy god wyll put nacyons lytle lytle exodi 23 • thou mayst cōsume leest beastes felde encrease vpō lorde thy god shall gyue ouer shall destroye myghtye tempest vntyll haue brought nought iosua x x • ▪ xii▪ shall delyuer theyr kynges thyne hande thou shalt destroye theyr name vnder heuen shall man able stande vntyll thou haue destroyed grauen ymages theyr goddes shalte thou burne fyre iosu vii ii xii c couet golde syluer take vnto lest thou snared therin abhominacyon lorde thy god brynge therfore abhominacyon thyne house lest thou ☞ dampned thyng vtterly defye abhorre dampned thyng ¶ moses putteth israelytes remembraunce god hath done wyldernesse capi viii cōmaundementes whiche cō maunde daye shall ye kepe ye maye lyue multyplye go possesse lande • lorde sware vnto father thou shalte thynke way lorde thy god led xl yeare wyldernesse humble proue wete thyne herte whyther thou woldest kepe commaundementes exodi • • nume xi • humbled suffered hungre fed manna whiche neyther thou thy father knewe make knowe math 4 man doth lyue breade onely euery ❀ vvorde procedeth mouth lorde doth man lyue diute • 9 thy rayment waxed olde vpon neyther dyd thy fote swell xl yeares also shalte thou consyder thy herte man nurtoureth son euen lorde thy god nurtoureth therfore shalte thou kepe commaundementes lorde thy god thou walke wayes feare hym lorde thy god bryngeth good lande lande whiche ryuers water foūtaynes spryngꝭ sprynge valeyes hylles lande wherin wheat barly vyneyardes fyg tree pomgarnates lande wherin oyle olyue honye lande wherin thou shalte eate breade without scarcenesse neyther shalte thou lacke thynge lande • ob 2 • • whose stoones yron whose hylles thou shalte dygge brasse thou hast eaten therfore fylled thy selfe thou shalte blesse lorde thy god good lande whiche hath gyuen beware thou forgette lorde thy god thou woldest kepe commaundementes lawes ordynaunces whiche commaunde day nume 〈…〉 x • yea thou hast eaten fylled thy selfe hast buylde goodly house dwelt therin thy beastes thy shepe waxed many thy siluer golde multiplied thou haste encreased beware leest thyne herte ryse thou forget lorde thy god whiche brought lande egypte house bondage whiche thy guyde great terrible wyldernesse wherin fyryt serpentes scorpyons drought water brought water euen rocke flint fed wyldernesse manna whiche thy father knewe euen humble proue myght good thy latter ende leest thou shuldest saye thyne herte • regū ii b power myght myne owne hande hath prepared abundaūce remembre lorde thy god howe whiche gyueth power get substaunce make good promesse whiche sware vnto thy father day dothe wytnesse yf thou forget lorde thy god walke straūge 〈…〉 goddes serue worshyp testifye vnto daye ye shall surely peryshe nacyons lorde destroyeth euen ye shal peryshe bycause ye wolde obedient voyce lord god ¶ forbydden trust theyr owne strength capi ix heare israell thou passest ouer iordane day go cōquere nacyons greater myghtyer thy selfe cityes greate walled vp heuen num 〈…〉 people great tall euen chyldren enakyms whiche thou knowest thou hast herde say wyll stand chyldren enake understande therfore daye lorde thy god euen whiche goeth ouer ❀ deuourynge consumynge fyre shall destroye shall brynge downe thy face shal cast brynge nought quyckely lorde hath sayde vnto speake thou thyne herte lorde thy god hath cast saynge ryghtousnesse lorde hath brought possesse lande naye wyckednesse nacions lorde hath cast oute thy ryghtousnes sake thy ryght herte thou goest possesse theyr land wyckednesseleuit 〈…〉 nacions lorde thy god dothe caste euen perfourme worde whiche lorde thy god sware vnto thy father abraham isaac iacob understande therfore thy ryghtousnes sake lorde thy god doth gyue good lande possesse seynge thou arte styffe necked people remembre forget thou prouokedst lorde thy god wyldernesse synce day yu dydest departe land egipt vntyl ye came vnto place ye haue rebelled agaynst lorde exodi 17 • and▪ 325 • also noreb ye angred lorde lorde wroth euyn haue destroyed goone vp mounte receyue table stoone table appoyntment whiche lorde made abode hyll xl dayes xl nyghtes neyther dyd eate breade dranke water exodi 〈…〉 lorde delyuered two table stone wrytten fynger god accordynge wordꝭ whiche lorde sayde vnto mounte myddes fyre day gatheryng togyther whē xl dayes and▪ xl nyghtes ended lorde gaue two table stone table couenaunt lorde sayde vnto exodi 32 b get downe quyckly hence thy people whiche thou hast brought egypt haue marred turned atonce waye whiche cōmaunded haue made molten ymage furthermore lord spake vnto saynge haue sene people beholde styffenecked people let alone maye destroye put name vnder heuen wyll make myghtye nacyon greater turned came downe hyll euen hyl burnt fyre two cable appoyntment handes loked beholde ye synned agaynste lorde god made molten calfe turned atonce way lorde cōmaunded exodi 32 • toke two table cast two handes brake eye exod 24 • 34 fell downe flat lorde euen fyrst tyme xl dayes xl nyghtes dyd neyther eate bread drynk water bycause synnꝭ ye synned doynge wyckedlye syght lorde ye prouoked hym vnto wrath afrayde wrath fearsnesse wherwith lorde moued agaynst wold haue destroyed lorde herde tyme also lorde angrye aaron also euen haue destroyed hym made intercessyon aaron also tyme toke syn exodi 32 • calfe ye made burnte hym fyre stamped hym grounde hym good euen vnto small dust cast dust therof broke descended mounte also burnynge nume xi temptacyon sepulchre lust ye angred lorde lykewyse whē lorde sent cades barne sayenge go vp conquere lande haue gyuen ••• eg vii • ye disobeyed mouth lorde god neyther byleued hym herkened vnto voyce ye haue ben disobedient vnto lord synce daye knewe fell downe flat lorde xl dayes xl nyghtes whiche laye lorde sayde wolde destroy made intercessyon therfore vnto lorde sayd exod 34 • lorde god destroye thy people thyne enheritaunce thou hast delyuered thorowe thy greatuesse whiche thou hast brought egypt thorowe myghtye hande remembre thy seruauntꝭ abrahā isaac iacob loke vnto stubburnesse people theyr wyckednesse synne leest lande whence thou broughtest saye lorde able brynge lande promised bycause hated therfore hath caryed sley wyldernesse behold thy people thyne enheritaunce thou broughtest thy myghty power thy stretched arme ¶ renuynge cable exhortaciyn gyue hede lawe capi x ceason lorde sayde vnto exod 34 • hewe two table stoone lyke vnto fyrste come vp vnto mounte make arke wood wyll wryte cable wordes fyrst table yu brakest thou shalte put arke made arke sethym wood hewed two table stone exodi 32 • vnto wyldernesse vntyll ye came vnto place dyd vnto num 16 • dathan abiram sonnꝭ eliab son ruben howe earth opened mouth swalowed theyr housholdes theyr tentes theyr substaunce theyr possessyon myddes israell doutles eye haue sene al great actes lord dyd therfore shal ye kepe cōmaundementes whiche cōmaūde day ye may strong go conquere lande whyther ye go possesse ye may prolonge dayes lande lorde sware vn father gyue vnto theyr seed lande floweth wt mylke honye deute • • lande whyther yu goest possesse land egypt ye came thou sowedst thy seede ☞ wateredst wt thy feete garden herbes lande whyther ye go ouer possesse lande hath hylles valeyes drynketh water rayne heuen lande doth lorde thy god care eye lorde thy god alwayes vpon begynnyng yeare vnto ende yeare yf ye shall herken thou shalt wryte vpō dore postes thyne house vpon thy gate dayes may multiplyed dayes chyldren land lorde sware vnto youre father gyue longe dayes heuen last vpon earth ✚ yf ye kepe cō maundementes cōmaunde ye namely ye loue lorde god walke wayes cleue vnto hym wyl lorde cast nacyons ye shal heyres greate nacyons myghtyet selues iosua place wheron sooles fete shal treade shalbe euen wyldernes libanon ryuer euphrates euen vnto vttermost see shall youre coost shal man able stand lorde god shall cast feare drede vpon lande ye shall treade vpon hath sayde vnto ⊢ deute 30 c beholde set day gyueth possesse longe ye lyue vpon earth deute 7 ye shal destroy place wherin nacions ye shal conquere serued theyr goddes vpon hye mountaynes hylles vnder euery thycke tree ouerthrowe theyr aulters breake theyr pyllers burne theyr groues fyre hewe downe grauen ymages goddꝭ haue bryng name nought place ☞ ye shall vnto lorde god ye shall seke place whiche lorde god shall haue chosen trybes put name dwell exod 14 b xvi b thyther thou shalte come thyther ye shal brynge burnt sacrifice offerynges tythes heueofferynges hande vowes frewylofferynges fyrst gendred ox shepe ye shall eate lorde god ye shall reioyse ye put hande vn ye housholdes wherin lorde thy god hath blessed ye shall thynges day euery man semeth hym good owne eye ye yet come rest enheritaunce lorde god gyueth ye go ouer iordane dwell lande whiche lorde god hath gyuen enherite hath gyuen rest enemyes roūde aboute ye dwell safetie vnto place lorde god hath chosen put name ye shall brynge commaunde namely burntsacrifices offerynges tythes heue offerynge youre hande youre syecyall vowes whiche ye vowe vnto lorde ye shall reioyse lorde god yea sonnes doughters seruauntes maydes leuite within gate deute • thou shalt cōmaunde notwithstandyng thou mayst kyll eate flesshe thy city whatsoeuer thy soule lusteth accordyng blessynge lorde thy god whiche hathe gyuen deut xv • bothe vncleane cleane may eate therof euen roo herte onely ye shal eate blood powre vpon earth water thou mayst eate within thy gate tythe thy corne thy wyne thy oyle fyrst gendred thyne ox thy shepe neyther thy vowes thou vowest bycause loueth thyne house well ease shalte thou take naule nayle eare dore therwith let hym thy seruaūt ☞ euer vnto thy mayde seruaunt thou shalt lyke wyse let greue thyne eye thou lettest hym go israel shall eate offerynges lorde enheritaunce therfore shall haue enheritaunce amonge theyr brother lorde theyr enheritaūce hath sayd vnto preestes dutie people offer sacrifice whyther oxe shepe must gyue vnto preest shoulder two chekes mawe fyrst fruytes also thy corne wyne oyle fyrst woll thy shepe shalt thou gyue hym nume iii b •• iii • lorde thy god hath chosen hym al thy trybes stande among one maketh sonne doughter go thorowe fyre vseth wytchcraft choser dayes leuiti 19 b regardeth fleynge foules sorcerer charmer coūselleth spirites soth sayer asketh ❀ trueth deade suche thynges vnto sorcerer lorde thy god hath suffered lorde thy god wyll leuiti iii vii • styrre vp vnto prophete among euen thy brother lyke vnto math 〈◊〉 • vnto hym ye shall herken accordynge thou desyredst lorde thy god horeb day gatherynge togyther thou saydest exodi ••• let heare voyce lorde god se greate fyre anye dye lorde sayd vnto haue well spoken wyll rayse vp prophete amonge theyr brother lyke vnto wyl put wordes mouth shall speake vnto shal cōmaunde hym soeuer wyl herken vnto wordes whiche shall speake name wyll requyre hym • 〈◊〉 • deuit 〈…〉 ez ••• 〈◊〉 • prophete whiche shall presume speake worde name haue cōmaunded hym speake speaketh name straunge god prophete shall dye yf thou saye thyne herte howe shall knowe worde lorde hath spoken ❀ token shalt thou haue euen prophete speaketh name lorde ☞ yf thyng folow come passe thing lorde hath spoken prophete hath spoken presumptuously thou shalte therfore afrayde hym ¶ fraun •• ese • townes punyshment hym beareth false wytnesse capi xix lorde thy god deut 〈…〉 hath roted nacyons whose lande lorde thy god gyueth thou succedest theyr enheritaunce dwellest theyr city theyr house thou shalte io •• •• appoynte iii city myddes lande whiche lorde thy god gyueth possesse ☞ thou shalt prepare way deuyde coostes thy lande whiche lorde thy god gyueth enherite iii partes exodi •• soeuer cōmytteth murther may flee thyther cause must steer f • ee thyther may lyue kylleth neyghboure ygnorauntly hated hym tyme passed man goeth vnto wood neyghboure hewe wood ❀ thynkyng harme hand fetcheth stroke axe cut downe tree heade slyppeth hafte smyteth neyghbour dyeth shall flee vnto one city lyue leest executer bloode folowe sleer whyle herte hote ouertake hym bycause way longe slee hym yet cause worthy death hym moche hated hym tyme past wherfore cōmaūde saynge thou shalt appoynte iii city yf lorde thy god enlarge thy coostes hath sworne vnto thy father gyue lande sayd wolde gyue vnto thy father thou shalte kepe cōmaundementes whiche commaunde daye thou loue lorde thy god walke wayes euer adde iii city mo vnto iii innocent blood shed thy lande whiche lorde thy god gyueth enheryte ☞ blood come vpon num xxx yf man hate neyghbour lay awayte hym ryse agaynst hym smyte hym dye fleeth vnto city elder citie shall sende fetche hym thence delyuer hym handes iustyce blood may dye thyne eye shall spare hym thou shalte put away innocent blood frō israel maye go well iob 34 • thou shalt remoue thy neyghbours marke whiche olde tyme haue set thyne enheritaunce thou shalte enherite lande whiche lorde thy god gyueth enioy num 35 one wytnesse shal ryse agaynst man maner trespasse maner sy • ie maner faute offende deut • 17 • math 18 c • hsi viii • mouth two wytnesses thre wytnesses shal matter stablysshed • cori 13 • timo v c ••• u • x c •• osā 1 8 vnryghteous wytnesse ryse vp agaynst man accuse hym trespasse bothe men whiche stryue togyther shall stande lorde preestes iudges whiche shall dayes iudges shall make diligent inquisicion yf wytnes foūde false hath gyuen false wytnesse agaynst brother thē shal ye vnto hym thought vnto brother thou shalte put euyll away shall heare feare shall henceforth cōmyt suche wyckednes among thyne eye shal haue compassion •••• 22 c 〈…〉 24 c 〈…〉 13 g math v • ☞ soule soule eye eye tothe fortothe hande hande fote fote ¶ ought go battayle lawe armes • anaanites must kyll capi xx whē thou goest battayle agaynst thyne enemyes seest horse charettes people mo thou deute v afrayde lorde thy god whiche brought lande egypte ye come nygh vnto battayle preest shall come forth speake vnto people shall say vnto heare israel ye encountre day enemyes battayle let hertes faynte neyther feare amased abrede num 14 lorde god goethdeute 28 • fyght agaynst enemyes saue let offycers speake vnto people saynge man haue buylte newe house haue dedicate let hym go returne house lest dye battayl man dedicate yf mā haue planted vyneyarde haue made cōmon ❀and laufull euery man cate let hym go returne agayne vnto house lest dye battayle another make cōmon deut 24 • yf man betrouthed vnto wyfe haue taken let hym go returne agayne vnto house lest dye battayle man take let offycers speake vnto people say iudi vii • man feare faynte herted let hym go returne vnto house leest make brother herte faynte well offycers haue made ende speakyng vnto people shal make captaynes war ouer thou comest nygh vnto citie fyght agaynst deute ii • offre peace yf answere agayne peasablye open vnto let people foūde therin tributary vnto serue yf wyll make peace make warre agaynst thou shalte besyege lorde thy god hath delyuered thyne hand • thou shalte smyte al male therof wt edge swerde woman chyldren iosu vii • cattell citie spoyle therof shalte thou take vnto thy selfe eate spoyle thyne enemyes lorde thy god hath gyuen thus shalte thou vnto city whiche ☞ great way city nacyons cityes nacyons lorde thy god shall gyue enheryte thou shalt saue alyue nothyng bretheth deut vii • iosus vi • viii • • • shalt destroy without redempcyon namely hethites amorites canaanite pherezites heuites iebusites lorde thy god hath cō maunded teache theyr abhominacions whiche haue done vnto theyr god ye shulde synne agaynst lorde god thou hast besyeged citie longe tyme made warre agaynst take destroye tree therof thou woldest thrust vnto eate thē cut downe tree feldes men come agaynst besyege onely tree thou knowest fruytfull ❀ vvylde fytte v shalte thou destroy cut downe make bulworkes agaynst citie maketh warre vntyll thou subdue ¶ inqu • sityon murther punyshment chyldren disobey father mother capi xxi one founde sleyne land lorde thy god gyueth possesse lyeth felde knowē hath sleyne hym thē thyne elder thy iudges shall come forthe mete vnto city rounde aboute sleyne let elder citie nexte vnto sleyne mā take droue beyffer laboured hathe drawen yoke let elder citie brynge heyffer vnto harde valey neyther eared norsowen stryke heyffers necke valey preestes sonnes leuy deut 17 b eccle 45 lorde thy god hath chosen ministre hym blesse name lorde shall come forth theyr mouthe shall stryfe plage tryed elder citie come forth sleyne man shal washe theyr handes ouer heyffer beheaded valey shal answere say handes haue shed blood neyther haue eye sene mercyfull lorde vnto thy people israel thou hast delyuered ionas lay mno cent blood vnto thy people israel charge blood shal forgyuen shalte thou put innocent blood whē thou shalte haue done ryght syght lorde thou goest warre agaynst thyne enemyes lorde thy god hath delyuered thyne handes thou hast taken captyue seest amonge captyues beautyfull woman hast de syre vnto thou woldest haue thy wyfe thou shalt bryng home thyne house let shaue heade let nayles growe put rayment taken let remayne thyne house bewepe father mother moneth longe shalte thou go vnto marrye shall thy wyfe yf thou haue fauour vn let go whyther lusteth sell money make cheuesaunce bycause thou hast ☞ humbled gene 〈◊〉 x •• man haue two wyues one loued hated haue borne hym chyldren bothe loued also hated fyrstborne sonne hated tyme commeth dealeth goodes among chyldrē may make son byloued fyrst borne sonne hated dede fyrst borne shall knowe sonne hated fyrst borne gyue hym double porcyon hath fyrst strengthe hym belongeth ryght fyrst borne exodi xx • man haue son stubborne disobedient wyll herken vnto voyce father voyce mother haue thastened wolde herken vnto shall father mother take hym brynge hym vnto elder citie vnto gate place saye vnto elder citie sonne stubborne dysobedient wyll herken vnto voyce ryoter dronkarde men citie shall stone stone vnto death thou shalte put euyll away al israel shal heare feare iosua • mā haue cōmytted trespasse worthy death put death thou hangest hym tree body shall remayne nyghte vpon tree thou shalt burye hym day gala 〈◊〉 curse god hym hanged defyle thou thy lande lorde thy god gyueth enheryte ¶ thou oughtest thou syndest thy neyghbourts beast goynge astray man shall weare woman clothynge woman mannes clothynge w • cote woolle • flaxe also forbydden punyshmente hym accuseth man vnryghteously aduouterer also hym • auesheth mayde capi xxii thou shalte se thy brother oxe shepe go astray withdraw thy selfe shalte brynge agayne vnto thy brother yf thy brother nygh vnto yf thou knowe hym brynge vnto thyne owne house shall remayne vntyll thy brother aske delyuer hym agayne lyke maner shalte thou asse shalte thou rayment lost thynges thy brother whiche hath lost thou hast founde shalt thou lykewyse thou mayst hyde exodi 23 math 12 luke 14 thou shalte se thy brother asse oxe fall downe waye withdrawe thy selfe shalt helpe hym heue vp agayne womā shall perteyneth vnto man neyther shall man put woman rayment al abhominacyon vnto lorde thy god thou chaunce vpon byrd nest way whatsoeuer tree grounde whyther yonge egges damme syttynge vpon yonge vpō egges thou shalte take damme yonge shalt wyse let damme go take yonge thou mayst prospere prolonge thy dayes thou buyldest newe house thou shalte make batelmente roufe thou lade bloode vpō thyne house yf man fall therof leuit xix thou shalte thy vineyerde dyuerse seedes leest fruyt seede whiche thou hast sowen fruyte thy vineyearde defyled thou shalt plowe oxe asse togyther thou shalt weare garment made woolle flaxe togyther nume xv thou shalte make gardes ❀ hemmes vpon foure quarter thy vesture thou couerest thy selfe yf man take wyfe hath lyen hate laye shamefull thynges vnto charge brynge vp euyll name vpon say toke wyfe came founde mayde shall father damsell mother brynge forth token damsel virginyte vn elder citye ☞ gate damsel father shall saye vnto elder gaue doughter vnto man wife hateth lo layeth shamefull thynges vnto charge saynge founde thy doughter mayde yet token doughters virgynyte shall sprede vesture elder citye elder citye shall take man chastyce hym merce hym hundred sycles syluer gyue vnto father damsell bycause hath brought vp euyll name vpon mayde israell shal wyfe maye put away al dayes yf thyng suretye damsell founde virgyn shall brynge damsell ☞ dore father house men citie shal stoone stone death bycause hath wrought folye israell playe hoore father house thou shalte put euyll awaye leuit xx • yf man founde lyenge woman hauynge husbande shall dye bothe well man laye woman woman thou shalte put awaye euyll euyll yf mayde handefasted vnto husband man fynde towne lye ye shal bryng bothe vnto gate citye shall stoone stoones death damsel bycause cryed beynge citye man bycause hath humbled neyghbours wyfe thou shalt put away euyll yf man fynde betrouthed damsell felde force lye man laye shall dye alone vnto damsell thou shalte harme bycause damsell cause death man ryseth agaynst neyghboure sleyeth hym euyn matter founde feldes betrouthed damsell cryed man succour exod xxi • • man fynd mayde betrouthed take lye founde man laye shal gyue vnto damsel father l sycles syluer shall wyfe bycause hath humbled maye put awaye dayes leuiti 18 • man shall take father wyfe vnheale father couerynge ¶ maner men maye admytted church pollucyons happen nyght usurye capi xxiii none leuiti 21 c esai ivi gelded hath preuye membres cut shall come congregacyon lorde borne comen woman shal come congregacyon lorde tenth generacion shal entre congregacyon lorde 2 e •• r 1 • • ammonite ☞ moabites shall come neuerthelesse lorde thy god wolde herken vnto balaam lorde thy god turned curse blessyng vnto bycause lorde thy god loued thou shalt seke prosperite welth thy dayes euer gene xxv c thou shalte abhorre edomite thy brother neyther shalt thou abhorre egyptian bicause thou wast straunger lande chyldren begotten shall come cōgregacyon lorde thyrde generacyon thou goest hooste agaynst thyne enemyes kepe wyckednesse yf amonge man vncleane reason vnclennesse chaunceth nyght let hym go hooste come agayne hoost euen let washe hym selfe water sonne downe let hym come hooste agayne thou shalte haue place also without hooste whyther thou shalte resorte ❀ thy naturall necessyte thou shalt haue sharpe poynte vpon thy wepon yu wylte ease thy selfe dygge therwith turne couer whiche departed lorde thy god walketh myddes thyne hooste ryd set thyne enemyes therfore shal place thyne hoost pure se vncleane thynge turne hym selfe ☞ thou shalte delyuer vnto mayster seruaunt whiche escaped mayster vnto shall dwell euen amonge place hym selfe lyketh beste one thy cityes good hym thou shalt vexe hym shall hoore doughters israell hoorekeper sonnꝭ israell thou shalt neyther brynge hyre hoore pryce dogge house lorde thy god maner vow euen abhominacion vnto lorde thy god exodi 22 leuit 25 f thou shalte hurte thy brother vsury money vsury corne ☞ vsury thynge maye hurte withall unto ☞ straunger thou mayst lende vpon vsurye vnto thy brother lorde thy god maye blesse thou settest thyne hande lande whyther thou goest conquere num • 0 ecclesi v baruch • • thou hast vowed vowe vnto lorde thy god thou shalte slacke paye lorde thy god wyll surely requyre shall synne thou shalte leaue vowynge shall synne gone thy lyppes thou must kepe accordynge thou hast vowed vnto lorde thy god frewyll thou hast spoken thy mouth thou cōmest thy neyghbours vyneyerde thou mayst eate grape thy belyfull thyne owne pleasure thou shalte put noone thy vessell euen whē thou cōmest thy neyghbours corne math xii • thou mayst plucke eares thyne hande thou shalte moue sycle vnto thy neyghbours corne ¶ deuo • cement permytted newly maryed shall compelled go warre capi xxiiii man hath taken wyfe maryed yf fynde fauour eye bycause hath spyed vnclennesse iere iii mala • ii math xix • let hym wryte byll deuorcement put hande send house departed house let go another man wyfe yf seconde husband hate let hym wryte also letter deuorcement put hande sende house yf seconde man dye whiche toke wyfe fyrste man whiche sent awaye maye take agayne wyfe defiled abhominacion syght lorde thou shalt cause lande synne whiche lorde thy god shall gyue enheryte deute • • man taketh newe wyfe shall go warfare neyther shall charged wt busynesse shal fre home one yere reioyse wyfe hath taken exodi 〈◊〉 • man shall take nether vpper mylstoone pledge shall hurte man lyfe exod xx • man found stealyng brother chyldren israel abuseth hym selleth shall dye thou shalte put euyll away take hede thy selfe concernynge plage leprosye thou obserue dilygently ye shall accordynge preestes leuites shal teach euen cōmaunded ye shall obserue remembre lorde thy god dyd vnto num x • • mir iam waye ye come egypt thou doest lende thy
