maye slepe owne rayment blesse shall ryghteousnesse vnto lorde thy god leuiti xix c tobi iiii c eccle vii c thou shalt defraude hyred seruaūt nedye poore whyther thy brother straungers thy lande thy gate leuit xix c shalte gyue hym hyre daye let sonne go downe theron nedye therwith susteyneth lyfe lest crye agaynst vnto lorde syn vnto iere xxxi c 4 r • 14 • ezech 18 e father shall dye chyldren chyldrē father euery mā shal dye owne syn thou shalt hinder ryght straunger fatherlesse take wydowes rayment pledge remembre thou wast seruaunt egypt howe lorde thy god delyuered thence therfore commaunde thynge leuit • xix b thou cuttest downe thyne heruest thy felde hath forgot sheafe felde thou shalt go agayne fetch shall straūger fatherlesse wydowe lorde thy god maye blesse workes thyne hande yu beatest downe thyne olyue tree thou shalt turne agayne gather vp thou leftest behynde shall straunger fatherlesse wydow thou gatherest thy vyneyerd thou shalt gather grape cleane leaue straūger y• fatherlesse wydowe remēbre thou also wast seruaūt lande egypte therfore cōmaunde thynge ¶ punysshment offender law raysyng seed thy brother deed measure weyghtes capi xxv yf stryfe bytwene men shal come vnto lawe let iudges gyue sentence bytwene iustifye ryghteous cōdempne vngodly yf man vngodly worthy strypes let iudge cause take hym downe beate hym face accordynge trespace vnto certayne nō bre •• • orl xi • xl strypes shall gyue hym passe leest yf shulde excede beate hym aboue many strypes thy brother shulde appeare vngoodly thyne eye • • orl ix • timo v c thou shalt mosel oxe treadeth corne ❀ barne math xii b ruth iiii b yf brother dwell togyther one dye haue chylde wyfe dead shall marry without vnto straunger brother shall go vnto take wyfe occupye rowme kynsman eldest son whiche beareth shall succede name brother deade name put israell yf man wyll take brother wyfe let go vp gate vnto elder say husbandꝭ brother refuseth styrte vp vnto brother name israel neyther wyll marry elder citye shall call hym comen hym yf stande saye wyl take shall kynswoman come vnto hym presence elder loose showe foote spyt face answere saye shall done vnto man doth buylde vp brother house name shall called israell vnshodhouse yf men stryue togyther one another wyfe one ran ryd husbande handes hym smyteth hym put forth hande take hym secretes thou shalte cut hande let thyne eye pitie thou shalt haue thy bagge leuit x •• • mich vi • two maner weyghtes great small neyther shalt thou haue thyne house dyuerse measure great small thou shalte haue ryght iust weyght perfecte iust measure shalt thou haue thy dayes may lengthened lande whiche lorde thy god gyueth al thynges vnryght abhominacyō vnto lorde thy god exodi 17 • remembre amalech dyd vnto waye ye come egypte howe met waye smote hyndmoost al feble came behynde thou wast faynted werye feared god therfore lorde thy god hath gyuen rest thyne enemyes rounde aboute lande whiche lorde thy god gyueth enheryt possesse se thou put remēbraunce amalech vnder heuen forget ¶ fyrst fruytes tythes leuytes fatherlesse wydowes straungers capi xxvi ✚ thou arte come lande whiche lorde thy god gyueth enheryte hast enioyned dwellest therin exodi 23 c xxxiiii c proue iii • take fyrste fruyte earth brynge thy lande lorde thy god gyueth put maunde go vnto place whiche lorde thy god shall chose set name thou shalt come vnto preest shall dayes saye vnto hym knowledge daye vnto lorde thy god come vnto countre lorde sware vnto father gyue v preest shall take maunde thyne hande set downe aulter lorde thy god thou shalte answere saye lorde thy god sirians went destroye father gene xlvi • went downe egypte soiourned fewe folke grew vnto nacyon great myghtye ful people exodi b egyptian vexed v troubled v laded v moost cruell bondage cryed vnto lorde god father exodi iii b lorde herde oure voyce loked aduersyte labour oppressyon lorde exodi 14 c brought v egypte myghtye hande stretched arme great terriblenes sygnes wonder ⊢ hath brought v place hath gyuen v lande floweth mylke honye deut 14 nowe ✚ loo haue brought fyrst fruytes lande whiche thou lorde hast gyuen thou shalte set lorde thy god worshyp lorde thy god reioyse al good thynges lorde thy god hath gyuen vnto vnto thyne house thou leuite straunger amonge thou hast made ende tythyng al tythes thyne encrease thyrd yere whiche yeare tythynge thou shalte gyue vnto leuite straungers fatherlesse wydowes maye eate within thy gate fyl selues thou shalte saye lorde thy god leuiti 18 b haue brought halowed thynges myne house haue gyuen vnto leuites straungers fatherlesse wydowes accordyng thy cōmaundementes whiche thou hast cōmaunded haue ouerskypped thy cōmaūdementes forgotten haue eaten therof mournynge suffered ought peryshe thorowe vnclennesse gyuen ought therof deade haue herkened vnto voyce lorde god haue done exodi xix • yu hast cōmaunded ⊢ baruch ii c ✚ loke downe therfore thy hooly habitacyon euen heuen blesse thy people israell lande whiche thou hast gyuen v thou swarest vnto father lande floweth mylke honye daye lorde thy god hath cōmaunded ordinaunces lawes kepe thou withall thyne herte thy soule exod 〈◊〉 deute v • thou hast set vp lorde daye thy god walke wayes kepe ordynaunces cōmaūdementꝭ lawes herken vnto voyce exod xix • deut 〈◊〉 • xiiii • lorde hath set vp daye seueral people vnto hym hath promysed thou kepe cōmaundementes make hye aboue nacions hath made prayse name honoure iere xiii • deut vii • thou mayst holy people vnto lorde thy god hath sayde ⊢ ¶ buylde aulter blossynges hyll garizim cursed hyll eball capi xxvii moses elder israell cōmaunded people sayenge kepe al cōmaundementes cōmaund daye iesu iiii • ye come ouer iordane vnto lande lorde thy god gyueth thou shalte set vp greate stone plaster plaster wryte vpon wordes lawe thou arte come ouer bycause thou arte come lande whiche lorde thy god gyueth lande floweth mylke honye lorde god thy father hath promysed therfore ye come ouer iordane ye shall set vp stoones whiche cōmaunde daye mount eball thou shalt plaster plaster iosua 〈◊〉 shalte thou buylde vnto lorde thy god exodi ••• aulter stone lyft vp yron vpon thou shalt make aulter lorde thy god hoole stone offre burntofferynges theron vnto lorde thy god thou shalte offre peaceofferynges shall eate reioyce lorde thy god thou shalt wryte vpon stoones wordes lawe manyfestly well moses preestes leuites spake vnto israell sayenge take hede heare israell daye thou arte become people lorde thy god thou shalt herken therfore vnto voyce lorde thy god cōmaundementes ordynaunces whiche commaunde day moses charged people daye sayenge shall stande vpon deute x •• mount garizim blesse people ye come ouer iordan symeon leui iuda isachar ioseph ben iamin shall stande vpō mount eball curse ruben gad aser zabulon dan nephthli leuites shall answere say vnto al mē israel wt loude voyce exodi xx • cursed man maketh anye carued molten ymage abhominacyon vnto lorde worke handes craftesman putteth secret place people shall answere saye amen exod xxi b cursed curseth father mother people shall say amen deut xix b cursed remoueth neyghbours marke al people shal say amen leuiti xix c cursed maketh blynde go way al peple shal say amen deute • 4 c cursed hyndreth ryght straunger fatherlesse wydowe people shall say amen leuiti 18 • cursed lyeth father wyfe vnhealeth father couerynge people shall say amen leuit 18 c cursed lyeth maner beast people shall saye amen leuiti 18 b cursed lyeth syster doughter father doughter mother al people shal say amen leuit 18 cursed lyeth mother law people shall saye amen exod xxi b cursed smyteth neyghbour secretly people shal say amen cursed lyeth vvith neyghbours vvyfe people shall say amen ezech 22 c cursed taketh rewarde sleye soule innocent bloode al people shall saye amen eala iii b cursed contynueth wordes lawe people shall saye amen ¶ promyses blessynges vnto regarde cōmaundementes curse contrary capi xxviii 〈…〉 26 thou shalt herken dilygently vnto voyce lorde thy god obserue cōmaundementes whiche cō maunde day lorde wyll set hye aboue nacyons earth deute xi blessynges shal come ouertake yf thou shalt herken vnto voyce lorde thy god blessed shalte thou towne blessed feldes blessed shall fruyte thy body fruyte thy grounde fruyte thy cattell fruyte thyne ox flockꝭ thy shepe blessed shall thy basket thy store blessed shalt thou thou goest blessed thou comest deut xx lorde shal gyue ouer thyne enemyes ryse agaynst maye fal thy face shal come agaynst one waye flee seuen wayes lorde shall put blessynge vpon thy store house thou settest thyne hande wyll blesse lande whiche lorde thy god gyueth lorde shall make holy people vnto hym self hath sworne vnto yf thou shalte kepe cōmaundementes lorde thy god walke wayes nacions earth shal se name lorde called vpon ouer shalbe afrayde lorde shall make plenteous goodꝭ fruyte thy body fruyte thy cattell fruyte thy grounde lande lord sware vnto thy father gyue lorde shal open vnto good tresure euen heuen deute xi b gyue rayne vnto thy lande due ceason blesse labour thyne hande deut xv thou shalte lende vnto many nacions shalte borowe thy selfe lorde shall set behynde thou shalt aboue onely beneth yf thou herken vnto cōmaundementes lorde thy god cōmaunde daye kepe se yu deute • 〈◊〉 b bowe asyde wordes whiche cōmaunde daye eyther ryght hand lefte thou woldest go straunge goddes serue leuiti 26 • yf thou wylte herken vnto voyce lorde thy god kepe cōmaundementes ordinaunces whiche cōmaunde daye baruch • daniel ix • curse shal come vpon ouertake cursed shalte thou towne cursed felde cursed shall thy basket thy store cursed shal fruyt thy body fruyte thy lande fruyte thyne ox flockes thy shepe cursed shalte thou thou goest cursed thou goest lorde shall sende vpon cursynge destruction rebuke thou settest thyne hande thou doest vntyll destroye brynge nought quyckly bycause wyckednesse thyne inuencions bycause thou hast forsaken lorde shall make pestylence cleue vnto vntyll haue consumed lande whyther thou goest enioye leuiti 26 b lorde shall smyte swellynge feuers heete burnyng swerde wytherynge blastynge shall folowe vntyl thou perysshe leuiti 26 • deute xi b heuen ouer thy heade shall brasse earth vnder yron lorde shall turne rayne lande vnto powder dust euen heuen shal come downe vpon vntyl thou brought nought lorde shall plage thyne enemyes thou shalte come one way agaynst flee seuen wayes shalt scattered amonge kyngdomes earth thy carkas shall meate vnto maner foules ayre vnto beastes earth man shal fraye away exodi ix b lorde wyll smyte botche egypt emarodes scalle maungenes thou mayst healed therof lorde shall smyte madnesse blyndnesse abashment herte thou shalte grope noone dayes blynde gropeth darkenesse shalt prosper thy wayes thou shalte oppressed wronge polled euermore man shall succoure •• reg xii c thou shalt betrowthed vnto wyfe another man shall lye deute 25 b thou shalte buylde house dwell therin thou shalte also plant vineyearde shalte gather grape thyne oxe shall sleyne thyne eye thou shalt eate therof thyne asse shall violently taken away euen thy face shall restored agayne thy shepe shall gyuen vnto thyne enemyes man shall rescue thy sonnes thy doughters shall gyuen vnto another nacion thyne eye shall se dase vpon daye longe shall myghte thy hande fruyte thyne lande thy laboures shall nacyon whiche thou knowest eate thou shalt continually suffre violence oppressed alway thou shalt cleane besyde thy selfe syght thyne eye whiche thou shalt se lorde shall smyte knee legges myscheuos botche healed euen soole thy fote vnto top thy heade dani 4 11 par 33 b 4 • e 24 iere 24 lorde shall brynge thy kynge thou shalt set ouer vnto nacyon whiche neyther thou thy father haue knowē thou mayst serue straunge goddes euen wood stone thou shalte wondred spoken iested among nacyons whyther lorde shall carye thou shalte carye moche seede felde shalte gather lytle greshop pers shall destroye thou shalte plante vyneyearde dresse shalte neyther drynke wyne neyther gather grape wormes shall eate thou shalte haue olyue tree thorowout thy coostes shalt anoynt thy selfe oyle thyne olyue tree shalbe rooted thou shalte beget sonnes doughters shalt haue shall caryed awaye captyue thy tree fruyte thy lande shall marred blastynge straunger amonge shall clyme aboue vp hye thou shalte come downe beneth alowe shall lende thou shalte lende hym shall thou behynde moreouer curse shall come vpon shall folowe ouertake tyll thou destroyed bycause thou herkenedst vnto voyce lorde thy god kepe cōmaundementes ordinaunces whiche cōmaunded shall vpon ☞ miracle wonder vpon thy seed euer bicause thou seruedst lorde thy god ioyfulnesse good herte thou haddest aboundaūce thynges therfore thou shalte serue thyne enemye whiche lorde shall sende vpon hunger thyrst nakednesse nede thynge shall putte yocke yron vpon thy necke vntyll haue brought nought lorde shall brynge nacyon vpon farre ende worlde swyfte egle flyeth nacion whose tonge thou shalte vnderstande harde fauoured nacyon whiche shall regarde person olde haue compassyon yonge shall eate fruyte thy cattell fruyte thy land vntyll haue destroyed shall leaue neyther corne wyne oyle neyther encrease thyne ox flockꝭ thy shepe vntyll haue brought nought shall kepe al thy cityes vntyll haue cast downe thy hye wallꝭ stronge holdes wherin thou trustedst thorowout al lande shall beseyge thy cityes thorowout thy lande whiche lorde thy god hath gyuen 4 reg 〈…〉 ba •••• 〈◊〉 leuit ••• thou shalt eate fruyte thyne owne bodye fleshe thy sonnes thy doughters lorde thy god hath gyuen straytnesse seyge wherwith thyne enemye shal beseyge shall greue man tender excedyng delycate amonge loke brother vpō wyfe lyeth bosome remenaunt chyldren whiche hathe yet lefte feare gyuyng vnto fleshe chyldren whome shall eate bycause hath nothynge lefte hym straytnesse seyge wherwith thyne enemy shal beseyge al thy cityes yea woman tender delycate dare aduenture set soole foote vpon grounde softnesse tendernesse shall greued loke husbande lyeth bosome sonne doughter afterbyrth come bytwene legges chyldren shall beare thynges lacke shall eate secretlye seyge straytenesse wherwith thyne enemy shall beseyge thy city exodi xv thou wylte kepe wordes lawe wrytten boke feare gloryous fearfull name lorde thy god lorde wyll sende vnto thy seede great plage longe contynuaunce euyll sycknesses longe duraunce moreouer wyl bryng vpon al disease egypte whiche thou wast afrayde shal cleaue vnto maner syckenesses al maner plage wrytten boke lawe wyll lorde bryng vpon vntyll brynge nought ye shall lefte fewe nombre ye deute x sterres heuen multitude bycause thou woldest herkē vnto voyce lorde thy god iere xxxi • shal come passe lorde reioysed ouer good multiplie euen wyll reioyce ouer destroy brynge nought ye shalbe wasted land whyther thou goest enioy lorde shal scatter amonge nacyons one ende world vnto thou shalte serue straunge god thou thy father haue knowen euen wood stone among nacions thou shalt fynde ease neyther shall • le thy foote haue rest lorde shall gyue vnquyet herte dasynge eye sorowe mynde thy lyfe shall hange thou shalte feare day nyght shalt haue trust thy lyfe mornyng thou shalt say wold god nyght nyght thou shalte say wolde god mornyng feare thyne herte thou shalte feare syght thyne eye thou shalte se lorde shal brynge egypte agayne shyppꝭ way whiche bad thou shuldest exod 14 se ye shalbe solde vnto enemyes bondman bondwoman man shall bye ¶ people exhorted obserue cammaundementes whiche yf breake threatened plaged capi xxix wordes exod xix • appoyntment lorde cōmaunded moses make chyldren israel lande moab besyde appoyntement whiche made horeb moses called israel sayde vnto ye haue sene lorde dyd eye lande epypte vnto pharao vnto seruauntes vnto lande greate temptacyons whiche thyne eye haue sene great myracles wonder yet lorde hath gyuen herte perceyue eye se eares heare vnto daye haue led xl yere wyldernesse deute • • clothes wared olde vpon thy shoo wared olde vpon thy foote ye haue eatē breade dronke wyne strong drynke ye myght know howe lorde god nume xi • ye came vnto place sehon kynge hesbon og kynge basan came agaynst v vnto battayle smote toke theyr lande gaue enherytaunce vnto rubenites gadites halfe tribe manasse deut iiii • kepe therfore wordes appoyntment ye may vnderstande ye ought ye stande daye euery one lorde youre god captaynes youre tribe youre elder offycers al men israel chyldren also wyues straunger thyne hoost iosua ix • hewer thy wood vnto drawer thy water thou shuldest go appoyntment lorde thy god othe gene 17 whiche lorde thy god maketh day make people vnto hym selfe maye vnto god hathe sayde vnto hathe sworne vnto thy father abraham isaac iacob make bonde othe onely hym standeth v day lord god also hym v daye ye knowe howe haue dwelte lande egypte howe came thorowe myddes nacyons whiche ye passed ye haue sene theyr abhominacyons theyr ydols wood stone syluer golde whiche amonge lest among man woman kynred trybe whose herte turneth awaye day lorde god go serue goddes nacions leest among roote beareth gal wormwood heareth wordes othe blesse hym selfe herte sayenge iere v • shall haue peace wyll walke meanyng myne owne herte ❀ put ☞ dronken thyrstye lorde wyl consent mercyfull vnto hym wrathe lorde ielousye shall smoke agaynst man curse wrytten boke shall lyght vpon hym lorde shall name frome vnder heuen lorde shal seperate hym vnto euyll tribe israel accordynge vnto curse appoyntment wrytten booke law generacion come chyldren shall ryse vp straunger shall come farre lande shall say se plagꝭ lande dyseases wherwith lorde hathe smytten howe lande burnt vp wt brymstone salte neyther sowen beareth grasse groweth therin lyke place ouerthrowynge gene xix • sodome gomor adama zeboim whiche lorde ouerthrewe wrathe angre euen shall nacions say iere xxii b • regū ix b wherfore hath lorde done facion vnto lande fearse great wrathe men shall saye bycause lefte testament lorde god theyr father made whē brought lande egypte went serued straunge goddes worshypped goddes whiche knewe gyuen nought wrathe lorde wared hoote agaynst lande brynge vpon curse wrytten boke lorde cast theyr lande angre wrath great indignacion cast straunge lande daye beareth wytnesse secretes lorde god • • orī 4 opened vnto v oure chyldren euer maye wordes lawe ¶ worde god hande capi xxx wordes come vpon blessynge curse whiche haue set thou shalte turne vnto thyne herte among nacyons whyther lorde thy god hath thrust come agayne vnto lorde thy god herken vnto voyce thyngꝭ cō maunde daye thou thy chyldren thyne herte al thy soule lorde thy god wyll turne thy captiuite haue compassyon vpon wyll turne fet agayne nacyons amonge whiche lorde thy god shal haue scattered though thou wast cast vnto extreme partes heuen euen thence wyll lorde thy god gather thence wyl fet lorde thy god wyll brynge lande whiche thy father possessed thou shalte enioye wyll shewe kyndnesse multiply aboue thy father deute •• lorde thy god wyl circumcyse thyne herte herte thy seede thou mayst loue lorde thy god thyne herte thy soule thou mayst lyue lorde thy god wyll put curse vpon thyne enemyes hate persecute thou shalte turne herken vnto voyce lorde al commaundementes whiche cōmaunde day lorde thy god wyll make plenteous al workes thyne hande fruyte thy bodye fruyte thy cattell fruyte thy lande thy welthe iere ••• lorde wyll turne agayne reioyce ouer good reioysed ouer thy father thou herken vnto voyce lorde thy god kepe cōmaundementes ordinaunces whiche wrytten boke lawe yf thou turne vnto lorde thy god thyne herte thy soule rome •• commaundement whiche cō maunde daye seperated neyther farre heuen thou nedest ❀ complayne saye shall go vp v heuen fet v may heare neyther beyonde see thou shuldest saye shall go ouer see v fet v may heare worde nygh vnto euen thy mouth thyne herte thou deute •• beholde haue set daye lyfe good deathe euyll commaunde daye loue lorde thy god walke wayes kepe cōmaundementes ordinaunces lawes yf thou thou shalte lyue multiplie lorde thy god shal blesse lande whither thou goest possesse yf thyne herte turne awaye thou wylt heare shalt go astray worshyppe straunge goddes serue pronounce vnto also daye ye shal surely peryshe ye shal prolong dayes vpon lande whyther thou passest ouer iordane go possesse deut iiii • call heuen earth recorde daye agaynst haue set lyfe death blessyng cursynge therfore chose lyfe thou thy seed may lyue thou mayst loue lorde thy god obedyent voyce cleaue vnto hym thy lyfe length thy dayes thou mayst dwell vpon earth whiche lorde sware vnto thy father abraham isaac iacob gyue ¶ moses beynge redy dye ordereth iosua rule people steade bo • e deuteronomy wrytten layde tabernacle besyde arke leuttes charged rede people capi xxxi moses went spake wordes vnto al israel sayde vnto hundred xx yere olde day go also lorde hath sayde vnto nume xx b thou shalt go ouer iordan lorde thy god wyll go ouer wyll destroy nacions thou shalte conquere nume 27 iosua shal go lorde hath sayd lorde shall vnto henume 27 • dyd sehon og kyngꝭ amorites vnto lande destroyed lorde shall gyue ouer face ye maye vnto accordyng vnto al cōmaundementes haue cōmaūded plucke vp hertes therfore strong drede afrayde lorde thy god hym selfe dothe go wt shall fayle forsake moses called vnto iosua sayde vnto hym syghte israell iosua b regū ii strong bolde thou must go wt people vnto land lord hath sworne vnto theyr father gyue thou shalt gyue enherite lord doth go shall fayle neyther forsake feare therfore discomforted moses wrote lawe delyuered vnto preestes sonnes leui nume iii bare arke testament lorde vnto elder israel moses cōmaunded saynge 〈◊〉 • poynte vii yeres solempnyte freyere euen feast tabernacle israel come appeare lorde thy god place whiche hath chosen thou shalt rede lawe israel theyr eares gather people togyther men woman chyldren straunger within thy gate may heare learne feare lorde god kepe obserue wordes lawe theyr chyldren whiche knowe nothyng may heare learne feare lorde god long ye lyue lande whyther ye go ouer iordane possesse lorde sayd vnto moses beholde thy dayes come thou must dye call iosua therfore stande ye tabernacle wytnesse may gyue hym charge moses iosua went stode tabernacle wytnesse lorde appeared tabernacle euen pyller cloude exodi 33 • pyller cloude stode ouer dore tabernacle lorde sayd vnto moses beholde thou shalte slepe thy father people wyll ryse vp go hooryng straunge goddes lande whyther go wyll forsake breake appoyntment haue made wrath wyll ware hoote agaynst wyl forsake wyll hyde face shall consumed moche aduersyte tribulacyons shall come vpon wyll saye trouble come vpon bycause god also wyl surely hyde away face daye euyls sake shal haue wrought turned vnto straūge goodꝭ nowe therfore wryte ye songe teache chyldren israell put theyr mouthes songe may wytnesse agaynst chyldren israel wyll brynge lande whiche sware vnto theyr father floweth mylke honye shal eate fyll selues waxe fat turne vnto straunge goddes serue ❀ blaspheme breake couenaunt moche myscheyfe tribulacion come vpon songe shall answere wytnesse shal forgotten mouthes theyr seede knowe theyrymaginacion goo aboute euen nowe haue brought lande sware ✚ moses therfore wrote song reason taught chyldren israell gaue iosua son nun charge sayd iosua b regū ii▪ bolde strong thou shalt bryng chyldren israel lande ☞ whiche sware vnto wyl whē moses made ende wrytyng wordes lawe boke vnto ende moses cōmaū ded leuites whiche bare arke testament lorde sayenge take ye boke lawe deute x put syde arke testament lorde god maye wytnesse agaynste know thy stubbornes 4 xvii c mala iii b thy styffe necke whyle yet alyue wt day ye haue bene dysobedient vnto lorde moche death gather vnto elder tribe offycers may speke wordꝭ theyr care call heuen earth recorde agaynst sure death ye wyll vtterly corrupte turne waye haue cōmaunded tribulacion wyll come vpon latter dayes bycause ye shal haue wrought wickednes syght lorde prouoke hym thorowe workꝭ handꝭ moses spake eares al congregacion israel wordes songe vntyll ended ¶ songe moses capi xxxii heare ye heuens mith iii b esaie shall speake let earth heare wordes mouth esai iv c doctryne ☞ shall drop doth rayne speche shal flowe dothe dewe showre vpon herbes droppes vpon grasse wyl call name lorde ascribe ye honour vnto god genesi eccle xlii perfite worke moost myghty god wayes iudgement god truth without wyckednesse ryghteous iust ❀ frowardly haue done agaynst hym thorow theyr deformity owne chyldren wycked froward generacion ye rewarde lorde folyshe nacion vnwyse mala b thy father thyne owner gene i▪ hath made ordeyned remembre dayes worlde past cōsyder yeres frō tyme tyme iob viii b aske thy father wyl shewe thy elder wyl tell moost hyghest deuyded nacyons seperated sonnes adam put border nacions fast multitude chyldren israel lordes parte folke iacob porcion enheritaūce ☞ foūd hym deserte lande voyde grounde roryng wyldernesse led hym aboute gaue hym vnderstandyng kepte hym apple eye egle styrteth vp nest flotereth ouer yong stretcheth wyngꝭ doth take vp beareth shoulder lorde alone guyde straūge god hym caryed hym vp hyelande myght eate encrease feldes psal ••• fed hym wt hony rocke oyle harde stone butter kyne mylke shepe wt fat lambes fat rāmes gootes fat plenteous wheate thou myghtest drinke ☞ pure blood grape shulde haue bene vpryght waxed fat spurned wt heele thou art wel fed yu art growne thicke thou art euen laden fatnes forsoke god maker regarded god saluacion prouoked hym angre straunge goddes euen abhominacions prouoked hym psal xvi • offered vnto deuyls god euen god whome knewe newe goddes came newly vp whome theyr father feared god begat thou arte vnmyndfull hast forgotten god made lorde therfore sawe angry bycause prouokyng sonnes doughters sayd wyll hyde face wyl se theyr ende shal frowarde generacion chyldrē fayth haue angred whiche god prouoked theyr vanitis rom •• also wyll prouoke ☞ whiche people wyl angre foolyshe nacion iere x •• fyre kyndled wrath burneth vnto bottome hell hathe consumed earth encreace set fyre bottom mountaynes wyll heape myscheues vpon wyll destroye myne arowes shalbe burnt hunger consumed heate bytter destruccion iere 〈◊〉 ioh • •• wyll also sende teeth beastes vpon furiousnesse serpentes dust without forth shall swerde rob theyr chyldren within chambre feare yonge men yong woman suckelynges men gray heades haue sayde wyl scatter abrode make remembraunce cease amonge men feared wrath enemye lest theyr aduersaries shulde vtterly withdrawe themselues lest shulde say hygh hande hath done lorde nacion without forecast neyther vnderstandyng wyse vnderstode wolde consyder theyr latter ende shulde one chace two put x flyght excepte theyr maker solde excepte lorde shut vp theyr god oure god 1 regū v b oure enemyes also themselues iudges theyr vyne vyneyarde sodome feldes gomorra theyr grape grape gall theyr cluster bytter theyr wyne poyson dragon cruell gall adder layde store sealed vp among treasure rom xii hebrue x • uengeaunce myne wyll rewarde theyr fete shall slyde due tyme day theyr destruction hande thyngꝭ shal come vpon make hast mac 7 lorde shall iudge people haue cōpassyon seruauntes seeth theyr power gone maner shut vp brought nought forsaken shal say iere ii theyr goddꝭ theyr god trusted fat whose sacrifice dyd eate dranke wyne theyr drynk offerynges let ryse vp helpe proteccion ❀ necessyte se daui 4▪ • god none • regū ii kyl wyl make alyue wounde wyl heale iob x neyther delyuer hande wyll lyfte vp myne hande heuen wyl say lyue euer whet edge swerde hande take holde iustyce wyll recompence vengeaunce myne enemyes wyll rewarde hate wyll make myne arowes dronke bloood swerde shall eate fleshe bloode sleyne theyr captiuite synce ☞ begyn̄yng wrath enemye rom xv b prayse ye hethen people wyl auenge blood seruauntꝭ wyll auenge hym aduersaryes wyl mercyfull vnto lande people moses came spake wordes song care people iosua son nun moses spake wordes vnto ende people israell sayde vnto deut xi b •• xi e set youre hertes vnto wordes whiche ☞ testifie vnto daye ye shall commaunde vnto youre chyldren maye obserue wordes lawe let vayne worde vnto lyfe thorowe worde ye shall prolonge youre dayes lande whyther ye go ouer iordane conquere lorde spake vnto moses selfe daye sayenge get vp mountayne abarim ❀ say passage vnto mounte nebo whiche lande moab ouer agaynst ierico beholde lande canaan gyue vnto chyldren israel possesse dye mounte whiche thou goest vp vnto thou shalte gathered vnto thy people nume xx 33 c aaron thy brother dyed mounte hor gathered vnto people bycause ye trespassed agaynst amonge chyldren israel nume xx water stryfe cades wyldernesse zin ye sanctified amonge chyldren israel thou shalte therfore se lande shall go thyther vnto lande whiche gyue chyldren israel ¶ moses dyenge blesseth trybes israell capi xxxiii blessynge wherwith moses man god blessed chyldren israel deathe sarde exodi iii lorde came smay shewed beames exod xi • • seir vnto appeared mount pharan came thousandes ☞ sayntes ryghte hande lawe fyre loued people sapi iii a▪ sayntes also thy handes ❀ smytten go thy feete receyue thy wordes moses gaue v lawe enheritaunce congregacyon iacob israell kynge heades people tribe israell gathered togyther let ruben lyue dye fewe nombre also happen iuda sayd heare lorde voyce iuda▪ brynge hym vnto people handes shalbe good ynough yf thou helpe hym agaynst enemyes vnto leut sayde ☞ thumin • urim shall euery one godly thou diddest proue hym also temptacyon stryuedst hym water stryfe hath sayd vnto father mother haue sene hym ☞ knewe brother knewe owne chyldrē haue obserued thy worde shall kepe thy couenaunte shall teache iacob thy iudgementes israell thy law shal put sence thy nose bur • sacrifice vpon thyne aulter blesse lorde fyrst fruytes accepte worke handes smyte loynes ryse agaynst hym hate hym ryse agayne ben iamin sayde lordes derlyng shall dwel safetie vpon hym lorde shall couer hym day long shall dwell bytwene shoulder ioseph sayd blessed lorde lande fruytes heuen thorow dewe sprynges lye bynethe swete fruytes encrease sonne rype fruytes moone fyrst fruyte principal mountaynes fruytes hylles brynge forth euer fruytꝭ earth fulnesse therof good wyll hym dwelte exodi iii busshe shall blessynge come vpon heade ioseph vpon top head hym seperated among brethrē ☞ fyrst borne oxe hath beautye horne horne vnicorne shall trouble nacions togyther euen vnto endes worlde also many thousandes ephram thousandes manasses vnto zabulon sayde reioyse zabulon thy goyng thou isachar thy tentes shall call people vnto hyll shal offre offerynges ryghteousnesse shal sucke aboundaunce see treasure hyd sande vnto gad sayde blessed rowme maker gad dwelleth lyon catcheth arme heed saw therfore begynnynge porcyon hyde lawe gyuer came heades people executed ryghtousnes lorde iudgementes israel vnto dan sayd dan lyon whelpe shall flow basan vnto nepthali sayd nephthali hath aboundance god good pleasure fylled blessynge lorde shall haue possessyons towarde souhtwest aser sayd aser shall blessed chyldren shal acceptable vnto brother shall dyp foote oyle thy dwellyng yron brasse thyne age thy youth none lyke vnto god israel though syt vpon heuen vpon horse yet thy helper whose glorye celestyall place eternall god thy refuge vnder armes euerlastyng god shalte thou lyue shall cast enemye say destroy israel shall dwel safetie alone eye iacob shall vpon lande corne wyne heuens shall drop dewe happye arte thou israell lyke vnto people arte saued lorde whiche shylde thy helpe swerde thy glory thyne enemyes haue lost theyr strength warde thou shalte ☞ treade vpon hyght ¶ moses dyeth israell wepeth iosua succedeth moses roume capi xxxiiii nume 71 moses went playne moab vp mount nebo vnto top deut ••• hyl ouer agaynst iericho lorde shewed hym lande gilead euen vnto dan nephthali lande ☞ ephraim manasse lande iuda euen vnto vttermost see south region playn iericho citie paulme tree euen vnto zoar lorde sayde vnto hym 〈…〉 ••• lande sware vnto abraham isaac iacob sayenge wyll gyue vnto thy seede haue caused also se thyne eye deute 4 thou shalte go ouer thyther moses seruaunt lorde dyed lande moab accordyng worde lorde buryed hym valey lande moab ouer agaynste house peor mā knoweth sepulcre vnto day moses hundred twentye yere olde dyed eye dym naturall coloure abated chyldren israel num •• wepte moses playn moab thyrtie dayes dayes wepynge mournynge moses ended iosua sonne nun full spirite wysdome num •• moses put handes vpon hym chyldren israel obedient vnto hym dyd lorde cōmaunded moses arose prophete synce israel lyke vnto moses lorde knewe face face accordynge vnto myracles wonder whiche lorde sent hym lande egypte vnto pharao seruauntes lande accordynge myghtye hande great vision whiche moses shewed syght israell ¶ ende fyfth booke moses called hebrue elle haddebarim latyn deuteronomium ❧ boke iosua hebrues call iehosua ¶ lorde courageth iosua inuade lande promesse cōmaundeth hym contynually rede deuteronomium capi primo death moses seruaunt lorde happened also lorde spake vnto iosua sonne nun moses minister saynge moses seruaūt deade nowe therfore vp go ouer iordan thou people vnto lande gyue vnto chyldrē israel deute xi c place sooles youre feete shall treade vpon haue gyuen sayde vnto moses wyldernesse libanon vnto great ryuer euphrates lande hethites euen vnto great see towarde goyng downe sonne shall cooste shal man able withstande dayes thy lyfe iesua iii b moses wyll hebru 13 b wyl fayll forsake deut 31 f 3 regū ii stronge therfore bolde vnto people shalte thou deuyde lande whiche sware vnto theyr father gyue onely thou strong bolde thou canst thou mayest obserue accordynge lawe moses seruaunt cōmaunded deute v turne therfrom neyther ryght hande lefte thou mayest wysely thou takest hande deut 17 let booke lawe departe thy mouthe recorde therin daye nyght thou mayst obserue accordynge wrytten therin shalte thou make thy waye prosperous thou shalte wysely haue cōmaūded stronge bolde thou shuldest feare faynt herted lorde thy god whyther euer thou goest iosua cō maunded officer people sayenge go thorowe myddes hoost cō maunde people sayenge prepare vitayles thre dayes ye shal passe ouer iordane go enioye lande whiche lorde youre god gyueth possesse vnto rubenites gadites halfe trybe manasses spake iosua saynge num 32 remember ☞ word moses seruaunt lorde cōmaūded sayenge lorde youre god hath gyuen rest hath gyuen lande wyues youre chyldren youre cattell shal remayne lande moses gaue syde iordane ye shall go brother armed men war helpe vntyll lorde haue gyuē brother rest hath vntyl also haue obteyned land whiche lorde god gyueth shall ye returne vnto lande possessyon enioye whiche lande moses lordes seruaūt gaue syde iordan towarde sonne rysynge answered iosua saynge deute v • iere xlii thou hast cōmaunded v wyl whyther soeuer thou sendest v wyll go accordynge obeyed moses thynges wyll obey onely lorde thy god wt moses whosoeuer doth dysobeye thy mouth wyll herken vnto thy wordes thou cōmaundest hym let hym dye stronge good courage ¶ iosua sendeth spyes ierico hyd rahab capi ii iosua sonne nun sent settim two men spye secretly sayenge go vewe lande also ierico went came harlot house named rahab lodged tolde kynge ierico sayd beholde came men hyther nyght chyldren israel spye coū trey kynge ierico sent vnto rahab sayenge brynge forth men come entred thyne house come searche lande woman toke two men hebru xi c iacob 〈◊〉 hyd sayd thus dede came men vnto wyst whence aboute tyme shuttynge gate darke men went whyther men went wote folow ye quyckly ye shall ouer take brought vp roofe house iosua v •• hyd stalkes flare whiche lyenge abrode vpon roofe men pursued waye iordan euen vnto ferye soone whiche pursued gone shut gate euer flepe came vp vnto thē vpon roofe sayde vnto men knowe lorde hath gyuen lande deut • 8 iosua v feare fallen vpon v enhabyters land faynt presence haue herde howe lorde exod xiiii c dryed vp water red see ye came egypt ye dyd vnto two kynges amorites syde iordan nu 21 f g sohon og whiche ye vtterly destroyed soone haue herde thyngꝭ ❀ vve vvere sore afrayde hertes dyd faynt remayned courage man presence lorde god god heuen aboue earth benethe nowe therfore praye sweare vnto deute x lorde haue shewed mercye ye shall also shewe mercye vnto father house gyue true token ye shal saue alyue father mother brother systers haue ye shall delyuer ☞ soules death men answered oure lyues dye yf ye vtter oure busynesse lorde hath gyuen v lande iosna vi c wyll deale mercifully truely let downe corde regū 19 c actes ix thorowe wyndowe house towne walle dwelt towne wall sayde vnto get mountayne leest pursuer mete hyde selues thre dayes vntyll pursuer returned shall ye go youre waye men sayde vnto wyll bla melesse thyne othe thou hast made v swere beholde come lande thou shalt bynde purple corde wyndowe whiche thou lettest v downe bye thou shalt brynge thy father thy mother thy brother thy father houshold euen thy house soeuer doth go dores thy house streete ☞ bloode shall vpon owne heade wyl gyltlesse whosoeuer shall house bloode shall heade yf mannes hande touche hym yf thou vtter wordes wyll quyte thyne othe whiche thou hast made v sweare sayde accordynge vnto youre wordes sent awaye departe bounde purple corde wyndow departed got mountayne aboue thre dayes vntyl pursuer returned pursuer sought thorowout waye founde two men returned descended mountayne passed ouer came iosua son nun tolde hym chaunced sayde vnto iosua lorde truly hath delyuered handes lande inhabyters coū trey faynte presence v ¶ iosua people passe ouer iordane capi iii iosua rose early remoued settim came iordā chyldren israell lodged went ouer thre dayes fortuned offycers went thorowout hoost cōmaunded people sayenge ye se arke testament lorde youre god preestꝭ leuttes bearyng ye shall departe place go yet shall space bytwene aboute two thousande cubites measure ye shall come nygh vnto ye may knowe way ye must go forye haue gone waye tymes past ❀ bevvare ye approche nygh vn arke iosua sayd vnto peple • xuiii 〈◊〉 nume 〈◊〉 〈◊〉 iosua •••• ☞ sanctifye youre selues morowe lorde shall wonder amonge iosua spake vnto preestes saynge take vp arke couenaunt go people toke vp arke testament went people lorde sayde vnto iosua daye wyl begyn ☞ magnifye syght israell maye knowe howe iosua •• moses wyll thou shalte commaunde preestes beare arke couenaūt sayenge ye come edge water iordayne ye shal stande styll iosua sayde vnto chyldren israel come hyther heare wordes lorde god iosua sayd hereby ye shall knowe lyuynge god amonge wyll without fayle cast cananites hethites heuites pheresytes gergesites amorites iebusites beholde arke appoyntment lorde worlde goeth iordan nowe therfore take among twelue men trybes israell euery trybe man assoone sooles feete preestes beare arke lorde gouernoure worlde treade water iordane water iordan ❀ beneath shall runne dovvne shall deuyded water come aboue shall stande styll vpon heape fortuned people departed theyr tentes go ouer iordan preestes bearynge actes vii • arke appoyntment went people soone bare arke came vnto iordane feete preestes bare arke dypped brym water eccle 24 iordane vseth fyll bankes tyme haruest water also came downe frō aboue dyd ryse vp vpon heape ❀ appeared great mountayne departed farre citye adam besyde zarthan water benethe towarde see wyldernesse fell awaye departed salte see peple psal 66 b went ryght ouer agaynst ierico preestꝭ bare arke appoyntment lorde stode drye within iordane redy prepared israelytes went ouer thorow drye vntyl people gone clene ouer thorowe iordane ¶ iosua setteth vp xii stone iordane capi iiii fortuned people gone deut 27 8 ouer iordane lorde spake vnto iosua sayenge take twelue men people euery trybe man cōmaunde sayenge take hence myddes iordane euen oute place preestes stode redynesse twelue ❀ moost hardest stoones whiche ye shall take awaye leaue place shal lodge nyght iosua called twelue men whiche prepared chyldren israell euery tryde man iosua sayd vnto get arke lorde god euen thorowe myddes iordan deut 27 take vp euery man stoone vpon shoulder accordynge vnto nombre trybes chyldren israell maye sygne amonge chyldren aske theyr father tyme come sayenge meane stone ye maye answere howe water iordane deuyded presence arke appoyntment lorde went ouer iordan water iordan deuyded stoones become memoryall vnto chyldren israell euer chyldren israell dyd euen iosua cōmaunded toke vp •••• 18 f twelue stoones myddes iordane lorde sayde vnto iosua accordyng nombre trybes chyldren israell caryed awaye vnto place lodged layde downe iosua set vp twelue stone also myddes iordan place foot preestes whiche bare arke testament stode haue continued ☞ vnto daye preestes whiche bare arke stode myddes iordane vntyll finysshed lorde commaunded iosua saye vnto people accordynge moses charged iosua people hasted went ouer fortuned also people cleane ouer arke lorde went ouer also preestes people num 32 c chyldren ruben chyldren gad halfe trybe manasses went chyldren israel armed moses charged euen fourtye thousande prepared war went lorde vnto battayle thorow playn ierico iosua iii • day lorde magnifyed iosua syght israell ☞ feared hym feared moses dayes lyfe lorde spake vnto iosua saynge cōmaunde preestes beare arke wytnesse come vp iordane iosua therfore cōmaunded preestes sayenge come ye vp iordane preestes bare arke appoyntment lorde come vp myddes iordan assoone sooles preestes foot set drye lande water iordā returned agayne vnto theyr place went ouer theyr bankes dyd people came vp iordane tenth daye fyrst moneth pytched gylgall euen east border citye ierico twelue stoones whiche toke iordane dyd iosua pitche gylgal spake vnto chyldren israell sayenge exodi xii • yf chyldren aske theyr father tyme come saye meane stone ye shall shewe youre chyldren saye israell came ouer iordane drye lande lorde god dryed vp water iordane vutyll ye gone ouer lorde youre god dyd red seeexodi 14 • whiche dryed vp v tyl gone ouer people worlde maye knowe hande lorde howe myghtye ye myght feare lorde god euer ¶ canaanite afrayde capi v fortuned kyngꝭ amorytes whiche beyonde iordan westwarde kynges cananytes whiche see herde howe lorde dryed vp water iordane child israel vntyll goone ouer iosua ii b theyr hertes faynted feare spiryte presence chyldren israell tyme lorde sayde vnto iosua exodi iiii f make sharpe knyues stone go agayne circumcyse chyldren israell seconde tyme iosua made hym sharpe knyues stone circumcised chyldren israell top foreskynnes cause iosua circumcysed people came egypte namely suche male bycause men warre dyed wyldernesse waye came egypte people came circūcysed people borne wyldernesse waye came egypt circūcised chyldren israell walked fourtye yeres wyldernesse tyll people men warre came egypte consumed bycause herkened vnto voyce lorde wherfore lorde sware wolde shewe lande num 14 f lorde sware vnto theyr father wolde gyue v euen lande nume • 3 floweth mylke honye theyr chyldren whome sette vp theyr steade iosua circūcysed vncircumcised bycause circumcised way circumcised people abode styll togyther hooste tyll hoole lorde sayde vnto iosua daye haue taken awaye shame egypte frō wherfore name place called gilgall vnto day child israell abode gilgall exodi xi helde feast passeouer fourtene day moneth euen playne ierico dyd eate corne lande morowe passeouer swete cake parched corne selfe daye exod 17 • manna ceased morowe begon eate corne lande neyther chyldren israel manna dyd eate corne lande canaan yere fortuned iosua nygh ierico lyft vp eye loked beholde stode man agaynst hym hauynge swerde drawen hande iosua went vnto hym sayd vnto hym art thou syde aduersaries sayd naye captayne hoost lorde nowe come iosua fell face earth dyd reucrence sayde vnto hym sayeth lorde vnto seruaunt captayne lordes hoost sayd vnto iosua exodi iii actes vii • thy shoo thy foote place wheron thou standest holy iosua dyd ¶ walles iericho fall destroyed capi vi ierico shut vp locked bycause chyldren israel neyther myght man go lorde sayd vnto iosua beholde haue gyuen thyne hande ierico kyng stronge men war ye shall cōpasse citye ye men warre go rounde aboute shall ye syre dayes seuen preestes shall beare arke seuen trompettes rammꝭ horne ❀ vsed iubilie seuenth daye ye shal compasse citye seuen tymes preestes shall blowe trompettes make longe blaste rammes horne ye heare soūde horne people shall shoute great shoute shall wall ☞ citye fall downe people shall ascende vp euery man streyght hym iosua sonne nun called preestes sayd vnto take vp arke appoyntment let vii preestes beare seuen trompettes rammes horne arke lorde sayde vnto people go compasse citye let hym harnessed go arke lorde iosua spoken vnto peple seuen preestes bare seuen trompettes rammes horne went forth arke lorde blewe trompettes arke couenaunt lorde folowed men armes went preestes blewe wt trompettes cōmen people came arke went blewe trompettes iosua cōmaunded people sayenge ye shall shoute make noyse wt youre voyce neyther shall worde procede youre mouth vntyl day byd shoute shall ye shoute arke lorde compassed citye went aboute returned hoost lodged iosua rose early mornyng preestꝭ toke vp arke lorde seuen preestes bare seuen trompettes rammꝭ horne went arke lorde blewe trompettes men armes went cōmen peple came arke lorde went blowynge trompettes seconde daye compassed citye returned agayne hooste dyd syxe dayes seuenth daye came rose early euen dawnynge daye compassed citye maner seuen tymes daye cōpassed citye seuen tymes seueth tyme preestes blewe trompettes iosua sayde vnto people shoute lorde hath gyuen citye citye shall ☞ dampned therin vnto lorde rahab harlot shall lyue house bycause iosua ii hyd messenger sent wyse ye ware excōmunicate thynges leest ye make selues excōmunicate take excōmunicate thyngꝭ make hoost israell excōmunicate trouble siluer golde vessel brasse yron shal consecrate vnto lorde shal come treasurye people shouted blewe trompettes people herde sounde trompe shouted great shoute wall fell downe sohebrue xi f people went vp citye euery man streyght hym toke citye vtterly destroyed citye man woman yonge olde ore shepe asse edge swerde iosua sayde vnto two men spyed coūtrey hebrue xi f go harlottes house bryng thence woman hath iosua • r ye sware yonge men spyes went brought rahab father mother brother al brought kynred put without hooste israell burnt citye fyre therin onely syluer golde vessel brasse yron put vnto treasure house lorde hebrue • • iosua saued rahab harlot father housholde al dwelt israell euen vnto daye bycause hyd messenger iosua sent spye ierico iosua sware tyme sayenge cursed man lorde ryseth vp buyldeth citye ierico shall laye foundacyon 3 reg 16 • ☞ eldest sonne yongest son shall set vp gate lorde iosua fame noysed throwout landes ¶ hai spyed acan stoned capi vii yet chyldren israell trespassed deut vii xiii excommunicate thynges iosua 22 para • 〈◊〉 mach 12 • acan sonne carmi sonne zabdi sonne zareh trybe iuda toke excommunicate thynges wrath lorde waxed hoote agaynst chyldren israeli iosua sentmen ierico hai whiche besyde bethauen east syde bethel spake vnto sayenge get vp vewe countrey men went vp spyed hai returned vnto iosua sayd vnto hym let people go vp let two thre thousand men go vp smyte hai make people labour thyther fewe went vp thyther people aboute thre thousande men fled men hai men hai smote vpon thyrtye syre men chased frō gare euen vnto sebarina smote goynge downe wherfore hertes people psal xxii • feare melted awaye lyke water iosua rent clothes fell earth vpon fare arke lorde vntyll euen tyde elder israell put earth vpon theyr heades iosua sayde dente ix • ala lorde god wherfore hast thou brought people ouer iordane delyuer v hande amorites destroye v wolde god ❀ ben content dwelte syde iordane oh lorde shall saye israel turneth theyr backꝭ theyr enemyes surely cananites enhabyters lande shall heare shall conspyre agaynst v destroye name v world wylt thou vnto thy myghtye name lorde sayd vnto iosua get vp wherfore lyest thou thus vpon thy face israell hath synned haue transgressed myne appoyntment whiche cōmaunded haue taken excōmunicate thynges haue stollen dissembled put vnto theyr owne stuffe therfore chyldren israell stande theyr enemyes shall turne theyr backes theyr enemyes bycause excommunicate neyther wyll excepte ye destroye excommunicate amonge exod xix therfore ☞ sanctifye people saye sanctifye youre selues agaynst morowe sayd lorde god israell damned thynge among israell therfore ye stande agaynst enemyes vntyll ye haue put dampned thyng amonge morowe mornynge therfore ye shall brought accordynge youre trybes tiybe whiche lorde taketh shall come accordynge kynreds therof kynred whiche lorde shall fynde gyliye shall come housholdes housholde whiche lorde shall fynde fautye shall come man man founde excommunicacyon shall burnte fyre hath bycause hath transgressed couenaunt lorde wrought folye israell iosua rose vp early mornynge brought israell theyr trybes trybe iuda caught brought kynreds iuda toke kynred zarehites brought kynred zarehites man man zabdi caught brought shousholde man man acan sonne carmi son zabdi sonne zareh trybe iuda caught iosua sayde vnto acan sonne ☞ gyue glory lorde god israell gyue hym prayse shewe thou hast doone hyde acan answered iosua sayde truth haue synned agaynst lorde god israel thus thus haue done saw amonge spoyle goodlye babylony garment two hundred sycles syluer tonge golde fyftie sicles meyght counted toke beholde lye hyd earth tente syluer vnder iosua sent messenger whiche ran vnto tente beholde hyd tent syluer vnder therfore toke myddest tent brought vnto iosua vnto chyldren israell layde lorde iosua toke acan son zarch syluer garment tonge golde sonnes doughters ox ass shepe tent israel hym brought vnto valey acor iosua sayd muche thou hast troubled v lorde shall trouble daye israell stooned hym stone burnte fyre ouerwhelmed wt stone cast vpon hym great heape stone vnto daye lorde turned wrathe indygnacion name place called valey acor vnto daye ¶ fe • ge wynnynge hai kynge therof hanged iosua setteth vp aulter blesseth people capi viii lorde sayd vnto iosua deut vii • feare neyther thou faynte herted take men war vp get hai beholde haue gyuen thy hande kyng hai people citye lande thou shalte hai kynge thou dydest vnto iosua vi • iericho kynge neuerthelesse spoyle deute ••• cattell therof shall ye take vnto selues lay watche vnto towne backesyde therof iosua arose men warre go vp agaynst hai iosua chose thyrtye thousande men war sent awaye nyght cōmaunded saynge beholde ye shall laye awayte vnto towne backesyde therof go farre citye al redye people wyl approche vn citye come agaynst v dyd fyrst tyme wyl fley wyl come v wyll brynge citie wyll saye fley v fyrste tyme wyll fley meane tyme shall ye aryse vp layenge awayte destroy citye lorde god wyll delyuer hande ye haue taken citye ye shall set fyre accordynge cōmaundement lorde shall ye beholde haue charged iosua therfore sent forth went lay awayte abode bytwene bethell hai west syde citye hai iosua lodged night among people iosua rose vp earlye mornynge nombred people went vp elder israell people agaynst hai men warre hym went vp drue nygh came agaynst citye pytched north syde hai valey bytwene hai toke vpon fyue thousande men put lay awayte bytwene bethel hai westsyde citye put people euen hooste northsyde agaynst citye layer awayt west iosua walked nyght myddes valey fortuned kynge hai sawe hasted rose vp early men citye went agaynst israel battayle people tyme appoynted euen playne wyst layer awayte bacsyde citye iosua israell fayned selues put worse fled towarde wyldernesse al people towne called gyther folowe folowed iosua drawen awaye citie man lette hai bethell went israell lefte citye open folowed israell lorde sayde vnto iosua stretche speare thyne hande towarde hai wyl gyue thy hande iosua stretched speare hand toward citie layer awayt rose quycklye theyr place ran soone iosua stretched hande entred citye toke hasted set citye fyre men hai loked backe sawe smoke cytye ascende vp heuen leasure fley eyther waye people fled wyldernesse turned backe agayne vpon folowers iosua israell sawe layer awayte taken citye smoke ascended turned agayne layde men hai yssued cytye agaynst myddꝭ israell one syde reeste syde iosua vi c layde vpon let one scape kynge hai toke alyue brought hym iosua israell made ende sleyenge enhabyters hai felde wyldernesse chased al fallen edge swerde vntyll wasted israelytes returned vnto hai smote edge swerde fell day men woman twelue thousande euen men hai iosua plucked hande backe agayne whiche stretched vpon speare vntyll vtterlye destroyed enhabitatours hai nume 35 deute xx • cattel spoyle citye israell toke vnto selues accordynge vnto worde lorde whiche commaunded iosua iosua set hai fyre made heape euer wyldernes euen vnto day kyng hai hanged tree vntyll euen soone sonne downe iosua cōmaunded deut xix shulde take carkas downe tree cast entrynge gate citye iosua 7 laye theron greate heape stoones remayneth vnto daye iosua deut 27 buylde aultre vnto lorde god israell mounte eball moses seruaunt lorde cōmaunded chyldren israell wrytten deut 27 bokeof law moses exodi xx • aulter ☞ hoole stoones ouer whiche man hath lylte toole yron sacrifyced theron burntsacrifyces vnto lorde offered peaceofferynges wrote vpon stoones rehearsall lawe moses wrote presence chyldren israell israel elder therof theyr offycers iudges stoode parte syde arke parte syde preestes leuytes whiche bare arke apoyntment lorde wel straunger borne among halfe forefront mounte garizim halfe forefront mount eball moses seruaunt lorde cōmaunded shulde blesse people israell afterward red wordes lawe blessynges cursynges accordyng wrytten booke lawe one worde al moses cōmaunded whiche iosua sed cougregacyon israel woman chyldren straungers come standynge amonge ¶ gibconyies obtayne peace iosua capi ix fortuned kyngꝭ dwell syde iordane hylles valeys alonge al coostes great see ouer agaynst libanō namely hethites amorites cananites pheresites heuites iebusytes herde therof gathered selues togyther fyght agaynst iosua agaynst israell one accorde • reg 〈◊〉 enhabytours gibeon herde iosua done vnto iericho hai played wylylye went made selues ambasadours toke ❀ vyttayles olde sackes vpon theyr ass wyne bottels olde rent worne • olde clouted shoos vpon theyr feete theyr rayment olde theyr prouysyon breade dryed vp hoored came vnto iosua hoost gilgall sayde vnto hym vnto al men israell come farre countrey nowe make ye agrement v men israell sayde vnto heuite peraduenture thou dwelldest among v howe make peace sayde vnto iosua thy seruauntes iosua sayde vnto agayne ye whence come ye answered hym far countrey thy seruaūtes come name lorde thy god haue herde fame ❀ poure hym dyd egypt dyd two nume 21 • kynges amorites beyonde iordane sehon kynge hesbon og kynge basan whiche astharoth wherfore oure elder enhabytours oure countrey spake • v sayenge take vitayles serue waye go meete saye vnto youre seruauntes nowe make ye couenaunt peace v foode breade toke v house hoote day departed come vnto nowe beholde dryed vp hoored bottels wyne whiche fylled newe se rent garmetes shoos worne oldnesse reason excedynge longe iourney men toke theyr vittayles counsayled mouth lorde iosua made peace 3 xxi made couenaunt shulde suffered lyue lorde congregacyon sware vnto fortuned thre dayes made peace herde theyr neyghbours dwelt among chyldren israell toke theyr iourney came vnto theyr cityes thyrde daye theyr cityes gibeon caphira beeroth kariath iarim chyldren israell slewe bycause lordes congregacion sworne vnto lorde god israell multitude murmured agaynst lordes lordes sayd vnto congregacyon haue sworne vnto lorde god israell therfore maye hurte wyll wyll let lyue leest wrathe vpon v bycause othe whiche sware vnto lordes sayd vnto agayne let lyue deut 29 • hewe wood drawe water vnto congregacyon lordes sayde vnto iosua sent talked sayde wherfore haue ye begyled v sayenge dwell farre ye dwell amonge v cursed shall cease bonde men hewer wood drawer water house god answered iosua sayde tolde thy seruauntes howe lorde thy god cōmaunded seruaunt moses gyue lande destroye enhabytours therof youre syght therfore excedyng sore afrayd ❀ dyd prouyde lyues presence haue done beholde thyne hand semeth good ryght thyne eye vnto v euen dyd vnto ryd hande chyldren israell selwe iosua made day hewer wood drawer water cōgregacyon aulter god vnto daye place whiche god shulde chose ¶ • rytes ouercome iosua rayneth stone son standeth •• yll fyue kynges hanged capi x fortuned adonizede • kynge ierusalem herde howe iosua taken hai destroyed howe iosua 〈◊〉 vi •• done ierico kynge euen done hai kynge howe enhabytoures gibeon made peace israell amonge feared excedynglye gibeon great citye citye kyngdome greater hai men therof myghtye wherfore adonizedec kynge ierusalem sent vnto hoham kynge hebron vnto pirea kynge irimoth vnto iaphia kynge lachis vnto dabir kynge eglon sayenge come vp vnto helpe may smyte gibeon haue made peace iosua chyldren israell therfore v kynges amorites kynge ierusalem kyng hebron kynge ierimoth kynge lachis kynge eglon gathered themselues togyther theyr hoostes beseyged gibeon made warre agaynst men gibeon sent vnto iosua hoost gilgal saynge withdrawe thy hande thy seruauntes come vp v saue v helpe v kynges amorites whiche dwell mountaynes gathered togyther agaynst v iosua ascended eilgal peole warre hym men myght lorde sayde vnto iosua feare haue delyuered thyne hande neyther shall stand agaynst iosua therfore came vnto sodeynly went vp gilgall nyght lorde troubled israell slewe great slaughter gibeon chased alonge way gothe vp bethoron smote esaka makeda fortuned fled israell goynge downe bethorō lorde cast downe great stone heuen vpon vntyll esaka mo deade hayle stone chyldren israll slewe swerde spake iosua lorde day lorde delyuered amorites chyldren israell sayd syght israell e • l xivi sonne stande thou styll vpon gibeon thou moone aialon son abode moone stode styll vntyll people auenged selues vpon theyr enemyes wrytten boke ☞ ryghteous sonne saye abode myddes heuen hasted go downe space hole day day lyke lorde herde voyce man lorde fought israell iosua returned israell hym vnto hooste gilgall fyue kynges fled hyd caue makeda tolde iosua one saynge fyue kynges founde hyd caue makeda iosua sayd rowle great stone vpon mouthe caue set men kepe stand ye styll folowe enemyes smyte hyndermoost suffre entre theyr city lorde god hath despuered hande fortuned iosua chyldren israell made ende sleynge great slaughter tyll wasted rest remayned entred walled cityes people returned hoost iosua makeda peace neyther dyd man moue tongue agaynst chyldren israell sayde iosua open mouthe caue brynge fyue kynges vnto oute caue dyd brought fyue kynges vnto hym caue euen kynge ierusalem kynge hebron kynge ierimoth kynge lachis kynge eglon fortuned brought kynges vnto iosua iosua called men israell sayde vnto cheyfe men warre whiche went hym come nere put youre feete vpon neckes kynges came nere put theyr feete vpon nerkes iosua sayde vnto ye shall feare faynt herted strong plucke vp hertes thus shall lorde al enemyes agaynst ye fyght iosua smote flew hanged fyue tree tyll euen goynge downe sonne fortuned iosua gaue cōmaundement toke downe iosua • • tree • ast caue wherin bene hyd layd great stone • •• mouth whiche remayne vnto daye daye iosua roke makeda smote edge swerde kynge therof also • ut • xx destroyed vtterly soules therin let nought remayne dyd kynge makeda iosua v • dyd kynge iericho iosua wente makeda israell hym vnto libna fought agaynst libna lorde delyuered kyng therof hande israell smote edge swerde soules therin let nought remayne dyd vnto kynge therof dyd vnto kynge iericho iosua departed libna israell hym vnto lachis beseyged assaulted lorde delyuered lachis hande israell whiche toke seconde daye smote edge swerde al soules therin doynge accordyng done citie libna horam kyng geser came vp helpe lachis iosua smote hym people vntyll nought remayned hym lachis iosua departed vnto eglon israell hym beseyged assaulted toke daye smote edge swerde soules therin vtterlye destroyed daye accordynge done lachis iosua departed vp eglon israell hym vnto hebron fought agaynst taken smote edge swerde kyng therof townes perteyne al soules therin lefte nought remaynyng dyd accordynge done eglon destroyed vtterlye soules therin iosua returned israel hym dabir fought agaynst taken kynge therof townes perteyned therto smote edge swerde vtterly destroyed soules therin neyther let ought remayne euen dyd hebron dyd dabir kynge therof done also libna kynge iosua therfore smote hyll countreys southe countreys valeys hyl sydes theyr kynges let nought remayne vtterly destroyed deute xx breathed lorde god israell commaunded iosua smote cades barne vnto asah countrey gosan euen vnto gibeon kynges theyr lande dyd iosua take one tyme bycause lorde god israel fought israel iosua israell returned vnto hoost gilgall ¶ battayle iosua dyuers hynges capi xi fortuned iabin kyng hazor herde thyngꝭ sent iobab kynge madon kyng simron kyng acsaph vnto kynges north mountaynes playnes toward south syde ceneroth lowe countreys border dor westwarde vnto cananites east west vnto amorites hethites pheresites iebusites mountaynes vnto heuites vnder hermon lande mizpa came theyr hoostes multitude folke euen sande see shore great nombre horse charettes excedyng many kynges met togyther came pytched togyther water merom fyght agaynst israel lorde sayde vnto iosua afrayde presence morow aboute tyme wyll delyuer sleyne israel thou shalte hough theyr horse burne theyr charettes fyre iosua came men war hym agaynst water merom sodeynly fel vpon lorde delyuered hande israell smote chased vnto great sidon vnto hoote water vnto valey mizpa eastwarde smote vntyl none remaynyng iosua dyd vnto lorde bad hym houghed theyr horse burnt theyr charettes fyre iosua tyme turned backe toke hazor smote kynge therof swerde hazor tyme head al kyngdomes smote soules therin edge swerde vtterly destroyenge nothynge breathed let remayne burnt hazor fyre city kynges kynges dyd iosua take smote edge swerde vtterly destroyed exodi 〈◊〉 34 • deute 7 • moses seruaunt lorde cōmaūded israel burnt none city ☞ stode styll theyr strength saue hazor onely iosua burnt spoyle sayd city cattel chyldren israel caught vnto selues men onely smote edge swerde vntyl destroyed neyther lefte ought breath lorde cōmaunded moses seruaunt dyd moses commaunde iosua euen dyd iosua deute •• mynysshed worde lorde cōmaunded moses iosua toke lande hylles south countrey lande gosan low countrey playne ☞ mountayne israel lowe countrey euen mounte partyng goth vp seir vnto playne gad valey libanon vnder mount hermō kynges toke smote slewe iosua made warre long tyme kyngꝭ neyther citie made peace chyldren israell saue hethites enhabited gibeon therfore toke battayle came lorde whiche dyd harden theyr hertes shulde come agaynst israel battayle shulde destroye vtterly shewe mercy bryng nought lorde commaunded moses reason came iosua destroyed enakites mountaynes namely hebron dabir anab mountaynes iuda al mountaynes israel iosua destroyed vtterly theyr city one enakite left lande chyldrē israel onely asah • reg 22 geth asdod remayned iosua toke hoole lande moses whyle chyldren israell wandered wyldernesse nowe • day foure score fyue yere olde yet stronge tyme moses sent loke howe stronge stronge nowe whyther go warre come agayne therfore gyue moūtayne brynke salte see frō rocke leaneth southward wente south syde towarde goynge vp acrabim wente along zinna ascended vp south syde vnto cades barne went along hezron went vp adar fet compasse karea thence went along azmon reached vnto ryuer egypte ende coost west syde theyr south coost theyr east coost salt see euen vnto edge iordan theyr border north quarter rocke see edge iordan border wente vp bethhagla wente longe north syde betharabah vp thence stone bohen son ruben agayne border went vp dabir valey acor nortwarde turnynge towarde gilgall lyeth goyng vp adonim southsyde riuer border
