ierusalem vnto day ¶ • otte parte ephraim capi xvi lot chyldren ioseph fel iordane iericho vnto water iericho eastwarde wyldernesse gothe vp iericho thorowout mounre bethel gothe bethel tolu runneth alonge vnto border arcimataroth gothe downe agayne westwarde euen coost iaph letht vnto cooste bethhoron nether gasor endes theyr coostes leaue west see chyldrē ioseph manasses ephraim toke theyr enheritaunce border chyldren ephraim theyr kynreds theyr border cast syde ataroth ador euen vnto beh horon vpper went westwarde machmathah north syde returneth eastwarde vnto thaanath silo past east syde vnto ianoah went downe ianoah ataroth noa rath came iericho wente iordan theyr border went thaphuah westwarde vnto ryuer kanah endes weste see enheritaunce trybe chyldren ephraim theyr kynreds seperate city chyldren ephraim amonge enheritaunce chyldren manasses euen city theyr village draue cananites dwelte gasar cananices dwelte among ephraites vn daye serued vnder tribute ¶ lotte porcyon halfe trybe manasses lananites • become try tutaryes israelytes manasses ephraim require greater proeyō heritage capi xvii lot tribe manasses whiche 〈…〉 eldest sonne ioseph machir eldest sonne manasses whiche father gilead man warte gilead basan possessyon reste chyldren manasses theyr kynreds namely chyldren abiezer chyldren helek • chyldren ariell chyldren sichem chyldren hepher chyldren semida male chyldren manasses sonne ioseph theyr kynreds nam 26 iivii • iiivi zelaphead sonne hepher son gilead son machir sonne manasses sonnes doughters whose name mahela noa hagla melcha thirza came eleazar preest iosua sonne nun lordes sayenge num 27 • xxxvi • lorde cōmaunded moses gyue v enheritaunce amonge brother therfore accordynge cōmaundement lorde gaue enherytaunce amonge brother theyr father fel ten poreyons manasses besyde lande gilead basan whiche syde iordan bycause doughters manasses dyd enherite amonge sonnes manasses sonnes lande gilead coost manasses aser machmathah lyeth sichem went alonge ryght hande euen vnto enhabiters entaphuah lande thaphuah belonged manasses whiche thaphuah besyde border manasses besyde border chyldren ephraim coost descended vn ryuer eanah southwarde euen ryuer city ephraim bytwene city manasses coost manasses went also north syde ryuer endes go see south perteyned ephraim north manasses see border met gyther aser northwarde isacar eastwarde manasses isaear aser bethsean townes iiblean townes enhabytoures dor townes perteynynge enhabitoures endor townes enhabitoures thaanath townes enhabitoures magedo townes euen thre countreys yet chyldren manasses coulde ouercome eities cananites presumed dwell lande neuerthelesse soone chyldren israell wared stronge put canaanite vnder tribute expelled chyldren ioseph spake vnto iosua sayenge hast thou gyuen one lot one porcion enheryt seynge great people moche lorde hath blessed hytherto iosua answered thou moche people get vp wood countrey prepare thy selfe lande pheresites giauntes yf mounte ephraim narow chyldren ioseph sayd hyll ynough v cananites dwell lowe countrey haue charetꝭ yron haue enhabite bethsean townes also dwell valey iezreel iosua sayde vnto house ioseph ephraim manasses ye moche people haue great power shall therfore haue one lot therfore hyll shall ye shall cut downe woode endes shalbe yf ye cast cananites haue yron charettes stronge ¶ lertayne sente de • yde lande 〈◊〉 trybes lotte lhyldren ben iamin capi xviii hoole congregacion chyldren israel came togyther silo set vp taberncle wytnesse lande subieccion remayned among chyldren israel seuen tribe whiche yet receyned theyr enheritaūce iosua sayd vnto chyldren israel howe longe ye slacke come possesse lande whiche lorde god father hath gyuen gyue amonge euery tribe thre men may sende maye ryse walke thorowe lande dystribute accordyng enheritaunce therof come agayne let deuyde vnto seuen partes iuda shall abyde theyr cooste south house ioseph shall stande theyr coostꝭ northe describe ye lande therfore seuen partes brynge descripcion hyther shall cast lotte lorde oure god butio • ua 〈◊〉 xiiii leuites haue parte among preesthode lorde theyr en heritaunce iosua x • gad ruben halfe tribe manasses haue receyued theyr en heritaūce beyonde iordan east warde moses seruaunt lorde gaue men arose went theyr way iosua charged wente describe lande sayeng departe go thorowe lande describe come agayne maye cast lotte lorde silo men departed walked thorowe lande described city seuen partes boke returned iosua hoost silo iosua cast lotte silo lorde iosua deuyded laude vn chyldren israell eche theyr porcion lot tribe chyldren ben iamin came vp accordynge theyr kynreds coost theyr lot came bytwene chyldren iuda chyldren ioseph theyr north coost iordan went vp syde ierico north syde wente vp thorowe mountaynes westwarde ended wyldernesse bethauen went thence toward lu euen south syde lu bethell descended agayne atcothadar vnto hylle lyeth southsyde nether bethhoron coost turneth thence cōpasseth corner see southwarde euen hylle lyeth bethhoron southwarde goeth kiriathbaal whiche kiriath iarim citye chyldren iuda west quarter south coost goeth edge kiriathiarim goeth westwarde thence turneth water wel nepthoah cōmeth dowrie agayne edge hyll lyeth valeye sonne hennon euen valeye gyauntes northwarde descendeth valey hennon besyde iebusi southwarde goth downe well rogell compasseth north goth forth wel sonne departeth thence place geliloth whiche towarde goynge vp vnto adomim goeth downe stone bohan sonne ruben goeth alonge towarde syde playne northwarde goeth downe feldes goth along syde bethhagiah northwarde endeth poynt salt see north therfrō euen south ende iordane south coost iordane kepeth coost cast syde enherytaunce chyldren beu iamin theyr coostꝭ round aboute thorowout theyr kynredꝭ cityes trybes chyldrē ben iamin thorowout theyr kynreds iericho bethhaglah playne kaziz betha rabah zamarim bethel auim pharah ophrah cheper ammona ophni gabai twelue cityes theyr vyllages gibeon ramah beroth mazphah caphairah mozah rekem iarephel tharela zela eleph iebust whiche ierusalem gibeath kiriath fourtene city theyr vyllages enheritaunce chyldren ben iamin thorowout theyr kynreds ¶ lotte partes habulon isachar aser nephthali dan iosua capi xix seconde lot came tribe chyldrē simeon theyr kynreds theyr enherytaunce myddes enheritaunce chyldren iuda theyr enheritaunce bersabe sabe moladah hazorsual balah azem eltholad bethull hormah zikelag bethmarcaboth hazetsusah bet ••• baoth saruhen thyrtene city wt theyr village aim remon ether asan foure city theyr village therto village rounde aboute • ities euen vnto balasath beor rama 〈◊〉 southwarde enheritaunce •• e tribe chyldren simeon thore •• theyr kynteds lot c ••• dren iuda came enherytaunce •• chyldren simeon parte chyldren iuda moche therfore chyldren simeon theyr enheritaunce enheritaunce thyrde lot arose chyldren zabulon thorowout theyr kynreds coostes theyr enheritaunce came sarid went vp westwarde morialah reached dabaseth came thence ryuer lyeth iokneuen turned sarid eastwarde towarde son rysyng vnto border chisloth thabor gothe dabereth gothe vp iaphia thence gothe longe castwarde gethah iepher ithah iazim gothe remon methoer neoh compasseth north syde nathan endeth valey iephthahel iatath nahalol semron iedaiah bethleem twelue city theyr village enheritaunce chyldren zabulon thorowout theyr kynreds city theyr village fourth lot came chyldren isachar theyr kynreds theyr coost iesraelah casuloth sunem hapharaim sion anaharath harabith kision abez rameth enganim enhadah bethphazez coost reacheth thabor sahazimah bethsames endeth iordan syxtene cyties theyr village enheritaunce trybe chyldren isachar theyr kynreds cityes theyr village fyfte lotte came tribe chyldrē aser theyr kynreds theyr coost helkath hall beten achsap alamelech amaad miseall came carmell westwarde sihor labanath turned towarde son rysynge bethdagon cōmeth zabulon valey iephthah towarde northsyde bethemek negell goeth lefte syde cabul hehrō rohob hamon kanah euen vnto greate sidō coost turneth ramah stronge citye azor turneth hozah endeth see possessyon achzibah amah also aphek rohob twentye two cityes theyr village enheritaunce chyldren aser theyr kynreds also cityes theyr village syxte lotte came chyldren nephthalt theyr kynreds theyr cooste neleph elom zaanaim adami nekeb iabneell euen lakum doeth go iordan coost turneth westwarde asanoth thabor goeth thence hukokah reacheth zabulon southe syde goeth aser west syde iuda vpon iordane towarde son tysynge theyr stronge cityes zidin ber hamath racath cenereth adamah hermah hazor kedꝭ edrai enhazor ieron magdelel horen bethanah bethsames nynetene cityes wt theyr village enherytaunce trybe chyldren nephthali theyr kynreds also cityes theyr village seuenth lotte came trybe chyldren dan theyr kynreds cooste theyr enheritaunce zaraah esthaoll otherwyse called citye • sonne irsames saelabin aialon iethlah eglon thēnathah akaron▪ elthekeh gibethon baalath iehud benebarak gathermō meiericon aarcon border lyeth iapho coostes chyldren dan went chyldren dan went vp fyght agaynst lesen toke smote edge swerde cōquered dwelte therin called • ud xviii • dan name dan theyr father enheritaūce trybe chyldren dan theyr kinreds also city theyr vyllages made ende deuydyng lande coostꝭ chyldren israell gaue enherytaunce vnto iosua sonne nun among accordynge worde lorde gaue hym citye whiche asked euen iosua 24 • thānath serah moūt ephraim buylte citye dwelte therin num 34 dthese enheritaunces whiche eleazar preest iosua son nun auncyent father trybes chyldren israell deuyded lotte siloh lorde dore tabernacle wytnesse made ende deuidyng coūtrey ¶ cityes refuge sanctuaryes capi xx lorde also spake vnto iosua sayenge speake chyldrē israel saye nume • 5 deut 〈◊〉 • appoynte among cytyes refuge wherof spake vnto hande moses sleyer kylleth persone vnwares vnwittyngly may flee thyther city shal refuge frō auenger blood doth flee vnto one city shall stande enterynge gate citye shall shewe cause eares elder citye shal take hym citye vnto gyue hym place may dwel among yf auenger blood folowe hym shall delyuer sleyer hande bycause smote frende ygnorantly hated hym tyme shall dwell sayde citye ☞ vntyll stande congregacyon iudgement nume 35 • vntyll death hye preest shall dayes shall sleyer returne come vnto owne citye vnto owne house vnto citye whence fled ☞ sanctifyed kedes galile mount nephthali sichem mount ephraim kiriatharbe ebrō mountayne iuda syde iordā ouer agaynst ierico eastwarde appoynted bozor wyldernes vpō playne trybe ruben ramoth gilead trybe gad golā basā trybe manasses cityes appoynted chyldren israel straūger sosourned among whosoeuer kylled person ygdorauntly myghteflee thyther shulde dye hande auenger bloode vntyll stode congregacion ❀ declare cause 〈2 page missing〉 aulter lorde oure god iosua 7 dyd acan son zareh trespasse excommunicate thyng wrath fell cō gregacyon israell alone perysshed wyckednesse chyldren ruben chyldē gad halfe tribe manasses answered sayde vnto heades ouer thousandes israell god goddes lorde god goddes euen lorde knoweth israell also shall know yf rebell transgresse agaynst lorde thou lorde saue v daye el yf haue buylde v aulter turne folowyng lorde offre theron burntofferynge meatofferynge offre peace offerynges theron let lorde require ❀ iudge yf haue rather done carefulnes sure occasyon sayenge tyme come chyldren myght saye vnto oures haue ye lorde god israell lorde hath made iordan border bytwene v ye chyldren ruben god ye haue parte therfore lorde shall chyldren make childrē cease frō fearyng lorde therfore ❀ toke better aduisement sayde wyll make v aulter burntofferynge sacrifyce gene 31 g iosua 24 f wytnesse bytwene v oure generacyons v shulde serue lorde offerynges sacrifice peace offerynges hym youre chyldren shulde say tyme come ye haue parte lorde therfore sayde yf shulde saye v generacyons tyme come wolde saye agayne behold facion aulter lorde whiche father made neyther burntoffryngꝭ sacrifice wytnesse bytwene v god forbyd shulde rebell agaynst lorde turne daye hym buylde aulter burntofferynges oblacions sacrifice saue aulter lord god tabernacle phinehes preest lordes congregacion heades ouer thousandes israell whiche hym herde wordes chyldren ruben chyldren gad chyldren manasses spake well content phinehes sonne eleazar preest sayde vnto child ruben chyldren gad chyldren manasses daye perceyue lorde among v bycause ye haue done trespasse agaynst lorde nowe ye haue ryd chyldren israell hande lorde phinehes son eleazar preest lordes returned chyldren ruben chyldren gad lande gilead vnto lande canaan chyldren israell brought worde agayne sayenge pleased chyldren israell ☞ blessed god dyd entende go agaynst battayle destroye lande chyldren ruben gad dwelte chyldren ruben chyldren gad called aulter wytnesse lorde god ¶ iusua exhorteth people ioyne selues gentyles capi xxiii came passe longe ceason lorde gyuen reste vnto israell theyr enemyes rounde aboute iosua waxed olde stryckē age iosua called israell theyr elder theyr heades theyr iudges officer sayd vnto olde stryken age ye haue sene lorde god hath done vnto nacions howe lorde god hath fought beholde haue subdued vnto nacyons remayne enheritaunce trybes euen iordane lande nacions haue destroyed euen vnto great see westwarde ❀ remayne yet many nacyons lorde god shall expell cast syght ye shal conquere theyr lande lorde god hath sayde vnto go therfore deute 〈◊〉 b strongly ye maye ye take hede wrytten booke lawe moses deut 〈◊〉 • 〈◊〉 • prouer • ye bowe syde therfrom ryght hande lefte lest ye come amonge nacions euen amonge lefte ye make mencion sweare name theyr goddes ye neyther serue bowe youre selues vnto ye stycke fast vnto lorde god ye haue done vnto daye shall lorde cast great nacyons myghtye man hath ben able stand hytherto deut 3 • • one man shall chase thousande lord god fyghteth hath promysed take good hede therfore vnto soules ye loue lorde youre god el yf ye go backe cleue vnto rest nacyons remayne shall make maryages go vnto ye sure lorde youre god wyll cast nacions num 33 g shall snare trappes vnto scourgꝭ sydes pryckꝭ eye vntyll ye perysshe good lande lorde god hath gyuen beholde day entre waye worlde ye know hertes youre soules iosua 21 nothynge hath fayled good thynges whiche lorde god promysed come passe nothynge hath fayled therof therfore good thynges come vpon whiche lorde youre god promysed shall lorde brynge vpō euyll vntyll haue destroyed good lande whiche lorde god hath gyuen ye haue transgressed appoyntment lorde god whiche commaunded haue gone serued straunge goddes bowed youre selues shall wrath lorde ware hoote vpon ye shall perysshe quyclye good lande whiche hath gyuen ¶ iosua exhorteth people kepynge law dyeth bone ioseph buryed eleazar dyeth capi xxiiii iosua gathered trybes israell sichem called elder israell theyr heades iudges offycers presented selues god iosua sayde vnto al people thus sayeth lorde god israell gene xi youre father dwelte syde floode olde tyme euen thareh father abraham nachor serued straunge goddes toke father abraham frō syde flood brought hym thorowout lande canaan multiplyed seede gene xxi math gaue hym isaac gaue vnto isaac iacob esau gene 31 gaue vnto esau mount seir possesse iacob chyldren went downe egypt sent moses also aaron exodi vii viii ix x xiiii plaged egypt whē done amonge brought brought father egypte came vnto see egyptian folowed father wt charettes horsmen vnto red see exodi 14 • cryed vnto lorde lorde put darknesse bytwene egyptian brought see vpon couered eye haue sene haue done egiptians ye dwelt wyldernesse longe ceason num 21 brought lande amorytes whiche dwelt syde iordane fought gaue hande ye myght conquere theyr countrey destroyed syght nume 22 deut 23 balac son ziphor kynge moab arose warred agaynst israel sent called balaam sonne beor curse wolde herken vnto balaam therfore rather blessed deliuered hande ye went ouer iordan came vnto ierico men ierico fought agaynst amorites pheresites canaanite hethites girgosites heuites iebusites deliuered hande sent deut vii • hornettes cast youre syght euen two kynges amorytes youre owne swerde youre owne bowe haue gyudn lande whiche ye dyd labour cityes whiche buylde whiche ye dwell vincyeardes also olyue tree whiche ye planted wherof ye eate • regū 7 • ohn 14 • nowe therfore feare lorde serue hym perfytenesse truthe put away goddes whiche father serued syde floode egypte serue ye lorde yf seme euyll vnto serue lorde chose day whome wyll serue whyther goddes whiche father serued syde stoode eyther goddes amorites whose lande ye dwell house wyll serue lorde people answered sayd god forbyd shulde forsake lorde serue straunge goddes lorde god brought v oure father lande egypt house bondage whiche dyd greate myracles syght preserued v way went amonge nacyons whiche came thorowe lorde dyd cast v nacions specially amorites dwelt lande therfore wyl also serue lorde god iosua sayde vnto people ye serue lorde holye god ielous god beare ininutte syn ye forsake lorde serue straunge goddes iosua 23 wyll turne euyll consume hath done good people sayde vnto iosua naye wyll serue lorde iosua sayde vnto people ye wytnesses selues ye haue thosen lorde serue hym sayde wytnesses put awaye sayde ☞ straunge goddes amonge bowe hertes vnto lorde god israell people sayde vnto iosua lorde god wyll serue voyce wyll obey iosua • reg 23 made couenaunt people daye ☞ set ordinaunce lawe sichem iosua wrote wordes booke lawe god • regū 7 toke great stone pytched ende sayd place euen vnder oke sanctuarye lorde iosua sayd vnto people beholde •••• 31 • iosua 22 • stoone shall wytnesse vnto v hath herde wordes lorde whiche spake v shall therfore wytnesse vnto leest ye denye ❀ dissemble vvith youre god iosua let people departe euery man vnto enheritaunce thynges came passe iosua sonne nun seruaunt lorde dyed beynge hundreth ten yeares olde buryed hym countrey iosua 19 b enheritaūce euen th • nath sareh whiche mount ephraim north syde hyll gaas israell serued lorde ii pa 34 • dayes iosua dayes elder ouer lyued iosua whiche knowen workes lorde done israell gene • exod xiil bone ioseph whiche chyldren israell brought egypt buryed sichem gene 33 parcell grounde whiche iacob bought sonnes hemor father sichem hundred peces syluer became enheritaunce chyldren ioseph eleazar sonne aaron dyed whome buryed hyll perteyned phinehes sonne whiche hyll gyuen hym mounte ephraim ende boke iosua hebrues call iehosua ❧ boke iudges called hebrue sophtim latyn iudicum ¶ iosua deade iuda constytute lorde ouer armye capi primo death iosua came passe chyldren israell asked lorde sayenge shall go vp v agaynst canauites shall fyrste fyght agaynst lorde sayde ☞ iuda shall go vp iosua 〈◊〉 • beholde haue delyuered lande handes iuda sayd vnto ☞ simeon brother come vp lot maye fyght agaynst cananites lykewyse wyll go thy lotte simeon went hym iuda went vp lorde deliuered cananites pheresytes theyr handes slewe bezeke ten thousand men founde ☞ adonibezeke bezeke fought agaynst hym slew cananites pheresites adonibezeke fled folowed hym caught cut thombes great toos adonibezeke sayd thre score ten kynges hauynge theyr thombes greate toos cut gathered theyr meate vnder table 〈…〉 iudi x • • haue done god hath done agayne brought hym ierusalem dyed chyldren iuda fought agaynst ierusalem toke dru •• ••• smote edge swerde set citye fyre afterward chyldren iuda went fyght agaynst cananytes dwelt mountayne towarde south lowe countrey iuda went agaynst cananites dwelte hebron whiche tyme called kariath arbe slewe sesai ahiman thalmai thence went inhabyters dabir whose name olde tyme called kariathsepher ❀ citye letter caleb sayde iosu 〈…〉 smyteth kariathsepher taketh hym wyll gyue aesah doughter wyfe othoniell sonne kenez calebs yonger brother toke gaue acsah douhhter wyfe went coūsayled aske father felde lyghted asse caleb sayde vnto ayleth answered vnto hym gyue blessyng thou hast gyuen southwarde drye lande gyue also sprynges water caleb gaue sprynges bothe aboue benethe chyldren ☞ kenite moses father law went vp iosua 4 deut 34 citye palme tree chyldren iuda wyldernesse iuda lyeth south arad went dwelt amonge people iuda went simeon brother slewe cananytes enhabyted zephath vtterlye destroyed nume 2 • called name citye horma laste iuda toke azah coostes therof askalon coostes therof akaron coostes therof lorde iuda conquered moūtaynes coulde dryue enhabyters valeyes bycause charettes yron gaue iosua 14 b hebrou vnto caleb moses sayde expelled▪thence thre sonnes nume 13 • enach iosua xv g chyldren ben iamin dyd cast iebusites enhabyted ierusalem iebusytes dwelte chyldren ben iamin ierusalem ☞ vnto daye iosu xvi lyke maner house ioseph went vp bethell lorde house ioseph scarched oute bethell whiche tyme called lu spyes sawe man come citye sayde vnto hym shewe v waye citye iosua ii • wyll shewe merry shewed waye citye smote wt edge swerde let man houshold go fr • e man went lande hethites buylde citye called name therof lu whiche name therof vnto dayes iosua 17 c neyther dyd manasses expell bethseā townes thaanach wt townes enhabitours dor townes enhabitours ieblaā townes neyther enhabytours magedo townes cananites bolde dwell lande came passe soone israel waxed myghty put cananytes trybute expelled iosua 16 lyke maner ephraim expelled cananytes dwelte gazer cananites dwelte styll gazer amonge neyther dyd zabulon expell enhabytours ketron neyther enhabytours nahaloll cananytes dwelte amonge became tributaryes neyther dyd aser cast enhabytours acho neyther enhabytours zidon ahalab aczib halbah aphek rohob aserites dwelt amonge cananytes enhabytours lande myght dryue neyther dyd nepthalim dryue enhabytours bethsames enhabytours bethanath dwelte amongest cananites enhabitours lande neuer thelesse enhabytours bethsames bethanath became trybutaryes vnto amorites troubled chyldren dan mountayne suffered come downe valeye amorites content dwel mounte here ❀ vvhich interpretacyon vvitnesynge hailon salabim hande ioseph preuayled became trybutaryes coost amorytes goynge vp acrahim rocke vpwarde ¶ angell rebuketh people bycause •• peace lana • ites dointrers pu •• sshed capi ii ☞ angell lorde came vp gilgall ☞ bochim sayd made come egypt haue brought vnto lande whiche sware vnto youre father 〈◊〉 vii • 〈◊〉 • sayde wyll breake myne appoyntment made ye also shall make couenaunt wt enhabytours lande shall breake • theyr aulters neuer thesse ye haue herkened vnto voyce haue ye done wherfore haue lykewyse determyned wyll cast shall thornes vnto theyr goddes shall snare vnto angell lorde spake wordes vnto chyldren israel peple cryed wept called name sayde place place wepe bochim offered sacrifyces vnto lorde iosua sente people away chyldren israell went euery man enherytaunce possesse lande iosua 24 • people serued lorde dayes iosua dayes elder lyued iosua sene al great workes lorde dyd israell iosua sonne nun seruaunt lorde iosua • 4 • dyed hundred ten yeares olde whome buryed coostes enherytaunce euen ☞ thamnath hare mount ephraim northsyde hyll gaas euen al generacyon put vnto theyr father arose another generacyon whiche neyther knewe lorde yet workes whiche done israell chyldren israell iudi iiii dyd wyckedlye syght lorde serued ☞ baalim forsoke lorde god theyr father whiche brought lande egypt folowed straunge goddes euen godꝭ nacyons round bowed themselues vnto angred lorde forsoke lorde ☞ serued baall astharoth wrathe lorde waxed hoote agaynst israell delyuered handes raueners spoyled solde handes theyr enemyes rounde aboute power longer stand theyr enemyes whyther soeuer went hande lorde agaynst euyll lucke euen lorde promysed sware vnto punysshed sore neuerthelesse lorde raysed vp iudges whiche delyuered handes theyr oppressers yet wolde herken vnto theyr iudges rather went hoorynge straunge goddes bowed themselues vnto turned quycklye waye whiche theyr father walked obeyenge commaundementes lorde dyd lorde raysed vp iudges iudge delyuered handes theyr enemyes dayes iudge exodi ii lorde compassyon ouer theyr sorowynges whiche reason oppressed vexed yet iudi iii b soone iudge deade turned dyd worsse theyr father folowynge straunge goddes seruynge ceased theyr owne inuencyons theyr malicyous way wrath lorde moued agaynst israell sayde bycause people hath transgressed myne appoyntment cōmaunded theyr father haue herkened vnto voyce wyll hence forth cast one man nacyons whiche iosua lefte dyed maye deute 13 proue israell whyther wyll kepe waye lorde walke therin theyr father dyd lorde lefte nacyons droue immedyatly neyther delyuered hande iosua ¶ othonyell delyuereth israell ahud kylleth kynge eglon samgar kylleth phelystines capi iii nacyons whiche lorde lefte myght proue israell euen many israell knowen warres canaan onlye lernyng generacion chyldren israel also myght teach warre asmoche ☞ knewe nothynge therof whome lefte fyue lordes philistine cananytes sidonytes heuites dwelte mount libanon euen fram mount baall hermon vnto hemath remayned proue israell wete whyther wolde herken vnto cōmaundementes lorde whiche commaunded theyr father hande moses chyldren israell dwelte amonge cananites hethites amorites pheresytes heuites iebusytes deut 〈◊〉 • toke doughters theyr wyues gaue theyr owne doughters theyr sonnes serued theyr goddes chyldren israel dyd wyckedlye syght lorde forgat lorde theyr god serued baalim aseroth therfore lorde angrye israell delyuered handꝭ chusā risathaim kynge mesopotamia chyldren israell serued chusā risathaim viii yeres chyldren israell cryed vnto lorde lorde styrred ☞ vp sauyour chyldren israell saued one othoniell son kenes calebs yonger brother spiryte lorde came vpon hym iudged israell went warre lorde delyuered chusan risathaim kyng mesopotamia hande hande preuayled agaynst chusan risathaim lande ii pe xvi rest fourtye yeres othoniel son kenes dyed chyldren israell went agayne cōmytted wyckednesse syght lorde lorde strengthed eglon kynge moabites agaynst chyldren israell bycause commytted wyckednesse lorde eglon gathered vnto hym chyldren ammon amalekites went smote israell conquered citye palme tree chyldren israel serued eglō kyng moab xviii yeres whē cryed vnto lorde lorde styrred vp sauiour ahud son gera son iemini man coulde nothyng handsomly wt ryght hande hym chyldren israell sent present vnto eglon kyng moab ahud made hym dagger two edge cubite lengthe dyd gyrde vnder rayment vpon ryght thyghe caried present eglon kyng moab eglon fat man fortuned presented present sent people bare awaye hymselfe turned agayne place grauen ymages gilgal sayd haue secret errande vnto kynge whiche sayd kepe sylence stode hym went hym ahud came vnto hym somer parler whiche sat hymselfe alone ahud sayd 2 reg 3 e haue message vnto god arose seate ahud put forth lefte hande toke dagger ryght thyghe thrust bely hafte went blade fat closed hafte myght drawe dagger bely dyrte came ahud gat hym postren dore shut dores parler aboute hym locked gone seruauntes came sawe dores parler locked sayde peraduenture ☞ couereth feete somer chā ber taryed tyll ashamed beholde seynge opened dores parler toke key opened beholde theyr lorde fallen downe dead earth▪ ahud escaped whyle taryed gone beyonde place grauen ymages escaped seirath come num • x blewe trompet mount ephraim chyldren israell wente downe hym hyll went sayde vnto folowe lorde hathe delyuered enemyes moabites youre hande descended hym toke passage iordan towarde moab suffered man passe ouer slewe moabites tyme vpon ten thousande men fat men warre scaped man deute ii b moab subdued daye vnder hande israel land rest lxxx yerꝭ hym samgar son anath whiche slewe philistine vi hundred men oxe goade delyuered israell also ¶ debora barah delyuer israel sisara kylled ia •• capi iiii chyldrē israel began agayn wyckedly syght lorde ahud deade lorde ☞ solde hande iabin kyng canaan reygned hazor whose captayne warre called sisara whiche dwelte ☞ haroseth gentyles chyldren israel cryed vnto lorde nyne hundred charettes yron twentye yeres troubled chyldrē israel sore debora prophetesse wyfe lapidoth iudged israel tyme debora dwelte vnder palme tree bytwene ramath bethel mount ephraim chyldren israel came vp iudgement sent called barak •• dis • • • son abinoam kedes nephthalim sayd vnto hym hath lorde god israel cōmaunded drawe mount thabor take ten thousand men chyldren nephthalim chyldrē zabulon wyl bryng vnto psal 〈◊〉 • ▪ ryuer kison sisara capitayne warre vnto iabin charettes people wyl delyuer hym thyne hand barak sayd vnto yf thou wylt go wyll go yf thou wylte come wt wyll go sayde wyll surely go wt iourney thou takest shall thyne honoure lorde shall sel sisara hande woman debora went barak kedes barak called zabulon nephthalim kedes led hym ten thousande men debora went vp hym haber kenite whiche chyldrē nume • • hobab father lawe moses remoued kenites pytched tente vntyl playne zaania • whiche kedes shewed sisara barak sonne abinoam gone vp mounte thabor sisara gathered togyther charettes euen ix hundred charettes yron people hym frō haroseth gentyles vnto ryuer kyson debora sayd vnto barak daye whiche lorde hath delyuered sisara thyne hande lorde gone barak went downe mount thabor ten thousande men hym lorde destroyed sisara charettes hoost edge swerde barak sisara lyghted downe charet fled awaye feete barak folowed charettes hoost euen vnto haroseth gentyles hoost sisara fell vpon edge swerde man lefte howbeit sisara fledde away feete tente iael wyfe haber kenite peace bytwene iabin kynge hazor housholde haber kenite iael went mete sisara sayde vnto hym turne lorde turne me▪ feare turned vnto tent couered hym ☞ mantell sayd vnto gyue lytell water drynke thyrstye opened iudi v bottell mylke gaue hym drynke couered hym agayne sayd vnto stande dore tent man dothe come enquyre whyther man thou shalte say nay iael haber wyfe toke nayle tente hammer hande went softly vnto hym smote nayle temple heade fastened grounde slombred sore wery dyed behold barak folowed sisara iael came mete hym sayde vnto hym come wyll shewe man thou sekest came tent beholde sisara lay deade nayle temple god brought iaben kynge canaan subieccyon daye chyldren israel hande chyldren israell prospered preuayled agaynst iaben kynge canaan▪ vntyll brought hym nought ¶ songe thankes gyuynge debora barak vyctory • ▪ capi v debora barak son abinoam sange day saynge prayse ye lorde ❀ auengynge israel people became wyllynge heare ye kynges herken ye prynces euen wyll synge vnto lorde wyl prayse lorde god israel lorde deut iiii b thou wentest seir yu departedst felde edom earth trembled heuens rayned cloudes also dropped water psal 97 • mountaynes melted lorde euen dyd sinay lorde god israel dayes iudi iii samgar son anath dayes iudi 〈◊〉 • iael ☞ hygh wayes vnoccupyed runner pathes walked thorowe bywayes enhabiters townes gone gone israell vntyll debora came vp came vp mother israel ☞ chose newe goddes enemye gate shylde spere sene among xl israel herte loueth gouernours israel wyllyng amonge people prayse ye lorde speake ye ryde fayre ass syt vppermost iudgement walke wayes cryenge archer amonge drawer water shall speake ☞ ryghtousnes lorde rightousnes vnfenced place israel thē shal people lord go downe gate debora vp got vp syng songe iudi 〈◊〉 aryse barak ☞ leade captiuite captyue thou sonne abinoam shall remayne haue dominion proudest people iabin lorde shall sake haue dominion ouer myghtie ☞ iudi▪ 〈◊〉 ephraim rote agaynst amalecke ben iamin among thy people▪ machir came ruler zabulon gouerne pen wryter isachar prynces debora isachar also barak sente theyr f • te valey departynge away ruben great men wyse herte abodest thou amonge shepe foldes heare bleatynges flockes seperate thy selfe awaye great men wyse herte gilead also abode beyonde iordane dothe dan remayne shyppes aser contynued see shore taryed decayed place people zabulon haue ieoperde theyr lyues euen vnto death lyke dyd nephthali hygh place felde kynges came fought fought kyngꝭ canaan thamah water megiddo wan money fought heuen euen sterres theyr course fought agaynst sisara ryuer cyson remoued auncient ryuer ryuer cyson soule shall treade hym downe myghtely horse hoofes smytten asunder meanes praunsinges theyr myghtye men made curse ye citye meros sayd angel lorde curse enhabitours therof bycause came ☞ helpe lorde helpe lorde myghtye iael wyfe haber kenyte shalbe blessed aboue woman blessed shall aboue woman tent iudi iiii c asked water gaue hym mylke brought forth butter lordly dysshe iudi iiii put hande nayle ryght hand smythes hammer hammer smote sisera smote head wounded hym pearsed temple bowed hym downe feete fell downe lay styll feete bowed hym downe fell sonke downe laye styll desolate mother sisera loked wyndowe cryed thorowe lattesse charet longe comynge cary wheles carte wyse ladyes answered yea owne wordes answered selfe surely haue founde deuyde spoyles euery mā hath damsel two sisera hath pray dyuerse coloured garmentes euen pray rayment dyed sondry coloures made nedle worke rayment dyuers coloures nedle worke mete cheyfe distributyng spoyles peryshe thy • e enemyes lorde loue hym let sonne ryseth myght lande rest fourtye yeres ¶ israell oppressed madianites gedeon sent god theyr delpue •• r capi vi chyldren israell iosua 4 • cōmytted wyckednesse syght lorde lorde delyuered handes madiā seuen yeres hand madian preuayled agaynst israell bycause madianites chyldren israell made dennes mountaynes caues strong holdes israel sowen madianites amalechites east countrey came vp togyther agaynst pytched theyr tentes agaynst▪ destroyed encrese earth euen tyl thou come vnto azah lefte sustenaūce israel neyther shepe ore asse went vp theyr cattel came theyr tentꝭ multitude greshoppers also theyr camel without nombre entred lande destroy israel excedyngly impoueryshed sight madianites cryed vnto lorde chyldren israel cryed vnto lorde bycause madiante▪ lorde sent vnto prophet whiche sayde vnto thus sayth lorde god israell fet egypt brought house bondage ryd hande egyptian hande al oppressed cast gaue theyr lande sayd vnto lorde god • • 7 • iere • • feare goddes amorites whose lande dwell haue obeyed voyce angell lorde came sat vnder oke whiche ephrah perteyned vnto ioas father ezerites sonne gedeon pressed wheate eares presse hyde madianites angel lorde appeared vnto hym sayde lorde thou myghtye man warre gedeon answered hym oh lorde yf lorde v al come vpon v yea myracles whiche father tolde v sayd▪ dyd lorde brynge v egypte nowe lorde hath forsaken v delyuered v handes madianites lorde loked vpō hym sayde go hence thy myght thou shalte delyuer israell handes madianites haue sent answered hym oh lorde wherwith shall saue israell beholde kynred poore manasses lytell father house lorde sayd vnto hym wyll thou shalte smyte madianites one man answered hym oh yf haue foūde grace thy syght shewe sygne thou talkest departe hence vntyll come agayne vnto tyll bryng myne offrynge haue set sayd wyll cary vntyl thou come agayne gedeon wente made redye kydde swete cake epha • floure put flesshe basket put broth pot brought vnto hym vnder oke presented angell god sayd vnto hym take flesshe swete cake lay vpon rocke powre broth dyd angel lorde put forth ende staffe helde hande touched flesshe swete cake 3 reg 18 f arose fyre rocke consumed flesshe swete cake angel lorde vanysshed syght gedeon perceyued angel lorde sayd ala lorde god exodi 33 iudi xiii haue therfore sene angel lorde face face shulde dye lorde sayd vnto hym peace vnto feare thou shalte dye gedeon made aulter vnto lorde called lorde peace vnto day yet ephrath perteyneth vnto father ezerites fortuned nyght lord sayd vnto hym take yonge bullocke thy father droue another vii yeres olde destroy aulter baal thy father hath cut downe groue make aulter vnto lorde thy god vpon top rocke conuenient place take seconde bullocke offre burntsacrifice vpō wod groue whiche thou shalte cut downe gedeon toke ten men seruauntes dyd lorde bad hym bycause durst day feare father houshold men citye dyd nyght men citye vp earlye mornyng beholde aulter baal broken groue cut downe seconde bullocke offered vpō aulter made sayde one another hathe done thynge enquyred asked sayde gedeon sonne ioas hathe done thynge men citye sayd vnto ioas bryng thy sonne may dye bycause hath destroyed aulter baal cut downe groue ioas sayde vnto stode hym wyll ye entreate baal wyll ye defēders ☞ hath medled hym let hym dye mornynge god let hym auenged hym caste downe aulter daye gedeon called ☞ ierobaal bycause father sayd let baal auenged hym hath broken downe aulter madianites therfore amalekites east gathered togyther went pytched valey izreel spirite lorde came vpō gedeon nume x blewe trompet called iudi viii • abiezar folowe hym sent messenger thorout al manasses called also dyd folowe hym sent messenger vnto aser zabulon nephthalim came mete hym gedeon sayd vnto god yf thou wylt saue israel hande thou hast sayde beholde wyll put fleece wolle thresshynge place yf dewe come fleece drye vpon earthe besyde shall sure thou wylte saue israel hande thou saydest came passe rose vp early morow thrust fleece togyther wrong dewe therout fylled bowle water gedeon sayde agayne vnto god angrye gene 〈◊〉 • speake wyll proue agayne fleece let drye onely vpon fleece dew vpon grounde god dyd nyght drye vpon fleece dew grounde ¶ gedeon iii hundred men ouercōmeth madianites oreb zeb sleyne capi vii iudi • • ierobaal otherwyse called gedeon people arose vp early pytched besyde well harad hooste madianites north syde rocke boweth towarde valey lorde sayd vnto gedeon people many gyue madianites theyr handes leest israell make theyr vaunte agaynst saye myne owne hande hath saued nowe therfore make proclamacyon eares people say deui 〈◊〉 •• • yf man drede afrayde let hym returne get soone mount gilead departed returned people xxii thousande abode ten lorde sayd vnto gedeon people yet many bryng downe vnto water wyll trye vnto saye vnto shall go shal go soeuer say vnto shall go shall go broughte downe people vnto water lorde sayd vnto gedeon many lape water theyr tongꝭ dog doth put selues knele downe vpon theyr knee drynke nombre put theyr handꝭ theyr mouthes laped thre hundred men remenaunt people kneled downe vpon theyr knee drynke water lorde sayde vnto gedeon iii hundred men laped water wyll saue delyuer medianytes thyn hande let al people go euery man vnto place therfore people toke vyrtayles theyr trompettes sent rest israel euery man vnto tent cōforted thre hundred hym hoost madian beneth hym valeye fortuned nyght lorde sayde vnto hym aryse get downe vnto hoost haue delyuered thyne hande yf thou feare go downe go thou pharah thy lad downe hoost thou shalte herken say shall thyne handes stronge goo downe vnto hoost went downe pharah ladde euen harde vnto men armes hoost madianytes amalekytes al east laye alonge valey lyke multytude greshoppers theyr camelles withoute nombre euen sande see syde multytude gedeon come beholde mā tolde dreame vnto neyghbour sayde beholde dreamed dreame thought loofe barlye breade tombled hoost madiā came vnto tent smote fel ouerturned tent laye alonge felowe answered sayde nothynge el saue swerde gedeon sonne ioas man israell hande hath god deliuered madian hoost gedeon herde tellynge dreame ☞ interpretacyon worshypped returned vnto hoost israell sayde lorde hath delyuered youre hande hooste madian deuyded thre hundred men thre companyes gaue euerye man trompet hande emptye pytcher lampes therin sayd vnto loke lykewyse come syde hooste euen blowe trompet blawe ye trompettes also euery syde hoost say swerde lorde gedeon gedeon thre hundren men hym came vnto syde hoost begynnynge mydle watch raysed vp watche men blewe theyr trompettes brake pytchers theyr handes thre companyes blewe trom pettes brake pytchers helde lampes theyr lefte handes trompettes theyr ryght blowe withall cryed swerde lorde gedeon stode styll euery man place rounde aboute hoost wtin hoost ran cryed fled thre hundred blew trompettes lorde set regū 14 • 11 pa xx • euery mannes swerde vpon neyghbour thorowout hoost hoost sted bethsitah zererath edge playne maholah vnto tabath men israel beyng gathered togither tribe nephthalim aser manasses folowed madianites gedeon sent messenger vnto moūt ephraim sayng come downe agaynst madianites take water vnto bethbarath iordan al men ephraim gathered togyther toke water vnto bethbarath iordan toke two captaynes madianites oreb zeb slewe oreb vpō rocke oreb zeb presse zeb folowed madiā brought heades oreb zeb gedeon syde iordan ¶ ephraim maketh insurreciyon agaynst gedeon soon • acifyed capi viii mē ephraim sayd vnto hym haste thou serued v thus yu calledst v thou wentest fyght madianites chode hym good ❀ almost done violence sayd vnto dede haue done lyke vnto youres ☞ clustre ephraim better wyne heruest abiezer god hathe delyucred handes lordes madian oreb zeb able lyke haue done theyr spirites abated hym sayd gedeon came iordā passe ouer thre hundred men hym faynt yet folowed chace sayd vnto men socoth gyue praye cake breade vnto people folowe fayntie may folowe zebath zalmona kynges madiā lordes socoth sayd handes zebath zalmona nowe thyne handes shulde gyue breade vnto thyne armye gedeon sayde therfore lorde hath delyuered zebah zalmona myne hande wyll teare fleshe thornes wyldernesse breers went vp thence phanuel spake vnto lykewyse mē phanuel answereed hym dyd men socoth sayd also vnto men phanuel come agayne peace wyl breake downe towre zebah zalmona carkar theyr hoostes wt vpon xv thousande men whiche lefte al hoostes east sleyne hundred twentye thousande men drewe swerdes gedeon wente thorowe dwelte tabernacle east syde nebah iebahah smote hoost hoost dyd cast percyls zebah zalmona fled folowed toke two kynges madian zebah zalmona dyscomforted hoost gedeon sonne ioas returned battayle sonne dowe caught lad men socoth enquyred hym wrote hym lordes elder socoth lxxvii men came vnto men socoth sayde beholde haue zebah zalmona whiche ye dyd cast teethe sayenge handes zebah zalmona redy thyne hande shulde gyue breade vnto thy faynty men toke elder citie thornes wyldernes breers made men socoth fele brake downe towre 3 reg 12 f phanuel slewe men citye sayd vnto zebah zalmona maner men ye slew thabor answered lyenesse one euen fassion chyldren kyng sayde brother euen mother chyldrē truely lorde lyueth yf ye saued theyr lyues wold sley sayd vnto iether eldest son vp slee lad drewe swerde ☞ feared bycause yet yonge zabah zalmona sayd ryse thou fal vpō v man strength gedeon arose slewe zabah zalmona toke awaye ornamentes theyr camel neckes mē israell sayd vnto gedeō reygne thou ouer v thou thy sonne thy sonnes sonne thou hast delyuered v hand madiā gedeon sayd vnto wyll reygne ouer neyther shall chylde reygne ouer lorde shall reygne ouer agayne gedeon sayde vnto wold desyre certayn request euen ye wolde gyue euerye man exo vi 3 •• earynges pray golden earyngꝭ bycause ismaelites answered wyll gyue spred mantel dyd cast therin euery mā earyngꝭ praye weyght golden earynges requyred thousande seuen hundred sycles golde besyde cheynes ☞ pomaunders purple rayment kynges madiā besyde cheynes aboute theyr camel neckes gedeon made ☞ ephod therof put citye ephrah israell wente ezech 〈◊〉 xx • hoorynge whiche thyng became ruyne vnto gedeon house thus madian brought lowe chyldren israell lyfte vp theyr heades countrey quyetnesse fourtye yeres dayes gedeon ierobaall sonne ioas wente dwelte owne house gedeon 〈…〉 lxx sonnes body begotten many wyues concubine sichem bare hym son also whose name called abimelech gedeon sonne ioas dyed good age buryed sepulchre ioas father euen ephrah perteyned vnto father ezrites fortuned soone gedeō dead chyldren israel turned away went hoorynge baalim made couenaūt baall theyr god chyldren israell thought lorde theyr god delyuered handes theyr enemyes euery syde neyther shewed mercy house ierobaall otherwyse called gedeon accordynge goodnesse whiche shewed vnto israell ¶ abimelech made kynge capi ix abimelech sonne ierobaall went sichem vnto mother brother cōmoned mother father kynred sayenge saye pray eares enhabytours sichem whyther better al sonnes ierobaall whiche lxx person reygne ouer eyther one reigne ouer remēber bone flesshe mother brother spake hym audience men sichem al wordes theyr hertes moued folowe abimelech sayd brother gaue hym lxx peces syluer temple baal berith wherewith abimelech hyred vayne lyght persones whiche went hym wente vnto father house ephrah ii pa xxi slewe brethrē sonnes ierobaal euen lxx persones ❀ one stone notwithstādyng yet ioatham yongest sonne ierobaal escaped hyd hym selfe men sichem gathered togyther al house mello came made abimelech kyng playne great stone sichem tolde ioatham wente stode top mount garizim lyfte vp voyce cryed sayd vnto herken vnto ye men sychem god may herken vnto • eid 4 b tree went forth anoynt kyng ouer sayde vnto olyue tree reygne thou ouer v olyue tree sayd vnto shuld leaue fatnesse goddes men prayse go promoted ouer tree tree sayde fygge tree come thou kynge ouer v fygge tree answered shulde forsake swetnesse good fruyte go promoted ouer tree sayde tree vnto vyne come thou kyng ouer v vyne sayde vnto shulde leaue wyne wherby chere bothe goddes mē go promoted ouer tree sayde tree vnto fyr busshe come thou reygne ouer v fyr busshe sayde vnto tree yf true ye wyll anoynte kyng ouer thē come put trust vnder shadow fyre come fyr busshe waste cedre tree libanon nowe therfore yf ye truely vncorruptly make abimelech kynge yf ye haue delte well ierobaal house haue done vnto hym accordynge deseruyng handes iudge ye euen father fought aduentured lyfe ryd hande madian ye rysen vp agayst father house daye haue sleyne chyldren euen lxx persones one stone haue made abimelech sonne mayde seruaunt kynge ouer men sichem bycause brother yf ye haue delte truely purely ierobaal house daye reioyse ye abimelech let hym reioyse yf ye haue delte truely pray god fyre may come abimelech consume men sichem house mello maye come fyre among men sichem house mello consume abimelech ioatham ran away fled went beer dwelt feare abimelech brother abimelech reygned thre yere god sent hate bytwene abimelech men sichem citezens sichem rayled vpon abimelech wysshed wyckednes done lxx sonnes ierobaal myght come hym layde blood vnto abimelech theyr brother slewe vnto men sichem whiche ayded hym kyllyng brother citezens sichem set men lay awayte hym toppe mountaynes whiche men ❀ vvhyle taryed co •••• robbed came alonge way tolde abimelech gaal sonne abed came brother gat sichem men sichem put theyr cōfidence hym went feldes gathered theyr grape trode made mery went house theyr goddes dyd eate drynke cursed abimelech gaal sonne abed sayde abimelech sichem shulde serue hym sonne ierobaal zebul offycer serue suche come gene 34 • hemor father sichem reason shulde serue hym wolde god people vnder hande wolde take abimelech way spake agaynst abimelech make thyne hoost greater go zebull ruler citye herde wordes gaal son abed wrothe sent messenger vnto abimelech pryuely sayenge beholde gaal sonne abed brother come sichem beholde set citye agaynst nowe therfore vp nyght thou people laye wayte felde aryse earlye mornynge soone sonne vp fall vpon citye yf people hym come agaynst hym thy handes shall able abimelech rose vp people hym nyght layde awayte agaynst sichem foure companyes gaal sonne abed wente stode entrynge gate citie abimelech rose vp folke hym frome laynge awayte gaal saw people sayd zebul beholde come people downe top mountaynes zebul sayde vnto hym shadowe hylles seme men vnto the❀ errour arte thou deceyued gaall answered agayne sayde se come folke downe myddle lande another company come alonge playne charmer thē sayd zebul vnto hym nowe thy mouth sayde felowe abimelech shulde serue hym people thou hast despysed go nowe fyght gaal went citizen sichem fought abimelech abimelech chased hym fled hym ❀ droue hym citye many ouer throwen woūded euen vnto entryng gate abimelech dwelte arumah zebul thrust gaal brother shulde dwell sichem ❀ suffered tarye thenin morowe happened people went felde told abimelech toke people deuided thre compan • e layde awayte feldes loked beholde people come citye ran vpon smote abimelech companyes hym reached farther stode entrynge gate citie two companyes ran vpon people feldes slewe abimelech fought agaynst citie al day toke slewe people therin destroyed citie sowed salte thorowe men towre sichē herd entred strong holde house theyr god baal berith ❀ vvhere made bonde vvith hym therof dyd place take name vvhich place vvas excedynge stronge tolde abimelech men towre sichem gathered togyther abimelech gat hym mount zelmon bothe people hym toke ax hym cut downe bownes tree toke bare shoulder sayde vnto folke hym iudi vii • ye haue sene spede selues lykewyse haue done men amonge people cut downe bowes folowed abimelech put holde set holde fyre ❀ vvith smoke fyre al men towre sichem sleyne vpon thousande men woman went abimelech thebez seyged toke strong towre within citye thyther ran men woman al cheyfe citie shut got vp ❀ bulvvorkes toppe towre abimelech came vnto towre fought agaynst went harde vnto dore towre set fyre certayne woman • 〈…〉 cast pece mylstone vpon head brake brayne pan abimelech called hastely vnto yonge man bare harnesse sayde vnto hym • 〈…〉 • pe •• •• drawe thy swerde sley men say woman slewe hym lad thrust hym thorow dyed men israel sawe abimelech deade departed euery man vnto owne house thus 〈…〉 wickednesse abimelech dyd vnto father sleyenge seuentye brother therto wyckednesse men sichem dyd god brynge vpon theyr heades vpon came curse ioatham sonne ierobaal ¶ thola iair iudges israell capi x abimelech arose defende israel one thola son phuah ☞ vncles sonne man isachar dwelte samir mount ephraim iudged israel xxiii yere dyed buryed samir hym arose iair giliadite iudged israel xxii yere thyrtye sonnes 〈…〉 rode thyrtie asse coltes thyrtie city whiche called townes iair vnto day lande gilead iair dyed buryed kamon 〈…〉 chyldren israell wroughte wyckednesse yet agayne syghte lorde serued baalim astharoth goddes siria goddes sidon goddes moab goddes chyldren ammon goddes philistine forsoke lorde serued hym lorde wroth israell solde handes philistine handes chyldren ammon yere forth pylde oppressed chyldren israell xviii yere syde iordane lande amorites whiche gilead moreouer chyldren ammō went ouer iordane fyght agaynst iuda beniamin house ephraim israell sore combred chyldren israell cryed vnto lorde sayenge haue synned agaynst haue forsaken owne god haue serued baalun lorde sayde vnto chyldren israell dyd egyptian amorites chyldren ammon philistine sidonites amaleckites maonites oppresse ye cryed delyuered theyr handes ye haue forsaken serued straunge goodꝭ wherfore wyll helpe go crye vnto goddes whiche ye haue chosen deut 32 c •• e 〈◊〉 • let saue tyme tribulaciō chyldren israell sayde vnto lorde haue synned thou vnto vnto v whatsoeuer please delyuer v daye put awaye straunge goddes serued lorde soule pitye miserye israell chyldren ammon gathered togyther pytched gilead chyldren israell gathered togyther pytched mizpa lordes gilead sayde eche soeuer wyll begyn battayle agaynst chyldren ammon shall heade ouer enhabyters gilead ¶ iephthath deliuered israell ammonite capi xi one iephthah gileadite stronge man son harlot gilead begat iephthah gileads wyfe bare hym sonnes come age thrust iephthah sayde vnto hym thou shalt enheryte father house thou arte son straunge woman iephthah fled frō brother dweit lande tob gathered ydle ❀ theuysshe men iephthah went hym chaunced processe tyme chyldren ammon made war agaynst israell chyldren ammon fought thus agaynst israell elder gilead went fetche iephthah lande tob ❀ helpe sayde vnto hym come oure captayne may fyght chyldren ammon iephthah answered elder gilead dyd ye hate expell father house happeneth come vnto nowe tyme youre tribulacyon elder gilead sayd vnto iephthah therfore turne agayn yu mayst go v fyght agaynst chyldren ammon heade ouer enhabytours gilead iephthah sayde vnto elder gilead yf ye brynge home agayn fyght chyldren ammō yf lord delyuer shall heade elder gilead sayde iephthah lorde wytnesse bytwene v yf accordyng thy wordes iephthah went elder gilead people made hym heade ruler ouer iephthah rehearsed al wordes lorde ☞ mizpa iephthah sent messenger vnto kynge chyldren ammon sayenge▪ hast thou thou arte come agaynst fyght lande kynge chyldren ammon answered vnto messenger iephthah bycause israell toke away lande came egypt euen frō arnon vnto iabo • • vnto iordan therfore restore • andes agayne wt fayre meanes iephthah sent messenger agayn vnto kyng chyldren ammon sayde vnto hym thus sayeth iephthah ••• 〈◊〉 • israel toke away lande moa • ▪ lande chyldren ammō israell came egypt walked thorow wyldernesse euen vnto red see came cades num • 〈◊〉 • sent messenger vnto kynge edō sayenge let praye go thorowe thy lande kyng edō wolde agre therto lyke maner sent vnto kynge moab wolde consent israel abode styll cades went alonge thorow wyldernesse cō passed lande edō lande moab came alonge east syde land moab pytched syde arnon wolde come within cooste moab nume 〈◊〉 • arnon vttermoost border moab israell deute ii • ▪ sent messenger vnto sehon kynge amorytes kynge hesbon sayde vnto hym let v passe thorowe thy lande vnto owne countrey sehō cōsented israell shulde go thorowe coost gathered people togyther pytehed iaza • fought israell lorde god israell delyuered sehon folke handes israell israell smote conquered lande amorites enhabyters sayde countrey cōquered coostes amorites arnon vnto iaboke wyldernesse vnto iordane nowe seenge lorde god israell hath cast amorites people israell shuldest yu possesse lande naye people camo thy god dryueth lande possesse thou euen whatsoeuer naciō lorde god expelleth lande ought enioye nume 22 deut 23 art thou better balack sonne zephor kynge moab dyd • tyue israell fyght agaynst whyle israell dwelte hesbon townes atoer townes cityes longe coostes arnō thre hundred yeares dydest y• recouer place wherfore haue synned agaynst thou doest wronge war agaynst lorde therfore iudge daye bytwene chyldren israell chyldren ammō howbeit kynge chyldren ammon herkened vnto wordes iephthah sent hym spiryte lorde came vpon iephthah passed ouer gilead manasses came mazphah lyeth gilead thence vnto chyldren ammon iephthah vowed vowe vnto lorde sayde nume vi yf thou shalte delyuer chyldren ammon handes thyng cōmeth dores house agaynst come home peace chyldren ammon shall lordes ☞ wyll offre vp burtofferynge iephthah went vnto chyldren ammō fyght lorde delyuered handes smote atoer tyll thou come menith euen xx cityes forth playne vineyerdes excedynge greate slaughter thus chyldren ammon brought vnder chyldren israel whē iephthah came mazphah vnto house se doughter came agaynste hym tymberels daunses whiche onely chylde besyde neyther son doughter saw rent clothes sayde ala doughter ❀ thou hast brought lowe arte one trouble haue opened mouth vnto lorde go backe sayd vnto hym father yf yu haue opened thy mouth vnto lorde wt accordynge proceded thy mouth moche lorde hath aduenged ❀ gyuen victory thyne enemyes chyldren ammon sayd vnto father thus moche let alone ii monethes may ☞ go downe mountaynes bewayle virgynyte felowes sayd go sent awaye two monethes went wt cōpanions lamented mayden heade vpon mountaynes ende two monethes turned agayne vnto father whiche ☞ dyd accordynge vowe whiche vowed knowen man grewe custome israell dougters israel came yere yere lament doughter iephthah gileadite foure dayes yeare ¶ battayle iephthah agaynste ephraim the▪ death iephthah succedeth elon elon abdon capi xii men ephraim gathered selues togyther went northwarde sayde vnto iephthah 〈…〉 wherfore wentest thou fyght chyldren ammon dydest call v go wyll therfore burne thyne house vpon fyre iephthah sayde vnto people great stryfe chyldren ammon called ye delyuered theyr handes sawe ye delyuered iob 〈◊〉 psal ••• ☞ put lyfe handes went vpon chyldren ammon lorde delyuered handes wherfore ye come vpon fyght iephthah therfore gathered togyther men gilead fought wt ephraites men gilead smote ephraites bycause sayde ye gileadites renegates ephraim amonge ephraites manassites moreouer men gilead toke passage iordane ephraites whē ephraitꝭ escaped sayde let v go ouer men gilead sayd vnto arte thou ephraite sayd nay sayd vn saye ☞ schibboleth ❀ vvhich interpretacyon eare corne sayde sibboleth manoah made intercession lorde sayd pray lorde let man god whiche thou sendest come vnto v teache v shall vnto lad borne god herde voyce manoah angell god came agayne vnto wyfe sat feld manoah husdand wt wyfe made hast ran shewed husbande sayd vnto hym beholde man appeared vnto came vnto day manoah arose went wyfe came man sayde vnto hym arte thou man spakest vnto wyfe sayde manoah sayde nowe thy sayenge come passe shall maner chylde shall angel lorde sayde vnto manoah thy wyfe must absteyne al sayd vnto may eate nothynge cōmeth vyne • tee drynke wyne strong drynke eate vncleane thynge must hym gene 〈◊〉 • askest thou name ☞ secrete manoah toke kyd meate offerynge offered vpon rocke vnto lorde angell dyd wonderouslye manoah wyfe lokyng vpon whē flame came vp warde heuen aulter angel lorde ascended vp flame aulter manoah wyfe loked vpon fell flat theyr face vnto groūde angell lorde dyd appeare vnto manoah wyfe manoah knewe angell lorde sayd vnto wyfe exodi 3 • iudi 〈◊〉 • shall
