wyfe father mother sayde vnto hym deut vii neuer woman amonge doughters thy brother amonge people thou must go take wyfe vncircumcised philistine samson sayd vnto father gyue womā pleaseth wel father mother wyst lordes doynge sought occasyon agaynste philistine tyme philistine reygned ouer israell went samson father mother downe thamnath came vineyeardes thamnath beholde yonge ❀ vvod lyon roored vpon hym spiryte lorde came vpon hym tare hym wolde haue rent kyd yet nothynge hande neyther tolde father mother done went downe talked woman▪ whiche semed well fauoured syght samson within shorte space went thyther agayne take wyfe turned waye se carkas lyon beholde swarme bee hony carkas lyon toke honye handes went eatynge came father mother gaue also dyd eat tolde taken honye carkas lyon father came vnto woman samson made feast vsed yonge men ❀ ❀ cy • esens place sawe hym brought xxx companion hym samson sayde vnto wyll put forth ryddle vnto yf ye declare within seuen dayes feast fynde oute wyll gyue thirtye shertes xxx chaung garmentes yf ye declare shall ye gyue thyrtye shertes thyrtye chaunge garmentes answered put forth ryddle may heare said vnto eater came meate stronge came swetnesse coulde thre dayes expounde ryddle seuenth daye come sayde vnto samson wyfe flater thyne husband ❀ persvvade hym maye declare v ryddle lest burne thy father house fyre▪ haue ye called v hyther make v beggers samson wyfe wepte hym ❀ complayned sayde surely thou hatest louest thou hast put forth ryddle vnto chyldren folke hast tolde sayde vnto beholde haue tolde father mother shall tell samson wyfe wepte hym seuen dayes whyle feaste lasted seuenth daye tolde bycause laye sore vpon hym tolde chyldren folke men ritye sayde vnto hym seuenth daye sonne went downe swetter honye stronger lyon sayd vnto yf ye ☞ plowed calfe ye founde ryddle went downe askalon slewe thyrtye men spoyled gaue chaunge garmentes vnto whiche expounded ryddle wrothe went vp father house sāsons wyfe gyuen one companyons taken vnto hym ¶ samson ty • th fyrebrandes fore tayles • awe bone asse hylleth thousande men great iaw god gyueth hym water capi xv chaūced within whyle euen tyme wheat heruest samson visyted wyfe kyd sayng wyll go wyfe chambre father wolde suffre hym go in▪ father sayde thought thou haddest hated therfore gaue vnto one thy cōpanyons youger syster fayrer take steade samson sayd vnto blamelesse philistine therfore wyll displeasure samson went caught thre hundred fox toke fyrebrandes fastened tayle tayle put fyrebrand myddes bytwene two tayles set brandes fyre sent ❀ myght run abrode vvhiche vvent immediatly standynge corne philistine burnt vp bothe reaped corne also standynge vineyeardes olyues philistine sayde hath done tolde samson sonne lawe thamnite bycause taken wyfe gyuen companyon philistine came vp burnt father fyre samson sayde vnto though ye haue done yet wyll aduenged wyll crase ❀ smote leg thygh myghtye plage went dwelte caue rocke etam philistine came vp pytched iuda laye ❀ place vvas aftervvarde called lehi ❀that iavve bone vvhere theyr hoost vvas scatered abrode men iuda sayde ye come vp vnto v answered bynde samson come vp hym hath done v thre thousand men iuda went downe caue rocke etā sayde samson wotest thou philistine ruler ouer v wherfore hast thou done thus vnto v answered •••••• 24 • iudi b dyd vnto haue done vnto sayd vnto hym agayne come downe bynde delyuer hande philistine samson sayd vnto sweare vnto ❀ promyse ye shall fall vpon selues answered hym sayenge wyll bynde delyuer vnto theyr handes wyll dot kyll bounde hym two newe cordes brought hym rocke came lehi philistine showted agaynst hym spiryte lorde came vpon hym cordes vpon armes became flax burnt fyre bandꝭ lowsed handes founde rotten iawbone asse put forth hande caught slewe thousande men therwith samson sayde iawe asse haue made heapes iawe asse haue sleyne thousande men lefte speakynge cast away iawe bone hande called place ☞ ramath lehi ❀ interpretacyon lyftynge vp iavve bone sore thyrst called lorde sayde thou hast gyuen greate victorye hande thy seruaūt nowe must dye thyrst fall handes vncircumsised god brake greate iawe came water therout dronke spiryte came agayne refresshed wherfore name therof called vnto daye well caller whiche came iawe iudged israell dayes philistine twentye yeares ¶ samson lyfteth vp gate • • deceyued dalila pulleth downe house vpon phylystynes dyeth capi xvi went samson otherwyse called ga • azath sawe harlot went vnto tolde azathites sayng samson come hyther went aboute layde awayt hym nyght gate citye styll nyght sayenge mornyng daye shall kyl hym samson toke rest tyl mydnyght arose mydnyght toke dores gate citye two syde postes rent barre put vpon shoulder caryed vp toppe hyll hebron fortuned ryuer sorek loued womā called dalila vnto whome came lordes philistine sayde vnto perswade hym se wherin great strength lyeth meane may ouercome hym may bynde hym brynge vnder euery one v shall gyue eleuen hundred syluerlynges dalila sayde samsom oh tell thy great strength lyeth howe thou myghtest bounde brought vnder samson answeeed vnto bynde seuen grene withe neuer dryed shall weake men lordes philistine brought seue wythes yet grene neuer dryed bounde hym therwith▪ notwithstandynge men lyenge wayte chambre sayd vnto hym philistine vpon samson immediately brake cordes strynge towe ❀ tvvyned breaketh feleth fyre strength knowen dalila sayde vnto samson se thou hast mocked tolde lye nowe therfore tell wherwith thou myghtest bounde answered yf bynde newe rope neuer occupyed shall weake another man dalila therfore toke newe rope bounde hym therwith sayde vnto hym philistine vpon samson lyers wayte chambre brake armes ben threde dalila sayde vnto samsom •• therto thou hast begyled tolde lye yet tell howe y• myghtest bounde sayde vnto thou plattedst vii▪ locke heade heere lace fastened nayle sayde vnto hym philistine vpō samson awaked slepe plucked awaye nayle plattynge heere lace sayde vnto hym agayne howe canst thou saye thou louest thyne herte behold thou hast mocked thre tymes hast tolde wherin thy greate strength lyeth laye vpon hym wordes contynually vexynge hym soule encombred euen vnto death tolde herte sayde vnto nume vi iudi xiii neuer came raser vpon myne heade haue ben absteyner ❀ say consecrate vnto god euen mother wombe therfore shauen strength wyl go shall waxe weake lyke men dalila sawe tolde herte sent called lordes philistine sayenge come vp yet hath shewed herte lordes philistine came vp vnto brought money theyr handes made hym slepe vpon knee ❀ laye heade dovvne lappe sent man dyd shaue seuen locke heade began vexe hym strength gone hym sayd philistine vpon samson awoke slepe sayde wyll go tymes shake selfe wyst lorde departed hym philistynes toke hym put eye brougth hym downe • aza azath boūde hym two fetter brasse ☞ dyd grynde pryson house howbeit heere heade began growe agayne shauen lordes philistine gathered togyther offre solempne offerynge vnto dagon theyr god reioyse sayde oure god hath deleuered samson oure enemye oure handꝭ people sawe hym praysed theyr god sayde god hath delyuered handes enemy distroyer oure countrey whiche slewe many v theyr hertes merye fortuned sayd sende sā son maye make v laugh fet samson prysonhouse played set hym bytwene pyllers samson sayde vnto lad led hym hand set maye touche pyllers house stande vpon maye leane house full men woman lordes philistine vpon roofe thre thousande men woman behelde whyle samson played samson called vnto lorde sayde lorde god thynke vpon strengthen tyme onely▪ god maye aduenged philistine two eye samson cought two myddle pyllers house stode whiche borne vp one ryght hande lefte sayde soule shall dye philistine bowed myght house fell vpon lordes vpon people therin deade slew death mo whiche slew lyfe brother al house father came downe toke hym vp brought hym buryed hym bytwene zarah esthaoll buryenge place manoah father iudged israell twentye yeare ¶ micah whose mother made hym ydoll syluer capi xvii man mounte ephraim named micah sayde vnto mother eleuen hundred syluerlynges taken aboute thou cursedst spakest myne eares behold syluer toke awaye mother sayde blessed thou son lorde restored eleuen hundred syluerlynges mother agayne mother sayde vowed syluer vnto lorde myne hande son thou shuldest make grauen ymage ymage metall nowe therfore wyl gyue agayne restored money agayne vnto mother mother toke two hundred syluerlyngꝭ gaue goldsmyth made therof grauen ymage ymage metall house micah man micah temple goddes made ephod theraphim ❀ say garment preest ydols fylled hande one sonnes whiche became preest • di 〈◊〉 • 〈◊〉 ▪ • dayes kynge israell euery man dyd whiche good owne eye yonge man bethleem iuda kynred iuda yonge man leuite soiourned man departed citye bethleem iuda go dwell coulde fynde conuenyent place came mounte ephraim house micah iourneyed micah sayde vnto hym whence cōmest thou leuite answered hym bethleem iuda go dwel may fynde place ❀ vvhere may spye profyt micah sayde agayne vnto hym dwell vnto father preest wyll gyue ten syluerlynges yeare two garmentes thy meate drynke leuite content dwel man vnto hym one owne sonnes micah consecrated hande leuyte yonge man became preest house micah sayde micah nowe sure lorde wyll good vnto seynge haue leuyte preest ¶ chyldren dan take god preest micah away destroy lais buylde agayne capi xviii dayes iudi 17 b kynge israell dayes trybe dan sought enherytaunce dwell io • 19 b vnto tyme ☞ fell none enherytaunce vnto amonge trybe israell chyldren dan sent theyr kynred fyue actyue men feates warre theyr coostes euen zarah esthaoll vewe lande searche lande whiche came mount ephraim euen house micah lodged house micah knewe voyce yonge man leuyte turned thyther sayde vnto hym brought hyther makest thou place hast thou answered thus thus dealeth micah hath hyred become preest sayd vnto hym ☞ agayne aske councell nowe god maye knowe whyther waye whiche go shalbe prosperous preest layd vnto go peace lorde gydeth waye whiche ye go fyue men departed came lais sawe people therin howe dwelte carelesse maner sidon styll without castynge peryls man made trouble lande vsurped dominyon far sidon busynesse men came vnto theyr brother zarah esthaoll theyr brother sayde vnto haue ye done answered aryse maye go vp agaynst num 13 • haue sene lande surely verye good one ye syt styll slouthfull departe come conquere lande ❀ shal laboure yf ye wyll go ye shall come vnto people casteth peryls large countrey whiche god hath gyuen youre handes also place whiche doth lacke nothynge worlde departed thence kynred dannitꝭ euen zarah esthaoll syre hundred men appoynted instrumentes warre went vp pytched kariath iarim whiche iuda wherfore called place hooste dan vnto day backe syde kariath iarim went thence vnto mount ephraim came house micah answered fyue men went spye countrey lais sayd vnto theyr brother wote ye house ephod ☞ theraphim grauen image image metall nowe therfore consydre ye haue turned thyther warde came house yonge man leuyte euen vnto house micah saluted hym peasably syxe hundred men g • rden wepons • warre whiche chyldren dan stode enterynge gate fyue men went spye lande went thyther toke carued image ephod theraphim image metall preest stode enteryng gate sixe hundred men armed vnto battayle whyle went micah house fet carued image ephod theraphim ymage metal sayd preest vnto ye answered hym holde thy peace ☞ lay thyne hande vpon thy mouth come v father preest better preest vnto house one man preest vnto trybe kynred israell preest glad toke ephod theraphim grauen image went people turned departed put chyldren cattell theyr substaunce whē good way house micah men house micah house made outcrye folowed chyldren dan called vnto turned theyr face sayde vnto micah ayleth thou makest crye sayde ye haue taken awaye goddes whiche made also preest go wayes haue howe say ye vnto ayleth chyldren dan sayde vnto hym let thy voyce herde among v leest angrye felowes run vpon thou lose thy lyfe lyues thyne house holde chyldren dan wente theyr wayes micah sawe stronge hym turned went backe vnto house agayne toke thynges micah made preest came vnto lais euen vnto people rest without mystrust smote edge swerde burnt citye fyre man help bycause lais far sidon medelynge man citye stode valeye lyeth hygh bethrehob buylte citye dwelt therin •• sus 19 • called dan name dan theyr father whiche borne vnto israel howbeit dede name citye lay begynnynge chyldren dan set vp grauen image ionathan son gerson sonne manasses sonnes preestes trybe dan • di 1 • vntyll caryed awaye lande captyue set vp carued image micah made▪ al whyle house god silo ¶ leuyte whose wyfe vyllanously • hylled gibea capi xix chaunced dayes kynge israell certayne leuyte soiournyng syde moūte ephraim toke wyfe concubyne betheleem iuda concubyne played hoore went away hym vnto father house bethleem iuda contynued foure monethes husband arose went speake frendlye vnto brynge home agayne hauynge lad hym couple ass brought hym vnto father house father damsell sawe hym reioysed commynge father lawe damsel father kepte hym leuyte abode hym thre dayes dyd eate drynke lodged fourth daye arose earlye mornyng man stode vp departe damsel father sayde vnto son lawe comforte thyne herte morsell gene 〈◊〉 ▪ • breade go waye sat downe dyd eate drynke bothe togyther damsel father sayde vnto man content praye the▪ tary nyght▪ let thyne herte merye man stode vp departe father lawe compelled hym turne agayne tary nyght arose vp early fyfth daye departe damsel father sayde conforte thyne herte taryed vntyll mydday dyd eate togyther man arose departe concubyne lad father lawe damsel father sayde vnto hym beholde daye gothe fast awaye draweth towarde euen tary nyght least waye tarye daye thyne herte may • ye morow get earlye vpon way thou mayst get thy tent neuerthelatter man wolde tarye arose departed came far iebus whiche ierusalem two ass laden cōcubyne lad hym fast iebus daye sore spent yonge man sayde vnto mayster come praye let v turne citye iebusytes lodge nyght mayster answered hym wyll turne straunge citye chyldren israell wyll go forth gibea sayde vnto lad go forwarde shall come one place lodge nyght eyther gibea rama went forwarde vpon theyr way sonne went downe vpon fast gibea whiche belongeth ben iamin turned thyther warde go lodge nyght gibea came sat hym downe streete citye man toke lodgynge beholde came olde man worke felde euen also moūte ephraim dwelte straunger gibea men place chyldren iemini lyfte vp eye saw wayfarynge man streete citye olde man sayd whyther goest thou whence cōmest thou answered hym come bethleem iuda towarde syde mount ephraim thence went bethleem iuda go nowe house lorde man receyueth house haue strawe prauender oure ass breade wyne thy handmayde lad thy seruaunt lacke nothynge olde man sayd peace thou lackest shalte thou fynde onely abyde streete al nyght brought hym house gaue fodder vnto ass wasshed theyr feete dyd eate drynke makyng theyr hertes mery beholde men citye whiche wycked beset house rounde aboute thrust dore spake man house olde man saynge brynge forth man came thyne house may knowe hym gene 19 b man house olde mā went sayde vnto oh nay brother wyckedly seyng man come myne house vnmete thyng beholde doughter mayden mannes concubine wyll brynge nowe vnto you▪ humble semeth good vnto man abhominable thynge men wolde herken hym man toke concubyne brought vnto knew abused nyght euen vnto mornynge daye began sprynge let go came womā dawnyng day fell downe doore mannes house lorde tyll day lorde arose vp mornyng opened dores house went go way beholde woman euen concubine lay along dore house handes stretched vpon thressholde ❀ thynkynge haue ben slepe sayde vnto let v goynge answered man ❀ perceyuynge vvas deade toke vp vpō asse stode vp gat hym vnto owne home come vnto house toke knyfe caught concubine deuyded bone twelue peces sent quarter israell saw • sayde suche dede done sene synce chyldren israell came egypte vnto daye ❀ consyder matter take aduisement say myndes ¶ battayle israelyties agaynst trybe ben iamin▪ leuites wyfe kylled capi xx al chyldren israel went congregacyon gathered togyther bene one man euen dan berseba vnto lande gilead vnto lorde ☞ mizpa stode folke quarter tribe israell congregacion people god foure hūdred thousande fore men drewe swerdes chyldren ben iamin herde chyldren israel gone vp mizpa sayde oh ye chyldren israell tell v wyckednesse happened leu •• woman husbande sleyn • answered sayde came gibea ben iamin concubyne l •• go nyght men gibea rose agaynste beset house round vpon nyght thought haue sleyne concubyne haue forced deade toke concubine cut peces sent thorowout landes enheritaūce israel haue cōmytted abhominacyon follye israel beholde ye chyldren israel pondre matter gyue youre aduyse case al people arose ben one man saynge shall man v go tente neyther turne house shall wyl • gibea wyll go vp lot agaynst wyl take ten men hundred thorowout tribe israell hundred thousande thousande ten thousande fet vytayle people make maye go agaynst gibea ben iamin bycause abhominacyon haue wrought israell men israell gathered togyther agaynste citye knyt togyther bene one man tribe israel sent men thorowe tribe ben iamin sayeng iosua 2 • • wyckednesse happened amonge nowe therfore delyuer v men chyldren beliall whiche gibea maye sley put awaye euyll israell neuerthelatter chyldren ben imin wolde h • rken vnto voyce theyr brother chyldren israell gathered themselues togyther cityes vnto gibea come fyght agaynst chyldren israel chyldren ben iamin nombred tyme cityes xxvi thousande men drewe swerdes besyde enhabitours gibea werē nombred seuen hundred chosen men amonge folke seuen hundred lefte handed mē euery one coulde flyng stone heere bredth mysse chyldren israell besyde ben iamin nombred foure hundred thousande men drewe swerdes men war chyldren israel arose went vp bethel asked counsayle god shuld begyn batayle agaynst chyldren ben iamin lorde sayd iuda shall begyn chyldren israell stode vp early befeyged gibea men israel wente battayle agaynst ben iamin men israell put themselues araye fyght agaynste besyde gibea chyldrē ben iamin came gibea destroyed israelite day xxii thousande men brought earth folke chyldren israell plucked vp theyr hertes went agayne made battayle place dyd fyrste day chyldren israell wente vp wepte lorde vnto euen asked lorde sayenge shall go agayne battayle agaynst chyldren ben iamin brother lorde sayde go vp agaynst chyldrē israel came agaynst chyldren ben iamin seconde day chyldren ben iamin went agaynst gibea seconde day destroyed earth chyldren israel agayne xviii mē drewe swerdes euery man chyldren israell people went vp came vnto bethell wepte sat lorde fasted daye vnto euen offered burntofferynges peaceofferynges lorde chyldren israell asked lorde arke appoyntment god dayes ☞ phinehes sonne eleazar son aaron waytyng vpon tyme sayde shall get vp go battayle agaynst chyldren ben iamin brother shall cease lorde sayde go morowe wyl delyuer handes israel set lyers awayte rounde aboute gibea chyldren israell went vp agaynst chyldren ben iamin thyrde tyme put themselues aray agaynst gibea twyse chyldren ben iamin came agaynste people drawen away citye began smyte people deade twyse two hygh wayes whiche one gothe vp bethel gibea thorow felde vpon thyrtye men israell chyldren ben iamin sayd fallen v fyrste chyldren israel sayd let v flee plucke awaye citye vnto hygh wayes men israel arose vp theyr place put themselues araye baal thamar lyke wyse lyers wayte israell came forth theyr place euen medowes gibea came agaynst gibea ten thousande chosen mē israel sore battayle wyst greate euyll nygh lorde plaged ben iamin israel chyldren israell destroyed beniamites day xxv thousand hundred men drewe swerdes euery one chyldren ben iamin saw put worse men israell gaue rowme beniamites bycause trusted vnto lyers wayte layde besyde gibea lyers wayte hasted ran vpon gibea went smote citye edge swerde appoyntment men israel lyers wayte shulde make great smoke aryse vp citye men israell sted battayle ben iamin began smyte dead chyldren israel aboute thyrtye persones sayde put worse v fyrst battayle began aryse citye pyller smoke beniamites loked backe beholde wastynge hole citye began ascende vp heuen men israel also turned agayne mē ben iamin abasshed sawe euyll approched therfore turned theyr backes men israel vnto way leadeth wyldernesse men warre ouertoke besyde whiche came oute citye destroyed myddest thus compassed beniamites chased hym manuha ouerran gibea east syde sleyne ben iamin xviii thousande men warre turned fled towarde wyldernes vnto rocke rimmon slue way rest fyue thousande mē stycked vnto vntyll came gideom slue two thousande mē sleyne day ben iamin xxv thousand men drue swerdes whiche men warre vi hundred men turned fled wyldernesse vnto rocke rimmō abode iiii monethes men israel turned backe agayne vnto chyldren ben iamin smote edge swerde cityes bothe man beast al came hande set fyre cityes coulde come ¶ enhabiters gilead vtterly destroyed capi xxi euery man israel sware mizpa saynge shall none v gyue doughter vnto ben iamin wyfe people came bethell abode tyll euen god lyfte vp theyr voyces wepte sore sayde oh lorde god israel chaūced israell shulde day one tribe lackyng israel morowe people tose vp tyme made aulter offered tofferynges peaceofferynges chyldren israel asked amonge al tribe israel came vp congregacyon vnto lorde made greate othe concernyng hym came vp lord mizpa saynge shal surely dye chyldren israel pytie ben iamin theyr brother sayd one tribe cut israel day shal vnto remenaūt may haue wyues haue sworne lorde wyll gyue doughters wynes sayde tribe israel came vp mizpa lorde beholde came none enhabitours iabes gilead vnto hoost congregacion people vewed beholde none enhabitours iabes gilead sent thyther multitude euen xii thousande men strongest cōmaūded saynge go smyte enhabitours iabes gilead edge swerde bothe woman chyldren •• ne 31 c ye shall vtterly destroy male woman haue lyen men founde amonge enhabytours iabes gilead foure hundred damselles vyrgyns knowen man lyeng male brought vnto hoost silo whiche lande canaan hole congregation sent spake chyldren ben iamin rocke rimmon called p • aceably vnto ben iamin came agayne tyme gaue wyues saued alyue woman iabes gilead suffysed people compassyon ben iamin bycause god made gap tribe israel elder congregacyon sayde shall remenaunt get wyues seynge al wyues ben iamin destroyed sayde must enheritaunce escaped ben iamyn • tribe destroyed israel howbeit may gyue wyues doughters chyldren israell sworne sayenge cursed gyueth wyfe ben iamin sayd beholde feast lorde yerely silo north syde bethell east syde waye gothe bethell sichem south libanon therfore cōmaunded chyldren ben iamin saynge go lye wayte vyneyardes▪ ye se doughters silo come oute daunce rowe come ye vyneyardes catche euery man wyfe doughters ben iamin theyr father brother come vnto v complane wyl say vnto haue pytie v theyr sake bycause reserued eche man wyfe tyme warre ☞ neyther haue ye gyu • n vnto ye shulde synne tyme chyldren ben iamin dyd euē toke wyues accordynge nombre daunced caught wente returned vnto theyr enheritaunce repared cityes dwelte chyldren israell departed thence tyme wente euery man tribe kynred wente oute thence euery man enheritaunce •••• • • xviii • dayes kynge israell euery man dyd whiche serued ryght owne eye ¶ ende boke iudges▪ called hebrue sophism boke ruth ¶ elimelec goth wyfe chyldren lande moab capi primo fortuned ❀ dayes certayne iudge iudges iudged fell derthe lande certayn man bethleem iuda went sotourne countrey moab wyfe 〈◊〉 sonnꝭ name man elimelec name wyfe naomi name two sonnes mahlon chilion ephraites bethleem iuda came lande moab contynued elimelec naomi husbande dyed remayned two sonnes whiche toke wyues nacions moabites one name orpha others ruth dwelled aboute ten yere mahlon chilion dyed also euen bothe woman lefte desolate two sonnes husbande stode vp doughters lawe returned countrey moab herde say coūtrey moab howe lorde visited people gyuen breade wherfore departed place two doughters went theyr way returne vnto lande iuda naomi sayd vnto ii doughters lawe go returne eche vnto youre mother house lorde deale kyndly ye haue delte dead lorde gyue ye may fynde reste eyther house husbande kyssed lyfte vp theyr voyce wepte sayd vn wyll go vnto thy folke naomi sayd turne agayne doughters cause wyll ye go mo chyldren wombe husbandes turne agayne doughters go olde haue husbande yf sayd haue hope yf toke man also nyght yea though redy borne sonnes wold ye tary tyl age wolde ye long refrayne frō takynge husbandꝭ doughters greueth moche sake hand lord gone agaynst lyfte vp theyr voyces wepte agayne orpha kyssed mother lawe ruth abode styl naomi sayd se thy syster lawe gone backe agayne vnto people vnto goddꝭ returne thou ruth answered entreate leaue returne whyther thou goest wyll go also thou dwellest wyll dwell thy people shall people thy god god thou dyest wyll dye wyll buryed lorde yf ought death onely departe asondre sawe stedfastlye mynded go lefte speakynge vnto went bothe vntyll came bethleem whē come bethleem noysed thorowe citye woman sayd naomi answered call naomi ❀ say beutyfull call mara ❀ say bytter almygh tye hath made verye bytter wente ful lorde hath brought home agayn emptye call ye naomi seynge lorde hath humbled almyghtye hath brought vnto aduersyte naomi wt ruth moabitesse doughter lawe returned oute countrey moab came bethleem begynnynge barley haruest ¶ ruth gathereth corne • eldes booz capi ii naomi husbande kynsman strength myght whiche kynred elimelec named booz ruth moabitesse sayde vnto naomi let go felde gather eares corne ❀ suche reaper leaue man whose syght synde grace sayde vnto go doughter went came felde gathered reaper chaūce felde perteyned vnto booz kynred elimelec behold booz came bethleem sayd vnto reaper lorde answered hym lorde blesse sayd booz vnto yong man stode reaper whose damsell yonge man stode reaper answered sayde moabity damsell came naomi countrey moab sayde vnto v oh let lease gather reaper eares remayne came hath continued euen mornyng vnto nowe saue taryed lytell house sayde booz vnto ruth hearest thou doughter go none felde gather neyther go frō hence abyde maydens let thine eye feld reape go thou maydens haue charged yonge men shall hurte moreouer thou arte thyrst go vnto vessel drynke whiche laddes haue drawen fell face 〈◊〉 33 bowed selfe grounde sayd vnto hym howe haue founde grace thyne eye thou shuldest know seyng alyaunt booz answered sayde vnto • tolde shewed thou hast done vnto thy mother lawe synee death thyne husbande howe thou hast lefte thy father thy mother lande thou wast borne arte come vnto nacyon thou knewest tyme passed lorde quyte thy worke full rewarde gyuē lorde god israell vnder whose wynges thou arte come abyde sayde let fynde fauoure thy syght lorde thou hast conforted spoken hertely vnto thy mayde whiche yet lyke vnto one thy maydes booz sayde vnto agayne tyme refe •• yon come thou hyther eate breade dypthy sop vyneygre sat downe reaper reached 〈◊〉 v b parched corne whiche dyd eate suffysed lefte parte rysen vp gather booz cōmaūded yong men saynge let gather euen amonge heapes forbyd leaue sheues nonce let lye may gather vp ❀ vvithout shame rebuke se gathered felde vntyl euen thresshed gathered measure vpon epha ❀ thre busshels barley toke vp went citie mother lawe sene gathered plucked also gaue reserued eaten ynough mother lawe sayde vnto hast thou gathered day wroughtest thou blessed knew shewed mother lawe wrought hym sayd mannes name wt wrought daye booz naomi sayde vnto doughter lawe blessed lorde ceaseth tobi 〈◊〉 • good lyuyng deade naomi sayde agayne vnto man nygh vnto v oure nexte kynne ruth moabite sayde sayd vnto also thou shalt yonge men vntyll haue ended haruest noami answered vnto ruth doughter law best doughter thou go wt maydens fall vpon felde kepte maydens booz gather vnto ende barley haruest wheate haruest also dwelte mother lawe ¶ ruth sleepeth booz feete knowen kynswoman capi iii naomi mother lawe sayde vnto doughter shall seke rest thou mayst prosper booz kynsman whose maydens thou wast beholde wyndo ••• barley nyght threshyng flore washe thy selfe therfore anoynte put thy rayment vpon get downe barne let man knowe vutyl • e haue lefte eatynge drynkynge whē gothe slepe marke place layeth hym downe go lyfte vp clothes feete lay downe shal tel thou shalte answered her▪ thou byddest wyl wente downe vnto barne dyd accordyng mother lawe bad booz eaten dronken made hym merye gone lye downe besyde heape corne came softely lyfte vp clothes fete layde downe mydnyght man afrayde groped beholde woman lay feete sayde arte thou▪ answered ruth thyne handmayde spreade thy wynge ouer thyne handmayde thou arte nexte hynne sayde blessed thou lorde doughter thou hast shewed moore goodnesse latter ende begynnynge moche thou folowedst yonge men whyther poore ryche nowe doughter feare wyl thou requyrest citye people dothe knowe thou arte woman vertue true thy nexte kynne howe one nygher tary nyght mornynge come yf wyll marry good let hym yf wyll haue sure lorde lyueth wyll haue lye styll vntyll mornynge laye feete vntyl mornynge arose vp one coulde knowe another sayde let man knowe came woman barne sayd agayne brynge thy mantell thou hast vpon holde vp helde vp met syxe measure barley layde gat citye came mother lawe sayde howe doughter tolde man done sayd also vi measure barley gaue sayde thou shalte come emptye vnto thy mother lawe sayde doughter syt styll vntyll thou knowe howe matter wyll chaunce man wyll rest vntyll haue fynysshed thynge daye ¶ booz taketh ruth wyfe whome begetteth obed capi iiii wente booz vnto gate sat downe beholde kynsmā whiche booz spake came unto sayd come syt downe called hym name turned sat downe toke ten men elder citie sayd syt • e downe sat downe sayd vnto kynsmā noami come agayn countrey moab leuiti 25 b iere 32 b wyll sell parcell lande whiche brother elimeltes thought wete byd bye enhabito • t elder people thou dysposed redeme yf thou wylte purchase tel may knowe none chalenge saue thou nexte answered wyll purchase sayde booz daye thou byest felde hande naomi thou must take also ruth moabite deute 25 b wyfe dead styrre vp name dead vpon enheritaunce kynsman answered purchase marrynge myne owne enheritaunce take thou ryght iean purchase maner olde tyme israell concernyng purches chaungyng stablysshe al thyng man must plucke shoo gyue neyghbour sure wytnesse israell therfore kynsman sayd booz bye thou drewe shoo booz sayd vnto elder vnto people ye wytnesses day haue bought elimelecs chtlions mahlons hande naomi moreouer ruth moabite wyfe mahlon haue purchased wyfe styrre vp name deade vpon enheritaunce name put amonge brother gate place ye wytnesses daye people gate elder sayde wytnesses lorde obed obed begat isai isai begat dauid ❧ ende boke ruth ❧ fyrst boke samuel called fyrst boke kynges ¶ elkana hath two wyues hanna phenenna capi primo man of☞ one ii ramathes kinred zophim mount ephraim named 〈◊〉 vi • elkana sonne ieroham son elihu son thohu son zuph ephrathite whiche two wyues one called hanna phenenna phenenna child henna none 〈◊〉 23 • 〈◊〉 16 • sayd man wente vp citie euery feastful day pray offre vnto lorde hoostes silo two sonnes eli hophni phinehes lordes preestes fel solemyne day elkana offered gaue phenenna wyfe sonnes doughters porcions ❀ vnto hāna gaue porcyon heuy chere loued hanna lorde made barren enemye phenenna vexed good moue bycause lorde made barren dyd yere yere ofte wente vp house lorde chafed whiche wepte dyd eate sayde elkana husbande hanna wepest thou eatest thou thyne herte troubled better ten sonnes hanna rose vp eaten dronken silo eli preest sat vpon stole one syde postes temple lorde troubled mynde prayed vnto lorde wepte sore vowed vowe sayde oh lorde hoostes yf thou wylte loke trouble thyne handmayde remembre forget thyne handmayde gyue vnto thyne handmayde man chylde wyll gyue hym vnto lorde al dayes lyfe 〈◊〉 •• ii 〈◊〉 vi b shal raser come vpon heade contynued prayenge lorde fortuned eli marked mouth hāna spake herte lyppes dyd moue voyce herde therfore eli thought bene dronken eli sayde vnto howe long wylte thou dronken put away wyne thou hast hanna answered sayde lorde woman sorowfull herte haue dronke neyther wyne stronge drynke haue psal x • ii • ☞ powred soule lorde count thyne handmayd lyke doughter belial aboundaunce heuynesse greefe haue spoken hytherto eli answered agayne sayd go peace god israell graunt thy peticion thou hast asked sayd let thyne handmayd fynd grace thy syght woman went waye dyd eate loked sad rose vp early worshypped lorde returned came theyr house ramath elkana knewe hāna wyfe lorde remembred processe tyme came passe conceyued bare sonne called name samuel sayenge bycause haue asked hym lorde elkana house went vp offre vnto lorde offeryng due feast also ☞ vowe neuerthelesse hāna went vp sayd vnto husbande wyl tary vntyll lad weyned wyll bryng hym may apeare lorde abyde euer elkana husbande answered semeth best tarye home vntyll thou hast weyned hym beseche lorde make good saynge woman abode gaue sonne sucke vntyll weyned hym weyned toke hym thre bullockes▪ epha floure bottel wyne brought hym vnto house lorde silo chylde yet tender age slewe bullocke brought lad eli sayde oh lorde truely thy soule lyueth lorde woman stode prayenge vnto lorde lad prayed lorde hathe gyuen desyre whiche asked hym therfore haue gyuen hym vnto lorde longe mete lorde worshyped lorde ¶ songe hanna offence sonnes eli capi ii hanna prayed sayd myne hert reioyseth lorde myne ☞ horne exalted lorde mouth wyde open ouer myne enemyes reioyse thy saluacyon none holy lorde without nothyng neyther strength god talke moche proudlye let olde thynges departe youre mouthes lorde god knowledge purpose come passe ☞ bowe strong broken weake haue gyrded selues strength ful haue hyred selues breade hungry cease tyll baren hath borne seuen many chyldren waxed feble deute 32 f lorde kylleth maketh alyue ☞ bryngeth downe hell fetcheth vp agayne lorde maketh poore maketh ryche bryngeth low heaueth vp hye psal • 3 b rayseth vp poore dust lyfteth vp begger dunghyl set amonge prynces enherite seate glory pyllers earth lordes hath set rounde worlde vpon wyll kepe feete sayntes wicked shal kepe sylence darkenesse deute • owne myght shall man stronge lordes aduersaries shall destroyed hym heuen shall thunder vpon lorde shall iudge endes worlde shal gyue myght vnto kyng exalte horne anoynted elkana went ramath house lad dyd ministre vnto lorde eli preest sonnꝭ eli ☞ chyldren belial knewe lorde preestes made l • people soeuer man offered offerynge preestes lad came whyle fleshe sethynge flesshe hoke thre teeth hande thrust pan ketle caldron pot flesshe hoke brought vp preest toke awaye dyd vnto israelite came thyther silo yea therto burnt fat preestes lad came sayde man offered gyue flesshe may dresse preest wyll haue sodden flesshe rawe yf man sayd vnto hym let burne fat accordyng day take moche thyne herte desyreth lad wolde answere yea thou shalte gyue yf thou wylte wyl take violence synne yonge men great lorde men abhorred offerynge lorde chylde samuel ☞ ministred lorde gyrded aboute lynnen ☞ ephod moreouer mother made hym lytell coote brought hym frome yere yere came vp husbande offre offerynge solempne feastes eli blessed elkana wife sayd lorde gyue seede womā peticion asked lorde went vnto theyr owne home lorde visited hanna conceyued bare thre sonnes two doughters chylde samuel grewe lorde eli olde herde sonnes dyd vnto israell howe lay woman wayted dore tabernacle wytnesse sayde vnto ye suche thynges people heare euyl reportes oh nay sonnes good reporte heare howe ye make lordes people trespasse one man syn agaynste ❀ dayesmen may iudges yf man synne agaynst lorde wyll dayesman notwithstandyng herkened vnto voyce theyr father bycause lorde wolde sley chylde samuel profited •••• ▪ 〈◊〉 ▪ grewe fauour lorde also men came man god vnto eli sayd vnto hym thus sayth lorde dyd appeare vnto house thy father whē egypte subiecte vnto pharaos house chose thy father tribe israell preest offre •••• 〈◊〉 〈◊〉 ▪ • ▪ vpon myne aulter burne insence weare ephod gaue vnto house thy father offrynges chyldrē israel wherfore treade ye downe sacrifice myne offerynge whiche cōmaunded made tabernacle honourest thy chyldren aboue make youre selues fat fyrst fruytes offerynges israel people wherfore lorde god israell sayth sayde thy house house thy father shulde walke euer nowe lorde saythe farre worshyp wyll worshyp despyse shal come shame beholde dayes come wyll cut thyne arme arme thy father house shall elder thyne house thou shalte se thyne enemye tabernacle al shal please israel shall elder thyne house euer neuerthelesse wyll dedestroye male come myne aulter make thyne eye dase make thyne herte melte multiplied thyne house • reg • 2 shal dye yf men shall sygne vnto shall come vpon thy two sonnes • reg ii g hophni phinehes euen one daye shall dye bothe wyll styrre vp faythfull preest shall accordyng herte mynde wyll buylde hym sure house shall walke myne anoynted euer lefte thyne house shall come crouche hym lytle pece syluer cake breade shall saye put praye one offyce amonge preestes maye eate morsell breade ¶ lorde called samuell thre tymes capi iii chylde samuell minystred vn lorde eli ☞ worde lorde precyous dayes neyther open visyon chaunsed tyme eli laye place • regū 4 c eye began ware dyu • coulde se ere lampe god went samuel layde hym downe slepe temple lorde arke god lorde called samuell sayde ran vnto eli sayde thou calledst sayde called go agayne slepe went layde downe slepe lorde called agayne samuell samuel arose went eli sayde thou dydest call answered called sonne go agayne take thy rest ☞ samuel knewe yet lorde neyther worde lorde yet opened vnto hym lorde went called samuell thyrde tyme arose went eli sayd thou hast called eli perceyued lorde called chylde therfore eli sayde samuell go lye downe yf cal agayne saye speake lorde thy seruaunt heareth samuell went layde hym downe place lorde came stode called samuel samuell samuell answered speake thy seruaunt heareth lorde sayde samuell beholde wyll thyng israel bothe eares many heareth shall tyngle daye wyll rayse vp agaynst eli haue spoken concernynge house begynnynge endynge haue tolde hym • ▪ regū ii • wyl iudge house foreuer wyckednes whiche knoweth ❀ people cursed sonnes wyckednesse hath correcte therfore haue sworne vnto house eli wyckednesse elies house shall pourged sacrifyce offerynge euer samuell laye tyll mornynge opened dores house lorde samuel feared shew eli visyon eli called samuell sayde samuell son answered sayde lorde hath sayd vnto se thou hyde ruth • ▪ • god yf thou hyde thynge sayd vnto samuell tolde hym euerye whyt hyd nothynge hym sayde lorde let hym semeth hym best samuell grewe lorde hym lefte none wordes vnper formed israell frō dan bersabe wyst faythfull samuel made lordes prophet lorde appeared agayne silo lorde opened hym selfe samuell silo thorow worde lorde ¶ arke lorde taken eli • hridren 〈◊〉 capi iiii samuell spake vnto israell ❀ fortuned dayes philistynes came togyther syght israell wen • cut agaynst philistine battayle pytched besyde ☞ • reg 〈◊〉 • helpe stoone philistine pytched aphek put selues araye agaynst israel ende batrayl israell put worse philistine philistine slewe aye alonge feldꝭ aboute foure thousand men people come theyr tentes elder israelll sayd wher fore hath lorde cast v downe daye philistine let v fetche arke appoyntment lorde silo vnto v cōmeth amonge v may saue v hande enemye people sent silo fet thence arke appoyntment lorde hoostes whiche dwelleth bytwene cherubyns two sonnes eli hophni phinehes wt arke appoyntment god fortuned arke appoyntment lorde came hooste israell showted myghtye showte arthe range agayne philistine herde noyse shoute sayd meaneth soude myghtye shoute hooste hebrues vnderstode howe arke lorde come host philistine afrayde sayde god come hoost sayd agayn wo vnto v neuer wo vnto v shall delyuer v hande mightie goddes goddes smote egyptian many plage wyldernesse stronge quite oure selues lyke men ye philistine ye seruaū te vnto hebrues iudi • 3 • haue ben men therfore fyght philistine fought israell put worse fled euery man tent ercedyng great slaughter ouer throwen israell thyrtye thousande footemen arke god taken two sonnes eli • reg • 〈◊〉 g hophni phinekes deade ran man ben iamin araye came silo daye clothes rent earth vpon head came eli sat vpon stoole loked towarde waye herte feared arke god man came citye tolde al citye cryed eli herde noyse cryenge sayde meaneth noyse rumour man came hastely tolde eli eli foure score eyghtene yeare olde • reg • 3 syght fayled hym coulde se man sayde vnto eli came aray fled day hooste sayde thynge fortuned son messenger answered sayde israell fled philistines▪ great slaughter chaunsed amonge people thy two sonnes hophni phines deade arke god taken fortuned made mencion arke god eli fell stoole backeward vpon thresholde gate necke brake dyed olde man heuye iudged israell fourtye yeres doughter lawe phinehes wyfe chylde nygh byrth herde tydynges arke god taken father inlawe husbande deade▪ bowed selfe traueyled paynes came vpon aboute tyme death woman stode aboute sayde vnto teare thou hast borne sonne answered regarded named chylde glory gone ichabod sayenge glorye departed frō israell bycause arke god taken bycause father inlaw husbande sayde agayne glorye gone frō israell arke god taken ¶ dagon god philistynes cast •• • arke capi v philistine toke arke god caryed helpe stone vnto asdod agayne philistine toke arke god brought house dagon set dagon asdod vp mornyng beholde dagon laye vpon earth arke lorde toke dagon set hym place agayne vp carlye nexte mornyng beholde dagon laye vpon grounde arke lorde heede two handes cut vpon thresholde ☞ shap fyshe lefte hym therfore preestꝭ dagon neyther man cōmeth dagon house treade threshold dagon asdod vnto daye hande lorde heuye vpon asdod destroyed smote emerodes bothe asdod coostes therof ❀ vyllages also feldes myddest countrey vvere full came vp myce vvas confusyon great death citye men asdod saw sayde arke god israell shall abyde v hande sore vpon v vpon dagon god sent therfore gathered lordes citye small great secrete dyseases ❀ gethites toke councell made selues preuye seates skynnes therfore sent arke god akaron soone arke god came akaron akaronites cryed sayenge haue brought arke god israell v sley v people sent gathered togyther lordꝭ philistine sayde sende away arke god israell go agayne vnto owne place sley v people deadly noyse thorow citye hande god excedynge sore men dyed smyten emerodꝭ crye citye went vp heuen ¶ kyne brynge home arke rewardes capi vi arke lorde countrey philistine seuen monethes philistine called preestes sothsayers saynge shall arke lorde tell v wherwith shall sende home agayne sayde yf sende arke god israell home agayne sende emptye rewarde trespasseofferynge ye shall hoole shall knowen hand departeth sayde shal trespasseofferynge whiche shall rewarde hym answered fyue golden • ss fyue golden myce accordynge nombre lordes philistine one maner plage lordes wherfore ye shal make ymages lyke ar ymages lyke myce corrupt lande ye shall gyue glorye vnto god israel may take hand goddes lande wherfore ye harden youre hertes egyptian pharao hardened theyr hertes whiche toke agaynst dyd let people go departed nowe therfore make newe carte take two mylche kyne whose neck hath come yocke tye kyne carte brynge calues home take arke lorde laye vpon carte put iuels golde whiche ye rewarde hym synofferynge coofer syde therof sende away maye go yf ye se go vp way owne coost bethsames dyd v greate euyll yf shall knowe hande smote v chaunce happened v men dyd euen toke two kyne gaue mylke tyed carte kepte calues home layde arke lorde vpon carte coofer myce golde ymages theyr ar kyne toke streyght waye bethsames went one waye went lowed turned neyther ryght hande lefte lordes philistine went vntyll border bethsames bethsames reapyng theyr wheate heruest valeye lyfte vp theyr eye spyed arke reioysed sawe carte came felde one iosua bethsamite stode styl also greate stoone claue wood carte offered kyne burntofferynge vnto lorde leuytes toke downe arke lorde coofer wherin iuels golde put great stone men bethsames sacrificed burntsacrifyce offered offerynges daye vnto lorde fyue lordes philistine sene returned akarō day golden ar whiche philistine gaue amendes trespasseofferynge lorde asdod one • z • gaza one askalon one gath one akaron one golden myce accordynge nombre al cityes philistine euen accordyng fyue lordes bothe walled townes townes vnwalled euen vnto greate stone lamentacion wheron set downe arke lorde stone remayneth vnto daye felde iosua bethsamite plaged men bethsames bycause sene arke lorde slewe amonge people fiftye thousande thre score ten men people lamented bycause lorde sleyne people great slaughter wherfore men bethsames sayd able stande lorde hooly god whome shall go v sent messēgers enhabyters kariath iarim sayenge philistine haue brought agayne arke lorde come ye downe therfore fet vp ¶ arke brought kariathiarim capi vii men kariathiarim came fet vp arke lorde ii reg vi • shalte deliuer people handes theyr enemyes vviche rounde aboute token shalt thou haue lorde hath annoynted prynce thou art departed daye thou shalte fynde two men gene 35 • rahels sepulchre border ben couenaunt wt yf maye thrust youre ryght eye brynge shame vpō israel elder iabes sayd gyue v vii dayes respyte may sende messenger vnto coostes israel yf man helpe v wyll come came messenger gibea vnto saul tolde tydynges eares people people lyfte vp theyr voyces wepte beholde saull came folowynge cattell felde saull sayd ayleth peple wepe tolde hym tydynges men iabes spiryte god came vpon saull herde tydynges excedynge angrye toke yocke ox wed peces sent thoroweout coostes israell handes messenger sayenge whosoeuer commeth forth saul samuel shall ox serued ☞ feare lorde fell people came ben one man 1 reg xv nombred bezek chyldren israell ccc men men iuda xxx sayde vnto messenger came saye vnto men iabes gilead morow tyme son hote ye shall haue helpe messenger came shewed men iabes glad therfore men iabes sayd morowe wyll come vnto ye shall wt v pleaseth morowe fortuned saull put people thre partes came vpon hoost mornynge watche slewe ammonite vntyll heate day remayned skattred two lefte togyther people sayde vnto samuell dare say shall saull reygne ouer vs▪ brynge men may sley saull sayde shall man dye daye daye lorde hath saued israell sayde samuell vnto people come maye go gylgall ☞ renewe kyngdome people went gilgall made saull kynge lorde gilgall offered peaceofferyngꝭ lorde saull men israell reioysed excedyngly ¶ samuell declareth hym selfe innocent iudge capi xii samuell sayde vnto israell beholde haue herkened vnto voyce ye sayde vnto haue made kynge therfore kynge walketh olde graye headed beholde sonnꝭ haue walked chyldhode vnto daye beholde restore agayne sayd yu hast done v wrong hurte v neyther hast thou taken ought mannes hande sayd vnto agayne lorde wytnesse gaynst anoynted wytnesse daye ye haue foūde nought handes answered wytnesse delyuer v handes enemyes wyll serue lorde sent ☞ ierobaall iudi xiil badan iudi xi iephthah 1 reg vii b samuell delyuered handꝭ enemyes euery syde ye dwelled safe al ye sawe nahas kynge chyldren ammō came agaynst ye sayde vnto regū • • kynge shall reygne ouer v yet lorde god kynge nowe therfore beholde kynge whome ye haue chosen whome ye haue desyred lorde hath set kynge ouer yf ye wyll feare lorde serue hym heare voyce dysobeye worde lorde bothe ye kynge reygneth ouer shall folow lorde god yf ye wyll herken vnto voyce lorde dysobeye lordes mouth shall hande lorde vpon youre father nowe also stande se great thynge whiche lorde wyl eye wheatheruest wyl call vnto lorde ☞ shall sende thunder rayne ye maye perceyue se howe youre wyckednesse great whiche ye haue done syght lorde askynge kynge samuell called vnto lorde lorde sent thunder rayne day people feared lorde samuell excedynglye people sayde vnto samuell praye thy seruauntes vnto lorde thy god dye haue synned askynge v kynge besyde synnes euer dyd samuell sayde vnto people feare ye haue dede done wyckednesse yet departe folowynge lorde serue hym euen youre hertes neyther turne ye vayne thyngꝭ whi •• able profyt vanitie good ryght way therfore feare ye lorde serue hym trueth youre hertes consydre howe great thynges hath done yf ye wyckedlye shall ye peryshe bothe ye youre kynge ¶ philistine •• ytten saull ionathas saull beynge dysn bedyent goddes ōmoundement shewed samuell shall reygne capi xiii saull ben kynge one yere thynges came passe reygned two yeres ouer israell saull chose hym thre thousande men israell two thousande saull michmas mounte betheil thousande ionathas gibea ben iamin rest people sent euery man owne house agayne ionathas smote hold philistine hyll came philistine eares saull blewe trompet thorowout lande sayenge let hebrues heare israell herde saye howe saull destroyed holde philistine wherfore ☞ israell stancke philistine people gathered togyther saul gilgall philistine also gathered selues togyther fyght israell thyrtye thousand charettes syxe thousand horse men people lyke esay •• sande see syde multitude came vp pytched michmas eastwarde bethauen men israell sawe euen vnto tyme samuell 1 reg • •• appoynted samuell came gilgal people therfore scattered hym saull sayde brynge burntsacrifyce peace offeryngꝭ offered burntsacrifice soone made ende offeryng selues togyther michmas therfore sayd philistine shal come downe nowe vpon gilgall haue made supplicacyon vnto lorde ☞ ouercome selfe last offered burntofferynge samuell sayde saull e 〈…〉 thou arte become foole thou hast kept cōmaūdement lorde thy god whiche cōmaunded tyme wolde lorde haue stablysshed thy kyngdome vpon israell euer nowe thy kyngdome shal contynewe 1 〈…〉 lorde hath ☞ sought hym man owne herte lorde hath cōmaūded hym captayne ouer people bycause thou hast kepte whiche lorde cōmaūded samuell arose gat hym vp frō gilgal gibea beniamin ❀ remenaunte folke vvente vp saull mere people vvhich fought agaynst vvere cōmynge gilgall gibea hyll ben lamin saull nombred people founde hym aboute vi c men saul ionathas son people founde hym theyr abydyng hyll ben iamin philistine pytched michmas came hoost philistine thre companyes destroy one company turned vnto way leadeth ophra vnto lande sual company turned way bethorō thyrde company turned waye coost sene aboue valey zeboim towarde wyldernesse smyth foūde thorowout lande israell philistine sayde lest haply hebrues make swerdes speres israelite went downe philistine mende euery man share mattocke axe came go ouer michmas ¶ ionathas harnes bearer putteth philistine fl • ght tasteth honye capi xiiii fortuned tyme ionathas son saul sayde vnto yong man bare harnes come let v go ouer philistine watche yonder syde tolde father saul taryed vttermost parte gibea vnder rimmon whiche migron people wt hym vpon vi c men ahia son ahitob iehabods brother sonne phinches son eli lordes preest silo ware ephod people wist ionathas gone myddes passage whiche ionathas sought go ouer vnto philistinꝭ watch two sharpe cockes euē one one syde syde one called bozez senne fore front one leaned northward towarde michmas southwarde towarde gibea ionathas sayde yong man bare harnes come let v go ouer vnto watche vncircumcised peraduenture lorde wyll worke v hardnesse lorde •• 14 • saue eyther many fewe harnes berer sayde vnto hym thyne herte go pleaseth beholde thyne herte lusteth sayd ionathas beholde go ouer vnto men shal shewe selues vnto yf say wyse v tary vntyll come wyll stande styll place go vp vnto yf say come vp vnto v wyl go vp 1 math 4 • lorde hath delyuered handꝭ shalbe sygne vnto v bothe shewed selues vnto watch philistinꝭ philistine sayd se hebrues come hole hyd selues men watche answered ionathas harnes bearer sayde come vp v wyll shewe thynge ionathas sayd vnto harnes bearer come vp lorde hath delyuered hande israell ionathas clambe vp vpon handes fete harnes berer hym ❀ vvhen sene • onathas face fell ionathas harnes berer slue hym fyrst slaughter whiche ionathas harnes berer made vpon rr men wt u compasse aboute halfe aker lande feare hoost felde among people moche gone watch rob afrayde also earth trymbled feare sent god watchmē saul gibea beniamin saw beholde people philistine scattered smytten wente sayde saul vnto people hym searche se gone awaye frō v nombred beholde ionathas harnes berer saul sayd vnto ahia bryng hyther arke god arke god tyme chyldren israel fortuned whyle saul talked vnto preest noyse hoost philistine syred farther abrode increased ❀ lytle lytle gaue cleare founde saul sayde vnto preest withdrawe thyne handes saull ioyned hym selfe vnto people hym came battayle behold iu •••• 7 • 〈◊〉 pa xx • euery mannes swerde agaynst felowe great tumour moreouer hebrues philistine tyme come al partes hoost turned israelite saul ionathas al mē israel also hyd selues moūt ephraim soone herde howe philistine fled folowed battayle god helped israel daye battayl cōtinued vnto bethauen whyle men israell kepte downe hunger daye saull charged people othe saynge cursed man eateth food vntyll nyght tyll auenged myne enemyes noone people tasted sustcnaunce al inhabitours land came wood houy lay vpon grounde people came wood beholde honye dropped man moued hand mouth people feared othe ionathas herde father charged people othe wherfore put forth ende rod wasin hand dypte hony combe put hande mouth ☞ eye receyued sight answered one people sayde thy father adiuted peple saynge cursed man eateth sustenaunce day people fayntye sayde ionathas father hath troubled land se howe myne eye haue receyued syght bycause tasted lytell honye howe moche daye yf people eaten spoyle theyr enemyes whiche founde bene moche greater slaughter among philistine layde philistine day michmas aiolon people excedyng fayntye people gat spoyle toke shepe ox calues slue grounde people dyd eate • cuit vii c xix • bloode men tolde saull sayenge beholde people synne agaynste lorde eate blood sayde ye haue trespassed rowle greate stone vnto day saul sayde agayne go abrode amonge people byd brynge euery man oxe euery man shepe fley synne agaynst lorde eatynge blood people brought euery mā oxe hande nyght flue saull made aulter vnto lorde fyrst aulter made vnto lorde saul sayd let v go downe philistine night spoyle vntyll day mornyng let v leaue one man sayde soeuer thou thynkest best sayd preest let v come hyther vnto god saul asked god shall go downe philistineswylte thou delyuer handes israell answered hym tyme saul sayde let people come hyther quarter knowe se whome synne chaunced daye truely lorde lyueth saueth israel though ionathas sonne shall dye death man among people answered hym sayde vnto israell ye one syde ionathas sonne wyl syde people sayd vnto saul thou thynkest best therfore saul sayd vnto lorde god israel gyue perfyte lot ❀ lorde god gyue thou indgement hovve happeneth thou gyuest thy seruaunt ansvvere daye yf syn ionathas sonne shevv yf iniquyte thy people saul ionathas caught people scaped free saul sayde cast lotte bytwene ionathas sonne ionathas caught thē saul sayd ionathas tell thou hast done ionathas tolde hym sayd tasted lytell honye ende rod myne hande lo must dye saul answered 〈◊〉 • god thou shalte dye death ionathas people sayd vnto saul shall ionathas dye whiche hath myghtely helped israel god forbyd truely lorde lyueth 2 〈…〉 shall one heere heade fall grounde hath wrought god daye people delyuered ionathas dyed saul departed vp folowynge philistine philistine went theyr owne place saul helde kyngdom ouer israell faught agaynst enemyes euery syde agaynst moab agaynst chyldren ammon agaynst edom agaynst kynges zoba agaynst philistine whyther soeuer turned hym selfe wan gathered hoost togyther sinote diui •• amaleckites tyd israell handes spoyled sonnes saul ionathas iosui melchisua two doughters thus named elder called merob yonger michol name saules wyr̄e ahinoa doughter ahimaaz name cheyfe captayne abner sonne ner saules vncle 1 〈…〉 ci saules father ner father abner sonne abiell sore wacre agaynst philistine al dayes saul soeuer saul sawe strong man mete warre toke hym vnto hym ¶ saul rōmaunded kyll aninlecke disobedient voyce god samuel moutneth saul capi xv samuel sayd vnto saul • rgii ix c lorde sent anoynt kyng ouer peple israel nowe therfore herken y• vnto voyce wordes lorde thus sayeth lorde hoostes remembre amalec dyd israel 〈◊〉 17 layd wayte way came egypte therfore go smyte amalec destroy ye al perteyneth vnto se thou haue compassyon ❀ 〈…〉 couet nothynge haue slee man woman infant suklyng • e shepe camel asse saul gathered people togyther 〈◊〉 xi c nombred telaim two hundred thousande foote men ten thousande men iuda saul came vnto citye amalec set watche valley saul sayde kenites go departe get downe among amaleckites leest destroy wt ye shewed mercy chyldren israel came egypte kenites departed among amaleckites saul smote amaleckites heuila yu comest sur lyeth egypte toke agag kyng amaleckites alyuc vtterly destroyed al people wt edge swerde num 24 b saul people spared agag better shepe fatter ox lambes good wolde destroy foule nought worth destroyed vtterly came worde lorde vnto samuel sayenge • ina vi repenteth haue made saul kynge turned hath perfourmed cōmaundementes samuel enyl apayde cryed vnto lord nyght samuel arose early mete saul mornyng tolde samuel saul come carmell beholde ☞ hath made hym place returned departed gone downe gylgal samuel sayd saul ❀ saul offered burntsacrifyce vnto lorde fyrst spoyles vvhich brought frō amalec vvhen samuel vvas come vnto saul saul sayd vnto hym blessed thou lorde haue fulfylled cōmaundament lorde samuel sayd meaneth thē bleatyng shepe myne eares noyse ox heare saul swered haue brought amaleckites people spared best shepe ox sacrifice vnto lorde thy god remenaunt haue destroyed vtterly samuel sayd saul let tell lord hath sayd nyght sayd vnto say samuel sayd regū ix • x • yu wast lytel thyne owne sight wast yu made head tribe israel lorde anoynted kynge ouer israel lorde sent iourney sayd go vtterly destroy synners amaleckites fyght agaynst vntyll yu vtterly destroy thē wherfore hast yu herkened vnto voyce lorde hast turned pray hast done wycked syght lorde saul sayd vnto samuel yea haue herkened vnto voyce lorde haue gone way lorde sent vnto haue brought agag kyng amalec haue vtterly destroyed amaleckites peple toke spoyle shepe oxē cheyfest thin ge shuld haue bene destroyed offre vnto lorde thy god gylgal samuel sayd hath lord great pleasure burntsacrifices offryngꝭ whē voyce lord obeyed beholde obey better sacrifice herken better thē fat rāmes rebellyon synne erodi 2 • • deu • 8 b wytcherafte stoburnes wickednes idolatrie bycause yu hast cast awaye worde lorde therfore hath lorde cast away also frō beyng kyng saul sayd samuel haue synned haue gone thē sayeng lorde thy wordꝭ bycause feared people obeyed theyr voyce therfore take away syn turne agayne may worship lorde samuel sayde vnto saul wyl returne yu hast cast away worde lorde lorde hath cast away yu shalt kyng ouer israel samuel turned hym selfe go away caught lap coote rent samuel sayd vnto hym lorde hath rent kyngdom israel daye hath gyuen neyghboure thyne better thē thou ☞ strength israel wyl begyle repent mā repent sayd haue synned nowe honour elder people israel turne agayne maye worshyp lorde thy god samuel turned agayne folowed saull saull worshypped lorde sayd samuel brynge ye hyther agag kyng amaleckites agag came vnto hym ☞ delicately agag sayd truely bytter death cometh samuel sayde thy swerde hathe made woman chyldelesse shall thy mother chyldelesse aboue woman samuel hewed agag peces lorde gilgal 1 regū 7 samuell departed rama saul wente home house gibea saul samuel came se saul vntyll day death neuerthelesse samuel mourned saul lorde ☞ repented made saul kynge ouer israel dauid anoynted kyng • uyl spirite cometh vpon saul capi xvi lorde sayde vnto samuel howe longe wylte thou mourne saul seynge haue cast hym away reygnyng ouer israel fyl thyne horne oyntment come maye sende isai bethleemite haue prouyded king among sonnes samuel sayd go yf saul heare wyll kyll lorde answered take heyfer saye come offre lorde call isai offeryng wyl shewe yu shalte thou shalte anoynt hym name vnto samuel dyd lord • bad hym came bethleem elder towne astonyed comynge sayde 3 regū ii c comest thou peaceably answered yea come offre vnto lorde ☞ nume 〈◊〉 iosua ii • b vii c sanctifie selues come offerynge sanctified isai sonnes bad offerynge come loked eliab sayd ☞ surely lordes anoynted hym lorde sayd vnto samuel loke facion heyght stature bycause haue refused god seyth man seyth mā loketh outwarde apperaūce god beholdeth herte isai called abinadab made hym come samuel sayd neyther hath lorde chosen isai made sāma come sayde neyther yet hath lorde chosen hym agayne isai made seuen of▪ sonnes come samuel samuel sayd vnto isai lord hath chosen none samuel sayd vnto isai al thy chyldren sayd yet lytel one behinde kepeth shepe samuel sayd vnto isai sende fet wyl syt downe tyl come hyther sent brought hym browne 〈…〉 excellent beautye well fauoured syght lorde sayde aryse anoynte hym therfore samuel toke horne oyntment anoynted myddes brother spirite lorde came vpon dauid day forwarde samuel arose vp wente rama spirite lorde departed frome saul euyll spirite sent lorde vexed hym saul seruauntes sayde vnto hym beholde▪ euyl spirite sent god vexeth let lorde therfore cōmaunde seruauntes seke man cōnyng player harpe whē euyll spirite sent god cometh vpon may play wt hande thou shalte eased saul sayd vnto seruauntes prouyde man playe well bryng hym answered one seruauntes sayd beholde haue sene son isai bethleemite playe vpon instrumentes actiue felowe mā war prudent doynge feates well made lorde hym wherfore saul sente messenger vnto isai sayd sende dauid thy son whiche shepe isai toke asse laden breade flacket wyne kyd sent dauid son vnto saul dauid came saul stode hym loued hym wel made harnes bearer saul sent isai sayeng let dauid remayne hath founde fououre syght fortuned euyll spirite sente god came vpon saul dauid toke harpe played hande saul refresshed dyd amende euyll spirite departed hym ¶ dauid ouercometh great gol • ath capi xvii philistine gathered theyr hoost battayle came togyther socoh whiche iuda pytched bytwene socoh azekah coost dammim saul men israel came togyther pytched oke valley put selues aray fyght agaynst philistine philistine stode hyll one syde israel stode hyll syde valey bitwene came man bytwene tentꝭ philistine named goliath 〈◊〉 x • gath vi cubites handbredth longe helmet brasse vpon heade coote mayle aboute weyght coote mayle fyue thousand spcles brasse bootes brasse vpon legges shelde brasse vpon shoulder shafte speare lyke weuers beame speare head wayed vi hūdred • cles pron one bearyng shelde went hym stode cryed agaynst hoost israel sayde vnto ye come aray battayle philistine seruauntes saul chose ye man amonge let hym come downe yf able fyght beate wyll seruauntes yf ouercome hym beate hym shall ye oure seruauntes serue v philistine sayde defye hoost israell daye gyue man may fyght togyther saul israel herde wordes philistine discouraged greatly afrayde dauid son ephrathite ❀ vvhom mencyon made bethleem iuda named isai whiche eyght sonnes olde man dayes saul came age amonge mē iii eldest sonnes isai went folowed saul battayle name thre sonnes went battayle eliab eldest nexte abinadab thyrde sāma dauid least thre eldest went saul dauid also went departed saul fede father shepe bethleem philistine came forthe mornyng euenyng ☞ continued xl dayes isai sayde vnto dauid sonne take thy brethrē epha parched corne ten loues bryng vnto hoost thy brother cary x freshe cheses vnto captayne loke howe thy brethrēn fare ☞ fet theyr pledge saul men israell oke valey fightyng wt philistine dauid rose vp early mornyng lefte shepe keper toke wente isai cōmaunded hym came within compasse hoost hoost went aray showted battayle israel philistine put selues aray one agaynst dauid toke downe gere frō hym put vnder handes keper vessel ran hoost came saluted brethrē talked wt beholde stode man myddes goliath philistine name gath araye philistine spake maner aboue rehersed dauid herde mē israel sawe man ran away hym sore afrayde euery man israel sayd sawe ye man come forth euen reuyle israell come iosua 1 • • hym beateth hym wyll kyng gyue great ryches wyll gyue hym doughter therto yea make father house free israel dauid spake men stode sayde shall done man beateth philistine taketh away shame frō israell vncircūcysed philistine shuld reuyle host lyuyng god people answered hym maner saynge shal done man beateth hym eliab eldest brother herde spake vnto men eliab angry dauid sayde camest thou downe hyther hast thou lefte fewe shepe wyldernesse know thy pryde malice thyne herte thou art come downe se battayle dauid sayde haue done worde departed hym presence snake maner people answered hym agayne herde wordes whiche dauid spake rehersed saul caused hym fet dauid sayde saul let mannes herte fayle hym bycause hym thy seruaunt wyll go fyght yonder philistine saul say de dauid agayne yu art able go agaynst yonder philistyne fyght hym thou arte chylde mā war euen youth dauid answered vnto saul thy seruaunt kept father shepe came iud • 14 • eb • ue xi • lyon lykewyse beare toke shepe flocke wente hym smote hym toke mouth arose agaynst caught hym bearde smote hym slue hym thy seruant slue lyon beare also hath thy seruaunt sleyn truely vncircumcised philistine shall▪be one ❀ novv vvyll go take avvay rebuke people vvhat vncircūcised philistine seyng hath rayled hoost lyuyng god dauid spake moreouer lorde delyuered hande lyon hande beare shall deluyer also hande philistine saul sayd vnto dauid go lorde shall saul put rayment vpon dauid put helmet brasse vpon heade put coote mayle vpon hym gyrded dauid owne swerde vpon rayment assayed go bycause neuer proued dauid sayde vnto saul go haue vsed selfe therto dauid put roke staffe hand chose hym fyue smoth stone broke put shepeheerdes bag whiche siyng poke slyng hande went philistine philistine came drue nere agaynste dauid man bare shelde wente hym philistine loked aboute sawe dauid dysdayned hym younge well coloured goodly loke vpon philistine sayd vnto dauid dog thou romest staffe philistine cursed dauid name goodꝭ philistine sayd dauid come wyll gyue thy flesshe vnto foules ayre beastes felde thē sayd dauid philistine thou comest swerde speare shelde come name lorde hoostes god hoost israell whome thou haste rayled vpon day shal lorde delyuer hande shall smyte take thyne heade wyll gyue carkasses hoost philistine daye vnto foules ayre beastꝭ earth whiche worlde maye knowe god israel congregation shal knowe lorde saueth swerde speare battayle lordes shall gyue handes philistine arose come drawe nygh vnto dauid dauid hasted ran battayle euen agaynst philistine dauid put hande bag loke stone slange smote philystyne forhead stone sonke foreheade eccle 47 fell grouelynge earth dauid ouercame philystyne • ynge stone smote philistyne slue hym euen whē dauid swerde hande dauid ran stode vpon philistine toke swerde drew shethe slue hym cut heade therwith philistine sawe theyr champyon deade iub • v ••• fled men israell iuda arose shouted folowed philistine vntyl came valey vnto gate akaron philistine fell downe wounded way saaraum euen vnto gath akaron chyldren israell returned chasynge philistine spoyled theyr tentes dauid toke heade philistine brought ierusalem put armoure tente saull sawe dauid go forth agaynst philistine sayd vnto 1 reg 14 • abner captayne hoost abner whose son yong man abnen answered truly thy soule lyueth kyng tell kyng sayd enquyre thou whose son yonglyng dauid returned slaughter philistine abner toke hym brought saul head philistiane hande saul sayd hym whose son art thou thou yong man dauid answered son thy seruaunt isai bethleemite ¶ bonde bytwene dauid ionatha • saull gothe aboute •• ee dauid capi xviii made ende sprakynge vnto saul soule ionathas knyt soule dauid ionathas loued hym owne soule saul • oke hym day wolde let hym go home father house ionathas made couenaunt dauid bycause loued hym owne soule ionathas put owne co • te vpon hym gaue dauid therto cloke swerde bowe gyrdle dauid went whyther soeue • saul sent hym behaued hym selfe wyselye saul set hym ouer men war accepted syght al people syght saul seruaūtes happened went dauid returned frō slaughter philistine woman came cityes israel syngyng daunsyng agaynst kyng saul tymbrels wt • oy instrumentes musyke woman answered one theyr play sayde 1 reg 〈◊〉 〈◊〉 saul hath slayne thousand dauid x saul excedyng wroth saynge dyspleased hym sayd haue ascribed vnto daiud ten thousande thousande haue saue kyngdome wherfore saul loked asyde dauid daye forwarde happened morowe euyll spirite sente god came vpon saul ☞ prophesyed myddes house dauid played hande lyke tymes iauelyn sauis hande saul • oke iauelyn sayd wyl nayle dauid wall dauid auoyded presence two tymes saul afrayde dauid bycause lorde hym departed saul therfore saul put hym hym made captayn ouer thousande ☞ went people dauid behaued hym selfe wysely wayes lorde hym wherfore saul sawe excedyng wyse afrayd hym israel iuda loued dauid bycause went saul sayde dauid beholde eldest doughter merob wyl gyue wyfe onely play man fyghte lordes battayles saul thought myne hande shall vpon hym hande philistine dauid answered saule lyfe kynred father israel shulde son lawe kynge howbeit whē tyme come moreb saul doughter shulde haue bene gyuen dauid gyuen vnto adriel meholothite wyfe beit michol saul doughter loued dauid shewed saul thyng dyspleased hym saul sayd wyll gyue hym may snare hym hand philistynes maye agaynst hym wherfore saul sayd dauid thou shalte day son law doughter saul cōmaunded seruauntes comen with▪ dauid secretly say beholde kyng hath fauoure seruauntes loue therfore kynges sonne lawe saul seruauntes spake wordes eares dauid dauid sayde semeth lyght thyng kynges sonne lawe poore man small reputacion seruauntes brought saule worde agayne sayenge maner spake dauid saul sayd wyse shall ye say dauid king careth none dowry hundred foreskynnnes philistine auenged kingꝭ enemyes saul thought make dauid fal handes philistine seruauntes tolde dauid wordꝭ pleased dauid wel kynges son lawe ☞ dayes expyred dauid arose men went slue philistine cc men dauid broughte theyr foreskynnes satisfied kyng therof sonne lawe •• reg 〈◊〉 • wherfore saul gaue hym michol doughter wyfe saul sawe vnderstode howe lorde dauid michol doughter loued hym afrayde dauid saul became alway dauids enemy lordes philistine vsed ☞ go forth fortuned went forth dauid behaued hym selfe wyselyer thē al seruauntes saul name moche set ¶ saul cōmaundeth flee dauid micholl wyfe saueth hym capi xix saul spake ionathas sonne seruauntes shulde kyll dauid • regū 〈◊〉 • ionathas saul sonne great fauour dauid ionathas tolde dauid saynge saul father gothe aboute fley therfore take hede thy selfe vntyll mornyng abyde secret place hyde thy selfe wyl go stande father felde thou art wyll comen father soeuer se wyll tell ionathas spake good dauid vnto saul father sayde vnto hym let kynge syn agaynst seruaunt dauid hath synned agaynst workes haue ben toward good dyd ☞ put •• di • ii • psal 〈◊〉 • lyfe hande slue philistine lorde brought passe great helth al israel thou sawest thou reioysed wherfore wylte thou syn agaynst innocent bloode sley daiud without cause saul herkened vnto voyce ionathas sware truely lorde lyueth shal dye ionathas called dauid shewed hym wordes brought dauid saul presence tymes past war began agayn dauid wente foughte philistine slue great slaughter fled hym euyll spirite sent lorde vpon saul sat house hauynge iauelyn hande dauid played hande saul entended nayle dauid wall iauelyn ryd hym selfe saul presence smote speare ❀ vvith vayne stroke wall dauid fled saued nyght saul also sent messenger vnto dauyds house watche hym sley hym mornyng michol dauyds wyfe tolde hym saynge thou saue thy selfe nyght morow thou wylte sleyne micholl iosua ii c actes ix let dauid downe thorowe wyndowe went fled saued toke ymage layde bed put pyllowe stuffed gootꝭ heere vnder heade couered cloth saul sent messenger fetch dauid sayd sycke saul sent messenger agayne se dauid sayenge brynge hym bed may sley hym whē messenger came beholde lay ymage bed pyllow gootes heere vnder head saul sayde micholl hast thou mocked sent away myne enmye escaped michol answered saul sayde vnto let go el wyll kyll dauid fled escaped came samuel rama tolde hym saul done hym samuel went dwelte ☞ naioth one tolde saul sayenge beholde dauid naioth rama saul sente messenger fet dauid whē saw company ☞ prophetes prophesyenge samuel standyng fast spirite god fell vpon messenger saul prophesyed tolde saul sent messenger prophesyed likewyse saul sent messenger yet agayne thyrde tyme prophesyed also went hym selfe rama came great well sechu asked sayde samuell dauid one sayde beholde naioth rama went thyther euen naioth rama spirite god came vpon hym also wente prophesyenge vntyll came naioth rama stripte clothes prophesyed samuel lyke maner ☞ fell naked day al nyght regū ix c therof saye saul also amonge prophetes ¶ dauid complayneth vnto ionathas capi xx dauid fledde naioth whiche rama came sayde ionathas haue done wherin faultie synne haue cōmytted thy father seketh lyfe sayde vnto hym god forbyd thou shalte dye beholde father wyll nothynge eyther great small wyll shewe howe shulde father hyde thynge wyll dauid sware agayne sayde thy father knoweth haue founde ☞ grace thyne eye therfore saythe ionathas shall knowe lest sorye dede euen truely lorde lyueth truely thy soule lyueth step bytwene death sayd ionathas vnto dauid soeuer thy soule desyreth wyll vnto dauid sayd vnto ionathas beholde morowe begynnyng ☞ moneth shulde syt kynge meate let go maye hyde selfe feldes vnto thyrde day euen thy father speake say dauid asked leaue myght go bethleem owne citye holden yerely feast kynred yf say well done thy seruaunt shall haue peace yf angrye sure wyckednesse vtterly concluded hym thou shalte shewe mercye vnto thy seruaunt 〈…〉 thou hast made thy seruaunt bonde lorde notwithstandynge yf trespasse slee thy selfe brynge thy father ionathas answered god kepe ❀ neyther possible come passe yf knowe wyckednesse concluded father come vpon thynkest thou shulde tel sayde dauid shall tell yf thy father answere cruelly ionathas sayd vnto dauid come let v go • felde wente bothe felde ionathas sayde vnto dauid lorde god israel loke haue groped father mynde one tyme within thre dayes stand wel dauid sende vnto shew lorde vnto ionathas yf father haue pleasure euyll wyl shewe also sende awaye thou mayst go peace lorde hath bene father thou shalt performe vnto mercy lorde onely whyle lyue euen deade plucke thy mercy awaye ☞ house euer lorde hath destroyed enemyes dauid euery one face earth ionathas made bonde house dauid desyrynge lorde shulde seke handꝭ dauids enemyes yf broken wordꝭ dyd ionathas sweate vnto dauid bycause loued hym loued owne soule sayde ionathas dauid morowe fyrste daye moone thou shalt myssed bicause place thou wast wonte syt shall emptye therfore daye thre dayes come downe wyse vnto place thou dyddest hyde thy selfe ☞ busynes hande euen stoone esell wyl shute thre arowes one syde therof though shot marke wyll sende lad byd hym go seke arowes yf say vnto lad se arowes syde bryng come thou peace hurte sure lorde lyueth yf say vnto lad behold arowes beyonde go peace forthe lorde hath sente awaye touchynge whiche thou haue spoken beholde ☞ lorde bytwene euer dauid hyd selfe felde newe moone come kynge sat hym downe eate meate kynge sat hym downe olde maner seate wall ionathas arose abner sat saul syde dauids place emptye neuerthelesse saull sayde nothynge daye thought thyng hath chaunced hym cleyne morowe second day new moone appened dauids place emptye agayne saull sayde vnto ionathas sonne wherfore cōmeth sonne isai meate neyther yesterday day ionathas answered vnto saull dauid asked lycence go bethleem sayde let go praye oure kynred doth holde offerynge citye brother hath sent therfore yf haue founde fauoure thyne eye let go se brother cause cōmeth vnto kynges table saull angrye ionathas sayde vnto hym thou wycked rebell knowe thou hast chosen son isai vnto thyne owne rebuke vnto rebuke shame thy mother longe son isai lyueth vpō earth thou shalt stablyshed yet thy kyngdom wherfore nowe sende fet hym vnto regū ii reg chylde death ionathas answered vnto saull father sayde hym wherfore shulde dye hath done saul lyfte vp speare hyt hym wherby ionathas wyst well vtterlye determyned father sley dauid ionathas arose table great anger dyd eate meat second daye moneth sory dauid bycuse father done hym shame nexte mornynge ionathas went felde tyme appoynted dauid lytle lad hym sayde vnto boye run seke myne arowes whiche shute boye ran shot arowe beyonde hym ladde come place whyther ionathas shot arow ionathas cryed lad saydens arowe beyonde ionathas cryed lad agayne make spede stande styll ionathas lad gathered vp arowes came mayster lad wyst nothynge matter ionathas dauid wyst ionathas gaue wepons vnto lad hym sayd vnto hym go carye towne soone lad gone dauid arose place toward south fell face grounde worshypped thre tymes kyssed eyther wepte togyther longe tyll dauid exceded wepynge ionathas sayd dauid go peace thyngꝭ haue sworne v name lorde sayenge lorde bytwene bytwene thy seed myne let stand euer rose departed ionathas went towne ¶ dauid fleeth nob ahimelech preest getteth hym shew breade satisfye hunger afterwarde fleeth kynge achis feyneth hym selfe mad capi xxi came dauid nob ahimelech preest ahimelech stonied sodayne cōmynge dauid sayde vnto hym arte thou alone man dauid sayde ahimelech preest kynge hath cōmaūded certayne thyng hath sayd vnto let man knowe aboute sende haue cōmaunded haue appoynted seruaūtes soch soche place nowe therfore yf yu • aught vnder thyne hande regū 25 • udi vi • gyue fyue loues breade commeth hande preest answered dauid sayde comen breade vnder hande halowed breade yf yonge men haue kept selues vncleane woman dauid answered preest sayde vnto hym trueth woman hath ben locked vp v aboute thre dayes came ☞ vessel yonge men holy howe ☞ waye vnpure howe muche shall holynesse vyssell leuit 24 b math xii preest gaue hym halowed bread none breade saue shew breades taken frō lorde put freshe bread daye taken awaye daye certayne man seruaūtes saull abydynge lorde named doeg edomite cheyfest saul heerde men dauid sayd vnto ahimelech vnder thyne hande eyther speare swerde haue neyther brought swerde harnesse bycause kyngꝭ busynes required hast preest sayde swerde goliath philistine whome thou sluest oke valeye beholde wrapt cloth behynde ephod yf thou wylte take take none saue dauid sayd none gyue dauid arose fled daye presence saull went achis kynge geth seruauntes achis sayd dauid kyng lande dyd synge vnto daunces saynge 1 reg 1 • b xxix c saul hath sleyne thou sande dauid x dauid put wordꝭ herte sore afrayd achis kynge geth chaūged speche feyned hym selfe mad theyr handes scrabled dores gate let spattell fall downe vpon bearde sayde achis vnto seruauntes lo ye se man besyde selfe wherfore haue ye brought haue nede mad men ye haue brought felowe play mad man presence shall come house ¶ doeg betrayeth dauid ahimelech accused treson sleyne lxxxiiii preestes moo hym bycause receyued dauid nob destroyed saull abiathar fleeth dauid capi xxii dauid therfore
