departed thence escaped came vnto caue odollam brother also al father house herde went downe thyther hym gathered vnto hym men cōbraunce det troubled theyr myndes became captayne ouer vpon iiii • men dauid went thence mizpa lande moab sayd vnto kynge moab let father mother pray ☞ come forth vnto tyll knowe god wyl brought kynge moab dwelte hym whyle dauid kept hym selfe holde prophet gad sayde vnto dauid abyde holde departe go lande iuda dauid departed came forest hareth saul herde dauid come abrode also men hym saull sat gibea vnder tree rama hauynge speare hande al men stode saull sayd vnto seruaūtes stoode hym heare praye ☞ ye sonnes iemini wyll son isai gyue euery one feldes vineyerdes make captaynes ouer thousandes ouer hundred ye haue also conspyred agaynst none telleth myne eare 1 regū 〈◊〉 • xx son hath made bonde wt son isai none mourneth sheweth myne eate beholde son hath styrred vp seruaunt laye awayte agaynst daye answered doeg edomite whiche also stode seruauntes saull sayde sawe son isai came nob ahimelech son ahitob whiche asked counsayle lorde hym gaue hym vyttayles swerde goliath philistine also kynge sent called ahimelech preest son ahitob father house saye preestes nob came kyng saull sayd heare nowe thou son ahitob answered lorde saull sayde vnto hym haue ye cōspyred agaynst thou son isai thou hast gyuen hym vyttayle swerde hast asked consayle god shuld aryse agaynst laye awayte day ahimelech answered kynge sayd faythfull amonge thy seruaūtes dauid therto kynges son lawe goeth thy byddynge honoure thyne house haue daye begon fyrst aske counsayle god hym far let kynge put soch thynge vnto seruaūt house father thy seruaunte knewe nothynge eyther lesse kynge sayde thou shalte surelye dye ahimalech thou thy father house kynge sayde vnto fate men stode aboute hym turne sley preestes lorde bothe bycause theyr hande dauid bycause knew dauid fled shewed seruauntes kynge wolde moue theyr handꝭ fal vpon preestꝭ lorde kynge sayde doeg turne thou fall vpon preestes doeg edomite turned ran vpon preestes slewe day lxxx v person dyd weare lynnen ephod nob citye preestes smote wt edge swerde men woman chyldren sucklynges ox ass shepe one sonnes ahimelech son ahitob named abiathar escaped fled dauid abiathar shewed dauid saull sleyne lordes preestꝭ dauid sayde vnto abiathar wyst day whē doeg edomite wolde tell saull cause death soulꝭ thy father house abyde thou feare yf man seke soule shall seke thyne also thou shalte sauegarde ¶ dauid fleeth wylldernes ziph capi xxiii tolde dauid sayenge beholde philistine fyght agaynst keilah spoyle barnes therfore dauid asked lord aduyse saynge shall go smyte philistine lorde answered vnto dauid go smyte philistine saue keilah dauids men wt hym sayd vnto hym se afrayd iuda howe muche yf come keilah agaynst hoost philistine dauid asked lorde agayne lorde answered hym sayde aryse go downe keilah wyll delyuer philistine thyne hande dauid men went keilah fought philistine droue awaye theyr cattell smote great slaughter dauid saued enhabyters keilah chaunced abiathar son ahimelech fled dauid keilah brought ephod hande tolde saul dauid come keilah saull sayd god hath delyuered hym myne hande shut come towne hath gate barres saull called people togither war go downe keilah beseyge dauid men dauid hauynge knowledge saull ymagened myscheyfe agaynst hym sayde abiathar preest • regū 30 • brynge ephod sayde dauid lorde god israell thy seruaūt hath herde saull aboute come agaynst keilah destroye citye sake wyll men keilah delyuer hande wyll saull come downe thy seruaunt hath herde saye lorde god israell tell thy seruaunt lorde sayde wyll come downe sayde dauid wyll men keilah delyuer men hand saul lorde sayde wyll betraye dauid men whiche vpon sixe hūdred arose departed keilah went whyther coulde tolde saull dauid fled keilah let iourney alone dauid abode wyldernesse stronge holdes remayned mountayne wyldernesse ziph saull sought hym euery daye god delyuered hym hande dauid sawe saull come seke lyfe dauid wyldernesse ziph thycket ionathas saul son arose went dauid thycket conforted hand god sayd vnto hym feare hande saull father shall fynde thou shalt kyng ouer israell must ne • te vnto doth saul father know 1 reg 〈◊〉 • ▪ 〈◊〉 b made bonde bothe togyther lorde dauid taryed styll thicket ionathas went house came ziphites saull gibea sayenge dothe dauid hyde selfe fast v strong holdes thycket hyll hachila ryght syde wyldernesse nowe therfore kynge yu mayest come downe accordynge lust thy soule come downe parte shall delyuer hym kyngꝭ hande saul sayd blessyd ye lorde ye haue cōpassyon go praye ordre matter well knowe se haunte foote hath ben hath sene hym tolde subtyl worketh craftly se therfore knowe lurkynge place hydeth hym selfe come ye agayne certeyntye wyl go yf lande wyll serche hym thorowout thousandꝭ iuda▪ arose went ziph saull dauid men wyldernesse maon playne ryght hande iesymon saull also men went seke tolde dauid wherfore went vnto rocke abode wyldernesse maon saul herde folowed dauid wyldernesse maon saull men went one syde mountayne dauid men syde dauid toke thought howe get saull saull men cōpassed dauid men rounde aboute take came messenger saull sayenge hast come philistine come lande wherfore saul returned persecutyng dauid went agaynst philistine therfore called place rocke separacion dauid went thence dwelte stronge holdes engadi ¶ dauid fleeth engadi hydeth hym • • au • saull • ōmeth thy thee • •• mente capi xxiiii saull come agayne folowynge philistine fortuned tolde hym sayenge beholde dauid wyldernesse engadi saul toke▪ iii chosen men israell went seke dauid men heygth rockꝭ wylde gootes remayne came flockes shepe waye saull went caue ☞ couer feete dauid men remayned inwarde partes caue men dauid sayde vnto hym se day come whiche lorde sayde vnto beholde wyll delyuer thy enemyes thyne hande thou shalte hym shal seme good thy syght dauid arose cut lap saul garment pryuelye immediatly ☞ dauids herte smote hym bycause cut lap saul garment sayd vnto men lorde kepe doyng thyng vnto mayster lordꝭ anoynted lay myne hande vpon hym seynge anoynted lorde ❀ truely lorde lyueth excepte lorde smyte hym excepte day come yf go doune vvar perysshe lorde mercyfull vnto lay hande vpon lordes anoynted dauid kepte seruauntes wordes suffered ryse agaynst saull saull rose vp caue went awaye dauid also arose went caue cryed saull saynge lorde kynge saull loked behynde hym dauid •• owped earth bowed hym selfe sayde saull wherfore gyuest thou care mennes wordes saye dauid seketh euyll agaynst beholde daye thyne eye haue sene howe lorde delyuered daye myne hande caue bad kyll cōpassyon sayde wyll laye handes mayster lordes anoynted moreouer father beholde se yet lap thy garment hande moche kylled cut lap thy garment understande therfore se neyther euyll wyckednesse haue synned agaynst yet y• huntest soule take lorde iudge bytwene lorde aduenge myne hande vpō accordyng olde prouerbe sayeth wyckednes procedeth wycked myne hande vpō whome kynge israell come whome doest yu moue persecucion ☞ dead dog flee lorde iudge iudge bytwene se pleate cause aduenge thyne hand dauid made ende speakynge wordes saull saull sayde reg 〈…〉 thy voyce son dauid saul lyfte vp voyce wept sayde dauid thou arte ryghtous yu hast rewarded wt good haue rewarded euyl thou hast shewed daye howe yu hast delte louynglye moche lorde locked thyne handꝭ thou kylledst shal fynde enemye let departe good way wherfore lorde rewarde good yu hast done vnto day behold wote well thou shalt kyng kyngdom israell shal stablysshed thyne hand sweare therfore vnto lorde thou shalte destroye seede thou shalte put name father house dauid ☞ sware vnto saull saull went home dauid men gat vp vnto holde samuel dyeth dauid fleeth wylder • ne pharan capi xxv 〈…〉 samuell dyed israelite gathered togyther lamented hym buryed hym owne house rama dauid arose gat hym wyldernesse pharan man maon whose possessyon carmell man excedyng myghtye iii shepe thousand gootes shearynge shepe carmell name man naball name wyfe abigaill woman god wyt bewtyfull man churlyshe shrewed condicions kynred caleb dauid herde wyldernesse naball dyd sheare shepe dauid sent ten yonge men sayde vnto get vp carmell go naball grete hym name thus shall ye saye peace peace thyne house peace vnto thou hast behold haue herde say thou hast shearer thy shepherd v ❀ vvyldernesse dyd spyte neyther ought ❀ flocke myssyng vnto whyle carmel aske thy laddes wyll shewe wherfore let yonge men fynde fauoure thyne eye come good ceason • reg 〈◊〉 • gyue praye whatsoeuer cōmeth thyne hande vnto thy seruaūtes thy son dauid dauids yonge men came tolde naball al wordes name dauid helde theyr peace naball answered dauids seruaūtes sayde dauid son isai plentye seruauntes nowe dayes breake awaye euery men mayster shall take breade water flesshe haue kylled shearer gyue vnto men wote whence dauids seruauntes turned theyr way •• agayne came tolde al sayenges dauid sayde vnto men gyrde euery man swerde gyrded euery man swerde aboute hym dauid gyrded swerde folowed dauid vpon iiii c men two hundred abode stuffe one laddes tolde abigaill nabals wyfe saynge beholde dauid sent messenger vnto mayster wyldernesse salute hym rayled yet men good vnto v dyd v dysplesure neyther myssed thyng longe conuersant feldes wall defence vnto v nyght day whyle kepyng shepe nowe therfore take hede se thou hast occasyon euyll gyuen agaynst mayster houshold seyng vngracyous speake abigaill made hast toke ii c loues two bottels wyne fyue shepe redye dressed fyue measure parched corne hundred frayles reasennes two hundred topnettes fygges laded ass sayde vnto yonge men go ye beholde come tolde husbande naball nothyng therof rode asse came pryuely downe syde hyll beholde dauid men came downe agaynst met dauid sayd vayne haue kepte felowe hath wyldernesse nought myssed perteyned vnto hym hath quyte euyll good god vnto enemyes dauid yf leaue perteyne hym dawnynge daye thynge ☞ pysseth agaynst walle abigaill sawe dauid hasted lyght asse fell dauid face bowed selfe groūde fell feete sayde let vnhappye dede counted myne lorde let thyne handmayde speake thyne audience heare wordes thy handmayde let lorde ❀ kynge regarde vnthryftye man nabal name ☞ nabal name follye hym thyne handemayde sawe yonge men lorde thou sendedst therfore lord sure lorde lyueth thy soule lyueth lorde hath withholden cōmynge shede bloode withdrewe thyne hande nowe praye god thyne enemyes entende lorde euyll maye naball nowe ☞ blessynge whiche thyne hande mayde hath brought vnto lorde let gyuē vnto yonge men folowe lorde forgyue trespasse thyne handmayde lorde wyl make lorde sute h • use bycause lorde fyghteth battels lorde coulde none euyl founde thy dayes yf man ryse persecute seke thy soule soule lorde shall bounde ☞ bundel lyuyng lorde thy god soules enemyes shal god cast euen mydle slyng lorde shall haue done lorde al good hath promysed shall haue made ruler ouer israell shall decaye vnto discourage herte vnto lorde thou hast shed blode causelesse aduenged thy selfe lorde shall haue delte well lorde thyncke thyne handmayde dauid sayde abigaill blessed lorde god israell whiche sente daye mete blessyd thy saynge blessyd arte thou whiche hast kepte day cōmyng shed blood aduengyng selfe myne owne hande dede sure lorde god israell lyueth hath kepte backe hurtynge excepte thou haddest hasted met thynkest thou ben lefte vnto naball dawnynge daye pysser agaynst wall dauid receyued hande whiche brought hym sayde go vp peace thyne house behold haue obeyed thy voyce haue accepted thy person abigaill came naball beholde helde feast house lyke feast kyng nabals herte mery within hym dronken wherfore tolde hym nothynge neyther lesse vntyll morowe day mornyng wyne gone naball wyfe tolde hym wordes herte dyed within hym became stone vpon ten dayes lorde smote nabal dyed dauid herde naball deade sayde blessyd lorde hath iudged cause rebuke hande nabal hath kept seruaunt euyll hath recompensed wyckednesse naball vpō owne heade dauid sent cōmen abigaill entent take wyfe seruauntes dauid come abigaill carmell spake vnto sayenge dauid sent v vnto take wyfe arose bowed selfe face arth sayd beholde let thy handmayde seruaunte washe feete seruaūtes lorde abigaill hasted arose gat vp vpon asse fyue damsel went feete went messenger dauid became wyfe dauid also toke ahinoam iesrahell wyues saull gaue ii reg iii • micholl doughter dauids wyfe phalti son lais whiche gallim ¶ saull slepeth tent dauid taketh away speare cruse water stode heade capi xxvi ziphites came vnto saull gibea sayenge doth dauid hyde selfe hyll hachila iesimon saull arose went downe wyldernesse ziph hauynge iii chosen men israell hym seke dauid wyldernesse ziph saull pytched hyll hachila whiche lyeth iesimon waye syde dauid dwelte wyldernesse sawe saull came hym wyldernesse dauid therfore sent spyes vnderstode saull come dede dauid arose came place saull pytched dauid behelde place saull laye abner son ner whiche cheyfe capteyne▪ saul laye within people hooste rounde aboute hym answered dauid spake ahimelech hethite abisai son zaruia brother ioab sayenge wyll go downe wt saull hooste abisai sayde wyll go downe dauid abisai came downe people nyght beholde saull laye slepyng within hoost speare stacke grounde heade abner people laye rounde aboute hym sayde abisai dauid god hath delyuered thyne enemye thyne hand day therfore let smyte hym speare earth wyll smyte hym seconde tyme dauid sayd abisai destroye hym laye hande lordes anoynted gyltlesse dauid sayd furthermore sure lorde lyueth lord shall smyte hym day shal come dye shall descende battayle perish lorde kepe laynge myne hande vpon lordes anoynted take thou nowe speare heade cruse water let v go dauid toke speare cruse water saul heade gat awaye man sawe awaked slepe bycause lorde sent slomber vpon dauid went ouer syde stode top hyll far greate space beynge bytwene dauid cryed peple abner son ner sayenge hearest thou abner abner answerd sayd arte thou ☞ cryest kynge dauid sayde abner arte thou man lyke israell wherfore hast thou kepte thy lorde kynge came one folke destroye kynge thy lorde good thou hast done truly lorde lyueth • reg • 〈◊〉 • ye worthy dye bycause ye haue kepte mayster lordes anoynted nowe se kyngꝭ speare cruse water heade saull knewe dauids voyce sayd • reg • • 4 thy voyce sonne dauid dauid sayde voyce lorde kynge sayde wherfore doth lorde thus persecute seruaūt haue done euyll myne hande nowe therfore let lorde kynge heare wordꝭ seruaunt yf lorde haue styrred vp agaynst let hym smell sauoure sacrifyce yf chyldren men cursed lorde haue cast daye abydyng enheritaunce lorde sayenge hence go serue goddꝭ therfore let bloode fall earth face lorde kyng israell come hunt flee one dothe hunt partrege mountaynes sayd saul haue synned come agayne son dauid wyll harme bycause soule precyous thyne eye daye beholde haue playde foole haue erred excedyngly dauid answered sayde beholde kynges speare let one yonge men come ouer set lorde rewarde euery man accordynge ryghtuousnesse ❀ fayth lorde delyuered hande day wolde lay myne hande vpon lordes anoynted beholde lyke thy lyfe moche set daye myne eye lyfe set eye lorde delyuer tribulacyon saull sayd dauid blessed arte thou sonne dauid ❀ thou shalt doer preuayle dauid went waye saull turned place agayne ¶ dauid ••• eth achis hynge gath capi xxvii dauid sayde herte shall peryshe one daye hande saull therfore nothynge better flee saue selfe lande philistine saull shall cease • ke coostes israell shall escape hande dauid arose syxe hundred men wt hym went vnto achis son mao • h kynge geth dauid dwelt achis geth men euery man wt housholde dauid two wyues ahinoam iezrahelit abigaill nabals wyfe carmell tolde saul dauid fled geth sought hym dauid sayde vnto achis yf haue nowe founde grace thyne eye let gyue place towne feldꝭ may dwell shulde thy seruaunt dwell head citie kingdom achis gaue hym zikleg daye whiche cause zikleg perteyneth vnto kyngꝭ iuda vnto daye tyme dauid dwelt countrey philistine foure monethes certeyne dayes dauid men went vp ran vpon gesurites gerzites amalechites nacions begynnyng enhabytours land men go sur vnto lande egypt dauid smote lande lefte neyther man woman alyue droue awaye shepe ox ass camel clothes returned came achis achis sayd haue ye ben • ouynge daye dauid answered towarde south iuda towarde south iezrahelit • towarde south ☞ kenites dauid saued neyther man woman alyue suffered come geth feare sayeth leest shulde tell v saynge dyd dauid wyll maner whyle dwelleth countrey philistine achis byleued dauid sayenge abhorreth people israell therfore shall seruaunt euer ¶ philistine mone warre agaynst saull whiche seketh alter enchaunter capi xxviii chaunced dayes philistine gathered theyr hoost togyther war fyght israell achis sayde dauid sure thou shalt go battayle thou men wt dauid sayd achis thē thou shalt knowe thy seruaunt achis sayde agayne dauid wyll make keper heade euer • reg • 〈◊〉 • samuell dead israell lamēted hym buryed hym rama owne citye exodi 〈◊〉 • saull put woman spirytes prophesye sothsayers lande philistine gathered togyther came pytched sunem saul gathered israel togyther pytched gilboa saull sawe hooste philistine afrayde herte sore astonyed saull asked counseyle lorde lord answered hym neyther dreames ☞ urim yet prophetes sayd saull vnto seruauntes leuit x •• • seke woman hath spiryte prophesye may go aske seruauntes sayde hym beholde woman hath spiryte prophesye endor saull chaunged hymselfe put rayment went two men hym came woman nyght sayde prophesye vnto spiryte brynge hym vp whome shall name vnto woman sayd vnto hym beholde thou knowest saul hath done hath destroyed woman prophesyenge spirytes sorcerer lande wherfore sekest thou occasion agaynst soule may kyll saull sware lorde saynge surely lorde lyueth shall harme chaūce thyng sayd woman whome shall fetche vp vnto answered brynge vp samuell woman sawe samuell cryed lowde voyce spake saull saynge hast thou deceyued yu arte saul kynge sayd vnto afrayd seest thou woman sayde vnto saull ❀ se goddꝭ ascendyng vp earth sayd vnto agayne fassion answered cōmeth vp olde man mantell vpon hym saull perceyued ☞ samuell stouped face ground bowed hymselfe samuel sayde saull hast thou vnquieted make brought vp saul answered sore encōbred philistinꝭ make war agaynst god departed answereth neyther prophetes neyther dreames therfore haue called yu mayest tell shall sayd samuell wherfore doest thou aske whyle lorde gone frō become thyne enemye truly lorde hath done hymselfe euen ☞ spake hande reg xv f lorde hath rent kyngdome thyne hande gyuen thy neyghbour dauid bycause thou obeyedst voyce lorde executedst fearce wrath vpon amalechites therfore hath lord done vnto daye moreouer lorde wyll delyuer israell handes philistine regū 31 morowe shalte thou thy sonnes lorde shall gyue hoost israell handes philistine saull fell streyght waye flat earth longe sore drede bycause wordes samuell strength eaten bread al day nyght woman came vnto saull sawe sore troubled sayde vnto hym se thyne handmayde hath obeyed thy voyce iudi xii • reg xix • psal • xix ☞ haue put soule hand haue harkened vnto thy wordes whiche thou saydest vnto nowe therfore harken thou also vnto voyce thyne handmayd let set morsell bread thou mayst eate get strength go thy iourneye refused sayde wyll eate seruaūtes woman togyther cōpelled hym herkened vnto theyr voyce arose earth sat hym bed woman fat calfe house hasted kylled toke floure kneded dyd bake swete cakꝭ therof brought saull seruaūtes whē eaten stode vp went awaye nyght ¶ dauid goth kynge achi • fyght agaynst saull capi xxix philistine gathered togyther theyr armyes vnto aphec israelite pytched aim iesrahell lordes philistine went forth wt hundred thousandꝭ dauid men came behynde achis sayde lordes philistine yonder hebrues achis sayde vnto lordes philistine dauid seruaunt saull kynge israell whiche hath ben ☞ dayes yeares haue founde faure hym sence fled vnto vnto daye lordes philistine wroth hym sayde vnto hym make felowe returne maye go agayne place thou hast apoynted hym let hym go downe wt v battayle leest battayle aduersary v wherwith coulde better obteyne fauour mayster heades men dauid sange daūses reg 〈…〉 •••• saull slewe thousand dauid x▪ achis called dauid sayde vnto hym sure lorde lyueth thou hast ben honest good syght thou wentest hoost neyther haue founde euyll sence thou camest vnto daye neuerthelesse lordes philistine fauour wherfore nowe returne go peace thou dysplease lordꝭ philistine dauid sayd vnto achis haue done hast thou founde thy seruaunt longe haue bene vnto day maye go fyght agaynst enmyes lorde kyng achis answered sayde dauid knowe thou arte good art sight angell god notwithstandynge lordes philistine haue sayd let go vp v battayl wherfore aryse vp early mornyng thy maysters seruauntes come ye vp early soone ye haue lyght departe dauid men arose vp early departe mornyng returne lande philistine philistine went vp iezrahel ¶ dauid returnyng kynge achis fyndeth zi • leg burnt capi xxx dauid men come zikleg thyrde daye amalekites russhed vpō south vpon zikleg smytten zikleg burnt wt fyre taken woman therin prysoners small great siue man saue caryed went theyr wayes dauid men came citie beholde burnt fyre theyr wyues theyr sonnes theyr doughters caryed away dauid people hym lyft vp theyr hoyces wepte vntyll coulde wepe dauids two wyues taken prisoner also ahinoam iezraelite abigall wyfe nabal carmelite dauid shrewde combraunce people entended stone hym bycause hertꝭ al people vexed theyr sonnes theyr doughters dauid toke good courage hym lorde god reg •• • 3 b sayd abiathar preest ahimelechs sonne pray bryng ephod abiathar brought ephod dauid dauid asked counsayle lorde saynge shall folow companye shall ouertake answered hym folow thou shalte ouertake recouer praye dauid vi c men hym went came ryuer besor parte abode dauid iiii c men folowed ii c abode behynde beynge wery go ouer ryuer besor founde egypcian felde brought hym dauid • rouer 25 c gaue hym breade eate water drynke gaue hym fewe fygges two cluster reasens eaten spirite came agayne hym eaten bread dronke water thre dayes thre nyghtes dauid sayd vnto hym belongest thou whence arte thou sayd yonge man egypte seruaunt amalekite mayster left behynde bycause thre dayes agone fell sycke came rouynge vpon south chretus agaynst iuda towarde south caleb burnt zikleg wt fyre dauid sayd vnto hym canst thou brynge companye sayde swere vnto god thou wylte neyther kyll delyuer handes mayster wyll brynge companye brought hym thyther beholde laye scattered abrode vpon earthe eatyng drynkyng daunsyng bycause plenteous great praye caried away lande philistine lande iuda dauid layd vpon euen vntyll twylyght morowe escaped man saue foure hundred yong men whiche rode away vpon camel fled dauid recouered amalekites caryed awaye dauid rescued two wyues person lackyng small great sonne doughter spoyle taken awaye dauid recouered agayne dauid toke shepe ox draue ca •• el sayde dauids pray daui • came ii c men werye folowe dauid made also abyde ryuer besor came mete dauid people hym dauid came people saluted answered wycked vnthryftes men went dauid sayd bycause went wt v therfore wyll gyue none pray haue recouered let euery man take wyfe chyldren let cary away walkyng sayde dauid ye shal • brother whiche lorde hath gyuen v hath preserued v delyuered companye came agaynst v handes shulde hecken vnto matter iosua 〈◊〉 parte goth downe fyghteth shal parte taryeth stuffe may parted alyke day forwarde made statute lawe israel vntyl daye dauid therfore came zikleg sent ❀ gyftes pray vnto elder iuda frendes saynge se blessyng spoyle enemyes lorde▪ sent bethel southe ramoth iathir aroer sephamoth esthemoa rachel city ierhameel cityes kenites horma borasā athach hebron place dauid men wonte haunte saul kylleth hym selfe chyldr • sleyne battell capi xxxi • para • • philistine fought agaynst israel men israel fled away philistine fell downe wounded mount gilboa philistine preased sore vpon saul sonnes slue ionathas abinadab melchusia saul sonnes whē battayle went sore agaynst saul archer wt bowes found hym sore afrayde archer sayde saul vnto harnes berer iudi ix • • para x draw thy swerde thrust thorow therwith lest vncircumcised come thrust thorow make mockyng stocke harnes berer wolde sore afrayde saul toke swerde fell vpon harnes berer sawe saul dead fel lykewyse vpon swerde dyed wt hym saul dyed iii sonnes harnes berer al mē day togyther men israell syde valey syde iordan herde men israel put flyght saul sonnes deade lefte cityes ran away philistinꝭ came dwelt • para x • morowe whē philistine come spoyle sleyne founde saul iii sonnes lye mounte gilboa cut heade stryped harnes sent land philistine euery syde shuld publishe tēple theyr ydols amōg people layde vp harnes house astharoth hanged vp body wal bethsan ii regū ii inhabitours iabes gilead herde therof philistine done saul arose many strong men wente nyght toke body saul bodyes sonnes wall bethsan came iabes •••• 34 ☞ burnt toke theyr bone buryed vnder tree iabes fasted vii dayes ¶ ende fyrst boke samuel otherwyse called fyrst kyngꝭ ¶ second boke samuel otherwyse called seconde boke kynges ¶ lamentacyon dauid saull ionathas capi primo death saull dauid returned regū 〈◊〉 • slaughter amaleckites bene two dayes zikleg beholde came mā thyrde day hoost saul clothes rent earth vpon head came dauid fell earthe dyd obeysaunce dauid sayde vnto hym whence comest thou sayde vnto hym hoost israell escaped dauid sayde vnto hym chaunced tell sayde people •• ed battayle many people ouerthrowen deade saull ionathas sonne deade also dauid sayd vnto yong man tolde hym thynges knowest thou saul ionathas sonne dead yong man tolde hym answered came chaunce mount gilboa beholde saul leaned vpon speare charettes companyes horse men folowed harde hym loked backe sawe called answered sayde vnto arte thou answered hym amelekite answered vnto agayne stand vpon slee anguyshe come vpon though lyfe yet stode vpon hym slue hym sure coulde lyue ☞ fallen toke crowne vpon heade bracclet arme haue brought hyther vnto lorde dauid toke holde clothes ii reg 〈◊〉 x ••• rent dyd al men hym mourned wepte fasted vntyll euen saul ionathas son people lorde house israel bycause ouerthrowen swerde dauid sayd vnto yong man brought hym tydynges whence arte thou answered son alyaunt amalekite dauid sayd vnto hym thou wast afrayde lay thyne hande lordes anoynted destroye hym dauid called one yonge men sayde go run vpon hym smote hym dyed thē sayd dauid vnto hym thy blood vpon thyne owne heade math • • c • xix thyne owne mouth hath testified agaynst saynge haue sleyne lordes anoynted dauid mourned lamentacion ouer saul ouer ionathas son bad teache chyldren israel ☞ vse bowe beholde wrytten boke ryghteous ❀ sayde consyder israell deade vvounded vpon thy hygh hylles ☞ noble israel wounded sleyne vpon thy hylles oh howe myghtye ouerthrowen ••• e tell gath publysshe streetes askalon lest doughters philistine reioyse lest doughters vncircumcised triumph ye mountaynes gilboa vpon neyther dewe rayne ☞ vpon feldes offerynges shelde myghtie cast downe shelde saull thoughe bene anoynted oyle bow ionathas swerde saul turned neuer backe agayne emptie blood sleyne fat myghtye warryours saul ionathas louely pleasaūt theyr lyues theyr deathes deuyded swyfter egles stronger lyon ye doughters israel wepe ouer saull whiche clothed purple pleasure hanged ornamentes golde vpon apparell howe myghtye sleyne battayle ionathas deade hygh hylles wo brother ionathas verye kynde hast thou bene vnto thy loue wonderful passyng loue woman ❀ mother loueth onely chylde euen dyd loue oh howe myghtye ouerthrowen weapon warre destroyed ¶ dauid anoynted hebron battayle seruauntes dauid isboseth capi ii fortuned dauid • reg 23 regū 5 • asked counsayle lorde saynge shal go vp city iuda lorde sayde vnto hym go dauid sayde agayne whyther shall go answered unto ebron dauid wente thyther two wyues ahinoam iesraelit abigall nabals wyfe carmelite mē hym dyd dauid cary vp also euery man wt housholde dwelte townes hebron men iuda came anoynted dauid kyng ouer house iuda tolde dauid saynge regū 31 e men iabes gilead buryed saul dauid sent messenger vnto men iabes gilead sayde vnto blessed ye vnto lorde ye haue shewed suche kyndnesse vnto lorde saul haue buryed hym lorde shew mercye truthe vnto wyll also suche kyndnesse ye haue done thynge therfore nowe let handes strong play ye mē mayster saul dead house iuda haue anoynted kyng ouer abner sonne ner captayne saul hoost toke isboseth son saul brought hym mahanaim made hym kynge ouer gilead ouer assurites ouer iesrahel ephraim ben iamin ☞ ouer israel isboseth saul sonne fourtye yere olde began reygne ouer israell reygned two yere house iuda folowed dauid •• reg • • tyme whiche dauid reygned hebron ouer house iuda vii yere syxe monethes abner sonne ner seruauntes isboseth sonne saul wente mahanaim gibeon ioab son zaruia seruauntes dauid went met poole gibeon sat downe one one syde poole syde abner sayd ioab let yong men aryse ☞ play v ioab sayde let aryse arose went ouer twelue ben iamin nombre whiche perteyned isboseth sonne saul twelue seruauntes dauid euery one caught felowe came agaynst hym heade thrust swerde syde fell downe togyther wherfore place called felde myghtye gibeon began excedynge cruel battayle day abner men israell fell seruauntes dauid thre sonnes zaruia ioab abisai asahel asahel lyght foote wylde roo asahel folowed abner gene 24 • turned neyther right hande lefte frō abner abner loked behynde sayd art thou asahel answered yea abner sayde turne eyther ryght hande lefte catche one yonge men take weapon asahel wolde departe hym abner sayd agayne asahel departe fro wherfore shulde smyte grounde able holde vp face ioab thy brother howbeit wolde wyse departe abner hynder ende spere smote hym vnder • regū xx c short rybbes spere came behynde hym fell downe place dyed many came place asa hell fel downe dyed stode styll ioab also abisai folowed abner son went downe come hyll ama lyeth giah way goeth thorowe wyldernesse gibeon child ben iamin gathered selues togyther heape abner stode top hyl abner called ioab sayde shall swerde deuoure styll euer knowest thou wyll ☞ bitternes latter ende howe longe shall thou byd people returne folowynge theyr brother ioab sayde truely god lyueth ☞ yf thou haddest spokē mornyng people ben departed euery one persecutyng brother • reg xx • ioab blew trompet people stode styl pursued israel neyther foughte abner men walked nyght thorowe playne went ouer iordan past thorowe bethhoron tyll came mahanaim ioab returned persecutyng abner gathered people togyther lacked dauids seruauntes nynetene men asahel seruauntes dauid sleyne ben iamin abners men thre bundred thre score men toke vp asahel buryed hym sepulchre father bethleem ioab men went nyght vntyll dawnynge day came hebron ¶ abner cōmeth dauid bryngeth hym wyse michol ioab kylleth abner capi iii longe war bytwene house saul house dauid dauid waxed stronger stronger houe saul weyker weyker 1 par iii c vnto dauid ❀ syxc chyldren borne hebron eldest sonne also amnon ahinoam iezrahelite seconde cheleab abigail wyfe nabal carmelite thyrde absalom son maachah doughter thalmai kynge gessur fourth adonai son hagith fyfte sephatia sonne abitall syxte iethream egla dauids wyfe borne dauid hebron fortuned whyle warre bytwene house saul house dauid abner helde vp house saul saul concubyne named rizpa doughter ahia isboseth sayde abner wherfore hast thou ☞ gone father cōcubine abner wroth wordes isboseth sayde 1 regū ••• dogges heade whiche agaynst iuda shewe mercy daye vnto house saul thy father brethrē frendes haue delyuered hande dauid thou fyndest faute daye woman rut • ▪ •• god abner lorde hath sworne dauid wyll syde bryng kyngdome frō house saul throne dauid may stablysshed ouer israel ouer iuda euen dan bersabe coulde gyue abner neuer worde answere bycause feared hym abner sent messenger dauid ❀ secretly sayenge whose lande make bonde beholde hande brynge israel vnto sayde good make bonde one thyng requyre thou se face excepte thou fyrst bryng michol saul doughter whē thou comest se dauid sent messenger isboseth saul son sayenge 〈…〉 delyuer wyfe michol maried 〈…〉 hundred foreskynnes philistinꝭ isboseth sent toke husbande 〈…〉 pal • iel son lais husbande went came wepyng behynde tyll came bahurim sayde abner vnto hym go returne returned abner cōmunicacion wt elder israell sayenge ye sought dauid tymes past myght hynge nowe lorde hath sayde dauid hande seruaunt dauid wyll saue people israel handes philistine hande theyr enemyes abner spake eares ben iamin went tel earꝭ dauid hebron israel content hole house ben iamin abner came dauid hebron hauyng twentye men hym dauid made hym men hym feast abner sayde vnto dauid wyll vp go gather israell vnto lorde kynge may make appoyntment thou mayst cōmaunde thyne herre desyreth dauid let abner departe went peace beholde seruauntes dauid ioab came chasynge robber brought great pray abner dauid hebron sent hym away depart peace whē ioab al hoost hym come men tolde ioab sayenge abner sonne ner came kyng • hath sent hym awaye gone peace ioab came kyng sayde hast thou done beholde abner came vnto hast thou sent hym away shuld scape quyte thou knowest abner son ner came deceyue knowe thy goyng goynge know thou doest ioab come oute dauid sent messenger abner whiche brought hym agayne well sira vnknowyng dauid abner come agayne hebron ioab toke hym asyde gate 〈…〉 speake hym secretly smote hym vnder shorte rybbes dyed ☞ blood asahel brother whē afterwarde • came dauids eare sayde kyngdome gyltlesse lorde euer concernyng blood abner son ner let blood remayne head ioab father house house ioab neuer without one▪or hath runnyng issue leper leaneth staffe doth fal swerde lacketh bread cause ioab abisai slue abner abner 〈…〉 sleyne theyr brother asahel gibeō battayle dauid sayd ioab people wt hym 〈…〉 b rent clothes put sacke cloth mourne abner kyng dauid hym selfe folowed corse buried abner hebron kyng lyft vp voyce wepte besyde sepulchre abner dyd people kynge lamented ouer abner sayde ☞ dyed abner foole dyeth thy handes bounde thy feete brought cheynes man falleth wycked chyldren fellest thou al people wepte yet ouer hym whē al people came eate meate dauid whyle yet daye dauid sware saynge god me▪ yf tast breade ought el tyl son downe people wyst pleased soeuer kyng dyd pleased people people israell vnderstode day kynges dede abner son ner sleyne kyng sayd vnto seruauntes knowe ye howe lorde great man fallen day israell day tender anoynted kyng men sonnes zaruia harde lorde rewarde doer euyll accordyng wyckednesse ¶ baanath rechab slue isboseth son saul capi iiii saul sonne herde abner dead hebron handes feble al israelite afrayde saul sonne two men captaynes ouer souldiours one called baanah rechab sonnes rimmon berothite chyldren ben iamin beroth rekened ben iamin berothites fled g •• thiam soiourned vntyll tyme 〈…〉 ionathas saul sonne sonne lame feete fyue yere olde tydynges came saul ionathas israel nurse toke hym vp • ed away made hast f • e childe fell began halte name miphiboseth sonnes rimmon berothite rechab baana went came heete day house isboseth whiche slepte bed noone ❀ vvoman vvas keper dore clensed vvheat vvas slepe came myddꝭ house ❀ though wolde haue fetched wheate rechab baana brother smote vnder short rybbes fled came house slept bed resting cham smote hym slue hym beheaded hym toke heade gat away thorowe playne nyght brought heade isboseth vnto dauid hebron sayd kynge beholde head isboseth saul sonne thyne enemye sought thy lyfe lorde hath aduenged lorde kynge day saul seede dauid answerd rechab baana brother sonnes rimmon berothite sayde vnto 1 reg 〈◊〉 b surely lorde lyueth whiche hath delyuered soule aduersities one 11 regū •• tolde sayd saul dead thynkyng haue brought good tydynges caughte hym slue hym zikleg thought wolde haue gyuen hym rewarde tydynges bryngynge howe moche wycked men haue sleyne ryghteous person owne house vpon bed shal requyre blood hande take earth dauid cō maunded yonge men slue cut theyr handes fete hanged vp ouer poole hebron toke heade isboseth buryed sepulchre ii reg iii f abuer hebron ¶ dauid yet agayne anoynted kynge taketh arke sion capi v came trybes israell para x dauid vnto hebron sayd beholde thy bone thy flesshe tyme past saul kyng thou leddest israel lorde hath sayde thou shalte fede people israell thou shalte captayne ouer israell elder israell came ii reg ii • kynge hebron kynge dauid made couenaunt hebron lorde anoynted dauyd kynge ouer israell dauid thyrtie yere olde whē began reygne reygned xl yere hebron reygned ouer iuda seuen yere syxe monethes ierusalem reygned thyrtye thre yeres ouer israel iuda kynge also men wente ierusalem vnto iebusites enhabitours lande whiche spake vnto dauid sayenge ☞ excepte thou take away blynde lame thou shalte come hyther sayde thou arte able come hyther neuerthelesse dauid toke stronge holde sion citye dauid dauid sayde daye soeuer smyteth iebusites getteth vp gutter house smyteth lame blynde hate ☞ dauids soule leuit xx • wherfore sayd blynde lame shal come house dauid dwelte towre called citye dauid buylte rounde aboute millo inwarde dauid prospered grewe lorde god hoostes hym hiram kynge tire sente messenger dauid cedar tree carpenter mason walles buylte dauid house dauid perceyued lorde stablysshed hym kyng ouer israel exalted kyngdom people israel sake dauid toke hym mo concubine wyues ierusalem come hebron mo sonnes doughters yet borne dauid pat ii • • name sonnes borne vnto hym ierusalem sāmua sobab nathan salomon iibhar also elisua nepheg iaphia elisama eliada eliaphalet whē philistine herde anoynted dauid kyng ouer israel came vp seke dauid soone dauid herde gat hym holde▪ philistine came layde along valey raphaim dauid1 reg 〈…〉 2 reg 〈…〉 asked counsayle lorde saynge shall go vp philistine wylte thou delyuer handes lorde answered vnto dauid go vp wyll delyuer philistine thy handes dauid came playne perazim smote sayd lorde hath deuyded myn enemyes asundre water deuided asundre therfore name place called playne perazim lefte theyr ymages dauid men toke vp philistine came yet agayne • layde selues valey rephaim dauid asked lorde ❀ shall go vp agaynst philistynes vvylt thou delyuer hande answered thou shalte go vp compasse backesyde come vpon ouer agaynst peretrees whē thou herest noyse thyng goyng top peretrees remoue shall lorde go smyte hoost philistine dauid dyd lorde commaunded hym smote philistine geba vntyll thou come gazer ¶ arke brought forth house abinadab uza stryken dyeth dauid daun • eth therfore despysed wyfe mithol capi vi agayne dauid gathered togyther chosen men israell euen thyrtye thousande arose wente folke hym men iuda fet ☞ away thence arke god whose name called name lorde hoostes dwelleth vpon bytwene cherubyns put arke god vpon newe carte brought 〈…〉 house abinadab gibea uza ahio sonnes abinabab draue newe carte brought house abinadab gibea wt arke god ahio went arke dauid house israel playde lorde sundrye instrumentes made cedre wood harpes psaltery tymbrelles fedyls symbals came nachons thresheynge floore uza put hande arke god helde ox stombled lorde wroth uza god smote hym place ☞ faulte dyed arke god dauid dyspleased bycause lorde smytten uza name place called renfynge uza vntyl day dauid afrayde lorde sayde howe shall arke lorde come dauid wolde bryng arke lorde vnto hym citye dauid dauid caryed house obeth edom gethite arke lorde contynued house 〈◊〉 1 • obeth edom gethite thre monethes lorde blessed obeth edom al housholde one tolde kynge dauid lorde blessed house obeth edom perteyned vnto hym bycause arke god dauid wente brought arke god house obeth edom citie dauid gladnes ❀ vvere vvich dauid vii sortes dauncers calues sacrifyce bare arke lorde gone syxe space offred axe fat shepe dauid ❀ played harpe strynges daunsed lorde al myght gyrded lynnen ephod dauid house israell brought arke ❀ couenaunt lorde showtyng trompet blowynge fortuned arke lorde came citye dauid michol saul doughter loked thorowe wyndew saw kynge dauid sprynge daunce lorde despysed hym herte brought arke lorde set place euen myddes tabernacle dauid pytched dauid offered burntofferynges peace offerynges lorde soone dauid made ende offryng burntoffrynges peaceoffrynges blessed people name lorde hoostꝭ gaue amonge folke euen among hole multitude israell well woman men euery one cake bread pece flesshe flacket drynke al peple departed euery one house dauid returned ☞ blesse houshold michol doughter saul came mete dauid sayd howe glorious kyng israel day vncouered daye eye maydens seruauntes yf ben lyght brayned felowe vncouered dauid sayd vnto michol thoughe daunce lorde chose rather thy father kyn cōmaunded ruler ouer people lorde euen ouer israel therfore wyll playe lorde wyll yet vyle wyl meke myne owne syght mayde seruauntes whiche thou hast spoken shal honour therfore michol doughter saul chylde vnto day death ¶ dauid wolde buylde god house forbydden god capi vii fortuned kynge sat house lorde gyuen hym rest rounde aboute enemyes sayd vnto nathan prophet beholde dwell nowe house cedar tree ☞ arke god dwelleth within curteyne nathan sayde vnto kynge go thyne herte lorde fortuned nyghte worde lorde came vnto nathan saynge go tell seruaunt dauid thus sayth lorde shalte thou buylde house dwell haue dwelte house synce tyme brought chyldrē israel egypt vnto day haue walked tent tabernacle al place wherin haue walked chyldren israell spake one worde tribe israell ☞ synce cōmaunded iudgis fede people israel sayenge buylde ye house cedar tree nowe therfore saye vnto seruaunt dauid thus sayth lorde hoostes 1 reg xvi▪ toke shepe coote thou waste folowynge shepe thou myghtest ruler ouer people israell thou wentest haue destroyed thyne enemyes thy syghte haue made great name lyke vnto name greate men worlde therfore wyll appoynte place people israell wyll plante maye dwelle place theyr owne moue neyther shall wycked people trouble dyd begynnynge synce tyme set iudges ouer people israell wyl gyue rest thyne enemyes lorde telleth wyll make house thy dayes fulfylled thou shalte ☞ slepe thy father wyll set vp thy seede whiche shall pracede thy body wyll stablysshe kyngdom 11 reg v psal 132 shall buylde house name wyll stablysshe seate kyngdom foreuer •• bru • b wyll father shall son 111 reg 〈◊〉 • psal 89 synne wyll chasten hym ☞ suche rod men chastened suche plage chyldren men plaged mercye shall departe awaye hym toke saull put downe thyne house thy kyngdom shall endure without ende iere 33 • thy seate shall stablysshed foreuer accordyng wordes accordynge vision byd nathan speake vnto dauid wente dauid set hym downe lorde sayde lorde god ☞ house thou shuldest haue brought thus far forth yet small thyng thy syght lorde god thou hast spoken also thy seruauntes house great whyle come ☞ ❀ vse mā lorde god dauid say vnto thou lorde god knowest thy seruaunt euen thy wordes sake ☞ accordyng thyne owne herte hast thou done great thynges make knowen vnto thy seruaunt wherfore thou arte great lorde god none lyke deut vii • neyther god saue thou accordynge haue herde eares deut iiii one people earth lyke thy people israel ❀ whose god went delyuered myght people myght make hym name shewe great terrible thyngꝭ earth thy people exodi 14 whiche thou redemedst oute egypte euen people theyr ☞ goddes thou hast ordeyned thy people israell thy people foreuer thou lorde arte become theyr god nowe lorde god worde thou hast spoken concernyng thy seruaunt house make good foreuer thou haste sayd shall thy name magnified foreuer men shall say lorde hoostꝭ god israel house thy seruaunt dauid shall stablysshed thou lorde hoostes god israel hast tolde eare thy seruaunt saynge ❀ wyll buylde house therfore hath thy seruaunt foūde herte pray prayer vnto deui • •• therfore nowe lorde god thou arte god thy worde must true thou hast tolde goodnes vnto thy seruaunt nowe go blesse house thy seruaunt maye contynue foreuer thou lorde god hast spoken thy blessyng shall house thy seruaunt blessed foreuer ¶ dauid ouercōmeth philistine capi viii fortuned dauid smote philistine subdued toke brydell bondage hande philistine num •• smote moabites ☞ measured lyne cast downe grounde ☞ euen two lynes measured slue length one lyne saued lyue became moabites dauids seruauntes payde tribute dauid smote also hadadezar sonne rehob kyng zoba went recouer brother ryuer pherat dauid toke thousand seuen hundred horsmen hoost twentie thousande fote men destroyed charettes reseruynge onely one hundred sirians damascon came socoure hadadezer kyng zoba dauid slue sirians two twentye thousande men put souldyours siria damascon siriens became seruauntes dauid payenge tribute thus lorde saued dauid al went vnto dauid toke sheldes golde belonged seruauntes hadadezer brought ierusalem beta berothai cityes hadadezer dyd dauid brynge excedynge moche brasse ❀ vvherof salomon made brasen vessell temple brasen lauatory pyllers aulter 〈…〉 thoi kyng hamath herde dauid smytten hoost hadadezer sent ioram sonne vnto kyng dauid salute hym peace ☞ blesse hym bycause fought agaynst hadadezer beaten hym thoi great warre wt hadadezer ioram brought hym vessel syluer vessel golde vessel brasse whiche brasse kynge dauid dyd dedicate vnto lorde syluer golde consecrated nacyons whiche subdued sirya moabites chyldren ammō philistine amalek spoyle hadadezer son rehob kynge zoba dauid gat hym name returned smyten siriens valey salte xviii men 〈◊〉 • 4 b put kepers edō euen thorowout al edom put soudyours al edom became dauids seruauntes lorde kept dauid whatsoeuer toke hande dauid reygned ouer israell executed ryght iustice vnto people 1 reg 〈◊〉 b ioab sonne zaruia ouer hooste iehosaphat son ahilud recorder sadoch son ahitob ahimelech son abiathar preestes saraia scrybe ❀ banaiahu son iehoiada ouer ☞ crethites phelethites dauids sonnes cheyfe ruler ¶ dauid restoreth feldes saull miphiboseth sonne ionathas capi ix dauid sayde yet man lefte house saull wyll shewe hym mercye ionathas fake housholde saul seruaunt whose name ziba called hym vnto dauid kynge sayde vnto hym arte thou ziba sayde thy seruaunt kynge sayde remayneth yet man house saull whome maye shewe mercye god vpon ziba answered kynge 1 reg 4 b ionathas hath yet son whiche lame feete kynge sayde vnto hym ziba sayde vnto kynge beholde house machir son amiell lodeber kynge dauid sent fet hym house machir son amiel lodeber nowe miphiboseth son ionathas sonne saull come vnto dauid fell face dyd reuerence kyng sayd miphiboseth answered beholde thy seruaunte dauid sayde vnto hym feare wyll surely shewe kyndnesse ionathas thy father sake wyll restore feldes saull thy father thou shalt eate breade myne owne table contynually bowed hymselfe sayde thy seruaunt thou shuldest vouchesafe loke vpon soche deade dog kynge called vnto ziba saul yonge man sayde vnto hym haue gyuen vnto thy maysters sonne perteyned saull house se therfore thou thy sonnes thy seruauntes tyll lande brynge micha thy maysters sonne maye haue foode cate miphiboseth thy maysters sonne shall eate breade alwaye vpon table ziba fyftene sonnes twentye seruauntes sayde ziba vnto kynge accordynge lorde kynge hath commaunded seruaunte shall thy seruaunt well sayde kynge miphiboseth shal eate vpon table one kynges sonnes miphiboseth son yonge named micha dwelled house ziba serua • ntes vnto miphiboseth miphiboseth dwelt ierusalem dyd eate euer kyngꝭ table 11 reg • • lame bothe feete ¶ messenger dauid vyllaynously • ntreated kynge moab capi x happened kynge chyldren ammon dyed hanon son reygned steade sayde dauid wyll shewe kyndnesse vnto hanon sonne nahas father shewed kyndnesse vnto dauid sent comforte hym hande seruauntes ouer ❀ death father dauids seruauntes came lande chyldren ammon lordes chyldren ammō sayd vnto hanon theyr lorde▪ thynkest thou dauid dothe honour thy father hath sent confortours hath dauid rather sent seruauntes vnto searche citye spye ▪ ouerthrowe wherfore hanon toke dauids seruauntes shaued one halfe euery mannes beerde cut theyr garmentes mydle euen harde buttockes sent away tolde vnto dauid sent mete men excedyngly shamed kynge sayd • arye ierico vntyll beerdes growen • turne chyldren ammō saw stancke syght dauid sent hyred siryans house rehob sirians zoba x • foote men kynge maacha thousand men istob twelue thousande men dauid herde sent ioab al hooste stronge men chyldren ammon came set araye entrynge gate sirians zobah rehob istob maacah themselues felde ioab sawe front battayle agaynst hym behynde chose fresshe yonge men israell put araye agaynst sirians rest people deliuered hande abisai brother might put araye agaynst chyldren ammon sayde yf siryans stronger thou shalte helpe yf chyldren ammon stronge wyll come succoure therfore quyte lyke man let v stande styffe oure people cityes oure god lorde good owne eye ioab proceded forth people hym fyght sirians fled hym chyldren ammon sawe sirians fled fled also abisat entred citye ioab returned chyldren ammon came ierusalem siryans sawe put worse israel gathered togyther hadadezer sent brought sirians beyonde ryuer came theyr armye sobah captayne hooste hadadezer went shewed dauid gathered israel togyther passed ouer iordane came helam sirians set themselues aray agaynst dauid fought hym sirians fled israel dauid destroyed seuen hundred charettes sirians fourtye thousande horseman smote sobah captayne theyr hooste whiche also dyed kynges seruauntes hadadezer sawe put worse israel made peace serued sirians feared helpe chyldren ammon ¶ aduoutry dauid bethsabe wy • e uria uria gyl • fully •• yne capi xi came passe yere expyred tyme kyngꝭ ☞ vse go forth battayle dauid sent ioab seruantes hym israell whiche • par xx destroyed chyldren ammon beseyged raba dauid taryed styll ierusalem chaunced euenynge dauid arose bed walked vpon roofe kynges palace roofe sawe woman exodi • • wasshynge herselfe woman bewtyfull loke vpon sent enquyre woman shulde saynge bethsabe doughter eliam wyfe uria hethite dauid sent messenger fet came vnto hym reu • ti 〈◊〉 • laye ❀ immediatly ☞ purifyed vnclennesse returned vnto house woman conceyued sent tolde dauid sayd chylde dauid sent ioab sayenge sende uria hethite ioab sent uria dauid whē uria come vnto hym dauid demaunded hym howe ioab dyd howe peple fared men war prospered dauid sayd uria go downe thyne house washe thy feete uria departed kyngꝭ palace folowed hym seruice kyngꝭ table uria slepte dore kyngꝭ palace withal seruaūtes lorde went downe house whiche tolde dauid sayenge uria went downe house dauid sayde vnto uria camest y• frō iourney dydest thou go downe vnto thyne house uria answered dauid arke israell iuda dwell pauylyons lorde ioab seruaū te lorde lye vpon flat earth shal go myne house eate drynke lye wyfe ii reg ••• ☞ lyfe lyfe thy soule wyll thynge dauid sayd vnto uria iudi 〈…〉 tarye day also morowe wyll let departe uria abode ierusalem day morow dauid called hym dyd eate drynke hym made hym dronke euen went lye couche seruauntes lorde went downe house morow dauid wrote letter ioab sent hande uria wrote thus letter sayenge put uria forefront sharper battayle come ye backe hym maye smytten dye ioab beseyged citye assygned uria vnto place wyst stronge men men citye came fought ioab certeyne ouerthrowen peple seruauntes dauid uria hethite dyed also ioab sent tolde dauid thynges concernyng war charged messenger sayenge thou hast made ende tellynge matter warre vnto kynge yf begyn fume saye vnto wherfore approched ye nygh vnto citye ye dyd fyght wyst ye wolde hurle shute wall smote abimelech sonne ☞ iereboseth •• di ix • dyd woman cast pece mylstone vpon hym wall dyed thebe went ye nygh wall saye thou thy seruaūt uria hethite deade also messenger went came shewed dauid al ioab sent hym messenger sayde vnto dauid men preuayled agaynst v came vnto v felde ❀ vvith violence stacke vnto euen vnto entrynge gate shuters shotte walles vpon thy seruauntes kyngꝭ seruauntes deade thy seruaunte uria hethite deade also dauid sayd vnto messenger thus shalt thou saye vnto ioab let thynge trouble ❀ chaunce vvarre dyuerse swerde deuoureth one well another make thy battayle stronge agaynst citye ouerthrowe se thou courage ioab wyfe uria herde husbande deade mourned hym mournynge past dauid sent fet house became wyfe bare hym son thynge dauid dyd dyspleased lorde ¶ dauid reproued slaughter uria • hy •• conceyued aduoutrye dyeth salomon borne capi xii lorde sent nathan vnto dauid came vnto hym tolde hym two men one citye one ryche poore ryche man excedynge many shepe ox poore nothynge saue one lytle shepe whiche bought norysshed vp grewe vp hym chyldrē also dyd eate owne meat dranke owne cup slept bosome vnto doughter came straunger vnto ryche man coulde fynde herte take owne shepe owne ox dresse straunger come vnto hym toke poore mannes shepe dressed man come hym dauid excedyng wrothe man sayde nathan surely lorde lyueth man hath done thynge • regū xx f ☞ chylde death shall restore lambe ••• di 22 • foure folde bycause dyd thynge petye nathan sayde dauid thou arte man thus saythe lorde god israel regū 16 • anoynted kynge ouer israell ryd hande saull gaue thy maysters house ☞ thy maysters wyues thy bosome gaue house israell iuda myght yf ben lytle haue gyuen moch wherfore hast thou despysed commaundement lorde wyckednesse syght thou hast kylde uria hethite swerde hast taken wyfe thy wyfe hast sleyne hym swerde chyldren ammon nowe therfore swerde shall neuer departe thyne house bycause thou hast despysed taken wyfe uria hethite thy wyfe wherfore thus sayeth lorde beholde wyll styrre vp euyll agaynst euen thyne owne house wyl deuit • 8 • take thy wyues thyne eye gyue vnto thy nyghboure shall lye thy wyues ☞ syght sonne thou dydest secretly wyll thynge israell open sonne lyght dauid sayd vnto nathan e ••• 〈…〉 haue synned agaynst lorde nathan sayd vnto dauid lorde also hath put awaye thy syn thou shalt dye howbeit bycause doyng dede thou hast gyuen enemyes lorde cause rayle chylde borne vnto shall surelye dye nathan departed vnto house lorde stroke chylde uria wyfe bare vnto dauid syckened sore dauid therfore besought god chylde fasted went laye nyght vpon earth elder house arose went hym take hym vp earth wolde neyther dyd eate meat happened seuenth daye chylde dyed seruaūtes dauid durst tell hym chylde dead sayd beholde whyle chylde yet alyue spake vnto hym wolde herken vnto oure voyce howe wyll vexe hymselfe yf tell hym chylde deade dauid seynge seruauntes whysperynge perceyued chylde deade dauid sayde vnto seruauntes chylde deade sayde yea dauid arose earth wasshed anoynted hymselfe chaunged apparell came house lorde worshypped afterwarde came owne house bad shulde ☞ set breade hym dyd cate sayd seruauntes vnto hym thynge thou h •• st done thou dyddest fast wepe chylde whyle lyue soone deade thou dyddest ryse vp eate meate sayde whyle chylde yet alyue fasted wepte thought tell whyther god wyll haue mercye chylde may iyue eccle 38 • nowe seynge deade wherfore shulde fast bryng hym agayne shall go hym rather shall come agayne dauid comforted bethsabe wyfe went vnto laye bare son called name p • ateable mata 1 1 pat iii b salomon lorde loued hym sent hande nathan prophete called name beloued lorde iedidia lordes behalfe ioab fought agaynst raba citye chyldren ammon toke ☞ citye kyngdom ioab sente messenger dauid sayenge haue made assaute ra •• haue taken ☞ citye water nowe therfore gather rest people togyther beseyge citye thou mayest take leest take call name dauid gathered people togyther went agaynst raba beseyged gat 1 par 〈◊〉 b toke theyr kynges crowne heade whiche wayed hundred weyght golde precyous stoones ☞ set dauids head brought spoyle citye excedynge greate abundance caryed peple thas therin ☞ put vpon sawes vpon yron harowes vpon ar̄es yron thrust tylekele thus dyd cityes chyldren ammon dauid people returned ierusalem ¶ amnen dauids sonne desyleth systet thamae absalom therfore hylleth amnon capi xiii chaūced absalom son dauid fayre syster named thamar whome amnon sonne dauid loued fore vered fell sycke loue syster thamar virgyn thought herde hym haue purpose amnon frende called ionadab sonne simeah dauids brother ☞ ionadab wyse man sayde vnto hym howe cōmeth thou beynge kyngꝭ sonne arte thus consumed euery daye wylt thou tell amnon answered hym loue thamar brother absaloms syster ionadab sayde vnto hym laye downe thy bed make thy selfe sycke thy father come se saye vnto hym oh lette syster thamar come gyue meat dresse syght maye se eate hande amnon laye downe made hym selfe sycke kynge come se hym amnon sayd vnto hym oh let thamar syster come make couple frytters syght maye eate hande dauid sent home thamar sayenge go nowe thy brother amnons house dresse hym meat thamar went brother amnons house layde downe toke floure made paste dressed frytters syght dyd bake toke platter powred hym wolde cate amnon sayde haue men went hym amnon sayde vnto thamar brynge meate chambrē maye eate thyne hande thamar toke frytters made brought chambre amnō brother set hym cate toke sayde vnto come lye syster answered hym nay brother force hath thyng ben done israell thou ab hominacyon whyther shall able go shame thou shalt one fooles israel speake vnto kyng shall denye vnto • wolde herken vnto voyce toke 〈…〉 forced laye amnon hated excedynglye hate wher hated greater loue loued amnon sayde vnto vp get hence answered hym thou hast cause euyll thou puttest away greater thou dydest vn neuerthelesse wolde heare called boye serued hym sayde put awaye woman bolte dore kyrtell dyuerse colour vpon soche kynges doughters virgyns apparelled seruaunt brought locked dore thamar toke put asshes heade rent gaye kyrtell la • de hande heade went went cryed absalom brother sayde vnto hath amnon thy brother ben yet styll syster thy brother let thynge greue thyne herte thamar remayned desolate brother absaloms house whē kyng dauid herde thyngꝭ wroth ❀ vvolde vexe spiryte amnon son loued hym bycause vvas fyrst borne absalom sayd vnto brother amnon neyther good bad nowe absalom hated amnon bycause forced syster thamar happened two yeare absalom e •• te 3 • c 〈◊〉 xx • viii shepe shearer playne nazor besyde trybe ephraim bad kynges sonnes came kynge sayde beholde thy seruaunt hath shepe shearer let kyng seruaūtes come thy seruaunt kynge answered absalom naye sonne wyll go al chargeable vnto absalom laye sore vpon hym howbeit wolde go blessed hym sayde absalom yf thou wylt come let brother amnō go v kynge answered hym nedeth go bvsalom made soche instance let amnon kyngꝭ chyldren go hym absalom cōmaunded yonge men sayenge marke amnons herte mery wt wyne byd smyte amnon kyl hym feare haue bydden holde therfore play men yong men absalom dyd vnto amnon euen absalom cōmaunded kyngꝭ sonnes arose euery man gat hym vp vpon mule fled fortuned whyle yet waye tydynges came dauid sayenge absalom hath steyne kynges sonnes ther none lefte alyue dauid arose •• 〈◊〉 l b iii f tare garmentes laye alonge earth seruauntes stode theyr clothes rent ionadah son simeah dauids brother answered sayd let lorde suppose haue sleyne yonge men kynges sonnes saue amnon onely deade hath ben determyned absaloms mynde sence forced syster thamar therfore let lorde kyng take thynge greuouslye thynke kyngꝭ sonnes dead amnon deade absalom fled yonge man kepte watche lyfte vp eye loked beholde came moche peple way behynde backe alonge hylles syde ionadab sayd vnto kynge beholde kynges sonnes come thy seruaunte sayd soone lefte speakynge beholde kynges sonnes came lyfte vp theyr voyces wepte kynge also seruauntes wepte excedynglye absalom escaped went thalmai son amihur kynge gesur dauid mourned son euery daye absalom escaped went gesur thre yeres kynge dauid desyred go forth vnto absalom amnon deade comforted ouer hym ¶ wysdom woman thekoa absalom called capi xiiii ioab sonne zaruia perceyued kynges herte towarde absalom sent thekoa fet thence wyse woman sayd vnto fayne thy selfe mourner put mournynge apparell anoynt thy selfe oyle woman longe • yme mourned deade bodye come kynge speake maner vnto hym ioab taught shulde say woman thekoa fall ••• face grounde done obeysaunce sayde vnto kynge helpe kynge kynge sayde vnto ayleth answered wedowe myne husbande deade thy hand mayde two sonnes two fought togyther felde man go bitwene one smote slewe hym beholde hoole kynred rysen agaynst thy handmayde sayde deut • • • delyuer v hym smote brother maye kyll hym ☞ soule brother whome slew wyll destroye heyre also shal quench sparkle lefte shall styrte vp husbande neyther name yssue vpon earth kynge sayde vnto woman go home thyne house wyll gyue charge woman thekoa sayde vnto kynge lorde kynge trespasse father house kynge seate gyltlesse kynge sayde yf man saye ought vnto brynge hym shall hurte sayde ☞ let kyng remembre lorde god aduenger blood gather heapes togyther destroye sleye son answered sure lorde lyueth 1 reg 14 • shall one heere thy son fall earth woman sayde let thyne handmayde speake one worde vnto lorde kynge sayde saye woman sayde wherfore hast thou determyned suche thynge agaynst people god kynge doth speake thyng one fautye shulde fet home agayne banysshed must nedes dye peryshe water spylt ground whiche gathered vp ☞ agayne neyther doth god spare soule let kyng therfore fynde meanes banysshed vtterlye expelled hym nowe therfore come speake thynge vnto kynge lorde people wyll feare thy handmayde sayd nowe wyll speake vnto kynge peraduenture kynge wyll perfourme request handmayde kyng shal heare handmayd delyuer hande man wolde haue destroyed also son enheritaunce god thyne handmayde sayd worde lorde kynge shal nowe cōfortable lorde kynge angell god hearyng good bad therfore lorde thy god kynge answered sayde vnto woman hyde praye thyng shall aske woman sayde let lorde kynge nowe saye kynge sayde ☞ hande ioab al matter woman answered sayde •• reg xi b sure thy soule lyueth lorde kynge el man ryght hande lefte lorde kynge hath spoken thy seruaunt ioab bad put wordes mouth thyne handmayde intent shulde alter communicacyon hath thy seruaunt ioab done thynge lorde wyse euen angel god vnderstande thynges earth kynge sayd vnto ioab beholde content thynge go • et home chylde absalom agayne ioab fell grounde face bowed hym selfe ☞ blessed kyng ioab sayd thy seruaunt knoweth haue founde grace thy syght lorde kynge kynge hath fulfylled request seruaunt ioab arose went gesur brought absalō ierusalem kynge sayde let hym turne owne house se face absalom returned owne house sawe kyngꝭ face israell goodlye man absalom beautyfull moche frō sole fole top heade blemesh hym shaued heade euery yeres ende shaued bicause heere heuy must nedes shaue heere head wayed cc syeles kynges weyght absalō thre sonnes borne hym one doughter named thamar fayre woman loke vpō absalō dwelt two yere ierusalem sawe kyngꝭ face therfore absalō sent ioab haue sent kyng wolde come hym sent agayne wolde come therfore sayd vnto seruaū te behold ioab hath parcell lande fast place hath barlye therin go set fyre absaloms seruauntes set fyre ❀ ioabs seruauntes came vvith theyr garmentes rent sayde absaloms seruauntes haue burnt pece lande vvith fyre ioab arose came absalom vnto house sayd vnto hym wherfore hath thy seruaūtes burnt felde fyre absalom answered ioab beholde sent desyrynge come bycause wolde haue sent kynge saye wherfore come gesur ben better haue ben styll therfore wolde se kynges face yf trespasse kyll thou ioab came kynge tolde hym whiche sent absalō came kynge fel grounde face hym kynge kyssed absalom ¶ absalom maketh insurrection agaynst father dauid fayne flee feare hym capi xv fortuned absalom gat hym charettes horse fyftye men run hym rose vp earlye mornyng stode place entrynge gate euery man matter came kyng iudgement hym dyd absalō call vnto hym sayd citye arte thou answered thy seruaunt one trybes israell absalom sayde vnto hym se thy matter good ryghteous man deputed kynge heare absalō sayde moreouer oh made iudge lande euery man whiche hath plee matter lawe myght come myght hym iustice whē man came nygh hym dyd hym obeysaunce put forth hande toke hym hym kyssed hym maner dyd absalom israell came kyng iudgement ☞ stale hertes men israel ☞ fourtye yeres fortuned absalō sayd vnto kynge let go nowe ☞ hebron pay vowe whiche haue vowed vnto lorde thy seruaunt vowed vowe • xv • gesur lande siria sayenge yf lorde shall brynge agayne ierusalem wyll serue lorde kynge sayde vnto hym go peace arose went hebron absalō sent spyes thorowout trybes israell sayenge soone ye heare voyce trompet blowe ye shall saye absalom reygneth kyng hebron wt absalom went cc men ierusalem called went pure hertes knowyng thynge absalom sent also ahithophell gilonite dauids coūseller shulde come citye gilo whyle offered sacrifyces wrought stronge treason peope went increased absalom multitude came messenger dauid sayde hertes men israell turned absalom dauid sayd vnto seruauntes hym ierusalem vp may gone shall el escape absalō make spede departe lest come sodenly catche v brynge myscheyfe vpon v smyte citye wt edge swerde kyngꝭ seruaū te sayde vnto hym beholde thy seruauntes redye whatsoeuer lord kyng shal appoynt kynge householde departed foote lefte behynde hym • xvi ix ten ☞ concubynes kepe house kynge people went fote taryed place far seruauntes went hym cerethites phelethites gethites ❀ myghtye men vvar euen vi c men whiche come fote frō geth went kynge sayd kynge • reg 18 bithai gethite wherfore cōmest thou v returne abyde kyng thou arte straunger arte remoued thyne owne place thou camest yesterdaye shulde vnquyet day go v wyll go whyther therfore returne thou carye agayne thy brother mercye trueth ❀ shall lorde shevve vnto ithai answered kynge sayde trulye lorde lyueth place lorde kynge shall whyther death lyfe euen also wyll thy seruaunt dauid kynge sayde ithai come go forwarde ithai gethite went forth men chyldren hym countrey wepte loude voyce dyd people went forth kynge also hym selfe passed ouer broke cydron people went towarde waye leadeth wyldernesse sadock al leuytes hym bare arke appoyntment god set downe arke god abiathar ☞ went vp vntyll people come ouer citye kynge sayde vnto sadocke carye arke god agayne citye yf shall fynde fauoure eye lorde wyll brynge agayne shewe bothe tabernacle therof yf lorde thus saye haue lust vnto beholde let hym semeth good eye kynge sayde also vnto sadocke preest arte thou regū 〈◊〉 • sear returne citye peace take two sonnes ahimaaz thy son ionathas son abiathar beholde wyll tarye feldes wyldernesse vntyll come word tolde sadock therfore abiathar caryed arke god agayne ierusalem taryed dauid went vp mount olyuete wepte went heade couered went barefoote people hym euery man heade couered went vp wepte also one tolde dauid sayenge ahithophell one haue conspyred absalom dauid sayd lorde turne counsayle ahithophell folyshnesse dauid come top mount ☞ worshypped god beholde husai arachite came agaynst hym coote torne hauynge earth vpon heade unto whome dauid sayd yf thou go thou shalte burthen vnto yf thou returne citye saye vnto absalom wyll thy seruaunt kyng haue thus longe ben thy father seruaunt nowe thy seruaunt thou mayst sake destroye counsayle ii reg xvii b c ahithophell thou hast sadocke abiathar preestes vnto whome thou shalte shewe thou canst heare kynges house beholde haue theyr two sonnes ahimaaz sadockes sonne ionathas abiathers sonne also shal ye sende ye heare ••• xvii husai dauids frende gat hym citye absalom also entred ierusalem ¶ ziba bryngynge presentes dauid doth falsely accuse miphiboseth semei curseth dauid hurleth stone hym absatom counsell ahithophell lyeth father concubynes capi xvi dauid lytle paste top hyll beholde ziba seruaunte miphiboseth came mete hym couple ass sadled vpon two hundred loues one hundred bunch reasyns hundred frayles dryed fygges bottell wyne kynge sayde vnto ziba meanest thou ziba sayde ass ☞ kynges housholde ryde breade fruyte yonge men eate wyne faynt wyldernesse may drynke kynge sayde thy maysters sonne ziba answered vnto kynge behold taryeth styll ierusalem sayd day shal house israell restore kyngdom father sayde kynge ziba beholde thyne perteyned vnto •• reg ix b miphiboseth ziba sayde beseche may fynde grace thy syght lorde kynge kynge dauid came bahurim beholde thence came man kynted house saull named ii xix • semei son gera came cursynge cast stone dauid seruauntes kynge dauid people also men war ryght hande lefte thus sayde exobi 22 semei cursed come forthe come forthe thou bloodsheder thou man belyall lorde hath brought vpon bloode house saull whose steade thou hast reygned lorde hath delyuered kyngdome hande absalom thy sonne beholde thou arte come thy mischeyfe bycause thou arte bloodsheder sayde abisai sonne zaruia vnto kynge dothe deade dog curse lorde kynge let go take heade hym kynge sayde haue ye sonnꝭ zaruia let hym curse lorde hath byden hym curse dauid dare say wherfore hast thou done dauid sayd abisai seruauntes beholde son whiche came myne owne bodye seketh lyfe moch maye sonne iemini suffre hym curse 3 regū ii • lorde hath bydden hym haplye lorde wyll loke wretchednes good cursynge daye dauid men went waye semei went alonge hylles syde ouer agaynst hym cursed went threwe stone hym cast dust kynge hym came werye refresshed selues ☞ •• 〈◊〉 〈◊〉 absalom people men israel came ierusalem ahithophell hym soone husai arachite dauids frende come vnto absalō sayde vnto hym god saue kynge god saue kynge absalom sayd agayne husai kyndnes thou owest thy frend wentest thou hym husai answered vnto absalom nay lorde people men israell chose wyll hym wyll dwell moreouer vnto whome shall seruice euen sonne seruaunt thy father euen shall spake absalom ahithophell gyue counsayle best v ahithophell sayde vnto absalom get vnto thy father •• reg 〈◊〉 • 〈◊〉 ▪ • concubine whiche hath lefte kepe house israell shall heare thou ☞ arte cast thy father shall handes wt stronge pytched absalom tent vpon ☞ top house went vnto father concubynes syght israell counsayle ahithophell whiche councelled dayes man asked counsayle god euen counsayle ahithophell dauid absalom ¶ ahithophell seynge counsell disalowed • u •• forsaken hangeth hym selfe capi xvii ahithophel sayde vnto absalom let chose nowe xii men wyl vp folow dauid nyght wyl come vpon hym whyle werye weyke handed wyll feare hym people wt hym shal flee wyl smyte kynge onlye wyll brynge agayne people vnto ❀ euen easely yf wolde brynge thyng haue sleyn man thou sekest al peple shall haue rest saynge pleased absalom well elder israell sayd absalom call also husai arachite let v heare counsayle husai come absalom absalom spake vnto hym sayenge ahithophell hath gyuen suche counsell shal saynge tell thou husai answered vnto absalom counsayle ahithophel hath gyuē good tyme sayd husai yu knowest thy father men howe stronge yf chaufed theyr myndes euen 〈◊〉 17 b beare robbed whelpes feelde thy father man also practised warre maketh taryenge people beholde lurketh caue place though ouerthrowen fyrst brunt yet heare wyll saye people foloweth absalom put worse best men thou haste whose hertes hertes lyon shal shrynke therat al israel knoweth thy father mightye man hym men warre therfore counsayle israel gathered vnto dan beerseba sande see nombre thou go battayle thyne owne person shal come vpon hym one place shal fynde hym wyll fall vpon hym euen thycke dewe falleth grounde men shal leaue one moreouer yf gotten towne shall men israel bryng rope citye wyl drawe ryuer vntyll one stone foūde absalom al men israel sayd counsayle husai arachite better counsell ahithophel esai xix • euen lordes determinacion destroy good counsayle ahithophel lorde myght bryng euyll vpon absalom sayd • reg xv g husai vnto sadocke abia preestes maner dyd ahithophel elder israell counsayle absalom thus thus haue counsayled nowe therfore sende quyckely shewe dauid saynge tary nyght feldes wyldernesse get ouer lest kyng deuoured people hym nowe ionathas ahimaaz abode well rogell myght sene come citie wenche went tolde wente shewed kynge dauid neuerthelesse lad sawe tolde absalom wente bothe away quyckly came mannes house bahurim whiche wel yearde whiche went downe woman toke spred couerlet ouer welles mouth strawed furmenty corne theron thyng spyed absaloms seruaūtꝭ cam wife house sayde ahimaaz ionathas woman answered gone ouer lytell broke water sought coulde fynde returned ierusalem soone departed came well went tolde kynge dauid sayde vnto hym vp get quyckly ouer water suche counsayle hath ahithophel gyuen agaynst dauid arose al peple wt hym come ouer iordan day lacked one come ouer iordan ahithophel saw counsayle folowed sadled asse arose gat hym home owne house owne citye put house holde order hanged hym selfe dyed buryed sepulthre father dauid came mahanaim absalom passed ouer iordan men israel hym absalom made amasa captayn hoost stede ioab whiche amasa mannes sonne named iethra israelite went abigail doughter nahas syster zeruia ioabs mother israel absalō pytched lande gilead dauid come mahanaim sobi son nahas •• reg x • • rabba citie chyldrē ammon machir son ammiel lodeber •• reg x •• • 3 reg 〈◊〉 ▪ 〈◊〉 berzela • geliadite roglim brought beddꝭ basyns earthen vessel wheat barly floure parched corne beenes rice ootemele hony butter shepe chese kyne dauid al people wt eate sayd people hungrye werye thrystye wyldernesse ¶ absalom ouercome battayle haugeth head oke kylled put dytche dauid sorowfull death absalom wepeth capi xviii dauid nombred people hym set captaynes thousandes hundredes ouer dauid sent forth one parte people vnder hande ioab parte vnder hande abisai sonne zeruia ioabs brother thyrde parte vnder hande itha • gethite kyng sayd vnto people wyl go wt also people answered thou shalte go forth yf flee aduersaries wyll care v neyther shal regarde v though halfe v sleyne thou arte worth ten thousande v wherfore better thou soccoure v • te citye kynge sayde vnto semeth best wyll kyng stode gate syde people came hundred thousandes kynge cōmaunded ioab abisai •• reg 16 itha • saynge entreate yonge man absalom gentylly sake people herde kynge gaue captaynes charge concernyng absalom people went felde agaynst israel battayle wood ephraim people israell put worse seruaūtes dauid great slaughter daye euen xx mē felde fought dyuerse place abrode vpon earth ☞ wood deuoured mo people day dyd swerde absalom came seruauntes dauid rydyng vpon mule whiche caryed hym vnder thic • e bowes great oke ☞ head caught oke lyfte vp bytwene heuen earth mule vnder hym went way one sawe tolde ioab saynge beholde saw absalom hange man oke ioab sayd vnto man tolde hym thou dydest se hym dydest y• smyte hym grounde wolde haue gyuen ten sycles syluer gyrdle man sayde vnto ioab though thou woldest lay thousande sycles syluer hande yet wolde stretch myne hande agaynst kynges sonne herde • are kynge charged abisai ithai sayenge beware none touche yong man absalom moreouer yf done shulde haue done agaynst myne owne lyfe matter hyd f • ō kyng yea thou thy self woldest haue bene agaynst thē sayd ioab may stand thus taryeng wt toke thre speares hande thrust thorowe absalom whyle yet alyue body tree ten seruauntes bare ioabs wrapons turned smote absalom slue hym whē ioab blew trompet people returned folowyng israell ioab spared people toke absalom cast great pyt wood layde myghtye great heape stone vpon hym israel fled theyr tentes absalom yet lyfe tyme • reg 〈◊〉 ▪ • ▪ toke • eared vp pyller whiche kynges dale sayde haue son therfore kepe name remembraunce called pyller owne name called vnto day absaloms pyller sayd ahimaaz son sadocke let run nowe beare kyng tydyng • howe lorde hath iudged hym quyte hande enemyes ioab sayd vnto hym thou arte man beare tydynges day y• shalte beare tydynges tyme day thou shalte beare none bycause kynges sonne deade sayd ioab chusi go tell kynge thou hast sene chusi bowed hym selfe vnto ioab ran sayd ahimaaz son sadocke agayne ioab come come wyll let also run chusi ioab sayde wherfore wylte thou run sonne seyng tydynges thou shalt haue rewarde well sayde come wyll let run sayd vnto hym run thē ahimaaz ran playne waye came chusi dauid sat bytwene two gate watchmā went vp roofe ouer gate vnto wall lyfte vp eye sawe beholde came man run nynge alone watchman cryed tolde kyng kynge sayde yf alone good tydynges mouth came drew nygh watchmā sawe man runnynge called vnto porter sayd beholde commeth man runnyng alone kyng sayde also tydynges brynger watchman sayd thynke runnynge formost lyke runnynge ahimaaz sonne sadocke kynge sayde good man cometh good tydynges ahimaaz called sayd vn kyng good tydynges fell downe flat earth vpō face king sayde blessed lorde thy god whiche hath ☞ shut vp men lyfte vp theyr handes agaynst lorde kynge kynge sayde yonge man absalom safe ahimaaz answered ioab sent chusi kynges seruaunt thy seruaunt sawe moche wote kynge sayde vnto hym turne stande turned stode styll beholde chusi came also sayde good tydynges lorde kynge lorde hath quytte daye hande al rose agaynst kynge sayd vnto chusi yonge man absalom safe chusi answered enmyes lord kyng ryse agaynst hurte yonge man kyng moued went vp chambre ouer gate wepte went thus sayde son absalom son son absalom wolde god dyed absalom sonne sonne ¶ dauid restored kyngdom brought agayne ierusalem capi xix tolde ioab beholde kyng wepeth mourneth absalom victory day turned mournyng vnto people people herde say day howe kyng sorowed son people stale away day goynge citye people cōfounded steale away flee battayle kynge hyd face cryed loude voyce son absalom absalom son son ioab came house kynge sayd thou hast shamed day face al thy seruauntꝭ day haue saued thy lyfe lyues thy sonꝭ thy doughters liues thy wyues thy concubine thou louest thyne enemyes hatest thy frendes thou hast declared daye yu regardest neyther thy • ordes seruauntes daye perceyue yf absalom lyued dyed daye pleased well nowe therfore vp come speake kyndely vnto thy seruauntes swere lorde excepte thou come wyll tary one man nyght wyll worse vnto euyl fell frō thy youth vnto houre kynge arose sat downe gate tolde vnto al people saynge beholde king doth syt gate people came kyng▪ israel fled euery man tent fortuned al people stryfe thorowout tribe israel sayenge kynge saued v hande enemyes delyuered v hande philistine nowe fled lande absalom absalom anoynted ouer v deade battayle therfore ye styl ye brynge kynge agayne kynge dauid sent sadocke abiathar preestes sayeng speake vnto elder iuda say ye behynde bryng kyng agayne house seing suche tydynges come israel vnto kynge euen house ❀ kyng sayd thus shal ye say vnto people • uda ye brother bone fleshe wherfore thē ye last bryng kyng home agayn say ye amasa art thou bone flesshe god yf thou captayne hoost euer roume ioab bowed hertes men iuda euen herte one man sent worde kynge returne yu thy seruauntes kyng returned came iordan iuda came gilgal go downe mete kynge conuay hym ouer iordā • mei •• • x •• • sonne gera sonne gemini whiche bahurim hasted came men iuda mete kyng dauid thousande mē beniamin hym •• r •• • 6 • ziba seruaunt house saul xv sonnes twentye seruauntes hym wente quyckely ouer iordan kyng went ouer boote caryed ouer kynges housholde dyd hym pleasure • mei sonne gera fell kyng come ouer iordan sayd vnto hym let lorde impute wyckednesse vnto remembre thynges thy seruaunt dyd wyckedlye lorde kyng departed ierusalem kynge shulde take herte thy seruaunt doth knowe haue done amysse therfore beholde fyrst day ☞ house ioseph come go downe mete lorde kyng abisat sonne zeruia answered sayd shall semei dye bycause cursed lordes anoynted dauid sayd matter bytwene ye sonnes zeruia daye ye aduersaries vnto shall man dye day israel know day kyng ouer israel therfore kynge sayd vnto semei thou shalte dye kyng sware vnto hym miphiboseth son saul came also mete kyng
