neyther wasshed fete shauen beerde wasshed clothꝭ frō tyme kyng departed vntyl came agayne peace fortuned come ierusalem met kyng kyng sayd vnto hym wherfore wentest thou miphiboseth answered lorde kynge seruaunt deceyued thy seruaunt sayd wolde haue myne asse sadled ryde theron go kyng bycause thy seruaunt lame ziba hath falsly reported thy seruaūt vnto lorde kynge lorde kyng angel god therfore semeth good thyne eye al father house dead men lorde kyng yet dydest thou put thy seruaunt amonge dyd eate thyne owne table ryght therfore haue yet cry vnto kyng kyng sayd vnto hym speakest thou yet thyne owne cause ❀ determyned haue sayd thou ziba deuyde landes bytwene miphiboseth sayd vnto kyng yea let hym take moche lorde kynge come agayne peace vnto owne house berselai gileadite came downe roglim wente ouer iordan kyng conuay hym ouer iordan berselai aged man euen iiii score yere olde prouyded kyng sustenaunce whyle lay mahanaim mā great substaunce kyng sayd vnto berselai come thou wyl fede ierusalem berselai •• • e 57 g sayd vnto kynge thus olde howe able go vp kyng vnto ierusalem day foure score yere olde ☞ descerne bytwene good euyll hath thy seruaunt taste eateth drynketh heare anye voyce syngynge men woman wherfore shuld thy seruaunt yet burthen vnto lorde kyng thy seruaunt wyl go lytell way ouer iordan kynge wyl king recompence suche rewarde oh let thy seruaunt turne backe agayne may dye myne owne citye buryed graue father mother beholde thy seruaūt ☞ chimean let hym go lorde kynge hym shall please kyng answered chimean shal go wyll hym yu shalte content soeuer thou shalte requyre wyll people wente ouer iordan kyng come ouer iordā kyssed berselai ☞ blessed hym wente backe agayne vnto owne place kyng went gilgal chimean went hym dyd people iuda brought ouer kynge halfe men israel beholde men israell came kynge sayd vnto hym haue brother mē iuda stolne away haue brought kyng housholde al dauids men hym ouer iordan • men iuda answered men israel kynge nere kyn v wherfore ye angry mattter thinke ye eate kynges cost take v gyftes men israell answered men iuda sayd haue ten partes kynge haue therto ryght dauid ye dyd ye despyse v aduyse shulde fyrst restorynge kyng agayne wordꝭ men iuda fearcer wordes men israel ¶ seba sonne bichri cayseth israel agaynst dauid ioab kylleth amasa trayterously heade seba delyuered ioab dauids receyuers nombred capi xx came thyther certayne mā belial named seba son bichri man gemini blew trompet sayd haue parte dauid neyther haue enheritaunce son isai let men israell depart vnto theyr centes euery man israell went dauid folowed seba son bichri men iuda claue fast vnto theyr kyng iordan ierusalem dauid came house ierusalem ii reg •• •••• toke ten woman concubine lefte behynde hym kepe house put warde fed lay wt enclosed vnto day theyr death lyuyng wydowhode sayde kynge • amasa cal men iuda togyther agaynst thyrde day thou also amasa went gather men iuda togyther taryed longer tyme whiche appoynted hym dauid sayde abisai nowe shall seba sonne bichri v harme dyd absalom take thou therfore ☞ thy lordes seruauntes folowe hym lest get hym walled cityes escape v wente hym ioabs men crethites phelethites al myghtyest men departed ierusalem folowe seba sonne bichri greate stone gibeon amasa went ioabs garment aboute hym gyrde vnto hym gyrded theron knyfe whiche ioyned fast loynes suche shethe went fell tymes ioab sayd amasa art thou helth brother ioab toke amasa chyn ryght hande 〈…〉 27 • kysse hym amasa toke hede knyfe ioabs hande therwith smote hym •• gū ii f shorte rybbes shed bowel grounde thrust hym dyed ioab abisai brother folowed seba sonne bichri one ioabs men ☞ stode hym sayde beareth fauoure ioab good wyll dauid let hym go ioab amasa lay walowed blood myddes way man whē saw reg ii g al people stode styl rolled amasa way felde cast cloth vpon bycause sawe euery one came stode styl hym sone tombled way al people went ioab folowe seba sonne bichri went thorowe tribe israel vnto abel bethmaacha place barim gathered togyther went came beseyged hym abell bethmaacha cast vp banke agaynst citye stode valley al peple ioab thrust wal ouerthrow cryed wyse woman oute cytie heare heare byd ioab come hyther may speake ioab come vnto woman sayde arte thou ioab answered sayd vnto hym heare wordes thy handmayde answered heare sayd agayne ❀ speake olde tyme sayenge ☞ men must aske abel haue contynuid hytherto one peaceable faythfull israel y• goest aboute destroy citye mother israel wyite y• deuoure enheritaunce lorde ioab answered sayde god forbyd god forbyd shulde eyther deuoure destroy matter man mount ephraim seba son bichri name hath ☞ lyfte vp hande agaynst kyng euē agaynst dauid delyuer v onely wyl departe citye woman sayde vnto ioab beholde heade shalbe throwen vnto ouer wall womā went vnto people ☞ wysdom smote head seba son bichri cast ioab 11 reg ii g blewe trompet scattered citye euery man tente ioab returned ierusalem vnto kynge ☞ ioab ouer hoost israell banaia son iehoiada ouer crethites phelethites aduram ouer tribute iehosaphat sonne ahilud recorder seua scribe sadocke abiathar preestes ira iairete ☞ dauids preest ¶ answered saul house blood bycause slue • reg 〈…〉 gibaonites kyng called gibaonites sayde vnto gibaonites • 〈…〉 〈…〉 chyldren israel remenaunt amorites chyldren israell sware vnto saull sought sley zelle chyldren israel iuda wherfore dauid sayd vnto shall wherwith shall make attonement ye may ☞ blesse enheritaunce lorde▪ gibaonites answered hym wyll haue syluer▪ golde saul house neyther mynde thou shuldest kyll man israel sayd say ye th • n shall answered kyng man consumed v ymagened brynge v nought hym wyl destroy nought hym contynue coostes israel let seuen men sonnes delyuered vnto v wyl hang vp vnto lorde gibeah saul lorde dyd chose kynge sayde wyll gyue kynge compassyon miphiboseth sonne ionathas sonne saull bycause lordes othe bytwene euen bytwene dauid ionathas sonne saul toke two sonnes rizpa doughter aia bare vnto saul euen armoni miphiboseth v sonnes michol doughter saul whome bare adriel son barselai meholathite delyuered vnto handes gibeonites whiche hanged hyll lorde fell seuen togyther sleyne dayes haruest euē fyrst dayes begynnyng barley haruest rizpa doughter aia toke sacke cloth ☞ hanged vp vpon rocke euen begynnynge haruest vntyl rayne dropped vpon heuē suffered neyther byrdes ayre fall day beastes felde night tolde dauid rizpa doughter aia concubyne saul done dauid went toke bone saul ionathas son men iabes gilead whiche stolen strete bethsan philistine hanged philistine sleyne saul gilboa brought thence bone saul bone ionathas sonne toke vp bone hanged bone saul ionathas sonne buried coūtrey beniamin zela sepulchre ci father performed al king cōmaunded god one lande fortuned philistine yet war agayne israel dauid went downe seruauntes hym fought agaynst philistine dauid waxed fayntie iesbi nob one sonnes gyaūtes yron whose speare wayed ☞ thre hundred sycles beyng gyrded wt newe swerde thought haue sleyne dauid 2 regū 23 c abisaia son zaruia socoured hym smote philistine kylled hym seruauntes dauid sware vnto hym saynge thou shalte go wt v battayle thou quenche ☞ lyght israel yet battayle philistine nob sibbechat husathite slue saph one sonnes gyaūtes yet battayle pa xxi nob philistine eihanā son iaere orgim bethleemite slue one goltath gethite staffe whose spere great weuers cloth beame yet battayle geth man great stature euery hande vi fyngers euery foote vi toe xxiiii al borne also kynred giauntes geth wen defyed israell ionathas son simea brother dauid slue hym foure giauntes borne geth fell hande dauid handes seruauauntes ¶ songe dauid delyueraunce enemyes capi xxii dauid spake wordes song vnto lorde tyme lord delyuered hym hande enemyes hande saul sayd lorde ☞ rocke castel delyuerer god strength hym wyl trust shelde horne saluacyon worshyp refuge sauiour thou shalt saue wrong psel ••• wyll prayse call lorde shall saued myne enemyes corrupcyons death closed aboute floudes beliall put feare sorowes hel compassed snare death ouertoke tribulaciō wyl call vpon lorde crye god shal heare voyce temple crye shall entre eares earth trembled quaked ☞ foundacyons heuen moued shoke angrye smoke went vp wrath consuming fyre mouth cole kendled therof bowed heuen came downe darkenes vnder fete sat vpon cherub dyd flye ☞ sene caried vpon wyngꝭ wynd made darkenesse tabernacle rounde aboute hym water gathered togyther thycke cloudes thorowe bryghtnesse presence fyre cole kyndled god thundred heuen moost hygh doth put voyce shot arowes scattered hurled lyghtenyng dyscomfyted flowyngꝭ see appeared foundacions worlde sene reason rebukynge lorde thorowe blastyng breth nose thryls shal sende frō heuen fet shal plucke many water shal deliuer frō myghty aduersary fro myne enmyes strong ouertaken day tribulacion lorde stayed vp brought roumth delyuered bicause loue vnto rom 〈…〉 lorde wyl rewarde accordynge ryghteousnesse accordyng purenesse handes wyll recompence haue kepte wayes lorde done wyckednes agaynst god lawes syght statute wyll put awaye fro syght also haue bene vndefyled ☞ haue kepte fro myne iniquite lorde dyd agayne accordyng ryghteousnes euen purenesse eye syght godly thou shalte godly man vncorrupte thou shalt vncorrupte pure thou shalte pure frowarde thou shalt frowarde people aduersyte thou shalte helpe proude shalte thou cast thyne eye thou arte lyght lorde lorde shall lyght darknesse wt thy helpe wyll run thorowe hoost mē ☞ god wyl spryng ouer wal ☞ god vncorrupte way worde lorde tryed fyre defender al trust hym god saue lorde myghtye saue god god strengtheth wt power ☞ ryddeth way cleare maketh feete lyke harte feete setteth fast vpon hye holde • sel 144 teacheth handes fyght euen bowe stcle weake myne armes thou hast gyuen shelde thy saluacion thy louyng mekenesse thou doest multiplie thou shalte make space walke legges shall fayle wyll folowe vpon myne enemyes destroy turne agayne vntyll haue consumed wyll waste smyte shal able arise yea shall fal vnder fete thou hast gyrded myght battayle arose agaynst hast y• subdued vnder thou madest myne enemyes hated turne theyr backes myght destroy loke helpe none saue yea euen vnto lorde crye heareth wyll beate small duste earth wyll stampe dyrte streete wyll spreade abrode thou shalte delyuer dyscencion people thou shalt kepe heade ouer nacions peple knewe shall serue straunge chyldren dissemble withme hearynge eare obey straunge chyldren wyll shrynke away shall smytten feare theyr preuye chambre god alyue blessed maker magnified god moost stronge saluacion god aduengeth bryngeth downe people vnder delyuereth myne enemyes thou also shalte lyfte vp hyghe frome ryse agaynst thou shalte delyuer wycked men therfore wyll prayse lorde amonge nacyons wyll synge vnto thy name whiche sheweth great saluacion kyng dealeth mercyfully anoynted euen dauid seede euermore ¶ last cōmunicatyon dauid descryptyo • myghtye men hym belongynge capi xxiii ☞ last sayenges dauid dauid son isai sayd mā made anoynted god iacob noble psalmist israel sayde spirite lord spake word tonge god israell spake ☞ euen moost myghtye israel sayde beareth rule ouer men oughte rule iustly feare god mornyng lyght sonne vp mornyng cloudꝭ let brightnesse grasse earth vertue rayne ☞ house god ii reg 7▪ • hath made euerlastyng couenaunt perfyte sute poyntes truely • che desyre growe vngodly man belial shalbe thorne clene plucked vp whiche taken wt handes mā shall touche must haue yron longe helue 〈…〉 el muste burnt fyre place name myghtye men dauid ☞ one sat seat wysdome beyng cheyfest among thre▪ pleasaunt strong slue eyght hundred one tyme hym eleazar son dodi son ahohi one thre worthyes dauid defied philistine gathered togyther battayle whē men israell gone vp arose layde philistine vntyl hande wery claue vnto swerde lorde gaue great victorye day people ❀ vvhiche fled returned went hym run spoyle hym sāma son age hararite philistine gathered togyther besyde towne parcell lande ful rice people fled philistine stode myddes groūd defended slue philistine lorde gaue great victory pat▪ xii • thre whiche thyrtie cheyfe captaynes went downe dauid haruest tyme vnto caue adullā hoost philistine abode valey gyauntes dauid holde souldiours philistine bethleem dauid longed sayde oh water wel gate bethleem drynke thre myghtye brake thorowe hoost philistine fet water well bethleem gate toke brought dauid neuerthelesse wolde drynke therof offred vnto lorde sayde lorde forbyd shulde blood mē went ieoperdye theyr lyues therfore wolde drynke thynges dyd thre myghtye men ii reg xxi abisai brother ioab sonne seruiah cheyfe among thre lyfte vp speare agaynst thre hundred slue name among thre nobler man thre theyr captayne howbeit atteyned vnto ❀ fyrst thre banaiahu sonne iehoiada son myghty man valyaunt actes kabzeel slue two strong lyon euen lyon moab went downe also slue lyon pyt tyme snowe slue egyptian goodly byg man whiche speare hande went downe staffe plucked speare egyptian hande slue hym owne speare thynges dyd banatahu son iehoiada name among thre worthyes honourable among thirtie atteyned fyrst thre dauid made hym coū sell asahel brother ioab also one thyrtie thē elhanam son dodo bethleem sāma haronite elica harodite helez paltite ira sonnes akes thekoite abiezer anathoth meobnal husathite zelmon ahohite maharai netophathite heleb sonne baanah netophathite ithai son ribai hyl chyldren beniamin banaiahu phirathonite hedai ryuer gaas abialbon arba • hice asmaueth barhumite elihaba saalbonite sonnes iasen ionathas sāma hararite ahiam son sarer hararite eliphelet son aisbai son maachathite eliam son aithophel gilonite hezrai y• carmelite paarai arbite igall son nathan zoba banithe gadite zelec amonite naharai berothite harnes bere • ioab sonne zaruia ira iethrite gareb iethrite uria hethit thyrtye seuen ¶ dauid causeth people nombred therfore israell plaged pestilence thre dayes dyed ixi thousande capi xxiiii agayne lorde wrothe agaynst israell ☞ dauid moued hym agaynst sayd exodi 〈◊〉 go nombre israel iuda kyng sayde ioab captayne hoost go thou abrode nowe thorowout trybes israell euen dan beer seba nombre ye people maye knowe nombre ioab sayde vnto kyng beseche lorde thy god make people many mo yea c tymes many mo eye lorde kyng may se cause lorde kynge hath lust thynge notwithstandynge kynges worde preuayled agaynst ioab agaynst captaynes hoost ioab captaynes hoost went presence kyng nombre people israel passed ouer iordan pytched aroer ryght syde citye lyeth myddes valey gad ouer agaynst iazer thē came gilead nether lande newe habitacion thence came dan iaan aboute sidon came strong holde tyre cityes heuites cauanites went south iuda euen beer seba bene abrode thorowout al lande returned ierusalem agayne ende ix monethes xx dayes ioab delyuered vp nombre sūme people vnto kyng israel ix c thousande mē myght drewe swerdes men iuda fyue c thousande men dauids herte smote hym nombred people dauid sayde vnto lorde haue synned excedyngly haue done nowe lorde take away trespasse thy seruaunt haue done folysshly dauid vp mornynge worde lorde came vnto prophet gad dauids sear saynge go say vnto dauid thus sayth lorde offer thre thynges chose whiche shal vnto gad came dauid shewed sayd vnto hym wylte thou haue ☞ seuen yeres hunger come thy lande wylte thou flee iii monethes thyne enemyes folowyng iii dayes pestylence thy lande therfore aduise se answere shal gyue hym sent dauid sayd vnto gad extreme trouble 〈◊〉 〈◊〉 • wyll fall nowe hande lorde moche mercye let fall hande man lorde sent pestylence israell mornynge vnto tyme appoynted dyed people dan beerseba seuentye thousande men angell stretched hande vpon ierusalem destroye lorde cōpassyon euyll sayde angell destroyed people nowe sufficyent holde thyne hande angell lorde thresshynge place aresna iebusyte dauid spake vnto lorde sawe angell smote people sayde loo haue synned haue done wyckedly shepe haue done let thyne hande praye agaynst agaynst father house gad came day dauid sayd vnto hym go vp reare aulter vnto lorde threshynge floore aresna iebusite dauid accordyng sayng gad went vp lorde cōmaunded aresna loked sawe kyng seruauntes cōmynge towarde hym aresna went bowed selfe kynge flat face vpon ground aresna sayde wherfore lorde kynge come seruaūt dauid answered bye thresshynge floore make aulter vnto lorde plage maye cease people aresna sayd vnto dauid let lorde kyng take offre semeth hym good eye beholde ox burntsacrifyce sleddes instrumentes ox woode thyngꝭ dyd aresna gyue vnto kynge sayd moreouer vnto kynge lorde thy god accept kynge sayde vnto aresna wyll bye pryce wyl offre sacrifyce vnto lorde god doth cost nothyng dauid bought thresshynge floore ox ☞ fyftye sycles syluer dauid buylde aulter vnto lorde offered hurt sacrifyces peaceofferynges lorde intreated land plage ceased israell ¶ ende seconde boke samuell otherwyse called seconde kynges ¶ thyrde boke kynges rekenynge latenistes whiche thyrde booke fourth also one hebrues ¶ yonge virgyn abisag kepeth dauid extreme age adonia occupieth realme vnwyttynge father salomon anoynted hynge adonia getteth hym away capi primo kynge dauid olde stryken yeres whē couered hym clothes caught heate wherfore seruauntes sayd vnto hym let sought lorde kynge yonge mayden stande kynge cheryshe hym let lye thy bosome lorde kynge maye get heate sought fayre damfell thorowout coostes israell founde one abisag sunamite brought kynge damfell excedynge fayre therysshed kynge ministred hym▪ kynge knewe adonia son hagith exalted hym selfe sayenge wyll kynge gat hym charettes horseman fyftye men run father wolde displease tyme sayde moche hym doest thou goodlye man mother bare hym nexte absalom toke coūsayle ioab sonne zaruia abiathar preest helped adonia sadocke preest banaiahu son iehoiada nathan prophet semei rei men myght whiche dauid fauoured adonia adonia sacrifyced shepe ox fat cattell stone zoheleth whiche fast iosua 〈◊〉 • well rogell called brother kynges sonnes men iuda kynges seruauntes nathan prophet banaiahu myghtye men salomon brother called wherfore nathan spake vnto bethsabe mother salomon sayenge hast thou herde adonia son hagith doth reygne dauid lorde knoweth nowe therfore come wyll gyue counsayle howe saue thyne owne lyfe lyfe thy son salomon go get vnto kynge dauid saye vnto hym dydest thou lorde kynge sweare vnto thy handmayde saynge salomon thy son shall reygne shall syt vpon seate adonia kynge behold whyle thou yet talkest kynge wyll come confyrme thy wordes bethsabe went vnto kynge chambre kyng olde abisag sunamite minystred vnto kynge bethsabe stouped made obeysauuce vnto kynge kynge sayde thy matter answered hym lorde thou swarest lorde thy god vnto thyne handmayde salomon thy son shall reygne shall syt vpon seate behold adonia kynge lorde kyng woteth hath offered ox fat cattell many shepe hath called sonnes kynge abiathar preest ioab captayn hooste salomon thy seruaunt hath bydden nowe lorde kynge eye israell wayte thou shuldest tel ought syt seate lorde kyng hym el lorde kynge layde rest father son salomon shall ☞ ❀ synners whyle yet talked kynge nathan prophet came also tolde kyng sayenge beholde cōmeth nathan pro phet come kyng made obeysaunce kynge vpon face grounde nathan sayde lorde kynge hast thou sayd adonia shall reygne shall syt vpon seate gone downe day hath sleyne many ox fat shepe hath called kyngꝭ sonnes captaynes hoost abiathar preest holde eate drynke hym saye god saue kynge adonia thy seruaunt sadocke preest banatahu son iehoiada thy seruaunt salomon hath called thynge done lorde kynge thou hast shewed vnto thy seruaunt shulde syt seate lorde kynge hym kynge dauid answered sayde call bethsabe came kynges presence stode hym kyng sware sayng truly lorde lyueth hath ryd soule aduersyte euen sware vnto lord god israell sayenge salomon thy sonne shall reygne shall syt vpon seate wyll daye bethsabe bowed face earth dyd reuerence vnto kynge sayde praye god lorde kynge ☞ dauid maye lyue euer kynge dauid sayde cal sadock preest nathan prophet banaiahu son iehoiada came kynge kynge also sayd vnto take seruauntes lorde set salomon son vpon myne owne mule carye hym downe ☞ gihon let sadocke preest nathan prophet anoynte hym kynge ouer israell blowe ye trompettes saye god saue kynge salomon come vp hym maye come syt vpon seate shall kynge steade wyll cōmaunde hym captayne ouer israell iuda banaiahu son iehoiada answered kyng sayde amen praye god lorde god lorde kynge saye god hath ben lorde kynge euen salomon also make seate greater seate lorde kyng dauids hath ben sadock preest nathan prophet banaiahu son iehoiada crethites phelethites went downe set salomon vpon kynge dauids mule brought hym gihon sadock preest toke horne oyle tabernacle anoynted salomon people blewe trompettes sayde god saue kynge salomon peple came vp hym pypyng pypes reioysynge greatly earth range sounde adonia gestes called vnto hym herde euen made ende eatynge ioab herde soūde trompet sayd howe happeneth soche noyse citye yet spake behold ionathas sonne abiathar preest came adonia sayd vnto hym come thou art valyaunt man bryngest good tydyngꝭ ionathas answered sayde adonia uerely lorde kyng dauid hath made salomon kynge kynge hath sent hym sadok preest nathan prophet banaiahu sonne iehoiada crethites phelethites haue set hym vpon kynges mule sadocke preest nathan prophet haue annoynted hym kynge gihon came vp agayne reioysed citye dyd sounde agayne noyse ye haue herde salomon sytteth seate kyngdom moreouer kynges seruauntes came blesse lorde kynge dauid sayenge thy god make name salomon honorable thy name make seate greater thy seate kynge bowed hymselfe vpon bed thus sayd kynge blessed lorde god israell whithe hath made one syt seate daye myue eye seynge gestes adonia afrayde rose vp went euery man waye adonia fearynge presence salomon arose went ❀ tabernacle lorde caught holde horne aulter one tolde salomon saynge behold adonia doth feare kynge salomon hath 〈…〉 di▪ 21 b caught holde horne aulter sayenge▪ let kynge salomon sweare vnto daye wyll sley seruaunte swerde salomon sayde yf wyll chylde vertue shall heere hym fall earth yf wyckednes founde hym shall dye kynge salomon sent brought hym aulter came dyd obeysaunce vnto kynge salomon salomon sayd vnto hym get thyne house ¶ dauid dyeth adonai requireth haue abisag con • ubine therfore salomon cōmaudeth sley hym▪ abiathar put preesthode semei ioab sleyne capi ii dayes dauid drewe nygh shulde dye charged salomon sonne sayenge go waye worlde 〈…〉 • ▪ • 〈…〉 ▪ ix ••• b 〈…〉 ▪ 〈◊〉 • thou stronge therfore shewe thy selfe man kepe thou watche lorde thy god thou walke wayes kepe ☞ statute preceptes iudgementes testymonyes euen wrytten lawe moses thou mayst prosper al thou doest euery thynge thou medlest lorde also maye make good worde whiche spake vnto sayenge yf thy chyldren take hede theyr waye walke trueth▪ theyr hertes theyr soules regst ix • shalt thou oute man seate israell reg iii c 〈◊〉 xx • moreouer thou wotest howe ioab sonne zatuia serued dyd two captaynes hoostes israell vnto abner sonne ner vnto amasa sonne iether whome slewe shed bloode tyme peace euen ben war ☞ put bloode war vpon gyrdle aboute loynes shoe feete▪ deale hym therfore accordynge thy wysdome brynge hoore heade downe graue peace ii reg xix • shewe kyndnesse vnto sonnes berselat gileadite maye eate thy table came fled absalomii xvi • thy brother beholde thou hast semei sonne gera son gemini bahurim whiche cursed horrible curse day whē went mahanahim came mete iordane sware hym lorde sayenge wyll sley swerde thou shalte count hym vngyltye thou arte man wysdome knowest thou oughtest hym hoore heade shalte thou brynge graue bloode actes ii c dauid slepte father buryed citye dauid dayes whiche dauid reygned vpon israel fourtye yeres seuen yeres reygned hebron thyrtye thre yeares reygned ierusalem • 〈◊〉 〈…〉 sat salomon vpon seate dauid father kyngdome stablysshed myghtely adonia sonne hagith came bethsabe mother salomon sayde reg▪ 〈…〉 commest thou peaceably sayde peaceably sayde moreouer haue somwhat say vnto sayde say sayde thou knowest kyngdome myne israel set theyr face shulde reygne howe kyngdome turned awaye gyuen brother appoynted hym lorde nowe aske peticyon denye sayde vnto hym say sayde speake praye vnto salomon kynge wyll say nay gyue abisag sunamite wyfe bethsabe sayde well wyll speake vnto kynge bethsabe therfore went vnto kynge salomon speake vnto hym adonia kynge rose vp mete bowed hymselfe vnto sat hym downe seate seate set kynges mother sat ryght syde sayd desyre lytell peticyon pray saye naye kynge sayde vnto aske mother wyll say naye sayde let abisag sunamite gyuen adonia thy brother wyfe kynge salomon answered sayde vnto mother doest thou aske abisag sunamite adonia aske hym kyngdome also myne elder brother hath hym abiathar preest ioab sonne zaruia kynge salomon sware lorde sayenge god yf adonia haue spoken worde agaynst owne lyfe nowe therfore truly lorde lyueth whiche hath ordeyned set seate dauid father ☞ made house promysed adonia shall dye day kynge salomon sent hande banaiahu sonne iehoiada smote hym dyed vnto abiathar preest sayde kynge get anatoth vnto thyne owne feldes thou arte worthy death wyll tyme kyll bycause thou barest arke lorde god dauid father bycause thou hast suffered father afflyctyons salomon put away abiathar beynge preest vnto lorde myght fulfyll wordꝭ lorde spake ouer house eli silo tydyngꝭ came also ioab ioab turned adonia ❀ though turned absalom ioab fled vnto tabernacle lorde caught holde horne aulter tolde kynge salomon howe ioab fled vnto tabernacle lorde stode aulter salomon sent banaiahu sonne iehoiada sayenge go fall vpon hym banaiahu came tabernacle lorde sayde vnto hym thus sayth kynge come sayde nay wyll dye euen banaiahu brought kyng word agayne sayenge thus sayde ioab thus answered kynge sayde euen hath sayde smyte hym bury hym thou mayst take awaye blood ioab shed causelesse house father lorde shall bryng blood vpon owne heade smote two men ryghtwyser better slue swerde father dauid knowynge therof euen abner sonne ner captayne hooste israell amasa sonne iether captayne hoost iuda theyr blood shall therfore returne vpon heade ioab heade seede euer vpon dauid vpon seede vpon house vpō seate shal peace euermore lorde banaiahu sonne iehoiada went vp smote hym slue hym buryed hym owne house wyldernesse kynge put banaiahu son iehoiada rowme ouer hoost put sadocke preest rowme abiathar kynge sent called semei sayde vnto hym buylde house ierusalem dwell se thou go forth thence whyther thou sure day thou goest passest ouer ryuer cedron thou shalt dye daye thy bloode shall thyne owne heade semei sayde vnto kynge good thynge lorde kynge hath sayd wyl seruaunt semei dwelte ierusalem many daye chaunced thre yeares two seruauntes semei ran awaye vnto achis son maacha kynge geth tolde semei sayenge beholde thy seruauntes geth semei stode vp sadled asse gat hym geth achis seke seruaūtes returned brought seruauntes agayne geth tolde salomon howe semei gone ierusalem geth come agayne kynge sent called semei sayde vnto hym dyd charge lorde othe testifyed vnto saynge sure soeuer thou goest walkest abrode whyther thou shalt dye death thou saydest vnto good tydynges haue herde hast thou kepte othe lorde cōmaundement charged withall kyng sayde moreouer semei 〈◊〉 thou remembrest wyckednes whiche thyne herte knoweth thou dydest dauid father lorde also shal brynge thy wyckednesse vpon thyne owne heade kynge salomon shall blessed seate dauid stablysshed lorde euer kynge commaunded banaiahu sonne iehoiada whiche went smote hym dyed kyngdome stablysshed hande salomon ¶ salomon taketh pharaos doughter wyfe lorde appeareth hym gyueth hym wysdom pleatynge two harlottes shulde owe lyuyng chylde salomon sentence therin capi iii salomon made affinite wt pharao kynge egypt toke pharaos doughter brought ☞ citye dauid vntyll made ende buyldyng owne house house lorde wall ierusalem rounde aboute people sacrificed aulters made hylles bycause house buylde vnto name lorde vntyll dayes salomon loued lorde walked ordinaunces dauid father saue sacrificed offered incense vpon aulters hylles • par kynge went gibeon offer ☞ specyall offerynge place thousand burntofferynges dyd salomon offre vpon aulter gibeon lorde appeared salomon dreame nyght god sayde aske thou wylt may gyue salomon sayde thou hast shewed vnto thy seruaunt dauid father great mercy walked trueth ryghtuousnes playnesse herte thou hast kept hym great mercy thou hast gyuen hym son syt seate come passe daye • pata nowe lorde god thou hast made thy seruaunt kynge steade dauid father •• pi ix yonge wote howe ☞ go thy seruaunt myddes thy people whiche thou hast chosen verely people many tolde nombred multitude •• pi ix b gyue therfore vnto thy seruaunt vnderstandynge herte iudge thy people maye dyscerne bytwene good bad able iudge thy myghtye people pleased lorde well salomon desyred thynge god sayde vnto hym bycause thou hast asked thynge hast asked longe lyfe neyther hast asked ryches ☞ soule thyne enemyes hast asked vnderstandynge discrecyon iudgement beholde haue done accordynge thy peticyon haue gyuen wyse vnderstandynge herte none lyke neyther shall aryse lyke vnto haue also gyuen whiche thou hast asked euen rychesse honoure shall kyng lyke thy dayes yf thou wylte walke wayes kepe myne ordynaunces cōmaundementes 3 xv dauid thy father dyd walke wyll lengthen thy dayes salomon awoke beholde dreame • pata b came ierusalem stode arke testament lorde offered burntofferynges peaceofferynges made feast seruaūtes ✚ came two woman harlottes vnto kynge stode hym one woman sayde oh lorde woman dwell one house delyuered chylde house thyrde daye delyuered delyuered also togyther straunger v house saue two wyues chylde dyed nyght smothered arose mydnyght toke son syde whyle thyne handmayd slept layde bosom put dead chylde bosom rose vp gyue chylde sucke beholde deade loked vpon mornyng beholde son whiche dyd beare woman sayd son lyueth thy sonne deade sayd agayne thy son deade sonne lyue thus pleated kynge sayde kynge one sayeth alyue son deade thyne sayeth naye thy son deade lyue chylde myne kynge sayde brynge swerde brought swerde kynge kynge sayd deuyde lyuynge chylde two gyue one halfe one spake woman whose lyuyng chylde vnto kynge bowel yerned vpon son sayd beseche lorde gyue lyuyng chylde wyse sley sayde let neyther myne thyne deuyde kynge answered sayd luke vii • gyue lyuynge chylde sley mother therof israell herde iudgement whiche kynge iudged feared kyng sawe wysdom god hym iustyce ⊢ ¶ prynces ruler vnder salomon purueyaunce vyttayles nombre horse parable capi iiii kynge salomon kyng ouer israell lordes azariahu son sadock preest elihoreph ahia sonnꝭ sisa scrybes iehosaphath sonne ahilud recorder banaiahu sonne iehoiada ouer hoost sadocke abiathar preestꝭ azariahu son nathan ouer ☞ offycers zabud sonne nathan preest kynges companyon ahisar stewarde housholde iii reg v adoniram son abda ouer trybutes salomon twelue offycers ouer israell whiche prouided vyttayle kynge householde eche man moneth yeare made prouisyon necessary thynges theyr name sonne hur mount ephraim sonne dekar makaz saalbin bethsames elon bethhauā sonne hesed aruboth whome pertayned socho lande hepher sonne abinadab regyon dor whiche tapheth doughter salomon wyfe baana sonne ahilud ouer thanach magiddo ouer bethsan whiche zarthana beneth iezrael bethsan playne mehola euen vnto place ouer agaynst iechmean son gaber ramoth gilead townes iair son manasse whiche gilead vnder hym regyon argob whiche basan lx great cityes walles barres brasse ahinadab sonnꝭ hiddo mahenaim ahimaaz nephthalim • oke basmath doughter salomon wyfe baana son husai aser aloth iehosaphat sonne paruah isachar semei son ela beniamin gaber sonne uri countrey gilead lande sehon kynge amorites og kynge basan offycer alone lande iuda israell many euen sande see nōbre eatyng drynkynge makynge mery 〈…〉 72 • salomon reygned ☞ ouer kyngdoms 〈…〉 ryuer vnto lande philistine euen vnto border egypt brought presentes serued salomon dayes lyfe salomon breade one day xxx quarter manchet floure thre score quarter meale ten stalled ox twentie pasture hundred shepe besyde harte buckes wylde gootes ❀ capon ruled regyon syde euphrates thiphsah 〈…〉 aza ouer kynges syde thousande horseman offycers prouyded • yttayle kynge salomon al • ame place kynge salomon table euery man moneth lacked nothynge barlye also strawe horse mule brought vnto place offycers euery man kynge tyre sent seruaūtes vnto salomō herde anoynted hym kynge rowme father 11 reg • • hiram euer louer dauid 11 〈…〉 salomon sent hiram sayenge thou knowest 11 〈…〉 dauid father coulde buylde house vnto name lorde god warres euery syde vntyll lorde put vnder sol feete nowe lorde god hath gyuen rest euery syde neyther aduersarye euyll plage beholde 〈…〉 determyned buylde house vnto name lorde god lorde spake vnto dauid father sayenge thy son wyll set vpon thy seate shall huylde house vnto name nowe therfore cōmaunde thou hewe cedartrees libanon seruauntes shall thyne vnto wyll gyue hyre thy seruaū te accordynge soche thynges thou shalte appoynt thou knowest amonge v skyll hewe tymbre lyke vnto sidon hiram herde wordes salomon reioysed greatly sayde blessed lorde day hath gyuen vnto dauid wyse sonne ouer myghtye people hiram sent salomon sayenge haue considered thyngꝭ whiche thou sentest wyl accomplyshe thy desyre concernyng tymbre cebar tree fyre seruauntes shall brynge libanon see wyll conuay shyppe vnto place thou shalte shewe wyll cause discharged thou shalte receyue thou shalt pleasure agayne yf thou minystre fode house hiram gaue salomon cedar tree fyrre tree accordynge good vnto promysse 〈…〉 promysed dauid thy father 〈…〉 wyll dwell among chyldren israell wyll forsake people israell salomon therfore buylte house finysshed syled walles house within bordes cedar tree worke namely pyctures cherubes palme tree grauen floures within queer without temple floore house couered golde bothe within queer also without temple enterynge queer made two dores olyue tree vpper cubytes dyd cōpasse ether made two heade peces molten brasse fassyon crowne set toppꝭ pyllers heyght one heade pece conteyned fyue cubytes heyght head pece cōteyned fyue cubites also made also net worke ga • landes cheyne worke vpō heade peces top pillers euen seuen rowes vpon one headpece seuen vpon made pyllers two rowes roūde aboute one wrythē worke couer headpeces vpon pomgarnates thus dyd also headpeace headpeces toppes pyllers couered aboue wt curyous worke rose towarde palace space iiii cubites lykewyse vnder headpeces ii pyllers beneth ouer agaynst myddes net worke vpō seconde headpece two hundred pomegarnates two rowes rounde aboute set vp pyllers porche temple set vp ryght pyller called name therof • •• ed fast 〈◊〉 iachin whē set vp lefte pyller called name therof • •• gth boaz top pyllers worke rose workmanshyp pyllers fynysshed made molten lauatory ten cubites wyde brym brym rounde compasse fyue cubites hygh stryng thyrtie cubites dyd compasse aboute vnder brym knoppes rounde ten one cubite compassed lauatory rounde knoppes cast two rowes cast stode twelue ox whiche iii loked towarde north iii towarde west thre towarde south thre towarde east lauatorye stode vpon theyr hynderpartes inwarde hande bredthe thycke brym wrought lyke brym cup floures lylyes contayned two thousande ☞ bates made ten socket brasse foure cubites longe foure cubites brode apece thre cubites hygh worke sockers maner sydes sydes bytwene ledge sydes bytwene ledge lyon ox cherub lykewyse vpon ledge aboue beneth lyon ox certayne addicions made thyn worke vnder euery socket foure brasen wheles bordes brasse four corner therof vndersetters vnder lauatorie cast eche ouer agaynst felowe stalke lauatorye mydle ❀ vvhere sene oursyde one cubyte hyghe cubyte halfe round heyght grauen workes whose sydes made four square rounde vnder sydes foure wheles axeltrees ioyned faste bottome heyght euerye whele cubyte halfe workemanshyp wheles lyke worke charet whele axeltrees nauels spoke shaftes molten iiii vndersetters iiii corner one socket vndersetters verye bottome selfe heyght bottome roūde compasse halfe cubite hye heyght bottom proceded ledge sydes bordes ledge sydes grauen pyctures cherubins lyon palme tree one rounde aboute thus made ten socket maner one fassyon castyng one measure one syse made ten lauers brasse one lauer conteynynge xl bathe one lauer foure cubites vpon euery one ten socket put one lauer put fyue socket ryght syde house fyue lefte set lauatorie ryght syde house eastwarde towarde south hiram made pottes shouels basens fynyshed worke made kyng salomō house lorde say two pyllers two rounde heade peces set toppes two pyllers foure hundred pomegarnates two net workes euen two rowes pomgarnates one net worke couer two headpeces set toppes pyllers ten socket ten lauers socket lauatorie twelue ox vnder pottes shouels basens al vessel whiche hiram made kyng salomon house lorde bryght brasse playne iordan dyd kyng cast euen thycke claye bytwene socoh zarthan salomon lefte al vessel vnweyed bycause excedynge many neyther founde oute weyght brasse salomon made vessel perteyned vnto house lorde golden aulter golden table wheron shewbread fyue candelstyckes right syde fyue lefte queer pure golde floures lampes snoffers golde bolles flat peces basens spones masoures pure golde hyndges made golde dores queer place holy dores people israel herte dauid father buylde house name lorde god israell lorde sayde vnto dauid father thyne hert buylde house vnto name thou dydest well thou wast mynded neuertheles thou shalt buylde house thy sonne shall come thy loynes shal buylde house vnto name lorde hath made good word spake rysen vp roume dauid father syt seate israel lorde promysed haue buylte house name lorde god israel haue prepared therin place arke wherin couenaunt lorde whiche made oure father brought oute lande egypte salomon stode aulter lorde syght al congregacion israel stretched handꝭ towarde heuen sayd ii p •• v • • lorde god israel god lyke heuen aboue earthe beneth thou kepest couenaunt mercye thy seruauntes walke theyr herte thou hast kepte thy seruaunt dauid father thou promysedst hym thou spakest also thy mouth hast fulfylled thyne hand come passe daye therfore nowe lorde god israell kepe thy seruaunt dauid father thou promysedst hym saynge ii regū •• thou shalte wt man syght syt seate israel thy child take hede theyr way walke thou hast walked syght nowe god israell let thy worde verified whiche thou spakest vnto thy seruaunt dauid father wyll god dede dwel earth beholde esai▪ 〈◊〉 ▪ • • te • ▪ ••• heuens heuens heuens able conteyne shulde house haue buylded haue thou therfore respecte vnto prayer thy seruaunt supplicacion lorde god heare voyce prayer daye thyne eye maye open towarde house nyght daye euen towarde place whiche thou hast sayd 〈…〉 name shall thou mayste herken vnto prayer whiche thy seruaunt prayeth place regarde thou supplicacion thy seruaunt thy people israel pray place heare thou heuen thy dwellynge place thou hearest haue mercye 〈…〉 vi yf man trespasse agaynst neyghboure go othe bytwene one compel come swearynge thyne aulter house herken thou heuen worke iudge thy seruauntes thou condempne vngodly brynge waye vpon heade iustifye ryghteous gyue hym accordyng ryghteousnesse 〈…〉 thy people israel put worse enemye bycause haue synned agaynste afterwarde turne agayne knowlege vnto thy name praye make supplycacyon vnto house heare thou heuen mercyfull vnto synne thy people israel bryng agayne vnto lande whiche thou gauest vnto theyr father 〈…〉 17 • heuen shut vp rayne bycause haue synned agaynst yet yf praye place knowlege vnto thy name turne theyr synne thorowe thy scourgynge heare thou heuen mercyfull ❀ vnto synnes thy seruauntes thy people israel thou shewe good waye walke gyue rayne vpon thy lande thou hast gyuen vnto thy people enherite lande derth pestylence brought blastyng greshopper caterpyller yf theyr enemye beseyge lande theyr cityes soeuer plage syckenesse chaunce 〈…〉 prayer supplicacion soeuer made man thy people israell whiche shall knowledge euery man plage owne herte stretche forth handꝭ towarde house heare thou heuen euen thy dwellyng place mercyfull worke gyue euery man accordynge wayes euen thou onely knowest herte thou onely knowest hertes chyldren men may feare longe lyue lande whiche thou gauest vnto father lykewyse yf straunger thy people israell 〈…〉 vi • • come oute farre countrey forthy name sake shall heare thy great name thy myghtie hande thy stretched oute arme shall come praye house therfore heare thou heuen thy dwellynge place straūger calleth nacions earth may know thy name feare thy people israell may knowe thy name called vpon house whiche haue buylte thy people go battayle agaynst theyr enemy whyther soeuer thou shalt sende shall pray vnto lorde dani vi • towarde way citye whiche thou hast chosen towarde house haue buylte forthy name heare yu heuen theyr prayer supplicacion iudge theyr cause synne agaynst 1 〈…〉 man synneth thou angry delyuer hande theyr enemyes carye away prysoners vnto lande theyr enemyes whyther far neare yet yf turne agayne vnto theyr hertes lande whiche caryed away captiue returne pray vnto lande theyr enemyes sayenge haue synned haue done wyckedlye haue cōmytted vngodlynesse turne agayne vnto al theyr herte theyr soule lande theyr enemyes whiche led awaye captiue pray vnto towarde waye theyr lande thou gauest vnto theyr father towarde citye thou hast chosen towarde house haue buylte thy name heare thou theyr 〈…〉 prayer supplicacion heuen thy dwellynge place iudge theyr cause mercyfull vnto thy people haue synned agaynst vnto theyr iniquity wherby haue done wickedly agaynst get thou fauour whiche led away captiue may haue compassyon thy people thyne enheritaunce whiche thou broughtest egypte euen myddes fournace yron let thyne eye open vnto prayer thy seruaunt vnto prayer thy people israel 1 esdr • • herken vnto call vnto yu dydest seperate among nacions earth thyne owne enheritaunce thou saydest hande moses thy seruaunt thou broughtest oure father exod • • egypte lorde god 11 par 7 • salomon made ende prayeng prayer supplicacion vnto lorde arose aulter lorde knelynge knee stretchynge handꝭ vp heuen stode blessed congre gacion israel loude voyce saynge blessed lorde hath gyuen rest vnto people israel accordyng promised • regili hath fayled one word good promyse whiche promysed hande moses seruaunt lorde god v father forsake v neyther leaue v maye bowe hertes vnto hym maye walke wayes kape cōmaundementes statute lawes cōmaunded father wordes whiche haue prayed lorde nygh vnto lorde god day nyght defende cause seruaunt cause people israell thynge socuer chaunce tyme al nacions earth may know lorde god none let herte therfore perfyte lorde god ye walke statute kepe cōmaundementes day kynge israell hym offered offerynges lorde 〈◊〉 7a salomon offered sacrifice peace offerynges vnto lorde offered vnto israel people ¶ lorde appeareth seconde tyme salomon salomon gyueth townes hirem lananytes become tret 〈◊〉 sendeth shyppes golde vnytoeth many litre capi ix salomō •• para 7 • finysshed buyldyng house lorde kynges palace mynde apoynted make lorde appeared vnto hym agayne appeared hym gibeon lorde sayde vnto hym haue herde thy prayer thy intercessyon thou hast made haue halowed house thou hast buylte put name euer myne eye myne herte shal perpetually yf thou wylte walke dauid thy father walked purenesse herte ryghteousnes al haue cōmaunded wylte kepe statute lawes wyll stablysshe seate thy kyngdom vpon israel euer promysed dauid thy father sayenge iii reg •• thou shalte without man vpon seate israel yf ye youre chyldren turne awaye wyll kepe cōmaundementes statute whiche haue set go serue goddes worshyp wyll wede israel lande haue gyuen house whiche haue halowed 4 reg • iere •• name wyl cast syght israell shall prouerbe fable among al nacions house shal taken away euery one passeth shall astonyed shall hysse shall saye ••••• 〈◊〉 iere 〈◊〉 • hath lorde done vnto lande house shall answere bycause forsoke lorde theyr god whiche brought theyr father lande egypte haue taken holde vpon goddes haue worshypped serued therfore hath lorde brought vpon euyll •• p ••• fortuned ☞ ende twentye yeres salomon fynysshed buyldyng two house wete house lorde kynges palace hiram kynge tyre broughte salomon tymbre cedar fyrre tree golde soeuer desyred salomon agayne gaue hiram twentie cityes lande galile • 〈◊〉 • hiram came oute tyre se cityes whiche salomon gyuen hym pleased hym sayde cityes whiche thou hast gyuen brother called lande ☞ cabull vnto daye hiram sente kynge syxe score hundred weyght golde summe whiche kynge salomon raysed tribute buylded house lorde owne house ☞ millo wall ierusalem hazoer meg • ddo gazer pharao kyng egypte went vp toke gazer burnt fyre slue cananites dwelt cytie gaue present vnto doughter salomon wyfe salomon buylte gazer beth horon nether baalath ☞ thamar wyldernesse lande treasure cityes salomon ❀ vvere vnvvalled made strong cite charettes city horseman al salomon desyred wolde buylde ierusalem libanon lande dominyon people lefte amorites hethites pheresites heuites iesubites whiche chyldren israell theyr chyldren left lande chyldren israel also able destroye dyd salomon compell brynge tribute vnto day chyldren israel dyd salomon 〈◊〉 • 5 • make bonde men men war minister lordes captaynes ruler charettes horseman lordes set ouer salomon worke euen fyue c fyftye ruled people wrought worke pharaos doughter came vp citie dauid vnto house salomon buylte dyd also buylde millo thryse yere dyd salomon offre burnt offerynges peace offerynges vpon aulter whiche buylte vnto lorde burnt insence vpon aulter lorde fynysshed house kynge salomon made nauye shyppes azion gaber whiche besyde elath brynke red see land edom hiram sent shyp also seruaūtes shypmen knowledge see seruauntes salomon came ophir fet thence one twentye score hundred weyght golde brought kynge salomon ¶ name saba cōmeth heare wysdom salomon whose royaltye discry • ed capi x quene 〈◊〉 • ii 〈◊〉 • • saba hearynge fame salomon cōcernynge name lorde came proue hym harde question came ierusalem great trayne camelles bare swete odoures golde excedyng moche precyous stone came salomō comuned wt hym herte salomon declared vnto al question one thyng hyd frō kynge expounded vnto quene saba consydered salomon wysdome house buylded meate table ☞ syttyng seruauntes order minister theyr apparell drynke burntsacrifices offred house lorde astonyed sayd vnto kyng true worde herde myne owne lande thy sayenges thy wysdome howbeit byleued tyl came sawe myne eye beholde one halfe tolde thy wysdome prosperite excedeth whiche herde happy thy men happy thy seruauntes whiche stande euer heare thy wysdome blessed lorde thy god whiche loued set seate israel bycause lorde loued israell euer made kynge equite rygteousnesse gaue kynge syxe score hundred weyght golde swete odoures excedyng moche precyous stone came haboundaūce swete odoures quene saba gaue kynge salomon nauye also 3 reg 〈◊〉 • shyppes hiram caryed golde ophir brought lykewyse great plentye ☞ almuge tre precyous stone kynge made almuge tree pyllers house lorde kynges palace made harpes psaltryes syngers came suche almuge tree sene vnto day kyng salomon gaue vnto quene saba accordynge desyre soeuer asked besydes gaue free wyll owne hande returned vnto owne countrey seruauntes weyght golde came salomon one yere syxe hūdred thre score syxe talentes golde besydes chapman merchauntes poticaries kynges arabie lordes countrey kyng salomon made two hundred buckelers beaten golde syxe hundred sycles golde went buckeler made iii hundred sheldes beten golde thre poūde golde went one shelde kynge put iii reg 7 • house wood libanon kynge made great seate yuerye couered best golde seate syxe steppe toppe seate roūde behynde pomels eyther syde place seat two lyon stode besyde pomels stode xii lyon steppe vi syde none like worke sene kyngdome deut 17 b al kyng salomon drynkyng vessel golde lykewyse al vessel house wood libanon pure golde syluer nothynge worth dayes salomon kynges nauye shyppes went see ☞ vnto tharsis nauye hirams shyppes euen thre yere went nauye tharsis brought golde syluer ☞ elephantes tethe ape pecockes •• pat ix f kynge salomon exceded kynges earth bothe rychesse wysdome al worlde resorted salomon wysdome whiche god put herte brought hym euery man present vessel syluer vessel golde rayment harnesse swete odour horse mule yere yere salomon gathered togyther charettes horseman thousande iiii hundred charettes twelue thousande horse men whome bestowed charet city kyng ierusalem 11 pat • kynge made syluer ierusalem plenteous stone cedar plenteous wylde fyg tree growe aboundauntly feldes ☞ bryngynge horse also egypte collectyon ware dyd kynges marchauntes take agayne solde stuffe pryce charet came vp egypt vi hundred sycles syluer ☞ one horse hundred fyftye euen kynges hethites kynges siria dyd bryng thorowe theyr handes ¶ salomon hath seuen hundred quenes thre hundred concubynes whiche brynge hym idolatrye aduersaryes •• agaynst hym dyeth capi xi kyng 111 • • salomon loued many outlandyshe woman doughter pharao woman moabites ammonite edomites zidonites hethites yet concernyng nacions lorde sayd vnto chyldren israel exod • 4 b ☞ come ye let come el wyll turne hertes theyr goddes neuertheles salomon claue vnto loue seuen hūdred quenes ccc cōcubines wyuesdeut • 7 turned away herte came passe salomon olde wyues turned herte god herte perfyte lorde god herte dauid father salomon folowed astaroth god zidons milcō obhominacion ammonitꝭ salomon wrought wyckednesse syght lorde folowed lorde perfytely dyd dauid father dyd salomon buylde ☞ hygh place chamos abhominacion moab hyll ierusalem vnto moloch abhominacion chyldrē ammon lykewyse dyd outlandyshe wyues burnt sence offered vn theyr god lorde angrye wt salomon bycause herte turned frō lorde god israel 111 〈◊〉 〈◊〉 whiche appeared vnto hym twyse gaue hym charge concernyng thynge shulde folowe god kepte whiche lorde cōmaunded hym wherfore lorde sayd vnto salomon moche done thou hast kepte myne appoyntment statute cōmaunded wyll rent kyngdom wyll gyue thy seruaunt notwithstandynge thy dayes wyll bycause dauid thy father wyll take hande thy sonne howbeit wyll take away kyngdome wyll gyue ☞ one tribe thy son bycause dauid seruaunt bycause ierusalem whiche haue chosen lorde styrred vp aduersarye vnto salomon euen one hadad edomite kynges seede whiche edom whē dauid edom ioab captayne hoost gone vp burye sleyne smote men chyldren edom vi monethes dyd ioab remayne israel tyll destroyed men chyldren edom hadad fled certayne edomytes father seruauntes hym come egypte hadad beyng yet lytell chylde arose madian came paran toke mē paran came egypte vnto pharao kyng egypte whiche gaue hym house appoynted hym vittayles gaue hym land hadad gat great fauour syght phara • • gaue hym wyfe syster owne wyfe euen syster thahpenes quene syster thahpenes bare hym genubath sonne whō thahpenes norished pharaos house genubath pharaos housholde amonge sonnes pharao whē hadad herde egypte dauid layde slepe father ioab captayne hoost deade also sayd pharao let departe may go myne owne coūtrey pharao sayd vnto haste thou lacked thou woldest thus go thyne owne coūtrey answered nothyng howbeit let go god styrred hym vp aduersary one rezom sonne eliada whiche fled lorde hodadezer kynge zoba gathered men vnto hym became captayne ouer company whē dauid slue wente damasco dwelte reygned damasco therfore aduersarye israell dayes salomon myscheyfe hadad dyd abhorre israel reygned ouer syria ieroboam sonne hebat ephrathite zareda whose mother called zetuah wydowe salomon seruaunt ☞ lyfte vp hande agaynst kynge cause lyfte vp hande agaynst kyng salomon buylte mello mended broken place citye dauid father felow ieroboam mā war salomon sawe yonge man able worke made hym ruler ouer charge house ioseph chaunced ceason ieroboā wente ierusalem prophet ahia silonite met hym way hauyng newe mantell hym two alone felde ahia caught newe mantel hym rent twelue peces sayd ieroboam take ten peces sayth lorde god israel beholde wyll sent kyngdome handes salomon wyll gyue ten tribe 〈◊〉 vii • shal haue one seruaunt dauids sake ierusalem citye whiche haue chosen tribe israel bycause haue forsaken haue worshypped astharoth god zedons chamos god moabites milcom god chyldren ammon haue walked wayes fulfyll pleasure statute lawes dyd dauid father wyll take hole kyngdome hande wyll make hym cheyfe lyfe longe dauid seruauntes sake chose bycause kepte cōmaundementes statute 〈◊〉 xii • 〈◊〉 132 b wyl take kyngdome sonnes hande wyll gyue vnto euen ten tribe sonne wyll gyue one trybe dauid seruaunt may haue light alway ierusalem citye haue chosen put name wyll take thou shalte reygne accordynge thy soule desyreth shalte kyng ouer israel yf thou herken vnto commaunde wylte walke wayes ryght syght thou kepe statute cōmundementes dauid seruaunt dyd wyl buylde sure house shal contynue buylte seruaunt dauid wyl gyue israell vnto therwith wyll vexe seede dauid euer salomon sought therfore kyll ieroboam ieroboam arose fled egypte vnto sisak kyng egypte contynued egypte vntyl death salomon rest wordes concerne salomon al dyd wysdom wrytten boke wordes salomon tyme salomon reygned ierusalem vpon israell fourtye yere salomon slepte layd hym father buryed citye dauid father rehoboam sonne reygued steade ¶ kyngdom deuyded rehoboam reygneth ouer 〈◊〉 trybes ieroboam ouer ten adu • stoned ieroboam maketh golden calues capi xii 11 〈◊〉 x • rehoboam went sichem al israel come sichem make hym kyng ieroboam sonne nabat whiche yet egypte herde 111 xii •• fled egypte presence kyng salomon dwelte egypte sent called hym ieroboam congregacyon israel came spake vnto rehoboam sayenge thy father made oure ☞ yoke greuous nowe therfore make thou greuous seruyce thy father sore yoke put vpon v lyghter wyl serue sayd vnto departe yet space iii dayes come agayn people departed kynge rehoboam toke counsayle olde mē stode salomon father whyle yet lyued sayd counsayle gyue ye may haue matter answere people sayde vnto hym yu seruaūt vnto people day folow theyr myndes answere speke kynde wordes thē wyl thy seruaūtes euer forsoke counsayie olde men gyuen hym called vnto counsayle yonge men growen vp hym wayted hym sayd vnto counsayle gyue ye maye answere people haue communed sayenge make yoke whiche thy father dyd put vpon v lyghter yonge men growen vp hym spake vnto hym sayenge thus shalte thou speake vnto people haue sayd vnto thy father made yoke heuy make thou v lyghter euen thus shalte thou say vnto ❀ lytell fynger shall weyghtyer thē father loyues nowe father dyd lade put greuous yoke vpon wyl make heuyer father also corrected scourge wyll chastyse wt ☞ scorpion ieroboam people came behoboam thyrde daye kynge appoynted sayenge come agayne thyrde day kyng answered people churlysshly lefte olde men counsayle gaue hym spake coūsayle yonge men saynge father made yoke greuous wyll make greuouser father also chastysed whyppes wyl chastyse wt scorpion kyng herkened vnto people ordenaunce god myght •• reg 〈◊〉 • performe sayenge whiche lorde spake ahia silonite vnto ieroboam sonne nebat israell sawe kynge regarded people answered kynge wordes saynge •• r •• • x procyon haue dauid haue enheritaunce sonne isai •• pat x tentes israel se thyne owne house dauid israell departed vnto theyr tentes howbeit ouer chyldren israel dwelte citye iuda dyd rehoboam reygne styll kynge rehoboam sent adurā receyuer tribute israel stoned hym deathe kyng rehoboam made spede get vp charet flee ierusalem israell rebelled agaynst house dauid vnto day al israell herde ieroboam come agayne sent called hym vnto multitude made hym kynge ouer israel tribe folowed house dauid iuda onely •• pat xi rehoboam come ierusalem gathered house iuda tribe beniamin hundred foure score thousande chosen men whiche good warryours fyght agaynst house israel brynge kyngdome agayne rehoboam sonne salomon worde god came vnto sema • man god saynge speake vnto rehoboam sonne salomon kyng iuda vnto house iuda beniamin remenaunt peple sayenge thus sayth lorde ye shall go vp yet fyght agaynst brother chyldren israel returne euery man house thyng doyng herkened therfore worde lorde returned departe accordynge worde lorde ieroboā buylte sichem mount ephraim dwelte therin went thence iudi 〈◊〉 buylte penuel ieroboam thought herte nowe shall kyngdome returne house dauid yf people go vp sacrifice house lorde ierusalem thē shal herte people turne agayn vnto theyr lorde rehoboam kynge iuda shall kyll go agayne rehoboam kyng iuda 〈◊〉 〈◊〉 erod • 47 exodi •• whervpon kyng toke counsayle made two calues golde sayde vnto moche go vp ierusalemerodi 〈◊〉 〈…〉 beholde israel thy goddꝭ brought land egipte set one bethel set dan thyng turned synne people went bycause one farre dan made house hyll aulters 〈…〉 made preestes lowest people sonnes leui ieroboā made feast xv day viii moneth lyke vnto feast iuda offered aulter dyd bethel offre vnto calues made put bethel preestes hyll aulters whiche made offered burnt offerynges vpon aulter whiche made bethel xv daye viii moneth euen moneth whiche ymagened owne herte made solempne feast vnto chyldren israel offered vpon aulter burnt insence ¶ ieroboam doynge sacrifice vnto calues reprehended prophet hand dryed vp whyle putteth agaynst prophet prophet kylled buryed capi xiii beholde came ☞ man god iuda worde lorde vnto bethel ieroboam stode aulter put insence cryed agaynst aulter worde lorde sayd aulter aulter thus sayeth lorde beholde chylde shall borne vnto house dauid iosia name vpon shal offre preestes hyll aulters burne incense vpon mennes bone shall brent vpon gaue token tyme saynge token lorde hath spoken beholde aulter shall rente asshes vpon shall fall kynge herde sayenge man god whiche cryed agaynst aulter bethell stretched hande aulter sayenge holde hym hande whiche put forth agaynst hym dryed vp coulde pull agayne hym aulter also claue asunder asshes fell aulter accordynge token whiche man god gyuen worde lorde kynge answered sayde vnto man god •• od • • b 〈◊〉 23 b 〈◊〉 • iii c oh praye vnto lorde thy god make intercession hande may restored agayne man god sought lorde kynges hande restored agayne became afore kynge sayde vnto man god come home thou mayest dyne wyll gyue rewarde man god sayd vnto kyng yf thou woldest gyue halfe thyne house wyll go neyther wyll eate breade drynke water place charged thorow word lorde saynge eate bread drynke water turne agayne waye y• camest went another waye returned way came bethell dwelt ☞ olde prophet bethell son came tolde hym workes man god done daye bethell wordes whiche spoken vnto kynge ☞ tolde theyr father also theyr father sayde vnto waye went sonnes shewed hym waye man god went whiche came frome iuda sayde vnto sonnes sadle asse sadled gat hym vp theron went man god founde hym syttynge vnder tre sayd vnto hym arte thou man god camest iuda sayde sayde vnto hym come home eate breade answered may returne go neyther wyll eate bread drynke water place sayde worde lorde thou shalte eate breade drynke water turne agayne go waye thou camest sayde vnto hym prophet also well thou angell spake vnto worde lorde sayenge brynge hym agayne thyne house maye eate breade drynke water lyed vnto hym went agayne hym dyd eate breade house dranke water fortuned sat table worde lord came vnto prophet brought hym agayne cryed vnto man god came iuda sayenge thus sayeth lorde thou hast dysobeyed mouth lorde haste kepte cōmaundement whiche lorde thy god cōmaunded camest backe agayne hast eaten breade dronke water place concernynge whiche lorde dyd saye vnto thou shalt eate bread drynke water thy carkas shall come vnto sepulchre thy father cam passe eaten breade dronke prophet whiche brought hym agayne sadled hym asse gone 〈◊〉 lyon met hym waye siue hym carkas cast waye asse stode therby lyon stode coorse also men passed sawe carkas cast way lyon standyng therby came tolde towne olde prophet dwelt whē prophet brought backe agayne frō waye herde therof sayde man god dysobedient vnto worde lorde therfore lorde hath delyuered hym vnto lyon hath rent sleyne hym accordynge worde lorde whiche spake vnto hym spake sonnes sayenge sadle asse dyd went founde bodye cast waye asse lyon stode coorse lyon eaten carkas hurte asse prophet toke vp bodye man god layde vpon asse brought agayn olde prophet came citye lament burye hym layde bodye owne graue lamented ouer hym ala brother buryed hym spake sonnes sayenge dead se ye burye sepulcre wherin man god buryed laye bone besyde bone • reg 23 saynge cryed worde lorde agaynst aulter bethell agaynst house hyll aulters whiche cityes samarie shall come passe howbeit ieroboam conuerted wycked way turned backe made lowest people preestes hylaulters pleased hym fylled hande became preest hylaulters thynge turned synne vnto house ieroboam euen destroye hym brynge hym nought face earth ¶ • ctoboams wyfe asueth councell ai • prophet ieroboam dyeth sysack kynge egypte robbeth house lorde rehoboam dyeth abram succedeth hym capi xiiii tyme abia sonne ieroboam fell sycke ieroboam sayd vnto wyfe vp praye dysguyse thy selfe thou knowen wyfe ieroboam get silo ahia prophet tolde • regū xi • shuld kynge ouer people take ten loues cracknels cruse honye go hym maye tel shal come chylde ieroboams wyfe dyd arose went silo came house ahia ahia coulde se eye waren dymme age lorde sayde vnto ahia beholde wyfe ieroboam cōmeth aske thynge sonne sycke thus shalt thou saye vnto came feyned selfe nother woman ahia herde sounde feete came dore sayd come thou wyfe ieroboam feynest thou thy selfe another sent shewe heuy thynges go tell ieroboam thus sayeth lorde god israell moche 3 regū ▪ 12 • eralied amonge people made prynce ouer people israell dyd rent kyngdom away house dauid gaue neuertheles thou hast ben seruaunt dauid whiche kepte cōmaundementes folowed wt herte whiche ryght myne eye hast done euyll aboue thou hast gone made goddes molten ymages prouoke hast cast behynde thy backe therfore beholde wyll brynge euyll vpon house ieroboam wyll rote ieroboam euen 1 reg xv • pysseth agaynst wall hym pryson forsaken israell wyl take awaye remenaunte house ieroboam man taketh awaye dounge tyll hath caryed iii 〈◊〉 • whosoeuer ieroboams house dyeth towne hym shall dogges eate dyeth felde shall foules ayre cate lorde hath sayde uy therfore get thyne house behold thy foote entereth citye chylde shall dye israell shall mourne hym burye hym ieroboam shall come scpulchre bycause hym founde goodnesse towarde lorde god israell house ieroboā moreouer lorde shall styrre hym vp kynge ouer israell whiche shall destroye house ieroboam day ☞ nowe lorde shall smyte israell rede shaken water shall wede israell good lande whiche gaue theyr father ☞ shall scatter beyonde ryuer bicause haue made groues angred lorde shall gyue israell vp bycause synnes ieroboam dyd synne made israell synne ieroboams wyfe arose departed came thirzah came threshold dore chylde dead israell buryed hym lamented hym accordynge worde lorde spake hande seruaunt ahia prophete rest wordes concerne ieroboā warred reygned beholde wrytten booke cronycles kynges israell dayes whiche ieroboam reygned xxii yeare layde slepe father nadab sonne reygned steade rehoboam sonne salomon reygned iuda rehoboam rli yeare olde began reygne▪ reygned xvii yeare ierusalem cytye whiche lorde dyd chose trybes israell put name mother name naama ammonite iuda wrought wyckednesse syght lorde angred hym mothynges theyr father dyd theyr synnes whiche synned also made ☞ hylaulters ymages▪ groues euery hye hyll vnder euery thycke tree stues male chyldrē lande dyd accordynge abhominacyons nacyons whiche lorde cast chyldren israell fortuned fyfte yeare kynge rehoboham sisack kynge egypte came vp agaynst ierusalem toke awaye treasure house lorde treasure kynges house spoyled toke awaye shyldes golde 〈…〉 whiche salomon made whose steade kyng rehoboam made brasen shyldꝭ commytted vnto handes kepyng captaynes garde wayted dore kynges house kynge went house lorde garde bare brought agayne garde chambre rest wordes concerne rehoboam dyd wrytten booke cronycles kynges iuda warre bytwene rohoboam ieroboam theyr lyues rehoboam slepte father buryed besyde father citye dauyd mother name naama ammonite abiam sonne reygned steade ¶ wycked abiam reygneth ouer iuda ryghteous • succedeth rou • ne battayle bytwene asa baasa iehosaphat succedeth asa nadab succedeth ieroboam▪ baasa hylleth nadab capi xv xviii yeare kynge 〈…〉 ieroboam sonne nabat reygned abiam ouer iuda thre yeare reygned ierusalem mother name maacha doughter abisalom walked synnes father whiche done hym herte perfyte lorde god 〈…〉 herte dauid father neuerthelesse dauids sake dyd lorde god gyne hym lyght ierusalem set vp ☞ son hym stablysshe ierusalem bycause dauid dyd whiche ryght syght lorde turned nothynge cōmaunded hym al dayes lyfe 1 reg xii saue onely matter uria hethite war bytwene rohoboam ieroboam longe l • ued rest wordes concerne abiam dyd wrytten booke cronicles kynges iuda war bytwene abiam ieroboam abiam slepte father buryed hym citye dauid▪ asa son teygued steade • par 14 • xx yeare ieroboam kynge israell reygned asa ouer iuda xli yeare reygned ierusalem mother name maacha doughter abisalom asa dyd semed ryght eye lorde dyd dauid father 3 reg 22 • toke awaye hoore kepers lande put awaye abhomynable idol father made put downe •• par 15 • maacha ☞ mother frō bearyng rule bycause made ymages groues asa destroyed ymages burnt broke cedron ☞ hylaulters put downe neuerthelesse asas herte perfyte lorde dayes brought holy vessel father dedicate vnto house lorde golde syluer iuels warre bytwene asa baasa kynge israel theyr dayes 〈…〉 baasa kynge israell went vp agaynst iuda buylt rama wolde let none go asa kynge iuda asa toke syluer golde lefte treasure house lorde treasure kyngꝭ house delyuered vnto handes seruauntes asa sent 5 〈…〉 ben •• dad sonne tabrimon sonne hezion kynge siria dwelt damasco sayenge bonde bytwene bytwene father thy father beholde haue sent vnto present syluer golde thou come breake bonde thou hast baasa kynge israell maye departe me▪ benhadad herkened vnto kynge asa sent captaynes hoostes whiche agaynst cityes israell smote hion dan abell beth maacah regyon ceneroth withall lande nephthali baasa herde therof lefte buyldynge rama dwelt thi •• kynge asa made proclamacyon thorowout iuda noone shulde excused toke stone rama tymbre wherwith baasa buylded kynge asa buylte hyll ben iamin mizpa remenaunt wordes concerne asa myght dyd cityes buylded wrytten booke cronicles kynges iuda▪ neuerthelesse olde age dyseased feete asa slepte father buryed besyde father citie dauid father •• pa 17 math • b iehosaphat sonne reygned steade nadab sonne ieroboam began reygne vpon israell seconde yere asa kynge iuda reygned vpon israell two yeare dyd euyll syght lorde walkynge waye father synne wherwith made israell • ynne baasa sonne ahia whiche house isachar conspyred agaynst hym baasa smote hym gibbethon whiche citye philistine nadab israell layde seyge gibbethon euen thyrd yere asa kynge iuda dyd baasa sley hym reygned steade • il 14 fortuned kyng smote house ieroboam left hym nought brethed vntyll put hym cleane accordynge vnto saynge lorde whiche spake seruaūt ahia selonete bycause synnes ieroboam wherwith synned made israell synne prouocacyon angred lorde god israell rest wordes concerne nadab dyd wrytten booke cronicles kyngꝭ israel war bytwene asa baasa kynge israell theyr dayes thyrde yere asa kynge iuda began baasa sonne ahia reygne ouer israell thirza xxiiii yere dyd whiche euyll syght lorde walkynge waye ieroboam synne whiche made isaell syn ¶ iehu prophesyeth agaynst baasa whome ela succedeth •• •• hylleth maystre ela destroyeth house baasa ahab succedeth amri taketh wyfe wythed iezabell capi xvi worde lorde came iehu sonne hanani agaynst baasa sayenge asmoche exalted dust made captayne ouer people israell thou hast walked waye ieroboam hast made people israell syn anger theyr synnes beholde wyll roote posterite baasa posterite house wyll make house lyke house ieroboam sonne nabat 3 reg 14 • •• x • • man baasa whiche dyeth cytye hym shal dogges eate man hym dyeth feldes shal foules ayre eate rest wordes concerne baasa dyd power wrytten booke cronicles kynges israell baasa slepte father buryed thirza ela sonne reygned steade hande prophete iehu sonne hanani came worde lorde agaynst baasa agaynst house agaynst wyckednesse dyd syght lorde angeryng hym worke owne handꝭ shulde lyke house ieroboam ❀ ☞ bycause kylled hym ❀ say • hu sonne hanani prophet xxvi yere asa kynge iuda began ela sonne baasa reygne ouer israell thirza two yere seruaūt zimri captayne halfe charettes conspired agaynst hym thirza drynkynge dronken house arza steward house thirza zimri came smote kylled hym xxvii yere asa kynge iuda reygned steade fortuned kynge 〈◊〉 〈◊〉 ▪ • •• ▪ • ▪ • satte seate siue house baasa leanynge therof one pysse agaynst walle yea slue kynsfolkes frendes also thus dyd zimri destroye house baasa accordynge worde lorde whiche spake agaynst baasa hande iehu prophet synnes baasa synnes ela sonne whiche synned made israell syn angre lorde god israell theyr vanityes rest wordes concerne ela al dyd wrytten booke cronicles kynges israell xxvii yere asa kynge iuda dyd zimri reygne vii dayes thirza people hooste beseygynge gibbethon citye philistine people hoost herde one say zimri hath conspired sleyne kynge wherfore israell made amri captayne hoost kynge ouer israel day euen hoost amri departed vp frō gibbethon israell hym beseyged thirza zimri sawe citye must nedes taken went palace kyngꝭ house burnt hym selfe kynges house fyre dyed synnes synned doyng euell syght lorde walkynge waye ieroboam synnes whiche dyd made israell synne rest wordes cōcerne zimri treason wrought wrytten booke cronicles kynges israell people israell deuyded two partes halfe people folowed thibni sonne ginath makynge hym kyng halfe folowed amri people folowed amri preuayled agaynst people folowed thibni sonne ginath thibni dyed amri reygned xxxi yeare asa kynge iuda began amri reygne ouer israell xii yere sixe yeare reygned thirza bought hyll ❀ sohomron one schemar two talentes syluer buylte hyll called name citye whiche buylte name schemar whiche ben owner hyll schomron amri wrought whiche euyll eye lorde dyd worse hym walked waye ieroboam sonne nabat synnes made israell synne anger lorde god israell theyr vanityes rest wordes concerne amri dyd strength shewed wrytten boke cronicles kynges israell amry slept father buryed schemaron ahab sonne reygned steade xxxviii yeare asa kynge iuda beganne ahab sonne amri reygne ouer israell ahab sonne amri reygned ouer israell samaria xxii yeare ahad sonne amri dyd euyll syght lorde aboue hym semed vnto hym lyght thynge walke synnes ieroboam sonne nabat toke iezebell also doughter ethbaal kynge sidonytes wyfe • reg x went serued baall worshypped reared vp aulter baall temple baall whiche buylded schomron ahab made groues proceded angerynge lorde god israell kyngꝭ israell hym ❀ dayes dyd hiell bethel buylde ierico iosua vi cost hym abiram eldest sonne layde foundacion yongest son segub set vp gate accordyng vnto worde lorde iosua vi spake iosua sonne nun ¶ elsa 〈◊〉 norysshed fed rauens sent zarphat otherwyse called sareptha woman whose chylde raysed lyfe capi xvii elia thesbite whiche enhabytours gilead sayde vnto ahab 3 reg • 8 • truly lorde god israell lyueth stand deute • • 3 reg • 8 iacob v shall neyther dewe rayne yeares accordynge worde worde lorde came vnto hym sayenge get hence turne eastward hyde thy selfe broke cherith lyeth iordan thou shalt drynke ryuer haue commaunded rauens feede went dyd accordynge vnto worde lorde went dwelte brooke cherith iordane rauens brought hym breade flesshe mornynge lyke wyse breade flesshe euenynge dranke brooke chaunced whyle brooke dryed vp bycause fell rayne vpon earth ✚ worde lorde came vnto hym sayenge luke ii •• • vp get ☞ zarphath whiche sidon dwel beholde haue cōmaunded wydowe susteyne arose went zarphath came gate citye wydowe gatherynge styckes called sayde iude 〈◊〉 • fet praye lytle water vessell maye drynke goynge fet cryed sayd brynge praye morsell breade also thyne hande sayde truely lorde thy god lyueth haue breade redye euen handefull meale barell lyttle oyle cruse beholde▪ gatherynge two styckes go dresse forme son maye eate dye elia sayde vnto feare come thou hast sayd make therof lyttle cake fyrst brynge vnto afterwards make thy sonne thus sayeth lorde god israel meale barell shall wasted neyther shall oyle cruse minysshed vntyll lorde haue sent rayne vpon earth went dyd elia sayde house dyd • ate good space meale wasted barell neyther oyle spent cruse accordynge worde lorde whiche spake ☞ hande elia ⊢ ✚ thynges hapned sonne wyfe house fell sycke sycknesse sore breath left hym sayde vnto elia haue thou man god arte thou come vnto call synne agayne remembraunce sley sonne sayde vnto gyue thy sonne toke hym lap caryed hym vp lofte abode layde hym vpon owne bed called vnto lorde sayde lorde god hast thou punysshed also wydowe whome dwell straunger hast sleyne sonne 4 reg 4 f actes xx c stretched selfe vpon chylde thre tymes called vnto lorde sayde lorde god let chyldes soule come hym agayne lorde herde voyce elia soule chyld came hym agayne reuyued elia toke boye brought hym downe chambre house delyuered hym vnto mother elia sayde beholde thy sonne lyueth woman sayde vnto elia nowe knowe thou arte man god worde lorde thy mouth true ⊢ ¶ elia sent ahab obadia otherwyse called abdia hydeth hundreth prophet elia kylleth baal prophet afterwarde obteyneth rayne capi xviii processe many dayes worde lorde came elia thyrde yeare sayenge go shewe thy selfe vnto ahab deute xi b 〈◊〉 v c wyll sende rayne vpon earth elia went shewe hym selfe vnto ahab great famyshment scom • ahab called obadia whiche gouerner house obadia feared god greatly iezabell destroyed prophetes lorde toke hundred prophetes hyd fyftie men one caue fyftie another prouyded breade water ahab sayde vnto obadia go lande vnto al fountaynes water vnto al brokes yf happly may fynde grasse saue horse mule destroye beastes deuyded lande bytwene walke thorowe ahab went one way hym selfe obadia went another way selfe chaunced obadia waye elia met hym obadia knewe hym fell face sayde arte thou lorde elia answered hym go tell thy lorde beholde elia sayde haue synned thou woldest delyuer hande ahab sley truely lorde thy god lyueth nacyon kyngdom whyther lorde hath sent seke sayde toke othe kyngdome nacyon founde nowe thou sayest go tell thy lorde elia soone gone spiryte lorde shall carye place knowe come tel ahab fynde shall sley thy seruaunt feare lorde youth vp tolde lorde dyd iezabel slue prophet lorde howe hyd hundred men lordes prophet fyftye men one caue fyftye another prouyded bread water nowe thou sayest go thou nowe shewe thy lorde beholde elia may sley elia sayd truly lorde hoostes lyueth whome stande wyll shewe selfe vnto hym daye obadia went mete ahab tolde hym ahab went mete elia fortuned ahab sawe elia sayde vnto hym arte thou troubleth israell answered haue troubled israell thou thy father house ye haue forsaken commaundementes lorde thou hast folowed baall nowe therfore sende gather israel vnto mount carmel prophetes baall 〈◊〉 foure hundred fyftye prophettes groues foure hundred eate iezabels table ahab sent vnto chyldren israell gathered prophettes togyther vnto mounte carmell elia came vnto peple sayde howe longe halte ye bytwene two opinyons yf lorde god folowe hym yf baall go hym people answered hym one worde sayd elia vnto people agayne onely remayne prophete lorde baal prophettes foure hundred fyftye let therfore gyue v two ox let chose one cut hym peces laye hym wood put fyre vnder wyll dresse one oxe laye hym wood wyll put fyre vnder call ye name youre goddes wyll call name lorde god answereth fyre let hym god • 〈◊〉 people answered sayde well spoken elia sayde vnto prophettes baall chose oxe dresse hym fyrst foxye many call name youre goddes put fyre vndre toke one oxe dyd gyue dressed called name •• th vi baall mornynge noone sayenge baall heare v voyce one answer lept vpon aulter made noone fortuned elia mocked sayde crye lowde ☞ god peraduenture talkynge occupyed folowynge vpon enemyes iourneye happely slepeth must awaked cryed lowde cut selues theyr maner knyues launcers tyll blood folowed chaunced myddaye passed ❀ ☞ prophesyed vntyll tyme euenynge sacrifyce neyther voyce one answere regarded elia sayde vnto folke come people came hym vp eate loked aboute hym behold loofe breade baked cole vessell water heade dyd eate drynke layde hym downe agayne slepe angel lorde came agayne seconde tyme touched hym sayde vp eate thou hast yet great iourney arose dyd eate drynke walked strength meate exodi 34 • math 4 fourtye dayes fourtye nyghtes euen vnto horeb mount god ⊢ came thyther caue lodged therin nyght beholde worde lorde came hym sayde vnto hym doest thou elia answered haue bene ielous lorde god hoostꝭ sake chyldren israell haue forsaken thy couenaunt rom xi broken downe thyne aulters sleyne thy prophet swerde lefte seke
