damasco thou mayest anoynt • reg • hazaell kynge ouer siria 4 reg ix b iehu sonne nimsi shalte thou anoynt kynge ouer israell elisa son saphat abell meholoh shalt thou anoynt prophet thy rowme shal come passe escapeth swerde hazaell hym shall iehu sleye yf man scape swerde iehu hym shall elisa put death therto r • xi • haue lefte seuen thousande israell whiche neuer man bowed knee vnto baall kyssed hym mouthe departed thence founde elisa son saphat plowynge hauynge twelue yocke ox hym xii elia went hym cast mantell vpon hym lefte ox ran elia sayde •••• ix • let praye kysse father mother wyll folowe sayde vnto hym go backe agayne haue done went backe agayne hym toke couple ox slue dressed fleshe instrumentꝭ ox gaue vnto people dyd eate arose went elia minystred vnto hym ¶ fyrst seconde tyme samaria beseyged benhadad kynge siria capi xx benhadad kynge siria gathered hoost togyther hauynge xxxii kynges hym horse charettes went vp beseyged samaria warred agaynst sent messenger ahab kynge israel citye sayde vnto hym thus sayeth benhadad thy syluer thy golde myne fayrest thy wyues thy chyldren myne kynge israell answered sayde lorde kynge accordynge thy sayenge thyne haue messenger came agayne sayd thus sayeth benhadad haue sente vnto saynge thou shalte delyuer thy syluer thy golde thy wyues thy chyldren wyll therfore sende seruaūtes vnto morow tyme shall serche thyne house house thy seruauntes soeuer pleasaunt thyne eye shall take theyr handes brynge awaye kynge israel sent elder lande sayd take hede pray se felow goth myschefe sent vnto wyues child syluer golde denyed hym elder people sayd herken vnto hym consent wherfore sayd vnto messenger benhadad tell lorde kynge thou dyddest sende thy seruaunt fyrst tyme wyll thynge maye messenger departed brought answere agayne benhadad sent vnto hym agayne sayd thus goddes vnto yf dust samaria ynough people folowe take euery man handfull kynge israell answered sayd tel hym let hym putteth harnes boost hym selfe putteth fortuned benhadad herde tydyngꝭ kynges drynkyng pauillyons sayd vnto seruaūtes put harnes set selues aray agaynst citie beholde came prophet vnto ahab kyng israel saynge thus sayth lorde hast thou sene al great multitude beholde wyll delyuer thyne hande day thou shalte knowe lorde ahab sayde sayde thus sayth lorde euen seruauntes gouernoures shyres sayde agayne shall ordre battayle answered thou nombred seruaū te gouernours shyres two hundred xxxii also nombred people chyldren israel euen vii thousande went noone benhadad dyd drinke tyll dronken pauylyons bothe kynges euen xxxii kynges holpe hym seruauntes gouernours shyres went fyrst benhadad sent shewed saynge men come samaria sayd whyther come oute peace take lyue whyther come oute fyght take yet alyue yong men gouernours shyres came citye hoost slue euery one enemye came way sirians fled israel folowed benhadad kynge siria scaped horse horseman kyng israel wente smote horse charettes great slaughter slue sirians came prophet kynge israel sayd vnto hym go forth playe man wyse take hede thou doest yere gone aboute kyng siria wyl come vp agaynst seruaūtes kyng siria sayd vnto hym god hylles theyr god therfore better v let v fyght agaynst playne ye wyl shall haue better take kyngꝭ away euery man place put duke theyr rowmꝭ thou nombre hoost lyke hoost thou hast lost horse charetꝭ wyll fyght agaynst playne thou shalt se v get better herkened vnto theyr voyce dyd euen fortuned yere gone aboute benhadad nombred sirians went vp aphek fyght agaynst israel chydren israel nombred theyr hole nombre went agaynst chyldren israel pytched lyke two lytell flockes kyddes sirians fylled countrey came man god sayd vnto kyng israel thus sayth lorde bycause sirians haue sayd lorde god hylles god valley therfore wyll delyuer great multitude thyne hande ye shall know lorde pytched one ouer agaynst seuen dayes came passe seuenth day battayle ioyned chyldren israell slue sirians hundred thousande foote men one day rest fled aphek citye fell wall vpon xxvii men lefte benhadad fled came citye frō chambre chambre seruauntes sayde vnto hym beholde haue herde say kynges house israel mercyfull kyngꝭ wyll therfore put sacke cloth oboute loynes rope aboute neckes go kyng israel yf haplye wyl saue thy lyfe gyrded sacke cloth aboute theyr loynes put rope theyr heades came kynge israel sayd thy seruaunt benhadad sayth pray let lyue sayde yet alyue brother toke worde good lucke hastely caught mouth sayd yea thy brother benhadad sayd go bryng hym hyther benhadad came vnto hym caused hym come vp charet sayde vnto hym cityes whiche father toke thy father wyl restore agayne thou shalte make streetes damasco father dyd samaria ☞ wyl make appoyntment sende awaye made appoyntment hym sente hym away certayne man chyldren prophet sayd vnto neyghboure worde lorde smyte pray man wolde smyte hym sayd vnto bycause thou hast herkened vnto voyce lorde beholde soone thou arte departed lyon shall sley 〈◊〉 came passe soone departed hym 3 regū 13 • lyon foūde hym slue founde man sayde smyte pray mā smote hym smytynge wounded hym prophet went forth wayted kyng way put hym selfe knowledge asshes whiche layde vpon face kyng came cryed vnto kyng sayd thy seruaunt went myddes battayle beholde went away man man brought vnto sayde kepe man yf myssed lost thy lyfe shall go el thou shalte paye talent syluer thy seruaunt gone kynge israell sayd vnto hym euen shall thy iudgement y• hast defined thy self hasted toke asshes awaye face kyng israel knew hym prophet sayd vnto hym thus sayth lorde bycause thou haste let go man ☞ curse thy lyfe shal go life thy people people king israell went house way warde displeasure came samaria ¶ iezabell cōmaundeth kyll nabath vyneyarde refused sell ahab elia reproueth ahab repenteth capi xxi thynges chaunced naboth iezrahelite vyneyarde iezrahel harde palace ahab kynge samaria ahab spake vnto naboth sayenge • regsi • • gyue thy vyneyarde may make garden herbes therof▪ bycause lyeth nyghe house wyll gyue better vyneyard rather yf please wyl gyue worth money naboth sayd ahab lorde forbyd shulde gyue enheritaunce father vnto ahab came house heuy euyll payde bycause worde whiche naboth iezrahelite spoken hym sayde wyll gyue enheritaunce father layde hym downe vpon bed turned awaye face ❀ vvall wolde eate bread iezabel wyfe came hym sayd vnto hym thy spirite way warde thou eatest breade sayd vnto spake vnto naboth iezraelite sayde vnto hym gyue thy vyneyarde money el yf please wyll gyue vyneyarde answered wyl gyue vyneyarde iezabell wyfe sayde vnto hym doest thou thus gouerne kyngdome israel vp eate bread set thyne hert rest wyl gyue vyneyarde naboth iezraelite wrote letter ahab name sealed seale sent letter vnto elder noble citye dwellynge naboth wrote letter sayeng proclayme faste set naboth hye among people set two vnthryftes hym beare ❀ false wytnesse agaynst hym saynge ☞ thou dydest blaspheme god kyng carye hym stone hym death men citye saye dwelte citye dyd iezabel sent vnto wrytten letter whiche sent vnto proclaymed fastynge set naboth among cheyfe people came two men chyldren belial sat hym two vnthryftie persones wytnessed agaynst naboth presence people saynge naboth dyd blaspheme god kyng actes 7 • caried hym citye stoned hym stone dyed sent iezabel sayenge naboth stoned death fortuned whē iezabell herde naboth stoned death sayd ahab vp take possessyon vyneyarde naboth iezraelite whiche denyed gyue money naboth alyue deade ahab herde naboth deade stode vp go downe vyneyarde naboth iezraelyte take passessyon worde lorde came vnto elia thesbite sayenge vp go downe mete ahab kynge israell whiche samaria gone downe vyneyarde naboth take possessyon therfore shalte thou say vnto hym thus sayth lorde hast thou kyssed gotten possessyon y• shalte speake vnto hym saynge thus sayth lorde 3 reg 〈◊〉 • place dogges lycked bloode naboth shall dogges lycke euen thy bloode also ahab sayd elia hast thou foūde y• myne enemye answered haue founde y• arte euen ☞ solde worke wyckednesse syght lorde behold wyll bryng euyll vpon wyll make cleane ryddaunce thy posterite wyl 4 reg 〈◊〉 • destroy ahab euen hym maketh water agaynst iehosaphat warre agaynst ramoth michea prophesyeth trueth whiche • smytten putte pryson ahazia otherwyse called ochosias capi xxii •••• 18 thyrde yere dyd iehosaphat kynge iuda come downe kyng israel kyng israel sayd vnto seruauntes knowe ye ramoth gilead oures syt styll take hande kynge siria sayde vnto iehosaphat wylte y• come battayle agaynst ramoth gilead iehosaphat sayde vnto kyng israel • reg 〈◊〉 • wyll thou arte people shal thyne horse thyne iehosaphat sayde vnto kynge israel regū ii aske counsel pray word lorde daye kynge israel gathered prophet togyther vpō regū • 8 • foure hundred men sayd vnto shal go agaynst ramoth gilead battayle shall let alone sayde go vp lorde shall delyuer handes kynge iehosaphat sayd neuer prophet lorde myght enquyre hym kyng israel sayd vnto iehosaphat yet one man michea sonne iimla maye aske counsayle lorde hate hym doth prophesye good vnto euyll iehosaphat sayd let kyng say thē kyng israel called chamberlayne sayde fetche michea sonne iimla hyther atonce kyng israell iehosaphat kyng iuda sat eyther seate theyr apparel voyde place besyde entryng gate samaria al prophet prophesyed zedekia son canaana made horne yron sayde thus sayth lorde▪ horne shalt thou pushe sirians vntyl thou haue made ende prophettes prophesyed euen sayenge go vp ramoth gilead prosper lorde shall delyuer kynges hand messenger gone call michea spake vnto hym sayenge beholde wordes prophet speake good vnto kynge one mouth let thy worde therfore pray lyke worde euerye one speake good michea sayd truely lorde lyueth soeuer lorde saythe vnto wyll speake came kyng kyng sayd vnto hym michea ought go agaynst ramoth gilead battayle styll answered vnto hym •• p ••• 〈◊〉 • • • • go prosper lorde shall delyuer hande kynge kynge sayde vnto hym many tymes charge y• tel nothynge whiche true name lorde sayd saw israel scattered vpon hylles shape haue shepheerde lorde sayd haue mayster let euery mā returne house peace kyng israel sayde vnto iehosaphat dyd tell wold prophesie good vnto euyll sayde agayne heare thou therfore worde lorde sawe lorde syt seate hoost heuen stode aboute hym ryght hande lefte lorde sayde •• 〈◊〉 〈◊〉 • shall persuade ahab maye go fal ramoth gilead one sayd maner came forth certayn spirite stode lorde sayd wyll persuade hym lorde sayde vnto hym wherwith sayde wyll go false spirite mouth prophettes sayde thou shalte persuade hym preuayle go forth euen nowe therfore beholde iere 14 • lorde hath put lyenge spirite mouth thy prophettes lorde hath sp • spoken euyll towarde zedekia son canaana went smote michea cheke sayde went spirite lorde speake vnto michea sayde beholde thou shalte se daye thou shalt go frō chambre chambre hyde kynge israel sayde take michea carye hym vnto amon gouernour citye vnto ioab kynges sonne say thus sayth kyng put felow pryson house fede hym bread affliction water trouble vntyl returne peace michea sayde thou returne peace lorde hath spoken sayde herken ye people euery one kyng israell iehosaphat kynge iuda wente vp ramoth gilead kynge israell sayd iehosaphat ☞ chaunge thou goest warre put thyne apparel kynge israel chaunged hym selfe wente battayle kynge siria cōmaunded xxxii captaynes rule ouer charettes sayenge fyght neyther small great saue onely agaynst kyng israell captaynes charettes sawe iehosaphat sayde surely kynge israell turned fyght agaynst hym iehosaphat cryed came passe captaynes charettes sawe kynge israell turned backe hym certayne man drewe bow ygnorauntly ❀ chaunce smote kynge israel bytwene rybbes harnesse wherfore sayde vnto dryuer charettes turne thy hande carye hoost ❀ sore hurte battayle encreased day kynge stode styll charet agaynste sirians dyed euen bloode ranne wounde myddes charet went proclamacion thorowout hoost aboute goyng downe son sayenge euery man citye owne countrey kynge israell dyed came samaria buried hym one wasshed charet pole samaria 3 reg 21 f dogges lycked vp blood harlottes wasshed pole syde accordynge worde lorde whiche spake rest wordes concerne ahab dyd iurye house whiche made cityes buylded wrytten booke cronicles kynges israel ahab slepte father ahazia sonne reygned steade ii 〈…〉 iehosaphat sonne asa beganne reygne vpon iuda fourth yere ahab kyng israel iehosaphat xxxv yere olde began reygne reygned xxv yere ierusalē mother name azuba doughter silhi walked wayes asa father bowed therfrom dyd whiche ryght eye lorde neuerthelesse hyll aulters taken way people offered burnt insence yet hyll aulters iehosaphat made peace kynge israell iii 〈…〉 rest wordes concerne iehosaphat myght vsed howe warred wrytten boke cronicles kyngꝭ iuda remenaunt stues male whiche remayned dayes father put cleane lande kynge made edom iehosaphat made x shyppes see come ☞ thorowe tharsis ophir golde wente shyppes brake ozion gaber sayde ahazia sonne ahab vnto iehosaphat let seruauntes go wt thy seruauntes shippes iehosaphat wolde iosaphat dyd slepe father buryed father citye dauid father iehoram sonne reygned steade ahazia sonne ahab begā reygne ouer israel samaria seuententh yere iehosaphat kyng iuda reygned two yeres ouer israell dyd euyll syght lorde walked way father way mother waye ieroboam sonne nabat whiche made israel synne serued baal worshypped hym prouoked lorde god israel vnto wrath accordyng vnto father 〈◊〉 ❧ ende thyrde boke kynges rekenynge latinystes whiche hebrues call fyrst boke kynges ¶ fourth boke kynges latunstes boke thyrde togyther one ☞ hebrues ¶ captaynes ouer fiftye theyr sould burnte fyre heuen prayer elia ahazia reproued elia dyeth iehoram brother succedeth hym capi primo moab ❀ dyd wyckedly agaynst israel death ahab ahazia fell thorow lattesse wyndowe vpper chambre samaria whyle syckenesse sent messenger sayd vnto go enquyre beelzebub god ekrom whyther shal recouer disease angell lorde spake elia thesbite aryse go vp agaynst messenger kyng samaria say vnto god israel ye go aske counsayle beelzabub god ekrom wherfore thus sayth lorde thou shalte come downe bed whiche thou art gone vp shalte dye death elia departed messenger turned backe agayne vnto hym sayde vnto ye nowe come agayne answered hym came man vp agaynst v sayd vnto v go turne agayne vnto kynge sent say vnto hym thus sayth lorde god israel thou sendest enquyre beelzebub god ekrom therfore thou shalte come downe bed whiche thou art gone vp shalt dye death sayd vnto manera man came vp waye tolde wordes answered hym heerye man • ath iii • gyrde gyrdle lether aboute loynes sayd elia thesbite kynge sent vnto hym captayne ouer fyftie wt fyftie men came hym beholde sat top hyll spake vnto hym thou man god kyng hath sayd come downe elia answered sayd captayne ouer fyftie yf man god fyre come downe heuen consume thy fyftye 〈◊〉 〈◊〉 • came fyre god consumed hym fyftye kynge went agayne sent hym captayn ouer fyftye fyftie answered sayd vnto hym mā god thus hath kyng sayd make hast come downe elia answered sayde vnto yf man god fyre come downe heuen consume thy fyftie came fyre god downe heuen consumed hym fyftie kynge went agayne sent thyrde captayne ouer fyftie fiftie men thyrde captayne ouer fyftie went vp came fell knee elia besought hym sayde vnto hym man god let lyfe lyfe fyfiye thy seruauntes precyous thy syght beholde came fyre downe heuen burnt vp two fore captaynes ouer fyftie theyr fyfties therfore let lyfe nowe precyous thy syght angell lorde sayde vnto elia go downe wt hym afrayde hym arose went downe hym vnto kyng sayd vnto hym thus sayth lorde moche thou hast sent messenger aske counsayle beelzebub god ekrom though bene god israell whose worde thou myghtest like therfore thou shalte come downe bed whiche thou arte gone vp shalt dye death dyed accordyng worde lorde elia spoken iehoram ❀ brother began reygne steade seconde yeare iehoram son sayd vnto hym tary pray lorde hath sent iordā sayd surely lorde lyueth thy soule lyueth wyll leaue two went togyther fyftye mē sonnes prophet came stode syde far two stode iordan elia toke mantell wrapte togyther smote water deuided parte one way parte two went ouer thorowe drye lande fortuned soone ouer elia sayd vnto elisa aske shall taken away elisa sayd praye ☞ let thy spirite double vpon sayde thou hast asked harde thyng neuerthelesse yf thou se taken away thou shalte haue yf thou shal fortuned went walkyng talkyng beholde appeared charet fyre horse fyre parted sonder eccle 4 • elia wente vp thorowe whyrle wynde heuen elisa sawe cryed father father charet israel horseman therof sawe hym toke owne clothes rente two peces toke vp also mantell elia fell hym went backe agayne stode iordans syde toke mantell elia fell hym smote water ❀ parted sonder sayd lorde god elia hym selfe smytten water parted waye way elisa went ouer chyldren prophettes iericho sawe hym farre sayde spirite elia doth rest elisa came mete hym fell grounde hym sayde vnto hym se thy seruauntes fyftie strong men ☞ let go seke thy mayster haply spirite lorde hath taken hym vp cast vpon mountayne valley sayd ye shall sende none say vpon hym tyl ashamed sayd send sent therfore fyftie men whiche sought hym thre dayes founde hym came agayne hym whiche taried iericho sayd vnto dyd say vnto ye shulde go men citye sayd vnto elisa beholde syr dwellynge citye pleasaunt thou lorde seest water nought grounde bareyne sayde brynge newe cruse put salte therin brought hym went vnto spryng water cast salte thyther sayde thus sayth lorde haue healed water shall come henceforth eyther death bareynnesse water healed vnto daye accordynge sayenge heliseus spake went vp thence vnto bethel goynge vp waye came lytell chyldren citye mocked hym sayd vnto hym go vp thou balde heade go vp thou balde heade turned backe loked cursed name lorde came two beares wood tare xlii chyldren went thence mount carmel thence turned agayne samaria ¶ kynges israell iuda edom lacke water whiche obteyne prayer heliseus kynge moab fygh eth agaynst israell capi iii ehoram son ahab began reygne vpon israel samaria xviii yere iehosaphat kyng iuda reygned twelue yeres wrought euyll syght lorde lyke father lyke mother put awaye ymages baal father made neuerthelesse ☞ cleaued vnto synnes ieroboam sonne nabat whiche made israel synne departed therfrom mesa kyng moab lorde shepe rendred vnto kynge israell hundred thousande lambes hundred thousande rammes wolle ahab deade fortuned kyng moab rebelled agaynst king israell kynge iehoram went samaria ceason nombred israell wente sente iehosaphat kynge iuda sayenge kynge moab hath offended agaynst wylte thou come agaynst moab battayle answered wyll come vp arte thou ☞ people thy people thy horse myne sayde waye shall go vp answered waye thorowe wyldernesse edom kyng israell toke iourney kyng iuda kynge edom compassed waye seuen dayes water hoost cattell folowed kyng israel sayd ala lorde hath called thre kyngꝭ togyther delyuer ouer hande moab iehosaphat sayd •• 22 • heare prophet lorde may enquyre lorde hym one kynge israel seruauntes answered sayde elisa sonne saphat whiche ☞ powred water handes elia iehosaphat sayde worde lorde hym kynge israel iehosaphat king edom went downe hym elisa sayde vnto kynge israel haue get prophet thy father prophettes thy mother kynge israell sayd vnto hym ☞ oh nay lorde hath called thre kynges togyther delyuer hande moab elisa sayd sure lorde hoostes lyueth whose syght stande regarde presence iehosaphat kyng iuda wolde loke towarde yet se bryng mynstrel mynstrell played hande lorde came vpon hym sayd thus sayth lorde make playne grounde full dytches thus sayth lorde ye shall se neyther wynde rayne yet broke shall fylled water ye may drynke ye beastes youre cattell yet small thynge syght lorde moche wyl gyue ouer moabites also handes ye shal smyte euery strong towne euery goodly citye shall fell euery pleasaunt tree stop euery well water mar euery good plat groūde stone mornyng meatofferyng offered fortuned came water way edom countrey fylled wt water moabites herde kynges come vp fyght agaynst gathered togyther yongest able put harnesse vpwarde stode border vp early mornynge sonne shone vpon water moabites sawe water farre red blood sayde blood slaughter kynges sleyne one hath smytten nowe therfore moab get spoyle came hoost israel israelite stode vp smote moabites fled folowed vpon smote moab ouerthrewe cityes euery good parcell lande cast euery man stone fylled stopte welles water felled good tree onely ☞ citye brycke lefte stone therof howbeit went aboute slynges smote kynge moab sawe battayle sore agaynst toke hym vii hundred mē drewe swerde haue gone thorowe euen vnto kyng edom coulde toke eldest son shulde haue reygned steade offered hym burntofferyng vpon wall great indignacion agaynst israell departed hym returned vnto theyr owne lande ¶ god gyueth certayne po •• woman oyle heliseus▪ heliseus text calleth elisa obteyneth g •• chylde hoostesse whiche dyeth raysed lyfe maketh swete pottage mult plyeth loues capi iiii ✚ cryed certeyne woman ☞ wyues prophettes vnto elisa sayeng thy seruaunt husbande deade thou knowest thy seruaunt dyd feare lorde creditoure come fet two sonnes bonde men elisa sayd vnto tell shal hast thou thyne house sayde thyne handmayde hath nothyng house saue pytcher oyle sayde vnto go borowe vessel without euen thy neyghbours emptie vessel fewe thou arte come yu shalte shut dore thy sonnes powre vessel set asyde whiche full woman went hym shu • dore sonnes brought powred came passe vessel • ul sayde vnto son bryng yet vessel sayd vnto haue mo oyle ceased came tolde mā god sayde go sell oyle pay thou arte det vnto lyue thou thy chyldren rest ⊢ fell daye elisa came sunem ☞ great woman toke hym eate breade came passe tyme forth ofte came waye turned thyther eate bread sayd vnto husbande beholde perceyue holy mā god cometh ofte place let v make hym chambre praye walles let v set hym bed table stole candelstycke maye turne thyther cometh v fortuned daye came thyther turned chambre lay therin sayde gehezi seruaunt call sunamite called presented self hym agayne sayde vnto hym tell beholde thou hast bene carefull v hast made prouision shal nowe woldest thou spoken kynge captayne hoost answered ☞ dwel among myne owne people sayd agayne done gehezi answered uerely hath chylde husbande olde sayde call called stode dore sayde ge • e • b 〈◊〉 1 • b suche tyme soone fruyte lyue thou shalte enbrace sonne sayd oh nay lad carye hym mother taken hym brought hym mother sat knee tyll noone dyed wente vp layde hym bed man god shut dore aboute hym went called vnto husbande sayde sende praye one yonge men one ass wyll went came vnto man god mount carmell fortuned man god sawe farre sayde gehezi seruaunt beholde yonder sunamite runne therfore mete say vnto well thy husbande lad answered well came man god vp hylle caught hym feete gihezi went thrust away man god sayd let alone soule vexed wtin lorde hath hyd hath tolde sayde dyd desyre sonne lorde dyd require thou shuldest deceyue sayde gehezi 4 reg • gyrde vp vpon bed wente therfore shut dore lad hym prayed vnto lorde 111 •• ▪ 〈◊〉 ▪ went vp lay vpon lad put mouth vpon mouth eye vpon eye handes vpon handes whē lay vpon chylde flesshe chylde waxed warme ☞ went agayne walked vp downe house went vp layde hym selfe vpon hym agayne chyldenesed seuen tymes opened eye called gehezi sayd call sunamite called whiche come vnto hym sayde vnto 〈…〉 take thy son therfore went fell feete bowed selfe grounde toke vp sonne wente ⊢ elisa came agayne gilgall derth lande chyldren prophettes dwelte hym sayd vnto seruaunt set greate pot fyre make pottage child prophettes one went felde gather herbes founde ❀ vvere wylde vyne gathered therof wylde coloquintidas lapfull came shred pot pottage knewe powred mē eate fortuned tasted pottage cryed sayde oh thou man god ☞ death pot coulde eate therof sayde brynge meale cast pot sayde fyll people may eate harme pot came man baall salisa brought man god breade fyrste fruytes euen xx loues barley new corne whiche yet bagges sayd gyue vnto people maye eate minyster answered shall set hūdred men sayd agayne gyue vnto people maye eate thus sayeth lorde 〈…〉 shall eate shalbe lefte ouer set dyd eate lefte ouer accordynge worde lorde ¶ naaman sirian heale • leprosye gehezi stryken leprosye bycause toke money rayment naaman capi v ✚ naaman captayne hooste kynge siria great man honourable syght mayster bycause hym lorde gyuen ❀ health vnto siria also myghty man experte war leper siryans gone companyes brought countrey israell lytle mayde naamans wyfe sayde vnto ladye wolde god lorde prophet samaria wolde delyuer hym leprosye ☞ went tolde lorde saynge thus thus sayde mayde lande israel kynge siria sayde come entre wyl sende letter vnto kyng israel came toke hym ten talentes syluer syxe peces golde ten chaunge raymentꝭ brought letter kynge israell cōteynyng tenour nowe letter come vnto beholde haue therwith sent naaman seruaunt thou mayst ryd hym leprosye fortuned whē kynge israell red letter rent clothes sayde 〈◊〉 32 f god shulde sley make alyue doth send shulde delyuer man leprosye wherfore consyder praye se howe seketh quarell agaynst • elisa man god herde howe kynge israell rent clothes sent kynge sayenge wherfore hast thou rent thy clothes let hym come nowe shall knowe prophet israell naaman came horse charettes stoode dore house elisa elisa sent messenger vnto hym sayenge go • iorbane seuen tymes • thy fleshe shall come agayne thou shalt clensed naaman wroth went awaye sayde beholde thought selfe wolde surely come stande cal name lorde god put hand place maye heale leprosye abana pharphar ryuers damasco better water israell yf washe also shall clensed turned hym departed displeasure seruauntes came cōmuned hym sayde father yf prophet byd greate thynge oughtest thou haue done howe moche rather sayeth wasshe cleane went downe wasshed hym selfe seuen tymes iordan accordyng saynge man god flesh chaunged lyke vnto fleshe lytle chylde 〈…〉 clensed turned agayne man god cōpanye stode hym sáyde beholde knowe nowe god worlde israell ⊢ nowe therfore take ☞ blessyng thy seruaunt sayde 〈…〉 surely lorde lyueth whome stande wyll receyue none wolde haue constrayned hym receyue wolde naamā sayd ❀ euen thou vvyl • beseche ☞ shall gyuen thy seruaunt moch earth two mule maye beare thy seruaunte wyll hence forth offre neyther burntsacrifyce offerynge vnto god saue vnto lorde herein lorde mercyful thy seruaunt mayster goeth house rimmō doth worshyp leaneth hand also worshyp house rimmō worshyp say house rimmon lorde mercyfull vnto thy seruaunt bycause thynge unto sayd go peace departed hym furlonge ground gehezi seruaunt elisa man god sayd behold mayster hath spared naaman siryan wolde receyue hande thyngꝭ offered surely lorde lyueth wyll run hym take hym gehezi folowed naaman naaman saw hym run nynge hym lyght downe charet mete hym▪ sayde 4 reg 4 well answered well beholde mayster hath sent sayenge se come euen nowe mounte ephraim two yonge men chyldren prophettes gyue praye one talent syluer two chaunge garmentes naaman sayde good wyll take two talentes compelled hym bynde two talentes syluer two baggꝭ two chaunge garmentes layde vpon two seruauntes beare hym came secrete place toke theyr hande bestowed house men let go departed went stode mayster elisa sayd vnto hym whence cōmest thou gehezi sayd thy seruaunt went whyther sayde vnto hym wente myne herte man turned agayne charet mete ❀ nowe tyme receyue money receyue garmentes olyue tree vyneyardes shepe ox men seruaū te mayde seruaūtes leprosye therfore naaman shall cleue vnto vnto thy seede euer 4 xv 〈◊〉 pa 16 went presence leper whyte snowe ¶ elisa maketh yron swymme aboue water serians beseyge israell two woman agree togyther eate theyr owne chyldren capi vi chyldren prophettes sayde vnto elisa beholde place dwel lytle v wyl therfore go vnto iordane take thence euery man beame buylde v place dwell answered go one sayd content pray come thy seruauntes answered wyll come went came iordane cut downe wood fortuned one fellynge downe tree th • axe heade fell water cryed sayde ala mayster lent man god sayd fell shewed hym place cut downe stycke cast thyther immedyatly yron dyd swym therfore sayd take vp stretched hand toke vp kynge siria warred agaynst israell toke coūsayle seruauntes sayd yonder secrete place shall remaynynge man god sent vnto kynge israell sayenge beware thou go ouer soche place sirians lurkyng therfore kynge israell sent place man god tolde hym warned hym saued hym selfe twyse herte kynge siria troubled thyng called seruaūtes sayde vnto wyll ye shew men ❀ betrayeth kynge israell one seruaūtes sayd none lorde kynge elisa prophet israell telleth kynge israel yea euer wordes thou speakest thy preuye chambre sayde go spye maye sende fet hym one tolde hym sayenge beholde dothā therfore sent thyther horse charettes myghtye hooste came nyght compassed citye whē seruaunt man god rose vp early go beholde hoost roūde aboute towne horse charettes seruaunt sayd vnto ala mayster shall answered •• pat 〈◊〉 • feare v mo elisa prayed sayd lorde beseche open eye maye se lorde opened eye yonge man beholde mountayne full horse charettes fyre rounde aboute elisa came downe hym elisa prayed vnto lorde sayd smyte people praye •••• 〈◊〉 〈◊〉 •• blyndnesse smote blyndnes accordyng desyre elisa elisa sayde vnto way neyther towne folowe wyll bryng man whome ye seke led samaria fortuned come samaria elisa sayde lorde open theyr eye may se lorde opened theyr eye saw behold myddꝭ samaria kyng israell sayd vnto elisa saw father shall smyte answered thou shalte smyte smyte thou hast taken thyne owne swerde thyne owne bow rather set breade water maye eate drynke go theyr mayster prepared greate refection eaten dronke sent awaye went theyr mayster souldyours siria ☞ came lande israel chaunced benhadad kynge siria gathered hooste went vp beseyged samaria greate derth samaria beholde beseyged vntyll ass heade • olde lxxx syluer pen fourth part ☞ cab doues dounge fyue sycles kynge israell goynge vpon wall cryed womā vnto hym saynge helpe lorde kynge sayd yf lorde succour wherwith helpe ☞ barne wt wyne presse kynge sayde vnto wylt thou answered yonder woman sayde vnto brynge thy son maye eate hym daye wyll eate myne morowe •••• 26 〈◊〉 28 • 〈◊〉 4 • dressed son dyd eate hym sayde day bryng thy sonne maye eate hym hath hyd sonne came passe kynge herde wordes woman rent clothes went vp wall people loked behold sacke clothe vnder vpon flesshe sayde •••• 19 • god yf heade elisa son saphat shall stande hym day elisa sat house elder sat kynge sent man hym messenger came hym sayde elder haue ye sene howe ☞ son murtherer hath sent take awaye myne heade circumspecte messenger cōmeth shut dore holde hym dore sounde maysters feete behynde whyle yet talked beholde messēger came downe vnto hym sayd beholde ☞ euyll lorde shal loke lord ¶ elisa prophesyeth plenteousnes vyttayles oth •• thynges samaria sirians runne away haue man folowynge lorde wolde byleue worde elisa troden death capi vii elisa sayde heare ye worde lorde thus sayeth lorde rig 7 • morowe tyme shall busshell fyne floure solde sicle two busshels barley sycle gate samaria certayne lorde whose hande kynge leaned answered man god sayde beholde yf lorde wolde make wyndowes heuen myght sayenge come passe sayde beholde thou shalt se thyne eye shalte eate therof foure leperous men entetynge gate sayde one another syt vntyll dye yf saye wyll entre citye beholde derth citye shall dye therin yf syt styll dye also nowe therfore come let v fall vpon hoost sirians saue lyues shal lyue yf kyl v dead arose nyght go hoost sirians come vttermoost parte hoost siria beholde man lord made hoost sirians math b esar 13 • heare noyse charettꝭ noyse horse noyse great hoost moche sayde one another lo kynge israell hath hyred agaynst v kynges hethites kynges egyptyans come vpon v wherfore arose fled nyght left theyr ten te theyr horse theyr ass felde whiche pytched euen fled theyr lyues leper came edge hoost went tent dyd eate drynke caryed thence syluer golde rayment went hyd came agayne entred another tent caryed thence also went hyd sayde one another well daye asmoch day brynge good tydynges holde peace yf tarye tyll day lyght myscheyfe wyl come vpon v nowe therfore come maye go tell kynges housholde came called vnto porter citye tolde sayenge came pauilions sirians se man neyther voyce man horse ass tyed tentes euen wont man called vnto porter tolde kynges house wtin kyng arose nyght sayde vnto seruaūtes wyll shew nowe sirians haue done vnto vs▪ knowe hungrye therfore gone pauilyons hyde selues felde sayenge come citie shall earth alyue get citye one seruauntes answered sayde let men ta •• pray fyue horse remayne lefte multytude beholde ☞ euen multytude israell lefte citye beholde say euen multytude israelite cōsumed wyll sende se toke therfore horse two chareties kynge sent hoost sirians sayenge go se went euen vnto iordan lo way full clothes vessel whiche sirians cast theyr haste messenger returned tolde kynge peple went spoyled tentes sirians came passe busshell fyne floure solde sycle two busshels barley sycle 4 vii • accordynge worde lorde kynge appoynted lorde whose hande leaned gate people trode vpon hym gate dyed accordynge worde man god whiche sayde kyng came downe hym came thynge passe man god spoken kynge sayenge two busshels barley sycle busshell fyne floure shall 4 reg 7 morowe tyme gate samaria vnto lorde answered man god sayde yea yf lorde made wyndowes heuen myght come passe sayde beholde thou shall se thyne eye shalt eate therof euen chaunced vnto hym people trode vpon hym gate dyed ¶ clisa prophesyeth vnto sunamyte derth seuen yeares death benhadad reygneth hazaell siria iehoram son iehosephat reygneth iuda edom falleth iuda • hozia succedeth iehoram capi viii spake 4 reg 4 elisa vnto woman whose sonne restored lyfe agayne sayenge vp go thou thyne house soiourne soeuer thou canst lord hath called derth shall come vpon lande seuen yeares woman arose dyd sayenge man god went bothe house holde soiourned lande philistine seuen yere seuen yeres ende fortuned womā came agayne land philistinꝭ went cal vpon kynge house lande kyng talked wt gehezi seruaunt man god sayenge tel pray great dedes elisa hath done tolde kynge howe restored dead body lyfe agayne meane tyme woman whose sonne raysed vp agayne cryed kynge house lande gehezi sayd lorde kynge woman son whome elisa raysed vp agayne kynge asked woman tolde hym kynge delyuered chamberlayne sayenge restore thou vnto fruytꝭ felde sence day lefte lande vnto tyme • reg xix • elisa came damascis benhadad kynge siria spcke one tolde hym sayenge man god come hyther kynge sayde vnto hazaell • • 14 • take present thyne hande go mete man god thou mayest aske lorde hym whyther shall recouer dysease hazaell went mete hym toke present hym euery good thyng damasco euen asmoch xl camel coulde beare came presented hym selfe hym sayde thy son benhadad kynge siria hath sent sayenge shall recouer dysease elisa sayde vnto hym go saye vnto hym thou shalt recouer howbeit lorde hath shewed shall surely dye ❀ loked asyde ashamed man god wepte hazael sayd wepeth lorde answered knowe euyll thynges thou shalte vnto chyldren israell theyr strong cityes shalte thou set fyre theyr yongmen shalt thou sley swerde shalte dashe braynes theyr suckynge chyldren teare theyr woman chylde hazaell sayde thy seruaunte dogge shulde greate thynge elisa answered lorde hath shewed thou shalt kynge siria departed elisa came mayster whiche sayde hym sayde elisa answered tolde thou shuldest recouer morowe fortuned toke thycke cloth dypte water ☞ spred face dyed hazaell reygned steade fyfte yere af iehoram sonne ahab kynge israell iehosaphat beynge also kynge iuda iehoram son iehosaphat kynge iuda began reygne 〈◊〉 xxxii yeare olde began reygne reygned viii yere ierusalem walked waye kynges israell house ahab doughter ahab wyfe dyd euyll syght lorde lorde wolde destroye iuda cause dauid seruaunt 〈◊〉 promysed hym gyue hym way lyght among chyldrē 〈…〉 dayes edom dyd wyckedly vnder hand iuda made kynge theyr owne iehoram went zair charettes hym arose nyght smote edomites whiche compassed hym captaynes charettes people fled theyr tentes edom rebelled wolde vnder hande iuda vnto day lobnah began dysobedyent euen tyme rest wordes concerne ioram dyd wrytten booke cronycles kyngꝭ iuda ioram rested father buryed besyde father citye dauid ☞ 〈◊〉 ahaziahu sonne reygned steade xii yere ioram son ahab kynge israell dyd ahaziahu sonne iehoram kynge iuda begyn reygne two twentie yeare olde ahaziahu began reygne reygned one yere ierusalem mother name athaliahu doughter omri kynge israell walked waye house ahab dyd euyll syght lorde euen dyd house ahab son lawe house ahab went ioram son ahab war agaynst hazaell kynge siria ramoth gilead sirians wounded ioram 〈◊〉 kynge ioram went backe agayne healed iezrahel woundꝭ whiche sirians gyuen hym ramoth fought agaynst hazaell kyng siria ahaziahu sonne iehoram kyng iuda went downe se ioram sonne ahab iezrahell bycause sycke ¶ iehu made kynge israell kylleth iehoram kynge therof ahaziahu kynge iuda also causeth iezabel cast downe wyndowe dogges eate hi • capi ix elisa prophet called one chyldren prophettes sayde vnto hym 〈◊〉 gyrde vp thy loynes take boxe oyle thyne hand get ramoth gilead thou cō mest thyther loke iehu sonne iehosaphat sonne nimsi go hym make hym aryse vp amonge brother cary hym secrete chambre take bore oyle power head say thus sayeth lorde haue anoynted kynge ouer israell open dore flee withoute taryenge seruaunt prophet gat hym ramoth gilead came beholde captaynes hooste syttyng togyther sayde haue erand captayne iehu sayd vnto v sayde captayne arose went house powred oyle heade sayde vnto hym thus sayeth lorde god israell 3 reg 19 • haue anoynted kyng ouer people lorde euen ouer israell thou shalt smyte house ahab thy mayster maye aduenge bloode seruauntes prophettes blood seruauntes lorde hande iezabell hoole house ahab shal destroyed wyll destroye ahab euen hym maketh water agaynste wall hym prysoned forsaken israell wyll make house ahab lyke house ieroboam sonne nabat lyke house baasa son ahia iezabell 3 reg xxi • dogges shall eate4 reg 29 f felde iezrahell shall none bury opened dore fled iehu came seruauntes lorde one sayde vnto hym well wherfore came mad felowe sayde vnto ye knowe maner man cōmunicacion sayd vnto hym agayne tell v sayde thus thus spake saynge thus sayth lorde haue anoynted kynge ouer israell hasted toke euery man garment put vnder hym maner iudges seate blewe trompettes sayenge iehu kynge iehu sonne iehosaphat son nimsi conspired agaynst ioram ioram kepte ramoth gilead israell bycause hazaell kynge siria 4 regū •• kynge ioram returned healed iezraell woundes whiche sirians gyuen hym fought hazaell kynge siria iehu sayde yf youre myndes let man departe escape citye go tell iezrahell iehu gat vp charet went iezraell ioram laye ahaziahu kynge iuda come downe thyther se ioram watchman stode towre iezraell spyed company iehu came sayde se companye iehoram sayde take horseman sende mete maye aske whyther peace went one horsebacke mete hym sayde thus sayeth kynge peace iehu sayde hast thou peace turne behynde watchman tolde sayenge messenger came cōmeth agayne sent horsebacke whiche came sayde thus sayeth kynge peace iehu answered hast thou wt peace turne behynde watchman told saynge came also commeth agayne dryuynge lyke dryuynge iehu son nimsi dryueth charet mad iehoram sayde make redye charet made redy iehorā kynge israell ahaziahu kynge iuda went eyther charet agaynst iehu met hym furlong naboth iezrahelite fortuned iehoram sawe iehu sayde peace iehu answered peace shulde longe hooredomes thy mother iezabell wytchcraftes great iehoram turned handes fled sayde ahaztahu falshed ahaziahu iehu toke bowe hande smote iehoram bytwene armes arowe went thorowe herte fell downe flat charet sayd iehu bidkara captayne take hym cast hym plat groūde naboth iezraelite remembre thou rode togyther charet ahab father lorde layd heuye burther vpon hym haue sene yesterdaye bloode naboth blood sonnes sayde lorde wyll quyte grounde sayeth lorde nowe therfore take cast hym plat ground accordyng worde lorde ahaziahu kynge iuda saw fled waye garden house iehu folowed hym sayde smyte hym also charet ❀ smote hym charet goynge vp gur iibleam fled magiddo dyed seruauntes caryed hym charet ierusalem buryed hym sepulchre father citye dauid xi yeare ioram son ahab beganne ahaziahu reygne ouer iuda iehu come iezrael iezabell herde ☞ starched face tyred head loked wyndow iehu entered gate sayde zimri peace whiche slewe mayster lyfte vp eye wyndow sayde syde loked hym two thre chamberlaynes sayde throwe downe threwe downe blood dasshed towarde wall towarde horse trode vnder feete come dyd eate drynke sayd go vyset pray yonder cursed creature bury 3 xvi g kynges doughter came burye founde scull feete palmes handes wherfore came agayne tolde hym sayd word lorde spake hande seruaunt elia thesbite sayenge 1 reg 〈◊〉 felde iezrahell shall dogges eate flesshe iezabel carkas iezabell euen donge vpon earth felde iezrahell man myght say iezabell ¶ iehn causeth lrx sonnes ahab sleyne rl •• brother fyndeth meane also kyll preested baall death sonne reygneth st • ade capi x hab iosue •• lxx sonnes samaria iehu wrote letter sent samaria vnto ruler iezrahell elder brought vp ahab chyldren sayenge nowe letter cō meth ye haue maysters sonnes ye haue charettes horse stronge citye haue ye also harnesse loke whiche maysters sonnes best moost mete set hym father seate ☞ fyght youre lordes house excedynly afrayde sayde se two kynges able stande hym howe shall able stande gouerner ahab house ruled citie elder also tutours sent iehu saynge thy seruauntes wyll thou shalt byd v wyll make man kynge therfore thou semeth good thyne eye wrote letter say enge yf ye myne wyll herken vnto voyce take heades men maysters sonnes come iezrahell morow tyme kynges sonnes lxx personnes greate men citye whiche brought vp letter came toke kynges chyldren slue euen lxx person layd theyr heades baskettes sent hym iezrahell▪ came messenger tolde hym sayenge haue brought heades kyngꝭ sonnes sayd let laye two heapes enterynge gate vntyll mornynge day went stode sayde folke ye ryghteous beholde cōspyred agaynst mayster slue hym slue al lerne shall fal vnto earth nothyng worde lorde spake cōcernyng house ahab lorde hath brought passe thynges spake ☞ hande seruaunte 〈…〉 21 • elia iehu slue remayned house ahab iezrahell great hym kynsfolkes preestes let nothynge hym remayne arose departed came samaria whe iehu way house shepherdes dyd shere theyr shepe met brother ahaziahu kynge iuda sayde ye answerered brother ahaziahu go downe salute chyldren kyng quene sayd take alyue taken alyue flue well besyde house shepe shorne euen xlii men neyther lefte departed thence met iehonadab son 〈…〉 35 rechab cōmynge agaynst hym ☞ blessed hym sayde hym thyne herte ryght myne herte true wt thyne iehonadab answered yea ❀ yf sayeth gyue thyne hande gyuē hand toke hym vp hym charet sayde come se zeele haue lorde made hym ryde charet came samaria slue remayned vnto ahab samaria tyll wypte hym accordynge sayenge lorde whiche spake elia iehu gathered al people togyther sayde vnto • reg 16 g ahab serued baall lytle iehu shall serue hym nowe therfore call vnto prophettes baal soche serue hym preestes let none lackynge haue great sacrifyce baall therfore whosoeuer myssed shall lyue iehu dyd subteltye tent myght destroye seruauntes baall iehu sayd proclayme holy conuocaeyō baall iehu sent vnto israell seruaūtes baal came man lefte behynd came came house baall house baall ful one ende sayde vnto hym keper vestrey brynge forth garmentes seruaūtes baall brought garmentꝭ iehu went iehonadab son rechab house baall sayde vnto seruauntes baall searche loke none seruauntes lorde seruauntes baall went offre sacrifyce burntofferyngꝭ iehu appoynted lxxx men without sayde yf men whome haue brought vnder handes escape letteth hym go shall dye hym fortuned soone made ende offeryng burntsacrifyce iehu sayde men war captaynes go sley let none come smote edge swerde men war captaynes cast went vnto ••• e temple baall fet ymages temple baall burnt brake ymage baall brake house baall made draft house vnto • aye iehu destroyed baall israel synnꝭ ieroboam son nebat made israell syn iehu departed neyther frō folowynge ❀ neyther forsoke ❀ golden calues bethell dan lorde sayde vnto iehu bycause y• hast done ryght well bryngyng passe thynge ryght myne eye hast done vnto house ahab accordynge thyngꝭ myne herte therfore shall 〈…〉 thy chyldren vnto fourth generacyon syt seat israell iehu cared walke law lorde god israell herte departed frō synnꝭ ieroboā whiche made israel syn ❀ dayes lorde began cu • israel shorte 4 regū • hazael smote al coostes israell iordan eastwarde euen lande gilead gad • te rubenites manasses aroer vnto ryuer arnon euen gilead basan rest wordes concerne iehu dyd powre wrytten boke cronicles kyngꝭ israell iehu slepte father buryed samaria iehoahaz son reygned steade tyme iehu reygned vpon israel samaria xxviii yeres ¶ • thalia putteth death kynges sonne • ▪ excepte iehokaz son • oziah whith hyd death made kynge capi xi athalia mother ahaziahu sawe son deade arose destroyed al kyngꝭ seed iehosaba doughter kynge ioram syster ahaziahu toke ioas son ahaziahu stale hym amonge kynges sonnes sleyne nurce hym slepynge chambre hyd hym athalia sleyne hyd house lorde vi yeare athalia dyd reygne ouer lande seuenth yeare iehoiads sent fet ruler ouer hundred captaynes garde toke hym house lorde made bond wt toke othe house lorde shewed kyngꝭ son cōmaunded saynge ye muste one thyrde parte whose duetye come sabboth daye shal kepe watche kyngꝭ house thyrde parte shall kepe gate sur thyrde parte shal kepe gate whiche behynde garde ❀ shall ye kepe watch house messah two porcyons go sabboth daye shall kepe watch house lorde kynge ye shall cōpasse kynge rounde euery man shall haue weapen hand whosoeuer cōmeth range let hym sleyne se ye kynge goeth captaynes ouer hundred dyd accordynge thynges 〈…〉 24 • iehoiada pretst cōmaunded toke euerye man men come sabboth day shulde go sabboth came iehoiada preest captaynes ouer hundred dyd preest gyue kynge dauids speares shyldes temple gard stode euerye man weapon hande rounde kynge frō ryght corner temple lefte alonge aulter temple brought kyngꝭ son put crowne vpon delyuered deut 17 ☞ wytnesse made hym kynge anoynted hym clapte theyr handes sayd god saue kynge ii par 23 athalia herde noyse runnynge people came peple temple lorde loked beholde kynge stode pyller maner syngers trompets kynge people lande reioysed blewe trompets athalia rent clothes cryed treason treason iehoiada preest cōmaūded captaynes hundred rule hoost sayd vnto haue without temple may rangꝭ yf folowe kyll hym swerde preest sayde maye sleyne house lorde layde handes tyll came waye whiche horse went kynges palace sleyne ii pat 〈◊〉 ▪ • iehoiada made bonde bytwene lorde kynke people shulde lordes people also bytwene kynge peple people lande went house baal destroyed aulters also ymages brake downe • ustely slue mathan preest baall aulters preest set watch ouer house lorde▪ toke ruler ouer hundred captaynes garde peple lande brought kynge house lorde came waye gate garde kynges palace sat downe seate kynges people lande reioysed citye quyetnesse slue athalia swerde besyde kyngꝭ palace seuen yere olde iehoas began reygne ¶ iehoas malteth prouisyon reparyng temple kylled two seruauntes amaziahn reygneth steade capi xii began reygne seuenthyere iehu fourtye yeare reygned ierusalem mother name zebiah beerseba dyd whiche good syght lorde longe iehoiada preest enfourmed hym hylaulters taken awaye people offered burnte incense yet vpon hylaulters iehoas sayd preestꝭ syluer dedycate thynges brought house lorde currant money saye money euery man ☞ set al money euery man wyllyng herte gyueth bryngeth house lorde let preestes take euery man aquayntaunce repayre broken place house soeuer decaye founde came passe vnto xxiii yere kynge iehoas preestes mended nothynge decayed temple kynge iehoas called iehoiada bysshop preestes sayde vnto repayre ye brokē place temple nowe therfore se ye receyue money aquayntaūce except ye delyuer repayre temple withall preestes consented receyue money people excepte repayre decayed place temple iehoiada preest toke chyst • oted hoole lyd set besyde aulter ryght syde euery mā cometh temple lorde preestꝭ kepte dores put money brought house lorde fortuned sawe moch money chyst xxii▪ kynges scribe hygh preest came vp tolde money founde house lorde put bag gaue money sealed handes executed worke ouersyght house lorde brought earpenters buylders wroughte vpon house lorde mason hewer stone bought tymbre free stone repayre decay house lorde went amende temple howvelt ☞ made house lorde bolles syluer instrumentes musyke basens trompettes vessell golde vessel syluer money brought house lorde gaue workemen repayred therwith house lorde moreouer rekened wt men whose handes delyuered money bestowed workemen dyd theyr busynesse faythfully howbeit ☞ trespasse money synne money brought house lorde preestes came hazael kyng siria vp fought agaynst geth toke hazael set face go vp ierusalē iehoas kynge iuda toke halowed thynges iehosaphat iehorā haziahu father kyngꝭ iuda dedicate hym selfe dedicated▪ golde founde treasure house lorde kynges house sent hazael kyng siria departed ierusalem remenaunt wordes concerne iehoas dyd wrytten booke cronicles kynges iuda owne seruauntes arose wrought treason slue iehoas house millo came downe silla iosabar son semeath iehozabad sonne somer seruauntes smote hym dyed buryed hym father citye dauid amaziahu sonne reygned steade ¶ iehoahaz sonne iehu deliuered heades siriane dyeth ioa • sonne reygneth steade elisa dyeth capi xiii xxiii yere ioas sonne ahaziahu kynge iuda iohoahaz son iehu began reygne ouer israell samaria seuentene yere wrought euyl syght lorde folowed synnes ieroboā son nebat whiche made israel syn de parted therfrom lorde angry israel delyuered bande hazael kyng siria hande benhadad sonne hazaell theyr dayes iehoahaz besought lord lorde herde hym consydered trouble israel wherwith kynge siria troubled lorde gaue israel delyuerer wente vnder subieccion sirians chyldren israell owelte theyr tentes tyme neuerthelesse departed synnes house ieroboam made israel syn walked remayned groue styll also samaria neyther dyd leaue peple iehoahaz fiftie horseman ten charettꝭ ten fotemen4 〈…〉 kynge siri • destroyed made lyke threshed dust rest wordes concerne iehoahaz dyd power wrytten boke cronicles kynges israel iehoahaz slept father buryed hym samaria ioas son reygned steade▪ xxxvii yere ioas kynge iuda began ioas son iehoahaz reygne ouer israel samaria syxtene yere dyd whiche euyll syght lorde departed synnes ieroboam sonne nebat made israel synne walked therin remenaunt wordes concerne ioas dyd power wherwith fought agaynst amaziahu kynge iuda wrytten boke cronicles kynges israell ioas slepte father ieroboā sat vpon seate ioas buryed samaria among kynges israell elia fallen sycke syckenesse wherof dyed ioas kyng israell came downe vnto hym wepte hym sayd 4 reg ii • father father ❀ charet israel horseman elisa sayd vnto hym take bowe arowes toke vnto hym bowe arowes sayd vnto kynge israell put thyne hand vpon bow put hand vpō it▪ elisa put handes vpon kynges handes sayde open wyndowe castwarde opened elisa sayd shute shot sayde arowe helpe lorde arowe helpe agaynst siria thou shalte smyte siria aphek tyll thou haue made ende sayde take arowes toke sayd vnto kynge israell smyte grounde smote thryse ceased mā god angry hym sayd thou shuldest haue smytten v vi tymes ❀ seuen tymes thou hadest smytten siriatyl thou hadest made ende nowe thou shalte smyte siria thryse elisa dyed buryed hym souldyoures moabites came lande ❀ yere chaunced buryenge man spyed souldyours cast man sepulcce elisa mā rolled downe touched bone elisa eccle 48 hereuiued stode vpon feete hazael vexed israel dayes iehoahaz lorde mercy pttyed respecte vnto bycause appoyntment made abrahā isaac iacob wolde destroy neyther cast hym yet hazael kyng sitia dyed benhadad son reygned steade iehoas son ichoahaz went agayne toke hande benhadad son hazael city taken away hand iehoa haz father warre thre tymes dyd ioas beate hym restored city vnto israel agayne ¶ amaziahu hynge zuda putteth death •• quellers father smyteth edom zoas dyeth ierot • son succedeth roume hym reygneth zacharia amazia kylled • achio azaria teygneth steade capi xiiii seconde yere ioas son ichoahaz kyng israel reygned amaziahu sonne ioas kynge iuda ii pa 25 xxv yere olde began reygne reygned xxix yere ierusalem mother name ieohadan ierusalem dyd whiche good syght lorde yet lyke dauid father dyd accordyng thyngꝭ ioas father dyd neyther hyll aulters taken away yet people dyd sacrifice burnt insence hyl aulters sone kyngdom satled hand 4 reg▪ xii v came passe slue seruauntes whiche kylled kyng father chyldren murtherers slue accordyng wryttē boke lawe moses wherin lorde cō maunded sayenge deut 24 • 11 par 〈◊〉 xx • • ezech 〈◊〉 • let father dye chyldren let chyldren sleyne father let euery man put deathe owne synne slue edom salt valley ii par 〈◊〉 • ▪ ten toke castel rocke battayle called name ioktheel vnto day amaziahu sente messenger iehoas son iehoahaz son iehu kyng israel sayenge come ☞ let v se eche iehoas kyng israel sent amaziahu kyng iuda saynge iudi 〈◊〉 • 4 esdr 4 • thystle libanon sende cedre tree libanon sayeng gyue thy doughter sonne wyfe wylde beast libanon went trode downe thystle thou hast smytten edom thyne herte hath made proude enioy glory tary home doest thou prouoke myscheyfe thou shuldeste ouerthrowen iuda amaziahu wolde heare iehoas kyng israel went vp amaziahu kyng iuda saw eyther bethsames iuda iuda put worse israel fled euery man theyr tentes iehoas kyng israel toke amaziahu kyng iuda sonne iehoas son ahaziahu bethsames came ierusalem gate ephraim corner gate foure hundred cubites toke golde syluer vessel founde house lorde treasure kynges house chyldren toke wardes returned samaria agayne rest actes ioas dyd power fought amaziahu kynge iuda wrytten cronicle boke kynges israell iehoas slepte father buryed samatia among kynges israel ieroboam soune reygned steade amaziahu sonne ioas kynge iuda lyued death iehoas sonne iehoahaz kynge israell fyftene yeare remenaunt wordes concerne amaziahu wrytten boke cronicles kyngꝭ iuda conspired treason agaynste hym ierusalem sled lachis sent hym lachis slue brought hym horse buryed ierusalem father citye dauid 〈◊〉 pa 26 • people iuda toke azaria whiche xvi yere olde made kyng father amaziahu buylte 〈…〉 reg 16 • elath brought agayne iuda kynge layde rest father xv yere amaziahu sonne ioas kyng iuda ieroboā sonne ioas made kynge ouer israell samaria reygned xli yere wrought euyl syght lorde neyther turned away synnes ieroboam son nabat whiche made israel synne restored coost israel entryng hemath vnto see wyldernes accordynge worde lorde god israell whiche spake ☞ hande seruaunt 〈…〉 ionas sonne amithai prophet whiche geth hepher lorde sawe howe afflicion israell excedyng bytter moche prysoned forsaken ende none helpe israel lorde sayde 〈◊〉 reg 13 〈◊〉 • • wolde put name israel vnder heuen helped hande ieroboam sonne ioas rest wordes concerne ieroboam dyd strength whiche executed warres howe restored damasco uziah iotham • haz capi xv xxvii yere ieroboam kynge israel began azaria son amazia kyng iuda reygne syxtene yere olde made kynge reygned lii yere ierusalem mother name iecholeiahu ierusalem dyd citye dauid iotham sonne regned steade xxxviii yere azaria kynge iuda dyd zacharia son ieroboam reygne vpon israel samaria syxe monethes wrought whiche euyll syght lorde dyd father turned awaye synnes ieroboā son nabat whiche made israel synne sallum son iabes conspired agaynst hym smote hym syght people kylled hym reygned steade rest wordes concerne zacharia beholde wrytten boke cronicles kynges israell also wordes lorde whiche spake vnto iehu sayenge 4 reg • • thy sonnes shall syt seate israell fourth generacion came passe sallum son iabes began reygne xxxix yere azaria kyng iuda reygned moneth samaria menahem son gadi went vp thirza came samaria smote sallum son iabes samaria slue hym reygned steade rest wordes concerne sallum treason conspired beholde wrytten boke cronicles kynges israell tyme menahem destroyed thiphsah al therin coostes therof frō therzahi bycause opened hym smote rypte vp al theyr womē chylde xxxix yere azaria kynge iuda began menahē son gadi reygne vpon israel x yere samaria dyd euyl syght lorde turned away dayes frō synne ieroboā son nabat made israell synne phul kyng assiria came vpon lande menahem gaue phul talentes syluer hand might hym stablysshe kyngdom hand menahē made proclamacyō money israel al men substaūce shuld gyue kyng assiria l sycles syluer pece kyng assiria turned backe agayne caryed land rest wordes cōcerne menahē dyd wrytten boke cronicles kyngꝭ israel menahem slepte wt father pikahia son dyd stead succede hym kyngdom l yere azaria kyng iuda began pekahia sonne menahem reygne ouer israel samaria two yere dyd whiche euyll syght lorde lefte synnes ieroboam son nabat made israel synne pekah sonne remaliahu whiche captayne conspired agaynst hym smote hym samaria euen palace kyngꝭ house argob aria hym fiftie men gileadites kylled hym reygned roume rest wordes concerne pekahia dyd beholde wrytten boke cronicles kyngꝭ israel lii yere azaria kynge iuda began pekah son remaliahu reygne ouer israell samaria xx
