manasse slepte father buryed hym owne house amon sonne reygned towme amon two twentye yere olde began reygne reygned two yere ierusalem dyd euyll syght lorde lyke dyd manasse father amon sa crificed carued ymages manasse father made serued submytted hym selfe lorde manasse father mekened hym selfe amon trespassed greatly owne seruauntꝭ conspired agaynst hym slue hym owne house peple lande slue al cōspired agaynst kynge amon peple lande made iosia sonne kynge rowme ¶ io •• destroyeth idol restoreth temple whiche boke lawe f •• nde sendeth hulda prophettesse counsell capi xxxiiii iosia eyght yere olde began reygne 4 reg 〈…〉 reygned ierusalem xxxi yeare dyd whiche ryght syght lorde walked wayes dauid father bowed neyther ryght hande lefte eyght yere reygne yet chylde began seke god dauid father twelfth yere began pourge iuda ierusalem hylaulters groues carued ymagꝭ ymages mettal brake downe aulters baalim euen presence ymages greater honoure caused destroyed groues carued ymages ymages mettal brake made dust strawed vpon graues offered burnt bone preestes vpon aulters clensed iuda ierusalē euen dyd cityes manasse ephraim simeon vnto nephthal • wyldernes rounde plucked sondre aulters groues dyd beate stampe powder dyd beate downe al ymages thorowout lande israel returned ierusalem agayne xviii yeare reygne pourged lande temple 4 〈◊〉 〈◊〉 • sent saphan sonne amaziahu maasiah gouernour citye ioah son ioahaz recorder repayre house lorde god came elkia hygh preest delyuered money brought house god whiche leuites kepte entry gathered hande manasse ephraim yet remayned israel iuda beniamin enhabitoures ierusalem put handes workemen ouersyght house lorde gaue labourer wroughte house lorde repayre amende house euen maso • carpenter gaue get stone tymbre couple beames house whiche kynges iuda destroyed men dyd worke faythfully ouerseers courage forwarde iahath obadiahu leuites chyldren merari secharia mesullam chyldren cahathites leuites whiche coulde skyl instrumentes musycke ouer berers burden ouer al wrought whatsoeuer worke manshyp scribe offycers porter leuites brought oute money brought house lorde •• xx • b helkia preest found boke lawe lorde gyuen moses helkia answered sayd saphan scrybe haue founde boke law house lorde helkia gaue boke saphan saphan caryed boke kyng brought kyng worde agayn saynge cōmytted thy seruaūtes haue gathered togither money founde house lorde haue delyuered handꝭ ouerseers worke handes workman saphan scribe shewed kynge sayenge helkia preest hath gyuen boke saphan red kynge fortuned kyng herde wordes lawe tare clothes kynge cōmaunded helkia ahikam sonne saphan habidon sonne micah saphan scribe asaia seruaūt kynges saynge go enquire lorde lefte israel iuda concernyng wordes boke foūde great wrath lorde fallen vpon v bycause father haue kepte worde lorde wrytten boke helkia kynge appoynted went hulda prophetesse wyfe sallum sonne tokhath sonne hasra keper wardrop dwelte ierusalem seconde wall comuned answered thus sayth lorde god israel tel ye man sent euen thus sayth lorde beholde wyl bryng euyll vpon place vpon enhabiters therof euen curse wrytten boke haue red kyng iuda bycause haue forsaken haue offered vnto goddes angre maner workes theyr handes therfore wrath set fyre agaynst place shall quenched kynge iuda sent enquire lorde shall ye saye vnto hym thus sayth lorde god israell concernynge wordes whiche thou hast herde bycause th • ne herte dyd melte thou dydest meke thy selfe god thou herdest wordes agaynst place agaynst enhabitours therof humbledst thy selfe tarest thy clothes wepte haue herde also sayeth lorde beholde wyl take thy father thou shalte put thy graue peace thyne eye shall se myscheyfe wyl bryng vpon place vpon enhabitours brought kynge worde agayne 4 reg • 3 • kynge sent gathered togyther elder iuda ierusalem kynge wente vp house lorde al men iuda enhabitours ierusalem preestes leuites people great smal kynge dyd rede theyr hearynge al wordes boke couenaunt founde house •• lorde kynge stode standyng made couenaunt lorde folowe lorde kepe cōmaundementes wytnesses statute herte soule fulfyl wordes appoyntment wrytten sayd boke set theyr rowme founde ierusalem beniamin enhabitoures ierusalem dyd accordynge couenaunt lorde god theyr father iosia put awaye maner abhominacions landes perteyned chyldren israell brought founde israell worshyp serue lorde theyr god turned asyde lorde god theyr father longe lyued ¶ iosia holdeth passeouer fyghteth agaynst kynge egypt dyeth people bewayle h ••• capi xxxv iosia helde 4 reg 23 • 3 e •••• • • feast passeouer vnto lorde ierusalem slue passeouer xiiii daye fyrste moneth set preestes theyr offyces ayded seruyce house lorde sayd vnto leuitꝭ taught israel sanctified vnto lorde put holy arke house whiche salomon sonne dauid kynge israel dyd buylde shall none burdē layd vpon shoulder serue lorde god people israell prepare selues youre auncient housholdes company according wrytynge dauid kyng israel wrytyng salomon sonne stande holy place accordynge deuision auncient housholdes brother chyldren people deuision auncient housholdes leuitꝭ kyl passeouer sanctifie prepare brother may accordynge worde lorde hande moses iosia gaue people flockes shepe kyddes al passeouer al present thyrtie usande tale thre thousande ox euen kynges substaūce lordꝭ gaue wyllynglye vnto people preestes vnto leuites helkia also zacharia iehiel tulers house god gaue vnto preestꝭ passeouer offerynges two thousande syxe hundred shepe thre hundred ox conama semetahu nathanel brother hasabiahu iaiel • osabad ruler leuites gaue vnto leuites passeouer offerynges euen fyue thousand shepe fyue hundred ox seruyce prepated preestes stode theyr place leuites theyr distincte companyes kynges cōmaundement slue passeouer preestes sprinkled bloode theyr hande leuites pulled skynnes beastꝭ fet away burnt offerynges gyue vnto people deu • ded auncient house shulde offre vnto lorde lyke 〈◊〉 wrytten boke moses dyd ox also exod xii b dressed passeouer fyre maner dedicate beastes • od pottes cauldron paunes deuyded among al people afterwarde made redy selues preestes chyldren aaron busyed offeryng burnt offerynges fat vntyll nyght therfore leuites prepared selues preestꝭ sonnes aaron syngers chyldren asaph stode theyr standyng • par xxv xxvi accordyng cōmaundement dauid • asaph heman ieduthun kynges sea • porter wayted euery gate myght departe theyr seruyce theyr brother leuites ☞ prepared al seruyce lord prepared daye offre passeouer offre burnt offerynges vpon aulter lorde accordyng cōmaundement kyng iosia chyldren israel present offered passeouer tyme kept feast swete bread seuen dayes passeouer lyke kepte israell dayes samuell prophet neyther dyd kynges israell holde suche passeouer feast dyd iosia preestes leuites iuda israel presen • e enhabitours ierusalem passeouer holden eyghtene yeare reygne iosia 4 reg 〈◊〉 • iosia prepared temple necho kynge egypte came vp fyght agaynst cat • amis besyde euphrates iosia went agaynst hym sent messenger hym sayde haue thou kynge iuda thou agaynst thy selfe daye wa • agaynst house god bad make haste leaue therfore medle god wt lest destroy neuertheles iosia wolde turne face hym rather toke aduyse fyght hym herkened vnto wordes necho mouthe god came fyght valley magedo shuters shot dartes kynge iosia kyng sayd seruauntes carye away sore wounded seruauntes therfore hym charet put hym ❀ kyng charet brought hym ierusalem dyed buryed sepulchre father •••• • 〈◊〉 • iuda ierusalem mourned iosia ieremia lamented lorde iere 〈◊〉 • •• 〈◊〉 • spoken mouth ieremia fynysshed lorde styrred vp spirite cyrus kyng persia made proclamacyon thorowout kyngdom wrytynge sayenge thus sayth cyrus kynge persia kyngdomes earth hath lorde god heuen gyuen hath charged buylde hym house ierusalem iuda wherfore soeuer amonge people lorde god hym let hym go vp ❧ ende seconde boke cronicles ❧ fyrst boke esdras ¶ cyrus sendeth agayne people captiuy • e▪ restoreth theyr holy vessel cōmaundeth buylde agayne temple capi primo fyrst yere ii pa 36 cyrus kyng persia word lorde spoken iere xxv b mouth ieremi myghte fulfylled lorde styrred vp spirite cyrus kyng persia caused proclaymed thorowout empyre wrytten saynge thus sayth cyrus kyng persia lorde god heuen hath gyuen kyngdomes earthe esal 44 hath commaunded buylde hym house ierusalem whiche iuda soeuer nowe among people lorde god hym let hym go vp ierusalem iuda buyld house lorde god israell god ierusalem soeuer remayneth yet maner place straunger let men place helpe hym syluer golde good cattell besyde wyllynglye offer house god ierusalem gat vp principall father iuda ben iamin preestes leuites whose spirite god raysed go vp buylde house lorde whiche ierusalem aboute strengthed theyr hande vessel syluer golde good cattell iuels moche euery one shewed hym selfe lyberall kynge cyrus brought forthe vessel house lorde ii par 36 • 3 e • g 25 daniel • whiche nabuchodonozer taken ierusalem put house god dyd cyrus kynge persia brynge forthe hand mithridates treasurer nombred vnto sesbazar prince iuda nombre thyrtie charger golde thousand changer syluer nyne twentye knyues thyrtye basyns golde syluer basyns foure hundred ten vessel thousand vessel golde syluer v foure hundred dyd sesbazar carye awaye came vp captiuite babilon vnto ierusalem ¶ nombre returned captiuyte capi ii chyldren lande went vp captiuite nabuchodonozer kynge babilō caried away vnto babilon came agayn vnto ierusalem iuda euery one vnto citye came zorobabel iesua 2 e •• ii • nehemiah saraea • laia mardochai bilsan mispar biguai rehum baana nombre men people israel child phares two thousand hundred seuentye two chyldren saphatia thre hundred seuentye two chyldren arath seuen hundred seuenty fyue chyldren captayne moab amonge chyldren iesua ioab two thousande eyght hundred twelue chyldren elam thousande two hundred fyfty foure chyldren zathu nyne hundred fourty fyue chyldren zaccai seuen hundred lx chyldren ban syxe hundred fourty two chyldren bebai syxe hundred thre twentye chyldren asgad thousand two hundred two twentye chyldren adonicam syxe hundred syxtye syxe chyldren beguai two thousande fyftye syxe chyldren adin foure hundred fyftie foure chyldren ater hezekia nyntye eyght chyldren bezai thre hundred thre twentye chyldren iora hundred twelue chyldren hasum two hundred thre twentye chyldren gebar nyntye fyue chyldren bethleem hundred thre twentye men netopha syxe fyftye men anathoth hundred eyght twentye chyldren asmaueth two fourtie chyldren kiriath iarim euen child cephira beeroth seuen hundred thre fourtye chyldren harama geba syxe hundred one twentye men michmas hundred two twentye men bethel hai two hundred thre twentye chyldren nebo two fyftye chyldren magbis hundred syxe fyftye chyldren elam thousand two hundred foure fyftye chyldren harim thre hundred twentye chyldren lodhadid ono seuen hundred fyue twentye chyldren iericho thre hundred fyue fourtye chyldren senaa thre thousande syxe hundred thyrtye preestes chyldren iedaia house iesua nyne hundred seuentye thre chyldren immer thousande two fyftye theyr father house theyr seede whyther israell chyldren delaia chyldrē tobia chyldren necoda syxe hundred two fyftye chyldren preestes chyldren hebaia chyldren hakoz chyldren berzilai whiche toke one doughters • • e 17 • 〈◊〉 〈◊〉 • • e • g ii • berzilat gileadite wyfe called theyr name sought theyr euidence among register byrth found therin therfore put preesthode ☞ hathirsatha sayde vnto shuld eate holy tyl rose vp exodi 28 • preest weare ☞ urim thumim hole congregacion togyther two fourtye thousande thre hundred thre score besyde theyr seruauntes maydens vii thousande thre hundred seuen thyrtye amonge two hundred syngynge men woman theyr horse seuen hūdred syxe thyrtie theyr mule two hundred fyue fourtye theyr camel foure hundred fyue thyrtie theyr ass syxe thousande seuen hundred twentye certayne cheyfe father whē came bycause house lorde ierusalē offred selues wylling house god set place gaue golde theyr abilite vnto tresure worke euen one thre score thousande pe •• fy • e thousande pounde syluer hundred preestes garmentes preestes leuitꝭ certayne peple syngers porter nethinims dwelt theyr cityes israel theyr cityes ¶ foundacyon temple renued sacrifyce vnto lorde capi iii ☜ ☞ ii esd • 8 • 3 esd • v • seuenth moneth came chyldren israel theyr cityes people came togyther euen one mā vnto ierusalem stode vp iesua sonne iosedee brother preestes zorobabel son salathiel brother buylded au • ter god israel offre burnt offrynges theron wrytten law moses man god aulter set vpon sockettes fearefulnesse amonge bycause nacions landes therfore offered burnt offerynges theron vnto lorde num 2 • • mornyng euen helde feast tabernacle num 29 • wrytten offered burnt sacrifice dayly accordyng nombre custome daye daye afterwarde offered dayly burnt offerynges also newe moones al feast dayes consecrate vnto lorde whiche dyd theyr owne fre wyl offre vnto lorde fyrst day seuenth moneth began offre burnt sacrifice vnto lorde euen foundacion temple lorde yet layde gaue money also vnto mason carpenter meate drynke oyle vnto zidon tire brynge cedre tymbre frome libanus see vnto ☞ iappa accordyng graunt cyrus kynge persia seconde yere theyr comyng vnto place house god ierusalem seconde moneth began zorobabell sonne salathiel iesua sonne iosedec remenaunt theyr brethrē preestes leuites come captiuite vnto ierusalem appoynted leuites twentye yeare olde aboue se worke house lorde went forwarde iesua stode sonnes brother cadmiel sonnes chyldren iuda forther workemen house god euen child • adab theyr child theyr brother leuites bulders layde foundacyon temple lorde preestes stode theyr aray trompettes leuites chyldren asaph cymbal prayse lorde • 〈◊〉 〈◊〉 • maner dauid kyng israel sang togyther whan gaue prayse thankes vnto lorde bycause gracious bicause mercy endureth euer vpon israell al people showted loude praysyng lorde bycause foūdacyon house lorde layde many also preestes leuites auncient father sene fyrst house foū dacyon house layde theyr eye wepte loude voyce many showted ioye noyse gaue great sounde moch peple could discerne ioyful sounde gladnes noyse wepynge amonge people people showted loude crye noyse herde farre ¶ buyldynge temple hyndered let capi iiii • esdr v g aduersaries iuda ben iamin herde chyldrē captiuite buylded temple vnto lorde god israel came zorobabel principall father sayde vnto wyll buylde seke lorde youre god lyke ye haue done sacrifice vnto hym synce tyme asor hadon kynge assur 3 〈◊〉 17 whiche brought v vp hyther zorobabell iesua auncient father israell sayd vnto togyther shuld buyld house vnto god selues wyl buylde alone vnto lorde god israel • esdr • • ▪ cyrus kynge persia hath cōmaunded v came passe folke lande hyndered people iuda troubled buyldyng hyred counsaylours agaynst hyndre theyr deuyce long cyrus kynge persia lyued vntyl reygne darius kynge persia reygne ahasuerus euen begynnyng reygne wrote vnto hym complaynte agaynst enhabitours iuda ierusalem dayes arthaxerses wrote mithridath tabeell counsayle vnto arthaxerses kynge persia fayre wordes scripture letter wrytten sirians speche interpretated language sirians rehum recorder samsai scribe wrote letter frome ierusalem arthaxerses kynge foloweth rehum recorder samset scribe theyr companye dina arphasath tarpla persia arach babilon susan deha elam people 3 reg 〈◊〉 great noble asnapar brought ouer set cityes samaria nowe syde water copy letter sent vnto kynge arthaxerses thy seruauntes men nowe syde water knowen vnto kynge iues whiche came vp v come vnto ierusalem citye sedicious frowarde buylde set vp walles therof laye foundacyons knowen nowe also vnto kyng yf citye buylded walles therof made vp agayne shall gyue toll tribute custome kynges profyte shal incur dāmage nowe meane season haue destroyed temple wolde longer se kynges dyshonoure therfore sent oute also certified kynge maye sought boke cronicles thy progenitours shalte thou fynde boke cronicles perceyue citie sedicious noysome vnto kynges land • cause also among rebell olde cause citye destroyed therfore certifie kynge yf citye buylded agayne walles therof made vp thou shalte hereafter haue porcion syde water sente kynge answere vnto rehum recorder samsai scrybe theyr companyons dwelte samaria vnto beyonde water • lam cheheth letter whiche ye sent vnto v hath ben openly red haue cōmaunded make search found citye olde hath made insurrection agaynst kynges rebellyon sedicion hath ben cōmytted therin haue ben myghty kyngꝭ also ierusalem haue reygned ouer countryes beyond water tolle trybute custome gyuen vnto gyue ye nowe therfore cō maundement men forbydden citye buylded agayne tyll haue gyuen another cōmaundement take hede nowe ye neclygent shulde kyng haue harme thorowe copye kyng arthaxerses letter red rehū simsai scrybe theyr companyons went vp haste ierusalem vnto iues forbad vyolence power ceased worke house god ierusalem contynued vnto seconde yeare darius kynge persia ¶ exhortacyon aggeus zachary temple buylded agayne capi v prophettes 〈◊〉 〈◊〉 • aggeus zachary sonne iddo prophecyed vnto iues iuda ierusalem name god israel 〈◊〉 • • gat vp zorobabell sonne salathiell iesua sonne iosedec began buylde house god ierusalem prophettes god helped tyme came tathnai whiche captayne syde water starbaznai theyr companyons sayde thus vnto hath commaunded buylde house make vp walles tolde name men made buyldynge eye theyr god vpon elder iues coulde cause cease tyll matter brought darius ☞ answered letter therunto copye letter tathnai whiche captayne syde water starbaznai coūsaylers apharsah whiche syde water sent vnto kyng darius matter sent vnto hym wryttē thus within letter unto darius kyng peace knowen vnto kynge went lande iurye house great god buylded myghtye great stone beames layde walles worke goeth fast forth prospereth theyr handes asked elder sayde vnto foloweth commaunded buylde house make vp walles therof asked theyr name also myght certifye wryte name men theyr ruler answered v wordes sayde seruauntes hym god heuen earth buylde house buylded many yeres go 3 reg v • • 〈◊〉 pa 〈◊〉 • greate kynge israel buylded set vp father prouoked god heuen vnto wrath 4 reg 24▪ and▪ xxv gaue ouer hande nabuchodonozer kynge babilon caldyes whiche brake downe house caryed people away captyue vnto babilon • 〈◊〉 • • fyrst yere cyrus kyng babilon kynge cyrus gaue cō maundement concernyng house god shulde buylte agayne vessel golde syluer house god whiche nabucodo • ozer toke temple ierusalem brought temple babilon dyd cyrus kynge take temple babilō • 〈◊〉 • • delyuered vnto one sasbazar name whome made captayne sayde vnto hym take vessel go thy way set temple ierusalem let house god buylded place came sasbazar layde foundacyō house god ierusalem synce tyme also vntyll hath ben buyldynge yet finysshed yf please kynge nowe therfore let searche made kynges librarie babilon whyther ben kyng cyrus cōmaundement temple god ierusalem shulde buylded let hym sende v kynges mynde concernynge matter ¶ cōmaundemente darius kynge persia temple buylded dedicate chyldren israell kepte feast vnleuended breade capi vi cōmaunded kynge darius made search librarye euen place layde vp treasure babilon • esdr ••• ❀ founde coffe • place land medꝭ • volume therein thus wrytten soche memoryall fyrst yeare kynge cirus gaue kynge cirus cō maundement concernynge house god ierusalem house shulde buylded place offer sacrifyces ❀ • oyne walles togyther thre score cubytes heyght thre score cubytes bredth thre rowes rough stone one rowe tymber expences shall gyuen kynges house let golde syluer vessell house god whiche nabuchodonozer toke oute temple ierusalem brought vnto babilon restored brought agayne vnto temple ierusalem theyr place house god get far • e therfore thou thahnai captayne beyonde water stharbuzanai counsaylers aphersechei whiche beyonde water get away frō let worke house god alone captayne iues theyr elder maye buylde house god place haue cōmaūded shall done elder iuda buyldyng house god shall dylygent hede taken kynges goodes euen rente beyond water gyuen vnto men hyndred yf haue nede calues rammꝭ lambes burnt offeryng god heuen wheate salte wyne oyle custome preestes ierusalem let gyuen daylye without delaye may offer swete sauours vnto god heuen pray kynges lyfe chyldren soche commaundement haue gyuen man soeuer altereth worde shall beame taken house set vp shal hanged theron house shall ❀ made donghyll thynge god set name destroye kynges people put theyr hande alter breake downe house god whiche ierusalem darius haue cōmaūded done spede tathnai captayne countrey beyonde water stharbuzanai theyr counsaylers whome kynge darius sent dyd theyr dilygence elder iues buylded prospered thorowe prophesyenge aggeus prophet zachary son iddo buylded layde v • foundacyon accordynge cōmaundement god israell commaundement cyrus darius arthaxerses kynges persia house finysshed thyrde daye moneth adar euen syxte yere reygne kynge darius •• p • 〈◊〉 • chyldren israell preestes leuites chyldren captiuyte helde dedicacyon house god ioye offered dedicacion house god hundred ox two hundred rammes foure hūdred gootes reconcylynge israell twelue gootes accordynge nombre trybes israell set preestes theyr sondrye course leuites theyr dyuerse office minyster vnto god ierusalem wrytten boke moses chyldren captyuyte helde passeouer vpon x • iii day fyrst moneth preestes leuites puryfied al cleane togyther kylled passeouer chyldren captiuyte theyr brother preestes selues chyldren israell come agayne captiuyte soche seperated selues vnto fylthynesse heathen lande seke lorde god israell dyd eate helde feast vnleuened breade seuen dayes ioye lorde made glad turned herte kynge assur vnto strengthen theyr handes worke house god euen god israell ¶ cōmaundement arthaxerses •• dras ta •• eth hi • companyo •• chyldren israel returneth ierusalē capi vii actes ther reygne • 〈…〉 • • arthaxerses kynge persia one esdras son saraiah son azaria son helkia son sallum son zadoc son ahitob son amaria sonne asaria sonne mera • oth sonne zeraia sonne uzi sonne bucki sonne abisua▪ son phinehes sonne eleazar sonne aaron cheyfe preest esdras also went vp babilon perfyte scrybe law moses exod 〈◊〉 • lorde god israell dyd gyue kyng gaue hym requyred bycause hande lorde god vpon hym went vp certayne chyldren israell preestes leuites syngers porter nethinims vnto ierusalem seuenth yere kyng arthaxerses came ierusalem fyfth moneth euen seuenth yeare kynge vpon fyrst daye fyrst moneth began go vp babilon fyrst daye fyfth moneth came ierusalem bycause good hand god vpon hym esdras prepared herte seke lawe lorde teache precepte iudgement israel copye letter kynge arthaxerses gaue vnto esdras preest scrybe whiche wryter wordes cōmaundementes lorde statute ouer israell arthaxerses kynge kynges unto esdras preest scrybe lawe god heuen peace salutacyon haue cōmaunded people israell preestꝭ leuites realme whiche mynded theyr owne good wyl go vp ierusalem go therfore arte thou sent kynge seuen counsaylers vyset iuda ierusalem accordynge lawe thy god thy hande thou shuldest take syluer golde whiche kynge counsaylers offer theyr owne good wyl vnto god israell whose habitacyon ierusalem syluer golde thou canst fynde countrey babilon peple offer theyr owne good wyl preestes gyue house theyr god whiche ierusalem take thou bye dilygently money ox rammes lambes theyr meate offerynges drynke offerynges thou shalte offer vpon aulter house god whiche ierusalem loke lyketh thy brother remenaunt money wyll youre god vessel gyuen minystracyon house thy god delyuer thou god ierusalem whatsoeuer thynge shall nedeful house thy god whiche necessary spende thou shalt receyue charge kynges treasure house kyng arthaxerses haue cōmaunded treasure beyonde water loke whatsoeuer esdras preest scrybe lawe god heuen requireth ye fulfyl spedyly vntyll hundred talentes syluer vntyll c quarter wheate tyl hundred batthes wyne tyl hundred •• 〈◊〉 b batthes oyle salte without measure whatsoeuer also belongeth law god heuen let done without delaye house god heuen wroth agaynst realme agaynst kynge chyldren certifye ye haue auctoryte requyre taxynge custome yearly rente vpon preestꝭ leuites syngers porter nethinims minysters house god thou esdras wysdome thy god thy hande set iudges arbyterers auctoryte iudge people beyond water euen soche knowe lawe thy god know se ye teach whosoeuer wyll fulfyll lawe thy god kynges lawe let hym haue iudgement without delaye whyther vnto death routed condempned goodes put pryson 3 esdra • • blessed lorde god father whiche hath inspired kynges herte garnysshe house lorde ierusalem enclyned mercy vnto • n presence kynge counsaylers kynges hygh estate comforted euen hande lorde god vpon gathered heades israell togyther myght go vp nombre returne ierusalē esdra • capi viii princypal father theyr regyster went vp babilon tyme kynge arthaxerses reygned chyldren3 e • • • • phinches gerson chyldrē ithamar daniell chyldren dauid hatus chyldren zecania amonge chyldren pharos zachary hym nombred hundred fyftye men chyldren captayne moa • elioenai sonne zerahia two hundred men chyldren zechania sonne iahasiell hym thre hundred men chyldren adin abed sonne ionathan hym fyftye men chyldren elam isai son athalia hym seuentye men chyldren saphatia zebadia son michaell hym foure score men chyldren ioab obadia son iehiell hym two hundred eyghtene men chyldren selomith sonne iosiphia hundred thre score men chyldren bebai zachary sonne bebai hym eyght xx men chyldren asgad iohanan son hakatan hym hundred ten men chyldren adonicam laste whose name eliphelet iehiell samaiah thre score men chyldren biguai uthai zabud seuentye men gathered togyther water renneth toward aha • abode thre dayes loked amonge people preestes founde none chyldren leui sent elieser ariel semeia elnathan iarib elnathan nathan zachary mesullam ruler ioiarib elnathan whiche men vnderstandynge gaue commaundement vnto iddo cheyfest casphia shulde fetch v minysters house god tolde shulde saye vnto iddo brother nethinims casphia thorowe good hande oure god vpon v brought v wyse man amonge chyldren moholi sonne leui sonne israell sarabia sonnes brother euen eyghtene hasabia hym isai chyldren merari brother theyr sonnes twentye nethinims whome dauid prynces gaue minyster vnto leuites two hūdred twentye nethinim whiche named name euen water besyde ahaua proclamed fast myght humble ourselues god seke hym ryght way v chyldren substaunce ashamed requyre kynge souldyers horseman helpe v agaynste enemye waye sayd vnto kynge hande god vpon seke hym goodnesse ❀ dominyon violence wrath agaynst forsake hym fasted besought god herde v toke twelue cheyfe preestes sarabia hasabia ten theyr brother weyed syluer golde vessel appyonted house oure god whiche kynge counsaylers lordes israell hande gyuen togyther weyed vnto theyr hande sixe hundred fyftye talentes syluer syluer vessell hundred talentes golde hundred talentes twentye basens golde thousand peces two costly ornamentꝭ good brasse cleare golde sayde vnto ye consecrate vn lorde lyke vessel holy also golde syluer gyuen good wyll vnto lorde god father watch ye kepe ye shal weye downe cheyfe preestes leuites auncient father israell ierusalem treasuryes house lorde toke preestes leuites weyed syluer golde vessel brynge ierusalem vnto house god brake vp water ahaua twelueth daye fyrste moneth go vnto ierusalem hande oure god vpon v delyuered v hande enemyes • h layde wayte v way came ierusalem abode thre dayes fourth daye syluer golde vessel weyed house god hande meremoth sonne uria preest hym eleazar sonne phy • ches iosabad sonne iesua noadia sonne benoi leuites accordynge nombre weyght euery one weyght wrytten vp tyme chyldren captiuyte come pryson offered burntofferynges vnto god israel xii bullockes al israel nynety syre rammes seuentye seuen lambes twelue gootes synofferynge burntofferyng lorde delyuered kynges commyssyon vnto kynges offycers captaynes • syde water promoted people house god ¶ esdra • complayneth people •• rned selues god maryed gentyles capi ix thynges done ruler came sayd people israell preestes leuites separated people landes touchyng theyr abhominacons namely cananites hethites pheresites iebusites ammonite moabites egyptian amorytes ••• 〈…〉 iosu • 13▪ iud • 〈…〉 〈…〉 haue taken doughters selues theyr sonnes holy seede myxt nacyons landes hande prynces ruler hath ben pryncypall trespasse • e ••• 8 c herde saynge rent clothes rayment piuckte heere heade beerde sat mournyng resorted vnto soch feared wordes lorde god israel bycause transgressyon people captiuite sat mournynge vntyll euenynge sacrifyce aboute euenyng sacrifyce rose vp heuynes rent clothes rayment fell vpon knee spred handes vnto lorde god sayde god ashamed dare lyf • vp myne eye vnto god wyekednesses growen ouer oure heade trespasse waxen great vnto heuen synce tyme father haue ben great trespasse vnto daye 〈…〉 〈◊〉 b • 〈…〉 33 b • 〈…〉 〈◊〉 b bycause wyckednesses haue oure kynges ben delyuered hande kynges nacyons swerde captiuyte shame confusyon face se day lytle sodayne gracyousnesse come lorde god causynge v escape maye gyue v nayle holy place god maye lyght eye gyue v lytle lyfe take breth bondage bondman god hath forsaken v oure bondage hath enclyned mercye vnto v syght kynges persia gyue v lyfe set vp house oure god redresse desolacyon therof gyue v wall iuda ierusalem nowe oure god sha •• say haue forsaken thy cōmaundementes whiche thou hast cōmaunded thy seruauntes prophettes sayenge lande vnto whiche ye go possesse vncleane land bycause fylthynesse people landes whiche wt theyr abhominacyons haue made full vnclennesse euery syde 〈…〉 〈◊〉 • therfore shal ye gyue doughters vnto theyr sonnes theyr doughters shall ye take vnto youre sonnes seke theyr peace welth euer ye maye stronge enioye good lande ye chyldren may haue enherytaunce euermore thynges come vpon v bycause euyl dedes great trespass thou god hast ☞ thrust downe wyekednesses hast gyuen v delyueraūce ❀ come passe day yf turne backe agayne let go thy cōmaundementes make contracte people abhominacyons wylte thou wroth v without cause tyll vtterly consumed nothinge remayne tyll delyueraunce lorde god israel thou art ryghteous remayne yet escaped se daye beholde also thy presence oure trespass bycause may stande ¶ people repente turn • put away theyr straunge wyues capi x 3 esdr 8 • esdras prayed maner knowledged wept lay house god resorted vnto hym israell greate congregacyon men woman chyldren people wept sore sechania son iehiell one chyldren elam answered sayde vnto esdras haue trespassed agaynst god haue taken straunge wyues people lande nowe hope yet israell concernynge thyng nowe wyl make couenaunt god put away wyues soch borne accordynge counsayle lorde wyll feare cōmaūdementꝭ god maye accordynge lawe get thevp matter belōgeth vnto also wyl good comforte therfore • e ••• 〈◊〉 • rose esdras toke othe cheyfe preestes leuites israell shulde accordynge word sware esdras stode vp house god wente chamber iohanan sonne eliasib came thyther dyd eate bread drynke water mourned bycause transgressyon peple ben captiuyte caused proclamacyon go thorowout iuda ierusalem vnto chyldren whiche ben captiuyte shuld gather selues togyther vnto ierusalem whosoeuer came within thre dayes accordyng deuyce ruler elder al substaunce shulde forfet shuld put congregacion captyue men iuda beniamin gathered selues togyther vnto ierusalem within thre dayes euen twentye daye nyenth moneth peple sat strete house god trembled bycause matter rayne esdras preest stode vp sayd vnto deut vii iudi iii ye haue transgressed haue taken straūge wyues make trespasse israell yet confesse nowe therfore vnto lorde god father pleasure seperate selues frō people lande straūge wyues congregacyon answered sayde loude voyce shall wyll thou hast sayde people many raynye wether people faynt tarye without streete neyther worke one daye two haue offended sore thynge let ruler stand therfore cōgregacyon let al haue taken straunge wyues oure cityes come tyme appoynted let elder euery citye theyr iudges tyll haue turned wrath oure god away v concernyng matter appoynted ionathan son asahel iahasia sonne thekua ouer matter mesullam sabathat leuites helped chyldren captiuyte dyd euen esdras preest auncient heades tho • house theyr father men great fame seperated selues sat downe fyrst day tenth moneth examen matter vntyll fyrst day fyrst moneth finysshynge busynesse men taken straunge wyues amonge chyldren preestes men foūd taken straunge wyues namely amonge chyldren iesua son iosedec brother masiah eliezer iarib gedalia gaue theyr handꝭ vpon wolde put awaye theyr wyues theyr trespasse offeryng gyue ram theyr trespas among chyldren emer honani zabadia amonge chyldren harim maasia elia semeiah▪ iehtel usia amonge chyldren phashur elioenai maasia ismaell nethanell iosabad elasa amonge leuites iosabad simei kela • kalithah pathahiah iuda eliazar among syngers also eliasib amonge porter sellum telem uri israell amonge chyldren phathos remia iesia malchia miamin eliazar malchia banaia among chyldren elam methania zachati iehiell abdy ierimoth elia amonge chyldren zathu elioenai eliasib mathania ierimoth zabad aziza amonge chyldren bebai iehohanan hanania zabai athalai amonge chyldrē beni mesulam maluc adaiah iasub saall ierimoth amonge chyldrē captayne moab adna cholal benaia masia mathania bezelell benui manasse amonge chyldren harim eliezer iesia malchia semeia simeon ben iamin malluch samaria amonge chyldren hasum mathanai mathathah zabad eliphelet ieremi manasse simei among chyldren ban madai amram huel bane • cheluhi badaiah uaniah maremoth eliasib mathania mathanai iaesai ban beni semeiah selemia nathan adaia machnadba • sa • ai sarai asarell selemiahu samariah sallum amaria ioseph amonge chyldren nebo ieh • ell mathathia zabad zabina iadai ioell banaia taken straūge wyues among chyldren wyues ¶ ende fyrst boke esdras ❧ ❀ ❧ ¶ second boke esdras otherwyse called boke nehemia ¶ nehemia butle • kynge iethax •• •• pr •• eth god people capi primo wordes nehemia sonne hachalia fortuned moneth ☞ chisleu twentye yere castell susan hanan • one brother came certayne men iuda asked howe iues dyd delyuered escaped captiuyte howe went ierusalem▪ sayde vnto remenaunt captiuyte land great misfortune rebuke 4 reg 〈◊〉 • wall ierusalem also broken downe gate therof butnte fyre fortuned herde wordꝭ sat downe ••• te mourned ce • tayne dayes fasted prayed god heuen sayde lorde god heuen thou great terryble god e • •• x • 〈◊〉 xxiiii 〈…〉 vii b thou kepest couenaunt mercye loueth obserue thy cōmaundementes let thyne eares herken besech let thyne eye open thou mayest heare prayer thy seruaunt whiche praye nowe daye nyght chyldren israell thy seruauntes knowledge synnes chyldren israell whiche haue synned agaynst father house haue synned haue bene vtterly dyspersed thy lawe haue kepte thy commaundementes statute lawes whiche thou commaundedst thy seruaunt moses beseche cal remembraunce worde thou commaūdedst thy seruaunt moses saydest ye wyll transgresse e •••• 〈◊〉 • wyl scatter abrode amonge nacions yf ye turne vnto kepe cōmaūdementes though ye cast vnto vt • ermoost parte heuen yet wyll gather thence wyll brynge vnto place haue chosen set name thy seruauntes thy people whome thou • ast delyuered thorowe thy greate power thy myghtye hande lorde beseche let thyne eare herken prayer thy seruaunt prayer thy seruaūtes whose desyre feare thy name let thy seruaunt prospere day graunt hym mercye syght man kynges butlar ¶ n • hemia obteyned letter arthaxerses cometh ierusalem •• yldeth walle • capi ii fortuned moneth • 〈…〉 • nisan twentyeth yere kynge arthaxerses wyne stode hym toke vp wyne gaue vnto kyng heuy presence kynge sayd vnto lokest thou sadly thou art sycke • nothyng el thou art heuy herted sore afrayd sayd vnto kyng god saue kyngꝭ lyfe euer howe shulde loke sadly citye place father buryall lyeth wast gate therof consumed fyre kynge sayde vnto thy request made prayer also god heuen sayd vn kynge yf please kyng yf thy seruaunt haue founde fauour thy syght send • iuda vnto citye father buryall maye buylde kynge sayde vnto quene wyfe syttynge hym howe longe shall thy iourney contynue wy • te thou come agayne pleased kynge sende set hym tyme sayd vnto kynge yf please kynge let hym gyue letter captaynes whiche beyonde water may conuey ouer tyll come iuda letter vnto asaph lorde kynges wood maye gyue tymber make beames ☞ gate palace herde house walles citye house shall entre into▪ kynge gaue accordynge hande god whiche good vpon came captaynes beynde water gaue kynges letter kynge sent captaynes horseman sanabalat also horonite tobia seruaunt ammonite herde greued sore •• man whiche sought welth chyldren israell came ierusalem thre dayes gat vp nyghtse • son fewe men neyther tolde man god gyuen herte ierusalem one beast saue rode vpon departed nyght valley porte dragon well dong porte consydered walles ierusalem howe broken downe porte therof consumed fyre went ouer vnto welporte kynges conduite rowme brast vnder passe •• nt nyght broke syde cōsydered wall turned backe came h • agayne valley porte ruler knewe whyther went dyd neyther dyd yet tell vn iues preestes noble men ruler laboured worke sayde vnto ye se myserye howe ierusalem lyeth waste howe gate therof burnt fyre come therfore maye buylde vp walle ierusalem r • buke tolde hande god gracyous ouer kynges wordes spoken vnto sayd let v get vp buylde ☞ strengthed theyr hande good sanabalat horonyte tobia seruant ammonite gesem arabian herde laughed v scorne mocked v sayde ye wyll ye fall awaye kynge answered sayd god heuen hath graunted v prosperite seruantes let v get vp buylde ye haue porcyon ryght remembraunce ierusalem ¶ nombre buylded walles capi iii eliasib hygh preest gat hym vp brother preestes buylded shepegate repayred set vp dores euen vnto towre mea repayred vnto iere xxxi g zatha 14 c towre hananeell nexte vnto hym also buylded men ierico besyde hym buylded sachur son amri fysshe porte dyd chyldren senaa buylde whiche also layed beames therof set dores locke barres nexte vnto hym buylded meremoth sonne uria sonne hakoz nexte vnto buylded mesulam sonne berechia sonne mesesabeell next vnto hym buylded zadoc son baana next vnto hym buylded thekoa great men among putte theyr neckes worke theyr lorde oldegate buylded iehoiada sonne paseah mesulam sonne besodia layde beames therof set dores locke barres next vnto buylded malatiah gibeon iadon merano men gibeon mizpa captayne syde water mansyon nexte vnto hym buylded usiell son harhaiah golde smyth nexte vnto hym also buylded hananiah son harakahym repayred ierusalem vnto brode walle nexte vnto buylded raphaiah sonne hur ruler halfe parte ierusalem next vnto hym buylded iedaia son harumaph ouer agaynst house nexte vnto hym buylded hatus son hasabnia melchia son harim hasub son captayne moab buylded pece towre besyde fornaces nexte vnto hym buylded sallum syngers son ruler halfe parte ierusalem doughters valley gate buylded hanun citezyns zanoa buylded set dores locke barres therof cubytes wall vnto dongeporte dongeporte buylded melchiah sonne rechab ruler fourth parte betheharē repayred set dores locke barres therof wel gate repayred sallum son cholhosah ruler fourth part mizpa buylded layde beames set dores locke barres therof wall vnto pole siloah kyngꝭ garden vnto steppe go downe citye dauid hym buylded nehemiah sonne • ocke ruler halfe parte bethzur vntyll syde ouer agaynst scpulchres dauid pole repayred vnto house myghtye hym buylded leuites rehum sonne ban nexte vnto hym buylded hasabia ruler halfe parte keilah quarter hym buylded theyr brother beua • sonne henadad ruler halfe parte keilah hym buylded ezer sonne iesua ruler mizpa pece herde ouer agaynst goyng vp house ordynaūce corner agayne hym brake forth baruch son zachai indignacyon repayred pece turnynge corner vnto dore house eliasib high preest hym also buylded merimoth son uria son hacos pece dore house eliasib euen longe house eliasib extended hym buylded prestꝭ men playne hym buylded beniamin hasub ouer agaynst theyr house hym wrought asaria son maasia son anania nexte vnto house also buylded benui sonne hanadad pece house asaria vnto turnynge wall vnto corner hym buylded pala sonne usai ouer agaynst corner hygh towre lyeth ouer kynges house besyde courte pryson hym phedaia sonne pharhos nethinims dwelte stronge holde vnto watergate towarde cast towre lyeth hym buylded thekua pece ouer agaynst great towre lyeth outward vnto wall stronge holde aboue horsgate forth buylded preestes euery one ouer agaynst house buylded zadock son immer ouer agaynst house hym buylded also semeia sonne sechania keper east gate hym buylded hanania sonne selemia hanun sonne zalaph syxte pece hym buylded mesulam sonne bara • hia ouer agaynst store house hym bulded malchia golde smythes sonne vntyll house nithinims merchauntes ouer agaynst gate mephkad parlour coruer bytwene parloure corner vnto shepe gate buylded golde smythes merchauntes ¶ buyldynge ierusalem hyndered let iues buylde beynge redy harnessed lest theyr enemyes shulde inuade capi iiii whē sanabalat herde buylded wall wrothe hym selfe toke great indygnacyon mocked iues sayde brother souldyours samaria impotent iues wyll heathen suffre shall offre shal perfourme one daye shall make stone hole agayne brought dust burnt tobiah ammonite besyde hym sayd though buylde yet yf foxe go vp shall breake downe theyr stonye wall heare thou god despised turne theyr shame vpon theyr owne heade gyue ouer despisyng land theyr captiuite couer theyr wyckednesse let theyr synne put thy presence haue prouoked buylders buylded wall ioyned hole togyther vnto halfe heyght therof people mynded laboure fortuned sanabalat tobiah arabian ammonite asdodites herde wallꝭ ierusalem made vp gappes began stopped wroth conspired togyther come fyght agaynst ierusalem make people hynderaūce therin neuerthelesse made prayer vnto god set watchman buylded day nyght ouer agaynst iuda sayd strength bearer feble yet moche morter able buylde wal aduersaryes sayde shal knowe neyther se tyl come myddes among fley hynder worke fortuned iues whiche dwelte besyde came tolde v good ten tymes place go vnto appoynted fall vpon v therfore set people theyr kynreddes theyr swerdes speres bowes beneth lowe place behynde wall loked gat vp sayde vnto cheyfe men ruler peple ye afrayde 2 esdra • • ix f thynke rather vpon great lorde whiche ought feared fyght youre brother sonnes doughters wyues house neuertheles chaūced enemyes herde gotten worde god brought theyr counsayle nought turned agayne wal euery one vnto labour tyme forth came passe halfe parte yong mē dyd laboure halfe parte helde speres sheldes bowes brest plate ruler stode behynde al house iuda whiche buylded wall bare burden laded one hande dyd euery one worke helde weapon euery one buylded swerd gyrde thygh buylded trompet blewe besyde sayd vnto principal men ruler people worke greate large separated vpon wall one farre loke place therfore ye heare noyse trompet resorte ye thyther vnto v exodi • 4 • god shall fyght v wyll labouryng worke halfe parte helde speres mornynge sprynge tyll sterres came forth tyme sayd vnto people euery one abyde seruaunt ierusalem nyght season may watche labour day tyme brother seruauntes men watche whiche behynde put neuer oure clothes dyd theyr harnesse saue onely bycause water ¶ people vexed hunger requireth lyuynge captayne capi v arose greate complaynte people theyr wyues agaynst theyr brother iues sayde sonnes doughters many therfore wyll take corne may eate lyue also sayde let v see landes vyneyardes house pledge take vp corne derth sayde let v borow money kynges tribute vpon landes vyneyardes beholde oure bodyes bodyes brother oure chyldren theyr chyldren el shulde sub due sonnes doughters vnto bondage doughters subdued vnto bondage alredy strength handes men haue landes vyneyardes herde theyr complaynte suche wordes displeased sore aduysed mynde rebuked counsellours ruler sayde vnto euery one chargeable vnto brother brought great congregacyon agaynst sayd vnto abilite haue bought brother iues whiche solde vnto hethen wyll ye sell brother agayn vnto heathen haue bene solde vnto v helde theyr peace coulde fynde nothynge answere nehemia sayde good ye ought ye walke feare god bycause rebuke heathen oure enemyes brother seruauntes lende money corne vsurye let v leaue therfore daye praye se ye restore theyr landꝭ agayne theyr vyneyardes oyle garden theyr house remytte hundred parte money corne wyne oyle ye haue wonne sayde wyll restore agayne wyll requyre nothynge wyll thou hast spoken called preestꝭ toke othe shulde shoke lap sayd▪ god shake euery mā maner house laboure maynteyneth worde euen thus shaken voyde cōgregacyon sayde amen praysed lorde peple dyd frō tyme forth kynge cōmytted vnto captayne lande iuda euen twentye yeare vnto xxxii yeare kyng arthaxerses twelue yeare brethrē lyued sustenaūce gyuen captayne olde captaynes bene chargeable vnto people taken breade wyne xl sycles syluer yea theyr seruauntes oppressed people dyd bycause feare god laboured also worke vpon wall bought lande seruauntes came thyther togyther vnto worke moreouer table hundred fyftye iues ruler whiche came vnto among hethen v prepared dayly oxe syx chosen shepe byrdes euer ten dayes great sūme wyne yet requyred lyuynge captayne bondage greuous vnto people 2 eso • 〈◊〉 and▪ x ••• • thynke vpon god vnto best accordynge haue done people ¶ buyldynge ye • agayne hyndered le •• e capi vi sanabalat tobiah gesem arabian oure enemyes herde buylded wall mo gappes therin howbeit tyme hanged dores vpon gate sanabalat gesem sent vnto sayenge come may mete take counsel togyther vyllages playne citye ono neuerthelesse thought euyll sent messenger vnto sayenge haue great busynes come downe worke shulde stande styll yf ne • lygent came downe howbeit sent vnto good iiii tymes maner gaue answere sent sanabalat seruaunt agayne vnto fyfth tyme open letter hande wherin wrytten tolde heathen gesem hath fayde thou iues thynke rebell whiche cause thou buyldest wall thou mayst theyr kynge matter haste ordeyned prophettes preache ierusalem saye kyng iuda nowe shall come kynges eares come therfore let v take counsel togyther sent vnto hym saynge suche thyngꝭ done thou sayst thou faynest thyne owne herte mynded make v afrayde sayenge shall withdraw theyr handes worke shall fynysshed howbeit strengthed hande came vnto house semaia sonne delata son mehetabeel shut hym selfe within sayde let v come togyther house god euen vnto myddes temple shut dores temple wyll come sley yea euen nyght wyll come put death sayd shulde suche man flee beynge wyll go temple saue lyfe wyll go perceyued god sent hym yet spake prophecie vpō neuerthelesse tobiah sanabalat hyred hym money therfore toke money feare shulde syn myght haue euyll reporte blaspheme god thynke thou vpō tobiah sanabalat accordynge vnto theyr workes prophet noadia prophettes wolde haue put feare wall fynysshed fyue twentye daye moneth elul two fyftye dayes enemyes herde therof al hethen aboute v afrayde theyr courage fayled perceyued worke came god tyme many cheyfe iuda whose letter wente vnto tobiah agayne tobiah vnto many iuda sworne vnto hym sonne lawe sechania sonne arah sonne iehonathan doughter mesullam sonne barachia spake good hym tolde hym wordes▪ tobiah sent letter put feare ¶ walle buylded watche appoynted returned captiuyte nombred capi vii nowe whē wall buylded hanged dores also porter syngers leuites appoynted cōmaunded brother hanani hanama ruler castel ierusalem faythfull man feared god dyd many sayd vnto let gate ierusalem opened vntyll sonne hote whyle standynge watche shut dores barred appoynted certayne citysens ierusalem watche men euery one kepe watche euery one ouer agaynst house citye large rowme great people fewe therin house buylded god gaue herte gathered togyther principal men offycers people nombre found register nombre • e • • 〈◊〉 • whiche came vp captiuite founde wrytten therin sonnes lande belsam mesperath beguai nahum baanah nombre men people israell chyldren pharos two thousande hundred seuentye two chyldren sephatiah thre hundred seuentye two chyldren arah syxe hundred fyftie two chyldren captayne moab among chyldren iesua ioab two thousande eyght hundred eyghtene chyldren elam thousande two hundred fyftye foure chyldren zathua eyght hundred fyue fourtye chyldren zachai seuen hundred thre score chyldren banu • syxe hundred eyght fourtye chyldren bebat syxe hundred eyght twentye child asgad two thousande thre hundred two twentye chyldren adonicam syxe hundred thre score seuen chyldren begoai two thousand thre score seuen chyldren adin syxe hundred fyue fyftye chyldren aser hezekia nyntye eyght chyldren hasom thre hundred eyght twenty child bezai thre hundred foure twentye chyldren hariph hundred twelue chyldren gibeon nyntye fyue men bethleem nethophah hundred foure score eyght men anathoth hundred eyght twentye men beth asmaneth two fourtye men karioth iarim seruauntꝭ thre hundred ixxxxii wente vp also thel mela thel harsa cherub adon immer coulde shew theyr father house theyr seed israel chyldren dalaiah chyldren tobia chyldren nocoda syxe hundred two fourtye preestes chyldren habaiah chyldren hacos chyldren bersilai whiche toke one doughters bersilai gileadite wyfe named theyr name sought theyr wrytyng register theyr generacion founde therfore put preesthode hathirsata sayd vnto shuld eate moost holy tyll came vp preest whiche shulde weare urim thumim hole congregacyon togyther two fourtye thousande thre hundred thre score besyde theyr seruauntes maydes seuen thousand thre hundred seuen thyrty two hundred seuen fourtie syngyng men woman theyr horse seuen hūdred syxe thyrtye theyr mule two hundred fyue fourtie camel foure hundred fyue thyrtye syxe thousande seuen hundred twentye ass certayne auncient father gaue vnto worke hathirsatha gaue treasure thousand peces golde fyftye basens fyue hundred thyrtye preestes garmentes cheyfe father gaue vnto treasure worke xx thousande peces golde two thousande two hundred pounde syluer people gaue twentye thousand peces golde two thousande pounde syluer thre score seuen preestes garmentes preestes leuites porter syngers people nethmims israell dwelte theyr cityes seuenth moneth came chyldren israell theyr cityes ¶ esdras gathereth people togyther redeth lawe kepe feast tabernacle bothes capi viii ✚ esdr iii • 3 esdr li • • people gathered selues togyther one mā strete water gate sayde vnto esdras scribe shulde fetche deute 〈◊〉 • 4 ro 23 • boke law moses lorde cōmaunded israel esdras preest brought lawe congregacyon bothe men woman coulde vnderstande dyd herken vnto vpon fyrste daye seuenth moneth red therin strete water gate mornynge vntyll noone daye men woman dyd herken eares people enclyned vnto boke lawe esdras scribe stode vpon hyghe pulpyt wood made preachynge besyde hym stode mathathia sema anania uriah helkia maasia ryght hande lefte hande stode pedaia misael malchia hasum hasebadana zachary mesulam esdras opened boke people stode aboue people opened people stode vp esdras praysed lorde great god people answered amen amen theyr handꝭ vp bowed themselues worshypped lorde fallynge downe vpon theyr face grounde iesua baam serabiah iamin acub sebathai hodaia maasia celita azaria iozabad hanan pelaia leuites caused people gyue hede vnto lawe people stode theyr place red boke lawe god distynctly playnly men vnderstode thynge red nehemiah whiche hathirsatha esdras preest scribe leuites caused people take hede sayd vnto al people day holy vnto lorde god ye sory wepe al people wepte herde wordes lawe sayd vnto • esdr ix g go waye eate fat drynke swete sende parte vnto also haue prepared selues day holy vnto lord ye sory therfore ioy lorde strength ⊢ leuites stylled people sayd holde peace day holy vexe ye selues al people went theyr way eate drynke sende parte vnto make great myrth bycause vnderstande wordes declared vnto nexte day gathered togyther cheyfe father amonge people preestes leuites vnto esdras scribe myght vnderstande wordes law founde wrytten law 〈…〉 23 f ••• 29 b 〈◊〉 mata c lorde cōmaunded moses chyldren israell shulde dwell bothes feast seuenth moneth shulde cause declared proclamed theyr cityes thorowout ierusalem sayenge go forth vnto mount fetche olyue braunches pyne braunches myrte braunches palme braūches braunches thicke tree make bothes wrytten people went forth fet made bothes euery one vpon rofe house theyr courtes courtes house god strete water gate strete porte ephraim congregacion come agayne captiuyte made bothes sat vnder bothes synce tyme iosua son nun vnto day chyldren israel done great gladnesse euery day fyrst day vnto laste red esdras boke lawe god seuen dayes helde feast eyght day gatheryng togyther accordynge vnto maner ¶ people repent forsake theyr straung wyues esdras recyteth benefytes god synnes people capi ix foure twentye daye moneth came chyldren israel togyther agayne esdra 8 eccle 58 fastyng sacke clothes earth vpon seede israell separated straunge chyldren stode knowledged theyr synnes wyckednesse theyr father stode vp theyr place red boke lawe lorde theyr god foure tymes day knowledged worshypped lorde theyr god iiii tymes day leuites stode hygh namely iesua ban cadmiel sabaniah buni sarebiah ban chanani creyed loude vnto lorde theyr god leuites iesua cadmiel ban hasabnia serebia hodia sebania phathahia sayd stande vp prayse lorde god euer let thankes gyuen vnto name thy glorye excelleth thankes gyuynge prayse thou arte lorde alone thou hast made heuen heuen heuens theyr hoost earth thyngs therin see therin thou preseruest hoost heuen worshyppeth thou arte lorde god hast chosen abram broughtest hym gene xl ur chaldea gen 17 • calledst hym abraham foundest herte faythfull gene xv madest couenaunte hym gyue vnto seede lande cananites hethites amorites pheresites iebusytes gersites hast made good thy wordes thou arte ryghteous exodi iii • hast consydered mysery father egypte herde theyr complaynte reed see shewed token wonder vpon pharao al seruauntes people lande thou knewest presumptuous cruell agaynst madest thou name day reed see dydest thou deuyde sundre went thorowe myddes see drye shod theyr persecutours threwest thou depe stone myghty water ledst day tyme cloudy pyller nyght season pyller fyre shewe lyght way went exod xix • thou camest downe also vpō mount sinay spakest vnto heuen gauest ryght iudgementes true lawes good cōmaundementes statute declaredst vnto thy holy sabboth cōmaundedst preceptes ordinaunces lawes hande moses thy seruaunt exodi 16 gauest breade heuen hongrye exod 17 num 25 b broughtest forthe water oute rocke thyrstye promysedst shulde go take possession lande ouer thou haddest lyft vp thyne hande gyue oure father proude harde necked folowed cōmaundementes wolde obey neyther myndfull wonder thou dyddest became obstynate headye moche turned backe theyr bondage theyr disobedience thou god forgauest wast gracious mercyfull pacient great goodnesse forsokest exodi 32 though made molten calfe sayd thy god brought lande egypte dyd great blasphemyes yet forsokest thou wyldernesse accordynge thy great mercy exod xiii num 14 c corin x cloudy pyller departed daye tyme leade awaye neyther pyller fyre nyght season shew lyght way went thou gauest thy good spirite enforme exodi 16 withheldest thy manna theyr mouth exodi 17 nume xx b gauest water thyrstye fourtye yeres long madest thou prouision wylder nesse lacked nothyng deute 8 b xix • theyr clothes waxed olde theyr feete swelled thou gauest kyngdomes nacions partedst accordyng theyr porcions possessed nume xxi • lande sehon kynge hesbon lande og kynge basan theyr chyldren multipliedst thou sterres heuen broughtest lande wherof thou haddest spoken vnto theyr father shulde go haue possessyon chyldren went possessed lande iesua ii iii iiii thou subduedst enhabitours lande euen cananitꝭ gauest theyr hande theyr kyngꝭ people lande myght wolde wan theyr strong cityes fat lande toke possessyon house full maner goodes welles dygged vyneyardes oyle garden many fruytfull tree dyd eate fylled became fat lyued welthe thorowe thy great goodnesse neuerthelesse disobedient rebelled agaynste cast thy lawe behynde theyr backes 3 reg 19 • slue thy prophettes exhorted ernestly myght bryng agayn vnto dyd great blasphemyes therfore thou gauest ouer hande theyr enemyes vexed tyme theyr trouble cryed vnto thou herdest heuen thorowe thy great mercy thou gauest ☞ sauiours whiche helped hande theyr enemyes came rest turned backe agayne euyll therfore leftest thou hande theyr enemyes dominion ouer conuerted cryed vnto thou herdest heuen many tymes hast thou delyuered accordynge thy great mercy testifiedst vnto thou myghtest bryng agayne vnto thy law notwithstandyng proud herkened vnto thy cōmaundmentes synned thy lawes leuiti 〈◊〉 • ezech xx b rom x • galat iii • whiche yf man shall lyue turned shoulder away styffe necked wolde heare many yeres dyddest thou forbere testifiedst vnto thorowe thy spirite euen hande thy prophettꝭ yet wolde heare therfore gauest thou hande nacions landes thy great mercyes sake thou hast vtterly cōsumed neyther forsaken thou arte gracious mercyfull god ii esdr exodi 〈◊〉 • 34 • nowe therfore god thou great god myghtye terrible thou kepest couenaunt mercy regarde lytell trauayle hath happened vnto v kynges prynces oure preestes oure prophettes father thy people synce tyme kynges assur vnto day truely thou arte iust thou haste broughte vpon v thou haste done ryght v haue ben vngodly kynges prynces preestꝭ father haue done thy law regarded thy cōmaundementes thy earnest exhortacions wherwith thou hast exhorted haue serued theyr kyngdome thy great goodꝭ thou gauest large plenteous lande whiche thou gauest haue conuerted theyr wycked workes beholde bondage day lande thou gauest vnto father enioy fruytes goodes therof beholde bonde men great encrease vnto kynges thou hast set ouer v bycause synnes haue dominion ouer oure bodyes cattell euen wyll selues great trouble al make sure couenaunt wryte oure prynces leuites preestes seale vnto ¶ name sealed couenaunte bytwene god peope capi x sealer nehemiah hathirsatha son hachaliah zedekia saraia azariah ieremy phashur amaria malchia hatus sebaniah malluch harim merimoth obadia daniel ienthon baruch mesulā abia miamin maasia belgai semeia preestes leuites iesua son azania benui amonge chyldren henadad cadmiel theyr brother sechania hodia celita pelaia hanan micha rehob hasabiah sachur serebia sabania hodia ban beninu heades peple phares captayne moab elam zathu ban boni asgad bebai adonia begoai adin ater hezekia asur hodia hasum bezai harip anathoth nebai magphias mesulam hesir mesesabell zadoc iaddua phalatia hanan anaia hosea hanania hasub halohes phaleha sobek rehum hasebna maasia ahia hanan anan malluch harim baana people preestes leuitꝭ porter syngers nethinims separated selues people landes vnto lawe god theyr wyues theyr sonnes theyr doughters many coulde vnderstande theyr lordꝭ rule receyued theyr brother re 24 f • ard • came attonement reconcyle israel withall busynes house oure god cast lot amonge preestꝭ leuites people offerynge wood brought vnto house oure god yere yere house father myght brent tymes appoynted vpon aulters lorde god wrytten lawe bryng fyrstlynges lande fyrstlynges fruytes al tree yere yere vnto house lorde fyrstlynges sonnes cattel wrytten lawe fyrstlynges ox shepe whiche shulde bryng house god vnto prestes ministre house god shulde bryng fyrstlynges oure dough heueoffrynges fruytes maner tree wyne also oyle vnto preestes chystes house god tythes lande vnto leuites leuites myght haue tythes cityes ministracyon preest sonne aaron shal leuites haue also tythes leuites leuites shall bryng vp tithe theyr tithe vnto house oure god store house treasure house chyldren israel chyldren leui shall bryng vp heueoffryngꝭ corne wyne oyle vnto store house vessel sanctuary preestꝭ minystre porter syngers forsake house oure god ¶ dwelled ierusalem buylded cityes iuda capi xi ruler people dwelte ierusalem people also cast iottes among ten one parte shuld go ierusalem holy citye dwel nyne partes cityes people thanked al mē wyllyng dwell ierusalem heades lande dwelte ierusalem cityes iuda euery one possession theyr cityes israel preestꝭ leuites nethinims chyldren salomon seruauntes ierusalem dwelte certayne chyldren iuda ben iamin chyldren iuda athaia sonne usia sonne zachary sonne amaria sonne sephatia sonne mahalaleel chyldren phares maasia son baruch son chal hose sonne hasaia sonne adaia sonne ioiarib son zachari son •• oni chyldren phares dwelte ierusalem euen foure c thre score eyght valyaunt mē chyldren beniamin sallu sonne mesullam sonne ioed sonne pedaia sonne colaia son masia sonne ithiel sonne isai hym gabai selai nyne hundred eyght twentye ioel sonne zichri iuda euery one enheritaunce nethinims dwelte ophel ziba gispa set ouer nethinims ouerseer leuites ierusalem ust son baani son hasabia son mathania son micha chyldren asaph syngers aboute busynes house god kynges cōmaundement concernynge syngers shulde deale faythfully euery day accordyng pathaia sonne mesebabel chyldren zerah son iuda nexte kyng matter concernyng people theyr village landes sūme chyldren iuda without townes theyr lande dwelte kariath atbe village therof didon village therof iecabzeel village therof iesua moladah bethphalet towne sual beer seba theyr village sikelag moconah theyr village enremon zarah ierimuth zonoa odollam theyr vyllages lachis feldes therof aseka village therof dwelte bersabe vnto valley hinnom chyldren also beniamin geba dwelte machmas aia bethel aboute watch iesua begat ioakim ioakim also begat eliasib eliasib begat ioiada ioiada begat ionathan ionathā begat iadua dayes ioakim cheyfe father amonge preestes vnder saraia maraia vnder ieremy hasabia serebia iesua son cadmiel theyr brother theyr presence gyue prayse thankes accordynge dauid man god ordeyned one watch ouer agaynst another mathania balbukia obadia mesullam talmon abub porter gladnesse thankꝭ geuynge syngyng cymbal psaltries harpes chyldren syngers gathered selues togyther frō euery syde playne countrey aboute ierusalem vyllages netho phathi house gilgall coūtreyes geba asmaueth syngers buylded vyllages roūde ierusalem preestes leuites purified clensed people gate walle brought prynces iuda vp vpon walle appoynted two greate queer men gyue thankes whiche went ryght hande wall towarde donggate went hosaia halfe prynces iuda asaria esdras mesullam iuda beniamin semeia ieremy certayne preestꝭ chyldren trompettes namelye zachary sonne ionathan son semeia son mathania son michaia sonne zacur son asaph brother semeia asaraell melalai gilalai maai nathanael iuda hanani musicall instrumentes dauid man god esdras scryhe wente besyde welgate went vp ouer agaynst vpon steppe citye dauid goynge vp wall beyonde house dauid vnto watergate east warde queer gaue thankꝭ went ouer agaynst halfe parte people vpon walle beyonde fornace gate vntyll brode wall beyonde porte ephraim beyonde oldgate beyonde fyshgate towre hananeel towre mea vntyll shepegate stode styl pryson gate stode two queer gaue thankes house god halfe ruler preestes namely eliakim maasia minsamin michaia elioenai zachary hanania trompettes maasia semeia eleasar u • si iehohanan melchiah elam ser syngers sange loude hauyng iesta hiad theyr ouerseer daye offered greate sacrifyces reioysed god gyuen great gladnesse wyues chyldren ioyfull myrth ierusalem herde far tyme men appoynted ouer treasure house wherin heueofferynges fyrstlyngꝭ tythes shuld gather feldꝭ cityes destribute vnto preestꝭ leuites accordyng lawe iuda glad preestes leuites stode wayted vpon offyce theyr god pure offyce syngers porter stode cōmaundement dauid salomon son pa • • 3 • tyme dauid asaph cheyfe syngers founded songes prayse thankes geuyng vnto god tyme zorobabel nehemia dyd israell gyue porcyons vnto syngers porter euerye day porcyon gaue tythes vnto leuites leuitꝭ gaue tythes agayne vnto chyldren aaron ¶ lawe red haue herde ii seperate straungers capi xiii daye dyd rede boke moses peple herkened therto founde wrytten therin deut 24 • ammonytes moabites shulde neuer come congregacyon god bycause met chyldren israell breade water num 23 • ▪ hyred balaam agaynst shulde curse god turned curse blessynge nowe herde lawe fortuned separated israell euery one myxte hym selfe therin preest eliasib ouersyght treasury house god kynsman vnto tobia made hym greate chambre tyme layed offerynges frankensence vessell tythes corne wyne oyle accordynge cōmaundement gyuen leuites syngers porter heue offeryngꝭ preestes al tyme ierusalem xxxii yere arthaxerses kyng babilon came vnto kynge certayn dayes opteyned licence kynge come ierusalem gatte knowledge euyll eliasib dyd vnto tobia made hym chambre courte house god greued sore cast forth vessel house tobia chambre cōmaunded clense chamber thyther brought agayne vessel house god meat offerynge insence perceyued porcyons leuites gyuen euery one •• ed land euen leuites syngers executed worke reproued ruler sayd house god forsaken gathered togyther set theyr place brought iuda tythes corne wyne oyle vnto treasure made treasurer ouer treasure euen selemiah preest zadoc scrybe leuites phadaia vnder theyr hande hanan son zacur son mathanta coūted faythful theyr offyce dystrybute porcyons vnto theyr brother • e • ra v • thynke vpon god herein wype mercy haue shewed house god offyces therof tyme sawe treadynge wyne press sabboth bryngyng sheaues ass laden wyne grape fygges bryngynge al maner burthen vnto ierusalem vpon sabboth daye rebuked earnestly daye solde vyttayles dwelt men tire also therin brought fyshe maner ware solde sabboth vnto chyldren iuda ierusalem reproued ruler iuda sayde vnto euyll thynge ye breake sabboth daye dyd father euen thus oure god brought plage vpon v vpon citye ye make wrath yet vpon israell ye breake sabboth fortuned porter ierusalem began darke euenynge sabboth cōmaunded shut gate charged shulde opened tyll sabboth seruaūtes set gate shuld burthen brought sabboth day remayned chapman merchauntes twyce ouer nyght without ierusalem maner ware reproued sore sayd vnto tary ye nyght aboute wall yf ye agayne wyll laye handes vpon tyme forth came sabboth sayde vnto leuites shulde clense selues shulde come kepe gate halowe sabboth daye thynke vpon god concernyng also spare accordynge thy great mercy tyme sawe iues maryed wyues asdod ammon moab theyr chyldren spake halfe spech asdod coulde speake iues language tongue myght man perceyue euery people reproued cursed smote certayne men made bare toke othe god ye shall gyue youre doughters vnto theyr sonnes neyther shall ye take theyr doughters vnto sonnꝭ selues dyd salomon kyng israell syn soch yet among many heathen kyng lyke hym deare vnto god god made hym kynge ouer israell yet neuertheles landysh woman caused hym syn shal obeye vnto al great euyl transgresse agaynst god marry straunge wyues one chyldren iehoiada son eliasib hygh preest made contracte sanabalat horonite chaced hym god thynke thou vpon defyle preesthode couenaunt preesthode leuites thus clensed al soch outlandysh appoynted course preestꝭ leuites euery one offyce offer wod tymes appoynted fyrst fruytes thynke thou vpon god best amen ¶ ende seconde boke esdras otherwyse called boke nehemia boke esther ¶ kynge abasu • rn maketh royall feast whereunto quene uasthi wyll come cause • 〈◊〉 deuorsed capi primo fortuned dayes ahasuerus reygned iudia vnto ethiophia ouer hundreth seuen twentie landes euen dayes kynge ahasuerus sat seate royal susan cheyfe citye thyrde yere reygne made feaste vnto prynces seruauntes myghtye men persia medium captaynes also ruler countryes hym shewed rychesse glorye kyngdome gloryous worshyp greatnesse many dayes longe euen hundreth foure score dayes dayes expyred kynge made feast vnto people susan cheyfe citye bothe vnto great small seuen dayes longe court garden kynges place hanged whyte grene yelow clothes fastened cordes fyne sylke purple spluer rynges vpon pyllers marble stone bench also gold syluer made vpon pauement grene whyte yelowe blacke marble dranke vessel golde chaunged vessell vessell kyngꝭ wyne moch accordynge power kynge drynke appoynted noone shulde compell man kynge commaunded offycers house euery one shulde lyked hym quene uasthi made feast also woman palace ahasuerus seuenth daye kyng mery wyne cōmaunded mehuman biztha harbona bigtha abagthan zethar car chas seuen chamberlaynes dyd seruice presence kynge ahasuerus fetch quene uasthi crowne regal kynges presence might shew people prynces fayrnesse beautyfull quene uasthi wolde come kynges worde chamberlaynes kynge wroth indygnacyon kyndled hym kynge spake wyse men vnderstandynge ordynaunces lande kynges matter must handled soch haue knowledge lawe iudgement ❀ cheyfe nexte vnto hym carsena sethar admata si mare marsena mamucan vit prynces persia medium whiche sawe kynges face sat aboue kyngdom lawe sayeth kyng shulde executed vpō quene uasthi bycause dyd accordyng worde kyng ahasuerus cōmaunded chamber laynes memucan answered kynge prynces quene uasthi hath done euyll agaynst kynge also agaynst prynces agaynst peple landes kyng ahasuerus dede quene shall come abrode vnto woman shall despyse theyr husbandes theyr eye shall saye kynge ahasuerus cōmaunded uasthi quene brought wolde come shall princess persia medium say lykewyse vnto kynges prynces heare dede quene thus shall aryse moch despytefulnesse wrath yf please kynge therfore let go cōmaundement hym let wrytten accordyng lawes persian median transgressed uasthi come kyng ahasuerus let kyng gyue kyngdom vnto another better cōmaūdement kynge shall made publysshed thorowout empyre whiche great woman shall holde theyr husbandꝭ honour amonge great small pleased kynge prynces kyng dyd accordyng worde memucan sent letter forth kynges landes euery lande accordynge wrytynge therof euery people theyr language euery man shulde lorde owne house caused spoken language people ¶ quene put away certayne goodly pon •• dau • ▪ sel • searched edissa otherwyse called ••• er pleaseth kynge made quene metdocheus openeth vnto kynge wolde betray hym capi ii actes dyspleasure kynge ahasuerus nowe layde thought vpon uasthi done concluded agaynst sayde kynges seruauntes minystred vnto hym let fayre yong virgyns sought kynge kyng appoynted certayne men landes empyre whome charged shulde brynge togyther fayre yonge virgyns vnto susan heade citye woman buyldyng vnder hand hagei kynges chamberlayne kepte woman gyue theyr apparel ❀ thynges necessarye damsell whiche pleased kynge shulde quene uasthis steade pleased kynge dyd citye susan iue whose name mardocheus sonne iaer son semei son ci man iemini caryed away ierusalē reg 24 c iere 24 • iekonia kyng iuda led away nabuchodonozer kyng babilon caryed thence norysshed hadassa esther vncles doughter neyther father mother fayre beutyful damsel matdocheus father mother deade receyued owne doughter fortuned kynges cō maūdement cōmyssyon publyshed many damsel brought togyther citye susan vnder hand hagei esther brought also vnto kyngꝭ house vnder hande hagei keper woman damsel pleased hym founde fauour syght caused ornamētes gyuen soch thyngꝭ belonged appoynted seuen comly damsel kynges house fauoured bothe gentyll woman syngularly house woman esther shewed peple kynted mardocheus charged shulde tell mardocheus walked euery daye courte woman house myght know esther dyd shulde become appoynted tyme euery damsell came shulde go kyng ahasuerus ben twelue monethes deckynge woman theyr deckynge must haue moch tyme namely syxe monethes balme myrre syxe monethes good spyces woman beautifyed went one damsell vnto kyng whatsoeuer requyred ❀ vvere comely must gyuen go woman buyldynge vnto kynges palace euenyng went morowe agayne seconde house woman abydyng vnder hand saasgas kynges chamberlayne whiche kepte concubynes came vnto kyng excepte pleased kynge haue called name nowe tyme came esther doughter abihan vncle mardocheus whiche receyued owne doughter shuld come kyng desyred nothynge hagei kynges chamberlayne keper woman sayde esther founde fauoure syght loked vpon esther taken vnto kynge ahasuerus house royall tenth moneth whiche moneth december▪ tebeth seuenth yere reygne kyng loued esther aboue woman found grace fauour syght virgin set crowne kyngdome vpon heade made quene steade uasthi kynge made greate feast vnto prynces seruauntes feast bycause esther caused landꝭ quyetnesse gaue gyftes became ryoaltye kynge virgyns gathered togyther seconde tyme mardocheus sat kynges gate yet esther shewed kynred people accordynge mardocheus bydden esther dyd word mardocheus lyke yf ben yet vnder gouernaunce tyme whyle mardocheus sat kynges gate two kyngꝭ chamberlaynes bygthan there kepte dore wroth sought laye theyr handes kynge ahasuerus wherof also mardocheus gat knowledge esther • tolde vnto quene esther esther certifyed kynge therof mardocheus name inquisicion made founde bothe hanged tree wrytten cronicles kynge ¶ haman maridonian eralted obteyned kynge iues shulde put death bycause mardocheus done hym worshyp capi iii actes dyd kynge ahasuerus promote haman son amadatha agagite set hym hygh set seate aboue prynces hym kynges seruaū te kyngꝭ gate bowed theyr knee worshypped haman kyng commaunded concernynge hym mardocheus bowed knee worshypped hym kyngꝭ seruaūtes whiche kynges gate sayde vnto mardocheus transgressest thou kynges commaundement spake thus dayly vnto hym folowed tolde haman myght se howe mardocheus matter wold endure tolde iue haman sawe mardocheus bowed knee vnto hym worshypped hym full indygnacyon thought lyttell laye handes onelye mardocyeus shewed nacyon mardocheus wherfore sought destroy iues thorowout hole empyre ahasuerus nacyon mardocheus fyrst moneth moneth nisan twelfe yere kyng ahasuerus cast phur lot haman daye day moneth moneth twelueth moneth moneth adar haman sayd vnto kyng ahasuerus people scattered abrode dyspersed amonge peple landes thyne empyre haue theyr lawes contrary peple kynges lawes neyther kyngꝭ profet suffre maner please kynge let wrytten may destroyed wyl weye downe ten thousand talentes syluer handes workemen brought kynges treasure kynge toke rynge hande gaue vnto haman son amidatha agagite iues enemye kynge sayde vnto haman let syluer gyuen people pleaseth kynges scrybes called xiii daye fyrst moneth ❀ • e •• nisan wrytten accordynge haman cōmaunded vnto kynges offycers captaynes al landes ruler euery people countryes euery syde accordynge wrytyng euery nacyon theyr language name kynge ahasuerus wrytten sealed kynges rynge wrytyngꝭ sent nostes al kynges landes rote •• kyl destroye iues bothe yonge 〈◊〉 chyldren woman one day namely •• ō thyrtenth daye twelueth moneth whiche moneth 〈…〉 uary adar spoyle theyr goodes summe wrytynge shulde cōmaundement gyuen landes publyshed vnto people shulde redy agaynst daye postes went hast accordynge kynges commaundement susan cheyfe citye cōmaundement deuysed kyng haman sat dranke meane tyme citye susan disquieted ¶ mardocheus gyueth quene knowledge cruell decre • kynge agaynst iues capi iiii mardocheus perceyued done rent clothes put sackecloth asshes went myddes citye cryed loude lamentably came kynges gate myght enter wtin kyngꝭ gate bycause sacke cloth al landes countryes place farre kynges worde cōmaūdement extended greate lamentacyon amonge iues fastynge wepynge mournynge many laye sack clothes asshes esther damsel chamberlaynes came tolde quene excedynly astonyed sent rayment mardocheus shuld put laye sack cloth hym mardocheus wolde take called esther hathath one kynges chamberlaynes whiche stode gaue cōmaundement vnto mardocheus myght know wherfore dyd hathath went forth mardocheus vnto strete citye whiche kynges gate mardocheus tolde hym happened vnto hym summe syluer haman promised • kyngꝭ treasury bycause iues yf wolde destroye gaue hym copye kynges cōmaundement deuysed susan destroye myght shewe vnto esther speake charge shulde go kynge make prayer supplycacyon vnto hym people hathath came tolde esther wordes mardocheus agayne esther spake vnto hathath cōmaunded hym saye mardocheus kynges seruauntes people landes kyng know whosoeuer cōmeth courte vnto kynge whyther man woman whiche called commaundement shall dye excepte kynge holde golden scepter vnto hym ❀ token graciousnes shall lyue haue ben called come kynge nowe thyrtye dayes certifyed mardocheus esther wordes mardocheus bad saye agayn vnto esther thynke saue thyne owne lyfe whyle thou art kyngꝭ house iues yf thou holdest thy peace tyme shall iues haue helpe delyueraunce another place thou thy father house shalbe destroyed knoweth whyther thou art come kyngdom cause sake esther bad gyue mardocheus answere go thou thy waye gyther togyther iues founde susan fast ye ye eate drynke thre dayes neyther day nyght damsel wyll fast lykewyse wyll go kynge thynge yet contrarye cōmaundement yf peryshe peryshe mardocheus went way dyd esther cōmaūded hym ¶ esther entreth kynge byddeth hym haman feast haman prepareth galous mardocheus capi v thyrde daye fortuned esther put royall apparell stode courte kynges palace within ouer agaynst kynges house kynge sat vpon royal seat kynꝭ palace ouer agaynst gate house kynge sawe esther quene standynge courte founde grace syght kyng helde golden scepter hand toward esther esther stepte forth touched top scepter sayde kynge vnto wylte thou quene esther requirest thou aske euen halfe empyre shall gyuen esther answered yf please kynge let kynge haman come daye vnto banket haue prepared hym kyng sayd cause haman make hast maye esther hath sayd kynge hamā came banket esther prepared kynge sayde vnto esther banket wyne thy peticyon may gyuen requirest thou yf euen halfe empyre shall done answered esther sayde peticyon desyre yf haue founde grace syght kynge yf please kynge gyue peticyon fulfyl request let kynge haman come banket shall prepare wyll tomorowe kyng hath sayde went haman forth daye ioyfull merye mynde haman sawe mardocheus kynges gate stode vp kneled hym full dygnacyon mardocheus neuerthelesse haman refrayned hym selfe came home sent called frendes zares wyfe haman tolde glory ryches multytude chyldren togyther howe kynge promoted hym greatly howe set hym aboue prynces seruauntes kynge haman sayde moreouer yea esther quene dyd let man come kynge vnto banket prepared excepte tomorowe bydden vnto also kynge satysfyed longe se mardocheus iue syttyng kynges gate sayde zares wyfe frendes vnto hym let make galous fyftye cubytes hygh tomorowe speake thou vnto kyng mardocheus may hanged theron go thou meryly kyng vnto banket haman well content withall caused galous made ¶ kynge turneth ouer cronicles fyndeth fidelite mardocheus confusion haman cōmaundeth mardocheus honoure capi vi nyght coulde kynge slepe cōmaunded brynge cronicles storyes red kynge happened place wrytten howe 〈…〉 • mardocheus tolde bigthana there kynges two chamberlaynes kept thressholdes sought laye handes kynge ahasuerus kyng sayd worshyppe good haue done mardocheus therfore sayde kynges seruauntes minystred vnto hym nothyng done kyng sayde courte haman gone courte without kynges house myght speake vnto kynge hange mardocheus tre prepared hym kynges seruauntes sayde vnto hym behold haman standeth without courte kynge sayd let hym come haman came kynge sayde vnto hym shall done vnto man whome kynge wolde fayne brynge vnto worshyp haman thought hert desyreth kynge brynge vnto worshyp haman answered kynge let man whome kynge pleaseth brynge vnto worshyppe brought hyther may arayed royal garmentes kynge vseth weare horse kyng rydeth vpon crowne royall maye set vpon heade let rayment horse delyuered vnder hande one gyngꝭ prynces maye aray man withal whome kynge disposed brynge honoure cary hym vpon horse thorowe strete citye proclame hym thus shall done man whome
