kynge pleaseth brynge honoure kynge sayde make hast take thou hast sayde rayment horse euen vnto mardocheus iue sytteth kynges gate let nothynge fayle thou haste spoken toke haman rayment horse arayed mordocheus brought hym horsebacke thorowe strete citye proclamed hym euen thus shal done vnto man kyng dysposed honour mardocheus came agayne kynges gate haman gat home al hast mournynge bare headed tolde zares wyfe al frendes euery thyng happened hym sayd wyse men zares wyfe vnto hym yf mardocheus sede iues thou hast begon fall thou shalt preuayle agaynst hym shalte surely fall whyle yet talkyng hym came kynges chamberlaynes caused haman make hast come vn banket esther prepared ¶ quene bydde •• kynge haman agayne prayeth selfe people accuseth haman hanged galous whiche prepared mardocheus capi vii kynge haman came banket quene esther prepared kynge sayd vnto esther seconde daye banket wyne thy peticyon quene esther may gyuen requirest thou yea aske euen halfe empyre shal done esther quene answered sayde haue founde grace thy syght kynge yf please kynge graunt lyfe desyre people peticyons sake solde people destroyed sleyne peryshe wolde god solde bondman bondwoman wolde holde tongue enemye pondreth kynges harme kynge ahasuerus answered sayde vnto quene esther dare presume mynde maner esther sayde enemye aduersary wycked hamā haman excedyngly afrayed kynge quene kynge arose banket wyne displeasure wente palace garden hamā stode vp besought quene esther lyfe saw myscheyfe prepared hym kynge alredy kyng came agayne palace garden place dranke wyne hamā layde hym vpō bed esther sat vpon sayde kynge wyll force quene also house soone worde went kynges mouth ☞ couered haman face harbona one chamberlaynes stode kynge sayd beholde standeth galous haman house fyftye cubytes hygh whiche made mardocheus spake good kynge kynge sayde hange hym theron hanged haman galous made mardocheus kynges wrath pacifyed ¶ death haman mardocheus exalted comfortable wordes sent vnto iues capi viii daye dyd kynge ahasuerus gyue house haman iues enemye vnto quene esther mardocheus came kynge esther tolde howe belonged vnto kynge put fynger rynge taken haman gaue vnto mardocheus esther set mardocheus ouer house haman esther spake yet kynge fell downe fete wepynge besought hym wolde put awaye wyckednesse haman agagite deuyce ymagyned agaynst iues kyng ❀ accordyng maner helde golden scepter towarde esther ❀ vvherby vvas declared token graciousnesse rose esther stode kynge sayde yf please kynge yf haue founde grace syght yf acceptable kynge let wrytten letter deuyce haman sonne hamadatha agagite may called agayne whiche letter wrote destroye iues whiche kynges landes howe suffer se euyll shall happen vnto people loke vpon destruccyon kynred kyng ahasuerus sayd vnto quene esther mardocheus iue behold haue gyuen esther house haman whome haue hanged vpon tree bycause layde hande vpon iues wryte ye also iues lyketh kynges name seale kynges rynge wrytynges wrytten kyngꝭ name sealed kynges rynge durst man dysanull kynges scrybes called tyme euen thyrde moneth monethma • e siuan thre twentyeth daye wrytten accordynge mardocheus cōmaūded vnto iues prynces debityes captaynes landes whiche india vntyll ethiopia namely hundred seuen twentye landes vnto euery one accordynge wrytynge therof vnto euery people theyr speche iues accordynge theyr wrytyng language wrote kynge ahasuerus name sealed kynges rynge postes roode vpon horse swyfte yonge mule sent wrytynges wherin kynge graunted iues cityes soeuer gather selues togyther stande theyr lyfe rote sley destroye power people lande wolde trouble chyldren woman spoyle theyr good vpon one daye landes kynge ahasuerus namely vpon thyrtenth daye twelueth moneth whiche moneth february adar sūme wrytyng shulde cōmaundement gyuen landes publysshed amonge people iues shulde redye agaynst day auenge themselues theyr enemyes postes rode vpon swyfte horse mule made hast spede execute kynges worde cōmaundement deuysed susan cheyfe citye mardocheus went ❀ palace kyng royal apparell yelowe whyte great crowne golde beynge arayed garment sylke purple citye susan reioysed gladde vnto iues come ❀ nevv lyght gladnesse ioye worshyp landes cityes place soeuer kynges worde cōmaundement reached ioye myrth prosperyte good dayes amonge iues moche many people land became iues bylefe feare iues came vpon ¶ cōmaundement kynge iues put theyr aduersaryes death sonnes haman hanged iues kepe feast daye remembraunce theyr delyueraunce capi ix twelueth moneth moneth adar vpon thyrtenth daye kynges worde cōmaū demente shulde done euen vpon daye enemyes shuld haue destroyed iues haue oppressed turned contrary wyse euen iues shuld sub due theyr enemyes gathered iues togyther theyr cityes within landes kynge ahasuerus laye hande soche wolde euyll man coulde withstande feare come ouer people ruler landes prynces debityes offycers kynge promoted iues feare mardocheus came vpō mardocheus greate kynges house reporte hym noysed landes howe increased grewe thus iues smote theyr enemyes sore slaughter slue destroyed dyd theyr wyll vnto soche theyr aduersaryes susan cheyfe citye slue iues destroyed fyue hundreth men slue pharsandatha dalphō asphatha poratha adalia aridatha pharmastha arisai aridai uaizatha ten sonnes haman sonne hamadatha enemye iues goodes layde handes tyme kynge certyfyed nombre sleyne citye susan kynge sayde vnto quene esther iues haue sleyne destroyed fyue hundreth men citye susan ten sonnes haman haue done thynkest thou landes kynge thy peticion maye gyuen requyrest thou done esther answered please kyng let hym suffer iues morowe also accordyng vnto dayes cōmaundement maye hange haman ten sonnes vpon tre kyng charged cōmaundement deuysed susan hanged haman ten sonnes iues susan gathered selues togither vpon fourtenth day moneth adar slue thre hundred men susan theyr goodes layde handes iues kynges landes came togyther stode theyr lyues myght haue rest theyr enemyes slue theyr enemyes fyue seuentye thousande howbeit layde hande theyr goodes dyd thyrtenth day moneth adar fourtenth daye moneth rested whiche day helde feastynge gladnesse iues susan came togyther thyrtenth day fourtenth fyftenth day rested helde daye feastynge gladnesse therfore iues dwelte village vnwalled townes helde fourtenth day moneth adar gladnesse feastynge kepte holy day euery one sent gyftes vnto mardocheus wrote actes sent wrytynges vnto iues landes kynge ahasuerus nygh farre shulde make lawe among themselues holde fourtenth fyftenth day moneth adar dayes wherin iues came rest theyr enemyes moneth wherin theyr payne turned ioye theyr sorowe holy day dayes shulde make feastes gladnesse one sende gyftes vnto distribute vnto poore iues contente begon mardocheus wrote vnto haman sonne hamadatha iues enemye deuysed agaynst iues howe myght destroy caused cast phur lot put feare brynge nought howe esther went spake kynge thorowe letter wycked deuyce ymagined agaynst iues myght turned vpon owne heade howe sonnes hanged tree whiche cause called day phurim bycause name lot bycause wordes wrytynge selues sene happened vnto iues set vp toke vpon theyr seede vpon suche ioyned themselues vnto wold mysse obserue two dayes yerely accordyng wrytten appoynted dayes forgotten kepte chyldrens chyldren among kynreds landes cityes dayes phurim whiche ouerslypte amonge iues memorial ought peryshe theyr sede quene esther doughter abihail mardocheus iue wrote auctorite confirme seconde wrytynge phurim sent letter vnto iues hundred seuen twentie landes empyre ahasuarus frend • ly faythfull wordes confirme dayes phurim theyr tyme appoynted accordyng mardocheus iue esther quene appoynted bounde theyr soule theyr seede fastynge prayer esther stablysshed wordes lotte wrytten boke kyng ahasuerus layde tribute vpon land vpon iles see dyd power auctorite great worshyp mardocheus whiche kynge gaue hym wrytten cronicles kynges medium persia mardocheus iue seconde nexte vnto kyng ahasuerus great among iues accepted among multitude brother one seketh welthe people speaketh best seede ende boke esther boke iob ¶ iob plaged god losse goodes chyldren capi primo lande gene 22 hus mā whose name iob perfyte iust man suche one feared god exchued euyll seuen sonnes thre doughters iob xiii substaunce also seuen shepe thre camelles fyue c yocke ox fyue c ass greate housholde one principal men among al east countrye sonnes wente made bankettes one daye one house daye sente theyr thre systers eate drynke fortuned passed ouer tyme theyr bankettynge rounde aboute iob sent ☞ sanctified gat vp early offered euery one burntofferyng iob sayde lest peraduenture sonnes haue done offence ☞ haue bene vnthankefull god theyr hertes thus dyd iob euery day vpon day iob ii • ☞ chyldren god came stode lorde fortuned satan come also amonge lorde sayde vnto satan whence comest thou satan answered lorde sayde • p •• v • haue gone aboute lande walked thorowe lorde sayde vnto satan hast thou consydered seruaunt iob none lyke hym lande perfyte iust man suche one feareth god exchueth euyll satan answered sayde vnto lorde doth iob feare god nought hast thou preserued hym house al hath euery syde thou hast blessed workes handes possessyon encreased lande laye thyne hande nowe vpon hym ❀ lytle touche al hath shal curse thy face lorde sayde vnto satan lo hath thy power onely vpon hym selfe se thou lay thyne hande satan went forth presence lorde vpon certayne day fortuned sonnes doughters eatyng drinkyng wyne theyr eldest brother house came messenger vnto iob sayde whyle ox plowynge ass goynge pasture besyde saber came violently toke awaye yea haue sleyne thy seruauntes edge swerde onely ran waye tell whyle yet speakynge came sayde fyre god fallen frō heuen hath brent vp thy shepe seruauntes consumed onely ranne way tell whyle yet speakynge came sayde caldees made thre armyes fell vpon camelles haue caryed awaye yea sleyne thy seruauntes swerde onely gotten awaye tel whyle yet speakyng came sayde thy sonnes thy doughters eatynge drynkynge wyne theyr eldest brother house beholde came myghty great wynde south smote foure corner house whiche fell vpon thy chyldren deade gotten away alone tell iob stode vp rente clothes shaued heade fell downe vpon grounde worshypped sayde ecclesi • • • • vi • naked came mother wombe naked shall turne thyther agayne lorde gaue lorde hath taken away ❀ euen hath pleased lorde come passe blessed name lorde iob ii • thynges dyd iob offende murmured folysshly agaynst god ¶ iob plaged sore byles afterwards mocked wyfe frendes vispt hym haue cōmpassyon hym capi ii chyldren god came stode lorde satan came also amonge stode lorde lorde sayde vnto satan frome whence comest thou satan answered lorde sayde haue gone aboute lande walked thorowe lorde sayde vnto satan hast thou consydered seruaunt iob▪ none lyke hym lande perfyte iust man suche one feareth god exchueth euyl contynueth styll godlynesse thou mouedst agaynst hym shulde punysshe hym nought • answered lorde sayde skynne skynne yea man wyll gyue euer hath lyfe laye thyne hande nowe vpon hym touche bon • flesshe shall curse thy face lorde sayde vnto satan lo haste thou hym thy power spare lyfe went satan forth presence lorde smote iob merueylous sore byles sole foote vnto crowne sat vpon grounde asshes scraped fylthe sore pot sharde sayde wyfe vnto hym 〈…〉 ii 〈◊〉 • iii doest thou contynue yet thy perfytenesse curse god dye iob sayde vnto thou speakest lyke folysshe woman shal receyue prosperite hand god receyue aduersyte iob thynges dyd iob synne lyppes nowe iobs frendes herde trouble happened vnto hym came thre euery one owne place namely eliphas themanite bildad suhite zophad naamathite agreed togyther come shewe theyr compassyon vpon hym conforte hym lyfte vp theyr eye farre knewe hym cryed wepte euery one rente clothes sprynkeled dust vpon theyr heades ayre sat downe hym also vpon grounde seuen dayes vii nyghtes neyther spake one worde vnto hym sawe payne great ¶ wordes iob wherin declareth present lyfe miserable death ryghteous ioyous • • unable capi iii opened iob mouth ☞ cursed day iob answered sayd lost day wherin borne nyght whiche sayd man chylde conceyued day turned darkenesse regarded god aboue neyther let shyne vpon lyght let stayned darkenesse shadowe death let dymme cloude fall vpon let • apped sorowe daye tyme let darke storme ouercome nyght let ioyned vnto dayes yere counted monethes desolate nyght without gladnesse let curse daye redye rayse vp mournynge gyue also theyr curse let sterres night dymme thorow darknesse let loke lyghte let se none neyther ❀ rysynge vp fayre mornynge bycause shut vp wombe bare shulde sorowes haue bene hyd fro myne eye ala 〈…〉 xx dyed byrth dyd perysshe soone came oute mother wombe set vpon theyr knee gaue sucke theyr brestes shuld nowe haue lyen styll shulde haue slepte bene rest lyke kynges lordes earth haue buylded selues specyal place prynces haue greate substaunce golde theyr house full syluer hyd thynge borne tyme eyther yonge chyldren whiche neuer sawe lyght ☞ must wycked ceasse theyr tyranny ouerlaboured rest let free haue bene pryson heare voyce oppressoure small great seruaunt free mayster wherfore lyght gyuen hym miserye lyfe vnto haue heuy hertes long death though come ☞ wolde dyg hyd place whiche also wolde excedyng glad reioyce yf coulde fynde theyr graue anywhere shuld ioy mā ☞ whose waye hyd god kepeth backe hym syghes come eate rorynges fall lyke water thynge feared come vpon thynge afrayde happened vnto happy quyetnesse rest nowe cometh suche misery vpon ¶ iob • reprehended impatience iustice 〈◊〉 presumptyon owne ryghteousnesse capi iiii eliphas themanite answered sayde begyn comen v • th wylte thou discontent withholde hym selfe speakynge beholde thou hast bene chastenet many hast conforted wery handes thy wordꝭ haue set vp fallen thou hast refresshed weyke knee nowe plage come vpon thou arte greued nowe hath touched thy selfe thou arte faynt herted • ob • ii iob ii c ☞ thy feare thy stedfastnesse thy pacience perfytenesse thy wayes consydre praye euer perysshed beyng innocent godly destroyed haue proued experience plowe iniquitie galat vi sowe wretchednesse reape blaste god perysshe breth nose thyrles consumed awaye rorynge lyon voyce lyon teeth lyon whelpes pulled lyon peryssheth lacke praye lyon whelpes scattered abrode vnto came worde secretly myne eare hath receyued lytell therof thoughtes vision nyght whē slepe cometh men fere came vpon drede whiche made bone shake wynde passed presence made heeres flesshe stande vp stode knewe face ymage myne eye stylnes herde voyce ☞ iob xxv psal 143 rom iii • shall man iust god shall man purer maker beholde ☞ founde trueth seruauntes • p •• ii b angel folye howe moche dwell house clay whose foundacyon dust shalbe consumed moth shall smytten frome mornyng vnto euenyng yea shal peryshe euer mā thynketh theron theyr royaltye gone away shall dye truely wysdome ¶ • ude foole ryghteousnes god lorde chasteneth deliuereth agayne capi v crye pray yf happly wyll answere loke thou vpon holy men folysshe mā displeasure kylleth hym angre sleyeth ygnoraunt psal 37 • haue sene selfe folyshe depe roted sodeynly ☞ cursed habitacion chyldren wt prosperite sleyne gate man delyuer deut • 8 • haruest eaten vp hungrie weaponed man spoyled thurstye dranke vp theyr laboure earth bryngeth forth iniquite neyther cometh sorow groūde ☞ man borne vnto labour lyke sparkes flye vp hote cole wyll aske counsell lorde wyl talke god doth thynges vnsearcheable meruayles withoute nombre deut 28 b gyueth rayne vpon earth poureth water vpon stretes ecclesi • b set vp low degre heuynes may come prosperite destroyeth deuyses subtyle theyr handꝭ able performe stedfast thyng • r • gū ii c compasseth wyse theyr owne craftynesse ouerthroweth counsel wycked moche run indeut 28 darkenes fayre day • corin 3 • grope noone day lyke nyght shall delyuer poore swerde threatenynges vngodly vyolence myghtye hope poore mouthe wycked shalbe stopped beholde heb 〈◊〉 〈◊〉 apo • iii proue▪ iii b happy man god punyssheth therfore refuse thou chastenyng almyghtye see vi • though make wounde gyueth plaster though smyte hande maketh hole agayne ☞ shall delyuer syxe trouble seuenth shal none euyll come hunger shall saue deathe warre power swerde thou shalte kepte euyl tougue trouble cometh thou shalte nede feare destruccyon derth thou shalt mery psal 91 • shalte afrayde beastꝭ earth ☞ stone lande shall confederate beastes felde shall gyue peace thou shalte knowe thy dwellynge place shall rest thou shalte go beholde thy habitacion shalte synne thou shalt se also thy sede shall encreace thy posterite shall grasse vpon earth thou shalte come also thy graue fayre age lyke take vp corne sheafe due season lo oure selues haue proued experience euen thus herken thou also thou mayste take hede thy selfe ¶ iob answereth payne greuous faute yet notwithstandynge delyteth therin capi vi iob answered also sayde ☞ dyspleasure haue truely weyed punysshment layde balaunces togyther heuyer thē sande see cause wordes sorowfull arowes almyghtie rounde whose indignacyon hath dronke vp spirite terrible feares god set agaynst amos iii • doth wylde asse rore hathe grasse cryeth oxe hath fodder ynough whiche vnsauerye shall eaten without salte taste whyte egge thyngꝭ sometyme myght awaye withall nowe meate sorowe myght haue desyre god wolde graunte thynge longe god wolde begynne smyte wolde let hande go take cleane awaye shuld haue cōforte yea wolde desyre hym payne shulde spare wyl agaynst wordes holy one power haue endure myne ende soule myghte pacient strengthe strengthe stone flesshe made brasse helpe substaunce taken tribulacyon ought conforted neyghbour feare lord cleane away myne owne brother passe ouer water broke ryuer water doth hastely go away fere horye frost snowe shall fall vpon theyr tyme cometh shalbe destroyed perysshe set fyre shall remoued theyr place pathes go croked haste vayne thyngꝭ shal perysshe turne pathes theman wayes saba wherin haue put theyr trust confounded put confidence come obteyne thynges loke brought confusyon euen ye also come vnto ye se miserye ye afrayde dyd desyre brynge vnto gyue substaunce delyuer enemyes hande saue frome hande tyrauntes teache wyll holde tongue arre shewe wherin howe stedfast wordes trueth whiche rebuke reproue ye take deliberacyon checke mennes sayenges iudge poore worde spoken vayne ye fall vpon fatherlesse go aboute ouerthrowe youre owne frende therfore content loke vpon wyl lye face turne pray indifferent iudges turne agayne ye shall se myne vngyltynesse whyther vnryghteousnesse tongue vayne wordes mouth ¶ iob sheweth lyfe battayle warfare capi vii hath man ❀ certayne tyme vpon earth • sal 39 • dayes also lyke dayes hyred seruaunt like bonde seruaunt desyreth shadowe hyrelyng wolde fayne haue ende worke euen haue laboured hole monethes longe vayne many carefull nyght haue tolde •• u • e 2 • • lay downe slepe say shall aryse agayne longed sore nyght meane tyme full sorowes vntyll twylyght flesshe clothed wormes dust earth skyn wythered become horrible iob 〈◊〉 • xiiii • dayes passe ouer spedely weyuer weyue webb • gone aware remembre lyfe wynd myne eye shall se pleasure therof yea none mannes eye shal se yf thou fasten thyne eye vpon come nought cloud consumed vanysshed away euen goeth downe graue ☞ shall come nomore vp turne agayne house neyther shall place know hym therfore wyll spare mouth wyll speake trouble spirite muse bytternesse mynde see whale fyshe thou kepest pryson saye bed shall comforte shal haue refresshyng talkyng selfe vpon couche danie • • thē troublest thou wt dreames makest afrayde thorow vision soule wysheth rather perysshe dye bone remayne se remedy shall lyue spare dayes vayne man thou hast hym suche reputacion settest moch hym thou visitest hym early euery daye sodeynly doest thou ••• ie▪ ••• • deut • • • trye hym goest thou fro lettest alone ☞ longe tyll may swalowe downe spetle haue offended shall vnto thou preseruer men haste thou made stande thy way heuy burden vnto selfe doest thou forgyue synne wherfore takest thou awaye wyckednesse beholde nowe must slepe dust yf thou seke morowe mornyng shall gone ¶ iob reprehended noted haue • e ••• ned payne descryptyon ypocrisye capi viii answered baldad suhite sayde howe longe wylte thou talke suche thynges howe longe shall thy mouth speake proude wordes doth god peruerte thyng lawfull dothe almyghty destroy thing right seynge thy sonnes synned agaynste hym dyd punyshe theyr wyckednesse thou woldest nowe resorte vnto god tymes make thyne humble prayer almyghtte yf thou woldest lyue pure godly lyfe shulde awake vp vnto immediatly gyue beau tye ryghteousnesse agayne moche wherin soeuer thou haddest lytel thou shuldest haue great aboundaunce enquyre pray haue ben the▪ dente 32 • searche diligently amonge theyr father yesterdaye consydre iob 〈…〉 psal 39 b dayes vpon earth shadowe shal shew tell yea gladly confesse may rysshe grene without moystnes maye grasse growe without water euer shot forth euer gathered withereth herbe euen gothe forget god euen thus also shall ypocrites hope come nought confidence shal destroyed trust shalbe spider web shall leane vpon house shall stande shall holde hym fast yet shall endure euen grene tree sonne shuteth forth braunches garden taketh many rote wel syde moch lyke house stone yf taken place euery man denyeth sayenge knowe • ot lo thus hym reioyseth owne doynges grow earth beholde god wyll cast away vertuous man neyther wyll helpe vngodly thy mouth shall fyll laughynge thy lyppes gladnesse also hate shall confounded dwellynge vngodly shal come nought ¶ iob declareth benefyte • god mannes ryghteousnesse nothynge capi ix iob answered sayde knowe trueth howe may man compared vnto god psal 114 • iob ii • • ix • • xxv rom iii • iustifyed wyll argue hym shall able answere hym vnto one amonge thousande concernynge suche wyse herte myghty instrength euer prospered toke parte agaynst hym translateth mountaynes euer aware ouerthroweth wrath remoueth earth oute place pyllers therof shake withall cōmaundeth sonne ryseth closeth vp sterrꝭ vnder sygnet hym selfe alone spreadeth oute heuens goeth vpon waues see maketh wayne heuen ☞ orion amos v b seuen sterres secret place south great thynges vnserchable yea wonder without nombre lo gothe ouer shal se hym departeth shal loke vpon hym shal perceyue hym hasty take thynge away wyl make hym restore agayn wyl say vnto hym eccle •• • • doest thou •••• • • god whose wrath man may withstand proudest must stoupe vnder hym shulde answere hym wordes shuld fynde agaynst hym yea though righteous yet myght gyue one worde agayn mekely submyt self hym iudge called vpon hym answered ☞ yet wolde byleue herde voyce trou bleth tempest woundeth measure without cause wyll let spirite rest fylleth wt bytternesse men wyl speke strength lo stronge yf men wyll speake ryghteousnesse dare recorde wyll iustifie selfe ☞ myne owne mouth shall condempne wyll put forth selfe perfyte man shal proue wycked doer though innocent conscience cleare yet wery lyfe one thyng therfore sayde destroyeth ryghteous vngodly though sley sodeynly wt scourge yet wyll laugh punysshment innocent worlde gyuen ouer hande wycked shal couer face iudges therof suche one iob 〈…〉 dayes swyfte runner gone haue sene good thyng passed away shyppes good vnder sayle egle flyeth praye purposed forget complaynynge leaue fro wrath conforte selfe afrayde sorowes knowe thou wyite iudge innocent wycked doer labour vayne wasshe selfe snowe water make myne handes neuer cleane ❀ well yet shalte thou dyp myre ☞ myne owne clothes shall defyle must gyue answere vnto go lawe man neyther dayes man laye hande bytwene v let hym take rod away fro yea let hym make afrayde hym shall answere hym without feare long thus make answere ¶ iob • wery lyfe setteth frag • lyte god desy • eth tyme repent dis • typryon death capi x greueth soule lyue wyll make complaynte wyl speake heuynesse soule wyl say vnto god condemne shew cause wherfore thou contendest thynkest thou well done oppresse cast beyng worke thy han de maynteyne counsell vn godly▪ hal • e thou flesshy eye doest thou loke man loketh thy dayes dayes man thy yeres man yeres thou makest suche inquisicion wyckednesse searchest synne notwithstandynge thou knowest wycked persone 〈…〉 32 • man able delyuer oute thyne hande 〈…〉 • • thy handes haue made fassyoned altogyther rounde wylt thou destroy sodeynly remembre beseke thou madest moulde earth shalt brynge dust agayne hast thou turned mylke turned cruddes lyke chese thou haste couered skynne fleshe ioyned togyther hone synnowes thou hast graunted lyfe done good dilygent hede thou tokest vpō hath preserued spiryte thou hast hyd thynges thyne herte sure thou remembrest thyng • dyd syn thou haddest eye vnto shalt declare innocent bycause myn offence • haue done wycked lye wo therfore yf haue done ryghteously yet da • e lyfte vp heade ful cōfusyon se myne owne misery thou huntest beyng heuynesse lyon troublest oute measure thou bryngest freshe wytnesses agaynst thy wrath increasest thou vpon many plage 〈…〉 whefore hast thou brought mother wombe perysshed eye sene caryed graue assoone borne shuld though neuer bene dayes fewe let hym leaue fro let alone maye ease selfe lytell go thyther frome whence shall turne agayne euen lande darkenesse shadowe deathe yea darke cloudy lande deadly shadowe ordre terrible feare darkenesse ¶ iob vn • ustly reprehended sophar god incomprehensyble mercyfull rep •• tou •• capi xi answered sophar naamathite sayde shulde maketh many wordes answered shulde bableth moche cōmended therin sulde men gyue eare vnto onely thou wyite laugh men scorne shal body mocke agayne wylte thou say vnto god thynge take hande perfyte cleane thy syght god wolde speake open lyppes agaynst myght shew secret wysdome rewardeth double appoynted shuldest thou knowe god forgotten bycause thy synne arte thou able fynde secretes god wylt thou atteyne perfitenes almyghtie hygher thē heuen arte thou able deper hel wylte thou know hym length excedeth length earth bredth bredth see though turne al thus ge vpside downe close gather togyther wyll turne hym purpose ❀ vvho maye saye vnto hym vvhy doest thou 〈◊〉 〈…〉 ier • 〈◊〉 • psal vii • rom • • knoweth vanite men seeth theyr wyckednes also shulde consydre vayne body exalteth hym selfe man newe borne lyke wylde ass colte thou dest nowe right hert lyftedst vp thyne handꝭ towarde hym yf thou woldest put away wyckednesse thou hast hande vn godlynesse dwell thy house myghtest thou lyfte vp thy face without shame shuldest thou sure haue nede feare shuldest thou forget thy mysery thynke vpon vpon water runne shulde residue thy lyfe cleare noone day spryng forth mornynge myghtest thou haue cōforte hope thou hast slepe quietly thou art buried shuldest thou take thy rest man make afrayde▪ yea many one shuld set moch eye vngodly shalbe cōsumed scape theyr hope shalbe misery sorowe mynde ¶ iob shewynge perpe • ce declareth myght power god capi xii iob answerd sayd doute yeare men alone wysdome shall perysshe haue vnderstandynge well ye lesse ye yea knoweth thynges thus calleth vpon god god hereth mocked neyghbour godlye innocente man laughed scorne godlynesse lyght despised hertes ryche set stomble vpon house robber welthe prosperite maliciously medle agaynst god dwell withoute care thynges god hath gyuen rychely hande aske cattell shall enfourme fowles ayre shall tel encreace earth shall shewe fysshes see shal certifie knoweth hande lorde made •• p • iii • whose hande soule euery lyuynge thynge breth flesshe men iob 34 • haue eares pleasure hearyng mouth tastyng thyng eateth iob xxxii b among olde persones wysdome age vnderstandynge yea god wysdome strength hath counsayle and▪ fore knowledge beholde breake downe thynge set vp agayne •••• • xii • 〈◊〉 • b ▪ 〈◊〉 • ▪ • shut thynge wyll open beholde yf withholde water drye vp let go destroy earth hym strength end wysdome knoweth deceyuer hym deceyued caryeth away wyse men spoyle bryngeth iudges theyr wyttes taketh away subieccion people theyr kynges gyrdeth theyr loynes bonde leadeth awaye great men captiuite turneth myghtye vpsyde downe ii 〈◊〉 1 • • 〈◊〉 14 • taketh verite mouth disapoynteth aged theyr reason poureth confusyon vpon prynces conforteth haue bene oppressed loke •••• xii 〈◊〉 x • lyeth hyd darkenesse declareth openly verye shadowe deathe bryngeth lyghte bothe encreaseth people destroyeth maketh multiplye dryueth awaye chaungeth hertes rule people earth disapoynteth go wandrynge waye grope darke without lyght maketh also sta • ker fro lyke dronken men ¶ iob reproueth frendes • owne sayenges condemneth ypocrps •• capi xiii lo haue sene myne eye herde myne eare vnderstande loke ye knowe know also neyther inferiour vnto neuerthelesse talke almyghtye desyre comen god ye worke maysters lye vnprofytable 〈…〉 phisicians togyther wolde god ye kepte tongue myght ye taken wyse men nowe heare chydynge pondre sentence lyppes ye speake iniquite agaynst god talke agaynst hym deceyte wyl ye accepte person hym wyll ye contende god shall helpe calleth rekenynge one man mocketh ye mocke hym shall punysshe reproue yf ye secretly accepte persone shall make afrayde whē sheweth hym self shall terrible feare fall vpon remembraunce lyke vnto sparke bodyes lyke claye holde youre tongue sake also may speak • sorowe shall lesse ☞ wherfore beare flesshe ☜ tethe iub • 〈…〉 psal 〈…〉 put soule handes lo though sley yet wyll put trust hym psal 32 〈…〉 luke 〈◊〉 〈…〉 wyl reproue myne owne wayes syght shal make hole maye ypocrite come hym heare wordes pondre sayenges eares beholde nowe haue prepared iudgement know shall founde ryghteous wyll go lawe ❀ let hym come may holde tongue dye neuertheles graunt two thynges wyll hyde selfe withdrawe thyne hande let fearful drede make afrayde call wyll answere el let speake gyue thou answere howe many mysdedes synnes let knowe transgressyons offence wherfore hydest thou thy face holdest thyne enemye wylte thou cruel extreme vnto flyeng leafe • low vpon drye stubble thou layest sharplye charge punysshest psal •• synnes youth iob 33 • thou puttest fete also stockes lokest narowly vnto pathes markest steppe fete notwithstandyng must cō sume lyke fowle caryon clothe moth eaten ¶ iob de • llybe • h lyte 〈…〉 prophesyeth resurre •• yon hope systeyneth godly vntyll obteyne th •• io • e capi xiiii man borne woman hath shorte tyme lyue full miserye cōmeth vp cut downe lyke floure flyeth shadow neuer continueth one state doest thou open thyne eye vpon soche one bryngest thy iudgement make cleane cōmeth vncleane thyng body iob • • 〈…〉 dayes man surely determyned nombre monethes knowen vnto thou haste appoynted hym boundes whiche go beyonde go hym maye rest ❀ lytle vntyll daye come whiche loketh lyke hyrelynge doth yf tre cut downe hope yet wyll sproute shutte forth braunches agayne though rote waxen olde stocke therof deade grounde yet getteth sente water wyl budde brynge forth bowes lyke ire planted man deade perysshed consumed awaye becommeth hym floodes dryed vp ryuers emptye fylled agayne thorowe flowynge water see man slepeth ryseth agayne owne strength 〈…〉 〈◊〉 • 〈…〉 iii b vntyl heuen perysh shal wake vp ryse slepe thou woldest kepe hyde hell vntyll thy wrath stylled appoynt tyme wherin thou myghtest remembre maye deade man lyue agayne 〈…〉 47 b dayes lyfe wyll wayte styll tyll chaungynge shall come thou shalt call shall answere 〈…〉 〈◊〉 b despyse yu worke thyne owne han de nowe thou nōbrest goynges yet thou extreme vpon synnes iniquite sealed vp bag mercyfull vnto wyckednesses moūtaynes fall away last rockes remoued theyr place water pearse thorowe stone lytle lytle floodes washe away grauel earth destroyest thou hope man thou preuaylest styll agaynst hym passeth awaye thou chaungest estate puttest hym whyther chyldren come worshyppe cannot tel yf men lowe degree knoweth whyle lyueth flesshe muste haue trauayle whyle soule hym must sorowe ¶ eliphas reprehendeth iob bycause •• ybeth wysdom purenes hym selfe descrybeth course falleth wyched rekenyng iob one nombre capi xv answered eliphas themanite sayde shal wyse man answere scyence wynde fyl man bely wynde east shall reproue worde nothynge worth speake thynges whiche good shame thou hast set syde el woldest thou make many wordes god thy wyckednesse teacheth thy mouthe thou haste chosen craftye tongue thyne owne mouth condemneth yea thyne owne lyppes shape answere agaynst art thou fyrst man euer borne wast thou made hylles haste thou herde secrete counsayle god wysdom lytle knowest thou knowe vnderstandest thou v bothe olde aged men yea soche haue lyued longer thy father thynkest thou small thynge consolacyons god lyenge worde doth thyne herte wherfore wynkest thou thyne eye thy mynde pufte agaynst god lettest soche wordes go thy mouth man shulde cleane hath whiche borne woman wherby myght ryghtuous iob 〈…〉 • ii 〈…〉 ii • beholde doth truste sayntes yey heuens cleane syght howe moch abhomynable vyle man whiche drynketh wyckednesse lyke water wyll tell heare wyll shewe haue sene wyse men haue told hath bene hyd theyr ☞ father vnto whome onely earth gyuen straunger went amonge gene iii • • vngodly soroweth dayes lyfe woman traueylynge chylde nombre tyrauntes yeres vnknowen fearfull soūde euer eares peace yet feareth destructyon byleueth neuer delyuered darkenesse swerde alway • eye goeth forth get lyuynge seeth playenly day • darkenesse hande sorowe carefulnesse wyll make hym afrayde compasse hym counde aboute lyke ☞ wer • kynge hoost redy battayle hath stretched hande agaynst god armed hym selfe agaynst almygh tye runneth proudly vpon hym styffe necke fyghteth agaynst couereth face fatnesse maketh body well lykynge therfore shall dwellynge desolate cityes house whiche man inhabyteth become heapes stone shall ryche neyther shall substaunce cōtynue encrease vpon earth shal neuer come darkenesse flame shall drye vp braunches blast mouth god shall taken awaye byleueth vanite yet waye vanite shall recōpence shall peryshe tyme worne braunch shall grene shalbe plucked vntymely grape vyne shal let floure fall olyue doth congregacion ypocrytes shall desolate vnfruytfull fyre shall consume house soche gredy receyue gyftes psal vii esai 〈◊〉 conceyueth trauayle beareth vanite theyr body bryngeth forth dysceyte ¶ iob repeatynge miserye sayth suffereth wyckednesse hath deserued capi xvi iob answered sayde haue ofte tymes herde soche thynges myserable gyuers conforte ye al sorte shall thy vayne wordes come yet ende hast thou yet anye saye coulde speake ye also wold god soule soules steade shulde heape vp wordes agaynst shake heade shulde confort mouth release payne talkynge lyppes ❀ vvhat shal wordes sorowe wyll cease though hold tongue yet wyl departe fro nowe god hath sent aduersite thou hast troubled al congregacyon thou hast fylled wrynkles fleshe recorde leanesse ryseth vp agaynst beareth wytnesse agaynst angry hateth gnassheth vpō teethe myne enemye scouleth vpon eye ☞ haue opened theyr mouthes wyde vpon 3 reg 22 math 14 • smytten vpon cheke despytefullye gather selues togyther agaynst god hath put prease vngodly delyuered handes wycked welth hath brought nought hath taken necke hath rent set marke hym selfe archer compasse rounde aboute wounded loynes doth spare bowel hath powred vpon grounde hath gyuen one wounde vpon another fallen vpon lyke gyaunt haue sewed sacke cloth vpon skyn lye heere dust face swollen wepynge myne eye shadowe death howbeit wyckednesse handes prayer cleane earth ☞ couer thou blood let cryenge fynde rowme lo wytnesse heuen knoweth aboue heygth frendꝭ gyue many wordes scorne myne eye powreth teares vnto god body might pleate god one mā doth another yet nombre yeares come waye must go hande whence shall turne agayne ¶ iob sayth consumeth away yet dothe paciently abyde capi xvii breth stynketh dayes shortened harde deathes dore frowarde men myne eye must contynue bytternesse delyuer loke one surely thy syght knoweth wyll promyse thou hast withholden theyr hertes vnderstandynge therfore shalt thou set vp hygh promyseth frendes parte good owne chyldren spende hath made á worde people theyr ioye myne eye dymme heuynesse strength become lyke shadowe uertuous men therfore shall well consyder innocent shall take parte agaynst ypocryte ryghteous also wyll kepe waye hath cleane handes wyll euer stronger stronger turne get hence pray seynge fynde one wyse man amonge dayes past counsayles though te herte vanysshed waye chaun gynge nyght daye lyght darknesse though tary neuer moch yet graue house haue made bed darke call corrupcyon father wormes call mother syster helpeth longe taryenge hath consydered thynge loke fore haue shall go downe pyt lye dust ¶ bildad rehe • seth paynes vnfaythfull wycked capi xviii answered bildad suhite sayde ☞ wyll ye make ende wordes marke well wyll speake wherfore counted beastes reputed vyle youre syght destroyeth hym selfe anger shal earth forsaken stone remoued place bycause yea lyght vngodly shall put oute sparke fyre shall burne lyght shal darke dwellyng candle shal put hym presumptuous goynges kept owne coūsayle shall cast hym downe feete taken net wyttes ende foote shall holden snare shall catch thyrstye bloode snare layed hym grounde pytfall waye fearfulnesse shall make hym afrayde euery syde shall knowe get hunger shalbe strength mysfortune shall hange vpon hym shall eate strength owne skynne euen fyrste borne death shall eate strength hope shall roted dwellyng fearfulnesse shall bryng hym ☞ kyng men shall dwell house shal none brymstone shalbe scattered vpon habytacyon rote shall dryed vp beneth aboue shal braunche cut downe remembraūce shal peryshe earth shall haue name strete shall dryue lyght darkenes caste hym cleane worlde shall neyther haue chyldren kynsfolkꝭ among people posterite dwellynges come hym shall astonyed day go shall aftayde soche nowe dwellynges wycked place hym knoweth god ¶ iob reciteth miseryes grenous payned prophesyeth generall resurreceyon capi xix iob answered sayde howe longe wyl ye vexe soule trouble wordes lo ☞ ten tymes haue ye reproued shamed laugh scorne yf go wronge go wronge selfe yf ye wyll enhaunce selues agaynst accuse wycked person bycause shame come vpon know god hath handled violently hath compassed aboute net yf abacu • c • • complayne violence done vnto herde yf crye sentence gyuen hath hedged vp waye passe hath set darkenesse patthes iob • • 〈◊〉 hath spoyled myne honour taken crowne awaye fro heade hath destroyed euery syde vndone hope hath taken awaye fro tre plucte vp rote wrath kyndled agaynst taketh though enemye ☞ men warre came togyther whiche made theyr waye ouer beseyged dwellynge round aboute psal 38 • hath put brother far awaye fro soche myne acquayntaunce become straūgers vnto psal 〈◊〉 • myne owne kynsfolkes haue saken frendes haue put remembraunce seruauntes maydens myne owne house toke straūger become alyaunt theyr syght called seruaunt gaue answere though prayed hym wt mouth myne owne wyfe myght abyde breth fayne speake fayre chyldren myne owne body yea chyldren despysed gone spake euyll vpon soche mooste familyers abhorred whome loued best turned agaynst bone hangeth skynne flesshe awaye onely lefte skynne teeth haue pyte vpon haue pyte vpon ye frendes hande god hath touched do▪ ye persecute god doth satisfyed fleshe wordes wryten put boke wolde god grauen yron pen leade stone continue sure redemer lyueth shal ryse earth laste daye shall cloched agayne skyn se god flesshe yea selfe shall hold eye raynes consumed within dyd ye saye doth suffer persecucyon theyr founde occasyon beware swerde swerde wyl auenged wyckednesse sure iudgement ¶ sophar sayth vnfaythfull couptou • wycked shall haue shorte ende capi xx answered sophar naamathite sayde cause thoughtes compell answere mynde redye within haue sufficyently herde thy checkynge reprofe therfore purposed make answere myne vnderstandynge knowest thou namely begynnynge euer synce creacyon man vpon earth gladnesse vngodly hath ben short ioye ypocrites cōtynued twynclynge eye though magnifyed vp heuen heade teacheth vnto cloudes yet turne peryssheth foreuer moche whiche haue sene hym shall saye shall vanysshe dreame founde shall passe awaye visyon nyght eye whiche sawe hym shall haue syght hym place shall knowe hym ☞ chyldren shal fayne agre pore handes shal restore theyr goodes youth bone full pleasure nowe shall lye downe hym earth wyckednesse swete mouth hyd vnder tongue fauoured wold forsake kepte close throte breade dyd eate turned poyson serpentes within body ryches deuoured shall perbrake agayne god shall drawe bely shall sucke gall serpentes adder tongue shall sley hym shall se ryuers brokes hony butter thynge men haue laboured shal restore agayn shall eate vp great trauayle shal make ryches shall enioye hath oppressed poore helped house hath spoyled buylded bely coulde neuer fylled therfore shall perysshe couytousnes therfore shall none meate lefte behynde therfore shall man loke prosperyte plenteousnesse euery thyng yet pore though helped euery syde though wycked haue neuer moch fyll bely yet god shall sende wrath vpon hym cause indignacyō reygne ouer yf fle yron weapon shall shot wt stele bowe arowe taken forth gone quyuer glysterynge swerde thorow gall hym feare shal come vpō shal darknesse able hyde hym vnkyndled fyre shall cōsume hym loke remayneth house shall destroyed heuen shall declare wyckednesse earth shall take parte agaynst hym substaūce hath house shalbe taken away perysshe day lordes wrath iob 27 • porcyon wycked man shall haue god heretage may loke god ☞ bycause wordes ¶ iob recyteth prosperyte wycked descrybeth theyr sodayne ruyne destruccyon capi xxi iob answered sayd heart wordes shalbe cōforte suffer lytle may speake also laugh wordes scorne ❀ yf lyke man sake make disputacyon whiche yf shuld spirite sore trouble marke well abasshed laye hande vpon mouth cōsyder myselfe afrayde fleshe smytten fere psal 73 • •• x •• • wherfore wycked men lyue health prosperite come theyr olde age increase ryches theyr chyldrē lyue theyr syght theyr generacyon theyr eye theyr house safe feare rod god doth smyte theyr bullocke gendreth tyme theyr cowe calueth vnfruytfull sende forth theyr chyldren flockꝭ theyr sonnes leade daunce esa • v • beare tabrettes harpes haue instrumentes musycke theyr pleasure spende theyr dayes welthynes sodenly go downe hell saye also vnto god go v desyre knowledge thy wayes e • ob • v • almyghtye shulde serue hym profet shulde haue submyt oureselues vnto lo vtterly goodnesse therfore wyll haue counsayle vngodlye howe ofte shal candle wicked put howe ofte commeth theyr destruccyon vpon sorowe shall god gyue theyr parte wrath yea shall euen haye wynde psal • • chaffe storme caryeth awaye though god saue theyr chyldren soche sorow yet wyll rewarde selues shal knowe theyr owne destruccion misery shall se theyr eye drynke fearfull wrath almyghtye careth become housholde deathe nombre monethes cut shorte moch god hath hyghest power al teache hym knowledge one dyeth myghtye best rych prosperyte euen whē bowel fattest bone full mary another dyeth sorowe heuynesse neuer good dayes shall slepe alyke earth wormes shall couer beholde know ye thynke ca subtyltye ye ymagyn agaynst ye saye ☞ prynces palace dwellynge vngodly haue ye asked go waye ☞ doutlesse ye denye theyr token 〈…〉 ii • mat x ••• wycked kepte vnto daye destruccyon vngodly shall brought forth daye wrath dare reproue hym way face wyll rewarde vngraciousnesse doth yet shall brought graue dwell amonge heape dead shal fayne buryed among stone playne men also must folow hym innumerable gone hym howe vayne cō forte ye gyue doth falseheed remayne answer ¶ eliphas reprehendeth iob vnmercyfulnesse capi xxii eliphas themanite gaue answer sayd maye man profytable vnto god wyse maye profytable hymselfe vauntage almyghtye thou art ryghteous shal profyte hym thou makest thy wayes perfyte afrayde reproue step forth iudgement thy wyckednesse greate thyne vngracious dedes innumerable thou hast taken pledge frō thy brother nought robbed naked theyr clothyng soch werye hast thou gyuen water drynke haste withdrawen breade hungrye shulde soch one vseth violence wrong oppression doyng thyng parcialyte hauynge respecte personnes dwell lande thou hast sent wydowes away emptye oppressed pore fatherlesse therfore arte thou compassed aboute snare euery syde sodeynlye vexed feare shuldest thou se darkenesse shulde water floode run ouer nowe eccle 23 • ezeche ix • bycause god hygher heuens bycause thou seyst sterres hygh wylte thou therfore saye tusshe howe shulde god knowe doth dominion reache vpon cloudes tushe cloudes couer hym maye se dwelleth aboue heuen doest thou kepe olde waye vayne men haue gone whiche cut downe tyme whose foundacyon runnynge water sayde vnto god go v dyd almyghtye fylled theyr house good thynges counsayle vngodlye far ryghteous • awe glad innocent laughed scorne increase hewen downe remenaunt fyre hath consumed therfore recōcyle vnto god content shall thynges prospere ryght well reccyue lawe mouth laye vp wordes thyne herte 〈…〉 〈◊〉 • yf thou wylt turne almyghty thou shalt stand fast put vnryghteousnesse thy dwellynge thou shalt make golde plentyfull dust golde ophit flyntes ryuers yea almyghty god owne selfe shall thy defence thou shalt haue plentye syluer shalt thou haue delyte almyghtye lyfte vp thy face vnto god shalte thou make thy prayer vnto hym shall heare thou shalte kepe thy promyses loke thou takest hande shall make prospere lyght shall shyne thy wayes 〈…〉 • humbleth hymselfe hym shall set vp loketh mekely shall healed yf thou innocent thou shalte delyuer countrey bycause vngyltynesse thyne handes ¶ iob affirmeth bothe knoweth feareth power sentaunce iudge • eth hath wa • hed ryghteousnesse capi xxiii iob answered sayde sayenge yet daye bytternesse hande heuy bycause gronynge myght se hym fynde hym myght come seate pleade cause hym fyll mouth argumentes myght knowe answere wolde gyue myght vnderstande wolde saye vnto wyll pleade agaynst greate power strength wyll make stronger iuste shall entre dysputacyon hym iudge shall delyuer foreuer beholde though go fynde hym yf come behynde get knowledge hym yf go lefte syde doth worke cannot atteyne vnto hym agayne yf go ryght syde hydeth hymselfe cannot se hym waye knoweth sapi iii 1 peter 1 b tryeth golde fyre ☞ fote doth kepe path hygh waye haue bolden wyll go wyll forsake cōmaundement lyppꝭ loke charged mouth haue shut vp herte ☞ styll one poynt wyll turne hym backe doth hym lysteth bryngeth passe wyll perfourmeth thynge appoynted many soche thynges doth cause schrynke presence consydre hym afrayde hym moch god maketh herte softe seynge almyghtye putteth feare thus cannot get darkenesse neyther hath couered cloude fro face ¶ iob descrybeth wyckednesse men sheweth curse belongeth wycked capi xxiiii consideryng tyme hyd almyghtye howe happeneth knowe hym regarde dayes men deute xix c xxvii c remoue men landmarkes robbe theyr cattell kepe theyr owne exodi 22 c dryue awaye asse fatherlesse take wydowes oxe pledge thruste poore waye oppresse symple worlde togyther beholde euen wylde ass deserte go forth theyr worke ryse tymes spoyle yea verye wyldernes minystreth fode theyr chyldrē reape corne felde theyr owne ☞ let vyneyearde vngodly alone cause many men naked bare hauynge clothes couer kepe colde shower moūtaynes haue rayned vpon wette haue none succoure kepe amonge rockes spoyle suckynge fatherlesse chylde take pledge poore moch let go naked without clothyng haue taken awaye sheafe hungrye poore fayne labour theyr oyle mylles yea treade theyr wyne press yet suffer thyrst men citye cryeth vnto lorde syghynge apor • 〈◊〉 • ▪ 〈◊〉 x •• soules sleyne also make theyr complaynte god destroyeth al notwithstandyng conuersaunt amonge abhorre lyght knowe waye contynue pathes luke 22 • tymely mornyng aryse murther symple poore nyght go stealynge eye aduouterer wayteth darkenesse sayeth thus hymselfe tusshe shall eye se dysgyseth face nyght ceason search house hyde themselues daye tyme wyll knowe lyght soone daye breaketh shadowe death commeth vpon go horryble darknesse vngodly swyfter water theyr porcion shall cursed earth shall behold waye vyne yerde wyckednes haue done drawen hell soner snow melteth drought heate compassyon vpon forgotten theyr dayntyes wormes cleane put remēbraūce vngodlynesse vtterly hewen downe lyke tree hath oppressed bareyne cannot beare vnto wydowe hath done good drue myghtye hym power gotten vp man without feare longe lyueth though might safe yet wyl receyue theyr eye loke vpon theyr owne wayes exalted lytle shortly gone brought extreme pouerte taken waye yea vtterly pluckte eares corne wyll reproue lyer saye wordes nothynge worth ¶ bildad proueth man cleane without synne god capi xxv answered byldad suhite sayde power feare hym aboue maketh peace syttyng hyghnesse whose men warre innumerable whose lyght aryseth oueral howe maye man compared vnto god iob 〈◊〉 〈◊〉 • psal 143 〈◊〉 iii c iustified cleane borne womā behold moone shyneth nothyng comparison hym sterres vncleane syght howe moch man corrupcyō sonne man worme ¶ iob sheweth man cannot helpe god proueth miracle capi xxvi iob answered sayd hast thou helped hym without strength comforte gyuest thou vnto hym hath strength counsayle thou shuldest gyue hym whiche hath wysdome hast thou shewed way ryght lyuynge whome hast thou spoken wordes made breth come thy mouth ☞ deade thynges shapen vnder water thynges water syde hell naked destruccyon itselfe cannot hyd syght stretcheth north ouer emptye hāgeth earth vpon nothynge byndeth •••• • •• water cloudes cloude broken vnder holdeth backe stole cannot seue spreadeth cloude iob 38 psal • iiii b iu • mi • • hath compassed water certayne boundꝭ vntyll daye nyght come ende pyllers heuen tremble quake reprofe •••• viii • stylleth see power thorowe wysdome smyteth strength therof spiryte hath garnysshed heuens hande hath made rebellyous serpent lo nowe shorte sūme wayes able sufficyently rehearse workes perceyue vnderstand thondre power ¶ constantnesse perfytenesse iob parte vnfaythfull god capi xxvii iob proceded went forth communicacyon sayenge truly god lyueth whiche hath taken awaye ☞ iudgement almyghtye hath vexed mynde lyppes shal talke vanite tongue shall speake disceate whyle breth longe wynde god hath gyuen nose thyrls god forbyd shulde graunt cause ryght vntyll myne ende come wyll neuer go fro myne innocency ryghtwyse dealynge kepe fast wyl forsake herte shall reproue dayes therfore myne enemy shal found vngodly taketh parte agaynst vnryghteous hope hath ypocryte though haue greate good though god gyue hym ryches hertes desyre doth god heare hym sooner cryeth vnto hym necessite hath soche pleasure delyte almyghtye dare alway cal vpō god wyll teache name god thynge haue almyghtye wyll kepe beholde ye stand owne conceyte though ye knewe thynges wherfore ye go aboute soch vayne wordꝭ sayenge iob xx porcyon wycked shall haue god herytage tyrauntes shall receyue almyghtye yf get many chyldren shall perysshe swerde posteryte shall haue scarcenesse bread loke whome leaueth behynde hym shall dye buryed man shall haue pitye wydowes though haue moch money dust earth rayment redy clay maye well prepare godly shall put vpon hym innocent shall deale money house shall endure moth boothe watchman maketh psal 〈◊〉 ▪ • luke 〈◊〉 ▪ 〈◊〉 rych man dyeth caryeth nothynge hym gone twynkelynge eye hath nothyng destruccyon taketh hold vpō water floode tempest stealeth hym awaye nyght season vehement east wynde caryeth hym hence departeth storme plucketh place russheth vpō hym spareth hym may escape power therof clap men theyr handes hym yea iest hym loke vpon place ¶ iob sheweth wysdon god vnsearchable capi xxviii place syluer brought golde tryed deut viii • yron dygged grounde stone resolued metall darkenesse shal come ende seke grounde al thynges stone darke shadowe death ryuer water parteth sunder straunge people knowe good neyghbourheade soch rude vnmanerly boystous bryngeth foode earth vnder cōsumeth fyre founde place whose stone cleane saphirs clottes earth gold way also byrdes knowe vultours eye hath sene wherin lyon whelpes walke lyon cōmeth putteth hande vpon stony rockes ouerthroweth moūtaynes ryuers flowe rockes loke pleasaunt eye seyth droppes bryngeth great floodes togyther thyng hyd bryngeth lyght cōmeth man wysdome 〈…〉 ii ••• te vii c iames 3 ••• sr 3 • •• • u • place men fynde vnderstandynge herely man tel howe worthy thyng neyther founde lande lyue ❀ theyr ovvne pleasure depe sayeth▪ see sayeth sapi vii • cannot gotten ❀ moost pure golde neyther may pryce bought syluer wedge golde ophir precious onix stone saphirs maye compared vnto neyther golde chrystall neyther swete odour golden plate nothyng worthy excellent named vnto perfyte wysdome goeth far beyonde topas commeth inde maye wyse lykened vnto yea maner apparel howe pleasaunt fayre soeuer whence cōmeth wysdome place vnderstandynge hyd eye men lyuyng yea foules ayre destruccion death say haue herde tell eares god seeth waye knoweth place beholdeth endes worlde loketh vpon vnder heuen weyed wyndes measured water whē set rayne ordre gaue myghtye floodes lowe dyd se declared prepared knewe vnto man sayd beholde 〈…〉 • p • l • xi • p • ••• • 〈◊〉 ix • feare lorde wysdome forsake euyll vnderstandynge ¶ iob complayneth prosperyte tyme past subtyllye reyrouynge frendes iniurye bycause sayde iob suffered accordynge destruynge capi xxix iob proceded went forth cō municacyon saynge monethes paste dayes god preserued lyght shyned vpō head went lyght shynynge euen thorow darknes stode yong god prospered house almyghtye yet chyldren stode aboute wayes ran ouer butter stony rockes gaue ryuers oyle went thorowe citye vnto gate set chayre strete yonge men soone sawe hyd themselues aged arose stode vp vnto prynces lefte theyr talkynge layde theyr haude theyr mouth myghtye kepte styll theyr voyce theyr tongue cleued rofe theyr mouth herde called happye sawe spake good delyuered poore cryed dyd fatherlesse hym none helpe hym shulde haue ben loste gaue good worde wydowes herte praysed ☞ put vpon ryghteousnesse whiche couered garment equite crowne eye vnto blynde foote lame father vnto poore knew cause sought diligently brake chawes vnryghteous man ••••• 1 • • pluckte spoyle teeth therfore thought verely shulde haue dyed nest dayes shulde haue ben many sandes see roote spred water syde dewe lay vpon corne myne honoure encreased bowe euer stronger hand unto men gaue eare regarded sylence taryed counsay •• yf spoken wolde haue none wyse wordes well taken among wayted rayne gaped vpon grounde doth receyue latter shower ☞ laughed knewe well earnest lyght coūtenaunce wolde put agreed vnto theyr way cheyfe sat kynge armye aboute hym heuynesse theyr comfortoure ¶ the▪ great dispysynge men curse god iob suffereth capi xxx nowe yonger haue decisiō yea euen whose father wolde haue thought scorne haue set dogges cattell power strength theyr handes myght • good tyme lost amonge miserye hunger fled wyldernesse place darke horrible waste pluckynge vp netles amonge busshes ieniper rootes theyr meate dryuen forth men cryed ben thefe theyr dwellyng besyde foule brokes yea caues dennes earth amonge busshes wente aboute cryeng vnder thornes gathered themselues togyther chyldrē fooles vylaynes vexed worlde •••• iii • psal 69 • theyr songe become theyr iestyng stocke abhorre flee farre fro stayne face spetle lorde hath loosed strength body brought lowe brydle haue cast oute syghte upon ryght hande ryse yonge men agaynst haue hurte feete treadyng vpon vpon wayes wolde destroye pathes haue cleane marred easy harme neded man helpe fel vpon bene br •• kynge water came heapes destroye fearfulnesse turned agaynst myne honoure vanysshed awaye swyftly wynde prosperite • e parteth hence lyke cloude therfore mynde powred full heuynesse dayes trouble haue taken holde vpon bone pearced thorowe myght season synowes take rest vehe • ence sorowe garment chaunged accordynge diuersite heuynes gyrded cote hath cast myre become lyke asshes dust crye vnto thou doest heare though stande yet thou regardest thou art become myne enemye thy vyolent hande thou takest parte agaynst tymes past thou dydest set vp hyghe aboue wynde nowe hast thou gyuen sore fall sure thou wylte delyuer vnto death ❀ euen lodyng due vnto men lyuynge nowe vse men vyolence vnto destroyed alredy hurte done vse helpe dyd wepe hym trouble soule cōpassion vpon poore▪ yet neuerthelesse loked good euyll happened vnto wayted lyght came darkenes bowel sethe within take rest dayes trouble come vpon mekely lowly come yea without dyspleasure stode vp congregacyon comuned nowe companyon dragons▪ felowe estriches skynne vpon turned blacke bone burnt heate harpe turned sorow pype wepynge ¶ iob reciteth innocen ••• lyuynge nombre • •• rt • e capi xxxi ☞ made couenaunt myne eye eccle • li • math • • wolde loke vpon damsell howe great porcyon shall haue god enheritaunce almyghtye hygh vngodly ioyneth hymselfe company wycked doer shal destruccyon misery come vpon hym iob • 4 • 〈◊〉 • • doth se wayes tel goynges haue walked vanite yf feete haue runne deceyue • 〈◊〉 weyed euen balaunce god maye se myne innosencye psal vii • haue withdrawen foote ryghte way yf herte hath folowed myne eye syght haue stayned defyled handes shall sowe eate 〈◊〉 generacion posterite shall cleane roted myne hert hath lusted neyghbours wyse yf haue layde wayte dore ❀ let wyfe grynde vnto another man let men lye 〈…〉 • wyckednesse synne worthy punysshed yea tyre vtterly shulde consume rote oute substaunce dyd euer thynke scorne ryghte vnto seruaūtes maydens matter agaynst seyng god wyll syt iudgement shall do▪ moche wyll nedes vysyte answere shall gyue hym fassyoned mother wombe made hym also bothe shapen lyke oure mother bodyes poore desyred anythynge haue denyed haue caused wydowe stande waytynge vayne haue eaten porcyon alone fatherlesse hath parte mercy grewe vp fro youth compassyon fro mother wombe haue sene man perysshe thorowe nakednesse want clothynge poore man lacke raymente whose sydes thanked bycause warmed wolle shepe▪ dyd euer lyfte vp hande hurte fatherlesse yea gate sawe myselfe auctorite thē let myne arme fal fro shoulder myne arme hole broken ioyntes haue euer feared vengeaunce punysshment god knewe well able beare burden haue put trust golde haue sayd fynest golde thou arte confidence haue reioysed bycause power greate bycause hande gat moche deutt 4 • vit b sapi xiii dyd euer greatly regarde rysynge sonne goynge downe moone great reputacyon hath myne herte medled pryuely deceyte dyd euer kysse myne owne hande wyckednesse worthy punysshed shulde haue denyed god aboue pro xvii haue euer reioysed hurte myne enemy euer glad harme happened vnto hym oh neuer suffered mouth suche synne wysshe hym euyll dyd men myne owne houshold say shall let v haue belly ful flesshe haue suffered straunger lye without opened dores vnto hym went waye haue kepte secrete synne hyd myne iniquite adam dyd haue feared great multitude people yf bene despised symple thē shuld haue bene afrayde thus haue quyetly spente lyfe gone dore one wolde heare lo cause whiche almyghtye shall answere though contrary partye hath wrytten boke agaynste yet ☞ wyll take hym vpon shoulder garland aboute heade wyll tell hym nombre geynges go vnto hym prynce yf case ☞ lande crye agaynst forowes therof make complaynte yf haue eaten fruytes therof vnpayde yea yf haue greued plowinē let thystles grow stede wheate cockle barley ¶ endeth wordes iob ¶ elihu fynysshed theyr cōmunicacyon reproueth folyshnesse age maheth man wyse spiryte god capi xxxii thre men wolde stryue iob bycause helde hymselfe ryghteous man elihu sonne barachel bussyte kynred ram sore dyspleased iob bycause called hymselfe iust god iobs thre frendꝭ angry also bycause founde reasonable answere ouercome iob nowe taryed elihu tyll ended theyr cōmunicacion iob elder elihu sonne barachel bussite sawe iii men able make iob answere myscontente elihu son barachel bussite gaue answere hymselfe sayd eccle 3 • • consyderyng yong ye men age afrayde durst shew forth mynd thought thus within myselfe becometh olde men speake aged teache wysdom euery man doute hath mynde 3 reg •• • • il ge ••• vii • iacob • proue 〈◊〉 dan •• 〈◊〉 • inspiracion almyghtye gyueth vnderstandynge great men alway wyse neyther doth euery aged mā vnderstande thyng lawful therfore wyll speake also heare wyl shewe also myne vnderstandynge wayted tyll ye made ende talkynge herde wysdom argumentes ye made cōmunicacyon yea diligently pondred ye sayde founde one made good argument agaynst iob directely coulde make answere vnto wordes leest ye shulde say haue founde wysdome god shal cast hym downe man hath spoken vnto wyl answere hym ye haue done abasshed coulde make answere speake one worde moche ye wyll speake standynge styl lyke dombe men makynge answere haue good hope parte shape hym answere shewe hym meanynge full wordes spirite within compelleth beholde belly wyne whiche hath vente brasteth newe vessel sunder therfore wyl speake may haue vente wyll open lyppes make answere wyll regarde maner persone mā wyl spare galat • • yf wolde go aboute please men knowe howe soone maker wolde take awaye ¶ elihu sheweth wherin iob offendeth god may stryue • curyous • ye searche workes capi xxxiii wherfore heare wordes iob herken vnto wyll saye beholde haue nowe opened mouthe tongue hathe spoken throte herte doth ordre wordes aryght lyppes talke pure wysdome spirite god hath made gene ii b breth almyghtye hath gyuen lyfe thou canst gyue answere prepare thy self stande face face beholde god euen thou fassioned made euen moulde therfore thou nedest afrayde neyther nedest thou feare auctorite shall heuy nowe hast thou spoken myne eares haue herde voyce thy wordes cleane without faute innocente wyckednes lo hath pycked quarell agaynst taketh enemy iob xiii hath put foote stockes loketh narowly vnto al pathes beholde hast thou done ryght wyll make answere vnto god man doest yu stryue agaynste hym shall gyue accomptes wordes god doth cōmaund thyng shulde mā curyous search whyther ryght gene 〈◊〉 • •• •• v •• • daniel 〈◊〉 • 〈…〉 ii dreames vision nyghte stombrynge cometh vpon men fall aslepe theyr beddes roundeth eares enfourmeth sheweth playnely whiche draweth man euyll delyuereth hym frō pryde kepeth hym graue lyfe swerde chasteneth hym wt sickenesse bryngeth hym bed sayeth sore punyshment vpon bone lyfe may away breade soule abhorreth eate dayntye meate moche body cleane consumed away bone appeare life draweth graue lyfe death nowe yf messenger one among thousand sent speake vnto man shewe hym ryght waye lorde mercyfull vnto hym sayeth shall delyuered fall downe graue sufficiently reconcyled shall flesshe well lykynge shall youth yf submyt hymselfe vnto god shal gracious vnto hym shewe hym countenaunce ioyfully rewardeth man ryghteousnes suche respecte hath vnto men therfore let man confesse saye haue offended dyd vnryghteously hath done good yea hath delyuered soule destruccyon lyfe shall se lyght lo thus worketh god alwaye man kepeth soule perysshynge letteth hym enioy light lyuyng marke well iob heare holde styll wyll speake yf thou hast anythyng say answere speake thyne answere pleaseth thou hast nothynge heare holde thy tongue shall teache wysdome ¶ elihu prayseth iustice god whiche iudgeth worl • e gouerneth capi xxxiiii elihu proceadynge forth answere sayd heare wordes ye wyse men herken vnto ye haue vnderstandynge eare proueth discerneth wordes iob xii • mouth tasteth meates iudgemente let v seke amonge ourselues may knowe good iob hath sayde righteous god doth wronge must nedes lyer though cause ryght violently plaged made faute suche one iob ☞ drynketh vp scornefulnesse lyke water whiche goeth companye wycked doer walketh vngodly men hath sayd though man good yet nought god therfore hecken vnto ye haue vnderstandynge farre god shulde medle wyckednesse farre almyghtye shulde medle vnryghteous dealynge mat 〈◊〉 rom 11 b shall rewarde workes man cause euery mā fynde accordynge wayes sure rom iii • god condemneth man wrongfully iudgement almyghtye vnryghteous ruleth earthe steade hath set gouerne hole worlde whome hath gyuen herte drawe spirite breth vnto hym flesshe shall come togyther vnto nought men shall turne agayne vnto gene iii psal 146 • dust thou nowe haue vnderstandynge heare saye herken boyce wordes maye ruler loueth ryght maye innocent man vngodly reason thou shuldest saye kynge thou arte wycked thou arte vngodlye prynces ii par 30 • rom ii ephe vi b collos 〈◊〉 eccle 35 • hath respecte vnto persones lordlye regardeth ryche poore worke handes twynkelynge eye shall dye mydnyght people tyrauntes rage shall perysshe taken away without handes iob xxxi • proue v eye loke vpon wayes mā seeth goynges darknesse shadowe death hyde wycked doer hym man shall suffred go iudgement god many one yea innumerable doth punysshe setteth theyr steades therfore shall declare theyr workes shal turne nyght shall destroyed steade scar delte lyke vngodlye men therfore punyshed bycause turned backe hym wolde consydre al wayes moche haue caused voyce poore come vnto hym nowe heateth complaynte suche trouble graunt pardon wyl condemne yf hyde away countenaunce shalbe able se whyther peple man thus wyl vngodlynesse people doth god make ypocrite reygne ouer moche haue begon talke god wyll hyndre haue gone amysse enfourme thou yf haue done wrong wyll leaue nothynge without thou hast reproued iudgement thou also hast thyne owne mynde speake thou knowest let men vnderstandyng tel let wyse man herken vnto iob hath neyther spoken purpose wisely father let iob wel tryed bycause hath answered wycked men yea aboue synne doth wyckedly triumpheth among v multiplieth wordes agaynst god ¶ neyther dothe godlynesse profyte vngodlynesse hurte god man capi xxxv elihu spake moreouer sayd thynkest thou ryght thou sayest ryghteous god thou sayest aduauntage wyll vnto profyte shalte thou haue synne therfore wyll gyue answere vnto thy companyons loke vnto heuen beholde consydre cloudes whiche hygher thou thou hast synned hast thou done agaynst hym thyne offence many hast thou done vnto hym thou ryghteous gyuest thou hym wyll receyue thy hande suche vngodly persone thou son man ryghteous thou pretendest greate crye complaynte made oppressed violence yea euery man complayneth vpon crueltye tyrauntes one neuer sayth god made gyueth v occasyon prayse hym nyght whiche gyueth v vnderstandynge doth beastꝭ earth teacheth v doth foules heuen suche complayne man gyueth answere bycause wyckednes proude tyrauntes yf man call vpon god doth heare hym dothe almyghty accepte crye thou speakest shulde pardon yf thou open thy selfe hym put thy truste hym vseth violence wrath neyther hath pleasure curious depe inquisicions therfore doth iob open mouth vayne folysshly doth make many wordes ¶ elihu sheweth wherfore god punysheth cor ••• teth capi xxxvi elihu proceded forth talkyng sayd holde styll lytell shall shewe haue yet speake god behalfe wyl open vnto yet myne vnderstandyng proue matter ryghteous truely wordes shall vayne seynge perfyte knowledge beholde great god casteth awaye man hym selfe myghtye power wysdome vngodly shall preserue hym shal helpe poore theyr ryght shall turne eye awaye ryghteous kynges shall theyr trone shall stablysshe euer shall exalted yf layde pryson cheynes bounde bondes trouble wyll shewe theyr worke synnes wherewith haue vsed cruell vyolence punysshynge nurturyng roundeth eares warneth leaue theyr wyckednesse amende esai • nowe wyll take hede serue hym shall weare theyr dayes prosperite theyr yeres pleasure ioye yf wyll herken shall go thorowe swerde perysshe euer aware suche fayned ypocrites shall heape vp wrathe selues call vpon hym though prysoners thus shal theyr soule perysshe folysshnes theyr lyfe shal condemned among fornicatours poore shall delyuer affliccion rounde care trouble euen shal kepe yf thou wylte contente bottomlesse pyt beneth yf thou wylt holde quyete shall fyll thy table plenteousnesse neuerthelesse thou hast condemned iudgement vngodly yea euen suche iudgement sentence shalte thou suffre shall thy cause stylled crueltye pacified many gyftes thynkest thou wyll regarde thy rychesse shall care golde excell strengthe prolonge thou tyme tyll come nyght set people thy steade beware thou turne asyde wyckednesse synne whiche hytherto thou hast chosen mekenesse beholde god myghty hygh power suche gyde law gyuer wyll reproue hym waye wyll saye vnto hym thou haste done wronge consydre howe great excellent workꝭ men loue prayse yea wondre hym yet se hym far beholde great god passeth knowledge neyther able come experience yeares 〈◊〉 • b 〈◊〉 xxviii turneth water small droppes dryueth cloudes togyther rayne powre downe droppe vpon men sprede cloudes coueryng tabernacle cause lyght shyne vpon couer botome see thynges gouerneth people gyueth aboundaunce meate cloudes hydeth lyghte cōmaundement cometh agayne rysynge vp therof sheweth frendes cattell ¶ elihu proueth wysdome god vnsearchable capi xxxvii herte astonyed moued place heare sounde voyce noyse goeth mouth gouerneth euery thyng vnder heuen lyght reacheth vnto ende worlde roryng voyce foloweth hym glorious maiesty gyueth suche thondreclap though man yet may perceyue afterwarde gyueth horryble sounde god sendeth voyce greate thynges doth whiche comprehende psal 147 • commaundeth snowe falleth vpon carthe soone gyueth rayne charge immediatly showres haue theyr strengthe fall downe sendeth •• vpon euery mā myght know theyr owne workes beastes crepe theyr dennes take theyr rest south cometh tempest colde north breth god frost cometh water shed abrode maketh cloudꝭ theyr laboure gyuynge moystnesse agayne lyght dryueth away cloude distributeth also euery syde according pleaseth hym deale oute workes may soeuer cōmaūdeth thorowe hole worlde whyther punysshe lande good vnto seke hym herken vnto iob stande styl consydre wonderous workes god arte thou counsel god doth thynges causeth lyght come forth cloudes arte thou counsel spredeth cloudes hast thou perfyte knowledge wonder howe thy clothes warme lande styl thorowe south wynde hast thou helped hym spreade heuen whiche loke vpon cast cleare mettall teache v shall say vnto hym vnmete bycause darknesse shall tolde hym say shuld man speake shulde kepe backe euery man seeth lyght kepeth cleare cloudes clenseth maketh wynde blowe golde brought north prayse honoure goddes feare cometh god hym selfe fynde almyghtye power equite ryghteousnes hygher expressed let men therfore feare hym shall man se hym wyse owne conceyte ¶ • er •• el eo • de hath done begynnynge capi xxxviii answered lorde vnto iob storme sayd hydeth mynde folysshe wordꝭ iob xi • gyrde vp thy loynes lyke man wyl question se thou gyue directe answere wast thou layde foundacions earth tell playnely yf thou hast vnderstandynge hath measured knowest thou hath spred lyne vpon whervpon stande pyllers layde corner stone therof wast thou sterres praysed togyther chyldren god reioysed triumphauntly iob xxvi ieremi v • psal •• iii b shut see dores brake forthe chylde mother wombe made cloudes coueryng swadled darke gaue cōmaundement makynge dores barres sayenge hytherto shalte thou come shalte thou laye downe thy proude hygh waues hast thou gyuen morning charge assoone thou wast borne shewed daye spryng place myght take holde corner earth vngodly myght shaken theyr token weapon turned lyke clay set vp agayne chaungyng garment vngodly shall disapoynted theyr lyght arme proude shall broken camest thou euer grounde see walkedst lowe corner depe haue gate death bene opened vnto hast thou sene dores shadowe death hast thou also perceyued howe brode earthe thou hast knowledge shewe lyght dwelleth darknes yu mayst bryng v vnto theyr quarter yf thou canst tell way theyr house knewest thou thou wast borne howe olde thou shuldest wentest thou euer treasury snowe hast yu sene secret place hayle exodi ix e iosua x c whiche haue prepared agaynst tyme trouble agaynst tyme battayle warre way lyght parted lande breaketh east wynde deuydeth aboundaunce water ryuers maketh waye lyghtenynge thondre watereth moystneth drye bareyne grounde make grasse growe place bodye dwelleth wyldernes mā remayneth father rayne hath begotten droppes dew whose wombe came theyse hath engendred coldnesse ayre water harde stone lye congeled aboue depe wylte thou hyndre swete influence seuen sterres arte thou able breake circle heuen canst thou brynge forth mornynge sterre euenynge sterre cōuentent tyme cōuey home agayne knowest thou course heuen thou mayest set vp ordinaunce therof vpon earth moreouer canst thou lyfte vp thy voyce cloudes may powre downe great rayne vpon canst thou thondre also may go theyr way obedient vnto sayenge lo gyueth sure wysdom stedfast vnderstandyng nombreth cloudes wysdom stylleth vehement water heuen turneth clottes dust clottes agayne wylte thou hunte pray lyon fede whelpes lyenge theyr dennes lurkyng theyr couch psal 147b prouideth meate rauen yong one crye vnto god flye aboute lacke meate ¶ god speaketh vnto iob shewynge hym example workes ryghteousnes vnsearchable capi xxxix knowest thou tyme wylde gootes bryng forth theyr yong among stony rockes layest thou wayte hyndes vse fawne rekenest thou monethes engendre thou knowest tyme theyr bearynge lye downe cast theyr yonge one delyuered theyr trauayle payne howe theyr yonge one growe vp waxe great thorowe good fedynge go forth returne agayne vnto letteth wylde asse go free whoo lowseth bondes mule euen whiche haue gyuen wyldernesse theyr house vntylled lande theyr dwellynge place may gyue force multitude people city neyther regarde cryenge dryuer seke theyr pasture aboute mountaynes folowe grene grasse wyl vnicorne tame seruyce abyde styl thy cryb canst thou bynde yocke aboute vnicorne thy forowe make hym plowe valley mayst thou trust hym cause stronge commyt thy laboure vnto hym mayst thou byleue hym wyll brynge home thy corne carye thynge vnto thy barne ❀ gauest thou fayre wynges vnto pacockes wynges fethers vnto storke leaueth egges earth layeth dust remembreth myght troden feete broken wylde beast harde vnto yonge one though laboureth vayne without feare bycause god hath taken wysdom hym hath gyuen hym vnderstandynge tyme flyeth vp hygh careth neyther horse man hast thou gyuen horse strength lerned hym bowe downe necke feare letteth hym selfe dryuē forth lyke greshopper stoute neyng maketh fearfull breaketh grounde hoofes feete chearefully strengthe runneth meete harnest men layeth asyde feare stomake abated neyther starteth abacke swerde though quyuers ratle vpon though speare shelde glystre yet russheth fearsly beateth vpon grounde feareth noyse trompettes soone heareth shawlmes blowe tusshe sayth smelleth battayle farre noyse captaynes shoutynge cometh thorowe thy wysdome goshauke flyeth towarde south doth egle mounte vp make nest hygh thy cōmaundement abydeth stony rockes vpon hygh toppes harde mountaynes mā come thence seketh praye loketh farre aboute eye yonge one fed bloode math • 4 • deade body lyeth immediatly ¶ iob humbleth hym selfe vnto god descryptyon behemoth leuiathan capi xl moreouer lorde spake vnto iob sayde stryueth almyghtie rest sulde dysputeth god gyue hym answere iob answered lorde saynge beholde vyle persone answere therfore wyll lay hande vpon mouth twyse haue spoken wyll saye answered lorde vnto iob storme sayde iob 〈◊〉 • gyrde vp thy loynes nowe lyke man tell thyngꝭ wyll aske wylte thou disanul iudgement wylt thou condemne thou thy selfe mayst made ryghteous thy power lyke power god maketh thy voyce suche sounde dothe arme thy selfe thyne owne power vp decke thy ioly araye powre indignacion thy wrathe se thou caste downe proude loke wel thou makest suche stubburne obey treade downe vngodly theyr place caste downe dust couer theyr face darkenes wyll cōfesse vnto also thyne owne ryght hande shall saue beholde ☞ beast behemoth made whiche eateth haye oxe lo howe stronge loynes power hath nauel body spredeth tayle lyke cedre tre vaynes styffe shynnes lyke pipe brasse ryg bone lyke staues yron fyrst god made hym ordeyned wyldernesse hym mountaynes shulde gyue hym grasse beastes felde take theyr pastyme lyeth amonge reedes moss fennes hyde hym theyr shadowe wyllowes broke couer hym rounde aboute lo without labour myght drynke hole floode sup iordane without trauayle dare laye hande vpon hym openly vndertake catche hym dare put hoke thorowe nose say snare hym darest thou drawe esai 2 • • psal 7 • • ☞ leuiathā angle bynde tongue snare canst thou put rynge nose hym bore iawe thorowe nayle wyll make many fayre wordes thynkest thou flatter wyll make couenaunte arte thou able compell hym contynuall seruyce wylte thou take thy pastyme hym byrde gyue hym vnto thy maydens thy companyons maye make • efeccion hym maye parted amonge merchaūt men canst thou fyl basket skyn fysshe panyer wt head darest thou lay hande vpon hym better consydre harme myght happen therthorowe touche hym thou thynkest haue holde vpon hym shall begyle ¶ leuiathan whiche ••• oned chapiter capi xli man cruell able styrre hym vp ier ••• • • able stande rom • 〈◊〉 • hath gyuen thing hande maye rewarde hym agayne thynges vnder heuen myne fere hym whither threaten speake fayre lifteth hym vp strypeth hym clothes taketh hym byt brydle openeth dore face hath horryble teeth rounde aboute body couered scale sheldes locked kepte well compacte togyther one ioyned ayre come yea one hangeth vpon stycketh togyther sundred nesyng lyke glystryng fyre eye lyke mornyng shyne mouth go torch nose thyrles goth smoke lyke hote sethynge pot breth maketh cooles burne flambe goth mouth necke remayneth strength nothyng laborous hym membres body ioyned strayte one cleue fast togyther moued herte harde stone •• st stythye smyth smyteth vpon goth myghtie afrayde feare troubleth man drawe swerde hym shall hurte hym may neyther speare iauelyn brest plate abide setteth moche strawe yron moche rotten stocke brasse statteth away hym bendeth bowe slynge stone careth moch stubble counteth dartꝭ better strawe laugheth hym scorne shaketh speare • rea deth golde myre lyke sharpe pot shardes maketh depe boyle lyke pot styrreth see togither lyke oyntment maketh path sent hym depe walkynge place upon earth power lyke vnto made feareth man wyll consyder hygh thynges kynge ouer chyldren pryde ¶ repentaunce iob prayeth frendes goodes restored hym double capi xlii iob answered lorde sayd esai 28 • • regū 19 b knowe thou hast power ouer thyngꝭ thought hyd kepe owne counsell secrete shall knowen therfore haue spoken vnderstode thynges hygh passe myne vnderstandynge herken thou vnto also let speake answere vnto thynge wyll aske haue gyuen diligent eare vnto nowe se myne eye wherfore gyue myne owne self blame take repentaunce duste asshes nowe lorde spoken wordes vnto iob fortuned lorde sayde vnto eliphas themanite displeased thy two frendes ye haue spoken thynge ryght lyke seruaunt iob hath done therfore take ye nowe seuen ox seuen rammes go seruaunt iob math • • marke • offre vp selues burnt offerynge seruaunt iob shal pray hym wyll accepte deale folysshnesse ye haue spoken thynge whiche ryghte lyke seruaunt iob hath done eliphas themanite bildad suhite sophar naamathite went theyr waye dyd accordynge lorde cōmaunded gene 〈◊〉 • lorde also accepted persone iob lorde turned captiuite iob prayed frendes yea lorde gaue iob math 〈◊〉 • twyse moche came vnto hym brother systers bene acquayneaunce dyd eate breade hym house wondrynge hym confortynge hym ouer trouble lorde brought vpon hym euery man also gaue hym certayne summe money iuel golde lorde made iob rycher fourtene thousande shepe syx thousand camel thousand yocke ox thousande ass seuen sonnes
