theyr trust hym ¶ iij psalme ¶ psalme dauid fledde face absalom sonne 2 reg 15 lorde howe increased troubledn̄e quid multiplicati many y• ryse agaynste many saye soule helpe hym god ☞ sela thou lord art defender thou art worship y• lyfter vp hede dyd cal vpon y• lord wt voyce herd holy hyll sela ☞ layde downe slepte rose vp agayne lorde susteyned wyl nat afrayed ten thousandes people haue set selues agaynste rounde lord saue god thou smytest almyne enemyes ☞ vpon cheke bone thou hast brokē teth vngodly saluacion belongeth vnto lorde thy blessynge vpon thy people ¶ iiij psalme ¶ hym excelleth musike psalme dauid heare call god mycum inuocarē ryghteousnes thou hast set lybertye whan trouble haue mercy vpon prayer ye sonnes men howe longe wyll ye blaspheme myne honour haue pleasure vanyte seke lesyng sela knowe also lorde hath chosē hym selfe man godly call vpō lorde wyll heare stāde awe synne nat comen owne hert chambre styll sela offre sacrifice ryghtousnes put youre truste lorde many saye wyll shewe v good lorde lyfte thou vp light thy countenaunce vpō v thou hast put gladnesse herte sence time theyr corne wyne ⚜ oyle increaced wyll laye downe •• peace take rest thou lorde onely makest dwell safetye ¶ v psalme ¶ excelleth songes musicke psalme dauid pondre wordes lorde consydre meditacyon herken thou vnto voice callyng king god vnto wyll pray voyce shalt thou heare tymes lord earely mornynge wyll directe prayer vnto wyll loke vp verba mea • thou arte theprou iii god hath pleasure wyckednesse neyther shall euyl dwell suche foolysh shall nat stande thy syght thou ☞ hatest worke vanyte thou shalt destroye speak lesynge lorde wyll abhorre bothe bloudy thyrstye disceytfull man wyll come thy house euen multytude thy mercy thy feare wil psa • • ▪ • worshyppe towarde thy holy temple leade lorde thy ryghteousnesse myne enemyes ☞ make thy way playne face faythfulnesse ☞ mouth theyr inwarde partes wyc kednesse ••• • • theyr throte open sepulchre flatter theyr tonge destroye y• god let thē perysh thorowe theyr owne ymaginacions caste multitude theyr vngodlynesse haue rebelled agaynste let thē put theyr trust reioyse shall euer geuynge thankes thou defendest thē loue thy name shall ioyfull thou lorde wylte geue thy blessynge vnto righteous thy fauorable kyndnes wylte thou defende hym shylde ¶ v • psalme ¶ excelleth musick vpon instrument eyght strynges lorde dn̄e • e ••• l • • 〈◊〉 x • rebu • e nat thy indigna cyon neyther chasten thy wrath haue mercy vpon lorde weake lorde heale bone vexed soule also sore troubled teares bewtye gone trouble worne awaye myne enemyes mat vii • and▪ • xv • • uke 〈◊〉 waye fro▪ ye worke vanyte lorde hath harde voyce wepynge lorde hath hearde peticyon lorde wyll receaue prayer myne enemyes shalbe confounded sore vexed shalbe turned backe put shame sodenly ¶ vij psalme ☞ sigaion dauid whiche sauge vnto lorde busynes ☞ •• hu • conne iemini lorde god haue put truste saue per secute delyuer lest deuour soule lyke lyon teare peces whyle none helpe lorde god dn̄e de • meus yf haue done suche thynge oriob xxx • yf wyckednesse handes haue rewarded euyll vnto hym dealt frendely withme yee haue delyue red hym cause myne enemye let myne enemye persecute soule take ye let hym treade lyfe downe vpon earth laye myne honoure dust sela stande vp lorde thy wrath lyfte vp thy selfe indyngnacions myne enemye aryse vp ☞ iudgemente thou haste promysed shall congregacyon people come aboute theyr sake therfore lyfte vp thy selfe agayne lorde shall iudge people geue sentence lorde accordynge ryghteousnes accordynge innocencye oh let wyckednes vngodly come ende guyde thou iuste ryghteous god tryeth hertes raynes helpe commeth god preserueth true hert 〈◊〉 • • god ryghteous iudge ⚜ stronge pacyent god prouoked euery daye man wyl nat turne wyl whette swerde hathe bente bowe made ready hathe prepared hym instrumentes death ordeneth hys arowes ⚜ agaynste persecutours bebolde • trauyleth mischefe hathe conceaued sorowe brought forth vngodlynesse iob xv • esay 〈◊〉 • e •• b •• 7 • • rou • 6 • e •• le xl e • cl • 32 • hathe grauen digged vp pytte fallen selfe destrue cyon made githith psalme dauyd lode gouernour howe excellente • n̄e •• •• oster thy name worlde thou haste sette thy glory aboue heauēs▪ 〈◊〉 xxl v mouthe verye babe sucklynges hast thou ordeyned ☞ strength thyne enemyes thou myghtest styll enemye auenger wyll consydre thy heuens euen worke thy fyngers mone starres whiche thou haste ordeyned 〈◊〉 ▪ 144 • man thou arte myndeful hym▪ sonne man thou vysitest hym thou madest lytle lesse aungels crowne glorye worshyppe thou makest hym haue domi nyon workes thy hādes ••• ii b cor xv thou haste put thynges sub • ectyon vnder fete al shepe ox yee y• beastes felde foules ayre fishe see euer wal keth thorowe pathes see lorde gouernour howe excellent thy name worlde ¶ ix psalme ¶ eycelleth vpon ☞ almuth l • ben psalme dauyd wyl consitebot tibi psal • xi 〈◊〉 138 8 gyue thankes vnto lorde whole herte wyll speake thy merueylous workes wyll glad reioyce yee songes wyl make thy name thou moste hyghest whyle myne enemyes dryuen backe shall fal peryshe thy presence thou haste mayntened ryght cause thou art set throne • ud ged ryght thou hast rebuked y• heithen destroied vngodly thou haste put name euer euer thou enemye distruccions come ende euen city thou hast distroied memorial perished lorde shall endure euer hath also pre pared seate iudgemēt shall iudge worlde ryghtuousnes ministre true iudgemēt vnto people lorde also wyl defence oppressed 〈◊〉 33 • euē refuge ī due time trouble y• knowe thy name wyll put trust thou lorde hast neuer fayled thē seke prayse lorde 〈◊〉 • 6 dwelleste syon shewe people hys doynges maketh quisycion bloude remembreth 〈◊〉 xxii • forgetteth complaynte poore haue mercy vpon lorde consydre trouble whiche suffre 〈…〉 thou lyftest vp frō ga 〈…〉 deathe maye shewe thy 〈…〉 porte doughter syon wyll reioyce thy saluacion heythen suncken downe pytte made net hyd pryuely owne fore taken lorde knowen execute iudgement vngodly trapped worke owne hādes consideracion sela wicked shalbe turned vnto hell people forget god poore shall nat waye forgotten hope meke shall nat peryshe euer lorde let nat man haue vpper hande let heythen iudged thy syght put feare lorde heythen maye knowe selues men sela ¶ x psalme standest thou farre lord hidest thy face tyme trouble ▪ vngodly owne lust doth ꝑsecute poore let taken craftye wylenesse haue ymagined vngodly hathe made boste owne hertes desyre speakethe good couetous god abhorreth vngodly proude yt careth nat god neither god thought hys wayes alwaye greuous thy iudgementes farre • syght therfore defyeth enemyes hath sayde tushe shall neuer caste downe shall harme happen vpon vt qui dn̄e hisrome iii e mouth ful cursing dis • frau • e vnder tong vngodlynesse vanite prou • • sytteth lurkynge stretes priuely doth murther y• innocent eye sette agaynste poore lyeth wayting secretly euen lion lurketh denne maye rauishe pore doth rauishe pore getteth hym nette ☞ falleth downe humbleth selfe congregacion poore maye fall hande captaynes hath sayde herte tushe god hath forgottē hydeth away face wyll neuer se aryse lorde god lyfte vp thyne hāde forget nat poore wherfore shulde wyeked blapheme god whyle dothe saye herte tushe thou carest nat • surely thou hast sene yu beholdest vngodlynesse wronge ☞ thou mayest take matter thy hande poore cōmiteth hym selfe vnto • one 〈◊〉 helper frendlesse breake • lord power vngodly malycyo▪ 〈◊〉 ☞ take awaye vngodlynesse 〈…〉 shalt fynde none lorde kynge euer euer hethen peryshed lande lorde thou hast hearde desyre poore thou preparest theyr hert thyne eare herkeneth therto helpe fatherlesse poore vnto theyr ryght man erthe exalted agaynste xi psalme ¶ chaunt ••• psalme dauydindn̄o consido lorde put truste howe saye ye soule shulde ☞ fle byrde vpon youre hyll lo vngodly bēde bowe make redy arowes quyuer maye pryuely shote whiche true herte ☞ foundacions wylbe cast downe hath ryghteous done abat 〈◊〉 lorde holy templeesa ixvi lordes seat heuen hys eye consydre ⚜ poore hys eye lyddes beholde chyldren men lorde aloweth ryghteous vngodly delyteth wyckednes dothe soule abhorre upon vngodly shall rayne snare fyre add brymstone storme tempest thys shalbe theyr porcyon drynke y• ryghteous lord loueth ryghteousnes coūtenaūce wyll beholde thynge iust ¶ xii psalme ¶ hym excelleth vpon iuste • mente eyght strynges psalme dauid helpe lorde nat onesaluum fac dn̄e godly man lefte faythfull mynisshed among chyldren mē talke vanyte euery one hys neyghboure flatter theyr lyppes dyssemble theyr herte lorde shall rote discetyfull lyppes tonge speketh proude thinges whiche haue sayed oure tonge wyl preuayle yt ought speake lorde nowe trouble sake nedye psa 119 • complaynte poore wyll vp sayeth lorde wyll helpe euery one fro • swelleth hym wyll set rest wordes y• lord pure wordes euen syluer frō earth tryed purifyed seuen tymes ī fyre thou shalt kepe lorde thou shalte preserue ☞ thys generacyon euer vngodly walke euery syde whan exalted chyldren men put rebuke ¶ xiij psalme ¶ chaunter psalme dauid howe longe wylte thou forget ovsqueco dn̄e lorde euer howe long wilt yu hyde thy face long shal seke coū cell soule vexed myne herte howe long shall myne enemye triūphe ouer consydre lorde god lyghtē myne eies y• slepe nat deth lest myne enemy say haue preuayled agaynst caste downe y• trouble wyl reioyce trust thy mercy herte ioyful thy saluacion wyll synge lorde hath dealte louyngly ⚜ wyl praise name lorde hyghest ¶ xiiij psalme ¶ chaunter psalme dauid dixit sipi • e • ▪ fole hath sayde herte god corrupte become abhomynable theyr doynges psal 〈◊〉 • psal 〈◊〉 • rom 〈…〉 one y• dothe good ⚜ one lorde loked downe frome heauen vpon chyldren men se wolde vnderstande seke god gone way togyther become abhomyable none dothe good one ⚜ throte open sepulcre tonges haue disceyued poyson aders vnder lyppes mouth ful cursyng bytternes fete swyfte shed blode distruccion vnhappynesse way way peace haue knowen feare god eies haue nat knowen yt worker mischefe eatyng vp people breade cal nat vpon lord brought greate feare ⚜ euen fere god y• generacion y• rightuous ye haue made mocke councel pore putteth truste lorde shal giue saluacion vnto israel sion whan lorde turneth captiuite people shall iacob reioy •• israel shalbe glad ¶ xv psalme lorde shall dwell thy tabernacle shall reste vpon thy holye hyll domine quis habitabit psal 4 • esap 33 • mat 〈◊〉 • euen leadeth vncorrupte lyfe dothe thynge whiche ryght speaketh trueh hert hath vsid disceyt tonge done euyl neyghbour hath nat sclandred neyghbours setteth nat hym selfe maketh muche feare lorde sweareth vnto neyghbour disapointeth ••• 28 • hathe geuen money vpon vsury taken rewarde agaynste innocēt doth thinges shall neuer fall ¶ xvj psame badge armes dauid preserue god haue icōserua dn̄e put trust thou hast sayde soule vnto lorde thou art god goodes nothynge vnto delyte vpon sayntes earth vpon suche excell vertue runne another god shall haue greate trouble theyr drynke offrynges bloude wyl offre nether make mencyon theyr name within lyppes lorde hym selfe porcyon myne enheritaūce cuppe thou shalt maynteyne lotte lot fallē vnto fayre groūde yee haue goodly heritage wyll thanke lorde geuynge warnynge reynes also chasten nyght season haue set god alwayes ryght hande therfore shall nat fall wherfore harte reioyced tonge glade flesh also shall reste hope ••• ii 〈◊〉 iiii e thou shalt nat leaue soule hell neyther shalte thou suffre thy holy one se corrupcyon thou shalte shewe pathe lyfe thy presence fulnesse ioye thy ryght hande pleasure euermore ¶ xvij psalme prayer dauid heare ryght lorde cōsyder complaynte herkē vnto prayer goeth fayned lyppes let sentence come forth thy presence let thyne eye loke vpon thynge equall exaudi •• e iusti • iam thou hast proued visited myne hert nyght season thou hast tryed shalte fynde wyckednes • ▪ vtterly purposed mouth shall nat offende men workes done agaynste worde thy lyppes haue kepte wayes distroyer holde thou vp goynges thy pathes • • e steppe • ppe nat haue called vpon god thou shalt heare encline thyne eare herken vnto wordes shewe thy meruelous louyng kyndnesse thou arte sauyour whiche put theyr trust suche resist thy ryght hande kepe pro 17 • apple eye hyde • acha ii • vnder y• shadowe thy winges vngodly y• troublemat 33 • myne enemyes cōpasse rounde take away soule main tayne owne welthinesse mouth speaketh proude thynges lye waytynge waye euery syde turnynge theyr eye downe grounde lyke lyon y• gredy pray lyon whelpe lurckinge secrete place lorde disapoynte hym cast hym downe deliuer soule vngodly swerde thyne frō mē thy hande lorde men world haue theyr porcion lyfe whose belyes thou fillest thy treasure haue chyldren theyr desyre leaue reste theyr substaunce theyr babe wyll beholde thy presēce ryghteousnes whē awake vp thy lycknesse shall satisfied xviij psalme ¶ chaunte • dauid seruaunt lorde whiche spake vnto lorde wordes songe daye lorde delyuered hym hande al enemyes hande soul sap • ediligam • e dn̄e wyl loue lorde strengthe lorde stonye rocke defēce sauyour god myght wyl trust buckler horne also saluacyon refuge ii reg 12 • wyll call vpon lorde worthy praised shal safe fro myne enemyes psal •• 6 • sorowes death compassed brooke vngodlynes made afrayed paynes hel came snare death ouertoke trouble wyl cal vpon lorde cō playne vnto god shal heare voyce ⚜ holy temple cō playnte shal come euen eares mat 〈◊〉 • earth trembled quaked foūdacyons also y• hylles sh • ke remoued wroth wēt smoke nostrels consuming fyre hꝭ mouth y• cole kyndled bowed heauēs also came downe darke vnder fete rode vpō cherubins dyd flye came flyenge y• wynges wynde made darcknesse pany lyon rounde darcke water thycke cloudꝭ couer hī y• brightnes p̄sēce cloudꝭ remoued hayle stone cole fire lord also thōdred heuen hyghest gaue thō dre hayle stone cooles fyre sent arrowes scatred cast forthe lyghtnynges destroyed springes water sene foūdacions rounde worlde discouered thy chydynge lorde blastynge brethe thy displesure shal sende downe heygth fetche shall take many water shal delyuer fro strongest enemy frō thē hate ar mighty preuented daye trouble lorde defence brought forth also place libertye brought forth fauour vnto lorde shall rewarde ryghteous dealyng according clennesse handes shal recompense haue kepte wayes lorde haue nat behaued selfe wyckedly agaynste god haue eye vnto lawes wyll nat cast commaundmentes also vncorrupte eschued myne owne wyckednes therfore shal lord rewarde rightuous dealyng accordyng vnto clennesse handes eye sight holy thou shalte holy perfecte man thou shalte perfecte cleane thou shalt clene frowarde thou shalt learne frowardenes yu shalte saue people aduersite shalte bryng downe hye lokes ye proude thou also shalt lyght candle lorde god shall make darckenes lyght shal disconfyte host men helpe god shall leape ouer wal way god vndetyled psal xii b ixix word lorde also tryed fyre defender put theyr trust deut iiii e god lorde hath strēgth except god god gyrdeth strēgth warre maketh waye perfecte maketh fete lyke hertes fete setteth vp hye techeth myne handes fyght myne armes shall breake2 reg xxii • psa 144 euen brasen bowe thou haste giuen defence thy saluacion thy right hand also shall holde vp thy louyng correccyon shall make greate thou shalt make rowme ynough vnder go y• fore steppe shall nat styde wyll folowe vpon myne enemyes ouer take thē wyll nat tourne agayne tyll haue dedestroyed wyl smyte thē shall nat able stande fal vnder fete thou haste gyrded strength vnto warre thou shalte throwe downe mine enemyes vnder thou hast made min enemyes also tourne theyr backes vpon shall destroye hate • bat iii shall crye shall none helpe yee euen vnto lorde shalprou •• • crye shall nat heare wyll beate small dust wynde wyll cast claye stretes thou shalte delyuer frome stryuynges people thou shalt make head heithē people haue nat knowen shall serue assone heare shall obey straunge chyldren shall dissemble wt straunge chyldren shall fayle frayed theyr habitacions lorde lyueth blessed stronge helper praysed god saluacion euē god seeth auenged subdueth people vnto delyuereth cruel enemyes setteth vp aboue mine aduersaries thou shalte ryd wycked man rom • 〈◊〉 • cause wyll gyue thankes vnto lorde among gentyls synge praise vnto thy name 2 〈◊〉 •• ii • greate prosperite gyueth vnto kyng sheweth louynge kyndnes vnto dauyd anointed vnto hꝭ sede euermore ¶ th • xix psalme ¶ chaunter psalme dauydceli • rant ⚜ heauens rom • • declare glorye god firmament sheweth hys handye worke ☞ one daye telleth another one nyght certyfyeth another ☞ neyther speache language voyces herde amonge ☞ theyr sounde gone allroma • • landes theyr wordes endes worlde hath set tabernacle sōne cōmeth forth bridegrome chambre reioyseth giaunt rūne course goeth forth vttermost part heauen runneth vnto ende agayne nothyng hyd heare therof lawe lorde vndefyled conuertynge soule testimonye lorde sure giueth wisdome vnto simple statutꝭ lorde right reioyse herte commaundemēt lorde pure gyueth light vnto eye feare lorde cleane endureth euer iudgemētꝭ lorde true ryghteous altogether ••• viii b desyred golde yee much fyne golde sweter also hony hony combe moreouer thy seruaunt taught keping great rewarde tell howe ofte offendeth oh clense thou fro secrete fautes kepe thy seruaunt also presumptuous synnes lest get dominion ouer thē shall vndefyled innocent frō great offence let wordes mouth meditacion hert ⚜ allwaye acceptable thy sight lorde strength redemer ¶ xx psalme ¶ chaunter psalme dauid lorde heare daye trouble name god iacob defende •••• diat • ond sende helpe frō ye santuary strength sion remēbre thy offerynges accepte thy brente sacrifyce sela strength ryght hande put theyr truste charettes horse wyll remembre name lorde oure god brought downe fallē rysen stand vp ryght saue lorde heare v kyng day shall call ⚜ vponthe ¶ xxi psalme ¶ chaunter psalme dauid kynge shal reioyce thy strength • omine ••• ute • ua lorde exceadynge glad shall thy saluacyon thou hast geuen hym hertes desyre hast nat denyed hym request lyppes sela thou shalt preuente hym blessynges goodnes shalte set crowne pure golde vpon heade asked lyfe thou gauest hym longe lyfe euen euer euer honoure greate thy saluacyon glory great worshipe shalt thou laye vpon hym thou shalt geue hym euerlastynge felycite make hym glad ioye thy coūtenaunce bycause kynge putteth trust lorde mercy hyest shal nat myscary thyne enemyes shal fele thy hande thy ryght hande shall fynde hate thou shalt make lyke fyrie ouen tyme thy wrath lorde shal destroye displeasure fyre shall consume theyr frute shalt thou destroy earth theyr sede amonge chyldren men intended myschefe agaynst ymagyned suche deuyce nat able perfourme therfore shalte thou put flyght strynges thy bowe shalt thou make redy agaynste face thou exalted lorde thyne owne streyngth wyll synge prayse thy power xxii psalme ¶ chaunter vpon hynde dawnynge psalme dauid deus de • men god god ⚜ loke vpon hast thou forsaken art farre fro health wordesmat▪ 〈…〉 mat xv • complaynte god crye daye tyme thou hearest nat night season also take rest thou contynuest holy thou worshyppe israel father hoped trusted thou dyddest delyuer thē called vpon helped put theyr trust nat confounded worme man scorne men outcast people psal cix se laugh scorne shote theyr lyppes shake heade mat 27 • trusted god let hym delyuer hym let hym delyuer hym yf wyll haue hym psal • 1 • thou ar • toke mother wombe thou wast hope whē hanged yet vpō mother brestes haue bene lefte vnto euer sense borne thou arte god euen fro mother wombe go nat fro trouble harde hande none helpe many ox come greate bulles basan close euery syde gape vpon theyr mouthes rampynge roarynge lyon iosu vii b powred lyke water al bone ioynt herte also myddest body euen lyke meltynge waxe strēgth dryed vp lyke po • sherde tonge cleueth go • e thou shalt bringe dust dethe ⚜ many ☞ dogges come councell wicked laye seage agaynste pearsed handes tete maye tell bone stande starynge lokynge vpon parte garmentes among thēmat 27 caste lotte vpon vesture thou farre fro lord thou art succoure hast helpe delyuer soule swerde darlyng power dogge saue frome lyon mouthe thou hast herde also among horne vnicornes wyl declare thy name vnto brethreu theioh rr • hed • c myddest congregacion wyll prayse prayse lorde ye feare hym magnyfie al ye sede iacob psal ix v feare al ye sede israel hath nat dispysed abhorred lowe estate pore hath nat hyd face hym called vnto herde prayse greate congregacion vowes wyl perfourme syght feare hym poore shall eate satisfied seke lorde shall prayse hym herte shall lyue euer endes worlde shall remēbre selues turned vnto lord al y• kynredes nacions shall worshyppe kyngdome lordes gouernour among people al suche fat vpon earth ☞ haue eaten worshypped al go downe duste lyue hardly shall knele hi soule shall lyue ⚜ sede shal serue shalbe counted vnto lorde generacion shall come ⚜ heauens shal declare rightuousnes vnto people shall borne whō lorde hathe made ¶ xxiij psalme ¶ psalme dauyd lorde shepherd therfore cā dn̄s regit lacke nothyng shall fede grene pasture leade forth beside water comforte shall conuerte soule bring forth pathes rightuousnes name sake yee thoughe walke throwe valley floudes • eu 〈◊〉 • cor •• • • shal ascende y• hylpsal vx • esa 〈◊〉 • mat 〈◊〉 • lorde shall ryse vp holy place euen hathe cleane handes pure harte hathe nat lyfte vp mynde vnto vanyte sworne bysceaue ⚜ hys neyghbour shall receaue blessynge lorde ryghteousnesse god saluacyon generacion seke hym euen seke thy face iacob sela ⚜ lyfte vp heades ye gate ye lifte vp ye euerlastynge dores kynge glory shal come kynge glorye lorde stronge myghty euen lorde myghty batell lyfte vp heades ye gate ye lyfte vp ye euerlastynge dores kynge glory shal come king glory euē lord hoostes kynge glory sela ¶ xxv psalme ¶ dauidad te domine le vnto lorde wyll ilyfte vp soule god haue put truste oh let nat cōfounded neyther lette myne enemyes tryumphe ouer rom 9 • • esa • • hope shall nat shamed trāsgresse without cause shall put confusion shewe thy wayes lorde teache thy pathes leade forth thy trueth learne thou arte god saluacyon hathe bene hope daye longe call remenbraunce lorde thy tender mercyes thy louyng kyndenesses whiche haue bene euer olde remembre iob 〈◊〉 • synnes offence youth accordynge vnto thy mercye thynke vpon lorde thy goodnesse good ryghtuous lorde therefore wyll teache synners waye meke shall gyde iudgement suche gentle thē shall learne waye pathes lorde mercy trueth vnto suche kepe couenaunt testimony esa xli • • thy name sake lorde mercyfull vnto synne greate man feareth lorde shall teache waye shall chose soule shal dwell ease sede shall inherite lande secrete lorde amonge feare iere xxxi • 〈…〉 • xxii • wyll shewe couenaunt myne eye euer lokynge vnto y• lord shal pluck fete yt net turne vnto haue mercy vpō desolate misery sorowes herte enlarged bring y• trouble loke vpon myne aduersyte misery forgyue al sine consydre min enemyes howe many beare malicious hate agaynst kepe soule delyuer let nat confounded haue put trust let perfectnesse ryghtuous dealynge wayte vpon hope hath bene delyuer israel god trouble ¶ xxvj psalme ¶ psalme dauyd afore enbalmediudica medn̄e bethov psal 17 iudge lorde haue walked innocētly trust hathe bene also lorde therfore shall nat fall psa 139 examen lorde proue trye reynes hert thy louynge kyndnesse myne eye wyl walke thy trueth haue nat dwelt wt vayne person neyther wyll haue felowshyp disceytfull haue hated congregacion wicked wyll nat syt amonge y• vngodly esa • • wyll wasshe hādes innocēcy lorde wyll go thyne aulter maye shewe voyce thankes gyuynge tell thy wonderous workes lorde haue loued habitacion thy house place thy honoure dwelleth shutte nat vp soule wt synners lyfe blode thrustye whose handes wickednes ryght hande full gyftes wyll walke innocentely delyuer mercyfull vnto fore standeth ryght wyll prayse lorde congregacions ¶ xxvij psalme dauid lorde • illu min itio psal xxii lyght saluacyon whome shall feare lorde strengthe lyfe shall afrayed wycked euen myne ennemyes foe •• vpon eate vp flesshe stombled fel though hoste men layed agaynst yet shall nat herte afrayed though rose vp warre agaynst yet wyll put trust hym luke x g • reg vli c one thynge haue desyred y• lorde whiche wyll requyre euen yt may dwel • house y• lorde dayes lyfe beholde fayre beutie lord vyset temple tyme trouble shal hyde 1 beg xxi tabernacle yee secrete place dwellynge shall kepe set vp vpon ii xxiii c rocke stone nowe shall lyfte vp heade aboue myne enemyes rounde aboute therfore wyl offre dwellyng oblacion thankes geuynge wyll synge speake prayses vnto lorde herken vnto voyce lorde crye vnto haue mercy vpon heare herte hathe talked seke ye face thy face lord wyl seke hyde nat thou thy face fro caste thy seruaunt awaye dyspleasure thou hast ben succoure leaue nat neyther forsake god saluacyon whā father mother forsake lorde taketh vp teache thy waye lord leade ryght waye myne enemyes delyuer nat ouer wyll myne aduersaryes false wytnesses rysen vp agaynste suche speake wronge beleue verely se goodnes lorde lande lyuyng tary thou lordes ley sure psal 〈◊〉 • stronge shal conforte thyne herte put thou thy truste lorde ¶ xxviij psalme ¶ psalme dauidad • e mine cla vnto wyll crye lorde strength thynke scorne lest yf thou make thoughe thou hardest nat become lyke go downe pytte heare voyce humble peticions crye vnto whā holde vp hādes towarde mercy seate thy holy tēple plucke nat awaye ⚜ neyther destroye vngodly wycked doer iere ix b whiche spake fryndely theyr neyghbours ymagin mischefe theyr hertes iob 34 mat 〈◊〉 rom ii • rewarde thē accordyng theyr dedes accordynge wycked nesse theyr owne inuencions recompense worke theye handes paye haue deserued regarde nat workes lorde operacyon hys handes therfore shall breake downe nat buylde vp praysed lorde hath harde voyce myne humble petyons deu viii lorde strengthe shylde herte hathe trusted hym helped therfore herte daunseth ioye songe wyll prayse hym lorde theyr strength wholsome defence hys anoynted saue thy people geue thy blessynge vnto deut 32 b thyne enheritaūce fede set vp euer ¶ xxix psalme ¶ psalme dauid perfourmyngeafferte domino tabernacle brynge vnto lorde ye myghtie ⚜ bring yonge rāmes vnto lorde ascribe vnto lorde worshippe strēgth geue lorde honoure due vnto hys name worshippe lorde holy worshippe exod vii viii lorde commaundethe water gloryous god maketh thonder ero xiiii g mat viii lorde ruleth see voice lorde myghtye operacyon voyce lorde gloryous voyce voyce lorde breaketh ezc xvii g cedre tree yee lorde breaketh ceders libanus made also skyppe lyke calfe libanus also sirion like yong vnycorne voyce lorde deuydeth flame fyre voice lorde shaketh wyldernesse yee lorde shaketh wyldernesse cades voyce lord maketh hyndes bryng forth yonge dyscouereth thycke busshes hys temple doth euery man speke honoure lorde sitteth aboue water floude lorde remayneth kyng euer lorde shal geue strēgth vnto people lorde shall blesse hys people peace ¶ xxx psalme ¶ psalme songe dedicacyon house dauydexaltabo te dn̄e wyll magnyfye lorde thou haste set vp nat made foe triumphe ouer lorde god tryed vnto thou haste healed thou lorde hast brought soule hel thou hast kepte lyfe go downe pyt synge praise vnto lorde ye sayntes hys geue thankes vnto hym remembraunce hys holynesse 1 cor 4 • hys wrath endureth twynclynge eye pleasure lyfe heuynesse maye endure night ioy cōmeth againe mornīg ꝓsperite sayd shal neuer remoued thou lord thy goodnesse hadst made hyll stronge thou dyddeste turne thy face fro troubled cryed vnto lorde gat lorde right humbly profit bloude whan go downe pyt shall duste geue thanckes vnto shall declare thy trueth heare lorde haue mercy vpon lorde thou helper thou haste turned heuynesse ioye thou hast put sacke clothe gyrded gladnesse therfore shall euery good man synge thy prayse without seassynge god wyll geue thanckes vnto euer ❧☞❧ ¶ xxxi psalme ¶ chaunter psalme dauydin te domine speraui lorde haue put trust let neuer put confusion deliuer thy ryghteousnesse bowe downe thine eare make haste delyuer thou stronge cocke house defence thou mayest saue thou arte stronge holde castell thou also gyde leade thy name sake drawe net haue layed pryuely thou arte strength luke 14 • actes 7 g thy hādes commende spyryte thou hast delyuered lorde thou god treuth haue hated holde supersticious vanity truste hathe bene lorde wyll glad reioyse thy mercy thou haste cōsydred trouble haste knowen soule aduersyte thou hast nat shut vp hāde enemye hast set fete large rowme haue mercy vpon lorde trouble myne eye consumed heuynesse yee soule bely lyfe waxen olde heuynesse yeares mournynge strengthe fayleth myne inyquyte bone consumed became reprofe amonge myne enemyes specyally amonge neyghbours mine acquaintaūce afraied dyd se without fled forgotten deed man vanisheth ryght waye thē lyue become lyke broken vessel haue herde blasphemye multytude euery mā abhorreth cō spyre together agaynst purposed take awaye lyfe hope hath bene lorde haue sayde thou arte god tymes thy hande delyuer hande myne enemy persecute shewe thy seruaunt light thy coū tenaūce saue thy mercyes sake let nat confounded lorde haue called vpon let vngodly put confucion put sylēce graue let lyenge lyppes put sylence whiche cruelly disdaynfully despytfully speake agaynste ryghtuous howe plentyfull thy goodnes whiche thou hast layed vp feare • thou hast prepayred put theyr truste euen sonnes men thou shalte hyde pryuely thyne owne presence frome prouokynges al men thou shalte kepe secretely thy tabernacle stryfe tonges thanked lorde hathe shewed merueylous greate kyndenesse stronge cytie made haste saide caste thy sight thyne eye neuertheles thou herdeste voyce prayer cryed vnto loue lorde al ye sayntes lorde preserueth thē faythfull plentuously rewardeth proude doer psal 27 〈◊〉 xxxi e stronge shal strength herte ye yt put trust lorde ¶ xxxii psalme ¶ instruccyon dauyd 〈…〉 quo ••• blessed whose vnrightuousnes forgyuen whose synne couered 〈…〉 4 blessed man vnto whome lorde imputeth synne whose sprete gyle whyle helde tonge bone consumed awaye thorowe daylye complaynynge thy hande heuy vpon day nyght moysture lyke drough sommer sela wyll knoweledge synne vnto myne vnryghteousnesse haue nat hyd sayd 〈…〉 c 〈◊〉 iv wyl cōfesse sinnes vnto lorde thou forgauest wyckednesse synne dela shall euery one godly make hys prayer vnto ☞ due season greate water floudes shall nat come nye hym thou arte defēce thou shalte preserue frō trouble thou shalt cōpasse sōges delyueraūce sela wyl enfourme teach way wherin yu shalt go wyll gyde y• myne eye ye shal nat lyke horse mule whiche haue vnderstāding whose mouthes must holdē wt byt brydle leste fall vpō y• great plage remayne y• vngodly putteth trust y• lorde mercy embraceth hi euery syde glad ye righteous reioyse y• lorde ioyfull ye true hrete ¶ xxxiii psalme reioyce exultate iusti dn̄o lorde ye ryghtuous becommeth well iuste thankful psal 97 prayse lord harpe synge psalmes vnto lute instrument ten strynges synge vnto lorde newe sōge synge prayses lustely ⚜ vnto hym good corage worde lorde true workes faythful loueth ryghtuousnes iudgement earth ful goodnesse lorde ephe v col iii c worde lorde heauens made thegene hoostes breth mouth gathereth water see togyther vpon heape layeth vp depe secret let al earth feare lorde stande awe ye dwell worlde psa 14 • • spake done commaunded stode fast lorde bryngeth psal esa viii b councell heithen nought maketh deuices people none effecte ⚜ casteth councels prynces councell lorde shall endure euer thoughtes hert generacyon generacyon blessed people whose god lorde iehouah blessed folke haue chosen bē theyr inheritaunce lorde loked downe frome heauen behelde chyldren men habitacion dwellyng consydreth dwel earthe tashyoneth hertes vnderstandeth theyr workes kynge saued multitude hoste neyther myghty man delyuered muche strength horse counted vayne thynge saue man neyther shal delyuer mā greate strength beholde eye lorde vpon feare vpon put theyr truste mercye delyuer theyr soules deathe fede thē tyme dearth soule hath paciently taried lorde helpe shylde oure herte shall reioyce hym haue hoped holy name let thy mercyful kyndnesse lorde vpon v lyke haue put trust ¶ xxxiiij psalme ¶ dauyd chaunged speache abimilech whiche droue awaye departedbenedic • dominum wyll waye gyue thankes vnto lorde hꝭ prayse shal euer mouth soule shal make bost lorde humble shall therof glad prayse lorde let v magnyfye name together 1 • eg xxi • soughte lorde hearde yee delyuered feare eye vnto lyghtened theyr face nat ashamed lo poore cryeth lorde heareth hym yee saueth hym hys trouble iosua v 4 reg 19 • psal ii b aungell lorde tarieth rounde feare hym delyuereth taste se howe gracious lorde psa 127 blessed man trusteth mat vi b feare lorde ye sayntes feare lacke nothyng lyon lacke suffre hunger whiche seke lorde shall wante maner thyng good come ye child herken vnto wyl teach feare lorde man hei pet iii c listeth lyue woloe fayne se good day kepe thy tonge euell thy lyppes speake gyle eschue cuyll good seke peace ensue eye lorde ouer rightuous eares open vnto prayer countenaunce lorde agaynst euyll rote membraunce earth rightuous crye lorde heareth thē delyuereth theyr trouble lorde nye vnto contrayte herte wyll saue suche humble sprete pro 24 b 〈…〉 ▪ 〈◊〉 • 〈…〉 • c greate trouble ryghteous lorde delyuereth hym kepeth bone nat one broken eut mysfourtune shal slaye vngodly hate rightuous shalbe desolate lorde delyuereth soules seruauntes y• put theyr trust shal nat destitute the▪ xxxv psalme • dauid pleade thou cause lorde stryue wtth fyght thou agaynste fyght agaynste laye hande vpon shylde bucler stande vp helpe brynge forth speare stope waye agaynste persecute say vnto soule thy saluacyon let coufounded put shame seke soule let turned backe brought confusion ymagyn myschefe iudica▪ dn̄e nocē te letpsal 83 c duste wynde aungell lorde scateringe let theyr way darke slippery let aungell lorde persecute haue preuely laied net destroy without cause yee euen without cause haue made pyt soule let sodaine destruccion come vpon vnawares hys net hath layed pryuely catche hym selfe maye fall hys owne myschefe soule ioyfull lorde shall reioyce hys • ix • osti 〈…〉 saluacyon bone shall saye lorde lyke vnto whiche delyuerest poore stronger hym selfe yee poore wretched hym spoileth false wytnesse dyd ryse vp lated charge thinges knowe nat rewarded euell good great dyscomforte soule neuerthelesse whē sicke put sacke cloth hūbled soule fastynge prayer shal turne myne owne bosō behaued self though bene frēde brother went heuely one morneth mother myne aduersyte reioysed gathered together yee abiectes came together agaīst vnawares kynge mowes ceassed y• flatterer busy mocker gnas shed agaynst theyr tethe lorde howe longe wylte thou loke vpon deliuer soule wicked rumour dearlynge lyon wyll geue thankes great congregacyon wyll prayse amonge much people let mine enemyes tryumphe ouer naught nether let wyncke theyr eye psal 6 • • ioh 〈◊〉 • hate without cause theyr cōmonynge nat peace ymagyn dysceytfull wordes agaynst quyet lande gaped vpon mouthes sayde fye fye dyd se oure eye thys thou haste sene lorde holde natnol •• li thy tong go nat farre fro lorde awake stande vp auenge thou cause god lorde iudge lorde god accordynge thy ryghtuousnesse let triumphe ouer let saye theyr hertes wolde haue neyther let saye haue ouer come let put confusyon shame together reioise trouble let thē clothed rebuke dishonoure boast sel ues agaynst let glad reioyse fauoure rightuous dealynge yee let saye alway blessed lord willeth peace seruaunte tonge shalbe talkynge thy ryghtuones thy prayse daye longe ¶ xxxvi psalme ¶ chauntee dauyd seruaunt lorde herte sheweth wyckednesse vngodly • ixit • oslus 〈…〉 iii c feare god eies flatereth hī selfe owne syght tyll abhomynable synne founde wordes mouthe vnryghtuous full disceyte hath lefte behaue selfe well good ymagyneth myschefe vpon bedde hath set selfe good way neyther doth refuse thynge euyll thy mercy lord reacheth vnto heauen thy trueth vnto cloudes thy ryghtuousnes standeth lyke stronge mountaines thy iudgementes lyke greate depe thou lorde wylte preserue bothe man beaste howe excellente thy mercy god child men shal put truste vnder shadowe thy wynges shall satysfyed plentuousnes thy house thou shalte gyue dryncke thy pleasure ryuer well lyfe thy lyght shall se lyght sprede forth thy louynge kyndnes vnto knowe thy ryghtuousnes vnto thē true herte let fote pryde come agaynste let nat y• hāde vngodly caste downe ☞ fallen worke wyckednes caste downe shal nat able stande ¶ xxxvij psame ¶ psalme dauyd fret nat thy self vngodly neyther thou enuious agaynst euyll doer shall sone cut downe lyke grasse wythered euen grene herbe put thou thy truste lorde good dwel lande • erely thou shalt fedde delyte thou lorde shall gyue thy hertes desyre commytte thy waye vnto lorde put thy truste hym shall brynge passe shall make thy ryghtuousnesse cleare lyght thy iust dealyng none daye holde styll lorde abyde pacyently vpon hym greue nat thy selfe hym whose waye dothe prospere dothe euyll councels leaue frō wrath let go displeasure frete nat thy selfe el shalt thou moued euell wycked doer shalbe roted pacyently abyde lorde shall enherete lande yet lytle whyle vngodly shalbe cleane gone thou shalte loke hys place shalbe awaye meke spreted shal possesse earth shalbe refreshed muche rest vngodly seketh coūcel iust gnassheth vpon tethe lorde shall laughe hym scorne hathe sene day cōmyng vngodly haue drawen swerde haue bended bowe cast downe poore nedye slee suche ryght conuersacyon theyr swerde shall go thorowe owne herte theyr bowe shalbe broken small thynge ryghtuous hathe better greate ryches v godly armes vngodly shalbe broken lorde vpholdeth ryghtuous lorde knoweth y• dayes godly inheritaūce shall endure euer shall nat confounded peryllous tyme dayes derth shal haue ynough vngodly shal perishe enemy lorde shal cōsume ☞ fat lā be yee euen smoke shal cōsume awaye vngodly boroweth payeth nat agayne rightuous mercyfull lyberal blessed god shal possesse lande cursed hi shalbe roted lord ordreth good man goieng maketh waye acceptableprou 24 selfe noli e •• lare though fall shall nat cast awaye lorde vpholdeth hande haue ben yong nowe olde yet sawe neuer rightuous forsakē hꝭ sede seke theyr bredeprou x • c prou x ryghtuous euer mercyful lendeth sede blessed fle euyll good dwel euer lord loueth thyng ryght forsaketh nat godly preserued euer ⚜ vnryghtuous shal punysshed sede vngodly shalbe roted ryghtuous shal inherite lande dwel therin euer mouthe rightuous exercised wysdome tonge wyll talkynge iudgement lawe god goynges shall nat slyde vngodly seythe ryghteous sekethe occasyon sleye hym lorde wyll nat leaue hym hys hande ner condempne whē iudged hope thou lorde kepe waie shal promote thou shalte possessethe lande vngodly shall perishe thou shalt se selfe haue sene vngodly great power floryshynge lyke grene baye tree wente lo gone soughte hym ⚜ place coulde foūd kepe innocency take hede vnto thynge rygte shal brynge man peace laste transgressours shall perysshe together vngodly shall roted laste saluacion ryghtuous commeth y• lorde also strēgth tyme trouble lordeshal stande by▪ saue shal delyuer vngodly shall saue put theyr truste hym ¶ xxxviij psalme ¶ psalme dauid remembraunce put nat • ne ne infuro psal 7 •• x rebuke lorde ī thine anger nether chasten thy heuy displeasure thyne arowes stycke fast thy hande presseth sore health flesshe thy displeasure nether reste bone reason synne wyckednesses gone ouer heade lyke sore burthen heuy beare woundes stynke corrupte thorowe folyshenesse brought greate trouble mysery go morninge al daye long loynes fylled sore dysese whole parte body feble sore smyten haue tored dysquyetnes hert lorde thou knowest desyre gronynge nat hyd herte panteth strength hath fayled lyght myne eye gone fro iob xix • louers neighbour dyd stande lokynge vpon trouble kinsman stode farre also sought lyfe layed snare wente aboute euyl talked wickednesse imagined dysceate daye longe like deafe man herde nat one domme whiche dothe nat open mouth euen man heareth nat whose mouth reprofes lorde haue put trust yu shalt answere lord god haue requyred y• ⚜ euen enemyes shuld nat tryūphe ouer whā fote slypte reioysed greatly agaynste truly set plage heuynesse euer syghte wyll confesse wyckednesse sory synne myne enemyes lyue myghtye hate wrongfully many nombre also rewarde euel good agaynste folowe thynge good forsake nat lorde god nat thou farre fro haste helpe lorde ⚜ god saluacyon ¶ xxxix psalme ¶ chaunter ☞ ieduthun psalme dauid sayde wyll take hede wayesdixi custodiam offende nat tonge wyll kepe mouthe brydle whyle vngodly syghte helde tonge spake nothynge kepte sylence yee euen good wordes payne grefe herte hote within whyle thus musynge fyre kyndled last spake tong psal x • • lorde let knowe myne ende nombre dayes maye certyfyed howe longe haue lyue iob vii • viii • beholde thou haste made dayes spanne longe myne age euen nothynge respecte veryly euery man lyuynge together vanite salah man walketh vayne shadowe disquyeteth hym selfe vayne heapeth vp ryches luke x •• • nat tell shall gather nowe lorde hope trulye hope euen delyuer myne offence make nat rebuke vnto foolyshe became domme opened nat mouthe thy doynge take thy plage awaye fro euen consumed meanes thy heauye hande thou rebuke doste chasten man synne thou makeste bewty consume away lyke mothe euery man therfore vanyte selah heare prayer lorde thyne eares cō sydre callynge holde nat thy peace teares pat 〈◊〉 • straūger songeouer father oh spare lytle may recouer strength god hence nomore sene ¶ xl psalme ¶ chaunter psalme dauid wayted pacyently lorde enclyned vnto hearde callynge brought also horrible pytte myre claye sette fete vpon rocke ordred goynges hathe put newe songe mouth euen thankesgeuynge vnto oure god many shall se feare shall put theyr trust lorde expec • •• s▪ ex blessed man hathe set hope lorde turned vnto proude suche go aboute lye lorde god great thy wonderous workes whiche thou haste done lyke also thy thoughtes whiche v warde yet man ☞ ordreth vnto yf wolde declare speake shulde mo able expresse • e • xvii b sacryfyce meat ••• xv • offerynge yu woldest nat haue ☞ ⚜ myne eares haste thou opened burnt offerynges sacrifice synne haste thou nat required sayde lo come ☞ volume boke wrytten shulde fulfyll thy wyll god contente yee thy lawe within • erie haue declared thy ryghteousnesse greate congregacyon lo wyll nat retrayne lyppes lord thou knowest haue nat hyd thy rygtuousnes within herte talkyng hathe ben thy trueth thy saluacyon haue kepte backe thy louyng mercy trueth great congregacion withdraw nat thou thy mercy fro lorde let thy louynge kyndnesse thy trueth alwaye preserue innumerable trouble come aboute synnes haue taken suche holde vpon nat able loke vp yee mo nombre heares hede hert hath fayled lorde let thy pleasure delyuer make haste lorde helpe let ashamed confoūded▪ togyther seke ☞ soule destroye let fal backewarde put buke wishe euyll let desolate rewarded wt shame saye vnto fye vpon fy vpon let al seke ioyfull glad let suche loue thy saluacyon say alway lorde praysed pore nedy lorde careth thou arte helper redemer make longe taryinge god ¶ xlj psalme ¶ chaunter▪ psalme dauidbeatus qui intel blessed prou 14 y• cōsidreth y• ☞ pore ⚜ nedy y• lorde shall delyuer hym tyme trouble lorde preserue hym kepe alyue maye blessed vpon earth delyuer nat thou hī wyll enemyes lorde comforte lyeth sycke vpon bedde make thou al bed sickenes sayde lorde mercyful vnto hele soule haue synned agaynst myne enemyes speake euyll shall dye name perishe yf come se speaketh vanite hert cōceyueth falshode within selfe whan commeth forthe telleth myne enemyes whisper togyther agaynst euē agaynst ymagyn euyl let sentence gyltynesse procede agaynste nowe lyeth let rise vp yee euen mine owne famylier thou forgotten go thus heuely enemye oppresseth bone smyten asunder whyle myne enemyes ⚜ trouble cast tethe namely whyle sayde daylye vnto nowe thy god art thou vexed soule art thou dysquieted within trouble psal 〈…〉 soule brought lowe euen vnto dust belye cieueth vnto grounde aryse helpe v delyuer v thy mercy sake ¶ xlv psalme ¶ excell amonge •••• e instruccyon chyldren lorah songe loueeruct • uit co • ▪ herte endytynge good mater speake thiges whiche haue made vnto kynge tong pēne redy wryter ⚜ thou arte fayrer chyldren men ful grace thy lyppes god hath blessed euer girde thy swerde vpon thy thigh thou moste myghty accordynge thy worshype renowne good lucke haue thou thyne honour ryde worde treuthe mekenesse ryghteousnesse thy ryght hande shall teach rerrible thynges thy arrowes sharpe people shalbe subdued vnto euen myddest amonge kynges enemyes •• b • • thy seate god endureth euer scepter thy kyngdome ryght scepter thou hast loued ryghteousnesse hated iniquite wherfore god euen thy god hathe anoyted oyle gladnes aboue thy felowes thy garmentes smell myrre aloe cassia yuerye palace wher haue made glade kynges daughter amonge thy honorable wemen vpon thy ryght hande dyd stande quene vesture gold ⚜ wrought dyuerse colour herken daughter consydre enclyne thyne eare forget also thine owne people thy father house shal yc kynge haue pleasure thy bewtye thy lorde ⚜ god worshype thou hym daughter tire shall gyfte lyke ryche also amonge people shall make theyr supplicacyon kynges daughter gloryous within clothynge wrought golde shal brought vnto kynge raymente nydle worke virgin felowes shall beare company shalbe brought vnto ioye gladnesse shal brought shal entre kynges palace steade thy father thou shalt haue chyldren thou mayest make prince landes wyll well knowen palace sure refuge lo kynges ⚜ earth gathered gone together merueled se thinges astonyed sodeynly caste downe feare came vpon sorowe vpon woman trauayle thou shalt breake shyppes see thorowe east wynde lyke haue herd haue sene citye lord hostes cytye oure god god vpholdeth euer sela wayte thy louing kyndnesse god y• myd dest thy rēple god according vnto thy name thy prayse vnto worldes ende thy right hand ful righteous ne let mounte sion reioyse daughter iuda glad thy iudgemētes walke sion go round tell towres therof marke well bulwerkes set vp house ye maye tel come god oure god e • er euer shall oure gyde vnto death ¶ xlix psalme ¶ chaunter psalme chyldren lorahaudite oēs gētes hec heare al ye people pōdre youre eares ye dwell worlde hye lowe ryche poore one another mouth shal speake wysdome hert shall muse vnderstandynge wyll enclyne myne eare parable shewe darcke speach vpon harpe wherfore shulde feare dayes wyckednesse wyckednesse heles cōpaseth roūde psal li • b luke xii c trust theyr abundaunce boast selues multitude theyr rychesse man maye delyuer brother make agrement vnto god hym 1 petr c 1 ioh ii • costeth redeme theyr soules must let alone euer • ee though lyue longe se nat graue eccle il c▪ iii seeth wyse men also dye peryshe togeyther wel ignoraunt folysh ioh • 7 luke xii c leaue theyr ryches yet thinke theyr house shal continue euer theyr dwellynge place shal endure frō one generacion another callyng landes theyr owne name neuerthelesse man wyll nat abyde honoure seynge may compared vnto beastes peryshe waye theyr folyshnesse theyr posterite prayse theyr sayeng sela lye hell lyke shepe death gnaweth vpō thē ryghteous shall haue dominacyon mornyng theyr bewtye shall consume sepulchre theyr dwellynge god shall delyuer soule place hell shall receaue sela nat thou afrayed though one made ryche yf glorye house increased iob 27 shal cary nothynge awaye hym dyeth nether shal pompe folowe whyle lyued coūted hym selfe happye man ☞ longe y• doest well vnto thy selfe mē wyll speake good shall folowe generacion father shal neuer se light man beyng honoure hath vnderstandynge compared vnto beastes peryshe ¶ l psalme ¶ psalme asaph lorde euen myghtie god hathe spoken called worlde rysynge vp sonne vnto goynge downe therof • ▪ ••• tum 〈◊〉 syonesa 〈◊〉 • hathe god apeared perfecte bewtye oure god shall come shall kepe sylence shall go hym cō sumynge fyre myghtye tempest shal stered vp rounde aboute hym shall call heauen aboue earth maye iudge hys people gather saynctes togeyther vnto haue made couenaunt sacrifyce heauens shal declare hys ryghtuousnesse god iudge hym selfe sela heare people wyll speake selfe wyll testifye agaynste israell god euen thy god wy • reproue thy sacrifice thy burnt offerynges nat way esay • • amos v l • actes vii • wyl take bullocke thy house goates thy foldes beastes forest myne cattell vpon thousande hylles knowe foules vpon mountaynes wylde beastes felde syght hongrye wyll nat tell e ••• 〈◊〉 ▪ • psal • 4 • • co ••• •• whole worlde myne y• therin thynkeste thou wyll eate bulles flesshe drincke bloude goates offre vnto god thankes geuynge paye thy vowes vnto moste hyghest 2 pa • • 5 • cal vppon tyme trouble wyll heare thou shalte prayse vnto vngodly sayde god doest thou preache lawes takest couenaunt thy mouth thou hatest refourmed haste cast wordes behynde whā thou sawest thefe thou consentedest vnto hym haste bene partaker aduouterers thou hast let thy mouth speake wickednesse thy tong thou hast set forth disceyt thou sattest spakest agaynst thy brother yee hast sclaūdred thine owne mother sonne thinges haste thou done helde tonge y• thoughtest ⚜ wickedly euē one thy selfe wyl proue set thynges thou hast done consydre ye y• forget god lest plucke away none delyuer offreth thākes praise honoureth y• ordreth conuersacion right wyll shewe saluacyon god • li psalme ¶ chaunter • psalme dauid prophet nathan came vnto gone bethsave 〈…〉 saluacyon verely strength saluacyon defence shall nat greatly fall howe longe wyl ye ymagyne myschefe agaynste euery mā ye shalbe stayne al sorte yee tottryng wall shall ye lyke brokē hedge theyr deuyce onely howe put god wyl exalte theyr delyte lye geue good wordes theyr mouthe curse theyr hert sela neuerthelesse soule wayte thou still vpō god hope truly strēgth saluaciō defence shall nat fall god healthe glory rocke might god trust put trust hym alwaye ye people reg • c p • xlii powre youre hertes god oure hope sela chyldren men vayne chyldren men bisceatfull vpon weyghtes al togeyther lyghter thā vanyte selfe truste wronge robbery gyue youre selues vnto vanyte yt ryches encrese set nat youre hert vpon god spake twyse haue also hearde power belongeth vnto god thou lorde arte mercyfull psal 18 • mat xii • thou rewardest euery man accordynge worke ¶ lxiij psalme ¶ psalme dauid wyldernes iuda god thou art god early wyll ideus de u meus▪ seke soule thrusteth flesshe also longethe baren drye lande water thus haue loked holynesse myght beholde thy power glory thy louynge kyndnesse better lyfe selfe lyppes shall prayse longe lyue wyll magnyfye maner lyft vp handes thy name soule shalbe satisfied euen wt mary fatnes mouthe prayseth ioyefull lyppes haue nat remembred bedde thought vpon whan wakynge thou haste bene helper therfore vnder shadowe thy wynges wyll reioyse soule hāgeth vpon thy ryght hande hath vpholden also seke hurte soule shall go lower partes earthe let thē fal vpon edge swerde y• may porcion fox y• kynge shal reioyse god deu vi c also y• swere hym shalbe cōmended mouth chat speake lye shalbe stopped ¶ lxiiij psalme ¶ chaunter psalme dauyd heare voyce god praerex • udi deus oracionem preserue lyfe fere enemy hyde gatherynge togyther frowarde insurrection wicked doer whiche haue whee theyr tonge lyke swerde shote theyr arrowes euen bytter wordes may pryu ••• shote whiche perfect sodenly hyt feare nat courage selues mischeife commune amonge selues howe may laye snare say man shal se ymagin wickednes practyse yt kepe secrete among selues euery man y• depe hert god shall sodenly shote swifte arow y• shalbe wounded yee theyr owne tonges shall make fall much y• seeth shall laugh scorne men se shall saye hathe god done shall perceaue hys worke ryghteous shall reioyse lorde put trust true herte shalbe glad ¶ lxv psalme partes erth shalbe afrayed thy tokēs thou makest ☞ goynges mornyng euenyng prayse thou visitest earth blessest thou makest plenteous ryuer god full water thou preparest corne thou prouydest earthe thou waterest forowes thou sendest rayne ī litle valley therof thou makest softe droppes raine blessest increase thou crownest yere wt thy goodnesse thy cloudes droppe fatnesse shal droppe vpon therof ruleth power euer eies behold y• people wyl nat beleue shal nat able exalte selues sela prayse oure god ye people make voice prayse heard holdeth soule lyfe suffreth nat fete slyp thou god haste proued v thou also haste tryed v lyke syluer tryed thou broughtest v snare layed trouble vpon loynes thou suffredest men ryde ouer oure heades e • ▪ • • • went thorow fyre water y• broughtest v father fatherlesse defendeth cause wydowes euen god holy habitacion god maketh men one minde house bryngeth prisoner captiuite letteth rennagates conty nue scarcenesse god exod xiii nume▪ 14 c esay sinai ephe 4 b thou art gone hye thou hast led captiuyte captyue receaued gyftes men yee euen thyne enemyes lorde god myght dwell amōge praysed lorde dayly euen god whiche helpeth v poureth benefytes vpon v sela oure god euē god commeth salua cyon god lorde escape death god shall woūde heade hys enemy heary scalpe one goth styll ī wyckednes lorde hath sayde wyll bryng people agayn dyd basan kyndnesse cōfortable turne vnto accordynge vnto multitude thy mercyes hyde nat thy face thy sernaūt trouble haste drawe nye vnto soule delyuer oh saue myne enemyes▪ thou haste knowen reprofe shame dyshonour▪ myne aduersaries al ī thy fight rebuke hath broken hert full heuynes loked haue pitye vpon man nether foūde conforte mat 27 b iob xix f gaue gall eate thyrsty gaue vineger drynke rom xi b thē let thy wrathful displeasure take holde mat 23 • cies c let theyr habitacion voyde man dwell theyr tentes persecute hym thou hast smytē talke howe may vexe thē thou hast wounded let fall frō vnto god voyce euē vnto god wyll crye voyce shall herken vnto tyme trouble sought lorde sore ran ceassed nat nyght ceasō soule refused comforte heuynesse wyll thynke vpon god herte vex • wyll complayne sela thou holdest myne eye wakynge feble speake haue consydred dayes olde yeres paste call remembraunce songe nyght cōmune myne owne herte searche spretes wyll lorde absente hym selfe euer right hāde moste hyest wyll remembre workes lorde psal 43 • call mynde thy wonder olde tyme wyll thynke also thy workes talkynge shalbe thy doynges ☞ thy waye god holy greate god • god thou art god dothe • wonder hast declared thy power amōge people thou haste myghtely delyuered thy people euen sonnes iacob ioseph sela water sawe god water sawe afrayed y• deapthes also troubled cloudes poured water ayer thondered thyne arowes wente abrode voyce thy thonder hearde rounde aboute thy lyghteninges st one vpon grounde earthe moued shoke thy waye see thy pathes greate water thy fotesteppes nat xiii • wyll declare harde se •• ēses olde whiche haue harde knowē de •• iii • • v • b • ti • ephe 〈◊〉 • suche oure father haue tolde v shulde nat hyde chyldren generacyons come shewe honour lord might wonderfull workes hath done made couenaunte iacob gaue israel lawe exo xii iosu iiii • whiche commaunded oure forfathers teache theyr childrē theyr posterite myght knowe chyldren whiche yet vnborne thintent came vp myght shewe chyldren myght put theyr trust god nat forget workes god kepe commaundementes e • eth • x c 〈◊〉 3 •• forfathers exo xiiii faithlesse stubburne generacyon generacyon set nat herte ryght whose sprete cleued nat stedfastly vnto god lyke ☞ chyldren ephraim whiche beynge harnessed caryenge bowes turned thē selues backe daye batayll kepte nat couenaunte god wolde nat walke lawe forgate done wonderfull worckes shewed maruelous thynges dyd syghte oure father lande egipte euen felde zoan exo xiiii • deuyded see broughte thorowe made water stande heape num xx b daye tyme also led cloude nyghte thorowe lyghte tyre cloaue exo 17 v • harde rockes wyldernesse gaue drynke therof bene greate deapth broughte water • • x • stony rocke gusshed lyke riuers yet synned hym prouoked mooste hyest wyldernes tempted god theyr hertes requyred meate theyr luste spake agaynst god also sayenge shall god prepare exo xvi b num • xi table wylder nesse • sinote stony rocke dede y• water gusshed streames flowed geue bred also prouyde flesh people whē y• lorde hearde thys wroth fyre kyndled iacob ther came vp heuy dyspleasure agaynste israel beleued nat god put nat theyr trust helpe commaūded cloudes aboue opened dores heauen rayned downe māna also vpon thē eate gaue exo xvi b • en viii • sap • vi iohn vi foode frō heauen man dyd eate ☞ angel fode sente meate ynough caused east winde blowe vnder heauen thorow power brought y• south west wynde ex •• xvi num • xi g rayned flesh vpō thicke dust fethered foules lyke sande see let fall amonge tentes euēroūde aboute habitacyon dyd eate well fylled gaue thē owne desyre nat disapoynted luste nume xi g whyle meate yet mouthes y• heuy wrath god came vpon thē flewe welthiest thē yee smote downe chosen men israell nu xiiii synned yet beleued nat wonderous worckes therfore theyr dayes dyd consume vanyte yeares • trouble nume xi g lori x slewe sought hym turned early enquered god remēbred god theyr strength hye god wrs theyr redemer neuerthelesse dyd flatter hym theyr mouthe dyssembled hym theyr tonge herte nat whole hym nether contynued stedfast couenaunte mercyfull forgaue theyr mysdedes destroyed nat yee many tyme turned hys wrathe awaye wolde nat suffre whole dyspleasure aryse psal • iii • consydered y• flesh euē mynde passeth awaye commeth nat agayne many tyme dyd prouoke y• wyldernesse greued deserte turned backe tempted god moued holy one israel thought nat hande y• daye delyuered thē hande enemye howe wrought myracles egipte wondres felde zoan exo vii turned theyr water bloude myght nat drynke ryuers exo viii sent lyce amonge thē deuoured vp ‡ frogges destroye thē gaue theyr frutes vnto exo viii b eatyr pyller theyr laboure vnto greshopper exod x • exod ix • destroied theyr vynes wt hayle stone theyr mulbery tree frost exod ix • smote theyr eatel also haile stone flockes hote thonder boltes cast vpon thē furyousnesse hys wrath anger displeasure trouble sent euyl angel among exod •• made away indignacion spared nat theyr soule death gaue theyr lyfe ouer pestylence exod 〈◊〉 ▪ psal 〈◊〉 ▪ 135 b smote fyrst borne egipt moste pryncipall myghtyest ☞ y• dwellynges ham owne people leade forth lyke shepe caried thē y• wyldernesse lyke flocke brought safely shulde nat feare ouer whelined theyr enemyes see brought within border sanctuary ☞ euē dwellyngesquam di le • ta ta beenacula thou lorde hostes soule hath desyre longinge entre courtes lorde herte flesshe reioyse lyuynge god yee sparow hath sounde house swalowe neste maye laye yonge euen thy aulters lorde hostes kynge god blessed dwell thy house wyl waye praysynge sela blessed man whose strength whose herte thy wayes whiche goynge thorowe vale sery vse wel pole fylled water wyll go strength vnto god goddes appeareth euery one sion lorde god hostes heare prayer herken god iacob sela beholde god oure defender loke vpon face thyne anoynted one day thy courtes better thosande psalme ¶ chaunter psalme sonnes lorah lorde thou arte become gracyous vnto thy lande thou haste turned away captyuyte iacob thou haste forgyuen offence thy people benedixisti on̄e coueredpsal 32 • theyr synnes sela thou haste taken awaye thy dyspleasure turned thy selfe thy wrathfull indingnacion turne v god sauyour let thyne angre ceasse v wylt thou displeased v euer wylte thou stretche thy wrath one generacion another wylte thou turne agayne quycken v thy people maye reioyse shewe v thy mercy lorde graunte v thy saluacyon wyll herken lorde god wyl say ⚜ concerning shal speake peace vnto people sayntes y• turne nat agayne folyshnes saluacion nye feare glorye may dwel lande mercy trueth met togither ryghtuousnesse peace haue kyssed eche truth shal floryshe earth ryghtuousnes hath loked downe fro heauen yee lorde shall shewe louynge kyndnesse lande shall gyue encrease ryghtuousnesse shall go ☞ shall directe goynge waye ¶ lxxxvj psalme ¶ prayer dauyd bowe downe thyne eare lorde neare pore misery preserue thou soule holye god saue thy seruaunt putteth trust mercyful vnto lord wyll call daylye vpon comforte soule thy seruaunte vnto lorde lyft vp soule inclina dn̄e autē thouero 34 • amonge goddes none lyke vnto lorde nat one thou doest al nacyons thou hast made shal come worshyppe lorde shall glorify thy name thou arte great doest wō derous thinges thou arte god alone teache thy way lorde wyll walke thy trueth knytte hert vnto maye feare thy name wyll thanke lorde god herte wyll prayse thy name euer greate thy mercy towarde psa xxix • thou hast delyuered soule nethermoste hell god proude rysen agaynste congregacions noughtie men haue sought soule haue nat set theyr eies exo 34 iere xxxi 2 par 30 b thou lorde god arte full compassion mercy long suffryng plentuous goodnes trueth turne vnto haue mercy vpon geue thy strength vnto thy seruaunt saue sonne thyne handmayde shewe token vpon good whiche hate maye se ashamed thou lord hast helped comforted ¶ lxxxvii psalme ¶ psalme songe sonnes lorah foundacions vpon holyefūdamē ta eius hylles lorde loueth gate syon dwellynges iacob uery excellente thynges spoken thou cyte god selah wyll thynke vpon rahab babylon knowe beholde yee phylistynes also tyre moryans lo borne syon shalbe reported borne moste hyest shall stablysh lorde shall rehearse whan wryteth vp people borne selah ☞ syngers also trompetters shal rehearse fresh sprynges shalbe ¶ lxxxviij psalme ¶ songe psalme sonnes lorah chaunter ☞ vpon mahelath geue thankes instruccion heman ezrahyte lorde god saluacyon haueosie deus salutis cryed daye nyght oh let prayer entre thy presence enclyne thyne eare vnto callynge soule ful trouble lyfe draweth nye vnto hell counted one go downe vnto pyrte haue bene euen man y• hath strēgth fre amonge deade lyke vnto wounded slepynge graue whithe remembraunce cut awaye thy hande thou haste layde lowest pitte darke depe place thyne dygnacyon lyeth harde vpō thou haste vexed thy stormes selah thou haste put awaye myne acquayntaūce farte fro made abhorred faste prysō nat get forth syght fayleth trouble lorde haue called dayly vpon haue stretched myne handes vnto psal 6 esa 38 wylt thou shew wonder amonge deade shal deed ryse vp agayne prayse • sela shall thy louynge kyndnes shewed graue thy faithfulnesse destruccyon shall thy wonderous workes knowen darke thy ryghtuousnes lande forgetfulnesse ☞ unto haue cryed lorde early shall prayer come lorde abhorrest thou soule hydest thou thy face fro mysery lyke vnto hym poynte dye euen fro youth vp thy terrours haue suffred troubled mynde thy wrathfull dyspleasure goeth ouer feare hathe vndone came rounde aboute daylye lyke water compased geyther euery syde louers frendes haste thou put awaye fro hyd myne acquayntaūce syght ¶ another sela lorde psal 19 heauens shall prayse thy wonderous workes thy trueth congregacyon saynctes amonge cloudes shal compared vnto lorde psal 86 b amonge chyldren goddes shalbe lyke vnto lorde god greatly feared councell sayntes reuerence aboute hym lorde god hostes lyke vnto thy trueth moste myghtye lorde euery syde ero 14 b math 8 thou rulest ragyng see thou styllest waues therof aryse thou hast subdued egypte destroyed thou haste scatred thyne enemyes abroade thy myghtye arme heauens thyne earth also thyne thou haste layed foundacyon rounde worlde al therin thou haste made north south tabor hermon shall reioyse thy name thou hast myghtie arme strong thyne hande hye thy ryght hande ryghteousnes equyte habytacyon thy seate mercy trueth shall go thy face blessed people lorde reioyse shall walke lyghte thy countenaunce theyr delyte shalbe daylye thy name thy ryghteousnesse shal make theyr boste thou art y• glory theyr strength thy louyng kyndnesse yu shalt lyfte vp horne esaic 1 lorde defēce holy one israel kyng thou spakest somtyme vysions vnto thy saīctes saidest haue layed help vpō one y• mighti haue exalted one chosen people actes 13 1 reg 10 b 2 reg 5 haue foūde dauid seruaunt holy oyle haue anointed hande shal holde hym faste myne arme shal strengthen hym enemye shall nat able hym vyolence sonne wyckednesse shal nat hurte hym shall smyte downe foe face plage thē hate trueth also mercy shalbe hym name shall horne exalted • 8 • wyll set dominion also see ryght hande floudes shall call thou art father god sure saluacyon wyll make hym fyrst borne hyer thē kynges earth mercy wyll kepe hym euermore couenaunte shall stande fast hym sede also wyll make endure euer hys trone dayes heauen yf chyldren forsake lawe walke nat iudgementes 3 reg 9 b breake statute kepe nat commaundementes exo 10 wyll vyset theyr offence rodde theyr synne scourge neuerthelesse louynge kyndnesse wyll nat vtterly take hym suffre trueth fayle couenaunt wyll nat breake alter thynge gone lyppes haue sworne holynesse •• •• 7 • wyll nat fayle dauid hys sede shall endure euer hys seate lyke pr lxxii • sonne shall stande faste euermore moone ☞ faythful wytnesse heauen selah thou haste abhorred saken thyne anoynted arte dyspleased hym thou haste broken couenaunt thy seruaunt caste crowne grounde thou haste ouerthrowne hedgespsal • 8 b broken downe stronge holdes go way spoyle become rebuke vnto hys neyghbours thou hast set vp ryght hande enemy made al aduersaryes • oyse thou hast takē awaye edge hꝭ swerde geuest nat victory battayle thou hast put glory cast hys trone downe y• grounde dayes youth hast thou shortened couered wt dishonoure selah lord lōge wilt thou hyde thy sel • e euer shal thy wrath burne lyke fyre remembre shorte tyme wherfore hast yu made al • naught gene 2 c man liueth shal nat se death shall delyuer owne soule frō hande hell selah lorde thy olde louing kindness yu sworest vnto dauyd thy truethe remember lorde rebuke y• thy seruauntes haue beare bosome thy rebuke many people wherwith thyne enemy haue blasphemed sclaunder fotesteppes thyne anoynted praysed lorde euermore amen amen ¶ xc psalme ¶ prayer moseo man god lorde thou haste bene oure refugedomine refugium one generacyon another mountaynes broughte forthe euer earthe worlde made thou arte god euerlastynge worlde without ende thou causest man returne vnto contrycion agayne thou sayest come agayne ye chyldren men 2 cor 7 • 2 pet 3 b thousande yeares thy syghte yestardaye seinge past watch nyght sone thou scatrest euen slepe fade away sodenly lyke grasse mornynge grene groweth vp euenynge cut downe ⚜ dryed vp wythered consume awaye thy displeasure afrayed thy wrathfull indignacyon thou haste set oure mysdedes secrete synnes lyght thy countenaunce thou arte angrye oure dayes gone brynge yeares ende tale tolde dayes oure age thre score yeares ten though men stronge come foure score yeares yet theyr strength laboure sorowe soone passeth awaye gone ▪but regardeth power thy wrath euen therafter man feareth thy dyspleasure psal 39 • teach v nombre oure dayes maye applye oure hertes vnto wysdome turne agayne lorde laste gracyous vnto thy seruauntes satysfye v thy mercy soone shall reioyse glad al dayes oure lyfe comforte v agayne nowe tyme thou haste plaged v yeares wherin haue suffred aduersyte shewe thy seruauntes thy worke theyr chyldren thy glory gloryous maiesty lorde oure god vpon v prospere thou worcke oure handes vpon v prospere thou oure handy worcke xcj psalme dwelleth vnder defence moste hyghest shall abide vnder • ui habi • shadowe almyghtye wyll saye vnto lorde thou arte hope stronge holde god hym wyll truste shall delyuer snare hunter frome noysome pestylence shal defende vnder wynge thou shalte safe vnder hys fethers faythfulnesse trueth shall thy shylde buckeler thou shalte nat afrayed tertour nyght arrowe flyeth daye pestylence walketh darkenesse syckenesse destroyeth noone day thousande shall fall besyde ten thousāde thy ryght hande shal nat come nye yee thyne eye shalte thou beholde se rewarde vngodly thou lorde arte hope thou hast set thyne house defence hye shal euyl happen vnto neither shall plage come nye thy dwellyng mat 4 • luke 4 b shall geue angel charge ouer kepe thy wayes shall beare theyr handes thou hurt nat thy fote agaynst stone thou shalt go vpon lyon adder yonge lyon dragon shalt thou treade vnder thy fete hath set loue vpon therfore shal deliuer shal set hi vp hathe knowen name psal 4 • shall call vpon wyl heare yee trouble wyll delyuer hym bryng hym honoure longe lyfe wyl satysfye hym shewe hym saluacion ¶ xcij psalme ¶ psalme • onge sabboth dayebonu • est cōfiteri hebr xiii good thynge gyue thankes vnto lor • e synge prayses vnto thy name moste hyghest tell thy louynge kyndnesse earely mornynge thy trueth nyght season upon instrumente ten strynges vpon lute vpon lowde instrument vpon harpe thou lorde haste made glad tho rowe thy workes wyll reioyse genynge prayse operacions thy handes lorde howe glorious thy workes thy thoughtes depe v • wyse man doth nat well cōsydre foole doth nat vnderstande whā vngodly grene grasse whā worker wyckednes florish thē shal destroyed • uer y• lord arte hyest euer lo thyne enemyes lorde lo thyne ennemies shall perishe worker wickednes shalbe destroyed horne shalbe exalted like horne unicorne anointed fresh oyle myne eye also shall se luste myne enemyes myne care shall heare desyre wycked ryse vp agaynst ryghtuous shall floryshe lyke palme tree shall sprede abrode lyke cedre libanꝰ suche planted house lorde shall floryshe courtes ⚜ house god shall also bryng frute age shalbe fat well lykinge may shewe true lorde strēgth vnryghtuousnesse ¶ xciij psalme lorde kynge hath put glorious apparell lorde hath put apparell gyrded selfe strength dūs tegnauit hath made roūde worldepsal 24 • sure nat moued euer syns worlde beganne hath thy seate ben prepared thou arte euerlastynge psa x • vi floudes rysen lorde floudes haue lyfte vp theyr noyse floudes lyfte vp waues waues see myghtye rage horrybly yet lorde dwelleth hye myghtyer thy testymonyes lorde sure holynesse becommeth thyne house deseruynge lorde howe long shal vngodly long shal vngodly triūphe howe longe shal wicked doer speake disdaifully make suche proude bostyng smyte downe thy people lorde trouble thyne herytage murthur wydowe straūger put fatherlesse death yet say tushe psal 23 b lorde shal se nether shal y• god iacob regard take hede ye vnwyse amonge y• people ye fooles wyll ye vnderstande y• planted care shall heare y• made eye shall nat se y• nurtureth hethen y• techeth mā knowledge shal nat punysh 1 corin 3 lorde knoweth y• thoughtes men y• vayne blessed man whome y• chastenest lorde teachest thy lawe thou mayste geue pacyence tyme aduersyte vntyll pyt dygged vp vngodly lorde wyll nat fayle people neither wyl forsake hys inherytaunce untyll ryghtuousnes turne agayne vnto iudgement al suche true herte shall folowe wyll ryse vp agaynst wycked wyl take parte euyl doer thou lorde nat helped nat fayled soule bene put sylence psal 32 b iob xiii • luke xv whan sayde fote hath slypped thy mercy lorde helde vp • iohn̄ • b 2 • • • n multitude sorowes herte thy comfortes haue refresshed soule wylte thou haue thynge wt stole wyckednes whiche ymagineth myschefe lawe gather together agaynste soule ex ultemus ephe v let v hertely reioise strength saluacion let v come hys presēce thanckesgeuynge shewe selfe glad psalmes lorde greate god great kynge aboue al goddes hande al corner earth heightes hye stomake wyl nat suffre hym myne eye loke vnto faythfull lande maye dwell leadeth godly lyfe shalbe seruaunte shall dysceytfull persone dwell house telleth lye shall nat tary syght shal sone remembraūce dyssobedient see euen reed see neuertheles helped hys name sake myght make hys power konwne 1 pa • 16 psal 〈◊〉 1 mac 4 e iudith 13 c esay xii rebuked reed see also dryed vp led thorowe depe thorowe wyldernesse saued aduersaryes hande delyuered hande enemye psal 〈◊〉 • thoseexo xiiii • troubled water ouer whelmed nat one lefte exo xv • beleued wordes sange prayse vnto hym within whyle forgat workes wolde nat abyde councell luste came vpon wyldernesse tēpted god deserte gaue theyr desyre sent leanesse withall theyr soule angred moyses also tentes aaron sayncte lorde num 1 • • earth opened swalowed dathan couered congre gacyon aberam fyre kyndled theyr company flame brente vp vngodly exodi • 2 • 1 cor 1 • • made calfe horeb worshipped molten ymage rom 1 • thus turned theyr glory simylytude calfe eateth haye forgat god theyr sauioure done great thynges egypte wonderous workes lande ham fearful thinges reed see sayde wolde haue destroyed thē nat moses chosen stande hym gappe turne awaye wraythful indig nacyon leste shulde destroye num 14 • ye thought scorne ye pleasaunt lande gaue credence vnto worde murmured theyr tentes herkened nat vnto voyce lorde lyfte vp hande agaynst thē ouerthrowe wildernes cast theyr sede amonge naciōs scater landes num 15 • io • x •••• 1 cor • • ioyned selues vnto baal peor eate thofferinges deed thus prouoked vnto anger theyr owne inuenciōs plage greate amonge num x ••• stode vp phinehes prayed plage ceased counted vnto righteousnesse amonge po sterites euermore exo xv •• • num • 〈◊〉 • angred hym also water stryfe punyshed moses theyr sake ꝓuoked hissprete y• spake vnaduisedly lyppes nether destroied heathen deut vii xii iudi • 〈◊〉 lorde commaunded myngled among heathen lerned theyr workes muche worshypped theyr ydolles whiche turned theyr owne decay deut • 32 • leuiti xx yee offred theyr sōnes doughters vnto deuils 4 reg 22 iere vii deut 18 b iere 4 4 b eze xx 8 shed innocent bloude euen bloude theyr sonnes doughters whome offred vnto ydols canaan lande defyled bloude thus stayned theyr owne workes wente whorynge theyr owne inuencions therfore wrath lorde kyndled agaynste people moche abhorred hys owne enheritaunce gaue ouer hande heathen hated lordes ouer enemyes oppressed thē subieccion many tyme dyd delyuer rebelled theyr owne inuencions brought downe wyckednesse neuerthelesse sawe aduersyte herde cōplaynte thought vpon couenaunt deu xxx pytied accordyng vnto multitude mercy yee made al led waye captiue pytie delyuer v lorde god gather v among heathen may geue thankes thy holy name glory thy prayse luke 1 • blessed lord god israel euerlastyng worlde without ende let people say amē amen prayse y• lorde ¶ cvii psalmecōfitemi 〈◊〉 • ̄o 1 par 16 b psal cv cvi 1 • 4 iudith 13 c esay xii gyue thankes vnto lord gracyous mercy endureth euer let geue thankes whome lorde hathe redemed delyuered hande enemye gathered lādes easte west north south went straye wyldernesse way founde cytie dwell hongrie thrysty soule faynted cried vnto lorde theyr trouble deliuered thē theyr distresse led forthe ryght waye yt myght go cyte dwelt men wolde therfore prayse y• lorde goodnes declare wonder ye doth chyldrē men exod 16 deu viii • satisfyed yt emptye soule fylled hongry soule goodnes syt darckenes shadow death beyng fast bounde myserye yron rebelled agaynst wordes ye lorde lyghtly regarded councel hygest also brought downe hert thorowe heuinesse fel downe none helpe whan cryed vnto lorde trouble delyuered distres brought darckenesse shadow death brake bondes sonder men wolde therfore praise lorde goodnesse declare wōders doth child men hath broken gate brasse smyten • ac • e yron sō der folysh men plaged theyr offeice theyr wyckednesse soule abhorred al maner meane euen harde deathes dore whā cryed vnto lorde trouble delyuered theyr dystresse mat viii • sent worde healed saued theyr destruccyon men wolde therfore prayse ye lorde goodnesse declare wonder doth chyldren men heb •• 13 eccle 35 • actes • rom xii • ▪ philip 4 b wolde offre vnto hym sacrifice thankesgeuynge tel hys workes wt gladnes go downe see shyppes occupye businesse greate water men se workes lorde wōders deape ionas 1 b hꝭ worde stormy wind ariseth whiche lyfteth vp waues therof caried vp heauen downe agayne deape soule mel telth awaye trouble rele fro stacker lyke droncken man theyr wittes ende whan crye vnto ye lord trouble delyuered thē distresse mat viii e maketh strome ceasse y• waues therof styll thē glad rest bringeth vnto hauen wolde men wolde therfore prayse lord goodnes declare wōdres yt doth chylden men wolde exalte hī also cōgregacyon people loue seate elder whiche turneth floudes wyldernesse3 reg 17 • dryeth vp water sprynges f • utfull lande maketh erth presence lorde presēce god iacob exod 17 b num 20 b turned y• hard rocke standynge water flynt stone spryngynge well ¶ cxv psalme vnto v lorde nat vnto v non nobꝭ domint vnto thy name geue prayse thy louing mercy thy truthes sake wherfore shal heathen saye nowe god oure god heauen hath done euer pleased theyr ydoles syluer goldepsal 135 c sapl xv baru vi euen worke mennes handes haue mouth speake eye haue se nat haue eares heare nat nose haue swel nat haue hādes hādle nat fete haue walke nat nether speake thorow theyr throte y• make lyke vnto suche put theyr trust ⚜ house israel trust thou lorde psal 79 c succour defencepsal▪ ix b ye house aaron put youre trust lorde helper defender ye feare lorde put trust lorde theyr helper defender lorde hathe bene myndfull v shall blesse call vpon name lorde lorde beseche delyuer soule gracyous lorde ryghteous yee god mercyfull▪ lord preserueth symple misery helped me▪ turne agayne vnto thy rest soule lorde hath rewarded psal lvi c thou hast delyuered soule death mine eies teares fete fallynge wyll walke lorde lande liuyng 2 corī 4 • beleued therfore wyl speake fore troubled sayd hast rom 3 men lyers reward shall geue vnto lorde benefytes ye hath done vnto wyll receaue cappe saluacyon cal vpon name lorde wyl paye vowes nowe presence al hys people ryght deare syght lorde death sayntes beholde lorde howe thy seruaunt thy
