house euen myddes ierusalem ¶ cxvii psalme ¶ prayse lordelaudate dominum rom xv b prayse y• lorde al ye heythē prayse ye nacyons psal c mercyfull kyndnes euer warde v truth lorde endureth euer ¶ cxviij psalme ¶ prayse lordecōfitemint dn̄o psal 105 and▪ 106▪ mat 4 • esay xil pat 16▪ bo geue thanckes vnto lorde hys gracyous hys mercy endureth euer let israell nowe confesse ⚜ gracyous hys mercy endureth euer let house aaron nowe confesse mercy endureth euer yee let nowe feare confesse mercy endureth euer called vpon lorde trouble lorde herd large hebre 13 b lord syde wyll nat feare man lorde taketh parte helpe therfore shal se desyre vpon myne enemyes better trust lord put cōfydence man better trust lorde put confydence prynces nacions compassed rounde y• name y• lorde wyl destroy thē kepte ī euery syde kept say euery syde name lorde wyll destroye came aboute lyke bee extincte euen fyre among thornes y• name lorde wyll destroye ☞ thou haste thrust sore myght fall lorde helpe exod xv esay xii lorde strength song become saluacion voyce ofioye healthe dwellynges ryghtuous ryght hande lord bringeth mightie thinges passe ryght hande lorde hath preemynence ryght hande y• lord bryngeth myghtye thynges passe wyll nat dye lyue declare workes lorde lorde hath chastened correcte hath nat geuē ouer vnto deth open gatꝭ ryghtuousnes may go geue thankes vnto lorde gate lord rightuous shall entre wyll thanke thou haste herde art become saluacion mat xxi c mat xii luke xx c actes 4 b stone whiche buylders refused become heade stone corner lordes doynge maruelous eye daye whiche lorde hathe made wyll reioyse glad helpe ⚜ nowe lorde lord sende v nowe prosperite mat xxi • luke xix f iohn̄ ▪ xii b mark xi b blessed commeth name lorde haue wisshed good lucke ye house lorde god lorde whiche hath shewed v lyght bynde sacrifice cordes ye euen vnto horne aultre thou arte god wyll thanke thou arte god▪ wyll praise geue thankes vnto lord gracyous mercy endureth euer ¶ c xix psalme bb • •• immaculati lessed vndefyled waye walke thepsal 1 lawe lorde blessed kepe testymonyes seke hym wyth theyre whole herte whiche wyckednesse walke wayes thou haste charged shulde dylygently kepe thy commaundementes wayes made directe might kepe thy statute shal confounded whyle haue respect vnto thy commaundementes wyll thanke vnfayned hert whan shall haue learned iudgementes thy ryghtuousnesse wyll kepe thy cerymonyes forsake nat vtterly shall yonge man clēse hys waye euen rulynge hym selfe thy worde whole herte haue sought let nat erre frome thy commaundementes deut vi b thy wordes haue hyd herte shulde nat synne agaynst blessed art thou lorde teache thy statute lyppes haue tolde iudgementes thy mouthe haue greate delyte waye thy testymonyes maner ryches wyll talke thy cō maundementes haue respecte vnto thy wayes delyte shalbe thy statute wyll nat forget thy worde well vnto thy seruaunte maye lyue kepe thy worde open thou myne eye may se wonderous thyngꝭ thy lawe gene xlvii iob xiiii b straūger vpon erth hyde nat thy commaundementes frome soule breaketh feruent desire hath alwaye vnto thy iudgemētes thou hast rebuked y• proude cursed erre frome thy cōmaundementes turne fro shame rebuke haue kepte thy testymonyes prynces also dyd syt speake thy seruaūt ocupied thy statute thy testymonyes delyte councelers psal 44▪ soule cleaueth dust quycken thou accordyng thy worde haue knowledged wayes thou herdeste teache thy statute make vnderstāde waye thy commaundementes shal talke thy wonderous worekes soule melteth awaye heuynesse cōforte thou accordynge vnto thy worde take fro waye lyenge cause y• make muche thy lawe haue chosen waye trueth thy iudgementes haue layed haue stycken vnto thy testymonyes lorde confounde nat wyll runne waye thy commaundementes thou hast set herte libertie teache lorde way thy statute shal kepe vnto ende geue vnderstandynge shall kepe thy lawe yee shall kepe whole herte make go path thy cōmaundementes desyre enclyne herte vnto thy testymonies nat couetousnes turne awaye myne eye left beholde vanite quycken y• thy waye stably thy word thy seruaunt maye feare take awaye rebuke afrayed thy iudgementes good beholde delyte thy commaundementes quicken thy ryghtuousnesse let thy louynge mercy come also vnto lorde euen thy saluacyon accordynge vnto thy worde shall make answere vnto blasphemer trust thy word take nat worde trueth vtterly mouth hope thy iudgementes shall alwaye kepe thy lawe yee euer euer wyll walke ☞ libertie seke thy commaūdementes wyl speake thy testymonies also euen kynges wyll nat ashamed delyte shalbe thy cōmaundementes whiche haue loued handes also wyl lyfte vp vnto thy commaundemantes haue loued study shalbe thy statute thinke vpon thy seruaūt concernyng thy worde wher thou hast caused put truste comforte trouble thy worde hath quyckened proude haue excedingly derisyon yet haue nat shrynked thy lawe remembred thine euerlastyng iudgementes lorde receiued comforte horrybly afrayed vngodly forsake thy lawe thy statute haue bene songes house pylgremage haue thought vpon thy name lorde nyght season haue kepte thy lawe kepte thy commaundemētes •• xvi •• c thou arte poreyon lord haue promysed kepe thy lawe made myne humble petycyon thy presence whole herte mercyfull vnto accordynge vnto thy worde call myne owne wayes remē braunce turne fete thy testimony made haste prolonged nat y• tyme kepe thy commaundementes congregacious vngodly haue robbed haue nat forgotten thy lawe mydnyght wyll ryse geue thankes vnto thy rightuous iudgementes companyon feare kepe thy commaū dementes psal 33 earthe lorde full thy mercy teache thy statute lorde thou hast dealt graciouslye wt thy seruaunt accordynge vnto thy worde learne true vnderstandynge knowledge haue beleued thy cōmaū demētes troubled wēte wronge haue kepte thy worde mat xix c thou arte good gracious teach thy statute proude haue ymagined lye agaynst wyll kepe thy commaundementes whole herte theyr herte fat brawne delyte hath bene thy lawe good haue bene trouble y• may learne thy statute lawe thy mouth dearer vnto thousādes golde syluer gene • iob x • thy hādes haue made fasshyoned geue vnderstandynge may learne thy commaūdementes feare wyll glad whē se haue put truste thy worde knowe lorde thy iudgemētꝭ right thou faythfulnesse haste caused troubled let thy mercyfull kyndnesse comforte accordyng thy worde vn thy seruaunt let thy louynge mercyes come vnto may lyue thy lawe delyte let proude confounded go wickedly destroye wyll occupied thy cō maundementes let suche feare haue knowen thy testymonyes turned vnto let myne herte sounde thy statute nat ashamed soule hath longed thy saluaeyon haue good hope thy worde myne eye longe sore thy worde sayenge wylte thou comforte become lyke bottell smoke yet forget thy statute howe many dayes thy seruaunt wylte thou auenged persecute proud haue dygged pyttes whiche nat thy lawe al thy commaundementes true persecute falsly thou helpe moste made ende vppon earthe▪ forsake thy commaundementes quycken thy louynge kyndnes shall kepe testimony thy mouth lorde thy worde endureth euer heauen psal xl • 1 pet • thy trueth also remayneth one generacion another thou haste layed foundacion earthe abydeth continue day accordynge thyne ordynaunce thynges serue delyte bene thy lawe shulde haue peryshed trouble wil neuer forget thy commaundementes wt thē thou hast quickened thyne oh saue haue sought thy cōmaundemētes vngodly layed wayte destroye wyll consydre thy testimony se al thinges come ende thy commaundement exceadyng broade • lorde loue haue vnto thy lawe daye longe studye thou thorowe thy commaū dementes haste made wyser myne enemyes euer haue vnderstandynge teacher thy testimony studie wyser aged kepte thy commaundementes haue refrayned fete frō euery euyl waye maye kepe thy worde haue nat shrynked thy iudgemētes thou teachest howe swete thy wordes vnto throte yee sweter hony vnto mouth thorowe thy commaundementes get vnderstandynge therfore hate wycked wayes psal xix • thy worde lanterne vnto fete lyght vnto pathes haue sworne stedfastly purposed kepe thy ryghteous iudgemē te troubled aboue measure quicken lorde accordynge vnto thy worde let frewyll offerynge mouth please lorde teach thy iudgementes ☞ iud xii iob xiii • soule alwaye hande yet nat forget thy lawe vngodly haue layed snare yet swarued nat thy commaundementes thy testymonies haue claymed myne herytage euer • ioye herte haue applyed myne herte fulfyll thy statute alwaye euen vnto ende hate ymagen euell thynges thy lawe loue thou arte defence shylde trust thy worde awaye fro ye wycked wyll kepe commaundementes god stablysh accordynge vnto thy worde maye lyue let nat disapoynted hope holde thou vp shall safe ye delyte shall euer thy statute thou hast troden downe swarue frō thy statute ymagin leasing disceate thou puttest awaye vngodly earth lyke drosse therfore loue thy testimonyes flesh trēbleth feare afrayed thy iudgementes▪ deale thynge laufull right geue nat ouer vnto myn oppressours make y• thy seruaūt delyte good y• proud wrong myne eye wasted awaye lokyng health word thy righteousnes deale thy seruaunt accordinge vnto thy louynge mercy teach thy statute thy seruaunte graunte vnderstandynge maye knowe thy testymonyes tyme lorde laye thyne hande haue destroyed thy lawe loue thy commaundementes aboue golde precious stone therfore holde streyght thy commaundemētes false wayes vtterly abhorre thy testymonyes wonderfull therfore dothe soule kepe thy worde goeth forth geueth lyght vnderstandynge euen vnto simple opened mouth drewe breth delyte thy commaundementes loke thou vpon mercyfull vnto thou vsest vnto loue thy name order steppe thy worde shall wyckednesse haue domynyon ouer delyuer wronge dealynges men shall kepe thy commaundementes shewe lyght thy countenaunce vpon thy seruaunte teach thy statute ryuers water ran myne eye men kepe nat thy lawe ryghteous art thou lorde true thy iudgemente testimonyes thou hast commaunded exceadynge ryghteous true zele hath euen consumed myne enemyes haue forgotten thy wordes p • 〈◊〉 • iohn 〈◊〉 • thy worde tryed vttermost thy seruaunspsal • ii b xvii • • loueth small reputacyon yet nat forget thy commaundementes thy ryghteousnesse euerlastynge ryghteousnes thy lawe trueth trouble heuynesse haue taken holde vpon yet delyte thy commaundementes ryghteousnesse thy testimony euerlastyng graūt vnderstandynge shall lyue cal whole hert heare lorde wyll kepe thy statute yee euen vpon call helpe shal kepe thy testimony early mornynge crye vnto thy worde truste myne eye preuente nyght watch myght occupyed thy wordes heare voyce lord accordyng vnto thy louig kindenes quickē according thou art wont drawe nye▪ malice persecute farre frō thy lawe thou nye hande lorde thy commaundementes true cōcernyng thy testimony haue knowen longe sen thou hast grounded thē euer consyder myne aduersite de 〈2 page lorde hathe chosen iacob vnto hym selfe israel hys owne possessyon knowe lorde greate oure lorde aboue goddes whatsoeuer lorde pleased dyd hem heauen earth see deape place ie •• x li dringeth forth cloudes endes worlde▪ turneth lyghtenynges vnto rayne brynging wyndes theyr treasuryes smote fyrste borne egypte bothe man beast exod▪ xi • • ex 7 8 9 10 psal 78 • • v c hathe sente token woūders xv buruch vi ymages heathen syluer golde worke men handes haue mouthes speake eye haue▪ • ey se haue eares yet heare neyther breth theyr mouthes make lyke vnto al put theyr trust prayse lorde ye house israell prayse lorde ye house aaron prayse lorde ye house leuie ye ye feare lord prayse lorde praysed lorde syon whiche dwelleth ierusalem ¶ cxxxvj psalme gyue thankes vnto lorde hecōfitemi mino iud xiii c p • v • vi • gracyous hys mercy endureth euer gyue thankes vnto god goddes hys mercy endureth euer thanke lorde al lordes mercy endureth euer iudi xiii psa lxxii whiche onely dothe greate wonder mercy endureth euer whiche wysdome made heauens mercy endureth euer whiche layed earth aboue water mercye endureth euer gene 1 b whiche hathe made greate lyghtes mercye endureth euer sonne rule day mercy endureth euer moone starres gouerne nyght mercye endureth euer exod 12 e whiche smote egypte theyr fyrste borne mercy endureth euer brought israel frome amonge mercy endureth euer myghtye hande stretched arme mercy endureth euer whiche deuyded reed see partes mercy endureth euer exod 14 e made israell go thorowe myddest hys mercye endureth euer pharao hoste ouerthrewe reed see hys mercy endureth euer exo 15 16 17 whiche led people thorow wil dernes mercy endureth euer iosue xii smote great kingꝭ mercy endureth euer yea slue myghtye kynges mercy endureth euer nume 21 c drut iii sehon kynge amorites mercy endureth euer og kynge basan mercy endureth euer gaue away theyr lande herytage mercye endureth uer euen heritage vnto israell seruaunte mercye endureth euer whiche remembred v trouble mercy endureth euer hathe delyuered v oure ennemyes mercy endureth euer psa ciiii whiche geueth fode vnto flesshe hys mercy endureth euer geue thankes vnto god heauen mercy endureth euer ¶ cxxxvij psalme ⚜ ieremy water suꝑ flumina babylon satte downe wepte remembredezec 1 • iii b ⚜ syon harpes hanged vp vpon tree therin led v awaye captyue requyred v songe melody heuynesse synge v one songes syon howe shall synge lordes songe straunge lande forget ierusalem let ryght hande forgotten remembre let tonge cleue rofe mouth yee yf preferre ierusalem myrth remembre chyldren • e • xlix ezec xxv ••• • • edom lorde daye ierusalē howe sayd downe downe euen grounde ☞ daughter babylon thou shalt come mysery thy selfe yea happy shall rewardeth y• haste serued v esay xiii • blessed shall taketh thy chyldrē throweth agaynst stone ¶ cxxxviij psalme dauyd confitebor tibi psal 9 • • cxi ai wyl gyue thankes vnto lorde whole herte euen ☞ goddes wyll synge prayse vnto psal v • wyll worshyppe towarde thy holye temple prayse thy name thy louyng kyndnesse trueth thou hast magnyfyed thy name thy worde aboue al thynges called vpon thou hardeste endewedst soule muche strength ☞ kynges earthe shall prayse lorde haue hearde wordes thy mouth yea shall synge wayes lord y• greate glorye lorde psa cxiii • though lorde hye yet hath respect vnto lowly proude beholdeth hym farre thoughe walke myddest trouble yet shalte thou refreshe thou shalte stretche forthe thyne hande vpon furyousnes myne eunemyes thy ryght hande shall saue lorde shal make good yea thy mercye lorde endureth euer iob 14 • espyse nat workes thyne owne handes ¶ cxxxix psalme ¶ chaunter psalme douyd lorde thou hast searched anddomine probast • knowen thou knoweste downe syttynge myne vprysynge thou vnderstandest thoughte farre thou arte aboute path bed spyest wayes lo▪ nat worde tonge thou lorde knowest together thou haste fashyoned behynde layed thyne hande vpon suche knowledge wonderfull excellent nat atteyne vnto 〈…〉 whyther shall go frō thy spret • wyther shall go thy presence clymme vp heauen thou arte yf go downe hell thou arte also take wynges mornynge remayne vr • ermpste part see euen also shal thy hāde lede thy ryght hande shall holde saye peraduenture darckenes shall couer shall nyght turned daye yea darckenesse darkenesse nyght clere daye darkenesse lyght bothe lyke reynes thyne thou haste couered mother wombe wyll gyue thankes vnto wonderously made maruelous thy workes soule knoweth ryght well bone hyd though made secretely fasshyoued beneth earthe thyne eye se myne vnpar fectnesse stande al wrytten thy boke dayes fashyoned yet ther one howe deare ⚜ thy councels vnto god great summe tell nombre sande wake vp present wyite thou nat slaye wycked oh god departe frome ye bloude thyrstye men speake vnryghtuouslye agaynste thyne ennemyes take thy name vayne hate lorde▪ hate nat greued ryse vp agaynst yea hate ryght foore euen thoughe myne enemyes psa xxvi • trye god seke grounde myne herte proue examyne thoughtes loke well yf waye wyckednesse leade way euer lastynge ¶ cxl psalme ¶ chaunter psalme dauyd delyuer lorde frome euyll man preserue wycked man whiche ymagyne myschefe theyr hertes stere vp stryfe daye longe haue sharpened theyr tonges • oma ii • c lyke serpente e •• pe adder poyson vnder theyr lippes sela kepe lord frome handes vngodly preserue wycked men whiche purposed ouerthrowe goynges proude haue layed snare spred net abrode cordes yea set trappes waye sela sayenge vnto lord thou art god heare voyce prayer lorde lorde god thou strength health thou haste couered heade daye battayle let vngodly haue desyre lorde let hym nat haue purpose least proude sela psal vii • let myschefe theyr owne lyppes fal vpon heade compase aboute let hote burnynge cole fal vpon let caste fyre pyt neuer ryse vp agayne man full wordes shall prospere vppon earth malycious wycked person shal hunted awaye destroyed sure lorde wyll auenge pore mayntene cause helpelesse ryghtuous also shall gyue thanckes vnto thy name iuste shall continue thy syght ¶ cxlj psalme ¶ psalme dauyd domint clama •• lorde call vpon haste vnto consydre voyce crye vnto let prayer sette forthe thy syght exo xxx • incense let lyftyng vp handes euenyng sacryfyce eccle xx •• • set watch lord mouth yea watch dore lippes let myne herte enclyned euyll thynge mynded vngodly orwycked men ☞ lest eate suche thynges please let ryghteous rather smyte frendly reproue wyll take though powred oyle vpō heade shal nat hurte heade yee wyl praye yet theyr wyckednesse let theyr iudges stomble stony place maye heare wordes swete oure bone lye scatered pytte lyke one graueth dyggeth vp grounde myne eye loke vnto lorde god trust oh cast nat soule kepe snare haue layde trappes wycked doer let vngodly fall theyr owne nettes geyther vntyll gone ¶ cxlij psalme ¶ instruc • yon dauid praye • caue uo • e men ad dūm psal 67 cryed vnto lorde voyce yee euen vnto lorde dyd make supplycacyon powred complaintes shewed hym trouble sprete heuynesse thou knewest pathe waye wherin walked haue preuely layed snare loked also vpon ryght hande se man wolde knowe place fle vnto man cared soule cryed vnto lorde sayd thou art hope porcyon lande lyuynge consydre complaynte brought lowe delyuer frō persecutours stronge brynge soule prysō maye geue thākes vnto thy name thynge yf thou wylt graunte shall ryghteous resorte vnto company ¶ cxliij psalme ¶ psalme dauid owne sonne persecuted hym heare prayer lorde consyder desyre herken vnto fordomine •• audi thy trueth ryghteousnesse sake entre nat iudgemente thy seruaunte iob iiii • 〈◊〉 xxv rom 3 c thy syght shall man lyuynge iustifyed enemye hath persecuted soule hathe smyten lyfe downe grounde hathe layed darckenesse deade men worlde therfore sprete vexed within herte within desolate psal 77 c yet remembre tymes past imuse vpon thy workes yee exercyse selfe worckes thy handes streatche forth myne handes vnto soule cryeth vnto thyrsty lande heare lorde soone sprete waxeth faynte hyde nat thy face left lyke vnto go downe pytte let heare exo 34 psal 86 iere 32 ioel 〈◊〉 c thy louynge kyndenesse tymes morninge trust thou waye shulde walke lyfte vp soule vnto delyuer lorde fro myne enemyes resorte vnto teache thynge pleaseth thou arte god let thy louynge sprete leade forth vnto lāde ryghteousnes quycken lorde thy name sake thy ryghteousnesse sake brynge soule trouble thy goodnesse scater myne enemyes abrode destroye vexe soule thy seruaunte ¶ cxliiij psalme ¶ dauid blessed lorde refuge whiche teacheth benedi • tus dn̄s 2 reg 22 psa▪ xiii • handes warre fyngers fyght hope castell defence delyuerer shylde whome trust whiche gouerneth people vnder psal viii • lorde man thou haste suche respecte vnto hym sonne man thou regardest hym iob viii • man lyke thynge naught hꝭ time passeth away like shadow bowe thy heauens lorde come downe touche mountaynes shall smoke sende forth lyghtynyng scater shute thyne arowes consume sende downe thyne hande aboue deliuer take greate water hande straunge chyldren whose mouth talketh vanyte theyr ryght hande right hande wyckednes wyl synge newe song vnto god syng prayses vnto vpon ten strynged lute thou geuest vyctory vnto kynges hast delyuered dauid thy seruaunte parell swerde saue delyuer hande straunge chyldren whose mouth taketh vanite theyr ryght hande ryght hande iniquite sonnes maye growe vp yonge plātes oure daughter may polyshed corner temple dau 28 • oure garner may 〈2 page missing〉 ❧ prouerbes salomon ¶ prayse wysdome • e nat harken vnto voluptuous prouocacyon • ysynges synners wysdome cōptayneth despysed al men prophecyeth destruccyon vnto desspis ••• capitvlo prouerbes salomon sonne david kynge israell learne wisdome instruccyon perceyue wordes vnderstandynge thereby receaue prudence ryghtuousnesse iudgement equytye simple myght haue wyt yonge men myght haue knoweledge vnderstandynge hearynge wyse man shal come wysdome endewed vnderstandynge shall optayne wyt perceyue parable interpretacyon thereof wordes wyse darcke speaches iob 28 b eccle • g psal 〈◊〉 proue ix e feare lorde begynnynge wysdome fooles despyse wysdome instruccyon sonne heare thy father doctryne forsake nat lawe thy mother shal brynge grace vnto thy heade shall cheyne aboute thy necke sonne consente vnto synners yf entyse say come v wyl laye wayte bloud surcke preuely innocent without cause shall psal 124 swalow vp lyke hell deuoure quycke whole go downe y• pyt shal fynde maner costely ryches fyll house wt spoyles cast thy lot amōg v let v haue al one purse sōne walke y• refrayne thy fote frō theyr way prouer 8 fete runne euyl hasty shed bloude vayne y• net layed forth byrdes eye yea thē selfes lay wayte one anothers bloud one wold sleye another wayes suche couetous y• one wolde rauysh anothers lyfe psa▪ xiiii wysdome tryeth without putteth forth voyce ī y• stretꝭ calleth y• cōgregacion y• opē gate sheweth wordes thorowe y• citie sayeng ye childrē longe wyl ye loue childeshnesse long wyl y• scorner delyte scornynge y• vnwyse enemyes vnto knowledge▪ turne vnto correccyon • wyll expresse mynde vnto make vnderstande wordes esay lxv • iere vii • haue called ye refused haue stretched hande man regarded councels haue ye dyspised set correccyon naught therfore shall also laugh destruccyon mocke thynge ye feare commeth vpon euen thynge ye afrayed falleth sodenly lyke storme misery like tempest yee trouble heuinesse commeth vpon shal cal vpon wyl heare shal seke earely shal fynde ha ted knowledge receyued feare lorde abhorred councell despysed correccyon therfore shall eate frutes theyr owne way fylled theyr owne inuencyons turnynge awaye vnwyse shal sley prosperyte fooles shall theyr owne destruccyon▪ prou 3 b harkeneth vnto shal dwel safely sure feare euyll ¶ wysdome 〈◊〉 embrased set whiche teacheth feare knowledge wysdome directeth way god aduouterous woman eschued capi ii sonne yf thou wilte receyue wordes kepe commaundementes thou wylte enclyne thyne eares vnto wysdome applye thyne herte vnderstandynge yf thou cryest wysdome callest knowledge thou sekest money dyggest treasure shalte thou vnderstande feare lorde fynde knowledge god iaco • eccle • • vii x 3 reg 3 b iiii • ▪ lord geueth wysdome hys mouthe cō meth knoweledge vnderstandynge preserueth well fare ryghtuous defendeth walke syncerely kepeth ryght pathe preserueth waye suche serue hym godlynesse shalte thou vnderstande ryghtuousnesse iudgement equite yee euery good waye wysdome entreth thyne herte thy soule delyteth knowledge shall coū cell preserue vnderstandynge shall kepe thou mayst delyuered frō euyll waye man speaketh frowarde thinges leaue right pathes walke wayes darkenesse whiche reioyse doyng euyl delyte wycked thinges whose wayes croked frowarde theyr pathes thou mayst delyuered also prou v 〈◊〉 vii frome straunge woman thyne owne whiche geueth swete wordes whiche saketh husbande youth forgeteth couenaunt god house enclyned vnto death pathes vnto hel al go vnto hir come nat agayn neyther take holde waye lyfe therfore walke thou waye suche vertuous kepe pathes ryghtuous iuste shall dwell lande perfecte shall remayne vngodly shalbe roted lande wycked doer shalbe roted ¶ commaundementes god muste dylygentely regarded obserued capi iii sonne deuit xi forgette thou lawe se thyne hert kepe cōmaū dementes shall prolonge dayes yeares thy lyfe bryng peace let mercy faythfulnes neuer go bynde aboute thy necke wryte table thyne herte shalte thou fynde fauoure good vnderstandynge syght god men put thy truste god thyne herte leane nat vnto thyne owne wytte thy wayes haue respecte vnto hym shall ordre thy goynges esaye v c rom 12 c wyse thyne owne conceyt feare lorde departe euyll▪ shall thy ☞ nauell whole thy bone stronge ☞ tobi 4 b deut 16 mala 3 b exod 2 c and▪ 37 c honoure lorde thy substaunce fyrstelynges thyne encrease ⚜ geue vnto poore shall thy barnes fylled plenteousnesse thy press shall flowe ouer swete wyne sonne despyse chastenynge lorde neyther faynte thou arte rebuked hym hebre xii b apo iii whō lorde loueth hym chasteneth yet delyteth ī hī euen father ī owne sonne well fyndeth wysdome optayneth vnderstandynge gettynge better marchaundise syluer profe • e better golde proue 8 wysdome worthe precyous stone thynges thou canste desyre compayred vnto upon ryght hande long lyfe vpon lefte hand • rich honour wayes pleasaunte wayes pathes peaceable gene ii b tree lyfe laye holde vpon blessed kepeth faste wysdome hath lorde layed foundacyon earthe thorowe vnderstandynge hathe stablyshed heauens thorowe hys wysdome deapthes breake vp cloudes droppe downe dewe sonne let thynges departe thyne eye kepe lawe councell shall lyfe vnto thy soule grace vnto thy mouth shalte thou walke safely thy way thy fote shal nat stōble prou 1 • yu slepest yu shalt nat afrayed take thy rest slepe swetely thou nedest nat afrayed sodayne feare nether y• vyolēte russhynge vngodly commeth lorde shall stande thy syde kepe thy fote thou nat taken withdrawe good thing haue nede longe thyne honde hable saye nat vnto thy neyghbour go thy waye come agayne morowe wyl geue thou hast geue intende hurte vnto thy neighbour seynge dothe dwel rest the▪ stryue nat lyghtely man hathe done harme prou 1 folowe nat wycked man chose none hys wayes lorde abhorreth frowarde hys councell amonge righteous curse lorde house vngodly blesseth dwellynges ryghteous scoruefull dothe laughe scorne geuethe grace vnto lowelye wyse shall haue honour possession shame promocyon fooles shall haue ¶ wysdome fruytes waye ought sought ¶ cap iiii heare ye chyldren fatherlye exhortacyon take good hede ye maye learne wysdome haue gyuen good doctryne forsake ye lawe selfe father deare sonne tenderely beloued mother taught also sayde vnto deut vi b▪ 〈◊〉 • 3 • g let thyne herte receyue wordes kepe commaundementes thou shalte lyue get wysdome get vnderstandynge forget y• wordes mouth shrīke nat frō thē forsake nat shal p̄serue y• leue shal kepe y• chefe poynt wysdome y• thou willīg opteyne wysdome thy goodes get vnderstandynge deut 26 make muche shall promote yee yf thou embrace her▪ shall bringe vnto honour shall make gracyous head garnyshe crowne glory heare sonne receaue wordes yeares thy lyfe shall many haue shewed waye wysdome led ryght pathes yf thou goest therin shal straytenesse hynder thou rūneste thou shalte nat fall take faste holde doctryne let nat go kepe thy lyfe psal 1 xxvii come nat path vngodly walke nat way wicked eschue go nat therin departe asyde passe ouer nat slepe except haue fyrst done myschefe nether take reste excepte haue fyrste done harme eate bred wyckednesse drynke wyne robberye pathe ryghteous shyneth lyghte euer bryghter bryghter vnto perfecte daye waye vngodly darcknes wherin men fall aware deute vi b and▪ xi • sonne marcke wordes encline thine eare vnto sayinges let nat departe thyne eye kepe euen mydeste thyne herte lyfe vnto fynde healthe vnto theyr bodyes kepe thyne herte dyligēce vpon hangeth lyfe put away frō frowarde mouthe let lyppes sclaunder farre let thyne eye beholde thynge ryght let thyne eye liddes loke straight pondre path thy fete let thy wayes ordred ryght deute v xxvii turne asyde neyther ryght hande lefte witholde thy fote euyll ⚜ lord knoweth wayes right hande wayes lefte hande froward shal direct thy goynges thy wayes shal gyde peace ¶ warneth eschue whordome forbyddeth wastfull spendynge wylleth v lyue owne laboures men muste loue theyr wyues capi v sonne gyue hede vnto wysdome bowe thyne eare vnto prudence thou mayst regarde good councell thy lyppes may kepe knowledge ⚜ applye thou thy selfe disceytful nesse woman lyppes harlotprou ii b vii droppynge honye combe throte softer oyle last bytter wormewode ⚜ tonge sharpe two edged swerde fete go downe vnto deathe steppe pearse thorowe vnto hell regardeth nat path lyfe vnstedfast wayes thou canste nat knowe nowe therfore sonne depart wordes mouthe kepe waye farre come nat nye dores house thou gyue nat thy strength vnto thy yeares cruell men nat fylled thy goodes thy laboures come nat straunge house ye thou mourne nat last thou hast spente thy body goodes saye ala hated nourture dyd herte despyse correccyon wherefore obedyente vnto voyce df teacher herkened vnto infourmed come almoste mysfortune myddest multitude congregacion ☞ drynke water thyne owne well ryuers runne thyne owne sprynges ☞ let thy welles flowe abrode may ryuers water stretes let onely thyne owne straungers let thy well blessed glad wyfe thy youth louynge hynde frendely roo let brestes alwaye satisfye holde euer contente loue sonne wylte thou haue pleasure harlot embrace bosome another woman iob xxxi 34 • euery man wayes open syght lorde pondreth theyr goynges wyckednesse vngodly shal catche selfe wt ye snare owne synnes shal trap ped shall dye without amendemente great folyshnesse shall go astray ¶ slouthefull slougyshe prycked styrred worke scysmatyke reproued aduoutry ought earnestly auoyded capi vi sonne pro xvii • xx • yf y• suertie thy neyghbour hast fastened thyne hand another man thou arte bounde thyne owne wordes taken thyne owne speache therefore sonne yu shalt discharged whē yu art come thy neyghbours daunger go thy wayes sone intreate thy neyghbour let thine eye slepe thyne eye lydde slombre saue thy selfe doo hande byrde hande fouler go emmet thou stougard consydre wayes lerne wyse hathe gyde teacher leder yet sōmer prouydeth meate gathereth fode together haruest pr • xiii howe longe wylt thou slepe thou slogysh man whē wylt thou aryse thy slepe yee slepe styll lytle slomber lytle folde thyne handes gether yet lytle y• mayeste slepe shall pouerte come vnto one trauayleth waye necessyte like armed man ⚜ yf thou nat slouthful thy haruest shal come sprynging well pouerty shal flye farre vngodly person wycked man goth frowarde mouthe wyncketh hys eye tokeneth wt fete poīteth finger euer ymagenige myschefe frowardnesse ī hert causeth discorde therfore shal destruccion come hastely vpon hym sodenly shal al broken nat healed pro xii c sixe thinges doth lord hate seuēth vtterly abhorreth proude loke dyssēblynge tōge handes ye shed innocēt bloude herte y• goeth wycked ymagynacyon psal 14 • prouet 1 • fete y• swyfte rennynge myschefe false wytnesse bringeth vp lye one soweth dyscorde amonge brother sonne kepe thy father commaundemente forsake nat lawe thy mother put vp together thyne herte bynde aboute thy necke maye leade thou goeste preserue thou arte slepe thou awakest thou mayest talke psal 119 commaundement lanterne lawe lyght ye chastenynge nurtoure waye lyfe may kepe pro v vii▪ euyll woman slateringe tonge harlot thou lust nat bewty thyne herte leste thou taken fayre lokes harlot wyll make man begge hys bred maryed woman wyl hunte precyous lyfe maye man take fyre hys bo clothes nat brente one go vpon hote coales hys fete nat hurt euen whosoeuer goeth neighbour wyfe toucheth cannat vngyity ero xxii men nat vtterly despyse thefe stealeth satysfye hys soule hongry yf may gotten restoreth agayne seuen tymes muche el maketh recompēse y• good house cōmitteth aduoutry woman foole hryngeth hys lyfe destruccion getteth hym selfe also shame dishonour shall neuer put gelousy wrath y• man wyll nat intreated though thou woldest offre hym greate gyftes make amendes wyll nat receaue ¶ god ought feared honoured commaunde inentes ou •• h 〈◊〉 hepte wanton apperytes desyres ought shonned capi vii sonne deut vi b xii kepe wordes laye vp comaundementes kepe commaundementes lawe euē apple thine eye thou shalt lyue bynde vpon thy finger wryte table thyne herte saye vnto wysdome thou art syster call vnderstandyng thy kynswoman prou 2 b 5 maye kepe straūge woman frō harlot geueth swete wordes wyndowe house loked thorowe latysse behelde y• simple people among yong folkes spyed one yong foole going ouer y• stretes corner way toward harlottes house twylight euenynge beganne nowe nyght darke beholde met womā ecele ix • harlottes apparell dysceytfull wanton vnstedfast womā whose fete coulde abyde house nowe without nowe stretes lurketh euery corner caught yong man kyssed hym nat ashamed faynge vowe peace offerynges paye ☞ thys day perfourme therfore came forth mete y• myght seke thy face haue founde haue deckte bed couerynges clothes egypte bed haue made smell myrre alos cynamon come let v lye together take oure pleasure tyll daye lyght good mā nat home gone farre hathe taken bagge money hym tell commeth home thus many swete wordes ouercame hym flattering lyppes entysed folowe oxe led slaughter lyke fole stockes punyshed longe tyll wounded hys lyuer wt darte lyke yf byrde hasted snare nat knowyng parell lyfe lyeth ther vpon heare nowe therfore chyldren marke wordes mouth let nat thyne herte wandre wayes nat thou disceaued pathes many one hathe woūded cast downe ye many stronge man hath bene slayne meanes house waye vnto hell bring mē downe chamber deth ¶ prayse wysdome god capi viii doth nat prouer • wysdome crye dothe nat vn derstan • ynge put forth voyce standeth nat hye place stretes wayes dothe nat crye whole cytie gate mē go ye men sayeth call unto chyldren mē lyfte vp voyce take hede vnto knowledge ye ignoraunte wyse herte ye foles geue eate wyll speake greate matter open lyppes tell thynges ryght throte shalbe talkynge truth lyppes abhorre vngodlynesse wordes mouth ryghteous frowardenesse falshede therin playne suche wyll vnderstande ryght fynde knowledge receaue doctryne nat syluer knowledge fyne golde prou iii b wysdome worth precyous stone yee thynges thou canst desyre maye nat compared vnto wysdome haue dwellynge knowledge prudente councell myne owne feare lorde abhorreth wyckednesse pryde disdayne euyll waye mouth speakethe wycked thynges vtterly abhorre geue councell gyde haue vnder standynge haue strengthe deu xvii sapi vi thorowe kynges reygne thorowe prynces make iust lawes thorowe prynces beare rule iudges earthe execute iudgement louynge vnto loue luke xi b seke early shall fynde ryches honour yee excellent goodes ryghteousnesse frute better golde precyous stone myne encrease worthe fyne syluer wyll gyde waye ryghteousnesse strete iudgemente may sende prosperyte loue encrease theyr treasure ☞ sapi ix b lorde selfe possessyou ☞ begynnynge wayes euer beganne hys worckes aforetyme eccle 24 • haue bene ordeued euerlastyng frō begynnynge euer earth made borne nether depthes springes water foundacions mountaynes layed ye al hylles borne earth vpon earth nat yet made nat grounde selfe sapi 〈◊〉 • made heauens present set vp depthes ordre hangd cloudes aboue fastened springes depe shut see gene iob xxvi • 38 psa • iiii • certayne boundes water shulde nat go ouer theyr marckes layed foundacions erath ordrynge thynges dely • ynge dayly reioysynge alwaye hym rounde compase thys worlde make ioyfull delyte amonge chyldren men therfore herken vnto me▪ ye chyldren blessed kepe wayes geue eare vnto nurtour wyse refuse nat blessed man heareth watchynge dayly gate geuynge attendaunce postes dores fyndeth fyndethe lyfe shal obtayue fauour lorde offendeth agaynst hurtethe owne soule hate louers deathe ¶ wysdome monethe men embrace property whore capi ix wysdome hathe buylded herselfe ☞ house hewen seuen pyllers hath kylled vitayles powred wyne prepared table hathe sente forthe maydens crye vpon hyest place cyty ignoraunte let hym come hyther vnwyse sayde come waye eate breade drynke wyne whiche haue poured forsake ignoraunce ye shall lyue se ye go waye vnderstandynge reproueth scornefull personne gettethe selfe dyshonoure rebuketh vngodly stayneth hym selfe reproue nat ☞ scorner leste owe euyll wyll rebuke wyse man wyll loue geue dyscrete man occasyon wylbe wyser teache righteous man wyll increase knowlege iob 28 psal 〈◊〉 • proue • 〈◊〉 ecclesi •• feare lorde beginnyng wysdome knowledge holy thynges vnderstādyng thorow thy dayes shall prolōged y• yeares thy lyfe shal many thou wyse thy wysdome shal thy selfe good ye thikest scorne therof shall thyne owne harme folysh rechelesse woman ful wordes one hathe knowledge sytteth dore house ye hygh place ye cite call suche go walke streyght theyr wayes ignoraunt sayeth let hym come hyther vnwyse sayeth stollen water swete breade preuely eaten hathe good taste dothe nat consydre deade whiche gestes ye depe hel ⚜ wyll ioyned vnto shall go downe hel auoydeth frome shalbe saued ¶ prouerbes salomon ¶ chapter folowe vnto thyrtye wyse man exhorteth dyuers sentence whiche calleth parable folowe vertues flye vyces sheweth also profet cōmeth wysdome hyndraūce proceadeth folyshnesse capitulo x wyse proue 15 • sōne maketh glad father vndiscrete sōne heuines vnto hꝭ mother prou 11 • eccle v b tresures yt wickedly gottē ꝓfyte nothīg ryghtuousnes delyuereth frō deth psa 34 b lord wil nat let ye soule ye ryghtuous suffce hongre putteth vngodly desyre ydle hande maketh poore quycke labourynge hand maketh ryche ⚜ regardeth lesynges fedeth wynde doth folowe byrdes haue taken theyr flyght ‡ gathereth sommer wyse slougy harueste bryngeth hym selfe confusion blessynges vpon heade ryghtuous mouthe vngodly kepeth myschefe secrete psa • xii memoriall iuste shall haue good reporte name vngodly shal styncke wyse man wyl receyue war nynge fole wyll soner smytē face psal 23 leadeth innocent lyfe wal keth surely goeth wrong way shalbe knowē y• wincketh wt hꝭ eye wyll harme y• hath folish mouth shalbe betē mouth rightuoꝰ mā veyne life y• mouth y• vngodly kepeth mischefe ī secrete euill wyl stereth vp strife loue couereth y• multitude sine y• lippes hī y• hath vnderstādig mā shal fynde wysdome y• rod belōgeth y• backe y• folish wyse • • ay vp knowlege y• mouth y• folish ny destrucciō riche mās goodꝭ hꝭ strōge holde pouerty oppresseth y• pore rightuoꝰ laboureth good y• vngodly vseth hꝭ encrease vnto sine take hede vnto y• chaste nīg nurture y• way life y• refu seth refourmed disceaueth hī self dissēblyng lippꝭ kepe hatred secretly y• speketh sclaūder fole much bablīg must nedes offēce y• refrineth hꝭ lippes wise innocēt tōg noble treasure y• hert y• vngodly nothīg worth lippꝭ y• rightuous fede • whole multitude foles shal die ī owne foly blessīg y• lord maketh richepsal 27 eccle xi • men eccle 27 careful trauayle doth nothīg therto fole doth wyckedly maketh sport neuertheles wysdome mā beware suche thinge y• y• vngodly afraied shal come vpō thē y• rightuous shal haue desire vngodly lyke tēpest y• passeth ouer sene y• righteoꝰ remaineth sure euer vineger y• teth smoke vnto eies euē slougysh ꝑson thē y• sende hī forth feare y• lord maketh long life ye yerꝭ yt vngodly shal shortened paciēt abidīg ye rightuous shalbe turned gladnes y• hope y• vngodly shal perish way ye lorde geueth corage vnto y• godly fere wicked doer 1 pe 4 • • 1 cor 13 b righteoꝰ shal neuerpsal 125 ouerthrowē vngodly shal nat remaine ye lāde prou xi b mouth y• iust wylpsal 37 • talkīg wisdome ye tōg y• froward shal perish lippꝭ y• rightuous occupied acceptable thīgꝭ y• mouth y• vngodly taketh thē y• worst cap xi prou 16 • • xx • false balaūce abhominaciō vn y• lord true weight pleseth hī pride shame also cōfusiō lowlynes wisdome īnocēt delīg ye iust shal lede thē ye wickednes suche dissēble shalbe theyr owne destrucciō prou x eccle • b rich helpe nat ī y• daye vēgeaūce righteousnes deliuereth frō deth rightuousnes y• inocēt ordreth hꝭ way ye vngodly shal fal owne wickednes rightuousnes y• iust shal deliuer thē y• wicked shalbe takē owne vngodlynes whē vngodly mā dyeth hꝭ hope gone y• cōfidēce rich shal perish rightuoꝰ shalbe deliuered trouble y• vngodly shal come hꝭ steade thorow ye mouth y• dissēbler hꝭ neighbour destroied thorow knowledge shall y• iust deliuered •••• v • whē goeth wel wt righteoꝰ y• cite mery whē y• vngodly perish gladnes whē ye iust ī welth y• cite ꝓspereth whē ye vngodly haue ye rule decaieth fole brīgeth vp sclaūder hꝭ neyghboure wyse man wyl kepe secrete pro xiiii dissēblyng ꝑson wyl wyse ignoraunce fooles folyshenesse faythfull wytnesse delyuereth soules lyar dysceuethe feare lorde strong holde chyldren vnder sure defence feare lorde well lyfe auoyde snare death increase prosperyte comens kynges honoure decay people confusyon prynce pacyent hathe muche vnderstandynge soone displeased prouokethe folyshenesse mery herte lyfe body rancoure consumeth awaye bone prou▪ • b math▪ xx • doth poore man wrong blasphemeth hys maker hathe pytie poore doth honoure vnto god vngodly afraied euery parel y• righteous hath good hope euen ī death wysdome resteth herte hym hath vnderstādinge shalbe knowen among vnlerned prou xi b ryghteousnesse setteth vp people wyckednesse bryngeth folke destruccyon discrete seruaūte pleasure vnto y• kynge one nat honeste prouoketh hym vnto wrathe ¶ capi xv pro xxv ca softe answere putteth downe displeasure frowarde wordes prouoke vnto anger tonge suche wyse vseth knowlege aryght folyshe mouthe babbleth nothynge folyshenesse eye lorde loke euery place bothe vpon y• good bad wholsome tong tree life y• abuseth hath broken mynde foole despyseth father correccyon taketh hede whan reproued shall haue vnderstandynge ⚜ vvere ryghteousnesse plentyfull greate power ymaginaciōs vngodly shalbe roted house y• righteous full rich y• increse y• vngodly destrucciō wise mouth poureth knowledge y• herte folyshe doth nat pro xxi eccle 34 • esaye 66 lord abhorreth sacrifice y• vngodly y• prayer y• ryghteous acceptable vnto hym waye vngodly abhominacyon vnto lorde foloweth ryghteousnes hym loueth forsaketh ryght waye shalbe sore punyshed hateth correccion shall dye hell perdiscion konwne vnto lorde howe muche hertes men sapi • 〈◊〉 • scornefull body loueth nat one rebuketh hym neyther wyl come vnto wyse prou 〈◊〉 • xv •• ▪ hert contynual feast psal 37 • ▪ 1 • im • • ▪ better lytle feare lorde great treasure sorowe better measse potage loue fatte oxe euell wyll prou xv • angrye man stereth vp stryfe pacyente stylleth discorde waye slouthfull man hedged thornes waye ryghteous well clensed prou x • wyse sonne maketh glade father vndyscrete body shameth mother foole reioyseth foolysh thynges wyse man loketh wel owne goynges unaduysed thoughtes shall come nought mē geue councell stedfastnesse ioyfull thynge man geueth conuient answere pleasaunte worde spoken due season waye lyfe leadeth vnto heauen man shulde beware hel beneth lord wyl breake downe house proude shall make fast border wyndowe lorde abhorreth ymaginacions wicked pure wordes pleasaūt vnto couetous man roteth vp owne house hateth rewardes shall lyue ⚜ thorowe mercy fayth synnes pourged thorowe feare lorde dothe euery one eschue euell ryghteous man museth mynde howe good mouth vngodly bryngeth forth euell thynges lorde farre vngodly heareth prayer ryghteous lyke clearnesse eye reioyseth herte doth good name fede y• bone eare harkeneth refourmacion lyfe shal dwell amonge wyse refuseth refourmed despyseth owne soule submitteth selfe correccyon wyse feare lorde ryght sience wysdome lowlynes goeth honoure capi xvi man maye well ☞ purpose thynge hert answere tōge commeth lorde prou 2 • psal 33 b man thynketh al wayes cleane lorde iudgeth myndes psal 37 commytte thy workes vnto lorde loke thou deuysest shall prospere lorde dothe thynges owne sake yee kepeth vngodly daye wrath lorde abhorreth suche proude herte may neyther strength power escape ⚜ begynnynge good lyfe ryghtwysnes accepted vnto god offre vp sacryfyces wyth louynge mercy faithfulnes synnes forgeuen feareth lorde eschueth euyll man wayes please lorde maketh hys enemyes frēdes better haue lytle thynge ryghteousnes greate rente wronge fully gotten pro 19 c man deuyseth waye herte lorde ordreth hys goynges ☞ prophecy lyppes kynge mouth shal nat go wronge iudgement pr 〈◊〉 20 b trewe measure trewe balaūce lordes maketh weyghtes great abhominacyon kynges wycked kynges seate shuld holdē vp righteousnesse ryghteous lyppes pleasaūt vnto kynges speaketh trueth shalbe beloued kynges displeasure messaunger death awyse man wyll pacifie hym cherefull countenaunce kynge lyfe louyng fauoure euenynge dewe proue 8 haue wysdome possessyon better haue golde get vnderstandynge worth haue syluer path ryghteous eschue euel loketh well wayes kepeth owne soule presumpteousnes goeth destruccyō proude stomake foloweth fall better humble mynde lowly codeuyde spoiles proude hādeleth matter wysely opteyneth good psal 2 b blessed putteth hys trust lorde hathe wyse vnderstandynge shalbe called councel •• • e speake fayre shall vaue mo • e lernynge understandynge wel • • f lyfe vnto hym hathe forthe chastenynge fooles foolyshnesse wyse harte ordreth mouth wysly amendeth doctryne hys lyppes fayre wordes hony combe refreshynge mynde health bone prou 14 b deut 12 esay 55 b waye mē thynke ryght ende therof leadeth vnto death troublous soule disquyeteth selfe oune mouth hath brought therto vngodly personne stereth vp euell hys lyppes hote burnynge fyre frowarde body causeth stryfe blabbe hys tonge maketh deuysyon amonge prynces wycked man begyleth neyghbour leadeth hym waye good wynketh eye ymagyneth myschefe byteth lyppes wyll▪ harme age crowne worshype yf founde waye ryghteousnes pacient man better one stronge rule selfe worth wynneth cytye lotte cast lappe ordryng therof standeth lorde capi xvii better drye morsell quyetnesse full house many fat catell stryfe eccle 1 • dyscrete seruaunte shal haue rule sonnes haue wysdome shall haue lyke herytage brethen sa •• ē 3 〈…〉 lyke syluer tryed fyre golde fornace euen dothe lorde proue hertes wycked body holdeth muche false lyppes frowarde personne geueth care dysceatfull tonge prou 14 iob 31 • laugheth poore scorne blasphemeth hꝭ maker glad another man hurte shall nat vnpunyshed chylders chyldren worshyppe vnto elder father honoure chyldren eloquēte speach becommeth nat foole dyssemblynge mouth also besemeth nat prynce lyberalyte precyous stone vnto hathe soeuer becōmeth prospereth couereth another man offence seketh loue • hat dyscloseth faute setteth prynce agaynst hym selfe one reprofe onely • good hym hathe vnderstandynge c • stor • pe vnto foole 1 reg 12 • ▪ sedycy • us▪ personne seketh myschefe therfore cruell messaunger sent agaynste hym better come agaynst 〈2 page missing〉 euyll put thy truste lorde shall defende prout 〈◊〉 1 • • lorde abhorreth two maner weyghtes false balaunce euyll thynge • ere x lorde ordreth euery man goynges howe maye man vnderstande owne waye snare man blaspheme whiche holy go aboute vowes 1 reg 〈◊〉 • wyse kynge destroyeth vn godly bryngeth whele ouer lanterne lorde breth man goeth thorowe warde partes body prou 29 b mercy faythfulnesse preserue kynge louynge kindnes seate holden vp strēgth yonge men theyr worshyp graye heade honour vnto aged woun de dryue awaye euyl strypes inwarde partes body capi xxi 4 reg • • kynges herte hande lorde lyke ryuers water maye turne whether euerhe wyll euerye man thynketh hys owne waye ryght lorde iudgeth hertes mich v • ryghtuousnesse iudgement acceptable lorde thē sacrifyce presumptuous loke proude stomake lanterne vngodly synne deuyces one dilygent brynge pletuousnesse vnaduysed commeth vnto pouerte hordeth vp ryches dysceytfulnesse tonge foole lyke vnto seke theyr owne death robberyes vngodly shall theyr owne destruccyon wyl thynges ryght wayes frowarde straunge workes hym cleane ryght eitū • • prou 25 • tter dwell corner vnder house toppe braulynge woman wyde house soule vngodly wyssheth euyll hathe pitye vpon neyghboure prou 19 • scornefull punyshed ignoraunt take better hede wyse man warned wyll receyue vnderstandynge ryghtuous wysely consydereth house vngodly seeth god ouerthroweth vngodly theyr owne wyckednesse mat 18 • stoppeth eare cryeng poore shall crye selfe herde preuy rewarde pacyfyeth dyspleasure gyfte bosome stylleth futyousnesse iuste delyteth doynge thynge ryght workes wyekednesse abhorre man y• wan dreth waye wysdome shall remayne ☞ congregacion deade prou • • • hath pleasure bancket • e shall pore man delyteth wyne delycates shall ryche vngodly shall gyuen ryghtuous wycked iuste eccle 25 • better dwel wyldernesse chydynge angry woman wyse man house greate treasure plentuousnesse folyshe body spendeth vp foloweth ryghtuousnesse mercy fyn deth lyfe ryghtuousnesse honoure wyse man wynneth cytie mightye strength trust bryngeth downe prou 〈◊〉 • kepeth mouth tonge kepeth hys soule trouble proude presumptuous called scornefull man whiche wrathe dare worke malycyously voluptuousnes slouthful owne death handes wyll labour coueteth desyreth daye longe ryghtuous alwaye geuynge kepeth nothynge backe sacrifice vngodly abhomynacion howe much whan offre thynge got ten wyckednesse false witnes shall peryshe wyl content heare shall alwaye haue power speake hym self vngodly man goeth forthe rashely iust refourmeth owne way prou 〈◊〉 • thereesay • • • x ••• • wysdome vnderstandyng councell agaynste lorde psal 33 • horse prepayred agaynste daye battayle lorde geueth vyctorye capi xxii eccl • 〈◊〉 • eccle 〈◊〉 • good name worthe greate ryches ☞ louynge fauoure better syluer golde ryche poore mette together lorde maker wyse man seeth plage hydeth hym selfe folyshe go styll punyshed ende lowelynes feare god ryches honour prosperite helthe thornes snare way frowarde dothe kepe hys soule wyl fle suche teache chyld youth waye shulde go shall leaue olde ryche ruleth pore borower seruaūt lender soweth wyckednesse shall reape sorowe rod crueltye shall peryshe •••• 31 • y• hathe louyng eye shalbe blessed geueth brede vnto poore ⚜ geueth rewardes shall obtayne vyetory honoure taketh waye soule suche receaue thē caste scornefull man shall stryfe go hym yee varyaunce sclaunder shall cease deliteth cleane hert gracyous lyppes kynge shall frynde eye lord ☞ preserue knowledge wordes despyteful bringeth thē naught slouthfull body sayth alyon without myght slayne strete 〈…〉 2 • • mouth harlot depe pytt wherin falleth lorde angrye withall folyshnes stycketh herte lad rod correc • ō shal dryue awaye hym doth poore man wronge increase owne ryches geueth vnto ryche laste commeth pouerte hym selfe sonne bowe downe thyne eare herken vnto wordes wysdome applye thy mynde vnto doctryne thou shalt excellēt yf thou kepe thyne herte practyse thy mouth thou mayest put thy trust lorde haue shewyd daye thynge thou knowest haue nat warned oft coūcel learnynge myght shewe y• truth thou veryte myghtest answere thē sende vnto se thou robbe nat poore weake oppresse nat symple iudgemente lorde selfe wyl defende theyr cause vyolence vnto haue vsed uiolē • e make fryndshype angrye wylfull man kepe cōpany suryous lest thou learne wayes receaue hurte thy soule •••• vi • • 〈◊〉 • 27 • nat thou one thē yt bynde theyr hande vpō promise suertye det yf thou haste nothyng paye shal take awaye thy bed vnder prou 23 • deut • 7 • thou shalt nat remoue lāde marke whiche thy fore elder haue set seest thou nat diligēt theyr busynes stande kynges nat amonge symple people capi xxiii thou syttest y• table eate lord ordre thy selfe manerly thynges set measure thyne appitite yf thou wylte rule thyne owne selfe nat ouer gredy meate meate begyleth disceaueth e ••• 27 • 〈◊〉 xvii b take nat ouer greate trauayle labour ryche beware purpose • tim vi • wylt thou set thine eye vpō thynge sodēly vanisheth awaye rich make thē selues winges take theyr flyght lyke aegle y• ayre eate nat thou enuyous desyre nat meate hathe meruelous herte sayeth vnto eate drynke herte nat yee morsel thou hast eaten shalt thou perbrake lese swete wordes tell nothynge eares foole wyll despyse wysdome thy wordes pro xxii v deut 27 • remoue nat olde lande marke come nat within felde fatherlesse delyuereth myghtie euen shal defende theyr cause agaynst applye thyne herte vnto correcyon thyne eates y• wordes knowledge pro xiii eccle xxx withholde nat correccion frō chylde yf y• beatest hym rod shall nat dye therof yf thou smyte y• rod thou shalt deliuer soule frō hell soone yf thy herte receaue wysdome herte also shal reioyce ye reynes shalbe glad yf thy lyppes speake thyng tha right prou 14 • • let nat thyne hert gelous folowe synners kepe styl feare lorde ☞ daye longe ende nat yet come thy pacient abydyng shal nat vaine sonne geue eare wyse shall thyne herte prospere waye kepe cōpany wt wyne bybbers prou xxi • ryotous eater flesh suche dronkardes ryotous shall come pouerte geuen much slepe shall go ragged coate geue eare vnto thy father begat despyse nat thy mother whē olde labour get trueth sell nat awaye wysdome nourtour vnderstandynge ryghteous father meruelous glad wyse sonne delyteth hym shall thy father glad thy mother bare shal reioyse sonne geue thyne herte let thyne eye haue pleasure wayes pro xxii b whore depe graue harlot narowe pyt lurketh lyke thefe bryngeth vnto mē full vyce hathe wo hathe forowe hathe stryfe hathe brauling hath woūdes without cause hathe reed eye euen euer wyne seke excesse loke nat thou vpō wyne howe redde coloure geueth glasse goeth downe softly last byteth lyke serpent styngeth adder shall thyne eye loke vnto straūge woman thyne herte shall muse vpon frowarde thinges yee thou shalt though thou slepeste myddeste see vpon toppe mast wounded shalt thou say hath nat hurt smote felte nat well wakened wyll go drynke agayne cap xxiiii b pro 23 b 24 • e nat thou gelous ouer wycked men desyre nat amonge ther hert ymagyneth herte theyr lyppes talke myschefe thorowe wysdome house buylded vnderstandynge sette vp thorowe dyscrecion shall chamber fylled costly pleasaunte ryches wyse man stronge yee man vnderstandynge better myghty strengthe dyscrecyon must warres taken hande many geue councel victory wysdom hye thinge yee euen foole darte nat open mouthe gate ymagyneth myschefe maye called vngracyous personne thought folyshe synne scornefull abomynacion vnto mē thou ouersene neglygent tyme nede thy strength small ☞ delyuer go vnto death led awaye slayne nat negligent therin thou wylt saye knewe nat thinkest thou made hertes doth nat cō sydre whiche regardeth thy soule seeth nat shall nat recompence euery man accordynge worckes sonne eate thou hony swete hony combe good swete thy mouth euen shall knowledge wisdome vnto thy soule sone thou haste gotten good hope yee thy hope shal nat vayne lay preuy wayte wyckedly vpō house ryghteous disquyete nat restynge place psal 37 iuste man falleth seuen tymes ryseth vp agayne vngodly fall wyckedness pro 17 reioyse hat thou fal chyne enemye let nat thyne herte glad stomblech leste lorde seyth angrye turne hys wrathe hym vnto pro 23 b 24 let nat thy wrath gelousy moue folowe wicked vngodly wicked hath nothinge hope iob 21 b proue 13 candle vngodly shal put prou 20 sonne feare thou lorde kynge kepe company sclaunderous theyr destruceyon shall come sodenly knoweth aduersyte bothe also saynges wyse pro 18 b nat good haue respecte persone iudgement sayeth vngodly thou arte ryghteous shall people curse yee comenty shall abhorre hym rebuke vngodly shalbe commended ryche blessynge shall come vpon ☞ euery man shall kysse hys lyppes geueth good answere fyrste make vp thy worcke without loke well vnto whiche thou hast felde builde thyne house false wytnesse agaynste thy neyghbour hurte nat thy lyppes saye nat wyll handle euen hathe dealte wyll rewarde euery man accordyng hys dede went felde slouthfull vyneyarde folysh man lo alcouered wt nettels stode ful thistels y• stone wall broken downe sawe cōsydred well loked vpon toke warnynge proue 9 b yee slepe styl ⚜ saye lytle stōber lytle folde thine handes together yet lytle shal pouerte come vnto one trauaileth waye necessyte lyke armed man ¶ also parable salomon whiche men ezekiah kynge iuda copyed capi xxv y• honour god kepe thinge secrete kynges honoure searche thynge heauen hye earth depe kynges herte vnsearcheable take drosse frō syluer shalbe cleane vessell therof take awaye vngodgodlynesse frō kynges syght seate shalbe stablished ryghteousnes put nat thy selfe presence y• kynge preace nat īto y• place great mē luke 14 • better yt saide vnto y• come vp hither thou set downe presēce y• prynce whō thou seyst thine eye eccle 8 • math 〈◊〉 • hasty go ye law lest happly y• ordre thy selfe y• last thy neighbour put shame handle thy matter thy neyghbour hīselfe discouer another mās secrete lest whē mē heare therof turne thy dishonour lest thyne euyll name nat ceasse ⚜ grace frendshyppe deliuer whiche se thou kepe thy selfe lest thou reproued worde spoken due season lyke apple golde syluer dishe correccyon wyse obedient eare golden cheyne iewel golde lyke colde snowe haruest faythfull messenger sende refressheth maysters mynde maketh great bostes geueth nothynge lyke cloudes wynde without rayne pacience prince pacified pron xv gene 32 reg 25 • softe tonge rygorousnes broken thou fyndest hony eate muche sufficiente leaste thou ouerful perbrake againe withdrawe thy fote thy neyghboures house lest wery abhorre beareth false wytnesse againste neyghbour speare swerde sharpe arrowe hope vngodly tyme nede lyke rotten slyppery fote taketh awaye man garmente colde wether lyke vyneger vpon chalke lyke syngeth songes heuy harte ⚜ lyke moth hurteth garment worme tre doth heuynesse man hurte hert rom 1 • c 1 reg 30 b thine enemye honger feade hym yf thryste geue hym drynke shalte thou heape cole fyre vpon heade lorde shall rewarde north winde dryueth awaye rayne euen dothe earenest sobre countenaunce backebyters tonge prou xxi better syt corner vnder ro • e brawlynge woman wyde house good reporte far coūtre lyke colde water thrysty soule aryghtuous man ☞ fallynge downe vngodly lyke troubled well sprynge destroied lyke nat • ccle 3 c good eate muche honye euen wyll searche hye thynges shall heuy rule hym self lyke cyte whiche broken downe hathe walles ¶ capi xxvi like snowe mete sommer rayne haruest euen worship unsemely fole lyke byrde swalowe take theyr flyght fle curse geuen vayne shal lyght vpon man psal 32 b unto hors belongeth whyppe asse brydle rodde foles back geue fole answere folyshnesse least thou become lyke vnto make fole answere folishnesse lest wyse owne conceate lame fete yea droncken vanite commytteth thynge foole lyke unsemely thynge haue legges yet halte euē parable foles mouth yt setteth • oole hye dignite euen man dyd cast precious stone vpon galous parable foles mouth lyke thorne prycketh dronken mā hande man experience discerneth thynges wel hyreth foole hyreth suche one wyll take hede 1 pet 2 • lyke dogge turneth agayne vomyte euen foole begynneth folyshnesse agayne fresshe thou seest man wyse owne conceyt hope foole hym pro xxii b slouthfull sayeth leoparde way lyon myddest stretes lyke dore turneth aboute vpon thresholde euen doth slouthfull welter hym selfe bed prou xix c slouthfull body thrusteth hande bosome greueth hym put agayne mouth • ogarde thynketh selfe wiser ☞ seuen men syt teache goeth medleth men stryfe lyke one y• taketh dogge eares lyke one shoteth deadly arowes dartes preuy place euen doth dissembler neyghbour sayeth whan thou arte taken dyd sport wod fyre goeth euen backebiter taken away y• stryfe ceaseth eccle 28 b cole kyndle heate wod fyre euen doth brawlyng felow stere vp variaunce sclaunderers wordes lyke flatery pearse inwarde partes body uenymous lyppes wycked hert lyke potsherde couered syluer drosse enemy shal knowē talkynge meane season ymagineth myschefe speaketh fayre beleue hym seuen ab hominacions herte kepeth euyl wyl secretely hurte malyce shalbe shewed whole congregaci eccle x b eccle 27 dyggeth vp pyt shal fal ther weltreth stone shal stomble vpon selfe dyssemblynge tong hateth one rebuketh flateryng mouth worketh myschefe ¶ capi xxvii make nat thy boste morowe luke 2 c ezec 28 • iames 4 b yu knowest may happen day let another man prayse thyne owne mouthe yea folkes lyppes thyne stone heuy sande weyghtye foles wrath heuyer bothe wrathe cruell thynge furiousnes tempest yea able abyde enuye open rebuke better secrete loue faythfull woundes louer ky enemye cruel ful abhorreth hony combe vnto hongrye euery sowre thynge swete oftetymes flitteth lyke byrde forsaketh nest herte glad swete oynt mente fauour stomake gyue good councel reioyseth man neyghbour thine owne frende thy father frende se thou forsake nat go nat thy brother house tyme thy trouble better frende bande brother farre sonne wyse thou shalte make glad herte shall make answere vnto rebuker wyse man seynge plage wyll hyde hym selfe fooles go styll suffre harme prouit x c take garmente suretie straunger take pledge hym vnknowen man sake hastye prayse neyghboure aboue measure shall taken one gyueth hym euyll reporte prou xix b braulyng woman rofe house droppynge taynye daye maye well compared togyther refrayneth refrayneth wynde holdeth oyle fast hande lyke one yron whetteth another doth one man comforte another kepeth fygge tre shall enioye fruites thereof euen wayteth vpon mayster shall come honoure lyke one water appeare dyuers face euen dyuerse men haue dyuerse hertes lyke ☞ hell destruccyon neuer full euen eccle 1 eccle 14 xxvii c eye men neuer satisfyed syluer tryed moulde golde fornace man openly praysed face ⚜ hart wycked man seketh myschefe true harte seketh knowledge thoughe thou shuldest bray foole pestell morter lyke otemell yet wyll nat foolyshenesse go hym se thou knowe nombre thy cattell thy selfe loke well thy flockes ryches abyde nat alwaye ☞ crowne endureth euer heye groweth grasse commeth vp herbes gathered mountaynes lambes shall clothe goates thou shalt haue money thy husbandry thou shalt haue goates mylck ynough fede vphold thy houshold susteyne thy maydens capi xxviii vngodly flyeth whan man chaseth hym ryghtuous standeth styffe lyon leuit 26 • sinne lande dothe ofte chaunge prynce thorowe men vnderstandynge wysdome realme endureth longe one poore man oppressyng another vyolence lyke contynuall rayne destroyeth fruyte forsake lawe prayse vngodly suche kepe lawe abhorre 1 cor • 2 • wycked men dyscer • e nat thynge ryght seke lorde discusse thynges prou 〈◊〉 • pore man leadynge godly lyfe better ryche goeth frowarde wayes kepeth lawe childe vnderstandyng cōpanion ryotus mē shameth father increasethe ryches vauntage wynnynge let gather helpe poore withall prouet • b turneth awaye eare hearynge lawe prayer shalbe abhominable ledeth ryghtuous euyll waye shall fall owne pyt iuste shall haue good possession ryche man thynketh hym selfe wyse poore hath vnderstaudyng perceyue wel ynough eccle x • prou 〈◊〉 • ryghtuous men prosperite doth honoure floryshe vngodly come vp state men chaungeth hydeth synnes shall prospere iob x • • • ▪ psal 32 b 1 iob • • knowledgeth thē forsaketh shall haue mercy well standeth alwaye awe harder • eth herte shall fal myschefe lyke roarynge lyon hongry bere euē vngodly price ouer poore people prince wythout vnderstandynge great oppressyon wronge yf suche one hateth couetousnesse shall longe rayne gen • 4 • vyolence sheddethe man bloude shall rennagate vnto graue man shal able succoureproue x • hym leadeth godly innocent lyfe shall saued goeth frowarde wayes shall onse haue fall prou 〈◊〉 • eccle 〈◊〉 • tylleth lande shal haue plē tuousnesse breade y• foloweth ydil nesse shall haue pouerte ynough man y• dealeth faythfully shalbe fylled blessynges 1 tim 6 b pro xxiii maketh haste ryche shal nat vngylty haue respecte personnes iudgemente nat good man wyll wronge yea euen pece breade wyll ryche soone hathe euyll eye consydereth nat pouerte shall come vpon hym rebuketh man shall fynde fauoure last flatereth hym mat xv robbeth father mother sayeth synne lyke vnto destroyer proude stomake stereth vp strife putteth truste lorde shal well fedde trusteth owne herte foole walketh wysely shall safe 2 cori 9 b gyueth vnto poore shall lacke turneth awaye eye suche necessytie shall suffre greate pouerte hym selfe prou 28 b 29 • vngodly come vp men fayne hide selues peryshe ryghtuous increase capi xxix styfnecked wyll nat refourmed shal sodaynly destroyed without helpe prou 28 b eccle x ryghtuous haue ouer hande people prosperite vngodly bereth rule people mourne loueth wysdome maketh hys father glad man proue v luke xv c kepethē company harlottes spendeth away hath true iudgement kynge setteth vp lande yf man couetous turneth vp syde downe flatereth hys neyghbour layeth nette fete ⚜ synne wycked owne snare ryghtuous doth synge reioyse ryghtuous consydreth cause poore vngodly regardeth vnderstandynge wycked people brynge cytie decaye wyse men set vp agayne wyse man go lawe foole whether deale hym frendly roughely getteth reste bloude thyrstye hate ryghtuous iuste ☞ seke hys soule foole powreth hys sprete together wyse man kepeth tyl afterwarde prynce delyte lye seruauntes vngodly poore lender mete togyther lorde lyghteneth bothe theyr eye proue xx▪ • seate y• kynge faythfully iudgeth poore shall contynue sure euer rodde correcion mynys • wysdome yf chylde nat loked vnto bryngeth mother shame vngodly come vp wyckednes increaseth ryghtuous shal se theyr fall nurtoure thy sonne correccyon thou shalt arrest yea shal good thyne herte worde god preached people peryshe well kepeth lawe seruaunt wyll better wordes though vnderstande yet wyll nat regarde yf thou seest man hastye speake vnaduysed thou mayst trust foole hym delycately bryngeth vp seruaūt child shal make hym mayster length angry man stereth vp stryfe beareth euyll wyll mynde doth moche euyll pryde commeth fall iob xxii lowely sprete bryngeth greate worshyppe kepeth company thefe hateth owne soule hereth blasphemyes telleth forthe feareth men shal haue fall putteth truste lorde without daunger many seke prynces fauoure euery man iudgement commeth lorde rightuous abhorreth vngodly ryght waye wycked hate ⚜ chylde kepeth worde shalbe without destruccyon ¶ putenes worde god ought requyre god certayne wonderfull thynges worlde capi xxx wordes agur sonne iakei propherye man spake vnto ithiel euen vnto ithiel uchall foolysshe man haue man vnderstandynge neuer lerned wysdome knoweledge holy thynges hathe clymmed vp heauen hathe come downe thence hathe holden wynde faste hys hande hathe comprehended water garmente hathe sette endes worlde hys name sonnes name canste thou tell psal xix • wordes god pure cleane shylde vnto put theyr truste deute 4 xii put yu nothynge vnto wordes lest reproue thou founde lyar two thinges haue requyred thou wylt denye dye remoue frome vanyte lie geue neyther pouerte ryches onely graunte necessary 〈2 page missing〉 errour folishnes perce • ued thys vexacyon mynde muche wysdome also great trauaile aud disquyetnes knowledge man hathe hys care ¶ aboundaunce rychesse pleasure buyldynge vayne thynges cap ii sayde thus herte nowe go wyl take myne ease haue good dayes lo vanite also muche sayde vnto laughter thou arte mad myrthe doest thou thought herte withdrawe flesshe wyne applye mynde vnto wysdome comprehende folishnesse vntyll tyme amonge thynges whiche vnder sunne myght se beste men long lyue vnder heauen 3 r 3456 made gorgyous fayre worckes buylded house planted vyneyardes made orchardes gardēs pleasure planted tree maner frutes 4 〈◊〉 4 9 made pooles water water grene frutefull tree withall boughte seruauntes maydens greate housholde catell shepe substaunce ierusalē gathered syluer golde together euen treasure kinges landes prouyded syngers wemen whiche coulde playe instrumentes make men myrth pastyme gat psaltery songes musycke greater worshype predecessours ierusalem wysedome remained loke whatsoeuer myne eye desyred let haue wherin soeuer hert delyted pleasure helde nat frō thus hert reioysed dyd porcyon trauayle considred worckes handes wrought al labour taken therin lo vanite vexacyon mynde nothynge value vnder sunne turned consydre wysdome errour folyshnesse among men myght compared kyng worckes sawe wysdome excellethe folyshnesse farre lyghte dothe darckenesse wyse man hath hys eye head foole goeth ī darckenesse perceaued also bothe one ende thought minde • happen vpon foole dothe vnto nedeth thē labour eny wysdome confessed hert also vanyte wyse euer lytle remembraunce folysh al dayes come shal forgotten yee wise man dyeth wel foole thus beganne weery lyfe muche coulde away nothing done vnder sūne vanyte vexacyon mynde yee weery labour whiche taken vnder sunne shulde fayne leaue vnto another man commeth knoweth whether shall wyse man foole yet shall lorde labour whiche suche wysdome haue takē vnder sunne also vayne thynge turned refrayne mynde suche trauayle toke vnder sunne muche man shulde weery hym selfe wysdome vnderstandynge oportunyte yet fayne leaue hys labour vnto another neuer swet also vaine thyng greate misery getteth mā y• laboure trauayle mynde taketh vnder sunne▪ heuynesse sorowe • isquyetnetnes dayes lyfe muche herte nat reste nyght also vayne thynge eccle v • nat better mā eate drynke soule mery labour yes sawe thys also gyfte god wyll eate go lustely worke geueth vnto mā pleaseth whether wysdome vnderstādyng gladnesse vnto synner geueth weerynes ⚜ superfluous ca • e may gather heape gether y• thynge afterwarde shalbe geuē vnto whō pleaseth god nowe vayne thyng yee disquietnesse vexacyon mynde ¶ al thynges come ī theyr tyme passe away theyr tyme capi iii euery thynge hathe tyme yee vnder heauen hathe conuenyente season time borne tyme dye tyme plāte tyme plucke vp thynge planted tyme slaye tyme make whole tyme breake downe tyme buylde vp tyme wepe tyme laugh tyme mourne tyme daunse tyme caste awaye stone tyme gather stone together tyme embrace tyme reftayne embracing tyme winne tyme lese tyme spare tyme spende tyme cut peces tyme sowe together • uis 20 • 31 〈◊〉 • tyme kepe sylence tyme speake tyme loue tyme hate tyme warre tyme peace hathe man elles doth thynge werynesse laboure touchynge trauayle carefulnesse whiche god hathe geuen vnto men se hathe geuen exercised hathe ordayned maruelous goodly euery thynge due tyme hathe planted ignoraunce also hertes men shulde nat cō prehende grounde hys workes whiche doth begynnyng ende perceyued thiges nothing better man mery well longe lyueth al man eateth dryncketh yea euer man enioyeth laboure gyfte god consyder also soeuer god dothe continueth euer nothynge put vnto taken god dothit intent men shulde feare e •••• x thynge hathe bene nowe thynge come hathe bene afore tyme god restoreth agayne thynge paste ouer sawe vnder sunne vngodlynesse steade iudgement iniquyte steade ryghtuousnesse thought mynde god shall seperate ryghtuous vngodly shalbe tyme iudgement al councels workes commoned myne owne herte also concernynge chyldren men howe god hath chosen yet letteth appere though beastes happeneth vnto men doth vnto beastes • ne dyeth dieth yea haue bothe one maner breth yt man hathe preemynence aboue beast subdued vnto vanytye go vnto one place dust shall al turne vnto dust agayne •• p •• 2 • knoweth sprete man goeth vpwarde breth beast goth downe earthe wherfore perceaue nothynge better man ioyfull laboure porcyon wyll brynge hym se thynge shall come hym ¶ myse • yes th innocent superfluou • laboures men chyld •• poore wyse c capi iiii soitvrned aba • ue 1 • eccl •• 5 • consydred vyolente wrong done vnder sonne beholde teares suche oppressed man comforte wolde delyuer defende vyolence oppressours wherfore iudged deade happye suche alyue yea hym yet vnborne better ease bothe seeth miserable workes done vnder sonne agayne sawe trauayle di lygence laboure hated euery man also vaine thyng vexacion mynde foole foldeth handes together eateth vp owne flesshe one hande full better reste bothe handes full laboure trauayle mynde moreouer turned behelde yet another vanyte vnder sonne one man mo hym selfe alone hauynge neither chylde brother yet ende carefull trauayle eye nat satisfied ryches▪ ⚜ yet doth remembre selfe say whome take suche trauayle whose pleasure thus consume awaye lyfe also vayne myserable thynge therefore two bet • er one maye well enioye profyte theyr laboure yf one fall hys companyon helpeth hym vp wo alone yf fall hathe nat another helpe hym vp agayne whē two stepe together warme howe body warme alone one maye ouercome two may make resystaunce threfolde threde nat lyghtly broken poore chylde beyng wyse better olde kyng doce • h ware tyme come gene • li 5 reg 10 c • reg 1 • c • pat 〈◊〉 c 4 re▪ • 5▪ • one commeth prison made kynge another whiche borne kyngedome commeth vnto pouerte perceyued men lyuynge vnder sonne go seconde chylde▪ commeth vp steade people haue bene come hym innumerable yet nat theyr ioye greater thorowe hym also vayne thyng vecacion mynde thou commest house god kepe thy fote drawnye thou mayest heare 1 reg x v • better thē offerynges fooles knowe nat euyll ¶ amonyeyon beware rasshe communication ought nat meruayle oppressyon • ort •• tous satisfyed hys ryches capit v hasty thy month let thyne herte speake thynge rashely god god heauen thou vppon earthe therfore let thy wordes fewe muche carefulnesse many dreames many wordes men maye heare fooles dut 23 datur • • thou make vowe vnto god nat slacke perfourme folyshe vowes hath plesure thou promyse thynge paye better thou make vowe thē thou shul best promyse nat paye ☞ suffre thy mouth cause thy flesh synne neither saye thou aungell thy ignoraūce god wylbe angrye thy voyce destroye workes thyne handes why▪ many dreames many wordes also dyuers vanity loke thou feare god thou feyst poore oppressedeccles 4 • 〈◊〉 1 • wrongefully dealte withall equyte ryght lawe wrested lande meruayle thou suche thynge one greate man kepeth touche another myghtye helpe selues together whole lande also feldes therein subieccion bondage vnto kynge loueth money wyll neuer satysfyed money delyteth ryches shall haue profyte therof also vayne thyage muche ryches many also spende away pleasure hathe possesseth sauynge maye loke vpon thē eye labouring man slepeth swetely whether lytle muche eateth aboundaunce ryche wyll nat suffre hym slepe yet sore plage whiche haue sene vnder sonne namely ryches kepte hurte hym hathe possessyon oft tymes perysh great mysery trouble yf haue chylde getteth nothynge iob • timo 6 b lyke came naked mother wombe goeth thither agayne caryeth nothyng away hym laboure myserable plage shall go away euē came helpeth hym hathe laboured wynde dayes lyfe also eate darke greate carefulnesse syckenesse sorowe eccle 2 • therfore thyncke better fayrer thyng man eate dryncke refreshed al labour taketh vnter sonne al day lyfe god geueth hym poreyon vnto soeuer god geueth ryches goodes power geueth hym enioye take hys porcyon refreshed laboure gyfte god thynketh nat much howe lōge shal lyue muche god fylleth herte gladnesse ¶ myserye ryche couetous dyfference foole wyse man capi vi yet plage whiche behelde vnder sonne generall thynge amonge men god gyueth man ryches goodes honour wantethe nothynge herte desyre yet god geueth hym nat leue enioye another mā spendeth vayne thynge myserable plage man beget hundreth chyldren lyue many yeares dayes many nombre yet nat enioye good neyther buryed say vntymely byrth better cōmeth naught goeth waye darckenesse name forgotten moreouer seeth nat sonne knoweth nat yet hath rest yea though lyued two thousande yeares yet hathe good lyfe come al one place laboure man taketh hym selfe yet desyre neuer fylled hys mynde hathe wyse foole helpeth poore knoweth walke lyuynge syght eye better soule shulde depart awaye howe also vayne thynge dysquietnesse mynde thynge hath bene named al redy knowe euen man hym selfe neyther maye go lawe hym y• myghtier many thinges y• increace vanyte hath man el knoweth good man lyuynge dayes hys vaine lyfe shadowe wyll tell man shal happē hym vnder y• sūne ¶ whiche passeth strengthes wyttes ought nat seke capi vii pro 22 good name worth cant 1 • precyous oyntmente daye deth better daye byrthe better go house mournyng bancketinge house ende men lyuynge taketh hert better sory laugh countenaūce heuy herte refourmed herte wyse mourning house hert folysh house mirthprou 17 • better geue eare chastenynge wyse man heare songe fooles laughynge foles lyke crackynge thornes vnder pot vayne thynge doeth wrong maketh wyse man go oute wytte destroyeth gentle hert ende thynge better begynnyne pacyent spryte better hye mynded nat hastely angry thy mynde wrath resteth bosome fooles say thou cause dayes olde tyme better nowe wyse quesyon wysdome better ryches yee muche worthe eye syghte wysdome defendeth well money excellent knowledge wysdome geueth lyfe vnto hym hathe possessyon consydre worcke god howe man make thing strayght maketh croked use well tyme prosperyte remēbre tyme mysfortune god maketh one man fynde nothynge el thynges haue considred tyme vanite iust man perysheth hys ryghteousnes sake vngodly lyueth hys wyckednesse therfore rom 11 c thou nether ryghteous ouer wyse thou peryshe nat nether vnrighteous also folyshe leste y• dye thy tyme good take holde thys nat let y• go thy hande feareth god shall escape wysdome geueth corage vnto wyse ten myghtye men cytye 3 reg • • 2 pata 6 g prou • 0 • 1 〈◊〉 1 b nat one iuste vpon earth dothe good synneth nat take nat hede vnto euery worde spoken lest thou heare thy seruaunt curse thyne owne knoweth thou thy selfe also hast ofte tymes spoken euyl men thinges haue proued wysdome sayde wyl wyse iob 28 • went farther fro yee depe y• myght nat reach vnto applyed mynde also vnto knowledge seke scyēce wisdome vnderstandyng know foolyshenes vngodly errour dotynge fooles foūde prou 7 woman bytterer thē deth angle herte net handes cheynes pleaseth god shal escape synner wyll taken beholde sayeth preacher haue dyligently searched proued myght come knowledge yet seke fynde among thousāde men haue founde one nat one womā amonge lo thys onely haue foūde y• gene • • god made man iust ryghte sought many inuencyons ¶ kynges commaundement ought obeyed▪ gladnes one chefe thynges vnder sonne capi viii wyse hath knowledge make answere mās wysdome prou 17 • iob 9 • maketh hys face shyne malyce putteth fauoure muste kepe kynges commaundemente othe haue made vnto god nat hastye go hys syght se thou contynue euyll thinge whatsoeuer pleaseth hym doeth lyke kynge geueth charge hys commaundement myghtye euen iob 9 b maye saye vnto hym est y• leui 18 • kepeth commaundement shall fele harme wise man herte discerneth tyme maner euery thyng wyl haue oportunyte iugement thys thynge maketh men full carefulnes forowe man knoweth nat come wyl tell hym nether eny man y• hath power ouer spryte kepe styl spryte haue power tyme death • nat also make ende battayle nether may vngodlynes delyuer medle al thynges haue considered applyed mynd vnto euery worcke y• done vnder sōne howe one man hathe lordshype 〈2 page missing〉 strong men shal shall feare hye place afrayed stretes almonde tree shall floryshe laden greshoper luste shall passe man goeth long home mourner go aboute stretes euer syluer lace taken awaye golden bande broken pot
