people knowledge gaue good hede sought grounde set forthe many parable hys diligence finde acce • ▪ • able wordes right scrypture wordes trueth hebre 4 • wordes wyse lyke pryckes nayles go thorowe wher men kepte togyther geuen one shepherde onely therfore beware sōne aboue thou make nat many innumeble bokes take dyuerse doctrynes hande wery thy body withall let v heare conclusion thynges feare god kepe commaundementes toucheth men god shall iudge worckes secrete thynges whether good euyll ❧ ende boke preacher otherwyse called ecclesiastes ballet ballettes salomon called latyn canticū canticorum ¶ mysticall songe spyrytuall godly loue betwene chryste spouse churche congregacyon hys spousesse capitvlo wolde kysse ky mouth thy loue pleasaunt wyne y• good pleasaūte sauour thy name eccle 7 • swete smellynge oyntment therefore maydens loue y• draw thou vnto wyl runne kynge hath brought hys preuy chambres wyll glad reioyce thynke thy loue wyne ryghtuous loue blacke ye doughters ierusalc̄ lyke gene 〈◊〉 • ▪ • tentes cedarenes p •• 3 • hangynges salomon yet fayre welfauoured withall maruayle blacke sunue hath shyned vpon mother chyldren euyll wyll made keper vyneyards myne owne vineyard haue kepte tel hi soule loueth y• fedest yu makest rea •• noone daye shall belyke hym goeth wronge flockes thy companyons yf thou knowe thy selfe thou fayrest among wemē thē go thy waye fotesteppes shepe fede thy goates besyde shepehardes tentes unto exod 14 • host pharaos charettes haue compared loue thy chekes thy neck beautiful turtils hanged spanges goodly iewels necke bande fayre art thou y• hast doues eies fayre art y• beloued wel fauored art y• bed decte wt floures y• selyngꝭ house cedre tree balkꝭ cypresse▪ capi ii ly • ie felde rose valleye rose among thornes loue amonge daughter lyke apple tree among tree wood beloued amonge sonnes delyte syt vnder hys shadowe frute swete vnto throte bryngeth hys wyne seller loueth specyally well refresh grape comforte apple sycke loue •• • • lefte hande lyeth vnder heade ryght hande shal embrace •• 3 • charge ye daughter ierusalem roe hyndes felde ye wake nat vp loue touche tyl contente selfe thynke heare voyce beloued lo commeth hoppynge vpon mountaynes leapynge ouer lytle hylles beloued lyke roo yonge hart holde standeth behynde wall loketh y• wyndowe pepeth thorowe grate beloued answered sayde vnto stande vp loue beutyfull come lo wenter nowe paste rayne awaye gone floures come vp felde tyme vyrdes syngynge come voyce turtle done harde lande fygge tree bryngeth forth fygges vynes beare blossom haue good smel stande vp loue beutyful come doue caues y• rockes hole wall let mese thy countenaunce heare thy voice swete thy voice fayre thy face get v fox yee lytle fox hurt vynes oure vynes beare blossom • enti 6 • loue myne hys whiche fedeth amonge rose vntyl daye breake tyll shadowes gone come agayne beloued lyke roo yonge hart vpon wyde mountaynes ¶ capi iii nyght bed sought hym whō soule loueth yee dilygently sought hym founde hym nat wyll get vp thought go cytie vpon market al uretes wyll seke hym soule loueth sought hym foūde hym nat watchman also go aboute cytie toude sawe ye nat ••• soule loueth • ytle paste founde hym soule loueth haue gotten holde vpon hi wyl nat let go vntyl brynge hym mother house chambre bare charge ye daughter ierusalem roe hyndes felde ye wake nat vp loue touche tyll content selfe commeth vp wyldernes lyke vapour smoke smell myrre franckencence maner spyces apotecary beholde aboute salomon bedstede ther stande xl valeaūe men myghtie israel holde swerdes euery one experte warre euery man also hathe swerde vpon thygh fere nyght kynge salamon made hym selfe palace wod libanus p • lars syluer couerynge golde seate purple grounde plesauntly paued loue daughter ierusalem go forth ye daughter sion beholde kynge salomon crowne wherwith mother crowned hym daye hys maryage day gladnes herte cap iiii canti 1 • howe fayre art thou loue howe fayre art thou thou hast doues eye besyde whiche lyeth hyd within c •• 6 thy hearye locke lyke wol flocke shepe shorne vpon mount g • lead thy teth lyke shepe gnesse went vp washyng place euery one beareth two twin nat one vnfrutefull amonge thy lyppes lyke rose coulored rybonde thy wordes louely thy chekes lyke pece pomgranate besydes whiche lyeth hyd within thy necke lyke tower dauid buylded bulwerckes wher vpon hang thousande shyldes yee weapens geauntes canti 7 thy two brestes lyke two twyns yonge roe whiche fede amonge rose myght go mountayne myrre hyll frankyncense tyll daye breake tyll shadodowes past awaye thou art fayre loue spott come lybanus spouse come lybanus loke toppe amana frō toppe san •• hermon frō lion dennes frō moūtaynes leopardes thou hast woūded hert 〈2 page missing〉 booke prophete esaye ¶ esaye prophecyeth angre god shall come vpon ierusalem theyr synnes capitvlo vysyon esaye sonne amos whiche sawe vpon iuda ierusalem dayes uzia ioathan aham iehezikiah kynges iuda heare heauens herken earthe lorde hathe spoken haue norished brought vp chyldren haue done wyckedly oxe hath knowē owner asse maysters cryb israel hathe receyued knoweledge people hathe vnderstandynge ala synfull nacyon people greate iniquytie frowarde generacyon vnnatural child haue forsaken lorde haue prouoked holy one israel vnto angre gone backward wherby shuld ye plaged ye euer fallynge awaye whole heed syke herte heuy sole y• fote vnto y• heed hole part al body al woundes botch sore strypes neither helped boūde vp molifyed eased oyntment lande lyeth waste cityes brent vp enemyes deuoure lande ye must fayne stande loke vpon desolate enemyes batayle moreouer daughter syon lefte alone lyke cotage vyneyarde lyke lodge gardeyn cucumber lyke beseged cytie excepte lorde hostes hadde lefte v fewe alyue shulde haue bene sodoma lyke vnto gomorra heare worde lorde ye lordes sodoma harken vnto lawe god thou people gomorra sayth y• lorde offre ye many sacrifyces vnto ful brent offerynges wether fatnesse fed beastes haue pleasure bloude bullockes lambes gotes ye appere requireth treade within porch offre mo oblacyons lost labour incense abhominable thynge vnto may awaye newe mones sabbathes solemne dayes fastingꝭ also vaine hate new holy dayes fastinges euen fro herte make wery abide whan ye holde handes wyl turne myne eies frō though ye make many prayer yet heare nothynge seynge handes ar full bloude washe make cleane put away euyll thoughtes syght cease euell learne ryght apply selues equite delyuer y• oppressed helpe fatherlesse right let wydowes cōplaynt come nowe go saythe y• lorde let v talke together though synnes reade searlet shalbe whyte snow though lyke purple shalbe whyte wolle▪ ye louing obedyent ye shal enioye best thing y• groweth lande yf ye obstinate rebellious ye shall deuoured wt swerde thus lorde hath promysed owne mouth howe happeneth ryghtuous cytie whiche full equyte become vnfaythfull whore ryghtuousnes dwelt nowe murther thy syluer turned drosse thy wyne myxte water thy prynces wycked companyons theues loue gyftes together gape rewardes fatherles helpe nat hꝭ ryght neyther wyll let wydowes cause c 〈…〉 e therfore sayth lord ¶ 〈…〉 hostes myghtye one israel al muste ease myne enemyes auenge myne aduersaries shall lay hande vpon burne drosse fynest purest put thy fynne sette thy iudges agayne somtyme thy senatours begynnyng shalt thou called ryghtuous citie faith full cyte syon shall redemed equite shall turne agayne vnto ryghtuousnesse transgressours vngodly suche become vnfaythfull vnto lorde must al together vtterly destroyed excepte ye ashamed y• oke tree wherin ye haue delyted garden y• ye haue chosen ye shalbe oke whose leaues fallen awaye garden hath moistnesse y• glory ☞ thiges shalbe turned drye strawe y• made thē sparke shal burne gether man shalbe able quench ¶ commynge death chryste callynge heathen capi ii worde opened vnto esay sonne amoz vnto iuda ierusalem wyll also ☞ last dayes hyll house lorde buylded shall chefe amonge hylles exalted aboue lytle hilles al nacyōs shal preace vnto multytude people shall go speakynge thus one another vp psa 122 mith 4 let v go hyll lorde house god iacob maye shewe v hys wayes maye walke hys pathes lawe shal come syō worde lorde ierusalem shall geue sentence amonge heathen shal reforme multytude people shal breake theyr swerdes also mattockes theyr speares make sythes one people shall nat lyfte vp weapen agaynste another nether shall learne fyght then forth come ye house iacob let v walke y• lyght lorde thou hast forsakē thy people house iacob cause go farre beyonde theyr father sorceres whō haue philistine ☞ straunge chyldren thynke selues haue ynough theyr lande full syluer golde neyther ende theyr treasure theyr lande also full horse ende theyr charets theyr lande also full vayne goddes worke theyr owne handes haue bowed selues yee euen thynge theyr owne fyngers haue made kneleth man falleth man downe thou canst nat brynge away frō thence therfore get rocke hyde grounde feare lorde▪ glory magestye whiche casteth downe hygh lokes presumptuous personnes bryngeth lowe pryde man lorde onely shall exalted daye daye lorde hostes shall go ouer pryde presumpcyon vpon exalte thē selues shall brynge downe vpon al hygh stoute cedre tree libanus vpon al okes basan vpō hygh hylles vpon stoute mountaynes vpon al costly rowres vpon stronge walles vpon shyppes see vpon euery thynge gloryous pleasaunte loke vpon shall brynge downe pryde man laye man presumptuousnesse full lowe lorde shall onely haue vyctory daye idol shal vtterly roted men shall crepe hole stone caues y• earth feare lorde glory magesty tyme shall ryse vp condemne earth shall man caste awaye goddes syluer goddes golde whiche neuertheles made honour thē vnto molle backes shall crepe caues rockes clyftes harde stone feare god glory magestye ryseth condemne earth feare nat ye man whose breth hys nostrels reputacyon ¶ prophecyeth cōmyng chryst strēgth power shall put forth iur • e capi iii forlo lorde god hostes dothe take away ierusalem iuda possessyons power meate drynke captayne soudyar iudge prophete wyse aged man prynce fiftie yeare olde honorable senatours men vnderstandynge master craftes oratours shal geue chyldren theyr prynces babe shal haue rule people also shalbe pylled polled one shall euer doyng violēce wronge another boye shall presume agaynst elder vyle person agaynste honorable yee one shall take frende owne kynred bosome saye thou hast clothynge thou shalt heade thou mayest kepe v frō thys fall parell shal sweare say nat helpe moreouer neyther meate clothynge house make ruler people ierusalem iuda muste decaye bothe theyr wordes coūcels lorde prouoke presence hys magestye vnto anger chaungynge theyr countenaunce bewrayeth yee declare theyr owne synnes selues sodomytes hyde nat wo vnto theyr soules haue rewarded euell vnto selues byd ryghteous well shall enioye frutes theyr study wo vngodly vnryghteous shalbe rewarded theyr worckes child extorciōners peple wemen haue rule people leader deceaue depraue waye thy fotesteppes lorde commen matter standeth geue iudgemente people lorde shal come forthe reason senatours prynces hys people ye y• haue destroyed vineyarde robbery y• poore house wherfore ye oppresse peple marre y• face y• poore sayeth lorde god hostes moreouer thus sayeth lorde seynge y• daughter sion come proude haue walked stretched neckes vayne wanton eye seynge come tryppynge nycely theyr fete therfore shall lorde shaue heades daughter sion lorde shal disconer theyr shame daye shal lorde take away gorgiousnesse apparell spanges cheynes partelettes colars bracelettes hooues goodly floured wyde brodred rayment oches headbandes rynges garlandes holy day clothes vale kerchefes pynnes glass smockes bonettes tach steade good smell shall styncke among theyr gyrdles shalbe loose bandes well set heare shalbe baldenesse steade stomachec sacke clothe theyr bewty witherdnesse sonne burninge yourhousbandes mightye men shal peryshe swerde batayle tyme shall ☞ theyr gate mourne complayne shall syt desolate folcke vpon earth ¶ want men seuē wemen desyred haue one man capi iiii shall seuen wyues take holde one man saye wyll laye meate clothing together comen may called thy wyues thys shamefull reprofe maye taken v tyme shall braunche lorde bewtyfull myghty frute earth shalbe fayre pleasaunt israelytes shall spring therof shall remnaunt sion remnaunt ierusalem called holy namely al wryttē amōg lyuynge ierusalem tyme y• lord shal washe away fylthynes y• daughter sion pourge bloude frō ierusalem wynde hys smoke fyre moreouer vpon dwellinges hyll sion vpon theyr whole congregacion shall lorde prouide cloude smoke daye shynynge flammynge fyre nyght theyr glory shalbe preserued ierusalem shal tabernacle shadow hete daye time place refuge man maye kepe hym wether rayne ¶ chryst hys vyneyarde execracion couetousnesse dronekennes capi v nowe wyll synge beloued frende songe hys vyneyarde beloued frende hathe vyneyarde frutefull plenteous grounde thys hedged thys walled rounde aboute planted goodly grape myddest buylded towre made wyne presse therin afterwarde loked shulde brynge hym grape brought forth thornes nowe therfore ye cytysens ierusalē whole iuda iudge praye betwyxte vyneyarde colde haue bene done haue nat done wherfore hathe geuen thornes loked haue grape well nowe shall tell howe wyll vyneyarde wyl take hedge maye peryshe breake downe wal may troden vnder fote wyll laye waste shall nether twysted cut beare thornes breares wyl also forbyd cloudes shall nat rayne vpon vyneyarde lord hostes house israel whole iuda hys fayre plantynge loked equyte se wronge ryghteousnesse lo mysery wo vnto ioyne one house another bryng one lande nygh vnto another poore get groūde y• ye maye dwell vpon earthe alone thynges eares lorde hostes shall nat many greater gorgyous house waste man shall dwel ten akers vynes shal geue quarte xxx bushel sede shall geue epha wo vnto ryse vp early folowe dronckennes contynue vntyllnyght tyl set fyre wyne cōpanyes harpes lute taberettes pipe wyne regarde nat worcke lorde consyder nat operacyon handes theyr fore commeth folke also captyuyte haue vnderstandynge theyr glory famashed hunger pryde marred thirst therfore gapeth hel openeth mouthe maruelous wyde theyr pryde bostyng welthe suche reioyse therein maye descende thus hathe man fal brought lowe high loke proude shalbe layde downe lorde hostes exalted iudgēment god holy praysed ryghtuousnes shall shepe eate order riche men landes layde waist shall straungers deuoure wo vnto drawe wyckednes vnto coardes vanyte syn cart rope vse speake maner let hym make haste nowe go forth worcke maye se let counsell holy one israell come drawe nye maye knowe wo vnto cal euel good good euell whiche make darcknes lyght lyght darckenesse make sowre swete swete sowre wo vnto wyse theyr owne syght thynke selues haue vnderstandynge wo vnto stronge suppe wyne experte men sete vp dronckennesse geue sentēce vngodly rewardes condempne iust cause ryghteous therfore lyke fyre lycketh vp strawe flame consumeth stubble euen theyr rote shalbe corrupcyon theyr blossome shall vanyshe awaye lyke duste haue caste awaye lawe lorde hostes blasphemed worde holy maker israel therfore wrath lorde kynd led also agaynst people shaketh hande yee hathe smytten hylles dyd tremble theyr karcases dyd lye open stretes lyke •• e wrath god hath ceased hys hande stretched stylus shall gyue token vnto straunge people call vnto far countre beholde shall come hastely spede shal one faynt feble amonge slogyshe slepery persone shall one put gyrdle loynes loose theyr lachet hꝭ shoe arowes sharpe al bowes bent horse hoofes lyke flynte carte wheles lyke stormy wynde crye lyon roareth lyke lyon whelpes shal roare hantche vp pray man shall recouer get daye shall fearse vpon see yf looke vnto lande beholde shalbe darknesse sorowe loke towarde heauen beholde shalbe darke ¶ esay sawe glory lorde sent prophecye desolacyon iurye capi vi yere kynge ozyah dyed sawe ☞ lorde syttynge vpon hygh gloryous seate trayne fylled palace aboue flakert seraphyns wherof euery one syx wynges twayne eche couered hys face twayne fete twayne dyd flye cryed also eche one maner holy holy holy lorde hostes whole worlde full glorye yea geastes dorechekes moued cryenge howse full smoke sayde wo loste asmoche man vncleane lyppes dwell amonge people hathe vncleane lyppes also myne eye haue sene kynge lorde hoostes flewe one seraphins vnto hauing hote cole hande whiche taken aulter tonges touched mouth sayde lo hath touched thy lyppes thyne vn ryghtuousnes taken awaye thy syn forgeuen also herde voyce y• lorde sayenge maner shal sende wyll messaunger sayde sende sayde go tel peple mat 13 b • 4 b luke 8 b actes 18 f iohn 12 f rom 11 b ye shal heare dede ye shall vnderstande ye shal playnly see nat perceaue harden hart people stop eares shut theyr eye se wt theyr eye heare theyr eares vnderstande theyr hertes conuerte healed spake lorde longe answered vntill cyties vtterly without ••••• tour house without men tyl lande also desolate lye vnbuylded lorde shall take men farre awaye lande shal lye waste neuertheles tenth parte shal remaine ther shall conuerte frutefull lyke wyse cerebintes oketrees brynge theyr frutes shall holy sede haue frute ¶ syryans moue ha • ayle agaynst ierusalem vyrgyn shall beare chylde capi vii happened tyme ahaz sonne iothan whiche sonne uziah king iuda 3 reg 16 2 dar 28 razin kynge siria prekeh sonne romelyah kynge israell wente vp towarde ierusalem besege wanne nat nowe house dauid ahaz herde worde therof siria ephraim confederate together hys herte quaked yee hertes also people lyke whan tre felde moued wynde sayde god vnto esaye go mete ahaz thou thy sonne seat iasub head ouer pole fore path fuller groūde saye vnto hym take hede thy selfe styll feare nat nether faynt harted two tale two smokynge fyre brandes wrath furyousnes razin syrian romelies sonne kynge syria ephraim romelies sonne haue wyckedly cōspyred saying wyll go vp agaynst iuda vexe brynge vnder v set kynge euen sonne tabeel thus sayeth lorde god therto shall nat go forth nether come passe ☞ head cytie strians damascus head damascꝰ rayin fyue threscore yeare shall ephraim peple chefe cytie ephraim samaria head samaria romelyes sonne yf ye beleue nat commeth owne vnstedfastnesse moreouer god spake vnto ahaz sayynge requyre token lorde thy god whether towarde depthe beneth towarde height aboue thē sayd ahaz wyll requyre none nether wyll tempte lorde lorde answered heare ye house dauyd nat ynough y• ye greupus vnto men ye muste greue god also therfore lord shal geue tokē behold vyrgin shal conceaue beare sonne shall call hys name ☞ emanuel butter hony shall eate maye knowe refuse euel chose good euer child come knowledge eschue euyl chose good land thou arte afrayde shalbe desolate kynges lorde also shall sende tyme vpon vpon thy people vpon thy father house neuer came sence y• tyme ephraim departed iuda thorow kynge assirians tyme shall lorde whystle flyes water egypte bee assirians lande shal come shall lyghte valeyes vawtes stone vpon grene thynges corner tyme shall lorde ☞ shaue heare heade fete beerd cleane rasour shal paye withall beyonde water namely kynge assirians time shal man lyue cowe two shepe aboundaunce mylcke shall make butter eate euery one whiche remayneth lande shal eate butter hony tyme vyneyardes though thousande vynes one solde thousande syluerlynges shalbe turned brears thornes lyke shall come lande arowes bowes shall lande come brears thornes hylles hewen downe ther shall nat come vpon feare brears thornes catell shall dryuen thyther shepe shall fede ¶ delyueraunce lande emanuell stone offence whiche many shall •• inble cap viii lorde sayde vnto take greate leafe ☞ wryte men penne spede hym robbe haste hym spoyle called vnto faythful wytnesses uryah preste • cariah sonne barachyah wente vnto prophetysse conceaued borne sonne sayde lorde geue hym thys name spedy robber hastye spoyler euer chylde shal haue knowledge crye father mother shall ryches damascus substaunce samaria takē awaye kynge assyrian lorde spake also vnto saying muche thys people refuseth styl rennynge water sylo put theyr delyte razin romelies sonne beholde lorde shall brynge myghtie greate floudes water vppon namely kynge assirians power whiche shal clyme vp vpon al floudes powre furyousnes vpon euerye man renne ouer theyr banckes shall breake vpon iuda increasing power tyll gette hym necke shall fyll also wydenesse thy laude ☞ brode wynges emanuel go together ye people gather herken ye farre countrees mustre gather inustre gather take councell together yet must youre councell come nought go hande withall yet shall nat prospere god v lorde chastysed toke hande warned sayenge vnto shulde nat walke y• waye thys people sayde ouer rounde none euer saye yonder people bounde together feare neyther afrayed sanctyfye lorde hostes let hym youre feare drede sanctifyenge stone stomble rocke fall vpon suare net house israel inhabyters ierusalem many shall stomble fall broken vpon hym yea shalbe snared taken nowe laye wytnesses together seale lawe disciple thus wyl wayte vpon lorde hathe turned face house iacob wil loke hym lo chyldren lord hath geuen token wondre israel lorde hoostes sake whiche dwelleth vpon hyll syon yf saye vnto aske counsell sothesayers wytches charmer coniurers make thys answere ther people asketh coūcel god luke 24 • shulde ronne vnto deade lyuynge man wante lyght let loke vpon lawe testymony whether speke meanyng stōbleth suffreth hūgre yf suffre hungre pa • ience blasphemeth kynge god loketh vpwarde downeward earth holde trouble darkenesse vexacion rounde aboute cloude errour suche aduersyte shall nat escape euen lyke tyme past hathe bene well sene lande zabu lon lande nepthali thorow see waye goeth ouer iordane lande galilee fyrste lytle trouble afterwarde fore vexed ¶ prohecyeth chrystes n • tyu • te domynyon capi ix people walke darkenesse haue sene great lyght dwell lande shadowe deathe vpon hathe lyght shyned thou haste multiplyed people increased theyr ioy psal 119 c reioyse euen men make mery haruest men haue gotten vyctory deale spoyle thou hast broken yoke people burthen staffe hys shoulder rod hys oppressoure dayes madian ouer temerarious sedycious power yea co • e fyled bloude shalbe burnt consumed fyre vnto v chylde borne vnto v sonne geuen upon shoulder doth kyngdome lye called owne name wonderous geuer councel myghtye god euerlastyng father price peace shal make ende encrease kingdome peace shall syt vpon seate dauyd kyngedome set vp stablyshe equyte ryghtuousues frome hence forth euermore shall gelousy lorde hoostes brynge passe lorde sent worde iacob come israel people ephraim shall knowe dwell samaria saye pryde hye stomackes maner tyle worke fallen downe wyll buylde harder stone molbery tymbre broken shall set vp agayne cedre neuertheles lorde shal prepare razin enemye agaynste ordre theyr aduersaryes siriās shall laye holde vpon philystynes behynde deuoure israel open mouth wrathe lord ceassed yet hys hande stret • hed styll people turneth vnto hym chastyseth neyther seke lorde hoostes therefore hathe lorde roted israel bothe heade tayle braunche twygge one daye heade vnderstande senatoure honorable man tayle prophete teacheth lye whiche enfourme people ryght case suche disceiuers men thynke also perfecte amonge cast awaye therfore shal lorde haue pleasure theyr yonge men neyther fauoure theyr fatherlesse wydowes together ypocrytes wycked theyr mouthes speake foly lordes wrath ceassed yet hande stretched styll vngodlynesse burneth fyre bryers thornes fyre wodde rede busshe ascendeth smoke theyr pryde cause wrathe lorde hoostes lande full darkenesse people consumed fyre man dothe spare brother man turne hym ryght hande shal famyshe lefte hande eate shall nat haue ynough euery man shall ☞ eate fleshe h • owne arme manasses shal eate ephraim ephraim manasses bothe shall eate iuda lordes wrath ceassed yet hande stretched styll ¶ threatneth oppressours poore prophecyeth agaynst sennaherib capi x wo vnto thē make vnryghtuous lawes deuyse thynges whiche harde kepe thorowe poore oppressed euery syde innocentes people robbed iudgement widowes maye theyr praye may rob fatherlesse wyll ye tyme visitacyon whan destruccion shal come farte whome wyll ye renne helpe wyll ye geue youre honoure maye kepe ye come amonge prysoners lye amonge deade al doth wrath lorde ceasse yet handes stretched styll wo also vnto assur whiche staf wrathe whose hande rod punyshement shal sende hym among ypocrytishe people amonge people y• haue deserued dysfauoure shall sende hym maye vtterly robbe spoyle treade thē downe lyke myre strete howe meanynge nat neyther thynketh herre fashyon ymagmeth onely howe may rote destroye muche people sayeth nat prynces kynges nat ☞ caluo easie wine char chamis harder conquere ☞ hamath arphad lyghter ouer come damascus samaria say able wynne kingdome idolater theyr goddes ierusalem samaria shall nat vnto ierusalem theyr ymages dyd vnto samaria theyr ydoles wherfore lorde sayeth assone haue perfourmed whole worke vpō hyll syon ierusalem wyll ☞ vyset noble stoute harte kynge assyria hys proude lokes standeth thus owne conceyte thorow power myne owne hande thorowe wysdome wyse remoue landes people robbe theyr treasure lyke one worthyes dryue thē theyr hye seates hande hathe founde strēgth people neste lyke eggꝭ layde gathered together gather countrees man dare bolde touche fether dare open mouthe whysper shall axe boste selfe agaynste hym heweth therwith doth saw make braggynge agaynste ruleth euē lyke yf rod dyd exalte selfe agaynste hym beareth though staffe shuld magnyfye itselfe saye wod therfore shal lorde hostes sende pouertie rich burne vp glorye fyre lyght israell shal fyre sayntuary shalbe flamme shall kyndle burne vp hys thornes breers one daye yea ☞ glory hys woddes feldes shalbe consumed body soule shalbe hooste men whose standerd bearer fayleth tree also felde whiche remayne shall suche nombre chylde maye tell day shall remenaūt israel suche escaped house iacob seke comforte smote thē faithfulnesse truth shal trust vnto lorde holy one israel remnaunt euen posteryte iacob shall conuerte vnto god myghty one though thy people israel sande see yet shall remnaunt conuerte hym perfecte iudgement hym floweth ryghteousnesse therfore lorde hostes shall perfectly fulfyll thing hathe determyned myddeste whole worlde therfore thus sayeth lorde god hostes thou people dwelleste syon nat frayed kynge assyryans shall smyte rodde shall wagge hys staffe egipcians dyd tyme soone shall wrathe myne indignacion fulfylled y• destruccion moreouer lorde hostes shall prepare scourge hi lyke y• slaughter mydian vpon rock oreb shall lyfte vp hys rode ouer see dyd somtyme ouer egypcyans shall hys burthen taken thy shoulder hys yoke thy necke yee yoke shalbe corrupt fatnesse shall come aiath go thorowe towarde mygron mychmas shall lay vp hys harnesse go ouer foorde gybea shalbe theyr restyng place rhama • shall afrayed gybea saul shall flye awaye voyce noyes thy horse daughter gallim shalbe herde vnto lais anathoth also shalbe trouble madmena shall tremble feare y• cytesyns gabinare manly yet shal remayne nob y• daye shal lyft vp hande mount y• daughter syon hyll ierusalem se lorde god hostes shall take awaye proude thence feare shal hewe downe proude fel hye mynded busshes also wode shall also rote yron lybanus shall haue myghtie fall ¶ prophecieth natiuyte chryst people remnaunt israell fayth • gentyles ¶ capi xi shall come rodde forthe kynred isaye blossome shall florysshe rote spiryte lorde shall lyght vpon hym y• spiryte wysdome vnderstandynge spiryte councel strength spiryte knowledge feare lorde shall make hym feruent feare god shall gyue sentence thynge shal brought eye nether reproue matter fyrst hearing ryghtuousnes shal iuge y• pore iustyce shall refourme symple worlde shall smyte worlde rod mouth breath mouth shall slaye vngodly ryghtuousnes shalbe gyrdle loynes ⚜ truth faythfulnes girdynge vp raynes wolfe shall dwell lambe leoparde shall lye downe goate bullockes lyon catel shall kepe company together y• lytell chylde shall rule cowe beare shal fede together theyr yonge one shall lye together lyon shall eate strawe lyke oxe cowe chylde whyle sucketh shal haue desyre serpentes nest whē weaned shal put hande cockatryce denne man shal euell man shal destroye another hyll holynesse earthe shall full knowledge lorde euen see floweth ouer water day shal gentyls enquere y• rote iesse whiche shalbe set vp token vnto people dwellynge shalbe glorious y• tyme shal y• lorde take hande agayne cōquere remnaunt peple shalbe lefte alyue assyrian egipcians arabian moryans elamite caldeys antio chyans ilandes see shall sette vp token amonge gentyles gather together y• dispersed israell yea caste iuda y• foure corner worlde hatred ephraim also enemyes iuda shalbe cleane roted ephraym shall beare euell wyll iuda iuda shal hate ephraym together shall flye vpō shulders philistine toward west spoyle together y• dwell towarde easte idumites moabytes shall let theyr handes fall ammonytes shalbe obediēt vnto lorde also shal cleane tunges egipcyans see myghtye winde shal lyft vp hande ouet nilus shall smyte seauen stremes make men go ouer drye shod thus shal waie people remaineth frō assirians like happened israelite time departed lande egypt ¶ songe churche obtayninge victory ouer comynge worlde capi xii thou shalte saye lorde wyll thanke thou wast dyspleased refrayne thou thy wrathe comforte beholde god saluacyon whome wyll truste nat afrayde lorde god strengthe songe also become saluacyon therfore ioye shal ye drawe water welles sauyoure ☞ shall ye saye geue thanckes vnto lorde call vpon hys name declare coūcels amōge people kepe thē remembraūce name excellent sing praise vnto lord hath done greate thynges knowne worlde crye synge thou dwellest syon great holy one israell myddes ¶ prophecyeth destruccyon babylon captiuyte comynge agayne people capi xiii thys ☞ heuy burthen babylon whiche esaye sonne amos dyd se lyfte vp banner vpon hye hyll call vnto holde vp youre hande prynces maye go gate haue sente debytyes gyauntes saieth lorde wrathe wyl cal tryumphe ī glory noyse multytude moūtaines lyke great people russhyng though kingdomes nacions came together lorde hostes captayne whole armye come farre countre ende heauen euen lorde himselfe wt minister hys wrathe destroye whole lande mourne ye day lorde hande shall come destroyer almyghtye therfore shal al hādes letten downe men hertes shall melte waye shall stande feare▪ carefulnesse sorow shal come vpō shall haue paine womā trauayleth chylde ☞ one shall abasshed another theyr face shal burne lyke flamme beholde daye lorde shall come terrible full iudignacyon wrathe make lande waste roote synners therof starres planet heauen shall nat geue theyr lyghte sunne shalbe darkened rysynge moone shall nat shyne hys lyght wyll punyshe wyckednesse worlde synnes vngodly sayeth lord hye stomackes proude wyll take awaye wyll laye downe boastynge tyrauntes wyll make man dearer fyne golde man worthe golden wedge ophyr therfore wyll shake heauen earth shal remoue place thus shall go babylon wrath lorde hostes day hys fearfull indignacion babylon shalbe hunted chased doo shepe mā taketh vp euery mā shal turne hys owne people flye eche one hys owne lande founde alone shall shot thorowe gather together shalbe destroyed swerde psal 〈…〉 theyr chyldren shalbe slayne theyr eye theyr house spoyled theyr wyues rauysshed lo shal bring vp medes agaynste whiche shall nat regarde syluer desirous golde bowes shall destroye yonge men haue pytye vpon wemen chylde theyr face shall spare chyldren babylon glorye kyngdomes bewty caldees honour shalbe destroyed euen god destroyed gene 〈…〉 sodome gomorta shall endure euer nether shall dwellyng generacyon generacyon ☞ arabyans shall pytche tentes ther nether shal shephardes make foldes wylde bestes shal lye house shalbe ful great oules estryches shall dwell ape shall daunse wylde cattes shall cry palace dragon shalbe ī plea saunt house babylon tyme hand dayes shall nat ꝓlōged ¶ retourne people captyuytye prosperitye people god affliccion enemy pryde babylon cap xiiii bvt lorde wyll mercyfull vnto iacob wyll yet chose israel agayne set theyr owne landestraungers shall cleaue vnto get house iacob people shall take cary home make enheryte house israell lande lorde maye seruauntes hande maydens lorde shall take prysoners whose captyues bene afore rule oppressed thē whē lorde shal bryng rest trauayle feare harde bondage thou wast laden withal shalt thou vse mockage vpon king babylon saye howe happeneth oppressour leaueth golden trybute come ende lorde hath broken cepter vngodly rodde lordly whiche wroth smyteth peple durable stroke wonder persecuteth thē tameth continually therfore whole worlde nowe rest quyetnesse men synge ioye yea euen fyrre tree cedres libanus reioyse thy fall sayenge nowe thou arte layde downe theare come mo vp destroye v hell also beneth trembleth thy commyng myghtie men prynces earthe steppe forth kynges earthe stande vp theyr seates maye aunswere speake vnto art thou wounded also arte thou become lyke vnto v thy pompe thy pryde layde downe pyt melody thy instrumentes mothes layde vnder wormes thy couerynge howe arte thou fallen heauen lucifer thou fayer mornynge chylde howe haste thou gotten fall euen grounde arte become weaker people thou saydest thyne hert wyl clyme vp heuen make seate aboue besyde starres god wyl syt also vpon holy mount towarde north wyll clyme vp aboue cloudes wylbe lyke hyghest yet thou shalt brought downe depe hell se shall narowly loke vpon thynke selues sayenge man broughte landes feare made kyngdomes afrayde made worlde maner waste layde cyties grounde let prisoner go kynges nacyons lye euery one ☞ owne house worshyppe thou arte cast thy graue lyke wylde braunche lyke deade men rayment stryken thorow swerde go downe stone depe deade coarse troden vnder fete art buryed euen thou hast wasted thy lāde destroyed thy people generacyon wycked shalbe without honour euer let awaye sought destroye theyr chyldren theyr father wyckednes come vp agayne possesse lande fyll worlde full enemyes wyl stande vp agaynst sayth lorde hostes root name generacion babylon sayth lorde wyll gyue otter wyll make water poddels wyl swepe • esome destruction sapc • e y• lorde hostes lorde hostes hath sworne • sayenge shall come passe haue determyned shalbe fulfylled haue deuysed assyria • shall destroye lande vpon mountaynes wyll treade vnder fote thorow yoke shal come thē burthen shall taken theyre shoulder deuyce hath god taken thorowe whole worlde thus hande stretched ouer peple yf lorde hostes determyn thyng able disa • ull yf stretch forth ha ••• maye holde agayne yere kynge ahaz dyed god threatened maner reioyse thou whole palestyna rod beateth broken serpentes ro • e shal come adder frute shalbe fyre worme ☞ 〈…〉 borne pore shal fed symple shall dwell safetie thy ro • e also wyll destroye honger shall •• eye remnaunt mourne thou porte wepe thou cytie feare thou whole palestyna shall come y• north smoke whose power man may abyde shal answere messangers y• gentyles lorde hathe stablyshed syon poore hꝭ people therin put theyr trust hym ¶ prophecye agaynste moab capi xv thys heuy burthen vpō moab ar moab destroyed nyght seasō kir also ī moab destroied peryshed ye nyght went vp ydols house euen dibon y• hye place wepe nebo moab mourne med • cheyr h • d balled al 〈2 page missing〉 ye foolysh prynces zoan ye wyse coūcellers pharao whose wyt turned foolyshnes howe say ye vnto pharao come wyse men auncient kynges thy wyse men let tell yf lorde hoostes hathe deuysed vpon egypte prynces zoan become fooles price noph disceiued haue disceyued egypte euen taken chefe kynred therof myddes hath lord powred sprete wyckenes haue disceyued egypte euery worke thereof euen droncken man stackereth vomyte neither shal ☞ heade tayle braūch rede able worke egypte y• daye shall egypte lyke vnto wemen shalbe afrayed stande feare • ocion hand lorde hostes whith shaketh ouer egypte shalbe afraied y• lande iuda y• euery one maketh mencion shalbe afrayed therat cause councel lorde hoostes whiche deuiseth daye shall fyue cyties lāde egypte speake lāgage canaan swere lorde hoostes ☞ cytye desolacyon shalbe called one day shall ☞ altare lorde myddes lande egypte thꝭ tytle besyde vnto lord shalbe token witnesse vnto lorde hoostes lande egypt shal crye vnto lord trouble shal sende saui great man delyuer lorde shalbe knowen egypte egyptiās shall knowe lorde daye sacrifice oblacion yee shall vowe vowe vnto lorde perfourme lorde also shall smyte egypte sore heale agayne shalbe conuerted vnto lorde shalbe intreated shall heale daye shall comen way egypte assyria assyria shall come egypte egypte assyria egypcyans assyrian shall serue lorde together day shal nacion israel thyrde egypte assyria shal blessed myddes lande lande lorde hostes hathe blessed sayeng blessed people egypte assur also worke myne handes israell myne inherytaunce ¶ agaynste egypte ethiopia capi xx yeare tharthan came vnto asdod whan ☞ sargon kyng assyrta sente hym foughte agaynste asdod taken tyme spake lorde hande esaye sonne amos sayeng go take ☞ sacke clothe frome thy loynes put thy shoo fote dyd walkynge naked barefoote lorde sayd lyke seruaunt esay hath walked naked bare fote sygne wonder thre yeares vpon egypte ethiopia euen shal kyng assyria take awaye egypte ethiopia chyldren olde men naked bare fote theyr loynes vncouered greate shame egypte shalbe brought feare also ashamed one another ethiopia egipt egypte ethiopia consydryng glory fore dwel yle shall saye daye beholde thus regarded whether shal flye helpe maye delyuered kynge assyrya howe shall escape ¶ agaynst babylon idumea arabia cap xxi burthen ☞ waste see euen stormye wether passeth thorowe noone daye come frome wyldernesse horrible lande greuous vision shewed vnto let one dysceytfull offender come agaynst another one destroyer agaynst another elam laye • ege thou medium ☞ al gronynge haue layde downe therfore loynes fylled sorowe heuynes hath taken holde vpon panges woman traueylynge made stoupe whan herd vexed whā sawe herte panted ferfulnes came vpon ☞ night voluptuousnes hath turned agaynst feare whyle garnyshed table y• watch manloked whyle eatynge drynkyng sayde vp ye captaynes take shylde thus hath lorde sayde vnto ☞ go set watch man tell seeth sawe charet whiche two horseman sat vpon caryage asse cariage camel loked toke dilygent hede lyon cryed lorde stande wayting whole daye appoynted kepe watche euery nyght beholde commeth charet men two horsmen answered sayde babylon fallen fallen ymages hyr goddes hathe smytten downe vnto grounde ☞ thou arte muste thresshe thou belongest corne floore▪ herde lorde hoostes god israel haue shewed vnto burthen duma calleth vnto seyr watchmā hast thou espyed nyghte watchman haste thou espyed nyght watchmā sayde ☞ mornynge commeth doth y• nyght yfye wyll aske anye questyon aske retourne come agayne burthen concernynge arabia pleasaunt grounde arabia shal ye tary al nyght euen stretes dedanin inhabitours lāde thema brought water hym thrystye preuēted hym theyr bred fled awaye swerdes become fugytiue euen drawen swerde bent bowe greuousnes warre thus hath lorde sayde vnto yet yeare acordyng yeares hyred seruaūt glory cedar shall fayle nombre shall escape bowes shall mynisshed myghtye chyldren cedar lorde god israel hathe spoken ¶ aprophecye agaynste ierusalem ¶ capi xxii burthen ☞ valley vision haste thou thou clymest vnto house toppes thou art full occupyenge thou sedycyous proude cytie thy slayne men nether put death swerde deed batell thy captaynes fugitiue together archer haue taken presoners y• founde captiuyte together fled farre therfore sayd let alone ••• 19 • wyll make lamētaciō ye shall nat able comforte destrucciō daughter people thys daye trouble ruyne destruccion lorde wyl bringe passe valley vysyon breakynge downe cyty crienge vnto moūtaynes elam bare quyuer charet fote men horsmen cytye kyr shewed shylde open thy chefe valley also full charetes horsmen set theyr face dyrectly towarde gate daye dyd enemye take awaye ☞ bewtye iuda dyddest thou loke towarde armour house forest yee haue sene also broken place cytye dauyd howe many ye gathered together water lower pole house ierusalem ☞ ye haue nombred house haue ye broken downe make wall stronge pyt also haue ye made betwene two walles water olde pole haue nat regarded maker therof neyther respecte vnto hym toke hande daye dyd lorde god hoostes call men vnto wepyng mournyng baldnesse gyrdynge aboute wich sacke cloth ☞ beholde haue ioye gladnes sleyeng ox kyllinge shepe catynge fleshe yonder treasurer euen vnto esay 36 • sebna whiche ruler house haste thou haste thou thou shuldest hewe sepulcre one heweth sepulcre hye graueth habytacion himselfe harde rocke beholde thou man lorde shal carye away captiuyte shall surely couer confusyon lorde shall turne ouer lyke bal hys handes ⚜ shal sende farre countre shalte thou dye steade charetes thy pompe shall house thy lorde haue confusion ☞ wyll dryue frō thy place thy dwellynge shall ouerthrow daye shall call seruaunt eliakim sonne helkia ☞ thy garmentes wyll clothe thy gyrdle wyll strengthe hym thy power also wyll yelde hys hande shalbe father dwel ierusalem house iuda iob 12 b apoca • b keye house dauyd wyll lay vpon shoulder shal opē man shall shut shall shut man shall open wyll fasten hym nayle sure place shal reioyse soule psal 63 143 soule hathe lōged y• nyght sprete within wyll seke early mornynge whan thy iudgementes earth inhabytatours worlde shall lerne ryghteousnes shall vngodly man fauoured hathe nat lerned ryghteousnes doth wyckedly earth nothynge ought done whiche ryghteous shall nat se glory lorde lorde whan thy hande lyfte vp se nar shall se confounded zele people fyre consumeth thyne enemyes shal deuoure lorde vnto v thou shalt prouyde peace philip 2 • thou also haste wrought oùre workes v lorde oure god lordes besyde hath subdued v wyl myndefull onely thy name ☞ deed wyll nat lyue lyfe wyl nat ryse agayne therfore hast thou visyted roted destroyed memory thou haste increased people lorde thou hast increased people thou art pray sed thou hast sent farre vnto coastes earth xxvii daye lorde sore great myghtie swerde shal visyte ☞ 1 cor 15 • apoca 1 •• leuiathan fugityue serpent euen leuiathan croked serpent shall slaye dragon see daye se ye syng vyneyarde bringeth forth best wyne euen lorde kepe due season shall water lest enemy harme wyll nyght daye preserue displeasure el whan vyneyarde bringeth forth breers thornes wolde go thorowe war burne vp together let take holde strēgth shall one euen one shall dayes cōming iacob shal take rote israell shalbe grene floryshe y• worlde shalbe fylled frute hath smytten hym sore dyd smote hym slayne sore slaughter slewe hym measure dothe smyte hym whyle sendeth vnto hym suche thynges wherby commeth mynde agayne daye east wynde bloweth sore taketh awaye frutes thus therfore shall iniquite iacob reconcyled frute takyng away synne yfhe make stone altare idoles chalke stone beaten sunder theyr graues ymages ryse nat vp agayne el shal strōgcytie desolate habytacyon forsaken left lyke wyldernes shall calfe fede shall lye eate vp yonge springes therof ☞ whan braunches drye broken wemen come set fyre deut 3 • • people vnderstāding therfore made thē shal nat fauoure thē created thē shal geue thē grace daye shall lorde make thresshynge myddes ryuer euphrates vnto ryuer egypte ye chyldren israel shalbe gathered together one another daye shal ☞ y• great trōpe blowen y• lost lande assyria banysshed y• lande people whiche ierusalē ye haue said ☞ haue made couenaunt death hell agremēt though go forth sore plage shall come vnto v haue made falshode refuge vnder vanite hyd therfore thus sayeth y• lorde god beholde lay syon foundacion stone euen tryed stone precyous corner stone sure foūdacion ☞ beleueth let hastye iudgement also wyl lay y• rule ryghtuousnes balaunce ☞ y• hayle shal take away vayne confydence preuy place refuge shall water renne ouer thus couenaunt ye made wt deathe shalbe disanulled agremēt ye made hell shall stande yea whan sore plage goeth forth ye shall troden downe vnder tyme goeth forth shall take awaye earely morninge euery day yea bothe daye nyght shall go thorowe whan noyse therof perceyued shall gendre vexacion ☞ bedde narowe large couerynge small man wynde hym selfe vnder esay 36 • lorde shal stonde ☞ mount 2 reg 5 iosue 10 pecazim shalbe wrothe lyke valley • 1 para 13 • gibeon may worke ☞ straunge worke brynge passe acte straunge acte nowe therfore se ye mocker lest punishemēt icrese haue herd lorde hostes shall come short ende vpon whole earth heare ye herkē vnto voyse cōsidre pondre speche doth husbande man plowe daye openeth breaketh clottꝭ grounde may sow whan hath made playne wyll nat sprede abrode fytches sowe comyn cast wheate measure appoynted barly • ye theyr place god wyl instruct haue descrecion euen god wyll teache fitch shal thresshed harowe nether shal cart whele brought thorowe cōmen fytches beaten staffe commyn wt rod y• sede y• bread made thresshed thoughe alwaye thresshing cart whele must brought ouer lest grynde
