25 b fyre payne ordeyned begynnynge yea euen kynges prepared hathe lorde set depe made wyde burnynge wherof fyre moche woode breth lorde whiche ryuer brymstone doth kyndle ¶ curseth forsake god seke helpe men capi xxxi wo vnto go downe egypte helpe truste horse put theyr confydence charettes many horse men lusty stronge regarde holy one israell aske questyon lorde neuertheles beynge wysest plageth wycked yet goeth worde steppeth forth taketh victory agaynst housholde frowarde agaynst helpe euel doer nowe egipcians men god theyr horse fleshe spiryte soone lorde stretcheth hande shall helper fal shulde haue bene helped shall together destroyed thus hathe lorde spoken vnto lyke apoc 5 lyon gene 49 b lyon whelpe roareth vpon praye hath gotten afray ed thoughe multytude shephardes crye vpon hym neyther abasshed heape shall lorde hostes come downe fyght mount syon defende hyll lyke byrdes flotre aboute theyr nestes deut 32 b shal lorde hostes kepe saue defende delyuer ierusalem therfore ye child israell turne agayne lyke ye haue exceaded goynge backe esay 2 c ☞ day euery man shall cast idol syluer golde whiche ye haue made synfull handes esay 37 e assur also shalbe slayne swerde man swerde swerde shal deuoure man swerde shall fle slaughter ⚜ hys seruauntes shall taken prysoners shall go feare hys stronge holdes prynces shall fle badge hath lorde spoken whose lyght burneth syon fyre ierusalem ¶ condicyons good ruler offycers capi xxxii beholde kynge shall gouerne rule ryghtuousnes prynces shall rule according balaūce equyte shalbe vnto men defence wynde refuge tempest lyke ryuer water thurstye place shadowe greate rocke drye lande eye seing shal dym eares heare shall take dilygent hede herte vnwyse shall attayne knowledge vnperfecte tonge shall speake playnely distinctly shall nygarde called gentle churle liberal churle wyll churlishly mynded herte wyll worke euyll play ypocryte ymagyn abhominacyons agaynst god make hungry leane witholde drynke thursty parlous weapon couetous shameful councels may begyle pore disceatful wordes yea euen shulde gyue sentence poore prou 17 • lyberall person ymagineth honest thynges commeth vp honestye ye ryche ydel cyties harken vnto voyce ye carelesse cyties marke wordes yeares dayes shall ye brought feare ye carelesse cyties haruest shall grape gatherynge shall come ye ryche yoel cyties ye feare parell ye shall abasshed remoued ye se barennesse nakednesse preparynge warre ye shall knocke vpon brestes pleasaunt felde frutful vyneiarde people felde shal bryng thornes thystels euery house voluptuousnes cyties wylfulnes palace also shalbe brokē greatly occupyed cyties desolate tower bulwerkes shall become dennes euermore pleasure mule shalbe turned pasture shepe vnto tyme spiryte poured vpon v aboue shall wyldernes frutefull felde plenteous felde shalbe rekenned wode shall equite dwell deserte ryghteousnesse frutefull laude rom 5 rewarde ryghteousnes shalbe peace hyr frute reste quyetnesse euer iere 33 c people shall dwell innes peace tabernacle pleasure ynough al hayle falleth shall fall wodde ☞ cytye shalbe set valleye howe happy shall ye ye shall safely sowe youre sede besyde water dryue thyther fete youre ox ass ¶ thretnynge agaynste assyrian descrypcyon shall se lorde capi xxxiii therfore wo vnto robber shalte nat thou robbed also vnto layest wayte say ther shulde wayte layde wo vnto doest hurte exod 21 b leuy 24 sapi 11 c mat vii euen shalte thou hurte also thou layest wayte shall wayte layde also lorde mercyfull vnto v put trust thyne arme poynte vyset v psol 9 b thou oure healthe tyme trouble people dyd fle anger thy voice thine vp standynge gentyles scatred abro de theyr spoyle shalbe gathered greshoppers comenly gathered together pyr stande vp lorde thou dwellest hye let syon fylled equyte ryghteousnesse let trueth faythfulnesse hyr tyme power health wysdome knowledge feare god hyr treasure beholde theyr aū gel crye without messaungers peace shall wepe bytterly stretes waste walketh man therin appoyntement broken cytyes dispised nat regarded y• desolate earth heuynesse lybanus taketh sporte hewen downe sarom lyke wyldernesse basan charmel turned vp syde downe therfore sayeth lorde wyll vp nowe wyll get vp nowe wyl aryse iere 5 • ye shal conceaue stubble beare strawe spryte shall fyre maye consume people shalbe burnt lyke lyme thornes burne y• hewen cast fyre nowe herken ye farre howe considre glory ye y• hande ☞ synners sion frayde sodayne ferfulnes come vpon y• ypocrytes among v say wyll dwell consumynge fyre v maye abyde euerlastynge hete psal 14 23 leadeth godly lyfe say speaketh y• truth abhorreth violence dysceate kepeth hande touch rewarde stoppeth hys eares heare councell agaynste innocent holdeth downe eye se none euyll shall dwell hye whose sauegarde shalbe true rocke hym shall geuen ryght true meate dryncke thyne eye shal se kyng glory wyde worlde thyne herte shal delyte feare god 1 corin • shall become scrybe senatoure hym teacheth chyldren shalte thou nat se people straunge tonge haue dyffused language maye nat vnderstande neyther straunge speache shalbe perceaued shal syon sene head cytye oure solempne feastes shall thyne eye se ierusalem gloryous habytacyon hebre 9 b tabernacle neuer shall remoue whose nayles shal neuer taken worlde without ende whose coardes euery chone shall neuer corrupte gloryous magesty y• lorde shal present amonge v place fayre broade ryuers streames shall nether galey rowe great shyp sayle ••• 4 c lorde shalbe oure capteyne lorde shalbe lawe geuer lorde shall oure kynge hymselfe shall oure sauyoure cordes layd abrode better mast set vp suche fashyon bāner sayle hangeth theron ther dealed great spoyle yee lame men runne praye lyeth man sayeth sycke al euel takē away people dwell ¶ laste destruccyon synagoge whiche kyngdome presthode people translated churche congregacyon chryste capi xxxiiii come ye heythen take hede ye people herken thou earthe therin thou rounde compasse al groweth vpon lorde angrye withall people dyspleasure kyndled agaynste multytude curse sleye theyr slayne shalbe caste theyr bodyes styncke euē hilles shal wet bloude starres heauen shall waaste heauen shall folde together lyke roll starres therof shall fall lyke leaues fall fro vynes fyge tree swearde shalbe bathed heuen shal immediatly come downe vpon idumea vpon people whiche haue cursed vengeaunce lordes swearde shalbe full bloude rustye fatnesse bloude lambes goates fatnes kydneys ye wether lorde shall kyll greate offrynge bosra greate slaughter lande idumea shal unicornes fall wt bulles gyauntes theyr lande shalbe washed bloude theyr grounde corrupt fatnes unto also siō shal come daye ye vengeaunce god yere thine owne iudgementes shalbe recompensed floudes shalbe turned pytche earth brymstone therwith shall lande kyndled shal quenched daye nyght smoke euermore forth lye waste man shall goo thorowe euer pellycanes storkes greate oules rauens shal haue possessyon dwell therin god shall spred lyne desolacyon vpon weye stone emptines kynges called vpon shalbe one prynces shalbe awaye thornes shall growe theyr palace nettels thystels stronge holdes dragon maye haue theyr pleasure therin maye courte estriches shal straunge visours monstruous beastes mete one wylde kepe cōpany together shall lamya lye haue lodgyng shall oule make nest buylde home brynge forth yongones shall kytes come togyther eache one lyke seke thorowe scrypture lorde rede shall none thingꝭ left shal one lyke fayle mouth cōmaundeth ye doth spirite gather together ful fylleth vpon soeuer lotte falleth dealeth line shall possesse enheritaunce generacyon generacyon dwell therin euer ¶ tyme kyngdome chryste ¶ capi xxxv bvt deserte wyldernesse shall reioyse waste grounde shalbe glad florysh lylly shal floresh plesauntly ioyfull euer geuynge thankes glory libanus beautie charmell saron shalbe geuen shal knowe honoure lorde magestye god hebre 12 b therfore strength weke handes comforte feble knee saye vnto fearefull herte good chere feare nat deut 2 • • 31 b beholde god cōmeth take vēgeaunce rewarde god cōmeth owne selfe wyll delyuer math 〈◊〉 • • 5 c luke 7 • shal eies blynde lyghtened eares deafe opened shall lame man leape herte psal 8 domme man tonge shall geue thankes esa 41 • 43 c 44 • wyldernes also shal welles sprynge floudes water deserte drye grounde shal turne ryuers thurstye sprynges water dragon dwelte afore shall growe swete floures grene rush shal fote pathes cōmon stretes shalbe called holy way vncleane person shall go thorowe lorde hym selfe shall go waye ignoraunt shall erre shalbe lyon rauyshynge beast shall come therin men shall go fre safe redemed lorde shal conuerte come syon thankesgyuynge euerlastynge ioye shall haue pleasure gladnesse shalbe among sorowe heuynesse shal vanyshe awaye ¶ ierusalem asseged sennaherib tyme kynge hezekias capi xxxvi i4 r • 18 • 2 par • 2 • esa 7 • • b • 10 • 17 • • 321 n xiiij yere kynge hezekias came sennaherib kynge assyryans downe laye sege vnto stronge cyties iuda kynge assyrian sent rabsaketh lachis toward ierusalem agaynste kyng hezekias greuous hoste whiche set hym condyte ouerpole waye goeth thorow fuller lande came forth vnto hym eliakim helkias sonne presydent esay 22▪ • sobna scrybe ioah asaphs sonne secretary rabsaketh sayde vnto tel hezekias greate kyng assiria sayeth thus vnto presumpcyon thys thou trustest vnto thou thynekest peraduenture thou hast councell power ynough mayntayne war el wherto trusteste thou y• casteste thy selfe fro • 4 18 b e •• 29 lo thou puttest thy trust broken staffe rede meane egypte whiche leaneth vpon goeth hys hande shutteth hym thorowe euē pharao kynge egypt vnto trust hym yf thou woldest saye truste lorde oure god goodly god dede whose hye place aulters hezekia toke downe commaunded iuda ierusalem worshyppe onely aulter byde thou hast made condicion lorde kynge assyrian shulde geue two thousāde horse art thou able set men vpon seyeng nowe thou canst nat resyst power smallest prynce lorde hathe howe darrest thou trust charettes horsemē egypt moreouer thynkest thou come vp hyther destroye thys lande without lordes wyll lorde sayde vnto go vp lande thou mayest destroye sayde eliakim sobna ioah vnto rabsaketh speake v thy seruauntes praye syrian language vnderstande wel speake nat v y• iewes tong lest folke heare whiche lyeth vpon wall answered rabsaketh thynke ye kyng sent speake vnto hathe sent thē also lye vpon wall nat cō pelled eate theyr owne donge dryncke theyr owne stale rabsakeh stode styffe cryed loude voyce iewes tonge sayde nowe take hede howe greate kynge assyriās geueth warnynge thus sayeth kynge let nat hezekias disceaue shall nat able delyuer moreouer let nat hezekias comforte lorde sayeth lorde without doute shall defende v shall nat geue ouer cytie handes kynge assyrian beleue thus sayeth kynge assyria opteyne fauoure encline maye euery man enioye hys vineyardes fyg tree dryncke water cysterne vnto tyme come selfe bring lande lyke youre owne wherin wheate wyne bothe sowen sede planted vyneyardes let nat hezekia disceaue sayeth vnto lorde shal delyuer v esay 1 • • myght goddes gētyles kepe euery man lande frō power y• kynge assyrian god hemath arphad god sepharuaim able defende samaria hande goddes landes hathe belyuered theyr countre power lorde shuld deliuer ieruselē fro hande unto hezekias messaūgers helde theyr tunges answered nat one worde kyng charged thē shuld geue none answere came eliakim helkias sonne president sobna scribe ioah asaphs sonne secretary vnto hezekeas rent clothes tolde hym wordes rabsaketh ¶ hezekias humbleth selfe lord army sennaherib slayne aung • lorde hym selfe hylled owne sonnes ¶ capi xxxvii hezekias herde rente clothes 4 〈◊〉 19 • put sacke cloth wente house lorde sent eliakim president sobna scrybe eldest preastes clothed 〈◊〉 〈◊〉 sack vnto prophet esay sonne amoz sayd vnto hym thus sayeth hezekias daye trouble plage blasphemy chyldren come place byrth ther power brynge forth lorde thy god doute hath well cō sydered wordes rabsakeh lorde kynge assyrian hath sent defye blaspheme lyuynge god suche wordes lorde thy god hathe hearde ryght well therfore lyfte vp thy prayer remnaunt yet lefte serua •• te kynge hezekias came esay esay gaue thys answere saye thus vnto youre lorde thus sayeth lorde nat afrayed wordes thou haste hearde wher kynge assyrian seruauntes haue blasphemed esay 31 • beholde wyll cause wynde go ouer sone heareth rumoure shal go agayne coū tre wyll destroye y• swerde 1 reg 23 • nowe rabsaketh returned foūde kynge assyria layenge sege libnas vnderstande departed frō lachis came rumore tharhakas kynge ethiopia come forth warre agaynste hym kynge assyria hearde sent messaungers king hezekias cōmaundemēt saye thus hezekias kynge iuda let nat thy god disceaue thou hopest sayest ierusalem shall nat geuen handes kynge assyria lo thou knowest well howe kynges assyria haue handeled landes haue subuerted hopest thou escape people gentile progenitor conquered delyuered tyme thorowe theyr goddes 2 reg 17 namely gozā haram rezeph chyldren eden whiche thalassar kyng hemah kynge arphad kynge cytie sepharnaim ena aua nowe ezekia receaued letter messaungers reade wente vp house lorde opened letter lorde ezekia prayed lorde maner lorde hostes thou god israel syttest vpō exod 25 c cherubin thou arte god onely god kyngdomes worlde thou onely haste gene 1 a▪ created heauen earth baruc 2 c enclyne thyne eare lorde consyder open thyne eye lorde se pondre wordes vpon sennaherib whiche hathe sent embassage blaspheme liuyng god true lorde kynges assirya haue conquered kyngdomes landes caste theyr goddes fyre natwithstandynge goddes workes men handes wood stone therfore haue destroyed delyuer v lorde god handes sennaherib kyngdomes earth maye knowe thou onely art lorde esay sonne amoz sent vnto hezekia sayeng thus sayeth lorde god israell thou haste made thy prayer vnto touchynge sennaherib kyng assyria answere lorde hathe geuen consernyng hym despised art thou mocked daughter sion hath shaken heade daughter ierusalē thou sennaherib zacha 2 b 〈◊〉 25 • 〈◊〉 〈◊〉 • c whō hast thou defyed blasphemed agaynst haste thou lyfted vp thy voyce exalted thy proude lookes euē agaynst y• holy one israel thou thy seruauntes haste blasphemed lorde thus holdest thou thy selfe wyl couer hye mountaynes sydes libanus horsmen wyll cut downe hye eedre tree fayrest fyrre tree wyll vp heyght chefest tymbre woddes water wyll graue drynke water defence shall drye vp fete myne hoost yee haste thou nat hearde haue taken hande brought passe olde tyme wyl nowe also wast destroye bryng stronge cyties vnto heapes stone theyr inhabytours shalbe lyke lame men brought feare confounded shalbe lyke grasse grene herbes felde lyke heye vpon house toppes withereth afore growne vp knowe thy wayes thy goynge forth thy commynge home yee thy madnesse therfore thy furiousnes thy pryde come wyll put rynge thy nose brydle byt chawes turne aboute euē waye thou camest wyll geue also token hezekia yeare shalt thou eate kept stoare next yeare suche groweth hym selfe thyrde yeare ye shal sow reape yee ye shall plante vyneyardes enioye frutes therof suche house iuda escaped shal come together remnaūt shal take rote beneth bryng forth frute aboue escaped shal go ierusalem remnaunt mounte syon shall gelousy lorde hostes brynge passe therfore thus sayeth lorde concernynge kynge assiryans shall come cytie shall shote arowe shal shilde hurte nether shal make bulwarke agaynst waye came shall retourne nat come thys cytie sayeth lorde wyll kepe saue cytie sayeth myne owne seruaunt dauids sake 4 16 • eccle 4 •• esay 〈◊〉 2 〈◊〉 • thus angell lorde went forth slewe assirians hoost hundred fourescore fyue thousande men arose vp early ierusalem beholde laye full deed bodyes sennaherib kynge assireans brake vp dwelt niniue afterwarde chaunsed prayed temple nesrah god adramalech sarazer hys owne sonnes slewe hym swearde fled lande arme •• asar hadon sonne raygned hys steade cap xxxviii ¶ hezekia sycke vnto death yet reuyued bythe lorde lyueth fyftene yeares whiche benefyte geueth thankes longe afore hezechia sycke vnto deathe 4 20 • par 3 2 f prophere esaye sonne amoz came vnto hym sayde thus cōmaundeth lorde set thyne house ordre y• must dye shall nat escape hezechia turned face towarde wall prayed vnto lorde sayde remembre lorde ye haue walked trueth stedfast herte haue done thynge pleasaunt hezechia wept • ore sayde god vnto esaye go speke vnto hezechia lorde god dauyd thy father sēdeth worde haue herde thy prayer cōsydred thy teares ionas 3 b holde wyl put fyftene yeares mo vnto thy lyfe delyuer cytie also hande kynge assiria wyl defende cytie 1 reg 2 g take token lorde wyll hathe spoken beholde wyl returne shadow ahaz dyal nowe layde y• sōne bryng ten degree backeward iosue 10 c sunne turned ten degree backewarde descended afore ¶ thankesgeuynge whiche hezekia kynge iuda wrote bene sycke recouered thought shulde haue gone gate hel best age haue wāted resydue yeres spake within selfe shal neuer viset lorde god lyfe shall neuer se man amonge dweller worlde myne age folden vp together taken awaye fro lyke shepherdes cotage lyfe hewē lyke weeuer cutteth webbe whyle yet takynge reste hewed made ende ī one day iob 4 b thought wold haue lyued vnto morowe brosed bone lyke lyon made ende one day chatred lyke swalowe lyke crane mourned doue lyfte vp myne eye heyght lorde sayde syckenes kepeth downe ease thou ⚜ shall speake saye yt hathe done shall therefore longe lyue remembre bitternes lyfe uerely lorde men must lyue bytternes al lyfe must passe ouer therin thou raysest vp • wakest lo wil well content wt bytternes neuerthelesse conuersacion hath pleased thou woldest nat make ende lyfe thou hast cast synnes behynde thy backe psal vi • lxxxxiii b • cx • b hell prayseth y• deathe doth magnyfie y• go downe graue prayse thy trueth liuing yea liuing knowledge lyke daye father telleth chyldren thy faythfulnesse luke 1 • deliuer v lorde wyll syng prayses thy house al dayes lyfe esay sayde take playster fygges lay vpon ye sore shall whole sayde hezekia greate thynge shall go vp house lorde ¶ hezekia reproued esaye shewed tresure vnto embassytours babylon capi xxxix tyme merodach baladam4 〈◊〉 • baladamus sonne kynge babylon sent letter presentes hezekia vnderstode howe bene sycke recouered agayne 1 pat 3 • • hezekia glad therof shewed cōmodyties treasure syluer golde spyces rootes precyous oyles cubbordes treasure house one thyng hezekias house thorowe al hꝭ kyngdome let se came esaye prophete kynge hezekia sayd vnto haue men sayd whence came vnto hezekia answered came farre coūtre vnto babylon esay sayde haue loked vpon thyne house hezekia answered al min house haue sene nothyng treasure shewed sayde esay vnto hezekia understāde worde lord hostꝭ 4 24 • beholde tyme wyll come euery thing whiche thyne house al thy proge nitoures haue layde vp stoare vnto day shalbe caried babylon nothing lefte behynde sayeth lorde yea parte thy sonnes shall come thou shalte get shal caried hence become gelded chāberlaynes kyng 〈2 page missing〉 shall breake smokynge flaxe shall nat quench faythfully truely shall geue iudgement shall neither ouersene hastye maye restore ryghtuousnes vnto earthe gē tyles also shall kepe lawes esay 40 • 44 • thus sayeth god lord vnto euen made heauens spred abrode set forthe earth increase whiche geueth breath vnto people dwell therin lorde haue called ryghtuousnesse led hande esay 4 9 • therfore wyll also defende geue couenaunt people luke • • lyght gentyles thou mayest open eye blynde zacha 9 b let prysoners syt darckenesse dongeon house selfe whose name lorde esay 48 • glory wyl geue none neyther myne honoure grauen ymages beholde olde thinges come passe newe thynges declare euer come tell psal • l synge vnto lorde newe songe thankesgeuyng blowe prayse vn ende worlde vpon see therin prayse iles dwell let wildernes city lyfte vp voice townes also cedar dwel let glad syt vpon rockes stone let crye downe hye mountaynes ascrybynge glorye vnto lorde magnyfyinge amonge gentyles lorde shall come forth gyaunt take stomacke lyke freshe man warre shall roare crye ouercome enemyes haue longe holden peace sayeth lorde shulde therefore styll kepe sylence euer wyll crye lyke trauaylynge woman wyll destroy deuoure wyll make waste bothe mountayne hyll drye vp euerye grene thynge groweth theron wyl drye vp floudes water dryncke vp ryuers wyll brynge blynde strete knowe lede thē fote pathe ignoraunt shall make darkenesse lyght thynge croked streyght thynges haue done vnto theym forsaken esay 44 b therfore let conuerte ashamed earnestly hope idoles say fashyoned ymages ye goddes heare ye deafe men sharpen • yghtes se ye blynde mat xv • blynde seruaūte deafe messaū gers sent vnto blynde people haue rule thou vnderstandest much kepest nothyng eares open man heareth lorde mercyfull vnto ryghtuousnesse sake worde myght magnified praysed mischeuous wycked people theyr yonge men belonge snare shut prison house deut 28 • caryed awaye captyue man dothe lowse troden vnder fote man doth labour bryng againe esay 44 • amonge pondreth consydreth taketh warnynge tyme come baruc 1 • tob • 3 • dani 9 • suffred iacob troaden vnder fote israel spoyled dyd lorde haue synned agaynst hym haue delyte walke wayes neyther bene obedyente vnto lawe therfore hathe poured vpon v wrathfull displeasure stronge bataile whiche maketh v haue euery syde yet wyl vnderstāde burneth v vp yet syncketh hertes ¶ god promyseth sende christ shal delyuct people forgeueth synnes owne sake capi xliii bvt nowe lorde made iacob fasshyoned israel sayeth thus 4 reg feare haue redemed • esay 4 • haue called name thou art myne owne 17 • deute 7 • xx ••• • yf thou goest thorow water wylbe strong floudes shulde pluck away exodi 14 • dani 〈◊〉 • thou walkest thorowe fyre shall burne flame shal kindle vpō lorde thy god y• holy one israel thy sauyour gaue egypt thy delyueraunce morians sabees thou waste deare syght set loued wyl geue ouer al men deliuer vp al people thy sake feare wt esay 41▪ • math •• wyl bryng thy sede frō east • gather together y• west wil say north let go south kepe backe esay 29 • gala 3 •• bring sōnes frō far daughter endes y• worlde namely called name haue created fasshyoned made myne honoure luk xiiii c bryng forth people whether haue eye blynde deafe haue eares ep •• ii c nacyons come one gathered together whiche amonge shall declare suche thynges tell v come let brynge theyr wytnesse shall fre el let heare saye trueth wytnesses sayeth lorde seruaunt haue chosen therfore certyfyed geue faythfull credence consydre esa x •• iii b apoca b neuer god shalbe none onely lorde osce xiii • without sauyoure geue warnynge make whole teache shulde straunge god amonge recorde must ye beare selues sayeth lorde god euen begynnynge iohn xx • none take thynge hande mā chaunge thus sayeth lorde holy one israel youre redemer esay v • youre sake haue sente babylon brought downe strongest fugitiue chaldee boost theyr shyppes euen lorde youre holy one whiche haue made israel youre kynge thus sayeth lorde ••• uc 〈◊〉 c euen ☞ maketh waye see 〈◊〉 • footepath myghty water 〈◊〉 〈◊〉 cwhiche bryngeth forth charettes horse hoste y• power warre may fall neuer ryse extincte lyke towe quenched ye remembre nat thynges olde regarde nothynge paste therfore beholde shall make newe thynge shortely shall appere ye shall well knowe tolde afore wyll cell agayne wyll make stretes deserte ryuers water wyldernes wylde beastes shall worshyppe dragon yonge estriches psal vi esa xxxv • 41 c 44 shall geue water wyldernes streames desert may geue drynke people whō chose thys people haue made selfe shall forth prayse thou iacob woldest nat call vpon thou haddest vnlust towarde israel thou gauest nat thy yonge beastes burnte offrynges neyther dydest honoure thy sacrifyces thou boughtest • deare spyce thy money nether pouredest fat thy sacryfyces vpon esay b iere vii c howe haue nat • e chargeable vnto y• offringes nether greuous incē se thou hast laden thy synnes weeried thyne vngodlynes psal 24 b ie xxxiii b yet euen onely myne owne selfes sake awaye thyne offence forgette thy synnes wyll neuer thynke vpon put nowe remembraunce wyll reason together shewe thou hast make ryghteous gene iii b num xx • thy fyrst father offended sore thy ruler haue synned agaynste therfore ether suspended slue chefest prynces dyd curse iacob gaue israel reprofe ¶ chryste promyseth delyuer hys churche whiche hathe redemed idolatry knelynge ymages 〈◊〉 confuted capi xliiii heare nowe iacob seruaunte israel haue chosen thus sayth lorde made fashyoned helped euen thy mother wombe nat afrayed iacob seruaunte thou ryghteous haue chosen esay 35 b 14 c 43 c shall powre water vpon drye grounde ryuers vpon thurstye eze 36 d▪ ioel ii f actes ii shal poure sprete vpō thy sede myne encrease vpō thy stocke shal growe together lyke grass wyllowes water syde ☞ one shall saye lordes another shall call hym selfe name iacob thyrde shall subscribe hande vnto lorde geue hym selfe vnder name israel thus hathe lorde spoken euen kynge israel redemer lorde hostes esay xii apoca b esay 4 • c apo xxii c esa x •••• • fyrste last without god euer lyke frō euerlastīge let hym shewe hys name thorowe maye lykened vnto let hym tel forth playnely thinges past come yee without feare stoppe haue nat euer tolde hytherto warned ye beare recorde youre selues god excepte maker shulde nat knowe hym caruers ymages vayne carued ymages loue good must beare recorde selues seynge neyther se vnderstande shalbe cōfounded esay xlii • dare make god fashion ymage profytable nothynge psa 114 sap xiii c beholde al felowshyppe muste brought confusyon let workemasters come stande together frō amonge men muste abashed confoūded one another smyth taketh yron tempereth hoate coales fashio neth hammer maketh strength armes yee sometyme faynt hunger thurstye hathe power carpenter ymage caruer taketh measure timbre spredeth forth lyne marketh coloure playneth ruleth squareth maketh ymage man accordynge bewty man maye stande house moreouer goeth oute hewe downe cedre tree bryngeth home elmes okes tymbre wod el fyrre tree whiche planted hym selfe rayne hath nouryshed whiche wood serueth men burne taketh warmeth hym selfe maketh afyre bake breade afterwarde maketh god honoure idole knele one pece burneth fyre another rosteth flesh maye eate roste belyfull y• thyrde warmeth hym selfe sayeth aha well warmed haue bene fyre resydue maketh hym god idole hym selfe kneleth worshyppeth prayeth vnto sayeth delyuer thou arte god esa xlii c yet men neyther consydre vnderstande eye stopped nat se theyr hertes cānot perceaue pondre nat theyr myndes haue neyther knowledge vnderstandynge thynke thus haue brente one pece fyre haue baked bred cole thereof haue rosted flesh eaten shall nowe resydue make abhomynacyon fall downe roten pece wood thus dothe lese hys labour hys herte whyche dysceaued dothe turne hym asyde none haue fre conscyence thynke maye nat erre consydre thys iacob israel thou art seruaunt haue made thou myghttest serue israel forget nat esa xiiii thyne offence haue dryuen awaye lyke cloudes thy synnes myst turne agayne vnto haue redemed glade ye heauens lorde hathe made let heare beneth vpō earth ioyfull reioyse ye mountaynes woddes tree therof lorde hathe redemed iacob shewed hys glorye vpon israel thus sayeth lorde thy redemer euen fashyoned thy mother wombe gede • ▪ esay 〈◊〉 • ▪ lorde thynges selfe alone onely spryde heauens onely haue layde foundacyon earth destroye token wytches make sothsaiers foles wyse turne bacwarde make theyr connynge folyshnesse dothe set vp purpose seruaūt fulfylleth councell messaungers concernynge ierusalem sayth shalbe inhabyted cyties iuda shal buylded agayne wyll repayre theyr decaied place sayeth grounde drye wyll drye vp thy water floudes sayth cyrus ☞ myne herdeman shall fulfyll thynges wyll sayeth also ierusalem shall buylded tēple shall fast grounded ¶ delyueraunce people cyrus cōmynge chryste callynge gentyles capi xlv thvs sayeth lorde vnto cyrus kynge leadeth ryght hande people maye fall downe hym 〈◊〉 •• wyll lose gyrdle kyngys shall opē gate thy face nat shut theyr dores wyll go make croked streight shall breake brasen dores burste yron barres shall geue hyd treasure thynge whiche secretly kepte thou mayest knowe lorde god israel haue called thy name gene 39 • ▪ iacob seruaū te sake israel chosen called thy name ordeyned euer thou knewest esa xiiii euen lorde whō none without god iere haue prepared euer thou knewest myght knowen rysynge y• sunne goynge downe y• nothing without lorde el none gene created y• lyght darckenes iud ix b make peace trouble yee euen lorde thynges ⚜ ye heauens aboue droppe downe let cloudes rayne ryghteousnes earth open selfe brynge forth health therby ryghteousnes maye florysh euen lorde brynge passe esay 29 c iere 18 c xix c boma ix c eccle 33 b wo vnto hym stryueth maker potsherde potter sayeth claye y• potter makest thou thy worke serueth nothynge wo vnto sayeth father begettest thou hꝭ mother bearest thou thus sayeth lorde euen holy one maker israel aske thynges come concerning sonnes put remembraunce touchynge workes handes haue made earth created man vpon myne handes haue spred forth heauen geuen cōmaundement hoost therof shal wake vp ryghteousnes ordre al wayes esoras shall buylde cytie let prysoners neyther gyft rewardes sayeth lorde hostes thus sayeth lorde occupier egypt marchaūtes morians sabees shal come vnto tribute shalbe thyne shal folowe go cheynes vpon theyr fete shal fall downe make supplicacion vnto god without whō none god shalbe rom xi howe profounde art thou god thou god sauyoure israel confounded al put dishonoure gone hence together shame euen maker ymages israel shalbe saued lord euerlastynge saluacyon yee shal nat come shame confusyon worlde without ende thus sayeth lorde gene euen created heauens god made earth fashyoned sett forth dyd make naught enhabited euen lorde without none exod xx c haue nat spoken secretly nether darke place earth nat naught sayde vnto sede iacob seke lorde whiche speake declareth thyng ryghteous true gather come together drawe nye hither escaped people esai 44 • baruc vi c haue vnderstandyng set vp stockes theyr idol praye vnto god nat helpe drawe nye come hyther let aske councell one another shewe forth tolde spake euer sence begynnyng haue nat lorde done esay 46 b without whō none god true god sauyoure el none esay 44 b therfore turne vnto ye endes earth ye maye saued god el none sweare selfe mouth commeth worde ryghteousnes maye man turne ro xiiii v phili ii knee shall bowe vnto tunges shall sweare name saying uerely y• lord ryghteousnes strength hym shall men come al thynke scorne shalbe confounded whole sede israel shallbe iustified make theyr boast lorde ¶ idolatry reproued health cometh chryst prophecyed capi xlvi b bel c 〈◊〉 xv ierem ell fallen nabo broken downe whose ymages burthen beastes catell ouerlade make weery soncke downe fallen together maye nat ease theyr burthen therfore muste go captiuite herken vnto house iacob ye remayne yet housholde israel haue borne frō youre mother wombe brought vp youre byrth tyll ye growen whiche shal beare vnto last age haue made wil also norysh beare saue exod xx wyll ye make syke fashion ymage maye lyke hym ex xxxii ye fooles doute wyll take syluer golde oute youre purse weye hyre goldsmyth make god men maye knele downe worshyppe esa 44 c baruc vi • yet must taken men shulders borne set place maye stande nat moue ala men shulde crye vnto hym whiche geueth answere delyuereth nat man calleth vpon hym hys trouble consydre well ashamed go youre owne selues ye runnagates remembre thinges past sence begynning world god el god yee nothynge lyke vnto begynnynge thynge shewe ende therof tell thynges nat yet come passe one worde deuyce accomplyshed fulfyll pleasure exo xvi call byrde easte take hande farre countres soone cōmaunde bring hyther soone thynke deuyse thynge heare ye hye stomacke farre ryghteousnesse shall bryng forth ryghteousnes nat farre health shall nat tary longe awaye wyl geue health syon israel glory ¶ worde lorde agaynste babylon capi xlvii bvtas daughter thou vyrgyn babylon syt thou downe dust syt vpon grounde nat trone thou mayden chaldea thou shalt nomore called tender pleasaūt ☞ brynge forth querne grynde meele put downe thy stomacher make bare thy knee wade thorowe water ryuers eze xvi • naum 3 thy shame shalbe discouered thy pryuyties shalbe sene wyll auenge man shall lette sayeth oure redemer whiche called lorde hostes holy one israel syt styll holde thy tunge get darke corner daughter chaldea thou shalt nomore called lady kigdomes wroth people punyshed myne enheritaunce gaue thy power pro xxi b ieremi l b neuertheles thou shewedest mercy euen aged men thē dydest thou oppresse right sore thy yocke thou thoughtest thus shalbe lady euer besyde thou haste nat regarded thinges neyther cast shulde come heare nowe therfore thou wylfull syttest careles spekest thus thyne hert esay x b apo xviii b alone without none shall neuer wedowe desolate againe yet bothe thynges shall come vpon one daye twynclynge eye dan v c namely wyddowheade desola cyon shall myghtely fall vpon multitude thy witch greate hepe thy coniurers thou haste trusted thy wyckednes haste sayde esa xxix c man seeth thyne owne wysdome connyng hath deceaued thou hast sayde alone without none therfore shall trouble come vpon thou shalt nat knowe whence shall aryse myschefe shal fall vpon whiche thou shalt nat able put sodayne mysery shal come vpon euer thou aware nowe go thy coniurers multytude thy wytches thou haste weryed thy selfe thy youth yf may helpe strength thou haste hytherto many councels let heauē gasers beholder starres come nowe delyuer yea let thē shew newe thynges shall come vpon beholde shalbe lyke st • awe yf kyndled fyre mā may rydde vehemencye flame yet geueth synders warme mā cleare fyre syt thus thou hast weryed thy selfe thus thy marchauntes haue bene thy youth euery one shall shewe hys erroneous waye yet shall none defende ¶ ypocryse iewes reproued lord alone wylbe worshypped hathe chosen v whiche socoureth v hys owne sake ¶ capi xlviii heare thys thou house iacob ye called name israel come one stocke iuda whiche sweare name lorde beare wytnes god israel nat trueth ryght whiche called ephe ii b esay li liiii • fre men holy cytie grounded vpon god israel iere xxxi • ▪ whose name lorde hostes thynges shewed euer sence begynnynge haue nat brought passe immediatly came mouth declared come howe knowe thou arte obstinate thy necke hathe yron veyne thy browe brasse neuerthelesse haue euer sence beginnynge shewed thynges come declared thē vnto euer come passe thou shuldest nat saye myne idol hathe done carued molten ymage hathe shewed heare consyder al thynges whether ye prophecyed tolde begynnynge newe secrete thynges y• thou knowest nat esay 37 • done nowe nat olde tyme wherof thou neuer hardest brought thou canst saye beholde knewe moreouer wherof thou haste nether herde knowen nether haue bene opened vnto thyne eares afore tyme knewe thou woldest malicyously offende therfore haue called transgressour euen thy mother wombe neuertheles name sake haue drawen wrath myne honour sake haue ouersene haue rooted beholde haue pourged syluer exod iii b haue chosen fyre affliccyon onely myne owne sake yea euen myne owne sake esay 41 43 b 44 b geue honour none thou shuldest despyse herken vnto iacob israell whome haue called euen fyrste last hande hath layde foundacion earthe ryght hande hath spanned ouer heauens assone call gather al together herken yonder goddes hath declared lorde hath loue ☞ vnto shal perfourme wil agaynste babell declare power agaynst caldees self alone euen haue tolde yea dyd call brynge forth shall giue prosperous iourney come nye heare haue spoken thynge darckely sence begynnyng thynge begynneth wherfore lorde god sprete hath sent thus sayeth lord god thy redemer holy one israell lorde thy god whiche teacheth profytable thinges leade waye y• shuldest go rom 7 b 1 eun 1 • titum 3 b y• haddest regarded commaundementes thy welthynes bene water streame thy ryghtu ousnes waues flowynge see thy sede also lyke sāde see frute thy body lyke grauell stone therof thy name shulde roted destroyed deute 28 go away babylon flye caldees mery voyce speke declare abrode go forth vnto ende world say lord hath redemed hys seruaunt iacob suffred thurst led thē thorowe wyldernesse caused water flowe vnto rocke iere li 1 eld 1 v claue rocke sonder water gushed exod 17 b num 20 b esay 57 c vngodly haue peace sayeth lorde ¶ thryst shal gather together nacyons neuer fo farre capi xlix ye iles harken vnto take hede ye people farre lorde hath called fro byrth made mencyon name fro mother wombe ☜ esaye li c hath made mouth ephe vi c like sharpe swerde vnder shadowe hande hath defended hyd hys quyuer ☜ good arowe saide vnto thou arte seruaunte israel ioh xvii wyll honoured answered haue lost laboure haue spent strength vayne neuertheles wyll cōmytte cause worke vnto lorde god nowe sayth lorde euen fashyoned mother wombe seruaunte maye brynge iacob agayne vnto hym howbeit israel wyl gathered vnto hym agayne whose syght greate whiche also lorde god strength sayde small thynge thou art seruaunt sette vp kynreddes iacob restore destruccyon israell esay 42 b iohan 8 • actes 13 • haue made lyght gen tyles thou mayst helth vnto ende worlde moreouer thus sayth lorde redemer holy one israell abhorrynge despisynge amonge gentyles concernynge seruaunt beare rule kynges prynces shall se aryse worshyp lorde faythfull holy one israell whiche hath chosen thus sayth lorde 2 cori 6 tyme iere xi accepted haue hearde esay xiii daye saluaciō haue helped esay 42 wyl preserue make attonement people thou mayste helpe vp earth agayne chalenge agayne scattered herytages zacha 9 b luke 4 bthat thou mayst saye prysoners go forth darknesse come lyght ☞ maye fede hye wayes gette theyr liuynge hye place apoc vii c shall neither hunger thurste heate sunne hurte fauoureth theym shall leade geue drynke sprynge welles wyll make wayes vpon al mountaynes fote pathes shalbe exalted beholde shall come farre lo north west south reioyce ye heauens synge prayses y• earthe talke ioy ye hilles god hath comforted hys people wyll haue mercy vpon hys trouble syon sayde rom x • god hathe forsaken lorde hathe forgotten wyl wyfe forget chylde hyr wombe sonne whome hath borne thoughe forget yet wyll forget beholde haue wrytten vp vpon handes thy walles euer syght ☜ make haste buylde vp agayne ouerthrewe made waste shal departe gene xv esay ix lyfte vp thyne eye loke aboute al gather together come truely lyue sayeth lord thou shalt put vpon apparell gyrde y• bryde doth iewels thy lande lyeth desolate wasted destroyed shalbe narowe shall dwell wolde deuoure shall farre awaye chylde whome baren shal bryng forth vnto shal saye thyne eare place narowe syt nye together maye haue rowme shalt thou thynke thy selfe hath begotten seynge baren alone captyue outcaste hath norysshed vp desolate alone whence come therfore thus sayth lorde god beholde wyll stretche hande gētyles set vp token people shall brynge thy sonnes theyr lappes carye thy daughter vnto vpon theyr shoulder kynges shalbe thy noursynge father quenes shalbe thy noursynge mother shall fall theyr face flat vpon earthe lycke vp dust thy fete thou mayst knowe lord rom 9 • putteth truste shall confounded spoyleth gyaunte praye taketh prisoner myghtye therfore thus sayeth lorde prysoners shall taken gyaunt spoyle delyuered frome violence wyll maynteyne thy cause agaynst thyne aduersaryes saue thy sonnes wyll fede thyne enemyes theyr owne flesshe make drynke theyr owne bloude swete wyne flesshe shall knowe iacob lorde thy sauyoure thy noble redemer ¶ iewes reproued also called capi l thvs sayeth lorde iere iii • ☜ byll mother deuorcement sente awaye vsurer solde esay lix • beholde owne offence ye solde transgressyons mother forsaken wolde man receyue whē came called noman gaue answere ⚜ hande shortened myght helpe haue nat power delyuer lo nume xi • esay lix • worde dryncke vp see exod 14 • iosue 3 water floudes make dry lāde wante water fyshe corrupt dye thurste ⚜ heauen iexodi x c clothe darkenesse put sacke vpon lorde god hathe geuen well lerned tong 1 lori 1 comforte whiche troubled yea due sea son waked myne eare vp time mornynge scole maysters myght herken psal 39 hebre x mat 2 • • luke xxii • lorde god hath opened myne eare therfore saye nay withdrawe selfe psal lv hebr • 13 • offre backe vnto smytters chekes nyppers ⚜ turne face frome shame spyttynge lorde god shall helpe therefore shall confoūded haue hardened face lyke flint stone sure shall come confusion hande iustifyeth wyll go lawe let v stande one agaynst another yf y• wyll reason let hī come forth rom 8 beholde lorde god standeth y• condēpne lo psal • ii 2 pet •• • • shalbe al lyke olde cloth mothe shall eate vp therfore feareth lord amōg let hym heare voyce seruaūt walketh darkenes lyght shyneth vpon hym let put truste name lord holde hym god take hede ☞ ye kyndle fyre stere vp coales walke glystrynge owne fyre coales ye haue kīdled cōmeth vnto fro hande namely ye shall slepe sorowe ¶ consolacyon comforte promysed vnto faythfull ¶ capi li herken vnto ye holde ryghtuousnes ye seke lord take hede vnto stone whereout ye hewen graue wherout ye digged consydre gen xxi rom 4 gene xii abraham father sara bare howe ⚜ called hym alone blessed hym encreased hym therfore shal lorde comforte syon repayre decaye makyng deserte paradyse wyldernes garden lorde myrth ioye shalbe founde thankesgeuyng voyce prayse haue respect vnto people leye thyne care esay • 2 • lawe ordynaunce shall go forth fro lyghten gentyles harde helthe ryghtuousnesse shal go forth people shal ordred myne arme ylandes gentyles shall hope put theyr trust myne arme lyfte vp eye towarde heauen loke vpon earth beneth ⚜ heauens shall vanysshe waye lyke smoke earthe shal teare lyke clothe dwell therin shall perysshe lyke maner saluacyon shal endure euer ryghtuousnes shall ceasse herken vnto ye haue pleasure rightuousnes thou people psal cii mat 24 • • pet 3 b beareste thou art euer afrayde syght thyne oppress • ure whiche redy harme wrath oppressoure commeth fast maketh haste appere shall peryshe shulde able destroye nether shal fayle taute norishing ⚜ lordemath 8 thy god make see styll toesay 48 esay 49 rage ⚜ whose name lorde hostes esay 14 b exod▪ 14 c haue put wordes thy mouth haue defended y• shadow hande maye plante heuens lay foundacion earth saye vnto sion thou art people awake awake stande vp ierusalem thou hande lorde haste droncken ⚜ cuppe wrathpsal 75 b iere xxv c thou haste supped sucked slumbring cup y• botome amonge al sonnes hath begotten one maye holde vp one leade hande al sonnes hathe noryshed bothe thynges happened vnto sorye yee destruccyon wastyng hungre swerde wyll comforte thy sonnes lye comfortles heade euery strete lyke taken venyson full terrible wrathe lorde punyshment thy god therfore thou myserable dronken howbeit wt wyne thus sayeth thy lorde thy lorde god defender people beholde wyll take slombryng cuppe thy hande euen cuppe dregges wrathe hēce forth thou shalt neuer drinke wyl put theyr hande trouble haue spoken thy soule stoupe downe y• may go ouer make thy body euen grounde strete go vpon ¶ consolacion comforte people god capi lii vp syon vp take thy strength vnto put thyne honest raymente ierusalem thou holy cytie thys tyme forthe shall vncircūcysed vncleane person come shake dust aryse stande vp ierusalē plucke thy necke frō y• bonde y• captyue daughter syon thus sayeth y• lorde rom 7 b ye sold naught therfore shal ye redemed also wt mony thus sayeth y• lorde god gene 46 exodi people wente downe afore tyme egypte straūgers 4 18 c kyng assyrian oppressed thē without cause nowe profyte sayeth lorde people frely caryed awaye brought heuynesse ruler ezec 36 name euer styll blasphemed sayeth lorde people may know name selfe wyl speake day beholde rom 2 howe beautyfull fete embassytours bryngeth message frome mountayne proclaymeth peace bringeth good tydynges preacheth healthe sayeth vnto syon thy god kynge thy watchemen shal lyfte vp theyr voyce loude voyce shall preache shal nume 2 • rom x • se hym present when1 iohn 1 c lorde shall conuerte syon esay 49 c glad thou desolate ierusalem reioyse together lorde hath comforted people hath delyuered ierusalē lorde hathe made bare holy arme shewed forth syght al gē tyles psal 98 • endes earth hathe sene sauyng health god cori • • away awaye get thence touche vncleane thynge go amonge suche cleane beare vesselles lorde ye shall escape rennynge flyenge away exodi 13 lorde shall go god israell shall gather together beholde seruaunt shall deale wysely therfore shall magnyfyed exalted greatly honoured lyke multytude shall wondre vpon hym hys face shalbe disfourmed mās face hys esay liii c beautye lyke man euen shal multitude y• gentyles loke vnto hym kynges shall shut theyr mouthes esay lxv • • oma xv • haue bene tolde hym shall se hym y• herde nothynge hym shall beholde hym ¶ p • ophecyeth euydentely passyon sauyour iesus chryste ¶ capi liii bvt hath iohn xii • rom 1 • e geuen credence vnto preachyng y• arme lorde knowen dyd growe lorde lyke braunche roote drye grounde esay • lii c hath nether bewtie fauoure whē loke vpon shalbe fairenesse shall haue lust vnto hym hebre v despysed abhorred men suche man hath good experyence sorowes infirmyties haue rekened hym vyle hyd face howbeit mat viii b 1 petri 2 c hath taken hym infirmytie borne paynes yet dyd iudge hym thoughe plaged cast downe god cor • x • • notwithstanding wounded offence smytten wyckednesse payne punishment layde vpon hym strypes healed psal 119 • v haue gone astraye lyke shepe euery one hath turned owne waye thorow hym lorde hath pardoned synnes suffered violence euell entreated dyd yet open mouth iere x • mat 27 actes 8 2 cor •• • • shalbe led shepe slayne yet shal styl lambe shearer open mouth awaye cause herde without iugemente whose generacion yet may nombre cut ☜ grounde lyuinge whiche punisshment dyd go vpon hym transgressyon people math 27 • graue gyuen hym condempned ☜ ryche man death 2 corin 5 • 1 pett 2 dyd neuer vyolence vnryght neyther hathe bene disceytfulnesse mouthe iohan x • • rom 8 yet hath pleased lorde smyte hym infirmite made soule offerynge synne myght se longe lastynge sede deuyce lorde shall prospere hande trauayle laboure soule shall optayne greate ryches rom • 〈◊〉 ▪ ryghtuous seruaunt shal wisdome iustifye de lyuer multitude shall beare away theyr synnes therfore wyl geue hym multytude parte shal deuyde stronge spoyle geueth ouer soule death mat 15 〈◊〉 luke 23 • reckened among trangressours whiche neuertheles hath taken awaye synnes multytude made intercessyon mysdoers ¶ greate dominyon chryst indignacyon god endureth shorte space ▪ mercye euerlastynge cap liiii glad nowe gala iiii luke xiii • thou baren barest reioyce synge mery thou arte chylde desolat hathe mo • chyldren maryed wyfe sayth lorde make thy tence wyder sprede hangynges thyne habitacyon spare laye forthe thy coardes make fast thy stake thou shalte multiplyed right syde left thy sede shall haue gentyles possessyon dwell desolate cyties feare thou shalt confounded ashamed thou shalt nat come confusyon yea ☞ thou shalte forget shame thy youth shalte nat remembre dishonour thy wedowed made shalbe thy lorde esa lxii eze xvi b husbande whose name ii cor xi esay 48 lorde hostes thy redemer shall euen holy one israel lorde whole worlde lorde hathe called beynge desolate sorowfull woman yonge wyfe hath broken wedlocke sayeth thy god esa xxvi • psa xxix • lytle whyle haue sorsaken greate mercyfulnes shall take vp vnto angry hydde face lytle season thorowe euerlastynge goodnesse haue pardoned y• sayeth lorde thy redemer gene ix b vnto water noe lyke haue sworne wyll nat brynge water noe vpon worlde 11 〈◊〉 vii haue sworne wyll neuer angry reproue mountaynes shal remoue hylles shall fall downe louynge kyndnesse shall nat moue bonde peace shall nat fall downe sayeth lorde thy mercyfull louer beholde thou poore vexed esay vi despysed wyll make thy walles precyous stone thy foundacyons saphyres thy wyndowes chrystall thy gate fyne cleare stone thy border pleasaunte stone 1 iohn ii b • iohn • • thy chyldren shall taught god wyll geue plenteousnesse peace ryghteousnesse shalfe thou grounded farre oppressyon whiche thou nedeste nat afrayed neyther hynderaunce shall nat come nye beholde alyaunt farre shall dwell sometyme straunger vnto shalbe ioyned beholde make smyth bloweth coales fyre maketh weapen handy worke make also waster destroye weapens y• made agaynste shall nat prospere luke xxi b 〈◊〉 iiii tunges shall resyste iudge mente thou shalt ouercome condempne thys herytage lordes seruauntes theyr righteousnes commeth sayeth lorde ¶ consolacion comforte people • ru • e profet worde god capi lv come water ye thrusty ye haue moneyecle li • iohn vii apo xxii d▪ come bye ye maye haue eate come bye wyne mylcke without money money worthe wherfore ye laye youre money thynge fedeth spende youre labour aboute thynge satysfyeth nat herken rather vnto ye shall eate beste youre soule shall haue pleasure plenteousnesse enclyne youre eares come vnto take hede youre soule shall lyue acte xii • ii vii c wyll make euerlasting couenaunte euen sure mercyes dauyd beholde gaue hym wytnesse amonge folke prynce captayne vnto people lo thou shalte call vnknowen people people nat knowledge shall runne vnto lorde thy god holy one israell whiche gloryfyeth seke lorde whyle maye founde call vpon hym whyle nye eze xviii c and▪ xxx ••• • let vngodly man forsake hys owne wayes vnryghtuous hys owne ymagynacyons turne agayne vnto lorde shall mercyfull vnto hym • oure god psal ciii • esay lxv redy forgyue thus sayeth lorde thoughtes youre thoughtes youre wayes wayes farre heauens hyer earthe farre wayes exceade thoughtes de xxxii b lyke rayne snowe commeth downe heauen returneth thyther agayne watereth earthe maketh frutefull grene may geue corne bread vnto sowet worde also commeth mouthe shall turne agayne voyde vnto shall accomplyshe wyll prospere thynge wherto sende shall ye go forthe ioye led peace mountaynes hylles shall synge ioye tree felde shall clappe theyr handes thornes shall growe fyrre tree myrre tre steade breers thys shal done prayse lorde euerlastynge token shall nat taken awaye ¶ exor • • yon iudgemente ryghtcousnes spy▪ ytual kepynge sabboth agaynst ••• pherdes deuoure theyr flo • ke capi lvi thus sayeth lorde math iii c kepe equyte ryght sauynge healthe shall come shortly ryghteousnesse shalbe opened blessed man doth man chylde kepeth esay 58 • taketh hede vnhalowe nat sabboth kepeth selfe euyl shal nat straunger whiche cleauethe lorde saye deu xxiii c ala lorde hathe shut cleane hys people nether shall sapi iii b gelded man saye lo drye tre thus sayeth lorde vnto gelded kepeth sabboth namely holdeth greatly thyng pleaseth kepeth couenaunte unto wyl gyue housholde walles better herytage name bene called sonnes doughters iohn 1 c wyll gyue euerlastynge name shall perysshe agayne saythe vnto straungers disposed stycke lorde serue hym loue name iohn 8 c shalbe bonde men whiche kepe selues vnhalowe sabboth namely fulfyll couenaūt wyl bryng holy mountayne make ioyfull house prayer theyr burnt offerynges sacrifyces shalbe accepted vpon myne aulter my3 reg 8 c math xx b mar xi b luk xix house shall called house prayer people thus sayth lorde god whiche gathereth together scattered israell wyll brynge yet another congregation hym come ye beastes felde ye may deuoure ye beastes wood iere xii b eze 34 a▪ watch men blynde haue together vnderstandynge domme dogges nat beynge able barcke slepery slogish lye snortynge shamelesse dogges neuer satysfyed sheperdes also lyke maner haue vnderstādynge iere vi b euery man turneth owne waye euery one owne couetousnes al power esa xxii b cor xv sapi ii b come saye wyl fetch wyne shall fyll selues maye dronken morowe lyke day yee muche ¶ iewes rebuked theyr iniurye done chryst capi lvii sapi ii ryghteous perysheth man regardeth hert good godly people taken waye man consydreth namely ryghtuous conuayed awaye thorowe wycked hymselfe myght rest lye quietly vpon bed lyue owne pleasure come hyther therfore ye charmer child math 12 • ye sonnes aduoutrer whore wherin take ye pleasure upon gape ye mouth bleare tong ye chyldren aduoutry sede dissimulacion eze xvi esa xiv iere vii 3 deut 18 • eze xx leuy xx • deut 32 • ye take pleasure vnder okes vnder al grene tree chylde beynge slayne valley dennes stone thy parte shalbe stony rockes riuer yea euē shal thy part yu haste poured meate drynke offringes vnto shuld ouerse thou haste made thy bed vpon hye mountaines thou wentest vp thyther hast thou slayne sacrifice deut 37 • behynde dores postes haste thou set vp thy remembraunce thou haddest discouered thy selfe another thou wenteste vp made thy bed wyder thou dyddest carue certayne yonder idol louedest theyr couch thou sawest thou wenteste streyght kynges eze xvi • osec xii • oyle dyuerse oyntementes thou hast sente thy messenger farre yet arte thou fallen pyt therby thou arte wery multitude thyne owne wayes yet saydest thou neuer wyll leaue math ix b thou thynkest haue lyfe health thy self therfore thou beleuest nat thou art sycke whē wylt thou abasshed feare seyng thou hast broken thy promyse remembrest nether hast thyne hert thynkest thou also wyl holde peace afore tyme y• thou fearest yea verely wyl declare thy goodnes thy worckes shal profyt thou cryest let thy chosen heape delyuer wynde shall take al awaye cary therom xi • ayre neuertheles put trust shal inheret lande haue holy hyll possessyon therfore thus sayeth esay xl • make redy make redy clense strete take vp ye waye leadeth people thus sayeth hye excellent euen y• dwelleth euerlastyngnesse whose name y• holy one psal 50 b esa lxvi • 66 • dwel hye aboue sanctuary hym also contrite humble sprete maye heale troubled mynde contryte herte psa c iii • iere iii • chyde nat euer nat wroth ende blastynge goeth though make breath wroth hym couetousnes smyte hym hyde angrye turneth selfe foloweth waye owne hert yf may se hys ryght waye agayne make whole lede hym restore hym vnto whō luke xv maketh ioyful sory hym make frutes thankesgeuyng geue peace ephe ii c vnto thē farre thē nye say lorde make hym whole wycked lyke raginge see cannot rest whose water fometh myre grauel euen esay 48 wycked haue peace sayeth god ¶ lorde mouthe prophete reproueth people theyr fastynges whiche full hypocrysye capi lviii crye eze iii • iera xix • nowe loude thou canste leaue nat lyfte vp thy voyce lyke trompet shewe people theyr offence house iacob theyr synnes seke daylye wyll knowe wayes euen people dyd ryghte nat forsaken statute theyr god argue concernynge ryght iudgement wyl pleate lawe theyr god math ix b wherfore fast saye thou seyste put oure lyues straytenesse thou regardeste nat esaye b beholde ye faste youre lust remayneth styll ye lesse vyolence detters lo ye fast stryfe debate smyte youre fyste y• speaketh vnto ye faste nat tyme voyce myght hearde aboue zatha vii b thyncke ye thꝭ fast pleaseth mā shuld chasten hym selfe daye wrythe hys head aboute lyke hoke heary cloth lye vpon earth shulde called fasting day y• pleaseth lorde dothe nat thys fastynge rather please thou deut xv lowse hym bondage thy daunger thou breake othe wycked bargaynes thou let oppressed go fre take al maner burthen eze xviiib esai xv x deale thy bred hongry brynge poore fatherlesse home thy house thou seyst naked thou couer hym hyde thy face thyne owne flesshe luke xi shall thy lyght breake forthe mornynge thy healthe floryshe ryghte shortly thy ryghteousnesse shall go glory lorde shal enbrace prou xxi b yf thou calleste lorde shall answere yf thou cryeste shall saye yea yf thou layeste awaye thy burthen holdest thy fyngers ceaseste blasphemous talkynge zacha viia math v b yf thou haste compassyon vpon hongrye refressheste troubled soule shall thy lyght springe darcnesse thy darcknesse shall noone daye lorde shal euer thy gyde satysfye desyre thyne herte fyll thy bone mary thou shalte lyke fresshe watred garden iohn iiii b lyke foū teine water neuer leaueth running place haue euer bene wast shal buylded shalte thou laye foundacyon many kynredes thou shalt called maker vp hedge buylder againe waye sabbathe yea yf thou turne thy fete esay lvi lxvi sabbath thou nat thynge pleaseth thy selfe holy day shalt thou called vnto pleasaunt holy glorious sabbath lord thou shalt honoure thou nat thyne owne ymaginacion nether seke thine owne wyll speake thyne owne wordes shalte thou haue thy pleasure lorde whiche shall carye hye aboue earthe fede herytage iacob thy father y• lordes owne mouth hath promysed ¶ lorde myghtye saue readye heare oure requestes capi lix beholde esay l nume xi lordes hande nat shortened nat helpe neyther eare stopped maye nat heare iere v b youre mysdedes haue separated youre god youre esaye v synnes hyde face heareth handes defyled bloude youre finger vnrighteousnes lyppes speake lesynnes youre tonge setteth oute wyckednes man regardeth ryghteousnes man iudgeth truly euery mā hopeth vayne thynges ymagyneth disceate iob xv psal vii b conceaueth weerynesse bryngeth forthe euyl brede cokatryce egges weaue spyders webbe eateth theyr egges dyeth yf one treade vpon commeth vp serpent theyr webbe maketh clothe maye couer thē theyr labour theyr dedes y• dedes wyckednes worcke robbery 〈2 page missing〉 haue set ☜ watchman vpon thy walles ierusalem shal neither cease daye nyght preache lorde ye also shall kepe hym close leaue speake hym vntyll ierusalem set vp made prayse world lorde hath sworne ryght hande stronge arme hence forth wyll geue thy corne meate thyne eue • e • uor thy vyne wherin thou hast laboured drynke straungers haue gathered corne shall eate gyue thankes lorde haue borne vine shal drinke courte sanctuary stande backe departe sunder ye stande vnder gate make rowme ye people repayre strete take awaye stone set token people beholde lorde proclaymeth vnto endes worlde esaye xl b z •• ha ix b mat x • x tel daughter sion se thy sauyour cōmeth beholde bringeth treasure workes go lorde de liuereth shalbe called esay 54 holy people thou shalte named greatly occupied forsaken cytie ¶ redempcy promysed people capi lxiii commeth frome edō redde coloured clothes bosra whiche costely clothe cōmeth nimbly strength teacheth rightuousnes power helpe wherfore thy clothyng reade thy rayment lyke ye treadeth wyne presse haue troaden presse self alone al people one thus wyll treade downe myne enemyes wrath set fete vpon indignacyon theyr bloude shalbe sprong vpon clothes wyll stayne rayment esay 34 b daye vengeaunce haue take han̄de yere delyueraunce come loked aboute mā shewe helpe marualed man helde vp thē helde myne owne arme feruentnesse susteyned thus wyll treade downe people wrathe bathe displeasure vpon earth wyll laye strength wyl declare goodnesse lord ye prayse lorde hathe geuen v greate good hath done israel whiche hath geuen owne fauoure accordynge multitude louynge kyndnesses sayde doute people shrynkynge chyldren theyr sauyour theyr trouble forsoke exod xv esay xii angell wente forth presence delyuered loue kyndnesse vnto redemed hathe borne caryed theym vp euer sence worlde beganne prouoked wrath vexed holy minde theyr enemye fought agaynste hym selfe yet remembred olde tyme moyses people exo xiii • 14 • • 3 • howe brought water see exod 14 • shepherde doth shepe howepsal 77 b giuen holy spiryte amonge howe led moses ryght hande glorious arme howe deuided water theym wherby gat hym selfe euerlastyng name howe led depe hors ledde playne sh • lde stumble spirite lord led tame beast goeth felde thus god hast thou led thy people make thy selfe glorious name deut 26 • daru • 2 • loke downe heuen beholde dwellynge place thy sanctuary thy glory howe thy gelousy thy strength multitude thy mercyes thy louynge kyndnesse wyll entreated v yet arte thou math 6 • luke xi 〈◊〉 xxiii • father abraham knoweth v neyther israel acquainted v thou lord arte rather redemer thy name euerlastynge lorde wherfore haste y• led v thy waye psa cxix • wherfore haste y• hardened herces y• feare one v agayne thy seruauntes sake generacion thyne herytage thy people hathe lytle thy saynctuary possessy enemyes haue taken become euen begynnynge thou arte lorde haue called vpon thy name ¶ prophete vnder person iewes wayleth theyr exple banyshement mannes ryghtuousness lyke cloth fyled floures woman capi lxiiii thou woldest cleue heauen sonder come downe mountaynes myght melte away thy presence lyke hote fire malycious myght voyle water dothe vpon fyre wherby thy name myght knowen amonge thyne enemyes gentyles myght trymble thou myghtest come downe thy wonderous straunge workes thē shuld hylles melt thy presence sence begynnynge worlde none excepte thou god hearde perceaued cor ii b neyther hathe eye sene thou dost thē put theyr trust thou helpest hym doth ryght cherefulnesse thyncke vpon thy wayes lo thou hast bene angrye offended haue bene euer synne rom li • b psa xiii nat one whole vnclene thynge oure ryghtuousnesses clothes stayned floures woman fal euery chone leafe synnes cary v awaye lyke wynde man calleth vpon thy name standeth vp take holde therfore hydest thou thy face v consumest v oure synnes nowe lorde thou father oures rom ix c psal 79 claye thou art potter worke thy hādes 〈…〉 temi x dbe nat sore dyspleased lorde kepe nat offence long thy remēbraūce consydre thy people cyties thy sanctuarye lye wast mich iii c syon wyldernesse ierusalem deserte holy house bewty father praysed brente vp yee al oure cōmodities pleasure wasted awaye wylt thou nat intreated lorde thys wylt thou holde thy peace scourge v sore ¶ felycytye ierusalem callynge heathen capi lxv esayc li c rom x athey seke hytherto haue nat asked fynde hytherto haue nat sought saye people neuer called vpon name thus longe haue euer holden handes vnfaythfull people go nat ryght waye theyr owne ymaginaryons people euer defyinge face deut xii xiiii b make theyr oblacyons garden theyr smoke vpon exod xx aulters brycke lurke among graues lye dennes nyght deu xiiii leui xi eate swynes flesh vncleane broth theyr vessel thou comest nye saye touche nat holyer thou men angrye shalbe turned smoke mat xxv fyre shal burne euer beholde wrytten face shall nat forgotten recōpen sed iere vii esa 57 • eze xi shall rewarde theyr bosome meane youre mysdedes mysdedes youre father together sayeth lorde whiche haue made theyr smoke vpon mountaynes blasphemed vpon hylles therfore wyll measure theyr olde dedes theyr bosome agayne moreouer thus sayeth lorde rom xi b lyke one wolde gather holy grape men saye vnto breake nat holy 3 reg 19 c rom ix c euen wyll also seruauntes sake wyl nat destroye al wyll take sede iacob iuda one take possession hyll chosen shall possesse thynges seruauntes shal dwell saron shalbe shepefolde iosu vii valley • hor shal geue stallynge catell people feare prouce c iere vii ye haue forsaken lorde forgotten holy hyll ye haue set vp aulter vnto fortune geuen ryche dryncke offerynges vnto treasure therfore wyll nombre swerde ye shall destroyed together called man gaue answere whē spake ye herkened nat vnto dyd wickednes myne eye chynge pleased nat therfore thus sayeth lorde god beholde seruauntes shal eate ye shal haue honger beholde seruaūtes shal drynke ye shal suffre thurste beholde seruauntes shalbe mery ye shall confounded beholde seruauntes shall reioyce quyetnesse herte ye shall crye sorowe herte complayne vexacyon mynde youre name shall nat sworne amonge chosen god lorde shall sleye call hys seruauntes another name iere ix b cona c 2 cor xi reioyseth vpon earth shall reioyse true god sweareth vpō earth shall sweare true god olde emnyte shalbe forgotten taken awaye oute syght ii pet iii b apo • xxi lo shal make newe heauen newe earth olde shall neuer thought vpō kepte mynde men shalbe glad euermore reioyse thynges shall beholde shal make ioyful ierusalem yee selfe wyl reioyse ierusalem glad people apo • xxi voyce wepynge waylynge shall nat harde thence forth shal neuer chylde olde mā haue nat theyr full dayes chylde cometh hondreth yeare olde shall dye yf hundreth yeare age wronge shalbe cursed deu 18 • c shall buylde house dwell shall plante vyneyardes cate frute shal nat buylde another possesse shall nat plante another cate gene ii b ier xvii b psal lyfe people shalbe lyke tre shal worke theyr handes chosen shall lyue longe shal nat laboure vayne begette trouble hye blessed sede lorde theyr frutes shallbe euer cal shal answere whyle yet thynckynge howe speake shall heare wolffe lambe shall fede together lion shal eate haye like bullock esay xi b gene iii c earth shalbe serpentes meate shal man hurte sleye another holy hyll sayeth lorde ¶ god dwelleth nat temple made mēnes hande despyseth sacryfyces done without • • fayth god comforteth troubled hys sake amonge chrysten sabboth contynuall capi lxvi thvs sayeth lorde 3 reg 8 c 〈◊〉 pa vi c ac • vii f heauen seate earth fote stole shall nowe hosue stande ye wyll buylde vnto shal place wyll dwell thynges hande hathe made created sayeth lorde psal l b esa lvii c lxi whiche shall regarde euen lowly troubled sprete standeth awe wordes sleyeth oxe dothe greate dishonoure kylleth mā y• killeth shepe choketh dogge bringeth meat offringes offreth swynes bloude maketh memo riall incense prayseth thynge vnright yet take wayes hande theyr soule delyteth abhomina cyon iob vi therfore wyll also haue pleasure laughynge scorne thynge feare wyll brynge vpon prou •• b esa lxv b called nomā gaue answere spake wolde nat heare dyd wyckeduesse myne eye chose thynges displease heare worde lorde yee feare thynge whiche speaketh youre brother hate caste name sake saye lette lorde magnyfye hym selfe maye se youre gladnesse yet shallbe confounded zach 〈…〉 touchynge cytie temple heare voyce lorde wyll rewarde recompence ene myes lyke wyfe bryngeth forth man chylde euer suffre payne byrth anguysh trauayle euer harde sawe suche thynges dothe grounde beare one daye people borne syon beareth sonnes thus sayeth lorde gene x 〈…〉 29 f 〈…〉 maketh beare beare nat selfe nat beareth maketh baren sayth thy god reioyse ierusalem glad ye loue mat v e ioyful ye mourned ye shal sucke comforte brestes satysfyed yeshall tast haue delyte plenteousnesse power thus sayth lorde beholde wyll lette peace lyke water floude myght heathen lyke flowynge streame shall ye sucke ye shall borne vpon sydes ioyfull vpon knee lyke chylde comforted mother shall comforte ye shalbe comforted ierusalem ye se thys youre herte shall reioyse pro x 〈…〉 ez • • 7 • bone shall florysh lyke herbe thus shall hande lorde knowne amonge hys seruauntes hys indygnacyon amonge hys enemyes beholde lorde shall come fyre charet shal lyke whorle wynde maye recompence hys vengeaunce wrath hys indygnacyon flame fyre lorde shall iudge flesh fyre swerde shalbe greate nombre slayne lorde suche haue made selues holy cleane garden haue eaten swynes flesh myce abhomynacyons shalbe taken awaye together sayeth lorde wyll come gather people tonges workes ymaginacions shall come se glory unto shal geue token sende certayne delyuered amonge gentyles celycia affryca lidia men handle bowes italie also greke lande esay 49 lii ix • •• v iles farre haue herde speake haue sene glorye shall preache prayse amonge gentyles shall brynge brother offerynge vnto flesshe shal come worshyp sayeth lorde shall go forthe loke vpon caryons haue transgessed agaynst mar ix theyre wormes shall dye neyther shall theyre fyre quenched fleshe shal abhorre ❧ ende booke prophete esaye ❧ booke prophete ieremye ¶ stocke ieremy tyme propheeyed excuseth selfe wolde refuse offyce prophete yonge vnexperte taught lorde becometh bolde god openeth vnto destruccyon iewes babylonyans hande ieremye commaunded speake worde god vnto iewes without feare capitv sermon ieremy sonne helkiah preste one thē dwelte iere xi anathoth lande ben iamm whē lorde fyrste spoken tyme iosiah sonne amon kynge iuda xiij yeare reygne durynge vnto tyme iehoakim sonne iosiah kynge iuda 4 reg 25 iere • 9 vntyll x • yeres zedekyah son iosyah kyng iuda ended ierusalem taken euē fyfth moneth worde y• lorde spake thus vnto esay • 4 46 psal 7 • fasshyoned thy mother wombe dyd knowe euer thou wast borne santifyed ordeyned prophete vnto y• people saide exodi 4 • •• e 9 b oh lorde god vnmete yet yonge lorde answered thus saye yonge math x c thou shalt go shall sendethe vnto 1 corin • euer cōmaunde shalt thou speake afrayed face delyuer sayth lorde psal vi iere 18 wt lorde stretched hande touched mouth sayd vnto beholde put wordes thy mouth day set ouer people kyng dome thou mayest rote breake destroy make waste thou mayest buylde vp plante lorde spake vnto saying ieremye seyst thou sayde se rod almonte tree sayde lorde vnto thou hast sene right wyl watche diligently vpon worde perfourme happened afterward lorde spake agayne sayde seyst thou sayde se seethyng iob xli b pot lokynge north sayde lorde vnto ofiere 4 b xxv b north shall come plage vpon ler lande lo abat b wyll call officer kyngdoomes north sayeth lorde shall come euery one shall set seate gate ierusalem walles rounde city iuda thorowe shal declare iudgement vpon al wyckednesse men haue forsaken haue offered vnto straunge goddes worshypped workꝭ owne handes ex c iii therfore girde vp thy loynes aryse tell al geue cōmaundement feare wyll haue afraied iere xv b beholde daye make stronge fensed towne yron pyller brasen wal agaynste whole lande agaynste kynges myghtye men iuda agaynste prestes people lande shal fyght agaynste shall able ouercome delyuer sayeth lorde ¶ god reherceth benefytes done vnto iewes agaynste preested prophetes preacher contemne despyse god iewes destroyed forsake god canne whore huntyng idoles capi ii moreouer worde lorde came vnto sayenge go thy waye crye eares ierusalem saye thus sayeth y• lord remembre kyndnesse thy youth thy stedfast loue thou folowedst thorow wyldernesse vntylled lande israel halowed thynge vnto lord fyrste fruytes iere x zatha ii deuoure israell shall offende mysfortune shall fall vpon sayeth lord heare therfore worde lorde thou house iacob generacions house israel thus sayeth lorde vnfaythfulnesse founde father wente farre awaye fro fallynge lyghtnesse beyng vayne thought theyr hertes haue lefte lord brought v lande egypte exod 14 c led v thorowe wyldernesse thorowe deserte roughe lande thorowe drye deadly lande yre lande man gone thorow wherin man dwelt deut vi b brought pleasaunte welbuilded lande ye ye myght enioye frutes commodity ye went forth defyled lande brought myne herytage abhominacyon prestes selues said lorde y• lawe theyr handes knewe ☞ shepherdes offended agaynst prophetes dyd seruyce vnto baal folowed suche thynges shall brynge profyte wherfore constrayned sayeth lorde make complaynte vpon vpon chyldrē go iles cethim loke well sende vnto cedar take diligent hede se whether suche thinges done whether gētiles selues deale falsly vntruly theyr goddes whiche yet goddes dede people hath geuē ouer theyr hye honour thynge may helpe astonyshed ye heauens afrayed abasshed suche thynge sayeth lorde people hathe done two euyls haue forsaken well iere xvii • iohn iiii • ▪ exo iiii • water lyfe digged pyttes yee vyle broken pyttes holde water israel bonde seruaunte one housholde thē spoyled roare crye vpon hym lyon haue made lāde waste esay • cyties brente vp man dwellynge yee chyldren noph taphnes haue defyled thy necke iere 3 2 • cōmeth vnto thou haste forsaken lorde thy god euer sence led waye hast thou nowe way egypt dryncke foule water eyther makest thou way assyrya dryncke water floude iob xxii • thyne owne wyckednesse shal reproue thy turnynge awaye shall condemne thou mayest knowe vnderstande howe euyll hurtefull thynge thou haste forsaken lorde thy god feared hym sayeth lorde god hostes esay 45 • haue euer brokē thy yoke olde burste thy bōdes yet sayest thou eze x ier • iii b wyl nomore serue lyke harlot thou rūnest vpon al hye hilles among al grene tree planted noble vyne good rote esaye v • art thou turned īto bitter vnfrutful straunge grape yee sore though thou washe y• nitrus make thy selfe sauoure swete smellynge herbe borith yet syght thou art stayned thy wyckednesse sayth lorde thy god saye nat nowe nat vnclene haue nat folowed goddes 4 17 b ie 4 b 5 b esa lvii eze xvi b loke vpon thyne owne wayes woddes vallyes dennes shalt thou knowe thou hast done thou art lyke swyft dromedary goeth easely waye thy wantonnes lyke wylde asse vseth wyldernesse snoffeth bloweth wyll tame seke shall nat fayle fynde thyne owne vnclennes thou kepest thy fote nakednes thy throte frō thyrste thynkest thus thy selfe tush wyl take sorowe wyl loue y• sta • ūge goddes hange vpon lyke thefe taken dede commeth shame euen house israel come confusion comen people theyr kynges ruler theyr prestes prophetes rom • saye stock thou art father stone thou haste begoten ie xxxii • acha vii b yee haue turned theyr backe vpon nat theyr face • deu 32 • tyme theyr trouble saye stande vp helpe v shal answere thē nowe thy goddes thou hast made byd stande vp helpe tyme nede iere xi b loke howe many cyties thou hast iuda many goddes hast thou also wherfore wyll ye go lawe seynge yee synners agaynste sayeth lorde lost baboure smyte youre chyldren receyue nat correccyon 2 pa 24 b youre owne swerde destroyeth youre prophetes lyke deuourynge lyon ye people lorde herken vnto worde become wyldernesse vnto people israel lande hathe lyght wherfore sayeth people lordes wyl come vnto dothe mayden forget raymente bryde stomacher dothe people forget longe boastest thou thy wayes hyl • e optayne fauour ther thorowe thou haste yet stayned thē blasphemy deut 18 b iere vii ezech x • psal c • e upon thy wynges foūde bloude poore innocente people nat corner hole onely openly place yet darrest thou saye ⚜ without synne gyltlesse tush wrathe nat come vpon beholde wyll reason thou darrest saye haue nat offended howe euell wyll abyde whē shall knowne nowe oft thou hast gone bacwarde thou shalte • e confounded well egypte assyrian yea thou shalt go thy waye smyte thyne handes together vpō thy head lorde shall brynge confydēce hope thyne naught thou shalt prospere ¶ god beyng mercyful calleth vnto repentaūce people whiche forsaken theyr whordome idol exorteth israel repentaunce promysynge shepherdes shulde haue true knoweledge god returne israel vnto god confessynge theyr offence capi iii comenly deut 24 man putteth away hys wyfe goeth hym maryeth another questyon shulde resorte vnto thys lande defyled vncleane osee ii eze xvi • thou haste played harlot many louers yet turne agayne sayeth lorde lyfte vp thyne eye euery syde loke yf thou defyled thou hast wayted thē wayes murtherer wyldernesse thorow thy whordome shamefull blasphemyes lande defyled 3 17 thys cause rayne euenynge dewe hathe ceased thou haste gotten whore forehead wylte nat ashamed el woldeste thou saye vnto father thou arte haste broughte vp led fro youthe wylt thou put awaye caste euer wylte thou withdrawe thy selfe cleane fro neuertheles thou speakest wordes thou art euer doynge worse worse iere iere ii 4 17 b lorde sayde also vnto tyme iosiah kynge haste thou sene y• rebellyō israel hath done howe hath runne vp vpon al hylles amōge al thycke tree played harlot hast thou sene also done thys howe sayde vnto shulde turne agayne vnto yet returned eze xxiii b iuda vnfaythfull syster also sawe namely well sene aduoutry shrynckynge harlot israel 4 17 put awaye gaue byll deuorcement vnfaythfull syster iuda nat ashamed went backe played whore also yea y• noyse whor dome hath defyled whole lande hathe commytted fornycacyon stone stockes neuerthelesse vnfaythfull sister iuda • see v turned vnto agayne whole herte famedly sayeth lorde lorde sayd vnto eze xvi • backslyder israel ryghtuous vnfaythfull iuda therfore go preache wordes towarde north saye thou disobediente israel turne agayne sayeth lorde wyll nat turne face mercyfull sayth lorde wyll nat alwaye psa • iii beare dyspleasure agaynst condicyon thou knowe thy greate blasphemy namely thou hast vnfaythfully forsaken lorde thy god hast made thy selfe partaker straunge goddes iere v b esay lvii vnder grene tree haste wyll heare voyce sayeth lorde ez • ii c osc • • 4 ye disobedient chyldren turne agayne sayeth lorde wyll maried wyl take one cytie two one generacyon amonge brynge syon wyll geue herdmē myne owne mynde shal fede lernyng wysdome moreouer ye increased multyplyed lande sayeth lorde shall boaste made arcke lordes testamēt noman shal thynke vpon nether shal man make mencyō thence forth shall nether bysyted honoured gyftes gala iiii c shall ierusalē called lordes seate heathen shalbe gathered vnto name lordes sake whi shalbe set vp ierusalem tyme forth shall folowe ymagynacyon theyr owne frowarde herte house iuda shall go vnto house israel mat vi •• • shall come together north lande haue geuen father haue shewed also howe toke vp beynge chylde gaue pleasaunte lande thyne herytage yee goodly hoste heathen howe commaunded thou shuldest math 23 • cal father onely nat shrynke fro lyke woman fayleth husbande ye vnfaythfull vnto ye house israel sayeth lorde iere xxxi • therfore voyce chyldren israel herde hye wepynge waylinge haue defyled theyr waye forgotten god theyr lorde ye disobedient chyldren turne agayne sayenge lo thyne thou arte lorde oure god shall heale backeturnynges hylles fall hye pryde mountaynes osee xiii acte iiii 〈◊〉 health israel standeth vpō god lorde th • e • 〈◊〉 dauid 〈◊〉 baruch 〈◊〉 iere x • iii • cōfusyon hathe deuoured father labour oure youth vp yee theyr shepe bullockes theyr sonnes daughter also slepe cōfusion shame couereth v psa • v • • esay 64 • iudi • vii • e • r ix • ▪ x b oure father frō oure youth vp vnto daye haue synned agaynste lorde god haue nat obeyed voyce lorde god ¶ true repentounte returnynge god exhorteth circumcisyon herte destruccyon iewry prophecyed alyce theyr hertes capi iiii israeel yf thou wylte turne turne vnto sayeth lorde yf thou wylt put awaye thyne abhomynacyons syght thou shalte nat moued ie • •••• shalt sweare lorde liueth trueth equyte ryghteousnesse people shall fortunable ioyfull hym thus sayeth lorde al iuda ierusalem plowe youre lande sowe nat amonge thornes iere v • b▪ • x • circuncysed y• lorde cut away foreskynne hertes al yee iuda al indweller ierusalem •• c xi 5 indignacyon breake nat lyke fyre kyndle man maye quench wyckednes youre ymagynacyons esay 58 b preache iuda ierusalem crye add speake blowe trompettes lande crye euery man maye heare saye gather together wyll go stronge cyties set vp token syon spede make taryeng ieremi • • wyll brynge greate plage greate destruccyon north spoyler gentyles broken vp hys place lyon denne maye make thy lande waste destroye cyties man maye dwel therin wherfore gyrde youre selues aboute sacke clothe mourne wepe fearefull wrath lorde nat withdrawen v tyme sayeth lorde herte kynge prynces shall gone prestes shalbe astonyshed prophetes shalbe sore frayed sayde lorde god hast thou disceaued people ierusalem sayenge deut 〈◊〉 • ye shall haue peace nowe swearde goeth thorowe theyr lyues shall sayde people ierusalem ier • n • cōmeth warme wynde frō north thorowe way people neyther fanne clense shall come vnto stronge wynde wyll also geue sentence vpon lo commeth vp lyke cloude charettes lyke stormy wynde • hie 4 dam 7 horseman swifter aegle wo vnto v destroyed ierusalaem psal li esay c wasshe thyne hert wickednes thou mayst helped howe longe shall thy noysome thoughtes remayne voyce dan hyl ephraim speaketh telleth destruccyon beholde heathen geue ierusalem
