warnynge preache vnto destroyer commynge far countrees tell cyties iuda also shall geue warnyng euery place lyke watchemen felde zatha 8 • haue prouoked wrath sayeth lorde 3 reg 18 iere ii c • xliiii • thy wayes thy thoughtes haue brought vnto thys thyne owne wyckednesse disobedyence hathe possessed thyne hert ah bely ah bely shalte thou crye howe herte sore herte panteth within styll haue herde cryeng pettes peales warre crye murthur vpon murthur whole lande shall peryshe immediatly tentes destroyed hangynges twynclynge eye howe longe shal se token warre heare noyse trompettes neuertheles shal come vpon esay v b baruc 3 b people become foolishe hath vtterly vnderstandynge osee 4 chyldren foolyshenesse without discrecion euyll haue wyt ynoughe well haue wysdome haue loked vpon earth se wast voyde loked towarde heauen shyne behelde mountaynes • trembled nylles feare loked aboute body byrdes ayre awaye marked well plowed felde become waste yea theyr city broken downe presence lorde indignacion wrathe thus hathe lorde sayde whole lande shalbe desolate yet wyll haue done ☜ therfore shall earthe mourne heauen forye aboue thynge haue purposed taken vpon shall repente wyll go whole lande shall fle noyse horseman bowemen shall runne dennes woddes clyme vp stonye rockes cyties shalbe voyde man dwellynge therin wylte thou nowe thou beynge destroyed iere ii • though thou clothest thy selfe scarlet deckest gold 4 reg 9 f thoughe thou payntest thy face colour yet shalt thou trym thy selfe vaine hytherto haue bene thy great fauourers shall abhorre go aboute sley heare noyse lyke woman trauaylynge one labourynge fyrste chylde euen voyce daughter syon casteth armes sowneth sayeng ah wo sore vexed faynt hert slayne ¶ iewry ryghtuous faythful man foūde eyther amongest people ruler whose sake lorde shulde spare citie wherfore iewry destroyed assyrian capi v loke thorowe ierusalem beholde se seke thorowe streates also within yfye fynde one man dothe equally ryght seketh trueth shall spare sayeth lorde iere iiii • • xii • thoughe saye lorde lyueth yet sweare disceaue thou lorde lokest onely vpon fayth trueth thou haste scourged toke repentaunce thou haste corecte amendement refused thy correccyon made theyr face harder stone wolde amende therfore thought selfe peraduenture simple folish vnderstande nothynge lordes way iudgementes god deut 17 • therfore wyl go vnto theyr heades ruler talke yf knowe waye lorde iudgementes god lyke maner haue broken yoke burste bandes sonder deut 32 wherfore ☞ lyon wodde hath hurte wolfe euening shall destroye ieoparde doth lye lurkyuge theyr cytyes teare peces thē come therout theyr offence many theyre departynge awaye great shuld al haue mercy vpon thy chyldren haue forsaken sopho • sworne goddes albeit bounde maryage yet fall aduoutrye haunt harlottes house desyre vnclenly lust come lyke stoned horse ezec xxii b euery man neyeth neyghboures wyfe iere ix shulde correcte sayeth lorde shulde auenged euery people lyke vnto clyme vp vpon theyr walles beate downe destroy vtterly cut theyr braunches cause lordes vnfaythfully hath house israel iuda saken sayeth lorde 2 petr 2 iere • 4 b 24 c •• xxix c haue denyed lorde sayde sopho 1 c tush shall misfortune come vpon v shall se neyther swerde hongre iere vi b xx b warnyng prophetes take wynde yea none whiche wyll tell suche thynges shall happen vnto wherfore thus sayeth lorde god hostes ye speake suche wordes beholde esaye 33 b wordes thy mouth wyl turne fyre make people wood may consume deute 28 c baruc 4 c lo wyll brynge people vpon farre house israell sayeth lorde myghtye people olde people people whose speache thou knowest nether vnderstandest say theyr arrowes sodayne deathe yea themselues grauntes people shall eate vp thy fruyte thy meate yea shall deuoure thy sōnes thy daughter thy shepe thy bullockes shall eate vp thy grape fygges thy stronge well tensed cyties wherin thou dydest trust shall destroye swerde iere xvi b neuertheles wyl haue done wt sayeth lord yf saye wherfore dothe lorde oure god thys vnto v answere deut 28 g lyke ye haue forsaken serued straūge goddes owne lande euen shal ye serue goddes also straunge lāde preache vnto house iacob crye iuda saye thus heare thou folyshe vndiscrete people esay 6 b iohan 9 b ye haue eye ye se eares haue ye ye heare feare ye sayeth lorde ye ashamed loke face iob 26 b • ▪ xxviii bynde see sande cānot passe boundes thoughe rage yet nothynge thoughe waues thereof swell yet maye go ouer people hath false obstinate herte departed gone awaye fro thynke theyr hertes let v feare lorde god geueth v raygne early late nede whiche kepeth euer styll harueste v yerely esay lix • neuertheles misdedes haue turned frome synnes haue robbed hereof amonge people founde wycked personnes preuely lay snare wayte men take destroye lyke net full byrdes theyr house ful haue gotten falshed disceate hereof commeth theyr great substaūce ryches hereof fat welthy runne away fro shameful blasphemyes esaye • minystre lawe make ende y• fatherles cause iudge poore accordyng equite iere v b • ix shuld punish thinges sayeth lorde shulde auenged suche people horrible greuous thinges done lande prophetes teache falsely prestes folowe people osee vii • rom hathe pleasure therin wyll come therof laste ¶ synnes whiche ierusalem afflyete un • •• ū cysed yeares couetousnes disceate lorde reiecteth sacryfices iewes cōmynge babylonian • prophecyed agayne ¶ capi vi come ierusalem yee stronge chyldren ben iamin blowe vp trōpettes ye 2 reg 14 • tecuytes set vp token vnto bethearam plage great misery pepeth north wyl lyken daughter sion faire tendre woman shal come shepherders theyr flockes tentes shal pitche rounde euery one shal fede yt vnder hande make batayle agaynst shall saye aryse let v go vp whyle yet daye ala day goeth awaye nyght shadowes fall downe aryse let v go vp nyght destroy strong holdes thus hath lorde hostes cōmaunded hewe downe tree set vp bulworkes agaynst ierusalem y• citie must punished al malisiousnes lyke cōdyte aboundeth water euen cytie aboundeth wyckednes robberye vnryghtuousnesse herde sorowe woundes euer syght amende ierusalē lest withdrawe herte make desolate thy lande also man dwell thus sayeth lorde hostes resydue israel shalbe gathered remnaunt grape therfore turne thyne hande agayne basket lyke y• grape gatherer vnto shall speake whome shall warne may take hede iere 4 ix eares vncircumcised may heare beholde iere v c xx b take worde lorde scorne haue lust therto therfore full thyne indignacyon lorde may suffre lōger shede vpon y• childrē wt vpon yonge men yea man must taken prysonner wyfe aged crepel house landes wyues shalbe turned vnto straungers stretche myne hāde vpon inhabitours lande sayeth lorde esay lvi c iere viii b y• least vnto hange al vpon couetousnes prophete vnto preest go aboute falsheede lye esay lvi iere viii b ezec xiii b besyde heale hurte people swete wordes sayeng peace peace whē peace al therfore must ashamed haue cōmytted abhomynacion howe shuld ashamed knowe nothing nether shame good nurtour iere x c therfore shall fall amonge slayne houre shall vyset shal brought downe sayeth lorde thus sayeth lorde go streates consydre make inquisicyon olde waye good ryght way go therin ye may fynde rest soules say wyll walke therin wyll set watchemen ouer therfore take hede vnto voice trompet saye wyll take hede heare therfore ye gentile thou congregacion shalte knowe haue deuysed heare thou earthe also beholde iere xix • wyl cause plage come vpon people euen fruyte theyre owne ymaginacyons haue bene obedient vnto wordes lawe abhorred wherfore esay b iere vii c bryng ye incense saba swete smellynge calamus •• r countrees burnt 〈…〉 please reioyce sacrifyces therfore thus sayth lorde beholde wyll make people fall shall fall amonge theym father chyldren one neyghbour shall perysshe thus sayeth lorde iere 1 c v c abar 1 c beholde shall come people northe great people shall aryse endes earth bowes dartes shal weapened rough fearce people vnmercyful people theyr voice roareth lyke see ryde vpon horse well apoynted batayle agaynste daughter sion crye haue herde armes feble henynesse sorowe come vpon v vpon woman trauaylynge chylde man go forth felde man cōmeth vpon hye strete swerde feare enemy euery syde wherfore gyrde sacke cloth thou daughter people sprynckle thyselfe asshes amoz 8 b mourne wepe bytterly vpon thy onely beloued sonne destroyer shall sodaynely fall vpon v haue set prouer harde people seke trye theyr wayes psa xiiii liii rom 3 c vnfaythful fallen awaye hange vpon fylthy lucre cleane brasse yron hurt destroye euery man bellous brente fyre leade consumed melter melteth vayne euyll taken away thē therefore call naughty syluer lorde hath cast ¶ ieremye commaunded shewe vnto people worde god▪ whiche trusteth outwarde seruyce temple euylles shall happen iewes despysynge theyr prophetes sacryfices dothe lorde thefely requyre iewes shulde obey worde capi vii wordes god spake vnto ieremy iere 17 b xxvi stande vnder gate lordes house crye wordes loude voyce saye heare worde lorde ye iuda go thys dore worshyppe lord thus sayeth y• lorde hostes y• god israel esay c iere xxvi c amēde wayes coūcels wyll let dwel place trust false lieng wordes saieng tēple lord temple lorde y• temple lorde yf ye wyll amende youre wayes councels ‡ yf ye wyl iudge ryght betwyxte man neyghbour exodi 22 • zacha 8 c leuit 29 g iob 24 ayf ye wyl oppresse straunger fatherlesse wydowe yf ye wyl shede innocent bloud place yf ye wyll cleue straunge goddes owne destruccyon wyl let dwel place yea lāde y• gaue afore tyme vnto youre father foreuer take hede ye truste councels y• begyle good ye haue stollen murthered cōmitted aduoutry periury ye haue offred vnto baal folowynge straunge vnknowne goddes come ye stande house 3 reg 8 6 hath name geuē vnto saye tushe absolued quyt thoughe haue done abhominacyons esay 59 • iob • b thynke house yt beareth name denne theues math 〈◊〉 b • r • 〈◊〉 • thynges done priuely myne eye sayeth lorde go place siloh io xviii wherūto gaue name afore tyme loke well ier xxvi 〈…〉 dyd place wickednes people israel nowe thoughe ye haue done dedes sayeth lorde myselfe rose vp euer tymes warne commen yet wolde ye heare prou c called ye wolde answere therfore esay lxv b luke xxi euē haue done vnto siloh wyl house y• name geuen vnto ye put truste ye vnto place haue geuen father shal thrust syght 1 〈…〉 haue caste youre brother whole sede ephraim ier 14 b 〈…〉 c 3 iona v c therfore thou shalte praye people thou shalte neyther geue thankes byd prayer thou shalte make intercession wise wyll heare seyst thou y• cyties iuda stretes ierusalem iere 44 e chyldren gather styckes father kyndle • yre woman kneade doughe bake cake quene heauen poure drynke offrynges vnto straūge goddes prouoke vnto wrath howbeit hurt sayeth lord rather confoūde shame thēselues therefore thus sayeth lorde god beholde wrathe indignacyon shalbe poured vpon place vpon men catell vpon tree felde frute lande shal burne man may quenche thus sayeth lorde hoostes god israel ☞ heape vp esay • • burnteoffrynges sacryfyces eate flesshe deute x • esay 4 • • brought father egypte spake worde vnto burntoffrynges sacryfyces commaunded sayenge exod xix • herken obeye voyce shalbe god ye shall people ye walcke wayes whiche haue commaunded ye maye prospere zacha vii • obedyent inclyned theyr eares vnto went theyr owne ymaginacions mocyons theyr owne wycked herte turned themselues away conuerted vnto haue done tyme youre father came egypte vnto daye iere 25 29 c 44 neuerthelesse sente vnto seruauntes al prophetes rose vp earely sent worde yet wolde herken offre theyr eares obstinate worse theyr father thou shalte nowe speake al wordes vnto shall heare thou shalte crye vpon shal swere therfore shalte thou saye vnto people neyther heareth voyce lorde theyr god receaueth correccyon iere v faythfulnesse trueth cleane roted mouth eze v • wherefore cut thyne hearre caste awaye take vp complaynte hye lorde hathe cast away scatred people displeased withall chyldren iuda haue done euyll syght sayeth lorde iere 32 • haue set vp theyr abhominacyōs house hath name haue defyled haue also builded aultre deute 32 c 4 reg 23 • psal cvi • iere 44 • topheth valley chyldren hēnom myght burne theyr sonnes daughter whiche neuer cōmaunded thē neither came euer thought therfore beholde dayes shal come sayth lorde shal nomore called topheth valley chyldren hē nom y• valley slaughter iere xix • topheth shalbe buryed shal el haue rowme iere 8 b • ix c yea deade bodyes people shalbe eaten vp foules ayre wylde bestes y• earth man shal fray awaye iere xvi • xxv ezec xvi • voice myrth gladnes city iuda ierusalem voyce brydegrome bryde wyll make ceasse lande shalbe desolate ¶ destruccyon iewes lorde moueth people amendement reckenynge vp theyr synnes reprehendeth lyinge doctryne prophetes prestes capi viii tyme sayeth lorde bone kynges iuda bone hys prynces bone prestes prophetes yee bone cytezins ierusalem shalbe brought theyr graues layed agaynste • u iiii • sunne moone heauenly hoost loued serued ranne sought worshypped shall nether gathered together buried shal lye vpō earthe theyr shame despysynge •• b xx ••• • remayne thys wycked generacyon shall desyre rather dye lyue whersoeuer remayne whereas scatre sayeth lorde hostes thys shalte thou saye vnto also thus sayeth lorde men fall arise vp againe turne farre awaye neuer conuerte wherfore thys people ierusalem gone farre backe turne agayne euer longer obstynate wyll nat conuerted eze xx f haue loked consydered man speaketh good worde man taketh repentaunce hys synne wyll muche saye wherfore haue done thys euery man soone turned backe runneth forthe styll lyke wylde horse battayll storke knoweth appoynted tyme turtle doue swalowe crane consydre tyme theyr trauayll esaye people wyll knowe tyme punyshment lorde dare ye saye wyse haue lawe lorde amonge v beholde dysceatfull penne scrybes setteth forth lye therfore shal wyse confounded shalbe afrayed taken lo • u iiii psal xix haue caste worde lorde wysdome amonge wherfore wyll geue theyr wyues vnto aleauntes feldes destroyer eze vi loweste vnto hyeste folowe filthy lucre prophete vnto preste deale wt lye esay lvi • iere vi b eze xiii neuerthelesse heale hurte people swete wordes sayenge▪ peace peace peace fye shame howe abhomynable thynges yet nat ashamed yee knowe shame iere vii wherfore tyme theyr vysitacyon shall fal among deed body sayeth lorde moreouer wyll gather sayeth lorde shal one grape vpon vine nether one fygge vpon fygge tre leaues shalbe plucte wyll cause departe saye prolonge tyme let v gather ourselues together go stronge cytye shall reste lorde oure god hath put v sylence geuen v water myxte gall dryncke haue synned agaynste hym iere xiiii loked peace fare better wayted tyme healthe lo nothynge trouble noyse hys horsses hearde dan whole lande afraied ueyenge hys stronge horsses come haue deuoured lande al cytyes dwell therin▪ leu • 26 moreouer wyl sende cockatrice serpentes amonge wyll charmed shal byte sayeth lorde sorowe come vpon heuynesse vexeth hert lo voyce y• cryeng people herde farre countre lorde sion king wherfore haue greued me▪ shal lorde say theyr ymages foolysh straunge fashyons haruest gone sommer hathe ende helped sore vexed hurt people heuy abashed triacle gylead physycyon heale hurte people ¶ complaynt bewaylyng prophete •• lyce people knowledge god ought onely reioyse vncyrcumcysyon herte capi ix e • xxii • wyll geue heade water ynough wel teares myne eye maye wepe nyghte daye slaughter people wolde god cotage farre folcke myght leaue people go thē aduoutrers shrynckynge sorte bende theyr tunges lyke bowes shute lye trueth maye nothynge awaye withall worlde go one wyckednes another wyl nat knowe sayeth lorde iere xii • yee one must kepe hym selfe another man may safely trust owne brother mat x c • mith 7 one brother vndermyneth another one neyghboure begyleth another yee one dissembleth another deale trueth psal 28 haue practysed theyr tunges lye taken great paine myschefe thou syttest myddes dysceatfull people whiche dissemblynge falshede wyll nat knowe sayeth lorde therfore thus sayth lorde hostes beholde wyll melte trye shulde el people prou 18 psal 28 theyr tunges lyke sharpe arowes speake disceate theyr mouth speake peacyable theyr neyghboure preuely laye wayte hym iere v b shuld nat punysh thynges sayth lorde shulde nat auenged suche people upon mountaynes wyll take vp lamytacyon sorowfull crye mournynge vpon fayre playnes wyldernesse namely howe brent vp yt man goeth yee man shall nat heare one beaste crye byrdes catel gone thence psal 79 mith iii c wyll make ierusalē also heape stone denne venymous wormes wyll make cyties iuda waste man shall dwell therin man wyse vnderstande thys hathe lorde spoken mouth maye shewe saye thou lande peryshest thou wherfore art thou brynt vp lyke wyldernes mā goeth thorowe yee lorde hym selfe tolde vnto forsoke lawe kepte nat thynge gaue commaundemente nether lyued therafter deu xxix b io xxiiii c folowed wickednes theyr owne hertes serued straunge goddes theyr father taught therfore thus sayeth lorde hostes god israel beholde ⚜ wyll fede people wormwod geue gall drynke deu xxii b ier xxiii c wyl scater thē also among heathen nether theyr father haue knowne deut xx c wyl sende swearde amonge persecute vntyll brynge thē naught moreouer thus sayeth lord hostes loke ye cal mourning wyues sende wyse wemen come shortely synge mournynge songe ye teares may fall eye eye liddes maye gusshe ont water lamentable noyse hearde sion howe sore destroyed pyteously confounded muste forsake oure owne naturall countre shut owne lodgyngges yet heare worde lorde ye wemen let youre eares regarde wordes hys mouthe ye maye lerne daughter mourne euery one maye teache neyghboresse make lamentacyon namely thus death clymynge vp oure windowes come oure house destroye chylde dore yonge man strete tell thou playnely thus sayeth lorde iere vii • viii • deed bodyes men shall lye vpon grounde donge vpon felde heye mower ther shalbe man take vp thus sayeth lorde let wyse man reioyse hys wysdome stronge man hys strength nether ryche man rychesse esaye iv • cor • ii cor xi • wyll reioyse let reioyse thys vnderstandeth knoweth lorde whiche mercy equyte ryghteousnesse vpon earthe math ix xii o • e vi b therfore haue pleasure thynges sayeth lorde beholde tyme commeth sayeth lorde wyll vyset whose foreskynne vncyrcumsysed egypciās iewes edomytes ammonytes moabytes iere xxv • iere iiii vi b shauen madyanytes dwell wyldernes rom ii c gentyles vncyrcumcysed flesshe house israel vncyrcumcysed herte ¶ constellacyone • arres nat feared weakenes idol power god euyll curate capi x heare worde lorde speaketh vnto thou house israel thus sayeth lorde esa xlvii c ye shall nat lerne maner heathen ye shall nat afrayed token heauen heathen afrayed yea customes lawes gentyles nothinge vanite esa 44 • hewe downe tree wod handes worckeman fashyon axe couer ouer golde syluer fasten nayles hāmers moue nat standeth stiffe palme tree nether speake go must borne baruc vi c 4 17 g ye afrayed suche nether good euell none lyke vnto lorde apoc xv thou arte great great name thy power wolde feare kynge gentyles wolde obey amonge wyse men gentyles theyr kyngdomes none maye lyckened vnto together vnlearned vnwyse al theyr connnyng vanyte namely wod syluer whiche brought tharsis beaten plate golde • reg ix c ophir worke made hande craftesman caster clothed yelowe sylke scarlet euen worke theyr wyse men al together lord true god lyuynge god euerlastynge kynge naum wroth earthe shaketh al gentyles may abyde indignacyon theyr goddes may wel sayde goddes made neither heauen earth therfore shal peryshe earth thynges vnder heauen god gene • made earth power wysdome doth ordre whole compasse world discrecion hath spred heuens voyce water gather together ayre psa 144 draweth vp cloudes vttermoste partes earthe turned lyghtnynge rayne bryngeth forth wyndes theyr treasure wysdome maketh al men fooles confounded caster ymages cast vayne thyng hath lyfe esay 44 b iere vi c vayne craftesmen theyr workes theyr vanite haue made shall peryshe one another tyme visitacyon neuerthelesse iacobs porcyon suche hathe made thynges israel rod inherytaunce lorde hoostes hys name gather vp thy ware lande thou arte stronge place thus sayeth lord beholde wyl thrust inhabytours lande greate waye trouble suche fashyon shall founde ala howe hurt ala paynful scourge vnto cōsidre sorowe selfe muste suffre carbernacle destroyed coardes broken chyldren gone fro founde nowe haue none sprede tente set vp hangynges ☞ herd men haue done foolyshly haue sought lorde therfore haue delte vnwysely theyr catell scatred abrode beholde noyse harde hande great sedicion north make cyties iuda wyldernesse dwellyng place dragon prou xx knowe lorde mannes power ordre owne wayes rule owne steppe goynges therfore chasten thou v lorde fauour psal vi 38 esay 64 b thy wrath bryng v vtterly naught psal 79 eccle 36 poure thyne indignacion rather vppon gentyles knowe vpon people cal thy name iere xxx c • haue consumed deuoured destroyed iacob haue made habitacion waste ¶ cursse obey worde goddes promesse people iuda folowynge steppe theyr father worshyppeth straunge goddes lorde sayeth wyll heare iewes forbyddeth also ieremye praye ¶ capi xi another sermon lorde commaunded ieremye preache sayeng heare wordes ☞ couenaunt speake vnto men iuda dwell ierusalem say thou vnto thus sayeth lord god israel deut 27 c 28 b gala 3 b cursed euery one nat obediente vnto wordes couenaunt whiche commaunded vnto father tyme broughte lande egypte frome yron fornace sayenge exod xix obedyent vnto voyce accordynge commaunde shall ye people wyll god wyll kepe promyse gene xv c xxvi xxviii c haue sworne vnto youre father namely wolde geue lande whiche floweth mylke hony ye se come passe vnto day answered sayde amen ☞ let euen lorde thou sayest lorde sayde vnto agayne preache cyties iuda rounde aboute ierusalē say wordes couenaunt ye may kepe haue diligētly exhorted father euer sence time brought land egypt vnto day gaue warnyng tymes saying herkē vnto voyce iere xiii b neuerthelesse wold nat obeye enclyne theyr eares vnto folowed wycked ymaginacyons theyr owne hertes therfore haue accused transgressours wordes couenaunt gaue kepe whiche notwithstandynge haue kepte lorde sayde vnto foūde whole iuda cytezyns ierusalem gone backe haue tourned selues blasphemyes theyr forefather whiche lust wordes euen lyke wyse haue also folowed straunge goddēs worshypped house israel iuda haue broken couenaunt whiche made theyr father therfore thus sayeth lord beholde wyl sende plage vpon shall able escape though crye vnto wyl • acha vii b shal townes iuda citezins ierusalem go cal vpon deute • 5 c theyr goddes vnto made theyr oblacions shall able helpe tyme theyr trouble iere ii many cytyes thou hast iuda many goddes haste yu also loke howe many stretes ierusalem many shamefull aulters haue ye set vp offre vpon vnto baall iere vii xv • therfore praye thou people byd neyther prayse prayer thoughe crye vnto theyr trouble yet wyll heare thou beloued doest thou shamefull greate blaphemyes house euē though agge ii b holy flessh myght absolue specially thou hast made thy boste thy wyckednes iere xvii b mat vii b rom xi c lorde called grene olyue tre fayre one frutefull one goodly one nowe cōtrary report abrode wyl burne vp destroye thy braunches lorde hoostes planted hath deuysed plage thou house israell iuda euyl ye haue done prouoke hym wrathe ye dyd seruyce vnto baal lorde haue lerned vnderstand thou hast shewed ymaginaciōs esaye lii b mekelābe caryed away slayne knowynge deuysed suche councel agaynst sayeng iere 18 b wyll destroye meate wood dryue hym lande liuing name shal neuer thought vpon therfore iere xx xvii • wyl besech nowe lorde hostes thou rightuꝰ iudgeꝰ thou triest raines te let se auenged vnto haue cōmytted cause lorde therfore spake thus cytezins anathoth sought sley sayeng esaye 30 • amos 7 • preache vnto v name lorde el thou shalt dye handes thus say spake lorde hostes beholde wyll vyset yong men shall perish swerde sonnes daughter shall vtterly dye hongre none shall remayne vpon cytezins anathoth wyll brynge plage euen yere theyr visitacion ¶ prophete maruayleth greately prosperite wycked thoughe confesse god ryghtuous iewes forsaken lorde speaketh agaynst curate preacher seduce people lorde threateneth destruccyon vnto nacyons bordered vpon iewry • whiche troubled vexed capi xii lorde thou art ryghtuous shulde dispute neuerthelesse let talke thinges reasonable iob xxi • aba • u • b psal 73 • howe happeneth waye vngodly prosperous goeth well whiche without shame offende lyue wickednes thou plantest take rote growe brynge forth fruyte boste much yet doest thou punysh thou lorde well knowen thou hast sene proued herte • p • • •• take awaye lyke flocke caryed slaughter house apoynte daye slaughter howe long shal lande mourne iere 14 • herbes felde perish wyckednes dwell therin catell byrdes gone yet saye tushe deut xix • iere v • xxiii • soph • god wyll destroye v vtterly seynge thou arte wery running foote men howe wylte thou runne horse peaceable sure lande thou mayest safe howe wylte thou furyous pryde iordane thy brother thy kynred haue together despised cryed vpon thyne absence iere ix • beleue thoughe speake fayre wordes saye haue forsaken myne owne dwellyng place lefte myne heritage lyfe also loue well haue geuen handes myne enemyes esaye • ix • myne herytage become vnto lyon wod cryed vpon therfore haue forsaken myne herytage vnto speckled byrde byrde dyuerse coloures vpon go hence gather beastes felde together maye eate vp esa • vi c esay v dyuerse herdmen haue broken downe vineyarde troden vpō porcion pleasaunt porcyon haue made wyldernes deserte haue layed waste wast sigheth vnto yee whole lande lyeth waste man regardethe destroyer come ouer heeth euery waye swearde lorde dothe consume one ende lande flesh hathe rest haue sowen wheat reaped thornes haue taken heritage possession doth thē good ye shall confounded youre owne wynnynges great wrathe lorde thus sayeth lorde vpon myne euyl neyghbours laye hande myne herytage whiche haue geuen people israel beholde wyll plucke namely israel theyr lande put house iuda amonge deut iiii • xxx • esa • iii b haue roted wyll one thē agayne wyll haue mercy vpon esdr • bryng agayne euery man owne heritage lande namely trouble people wyl lerne way sweare name lorde lyueth lyke learned people sweare baal shall rekened among people mat xxii b yf wyl nat obey wyll rote folke destroye sayeth lorde ¶ destruccyon iewes prefygured theyr sparsinge abrode israel receaued people god forsaken capi xiii thus sayeth lorde vnto go thy waye get lynen breche gyrde aboute thy loynes let • nat wet got breche accordyng commaundement lorde put aboute loynes thys lorde spake vnto againe take breche thou hast prepared put aboute get vp go vnto euphrates hyde hole rocke went hyd euphrates lorde cōmaunded happened longe y• lorde spake vnto get euphrates fet breche thence cōmaunded hyde thee went euphrates dygged vp toke breche place hyd beholde breche corrupt profytable nothynge sayde lorde vnto thus sayeth lorde euen wyll corrupte pryde iuda hye mynde ierusalem thys people wycked people iere vii • ▪ xi • xviii xix c wyll heare worde folowe wicked ymaginacyons owne herte hang vpon straunge goddes serue worshyppe therfore shalbe breche serueth nothynge straytely breche lyeth vpon man loynes straytely dyd bynde whole house israel whole house iuda vnto sayeth lorde deut iiii • xxvi iere xxx myght people myght haue gloryous name myghte honour wolde obeye therfore laye thys rydle say thus sayeth lorde god israel euery pot shalbe fylled wyne shall saye thynkeste thou knowe euery pot shalbe filled wine shalte thou saye vnto thus sayeth lorde beholde shall fyll inhabytours thys lande dronekennes kynges syt vpon dauyds stole prestes prophetes dwell ierusalem wyll shute one agaynst another yee father agaynst sonnes sayeth lorde wyll pardon wyll spare haue pytye vpon destroye obedyent geue eare take nat dysdayne lord hi selfe speaketh honoure lord god take hys lyghte euer youre fete stomble darckenesse hyll leste ye loke lyght turne shadowe darkenesse death yf ye heare geue secret warnynge mourne frō whole hert stubburnes iere xxx • ▪ • threno • pyteously wyll wepe teares shall gusshe myne eye y• lordes flocke shall caryed awaye captiue tell kyng quene humble youre selues set downe lowe crowne glory shal fall head cytyes towarde southe shalbe shut vp man shall open iuda shall caryed awaye captyue none shall remayne▪ lyft vp eye beholde come north lyke fat flocke shal fal vpō wylt yu make thy mone come vpon ▪ thou haste taughte thy selfe made master ouer shall nat sorowe come vpon woman trauayllynge chylde yf thou woldest say thyne herte wherfore come thinges vpon iere xxi • ▪ esay xiii • euen multytude thy blasphemyes shall thy hynder partes thy fete dyscouered lyke man inde maye chaunge hysskynne cat mountayne sportes may ye exercysed euyl good therfore wyll scatre lyke stoble ye taken away y• south wynde thys shall youre porcion poreyon youre measure wherwith ye shalbe rewarded sayeth lorde ye haue forgotten put youre truste dysceatfull thynges iere xv b therforeos •• ii shall turne thy clothes ouer thy heade dyscouer thy thyghes thy preuytyes maye sene thy aduoutry thy deedly malyce thy beastlynesse thy shamefull whordome vpon feldes hylles haue sene thy abhomynacyons wo vnto ierusalem wylte thou euer clensed ¶ dea • shulde come iewry prayer people askynge mercy lorde vnfaythfull people hearde praier • astynge false prophetes seduce people capi xiiii worde lorde shewed vnto ieremy concernyng derthe frutes iuda hathe mourned gate desolate brought heuinesse euen vnto grounde crye ierusalem goeth vp lordes sente theyr seruauntes fetche water came welles dyd fynde water caryed theyr vessel home emptye ashamed confounded couer theyr heades iere xxiii b grounde dryed vp commeth rayne vpon plowman also ashamed couer theyr heades hynde also forsoke yonge fawne broughte forthe felde grasse wylde ass dyd stande hye place drewe theyr wynde lyke dragon theyr eye dyd fayle wante grasse doutles oure owne wyckednesse dothe rewarde v lorde thou accordynge thy name though oure transgressyons synnes many esay 49 • iere xvi • and▪ xvii • ▪ thou art cō forte helpe israel tyme trouble wylt thou straunger lande one goeth ouer felde cōmeth remayne nyght wylt thou make thy selfe cowarde gyaunt yet maye nat helpe thou lorde art myddes v thy name called vpon v forsake v nat thus hathe lorde sayde vnto people ☞ seyng haue suche lust wander abrode haue nat refrayned theyr fete therfore displeased lorde wyll nowe brynge agayne remembraūce theyr mysdedes punysh theyr synnes yee euen thus sayde lorde vnto iere vii • esay • • thou shalt nat praye people good though fast wyll nat heare theyr prayer though offre burnt offrynges sacryfyces yet wyl nat accepte wyll destroye swerde honger pestilence answered lorde god iere v • soph • prophetes saye vnto thē tush ye shall • iere xi • • xxiii • nede feare swearde honger shall come vpon lorde shall geue cōtynuall rest place lorde sayde vnto prophetes preache lye name haue iere xx ••• • sent nether gaue charge nether dyd speake vnto thē yet preach vnto false visiōs charmynge vanyte disceatfulnes theyr owne hert therfore thus saieth lorde prophetes preache name neuerthelesse haue nat sente saye tush shall swearde hōger lande ••• ha • 3 • swearde honger shal prophetes perysh people preache shalbe caste ierusalem dye honger slayne swearde iere xv • • shalbe man burye bothe theyr wyues theyr sonnes theyr daughter thus wyll poure theyr wyckednesse vpon thē thys shalte y• say also vnto treno • ii • mine eye shal wepe without ceassynge daye nyght people shal destroyed great harme shall peryshe great plage go felde lo lyeth al ful slayne men come cyty lo famyshed honger yee theyr prophetes also prestes shall led vnknowen lande haste thou vtterly forsaken iuda plaged v healed nomore iere viii • loked peace commeth good tyme health lo nothynge trouble knowledge lorde mysdedes synnes father haue offēded displeased lord thy name sake 〈…〉 xlix • forget thy louynge kyndnesse remembre trone thyne honoure breke couenaunt y• thou hast made v iere v amonge goddes gentile sende rayne geue shower heauen dost thou lorde god trust yee lorde thou doste thynges ¶ lorde wyll heare moses aaron yf pray people wyll wrape many myseryes •• use suche great myseryes capi xv spake lorde vnto iere 7 b 11 1 14 b ezec xi • ii • thoughe moses samuel stode yet haue herte people dryue awaye maye go syght yf say vnto ther shall go tell lorde gyueth aunswere ezech v • vnto deathe swearde honger captyuite wyl bryng foure plage vpon sayeth lorde swearde shall strāgle dogges shal deuoure iere xvi foules ayre beastes earthe shall eate vp destroye wyll scatre aboute also kyngdomes landes plaged 4 21 manasseh sōne hezekia kynge iuda thynges dyd ierusalem shall haue pyte vpon ierusalem shall sorye shal make intercessiō optayne peace seynge thou goest fro turnest backewarde sayeth lord therfore dyd stretche myne hande agaynst destroye wyll intreated haue scatred abrode fanne euery syde lande iere vii • haue wasted people destroyed yet haue lust turne owne wayes haue made theyr wydowes mo nombre sādes see upon mother theyr chyldren dyd brynge destroyer none day 1 te 5 sodēly vnawares dyd sende feare vpon theyr cyties hath borne seuen chyldren hathe none herte full sorowe 〈…〉 b sonne doth fayle clere daye confounded faynte heuynes cemayne wyll delyuer vnto swerde theyre enemyes sayeth lord iere xx mother ala euer thou didest beare enemye hated whole lande thoughe neuer lent receyued vpon vsurye yet men speake euyl vpon lorde answered lede y• vnto good come thou arte trouble helpe thyne enemy oppresseth doth one yron hurte another one metell commeth north another iere xvii • xx • thy rychesse treasure wyl geue pray money al thy synnes thou hast done al thy costes deute 32 • wyl bryng thyne enemyes lande thou know est fyre kyndled indignacion shall hurne vp lorde thou knowest therfore remembre vyset delyuer fro persecuters receyue cause thy longe wrathe yet thou knowest thy sake suffre rebuke psal • ix • ezec iii founde thy wordes dyd eate vp gredely haue made herte ioyful glad call vpon thy name lorde god hostes dwell amonge scorner neither delyte therein dwell onely feare thy hande thou haste fylled bytternes shall heuynesse endure euer plage great may neuer healed • wylt thou water falleth nat continue upon wordes thus sayde lorde vnto thou wylte turne agayne shall set seruyce yf thou wylte take thynges precious vyle thou shalte euen myue owne mouthe iere xxi shall conuerte vnto turne thou vnto shall make stronge brasen wall thꝭ people iere▪ • • shal fyght shall preuayle selfe wyll helpe delyuer sayeth lorde wyl ryd handes wycked delyuer hande tiraun • e ¶ prophecyeth mysery iewes sheweth worshyppynge idoles contempte god lawe cause myserye prophecyeth captyuite babylon theyr delyu • raunce frome thence agayne callynge gentyles capi xvi thvs sayde lord vnto me▪ thou shalte take wyfe norbeget chyldren place chyldren borne place theyre mother haue borne theyr father haue begotten lande thus sayeth lorde ⚜ shal dye horrible death leuit r iere xiiii c man shall mourne burye shall lye donge vpon earth shall perishe thorowe swearde honger psal • 9 iere xv theyr body shalbe meate foules ayre beastes earth thus sayth ye lord go thou vnto thē come mourn wepe thē haue taken peace people sayeth lorde yee fauoure mercy lande shal dye olde yonge shal buried man shal wepe man shal clyppe shaue selfe shal one viset another mourne deade comforte one shall offre another cuppe consolacyon forget theyr heuynesse father mother 1 cor xv b thou shalt go feaste house sytte downe eate dryncke thus sayeth ye lorde hostes god israell iere vii xv b beholde shal take awaye place voyce myrth gladnesse voyce brydegrome bryde yee dayes ye may se nowe thou shewest people al wordes saye vnto iere v wherfore hath lorde deuysed thys greate plage v offence synne haue done agaynste lord god make thou answere deut iiii • ire vii father haue forsaken sayeth lorde haue walked straunge goddes whome haue honoured worshypped haue forsaken haue kepte lawe iere vii ye youre shamefull blasphemyes haue exceaded wyckednesse youre father euery one hath folowed frowarde euyll ymagynacyon owne herte obedyent vnto deut 28 • therfore wyll caste lande lande ye father knowe shal ye serue straunge goddes day nyght wyll shewe fauoure iere xxiii b beholde therfore sayeth lorde dayes come shall sayde lorde lyueth whiche brought child israel ye land egypte shall sayde lorde lyueth brought chyldren israell north landes scatred wyl bringe agayne lande gaue vnto theyr father beholde sayeth lorde math 4 c wyl send many fysshers take wyll sende many hunter hūte mountaynes hylles caues stone myne eies beholde theyr wayes hyd fro face neyther theyr wycked dedes kepte close syght fyrste wyll sufficiently rewarde theyr shamefull blasphemyes synnes haue defyled lande namely theyr stynckynge idoles abhominacyons wherwith haue fylled myne herytage iere xiiii xvii lorde strength power refuge tyme trouble gentyles shall come vnto frome endes worlde saye uerely father haue cleued vnto lye theyr idol vaine vnprofitable howe mā make hꝭ goddes able godes therfore wyl teach sayeth lorde wyl shewe hande power maye knowe name lorde ¶ frowardenesse iewes curssed put theyr confydence man blessed truste god mannes herte wycked god searcher herte lyuynge water forsaken halowynge sabboth commaunded capi xvii yovre synne ye tribe iuda wrytten table hertes grauen vpon edge youre aulters penne yron adamant clawe chyldren also may thynke vpon aulters woddes thycke tree hye hylles mountaynes feldes iere xv • xx • wherfore wyll make al youre substaūce treasure spoyled great synne ye haue done vpon hye place thorowe al costes lande ye shal caste also herytage gaue wyl subdue vnder heuy bondage youre enemyes lande ye know ye haue ministred fire indignacion whiche shall burne euer thus sayeth lorde psal 〈◊〉 proue x • • iere • ivi • 48 a▪ eze xxix cursed man putteth truste man taketh flesshe arme whose herte departeth lorde shall lyke heath groweth wyldernesse good thynge come shall se dwell drye place wyldernes salte vnoccupyed lande psal ii b 39 • prou x ••• • blessed man putteth hys truste lorde whose hope lorde hym selfe psal prou xi shal tre planted water syde spredeth rote vnto moystnesse whō heate cā nat harme whēit cōmeth hys lefe shalbe grene though growe lytle frut drouth yet nat carefull neuer leaueth brynge forth frute amonge thynges man bathe disceatfull vnsexcheable herte shall knowe iere xi • poca ii psal vii b euen lorde searche grounde herte trye raynes rom 〈◊〉 • rewarde euery man accordynge hys wayes accordynge frute hys workes ☞ pro 〈◊〉 psal iii b luk xiii b partriche maketh nest egges bryngeth forth yonge commeth ryches nat ryghteously myddest hys lyfe muste leaue behynde hym last founde foole thou lorde whose trone glorious excellent moste antyquite dwellest place holy rest thou art comforte israel forsake shalbe confounded departe ☞ shalbe wrytten earth iere iii eze 36 iohn 〈◊〉 b haue forsakē lorde condyte water lyfe heale lorde shal hole saue thou shal saued thou art prayse beholde men saye vnto worde lorde let come nowe neuertheles ledynge flocke thy wayes haue compelled none violēce neuer desyred man • eth knowest thou wel wordes also ryght nat terryble vnto lorde iere xi • • xvi c thou art whō hope parell let persecuters confounded nat let afrayed nat thou shalte brynge vpon tyme theyr plage shalte destroye ryght sore thus hathe lorde sayde vnto iere vii xxvi go stande vnder gate thorowe people kynges iuda go yee vnder gate ierusalem saye vnto heare worde lorde ye kynges iuda thou people iuda ye cytesyns ierusalem go thorowe thys gate thus lorde commaundeth exod 23 b deut v b take hede lyues ye carie burthen vpō y• sabboth brynge thorowe gate ierusalem ye shall beare burthen also house y• sabboth ye shal labour therin ☞ halowe sabboth exod xx b commaunded youre father howe obeyed nat neyther herkened vnto obstynate stubburne neyther obeyed receaued correccyon neuertheles yf ye wyll heare sayeth lorde beare burthē cytie thorowe gate vpon sabboth ye wyl halowe sabboth ye worke therin shall go thorowe gate thys cyt • e kynges prynces shall syt vpon stoole dauid shall caried vpon charettes ryde vpon horse bothe theyr prynces yee whole iuda cytesyns ierusalem shall go thorowe thys cytie shall euer inhabited shall come men also cyties iuda ierusalem lande beniamin playne feldes mountaynes frō wyldernesse whiche shall brynge burnt offerynges sacrifice oblacions incense offre vp thankesgeuynge house lorde yf ye wyl nat obediente vnto alowe sabboth ye wyll beare youre burthen thorowe gate ierusalem vpon sabboth thē shall set fyre vpon gate ierusalem shall burne vp house ierusalem man shall able quench ¶ god sheweth example pott • r power destroye despys • r hys worde helpe thē agayne whē amēde conspira • ye iewes agaynste ieremy hys prayer agaynste hys aduersary • capi xviii thys another cōmunicaciō god ieremy sayinge aryse go downe potter house shall tel mynde nowe whē came potter house founde hym makynge hys worke vpon whele vessell potter made claye brake amonge handes beganne newe made another vessell accordynge hys mynde sayde lorde thus vnto esa xlv b iere xix • rom ix • may nat thys potter dothe ye house israel sayeth lorde holde ye house israell ye hande euen claye potter hande eze xviii • 33 • luke xv take hande rote destroye waste awaye people kyngdome iona • 3 b yf people agaynst haue thus deuysed conuerte theyr wyckednes repēte plage deuysed brynge vpon thē • reg xv f agayne take hande buylde plante people kyngdome yf people euell heare nat voyce repente good deuise speake nowe therfore vnto whole iuda thē dwell ierusalem thus sayeth lorde beholde deuysynge plage takynge thynge hande agaynste ier xxv xxxv c iona iii b therfore let euery man turne hys euell waye take vpon thynge good ryght sayde nomore ier xiii wyll folowe oure owne ymaginacions euery mā accordyng wylfulnesse owne mynde therfore thus sayeth lorde aske amonge heathen yf mā hath harde suche horryble thynges daughter syon hath done shal nat snowe melteth vpon stony rockes libanus moysten feldes maye sprynges water grauē awaye runne nomore geue moystnesse make frute full people hath forgotten haue made sacryfyce vnto vayne goddes whyle folowed theyr owne wayes come hye strete gone fote waye nat vsed betrodē thorowe haue brought theyr lande euerlastynge wyldernesse scorne iere xix b xlix c whosoeuer trauayleth therby shalbe abashed wagge theyr heades easte wynde wyll scater theyr enemye theyr destruccyon commeth wyll turne backe vpon thē nat face sayde iere xi b come let v ymagin sumthing agaynste ieremy ☞ prestes shall nat destitute lawe nether shal wyseman destitute councel prophetes destitute worde god come ☞ let v smyte hym tonge let v make wordes cō sydre lorde heare voyce myne enemyes psal cix shal recompence euell god haue dygged pyt soule iere x remembre stode speake good turne awaye thy wrath psal cix b • hren iii f therfore let theyr chyldren dye hunger let oppressed swearde let theyr wyues robbed theyr chyldren become wyddowes let theyr husbaundes slayne let theyr yonge men kylled swearde felde let noyse herde theyr house murtherer commeth sodēly vpon iere xi haue dygged pyt take layed snare fete yet lord thou knowest theyr councell haue deuised sleye forgeue nat theyr wyckednes let nat theyr synne put thy syght let iudged gyltie thys shalt thou vnto tyme thy indygnacyon ¶ prophecyeth destruccyon ierusalem cō tempt despysynge worde god capi xix thvs sayde lorde go thy waye bye erthen pytcher bryng forth senatours chefe preastes valley chyldren hennom whiche lyeth dore made brycke shewe wordes shall tell saye thus vnto heare worde lorde ye kynges iuda ye cytesyns ierusalem 3 reg 21 • ieremi 6 c thus sayeth lorde hostes god israel deut xii 28 b psal • vi • eze xvi c xx beholde wyll brynge suche plage vpon place eares heare shall glowe haue forsaken vnhalowed place haue offred vnto straunge goddes neyther theyr father kynges iuda haue knowen haue fylled thys place also bloude innocētes iere vii haue sett vp aulter vnto baal burne theyr chyldren burnt offerynge vnto baal whiche neyther commaunded charged neyther thought vpon beholde therfore 3 reg 9 b ier xviii b xxix c • b tyme commeth sayeth lorde place shal nomore called topheth valley chyldren hennō valley slaughter place wyll sleye senatours iuda ierusalem kyll downe swearde syght theyr enmyes seke theyr lyues theyr deed carcase wyll geue meate foules ayre beestes felde wyl make thys cytie desolate despysed goeth shall abashed • east vpon plage thre iiii b wyll fede also fleshe theyr sonnes theyr daughter deut 28 c 4 reg vi • yee euery one shall eate vp another besegynge straytnesse wherwith theyr enemyes seke theyr lyues shall kepe y• pitcher shalt thou breake syght mē shalbe saye vnto thus sayeth lorde hostes ••• xviii • euen wyll destroye people cytie man breaketh earthen vessell cannat made whole agayne iere vii topheth shall buryed shal haue none place thus wyll vnto thys place also sayeth lorde dwel therin yee wyll cytie vnto topheth house ireusalem house kynges iuda shalbe defyled lyke topheth al house whose parlers dyd sacryfyce vnto hooste heauen powred drynke offerynges vnto straunge goddes ieremy ca • topheth lorde sente hym prophecie stode courte house lorde spake people thus sayeth lorde hostes god israel beholde wyll brynge vpon cytie vpon euery towne aboute al plage haue deuised agayne iere vii c xiii b haue bene obstynate wolde nat obeye warnynges ¶ ieremy smytten east preson preachyng worde god prophecyeth captyuyi • e babylon complayneth mockynge stoche worde god compelled sprete preache worde capi xx phashur preste sonne emer chefe house lorde harde ieremy preache sted fastly iob xv • ii c 〈◊〉 xxiii smote ieremy put hym stockes hye gate ben iamin house lorde nexte daye folowynge phashur brought ieremy stockes agayne sayde ieremye vnto hym lorde shall call nomore phashur excellente increasynge magor fearfull afrayed euery thus sayeth lorde beholde wyll make afrayed euen thy selfe fauoure whiche shall perysh swearde theyr enemyes euen thy face wyll geue whole iuda vnder power kynge babylon shal carye vnto babylon presoners sleye swearde 4 reg ix c iere xv c xvii moreouer substaunce thys lande theyr precyous gorgeous workes costlynesse tresure kynges iuda wyll geue handes theyr enemyes whiche shall spoyle carie vnto babylon phashur thou shalt caryed vnto babylon thyne housholde babylon shalt thou come thou shalt dye buryed thou thy fauourers thou hast preached lye lorde disceaued thē hast thou disceaued thou haste dealte strongly hast preuayled makest strong agayn thre • b daye longe despysed laughen scorne euery man haue preached longe agaynst malycious tyranny shewed thē destruccyon iere vi b cause cast worde lord teeth take euer worst wherfore thought hence forth nat speake preach name worde lorde burnynge fyre herte bone whiche wolde haue stopped myght nat psa • xxi b harde many derision blasphemy yee euen myne owne companion suche conuersaunte whiche wente aboute make afrayed sayinge vpon hym let v go vpon hym feare hym make hym holde tonge maye ouercome auenged hym lorde stode lyke myghtye gyaunte therfore persecutours fell coulde thynge shall sore confounded haue done vnwysely shall haue euerlastynge shame iere xi nowe lord hostes thou righteous sercher whiche knowest reynes hertes let se thē punished vnto commytte cause synge vnto lorde prayse hathe delyuered soule oppressed frō hande vyolent iob iii iere xv b cursed day wherin borne vnhappye daye wherin mother brought forth cursed man brought father tydinges make glad saying thou haste gotton sonne lette happen vnto man cyties gene xix c whiche lorde turned vp syde downe hearde longe wycked rumoure slewe nat sone cam mother wombe mother nat graue self byrth myght nat haue come remayned styll iob x c wherfore cam forth mother wombe haue experience laboure sorowe leade lyfe shame capi xxi ꝓphecieth zadekiah shall takē • cytie burned wordes y• lorde spake vnto ieremy iere 37 tyme kyng zedekiah sent vnto phashur sonne melchias sophonias sonne maasias preste sayinge 4 • 2 b 2 par 1 • ier xlii aske councell lorde praye oure behalfe nabuchodonosor kynge babylon besegeth v yf lorde peraduenture wyll deale v accordynge meruelous power take hym v spake ieremy geue zedekias answere thus sayeth lorde god israel beholde wyll turne backe weapens ye haue youre handes wherwith ye fyght agaynste kynge babylon caldees besege roūde aboute walles wyll brynge together myddest cyrie myselfe wyll fyght agaynst outstretched hande myghtie arme greate displeasure terrible wrath wyll smyte dwel cytie ye bothe men catell shall dye greate pestilence iere 39 thys sayeth lorde shall delyuer zedekias kyng iuda seruantes people suche escaped cytie pestilence swearde honger power nabuchodonosor kynge babylon yee handes theyr enemyes y• handes folowe vpō theyr lyues shal smyte thē wt swearde shal nat pytie shal nat spare shall haue mercy vpon vnto people yu shalt saye thus sayeth lorde deu xxx • beholde laye waye lyfe deathe iere 27 38 abydeth thys cytie shal perish ether swearde honger pestilēce goeth holde chaldee parte besege shall saue hys lyfe shall wynne soule praye ie • xxxii haue set face agaynste cytie sayeth lorde plage good must geuen hande kynge babylon brent fyre vnto house kynge iuda saye thus heare worde y• lorde thou house dauid thus saieth lorde esaye • ier xxii zacha vii b ministre ryghteousnes soone delyuer oppressed violente power iere iiii euer terryble wrath breake lyke fyre burne man maye quench wyckednes ymaginacyons iere 48 beholde sayeth lorde wyll come vpō dwell valley rockes feldes saye deu xx • x • iere v b 12 14 b 23 c sophi • ▪ c tush wyl make v afrayed wyll come oure house wyll vyset sayeth lorde wyckednes inuencyons wyll kyndle suche fyre youre wod shall consume aboute ¶ exorteth kynge iuda iudgemēt ryghteousnes ierusalem brought captyuyte death selum sonne iosua prophecyed capi xxii thus sayde lorde goo downe house kynge iuda speake wordes saye heare worde lorde thou kynge iuda syttest kyngly seate dauid thou thy seruaūtes thy people go thys gate thus lorde commaundeth esaye • iere xxi • zacha vii kepe equyte ryghteousnesse delyuer oppressed power vyolent nat greue oppresse straunger fatherlesse wyddowe shedde innocent bloude thys place yf ye kepe thynges faythfully shall come dore thys house kynges syt vpon dauids seate shal caryed charettes ryde vpon horse bothe theyr seruauntes theyr people yf ye wyll nat obedient vnto commaundementes esaye • iere 51 • hebr vi b sweare myne owne selfe sayeth lorde thys house shall waste thus hathe lorde spoken vpon kynges house iuda thou gilead art vnto heade libanus shall nat make waste thy cyties also man shall dwell therin wyll prepare destroyer weapens hewe downe thy speciall cedre tree cast fyre people go thys cytye shall speake one another deu • 9 • 3 reg ix b wherfore hath lorde done thus vnto noble cyty shall answered deut 29 • 3 reg 9 b 4 • 3 b 2 pat 7 haue broken couenaūt lord theyr god haue worshyped serued straunge goddes 4 reg 23 • mourne ouer deed wo sory departeth awaye commeth agayne seeth natiue countre thus sayeth lorde touchynge ii pa iii • selum sonne iosias king iuda whiche raygned father caried place shal neuer come hyther againe shal dye y• place whervnto led captiue shal se lande nomore esay • v c agge wo worth buildeth house vnryghtuousnes parlers good hath gotten vyolē ce neuer recōpenseth neighbour laboure payeth hyre thynketh himselfe wyll buylde wyde house gorgeous parlers causeth windowes hewen therin sylynges ioystes maketh cedre paynteth thē wt smaper thynkest thou raygne nowe thou prouokest wrathe cedre tree thy father eate drincke prospere well longe dealte equite ryghtuousnesse yee helped oppressed poore theyr ryght prospered well whence came onely eye sayeth lorde neuerthelesse thyne eye thyne herte loke vpon couetousnes shed innocent bloude wronge vyolence 4 reg 23 c 24 iere 36 therfore thus sayeth lorde agaynst iehoakim y• sonne iosias kyng iuda shal mourne vse ala brother ala syster nether shall say vnto hym ala syr ala noble prynce asse shal buryed corrupte cast without gate ierusalem clyme vp hyll libanus thou daugter syon lyft vp thy voyce vpō basan crye frome partes thy louers destroyed gaue warnynge whyle thou waste yet prosperite thou saydest wyll maner hast thou vsed frō thy youthe thou woldest neuer heare voyce thy herdmen shal driuē wynde thy derlynges shalbe caried awaye captiuite shalt thou brought shame confusion al thy wickednes thou y• dwellest vpon libanus makest thy neste cedre tree esaye 13 • x •• iere xii b xxx howe great shall thy mournynge thy sorowes come vpon woman trauaylynge chylde 4 24 b truely lyue sayeth lorde though conanias sonne iehoakim kynge iuda sygnet ryght hande yet wyll plucke wyl geue power seke sleye power thou fearest power nabuchodonosor kynge babylon power caldees moreouer wyll sende thy mother bare straunge lande ye borne shall ye dye lande ye wyll desyre returne vnto ye shall neuer come agayne man conanias shall lyke ymage robbed torne peces whiche pleaseth man appparell wherfore bothe sede shalbe sent awaye cast lande knowe thou earth earth earth heare y• worde lorde thus sayeth lorde wryte man amonge outlawes prosperite shal man haue al lyfe long neyther shall sede happye syt vpon seate dauyd beare rule iuda ¶ speaketh agaynst euyll curate make hauocke flocke lorde co • u • rsyon remenaunt iewes fayth commyng true shepherde chryste prophecyed agaynste false prophetes prophete preacheth worde god god cōuerteth hertes hearer agaynst prophetes preache lye vnder name god myracles false prophetes capi xxiii wo ezec 34 vnto shepherdes destroy scatre flocke sayeth lorde wherfore cōmaundemente lorde god israell vnto shepherdes fede people ye scatre thrust flocke loke vpon thē therfore wyl byset wyckednesse ymaginacions sayeth lorde wyll gather together remnaunt flocke landes driuen vnto wil bring agayne theyr pasture yt maye growe increase wyll set shepherdes also ouer shal fede shall feare drede shall none lost sayth y• lorde iere 33 c beholde tyme commeth sayth lorde wyll rayse vp ⚜ ryghtuous braunche dauyd esay xi • whiche shall beare rule discusse matter wysdome shall sette vp equite rightuousnes agayne y• earth tyme shall iuda saued israell shall dwell without feare name shal call hym deut 33 c euen lorde oure ryghtuousnesse 1 corin therforeiere xvi c beholde tyme cōmeth sayeth lorde shall sayde lorde lyueth brought chyldren israel lande egypte lorde lyueth whiche brought forth led sede house israel north land al countrees scatred shal dwel theyr owne land agayne herte breaketh body false prophetes al bone shake become lyke dronken man reason wine cā take rest feare lorde holy wordes laude full aduoulterers thorowe swearyng mourneth iere xiiii pleasaūt pasture deserte dried vp yee y• way mē take wycked theyr gouernaūce nothyng lyke holy worde lorde prophetes prestes selues poluted ypocrytes theyr wyckednes haue foūde house sayeth lorde wherfore theyr way shalbe slyppery darckenesse wherin may stacker fall wyl bryng plage vpon euen yere theyr visitacion sayeth lorde haue seue foly amonge prophetes samaria preached baal disceaued people israel haue sene also amonge prophetes ierusalem foule aduoutry presumptuous lye take shameful men hande flatterynge returne theyr wyekednes wt citesyns vnto sodome inhabytours gomorre therfore thus sayeth lord hostes concernynge prophetes iere ix b beholde wyll fede wormewod make drynke water gall frome prophetes ierusalem ypocrysye come lande therfore lorde hostes geueth warnyng iere 27 b xxix b heare wordes prophetes preache vnto disceaue speake meanynge theyr owne herte mouth lorde iere xii xiiii b sopho c saye vnto despyse lord hath spoken tush ye shall prospere ryght well vnto walke lust owne herte say tush shall mysfortune happen hath sitten councel lorde hath herde vnderstande aboute hath marked deuyse herde iere xxx beholde stormye wether lorde indignacion shall go forth shall fall downe vpon heade vngodly wrath lorde shall turne agayne vntyll perfourme fulfyll thought hert iere xxx latter dayes ye shall knowe meanynge haue sent prophetes sayeth lorde yet ranne iere xiiii b haue spoken yet preached yf contynued counsell herde wordes turned people theyr euyll wayes wycked ymagynacions psal 139 ezech 8 b god seyth thynge whiche nye hande farre sayeth lorde psal 139 amos ix maye man hyde hym selfe shall se hym sayeth lorde esay 66 actes vii • xvii fulfyll heauen earthe sayeth lorde haue herde well ynoughe prophetes saye preache lye name sayenge haue dreamed haue dreamed howe longe wyll contynue prophetes herte tell lye preache craftye sotyltye theyre owne herte whose purpose dreames euery one tell make people forget name theyr forefather dyd baal came vp prophete hath dreame let hym tell 2 lori 4 1 petr 4 • vnderstandeth worde let hym shewe faythfully hathe chaffe wheate together sayeth lord worde lyke fyre sayeth lorde lyke hammer breaketh harde stone therfore thus sayeth lorde beholde wyll vpon prophetes steale worde priuely euery mā beholde sayeth lord agaynst prophetes take vpon theyr tonges speake lorde hath sayde beholde sayeth lorde agaynst prophetes dare prophecye lye dysceaue people theyr vanyties myracles neuer sent commaunded shal people great harme sayeth lorde people prophet prest aske saye ☞ burthen lord thou shalt say vnto thē burthen therfore wyll caste fro sayeth lord ye selues burthen prophet prest people vseth thys terme burthen lorde wyll vyset house also thus shall ye saye euery one another ☞ answere hath lorde geuē lordes commaundemēt burthen lord ye shall speake nomore euerye man owne worde burthen ye haue altered wordes lyuyng god lorde hostes god thus shall euery man saye prophetes answere hath lorde geuen sayeth lorde name burthen lord therfore thus sayeth lorde muche ye haue vsed terme burthen lorde withstandynge sente vnto forbadde speake lordes burthen beholde therfore wyll repute burthen wyll cast presence yee citie also gaue father wyl brynge euerlastyng confusion shame shall neuer forgotten ¶ vysyon two pannyers fygges fyrste vysion sygnifieth parte people shulde brought agayne captiuyte seconde zedekyas rest people shulde destroyed capi xxiiii lorde shewed vysion beholde stode two maundes fygges temple lorde afterthat 4 24 nabuchodonosor kyng babylon led away captyue iechonias sonne iehoakim kynge iuda myghtye men also iuda worke maisters connynge men ierusalem vnto babylon one maunde good fygges euen lyke fyrst rype maunde naughtye figges might eaten euyl sayde lord vnto seyst thou ieremy sayde osee ix b fygges wherof good euyl man may eate came worde lorde vnto maner thus sayeth lord god israel lyke thou knowest good fygges shall knowe mēled way haue sent place lande caldees theyr profit wyl set myne eye vpon best wyl bryng agayne lande wyl buylde vp breke downe wyll plante rote deut 29 〈◊〉 iure xxx 31 f 1 32 e wyll geue herte knowe howe lorde shalbe people wyll god shall retourne vnto theyr whole herte 〈◊〉 xxix c lyke thou knoweste naughtie fygges may eaten euyll euen wyll sayeth lorde let zebekias kynge iuda ye al prince residue ierusalē remayne ouer lande also dwelle egypte vexed plaged kyngdomes landes wyl make thē psal 79 • • atuc 3 reprofe comen word laughyng stocke shame al place shall scatre wyll sende swearde honger pestilence amonge vntyll haue cleane consumed oute lande gaue vnto theyr father ¶ ieremy prophecyeth shalbe capituyte lxx yeres bycause cont • iuned dispysed worde god sheweth lxx yeares babeloni • ri shulde destroyed destruccion • aryone propheried moueth preastes nacyons waylings capi xxv sermon geuen vnto ieremy vpon people iuda fourth yere iehoakun sonne iosias kynge iuda fyrste yeare nabuchodonosor kynge babylon whiche sermon ieremye prophet made vnto al people iuda inhabitours ierusalem maner thyrtene yeare iosias sonne amon kynge iuda vnto thys presente daye euen xxii • yeare worde lorde hathe bene cōmytted vnto iere xxix c • 5 c • xxxviii • haue spoken haue rysen vp earely haue geuen warnynge season ye wolde heare 2 par 36 • thoughe lorde hathe sente seruauntes prophetes vnto season yet wolde ye obey ye wolde enclyne eares heare sayde 4 reg 17 • tourne agayne euery man frome euyll waye frome wyeked ymaginacions shall ye dwel euer lande lorde promysed forefather go straunge goddes serue worshyppe nat angre nat workes youre handes wyll punyshe neuerthelesse ye wolde heare sayeth lorde haue defyed workes handes owne great harme wherfore thus sayeth y• lorde hostꝭ ieremy • b ye haue herkened vnto worde lo wyll sende call people dwell north sayeth lorde wyl prepayre nabuchodonosor kynge esay • • iere xvii • babylon seruaunte wyll brynge vpon lande vpon dwell therin vpon people aboute wyll vtterly rote wyl make wildernesse morkage continual deserte iere lvii b xvi b moreouer wyll take voyce gladnesse solace▪ voyce bryde grome bryde voyce anoynted cresshettes whole lande shal become wyldernesse shall serue sayde people kyng babylon threscore yeares ten 2 • 36 1 esd 1 iere v c • 9 b dani ix • zotha 1 b ixx yeares expired wyll vyset also wyckednesse kynge babylon people sayeth lorde yee lande caldees wyll make perpetuall wyldernes wyll fulfyll al wordes vpon lande haue deuysed agaynst yee written boke whiche ieremy hathe prophecyed al people also shalbe subdued vnto dyuerse nacyons greate kynges iob 34 b wyll recompense accordynge theyr dedes worckes theyre owne handes thus hath lord god israel spoken vnto take esay li psal 75 b wyne cup indignacyon fro hande thou mayest cause people sende y• drinke haue dronckē thereof maye mad theyr wyttes swearde commeth wyll sende amonge toke cuppe lordes hande made al people dryncke therof vnto whome lorde sente fyrste cytye ierusalem al cyties iuda theyr kynges prynces make desolate waste despysed cursed accordyng come passe day yee pharao kynge egypte seruauntes prince people together one another al kinges lande hus kynges philistine lande ascalon azah accaron remnaunt asdod edomites moabites ammonite kynges tirus sidon kynges y• iles beyonde see dedan thema buz dwel vtter partes worlde kynges araby generally kynges dwel deserte al kynges zamri kynges elam kynges medees al kynges towarde north whether farre nye euery one neyghbours yee al kingdomes vpon whole earth kyng sezach sayde shall drynke thē also therfore saye thou vnto commaundement lorde hostes god israell drinke dronken spewe fall ye neuer ryse thorowe swearde whiche wyll sende amonge yf wyll receaue cuppe thy hande drynke tell thus doth lorde hostes threaten drynke ye shall shortly lo iere xlix b ezech ix b 1 petr 4 • begynne plage cytye name geuen vnto thynke ye wyl leaue vnpunyshed ye shal go quite cal swerd vpon inhabitours earth saith lorde hoostes therfore tell wordes saye vnto ioel iiii c • mo lorde shall cry aboue let voyce herde hys holy habytacyon greate noyse shal crye court regall shall geue greate voyce lyke grape gatherer soūde therof shalbe herd vnto endes worlde lord hath iudgmēt geue vpon people wyll holde courte iustice flesshe punysh vngodly sayeth lorde thus sayeth lorde hoostes iere xxx beholde myserable plage shall go frome one people another greate stormye water shall aryse frome endes earth day shal lorde himselfe sleye one ende earth another shal mone made none gathered vp none buried shall lye dunge vpon grounde mourne ye shepherdes crye sprinkle yourselues asshes ye rammes flocke tyme youre slaughter fulfylled ye shall fal lyke vessel connyngly made pleasure psa 142 • shepherdes shall haue waye flie rammes flocke shall escape shall shepherdes crye horrybly rammes flocke shall mourne lorde hath consumed pasture theyr beste feldes lye deade horryble wrathe lorde haue forsaken theyr foldes lyke lyon theyr lande wast fearfull indignacion ¶ ieremye moueth people amendement taken prophetes preestes brought iudgement uryah prophete kylled ioachim cōtrary wyll god capi xxvi begynnynge raygne iehoakim sonne iosiah kynge ivda came thys worde frome lorde sayenge thus sayeth lorde iere vii • xvii • stande courte lordes house speake vnto whiche cyties iuda come worship lordes house al wordes commaunde say deu iiii xii b loke thou kepe one worde backe yf peraduenture wyl herken turne euery man hys wycked waye iere 18 iohn iii b maye also repente plage whiche haue determyned brynge vpon theyr wycked inuencyons thys maner shalte thou speake vnto thus sayeth lord yf ye wyl obey walcke lawes whiche haue geuen heare wordes seruauntes prophetes whō sent vnto rysynge vp tymely styll sendynge ye wyll folowe saye wyll house iere vii ☜ dyd vnto siloh wyll make cytie abhorred people earth preastes prophetes people herde ieremye preache wordes house lorde nowe spoken wordes lorde commaunded hym preach vnto people prestes y• prophetes al people toke holde vpō sayde thou shalt dye darrest thou bolde saye name y• lorde shal happen house vnto siloh thys cytye shalbe wast man shall dwell therin people gathered aboute ieremy house lord prynces iuda herde rumour came soone kynges palace house lorde sat downe 4 xv g iere • 6 b newe dore lorde spake prestes prophetes vnto ruler people wordes iohn xix • 26 g thys man worthy dye hathe preached agaynste thys cytie ye youreselues haue herde youre eares sayde ieremy vnto ruler al people lorde hath sent preach house agaynst cyty y• wordes ye haue herde therfore amende youre wayes youre aduysementes obedient vnto voice lord god shall lord repēte plage deuysed agaynste youre handes ye thincke expedient good thꝭ shal ye know ye put death math 23 3 ye shall make youreselues cytye inhabytours therof gyltye innocent bloude thys trueth lorde hathe sent vnto speake wordes youre eares sayde ruler people vnto prestes prophetes man maye condemned death hath preached vnto v name lorde oure god elder also lande stode vp▪ sayd thus vnto al people micheah morasthite mich • prophet vnder ezekiah kyng iuda spake people iuda thus sayeth lorde hostes mich iii • sion shalbe plowed lyke felde ierusalem shalbe heape stone hyl lordes house shalbe turned hye wod dyd ezekiah kyng iuda people iuda put deth verely ionas 3 • rather feared lorde made theyr prayer vnto cause also lorde repented plage yt deuysed thē shulde thē shameful dede agaynst soules prophet also yt preached stifly name lorde called uriah sonne semeiah caryathyarym thys man preached also agaynst cyty lāde according al ieremy sayeth nowe 3 reg 22 iehoakim kynge al estate prīces herde wordes king went sleye 3 reg 19 • math 1 • c whē uriah perceaued afraied fled departed egypte iehoakim kyng sent seruauntes lande egypte namely elnathā sonne achbor certayne men egypte fetched uriah oute egypt brought vnto kyng iehoakim slewe hym swearde cast hys deed body comen people graue ahikam sonne saphan helped ieremy came handes people slayne ieremy commaundement lorde sendeth bondes kyng iuda kynges nye wherby monyshed become subiectes vnto nabuchodonosor warneth people kynges ruler beleue false prophetes capi xxvii begynnynge reygne iehoakim sonne iosiah kynge iuda came thys worde vnto ieremye lorde whiche spake thus vnto make bondes chaynes put aboute thy necke sende kynge edom kynge moab kynge ammon kyng tyrus kyng sidon messaungers shall come ierusalē vnto zedekiah kinge iuda byd saye vnto theyr master thus sayeth lorde hostes god israel speake thus vnto youre master deut x made earth • catell vpon grounde greate power outstretched arme haue geuen vnto pleased • rcl • x • iubit xi ie xxxii • nowe wyl delyuer landes power nabuchodonosor y• kyng babylon da • iiii • iere xxv sernaunte beastes also felde shall geue hym seruyce iere xxi • 38 42 c al people shal serue hys sonne hys chylders chyldren vntyl tyme lande come also yee many people greate kynges shall serue hym moreouer people kyngdome whiche wyll nat▪serue nabuchodonosor wyll put theyr neckes vnder yoke kynge babylon people wyll vyset swearde honger pestylence vntyll haue consumed thē hys handes sayeth lorde ie 23 c 29d therfore folowe prophetes sothesayers expounder dreames charme • wytches saye vnto ye shall serue kynge babylon preache lye brynge farre lande might cast destroye people put theyr neckes vnder yoke king babylon serue hym wyl let remayne styll theyr owne lande sayeth lorde shall occoupye dwell therin thynges tolde zedekiah kynge iuda sayde iere 38 • put youre neckes vnder yoke kyng babylon serue hym hys people ye maye lyue wylt thou thy people peryshe swearde honger pestylence lyke lorde hathe deuysed forall people wyll serue kynge babylon iere xxii c iere 39 therfore geue eare vnto prophetes tel ye shall serue kynge babylon preache lye neyther haue sente sayeth lorde howbeit bolde falsely prophesye name myghte sooner dryue oute ye myght perysh preacher spake prestes also people thus sayeth lorde heare wordes prophetes preach vnto saye beholde iere 28 • ☞ vessel lordes house shall shortly brought hyther againe babylon prophecye lye vnto heare nat serue kyng babylon ye maye lyue wherfore wyl ye make thys cytie destroyed yf true prophetes dede yf worde resydue ornamentes yet remayne thys cytye whiche nabuchodonosor kynge babylon toke 4 • e 24 • caryed away iechoniah sonne iohoakim kynge iuda power iuda ierusalem ierusalem vnto babylon captyue yee lorde reproueth hananiah prophecyinge • • deathe capi xxviii bvt fourthe yeare raygne zedekiah kyng iuda fyfth moneth happened hananiah sōne assur prophet gybeon spake house lorde presence prestes al people sayde thus sayeth lorde hoostes god israell haue broken yoke kynge babylon •••• 〈◊〉 • two yeare wyl brynge agayne thys place ornamentes lordes house nabuchodonosor kynge babylon caryed awaye place vnto babilon yee wyll brynge agayne ie choniah sonne iehoakim kynge iuda self al presoners iuda caried vnto babylon euen place sayeth lorde wyl breake yoke kynge babylon prophet ieremy gaue answere vnto prophet hananiah prestes people present house lord 〈…〉 iii • prophet ieremy sayde amen lorde graunte thynge whiche thou haste prophecyed may bryng agayn ornamentes lordes house restore presoners babylon thys place neuertheles herken thou also wyll saye thou al people maye heare prophetes v tymes paste whiche prophecyed warre trouble pestylence ether peace vpon many nacyons great kyngdomes proued yf god sende thē dede deut • 8 〈◊〉 xvi • whē thing came pa prophet told hananiah prophet toke chayne prophet ieremyes necke brake sayde hananiah al people myght heare thus hath lorde spoken euen wyll breake yoke nabuchodonosor kynge babylon necke nacyons yee within two yeare prophet ieremy wente waye nowe hananiah prophet takē chayne prophet ieremyes necke broken worde lorde came vnto prophet ieremy sayinge go tell hananiah wordes thus sayeth lorde thou haste broken chaine wod steade wod thou shalte muke chaynes yron thys sayeth lorde hoostes god israel wyll put yoke yron vpon necke people maye serue nabuchodonosor kinge babylon yee shall wyll geue hym beastes felde sayde prophet ieremy vnto prophet hananiah iere xxix • heare hananiah lorde hath sent thou bringest people false belefe therfore thus sayeth lorde beholde wyll sende lande within yeare thou shalt die thou hast falsely spoken agaynst lorde hananiah prophet dyed yeare seuenth moneth ¶ pystle ieremy sent vnto captyuyte babilon prophecyeth theyr returne captyuytys • ter ixx yearc • prophecyeth destruccyon kynge people remayned ierusalem threatneth ii prophetes seduced people death semeiah nehelamyte • prophecyed capi xxix wordes boke ieremy prophet sent ierusalē vnto presoners senatours prestes prophetes al people nabuchodonosor led ierusalem vnto babylon tyme kynge iechoniah hys quene chamberlaynes prince iuda ierusalem workmasters ierusalem departed thyther whiche boke elasah sonne saphā gamariah sonne helkiah dyd beare zedekiah kynge iuda sent vnto babilon nabuchodonosor kynge babylon wordes ieremyes boke thus hathe lorde hostes god israel spoken vnto al presoners led ierusalem vnto babylon ie xxxv builde house dwel therin plāte garden ye may enioy frutes therof gene lorde thoughtes geue peace trouble geue redye ye myght haue hope agayne deu iiii c and▪ xxx • ye shal crye vnto ye shal go call vpō shall heare iohn vii ye shall seke fynde yee yf ye seke whole hert wyl founde sayeth lorde wyll delyuer pryson gather together agayn al place haue scatred saieth lorde wyll brynge agayne place whence caused caryed awaye captyue ye saye god hathe raysed vp prophetes babylō thꝰ hath lorde spoken kynge sitteth stole dauid al people dwell cyty youre brother 4 • e 24 gone captyuite thus speaketh lorde hoostes beholde iere 14 b wyll sende swearde honger pestilence vpon wyll make lyke vntymely fygges may eaten bitternes wyll persecute swearde honger death wyll delyuer vp vexed kingdomes cursed abhorted laughed scorne put confusyon al people amōge haue scatred haue bene obedyente vnto cōmaundemētes sayeth lord whiche sent vnto seruauntes y• prophetes iere xxv 44 n stode vp early sent vnto wolde heare sayeth lorde heare therfore worde lorde ye presoners sent ierusalem vnto babylon thus hath lorde hoostes god israel spoken ahab sonne colaiah zedekiah sonne maasiah prophecye lye vnto name beholde wyll delyuer hande nabuchodonosor kynge babylon maye sleye youre eye presoners iuda babilon shal take vpon thys terme cursynge say nowe god vnto dyd vnto zedekiah ahab kynge babilon rosted fyre sinned shamefully israell haue onely defyled neighbour wyues also preached lyeng wordes name whiche haue commaunded testyfy assure sayeth lorde semeiah nehelamyte thou shalte speake vnto hym thus sayeth lorde hoostes god israel thou haste sealed letter vnder thy name vnto people ierusalem sophoniah sonne maasiah preste yee sent prestes thou wryteste thus vnto hym lorde hathe ordeyned preste steade 4 reg xi▪ • ▪ pa 23 iehoiada preste thou shuldeste chefe house lorde aboue al prophetes preacher thou mightest put thē preson stockes happeneth thou hast reproued ieremy anathoth neuer leaueth prophecyige besyde al hath sent v worde iere 29 c vnto babylon tolde v playnely oure captyuyte shal long endure shulde builde v house dwel therin plant v garden myghte enioye frutes therof letter sophoniah prest dyd rede let ieremy prophet heare came worde lorde vnto ieremy sayinge sende worde captyuyte thys maner thus hath lorde spokē concerning semeiah nehelamite ier 28 c semeiah hath prophecied vnto without commission brought false hope therfore thus lorde dothe certyfye beholde wyl vyset semeiah nehelamite sede none shal remayne amonge people none shall se good wyll thys people sayeth lorde hathe preached falsely lorde ¶ retourne people babylon god hys chastenyng sheweth people synfull destruccyon enemyes israel capi xxx wordes lorde shewed vnto ieremy sayinge thus sayeth lorde god israell iere xxx • wryte vp diligently wordes haue spoken vnto boke io tyme commeth sayeth lord wyl bring agayne presoners people israell iuda sayeth lorde wyll restore vnto lande gaue theyr father shal haue possessyon▪ agayne wordes spake lorde concerning israel iuda thus sayeth lorde haue hearde terryble erye feare dysquietnes el doth signifye se namely strong men smyte euery man hys hande vpon hys loines iere xlii • woman paine trauayle euer sawe man trauaile chylde enquere theafter se yee theyr face maruelous pale ala thys daye whiche dredefull none may lykened vnto ala y• tyme iacobs trouble frō shall yet delyuered day sayeth lorde hostes wyl take yoke frō thy necke breake thy bondes shal nomore serue straunge goddes vnder shal seruice vnto god lorde to▪ e • e 34 dauyd kyng wyl rayse vp vnto iere 46 • tho seruaunt iacob feare sayeth lorde afrayed israel lo wil helpe also farre thy sede lande theyr captiuyte iacob shall turne agayne shall rest haue prosperous lyfe man shal make afrayed helpe sayeth lord •••• ix b though shall destroy al people among haue scatred yet wyll destroye correcte iere • • dyscrecyon knowe thou art wiseexod 34 • nah ••• • without fau • e therfore thus sayeth lorde sory thy hurte woundes man medle thy cause bynde vp thy woundes maye man helpe thy louers haue forgotten care nothyng haue geuen cruell stroke chastened roughly multytude thy mysdedes thy synnes haue hadde ouer hande makeste thou mone thy harme myselfe haue pyte thy sorow iere xiii • multitude thy mysdedes synnes haue done vnto iere ii • • 1▪ • therfore deuoure shalbe deuoured al thine enemyes shal led captiuite make waste shalbe wasted themselues al robbe wyll make also robbed wyll geue thy health agayne make thy woundes whole sayeth lorde reuyled one caste away despysed syon thus sayeth lorde beholde •• 24 wyll set vp iacobs tentes agayne defende dwellynge place cytie shalbe buylded olde estate house shall haue theyr ryght foundacyon shal go thankesgeuyng voyce ioye wyll multiple shall fewe shall endue honour man shall subdue theyr chyldren shalbe fore tyme theyr congregacion shall continue syght vexe wyll vyset mith v a▪ captayne also shall come prynce shall sprynge myddest wyl chalenge myselfe shal come vnto iohn vi • geueth ouer hert come vnto sayth lorde iere xiii b • 4 b • 1 • ye shalbe people also wylbe god iere xxiii▪ • • nd xxv beholde syde shal wrathe lorde breake sayeth lorde nume 13 c people israel whiche escaped wildernesse swearde founde grace come theyr reste euen shall lorde nowe also appere vnto far saye loue wyth euerlastynge loue therfore sprede mercye wyll repayre agayne thou daughter israel y• thou mayest faste sure thou shalt take thy tabrettes agayne go forth lede daunce thou shalte plante vynes agayne vpon hylles samaria grape gatherer shall plante synge tyme watchman vpon mount ephraim shall cry esaye ii • aryse let v go vp vnto syon lord god thus sayeth lorde reioyce gladnes iacob crye vnto head gentyles speake synge saye lorde shall delyuer people renaunt israel make whole beholde wyll bryng agayne north land gather y• endes worlde blynde l • amonge wemen great chylde also delyuered company come agayne shalbe greate departed hence heuynes ioye wyll brynge hyther agayne wyll lede thē ryuers water strayght waye shall stomble deut 33 israel father gene 47 • ephraim fyrst borne heare worde lorde ye gentile preache iles lye far saye hathe scatred israel shall gather together agayne shall kepe hym shepherde doth flocke lord hath redemed iacob ryd hande vyolent shall come reioyse vpon hyl syon shal haue plentuousnes goodes whiche lorde shall geue thē namely wheate wyne oyle yonge shepe calues theyr conscyence shal wel watred garden shall hongrye shal mayde reioyse daūce yee yonge olde folkes wyl turne theyr sorowe gladnesse wyll comforte make ioyfull euen theyr hertes wyl poure plentuousnes vpon hertes prestes people shalbe satisfyed goodnesse sayeth lorde thus sayeth lorde ☜ iere iii • math iii • voice heuynes wepyng lamentacion herd hye euen rachel mournynge chyldren wolde comforted cause away nowe sayeth lorde leaue wepynge cryenge witholde thyne eye teares ☜ thy laboure shal rewarded sayeth lorde shall come agayne lande theyr ennemyes yee euen thy posterytie shall haue consolacyon sayeth lorde thy chyldrēn shall come agayne theyr owne lande moreouer herde ephraim led away captiue complaine maner eze • xx • lorde thou hast correcte thy chastenynge haue receyued ☜ vntamed calfe • ren • • • z • tha 1 conuerte thou shalbe conuerted thou arte lorde god yee sone y• turnest shall refourme selfe
