vnderstand shal smyte vpon thyghe verely haue commytted shamefull thynges let youth beare reprofe confusion upon complaynt thought thus selfe g • n • 4 • b ephraim deare son chylde whome haue myrth pastyme sence tyme fyrste commened hym haue hym euer remembraunce therfore herte driueth vnto hym gladly louingly wyl haue mercy vpon hym sayth lorde get watchman prouide teacher set thyne hert vpon y• ryght waye thou shuldest walke turne agayne thou daughter israell turne agayne city thyne howe longe wylt thou go astraye thou shrynkynge daughter lorde wyll worke newe thynge vpon earthe woman shal compasse man thus sayth lorde hostes god israel wyl come therto yt haue brought iuda captiuite wordes shalbe herde lande city lorde faireesay 42 bryde grome ryghtuousnesse make fruteful thou holy hyll shall dwel iuda cityes shepherdes husbande men math v xi • shal fede hongry soule refreshe faynte hertes herde came agayne selfe mused lyke bene waked swete slepe beholde sayeth lord dayes come wyll sowe house israell house iuda mē catel deut 28 • iere 32 • zacha 8 • yee shall come therto lyke haue gone tymes past rote scatre breake •• wne destroye chasten euen wyll also go diligently abonte buylde vp agayne plante sayeth lorde ezec 18 • shall sayde father haue eaten sowre grape childrens teth set edge euery one shal dye owne misdede eateth sowre grape hꝭ teth shalbe set edge hebr viii b beholde dayes come sayeth lorde wyll make ☞ newe couenaunt house israel house iuda nat couenaunt made father toke thē hande led lande egypte whiche couenaunte brake yee euen whan husbande rule ouer sayeth lord hebre x b shall couenaunt wyll make house israel dayes sayeth lorde esays li b wyll plante lawe inwarde partes wryte theyr hertes iere 24 b xxx wyll theyr god shalbe people thence forth shall man teache neyghboure brother say knowe lorde shall knowe lowest vnto hyghest sayeth lorde wyll forgeue theyr mysdedes wyll neuer remembre theyr synnes thus sayeth lorde whiche gaue •• ne • b sonne lyght daye mone starres shyne nyght moueth see flou de therof waxe fearce name lord hostes lyke ordinaunce shall neuer takē syght sayth lord shall sede israel neuer ceasse alway people moreouer thus sayeth lord lyke heauen aboue nat measured foūdacions earth beneth may sought rom xi • wyl also nat cast whole sede israel haue commytted sayeth lorde beholde dayes come sayeth lorde yt cytie yt lord shal enlarged • esor 3 n zacha 14 b tower hananeel vnto gate corner wal thence shall ryght measure taken vnto hylltoppe iere xix b gareb shall come aboute gaath whole valley deade karcases ash feldes vnto broke cedron vnto corner horsegate towarde east saintuarye lorde also shall set nowe buylded set vp fasshyon shall neuer broken caste downe ¶ ieremye caste preson prophecyed cytie shulde taken kynge babylon felde ieremy bought commaundement lorde sygnyfyed people shulde come agayne theyr owne possessyon people god seruauntes theyr lorde feare god godes gyfte thyntent synnes may eschued capi xxxii wordes spake lorde vnto ieremy tenth yere zedekiah kynge iuda whiche xviii yeare nabuchodonosor tyme king babylon hoste layed seage vnto ierusalem ieremy prophet lay bounde courte preson whiche kyng iudaes house zedekiah kynge iuda caused layed prophecyed maner thus sayeth lorde iere 34 38 • xxxix beholde wyl delyuer citie hādes king babylon whiche shall take zedekiah kynge iuda shall able escape caldees surely shal come handes kynge babilon whiche shall speake mouth mouth one thē shal loke another face zedekiah shalbe caried vnto babylon shall vntyll tyme viset sayeth lorde yf thou takest hande fyght agaynst caldees thou shalt prospere ieremy sayde thus hath lorde spokē vnto beholde hananeel sōne selum thyne uncle sonne shall come vnto requyre redeme lande lyeth anathoth vnto thy selfe ie • 25 num 27 • xxxxi • uth iiii reason kinred thy right redeme bye hananeell myne vncles son came courte pryson accordyng worde lorde sayde vnto bye lande praye lyeth anathoth countre ben iamin herytage thou hast ryght lowse thy selfe therfore redeme perceaued commaundement lorde bought lāde hananeel anathoth myne uncle sōne weyed money euen seuen sycles ten syluer pen caused also make wrytyng seale called record therby weyed hī money vpon wayghtes toke euydence copy orderly sealed red ouer gaue euydence vnto baruch sōne neriah sonne maasiah syght hananeel cosyn presence wytnesses named euydēce iewes therby courte preson charged baruch also thē saying lorde hostes god israel cō maundeth take thys sealed euydence copye lay erthen vessel maye longe continue lorde hoostes god israel hath determyned house feldes vyneyardes shalbe possessed agayne lande nowe deliuered euydēce vnto baruch y• sōne neriah besought lorde saying lord god gene • iere 1 • b thou hast made heauen earthe thy great power hye arme nothynge hyd exo 34 • thou shewest mercy vpon thousandes thou recōpencest wickednes father bosome y• chyldren come thou art great myghtye god whose name lorde hostes greate councell excellent worke thyne eye loke vpon wayes men chyldrē rom ii rewarde euery one wayes accordyng frutes hys inuencions exo vii vnto 1 • chaptre thou hast done greate token wōders lande egypt se daye vpon people israell vpon men make thy name greate come passe daye thou hast brought thy people israell lande egypte token wonder myghtye hande stretched arme great terryblenes hast geuen lande lyke thou haddest promysed vnto father namely y• woldest geue lāde floweth mylcke honye iud ii iii iiii vi vii nowe came therin possessed folowed thy voyce walked thy lawe hist v b thou commaundedest haue done therfore come plage vpon beholde bulwarkes made nowe agaynst citie take shal wonne caldees besege swearde honger deathe loke thou hast spoken shal come vpon lo thynges presente vnto yet sayest thou vnto lorde god cōmaundest shall lowse pece lande vnto selfe take wytnesses thereto yet meane season citie delyuered power caldees came worde lorde vnto saying beholde lord god flesshe thynge harde therfore thus sayeth lorde iere xxv b 〈◊〉 • • holde shal delyuer cytie y• power caldees power nabuchodonosor kynge babylon shall take caldees shall come wynne cytie set fyre vpon burne gorgyous house whose parlers haue made sacryfyce vnto baal poured drynke offerynges vnto straunge goddes prouoke vnto wrath seying child israel chyldren iuda haue wrought wickednes euer frō youth vp haue el done prouoked workes theyr owne handes sayeth y• lorde hathe cytie bene el prouokynge wrath euer ☜ sence daye buylded vnto houre wherin cast syght great blasphemyes chyldren israel iuda whiche haue done prouoke 〈…〉 yee theyr kinges theyr prynces prestes prophetes men iuda cytesyns ierusalem iere ii stode vp early taught thē instructed thē turned theyr backes theyr face wolde heare refourmed correcte iere vii set theyr idoles house halowed vnto name defyle haue buylded hye place baal valley chyldren hennom bowe theyr sonnes daughter vnto moloch whiche neuer commaunded neyther came euer thought make iuda synne wyth suche abhominacion nowe therfore thus hathe lorde god israel spoken concernynge thys citie whiche ye selues confesse shalbe delyuered hande kynge babylon whē wonne swerde honger pestilence deut xx •• beholde wyl gather together al landes wherin haue scatred wrath fearefull great displeasure wyl brynge agayne vnto place shall dwel safely shall people wyll theyr god psal •••• wyll geue one herte one waye maye feare dayes theyr lyfe theyr chyldren may prospere ezec 36 • wyll set vp euerlastynge couenaunt namely wyl neuer ceasse thē good wyl put feare theyr hertes shall runne away deut 33 • iere xx •• • yee wyll haue luste pleasure good faythfully plant lande whole herte soule thus sayeth lorde lyke haue brought al great plage vpon thys people wyll also brynge vpon good haue promised men shal haue possession lāde wherof ye say nowe shall neyther inhabited people catel deliuered hādes y• caldees yee lande shalbe bought money euydences made therupon sealed wytnesses coūtre ben iamin rounde ierusalem city iuda city y• vpon mountaynes lye beneth yee city southe wyll brynge theyr presoners hyther agayne sayeth lorde ¶ prophete monyshed lorde pray delyueraunce people whiche lorde promyseth god forgeueth synnes doth graciously people owne renowne byrth christe kyngdome christe churche shall neuer ended capi xxxiii worde lorde • ame vnto ieremye maner iere 〈◊〉 • xxxii whē yet bounde courte preson thus sayeth lorde whiche fulfylleth thyng speaketh lorde whiche perfourmeth thynge taketh hande euen whose name lorde e •• xiiii • 1 reg vii • crye vnto wyl answere shewe greate hye thynges whyche vnknowen vnto thus saye spake lorde god israel concernyng house cytie house kynges iuda shalbe broken thorowe ordinaunce weapens caldees come besege shalbe fylled deed karcases men wyll steye wrath dyspleasure turne face thys cytie wyckednes beholde sayeth lorde wyl heale theyr woundes make whole wyll open thē treasure peace trueth wyll returne captyuyte iuda israell wyll set vp agayne afore esa xiiii • frō mysdedes wherin haue offended agaynste wyll clense thē al theyr blasphemy haue done regarded nat wyll forgeue thys shall get name prayse honoure amonge people earth whiche shall heare good wyll shewe vnto yee shall afrayed stonnyed good dedes benefytes wyl thē moreouer thus sayeth lorde iere vii thys place wherof ye saye shall wyldernesse wherin neyther people catell shall dwell lyke maner cyties iuda without ierusalem whiche also shalbe voyde nether people catell shall dwell shall voyce gladnesse harde agayne voyce brydegrome bryde voyce thē shal synge psal 118 1 mat 4▪ prayse y• lorde hostes louynge mercy endureth euer voyce shall offer vp gyftes house lorde wyll restore captyuyte thys lande afore sayeth lorde thus sayeth lorde hostes shall come yet therto thys lāde whiche voyde men catell cyties lande shall sette vp shepherdes cotages cyties vpon mountaynes cyties lye vpon playne cyties southe lande ben iamin feldes ierusalem cyties iuda shall shepe nombred agayne vnder hande hym telleth sayeth lorde ier xxiii • beholde tyme commeth sayeth lorde wyll perfourme good thynge haue promysed vnto house israell y• house iuda dayes tyme wyll brīge forth vnto dauid braunche ryghtuousnes shall equyte ryghtuousnesse lande dayes shal iuda helped esa xxxii c ierusalem shal dwell safe shal cal euen god ryghtuousnesse thus lorde promeseth 2 reg vii c dauid shall neuer want one syt vpon stole house israel 1 reg ii • neyther shall prestes leuytes want one offre waye burnt offeringes kyndle y• meatofferynges prepare sacrifyces worde lorde came vnto ieremy maner thus sayeth lorde maye couenaūt gene viii whiche haue made daye nyght broken shulde nat daye nyght due season maye couenaunt also broken made dauid seruaunt nat haue sonne reygne trone 1 pet ii shall also prestes leuytes neuer fayle serue gene xv b xxii c lyke starres heauen maye nat nombred neyther sande see measured wyll multiplye sede dauid seruaūt leuites mynisters moreouer worde lorde came ieremy sayenge consydrest thou nat people speaketh two kynreddes saye lorde chosen two hathe cast awaye farre people come haue hope come together one people agayne therfore thus sayeth lorde haue made couenaunte daye nyght geue statute vnto heauen earth thē wyll also cast awaye sede dauid seruaunte wyll take prynce sede rule posterite abraham isaac iacob yet wyll turne agayne theyr captyuite mercyfull vnto ¶ threateneth cytie kynge zedekiah also shal geuen handes kyng babylon rebuketh brought suche theyr brother captiuyte pardoned go theyr lybertye capi xxxiiii wordes whiche lord spake vnto ieremy ier xxxix • tyme nabuchodonosor kyng babylon hys hostes kyngdomes vnder hys power al people fought agaynste ierusalem cyties therof thus sayeth lorde god israel goo speake zedekiah kynge iuda tell hym lorde sendeth worde beholde 4 25 ier xxxi • xxxix wyl delyuer cytie hande kynge babylon shal burne thou shalte nat escape hys handes shalte led awaye presoner delyuered power thou shalt loke kynge babylon face shall speake mouth mouth shalt thou go babylon yet heare worde lorde zedekiah thou kynge iuda thus sayeth lorde vnto thou shalte nat slayne wyth swearde shalt dye peace xxxi c lyke thy fore father kynges thy progenitours brente shalt thou brent also mournynge shall saye oh lorde thus haue determyned sayeth lorde spake ieremy prophet wordes vnto zedekiah kynge iuda ierusalem tyme kynge ba bylons hooste beseged ierusalem remnaunt cyties namely lachis azecach yet remayned 2 dat xi strōg defensed cyties iuda wordes lorde spake vnto ieremy prophet zedekiah agreed people ierusalem shulde proclamed exo xxi • eui xxv f deu xv b lyberty euery man shulde let seruant handmayde go fre hebrue hebruesse iewe holde hys brother bonde man nowe conseted euen obedient let go fre afterwarde repented toke agayne seruaūtes haude maydēs let go fre made bonde agayne whiche cause worde lorde came vnto ieremy lorde hym selfe sayinge thus sayeth lorde god israel deut xv c • exo 21 made couenaunte youre father brought egypte shulde bondman sayinge seuen yeares euery mā shall let hꝭ bought seruaūt hebrye gofre yf haue serued hym syxe yeares father obeyed nat herkened nat vnto ye nowe turned dyd right ye proclamed euery man let hys ueyghboure go fre ye made couenaunt temple bea reth name yet ye haue turned self agayne blasphemed name euery man hathe requyred seruaūt handmayden agayne whō ye let go quyte fre cōpelled thē serue agayne youre bonde men therfore thus sayeth lorde ye haue nat obeyed euerye man proclayme fredome vnto brother neyghbour wherfore ☞ wyll call vnto fredome sayeth lorde euen vnto sweared pestylence honger wyll make plaged kyngedomes earth yee men haue broken couenaunte nat kepte wordes appoyntement whiche made megene xv b ☞ whē hewed y• calfe two went thorow two halfes therof prince iuda prynces ierusalem gelded men priestes al people lande wente thorow two sydes calfe men wyl geue power enemyes handes folowe vpō theyr lyues psa 79 • ierc vii deed bodyes shalbe meate foules ayre beastes felde zedekiah kynge iuda prynces wyl delyuer power theyr enemyes desyre sleye hande kynge babylous hoste ieue 37 c ☞ whiche nowe departed thorowe cōmaundement sayeth lorde shall come agayne thys cytie shall fyght agaynste wynne burne moreouer wyll laye cyties iuda waste mā shall dwell therin capi xxxv ¶ propoundeth obedsente rechabites ther confoundeth pryde iewes commaundement ionādab father rechavites threateneth punishmēt vnto rebellyous iewes ꝓmiseth prosperite vnto rechabi • ꝭ obediēce vnto father wordes whiche lorde spake vnto ieremy rayne iehoakim sonne iosiah kynge iuda go vnto house 4 •• eg x • rechabytes call brynge house lorde commody oiis place geue wyne dryncke toke iazaniah sōne ieremy sonne habaziniah brother sonnes whole houshulde rechabytes brought thē house lord closet chyldren hanan sonne iegebaliah man god whiche closet prynces aboue closet maasiah sonne selum y• treasure sonnes y• kynred rechabites ser pottes full wyne cuppes sayde vnto drynke wyne sayde wyll dryncke wyne ionadab sonne rechab oure father commaunded v sayinge ye sonnes shall neuer dryncke wyne ier xxix b buylde house sowe sede plante vynes yee ye shal haue vyneyardes al tyme ye shall dwell tentes ye maye lyue long lande wherin ye straungers thus haue obeyed commaundement ionadab sonne rechab oure father hathe charged v drynke wyne lyfe longe oure wyues oure sonnes oure daughter nether buylde house dwell therin haue also amonge v neyther vyneyardes corne lande sowe dwell tentes obeye accordynge vnto ionadab oure father commaunded v nowe nabuchonosor kynge babylon came vp y• lande sayde come let v go ierusalem maye escape hooste caldees assyrian dwell nowe ierusalē came worde lorde vnto ieremy sayenge thus sayeth lorde hoostes god israel go tell men iuda inhabitours ierusalem wyll ye refourmed obey wordes sayeth lorde wordes whiche ionadah sonne rechab commaunded sōnes shulde drynke wyne fast surely kepte vnto thys daye drynke wyne obeye theyr father commaundement ie xviii xxv haue stande vp early haue spokē vnto geuen earnest warnyng yet haue ye nat bene obedient vnto yee haue sent seruauntes prophetes vnto rose vp early sent worde saieng turne nowe euery man hys wycked waye amende youre lyues go nat straunge goddes worshyppe ye maye contynue lande haue geuen vnto youre father ye wolde neyther heare folowe chyldren ionadab rechabs soune haue stedfastly kepte theyr father commaundemente gaue thys people nat obedient vnto therfore thus sayth lorde boostes god israel beholde wyll brynge vpon iuda vpon euery one dwelleth ierusalen trouble haue deuysed agaynst thē prouer • esa lxv b iere vii b haue spoken vnto wolde nat folowe haue called vnto neuer theles wolde geue answere ieremy also spake vnto houshoulde rechabites thus sayeth lorde hostes god israel muche ye haue obeyed cōmaundemēt ionadab father kepte al preceptes done accordyng vnto al bydden therfore thus sayeth lorde hostes god israel ie ionadab sonne rechab shall nat fayle haue one hys stocke stande alwaye capi xxxvi ¶ baruch wryteth ieremy endyteth boke cur agaynste iuda israel sent boke vnto people readeth colled ruler readeth also rulars shewe vnto kynge wordes boke iehuti taketh boke readeth lyttell casteth fyre another wrytten commaundemente lorde fourth yeare iehoakim y• sonne iosiah kyng iuda came worde lorde vnto ieremy sayinge iet take boke wryte therin al wordes haue spoken y• agaynst israel iuda agaynste people tyme beganne speake vnto raygne iosiah vnto day house iuda hereth plage whiche haue deuysed thē maye peraduenture iet turne euery man frō hys wycked way may forgeue theyr offence synnes dyd ieremy call baruch sonne neriah iet • baruch wrote boke mouth ieremy wordes lorde spoken vnto hym ieremy commaunded baruch saying preson maye nat come house lorde therfore go thou thyther reade boke thou hast wryten mouth namely wordes lorde rede lordes house vpon fastynge daye people whole iuda come cyties maye heare peraduenture wyll praye mekely face lorde turne euery one wycked waye greate wrath dyspleasure lorde hathe taken agaynste thys people baruch sonne neriah dyd accordyng vnto ieremy prophete cōmaunded hym readynge wordes y• lorde boke lordes house done y• lyft yeare iehoa kim sonne iosiah kynge iuda ix mouth io •• commaunded people ierusalē shulde faste lord also come cyties iuda vnto ierusalem red baruch wordes ieremy boke y• house lorde treasury gamariah sonne saphan scrybe whiche besyde hyer lofte iere xxvi • newe dore lordes house people myght heare nowe micheah sonne gamariah sonne saphan harde wordes lorde boke wente downe kynges palace scrybes chambre prynces set elysama scrybe dalaiah sōne semei elnathan sonne achbor gamariah sōne saphan zedekiah sonne hananiah prynces mischeah tolde wordes harde baruch rede boke people prynces sent iehudi sonne nathaniah sōne selamiah sonne chusi vnto baruch sayinge take thyne hande y• boke wherout thou haste rede people come baruch sonne neriah toke boke hande came vnto thē sayde vnto hym syt downe rede boke y• may heare also baruch red myght nowe hearde y• wordes abashed one vpon another sayde vnto baruch wyll certyfye kynge wordes examyned baruch saying tell v howe dydest thou wryte wordes mouth baruch answered spake wordes vnto mouth wrote boke sayde prynces vnto baruch go thy waye hyde ieremy man knowe ye went kynge courte kepte boke chambre elisama scrybe tolde kynge wordes myght heare kynge sent iehudi fetch hym boke brought elisama the▪ scrybes chambre iehudi red kynge prynces whiche hym myght heare nowe kynge satan wynter house ix moneth fyre hym ieiudi red thre foure leaues therof cut boke peces penne knyfe mat 3 • cast fyre vpō harth vntyll boke brente fyre vpon harth yet man abashed therof rente clothes neyther kynge hym selfe seruauntes though hearde wordes neuerthelesse elnathan dalaiah gamariah besought kynge wolde nat burne boke nat withstandynge kynge wolde nat heare cōmaunded ierahmael sonne amalech saraiah sonne ezriel selamiah sonne abdiel laye handes vpon baruch scrybe vpon ieremy prophete lorde kepte syght nowe kynge brent boke sermon whiche baruch wrote mouth ieremy worde lorde came vnto ieremy sayinge take another boke ☞ wryte forsayde sermon wrytten fyrst boke whiche iehoakim kynge iuda hathe brente tell ieoakim kynge iuda thus sayeth lorde thou hast brente boke thoughtest within thy selfe hast thou wryttē ther kynge babylon shall come make thys lande waste y• shall make bothe people catel ther fore thus lorde sayeth iehoakim y• kynge iuda 4 24 b iere xxii • shall none hys generacyon syt vpon throne dauid hys deed corse shalbe cast y• heate daye frost nyght maye come vpon hym wyll byset wyckednes hym hys sede hys seruaūtes ouer euel haue promysed though herde nat wyl bringe vpon vpon inhabytours ierusalem vpon iuda thē toke ieremy another boke gaue baruch scrybe sonne neriah whiche wrote therin mouth ieremy sermon fyrst boke whiche iehoakim kynge iuda dyd burne ther added vnto thē many mo sermon zedekiah succedeth cononiah sendeth vnto ieremy praye hym ieremy goinge londe ben iamin taken beaten put preson delyuered hynge zedekiah capi xxxvii zedekiah sonne iosiah 4 24 • made kynge throwe nabuchodonosor kynge babylon reigned lande iuda steade cononiah 〈…〉 sonne iehoakim neyther hys seruauntes people lande wolde obeye wordes lorde whiche spake porphet ieremy neuertheles zedekiah kynge sent iehucal sonne selemiah sophoniah sonne maasiah preeste prophete ieremye sayinge praye thou vnto lorde god v ieremye walked fre amonge people tyme put preson yet iere xxi xlii pharaos hoste also come ofeze xvii b egypte whiche caldees beseged ierusalem perceyued departed thence came worde lorde vnto ieremy prophete saying thus sayeth lorde god israel answere shal ye geue kynge iuda sent vnto councell iere xlvi beholde pharaos hoste come forth helpe shal returne egypte owne lande caldees shall come agayne fyght agaynst cytie wynne set fyre vpon thus sayeth lorde dysceaue youre owne myndes thynkyng maner tush caldees go nowe way frome v shall go waye thoughe ye slayne whole hoste caldees besege euery one slayne laye tente yet shulde stande vp set fyre vpon cytie nowe hoste caldees broken vp ierusalem feare egypcyans armye ieremye wente ierusalem towarde lande ben iamin get amonge people came vnder ben iamyns porte porter called ieriah sonne selemiah sonne iere 28 b hananiah whiche fell vpon hym toke hym sayinge thy mynde runne calbees sayde ieremye go caldees neuerthelesse ieriah wolde beleue brought ieremy bounde prynces wherfore prynces angry ieremy smote hym layed hym preson house ionathas scrybe ruler prison thus ieremy put dongeon prison lay longe tyme iere 38▪ c zedekiah kynge sent called asked quyetly owne house saying thynkest thou busynes nowe hande commeth lorde ieremy answered yee doth thou sayde shalt delyuered kynge babylon power moreouer ieremy sayd vnto kyng zedekiah haue offended agaynst agaynst thy seruaūtes agaynst people ye haue put prison iere 27 c prophetes whiche haue prophecied vnto sayde kynge babylon shulde come agaynste thys lande therfore nowe lorde kynge lette prayer accepte sende house ionathas scrybe dye zedekiah kynge cōmaunded put ieremy fore entrye preson dayly geuen cake breade vntyll breade cytie eaten vp thus ieremy remayned fore entry preson ¶ mocyon ruler ieremy put dongeon requrste abedmelech chamberlayne kynge commaundeth ieremye brought dongeon ieremy sheweth kynge howe myght escape death capi xxxviii saphatiah sonne mathan godoliah sonne phasphur iucall sonne semeliah phashur sonne melchiah perceaued wordes ieremy spoken vnto people namely maner thus sayth lord iere xxi b • ▪ xxvii remayneth citye shall peryshe eyther swearde honger pestylence falleth vnto caldees shall escape wynnynge soule pray shall lyue iere xxii thus sayeth lord thys cytie doute muste delyuered power kynge babylon also shall wynne sayde prynces vnto kyng syr beseche let man put death thus discourageth handes • oudyours cytie handes people speaketh wordes vnto man verely laboureth peace people mischefe zedekiah kyng answered sayde lo youre handes kynge may denye nothyng toke ieremy cast dongeon melchiah sonne hamelech dwelt fore entre preson let downe ieremy cordes dōgeon water myre ieremy stacke fast myre nowe abedmelech morian beyng chamberlayne kinges courte vnderstode cast ieremye dongeon went kinges house spake kynge whiche sat vnder porte ben iamin wordes lorde kynge men medle ieremy prophete wrong namely y• haue put preson dye honger breade citie kynge commaunded abedmelech morian sayde take hence xxx men thou wylte draw vp ieremy prophete dō geon dye abedmelech toke y• men hym went house kynge vnder almery gat olde ragges worne cloutes let downe corde dongeon ieremy abedmelech morian sayd vnto prophete ieremy put ragges cloutes vnder thyne arme hole betwyxte cordes ieremy dyd drew vp ieremy cordes toke dongeon remayned fore entrye preson iere 37 c zedekiah kynge sent caused ieremy prophete called vnto hi thirde entrye y• house lorde kynge sayde vnto ieremy wyll aske hyde nothynge fro me▪ ieremy answered zedekiah yf playne vnto thou wylte cause suffre death geue councel thou wylte folowe kynge swore othe secretely vnto ieremy saying truely lorde lyneth made v soules wyll sleye geue hā de seke thy lyfe sayde ieremye vnto zedekiah thus sayeth lorde hoostes god israell iere • 7 c case thou wylte go forthe vnto kynge babilons prince thou shalt saue thy lyfe cytie shall brente yee bothe thou thy housholde shall escape lyues yf thou wylte go forth kynge babylon prynces shall citie delyuered handes caldees shall set fyre vpon thou shalte able escape kynge zedekiah sayde vnto ieremye afrayed iewes fled vnto caldees least come theyr handes haue derision ieremy answered shal betraye herken vnto voyce lorde beseche whiche speake vnto shalte thou well saue thy lyfe yf thou wylte go forthe lorde hath tolde playnely beholde al wemen lefte kyng iudaes house shall go kynge babylon prynces thynke thou arte disceyued men whome thou dyddest put thy trust haue gotten vnder set thy fete faste myre gone theyr way therfore thywiues wt theyr child shall fle vnto y• caldees thou shalte escape theyr handes shalt kynge babylon prisoner cytie shalt thou cause brēt sayde zedekiah vnto ieremye loke body knowe wordes thou shalte dye yf prince perceaue haue talked come vnto sayinge speake saydest thou kynge hyde v wyll put death tell v praye sayde kynge se thou geue answere haue hūbly besought kynge wyll let lye nomore iehonathans house dye came al prynces vnto ieremye asked hym tolde maner kynge bad helde theyr peace perceyaued nothynge iere 39 c ieremy abode styll fore entrye preson vntyll daye ierusalem wonne ¶ nabuchodonosor besegeth ierusalem zedekiah flyeth 〈◊〉 taken l •• dces sonnes slayne eye thrust ieremye prouyded abedmelech delyuered frome captiuite confydence hathe god capi xxxix nowe iere 32 • 4 reg • 5 • cytye ierusalem taken ix yeare zedekiah kynge iuda tenth moneth came nabuchodonosor kynge babylon hoste beseged ierusalem xi yeare zedekiah fourth moneth ix daye moneth brake cytie prince kyng babilon came sat thē downe vnder porte neregel sarezer samegarnabo sarsachim rabsaris neregel sarezer rabmag prynces kynge babylon iere 34 • zedekiah kinge iuda soudiours sawe fled departed cytie night thorowe kinges garden thorowe porce betwene two walles wente towarde wyldernesse caldees hoste folowed faste toke zedekiah felde iericho brought presoner nabuchodonosor kynge babylon vnto reblath lyeth lande hemath gaue iudgement vpon kynge babylon caused chyldren zedekiah noble iuda slayne face reblath made zedekias eye put bounde chaynes sente babylon 4 reg 25 b iere 32 moreouer caldees brente vp kynges palace house people brake downe walles ierusalem remnaunt people citie come helpe soeuer lefte comen sorte nabuzaradan cheife capytayne caryed babylon nabuzaradan chefe captayne let • ascal people nothynge dwell styll lande iuda gaue vineyardes corne feldes tyme nabuchodonosor also kynge babylon gaue nabuzaradan chefe captayne charge concernynge ieremye sayinge take cheryshe hym make muche hym se thou hym harme intreate owne desyre nabuzaradan chefe captayne nabusasban chefe chamberlayne nergalsarezer treasurer kyng babilons lordes sent ieremy •••• 38 caused fet fore entrye preson committed vnto godoliah sonne ahicam sonne saphan shulde cary home iere xl b dwelte amonge people nowe whyle ieremye laye yet bounde fore entrie pryson worde lorde came vnto sayinge go tell abedmelech morian thus sayeth lorde hostes god israel beholde cruell sharpe plage y• haue deuysed cyte wyl brynge vpon thou shall se wyll delyuer sayeth lorde thou shalte come handes men thou fearest douceles wyll saue thou shalt peryshe swearde thy lyfe shalbe saued thou hast put thy truste sayeth lorde ¶ ieremy hath lycence go whether wyll dwelleth people remayneth ierusalem ouer whome godoliah ruleth iohanā prophecyeth deth vnto godoliah capi xl maner howe lorde treated ieremy iere xli •• nabuzaradā chefe captayne let go fre iosue 18 ramah whyther led hym bounde amonge presoners caryed ierusalem iuda vnto babylon chefe captane called ieremy said vnto lorde thy god spake mygh tely myserye vpon place nowe lorde hath sente perfourmed promysed ye haue synned agaynst lorde haue bene obedyent vnto voyce therfore commeth thys plage vpon beholde lowse bondes thy handes daye yf thou wylte nowe go wyth vnto babylon vp wyll se prouyde yf thou wylte go wyth babylon remayne ••• xi • b tobi • b beholde al lande thy wyll loke thou thynkest conuenient good abyde dwell thou canst content dwell alone remayne godoliah sonne ahicam sonne saphan 4 reg 25 c kynge babylon hathe made gouernoure ouer cytyes iuda dwel amonge people remayne soeuer pleaseth chefe capytayne gaue expense rewarde let hym go iere 〈◊〉 • wente ieremye vnto godoliah sonne ahikam mizpa dwelt amonge people lefte lande nowe captaines hoste iuda whiche theyr felowes scatred abrode euery syde lande vnderstode kynge babylon made godoliah sonne ahicam gouernour lande man wyfe chylde yee poore men lande led captiue babylon shuld vnder iurisdiccion came godoliah vnto mizpa namely ismaell sonne nathaniah iohanan ionathan sonnes careah sareah sonne thanhometh sonnes ophai netophathite iesaniah sōne maachati theyr companion godoliah sonne ahicam sōne saphan swore vnto felowes maner 4 reg 25 c nat afrayed serue y• caldees dwell lande kynge babylon seruice shal ye prospere beholde dwel mizpa officer y• caldees behalfe satisfye suche come v therfore gather wyne corne oyle kepe ware house dwel city ye haue kepynge yee al iewes also y• dwelt moab vnder ammonite idumea countrees whē herde king babylō made godoliah sonne ahicam sonne saphan gouernoure vpon thē y• left iuda al iewes say returned al place fled vnto came lande iuda godoliah vnto mizpa gathered wyne frutes muche moreouer iohanan sōne careah captaynes hoste scatred euery syde lande came godoliah mizpa sayde vnto hym knowest thou baalis kynge ammonite hath sent ismaell sonne nathaniah sleye ther godoliah sonne ahicam beleued sayde iohanan sonne careah vnto godoliah mizpa wordes secretely let go praye wyll sleye ismael sonne nathaniah body shall knowe wherfor wyl kyll al iewes whiche resorte vnto myght scatred remnaunt iuda perishe iohanan sonne careah thou shalt lye y• thou sayest ismael ¶ ismaell kylleth godoliah gylefully many hym iohanan foloweth ismael capi xli seuenthe moneth happened 4 25 • ismaell sonne nathaniah sonne elisama one kynges bloude came wyth greatest aboute kynge tenne men sworne vnto godoliah sonne ahicam mizpa dyd eate together ismael sonne nathaniah ten mē sworne starte vp smote godoliah sonne ahicam sonne saphan swearde slewe kynge babylon made gouernour lande ismael also slewe iewes godoliah mizpa caldees founde waytynge vpon nexte daye slayne godoliah matter yet vnknowen came certaine mē sichem siloh samaria nombre lxxx shauen beardes rente theyr clothes al heuy bryngyng meate offringes incēse theyr hādes ☜ offre house lorde ismael sōne nathaniah wēt forth mizpa eccle xii c wepyng mete nowe met thē sayde go way godoliah sōne ahicā came middest cytie ismael sonne nathaniah thē sworne vnto hym slewe euen myddest pyt among lxxx men ten sayd vnto ismael oh sleye v nat haue yet greate treasure felde wheate bar lye oyle hony spared slewe theyr brother noew pyt wherin ismael dyd caste deade bodyes men slewe godoliah kynge asa caused made feare bassa kynge israell sa • e pytte dyd ismael fyl slayne men • remnaunte people kynges daughter people yet lefte mizpa vpon whome 3 reg 25 nabusaradan chefe capytayne made godoliah sonne ahicam gouernoure ismael sonne nathaniah caryed awaye presoners towarde ammonite iohanan sonne careah whiche bene captaynes ouer kynges hoste herde wyckednesse ismaelgene 14▪ • 1 xxx • sōne nathaniah done 4 reg 25▪ • toke theyr companion went fyght ismael sonne nathaniah founde hym greate water gibeon nowe people ismael led captyue sawe iohanan sonne careah al capytaynes hoste glad people y• ismael caryed away mizpa brought agayne returned came iohanan sonne careah ismael sonne nathaniah fled iohanan eyght sworne companion wente ammonytes iohanan sonne careah captaynes hoste y• hi toke remnaunt people ismael sonne nathaniah led away whē slayne godoliah sōne ahicam also rescued fyghtynge men wemen chyldren gelded men brought agayne gibeon went thence sat thē downe geruth camaam whiche lyeth besyde bethlehem iere xlii▪ • myght go egypte feare caldees afrayed ismael sonne nathaniah slayne godoliah ahikams sonne iere • kynge babylon made gouernour lande capi xlii ¶ captaynes aske councell ieremye ought ieremy monysheih remnaunt people go egypte soal captaynes iohanan sonne kareah iezaniah sōne osayah came people leaste vnto moste sayde vnto ieremye prophet ••• xxi▪ a▪ •• 37 heare oure petycyon thou mayeste praye v vnto lorde thy god namely al remnaunt wher fewe v left many thou seest v lorde thy god may shewe v waye go tell v shulde ieremye prophet sayde vnto haue herde beholde wyll praye vnto god lorde ye haue requyred loke answere lorde geueth shal certyfye therof kepe nothynge backe sayde vnto ieremy io •• e i▪ math 2▪ • ••• ▪ xliii • lorde trueth faythfulnes oure recorde wyll lorde thy god commaundeth v whether good euyl wyll herkē vnto y• voyce lorde god whō wesende maye prospere haue folowed voyce lorde oure god ten dayes came worde lorde vnto ieremy called iohanan sonne kareah al captaynes people yee people leaste mooste sayde vnto thus sayeth lord god israell vnto ye sente laye forthe prayer hym ••• xxi b ye wyll dwell thys lande shal buylde vp breake downe shal plant rote ☜ repente cōcernyng trouble haue done feare kynge babylon ye stande awe nat afrayed sayeth lorde wyll helpe delyuer hande wyll pardon wyll haue mercy vpon brynge agayne youre owne lande neuertheles yf ye purpose dwell thys lande folowe voyce lorde youre god wyll saye thus wyll dwell go egypte wher shall nether se warre heare y• noise trompe suffre honger wyll dwell wherfore heare nowe y• worde lorde ye remnaunt iuda •• e▪ 17▪ • thus sayeth y• lorde hoostes god israel ye wholy purposed go egypt straungers iere xli▪ c swearde ye feared shall ouer take egypt honger wherof ye afrayed shall hange vpon folowe egypte ther ye shall dye set purpose vndertake go egypte sogeourne shall peryshe swearde honger pestylence one shall remayne shal none escape plage wil bring vpon thus sayeth lorde hoostes god israel lyke wrath indignacyon moued agaynst inhabytours ierusalē shal displeasure kindled agaynst also yf ye go egypte ye shalbe reuiled abhorted brought shame confusyon thys place ye shall neuer se lorde forbyddeth ye remnaunte iuda ye shall go egypte forget haue warned earnestly thys daye ye haue dyssembled iere xlii • ye sente vnto lorde youre god sayde praye thou lorde oure god v loke answere lorde oure god geueth brynge v agayne shall ther nowe haue shewed declared vnto voyce lorde youre god whiche cause hathe sente nowe therfore deut 〈◊〉 • ye wyll folowe sure y• ye shall peryshe swear •• honger pestylence euen place youre lust go dwell ¶ iohanan caryeth remnaunte pro • l • egypte contrary mynde ieremye ieremye prophecyeth desiruceyon egypte capi xliii nowe ieremy ended wordes lorde god vnto people theyre sake god sent azariah sonne osaiah iohanan sonne kareah proude personnes sayde vnto ieremye iere xlii thou lyest lorde oure god hath sente speake vnto v shulde go egypte dwell baruch sonne neriah prouoketh agaynste v myghte brynge v captyuytye caldees myght fleye v cary v away presoners vnto babylon iohanan sonne kareah al captaynes hooste al y• people folowed nat commaundement lorde namely dwell lande iuda iohanan sonne kareah captaynes hoost caryed away remnaunt iuda iere lxi c come together agayne heythen among bene scatred dwel lande iuda men wemen chyldren kynges daughter nabuzaradan chefe captayne lefte godoliah sonne ahikam sonne saphan caried awaye also prophet ieremy baruch sonne neriah came egypte obedyent vnto commaundemēt god thus came thaphnis taphnis worde lorde happened vnto ieremy sayinge take great stone thyne hande hyde brycke wall vnder dore pharaos house thaphnis al men iuda may se saye vnto thē thus sayeth lorde hoostes god israell iere xlvi c beholde wyll sende call nabuchodonosor kynge babylon seruaunte wyll set seate vpon stone haue hyd shall sprede hys tente ouer commeth shall smyte lande egypte slaughter presonment y• swearde shall set fyre vpon temple egypcyans goddes burne vp take thē selues presoners moreouer shall araye selfe lande egypte lyke shepherde putteth hys • ore shall departe way thence peace pylers also ☞ temple sunne egypte shall breake peces burne temple egypcyans goddes ¶ reproueth people theyr idolatry set lyght threatynge lorde chastenad desteruicion egypt iewes therin prophecied capi xliiii thys worde shewed ieremy concernyng al iewes whyche dwelte egypte mygdol thaphnis noph lāde patures thus sayeth lorde hoostes god israell ye haue sene mysery haue brought vpon ierusalem vpon al cyties iuda day desolate man dwelling therin greate blasphemy committed prouoke vnto anger wente backe sacryfyce worshype vnto straūge goddes neyther ye father haue knowne howbeit sent vnto seruauntes al prophetes iere xxv • xxix • rose vp early sent vnto thē gaue warninge suche abhomynable thynges thynges hate wolde folowe herken turne wyckednes nomore sacryfyce vnto straunge goddes wherfore myne indygnacyon wrathe kyndled brente vp cytyes iuda feldes stretes ierusalem made waste desolate come passe day nowe therfore thus sayeth lorde hoostes god israel howe happeneth ye great euel vnto youre owne soules thus destroye men wemen chyldrē babe iuda none left ye prouoke vnto wrathe worckes youre owne handes ye offre vnto straunge goddes lāde egipt ye gone dwel ye might vttterly perishe ye myght reuiled shamefully intreated nacyons haue ye nowe forgotten wyckednes forefather wyckednes kinges iuda wyues wyckednes ye selues wyues haue done lāde iuda stretes ierusalem yet ye sory thys daye ye feare nether walke ye lawe commaundemētes haue geuen vnto youre forefather therfore thus sayeth lorde hoostes god israell stedfastly aduysed determyned punyshe rote iuda remnaunte iuda purposly wente egypte dwell wyll take iere xiii c x ••• • shall al destrayed lande egipte shall perishe beynge consumed swearde honger least moost shall peryshe swearde honger moreouer shalbe reuyled abhorred shamed confounded wyll vyset dwell egypt ie xxxix • haue vysyted ierusalem swearde honger pestylence none remnaunte iuda whiche gone dwell egypte shall left con • e agayne lande iuda al though thinke come thyther agayne dwell none shall come agayne suche fled awaye men whiche knewe theyr wyues offred vnto straunge goddes great sorte wyues stode yee al people dwelt egipt cytye patures answerde ieremy sayde wordes thou hast spokē vnto v name lord wyll wyse heare soeuer goeth owne mouthe wyll wyll sacryfyce offre oblacions vnto quene heauen iere vii b like forefather kinges heades haue done city iuda stretes feldes ierusalem plenteousnesse vytales prosperyte mysfortune came vpon v • mac b sen lefte offre sacryfice vnto quene heauen haue scarcenes al thīges perishe swearde honger laste wemen dyd sacrifice offred vnto quene heauen dyd make cake poure vnto drinkoffringes seruice without oure husbandes wylles sayde ieremy vnto people men wemen folcke whiche geuen hym answere dyd lorde remembre sacryfices ye youre forefather youre kinges ruler people haue offred cyties iuda stretes land ierusalem hath consydred mide much lord might longer suffre wyckednes youre inuencyons abhomynable thynges ye dyd esay • youre lande desolate voyde yee abhorred man dwelleth therin eny come passe daye 3 reg 18 b ieremi 2 • 3 c • 5 e dyd happen vnto ye made sacrifice synned agaynst lorde baruc iii ye haue folowed voyce walcke hys lawe ordynaunces statute yee thys cause mysfortune happened vnto come passe day moreouer ieremy spake vnto al people wemen heare worde lord al iuda ye lande egypte thus sayeth lorde hostes god israel ye youre wiues haue spoken youre owne mouthe thynge ye haue fulfylled dede iere 44 c yee thus haue ye sayde wyl fayle perfourme vowes haue vowed wyll sacryfice powre dryncke offrynges quene heauen purposly wyll ye set vp owne meanynges perfourme youre vowes therfore heare worde lorde iuda ye dwell lande egypte beholde gen xxii c haue sworne greate name sayeth lorde name shall rehearsed thorowe man mouth iuda lande egypte saye lorde god lyueth wyl watche plage theyr wealthe iere xiii c men iuda lande egypte shall peryshe wyth swearde honger vntyl vtterly destroyed neuerthelesse fled awaye swearde shal come againe land iuda shall fewe remnaunte iuda gone egypte dwell shall knowe whose wordes shalbe founde true theyrs myne take thys token wyll vyset thys place sayeth lorde ye maye knowe howe without doute wyll perfourme purpose vpō punish beholde saieth lorde wyll deliuer pharao hophrea kynge egypte handes enemyes seke lyfe 4 reg 25▪ • iere 39 b euen gaue zedekias kynge iuda handes nabuchodonosor kynge babylō enemy sought lyfe ¶ baruch reproued ef ieremye capi xlv wordes ieremy prophet spake vnto baruch y• sōne neriah iere 36 • written sermon boke mouthe ieremy fourth yeare iehohakim sonne iosias kynge iuda sayinge thus sayeth lorde god israell vnto baruch moche thou thoughtest thus whē thou wast wrytynge wo lorde hathe geuen payne trauayle haue weeryed selfe syghynge haue founde reste therfore tell ieremy lord sayeth thus beholde thynge haue buylded wyl breake downe agayne rote thing haue planted yee whole lande sekest thou yet promocyon loke desyre wyll brynge myserable plage vpon fleshe sayeth lorde iere xxi b thy lyfe wyl geue pray place wher euer thou goest ¶ prophecyeth destruccyon egypte delyu • • aunce promysed israel capi xlvi folowe wordes lord prophete ieremye whiche spake agaynste gentyles wordes folowynge preached esai xix xx 〈◊〉 egypcyans concernynge hoste pharao necho kynge egypte eze 29 30 31 4 24 b charcamis besyde water euphrates tyme nabuchodonosor kynge babylon slewe fourthe yeare iehohakim sonne iosias kynge iuda ier xxxi make redy buckler shylde go forth fyght harnesse horse set youre selues vpō set salettes fast bryng forth speares scoure youre swerdes put breste plate ala howe happeneth se afrayed shryncke ye backe theyr worthyes slayne yee runne fast awaye none loketh behynde fearfulnes fallen vpon euerychone sayeth lorde lyghteste fote shall fle awaye worthyes shall escape towarde northe water euphrates dyd stōble fall swelleth vp flou de roarynge ragyng lyke streames water egypte ryseth vp lyke floude casteth water greate noyse sayde wyll go vp wyll couer earthe wyll destroye cytye therin get vp ye horse roll ye charettes come worthies▪ ye morians ye lybeans youre buckler ye lydea • youre bowes thys daye lorde god hoostes daye vengeaunce may avenge enemyes swearde shal deuoure shall besatysfyed bathed theyr bloude lorde god hoostes shall haue slayne offerynge towarde northe water euphrates go vp gilead brynge tryacle vnto daughter egypte vayne shalte thou go surgery thy wounde shall stopped heythen haue hearde thy shaine lande full thy confusion one strong man dyd stomble vpon another fallen together ier xliii b wordes lord spake prophet ieremy concernynge cō mynge nabuchodonosor kynge babylon whiche sente destroye lande egypte preach thorowe lande egypte cause proclamed mygool noph taphnis saye stande styl make redye swearde shall consume rounde aboute howe happeneth thy myghtye worthyes fallen stode fast euen lord thrust downe slaughter greate one fell euer styl vpon another one cried vpō another let v go agayne oure owne people owne natural countre cruell swearde▪ dyd crye euen pharao kyng egypte time wyl bringe sedicion truly lyue sayeth kynge e • 4 •• li • whose name lorde hostes shal come moūt thabor lybanus yf stode see thou daughter egypte make redy thy geer flit noph shalbe voide desolate mā shal dwel therin lande egipt like goodly faire calf one shal come north pricke forward wagied soudiers hyr lyke fat calues also shall fle awaye together abyde daye theyre slaughter tyme theyr visytacyon shal come vpon crye shall make noyse blast trompete shall entre theyr hoostes come ax hewer downe wod shall cut downe wod sayeth lorde shall mo nōbre greshoppers man shalbe able tell daughter egypte confounded deliuered hādes people northe thus sayeth lorde hoostes god israell behold wyll vyset restlesse people alexandria pharao egypte yee bothe theyr goddes theyr kynges euen pharao put theyr truste hym yee wyll delyuer handes seke theyr lyues namely power nabuchodonosor kynge babylon power seruauntes thynges shalbe inhabyted afore time saieth lorde thou afrayed seruaunte iacob feare thou israel lo wyl helpe farre thy sede lande theyr captiuite iacob also shal come againe rest shal prospere man shal ha •• e feare thou iacob seruaunt sayth lord • wyll destroye nacyons amonge haue scatred neuerthelesse wyll consume chasten correcte yee discrecion neyther wyll spare one fautelesse ¶ worde lorde agaynst philistirles capi xlvii wordes lord spake vnto ieremye prophete agaynst philistine pharao smote cite azah thus sayth lord beholde shal water aryse north shall growe greate floude runnynge ouer couerynge lande cittes dwel therin men shall crye dwell lande shall mourne noise stampynge theyr stronge barbed horse shakynge theyr charettes romblyng wheles father shal loke theyr chyldren feable wery shal handes tyme shalbe destroye whole lande phylistines shal make wast tyrus sydon sworne vnto lorde wyll destroye philistine remnaunt ile caphtor ☜ baldenes come vpon azah ascalon valley shall kepe peace howe longe wilt thou sleye thou swearde lorde whan wylt thou ceasse turne agayne thy swete rest leaue howe ceasse lord hym selfe hath geuen charge agaynst ascalon raysed vp agaynst city see coste ¶ worde lorde agaynst moabites capi xlviii thus sayeth lorde hoostes god israel agaynst esay xv • • vi 〈◊〉 b ezec xxv▪ b 〈◊〉 eph ii b moab wo cytie nebo layed waste brought confusyon kariathia • im taken mysgab brought shame frayed moab boste nomore hesebon haue deuysed agaynst come shal say let v rote may nomore amonge nombre gentile thou madman maye nomore thought vpon swearde shal persecute voyce shall crye horonaim great wastynge destruccion moab made desolate chyldren coulde tell crye thereof goynge vp vnto luyth hearese lamentacion mournyng downe towarde horonaim herde cruell deadely crye get awaye saue lyues lyke vnto heeth wyldernes esay 〈◊〉 b iere▪ xvii b ezec xxix • thou hast trusted chine owne workes treasure thou shalt takē chamos prestes prince shall go away captyuyte destroyet shall come vpon al cyties none shall escape valley shalbe destroyed feldes shalbe layed waste lyke lorde hath spoken make token vnto moab get away spedely cyties shalbe made desolate man shall dwell therin cursed dothe worcke lorde neglygently cursed kepeth backe iere 47 b swearde sheddyng bloude moab hath euer bene ryche careles youth vp hath syttē taken ease treasure neuer yet put one vessell another y• neuer went away captiuice therfore taste remayneth sauoure yet chaunged lo tyme cōmeth sayeth lord shall sende trussers trusse vp prepare season vessel ye tanckerdes tatell shake • ro moab shalbe ashamed chamos lyke israell ashamed 3 • xi • ▪ bethel wherein put trust wherfore ye thynke thus mightye stronge men warre moab destroyed cyties brent vp chosen yong men slayne sayeth kyng whose name lorde hoostes destruccion moab commeth pace fall hande al neyghbours shal mourne al knowe name shall say howe happeneth strong staf goodly rod thus broken thou daughter dibon come downe frō thy glory syt pouertie destroyeth moab shal come vp also breake downe thy stronge holdes thou dwellest aroer get strete loke aboute aske fled escaped say thinge happened moab confounded ouercome▪ mourne crye tell arnon y• moab destroyed misery shal come vpon playne lande namely vpon holon iahazah vpon mephaath dibon vpon nabo house deblathaim vpon cariathiarim vpon house gamul vpon house maon carioth vpon bozrah city lande moab whether lye farre neare ⚜ horne moab smyten downe arme broken sayeth lorde make droncken magnyfieth herselfe lorde men may clappe handes vomite also may laughed scorne israel shalte thou laugh scorne taken monge theues yee thy wordes thou hast spoken agaynste hym thou shalt driuen awaye yee moabites shall leaue cyties dwel rockes stone become lyke doues make nestes hole nume 25 moabs pryde haue herde verye hye mynded knowe stoutenesse bostynge arrogancye pryde stomacke sayeth lorde furtousnesse maye neyther vpholde strength dede therfore shall mournynge made moab euery man shal cry moabs sake lamentacyon shalbe made men stande vpon wall wyll mourne also iazar thou vyneyarde sabamah thy wyne braunches shall come oueresai xvi b iere x • ix c see braunches iazer vnto see destroyer shall breake thy haruest grape gatherynge myrth cheare shalbe taken away tymbre felde whole lande moab shal swete wyne presse treader shall haue stomacke crye yee shalbe none crye vnto whiche afore tyme herde hesebon eleale iahaz whiche lyfted vp theyr voyce zoar vnto horonaim ☜ bullocke thre yeare olde water also mem • im shalbe dried vp moreouer wyll make moab ceasse sayeth lorde frome offrynges censinge hath made vnto goddes hye place wherfore herte mourneth moab lyke crowde playenge heuy songe men sake bryck wall hert mourneth also euen pype pypyth dolefull songe shalbe fewe destroyed esay xv heades shalbe shauen beerdes clypped handes bounde loynes gyrded aboute sacke clothe upon house toppes stretes moab shalbe mournynge wyll breake moab lyke vnprofytable vessell sayeth lord ohowe destroyed mourneth howe doth moab hange downe heade ashamed thus shal moab laughyng stocke derision al rounde aboute thus sayeth lorde beholde thedeut 〈◊〉 • iere 49 • enemy shall come flyenge aegle sprede wynges vpon moab shall clyme ouer walles wynne stronge holdes myghtye men hertes moab shalbe lyke herte woman trauelynge chylde moab shalbe made desolate y• shall people hathe sette vp selfe agaynst lorde esay 24 • feare pyt snare shal come vpon moab sayth lorde escapeth feare shall fall pyt getteth pyt shal taken snare wyll brynge yere visytacyon vpon moab sayth lorde able flye shall stande vnder shadowe hesebon shall go fyre hesebon flame frome syon shal burne vp proude people moab behynde wo vnto moab thou people chamos shalt perysshe yee thy sonnes daughter shall led awaye captyue yet last wyl bryng moab captiuyte agayne sayth lorde thus farre plage moab ¶ worde lord agaynst ammonytes idumea damascus cedar▪ elam capi xlix concernynge ammonytes ez • xx • • xx • • amo • • • thus lorde sayth hath israell chyldren without heyre hath kynge taken gad wherfore doth people dwell cyties beholde therfore tyme commeth sayth lorde wyll bryng noyse war rabah ammonytes lahel shalbe desolate cyties brent vp israelytes shall lordes ouer▪ possession afore sayth lord hesebon shall mourne shall roted grounde sayth lorde city ☞ rabah shal crye gyrde themselues sacke cloth shall mourne run aboute walles theyr kinges shall led awaye presoner yee preestes prynces hym wherfore trustest thou water streames flowe fro • thou fearce daughter thynkest thou art safe reason thy treasure man shall come beholde wyll brynge feare vpon saieth lord god hostes al aboute ye shal scatred euery man another man shall gather together agayne fled wyll brynge ammonytes also cap •• uite agayne esay xxi b 〈◊〉 xxv b xxxii • xxxv upon edomites hath lorde hoostes spoken maner wysdome themā good councell amonge people wysdome turned clene naught get hence turne backes crepe downe depe ye cytesyns dedan wyll bryng destruccion vpon esau yee day visitacion yf y• grape gatherer came vpon shulde leaue grape nyght robber came vpon shulde take much thought ynoughe wyll make esau bare discouer secretes shal able hide thē sede shalbe wasted away yee brethrē neyghbours selfe shall lefte behynde thou shalt leaue thy fatherlesse chyldren behynde wyll kepe thy wydowes shall take comforte thus hath lorde spoken iere xxv b e • cc •• ix b 1 p •••• 4 c beholde mē thought vnmere drink cuppe haue droken first thynkest thou fre thou shalt neither quyte fre thou must drinke also haue sworne selfe sayeth lorde bozrah shall become wyldernesse open shame laughyng stocke cursyng cyties shalbe continuall deserte perfectly infourmed y• lord hath sent message redy vnto heathen gather together go forth agaynste make ready battayle lo •••• • wyll make small amonge heathen lytle regarded amonge men esay 4 • b 〈◊〉 48 b thy hye stomake pryde thy hert hath disceyued thou wylt dwell hole stony rockꝭ haue hye mountaynes possessyon neuerthelesse thoughe thy nest hye aegles yet wyll cast downe sayeth lorde moreouer dumea shal wyldernesse 〈◊〉 〈◊〉 b 〈◊〉 19 b • • b goeth shalbe abashed wondre miserable plage 〈◊〉 xix c like sodome gomor cyties laye aboute turned vp syde downe sayeth lorde shal body dwel idumea man shal haue habitacyon beholde lyke lyon cōmeth vp pleasaūt medowes iordane vnto grene pasture etham wyll dryue make runne agaynst yonge man wyll ordayne therto lyke vnto yt wyl stryue shepherde maye stande handes psal 37 b therfore heare coūcel lord hath taken vpon idumea purpose hath deuysed vpon cytesyns theman leaste flocke shall teare peces loke fayre thynge haue shall make waste selues also noyse theyr fall earthe shall quake crye theyr voice shalbe herde vnto red see behold iere 48 • enemye shall come fle vp hyther lyke aegle sprede winges vpon bozrah shall hertes worthyes edom herte woman trauaylyng chylde e •• ▪ • vii • • •• • • upon damascus ☞ math arphad shal come cō fusion shall heare euell tydynges shalbe tossed fro lyke see stande styll damascus shalbe sore afrayed shall fly tremblynge shal come vpon sorow payne shal ouer take woman trauaylyng chylde howe shalde worshypfull glorious cytie forsaken heare therfore yonge men shall fall stretes men warre shall taken away tyme sayeth lorde hostes wyll kyndle fyre walles damascus shal consume place benhadad esay xxi • cedar kingdome hazor whome nabuchodonosor kynge babylon smote downe lorde hath spoken thus vpon aryse get vp vnto cedar destroy people toward easte theyr tentes flockes shal take away yee hangynges theyr vessell camel also shall carye awaye shall come aboute euery syde wyth fearefull crye fle get soone awaye • repe caues ye may dwell yee inhabitours hazor sayeth lorde nabuchodonosor kynge babylon hath holden councel concernyng cōcluded deuyse agaynst aryse get vp agaynst yonder riche careles people sayeth lorde whiche haue neither gatꝭ dore barres dwell alone camel shalbe stollen droues theyr cattell dryuen awaye moreouer y• shauen wyll iscater towarde wyndes bryng destruccion yee thorowe theyr owne familiers sayeth lorde hazor also shalbe dwellynge dragon euerlastyng wyldernesse body shal dwel man shal haue habitacyon wordes y• lord spake prophete ieremy concernyng ezec 32 dani 8 elā beginnyng reygne zedekiah kynge iuda thus sayeth lorde hoostes beholde wyll breake bowe elam take away theyr strength vpon elam wyl brynge foure windes foure quarter heauen wyl scatre agaynst foure wyndes shalbe people elā shal • lie vnto wyll cause elam afrayed theyr ennemies seke theyr lyues wyll brynge vpon indignacyon wrath sayeth lorde wyll persecute swearde long tyl haue brought naught wyll set stole elam wyll destroye kyng prynces thence sayeth lorde processe tyme wyll bryng elam captyuite agayne sayeth lorde ¶ prohecyeth destruc • ion babylon delyueraunce israel whiche captiuite capi l wordes lorde spake vnto prophete ieremy concernynge babylon▪ lande caldees esay xiii and▪ xlvii iere x • v b li preache amonge gentyles lette youre voyce hearde make token crye kepe sylence saye babylon wonne esa xlvi bel confounded merodach ouercome dani v yee theyr godes brought shame theyr ymages stande feare northe ☞ dothe come people agaynst whiche make lande wast body dwell therin neyther man beaste flye departe thence 1 e •• • dayes tyme sayeth lorde chyldren israel shal come chyldren iuda wepyn • makyng haste shal seke lord 〈…〉 god shall aske way 〈…〉 yther shall turne theyr face 〈…〉 hange vpon couenaunte neuer shalbe broken people hathe bene loste ier xx • ii • ezech 36▪ • flocke ☞ shepherdes haue disceyued haue made go astray vpon hylles haue gone mountaine lytle hyl forgotten theyr folde al came vpon haue deuoured theyr enemyes sayde haue made faute agaynst haue displeased lorde yee euen lorde whiche beautye theyr ryghteousnes defended theyrs father yet shall ye fle frome babilon departe lande caldees ☞ ye rammes go flocke iere l • • wyl wake vp hoste people northren lande brynge vpon babylon shal laye sege winne arrowes shal mysse lyke conning archer shuteth wronge caldees shall spoyled al spoyle shalbe satysfyed sayeth lord esay 47 • ye chereful glad treade downe myne heritage▪ fulfylled pleasure calues grasse triumphed ouer like bulles ye gotten victory mother shalbe sore confounded bare shall come shame shalbe leest set amonge nacyons voyde wasted dryed vp man shall able dwell feare lorde shal whole desolate iere 18 • 19 b 49 • go babylon shall stande styll abashed shall wondre plage go forth aray agaynst babylon rounde aboute al ye handle bowes shute spare arrowes hathe synned agaynste lorde crye vpon vpon agaynst rounde shall yelde selfe foundacyons shall fall walles shall come downe shalbe vengeaunce lorde exo xx • • leui • 4 • io •• • •• yee vengeaunce shalbe taken hath done shal dealte withal shall rote sower babylon handleth syckle haruest feare swerde enemy euery man shall gette hym owne people euery man shall flye owne lande israel scatred flocke lyon haue despersed 4 reg 〈…〉 esay • • fyrste kynge assyrian deuoured 3 reg 〈…〉 last nabuchodonosor kyng babylon hath brosed bone therfore thus sayeth lord hostes god israel beholde wyll vyset saynge babylon kyngdome 〈…〉 haue visited kynge assirians wyll brynge▪ israel agayne pleasaunte pasture may • ede vpō charmel ba • u satysfyed vpon mount ep • raim galaad 〈…〉 c dayes tyme sayeth lorde ☞ yf offence israel besought shal none founde yf men enquere synne iuda shalbe none wyll mercyfull vnto suffer remayne ouer go downe thou auenger enemy lāde viset dwel therin downe smyte vpon backes sayeth lorde according al haue commaunded gone aboute lande crye slaughter • reat murthur namely thꝭ maner howe happeneth hāmer whole worlde thus broken brosed sonder howe chaūceth babylon become wyldernes amonge heathen thys maner selfe haue layed wayte thou art takē vnawares art thou trapped snared thou haste prouoked lorde vnto anger lorde hathe opened house ordinaunce brought forth weapens wrath y• thing done lande caldees lorde hostes worcke thynges shal come vpon laste shall breake preuy chambres shall leaue bare stone layed together vpon heapes shal destroye nothing shalbe left▪ shal sleye al theyr myghtie souldyers put death wo vnto daye tyme theyr vysitacion hande thynke heare ready crye fled escaped lande babylon shewe syō vengeaunce lorde god vengeaūce temple yee voyce thē crye agaynst babylō cal vp al archer agaynst babylon pytch • ntes rounde none escape 〈◊〉 • • apo xviii • recompence hathe deserued accordynge hath done deale agayne hathe 2 〈◊〉 • set vp selfe agaynste lorde holy one israel therfore shall yonge men fall downe stretes men warre shalbe roted daye sayeth lorde beholde speake vnto thou pro • de sayeth lorde god hostes thy daye shall come euen tyme thy vysytacyon proude shall stomble fall man shall helpe hym vp wyll burne vp hys cytyes fyre shall consume rounde aboute hym thus sayeth lorde hostes chyldred israell iuda suffer violence together haue captyuyte kepe faste wyll nat let go theyr auenger redemer myghtye whose name lorde hostes shall maynteyne theyr cause shal make lande shake iudge dwel therin one another swearde shall come vpon caldees sayeth lorde vpon dwell babylon vpon theyr prynces vpon theyr wyse men swearde vpon theyr sothsayers shall become fooles swearde vpon theyr worthyes shall stande feare swearde vpon theyr horsmen charettes vpon comen people dwell vnder shall become lyke wemen swearde vpon theyr treasure shall stolen awaye swearde vpon theyr water shalbe dryed vp lande worshyppeth ymages delyteth straunge wondrefull thynges therfore shall wylde beestes ape estriches dwel therin shall neuer man dwel neyther shall man haue habytacyon euermore lyke god destroyed gene xix • sodome gomorre cyties laye aboute sayeth lorde shall man dwell also neyther shall man haue habytacyon 〈◊〉 l b deut 28 c beholde shal come people north great bonde men many kynges shall stande vp endes earth beare bowes buclers cruell vnmercyfull theyr voyce roareth lyke ragyng see ryde vpon horse come weapened fyght agaynst babilon soone kynge babylon hereth tel thē hys handes shall waxe feable soro • ee heuynes shal come vpō hī womā trauelynge chylde beholde iere xlix • lyke lyon commeth vp pleasaunt medowes iordane vnto grene pasture ethan wyll dryue thē forth make ru •• e agaynst shal chose ordayne thynge iob xli lyke wyl stryne shepherde may stāde agaynste therfore heare councel lorde hathe geuen vpon babylon deuyce hathe taken vpon lande caldees least amonge people shall teare peces loke pleasaūt thyng haue shal laye wast noyse wynnynge babylon shall moue earth crye shalbe herde amonge gentyles ¶ howe babylon shulde ouerthrowen ieremy geueth boke saraias capi li thvs hath lorde sayde iere xxv b and▪ l beholde wyll rayse vp perlous wynde agaynst babylon cytezēs beare euell wyll agaynste wyll fende also babylon fanners fanne destroye lande daye trouble shalbe euery syde moreouer lorde hathe sayde vnto bowe men clyme ouer walles brest plate yee shal nat spare yonge men kyll downe hoost thus sleyne shal fal downe lande caldees wounded stretes •••• l israel iuda shall nat forsaken theyr god lorde hostes ye holyone israel though haue fylled al theyr lande full synne esay 48 flye awaye babylon euery man saue lyfe let man holde tunge wyckednes tyme lordes vengaūce come yee shall rewarde agayne babylon hathe bene lordes hande ☞ iere xxv c golden cuppe maketh landes droncken wyne haue people droncken therfore theyr wyttes esay xxi b apo • 18 sodenly babylon fallen destroyed mourne brynge plaster woundes yf maye peraduenture healed agayne wolde haue made babylon whole sayeth nat recouered therfore wyll let alone go euery man owne countre iudgement come heauen gone vp cloudes therfore come wyll shewe syon worcke lorde oure god make sharpe arowes fyll quyuers iudit ii c • •• g xi c lodre shal rayse vp sprete kynge meeades whiche hath ready desyre destroye babylō thys shalbe vengaunce lorde vengaunce temple set vp token vpon walles babylon make youre watch stronge set youre watch men araye yee holde preuye watch yet shall lorde go forth deuyce whiche hath taken vpon dwell babylon thou dwellest greate water thou hast great treasure rich thyne ende come rekenynge thy wynninges amos vi • iere▪ xxli • lorde hoostes hath sworne hym selfe wyll ouer whelme men lyke greshoppers nombre corage shall crye alarum alarum agaynste iere 135 b▪ yee euen lorde hoostes power made earth hys wysdome prepared roūde worlde discrecion spred heauens soone letteth hys voyce herde water ayre waxe fearce psa • 35 • draweth vp cloudes endes earth turneth lightenynges rayne bryngeth wyndes theyr secrete place reason wysdome men become fooles esa 44 c bar • vi • cō founded caster ymages thynge make dysceate hathe breath uayne worthy laughed tyme vysitacion shall perishe neuertheles porcyon iacob none suche made thynges whose name lorde hoostes rodde enheritaunce thou breakest weapens warre yet thorowe haue scatred nacions kingdomes thorowe haue scatred horse horse man yee charrectes suche sat vpō thorowe haue scatred man woman olde yonge bacheler mayden thorowe haue scatred shepherde flocke husbande mā catell prynces ruler therfore wyll rewarde cytie babylon cytesins caldees al euel haue done vnto syon yee ye youre selues shall se sayeth lorde beholde come vpon ☞ thou noysome hyl sayeth ye lorde thou destroyest landes wyl stretch hande ouer cast downe stony rockes wyll make brente hyll neyther corner stone pynnacles foundacyon stone shalbe taken wast desolate shalt thou lye euer sayeth lorde set vp tokē ye lande blowe trō pettes amonge heithen prouoke nacions agaynst cal ye kyngdomes ararat meum ascanes agaynst set prynce agaynst brynge greate sorte horse agaynste yf greshoppers prepare agaynste people meedes theyr kynges prynces theyr chefe ruler yee whele lande vnder lande also shall shake afrayed deuice lorde shal come forth agaynste babylon make lande babylon waste man shall dwell therin worthyes babilon shall leaue batayl kepe selues stronge holdes theyr strength hathe fayled shalbe lyke wemen theyr dwellynge place shalbe brente vp theyr barres shalbe broken one purseuaunt shal meate another yee one poste shall come another brynge kynge babylon tydynges cytie takē euery syde foordes occupyed fennes brent vp soudyers sore afrayed thus sayeth lorde hoostes god israell daughter babylon hathe bene tyme lyke thresshyng floore shortly shall haruest come nabuchodonosor kynge babylon hathe deuoured destroyed hathe made mean emptye vessell swalowed vp lyke dragon fylled hys bely delycates hathe caste hathe taken substaunce awaye thyng lefte hath caryed vnto babylon sayeth daughter dwelleth syon yee bloude also vnto caldees sayeth ierusalem therfore thus sayeth lorde beholde wyll defende thy cause auenge wyl drinke vp see drye vp water sprynges eso xii c babylon shall become heape stone dwellynge place dragon fearfulnes wondrynge man dwelleth shall roare together lyke lyon yonge lyon angrye shall bende selues theyr heate shal set dryncke shalbe droncken ioye iere ii b shall slepe euerlastynge slepe neuer wake sayeth lorde shall carye downe slayne lyke shepe lyke wether goates howe ☞ sesach wonne howe glorye whole lande taken howe happeneth babylon wondred amonge heathen see rysen ouer babylon hathe couered hys greate waues cyties layde waste lande lyeth vnbuylded voyde lande man dwelleth man trauaylleth thorowe moreouer iere esa lxvi • dan 14 wyll vyset bell babylon thyng hath swalowed vp▪ shall plucke hys mouth gentyls also shall runne nomore vnto hym yee walles babylon shall fall people esa lii b 2 cor vi c come babylon euery man maye saue hys lyfe frō fearfull wrath lorde nat faynte herted ☞ feate nat euery rumoure shalbe herde lāde euery yeare bryngeth newe tydynges yee straung wickednes lordeshyppe lo tyme commeth wyll vyset ymages babylon whole lande shalbe cō founded yee slayne shall lye myddest heauen earth vith therin shall reioyce ouer babylon destroyer shal come vpon frō north sayeth lorde iere l c lyke babylon hathe beaten downe slayne many israel shal fall many slayne kyngdome ye haue escaped swearde hast stande nat styll remembre lorde farre thynke vpon ierusalem ashamed heare blasphemyes face couered shame straūge aleauntes came sanctuary lorde wherfore beholde sayeth lorde tyme commeth wyll vyset ymages babylon thorowe whole lande shall mourne fall iere xlix though babylō clymed vp heauen kept power hye yet shall sende destroyer sayeth lorde piteous crye shalbe hearde babylon agreat mysery lande caldees lorde destroyeth thē dryueth hye stomacke proude bostynge wherwith haue bene furious waues great water floudes made greate crake theyr wordes destroyer shall come vpon euen vopon babylon whiche shall take theyr worthyes breake theyr bowes god dysposed auenge hym selfe vpon suffycyently recompence yee sayeth lorde wyll make theyr prynces theyr wyse men theyr chefe ruler theyr worthyes droncken shall slepe euerlastynge slepe neuer wake thus sayeth kynge whose name lorde hostes moreouer thus sayeth lorde hostes thycke wall babylō shalbe broken hye gate shalbe brent vp thynge gentyles people haue wrought great trauayle laboure shall come naught consumed fyre thys charge ieremy gaue vnto saraiah sōne neriah sōne maasiah went towarde babylon zedekiah kynge iuda iiij yeare hys raygne nowe thys saraiah peaceable prynce ieremy wrote booke mesery shulde come vpon babylon yee sermon wrytten agaynste babylon gaue saraiah thys charge thou commest vnto babylon se thou reade wordes saye lorde thou arte determyned rote place neyther people catell shall dwell lye wast euer thou hast redde booke bynde stone caste myddest euphrates saye euen thus shall babylon syncke thrust downe burthen trouble wyll brynge vpō shall neuer come vp agayne thus farre preachīges ieremy ¶ repeteth takynge zedekiah ierusalem takē chaldee zedekeas sonnes kylled face hys eye put cytie burned tēple spoyled robbed lafte ierusalem caryed babylon kynge ieoakyn brought forth preson fed lyke kynge capi lii zedekiah 4 24 2 pat 36 b one xxx yeare olde whē made kynge raygned eleuen yeare ierusalem hys mother name hamutall ieremyes daughter lybna lyued wyckedly lorde euen ieoakin dyd lorde angry ierusalem iuda longe tyll cast presence zedekiah fel kynge babylō iere 39 4 25 nynth yeare raygne tenth moneth tenth day moneth happened nabuchodonosor kynge babylon al hoste came ierusalem beseged made bulworkes roūde thys besegynge cytie endured vnto eleuēth yeare kynge zedekiah 4 25 iere 38 b xxxix fourth moneth ix daye moneth great honger cytie vytayles people lande soudyers bruke awaye fled cytye nyght thorowe waye porte betwene two walles kynges garden nowe chaldee cōpassed cytie roūde yet went men theyr waye towarde wyldernes caldees folowed vpon thē toke zedekiah kynge felde iericho hoost runne hym caryed kynge awaye prysoner reblath vnto kynge babylon lande hemath iere 3 • • gaue iudgement vpon hym kynge babylon also caused zedekias sonnes slayne face yee put prynces iuda death reblath moreouer put eye zedekiah caused bounde cheynes caried vnto babylon let hym lye preson tyll dyed nowe tenth daye fyfth moneth y• nynth yeare nabuchodonosor kyng babylon nabusaradan chefe captayne kynge babylon seruauntes came vnto ierusalem brent vp house lorde brent vp also kynges palace house y• gorgeous buyldynges ierusalem whole hoost chaldee chefe captayne brake downe walles ierusalem rounde aboute poore people suche folke yet left cytie also fallen kynge babylon yee people yet remayned nabusaradan chefe captayne caryed awaye presoners poore people countre dyd nabuzaradan chefe captayne leaue lande occupy vyne ardes feldes caldees also brake brasen pyllers house lord yee seate brasen lauer house lorde caryed metall vnto babylon toke awaye also cauldrous shouels flesh hokes sprinkler spones brasen vessell occupyed seruyce basens colepannes sprynklers pottes candelstyckes spones cuppes wherof golde syluer chefe captayne toke also two pyllers lauer twelue brasen bullockes stode vnder y• seate 3 ••• kyng salomon made house lorde vessel conteyned much metal might nat weyed euery piller eyghtene cupyres hye rope yt went aboute twelue cubytes foure fyngers thycke rounde nowe vpon rope brasen knoppes euery knoppe fyue cubytes hye vpon knoppes whopes pomgranates roūde aboute cleane brasse maner bothe pyllers fashyoned pomgranates whereof hundreth xcvj whiche hanged vpon whopes rounde aboute chefe captaine also toke sariah hye prest sophoniah chefe nexte hym thre kepers treasury toke cytie chamberlayne captayne souldyers seuen men kynges seruauntes whiche founde citie sepher captayne vsed muster men warre threscore men countre taken cytie nabuzaradan chefe captayne toke caried kynge babylon vnto reblath kynge babylon caused put death reblath lande hemath thus iuda led awaye captyue hys owne lande people whome nabuchodonosor led away captiuie seueth yere raygne caryed away iewes thre thousand thre twenty xviij yeare nabuchodonosor caried awaye ierusalem eyght hundreth thirtye two personnes xxiij yeare nabuchodonosor nabuzaradan chefe captayne toke awaye seuen hundreth fourty fyue iewes presoners whole summe presoners foure thousande syxe hundreth xxxvij yeare iehoacin kynge iuda caryed away xxv daye xij moneth euilmerodach kynge babilon yeare reygned gaue iehoacin kynge iuda pardon let hym preson spake louyngly hym set trone aboue trones kynges babylon chaunged also clothes preson yee dyd eate hym al lyfe longe contynuall lyuynge geuen hym kynge babylon euery day certayne thynge alowed hym dayes lyfe vntyll dyed ¶ ende boke prophete ieremye ❧ lamentary ons ieremye ¶ happened israel brought captyuyte ierusalem destroyed ieremy prophet sat wepynge sorowfully bewayled ierusalem syghynge howlynge heuy wofull herte sayde capivlo ala howe sitteth cytie desolate somtyme full people howe become lyke wydowe 2 reg 4 4 xv whiche lady nacyons howe brought vnder trybute ☞ ruled landes wepeth sore nyght teares runne downe chekes amonge louers none geueth cōforte iob vi • yee nexte frendes abhorre become ennemyes iuda taken presoner defyled seruynge many straunge goddes dwelleth nowe among heithen fyndeth rest persecuted toke dwelleth amonge enemyes streates sion mourne man cōmeth solempne feastes gate desolate preestes make lamentacyon maydens carefull herselfe great heuynesse enemyes fallen vpon heade haue put shame lorde hath chastened greate wyckednes ier • lii chyldren led awaye captiue theyr enemy beautye daughter syon away prynces become lyke wether fynde pasture dryuen away theyr ennemye haue nomore power nowe dothe ierusalem remembre tyme mysery disobedyence yee ioye pleasure hath tymes paste seyng people brought downe thorowe power theyr enemy man helpe enemyes stande lokynge laugh sabbath dayes scorne ierusalem hath synned euer therfore come decaye honoure despyse haue sene fylthynes yee sygheth ashamed herselfe ☞ skyrtes defyled remembred wolde folowe therfor fore fall great man comforte lorde consydre trouble myne enemy hath vpperhande enemye hathe put hande precyous thinges yee euē eye came heythen saynctuarydeute 23 c thou neuerthelesse haste forbydden come within thy congregacyon 4 rer vi c treno 〈◊〉 c al people seke theyr bread heuinesse loke precious thyng euery man hath geueth meate saue lyfe consydre lorde se howe vyle become ye go fore holde se sorow lyke vnto myne wherwith lorde hathe troubled daye fearefull wrath ⚜ aboue hath sent downe fyre bone chastened hathe layed net fete thorowen wyde open hath made desolate y• must euer mournyng yoke trans gressyon come laste hande hathe taken vp put aboute necke strēgth gone lord hath delyuered handes wherout quyte selfe lorde hath destrroyed al myghtye men hath proclaymed feast slaughter al best men lord hath trodē downe daughter iuda lyke wyne presse iere 4 • treno 〈◊〉 c therfore wepe myne eye gushe water comforte shulde quyckē farre fro chyldren dryuen awaye enemy hath gotten ouerhande sion casteth handes man cōforte lord hath layed enemyes rounde aboute iacob ierusalē become abhominacion myddest dani • x lord rightuous haue prouoked coūtenaunce vnto anger take hede ye people consydre heuynesse maydens younge men led away captiuite called louers begyled prestes councellers perished euen whyle sought meate saue theyr lyfes treno 〈◊〉 c consydre lord howe troubled wombe disqueted hert turneth ful heuinesse swearde hurteth wt within lyke vnto death heare mournynge none wyl cōforte myne enemy haue herde trouble glad ther thou hast done thou shalt brynge forth tyme also shalbe lyke vnto shal come al aduersitie thou shalte plucke awaye euen thou hast plucked wyckednes sorow great herte heuy capi ii ala treno 4 b hath lord darkened daughter syon sore hys wrath honour israel hath cast downe heauen happeneth remembred owne 1 pat 29 psal 8 8 • fote stole angrye lorde hath cast downe glory iacob fauoure stronge place daughter iuda hathe broken hys wrathe throwen downe grounde kyngdome prynces hath suspended wrath indignacyon hathe broken ☞ horne israel hath wt drawen hꝭ ryght hande frome enemy yee flame fyre kyndgled iacob hathe consumed vp al roūde hath bent bowe lyke enemy hathe fastened ryght hande aduersarye euery thynge y• pleasaūt se hath smiten downe hath poured wrath lyke fyre tabernacle daughter syon lorde become lyke enemy hath cast downe israel al hꝭ place yee stronge holdes hathe destroyed fylled daughter iuda muche sorowe heuynesse iere vli • tabernacle whiche lyke garden pleasure hath destroyed hye lēpne feastes hath put downe lorde hath brought passe hye solempne feastes sabbathes sion cleane forgotten heuye displeasure hath made kyng prestes despysed lord hath forsaken owne aulter wroth owne sainctuary hathe geuen walles theyr towres handes enemy enemyes made noyse house lorde bene solēpne feast day lorde thought breake downe walles daughter syon spred lyne drewe hys hande tyll hadde destroyed therefore mourne turrettes broken walles together porte casten downe groūde barres broken smytten sonder iere 〈◊〉 • kynge prynces caryed awaye gentyls haue neyther la •• prophetes yet vision frō lorde senatours daughter syon syt vpon grounde sylence haue strawed asthes vpon theyr heades gyrded selues sacke cloth maydens ierusalem hange downe theyr heades grounde myne eye begyn fayle thorowe wepynge treno • body disquyeted lyuer poured vpon earth great hurt people seyng chyldren babe dyd swowne streates cytye euen spake theyr mother meate drynke whyle sayde fell downe stretes cytie lyke bene wounded dyed theyr mother bosome shall saye thou daughter ierusalem shall lyken shal cōpare yu daughter syon comforte withall thy hurte lyke mayne see may heale iere v b 14 b 23 c 27 b 29 b thy prophetes haue loked vaine folysh thinges haue shewed thy wyckednes kepe captiuite haue ouerladen thorowe falshed scatred abrode al go clappe theyr handes hissing waggyng heades vpon daughter ierusalem saye cyte men cal fayre wherin whole lande reioyseth thyne enemyes gape vpon whysperyng bytyng theyr teth sayinge let v deuoure tyme loked come haue founde sene lorde hath fulfylled thynge purposed ꝑfourmed deuysed longe go hath destroyed spared hath caused thin aduersary triūp ouer set vp horne thyne enemy • ute 4 c xxx • iere 29 • let thyne herte crye vnto lorde yu cyte daughter syon let thy teares runne downe lyke ryuer daye nyght rest let aple thyne cye leaue stāde vp make thy prater first watch nyght poure thyne herte lyke water lorde lyfte vp thyne handes lyues thy yonge child dye honger stretes beholde lorde consydre haste thou gathered vp cleane shal wemē eate owne frute euen chyldren spāne longe shal prestes prophetes slayne thus sayntuary lorde yong olde lye behinde stretes vpon groūde maydens yong men slayne swearde whome thou daye thy wrathefull indignacyon hast put deathe yee euen thou haste put death spared neighbour rounde aboute haste thou called feast daye daye lordes wrathe none escaped neyther lefte behynde brought vp norished hath myne enemy destroyed capi 〈◊〉 iam man thorowe rodde wrath haue experience mysery droue forth led yee darkenesse lyght agaynst onely turneth hande layeth
