euer vpon slesshe skynne hath made olde bone hath brused hath buylded rounde closed gall trauayle hath set darckenes deade euer hathe hedged get hath layed heuy lynckes vpon thoughe crye call pyteously yet heareth prayer hathe stopped vp wayes foure squared stone made pathes croked layeth wayte lyke beare lyon hole hathe marred way broken peces hath laied wast together hath bente hys bowe made marke shut arowes quyuer hath shot euen reynes iere xx b laughed scorne people make songes vpon daye longe hath fylled bitternes geuen wormwod drynke hath smitten teeth peces rolled dust hathe put soule reste forget good thynges thought selfe vn done hope lorde remēbre yet mysery trouble wormwod gall yee thou shalte remembre soule melteth awaye whyle cōsidre thinges herte get hope agayne namely mercyes lorde cleane gone louynge kyndnesse ceasseth hys faythfulnes greate renueth selfe mornynge psal xvi lorde porcyon sayeth soule therfore wyl hope hym howe good lord vnto thē put theyr trust soule seketh hym howe good stylnes wayte tary health lorde howe good man take yoke vpon hym youth vp sytteth alone holdeth hym styll dwelleth quyetly hym selfe layeth face vpon earth yf percase happen hope offereth cheke smyter wyll content reproues lorde wyll forsake euer 3 reg • thoughe cast yet accordynge multytude mercyes receaueth grace agayne doth plage caste chyldren men herte treade prysoners earthe vnder fete moue iudgement man highest condempne man cause lorde hath pleasure suche thynges sayth shulde somthynge done without lordes commaundement mouth mooste hyghest goeth euell good wherfore murmureth lyuinge man let hym murmure owne synne iob xxxi b psal 14 u let v loke well vpon owne wayes remember selues turne agayne lorde let v lyfte vp hertes handes vnto lorde heuen haue bene dissembler haue offended wylt thou therfore intreated thou haste couered v thy wrath persecuted v thou hast slayne v without fauoure eccle 35 thou hast hyd thy selfe cloud prayer shulde go thorow thou hast made v outcaste despysed amonge people enemyes gape vpon v feare snare come vpon v yee despite destruccyon whole ryuers water gusshe myne eye great hurte people myne eye runne ceasse rest lorde wylt thou loke downe heauen cousydre myne eye breaketh herte daughter cytie myne enemyes hunted sharpely lyke byrde yee without cause haue put downe lyfe pytte layed stone vpon poured water vpon heade thought nowe vndone called vpon thy name lorde depe pyt thou hast herde voyce hast turned awaye thyne eares fro syghynge cryenge thou hast enclyned thy selfe vnto called vpon hast sayd feare thou lorde hast mayntyened y• cause soule hast redemed lyfe lorde thou hast sene blasphemer take thou cause vpon thou hast well consydred howe go aboute harme theyre councels agaynst thou hast herde theyr despyteful wordes lorde yee theyr ymaginacyons agaynst lyppes myne enemy theyr deuyces take agaynst day longe thou seyst also theyr syttyng downe theyr rysyng vp make theyr songes nothynge rewarde lorde accordyng workes theyr hā de geue thynge theyr owne herte afrayed euen thy curse persecute lorde thyne indignacion rote frome vnder heauen capi iiii howe golde become dymme howe goodly colour sore chaunged stone sayntuary thus scatred corner euery strete chyldren sion alway honour clothed precyous golde howe nowe become lyke erthen vessel whiche made potter hande dragon geue theyr yonge one sucke bare brestes daughter people cruell dwelleth wyldernesse lyke estriches tonges suckynge chyldren cleue rofe theyr mouthes verye thriste yonge chyldren aske breade man geueth wont fare delycately peryshe stretes afore brought vp purple make nowe muche donge synne daughter people become greater gene x • x • wickednes sodome sodēly destroyed taken handes absteyners nazarees whyter snowe mylke theyr colour fresh reed corall theyr beautie lyke saphyre nowe theyr face blacke much thou shuldest knowe stretes psal 〈◊〉 • theyr skynne cleueth bones▪ withered become lyke drye stocke slayne y• swerd happyer dye honger peryshe away samyshynge frutes felde deut 〈◊〉 • 4 reg vi • wemen whiche nature pytiefull haue sodden theyr owne c • dren handes might theyr meate miserable destruccion y• daughter peopye exe • ii lorde hath perfourmed hys heuy wrath hath poured y• furiousnes dyspleasure hath kyndled fyre siō hath consumed foundacions therof nether kynges earth inhabetours worlde wolde haue beleued enemy aduersarye shulde haue come gate cytie ierusalem whiche neuerthelesse come passe synne prophetes wyckednesse preestes haue shed gene ix innocentes bloode within blynde men wente stomblynge streates stayned selues wt bloude whiche el wolde touche bloudy clothe cryed vnto euery man slee staynynge awaye get hence touche yee sayde ye muste brente ye must dwell amonge gentyles byde longer countenaunce lorde hathe banyshed shall neuer loke vpon selues nether regarded prestes pityed theyr elder wherfore yet oure eye fayle v whyle loke vayne helpe seynge euer waytynge vpon people v good laye sharpe wayte v cannot go safe vpon stretes oure ende come dayes fulfylled ende ••• • ii • b ab • c • b persecuters swyfter aegels ayre folowed vpon v ouer mountaynes layed wayte v wyldernesse ☞ breth mouthe euen anoynted lordegene 〈◊〉 b hym selfe shall taken oure synnes saye shadowe shal preserued amonge heythen thou daughter edom dwelleste lande huz glad reioyce cuppe shall come vnto also whan thou suppest thou shalte droncken thy synne well punyshed thou daugter sion shall suffre caryed awaye thy wyckednes daughter edom shall vyset thy synnes sake shall lede captyuyte ¶ prayer ie • emye capi v call remembraunce lorde haue suffred consydre se oure confusyon oure enherytaunce turned straungers house aleauntes become carefull fatherles mother wyddowes sayne dryncke oure owne water money oure owne wod must bye money neckes vnder persecucyon weery haue reste afore tyme yelded oure selues egypcians assyrian might haue bred ynough ier xxxi • eze xvii • father whiche nowe gone haue syned muste beare theyr wyckednes seruauntes haue rule v man delyuereth v theyr handes must get lyuynge parel lyues y• drouth wildernes oure skynne bene brente ouen sore honger wyues raueshed syon maydens city iuda prince hanged vp hand enemy haue spared olde sage men haue taken yonge mēnes lyues frō boyes hanged vp vpon tree elder syt nomore vnder gate yong men vse nomore playenge musycke ioye oure hert gone mery queer turned mournynge garlande head fallen ala euer synned sore therfore oure herte full heuynesse oure eye dymme hyll syon destroyed much fox runne vpon thou lorde remayneste euermore thy seate worlde without ende wherfore wylte thou styll forget v forsake v long▪ • xxxi • lord turne thou v vnto shall turned renue dayes olde tune thou haste banyshed v nowe long ynough haste bene sore dysple sed v ende lamentacyons ieremye ❧ booke prophete ezechyel ¶ tyme wherin ezechyel prophecyed place hys offprynge offyce vysyon • oure bestes vysion wheles vision throne ymage aboue throne capitv chaunced xxx yeare fifth day fourth moneth among presoners ryuer cobar ☞ wher heauens opened sawe vision god nowe y• v daye moneth made v yeare kynge iohacins captyuyte tyme came worde lorde vnto ezechyel th • sonne buzi preste lande chaldee water cobar eze x ⚜ hande lorde came vpon hym loked beholde stormy wynde came north greate cloude full fyre whiche hys glystre lyghtened al rounde aboute middest fyre cleare lyke face aungel lykenes foure beastes fashyoned lyke man sauyng euery one foure face foure wynges theyr legges streyght theyr fete lyke bullockes fete glystered bene fayre scoured metal theyr winges vpon al foure corner men handes theyr face theyr wynges towarde foure corner yet wynges one euer touched another wente turned aboute eche one went streyght forwarde eze x b upon ryght syde foure theyr face lyke face man face lyon vpon lefte syde face oxe face aegle theyr face also theyr wynges fyred aboue two wynges one touched euer two wynges another couered theyr body euery one wente wente streyghte forwarde spryte led thyther wente eze x • • turned theyr goynge fashyon countenaunce beastes lyke hoote coales fyre euen though burning cressets bene amōg beastes ⚜ thys vysyon fyre gaue glystre fyre wente lyghtenynge beastes wente forwarde backwarde one wolde haue thought lyghtened nowe whē well consydered beastes sawe worcke wheles vpon earthe foure face also nye vnto beastes fashyon worcke wheles lyke see foure wheles ioyned made loke vpon bene one whele another one went forwarde wente foure turned aboute theyr goynge large great horrile loke vpon backes full eye roūde foure beastes wente wheles wente also beastes lyfte selues vp earthe wheles lyfte vp also whyther soeuer spryte wente thither wente also wheles lyft vp folowed spryte lyfe wheles beastes went forth stode styll lyfte thē selues frō earth wheles also wente stode styll lyfte vp breth lyfe wheles aboue ouer heades beastes fyrmamēt whych fashyoned bene y• moste pure chrystal spred aboue vpon theyr heades vnder fyrmament theyr wynges layed abrode one towarde another two wynges couered body euery beast wente forth hearde noyse theyr winges lyke noyse greate water bene voyce great god russhyng together hoost men stode styll lette downe theyr wynges nowe whē stode styl letten downe theyr wynges thondred y• firmamente aboue theyr heades aboue firmament ouer theyr heades fashyon seate bene made saphir upō seate satt one lyke man e • e viii • behelde hym lyke aungell bene fyre within hys loynes vpward beneth loked vpon hym vnder y• loynes thought lyke shynynge fyre geueth lyght eue • syde yee shyne glystre lightened roūde aboute lyke raynbowe whiche raynye daye apeareth cloudes euen symylytude wherin glory lorde appeared sawe fell vpon face herkened vnto voyce hym spake ¶ prophete sende call agayne people theyr errour capi ii sayde vnto stand vp vpon thy fete thou sonne man wyll talke e •• iii communynge spryte came set vp vpon fete marcked thynge sayd vnto sayde beholde thou sonne man wyll sende chyldren israell runnagates obstynate people haue taken parte agaynst runne awaye fro exo xxii theyr forefather vnto daye yee wyll sende vnto people haue rough vysages styffe stomakes vnto whome thou shalte saye thys maner thys lorde god hym selfe hathe spoken whether obedient frowarde housholde maye knowe yet hathe bene prophet amonge ieremy • therfore thou sonne man feare neyther afrayed theyr wordes shall rebell agaynste despyse yee thou doste dwell amonge scorpyons feare theyre wordes abashed theyre lookes frowarde housholde se thou speake wordes vnto whether obedyent obstynate therfore thou sonne man obey thou al thinges say vnto thou stifnecked lyke styfnecked houshold opē thy mouth eate geue lokynge vp beholde sente vnto hande wherin closed apo •• v • booke hande opened wrytten within without full carefull mournynges ala wo ¶ prophete beynge sedde worde god constante boldenes spryte sente vnto people captyuite punyshement curate shewed people theyr synnes capi iii thys sayde vnto thou sonne man eate whatsoeuer yee iere xv c apo x b 4 esd 14 c eate closed booke go thy waye speake vnto chyldren israel opened mouthe gaue booke eate sayde vnto thou sonne man thy bely shall eate thy bowel shall fylled boke geue dyd eate boke psal xix b and▪ cxi • • apoc 〈◊〉 • mouth sweter hony sayde vnto thou sonne man ierem • 1 c get soone vnto house israell shewe wordes commaunde sende people hathe straunge vnknowne harde speache vnto house israell many nacyons whiche haue dyuerse speaches harde language whose wordes thou vnderstandest 〈◊〉 iii neuerthelesse yf sente people wolde folowe house israell wyll folowe wyll folowe yee house israell haue styffe foreheades harde hertes • ch▪ iii b beholde therfore wyll make thy face preuayle agaynst theyr face harden thy forcheade againste foreheades thy foreheade shalbe harder esay • b adamant • ynt stone thou mayest feare lesse lesse afrayed frowarde housholde sayde moreouer vnto thou sonne man take dylygēt hede thyne eares wordes speake vnto fasten thyne hert go presoners thy people speake vnto say maner thus lorde god hath spoken whether ye heare heare spryte toke vp heard noyse great russhynge remouynge blessed glory lorde hys place hearde also noyse wynges beastes russhed one agaynste another yee ratling wheles whiche russhynge noyse greate eze 8 11 nowe spryte toke vp caryed awaye wente wyth heuy sorowful mynde hande lorde comforted ryght soone begynnynge moueth abib came presoners psa 137 dwelt water cobar remayned place continued amonge seuen dayes sory seuen dayes expyred lorde sayde vnto eze xxxiii b thou sonne man haue made watchman vnto house israel therfore take good hede wordes geue warnynge commaundement saye vnto concernynge vngodly man without doute muste dye thougeueste hym warnynge speakest vnto hym maye turne hys euyll waye lyue shal vngodly man die owne vnryghteousnesse hys bloude wyll requyre thyne hande neuerthelesse yf thou geue warnynge vnto wycked yet forsake hys vngodlynesse shall dye hys owne wyckednesse thou hast dyscharged thy soule nowe yf ryghteous man go eze xvii hys ryghteousnesse thynge yt euyl wyl laye stomblyng blocke hym shall dye thou hast geuē warnyng yee dye shall hys owne lynne vertue shalnot thought vpon bloude wyll requyre thyne hande neuerthelesse yf thou exhortest ryghteous synne ryghteous synne shal lyue hathe receaued thy warnynge thou hast discharged thy soule came y• hande lorde vpon sayde vnto stande vp go felde may talke rysen vp gone forth felde beholde glory lord stode ezec lyke sawe afore water cobar ezec ii fell downe vpon face spryte came set vp vpon fete sayd thus vnto go thy waye sparre thy selfe thine house beholde thon sonne man shall chaynes brought bynde withall thou shalt escape thē wyll make thy tunge cleue rofe thy mouth thou shalte domme chyder obstynate housholde speake vnto opē thy mouth say thus sayeth lorde god heareth let heare wyl let hym leaue obstinate housholde ¶ sege cytye ierusalem signifyed longe contynuaunce captyuyty israel honger prophecyed come captyuyty capi iiii thov sonne man take tyle stone laye descrybe vpon cytye ierusalem howe beseged howe bulwerckes stronge dyches grauen euery syde describe also tentes hooste men rounde aboute moreouer take yron panne set betwixte cyte steade yrō wall set thy face warde besege laye ordinaunce wynne shal tokē vnto house israel thou shalte slepe vpon thy left syde lay synne house israel vpō certayne dayes appoynted thou shalt slepe vpon syde beare synnes dani ix • neuerthelesse wyl appoynte tyme put theyr synnes nombre dayes thre hundreth xc dayes must thou beare wyckednesse house israel whē thou hast fulfylled dayes lye downe agayne slepe vpō thy ryght syde xl dayes beare synnes house iuda num 14 • daye yeare daye saye yeare wyll euer laye vpon therfore set thy face agaynst beseged ierusalem dyscouer thyne arme thou mayest prophecye agaynste beholde wyll laye chaynes vpon thou shalte turne one syde another tyl thou hast ended dayes thy sege wherfore take vnto wheate barly beanes growell sede milium fytches put together vessel make loaues bred ther accordynge nombre day thou must lye vpō thy side thou mayest haue bred care thre hundreth xc dayes meate thou eateste shall haue certayn wayght appoynted namely twenty sycles euery daye thys appoynted meate shalte thou eate daylye begynnynge ende thou shalt dryncke also certayne measure water namely syxte parte hin shalt thou dryncke daily frō beginnynge vnto y• ende barly cake shalt thou eate yet shalt thou fyrst strake ouer wt man donge mayese sayde lorde euen thus shall child israel eate theyr defyled bred myddest gentile among wyll scatre sayde oh lorde god beholde soule yet neuer stayned fro youth vp vnto houre dyd neuer eate dead carcase whiche slaine wylde beastes neyther cā euer vnclene flesshe mouth vnto answered sayde well wyll graunt take cowes donge donge man strake breed ouer sayd vnto beholde thou sōne man ezech v xiiii • reg 25 wyll mynyshe prouision bred ierusalem shall wey bred eate scarcenesse water shal haue lytle measure ther drynke haue bred water one shal destroied another famyshe away theyr wickednesse ¶ rydle hearres whiche sygnified destruccyon people cause anger god towarde people lorde discloseth ryddle hearres capi v thou sonne man take sharpe knyfe namely rasour take shaue hearre thy heade beerd take scale weyght deuyde hearre sunder burne thyrde parte ther fyre myddest cytie dayes besegynge fulfylled cut thyrde parte peces knyfe • ere vii thyrde ꝑte remayneth caste wynde wyl draw y• swerde thē yet afterwarde take lytle bynde thy cote lappe take curtesy cast myddest fyre burne fire fyre shall go flame vpon whole house israel moreouer thus sayeth lorde god ierusalem set myddest heathen nacions rounde aboute hath despysed iudgementes gentile selues broken commaunde mentes nacions lye roūd aboute haue cast myne ordinaunces walcked lawes therefore thus sayeth lord god leui 18 muche ye wickednesse farre exceade heythen dwell rounde aboute ye haue nat walcked lawes neyther haue ye kepte myne ordynaunces accordynge ryghtuousnes gentyles whyche aboute ye haue doue therfore thus sayeth lorde god wyl also come vpon myddest wyll syt iudgemente syght heathen wyl handle suche fashyon neuer dyd neuer wyll frome tyme thyne abhominaciōs father deut 28 • treno 4 b 4 reg 16 f shall fayne eate theyr owne sonnes sonnes theyr owne father suche courte wyll kepe whole remnaunt wyl scatre wyndes wherfore truly lyue sayeth lorde god seyng thou hast defyled sā ctuary al maner abhominaciōs thy shamefull offence cause wyl also destroy myne eye shal ouerse neyther wyll spare • ere xv one thyrde parte within shall dye pestylence hongre another thyrde parte shall slayne downe rounde aboute swearde thyrde parte remayneth wyll scatre abrode towarde wyndes drawe swearde thus wyll perfourme indygnacyon set wrath agaynst ease selfe haue fulfylled myne angre agaynste shall knowe lorde whiche feruente gelousy haue spoken moreouer wyll make waste abhorred heathen dwell aboute syght al go punysh wrath myn angre plage whole dyspleasure thou shalte abhominacyon shame gasynge wondrynge stocke amonge heathen lye aboute euen lorde haue spoken shall come passe shute amonge perlous dartes honger whiche shal death yee therfore shall shute wyll destroye ezech 4 e wyll encrease hunger mynyshe prouysyon breade amonge plage mysery wyl sende yee wylde beastes also destroye pestylence blodsheding shal come vpon swerde wyl brynge ouer euen lorde haue sayde ¶ weth people shall plaged synne idolatrye prophecyeth repentaunce remnaunt people theyr delyueraunce destruccyon frowarde prophecyed capi vi worde lord came vnto saying thou sonne man turne thy face ezec 36 mountaynes israell thou mayst prophecye vnto saye heare worde lorde god ye mountaynes israell thus hath lorde god spoken mountaynes hylles valley dale beholde wyll brynge swearde ouer destroye hye place wyll cast downe aulters breake downe temple slayne men wyll laye goddes deed carcase chyldren israell wyll cast theyr idolles youre bone wyll scatre rounde aboute aulters dwellyng place cyties shalbe desolate hylchapels layed waste youre aulters destroyed broken youre goddes caste downe taken waye tempels layde euen grounde youre owne workes cleane roted slayne men shall lye amonge ye maye learne knowe howe lorde among haue escaped swearde wyll leaue amonge gentyles wyll scatre among naciōs escape shal thynke vpon amonge heathen shalbe captiuite whorysh vnfaythful hert theyrs wherwyth runne awaye fro wyll breake yee put eye theyrs commytte forny cacyon idol shal ashamed displea sed theyr selues wyckednesses abhominacions whiche haue done shal lerne knowe howe vayne lorde spake brynge suche mysery vpon lord sayd moreouer vnto smite thine handes together stampe thy fete saye wo worth abhominacions wyckednes house israel shall perysshe swearde honger pestylence farte shal dye pestylēce nye hande shall perysshe swearde beseged shall dye honger thus wyll satisfye wrothfull displeasure vpon shall ye learne knowe lorde youre slayne men lye amonge idol aboute aulters vpon hye hylles toppes mountaynes amonge grene tree amonge al thycke okes euē place dyd sacryfice theyr idol wyll stretche hande vpon wyll make lande waste shal lye esolate voyde wyldernesse ☞ deblothah forth thorow theyr habytacions learne knowe lorde ¶ ende lande israel shall sodenly come cause destruccion therof prophete commaūded shewe summe euylles hāde capi vii worde lorde came vnto maner cal thou sōne man thus sayeth lorde god vnto lande israel ende commeth yee verely ende commeth vpon al foure corner earth nowe shall ende come vpon wyll sende wrath vpon wyll punyshe accordynge thy wayes rewarde thy abhominacyons ez • 7 b 9 • myne eye shall ouerse neyther wyll spare rewarde accordynge thy wayes declare thy abhominacyōs shall ye knowe lorde thus sayeth lord god beholde one mysery plage shall come another ende ende saye wayteth come readye houre come agaynst dwellest lande tyme hande day sedicyon harde glad tydynges vpon mountaines therfore wyl shortly poute sore displeasure ouer fulfyll wrath vpon wyll iudge thy wayes recompence al thy abhomynacions ez • 7 b 9 • myne eye shal ouerse neither wyll spare rewarde thy wayes shewe thy abhomynacyons learne knowe lord smyteth beholde day daye come houre runne rodde florisheth wilfulnesse waxeth grene malicious violēce growen vp vn godly waxen staf yet shal complaynte made trouble shall come thynges tyme cōmeth daye draweth nye 1 cor • • iere xv • byeth let reioyse selleth let sory 1 thes • • trouble shall come myddest reste seller shall come agayne byer neyther shal lyue vision shall come greatly oueral shall nat hyndered man also wyth wickednes shal able saue owne lyfe trōpettes shal blowe ye make ready man shall go batayle wrothe al whole multitude swearde shalbe without pestylence honger within felde shalbe slayne swearde cytie deu xxii shall peryshe honger pestylence suche escape fle among shalbe vpon hylles lyke doues felde euery one shalbe afrayed owne wyckednesse handes shalbe let downe knee shalbe weake water shall gyrde selues sacke cloth feare shall fal vpon theyr face shalbe confounded esay • xv • theyr heades balde theyr syluer shall lye stretes theyr golde shalbe despysed • pho ecclesi v b proue xi u yee theyr siluer golde may delyuer day fearful wrath lorde shall satisfye theyr hongry soules neyther fyll theyr emptye bellyes therwith become owne decaye thorowe theyr wyckednes • ie v •• made thereof onely costely iewelles theyr pompe pryde also abhomynable ymages idoles cause wyll make abhorred moreouer wil geue handes straungers spoyled wycked tobe robbed shall destroye face wyll turne treasury shalbe defyled theues shall go suspende wyll make cleane riddaunce lande whole defyled vntyghtueus iudgement innocente bloude cite full abhominacions wherfore wyl brynge cruel tyrauntes amonge heathen take theyr house possession wyll make pompe proude ceasse shall take theyr saynetuary thys trouble commeth shall seke peace shall haue none one myschefe sorowe shal folowe another one rumoure shall come another iere 38 c shall seke vysions vayne theyr prophetes lawe shalbe gone prestes wysdome frome elder kynge shal mourne prince shalbe clothed heuynes hā de people lande shall tremble feare wyll vnto theyr owne wayes accordynge theyr owne iudgementes wyll iudge learne knowe lorde ¶ apperaun • e symylytude god ezechiel brought vnto ierusalem sprete lorde sheweth prophete idolatryes house israel fely preastes capi viii happened syxte yeare fyfth day syxte moneth sat house lordes councell iuda hande lorde god fel euen vpon loked vp ezechiel c sawe lyckenesse fyre hys loynes downewarde loynes vpwarde shyned maruelous cleare lyke angell loke vpon ezech iii b xi symylitude stretched hande toke hearrye locke heade sprete lyft vp betwyxte heauē earth brought vysyon ierusalem entrye inner porte lyeth towarde north stode ymage wt hath al thynges power wroth beholde glory god israel place euen ezechi • sene afore felde sayde vnto thou sone man lyft vp thyne eye loke towarde north lyft vp myne eye towarde north beholde • besyde porte northwarde aulter made vnto ymage prouocacion entryng sayde vnto thou sonne mā ••• st thou seyst thou greate abhomycions house israel cōmytteth place ought •• • e 〈◊〉 sainctuary turne th •• shalt se yet greater abhomyna • ion 〈◊〉 brought cour • 〈◊〉 whē loked beholde hole ī wal sayde vnto thou sōne man dygge thorowe wal whē dygged thorowe wal beholde dore sayde vnto go thy waye loke wycked abhomynacyons went sawe beholde maner ymages wormes beastes idoles abhomynacyons house israel paynted euery one roūde wall stode also ymages e •• 〈◊〉 nume xi lxx lordes councell house israel myddest stode iaazanth sonne saphan euery one thē censoure hāde incense wente smoke bene cloude sayde vnto thou sonne man hast thou sene senatours house israel secretely euery one chambre • iob xxii esay 29 c iere 〈◊〉 ezech 〈◊〉 • say tush lorde seyth v lorde regardeth nat worlde sayde vnto turne yet againe thou shalt se great abhomynacyons wyth broughte dore porte lordes house towarde northe beholde sat woman mournynge thamus sayde vnto haste thou sene thou sonne man turne aboute thou shalt se yet greater abhomynacyons broughte inwarde courte lordes house beholde porte lordes house betwyxte fore entrye aulter fyue twentye men turned theyr backes vpon temple lorde theyr face towarde easte worshypped sonne sayd vnto hast thou sene thou sonne man thynketh house iuda tryfle abhomynacyons shuld fyl lande ful wyckednesse vndertake prouoke vnto anger yee purposely cast vp theyr nose vpon therfore wyll also thynge wrathefull dyspleasure y• myne eye shall ouerse thē neither wyl spare prouer • iere 〈◊〉 • • • iiii b ••• iii • yee though crye myne eares wyth loude voyce yet wyll heare ¶ destruccyon idolatryes conuersyon ryghtuous shalbe saued marched vnmarcked slayne complaynt prophet destruccyon people capi ix cryed also loude voyce myne eares sayinge come ye ruler cyte euery man hys weapened hande slaughter came syxe men strete vpper porte towarde northe euery man weapen hys hande slaughter ther one amongest hym lynen rayment wryters ynckehorne hys syde went stode besyde brasen aulter y• glory lord israel gone away frō exo xl • nume • x c 3 regū 8 b cherub vpō come downe thresholde house called mā lynen raymente vpon wryters ynckehorne syde lorde sayde vnto hym go thy waye thorowe cyte ierusalem ☜ set marcke vpon foreheades mourne sory abhominacions done therin sayde myght heare iud • ii • go ye hym thorowe cytie steye ouerse none spare none kyll destroye olde men yonge maydens chyldren wyues haue marcke vpō se ye touch thē nat iere xx • • • x • ix b 1 p ••• 4 • begynne sanctuary began elder whiche temple sayde vnto ye haue defyled temple filled cour • e slayne go waye forthe went slewe downe thorowe cyte nowe whē done slaughter yet escaped fell downe vpon face cryed sayinge lorde god wylte thou destroye resydue israell thy sore dyspleasure thou haste poured vpon ierusalem sayde vnto wyckednes house israell iuda greate lande ful bloude cyte full vnfaythfulnesse saye iob 22 b esay 29 • eccle 2 • • tushe lorde regardeth earth seyth v therfore wyll vpon ezec v • • myne eye shal ouerse neyther wyll spare wyll recompense theyre wyckednesse vpon theyr heades beholde man lynnen raymente vpon hym wrytters ynckehorne syde tolde matter howe happened sayde lorde thou haste commaunded haue done ¶ man toke whote burnynge cole mydle wheles cherubyns token burnynge ierusalem rehersall vysyon wheles beastes cherubyns capi x loked behold fyrma ment aboue cherubyns appered symylytude stole saphyr vpon ezech • x • sayde sat therin lynen raymēt vpon hym crepe betwene y• wheles vnder cherubynes take thyne hande ful hoate coales betwene cherubyns cast ouer cyte crepte myght se cherubins stode vpon ryght side house man went cloude fylled inner courte 2 p •• • • glory lorde remoued cherubyns came vpon thresholde house temple ful cloudes courte full shyne lordes glory yee soūde cherubynes wynges hearde fore courte lyke bene voyce almyghtye god speaketh nowe bydden man clothed lynen go take hoate coales myddest wheles whiche vnder cherubyns wente stode besyde wheles one cherub reached forthe hys hande vnder cherubyns vnto fyre betwene cherubyns toke therof gaue vnto lynen raymente hys hande whiche toke wente vnder wynges cherubyns appeared lycknesse man hande sawe also foure wheles besyde cherubyns euery cherub stode whele wheles loke vpon fashion precyous stone tharsys yet vnto syght fashyoned lyke yf one whele bene another wente forth wente foure together nat turnynge theyr goynge fyrst wente thyther wente also turned nat aboute theyr goynge theyr whole bodyes theyr backes theyr handes wynges yee wheles also ful eye rounde aboute foure hearde hym call wheles ezech • • euery one foure face one face face cherub seconde man thyrde lyon fourth aegle lyfted vp aboue beast sawe water cober nowe cherubyns went wheles wente cerubyns shoke theyr wynges lyfte selues vpwarde wheles remayned nat behynde thē also shortly stode stode also lyfte vp wheles lyfte vp also sprete lyfe wheles ezech x • • 〈◊〉 〈◊〉 glory lorde lyfte vp thresholde temple remayned vpon cherubins cherubyns flackred wyth theyr wynges lyfte selues vp frō earth sawe wente wheles thē stode easte syde porte house lorde glory lorde vpon thys beast sawe vnder god israel water cobar perceaued cherubyns euery one foure face euery one foure wynges vnder theyre wynges men handes nowe fygure theyr face euen sene water cober countenaunce euery one hys goynge wente strayght forwarde capi xi seduced people israel againste prophecyeth shewynge howe shalbe scatred abroade rennynge herte commeth god▪ otherwyse nat walke commaūdementes threteneth leaue vnto theyr owne councelles moreouer sprete lorde lyfte vp brought vnto easte porte lordes house beholde xxv mē vnder dore amonge whome sawe iaayaniah sōne azur pheltiah sonne bananiah ruler people sayde lorde vnto thou sonne man men ymagyn myschefe wycked councell take cytie sayinge tush destruccyon hande let v buylde house ierusalem cauldron flesh therfore shalt thou prophecye vnto yee prophecye shalt thou vnto sonne man fell sprete lorde vpō sayde vnto speake thus sayeth lorde thys maner haue ye spoken ye house israel knowe ymagynacyons youre hertes many one haue ye murthured thys cytie fylled stretes full slayne therfore thus sayeth lorde god sleyne • ye haue layed grounde thys cytye flesh thys cytye cauldron eze 34 • wyll brynge mat 26 • ye haue drawen swearde euē wyll also brynge swearde ouer sayeth lorde god wyll dryue thys cytie delyuer enemyes hande wyll condemne ye shalbe slayne coastes israel wyll auenged lerne knowe lorde thys cytie shall youre cauldron neyther shall ye flesh therin y• coastes israell wyll punysh ye maye knowe lorde whose commaundementes ye haue nat walked kepte lawes leu • 〈◊〉 • •• xii • haue done customes heathen lye round aboute nowe whē preached pheltiah sonne bananiah dyed fell downe vpon face cryed loude voyce sayeng lorde god wylt thou thē vtterly destroye remaūt israel y• worde lorde came thys maner thou sonne man thy brother thy knyffolke holy house iuda whiche dwell ierusalem saye gone farre lorde lande geuen v possessyon therfore tell thus sayeth lorde god wyll sende far amonge gentyles skatre amonge nacyons wyll halowe lytle landes ye shall come tell also thus sayeth lorde god wyll gather agayne nacyons brynge countryes ye scatered wyll geue lande israel agayne thyther shall ye come impedimentes youre abhomynacyons wyll take awaye ier xxxi • eze xxxvi f wyll geue one herte wyll plāte newe sprete within youre bowel stony herte wyll take youre bodye geue ☞ flesshy hert ye maye walke commaundementes kepe myne ordinaunces thē ye may people god loke whose hertes dysposed folowe theyr abhomynacyons wycked lyuenges men dedes wyll brynge vpon theyr owne heades sayeth lorde god thys dyd cherubyns lyfte vp theyr winges wheles went glorye lorde israel vpon ezechel x • xliii glorye lorde wente myddest cytie stode vpon mounte cytye towarde east ezech iii b viii wynde toke vp vision came sprete god brought agayne caldea amonge presoners visyon sene vanished away fro spake vnto presoners wordes lorde shewed ¶ parable vessel captyuytie exposicyon parable takynge kyngs • e • ikiah signified another parable wher dystresse honger thryst sygnyfyed capi xii worde lorde came vnto sayinge thou sonne man thou dwellest myddest frowarde housholde esay vi b mat xiii b mar iiii luk viii b acte 28 rom xi b whiche haue eye se yet se nat eares haue heare yet heare nat obstinate houshold therfore thou sonne man make thy gere rydy flyt go forth fayre daye lyght maye se yee euen theyr syght shalte thou go thy place another place yf paraduenture wyl consydre vnobedyent housholde thy gere thou haste made redy flyt withall shalt thou beare fayre daye lyghte maye se thou thy self shalt go forth also euē theyr syght man dothe flytteth dygge thorowe wall maye se beare thorowe thynge thou tokeste vp theyr syght thy selfe thou shalte go forth darcke hyde thy face thou se earthe haue made shewtoken vnto house israel nowe lorde commaunded dyd gere made redy brought oute daye euen brake downe hole thorowe wall wyth hande darcke toke gere vpon shoulder bare theyr syght mournynge came worde lorde vnto sayinge thou sonne man yf israel frowarde housholde aske saye doest thou tell thē thus sayeth lorde god punyshmente toucheth chefe ruler ierusalem house israel dwell amonge tell youre shew token lyke haue done shall happen vnto flyt shall ye also go captyuyte iere xx • • xxiii b 〈◊〉 xxxii b chefest amonge shall lade hys shulders darcke get hym awaye shall breake downe wall carye stuffe therthorowe shall couer face se nat grounde hys eye ex • xvii • xxxii • lyne wyll sprede vpon hym catch net cary hym babylon lande caldees whiche shall nat se yet shall dye al helper hys hostes aboute hym wyll scater thē towarde wyndes drawe swearde ezec xv • xx •• • haue scatred amonge heathen strowed landes shall knowe lorde wyll leaue lytle nōbre frō swearde hunger pestilence tel theyr abhominacions among heathen come y• maye knowe howe lorde moreouer worde lorde came vnto sainge thou sonne man wyth fearfull trēblyng shalt thou eate thy bred carefulnesse sorow shalt thou drinke thy water vnto people lande speake thou thys maner thus sayeth lorde god dwell ierusalem lande israell ye shall eate bred sorowe drynke youre water heuynesse yee lāde fulnesse therof shalbe layde waste wyckednesse dwel therin cyties y• nowe well occupyed shall voyde lande desolate ye maye knowe howe lorde yet came worde lorde vnto agayne sayinge thou sonne man maner worde whiche ye vse lande israel sayinge tush 1 pet 3 b seynge dayes slacke commyng vysyons none effecte tell therfore thus sayeth lorde god wyll make worde ceasse shall commenly vsed israell saye thys vnto dayes hande euery thynge whiche hathe bene prophecyed shalbe fulfylled shall vysyon wayne nether prophecie fayle amonge chyldren israel lorde speake whatsoeuer lorde speake shal perfourmed nat slacke commynge yee euen dayes ye frowarde houshoulde wyll deuyse thyng brynge passe sayeth y• lorde god worde lorde cam vnto saying beholde thou sonne man house israel saye maner tush vycyon hathe sene wyll many daye come passe farre yet thynge prophecyeth therfore saye vnto thus sayeth lorde god wordes shall slacke loke speake shall come passe sayeth lorde god ¶ worde lorde agaynst false prophetes whiche teach people councelles theyr owne hertes capi xiii worde lorde came vnto saying thou sōne man speake prophecye agaynst prophetes preache israel saye thou vnto prophecye theyr owne hertes heare worde lorde thus sayeth lorde god ezec • 4 wo vnto folysh prophetes folowe theyr owne sprete speake se nothynge israel thy prophetes like fox vpō drye telde stande nat y• gappes nether make hedge house israel men myght abyde parel daye lorde uayne thynges se tell lye ier xxvi • • mayntayne theyr preachynges al lorde saye hath spoken whā dede lorde hath nat sent uayne visyons haue ye sene spoken falce prophecyes ye saye lorde hathe spoken neuer sayde therfore thus sayeth lorde god youre wordes vayne ye seke lye beholde wyll vpon sayeth lorde god myne handes shall come vpon y• prophetes loke vayne thynges preache lye shall nat councell people wrytten boke house israell neyther shall come lande israell ye maye knowe howe lorde god thys cause haue dysceaued people iere viii b tolde peace peace one setteth vp wall dawbe lowse claye therfore tell whiche dawbe vntempered morter shall fal mat vii c shall come greate shower rayne greate stone shall fall vpon sore storme wynde shall breke shall wall come downe sall nat sayde vnto nowe morter ye dawbed withal therfore thus sayeth lorde god wyll breake wrathfull dyspleasure stormy wynde myne anger shall come myghtye shower rayne hayle stone wrath destroye withall wall ye haue dawbed vntempered morter wyll breake downe make euen grounde foundacyon therof shall remoue shal fall yee ye youre selues shal perysh myddest therof lerne knowe lorde thus wyll perfourme wrathe vpon thys wall vpon haue dawbed vntempered morter wyll saye vnto wall gone dawbers awaye prophetes israell whiche prophecye vnto cytye ierusalem loke vysyons peace wher peace saieth lorde god wherfore thou sonne man set thy face agaynste daughter thy people whiche prophecye theyre owne hertes speake thou prophecye agaynste saye thus sayeth lorde god wo vnto pylowes vnder arme hole bolster vnder heades bothe yonge old • catch soules •• oye v c math ii • • whan ye haue gotten soules people captyuyte ye promyse lyfe dishonour people hande full barly pece breade whan ye kyll soules thē dye nat promes lyfe thē lyue nat thus ye dissemble people beleueth youre lye wherfore thus sayeth lorde god holde wyll also vpon pyllowes wher ye catch y• soules flyenge wyll take youre armes let soules go ye catch flyenge youre bolster also wyll teare peces delyuer people youre handes shal come handes spoyled ye shall knowe lorde seynge youre lye ye disconforte herte ryghteous whō haue nat discomforted agayne moch o •• 4 • ye corage hande wycked y• may nat turne frō wycked waye lyue therfore shal ye spye nomore vanyte pro phecye youre owne gessynges wyll de lyuer people youre hande ye maye knowe howe lorde ¶ lorde denyeth hys worde people theyr synnes sake dis • ysers worde dothe lorde sometyme deceaue falce prophetes comforte fledde vnto babylon capi xiiii resorted ezech xx • vnto certayne elder israel sat downe came worde lorde vnto sayeng thou sonne man men beare theyr idol theyr hertes go purposly vpon stomb • nge blocke theyr owne wyckednesse howe darre aske councell therfore speake vnto saye thus sayeth lorde god euery man house israel areth hys idol hys herte purposyng stomble owne wyckednes cō meth prophet enquere thynge hym vnto man wyll lorde myselfe geue answere accordynge multytude hys idol house israel may snared theyr owne hertes clene gone fro theyr abomynacyons sake wherfore tell house israel thus sayeth lorde god ezech xx c conuerted forsake youre idol turne youre face youre abhominacyons euery man whether house israell straunger geourneth israel departeth fro caryeth idol hys herte purposynge go styll stomblynge hys owne wyckednesse commeth prophet aske councel thorowe hym vnto man wyll lorde geue answere myne owne selfe wyll set face agaynste man wyll make hym example yee comen worde wyl rote people ye may knowe howe lorde 3 reg 22 • iob xii • yf prophete dysceaued telleth hym worde lorde myselfe haue dyfceaued prophet wyll stretch forth myne hande vpon hym rote hym people israell bothe shalbe punyshed theyr wyckednes accordynge synne hym asketh shall synne prophete house israel led nomore fro thorow erroure nomore defyled theyr wyekednesse maye people theyr god sayeth lorde god worde y• lorde came vnto saying thou sonne man lande synneth agaynste goeth forth wyckednesse wyll stretch myne hande vpon ezech iii iiii destroye prouysyon theyr breade sende derth vpon destroye man beaste lande ier • • v • though noe daniel iob thre men among thē yet shal ī theyr right • ousnesse deliuer theyr owne soules saith lorde god brynge noysome beastes lande waste vp desolate man maye go therin beastes yf thre men also lande truly lyue sayeth lorde god shall saue neyther sonnes daughter onely delyuered thēselues lande shall wast yf brynge swearde lande charge go thorowe y• lande sleye downe man beast yf thremen therin truly lyue sayeth lorde god shall delyuer neyther sonnes daughter saued themselues sende pestylence lande poure sore indyngnacyon vpno bloude rote bothe man beast yf noe daniel iob therin truly lyue sayeth lorde god shal delyuer nether sonnes daughter saue theyr owne soules theyr ryghtuousnes moreouer thus sayeth lorde god though sende • r 〈◊〉 • foure troublous plage vpon ierusalem swearde honger perlous beastes pestylence destroye man beast yet shall tēnaunt saued therin shal bryng forth theyr sonnes daughter beholde shall come forth vnto ye shall se theyr waye take hande ye shalbe cōforted touchynge plage haue brought vpon ierusalē shall comforte ye se theyre waye workes ye shall knowē howe without cause haue done agaynste ierusalem dyd sayeth lorde god ¶ vnprofytable woode vyne tree cast syre sayeth ierusalem shalbe brent capi xv worde lord came vnto sayinge thou sonne man what▪ cōmeth vyne amonge tree vyne stocke amonge al tymbre groaue men take wodde make worke may nayle made hange thynge vpon beholde cast fyre brēt fyre consumeth bothe endes myddest brente asshes mete worke seynge mete worke beynge whole muche lesse may thynge made fyre hath consumed brent therfore thus sayeth lorde god lyke caste vyne fyre brente tree wod euen wyl dwell ierusalem set face shal go fyre yet fyre shall consume e •• xi • • and▪ xxii b shal ye knowe lorde set face agaynst make lande wast haue sore offended sayeth lorde god ¶ prophete entendynge speake abhomyncryons ierusalem▪ doth fyrste shewe benefytes god towarde • ierusalem reproued vnkind • e fornycacion idoles iustifyeth wyckednes people cōparyson synnes ierusalem cause abhomynacions whiche • odomytes fell mercy promysed repentaunt capi xvi agayne worde lorde spake vnto saying thou sonne man shewe cytie ierusalem abhominacions saye thus sayeth lorde god vnto ierusalem thy progeny kynred came lande canaan thy father amoryte thy mother cethyte day thy byrth thou wast borne y• strynge thy nauell cut y• waste bathed water make clene thou waste neyther rubbed wyth salt swadled cloutes mā regarded muche thyngꝭ shewe suche fauoure thou wast vtterly cast vpon felde yee despysed wast thou day thy byrth came sawe trodē downe thyne owne bloude sayde vnto thou shalt pourged thyne owne bloude frō thyne owne bloude say shalte thou clensed esay v icre x • c planted blossome thy felde thou art growen vp waxen great thou hast gotten maruelous pleasaunte beutie thy brestes come vp thy hearre goodly growen thou wast naked bare afore nowe went loked vpon beholde thy tyme come yee euen tyme wowe spred clothes ouer couer thy dish •• esty yee made othe vnto iere iii • 〈◊〉 xx • • maryed myselfe sayeth lorde god thou becamest myne owne washed wyth water pourged thy bloude anoynted oyle gaue chaunge ra •• entes made shues taxus lether gyrded aboute wyth white sylke clothed wt kerchefes decked costely apparell put tynges vpon thy fyngers chayne thy necke spanges vpon thy fore heade eare rynges vpon thyne eares set beutiful crowne vpon thyne heade thus wast thou deckte siluer golde thy rayment fyne whyte sylcke nedle worke diuerse colour thou dyddest eate nothynge symnels hony oyle maruelous goodly waste thou beutyfull yee euen quene wast thou muche thy beuty spoken among nethen thou wast excellent beautie whiche put vpon sayeth lord god thou hast put confidence thyne owne beuty played harlot thou haddest gotten • name thou hast commytted whoredome wente haste fulfylled desyres yee thou hast takē thy garmentes diuers colour deckte thy • e aulteres therwith vpon thou myghtest fulfyl thyne whoredome iere iii • h esay 46 suche fashyon neuer done shal • e •• 〈◊〉 • 〈◊〉 〈◊〉 〈◊〉 • xx goodly ornamentes iewels whiche gaue myne owne gold siluer ha • r thou taken made men ymages ther commytted whoredome withall thy garmentes diuerse colour hast thou taken deckt therwith myne oyle incense haste thou set meate whiche gaue symnels oyle hony fede withal hast thou set swete sauour came also passe sayeth lord god leuit 18 • xx deut 18 b • xxxii • iere vii ezech xx psal cv thou haste taken thine owne sonnes daughter whome thou haddest begotten vnto hast thou offred vp vnto meate thys small whorewme thine thinkest thou thou sleyest child geuest ouer brent vnto yet thy abhominacions whoredome thou hast notre membred dayes thy youth howe naked bare thou wast tyme troden downe thyne owne bloude thy wyckednesses wo wo vnto sayeth lorde god thou haste buylded thy stewes brodel house euery place yee head euery strete hast thou buylded aulter thou hast made thy beautye abhorred thou haste layde thy legges euery one came multiplyed thyne whoredome ezech 23 b thou hast commytted fornicacion wt egyptian thy neighboures whiche muche flesshe thus hast y• vsed thine whoredome anger beholde dyd stretche myne hande ouer wyl ezech 〈◊〉 • • 〈◊〉 c mynish thy store fode delyuer ouer wylles philistine thine enemyes whiche ashamed thy abhominable waye ezer 23 • thou hast played whore also assyryans myght satisfye yee thou hast played harlot ynough thus hast thou styl cōmitted thy fornicacion lande canaan vnto caldees yet thy lust satysfyed howe shulde cir cumcyse thyne herte sayeth lorde god seynge thou doest al thynges thou pre cyous whore buyldynge thy stewes heade euery strete thy brodell house place thou hast bene whore maketh booste mynnynge wyfe breaketh wedlocke taketh steade husbande gyftes geuen whore thou geuest rewardes vnto thy louers offrest gyftes come vnto place cōmytte fornicacyon come passe thy whoredomes contrary vse woman yee hathe suche fornycacion bene commytted seynge thou profrest gyftes vnto rewarde geuen contrary thynge therfore heare worde lorde thou harlot thus sayeth lorde god muche thou hast spent thy money discouered thy shame thorow thy whor dome thy louers idol thy abhommacions blode thy child 4 reg 〈◊〉 17 • thou hast geuen beholde therfore wyll gather together al thy louers vnto thou haste made thy selfe comen yee thou fauourest euery one thou hatest esay 47 • n ••• 〈◊〉 • wyll discouer thy shame maye se thy fylthynes ezech 〈◊〉 • moreouer wyl iudge breaker wedlocke murtherer recōpeuce thine owne bloude wrath gelousy wyll geue ouer power shall breake downe thy stewes destroye thy brodell house shall strype thy clothes thy fayre beutifull iewels shall take let syt naked bare leui 〈◊〉 • yee shall brynge comen people vpon shal stone sleye downe theyr sweardes 4 reg 〈◊〉 • shal burne vp thy house punysh syght many wemen thus wyl make thy whoredome ceasse y• shalt geue mo rewardes shuld make wrath styl take gelousy contente nomore displeased seinge thou remembrest dayes youthe haste prouoked wrath thynges beholde therfore wyll brynge thyne owne wayes vpon thyne heade sayeth lorde god howbeit neuer dyd vnto accordynge thy wyckednesse thy abhomynact ons beholde vse comen prouerbes shall vse prouerbe also agaynst suche mother suche daughter thou art euen thy mother owne daughter hath cast housbande chyldren yee thou arte syster thy systers whiche forsoke theyr husbandes theyr chyldren eze • •••• mother cethyte father amoryte thyne eldest syster samaria daughter dwell vpon thy lefte hande thy yongeste syster dwelleth thy ryght hande sodoma daughter yet haste thou walked wayes done theyr adhomynacyo • thy wayes thou haste bene corrupt truly lyue sayeth lorde god sodoma thy syster daughter hath done euell thou thy daughter beholde gene x • ii • 1 18 • • 19 b • synnes thy syster sodoma pryde fulnesse meate aboundaunce idylnesse thynges • daughter besydes reached theyr hande poore nedy proude dyd abhominable thynges therfore toke awaye sene neyther hath samaria done halfe thy synnes iere • • • yee thou haste exceaded wyckednesse muche comparysyon abhomynacy ons whyche thou haste done thou haste made thy systers good woman therfore beare thyne owne shame thou synne haste ouercome thy systers seynge thou haste done abhomynably better thou ashamed therfore say beare thyne owne confusyon thou makest thy systers good woman theyr captiuite namely captiuyte sodoma daughter captyuite samaria daughter wyll brynge agayne wyll also brynge agayne thy captiuite amonge thou mayest take thyne owne confusyon vpon ashamed al thou hast done comforte thus thy systers namely sodoma daughter samaria daughter thy selfe thy daughter shalbe brought agayne olde estate thou wast thy pryde thy wyckednesse came lyght thou woldest heare speake thy syster sodoma vntyl tyme spryans theyr townes phylystines withall lye rounde brought shame confusion thou myghtest beare thyne owne fylthynes abhominacion sayeth lorde thus sayeth lorde god shulde ryght deale thou hast done thou haste despysed othe broken couenaunt neuerthelesse wyl remembre couenaunt made wyth thy youth much shalbe euerlastynge couenaunte thou also remembre thy wayes ashamed thē shalte thou receaue thy elder yōger systers wyl make thy daughter besyde thy couenaunt iere xxi • 〈◊〉 vi •• • wyll renue couenaunte thou mayest know lord thou mayst thynke vpon ashamed excuse thyne owne confusyon nomore haue forgeuen y• thou haste done sayeth lorde god ¶ parable two aegles sygnyfyeth zedekiah whiche contrarye othe forsaken frendeshyppe nabuchodonosor turneth hym selfe kyng egypte therfore peryshed exposicyon parable prophecy chryst capi xvii worde lorde vnto say enge thou sonne man put fortheezech 24 darcke speakyng parable vnto house israell saye thus sayeth lorde god came greate dani vii aegle great wynges yee myghtye long wynges full fethers dyuerse coloures vpon mounte libanus toke braunche cedretre brake toppe twygge caryed lande canaan set cyte marchauntes toke also braunche lande planted frutefull groū de brought vnto greate water set wyllowe tree therby dyd grow great vynestock lowe grounde whose braunches bowed towarde hym rote thereof vnder thus came vyne brought forth blossomes spred braū ches another aegle great one whiche great wynges many father beholde rote vine hunger spred braū ches towarde water frut •• neuer thelesse planted vpon go • groūde besyde greate water reason shulde haue broughte braunches fruyte haue bene goodly • yne speake thou therefore thus sayeth lorde god shall vyne prospere shall rote pluckte frute broken grene braunches wyther fade away yee without eyther strong arme many people shall plucked vp rote beholde planted▪ shal prospere therfore shal dryed vp wythered yes euen shurynge blossomes sone east wynde bloweth moreouer worde lorde came vnto sayeng speake frowarde housholde knowe ye thing sygnyfye tell beholde y• kyng4 24 c babylon came ierusalē toke kynge hys prynces ledde babylon toke kynges sede made couenaunte hym toke othe hym prince lande toke hym also lande myght holden subieccyon rebelle kepe couenaunt fulfyll fell sent embassatours egipt myght haue horse muche people shulde prospere shulde kepte safe doth suche thynges shulde escape breaketh couenaunte truely lyue sayeth lorde god shall dye babylon place kyng dwelleth made kyng whose othe hath despysed whose couenaunt hath broken neyther shall pharao greate hoste multytude people mayntayne warre cast vp ditch set vp bulworkes destroy much people seing hath despysed othe broken couenaunte yet gaue hande vpon done thynges shall escape therfore thus sayeth lord god truely lyue wyll brynge myne othe hath despysed couenaunte hath broken vpon owne heade 〈…〉 wyll caste net aboute hym catche hym yarne babylon wyll • arye hym wyll punyshe hym greate offence made flye frome hym hooste shalbe slayne swearde resydue shalbe scatted towarde windes ye shal knowe lord haue spoken thus sayeth lorde god wyl also take braunche hye cedre tre wyll set take vppermost twyg yet tendre plante vpon hye hyll namely vpon hyehyll israell wyll plante •• maye brynge forthe twygges geue frute great cedre tree al maner foules may byld make nestes vnder shadowe braunches tree felde shall knowe lorde haue brought downe hye tree set lowe tree vp haue dryed vp grene tree made drye tree florysh euen lorde spake haue also brought passe ¶ sheweth euery man shall beate owne synne hym amendeth salua • yon promysed deathe prophecyed ryhgtuous whiche •••• e • h backe frome ryght waye capi xviii worde lord came vnto maner meane ye comen prouerbe ye vse lande israel sayinge iere xxxi • father haue eaten soure grape chyldrens teth set edge truely lyue sayeth lorde god ye shall vse byworde nomore israel beholde psal • • soules myne lyke y• father myne sōne myne also soule synneth shall dye •••• 〈◊〉 • ▪ man godly thynge equall ryght eateth vpon hylles lyfteth eies vp y• foule idol israel defyleth nat neyghbours wyfe medleth menstruous womā greueth body geueth hꝭ detter pledge agayne taketh none man good violence mat 〈◊〉 ▪ parteth mete hongrye clotheth naked psal 〈◊〉 • lendeth nothynge vpon vsury taketh nothynge ouer withdraweth hāde doyinge wrong handleth faythfully betwyxt mā • man walketh commaundementes kepeth lawes perfourmeth thē faythfully rom • • ▪ • ▪ ryghtuous man shall surely lyue sayeth lorde god nowe get sonne murtherer sheder bloude yf one thinges iaco ii • though al eateth vpon hylles defyleth neyghbours wyfe greueth poore nedy robbeth spoyleth geueth nat detter pledge agayne lyfteth vp eye vnto idol medleth abhomynable thynges hé lendeth vpon vsury taketh ouer shall thys man lyue shal lyue seynge hath done al abhominacions shall dye hys bloude shalbe vpon nowe yf man get sonne also seyth father synnes whiche hath done feareth neyther dothe suche lyke namely eateth vp mountaynes lyfteth hys eye vp idol israell defyleth hys neyghbours wyfe vexeth man kepeth man pledge▪ neyther spoyleth robbeth eny man dealeth meate hungrye clotheth naked oppresseth poore receaueth vsury thynge ouer kepeth lawes walcketh commaundementes thys man shall dye hys father synne shall lyue wythout fayle hys father oppressed spo • led hys brother dyd wyckedly amonge people lo deed owne sinne yet saye ye wherfore shulde thys sonne beare father • ynne therfore sonne hath done equite right hathe kepte al commaundementes done therfore shall lyue dede soule synneth shall dye deut▪ 24 • ▪ • ▪ • c 14 a▪ • ▪ 〈◊〉 25 sonne shall beare father offence neyther shall father beare sonnes offence ryghteousnes ryghtuous shalbe vpon wyckednes wycked shalbe vpon selfe also ••• xviii a▪ • zech 33 c yf vngoly wyl turne away al hys synnes hathe done kepe commaundementes thynge equall ryghte doutlesse shall lyue dye synnes shal thought vpon righteousnes hath done shall lyue • •• 3 b haue eny pleasure death synner saieth lorde god rather cōuert frō wayes lyue agane yf ryghtuous turne awaye rightuousnes iniquite accordyng abhominacyons wycked man dothe shall lyue ryghtuousnesse hath done shall thought vpon faute hath offended withal synne hath done shall dye yet ye saye tush ezech 33 waye lorde indyfferente heare therfore ye house israell waye ryght youre wayes rather wycked ezech 33 c ryghtuous man turneth awaye ryghtuousnesse medleth vngodlynesse muste dye therin yee vnryghtuousnesse hathe done must dye agayne esay • v b wycked man turneth awaye wyckednesse hathe done dothe thynge whiche equall ryghte shall saue soule aliue much remembreth hym selfe turneth hym vngodlynes hathe vsed shall lyue dye yet sayeth house israel tushe waye lorde equall wayes vnryght ye house israel way rather vnequal wyll iudge euery man accordinge hys wayes ye house israel sayeth y• lorde god •••• 〈◊〉 b mat iii • wherfore conuerted turne cleane wyckednesse shall synne harme caste awaye frō youre vngodlynesse ye haue done ezech xi • 3 • 8 make newe hertes newe spryte wherfore wyll ye dye ye house israell seynge haue pleasure deathe hym dyeth sayeth lorde god turne ye shall lyue ¶ captyuyiye iehoahaz • iehoacin sygnyfyed lion whelpe • •• ō setteth prosperytye cytye ierusalem past 〈◊〉 serye therof present capi xix bvt mourne thou prynces israell saye wherfore laye thy mother lyonesse amonge lyon noryshed yonge one amonge lyon whelpes one whelpes brought vp became lyon lerned spoyle deuoure folke heathen herde hym toke hym theyre nettes brought chaynes vnto lande egypte nowe damme sawe hope comforte awaye toke another whelpes made lyon hym whiche went amonge lyon became fearce lyon lerned spoyle deuoure folcke destroyed theyr palace made theyr cytyes waste much whole lande euery thing therin vtterly desolate thorowe voyce hys roarynge came heathen together euery syde oute countrees agaynst hym layed theyr nettes hym toke pitte 4 reg 〈◊〉 • iere 〈◊〉 • 〈◊〉 ▪ • boūde chaynes brought kynge babylon put preson voyce shulde nomore herde vpon mountaynes israel thy mother lyke vyne thy bloude planted water syde frutes braūches growē many water stalkes strong men might haue made staues therof offycers grewe hye stalkes whan men sawe exceaded heyght multytude braunches roted dyspleasure caste downe grounde easte wynde dryed vp frute stronge stalkes broken wythered brent fyre nowe planted wyldernesse drye thrustye grounde fyre gone stalckes whiche hathe brente vp braunches frute hathe mo stronge stalckes staues offycers thys pyteous myserable thynge ¶ lorde denyeth wyll answere thē praye offēce vnkyndnes obiecteth promeseth people shall returne captiuyty wod shulde brent sygnyfyed burnyng ierusalem capi xx vij yeare x daye v moneth ezec xiiii happened certayne elder israell came vnto aske councell lorde sat downe came worde lorde vnto maner thou sonne man speake vnto elder israell saye vnto thus sayeth lorde god ye come hyther aske eny thyng truly lyue saieth lorde wyl geue answere wylt thou reproue thou sonne man wilt thou reproue shew abhomy nacyons theyr fore father tel thus sayeth lorde god exod iii b daye chose israell lyfte vp myne hande vpon sede house iacob shewed selfe vnto lande egipte yee lyfte vp myne hande ouer sayde lorde god euen daye lyfte vp myne hande ouer brynge lande egypte lande prouyded whiche floweth wyth mylcke hony pleasaunt lande among sayde vnto deu vii cast awaye euery man abhomynacyons hath defyle selues idoles egypte lorde youre god rebelled agaynst wolde folowe cast awaye euery man abhomynacyons eye forsake idoles egypte made poure indignacion ouer satisfye wrath vpon yee euen myddeste lande egypte wolde name sake shuld vnhalowed heathē amonge dwelte amonge shewed selfe vnto wolde brynge lande egypte nowe caryed lande egypte brought wyldernesse gaue commaundemētes shewed lawes deu iiii b gala iii b luite 18 exo xvi c 31 c 32 c whiche woso kepeth shall lyue gaue also holy dayes token betwyxte therby knowe lorde halowe yet house israell rebelled agaynst wyldernesse wolde wallke commaundementes haue caste awaye lawes whiche whoso kepeth shal lyue sabboth dayes haue greatly vnhalowed nu xiiii • psa xiv • made poure indygnacyon vpon consume wyldernesse yet wolde name sake leste shulde dyshonoured heathen caryed awaye swore vnto wyldernesse wolde brynge lande whiche gaue lāde floweth wyth milcke hony pleasure landes refused lawes walcked commaundementes vnhalowed sabbathes theyr herte gone theyr ydoles neuerthelesse myne eye spared woled vtterly sleye consume wyldernesse morouer sayde vnto theyr sonnes wildernes exod 1 • • walcke statute youre forefather kepe theyre ordynaunces defyle youre selues wyth theyr ydoles lorde youre god walcke statute kepe lawes halowe sabbathes ex 1 • •••• token betwyxte ye maye knowe howe y• lorde god notwithstandinge theyr sonnes nume 〈◊〉 leu xviii • gala iii • 〈…〉 rebelled agaynst also walked statute kepte lawes fulfyll doth shal lyue neyther halowed sabboth dayes made agayne poure indyngnacyon ouer satysfye wrath vpon wyldernesse neuerthelesse wythdrewe hande name sake lest shulde vnhalowed amonge heathen brought forthe lyft vp myne hande ouer also wyldernesse wolde scatre among heathen strawe amonge nacyons kepte lawes caste asyde commaundementes vnhalowed sabbathes lyfte vp theyr eye theyr father idoles wherfore gaue also commaundemētes good lawes thorowe whiche shulde lyue vnhalowed theyr owne gyftes exo xiii • appoynted selfe fyrst borne make desolate might know lord therfore thou sonne man tell house israel thus saieth lorde god besyde thys youre forefather haue yet blasphemed greatly offended agaynst brought lande promysed gyue sawe euery hye hyll thycke tree made theyr offrynges prouoked oblacions makynge swete sauoures poured drynck offringes asked haue ye withall ye go thyther therfore called hye place vnto thys daye wherfore speake vnto house israell thus sayeth lorde god ye euen vncleane fore father commytte whordome also theyr abhomynacions idoles vnto ye bryng oblacions iere xix deut xii xviii b ezec xix c 4 reg 18 c xxi 2 par 28 whose honoure ye burne child ye defyle selues euen vnto thys daye howe dare ye come aske questyon ye housholde israel truly lyue sayeth lorde god ye get answere thynge ye go shall come passe ye saye wyl heathen people lande wood stone wyll worshyppe truly lyue sayeth lorde god selfe wyll rule myghtye hande stretched arme indignaciō poured ouer wyll bring oute nacyons landes wherin ye scatred gather together mightye hande stretched arme indignacion poured vpon wyl brynge wyldernesse people wyll reason face face like punished forfathers wyldernes egypt wyl punish also saieth y• lorde god wyll bryng vnder iurisdiccyō vnder bonde couenaūt forsakers also transgressours wyl take frō amonge brynge lande youre habitacion lande israel shal come maye knowe howe lorde go nowe sayeth lorde god ye house israell esaye ii c xxx eze xiiii caste awaye destroye euery man hys idoles shall ye heare nomore blaspheme holy name offrynges idoles vpon holy hyll euen vpon hye hyl israell sayth lorde god shal house israel lande worshyppe deut xii xiiii b y• place wyl fauoure thē wyl require heaue offringes firstlynges oblacions al holy thinges wyll accepte youre swete sauoure bringe nacions gather together landes wherin ye scatred maye halowed heathen ye maye knowe lorde haue broughte lande israel yee y• lande swore geue vnto forefather shal ye call remembraūce owne wayes youre ymagynacyons wherin ye haue bene defyled iere viii 18 31 c ye shall dyspleased youre owne selues youre wyckednes ye haue done ye shall knowe lorde entreate name youre wycked wayes accordynge corrupte workes ye house israel sayeth lorde god moreouer worde lorde came vnto saying thou sonne man set thy face towarde south speake south wynde saye wood towarde south heare worde lorde thus saieth lorde god beholde wyll kyndle fyre shall consume grene tree drie man shalbe able quench flame loketh southe northe shalbe brent therin al fleshe shall se lorde haue kyndled man may quench sayde lorde god wyll saye iere xx • tushe fable telleth ¶ threatneth swerde saye destruccyon cytye ierusalem sheweth fall king zedekiah comaunded prophecy destruccyon chyldren ammon slaughter laste lorde threateneth deathe vnto nabuchodonosor hym selfe capi xxi worde lorde came sayinge thou sonne man set thy face towarde ierusalem speake agaynste sanctuary prophecye agaynst lande israel saye lande israel thus sayeth lorde beholde wyll vpon wyll drawe swearde sheath rote rightuous wycked seinge wyll rote rightuous wicked therfore shall swearde go sheath againste fleshe north southe fleshe maye knowe howe lorde haue drawen swearde sheath shal put agayne mourne therfore thou sonne man y• thy loynes cracke withall ye mourne bytterly yf saye wherfore mournest thou tell tydynges cōmeth hertes shall melte handes shalbe letten downe stomackes shall faynte knee shall waxe feble beholde commeth shalbe fulfylled sayeth lorde god agayne worde lorde came vnto sayinge thou sonne man prophecye speake thus sayeth lorde god speake swearde sharpened well scoured sharpened slaughter scoured maye bebryghte destroyenge staffe sonne shal bryng downe al wod hathe puthꝭ swearde y• dightynge y• good holde may taken thys swearde sharpened dyght y• may geuen hāde mā slayer crye thou sonne man howle swearde shall smyte people al ruler israel people shal slayne downe grounde thorow swearde smyte thou vpon thy thyghe wherfore shulde plage staffe iudgement come prophecye thou sonne man smyte thine hādes together make swearde two edged yee make thre edged y• manslayer swearde y• swearde greate slaughter whiche shall smyte euen theyr preuychambers make abashed faynte hertex gate make fall howe bryghte sharpe howe well dyghte met slaughter get place alone eyther vpon ryghte hande lefte whyther euer thy face turneth wyll smyte handes together also satysfye wrothfull indignacyon euen lorde haue sayde worde lorde came yet vnto agayne sayenge thou sonne man make two stretes swearde y• kynge babylon maye come stretes shal go one lande shal set vp place hede strete shal chose corner make strete swearde may come towarde rabath ammonite stronge cytye ierusalem kynge babylon shal stāde turnynge waye heade two stretes leul xix f xx • deut 18 b aske councell sothe sayers castyng lotte wyth hys arrowes aske councell idole loke lyuer sothesaynge shall poynt right syde vpon ierusalē y• maye set men warre smyte wyth greate noyse crye alarum set batell rammes gate graue vp dyches make bulworkes neuertheles sothesayenge shall holde vanite euen though ieste tolde yee selues remembre theyr wyckednesse ryght must taken wonne therfore sateth lorde god much ye selues shewe offence haue opened wickednes y• al workes men may se synnes yee much say ye selues haue made mencyon therof ye shall taken vyolence thou shamefull wycked gyde israel whose daye come euen tyme wic kednes shal haue ende thus sayeth lorde god take awaye garlande put crowne awaye humble exalted proude brought lowe punyshe punyshe yee punyshe wyll destroye shall fulfylled vntyll come whome iudgemente belongeth whome haue geuen thou sonne man prophecy speake thus sayeth lorde god chyldren ier • x ••• • exech xx • • amo • • • ammon theyr blasphemye speake yu swearde y• swearde drawē forth alredy y• slaughter scoured y• glistreth y• hast loked y• vanity prophecyed lye y• maye come vpō thy necke like vpō y• vngodly slame whose day came whā theyr wyckednes ful though put vp agayn sheath yet wil punyshe ye lande wher yu wast norished borne poure indignacyon vpon y• wyl blow vpō y• fyre wrath de lyuer y• vnto cruel people lerned destroy thou shalt fede y• fyre thy bloud shalbe shed y• lande yu mayest put remembraunce euen lorde haue spoken ¶ word lord agaynst ierusalē mā slaughter denyinge due honour vnto theyr father mother wychednesses wycked doctryne false prophetes prestes theyr vnsutiable couetousnes tyrannye ruler wyckednes people cap xxii morouer y• worde y• lorde came vnto sayde yu sonne man wylt thou reproue thꝭ bloudthrusty cyte shewe thē theyr abominaciōs tel thē thꝰ saieth y• lorde god yu cyte y• sheddest bloude myddest y• thy tyme maye come also makest idoles defyle yc withal thou hast made thy selfe gylty y• bloude thou haste shed defyled idoles whiche thou hast made thou hast caused dayes drawe nye made tyme thy yeares come therfore wyl make confounded amonge hea thē despysed landes whether nye farre shall laugh scorne thou hast gottē foule name arte full myschefe beholde ruler israel haue brought euery man power shed bloude deute v c xxvii c haue despysed father mother haue oppressed straunger haue vexed wydowe y• fatherlesse thou hast despysed sanctuary vnhalowed sabbath murthe rers shede bloude eate vpon hylles vse vn happynesse leui 18 y• haue discouered father shame haue vexed wemē syckenes euery man hath dealt shamefully neyghbours wyfe abhominably defyled daughter lawe hathe euery man forced owne syster euē fa thers daughter yee deut 27 c • zet xiii gyftes haue bene receaued y• shed blode exod 22 c thou hast taken vsury encreace thou hast oppressed thy neyghbours vy extorcion forgotten sayeth y• lord god beholde haue smytten handes vpon thy couetousnesse thou hast vsed vpon bloude whiche hath bene shed thy herte able en dure may thy handes defende selues tyme shal brynge vpon y• euen lord speake wyll brynge also passe e • ech xii c xv b wyll scatre y• amonge heathen strowe aboute landes wyll cause thy fylthynesse ceasse yee wyll haue possession syght heathen thou mayest knowe lorde worde lorde came vnto saying thou sonne man esay • • house israell turned drosse shulde brasse tynne yron leade fyre become drosse therfore thus say eth lorde god muche ye turned drosse beholde wyl bring together vnto ierusalem lyke syluer brasse yron tynne leade put together fornace fyre blowen vnder melte euen wyll gather put together melre wrath indignacyon wyll brynge together kyndle fyre cruell dyspleasure vnder ye maye melted therin lyke syluer melted fyre shall ye also melted therin ye may knowe howe lorde haue powred wrath vpon worde y• lorde came vnto sayinge thou sonne man tell thou art vnclene lande whiche rayned vpon day yu cruel wrath mich iii thy prophetes sworne together deuoure soules lyke roaryng lion yt lyueth praye receaue ryches good make many wyddowes thy prestes breake lawe defyle sāctuary leuiti x • put dyfferēce betwene holy vnholy neyther discerne betwene y• cleane vncleane turne eies fro sabbathes vnhalowed amonge thē thy ruler lyke rauyshynge wolues shed bloude destroye soules theyr owne couetous lucre mich iii • • n iii • eze • h 13 • thy prophetes dawbe vntempe red claye se vanytyes prophecye lye vnto thē saying lorde god sayeth lord hath spoken people lande vseth wycked extorcyon robbery vexe poore nedy e • odi 22 • oppresse straunger agaynst ryght sought lande man wolde make vp hedge set hym selfe gappe landes behalfe shulde vtterly destroye coulde fynde none therfore wyll poure cruel dyspleasure vpon burne thē fyre wrathe theyr owne wayes wyl recompence vpon heades saieth lorde god ¶ fornycacion saye idolat • ye samaria ierusalem vnder name dholah dholivah comparyson samaria sheweth fornycacyon ierusalem fylthyer destrucryon ierusalem prophecyed aduoutry re founde theyr destruccyon capi xxiii worde lord came vnto sayinge thou sōne mā two wemen one mother yonge beganne play harlottes ezech xx egypt theyr bre stes brosed pappes theyr mayden heade destroyed eldest cal led dholah yōgest syster dholibah two myne bare sonnes daughter name samaria dholah ierusalem dholibah dholah begāne go whoring whē takē 4 reg 15 sette fyre vpon louers assyryans whiche wyth euen prynces lordes deckte costely araye fayre yonge men lusty ryders horse thus thorow whordome cleaued vnto yonge men assiria yee mad vpon defyled herselfe al theyr idol nether ceassed fornacyon vsed egypcyans youthe laye brosed brestes maydenhead poured theyr whordome vpō wherfore 4 17 c delyuered handes louers euen assyryans loued dyscouered shame toke sōnes daughter siewe swerde euyl name gat people punyshed iere iii b syster oholibah sawe destroyed herselfe inordynate loue exceaded syster whoredome 4 16 b ezec 〈◊〉 • loued assyrtans whiche also lay wt namely prince great lordes clothed maner gorgeous apparell lusty horseman fayre yonge personnes sawe bothe defyled lyke increased styll whoredome sawe men paynted vpon wal ymages caldees set forth freshe coloures fayre gyrdles goodly bonettes vpon heades lokynge lyke prynces maner babylontans caldees theyr owne lande borne immediatly sone sawe brēt loue vpon sente messaungers lande caldees nowe babylonyans came laye defyled theyr whoredome polluted luste abated frome esay 4 • • 〈◊〉 3 ezec 〈◊〉 whoredome shame discouered sene herte forsoke lyke herte gone syster also neuerthelesse vsed whordome euer longer remembred dayes youth wherin played harlot lande egypt ezec x •• c brent luste vpon whose flesshe lyke flesshe ass theyr sede lyke sede horse thus thou hast renued fylthynesse thy youth thy louers brosed thy pappes marred thy brestes egypte therfore oholibah thus sayeth lorde god wyl rayse vp thy louers thou hast satysfyed thy lust agaynst gather together roude namely babylonian caldees ruler myghtye men tyraūtes assyryans yonge fayre louers prynces lordes knightes gentylmen whiche good horseman shall come vpon horse charettes great multitude people whiche shalbe harnessed aboute euery side brestplates sheldes helmettes wyll punysh yee themselues shall punysh accordynge theyr owne iudgement wyll put gelousy vpon shal deale cruelly shal cut thy nose thyne eares rēnaunt shal fal thorowe swerde shall carye awaye thy sonnes daughter resydue shalbe brente fyre shall strype thy clothes cary thy costely iewels awaye thus wyll make ende thy fylthynesse whoredome whiche thou haste brought lande egypte thou shalte turne thyne eye nomore cast thy mynde nomore vpon egypte thus sayeth lorde god beholde wyll delyuer handes thou hatest yee euen handes thou haste fulfylled thy lust whiche shall deale cruelly wt thy laboure shall take wyth leaue naked bare thus shame thy fylthy whordome shal come lyght thynges shal happē vnto thy whoredome whiche thou hast vsed amonge gentyles whose idol thou hast defiled thyself thou hast walked waye thy syster therefore wyl geue cup thy hande thus sayeth lord god thou shalt dryncke thy systers cuppe howe depe farre euer botome thou shalt laughed scorne greately derisyon possyble thou shalte full dronckenes sorowe cup thy syster samaria cuppe destruccyon wastynge shalt thou dryncke suppe euen dregges yee yu shalt eate vp broken peces teare thine owne brestes euen haue spoken sayeth lorde god therfore thus sayeth lorde god much thou hast forgotten cast asyde beare nowe thyne owne fylthynes whordome lorde sayde moreouer vnto thou sonne man wylt thou reproue oholah oholibah shewe abhominacyōs namely haue broken wedlocke stayned theyr handes bloude yee euen ydoles haue cōmytted aduoutry 4 ••• e 21 ezec xvi c offred theyr owne chyldren deuoured borne vnto yee thys haue done vnto also haue defiled sanctuary day haue vnhalowed sabboth slayne child theyr idoles came daye sanctuary defyle lo haue done house besyde al thou hast sente thy messaungers men farre countrees came thou hast bathed trymmed set forth thyself best fashion thou sattest vpon goodly bed table spred wherupō thou hast set mine exo xxx incense myne oyle great chere men sent farre countrees ouer deserte vnto gaue bracelettes vpon theyr handes sett glorious crownes vpon hedes thoughe doute wyll vse harlotrye also wente vnto comen harlot euen went also ohalah oholibah fylthy wemen ye loue vertu ryghtuousnes iudge punysh leui xx b ezec xvi aduoutrers murtherers ought iudged punyshed brekers wedlock bloude theyr handes wherfore thus sayeth lorde god brynge greate multytude people vpon make scatred spoyled shal stone gore theyr sweardes shal sleye theyr sōnes daughter burne vp theyr house fyre thus wyl destroye suche fylthynes lande wemen may learne vnclennes shall laye fylthynes vpon youre owne selues ye shalbe punished sinnes ye haue cōmitted idol ye shall knowe lorde god ¶ proueth fyrynge ierusalem parable sethynge potte parable ezechi • lo wyfe beyng deed whiche expoundeth capi xxiiii nynth yeare tenth monethe tenthe daye moneth came worde lorde vnto sayenge thou sonne man wryte vp name daye yee euen houre thys presente daye kyng babylon set hymselfe agaynste▪ ierusalem • shewe obstynate housholde ezec 17 parable speake vnto thus sayeth theezech xi b lorde god get potte set poure water put peces together good peces loyne shoulder fyll best bone take one best shepe heape bone let boyle well let bone seeth well therin sayde lorde god thys maner naum 3 • • ba • 11 b wo vnto bloudy cyty pot wherupon rustynes hangeth yet scoured awaye take peces one another▪ neade lotte cast therfore bloude yet upon playne drye stone hathe poured vpon grounde myght couered duste therfore haue letten poure bloude vpon playne drye stony rocke shuld hyd myght brynge wrothful indignacyon vengeaunce vpon wherfore thus sayeth lord god wo vnto bloude thursty cyte whō wyl prepare heape wodde beare thou bone together kyndle thou fyre seeth flesshe let well sodden bone maye suckte moreouer set pot emptye vpon coales may warme metall hote fyfth rustynes maye consumed wyl go muche rustines must brent thy fylthynesse abhomynable wolde haue clensed thou woldest clensed thou canst pourged thyne vnclenuesse tyll poured wrothefull indyguacyon vpon euen lorde haue deuysed yee come therto redy wyll wyll go backe wyll spare wyll entreated accordynge thy wayes ymagynacyons thou shalte punysshed sayeth lorde god worde lorde came vnto sayinge thou sonne man beholde wyll take awaye pleasure thyne eye plage yet shalte thou neyther mourne wepe water thy chekes therfore thou mayest mourne thyselfe alone vse deadely lamentacyon holde thy bonet put thy shues vpon thy fet • couer thy face eate mourner breade spake vnto people tymes mornyng euen wyfe dyed vpon nexte thorowe dyd cōmaunded people sayd vnto wylte thou tell v sygny fyeth whiche thou doest answered worde lorde came vnto sayenge tell house israell thus sayeth lorde god beholde wyll suspende sanctuary euen glorye youre power pleasure eye thyng ye loue sonnes daughter ye haue lefte shall fall thorowe swearde lyke haue done shall ye also ye shall hyde face ye shall eate mournets bread bonettes shal ye haue vpon heades shues vpon youre fete ye shall neyther mourne wepe synnes ye shalbe sorowfull one reyente another thus ezechiell shewe token loke hath done commeth ye shall also ye may lerne knowe lorde god beholde thou sonne man daye take frome theyr power theyr ioye honoure luste theyr eye burthen theyr bodyes namely theyr sonnes daughter shal one escape come vnto shewe daye shall thy mouth opened hym whiche escaped thou mayest speake domme yee thou shalte theyr shewe token maye knowe howe lorde ¶ worde lorde vpon sonnes ammon whiche reioysed fal ierusalem moab seyr agaynst idume • agoynst philistynes capi xxv worde y• lord came vnto sayenge thou sonne man set thy face agaynst e •• xxi iere xlix ammonytes prophecy vpon saye vnto ammonytes heare worde lorde god thus sayeth lorde god muche thou speakest ouer sanctuarye ha trowe nowe suspended ouer lande israel trowe desolate yee ouer house iuda trow led awaye presoners beholde wyll delyuer people east yt maye haue possessyon shal set theyr castels house shall eate thy fruyte dryncke vp thy mylcke rabath wyl make stal camel ammon shepefolde ye shall knowe lorde thus sayeth y• lorde god much thou hast clapped thyne hādes stamped thy fete yee reioysed thyne herte ouer lande israel despyte beholde wyll stretche hande ouet also delyuer spoyled heathen rote amonge people cause destroyed landes yee wyll make layed waste thou mayest knowe lorde thus sayeth lorde god much esay 15 16 48 • sopho 2 • moab seir saye house iuda lyke gentile therfore beholde wyl make cyties moab weapenelesse take awaye theyr strength theyr cyties chefe coastes theyr lande whiche pleasure countre namely bethiesimoth baalmeon cariathaim wyll open vnto east may tall vpon ammonytes wyll geue possession ammonytes shall nomore remēbraunce among heathen euen thus wyll punysh moab also maye knowe howe lorde moreouer thus sayeth lorde god esay 34 • iere xlix b ezec 〈◊〉 • • xxxv • psal 137 b gen xxv • edom hath auenged eased hym selfe vpon house iuda therfore thus sayeth y• lorde wyl reache myne hande vpon edom take awaye man beast theman vnto dedan wyll make desolate shal slayne swearde 2 • v • thorowe people israell wyll auenge agayne vpon edom shall handle hym accordyng wrath indignacyon shal knowe vengeaunce sayeth lorde god thus sayeth lord god muche esay 14 • iere 47 • sopho •• philistine haue done namely taken vengeaunce
