despytefull stomackes olde euell wyl set sel •• e destroye therfore thus sayeth lorde god beholde wyl stretch myne hāde ouer philistine destroye y• destroyer cause al remnaunt see coast perysh great vengeaunce wyll take vpon punysh cruellye may knowe howe lord whiche haue auenged ¶ prophecyeth tyrus shalbe ouerthrowen reioyced destruccyon ierusalem wonderyng astonyshement • chauntes desol • ryon tyrus capi xxvi thappened eleuenth yeare y• fyrste day moneth worde lorde came vnto sayenge thou sonne man esa xxiii ier xlvii b eze xxxii xxviii tyre hathe spoken vpon ierusalem ha • nowe trowe porte people broken turned vnto haue destroyed belyfull yee therfore sayeth lorde god beholde tyre wyll vpon wyll brynge great multitude people agaynst lyke see aryseth hys waues shall breake walles tyre cast downe towres wyll scrape grounde make bare stone yee dryeng place fyshers hange vp theyr nettes see syde euen haue spoken sayeth lorde god gentyles shall spoyle daughter vpon felde shall perysh swearde maye knowe howe lorde thus sayeth lorde god beholde wyl bryng hyther nabuchodonosor whiche kynge babylon kynge kynges north vpon tyre horse charettes horsmē greate multytude people thy daughter lande shall slayne swearde agaynst shall make bull workes graue vp diches lyfte vp shylde agaynst slynges batelrammes shall prepare thy walles weapens breake downe thy wr • dust hꝭ horse shal couer shalbe many thy walles shall shake noyse horsmen charettes wheles commeth thy porte men open cytie hoffes horse fete shal treade downe al stretes shal steye people swearde breake downe pylers thy strength shal wast awaye thy ryches spoyle thy marchaundyse thy walles shall breake downe destroye thy house pleasure thy stone thy tym bre foundacyons shall caste water iere vii b thus wyll brynge y• melody thy songes voyce thy mynistrelsy ende shall nomore herde wyll make bare stone yee dryinge place nettes thou shalt neuer buylded agayne euen y• lorde haue spoken sayeth lorde god thus hathe lorde god spoken concernynge tyre iles shall moued noyse thy fall crye slayne shall murthered kynges see shall come downe theyr seates regall shall laye awaye theyr robe put theyr costly clothynge yee trem blynge shall clothed shall syt vpon grounde shalbe afrayed thy soden fall abaysshed shall mourne saye vnto treno • apo xviii • thou noble cytie haste bene greatly occupyed olde thou haste bene strongest vpon see thyne inhabytonrs men stode feare howe arte thou nowe vtterly destroyed nowe tyme thy fal inhabytours iles yee iles thē selues shal stande feare thyne ende thus sayeth lorde god make desolate cytie cyties man dwell brynge depe vpon greate water may couerthe wyll cast downe vnto descende pytte vnto people hathe bene longe deed set lande beneth lyke olde wyldernes go downe theyr graues man shall dwell wyll make nomore honoure lande lyuynge wyl make ende thou shalt gone though thou sought yet shalte thou nat founde euer sayeth lorde god ¶ prophete moued bewayle desulacyon tyrus se • teth pr • yse tyrus 〈◊〉 marchaunt • ther • capi xxvii worde lorde came vnto sayenge thou sonne man make lamētable compl ••• te vpō eze 2 • 28 tyre saye vnto tyre whic •• • porte see occupyeth muche people many iles thus speaketh lorde god tyre thou haste sayde noble cytie thy border myddest see thy buylders haue made maruelous goodly thy table haue made cypre tree mounte sanyr libanus haue takē cedre tre • make mastes okes basan make owers thy bordes haue made yuery costly wod ile cethim thy sayle whyte smal nedle worke lande egypt hange vpon thy maste thy hangynges yelowe sylke purple iles elisah sydon arnad thy maryners wysest tyre thy shypmasters eldest wysest ☞ gebal mended stopped thy shyppes shyppes see theyr shypmen occupyed theyr marchaundies perses lidians lybians thyne host helped fyght hanged vp theyr shyldes helmettes set forth thy bewty atnad thyne host rounde aboute thy walles thy watchman vpon thy towres hanged vp theyr shyldes rounde thy walles made meruelous goodly tharsis occupyed maner ware syluer yron tynne leade made thy marcket greate iouan tubal mesech thy marchauntes whiche brought men ornamentes metall thy occupyenge house thogarma brought vnto tyme thy marte horse horsmen mule e • c • xxv c dedan thy merchauntes many iles occupyed brought weather elephant bone peacockes present syrian occupyed thy dyuerse workes increased thy merchaundyes smaragdes scarlet nedle worcke whyte lynen cloth sylcke crystall iuda lande israell occupyed brought vnto thy markettes wheat balme hony oyle triacle damascus also vsed marchaundyes best wyne whyt woll cause thy occupyenge great thy ware many dan iauan meusall haue brought vnto thy markettes yron redy made cassia calamus accordynge thy •• occupyenge dedan occupyed th •• n fayre tapestrye worke quoshyns arabia prynces cedar haue occupyed shepe weather goates marchauntes seba rema haue occupyed also costly spyces precyous stone golde whiche brought vnto thy markettes haran chene eden marchauntes saba assiria chelmad doer occupyed costly rayment yalowe sylcke nedle worcke precyous therfore packte bounde together rope yee cedre wodde tyme thy markettes shyppes tharsis chefe thy occupyenge thus thou art full greate worshyp euen myddest see thy maryners euer bryngynge vnto many water easte wynde shall ouerbeare myddest see thy ware thy marchaundyes thy ryches thy maryners thy shypmasters thy helper thy occupyers brought thynges necessary mē warre yee thy comens shall perysh myddest see daye thy fall suburbes shall shake loude crye thy shypmen al whyry men maryners vpon see shall leape theyr boates set selues vpon lande shall lyfte vp theyr voyce make lamentable crye shall caste duste vpon theyr heades lye downe asshes shall shaue selues put sacke cloth vpō thy sake shall mourne hertfull sorowe heuy lamentacyon yee theyr chyldren also shall wepe ala cytie hathe bene destroyed see tyre thy ware marchaundyes came see thou gauest al people ynough kynges earth hast thou made ryche thorowe multitude thy water occupyenge thou arte nowe cast downe depe see thy resorte people peryshed dwell iles abashed al theyr kynges afrayed yee theyr face haue chaunged coloure marchauntes nacyons wondre y• thou art cleane brought naught commeth nomore vp ¶ worde god kyng tyr • pride daniel prophet moued bewalk kyng tyrus worde lorde agaynst sydon lord pro miseth wyll gather together chyldren israel worde lord came vnto sayenge thou sonne man tell prynce eze 26 7 tyre thus sayeth lorde god thou hast proude hert hast sayde esai▪ xiii • god haue seate myddest see lyke god thou art man nat god yet stādest thyne owne conceyte thou art god beholde thou thynkest thy selfe ☞ wyser • 〈◊〉 daniel secretes hyd thy wysdome thy vnderstandynge hast gotten great welthynes gathered treasure syluer golde thy greate wysdome occupyenge hast thou increased thy power thy great rychesse thy herte proude therfore thus sayeth lorde god much thou hast lyft vp thine hert though thou god beholde wyl brynge enemyes vpon euen tyrauntes heathē shal drawe theyr sweardes vpon thy bewty wysdome shall defyle thy glory shall caste downe pytte thou shalt dye myddest see slayne let se yf thou wylt saye slaye god thou art man nat god handes slaye dye shalt thou euen vncircumcised handes enemyes selfe haue spoken sayeth lorde god moreouer worde lorde came vnto sayeng thou sonne man make lamentable complaynte ouer kynge tyre tell hym thus sayeth lorde god thou art seale lycknesse full wysdome excellent bewty thou hast bene pleasaunt garden god thou art decte maner precyous stone ruby topas crystall iacyncte onix iaspis saphyr smaragde carbouncle golde thy bewty hole set forth daye thy creacyō ⚜ thou art fayre cherub stretched wyde couer haue set vpon holy mounte god haste thou bene walked amonge fayre glysterynge stone tyme thy creacyon thou haste bene ryght excellent tyll wyckednes founde esaye ii b thy great marchaundyse thy herte full wyckednesse thou haste offended therfore wyll cast mounte god thou couerynge cherub destroye amonge glystrynge stone thy hert pronde thy fayre bewty thorowe thy bewte thou haste destroyed thy wysdome wyll caste downe grounde syght kynges thou hast defyled thy sanctuary greate wyckednes thy vnryghteous occupyeng wyl brynge fyre myddest consume wyl make asshes sight loke vpon haue bene acquaynted among heathen shalbe abasshed seyng thou art clene brought naught cōmest nomore vp worde lorde came vnto sayeng thou sonne man set thy face agaynst sydon io • iii • otha ix • prophecye vpon speake thus sayeth lorde god beholde sydon wyll vpon get honoure maye knowne howe lorde punyshe get honoure wyll sende pestilence bloude sheddynge streates whiche slayne swearde shall lye rounde aboute myddest shall knowe lorde shall nomore pryckynge thorne hurtynge breer vnto house israel vnto thē lye rounde aboute hate shall knowe lorde thus sayeth lorde god whan gather housholde israel together agayne nacyons amonge scatered shall sanctifyed syght gentyles shall dwell lande gaue seruaunt iacob shall dwell safely therin buylde house plante vyne yardes yee safely deut 〈◊〉 • esa lxv • shall dwell therin haue punyshed despyse thē rounde aboute shall knowe lorde theyr god ¶ prophecyeth phardo prophe • yeth •• sola • yō egypte sparklyng abrode egypcyans lorde promyseth wyl restoare egypte agayne xl yeares egypte rewarde kyng nabu • hodonosor labour whiche toke agaist tyruis capi xxix tenth yeare vpon twelueth day ef tenth moneth worde lorde came vnto sayenge esay xix x • iere 46 e ••• 3 • 31 xxx •• thou sonne man sette nowe thy face agaynst pharao kynge egypte prophecye agaynst agaynst whole lande egypte speake tell hym thus sayeth lorde god beholde pharao thou kynge egypte wyll vpō ☞ thou greate dragon lyest water thou sayest water myne haue made selfe wyll put hoke thy chawes hange fysh thy water vpon thy skales wyll drawethe thy water yee fysh thy water hange vpon thy skales ☞ wyll caste vpon drye lande fysh thy water thou shalt lye vpon felde thou shalt nat gathered taken vp shalte meate beastes felde foules ayre dwell egypt may knowe lorde ☞ thou hast bene 4 18 e •• xxx • 31 36 • • fe rede house israell toke holde theyr hande thou broke pryckedst thē euery syde yf leaned vpō thou brakest hurtest reynes theyr backes therfore thus sayth lorde god beholde wyl brynge swearde vpon rote man beaste yee lande egypte shalbe desolate waste shall knowe lorde sayde water myne selfe haue made beholde therfore wyl vpon vpō thy water wyll make lande egypte wast desolate ye tower syenes vnto border morians lāde fourty yeares shall fote man walke neyther fote catell go neyther shal inhabyted wyll make lande egypte desolate amonge waste countrees cytyes lye voyde xl yeares amonge voyde cytyes wyll scatre egypcyans amonge heathen nacions strowe landes aboute agayne thus sayeth ye lorde godiere xlvi • xl yeares expyred wyll gather egypcians together agayne nacyons amonge whome scatred wyll brynge presoners egypt agayne ye lande patures theyr owne natyue countre maye lowly small kyngdome yee shalbe smallest amonge kyngdomes lest exalte selues aboue heathen wyll monysh shal nomore rule heathen shall nomore hope vnto house israell neyther prouoke wyckednes cause thē turne backe folowe shal knowe lorde god xxvij yeare fyrst daye fyrst moneth came worde lorde vnto sayenge thou sonne man nabuchodonosor kynge babylon hathe made hys hoost greate trauayle laboure come tyre yt euery heade maye balde euery shulder bare yet hathe tyre geuen neyther hym hys hoost rewarde greate trauayle hathe taken therfore thus sayeth lorde god beholde wyl geue lande egypte vnto nabuchodonosor kynge babylon maye take awaye substaunce robbe roberyes spoyle spoyles paye hys hoost theyr wagyes withall wyll geue hym lande egypt labour toke tyre tyme wyll cause horne house israel growe forth open thy mouth agayne amonge thē maye knowe howe lorde ¶ tho distruccion egypt cyties bewayled capi xxx worde lorde came ouer vnto sayenge thou sonne man prophecye speake thus sayeth lorde god mourne wo worth thys daye daye daye lorde come ☞ darke daye heathen houre hande swearde commeth vpon egypte wounded men fall downe egypte people taken awaye foundacyons destroyed morians lande shal afrayed yee morians lande libia lidia theyr comen people chu • confederate vnto thē shall fall thorowe swearde thus sayeth lorde maynteyners lande egypte shall fall pryde power shall come downe euen vnto tower syenes shall slayne downe swearde sayeth lorde god among desolate coūtrees shalbe made desolate amonge waste cyties shalbe wasted shall knowe lorde kyndle fyre egypte helper destroyed tyme shall theyr messaungers go forth frō shyppes make carelesse morians afrayed sorowe shall come vpon thē daye egypte doubtles shall come thus sayeth lorde god wyl make ende people egypte thorowe hande nabuchodonosor kyng babylon hys people yee cruell tyrauntes heathen shalbe brought destroye lande shall drawe theyr sweardes vpon egypte fyll lande full slayne men wyll drye vp theyr floudes water sell lande handes wycked people lande therin wyll destroye thorowe enemyes euen lorde haue sayde thus sayeth lorde god zoch • 〈…〉 wyl destroye idol brynge ymages ☞ noph ende shal nomore prince egypte fearfulnes wyl sende egipcians lāde pathures wyl make desolat kyndle fyre zoan alexandria wil punysh poure wrathful indygnaciō vpon sin whiche strength egypte al substaunce alexandria wyll destroye kyndle fyre egypte sin shalbe greate heuynesse alexandria shalbe roted noph shall haue bayly sorowe beste men helyopolys bubasto shall slayne swearbe caryed awaye captyue caphnis day shalbe darcke breake scepter lande egypt pompe power shall haue ende ☜ cloude shall couer daughter shalbe led awaye captyuyte thus wyl punyshe egypt may know howe lorde happened eleuenth yeare vpon seuēth daye fyrste moneth lordes worde came vnto sayinge beholde thou sonne man wyll breake arme pharao kynge egypte lo shall bounde vp healed neyther shal playster layed vpon ease make stronge holde swearde therfore thus sayeth lorde god beholde wyll vpon pharao kyng egypte bruse strong arme yet broken one wyl smite swearde handes egyptyans wyll seatre amonge heathen strowe landes aboute agayne wyll strength arme kynge babylon geue hym swearde hande wyl breake pharaos arme shal holde hym pyteously lyke wounded man yee wyll stablyshe kynge babilons arme armes pharao shal fall downe maye knowen lorde whiche geue kynge balyon swearde hande may drawe vpon lande egypte scatre egyptyans among gentyles strowe landes aboute may knowe lorde ¶ comparyson prosperite pharao prosperyte assyryans prophecyeth lyke destruccyon vnto bothe capi xxxi moreover happened eleuenth yeare fyrst daye thyrde moneth worde lorde came vnto saying thou sonne man speake vnto pharao kynge egypte people arte thou lyke thy greatnesse beholde assur lyke cedre tree vpon mounte libanus fayre braunches thycke gaue shadowes shot verye hye hys toppe reached vnto cloudes water made hym greate depe set hym vp hye rounde aboute rote hym • ā ne floudes water sent lyt le ryuers vnto al tree felde therfore hygher tree felde thorowe multytude water sente hym optayned many longe braunches al foules ayre made theyr nestes hys braunches vnder bowes gendred beastes felde vnder shadowe dwelte people fayre beautyfull greatnesse length hys braunches hys rote stode besyde greate water ☞ cedre tree myght hyde pleasaūt garden god fyrre tree lyke braūches playne tree lyke bowes hym tree garden god myght compared vnto hym beauty fayre goodly made hym ye multytude hys braū ches muche ⚜ tree pleasaunt garden god enuye therfore thus sayeth lorde god moche hath lyfte vp hym selfe hye stretched top cloudes seynge herte proude hyghnesse wyll delyuer hym handes myghtiest amonge heathen shal rote hym accordynge wyckednes wyll caste hym awaye enemyes shall destroye mighty men hethen shall scatre hym braunches shall lye vpon mountaynes valley bowes shalbe broken downe grounde thorowe lande people lande shall go shadowe forsake hym fallen foules ayer shall syt vpon hym wylde beastes felde shall go aboute ☞ amonge braunches hence forth tre water shal attayne hyghnesse reache toppe vnto cloudes neyther shall tree water stande hye hath done vnto death shall al delyuered vnder earthe go downe graue lyke men moreouer thus sayeth lord god day goeth downe graue wyll cause lamentacyon made wyll couer depe vpon hym wyl staūch hys floudes great water shalbe straygned shall cause lybanus sorowefull sake tree felde shalbe smytten wyl • make heathen shake sounde fall cast downe esay x • iii • ezech • 32 • hell descende pytte tree eden chosen beste tree lybanus yee planted vpon water shall mourne hym also lower habitaciōs shal go downe hell hym vnto slayne swearde whiche dwelte afore vnder shadowe arme among heathen shalt thou lyckened arte glorious great among tree eden▪ yet arte thou cast downe vnder earth among tree eden thou must lye amonge vncircumcysed slayne swearde euen thus pharao people sayeth lorde god ¶ prophete commaunded bewayle pharao • ynge egypt prophecyeth destruccyon shal come vnto egypte thorowe kynge babylon capi xxxii ☜ n twelueth yeare fyrste daye twelueth moneth worde lorde came vnto sayenge thou sōue man take vp lamentacion vpon e • rth xxix xxx xxxi pharao kynge egypte saye vnto hym thou arte reputed lyon heathen whalefyshe see thou castest thy water aboute thou troublest water thy fete stampest theyr floudes thus sayeth lorde god ezeth xii b xvii • wyll sprede net ouer namely greate multytude people shall dryue yarne wyl cast vpon lande let lye vpon felde foules ayre maye syt vpon wyll geue al beastes felde ynoughe thy flesshe wyll caste vpon h • lles fyll valley hyghnesse wyll water lande aboundaunce bloude euen mountaynes valley shall full thou arte put wyll couer heauen make hys starres dymme esay xiii b wyll sprede • loude ouer sonne moone shall geue lyght lyghtes heanen wyll put ouer brynge darckenes vpon thy lande sayeth lord god wyl trouble hertes many people bring thy destruccyon amonge heathen countrees thou knowest yee wyl make many people kinges afrayed thorowe theyr heare shall stande vp shake swerde face sodenly shal astonyed euery man selfe day thy fall thus sayeth lord god kyng babilons swearde shall come vpon sweardes worthyes wyll smytte downe thy people myghtye amonge gentyles shall waste proude pompe egypte bring downe people catell also egypte wyll destroy shal come vpon water neyther man fote beastes clawe shal stere wyll make theyr water cleare cause theyr floudes runne lyke oyle sayth lorde god make lande egypte desolate countre therein shall layde waste smyte whiche dwell maye knowe lorde mournyng daughter heathen shal make yee sorowe lamentacion shal take vp vpon egipt people sayeth lorde god xij yeare xv day moneth came worde lorde vnto sayinge thou sonne man take vp alamentacion vpon people egypte cast downe yee myghtye people heathen also euen thē esay 14 • ▪ ezec 〈◊〉 ▪ • dwell beneth go downe graue downe howe fayre euer thou lay vncircumcised amonge slayne swearde shal lye swearde geuen al redy shall drawen forth people myghty worthyes helper gone downe lye vncyrcumcised slayne swerde shal speake hel assur also company theyr graues rounde aboute whiche slayne fell swearde whose graues lye besyde lowe pytte comens buried rounde aboute graue al together wounded slayne swerde men afore tyme brought feare lande lyuynge iere 〈◊〉 • 〈◊〉 〈◊〉 elam also hys people graues rounde aboute al beyng wounded slayne swerde gone downe vncircumcysed vnder earthe whiche neuerthelesse sometyme brought feare lande lyuyng whiche beare shame goue downe graue theyr burial geuen al people amonge slayne theyr graues rounde aboute whiche vncircumcysed slayne thorowe swearde seyinge tymes past made lande lyuyng afrayed muste nowe beare theyr owne shame go downe pytte lye among thē slayne mesech also tuball theyr people theyr graues rounde aboute amonge vncircumcysed slayne swearde cause afore tyme made lande lyuynge afrayed shulde lye also amonge worthyes vucircumcysed gyauntes whiche theyr weapens gone downe hell whose sweardes layde vnder theyr heades whose wyckenesse vpon theyr bone worthyes haue brought feare lande lyuynge yee among vncircumcysed shalt thou destroyed slepe peryshed thorowe swearde lande iere x • ix b 〈◊〉 • xv b xx • v edom kynges prynces also whiche theyr strength layde slayne swearde yee amonge vncircū cysed gone downe pytte moreouer prynces north al sidouyans gone downe slayne theyr feare strength come confusion lye vncircuncised amonge slayne swearde beare theyr owne shame gone downe pytte whan pharao seyth shalbe comforted ouer hys people slayne swearde bothe pharao al host sayeth lorde god haue geuen feare y• lande lyuyng pharao people shall lye amonge vncircuncysed amonge slayne swearde sayeth lorde god ¶ setteth offyce curate preacheth gospel strengtheneth dy • n • boldeneth promes mercy worde lorde agaynst remnaunt people agaynste mocker wordes prophete capi xxxiii agayne worde lorde came vnto sayinge thou sonue man speake chyldren thy people tell theym whan seude swearde vpon lande yf people lande take man theyr countre set hym theyre 3 reg 9 • watcheman man whan seyth swearde come vpon lande shall blowe trompet warne people man nowe heare noyse trompette wyll warned swearde come take hym awaye hys bloude shall vpon owne heade herde sounde trompet wolde take hede therfore bloude vpon hym yf wyll receaue warnynge shall saue lyfe agayne yf watcheman se swerde come shew trōpet people warned swerde come take man amonge shall taken awaye owne synne bloude wyll requyre watchman hande ezech iii • thou sonne man haue made watchman vnto house israell thou hearest thyng mouthe thou mayest warne behalfe saye vnto wycked thou wicked thou shalt surely dye thou geuest warnyuge maye bewarre vngodly waye shall wycked dye owne synne bloude wyl requyre thy hande neuertheles yf thou warne wycked waye turne yet wyl turned shall dye hys synne thou hast delyuered thy soule therfore thou sonne man speake vnto house israel ye saye thus offence synnes lye vpon v corrupte howe shulde restored vnto lyfe tell eze xviii • truely lyue saieth lord god haue pleasure death wycked much rather wycked turne waye lyue turne turne youre vngodly wayes ye house israell oh wherfore wyll ye dye thou sonne man tell chyldren thy people ezech 〈◊〉 ryghtuousnes rightuous shal saue whan soeuer turneth awaye vnfaythfully agayne wyckednesse wycked shall hurte whan soeuer conuerteth vngod lynesse ryghtuousnes ryghtuous shall saue hys lyfe whan soeuer synneth saye vnto ryghtuous shall surely lyue trust owne ryghtuousnesse synne shall hys ryghtuousnesse nomore thought vpon wyckednesse hath done shall dye esay iv • 〈◊〉 18 • agayne saye vnto wycked thou shalte surely dye turne synnes thynge lawful ryght much wycked man geueth pledge agayne restoreth taken awaye robbery walcketh commaundementes lyfe dothe wronge shall surely lyue dye yee sine hath done shall neuer thought vpon muche dothe nowe thynge lawful ryght shall lyue yet chyldren thy people say tush way lorde ryght owne way rather vnryght ryghtuous turneth hys ryghtuousnesse dothe thynge wycked shal dye therefore yf wycked turne wyckednesse doyng thyng lawful ryght shal liue therfore yet ye say e •••• • 〈◊〉 • way lord equal ye house israel rom • ii • wyl iudge euery one wayes xij yeare v daye tenth moneth oure captyuite happened one fled ierusalem came vnto sayde cytie destroyed nowe hande lorde bene vpon euenynge afore man escaped came vnto ☜ opened mouth vntyll mornynge came ye opened mouth dōme came worde lorde vnto sayde thou sōne man dwell wasted lande israel saye abraham one man lande possession many lande geuen v possesse also therfore tell thus sayeth lorde god leu • xvii bloude haue ye eaten eye haue ye lyfte vp idoles deu • iii c haue shed bloude shall ye haue lande possession yeleane vpon sweardes ye worke abhomynacyons euerye one defyleth▪ hys neyghbours wyfe shall ye possesse lande saye thou wordes vnto thus sayeth lorde god truely lyue ye dwell wyldernesse shall slayne swearde euer vpon felde wyll geue vnto beastes deuoured stronge holdes dennes shall dye pestylence wyl make lande desolate wast pōpe strēgth shal come ende mountaynes israell shalbe waste man shal trauayle therby ez •• xxv • shall lerne knowe lorde make lande wast desolate theyr abhomina cyon haue wrought thou sonne man child thy people talcke walles dores house saying one another come let v heare worde gone forth lorde come vnto maner greate people yee people syt downe heare thy wordes thereafter e •• 〈◊〉 • mat xv • theyre mouthes shewe selues though feruente theyr herte goeth theyr owne couetous lucre balet hathe swete tune pleasaunt synge shalte thou vnto thy wordes shall heare wyll therafter whan thys commeth passe lo commeth dede shall knowe hath bene prophete amonge ¶ agaynst byshoppes • urate despyse flocke chryst seake theyr owne lorde sayeth wyll vyset disparsed flocke gather together reproueth malyce certayne flocke promyseth true shepherde christ peace capi xxxiiii worde lorde came vnto sayinge thou sonne man prophecye agaynste shepherdes israell prophecye speake vnto thus sayeth lord god ezec • iii • iere 14 〈◊〉 xxiii • wo vnto shepherdes israell fede selues shuld shepherdes fede flockes ye haue eaten vp fatte ye haue clothed woll beste fedde haue ye slayne flocke haue ye norysshed weake haue ye holden vp luke 〈◊〉 ▪ • syck haue ye healed broken haue ye nat bounde together caste haue ye brought agayne loste haue ye soughte churlysly cruelly haue ye1 pe ••• •• ruled thus scatred without shepherde yee beastes felde deuoure go astraye shepe go wandringe vpon mountaynes vpon euery hye hyl yee scatred abrode feldes man careth thē seketh aftēr thē therfore ye shepherdes heare worde lord thus sayeth lord god truly lyue much shepe robbed deuoured wylde beastes felde hauynge shepherde seinge shepherdes take regarde shepe sede selues onely shepe therfore heare worde lord ye shepherdes thus saieth lorde god beholde selfe wyl vpon shepherdes requyre shepe handes make ceasse fedynge shepe • yee shepherdes shall fede selues wyl deliuer shepe theyr mouthes shall deuoure thus sayeth lorde god iohn x • hebre 13 1 p • 2 • 5 beholde wyll loke shepe selfe seke lyke shepherde amonge flocke seketh shepe scatred abrode euen wyll seke shepe gather together place haue bene scatred cloudy darcke daye wyll brynge people gather together landes wyll brynge theyr owne lande fede vpon mountaines israel ryuers al place countre wyll fede right good pasture vpō hye moū taynes israel shal foldes shal lye good folde fat pasture shall fede euen vpon mountaynes israell wyll fede shepe selfe brynge theyr rest sayeth lorde god ••• iiii b iohn x lost wyl seke go astray wyl bryng agayne woū ded wyl bynde vp weake wyl make strong fat wel likinge wyll preserue fede thē thyng lauful shepe sayeth lorde god mat xxv • wyl put difference among shepe among wether y• goates ynough eate vp good pasture ye must treade downe resydue youre pasture fete also ynough drincke cleare water ye muste trouble resydue also fete thus shepe must fayne eate thynge ye haue troden downe wt fete drincke ye fete haue defiled therfore thus sateth lord god vnto beholde wyl seuer fat shepe leane muche ye haue shot weake shepe vpon sydes shoulder runne vpon horne longe tyll ye haue vtterly scatred abrode wyll helpe shepe shal nomore spoyled yee wyl discerne one shepe another wyll rayse vp vnto one onely shepherde euen ☞ seruaunt iere xxx v actes • • miche v • dauid shall ‡ fede thē shall theyr shepherde lorde wyl god seruaunt dauyd shall theyr prynce euen lorde haue spoken moreouer wyll make couenaunte peace dryue al euyll beestes lande maye dwell safely wyldernes slepe woddes good fortune prosperyte wyll geue vnto al round hyll deut xi b xxviii b prosperous shower rayne wyl sende thē due season tree wodde maye bring forth theyr frutes grounde increase shalbe sa • e theyr lande shall knowe lorde haue brokē yoke delyuered oute handes helde subieccyon shall spoyled heathen deuoured beastes lande safely shal dwel man shall fraye wyl set vp excellente plante shall suffre hunger lande neyther beare reprofe heathē thus shall vnderstande lorde theyre god euen house israell people sayeth lorde god ye men flocke psa 〈◊〉 • x ••• • ye shepe pasture god sayeth lorde god ¶ destruccyon shall come hyll seyr idumeans troubled people • lorde capi xxxv moreover worde lorde came vnto sayinge thou sonne man turne thy face towarde mounte esay 34 • iere x ••• b e ••• xxv • xxxii f xxxv xxxvi • seir prophecye vpon say vnto thus sayeth lorde god beholde thou mounte seyr wyll vpon wyl reache myne hande ouer yee waste desolate wyll make thy cytyes wyll breake downe thou shalte lye voyde thou mayste knowe howe lorde nume xx c deute 〈◊〉 • muche thou beareste olde enemyce agaynste chyldren israell cruell hande hast made afrayed tyme troubled punyshed theyr synne therfore truly lyue sateth y• lorde god wyl prepare vnto bloude yee ☞ bloude shall folowe vpon • mac v • seinge thou layeste wayte bloude therfore shall bloude persecute thus wyll make mount seyr desolate waste brynge passe shall man go thyther come thence hys mountaynes wyll fyll wyth hys slayne men thy hylles dale valley shall lye full thëm slayne swearde wyll make perpetuall wyldernesse man shall dwell thy cytyes ye maye knowe howe lorde thou haste sayde ☞ bothe nacions bothe landes muste myne wyll haue possessyon e •• xxv c lorde therfore thus sayeth lorde god truly lyue wyll handle accordynge thy wrathe gelouse lyke thou hast dealte cruelly maye knowen amonge thē howe haue punyshed yee thou also mayest sure lorde haue herde thydespytefull wordes thou hast spoken agaynste moūtaynes israel sayinge lo made waste geuen v deuoure thus youre mouthes ye haue made youre boast yee multyplyed youre proude wordes agaynste whiche haue herde altogether vnto thus sayeth lorde god whole worlde wealthe wyll make waste e • e xxv x vi • lyke thou mount seyr wast glad herytage house israel destroied euen wyll vnto also thou whole edom shall destroyed knowe lorde ¶ promyseth despueraunce gentyles vnto israell vencrytes done vnto iewes astrybed mercy god vnto theyr deseruynges god renueth oure hertes maye walke commaundementes capi xxxvi thov sonne man prophecy vpon mountaynes israel speke ezec v • • heare worde lord oye mountaynes israell thus sayeth lorde god enemy hath sayde vpon ☞ ha hye euerlastynge place nowe become prophecye therfore speake thus sayeth lorde god seynge ye wasted troden downe euery syde become possessyon vnto resydue gentyles whiche haue brought men mouthes vnto euyll name amonge people therfore heare worde lorde god ye mountaynes israell thus sayeth lord god vnto mountaynes hylles valley dale voyde wyldernes desolate cyties spoyled derysyon euery syde among resydue heathen yee euen thus sayeth lorde god fyre gelousy haue taken deuyce resydue gentyles ezech 35 • edom whiche haue taken lande vnto thēselues possessyon whiche also reioysed whole hert dispitefull stomacke waste spoyle prophecye therfore vpon lande israel speake vnto moūtaynes hilles valley dale thus sayeth lorde god beholde thys haue deuysed gelousy terryble wrathe muche ye haue suffred reprofe heathen therfore thus sayeth lorde god ☞ haue sworne gentyles whiche lye aboute shall beare youre confusyon selues mountaynes israel ye shal shute braunches brynge youre frute people israell harde wyll come beholde come vnto vnto wyll turne ye maye tylled sowen ☞ wyll sende much people whiche shalbe house israell cytyes shall inhabyted decayed place shalbe repayred agayne wyll prouyde muche people catell whiche shall increase brynge frute wyll restore also olde estate shewe kyndnes euer ye wherby ye shal knowe lord yee people wyll sende vnto folke israell shall haue possessyon thou shalte theyr inherytaunce thou shalte without agayne thus sayeth lorde god muche saye vnto thou arte eater vp men waster thy people therfore thou shalte eate mo men neyther destroye thy people sayeth lorde god wyl suffre heare thine owne confusion amonge gentyles hē • forth thou shalt beare reprofe naciōs cast thyne owne people eny saieth lorde god moreouer worde lorde came vnto saying thou sonne man whē house israell owe • vpon owne grounde defyled selues wyth theyr owne wayes ymagynacions syght way lyke vnclenues mēstruous woman wherfore poured wrothful displeasure vpon thē ☞ bloude shed lande theyr idol wherwith defiled selues scatred also among heathen strowed aboute landes accordynge theyr wayes theyr owne inuencyons dyd punyshe esay lii v rom ii c nowe gone vnto heathen come amonge thē dishonoured holy name said people god must go theyr owne lande spared holy name whiche house israel dishonoured amonge gentyles came therfore tell house israel thus saieth lord god sake house israell holy name sake ye dishonoured amonge heathen ye came therfore wyll halowe greate name agayne amonge gentyles euyll spoken ye youre selues haue dyshonoured amonge gentyles shal know lorde whan honoured theyre eye sayeth lorde god wyll take amonge heathē gather together countrees brynge agayne owne lande esai 44 • • ere xvii • wyl poure cleare water vpon ye shalbe clene yee al vnclennesse al idol shall clense newe herte also wyl geue new sprite wyl put stony hert wyll take youre body gyue fleshly herte wyl gyue spryte among deu xiii • cause walcke commaūdementes kepe lawes fulfyll ye shall dwell lande gaue youre forefather ye shalbe people wylbe god wyl helpe al vnclennes wyl cal corne wyll increase let haue honger wyl multyply frutes tree increase feld ye shall beare reprofe hō ger amonge heathen shall ye remembre owne wicked wayes youre ymaginaciōs good▪ ye shal take displesure owne selues reason sinnes abhominacions wyll thys youre sake sayth lord god ye sure therfore ye house israell ashamed youre synnes moreouer thus sayeth lorde god tyme shal clense youre offence wyll make cytyes occupyed agayne wyll repayre place decayed desolate lande shalbe builded agayne whiche afore tyme laye wast syght al wente shall sayde thys waste lande become lyke garden plesure voyde desolate broken downe cytyes nowe stronge fensed againe resydue heathen lye rounde shall know lorde whiche repayre broken downe plant agayne made waste euen lorde haue spoken wyll dede thus sayeth lorde god wyll yet founde agayn house israel ieremi • ▪ • shal increase flocke men lyke holy flocke flocke ierusalē hye solēpne feastes shal also wylde wasted cytyes fylled flockes men shall knowe lorde ¶ prophecieth bryngynge agayne people beinge captyuyte sheweth vnyon ten trybes two capi xxxvii hande lorde came vpō caried spryte lord let downe playne felde laye full bone led rounde aboute beholde bone lay vppon felde many maruelous drye also sayde vnto thou sonne man thinkest thou bone may lyue againe answered lord god thou knowest sayde vnto prophecy thou vpō bone speke vnto ye drye bone heare worde lorde thus sayeth lorde god vnto bone beholde wyll put brethe ye maye lyue wyll geue synowes make fleshe growe vpon couer ouer skynne gyue gene ii • brethe ye maye lyue knowe lorde prophecyed commaunded prophecyinge came anoyse greate mociō bone euery one another loked beholde • nowes 〈◊〉 grewe vpon aboue couered skynne breth saide vnto thou sōne man prophecye thou towarde wynde prophecye speake wynde thus sayeth lorde god come thou ayre foure wyndes ☞ blowe vpon slayne maye restored life prophecied comaūded came breth reccaued lyfe stode vp vpon theyr fete maruelous greate sorte moreouer sayde vnto thou sonne man bone whole house israell beholde saye oure bone dried vp hope gone clene cut therfore prophecy thou speake vnto thus sayeth lorde god beholde wyll open youre graues people take youre sepulcres bryng lande israel agayne shall ye knowe lorde open graues brynge spryte also wyll put ye shall lyue wyl set againe youre owne lande ye shall knowe lorde whiche haue sayde fulfylled dede worde lorde came vnto saying thou sonne man take stycke wryte vpon unto iuda chyldren israel companyons take another sticke write vpon unto ioseph y• stoke ephraim al housholde israell companion take bothe together thyne hande shall one sticke therof nowe yf chyldren thy people saye vnto wylte thou shewe v thou meaneste geue thys answere thus sayeth lord god beholde o • e • b wyl take stock ioseph hand ephraim tribe israel felowes wyll put thē stocke iuda make one stocke shal one hande two styckes vpon thou wrytest shalte thou haue thyne hande may se shalte saye vnto them▪ thus sayeth lorde god beholde wyl take awaye child israel amonge heathen vnto whome gone wyl gather thē together euery syde brynge agayne theyre owne lande yee wyll make one people lande vpon mountaynes israel al shal haue one kyng shall nomore two people frō hece forth nether deuided two kigdomes shal also defile thē selues nomore theyr abhominaciōs idoles wicked doinges wyl helpe thē al theyr dwelling place wherin haue synned wyll clense shalbe people theyr god dauid seruaunt shalbe kinge al shal haue one shepherd onely shall walcke lawes commaū dementes shall bothe kepe fulfyll shall dwell lande gaue vnto iacob seruaunt father also haue dwelt yee euen lande shal chyldren childers childrē dwell euermore seruaunt dauid shalbe euerlasting price moreouer wyll make ☞ bonde peace thē shall vnto euerlasting couenaūt wyl setle also multyplye sanctuary wyll set among thē euermore leui ••• dwellynge shalbe yee wyl theyr god shal people thus heathen also shall knowe lorde holy maker israel whē sāctuary shalbe amonge euermore ¶ prophecyed gog magog shall come appoyneed haste lande promes theyr entent reherceth cōurynge gog prophecyed prophetes destruccyon hym capi xxxviii worde lorde came vnto sayinge thou sonne man turne thy face ☞ towarde gog lande magog whiche chefe prince meseche tubal prophecye agaynst hym saye thus sayeth lorde god ezec 39 • apoca ••• gog thou chefe prynce meseche tubal beholde wyll vpon wyll turne aboute put bytte thy chawes wyll brynge forth thyne hooste bothe horse horsmen whiche weapened beste fashyon greate people handle altogether speares childes swerdes perses morians libians al beare childes helmettes gomar al hoostes house thogorma oute northe quarter hys hoostes yee muche people therfore prepare set thy selfe araye thy people come vnto heapes thou theyr defence many day thou shalt visited latter yeares thou shalt come lande hath bene destroyed swearde nowe replenished agayne diuerse people vpō moūtayues israel haue longe lyen waste yee brought nacions dwell safe thou shalt come vp like stormy wether couer lāde darcke cloude thou al thyne hostes great multitude people moreouer thus sayeth lord god tyme shal many thynges come thy mynde thou shalte ymagyn myschefe saye wyll vp yonder playne lande seinge syt ease dwell safely dwell without walles haue neither barres dores spoyle robbe lay hande vpon wel inhabyted wilderness agaynst people gathered together frō amōg heathen whiche haue gotten catell good dwell myddest lande shall saba dedan mat chauntes tharsis al worthy saye vnto art thou come robbe hast thou gathered thy people together thou wylt spoyle take syluer golde cary awaye catell good haue great pray therefore thou sonne man thou shalt prophecy saye vnto gog thus sayeth lord god day thou shalt knowe people israell dwelleth safe shalt come thy place y• north partes thou much people wt whiche ryde vpon horse wherof great multitude innumerable sorte yee thou shalt come vpon people israel cloude couer lāde shal come passe y• latter dayes wyl bringe vp lande y• heathen maye knowe get honour vpon gog theyr eye thus sayeth lorde god thou arte haue spoken afore tyme seruaūtes propbetꝭ israel prophecyed dayes yeares shulde brynge vpon tyme gog commeth vp lande israel sayeth lorde god shal indignacyon go forth wrathe gelousy hote displeasure haue deuysed •• ni 12 • 24 b •• ke 21 • shalbe great trouble lāde israel tyme fyshes set foules ayre beastes felde men vpon earth shall tremble feare hylles also shall turned vp syde downe stayres stone shal fal al walles shal syncke grounde wyl cal swearde vpon al mountaynes sayeth lorde god euery man swearde shall vpon another pestylence bloude wyl punishe stormy rayne hayle stone fyre brymstone wyll cause rayne vpon heape yee vpon greate people hym thus wyll magnyfyed honoured knowen amonge heathen may sure howe lorde ¶ sheweth destruccyon gog magog graue gog hooste prophecyeth gog company shalbe deuouted byrdes beastes wherfore house israell wasted bryngynge agayne capt • uite promysed capi xxxix therfore thou sonne man prophecye agaynst gog speake thus sayeth lorde god beholde ezech 38 • gog thou chefe prynce mesech tuball wyl vpon ☞ punyshe sixe plage leade north partes brynge vp mountaynes israel thy bowe wyll smyte thy left hande cast thyne arowes thy ryght hande thou al thyne heape people y• must fall vpon mountaynes israell wyll geue vnto foules wylde beastes felde deuoured must thou lye vpon felde euen lord haue spoken sayeth lorde god magog amonge syt carelesse iles wyll sende fyre shal knowe lord wyl make also name holynesse knowē among people israel wyl let holy name euyll spoken hethen also shal knowe lorde holy one israel beholde commeth shall fulfylled dede sayeth lorde god daye wherof haue spokē dwell cyties israel shall go forth set fyre vpon weapēs burne shyldes speres bowes arowes bylles clubbes seuen yeares shall burnyng therof shal el bryng stickes frome felde neyther haue nede hewe downe y• wod shal haue weapens ynow burne shall robbe robbed thē spoyle spoyled sayeth lorde god tyme wyll geue vnto gog place beburied israel euē val ley thorowe men go ea • shall abhorre shall gog al people buried shalbe called valley people gog seuen monethes longe shall house israell buryenge maye clense lande yee people lande shall burye shalbe glorious daye get honoure sayeth lorde god shal ordayne mē also deed buriers euer goynge thorow lande appoynt certayne place bury whiche remayne vpon felde lande maye clensed ende ende shal seke seuen monethes long nowe go thorowe lande se man bone shall set vp token tyll deed buriers haue buryed also valley people gog name cite shalbe called hamonah thꝰ shal make lande clene thou sonne man thus sayeth lorde god speake vnto al foules euery byrde yee wylde beastes felde heape together come gather rounde aboute vpon slaughter haue slayne euen great slaughter vpon mountaynes israell eate fleshe dryncke bloude ye shal apoc xix • eate fleshe worthy drynck blode prynces lande wether lambes goates ox al slayne basan eate fat bely full dryncke bloude tyll ye drō ken slaughter whiche haue slayne vnto fyll table horse stronge horseman captaynes men warre sayeth lorde god wyll brynge glory also amonge gentyles heathen maye se iudgement haue kept hande whiche haue layde vpon house israel knowe lorde theyr god daye forthe heathen shal know house israel led captiuite wickednes sake offended whiche cause hyd face deliuered handes enemyes myght al slayne swearde▪ accordyng theyr vnclē nesse vnfaythfull dealynges haue entreated hyd face therfore thus sayeth lorde god wyll bryng agayne captiues iacob haue mercy vpon whole house israel ••• ous holy name sake theyr confusion offence haue done agaynst shall taken awaye safely shall dwell theyr lande man shal make afrayed haue brought agayne among people haue gathered together enemy landes praysed many heathen shall knowe lorde god whiche suffred led captiuite amonge heathen nowe haue brought agayne theyr owne lāde lefte one yonder wyll hyde face nomore thē e ••• 36▪ • wyl poure sprete vpō house israel sayeth lorde god ¶ restorynge cytyes temple come shewed vnto prophete capi xl xxv yeare captyuite begynnyng yeare x day moneth xiiij yeare cyte smyten downe daye came hande lorde vpon caryed forth euen ye lande israel brought vysyons god set downe vpon maruelous hye mountayne wherevpon buyldynge bene cyte towarde north thyther caried behold mā whose similitude lyke brasse whiche threde flax hande meterodde also stode dore said vnto thou sonne man marcke well thine eye herken thyne eares fasten thyne herte whatsoeuer shal shewe entent myght shewed therfore art thou brought hither soeuer thou seyst thou shalt certyfye house israel therof beholde wall oute syde rounde aboute house meterode hande syxe cubytes long spanne measured bredthe buyldynge whiche meterode height also meterode came vnto easte dore wente vp stayres measured postes dore wherof euery one meaterodde thicke euery chaumbre meterodde longe brode betwene chamber fyue cubytes poste dore within porche one meterodde measured also porche innermer dore whiche conteyned meterodde mesured entrye dore conteyned eyght cubytes hys pyllers two cubytes entrye stode inwarde chamber dores eastward thre euery syde lyke broade longe pyllers also stode sydes one measure measured wydenesse dore whiche x cubytes heygth dore xiij cubytes edge chamber one cubyte brode vpon bothe sydes chamber syxe cubytes wyde eyther syde measured dore frome rydge one chamber another whose wydenesse fyue tweyntye cubytes one dore stode another made pyllers also lx cubytes hygh rounde court dore inwarde parte vnto fore entrye ynnermer dore fyftye cubytes chamber pylers within rounde aboute vnto dore syde windowes fore entry also whose wyndowes wente rounde within vpon pyllers stode date tree brought fore courte chamber paued workes made fore courte rounde aboute xxx chamber vpon one paued worcke nowe paued worke longe besyde dores lower paued worke measured bredth lower dore vnto ynnermer courte outsyde whiche c cubytes vpon east north parte dore vttermoste courte towarde northe measured length bredth thre chamber also eyther syde wyth pylers fore entryes euen measure fyrste dore heygth fyftye cubites bredth xxv cubytes wyndowes porch date tree euen lyke measure dore towarde east vij steppe go vp vpon porche nowe dore ynnermer court stode streyght ouer agaynst dore toward north east one dore another measured c cubytes brought ye southsyde stode dore towarde south whose pilers porch measured fyrste measure wyth theyr porch wyndowes roūde lyke fyrst wyndowes heygth l cubytes bredth xxv wyth steppe go vp vpon porche stode wyth pyllers date tree eyther side dore ynnermer courte stode towarde south measured one dore another c cubytes brought innermer courte thorowe dore south syde whiche measured measure afore sayde lyke maner chā bers pylers fore entryes euen fore sayd measure also porch rounde aboute wyndowes l cubytes heygth xxv cubytes brode porch rounde aboute xxv cubytes longe v cubites brode porche reached vnto vttermost court vpon pylers date tree viij steppe go vp vpon brought also ynmost court vpon east syde measured dore accordynge measure afore sayde hys chamber pilers porch euen measure fyrst porch wyndowes rounde aboute heygth l cubytes bredth xxv cubytes porch reached vnto vttermost court pilers also date tree eyther syde viij steppe go vp vpon brought north dore measured whiche also fore sayde measure chambres pylers porch wyndowes rounde aboute whose heygth l cubytes bredth xxv hys pylers stode towarde vttemost courte vpon date tree viij steppe go vp vpon stode chambre also whose intraūce dore pylers burnte offerynges wasshed dore porche stode eyther syde two table slaughtynge sleye brent offrynges synne offerynges tresspace offrīges thervpon syde men go forth north dore stode two table foure table stode ether syde dore viij table whervpon slaughted foure table hewen stone burnt offerynges cubyte halfe longe brode one cubite hygh wherupon layed vessel ornamentes whiche vsed burnt slaine offringes slaughted within hokes foure fyngers brode fastened rounde aboute hāge flesshe vpon vpon table layd offerynge flesshe syde innermer dore fyngers chamber inwarde courte besyde north dore ouer agaynst south stode one also besyde east dore northwarde sayde vnto chambre south syde belongeth preestes kepe habitacyon thys towarde north • p • r 25 • prestes wayte vpon aulter whiche sonnes • reg ii f sadoche seruyce lorde insteade child leui measured fore courte whiche length c cubytes muche bredth foure corner nowe aulter stode house brought fore entre house measured walles entrye dore whiche fyue cubytes longe eyther syde thyckenesse also dore eyther syde thre cubites length porche xx cubytes bredth▪ xi cubytes vpon steppe went men vp walles also pilers eyther syde one ¶ disposy • yon deuyce buyldynge agayne ••• ple • thynges therto belongy • e capi xli thys brought tē ple measured postes whiche bothe sydes vj cubytes thycke accordynge wydenesse tabernacle bredth dore x cubytes walles dore eyther syde fyne cubytes measured length therof whyche contayned xl cubytes bredth xx wente measured dore postes whiche two cubytes thycke dore selfe syxe cubite bredth dore vij cubytes measured length bredth therof whiche euery one xx cubytes temple sayde vnto holyest al measured also wal house whiche syxe cubytes chambres stode rounde aboute house euery one foure cubytes wyde one stode harde vpon another whereof xxxiij stode postes beneth walles rounde aboute house beare vp wal house fastened syde chamber hyer wyder steppe thorowe rounde house thus wider aboue lowest men myght go hyest myd chamber sawe also house hye rounde aboute foundacion syde chamber meterodde syxe cubytes brode thyckenes syde wal without contayned fyue cubites dyd wall chamber house betwene chamber wydenes xx cubytes rounde aboute house chambre dores stode ouer agaynste outwal one dore towarde northe towarde south thyckenesse outwall v cubytes rounde aboute nowe buyldynge seperated towarde west lxx cubytes wyde wall buyldynge v cubytes thycke rounde aboute length foure score cubytes ten measured house whyche c cubytes longe seperated buyldynge wall c cubytes long also wydenes house seperated towarde east c cubytes measured length buyldynge behynde wyth chābers vpon sydes contayned c cubytes ynnermer temple porch fore court syde postes thre syde wyndowes pyllers rounde aboute ouer agaynste postes grounde vp wyndowes wyndowes selues syled ouer bordes thus aboue dore vnto house without also yee whole wall euerye syde within without syled ouer greate bordes cherubins date tree made also one date tre stode euer betwyxte two cherubins one cherub ij face face man lokynge syde towarde date tre lyon face syde thus made rounde aboute al house yee cherubyns date tree made groūde vp aboue dore stode also vpon wall temple postes temple foure squared fashyon sanctuary ez • ch • • • euen appered vnto fore y• visyon exod • 〈◊〉 • table wodde thre cubites hye two cubites long corner length walles wodde sayd vnto table shall stande lorde temple holyest either thē two dores euery dore two lytle wyckettes folden one vpon another euerye syde two vpon dores temple made cherubins date tree lyke vpon walles great thycke balke wod syde y• porche upon side walles porche made depe windowes date tree hauynge beames balkes lyke house ¶ chambres temple preastes holy thynges capi xlii caried fore court warde north brought chambre stode ouer agaynst backe buyldynge north warde whiche length c cubytes whose dore turned towarde north wydenesse conteyned l cubytes ouer agaynst xx cubytes ynnermer court agaynst paued worke courte besyde thre stode pylers one ouer agaynste another thys chambre walkynge place x cubytes wyde within awaye one cubyte wyde theyr dores towarde north thus hyest chambres allwaye narower lowest myddelmost buyldyng bare chambre vpon chambre stode thre together one vpon another hauynge pylers lyke fore court therfore smaller thē beneth myddest reken grounde vpwarde wall without stode chā bres towarde vttemost courte vpon fore syde chambres l cubytes longe length vttemost chambres fore courte l cubytes also length therof temple c cubytes chambres vnder intraunce east syde wherby mā myght go fore courte thorowe thycke wall fore courte towarde east ryght ouer agaynst separated buyldynge buyldynge vpon thys syde chā bers also whiche away vnto lyke chamber y• north syde length wydnesse theyr intraunce fashyon dores also maner yee euen like chamber dores were▪ also south syde waye towarde y• syngers steppe y• east syde stode dore go sayd vnto chamber toward north south whiche stande y• backe buyldynge holy habytacyons wherin prestes seruyce lorde must eate holy offringes must laye ye holy offrynges meatoffrynges synne offrynges trespace ofrynges holy place prestes come therin shall nat go fore courte seynge holy shal leaue clothes theyr ministra cyon put garmētes haue thynge people nowe whē measured ynnermer house brought forth thorowe east porte measured rounde boute measured east syde wyth meterode whiche rounde aboute conteyned v c meterodes north syde measured conteyned rounde aboute eu • much two sydes also towarde south west whiche measured conteyned eyther them▪ v c meterodes mesured foure sydes wente wall rounde aboute v c meteroddes longe brode also whiche separated holy vnholy ¶ seyth glory god goyng temple whence departed mentyoneth idolatry chyldren israell whiche consumed brought nawght commaunded call agayne repentaunce capi xliii brought dore turneth towarde east beholde came glory god israell y• east whose voyce lyke great noyse warers earth lyghtened glorye hys syght loke vpon eze x • xi • lyke fyrst sawe whē wente tyme cytie shulde haue bene destroyed 〈◊〉 • • • • xi • lyke vysyon sawe water cobar fell vpon face glory lorde came house thorowe easte dore wynde toke vp brought ynnermer courte beholde house full glory lorde hearde one speakynge vnto house stode one sayde vnto thou sōne man thys rowme seate theesay vi lxvi • poc xxi place fotesteppes wyll dwell amonge chyldren israell euermore house israell shall nomore defyle holy name neyther theyr kynges thorowe theyr whordome thorowe theyr hye place thorowe deed bodyes theyr kynges whiche haue buylded theyr thresholdes maner harde vpon thresholdes theyr postes almost postes y• bare wall betwyxte thus haue defyled holy name theyr abhomynacyons haue commytted wherefore haue destroyed wrath nowe shall put awaye theyr whordome deed body theyr kynges sight may dwell amonge euermore zacha 〈◊〉 therfore thou sonne man shewe thou housholde israell tēple maye ashamed theyr wyckednesse measure selues example therat shamed theyr workes shewe fourme fashyon temple commynge goynge maner descrypcion therof yee v ordynaunces maye kepe fulfyl fashyons customes therof thys descripcyon house aboue vpon mounte rounde aboute corner shalbe holyest beholde descrypcyon fashyon house thys measure aulter true cubyte spā ne longer another cubyte hys botome myddest cubyte longe wyde ledge wente rounde aboute spanne brode thys heygth aulter groūde lower steppe length two cubytes bredth one cubyte lower steppe hygher foure cubytes bredth one cubyte exo xxvii • aulter foure cubytes hye aulter vpwarde stode foure horne xij cubytes longe xij cubytes brode vpon foure corner couerynge aulter xiiij cubytes longe brode vpon foure corner ledge wente rounde aboute halfe cubyte botome therof roūde one cubyte steppe stode towarde east sayde vnto thou sonne man thus sayeth lorde god ordynaunces lawes aulter daye made offre burntoffrynges sprynckle bloude ther vpon prestes leuites y• sede e ••• 44 • • 4 • b sadoch▪ treade seruyce sayeth lorde god unto geue thou yonge bullocke synoffrynge take bloude hym sprynckle foure horne withall foure corner aulter couerynge ledge goeth roūde shalt thou clense reconcyle leui xvi f thou shalt take bullocke also synoffrynge burne hym seuerall place without sanctuary nexte daye take goatbucke without blemysh synoffrynge reconcyle aulter withall lyke reconcyled bullocke nowe thou hast made cleane offre yonge bullocke leui xxii▪ • without blemysh ramme flocke without blemysh also offre lorde let prest caste leuiti ii • salt ther vpon geue vnto lorde burntoffrynge seuen dayes shalt thou brynge euery daye goatbucke sinne yonge bullocke ramme flocke bothe without blemysh shal offre seuen dayes shall reconcyle clense aulter offre vpon dayes expired vpon viij daye forth prestes shal offre burntoffrynges healthoffrynges vpon aulter wyll mercyfull vnto sayeth lorde god capi xliiii ¶ sheweth dore temple shutte commaunded vpbrayde people theyr offence vncyrcuncysed herte flesh admytted seruyce temple refused sheweth prestes wolde haue admytted holy place also theyr offyce thys brought agayne outwarde dore sanctuary east syde shut thē sayde lorde vnto thys dore shall styll shut nat opened man go thorowe onely lorde god israel yee shal go thorowe el shal shut styll prynce hym selfe shall come thorowe maye eate breade lorde porche shal come shall go agayne brought dore vpon north syde house loked aboute beholde exod • 4 • x • • num • 〈◊〉 4 reg 8 • 2 pat 7 • glory lorde fylled house fell downe vpon face lorde spake vnto thou sōne man fasten thys thyne herte beholde take diligent hede al wyl saye vnto concernynge ordynaunces lorde hys lawes pondre wel thyne herte cōmynge y• house goynge forth sanctuary tel obstynate housholde israel thus sayeth lorde god house israel ye haue nowe done ynough withall youre abhomynacions seynge ye haue brought sanctuary straungers hauynge vncircuncysed hertes flesh thorowe sanctuary defyled ye offre bred fat bloude thus youre abhomynacyons ye haue broken couenaunt nat kept holy ordynaunces sanctuary set kepers sanctuary euen youre owne mynde therfore thus sayeth lorde god straungers dwell amonge chyldren israell straunger whose herte flesh nat circumcysed shal come within sāctuary leuites y• gone backe fro haue dysceaued people israell erroures goynge theyr ydoles therfore shal beare theyr owne wyckednes shulde set ordened mynistre vnder dores house sanctuarye seruyce house slaye burntoffrynges sacryfyces people stande thē serue seynge seruyce theyr idoles cause house israel stomble thorow wyckednes • reg ii • whiche cause haue pluckte myne hande ouer sayeth lorde god nowe must beare theyr owne iniquyte nat come nye serue theyr presthode sanctuary moost holyest maye beare theyr owne shame abhominacyons haue done shulde vse porter house y• seruyce done therin prestes leuytes sōne sadoch kepte ••• • 3 x • viii b holy ordynaunces sanctuary chyldren israell gone fro shall come seruyce stā de offre fat bloude sayeth lorde god shall go sanctuary treade table seruice wayte vpon myne ordinaūces whē go dores innermer court shall put lynen clothes y• wollyne come vpon whyle seruyce vnder dores ynnermer courte within shall haue fayre lynen bonettes vpon theyr heades lynen breches vpon theyr loynes whiche theyr laboure shall nat put aboute whē go forth people outwarde courte shall put clothes wherin haue mynistred laye habytacyon sanctuary put apparell lest vnhalowe people theyr clothes leui xix • xxi leuit x • shall nat shaue theyr heades norysh bushe theyr heare rounde theyr heades prestes go inmost court shal drinke wyne leui xxi b ose 1 • 3 • shall mary wydowe neyther one put husbande mayde sede house israel wyddowe hathe preste deu xvii • shal shewe people dyfference betwene holy vnholy betwixt clene vnclene discorde aryse shall discerne geue sentence iudgementes solempne feastes lawes ordynaunces shal kepe halowe sabbathes ☞ leui xxi • nume vi • shall come deed persone defyle thē selues excepte father mother sonne daughter brother syster hath yet husbande maye defyled clensed shall rekened vnto hym vij dayes yf go sanctuary agayne seruyse shall brynge synoffrynge sayeth lorde god de xviii • nume • 8 c • osu x ••• • shall haue herytage yee selfe wylbe theyr herytage el shall ye geue thē possession israel theyr possession meatoffryng synoffrynge treaspaceoffryng shal eate ☞ euery dedycate thynge israel shalbe theyrs fyrstlynges fyrst frutes fre wyloffrynges shall prestes ye shall geue vnto prest also fyrstlynges youre dough god maye prospere resydue exo xxii leui xxii • deed caryō shal preste eate suche deuoured wylde beastes foules catell ¶ lande promes seperate iiii porcyons whiche fyrst geuen prestes temple seconde leuites thyrde • ytie fourth prynce exhortacyō heades israel • ust weyghtes measure fyrste frutes c capi xlv ye deuyde lāde lot ye shall put asyde one ezec 48 • ▪ parte lorde holy landes namely xxv meteroddes longe x broade thys shalbe holy wyde rounde aboute thys parte shall belonge vnto sanctuary v c meteroddes al foure corner l cubytes wyde rounde aboute suburbes measure namely xxv meteroddes longe x broade thou shalt measure wherin sanctuary holyest maye stande resydue holy grounde shal prestes whiche seruyce sanctuary lorde goo lorde serue hym maye haue • ome dwell sanctuary shal stande selfe leuites y• serue house shalbe geuen xx habytacyōs xxv length x bredth ye shal geue also vnto cytie possessyon v meteroddes brode xxv lōge besyde parte sanctuary shalbe whole house israel •••• 4 • upon bothe sydes sanctuaryes parte cytie shalbe geuen vnto prince soeuer lyeth ouer agaynst cytie farre recheth westwarde eastwarde whiche shalbe longe one parte west vnto easte thys shalbe owne lande israell prynces chargeable vnto people suche remayneth yet ouer lande shalbe geuen house israel accordynge theyr trybes thus sayeth lord god ye prynces ye haue nowe oppressed destroyed ynough leaue handle nowe accordyng y• thing equall laufull thrust people nomore sayeth lorde god leui 〈…〉 x • b ye shal haue true weyght true ephah true bath ephah bath shalbe lyke one bath shal cōteyne tenth parte homer shal one ephah theyr measure shall homer 〈…〉 iii g one sycle maketh xx geras xx sycles xxv xv sycles make pounde heaueoffrynge ye shall geue heaued namely v • parte ephah homer wheate vj parte ephah homer barly oyle shall measured bath euen y• tenth parte one bath cor ten bathe make one homer one homer fylleth ten bathe one lambe two hundreth shepe pasture israel▪ meatoffryng burntoffrynge healthoffrynge reconcyle thē sayeth lorde god people lande shal geue thys heaueoffringe fre wyl prynce israel agayne shall prynces parte offre burntoffrynges meatofferynges drynckoffringes vnto lorde holy dayes newe moones sabbathes hye feastes house israel synoffrynge meatoffrynge burntofferynge healthoffrynge shal geue recōcyle house israel thus sayeth lorde god fyrst day fyrst moneth thou sholt take yonge bullocke without blemysh clenle sanctuary preste shall take bloude synoffrynge spryncle vnto postes house vpon foure corner aulter dore postes ynnermar courte thus shalt thou also seuenth day moneth num x • • suche haue synned ignoraūce beynge disceaued reconcyle house withall exod xii • leuit 〈◊〉 • deu xvi • upon xiiij daye fyrst moneth ye shall kepe easter seuen dayes shall feast contynue wherin shall sowre leuened breade eaten upon daye shall prynce geue hym selfe people lande bullocke synoffrynge feast seuen dayes shall offre euery day bullocke ram without blemysh burntofferyng vnto y• lorde goate daylye synoffrynge meatoffrynges shall geue euer ephah bullocke ephah ram hyn oyle ephah upon xv daye seuenth moneth shall kepe y• seuen dayes holy one another euen seuen dayes synoffrynge burntoffrynge meatoffryng oyle ¶ sacryfyces sabboth newe mones thorowe whiche dores muste go come temple • c capi xlvi thvs sayeth lord god dore ynnermer courte towarde easte shal shut vj workynge dayes sabboth daye newe moone shalbe opened shal prynce come vnder dore porche stande styll without dore cheke prestes shal offre vp burnt healthofferynges shall worshyppe dore poste go hys waye forth agayne dore shall nomore shut tyll euenynge maner shall people lande also theyr worshyppe lorde thys dore vpon sabbathes newe moones thys nowe burntofferynge prynce shall brynge vnto lorde vpon sabboth syxe lambes without blemysh ram without blemysh ephah meatoffrynge ram lambes may geue many meatoffrynges wyll hyn oyle ephah daye newe moneth shal yong bullocke without blemysh syxe lambes ram also without blemysh bullocke shall geue ephah ram ephah also meate offering lambes maye come euer hin oyle ephah prynce commeth shall go vnder dore porche euen departe forth agayne people lande come lord hyghe solempne feaste many come north dore worshyppe shall go agayne southe dore come y• south dore shal go forthe agayne northe dore shall none go dore came shal go ryght forthe ouer syde prynce shall go amonge upon solempne hye feast dayes shalbe meat offerynge epha bullocke epha ram lambes many wyl euer hin oyle epha nowe prynce bryngeth burnt offerynge healthofferyng fre wyl vnto lorde east dore shalbe opened vnto may burnt healthofferynges doth vpon sabboth goeth forth dore shal shut agayne shall daylye brynge vnto lorde lambe yeare olde without blemyshe burnte offeryng shall euery mornynge meatofferynge shall geue syxt parte epha thyrde parte hin oyle myngle cake euery mornynge yee thys shalbe daylye meateofferynge vnto lorde euerlastynge ordinaunce thus shal lambe meatofferynge oyle geuē euery mornynge daylye burntofferynge moreouer thus sayeth lorde god prynce geue gyfte vnto hys sonnes shall hys sonnes herytage perpetuall maye possesse wyll geue one hys seruauntes hys herytage shall hys ☜ leui xxv b num 36 • fre yeare returne agayne vnto prīce herytage shalbe sōnes onely 3 reg 21 • reg ix b prynce also shall take none people enherytaunce put frome possession owne sonnes shal geue possession people scatred abrode euery man may haue owne brought thorow entraunce syde dore habytacyon sanctuary belongeth preastes stode towarde northe beholde place vpon west syde sayde vnto place preestes shall dyght trespace syn offerynges bake meate offerynges nede beare outwarde courte vnhalowe people brought vttemoste courte rounde aboute al foure corner beholde euery corner fore courte yet lytle courte yee foure corner courte made lytle courte xl cubites longe xxx cubytes broade foure lytle courtes one like measure went rydge wall rounde aboute foure vnder whiche harthes made roūde sayde vnto kechyn mynysters house shall dyght slayne offerynges people ¶ vysyon water come temple coastes lande promesse • yuis • therof trybes capi xlvii thys brought agayne dore house beholde gushed water vnder postes house eastwarde ye house stode towarde east ranne downe vpon ryght syde house whyche lyeth aulter southward caried north dore brought forth rounde aboute vttermost dore y• turneth eastewarde zacha 13 • xiiii • beholde came forth water vpon ryght syde nowe whan man meterode hande wente vnto east dore measured cubytes brought thorowe water euē ancles measured yet thousande brought thorowe water agayne vnto knee yet measured thousande brought thorow water vnto loynes thys measured thousande agayne ryuer myght wade thorowe water depe nedefull haue swymmed myght waded ouer sayde vnto haste thou sene thou sonne man wyth brought ryuer bāck agayne nowe came stode many tree vpon either syde ryuer bācke said vnto water floweth towarde easte runneth downe playne felde commeth see see runneth maketh water whole yee al lyue moue vnto ryuer commeth shal recouer math 4 • xiii f water commeth shalbe muche fyshe io • 4 • vii commeth water shalbe lusty whole thys ryuer shall fyshers stande engaddy vnto en eglaim spred nettes shalbe greate heapes fyshe lyke mayne see claye pyttes shal whole shal occupyed salte ryuer vpon sydes shore shall growe maner frutefull tree whose leaues shall fall nether shall frute perysh euer rype theyr mouthes theyr water runneth theyr sanctuary frute good eate leafe profytable medycynes thus sayeth lorde god let border wherin ye shal deuyde lāde vnto xij trybes israel lyne parte indifferently vnto one vnto another gene xxii • whiche lande swore vnto father shulde fall enherytaunce border lande vpon northesyde frome mayne see men go zadada namely hemath berotha sabarim border damascus hemath vnto hazar tichon lyeth vpon coastes haueran thus border see forth shalbe hazar euan border damascus north border hemath northe parte east syde shal ye measure haueran damascus galead lande israel iordane forth frō see coast lyeth east warde easte parte southe syde frome thamar forthe num xx b exo xvii b water stryfe vnto cades ryuer mayne see y• south parte west parte namely greate see frō border therof tyll mā come vnto hemath west parte nume 33 f thys lande shall ye parte amonge accordyng trybes israel deuyde herytage leuit xix g deu • e x xxiiii • straungers dwell amonge beget chyldren ye shal take amonge chyldren israel lyke though youre owne houshole countre shall haue herytage wyth amonge chyldren israel loke tribe straunger dwelleth trybe shal ye geue herytage sayeth lorde god ¶ lotte vii trybes partes possessyon preastes temple leuytes cytie prynce rehearced lotte trybes gate cytie capi xlviii name trybes lye vpon northsyde waye hetlon tyll thou cōmest vnto hemath hazar euam border damascus towarde northe besyde hemath dan shall haue hys porcyon easte quarter vnto west upon border dan east syde vnto west shall asser haue porcion upon border asser east parte vnto west shal nephthaly haue hys porcyon upon border nephthali east quarter vnto west shall manasses haue porcyon upon border manasses east syde vnto west shal ephraim haue porcyon upon border ephraim east parte vnto west shall ruben haue porcyon upon border ruben east quarter vnto weste shall iuda haue porcyon upon border iuda frome easte parte vnto weste ye shall set syde one porcyon xxv meteroddes longe brode lyke another porcyon frome east syde vnto west wherin sāctuary shall stande ezec xiv • porcyon ye shall seperate lorde shalbe xxv longe x brode seperated holy porcyon shall longe vnto namely preestes towarde northe xxv towarde west x brode towarde easte x brode also toward south xxv longe wherein sanctuarye lorde shall stande yee place shalbe preestes chyldren ezec x • iii • xliiii c sadoch haue kepte holy ordynaunce whiche wente astraye erroure chyldren israell lyke leuytes gone astraye seperated pece haue lande shall holy harde vpon border leuytes nexte vnto preestes shall leuytes haue xxv longe x brode shalbe euery syde xxv longe x brode porcyon shall sell nothynge make permutacyon therof least chefe land fal vnto halowed vnto lord v bredth lyeth xxv shalbe comen shall belonge cytie suburbes habytaciōs cyte shal stande middest therof let y• measure toward y• north part v c iiij towarde south parte v c iiij towarde east parte v c iiii towarde west parte v c iiij suburbes harde vpon cyte shall haue towarde north l ij c towarde south l ij c towarde east l two c towarde west also l two c resydue lengthe lyeth harde vpon seperated holy grounde namely x thousande towarde easte x towarde west next vnto holy porcyon increase therof shal serue theyr meate laboure cyte laboure welth cytye shall mayntayne also trybe soeuer israel seperated xxv longe xxv brode foure partes shall ye put asyde seperated porcyon sanctuary possessyon cyte resydue vpon sydes sanctuary possessyon cyte shall belonge prynce place xxv vnto eastende place xxv west ward vnto border cyte shalbe prynces porcyon thys shalbe holy place house sanctuarye shall stande myddest moreouer leuites cyties possessyon lye myddest prynces parte loke remayneth betwyxte border iuda border ben iamin shalbe prynces nowe trybes east parte vnto west shall ben iamin haue porcion upon border ben iamin east syde vnto west shall symeon haue porcyon upon border symeon east parte vnto west shall izakar haue hys porcyon upon border izakar east syde vnto west shall sabulon haue porcyon upon border sabulon easte parte vnto weste shall gad haue porcyon upon border gad southwarde coastes shall reache thamar forth vnto water stryfe cades floude euen vnto mayne see thys lande wyth hys nume 32 iosu 13 14 porcyons whyche ye shall dystrybute vnto trybes israell sayeth lorde god thus wyde shall cyte reache vpon northe parte fyue hundreth foure thousande measure porte cytie shall haue name trybes israell thre porte northesyde one ruben another iuda thyrde leuy upon east syde fyue hundret hand foure thousande measure thre porte one ioseph another ben iamin thyrde dan upon southsyde fyue hundreth foure thousande measure wyth thre porte one symeon another izakar thyrde sabulon vpon west side fiue hondreth foure thousāde measure thre porte also one gad another asser thyrde nephthalye thus shall haue xviij measure rounde aboute tyme forthe name cytie shalbe lorde ❧ endeth booke prophete ezechiell ❧ booke prophete daniell ¶ prophete sheweth captiuite iehoakim kyng iuda sonnes captiuytie kynge commaundeth whiche shulde taught lernynge language chaldee alowed kynges fedyng daniel absteyneth meate kynge babylon capi thyrde yeare raigne iehoakim kynge iuda came nabuchodonolor kynge babylon vnto ierusalem beseged 4 24 2 par 3 • c lorde delyuered iehoakim kynge iuda hys hande certayne ornamentes house god whiche caryed away vnto lande sc̄nar house god brought hys goddes treasury kynge spake vnto asphanaz chefe chamberlayne shulde brynge hym certayne chyldren israel come kynges sede prynces yonge spryngaldes without blemysh fayre welfauoured instructe wysdome connynge vnderstandynge whiche able stande kinges palace rede lerne speake caldeysh unto kynge apoynted certayne porcyon owne meate wyne whiche dranke hym selfe norysh thē thre yere afterward myght stande kynge amonge nowe certayne chyldrē iuda namely daniel ananias misael azarias unto chefe chamberlayne gaue name called daniel balthasar anamas sidrach misael misach asarias abednago daniell poynte wyth hym selfe gene 43 c tobie 1 b iudie 12 • wolde defyled thorowe kynges meate wyne whyche dronke desyred chefe chamberlayne left shuld defyle hym self god gaue daniel fauour grace chefe chamberlayne sayde vnto hym afrayed lorde kyng whiche hath appoynted meate dryncke lest spye face worse lykyng spryngaldes age ye shal make lose heade vnto kynge daniel answered melassar chefe chāberlayne set ouer daniell ananias misael asarias sayd proue ten dayes thy seruauntes let v haue potage eate water drynck loke vpon face eate kynges meate thou seyst deale wyth thy seruauntes consented thys matter proued tenne dayes tenne dayes theyre face betterr lykynge fatter yonge spryngaldes whyche dyd eate kynges meate thus melassar toke way meate wyne gaue potage therfore god gaue nowe foure springaldes connynge leruyng al scrypture wysdome vnto danyell specyally gaue vnderstandyng al visyons dreames nowe tyme expyred kyng appoynted bryng yong spryngaldes vnto hym chefe chamberlayne brought nabuchodonosor kynge communed amonge founde none suche daniel ananias misael asarias therfore stode kynge whiche wysdome matter vnderstandynge enquered founde thē ten time better al sothsayers charmer hys realme daniel abode styll vnto fyrste yeare kynge cyrus capi ii ¶ dreame nabuchodonosor calleth vnto hym sothsayers requyreth dreame • interpretacyon therof answere cannot shewe kynge commaundeth wyse men babylon slayue daniel requyreth tyme solu • e questyon lorde openeth mystery vnto danyel danyel brought vnto kynge sheweth hym hys dreame interpretacyon therof euerlastynge kyngdome chryste seconde yeare raygne nabuchodonosor nabuchodonosor dreame iob vii b danie 4 v thorowe hys sprete vexed hys slepe brake hym kyng commaunded call together sothesayers charmer wytches caldees shewe king dreame came stode kynge kynge sayde vnto haue dreamed dreame sprete troubled therwith y• haue clene forgotten dreamed upō caldees answered kynge ☞ syryans speach kynge god saue thy lyfe euer shewe thy seruauntes dreame shal shewe meaneth kyng gaue caldees theyr answere saide gone fro yf ye wyll make vnderstande dreame interpretacyon therof ye shal dye house shalbe prysed yee tel dreame meanynge therof ye shall haue gyftes rewardes great honoure shewe dreame sygnyfycacyon answered againe sayde king must shewe seruauutes dreame shall declare meaneth kynge answered sayinge perceaue trueth ye prolonge tyme moch ye se thynge gone fro therfore ye wyll tell dreame ye shal al haue one iudgement ye fayne dissemble vayne wordes whiche ye speake put tyme therfore tell dreame shal knowe yf ye shew meaneth upon y• caldees gaue answere befoe kynge sayd man vpon earth tel thyng king speaketh yee nether kyng prynce lorde euer asked thinges sothsayer charmer caldee harde matter kynge requyreth neyther certyfye kynge therof excepte goddes whose dwellynge amonge creature cause kynge wroth great indignacion cōmaunded destroye wyse men babylon proclamacyon wente forthe wyse men shulde slayne sought also sleye daniel companyons daniel enquered arioch kynges stewarde iudgement sentence gone forth alredy kyll suche wyse babilon answered saide vnto arioch kinges debyte hath king proclamed cruel sentence arioch tolde daniel matter upon went daniel vp desyred king myght haue leysoure shewe kynge interpretacyon came home agayne shewed thynge vnto ananias misael asarias hys companyons shulde beseche god heauen grace secret daniel hys felowes suche wyse babylō peryshed thē mystery shewed vnto daniel vysyon nyght daniel praysed god heauen daniel also cryed loude sayde name god myght praysed euer euer wysdome strength hys owne dan vii luke • c iob 34 e iere 27 dani iiii c chaungeth tymes age iob xxxii b putteth downe kynges setteth vp kynges 1 timo • c geueth wysdome vnto wyse vnderstandynge vnderstande openeth depe secretes knoweth thyng lyeth ī darcnesse 1 iohn • • lyght dwelleth thancke prayse yu god father thou haste lente wysdome strength hast shewed thyng desyred thou hast opened kynges matter vnto upon went daniel vnto arioch whome kynge ordeyned destroye wyse babylon wente vnto saide destroye suche wyse babylon brynge vnto kynge shall shewe kyng interpretacion arioch brought daniel king haste saide vnto hym haue foūde man among presoners iuda shall shewe kynge interpretacyon answered kynge sayde vnto daniel whose name balthasar arte thou canste shewe dreame whiche haue sene interpretacyon therof daniel answered kynge face saide secrete whiche kynge maketh inquysycion neyther wyse sorcerer charmer deuyl coniurer certyfy kynge mat xi 8▪ god heauen open secretes sheweth kyng nabuchodonosor come latter dayes thy dreame thou hast sene thyne head vpon thy bed king thou dydest caste thy mynde shulde come hereafter y• opener mysteryes telleth come secrete shewed eny wysdome haue lyuing y• myght shewe king interpretacyon myght knowe y• thoughtes owne herte thou kyng sawest beholde stode greate image whose fygure maruelous greate vysage grymme image head fyne golde breste armes syluer hys body loynes copper legges yron hys fete parte yron parte earth mat xxi c luke xx b thou saweste tyll tyme without handes hewen stone smote image vpon fete bothe yron earth brake pouder yron erth copper syluer golde broken al together peces became lyke chaf corne wynde bloweth awaye frō somer floores founde stone smote ymage became greate mountayne whiche fulfylleth whole earthe dreame nowe wyll shewe kynge meaneth dani v kynge thou arte kynge kynges god heuen hath geuen kyngdome ryches strength maiestye hath delyuered al thynges amonge chyldren men beastes felde foules vnder heuen geuen dominyon ouer all▪ thou arte golden heade shall aryse kyngdome shall lesse thyne thyrde kyngdome shall lyke copper haue dominacyon landes fourth kyngdome shall stronge yron lyke yron broseth breaketh thynges ye euen yron baeteth euery thyng downe shall beate downe destroye thou sawest fete toe parte earth parte yron deuyded kyngdome whiche neuertheles shall haue yron grounde myxte moche thou haste sene yron myxte claye toe fete parte yron parte claye sygnifyeth shall kyngdome partely stronge partely weake thou sawest yron myxte claye shall myngle themselues sede symple people yet continue one lyke yron wyll souldered potte sharde dayes kynges shall god heuen set vp esaye ix b euerlasting kyngdome shall peryshe kyng dome shal geuen ouer people yee shall breake destroye kyngdomes shall endure foreuer thou sawest without eny handes cut
