y• hebr xii • mount mat xxi c stone whiche brake yron copper earth syluer golde peces hath greate god shewed kynge wyll come thys true dreame interpretacyon sure kynge nabuchodonosor act xilll • fell downe vpon face bowed hym selfe vnto danyell commaunded shulde offre meatoffrynges swete odoures vnto kyng answered daniel sayde yee trueth youre god god aboue goddes lorde aboue kynges opener secretes seynge thou canst dyscouer mysterye kynge made daniel greate man gaue hym many greate gyftes gene 4▪ • made ruler al countrees babilon lorde noble babylon nowe danyel intreated kynge sidrach mysach abednago made ruler ouer officer lande babylon danyel selfe remained styl court kynge ¶ kynge setteth vp golden image whiche commaundeth worshypped sydrach mysach abednago accused dispysed kynges commaū dement brought vnto kynge commaunded worshyp ymage refuse put burnynge ouen belyfe god delyuered fyre nabuchodonosor confesseth power god syght myracle capi iii nabuchodonosor kynge caused golden image made lx cubytes hye syxe cubytes thycke made set vp y• felde dura lande babylon sent oute togather together duke lordes noble iudges offycers debytes shreues ruler lande myght come dedycacyon image whiche nabuchodonosor kynge set vp duke lordes noble iudges offycers debytes shreues ruler lande gathered together came vnto dedycatynge image nabuchodonosor kynge set vp nowe stode image nabuchodonoror set vp y• bedil cried al might ye people kynreddes tunges sayde whē ye heare noyse trompettes shalbe blowen harpes shawmes psaltery symphonyes maner musike ye fall downe worshipe y• golden image nabuchodonosor king hath set vp whose falleth downe boweth hym selfe shall euen houre caste hote burnynge ouen therfore al folcke herde noise trōpettes blowen harpes shawmes psalteryes symphomes al kinde melody thē al people kynreddes nacions fell downe bowed selues vnto golden image nabuchodonosor kynge set vp nowe certayne men caldees went euen accused iewes sayde vnto kynge nabuchodonosor king god saue thy lyfe euer thou beynge kynge hast geuen cōmaundemente men heare noyse trompettes harpes shawmes psalteryes symphonyes melodyes shall fall downe bowe selues towarde golden image whoso fell downe worshypped shulde cast hote burnyng ouen nowe certayne iewes daui ii g thou haste set ouer offyces lande babylon namely sydrache mysache abednago men kynge regarde thy commaundement yee wyll serue thy goddes bow selues golden image thou haste set vp nabuchodonosor cruell wrathe displeasure cōmaunded sidrach misach abednago shulde broughte vnto hym men brought kynge nabuchodonosor spake vnto sayde sydrach mysache abednago wyl ye serue goddes bowe youre selues golden image haue set vp wel redy hereafter ye heare noise trompettes blowe wyth harpes shawmes psaltery symphonyes melodyes ye fall downe worshippe image haue made yf ye worshyppe ye shal cast immediatly hote burnyng ouen let se god maye delyuer oute handes sidrach misach abednago answered kynge sayde nabuchodonosor ought cōsent vnto matter oure god serue num 16 g able kepe v hote burninge ouen kynge ryght well delyuer v thy handes though wyll yet shalte thou knowe kynge wyll serue thy goddes reuerence image thou haste set vp nabuchodonosor full indignacyon countenaūce face chaunged vpon sidrach misach abednago therfore charged commaūded yt ouen shuld made seuē tymes hoter wâs wōte spake vnto strongest worthyes host bynde sidrach misach abednago cast hote burnynge ouen men bounde theyr cote hosen shues wyth theyr garmentes caste hote burnynge ouen kynges commaundemēt strayte ouen excedynge hote men put sidrach misach abednago flamme fyre destroyed thre men sidrach misach abednago fell downe hote burnynge ouen beinge fast bounde nabuchodonosor king marueled stode vp hast spake vnto hys councell sayde dyd ye caste thre men bounde fyre answered saide vnto kynge yee kynge answered sayde lo yet se foure men goinge low • e myddest fyre nothynge corrupte fourth ☞ lyke aungel loke vpon upon went nabuchodonosor vnto mouth hote burnynge ouen spake also sayde sidrache misache abednago ye seruauntes hye god go forth come hither sidrach misache abednago wente oute fyre duke lordes noble kynges councel came together se men esa xliii vpon fyre maner power theyr bodyes muche heare theyre head burnt theyr clothes vnchaunged yee smell fyre felt vpon spake nabuchodonosor sayd blessed god sidrach misach abednago psal 34 dani vi actes xii f hath sent hys angell defended seruauntes put trust altered kynges commaundemente ieoperde theyr bodyes thervpon rather wolde serue worshype god except theyr owne god therfore wyll commaunde people kynredes tunges whiche speake blasphemy agaynst god sidrach misach abednago shall dye theyr house shall praysed esai 44 • ose xiii • god maye saue kynge promoted sydrach mysache abdenago lande babylon capi iiii ¶ nabuchodonosor dreameth againe daniel interpreteth nabuchodonosor put realme eateth beastes confesseth power god restored hys kyngdome n dani vi c abuchodonosor kynge vnto al people kynreddes tunges dwell vpon whole earthe peace multyplyed among thought good shewe token maruelous worckes bye god hath wrought vpon howe greate hys token howe mightie wonder psal xiv b dam vii • luke • c hys kingdome euerlastyng kingdome power lasteth euer euer nabuchodonosor beynge rest myne house florishynge palace sawe dreame whiche made afrayed thoughtes vpon bedde vysyons myne heade troubled dani ii sent cōmission wysdome babylon shulde brought tell interpretacyon dreame came sothsayers charmer caldees coniurers deuels tolde dreame betokened coulde shew tyll laste came one daniel otherwyse called balthazar accordyng name god whiche hath sprite holy goddes told dreame sayinge balthazar thou prince sothesayers muche knowe thou hast spryte holy goddes secrete hyd tell therfore vysion dreame haue sene maye sygnyfye sawe vysyon head vpon bed beholde stode tre vpon grounde whiche hye greate myghtye heyghthe reached vnto heauen bredthe extended endes earthe hys leaues fayre much frute euery man ynough eate therin beastes felde shadowes vnder foules aire dwelt bowes therof shortly creature fed sawe head vision vpon bed beholde watcher came downe heauen cryed myghtely saying hewe downe ire breake braūches shake leaues scatre frute abrode beastes may get away vnder foules frō braunches neuertheles leaue grounde rote styl earth bynde vpon playn felde cheynes yron stele wyth dewe heauen shall wet shal haue hys part herbes grounde wylde beastes man herte hys shal taken beastes herte shall geuen tyll seuen yeare come gone vpon erande watcher comaūdement grounded sought councell holy learne men vnderstande hiest hath power ouer kyndomes men geueth lyketh hym bryngeth oute caste men ouer thꝭ dreame kyng nabuchodonosor haue sene therfore balthazar tell thou signifieth much al wyse men kyngdome able shewe meaneth thou canste spryte holy goddes daniel whose name balthasar helde peace space houre hys thoughtes troubled hym kinge spake sayde balthazar let neyther dreame interpretaciō therof feare y• balthazar answered saying lorde dreame happē thine enemy interpretacyon thyne aduersaryes tre thou sawest whiche great myghtye whose heyght reached vnto heauen bredth worlde whose leaues fayre frute muche vnder whiche beastes felde habitacyon vpon whose braunches foules ayre dyd syt euen thou kyng art tre greate strong thy greatnes increaceth reacheth vnto heauen doth thy power endes earth kyng sawe watcher euen holy angell came downe heauen sayde hewe downe tre destroye yet leaue grounde rote earthe bynde hym vpon playne felde cheynes yron stele shall wet dewe heauen parte shal beastes felde tyll seuen yeares become gone vpon hym kyng interpretacyon yee deuyce hym hyest toucheth lorde kynge thou shalt cast men thy dwellyng shalbe beastes y• felde wyth grasse shalte thou fed lyke oxe thou must wet wyth y• dewe heauen yee seuen yeares shall come go vpon tyll thou knowe daniel 〈◊〉 iere • 7 • hyest hath power vpon kyngdomes men geueth thē lyst moreouer sayd rote tree shuld left styl groūde betokeneth yt thy kyngdome shal remayne whole vnto thou hast lerned knowe y• power commeth heauen wherfore kyng cōtent coūcell thou mayest lowse thy sinnes ryghtuousnesse eccles 19 b thyne offence mercy poore people suche thynges shall prolonge thy peace thynges touche kynge nabuchodonosor xij monethes kyng walked vp downe palace y• kyngdome babylon sayde great cyte babylon whiche self wt power strēgth haue made kinges courte honour magesty whyle wordes yet kynges mouth fell voyce heauen sayeng kyng nabuchodonosor y• spokē thy kingdome shall departe thou shalt cast men cōpany thy dwellynge shalbe bestes felde thou shalt eate grasse lyke oxe tyl seuē yeares come gone ouer euen vntyll thou knowest y• hyest hath power vpō kyngdomes men may gyue thē vnto pleaseth hym houre matter fulfylled vpon nabuchodonosor cast men cōpany dyd eate grasse lyke oxe body wet dewe heauē tyll hearres great aegles fethers nayles lyke byrdes clawes tyme past nabuchodonosor lyft vp myne eye vnto heauē myne vnderstanding restored vnto agayne gaue thankes vnto highest magnifyed praysed lyueth euermore dani iii • whose power endureth alway kyngdome one generacyon another comparyson dwell vpon earthe reputed nothyng psal 135 handleth accordynge wyl amonge power heuē amonge inhabytours earth none y• may resyst hande saye doest y• io • xlii b yt tyme myne vnderstanding geuen agayne restored honoure kyngdome dignyte myne owne shape agayne greate estate prynces sought vnto set kyngdome agayne yet greater worshyppe dyd nabuchodonosor loue magnifye prayse kyng heauē worckes true wayes ryght go proudly able bryng downe ¶ balthazar kynge babylon abusynge vesselles temple seyth hande wrytynge wall sothe sayers called kynge expounde wrytynge daniell called whiche readeth interpreteth also balthasar beyng slayne darius succedeth rowme capi v kynge balthazar made greate bancket hys thousande lordes wyth thousande made greate chere droncken wyth wyne commaunded brynge hym golden syluer vessel 2 par 36 • whiche father nabuchodonosor takē tēple ierusalem kyng lordes quene concubynes myght drinke therout brought golden vessell taken temple lordes house ierusalē kynge lordes quene concubine dron • k droncke wyne praysed idoles golde syluer copper yrō wodde stone houre appeared fyngers bene man hāde writynge ryght ouer agaynste candelstycke vpon playne wall kynges palace kyng sawe palme hande th •• wrote 〈…〉 chaūged kyng countenaūce thoughtes troubled ioyntes body shoke hys knee smote one agaynste wherfore 〈…〉 kyng cryed myghtelye shulde brynge hym charmer caldees coniurers deuylles kynge spake also wyse men babylon sayde rede wrytyng shewe playne meaning therof shalbe clothed purple haue cheyne golde necke rule thyrde parte kyngdome upon came al kynges wyse mē coulde neyther rede y• wrytyng shewe kyng signifyed thē kyng sore afrayed muche y• hys coloure chaūged lordes sore vexed reason thys matter happened kyng lordes y• quene went vp self bancket house spake vnto y• kyng sayinge kyng god saue thy lyfe euer let thy thoughtes trouble let thy countenaunce chaunged man thy kyngdome hath sprete holy goddes within hym daniel 2 sene thy father dayes hath vnderstāding wisdome lyke goddꝭ ye kyng nabuchodonosor thy father made man chefe y• sothsayers charmer caldees deuyl cō iurers suche aboundaunte sprete knowledge wysdome expounde dreames open secretes declare harde dowtes founde yee euen daniel kyng named balthazar let daniel sente shal tel meaneth daniell brought kyng kyng spake vnto daniel sayde art thou daniel one prysoners iuda father kyng brought iewry haue herde speake thou hast sprete holy goddes experience vnderstandyng hath bene great wysdome founde y• haue bene brought wyse connyng charmer reade thys writyng shewe meanyng therof coulde tel matter signifyed hearde say thou canst expounde darcke thinges declare harde doutes well yf thou canst reade thys wrytynge shewe meaninge ther thou shalt clothed wyth purple haue cheyne golde thy necke rule thyrd part kyngdome daniell answered sayde ye kyng 4 reg v math x thy rewardes kepe thē thyself gyue thy rych gyftes another yet thelesse wyll rede y• wrytyng vnto kyng shewe y• interpretacyon therof daniel 2 c kyng god hyghest gaue vnto nabuchodonosor thy father dygnyte kyng worshyppe honour people kynreddes tunges stode awe feare hym reason hye estate lent slew wolde smote pleased againe whō wolde set vp lyst put downe dani 4 hert proude stomake set fast vnto wylfulnes deposed frō kyngely trone magesty taken shut among mē hert lyke beastes hert dwellyng wyth wylde ass fayne eate grasse lyke oxe body wet dewe heuē tyl knewe hyest god power vpon kingdomes mē setteth ouer lyst thou sōne balthazar hast submytted thyne herte though thou knewest al thinges hast magnyfied thyselfe aboue lorde heauen vessel house brought thou thy lordes thy quene concubynes myght drincke wine therout hast praysed idoles syluer golde copper yron wod stone neyther se heare vnderstād god actes 17 • whose hande consysteth bredth thy wayes thou haste loued hym therfore palme hande sente hyther token vp wrytyng scrypture writen vp mane thetel phares interpretacyon thynge mane god hath nombred kyngdome brought ende thetell thou art weyed balaunce art founde lyght phares thy kyngdome delt partes geuen medes perses cōmaūded balthazar cloth daniell wyth purple hange cheyne gold aboute necke make proclamacion concernyng hym shulde ruler thyrde parte kyngedome esay 47 • nyght balthazar kynge caldees stayne dani ix • darius medium toke kyngdome beyng lxij yeare age ¶ daniel made ruler ouer lordes ymaginacion arte agaynste daniell proclamacion arte wherof daniel accused vnto kyng transgressour put denne lion cōmaundement kyng delyuered fayth god daniel accusars put vnto lyon corne sonder darius proclamacyon decree magnyfyeth god daniel capi vi pleased darius set ouer kyngdome c xx lordes shulde al kyngdome aboue set thre prynces daniell one ye lordes myght geue accomptes vnto thē kyng vndiseased daniel exceaded al prynces lordes sprete god plentuous hym kynge mynded set hym ouer whole realme wherfore prynces lordes sought pycke daniel quarel agaynst kyngdome yet could fynde none occasion faute vpon faythful blame dyshonesty founde hym sayde men get quarell agaynst thys daniel excepte law god upon wēt prynces lordes together vnto kyng sayde thus vnto kyng darius god saue thy lyfe foreuer al great estatꝭ realme prynces duke senatours iudges determyned put commaundement kynge make sure statute namely desyreth petycion either god man within xxx dayes except onely kyng person may cast lyon denne wherfore kynge confyrme thou statute make wrytynge thynge medes perses haue ordeyned altered broken darius made wrytynge confirmed nowe daniell vnderstode wrytynge made wente hys house wyndowes wall towarde ierusalem stode open kneled downe vpon knee thre tymes daye made hys petycion praysed hys god lyke maner afore tyme men made searche founde daniell makynge peticyon prayinge vnto god came kyng spake concerning commaundement saying kyng hast thou subscribed statute y• within xxx dayes requyreth peticyon god mā onely thyselfe kyng shalbe cast denne lyon kynge swered sayde yee true must lawe medes perses maye broken answered sayde vnto kynge daniel one prisoner iuda kyng regardeth nether y• thy statute yu haste made maketh petycyon thre tymes daye kynge hearde wordes sore greued wold haue excused daniel delyuer put matter vnto sunne wēt downe intent myght saue hym men perceauyng y• kinges mynde sayde vnto knowe kynge lawe medes perses y• cōmaundement statute kynge maketh may altered ••• • y• kyng bad brynge daniel cast hym lyon denne kynge also spake vnto daniell sayde thy god thou alwaye seruest euen shall defendethe brought stone layed vpon hole denne y• kyng sealed owne ryng sygnet prynces kynges cōmaundement concerning daniel shulde broken kyng wente palace kepte sober nyght table spred hym neyther coulde take slepe time morning breake daye kynge arose went haste vnto denne lyon nowe came nye vnto denne cried piteous voyce vnto daniel yee kynge spake sayde vnto daniel daniel thou seruaunt lyuyng god thy god thou alwaye seruest able delyuer lyon daniel sayde vnto kynge kynge god saue thy lyfe foreuer daniel 3 • god hathe sente hys aungell actes 〈◊〉 c iudic 14 c 1 reg 17 e hebre xi f whiche hath shut y• lyōs mouthes myght hurte myne vngyltynesse founde y• kynge neuer offended y• kynge exceadyng glad cōmaunded take daniel denne daniel brought denne▪ maner hurte founde vpon hym put trust god men whiche accused daniell kyng commaunded bryng cast thē lyon denne theyr chyldren theyr wyues y• lyōs maystryedani 14 brake bone sonder euer came grounde daniel 3 • wrote kyng darius vnto al people kynceddes tūges dwelt al landes peace multiplied commaundement dominyon kyngdome men feare stande awe daniel god dani 14 • lyuynge god whiche abydeth euer kyngdome shal fayle power euerlastynge esay 14 • oser xiii • daniel 3 • delyuereth saueth dath wonder maruelous workes heauen earthe hath preserued daniel power lyon daniel prospered y• raygne darius cirus persia ¶ vysyon iiii beastes shewed vnto daniel vysyon interpreted iiii kyngdomes worlde power increase antichryst euerlastyng kyngdome chryste capi vii fyrste yeare balthazar kynge babylon sawe danyell dreame vysyon hys heade vpon hys bedde whiche dreame wrote somme matter daniel spake sayde sawe vysyon nyght beholde foure windes heauen stroue vpon see foure great beastes came vp see one vnlyke another fyrst iere 4 b ezech 1 b x b lyon yet ezech 17 aegles wynges sawe wynges plucte taken awaye earthe stode vpon hys fete man geuen hym man herte beholde y• seconde beast lyke prou 28 c beare stode vpon one syde amonge teeth mouth iij great longe teeth sayde vnto aryse eate vp much flesh loked beholde another lyke vnto leoparde wynges foule daniel 8 b xi 1 mat 1 euen foure vpon backe beast foure heades power geuen sawe visyon nyght beholde fourth beast grymme horrible maruelous stronge great yron teeth deuoured destroyed stamped resydue vnder fete farre vnlyke beastes yt apo • • 3 c ten horne wherof toke good hede beholde came vp amōg another lyke horne thre first horne pluckte awaye beholde horne eye lyke man mouth speakynge presumptuous thynges • pe • • • 〈…〉 • xx b daniel x loked tyll seates prepared tyl yu olde aged sat downe clothyng whyte snowe hearres hys heade lyke pure wol hys trone lyke fyrye flame hys wheles burnynge fyre drewe forth fyrye streame went • poca v b thousāde tymes thousande serued hym x tymes ten thousande stode iudgement set bokes opened toke hede vnto voyce proude worde • whiche y• horne spake behelde tyl beaste slayne body destroyed math 25 apoca 19 xx c geuen ouer brent fyre power beastes also taken away lyues prolonged tyme season sawe vysion night beholde mat xiii • actes b apo • a▪ came one cloudes heauen lyke sonne man whiche went vnto olde aged brought gaue phillip 2 power dignite regall people tribe tūges shulde serue math 28 c iohn xii hys power euerlastynge power shal neuer put downe kyngdome endureth vncorrupte herte vexed dani 14 f daniel troubled sprete within visiōs heade made afrayed tyl gat vnto deuit ix • one stode knowe trueth concernyng thinges tolde made vnderstande interpretacyon thinges foure greate beastes foure kynges whiche shall aryse earth shall take y• kingdome saintꝭ hyest possesse styll longe season requyred diligently knowe trueth concernynge y• fourth beast farre vnlyke beastes horrible whose teeth yron nayles brasse deuoured destroyed stāped resydue vnder hys fete desyre also knowe trueth touchynge y• apoca 13 13 • xvii • ten horne vpon head thys whiche came vp afterwarde whose face fell downe thre whiche horne eye mouth spake presumptuous thinges loked wyth grymmer visage felowes beheld horne made batayle agaynst sayntes yee gat vyctory vntyl tyme olde aged came iudgemēt geuen chefest sayntes tyl tyme y• saynctes kyngdome possession gaue answere fourth beast shalbe y• fourth kyngdome vpon earth shalbe kyngdomes shall deuoure treade downe destroy al landes zacha c ten horne ten kynges ye shall aryse y• kyngdome shall stande vp another shalbe greater y• fyrst shal subdue thre kynges shall speake wordes agaynste hyest shall destroye sayntes hiest daniel • • thynke may chaūge tymes lawes shalbe geuen vnder power apoca xii • vntyll tyme two tymes halfe tyme iudgement shalbe kepte power shalbe takē shall destroyed peryshe last kyngdome power myght vnder y• heuen shalbe geuen holy people hyest luke c dani 14 • whose kyngdome euerlastynge ye • power shall serue obeye hym thus farre extende wordes neuertheles danyel vexed thoughtes countenaunce chaūged luke ii • wordes kepte styll herte ¶ visyon steyfe betwene ra 〈…〉 e goate vnderstandynge visyon battell betwene kynge persia kynge ere • yms shamelesse kynge antichrist capi viii thryde yeare raygne kyng balthazar apeared vysion vnto daniel sene dan vii fyrst sawe vision sawe susis chefe cytie whiche lyeth lande iere xlix f ezech 32 elam vysyon thought ryuer ulai loked vp sawe beholde stode ryuer ramme horne horne hye one hyer another hyest came vp laste sawe thys ramme pusshed hys horne agaynste west agaynst north agaynste south beastes myght stāde hym defende thē frō hys power dyd lysted waxed greatly toke hede vnto came goate west ouer whole earth touched nat grounde goate meruelus goodly horne betwyxte eye came vnto ramme two horne sene afore thy ryuer syde ranne fearcely vpō might sawe drawenye vnto ramme beyng fearce vpō hym yee gaue suche stroke brake two horne neyther rāme much strength stāde caste hym downe croade hym vnder hys fete man able delyuer rāme hys power goate waxed exceadynge greate strongest great horne broken also dan vii 〈◊〉 • ath • grewe foure lyke steade towarde iiij wyndes heauē yee one least horne came vp yet another horne waxed meruelous great towarde south towarde east towarde fayre pleasaunt lande grewe vp hoost heauen wherof dyd cast downe grounde starres also trode vnder fete yee grewe vp vnto prynce hoost daylyeofferinge taken place sanctuary casten downe certayne season geuen vnto agaynste daylyeofferynge wyckednesse myght caste downe veryte grounde prospere al thynges wente upon herde one sayntes speakynge whiche saynte sayde vnto one asked question howe longe shall thys vysyon daylye sacryfyce wastyng abhominacion endure sanctuary power shal troden vnder fote answered hym unto euenynge mornynge euen two thousande thre hundreth dayes shall sanctuary clensed agayne nowe whē daniel sene visiō sought vnderstāding beholde stode thynge lyke vnto man harde man voyce ye ryuer ulay cryed sayde gabriel make man vnderstande visiō came stode afrayed cōmynge fell downe vpon face sayde vnto thou sonne man marke well laste tyme shall vysyon fulfylled nowe speakynge vnto waxed faynte suncke downe grounde toke holde vpon set vp agayne sayinge beholde wyll shewe shal happen last wrath tyme appoynted shalbe fulfylled ramme thou sawest two horne kynge medes perses goate kinge greke lande greate horne stode betwyxte eye principall kynge brake foure rose vp steade signifieth people shall stande vp mat foure kyngdomes myghtye kingdomes whyle vngodlynesse growing shal aryse kynge vnshamefast face whiche shalbe wyse darcke speakynges shalbe myghtye stronge nat owne strēgth shall destroye aboue measure goeth aboute shall prospere shall sleye stronge holy people thorowe craftynes falshed shall prospere hande herte shalbe proude many one shall put death welthynesse shal stāde vp agaynst prynce prynces 2 mat 9 c 2 thes 2 b shalbe destroyed without hande thys vysyon shewed vnto sure euenynge mornynge esa viii therfore wryte thou vpō sight wylbe • onge come passe upon daniel faynte laye sicke certayne dayes rose vp wente aboute kynges busynesse merueled vision neuerthelesse man knewe ¶ daniel desyreth haue performed god whiche promysed consernynge retourue people frō theyr bannysh ment babylon true confession daniel prayre hearde gabriel aungel expoundeth vnto hym vysyon lxx weakes anoyntyuge chryste buyldynge agayne ierusalē vnder nehemiah death chryste capi ix fyrst yeare darius sonne ahalures danie v sede medes made kynge ouer realme caldees yee euen fyrst yeare raygne daniel desyred knowe yearly nombre bokes wherof lorde spake vnto ac • xxv b xxix b ieremy prophete ierusalē shulde lye wast lxx yeares turned vnto god lord pray make myne intercession fastynge sacke cloth ash prayed y• lorde god knowledged sayeng ii esdr ix c lorde thou greate fearful god thou kepest couenaunt mercy loue thy commaundementesbaruc haue synned haue offended haue bene disobedient gone backe yee haue departed thy preceptes iudgementes wolde neuer folowe thy seruauntes prophetes spake thy name kynges prince forefather al people lande •• eno lorde righteousnesse belongeth vnto vnto v pertayneth nothynge open shame come passe thys daye vnto euery man iuda dwell ierusalem yee vnto israel whether farre nye thorowe landes wherin thou haste strowed offence done agaynste yee lorde vnto v kynges prynces oure forefather euen v psal cvi haue offeded belongeth opē shame vnto lorde oure god pertayneth mercy forgeuenesse v gone backe hym haue nat obeyed voyse lorde oure god walke lawes 2 petri zacha vii b whiche layed v seruaūtes prophetes yee israel haue trāsgressed gone backe lawe haue nat herkened vnto thy voyce wherfore curse othe deut xxvii xxviii leui xxvi wrytten lawe moyses seruaūt god agaynst whō haue offēded poured vpon v baruc ii hath perfourmed hys wordes whiche spake agaynste v agaynste oure iudges iudged v brynge vpon v greate plage neuer vnder heauen lyke nowe come passe ierusalē yee plage wrytten y• lawe moses come vpō v yet made nat praier lorde oure god myght turne agayne wickednesse lerned thy verite therfore hath lorde made haste brynge plage vpon v lorde oure god ryghteous workes whiche dothe wolde herken vnto voyce baruc ii • nowe lorde god exo 12 〈◊〉 xiiii • thou myghtie hande hast brought thy people egypt get thy selfe name remaineth daye haue synned lorde done wyckedly agaynst thy ryghteousnes yet let thy wrothfull displeasure turned awaye beseche frō thy cyte ierusalem thy holy hyll oure synnes sake wyekednesse forefather ierusalem thy people abhorred thē y• aboute v nowe therfore god heare praier thy seruaunte intercession let thy face shyne ouer thy sanctuary yt lyeth waste god enclyne thyne eare herken leest thyne owne sake open thyne eye beholde howe desolated yee cytye also whiche called thy name nat cast prayer oure owne ryghteousnes onely thy greate mercyes lorde heare forgeue lorde lorde consydre tarye nat ouer lōge thyne owne sake god thy cytie thy people called thy name yet speakynge prayer knowledgyng myne owne synnes synnes people israel makynge myne intercessiō lorde god holy hils sake god yee whyle yet speakinge prayer beholde mā gabriel dani 〈◊〉 〈◊〉 viii • whō sene afort vision came flyinge touched aboute offerynge tyme euenynge informed spake vnto danyel sayde nowe come make vnderstande soone thou begannest make thy prayer dyuised therfore come shewe 〈◊〉 thou art man greatly beloued wherfore pondre matter well thou mayest lerne vnderstande visiō lxx wekes determined ouer thy people ouer thy holy cytie wyckednes maye consumed synne may haue ende offence may reconcyleo bryng euerlasting ryghteousnesse fulfyl vysyons prophetes anoynte moost holy one understande marke well tyme shalbe concluded • pat 36 1 esdr go repayre ierusalem agayne vnto chryste anoynted prynce shalbe seuen wekes shall stretes walles buylded agayne lxij wekes hard troublous tyme lxij wekes shall chryst slayne shal haue pleasure hym shall come people prynce destroye cytte sanctuary hys ende shall come water floude desolacyon shall contynue tyll ende batell shall make stronge bonde many space weke weke halfe gone shall put downe slayne meatoffringe mat • 4 b mat xiii b temple shalbe abhomynable desolacion tyll haue destroyed concluded wastynge shall continue vnto ende capi x ¶ appeareth vnto daniel mā clothed lynen whi sheweth hym wherfore sent thyrde yeare kynge cirus persia shewed vnto daniel wyse called balthasar matter yee true matter yet longe tyme vnto vnderstode matter well petreaued vysyon tyme daniel mourned space thre wekes lust eate brede fleshe wyne came none within mouth dyd nat one anoynte selfe tyll whole thre wekes upon xxiiij daye fyrst moneth greate floude called tygris dan vii b apoca c lyfte vp myne eye loked beholde man clothed lynen whose loynes gyrded vp wt fyne golde araby hys body lyke chresolite stone face loke vpō lyke lyghtenyng eye flame fyre armes fete lyke fayre glystering metal voyce wordes lyke voyce multitude dani iii ei daniel alone sawe vysion 〈◊〉 ix men sawe nat greate fearfulnesse fel vpon thē fled awaye hyd thē selues lefte selfe alone sawe great vy syon longe tyll remayned nomore strength within yee loste coloure clene wasted awaye strength gone yet herde voyce wordes soone harde fayntnesse came vpō fell downe flat groūde vpon face beholde hande touched whiche set vp vpon knee vpon palmes handes saying vnto dani ix • daniel thou well beloued man take good hede wordes shall saye vnto stande ryght vp vnto nowe sent sayde wordes stode vp tremblinge sayde vnto feare nat daniel sence y• fyrst daye thou set thyne herte vnderstande dydest chasten thy selfe thy god thy wordes haue bene herde come vnto whem thou begannest speake nat prynce ouer kyngdome y• perses withstāde xxj dayes lo iosue v dani 〈◊〉 michael one chefe prince came helpe hym haue lefte kynge persia come shewe shall happen vnto thy people latter dayes wylbe longe yet vysyon fulfylled nowe spoken wordes vnto cast downe heade y• groūde helde tunge beholde touched lyppes one lyke vnto man opened mouth sayde vnto hym stode lorde ioyntes lowsed vision nomore strength within howe may lordes seruaunte talke lorde seinge strength nat take breth upon thys touched agayne one much lyke man dani ix conforted sayinge thou man well beloued feare nat contente take good hert vnto stronge spoken vnto recoue red sayde speake lorde thou hast refreshed sayde knowest thou wherfore come vnto snowe wyll go agayne fyght prynce perses soone go forth lo prynce grekelande shall come neuertheles wyll shewe thyng faste noted scrypture truth yonder matter none y• helpeth thē michael prince ¶ prophecy kynges persia kyngdome grece kyngedome egypt bonde euerof batell kyngedome spirit iewes flye vnto kynge egypte antiochus kynge syreya persicuted fygureth vnto v antythryst pryde antiochus capi xi y• first yeare darius dea stode hym comforte hym strength nowe wyl shewe trueth beholde shall stande vp yet thre kynges persia forth shalbe farre rycher whē chefest power hys ryches shall prouoke euery man agaynste reame grekelande dan vii • shall aryse yet myghtye kynge shall rule greate dominion hym lyst • mab • soone kyngdome cometh vp shalbe destroyed deuyded towarde foure wyndes heauen come hym shal nat haue suche power dominion kyngdome shalbe scatred yee euen among kynge south shalbe myghtyer thē prynces agaynst hym shall one make hym selfe stronge shall rule domynion greate power sertayne yeares shalbe ioyned together kynges daughter south shal come kyng y• north make frendshyppe shal nat • tayne power arme neyther shall able endure thorow might brought yee begather comforted tyme shalbe delyuered vp braunches rote shall one stande vp hys steade power armes shall go thorowe kynges lande north bandle hym accordynge strength theyr idol prynces theyr costly iewels golde syluer shal cary awaye captyues egypte shall preuayle agaynst kynge north certayne yeares come kynges realme south shalbe fayne turne agayne owne lande wherfore sonnes shallbe displeased shal gather together myghtye greate hooste people one shall come go thorowe lyke water flowde shall returne go forth defyinge boastynge vnto hys owne lande kynge south shalbe angry shall come forth fyght agaynste kynge north yee shall brynge greate multitude people together greate heape shalbe geuen hande shal cary awaye greate pryde muche hath cast downe many thousandes neuertheles shall nat preuayle kynge north shal gather newe greater heape people afore come forth certayne tyme aud yeares myghtye hoost exceadynge greate good tyme shall many stāde vp agaynste kynge south wycked chyldren thy people also shal exalte selues fulfyll vision fall kynge north shall come laye sege take stronge fensed cyties power south shal nat able abyde best men people shall nat strōge resyst hym shortely commeth shall handle lyst man shalbe hardy stande agaynste hym shall stande pleasaunt coū tre whiche thorowe hym shalbe destroyed shall set hys face hys power optayne hys kyngdome lyke yee shall geue hym vnto daughter amōge wemen destroye shall fayle neyther shall optayne hys purpose thys shall set hys face vnto iles take many prynce shall stoppe hym hym shame besyde confusyon el shal come vnto hym thus shall turne agayne hys owne lande stomble fal nomore founde came vpon dyd hym vyolence shall stande place haue pleasaunte kyngdome fewe dayes shalbe destroyed neyther wrath battel hys steade shal aryse vyle persō natholden worthy kynges dygnyte shall come craftely optayne kyngdome fayre wordes shall fyght agaynste armes y• myghtye destroye thē yee prynce couenaūt hathe taken truce hym shall handle dysceatfully may get vp ouercome smal flocke craftynesse get hym fattest place lande deale wyse thē eyther father graūdfathers dyd shall destroye y• thynge robbed spoyled yee theyr substaunce ymagenynge thoughtes agaynst stronge holdes tyme hys power harte shalbe styrred vp greate armye agaynst kynge south thorowe kynge south shalbe moued vnto batell great myghty hoost also neuer thelesse shall nat able stāde shall conspyre agaynste hym yee eate meate shal hurte hym hoost shall fall many slayne downe two kynges shalbe mynded myschefe talke disceyte one table shall prospere ende shall come yet vnto tyme apaynted 2 mat v shall go home agayne owne lande great good set herte agaynst holy couenaunt shalbe busy agaynst returne home tyme apoynted shal come agayne go toward south shall happen otherwyse fyrst yet one agayne •• 24 shippes cithim shal come vpon may smytē turne againe may take indignacy agaynst couenaunt holynesse medle agaynst yee shal turne drawe vnto leaue holy couenaunt shal set myghty men vnhalowe sanctuary strēgth put downe dailye offering aud set vp abhomynable desolacion suche breke couenaūt shall flattre fayre wordes people wyl knowe god shal haue ouerhande prospere also haue vnderstanding among people shal enfourme multitude longe season shalbe persecuted swerd fyre captiuite takyng away theyr goodes nowe whē fall shalbe set vp lytle helpe many shal cleue vnto faynedly yee haue vnderstandyng shal persecuted also may tried purifyed clensed tyll tyme yet another tyme appoynted kyng shall lyst 2 thes 2 shall exalte magnyfie selfe agaynst god yee shall speake maruelous thinges agaynst god al goddes wherin shall prospere longe tyll ap • c • 5 wrath fulfylled conclusion deuised alredy shall regarde god father lust shalbe vpon wemen yee shal care god shall magnyfie selfe aboue hys place shall worship myghtye idoles god father knewe shall honour golde syluer precious stone pleasaunt iewels shall sekyng helpe succoure myghtye idoles straunge goddes suche wy • beceaue take god shal geue greate worshype power • ee make lordes •• •• tude geue thē lande 〈…〉 latter tyme shall kyng south striue king northe lyke maner shall come agaynst charettes horseman greate nauy shyppes shall come landes destroye go thorowe shall entre also fayre pleasaūt land many city coūtrees shal decaye apoc xii • excepte edom moab best chyldren ammon shall escape hande shal stretche forth hādes vpon countrees lande egypte shal escape thorowe goyng shal haue dominion ouer treasure syluer golde ouer precyous iewels egipte libia ethiopia apoca xi • neuerthelesse tydinges east north shal trouble hi cause shal go forth destroye curse great multitude tentes palace shall pytched betwyxte two see vpon hyl noble sanctuary shal come ende apoc •• e v x • shall man helpe hym ¶ prophecyeth resurreccyon deade darkenesse prophecye daniel capi xii tyme wyll come also great prynce apoc xi • • michael whihce standeth thy people syde shall aryse vp mat 425 shall come tyme trouble suche neuer sen began people vnto tyme shall thy people delyuered yee al founde wryt ten boke iob xv c 1 cor • 15 many slepe dust earth shall awake euerlastig lyfe perpetual shame reprofe mat xiii c sapi xiii c wyse suche haue taught shal glyster shynyng heauē haue instructe multitude vnto godlynes shalbe starres world without ende thou daniell shut vp wordes seale boke tyl y• last tyme many shall go abonte shall knoweledge increase daniel loked beholde stode two one vpon thys shore water vpon yonder syde one sayde vnto clothed lynen stode aboue vpon water y• floude howe long shal ende wō derous workes apoca x herde mā lynē clothes stode aboue vpon water floude helde vp ryght left hande vnto heauen sware hym whiche lyucth euer apoca xi c xii • shall tary tyme two tymes halfe tyme power holy people clene scatred abrode shal al thynges fulfylled herde well vnderstode sayde lorde shal happen aunswered go thy waye daniel wordes shalbe closed vp sealed tyll last tyme many shall purified clensed tried ⚜ fyre vngodly shall lyue wyckedly mat xiii b wycked many shall haue vnderstandynge suche haue vnderstandyng shal regarde tyme forth daylye offeryng shalbe put downe abhominable desolacyon set vp shall thousande two hundreth xc dayes math x • xxiiii • wel wayteth cōmeth thousande iij c xxxv dayes go thou thy way nowe tyl ended take thy rest byde thy lot tyll dayes haue ende ¶ ende prophecye daniell ❧ booke prophete oseas ¶ tyme wherin oseas prophecyed oseas takyng hatior wyfe sygnyfyeth idolatrye people destruccyon ofsprynge iehu israelytes prophecyed capi word lorde came vnto oseas sonne beery 4 15 16 xvii c ye dayes oseas ioathan ahas iezekias kynges iuda tyme ieroboā sōne ioas kynge israel fyrst lorde spake vnto oseas ☞ sayde vnto •• ui xxi • ezec 44 go thy waye take harlot thy wyfe get chyldren lande hath cōmytted great whoredome agaynst lorde wente toke gomer daughter deblaim whiche conceyued brought forth sonne lorde sayd vnto cal hys name iesraell 4 reg 15 c • 17 • 18 b ☞ wyll shortly auenge bloude 3 reg xxi b iesrael vpon house iehu wyll brynge kyngdome house israel ende thē wyll breake bowe israel valley iesrael conceyued yet agayne bare doughter sayde vnto hym call name loruhamah optayninge mercy 4 reg 17 • wyll haue pitye vpon house israel forget put cleane remēbraunce gen 49 b 4 xix • neuerthelesse wyl haue mercy vpon house iuda wyll saue euen thorowe ye lord god wyll delyuer thorowe bowe swearde batell horse horsmē nowe weaned loruhamah conceyued agayne bare sonne sayde cal name lo amy ye people therfore wyll though nombre chyldren israel sande see whiche neyther measured tolde yet place sayde vnto themroma ix • ye bē people euen shall thus reported thē iohn chyldren lyuyng god ezech 37▪ • shal chyldrē iuda child israel gathered together agayne chose selues one head departe lande greate shalbe day israel ¶ people called vnto repentaunce capi ii tell youre brother people youre systerne haue optayned mercy ☞ mother ye shall chyde reproue iere iii • wyfe neyther husbande onelesse put awaye whoredome syght aduoutry brestes shall strype naked set ezec xvi▪ • euen came worlde yee shall lay wast make lyke wyldernesse sleye thyrst shall haue pite also vpon chyldrē iohn 8 chyldren fornicacion mother hath broken wedlocke bare 4 • 7 • come confusyon sayd ☞ wyl go louers geue water bred woll flaxe oyle dryncke wyll hedge way thornes stoppe shall fynde fotesteppes though rūne louers yet shal get shal seke thē fynde leuit xv c shall saye well wyll go turne agayne fyrst housbande tyme better ease nowe wolde knowe yet gaue corne wyne oyle siluer gold ezec • vi b whiche hath hanged vpon baal wherfore ☞ nowe wyll go take corne wyne agayne season set agayne woll flax gaue couer shame iere xiii • nowe wyll discouer foolyshnesse euen syght louers man shall delyuer hādes moreouer wyll take awaye al myrth ••• xvi • holy dayes uewmoones sabbathes solēpue feastes wyl destroye vyneyardes fygge tree thoughe sayeth lo rewardes y• louers haue geuen wyll make wodde wylde beastes shal eate vp wyll punish also y• dayes baal iu • ic ii b x b wherin censed hym deckynge earinges cheynes whē folowed louers forgat sayeth lorde wherfore beholde wyl cal • agayne bryng wyldernesse speake frendly vnto wyll geue vyneyardes agayne yee iosu vii valey achor also shewe hope comforte shall fynge • odic v tyme youth exod xv lyke daye came lande egypt sayeth y• lorde shall saye vnto housbande shal call nomore baal wyll take awaye name baal frō mouth yee shal neuer remēbre name leuit • 6 thē wyl make couenaunte wylde beastes foules ayre euery thynge crepeth vpon earth esay • ii bowe swerde batel wyll destroy suche y• lande wyl make thē slepe safely eze xvi b thus wyll marye vnto myne owne selfe euermore yee euē selfe wyl mary ryghtuousnesse equyte louynge kyndnesse mercy fayth also wyl mary vnto selfe thou shalt knowe lord tyme wyll shewe selfe frendly gracious vnto heauens sayeth lorde heauens shal helpe earth earth shall helpe corne wyne oyle shal helpe iesrael pet ii b wyl sowe vpon earth sede myne owne selfe rom ix c wyll haue mercy vpon without mercy people wyl saye thou arte people shal saye thou arte god ¶ loue god towarde people capi iii sayde lord ezec 44 b go yet thy waye loue aduouterous woman thy nyeghboure loueth lorde doth chyldren israel howe haue respecte straunge goddes •• ope • 8 • mo vi loue wyne kannes ☞ gather xv syluerlinges homer halfe barlye sayd vnto thou shalt byde long season se thou playest y• harlot loke y• medle wt none mā wyll kepe selfe 2 pa xv thus child israell shal syt great without kyng prince without offeryng aulter without preste reuelacyon afterwarde shal chyldren israel conuerte seke lorde god ezec 34 dauid kynge latter dayes shall worshype lorde hys louynge kyndnesse ¶ cōplaynt agaynst people prestes israel capi iiii heare worde y• lorde ye chyldren israell lorde muste punish thē dwel lande faythfulnesse mercy knowledge god lande swerynge lyeng manslaughter theft aduoutry haue gotten ouerhande one bloudgilttines foloweth another therfore shal land miserable case al dwel therin shal mourne beastes felde foules ayre fish see shal dye yet none y• wyl chasten reproue another mala • preastes shuld refourme mē become lyke people therfore stomblest thou daye tyme prophet wt 〈◊〉 y• night wyl bringe thy mother silence 〈…〉 〈…〉 e •• 〈…〉 people perysh haue knoledge seinge y• thou hast refused vnderstāding therfore wyll refuse also thou shalt nomore preste muche thou hast forgottē y• lawe thy god wyl also forget thy chyldren increased multytude y• sinned therfore wyl chaūge honoure shame leui vi eze xiii eate vp y• synnes people corage theyre wickednes esay • 4 thus y• prest become lyke people wherfore wyl punish theyr wycked wayes rewarde thē accordinge owne ymaginacions leui 26 mith vi • • gge shal eate haue ynough haue vsed whordome therfore shal prospere haue forsaken lorde regarded whordome wyne dronckenesse taketh herte awaye 4 reg • people aske councell stockes staffe must tel thē whorish mynde hath disceaued cōmytte fornycacion god 4 〈◊〉 ▪ 〈…〉 make sacrifice vpon hye mountaynes burne incense vpon hylles yee among okes groues bush good shadowes therfore daughter become hariottes spouse haue broken weclocke wyll punyshe daughter beinge defyled youre brydes became whoresnume 25 c seinge father thē selues haue medled harlottꝭ offred vnthriftes people wyll vnderstand must punyshed though thou israel art disposed play harlot yet shuldest thou haue offended iuda thou shuldest haue runne ☜ gilgal 3 reg xii haue gone vp bethauen deute x▪ haue sworne lord lyueth israel gone backe lyke wanton cowe▪ lorde therfore shall make fede lambe goeth astraye ephraim become partaker idol wel let go dronckennes hath put thē backe brought thē whordome ruler loue rewardes brynge saye owne shame wynde shall take holde theyr fethers shalbe confounded theyr offringes ¶ agaynst prestes ruler israel helpe man nothynge agaynst god capi v oye preastes heare take hede thou housholde israell geue eare thou kyngly house punyshment wyl come vpon become snare vnto myzphah spred net vnto mount thabor kyll sacrifyces heapes begyle people therwith therfore wyll punyshe earth 8 b iere 23 knowe ephraim wel ynough israell hyd frome ephraim nowe become harlot israel defiled mynded turne vnto god haue whoryshe hert know y• lord o •• vii b pryde israel wyl rewarded face yee israel ephraim shal fal wickednesse iuda wt thē also iere iii b deute 4 • shal come theyr shepe bullockes ezer 14 seke lorde shall fynde gone thē lorde haue refused brought vp bastarde childrē moneth therfore shal deuoure porcions blowe shawmes gabea trompet ramah crye bethauē vpon yonside beniamin tyme plage shall ephraim layde waste therfore dyd faythfully warne trybes israel yet prīces iuda become lyke deut 〈◊〉 • xxvii • remoue landemarckes therfore wyll poure wrath vpon lyke water ephraim oppressed haue ryght lawe folowe doctrynes men therfore wyll vnto ephraim moth y• house iuda caterpyller ephraim sawe sickenesse iuda dysease 4 x • • ephraim wente vnto assur sent vnto kyng • • yet coulde helpe ease youre payne vnto ephraim lyon lyon whelpe house iuda euē wyll spoyle go waye wyll take man shall rescue wyll go returne place tyll waxe faynt seke ¶ afflyctyon causeth man returne god wyckednesse prestes capi vi theyr aduersytye shall seke saye come let v turne agayne lorde iob v b hath smyten v shall heale v hath wounded v shall bynde v vp agayne two dayes shall quycken v y• thyrde day shal rayse v vp shal lyue syght shall haue vnderstandyng endeuour selues knowe lorde shall go forth sprynge day come vnto v pro •••• euenynge mornynge rayne vpon earth ephraim shall vnto iuda howe shall intreate seynge youre loue lyke mornynge cloude lyke dewe goeth earely awaye therfore haue cut downe prophetes let theym slayne wordes sake thy punyshemente shall come lyght math 〈◊〉 xii • haue pleasure louynge kyndnesse iere vi •• offerynge yee knoweledge god burntsacryfyce euē lyke g ••• •••• adam dyd haue brokē couenaunt set nought ☞ gilead cyte wycked doer malycyous people bloud shedder multytude prestes lyke heape ues murtherers bloudthurstye haue wrought abhomynacyon iere 〈◊〉 • horryble thynges haue sene house israel playeth ephrai harlot israel defyled iuda shall haue haruest hym selfe returne captyuyte people ¶ vyces wantonnnes people capi vii vndertake make israel whole vngraciousnesse ephraim wyckednesse samaria cōmeth lyght go aboute lye home theues without fall robbynge consydre theyr hertes remembre theyr wyckednes go aboute theyr owne inuencyons se well ynough rom make kynge prynces haue pleasure theyr wyckednes lye burne aduoutry ouen baker heateth whē hath left kneadyng tyl dowe leuened euen goeth thys daye oure kynges prynces begynne woode droncken thorowe wine vse familiarite disceaue ymaginacyon hart like ouen theyr slepe nyght lyke slepe baker y• mornynge hote flame fyre together hote ouen haue deuoured theyr owne iudges kynges fallen yet none calleth vpon ☞ therfore must ephraim myxte amonge heathen ephraim become lyke cake man turneth straungers haue deuoured strength yet regardeth waxeth ful gray heares yet wyl knowe ••• v • pryde israell cast downe theyr face yet wyll turne lorde theyr god seke thys ephraim lyke doue begyled hath harte • 〈◊〉 xvi▪ • cal vpon egypcians nowe go assyrian whyle goynge shal sprede net ouer drawe downe foules ayre according haue bene warned wyll punyshe esaye • wo vnto haue forsaken muste destroyed haue set naught •• p • ii • haue redemed yet dyssemble mat xv esaye xx • ezech 33 • call vpon wyth theyre hertes lye houlynge vpon beddes come together meate dryncke wyl obey haue taught defended theyr arme yet ymagyn mischefe agaynst turne selues ryghte become broken bowe prynces shall slayne wyth swearde malyce theyre tunges blasphemyes haue lerned lande egypte ¶ destruccyon iuda israel theyr idolatrye capi viii set horne thy mouthe blowe get swyftely aegle vnto house lorde haue broken deu xxxi couenaunt transgressed lawe israel saye vnto thou art god knowe hath refused thing good therfore shal enemye folowe vpon hym 3 reg xi • • haue ordened kynges thorowe haue made prynces must knowe it▪ ezer vii siluer golde haue made image brynge selues destruccyon3 reg xii thy calf samaria shalbe taken awaye wrothful indignacion gone forth howe long wyl clensed calfe came israel worcke man made therfore god euen spyders webbe shal calfe samaria turned ☞ haue sowen wynde therfore shall reape storme theyr sede shall beare corne shall meale made theyr increase though reape yet shall straungers deuoure vp israell shall peryshe gentyles shal intreate foule vessell sence went vp assyryans become lyke wylde asse deserte 4 • vit • ezce xvi • ephraim geueth rewardes get louers therfore scatred among heathē ther wyll gather thē vp shal soone weery y• burthen kynges prynces ephraim hathe made many aulters wickednes therfore shall y• aulters turne synne though shewe lawe neuer muche counte straunge doctrine wher sacrifice offering flesshe eatynge lorde wyll haue pleasure therin wyl remembre theyr wyckednes punishe sinnes • • vii • 4 reg 17 • israell turneth agayne egipte haue forgotten hym y• made thē buylde church iuda maketh many strong cyties 4 •• v • therfore wyll sende fyre cytyes shal consume theyr place ¶ hunger captyuyte israel capi ix ☞ thou triumphe israel make boastynge heathen thou haste commytted aduoutry agaynste thy god straunge rewardes haste thou loued cornefloures • gg •• ii • therfore shall nomore enioy y• corne floures wyne press theyr swete wyne shall fayle wyll dwell lordes lande •••• ii •• c ephraim turneth agayne egipte eateth vncleane thinges amonge assyryās poure wyne drinckofferyng vnto lorde neyther geue theyr slayne offringes vnto mourner meates wherin eate defyled bred haue suche luste vnto shall come house lorde ☞ wyll ye solempne dayes feast lorde lo shall get awaye destruc • yon egypte shall receaue noph shall bury nettle shall ouergrowe theyr pleasaunte goodes burres shall theyr tabernacle ye sure israel tyme visytacion come dayes recompensynge hande prophete ye holde foole rych sprite mad man great youre wickednes malyce ephraim hath made selfe watchmā god prophet become snare hurte euery strete abhomynacyon y• house god gone fare haue destroyed selues like dyd afore tyme iu • xix gabaa • reg • c 4 reg 〈◊〉 c therfore theyr wyckednes shall remembred theyr synnes punyshed founde israell lyke grape wyldernesse sawe theyr father fyrst iere 24 fygges toppe fygge tre nume 25 b gone baal peor runne awaye fro shameful idol become abhomynable theyr louers ☞ ephraim •• ieth lyke byrde shal glory also muche shal neyther beget conceaue bear • chyldren though bryng vp yet wyl make chyldeles amonge men yee wo shall come departe gene 48 ephraim thincke planted welthynes lyke tyrus must brynge owne chyldren forthe mansleyer lorde thou shalt geue shalte thou geue geue vnfrutefull wombe drye brestes theyr wyckednes done iosu ••• • gylgal iabhorre vngraciousnes theyr owne inuencyons wyll dryue house wyl loue nomore theyr prynces vnfaythfull ephraim hewen downe theyr rote dryed vp shall brynge nomore frute yee though bryng forth yet wyll sle • e euen best beloued frute theyr body god shall cast awaye haue bene obedient vnto hym therfore shall go astraye amonge heathen ¶ agaynst israell hys idol • capi x israel goodly esaye • • vyne hath brought forth vnprofytable frute yee frute mo aulters made good dyd theyr lande frendshype shewed theyr ymages theyr herte deuyded therfore wyll destroyed lorde shall breake downe theyr ymages shal destroy theyr aulters shal saye haue king haue feared lorde shall kynge v comen together swear • vayne othes cōfederate together therfore groweth theyr punyshment wedes forowes lande dwell samaria haue worshyped calfe bethauen therfore shall people mourne ouer yee prestes also theyr welthynesse reioysed shall passe away shall brought assirian presēt vnto kynge iareb ephraim shall receaue full punyshment israel shalbe confounded hys owne ymagynacyons samaria kynge shal vanyshe awaye fome water ☞ hye place auen israel doth sinne shal cast downe thystels thornes shal growe vpon aulters luk 〈◊〉 ▪ • apoca ••• shall say mountaines couer v hylles fal vpon v israel thou hast synned iud 〈◊〉 • gabaa afore tyme remayned shuld batayle come vpon wycked chyldren well vpon gabao •• te wyll chasten euen myne owne desyre people shalbe gathered together ouer whē punysh thē great wyckednes ephraim vnto cowe vsed go plowe therfore loued hym fel vpon hys fayre necke droue ephraim iuda plowed iacob played husbande man myght sowe vnto righteousnes reape frutes weldoing myght plowe vp theyr freshe lande seke lorde tyl came lerned ryghteousnes nowe haue plowed wyckednes therfore shal reape synne eate frute lye seynge thou puttest thy confydence thyne owne wayes • eaneste multytude thy worthyes shal growe sedicyon among thy people al thy strōge cyties shalbe layed waste euen salmana destroyed famylters thorowe auenged arbell daye batayll mother perished chyldren euen shall go bethell youre malycyous wyckednesse lyke mornynge goeth awaye shall kynge israel passe capi xi ¶ agaynste vnkyndnesse israel israel yong loued hym ☜e • • destroye ephraim wrothful displeasure god mā euen holy one middest though came within ey • ye lorde roareth lyke lyon maye folowe hym yee • po • 4 • lyon roareth maye afrayed • yke chyldren see maye scatred awaye egypte▪ men scatre byrdes frayed awaye • e vse assyryans lande wolde haue tary home sayeth lorde ephraim goeth • e lye house israel dissembleth onely iuda holdeth hym god true holy thynges ¶ agaynst vayne trust people capi xii ephraim ☜ fed ayre foloweth east winde euer increasynge lye destruccyon confederate assirians▪ • reg 16 d▪ e • ay 〈◊〉 b theyr oyle caryed egypte lorde marchaunte hathe false weyght hys • ande hath pleasure occupye extorc • • ephraim thinketh thus • po •• 〈◊〉 c tush • yche haue good ynough worckes shall one faute founde haue offended yet lorde thy hath prouoked hym • displeasure thorowe hys abhomynacyons therfore shall hys bloude poured vpon selfe lorde hys god shall rewarde hym hys blasphemyes ¶ abhomynacyon israel capi xiii tte abhomynacyon ephraim come also israell gone backe baal therfore must • dye nowe synne esay 46 e ••• x •• • ••• 〈◊〉 • 〈◊〉 theyr syluer make molten ymages lyke idol heathes yet nothynge worcke craftesman notwithstandynge preach wyl kysse calues offreth men therfore shalbe morninge cloude dewe early passeth awaye lyke dust wynde taketh awaye flore smoke goeth chymney exod xx • lorde god brought land egypt thou shuldest knowe god onely thou shuldest hane esa • 43 b sauioure toke vyligent hede wyldernesse drye lande well •• dde ynough waxed proude forgat exod 4 • b therfore wyll • e vnto thē lyon leoparde waye assirians wyll come vpon beare robbed whelpes wyl breake stubburne hert wyll deuoure lyon yee wylde beastes shall teare iob x • ii • israell thou doest destroye thy self thy helpe thy kynges shulde helpe al thy cyties yee thy iudges thou saydest 〈…〉 geue king prynces wel gaue kynge wrath dyspleasure wyll take hym agayne wyckednesse ephraim bounde together hys synne lyeth hyd therfore shal sorowes come vpon hym vpon woman trauayleth vndyscrete sonne consydreth shulde haue bene able haue endured tyme hys byrth defē ded hym graue delyuered hym death • cor xv f • r • • death wyll thy death hell wyll thy styng yet se comforte nowe goodlyest amonge brother east wynde euen wynde lorde shall come downe wyldernesse drye vp condyte dryricke vp hys welles shall spoyle treasure pleasaunt vessel samaria shall made waste dysobedyente vnto theyr god shall perysh swearde theyr chyldren shalbe slayne theyr wemen great chylde shalbe rypte vp ¶ de •• u •• yon samaria capi xiiii israell • xviii▪ • e •• x • iii • 〈◊〉 xxxii • ▪ • turne nowe vnto lorde thy god • r • g xii • thou hast taken greate fall thorowe thy wyckednesse ☜ take wordes ye turne lorde saye vnto hym forgeue v oure synnes receaue v graciously psa x • ii • ebre iii wyll offre bullockes oure lyppes vnto assur shalbe nomore oure helper neyther wyll ryde vpon horse workes oure handes wyll call vpon thou arte oure god thou sheweste euer merrye vnto fatherlesse yf wolde thys shulde heale theyr sore yee withal hert wolde loue wrathe shulde cleane turned awaye frō yee wolde vnto israel dewe shulde growe lyly hys rote shulde breake oute lybanus hys braunches shulde sprede abroade fayre olyue tre smell libanus dwel vnder hys shadowe shulde come agayne growe vp corne florysh vine shulde haue good name wyne libanus ephraim haue idol wyll gracyously heare hym lede hym forth wyl vnto grene fyrre tre vpō shalt thou fynde thy frute ••• • ▪ • ▪ wise shal vnderstande thys ryght enstructe wyl regarde psa x •••• wayes lorde ryghteous suche godly wyll walcke wycked wyll stomble therin ¶ ende prophecye oseas ❧ booke prophete ioel ¶ prophery agaynst iewes exhorteth prestes prayer • astynge myserye commyng hande capi • word lorde came vnto ioell sōne phatuel heare ye elder pondre wel ye dwel y• land yf euer ther happened thyng ī dayes ī dayes father tell childrē let thēshewe vnto chyldren certifye posterite therof loke 〈◊〉 caterpiller hath left y• hath gresshoper eaten vp y• greshoper left hath locust eaten vp locuste hath left hath blastinge consumed wake vp ye drōckardes wepe mourne al ye wine supper swete wine shall taken awaye frō mouth yee mighty innumerable people shal come vp lande haue teeth like teeth lyon cha • tbones lyke lyonesses •• ie 32 shall make vyneyarde wast shall pyl barckes • ygtrees strype thē bare cast thē away make braunches whyte make thy mone vyrgin doth girdeth selfe sack bryde grome y• meate drincke offering shalbe taken away house lord prestes lordes ministtrs shal mourne felde shalbe wasted lāde shalbe myserable case corne shalbe destroyed swete wyne shal come confusion oyle vtterly desolate housbandmen wyne gardener shal loke piteously make lamētacion wheat wyne barly haruest vpon felde cleane destroyed grape gatherer shall make great mone vineyarde fygtrees vtterly wasted yee al pōgarnettꝭ palmtrees apletrees tree felde shall wyther away thus mery chere chyldren men shall come confusion gyrdē make mone ye prestes mourne ye mynysters aulter go way stepe sacke cloth ye officer god meat drinckofferyng shal taken away house god proclayme fastyng call cōgregacion gather elder io •• 2 inhabytours lande togyther house lorde god crye vnto y• lorde ala ala day day lord hande cōmeth destroyer almighty shal meates taken away eye ☜ myrth also ioye house god sede shal perysh groūde garner shall lye wast flores shalbe broken downe corne shal destroyed syghynge make euyll bullockes euel lyking haue pasture shepe samyshed away lorde wyll crye fyre hath consumed goodly pasture wyldernesse flame hath brent vp al tree felde yee wylde beastes crye also vnto water riuers dryed vp fyre hath consumed pasture wyldernesse ¶ propheryeth commyng cru ••• ye theyr enemyes exhort • cion moue conuerte capi ii blowe trompet syon crye vpon holy hyll y• suche dwell lāde may trēble sopho • amo • • day lorde tōmeth harde hande darcke day gloomyng day cloudy day yee stormy daye lyke mornynge spredeth vpon y• hylles namely great mightye people suche haue bene sen begynnyng neyther shall euer hym shal consumyng fyre behynde burnynge flame lande shalbe garden pleasure behinde hym shall wast wyldernesse man shall escape loke vpon lyke barbed horse rūne lyke horsmen skyp vp vpon y• hylles soūde charettꝭ y• flame fyre y• consumeth y• strawe myghty people redy batayle tolke shalbe afrayed hym face shalbe blacke pot shal rū ne lyke gyauntes leape ouer walles lyke men warre euery man going shall kepe hys araye go hys path shal one driue another eche shall kepe owne waye shall breake wyndowes hurte shal come cy •• e runne vpon walles shall clyme vp vpon house slyppe wyndowes lyke thefe earth shall quake hym yee y• heauens shalbe moued▪ io • l •• • • 24 • sunne moone shalbe darckened starres shall withdrawe theyr shyne lord shal shall shewe voyce hooste hooste great stronge myghty fulfyll commaundement great maruelous fearefull daye lorde apoc vi • able abyde therfore sayeth lorde deut iiii e and▪ xxx turne vnto hertes fa • ynge wepynge mournyng rent hertes youre clothes turne vnto lord god psal 86 ione iiii gracyoꝰ mercyfull long suffering greate compassion redy pardon wickednes doute also shall turne forgeue chastenynge shall let increase remayne▪ meat drinckoffrīges vnto lord god io •• c blowe trompet syon proclayme fastynge call congregacyon gather people together warne congregaciō gather elder brīge chyldren suckelynges together let brydegrome go forth hys chābre bryde rloset let preastes serue lorde betwyxte porche aulter wepyng saying fauourable lord fauourable vnto thy people let thine heritage brought suche cōfusion lest hethen lordes therof psal 79 b wherfore shuld say among hethen god shal lorde gelous ouer lande spare people yee lorde shall answerre saye vnto people beholde wyll sende corne wyne oyle ye shall haue plēty wyll geue ouer reprofe amōg hethen againe north shal dryue farre shut drye wast lande face toward east sce hynder partes towarde vtmost see styncke shall go vp filthy corruption shall fal vpon hym selfe hath dealt proudly feare lande glad reioyse lord wyl great thinges ye afraied neither ye beastes felde pasture shalbe grene tree shal beare theyr frute fyg tree vyneyardes shall geue theyr increase glad ye chyldrē syon reioyse lorde god hath ge uen teacher rightuousnesse l • uit 26 deu • e xi • b • xxviii b yt shal sende downe shower rayne early late fyrst moneth yt garner shalbe ful corne press plentuous wyne oile yeres greshoper locust blastyng caterpyller grethost sēt among haue eaten vp shal restore thē againe ye shal haue ynough eate satisfied prayse name lord god maruelously hath dealt people shal neuer confounded ye shal wel knowe y• middest israel lord god ye none people shal brought confusion nume • • esay 44 ezeth 36 • actes ii b wyll poure sprete ☜ vpon al flesh sōnes daughter shal ꝓphecy olde men shal •• ame ☜ dreames yong men shal se vysiōs yee day wil poure sprete vpon seruaūtes maydens wyl shewe wonters heauen aboue token earth beneth bloude fyre vapour smoke sūne shalbe turned darknes moone bloude great notable day lorde come tyme shall conte rom x b whosouer calleth name lorde shalbe saued vpon mount syon ierusalem shalbe saluacion lyke lorde hath promysed • e • among rē naunt lorde shall call ¶ iudgement god agaynst enemyes people capi iii take hede dayes tyme turne againe cap tyuite iuda ierusalē shal gather al people together bryng thē valley iosophat wyl reason wt people herytage israel whō haue scatred nacyons parted land yee haue cast lot te people yonge men haue set ī bordel house solde damsel wyne yt myght haue drincke e •• 〈…〉 xxvii 〈…〉 amo • b thou tirus sidon ye border philystynes haue ye wyll ye defye well yf ye wyll nedes defye shall recompence euen vpon head right worthely ye haue taken away syluer golde sayre goodly iewels brought thē goddes house chyldren also iuda ierusalem haue ye solde vnto y• grekes ye myght brynge farre border owne countrees beholde therfore wyl rayse place ye haue solde thē 〈…〉 wyl rewarde euē vpon head sonnes daughter wyll sel thorow hādes chyldren iuda shall geue thē forth sel vnto thē saba people farre countre lord selfe hath sayd crye thynges among gētyles proclayme warre wake vp gyaūtes let drawe nye let come vp al lusty warriours thē make sweardes plowshare speares sycles sythes let weake man saye strong mustre come ye heathen rounde gather together shal lorde laye thy gyauntes grounde thresshed galaad yron flayles wyll sende fyre house hazael shal consume y• pa lace benadab thus wyll breake barres damascus roce inhabyter felde auen holdeth scepter pleasaūt house people shalbe driuen fayre syrya sayeth lord thus sayth yt lord thre foure wyckednesses zacha ix gaza wyl spare make prisoner yet capciue haue dryuen lande edom therfore wyl sēde fyre walles gaza shal de uoure house wyll rote dwel asdod holdeth scepter ascalon stretch mine hande ouer accaron rēmnaunt philistynes shal perish sayeth lorde thus sayeth lorde thre foure wickedness cyte ioc • iii tyre wyl spare haue increased y• cap tyutte edomites haue remēbred 3 reg v • brotherly couenaūt therfore wyll sede fyre walles tyre shall consume palace thus sayeth lord thre foure wyckednesses 〈…〉 • iere ••• x edom wyll spare gene • 7 g persecuted brother wt swerde destroyed mother wōde bare hatred long kept indignacyon al waye hym therfore wyl sende fyre theman whiche shal de • oure palace bosra thus sayeth lorde thre foure wyckednesses chyldren 〈…〉 xxv a▪n non wyll spare rypt vp wemen great chylde galaad make border theyr landes wider therfore wyl kyndle tyre walles rabbath shal consume palace great crye day barayle 〈◊〉 tē pest daye storme theyr kynge shall go captiuite pryaces together sayeth lorde ¶ agaynst moab iuda israel capi ii thus sayeth lorde thre foure wyckednesses esay 〈◊〉 iere hym sayth lorde thus sayeth lorde thre foure wyckednesses • ch • iuda wyll spare hath cast syde lawe lorde kepte hys commaundementes iere 44 • ezech xx • wolde nedes disceyued lye theyr forefather folowed therfore wyl sende fire iuda shal consume palace ierusalem thus sayeth y• lord thre foure wyckednesses israel wyl spare hi hath solde ryghtuous money pore shoe trede vpō pore men heades dust earth croke way meke sōne father go ha •• ot dishonour holy name lye beside euery alter vpon clothes take pledge house goddes drincke wyne oppressed yet destroyed y• ammoryte thē y• asnum xiii c hye y• cedre tree strōg okes notwithstanding destroyed frute aboue rote vnder exod • 14 c 〈◊〉 viiii • agayne brought lāde egypt led fourty yeares thorow wyldernes ye might haue amorites lādes possession raysed vp prophetes amonge youre chyldren absteyners amonge youre yong men ye chyldren israel sayeth lorde 〈…〉 vi ye gaue absteyners wyne drynke 〈…〉 xi yee ye commaunded prophetes saying prophecy beholde wyl crashe son der lyke wayne crassheth full sheaues swyfte shal escape neyther strong able thyng gyaunte shall saue owne lyfe archer shall abyde swyfte fote shal escape horsinā shal saue hys lyfe yt manly stomake gyaūt shal day fayne rūne way naked sayeth lorde ¶ reproueth house israel wychednes capi iii heare lorde speaketh vnto ye chyldren israel namely vnto trybes brought egypt sayde deu iiii c und xxii x • onely haue accepted al generaciōs earth therfore wyll viset youre wyckednesses may twayne walke together except agreed amonge themselues doth lyoniob vi • roare wod except haue pray crieth liōs whelpe denne except haue gotten thynge dothe byrde fall snare vpō earth fouler taketh mā snare vp frō groūde afore catche somwhat cry alarū y• trōpet cyte people afrayed commeth plage cite without lordes doyng doth lorde god maner thynge telleth secrete vnto hys seruauntes prophetes whē lyon roareth wyll afrayed seynge lorde god hym selfe speaketh • wyll prophecy preache palace asdod palace lande egypte say gather together vpon mountaynes samaria shall ye se great murthur vyolent oppressyon amonge regarde thynge ryght sayeth lorde gather together euyl gotten goodes lay vp robbery theyr house therfore thus sayeth lorde god lande shalbe troubled beseged roūde aboute thy strength shalbe plucte frome thy palace robbed thus sayeth lorde lyke herdman taketh two legges pece eare liōs mouth euen child israel dwel samaria hauyng theyr couch corner beddes damscus shalbe plucte awaye 4 xvi xvii ☞ heare beare recorde house iacob sayeth y• lord god hoostes begynne vyset wyckednesse israel wyll vyset aulters bethell also horne aulter shalbe broken fall grounde wynterhouse sommer house wyl smyte downe house yuery yee many house shall perysh destroyed sayeth lorde ¶ agaynst gouernours samarin capi iiii heare worde ☞ ye fat kyne vpon hyll samaria ye poore men wronge oppresse nedy ye saye lordes bryng hyther let v dryncke therfore lorde hathe sworne holynesse dayes shall come vpon ye shalbe lyfte vp vpon speares youre posteryte caryed awaye fyshers pannyers ye shall get y• gappꝭ one another armō shal ye cast awaye sayeth lorde ye came iosu xli • 3 •• eg • • ose • 〈◊〉 bethel worcke vngraciousnes haue increased sine atosce ix▪ • and▪ xii • galgal ye brought sacrifice mornynge tythes vnto thyrde daye ye māde thank offrynge leuen ye promysed frewyloffrynges proclamed lust ye ye chyldren israel sayeth lord god therfore haue geuen • le teeth al cytyes scarsenes bred al palace yet wyl ye turne vnto sayeth lorde whē thre monethes vnto haruest deut 〈◊〉 28 • iere 14 • ioel iii • withelde rayne ye rayned vpon one cyte vpō another one pece groūde mostured wt rayne grounde rayned nat vpon drye wherfore two yee thre cyties came vnto one dryncke water nat satisfyed yet wyll ye nat turne vnto sayeth lorde haue smytten drought blastynge loke howe many orchardes vineyardes fyggetrees olyuetrees ye caterpyller hathe eaten vp yet wyll ye nat turne vnto sayeth lorde pestilence haue sent amōg exod ix b dyd egipt yonge mē haue sleyne wt swerde caused horse takē captiue made stynckynge sauour tentes come vp youre nostrels yet wyll ye turne vnto sayeth lorde haue ouerthrowen gene xix f 〈◊〉 pet ii • ouerthrewe sodome gomore ye brande plucte fyre yet wyl ye nat turne vnto sayeth lorde therfore thus wyl handle y• agayne israel ye euen thus wyll handle make ready thē mete thy god israel lo maketh moūtaynes ordeneth wynde sheweth man aboute maketh morninge darkenes treadeth vpon hye place earth lorde god hostes name ¶ compl • ynte captyuyte israel capi v heare thys worde ye house israel muste make thys mone vyrgyn israel shall fall neuer rise vp againe shalbe cast downe vpon owne grounde mā shal helpe vp thus sayeth lorde god dwelt one citie shalbe lefte scarce hūdred therin dwelt c shall scarce ten lefte house israel neuertheles thus sayth y• lord vnto house israel seke ye shal lyue seke nat bethel come nat galgal go nat bersaba galgal shalbe caryed away captiue bethel shall come naught seke lorde y• ye may lyue lest house ioseph brent fyre consumed lest none quench bethell ye turne lawe wormewod caste downe ryghteousnes vnto y• groūde iob ix lord maketh vij starres oriōs turneth nyght daye daye maketh darckenesse • mo ix calleth water see poureth vpon playne grounde lorde name rayseth destruccyon vpon mygntye people bryngeth downe stronge holde owe euell wyll y• reproueth thē opēly telleth thē playne trueth abhorre hi muche ye oppresse pore robbe best sustenaūce deut 28 c sopho • c therfore ye haue buylded house square stone ye shal dwell thē maruelous pleasaunt vineyardes shal ye plāte y• wyne thē shal ye drīke • y• multitude youre wyckednesse stoute sinnes know thē right well enemyes ye ryghteous exo xxiii mich iii c ye take rewardes ye oppresse poore iudgemēt therfore y• wise must nowe fayne holde tunge wycked tyme seke y• thing ye good nat euel shal ye lyue yee y• lorde god hoostes shalbe accordynge youre owne desyre psal 97 b rom xii b hate y• euell loue good deu xvii syt vp right agayne ī porte doute lorde god hoostes shalbe merciful vnto remnaunte ioseph sayeth lorde god god hostes shal mournyng stretes yee shall saye euery strete ala ala shal cal housbandemā lamētacion mourne mournynge vyneyardes shal heuinesse wil come amōg sayeth lorde wo vnto thē yt desyre daye y• lorde wherfore wolde ye haue day lorde shal darke cleare yee lyke man runneth frō lyon beare meteth whē cōmeth house leaneth hande vpō y• wall serpent byteth shal y• day lorde darke ioel ii b sopho c • saye • • lviii cleare shall cloudy shyne mich vi b mala hate abhorre holy dayes ye cense ye come together wyll accepte though ye offre brentoffrynges meatoffringes yet haue pleasure therin youre fat thanck offerynges wyll loke vpō thē awaye y• noyse thy son ge wyl nat heare thy playes musyck se y• equyte flowe y• water ryghteousnesse mighty streame ye house israel ic • e vii c •• ce vii • gaue ye offrynges sacryfices fourty yeares longe wylder ny yet haue ye set vp tabernacle leuit xx • 3 reg xi • moloch ymages idol yee starre youre god rempha fygures ye made worshyppethē therfore wyll cause caryed awaye beyonde damascus saieth lord whose name god hoostes ¶ agaynste prynces israel lyuynge pleasure capi vi luke vi cowo proude welthy syō suche thynke sure vpon mount samaria holde selues best worlde rule house israel euen lyst go vnto calue se thence get hemath greate cytye go downe gath philystines better ease kyngdomes border theyr lande wyder ye taken euell daye euen ye syt stole wyckednesse ye lye vpō beddes yuery vse youre wantounesse vpon couch ye eate best lambe flocke fattest calues droaue ye synge lute playnge instrumētes cōpare selues vnto iob xxi b ela •• v • dauid ye dryncke wyne goblettes anoynte selues best oyle noman sory iosephs hurte▪ ther fore nowe shall ye fyrst shall led awaye captyue lusty chere wylfull shall come ende 〈…〉 lorde god hathe sworne euen selfe sayeth lorde god hostes hate y• pryde iacob abhore palace wyl geue ouer y• cytie withal therin yt though remayne ten mē one house shall dye theyr nexte kyn • folkes deed buriers shal take thē cary awaye theyr bone saye vnto hym y• ynnermer house yet mo shal answere gone holde thy tūge shal saye deu viii ⚜ wolde nat remembre name lorde beholde lorde mynded smyte great house shal decaye lytle house y• shal cleue sunder runne horse plowe ox vpō harde rockes stone ye haue turned true iudgemēt bytternesse y• frute ryghteusnesse wormwode yee euen ye ye reioyse vayne thinges ye saye haue optayned horne oure owne strēgth wel take hede ye house israel sayeth lorde god hoostes wyll brynge people vp shal trouble frō way y• goeth warde hemath vnto y• broke y• medowe ¶ captiuytie israel iuda capi vii lorde god shewed suche vysyou beholde stode one made greshoppers euen whē corne shutynge forth kynge clypte shepe nowe vndertoke eate vp al grene thynges lande sayde lorde god mercyful beseche shulde el helpe vp iacob brought lowe lorde gracyous therin lorde sayde well shal agayne lorde shewed thys vysyon beholde lorde god called fyre punysh withall deuoured great depe yee consumed parte al redy sayde lorde god holde thyne hande shulde el helpe vp iacob brought lowe lorde mercyfull therin lorde god sayd well shal nat moreouer shewed thys vysyon beholde lorde stode vpō plastered wall mason trowel hande lorde sayde vnto amos seest thou answered mason trowel thē sayde lorde beholde wyll laye trowell amonge people israel wyll nomore ouer se thē hye hylchapels isaac muste layed waste church israel made desolate 4 〈◊〉 house ieroboam wyl stande vp swerde upō thys sent amasyah prest bethel vnto ieroboā kyng israel sayenge • reg 〈◊〉 • amos maketh house israell rebell agaynste lande nat awaye wordes amos sayeth ieroboam shal dye swearde israel shal led awaye captyue theyr owne lande amasiah sayde vnto amos gette hence esay xx •• thou canst se wel fle lande iuda get thy lyuynge prophecy prophecy nomore bethell kynges chapell kynges courte amos answered sayde amasiah • ath xii • neyther prophet prophetes sonne keper catell nowe breakinge downe molberyes goynge catell lorde toke sayde vnto go thy waye prophecy vnto people israel therfore heare yu nowe y• worde y• lord thou sayest prophecy nat agaist israel speake nothynge agaynst y• house isaac wherfore thus sayeth y• lorde thy wyfe shalbe defiled cytie thy sonnes daughter shal slayne swearde thy lande shalbe measured y• lyne thou thy selfe shalt dye vnclene lāde 4 〈◊〉 israel shalbe dryuen hys owne countre ¶ agaynst ruler israel lorde sweareth wyll fulfyll thynges whiche hathe determyned agaynste israel capi viii lorde god shewed thys vysyon beholde maunde somer frute sayd amos seyst thou answered maunde sommer frute sayde lorde vnto ende cōmeth vpon people israel wyl nomore ouerse thē yt daye shal songes temple turned sorowe sayth y• lorde god many deed bodyes shal lye euery place cast forth secretly esaye v b heare ye y• oppresse poore destroye nedy lande saying whē wyl newe moneth gone yt may sell bytayle sabboth may haue scarcenesse corne make y• busshell lesse sycle greater shal set vp false wayghtes maye get pore vnder v theyr money nedy also shoe yee let v sell chaffe corne amos vi b lord hath sworne agaynst y• pryde iacob workes theyrs wyll neuer forget shall nat lande trēble dwell therin mourne thys shall nat theyr destruccyō come vpon thē lyke water streame flowe ouer thē floude egypte iere xv b tyme sayeth lorde god ☞ shal cause sunne go downe none lande darcke cleare daye tobi ii youre hye feastes wyll turne sorowe youre songes mournynge wyll brynge sacke cloth vpō backes baldnes vpon euery heade yee suche mournynge wyll sende iere vi made vpon onely begotten sonne shal haue myserable ende beholde tyme commeth sayeth lorde god shall sende hunger earth ☞ nat hunger brede thyrst water hunger heare worde lorde shall go one see yee north vnto east runnynge seke worde lorde shall nat fynde ☞ tyme shall tayre virgin yonge men perysh thyrst yee euē sweare offēce samaria saye truly thy god lyueth dan truly thy god liueth bersaba shalt fall neuer ryse vp agayne ¶ threatenynges agaynste israel man escape hande god capi xi sawe lorde stādynge vpon aulter sayde smyte dore cheke postes maye shake withall theyr couetousnesse shall fall vpon theyr heades theyr posterite shalbe slayne swearde psal 139 shal nat fle away shall nat one thē escape delyuered abdy though buryed hell hande shal fetch thē frō thence though clyme vp heauen yet shall caste downe though hyde selues vpon toppe carmel yet shal seke thē brynge thence though crepe downe fro syght depe see shall cōmaunde serpente euen byte go awaye theyr enemyes captiuite shall cōmaunde swearde sleye thus wyll set myne eye vpon thē theyr harme wealth whē lorde god hoostes toucheth lande consumeth awaye al dwell therin must nedes mourne theyr destruccion shal aryse euery streame runne ouer thē floude egypt 3 viii g hathe hys dwellynge heauen groundeth hys tabernacle earth amos v b calleth water see poureth vpō plyane grounde hys name lorde ye chyldren israel ye nat vnto euen moryans saieth lorde haue brought israel outof lande egypte gene x b philistynes capthor syrtans cyr beholde eye lorde vpon realme synneth rote cleane earth neuertheles iere xxx b • • ua xiii b rom ix c wyl vtterly destroye house iacob sayeth y• lorde forlo promyse though syfte house israel among al nacyons lyke vse syfte syue yet shall nat smallest grauel stone fall vpō earth al wycked doer people saye tush plage nat nye come hastely vpon v shall perysh swearde actes xv c mith 7 b tyme wyll buylde agayne ☞ tabernacle dauid fallē downe hedge vp gappes loke broken shall repayre yee shall buylde agayne afore tyme maye possesse remnaunt edom yee suche people call vpon name thē sayeth lorde whiche dothe thynges beholde tyme commeth sayeth lorde plowmā shall ouer take mower treader grape hym y• soweth sede ioel iii c mountaynes shall droppe swete wyne hylles shal fruteful wyll turne captyuyte people israel shall repayre waste cyties haue thē possessyon shall plante vynyardes dryncke wyne therof shall make garden enioye frutes wyll plante vpon theyr owne grounde wyl neuer rote thē agayne theyr lande haue geuen sayeth
