holdes stone haste made y• hye seate thou sayest thyne hert shal cast downe grounde amon • ab •••• 2 • though thou wētest vp hye aegle madest thy ‡ nest aboue amonge y• starres yet wolde plucke downe frō thēce sayeth y• lorde yf theues robber came y• night thou takyng thy rest shulde nat steale tyll ynough▪ yf y• grape gatherer came vpon wolde nat leaue y• grape howe shall repe esau seke treasure yee men y• sworne vnto shall dryue y• y• border thyne owne lande y• nowe one y• shall disceaue ouercome euen y• eate thy brede shal betraye euer y• perceaue esa xxix c lorin • shal nat y• tyme sayeth lorde destroye y• wyse mē edom y• haue vnderstādyng mount esau thy gyauntes theman shallbe afrayed thorowe slaughter shalbe al ouerthorowen vpō mount esau shame shall come vpō malyce y• thou shewedest thy gent 27 • brother iacob yee euermore shalt thou perysh tyme thou dydest set thy selfe agaynste hym euen enemyes caryed awaye hoost aleauntes came porte cast lotte vpon ierusalem thou thyselfe waste one thou shalte nomore se daye thy brother thou shalte nomore beholde tyme hys captyuyte thou shalte nomore reioyse ouer child iuda day • theyr destruccyon thou shalte tryumphe nomore tyme theyr trouble thou shalt nomore come gate people tyme theyr decaye thou shalte nat se theyr mysery daye theyr fall thou shalt sende man agaynste theyr hoost daye theyr aduersyte neyther shalte thou stande waytynge corner stretes murthur suche fled take presoners remayne daye theyr trouble daye lorde harde vpon heathen 〈…〉 ▪ • • l 〈◊〉 • lyke thou hast done shalt thou dealte wthal yee thou shalte rewarded euen vpon thyne heade lyke wyse ye haue dronken vpon myne holy hyll shall heathen dryncke continually yee dryncke shal swalowe vp • y• ye shalbe though ye neuer bene ☞ vpon mounte syon shall saluacyon holynes shalbe holy house iacob shall possesse euen • acha 〈◊〉 • selues afore possessyon moreouer ☜ house iacob shalbe fyre house af ioseph flame ierem • • house esau shalbe ionas made redy fle ☞ vnto tharsis presence lorde gat downe ioppa foūde shyp redy go vnto tharsis payde fare wente abrode myght go vnto tharsis presence lorde lorde hurled greate wynde see myghtye tēpest see shyppe teoperdy goyng peces y• maryners afrayed cryed euery mā vnto god goodes shyppe cast see lyghten thē ionas gat vnder hatch layed downe slombred master shyppe came sayde vnto slomberest thou call vpon thy god yf god happely wyll thynke vpon v peryshe sayde one another come let v caste lotte may knowe whose cause thus troubled iosne 7 c cast lotte lot fell vpon ionas sayd vnto tel v whose cause thus troubled thine occupacion whence commest thou whe ther goest thou▪ coūtreman art thou nacion answered thē ebrue fere lorde god heauen made y• see dry lāde mē excedyngly afrayed sayd vnto dydest yu knew y• fled presēce lord tolde thē sayde moreouer vnto shal vnto y• see may ceasse frō troublynge v see wrought troublous answered take cast see shal let rest wote sake great tempest come vpon neuerthelesse mē assayed rowynge brynge shyppe lande wolde see wrought troublous agaynst wherfore cryed vnto lord sayde deut xxi • lord let v perysh thys man death neyther lay yu innocēc blode vnto charge yu lord hast done euē thy plesure toke ionas caste see see lefte ragyng mē feared lorde excedyngly doynge sacryfices makyng vowes vnto lorde ¶ ionas swalowed whale prayer ionas capi ii lorde prepared greate fyshe swalow vp ionas mat xii • ionas bely y• fysh thre day iii nightes ionas prayed vnto lord god fish bely sayde psal 120 e trouble called vnto lord herde y• bely hell cryed thou herdest voice thou haddest cast downe depe myddest see sloude cōpa sed aboute yee psal xlii thy waues roules water wēt ouer thought bene cast awaye thy syght wyll yet agayne loke towarde thy holy temple water compassed euē soule depe laye aboute wedes wrapte myne heade went downe botome hylles barred wyth earth euer thou lorde god haste brought vp lyfe agayne corrupcion whē soule fainted within thought vpon lorde prayer came vnto euen vnto thy holy temple ⚜ holde vayne vanyties wyll forsake mercy wyll sacrifice voice thankesgeuyng wyll paye haue vowed saluacyon commeth lorde lorde spake vnto fyshe caste ionas agayne vpon drye lande ¶ ionas sente agayne ninyue repentaunce kynge ninyue capi iii came worde lorde vnto ionas agayne sayenge ionas • vp get ninyue ☞ great cytie preache vnto theym preachynge whiche bade ionas arose went niniue lordes commaundement niniue greate cytie vnto god namely thre dayes iourney ionas wente entred cytie euen dayes iorney cryed sayenge yet xl dayes shal niniue ouerthrowen ☞ esay 37 • people niniue beleued god p • laymed fastyng arayed thē selues sacke cloth well great smal • • ge came vnto kynge niniue whiche arose seate dyd apparell put sacke cloth sat downe asshes cryed cōmaunded niniue auctoryte kynge hys lordes sayng mat xii luke xi c se neyther mā beest oxe shepe taste ought nether fede drinck water put sack cloth bothe man beast crye myghtely vnto god iere 18 yee se euery man turne frō euyll waye wyckednesse hath hande tell▪ god maye turne repent ceasse fearce wrath perysh god sawe workes howe turned wycked wayes esay 38 b repented euyll whiche sayde wolde vnto dyd ionas reproued god capi iiii therfore ionas sore discontente angrie prayed vnto lorde sayde lorde sayinge praye yet coūtre therfore hasted rather fle vnto tharsis 〈◊〉 • 〈◊〉 • 〈◊〉 〈◊〉 c knowe wel ynough yt thou art mercyfull god full cōpassyon longe suffryng great kindnes repētest whē thou shuldest take punyshment • ▪ reg • 9 nowe lorde take lyfe fro beseche rather dye lyue sayde lorde art thou angrye ionas gat cytie sat downe easte syde ther made boothe sat vnder shadowe tyll myght se shuld chaunce vnto cyte lorde god prepared wylde vine whiche sprange vp ouer ionas myght haue shadowe aboue head deliuer payne ionas exceadynge glad wylde vyne vpon nexte morowe agaynst spryng y• day lord ordeined worme smote wylde vyne y• wethered away y• sunne vp god prepared feruent east winde sunne bet ouer head ionas yt faynted againe wysshed vnto soule myght dye sayd better die liue god sayde vnto ionas art y• angry wylde vyne said yee angry euē vnto death lord sayd y• haste cōpassyon vpon wylde vyne wheron y• bestowdest laboure madest growe whiche sprāge vp one nyght peryshed another shulde haue cōpassion vpon niniue great cyte wherin aboue c xx thousāde persōnes knowe theyr ryght hande lefte besydes muche catell ¶ ende prophecye ionas ❧ booke prophet micheas ¶ destruction samaria ydolatry capi thys worde lorde came vnto micheas morastite y• day 4 reg • 5 • 2 par 27 • 4 16 • 4 reg 18 • xix deut • 2 esay • iothan ‡ ahas ‡ iehezekiah kīges iuda shewed hī vpon samaria ierusalē al ye people marcke well earth therin yee lorde god selfe wytnesse among euē lorde holy tēple esaye 26 • beholde y• lorde shal go hꝭ place come downe trede vpon hye thiges earth moū taines shal cōsume vnder valley shall cleue sunder lyke waxe cōsumeth fyre water rūne downwarde al shalbe wickednesse iacob synnes house israel wyckednesse iacob 3 reg 1 • • 3 reg 〈◊〉 samaria hye place iuda 4 10 • xxi • ierusalem gathered hyre whore whore hyre shal turned agayne wherfore wil mourne make lamentacyon bare naked wyll go must mourne lyke dragous take sorowe estriches theyr wounde past remedy come iuda hath touched porte people ierusalem alredy 2 reg • • wepe lest geth perceyue thou betaphra welter thy selfe y• dust asshes thou y• dwellest sephyr get hence wyth shame proude shall boste nomore sorowe neyghbour shall take frō hath rebellyous cytie hopeth yt shall euyll al y• plage shall come frō lord euen porte ierusalē great noyse charettꝭ shal fere thē dwel 4 17 c lachis occasion sine daughter syon y• came vp wyckednesses israel yee sent courser lande geth house lye wyl dysceyue kinges israel thou y• dwel lest morassa shall bryng possessioner vpō plage israel shall reath vn odolla make balde shaue thy tender chyldren make clene balde aegle shalbe caryed away captiue ¶ thre • ynges agaynst synfull people capi ii owo vnto thē imagin harme deuyse vngraciousnes vpō beddes perfourme cleare day power agaynst god couet haue lāde • reg 21 take violence robbe men theyr house thus oppresse man house euery mā hꝭ herytage therfore thus sayeth y• lord beholde amos v b houshold haue deuised plage wherout ye shal plucke neckes ye shall go proudly wyl perlous time day shal terme vsed mourning shalbe made ouer maner vtterly desolate porcion people translated whan wyll parte vnto v lande hath taken v neuerthelesse nunie 33 • shalbe man deuyde thy porcyon congregacion lord tush holde tunge say shall fal vpon people shal come cōfusion sayeth y• house iacob sprete lord cleane away mynded truth wordes frēdly vnto thē lyue ryght people doth contrary therfore must take part agaynst thē take away cote cloke simple ye haue turned selues fyght wemen people haue ye shut good house takē away excellent gyfres theyr child get hence shal ye haue rest theyr idolatrye corrupte shall miserably perysh fleshly felowe preacher lye tolde myght syt bybbyng bollynge dronkē prophete people wyl gather dede iacob dryue rēnaunt israel together shall cary one another flocke folde catel theyr stalles may dysquieted mē breaketh gappe shal go shal breake vp y• port go theyr kynge shal go thē lorde shalbe vpon y• head thē ¶ agaynst tyranny prynces false prophetes▪ capi iii heare ye heades house iacob ye leders house israell deut 17 • ieremy 5 • psal 82 • esaye v c shuld ye knowe lawefull ryght ye hate good loue euyll ye plucke mennes skynnes flessh theyr bone ye eate flessh people flaye theyr skynne ye breake theyr bone ye choppe thē peces cauldron fleshe p • nowe tyme shal come esaye 1 b ezec viii c 1 petr 3 • call vnto lorde shall heare hyde face thorow theyr owne imaginaciōs haue dealte wyckedly concernynge prophetes dysceyue people thus lorde sayeth agaynst ezech • 3 • whē haue chynge byte vpon preache al shalbe wel man put thynge theyr mouthes preache warre agaynst deut 1 • • therfore vysyon shalbe turned nyght youre prohe • yenge darckenesse sunne shall go downe ouer prophetes day shalbe darcke vnto shal visyon seer ashamed sothsayers confounded yee shalbe fayne packe stoppe theyr mouthes haue god worde iere 1 • ezch 〈◊〉 • ful strength y• sprete lorde full swearde agaynst another yee shall nomore lear ne fyght euery mā shall syt vnder vyneyarde vnder hys fyg • mā fraye away mouth y• lord hostes hath spokē therfore al people haue walked euery mā y• name owne god wyl walke y• name lord god euer euer sopho • tyme sayth lord wyl gather vp y• lame outcaste haue chastened wyl geue issue vnto lame make outcaste great people luke • lorde selfe shalbe theyr kyng vpon mount sion tyme forth euermore vnto y• thou tower gene 35 • eder thou stronge holde daughter syon vnto shal come euen lordshippe kyngdome daughter ierusalē art yu nowe heuy kyng thy councelers away thou arte payned woman trauayle nowe thou daughter syon sorye let greue wyfe laboryng chylde nowe must thou get cytie dwel vpon playne felde yee vnto babylon shalt thou go shalt thou delyueredmith v • lorde shal lowse hande thyne enemyes nowe also many people gathered together saying siō cursed shall se lust vpon knowe esay 14 thoughtes y• lorde vnderstande councell shal gather together sheeues barne therfore get vp thou daughter syon thresshe corne wyll make thy horne yron thy clawes brasse thou mayest grynde many people theyr goodes shalt thou appropriate vn lorde theyr substaunce vnto ruler whole worlde ¶ destruccyon ierusalem capi v shalt thou robbed thy selfe yu robber daughter shall laye sege agaynst v smyte iudge israel wt rodde vpon cheke math ii • oh vii • yu bethleē ephrata art lytle amōge thousandes iuda shal come vnto shalbe gouernour israell whose goynge hath bene begynnynge euerlastynge meane whyle plageth season vntyll tyme whiche shal beare haue partes worlde shall peace assyrian maye come lande treade oure house shall brynge vp seuen shepherdes viii prince vpon thē shal subdue lande assur wt swerde lāde gene • • nymrod wyth naked weapēs mith • iii thus shall deliuer v y• assirian cōmeth within lande setteth fote within border rēnaunt iacob shalbe among multitude people dewe lorde droppes vpon grasse taryeth man wayteth body yee y• resydue iacob shalbe amonggene 4▪ • gentile multitude people lyon among beastes wod lyōs whelpe among flocke shepe goeth thorow tredeth teareth peces man helpe thyne hande shalbe lyfte vp vpon thyne enemyes thyne aduersasaries shall peryshe tyme shall come also sayeth y• lorde wyll take thyne horse destroye thy charettes wyl breake downe cytyes thy lande ouerthrowe thy stronge holdes deut 1 • • witchcraftes wyll rote oute thyne hande shal mo soth sayinges within naum •• thyne idol thyne image wyll destroye y• thou shalt nomore bowe thy selfe vnto worckes thyne owne handes thy groues wyll plucke vp rote breake downe y• cyties thus wyl auē ged also vpō al y• heathen yt wyl heare ¶ •• hortacyon heare iudgment agaīst israel beynge vnkynde maner sacrifyces please god capi vi herken nowe lord sayeth esa 58 reproue mountaines let hylles heare thy voyce heare punyshemēt lorde ye mountaynes ye mighty foundaciōs earth y• lorde wyl reporue people reason wt israel people haue done vnto y• wherin haue hurte geue answere exod 14 • brought lande egypte delyuered house bondage nume 12 • made moses aaron miriam lede y• remēbre people nu 22 23 • iiii xxv balach y• kyng moab imagyned agaynst answere balaam sonne beor gaue hym sethim vnto galgal ye may knowe louynge kyndnesses lorde acceptable thynge shal offer vnto lord shall bowe kne hye god shall come hym brent offrynges calues yeare olde hath lord pleasure many thousāde rammes innumerable streames oyle shall geue fyrst borne myne offence frute body synne soule wyll shewe mā good lorde requyreth namely right haue pleasure louyng kyndnesse lowly walcke wt thy god esaye thou mayest called citie lorde thy name maye rightuousnesie heare ye trybes wolde el geue warnyng leui xix g deut 25 c prou • b eze • x • v b shuld displeased y• vnrightuous good y• house wycked measure mynyshed shulde iustifye false balaunces bagge disceatful weyghtes amonge full ryches vnryghtuously gotten cytesyus deale falshede speake lye haue disceatfull tunges mouthes therfore wyll take hāde punish y• make y• desolate thy sine thou shalt eat haue ynough yee thou shalt brīge thy self downè thou shalt fle escape thou woldest saue wyll delyuer leui 26 osee iiii • • gg • ne deut 28 swerde thou shalt sowe reape yu shalt presse olyues oyle shalt y• haue anoint thy self thou shalte treade swete muste shalt dricke wyne ye kepe ordiuaunces 3 xvi • amri al customes house ahab ye folowe pleasure therfore wil make wast cause thy inhabyters abhorted people thus shalt thou beare thyne owne shame capi vii ¶ • cōplaynt lyttel nōbre rightuouse agaynst truth ought holde greatest frendes wo become one goeth gleanyng haruest ther grape eate yet wolde fayne wt herte haue best frute rom iii • godly man vpon earth one ryghtuous amonge men labour shed bloude euery man hunteth hys brother death yet saye well euyll prynce wyll saieth iudge may pleasure agayne greate man speaketh herte desyreth hearer alow best thē thistle rightuous thē breer hedge daye thy preacher cōmeth thou shalt visyted thē shall wasted awaye iercui • let man beleue frende put hys confydēce price kepe y• porte thy mouth lyeth thy bosome math • c deu • iii • • xxxiii • psal 7 • 〈◊〉 b sōne shal put father dishonoure daughter shal rise agaynst mother daughter lawe agaynst mother lawe man foe shalbe euen hys owne housholde neuertheles wyl loke vp vnto y• lord wyll pacyently abyde god sauioure god shall heare thou enemye myne reioyce fall shall get vp againe though syr darcknesse yet lorde lyght wyll beare punishemēt y• lorde haue offended til syt iudgmēt vpō cause se yt haue right wyll bryng forth lyght shall se rightuousnesse myne enemy shal loke vpon confoūded saieth pro xvii • thy lorde god myne eye shall beholde shalbe trodē downe y• clayamos ix • y• stretes 4 xix tyme wyl come thy gappes shal made vp lawe shal go abrode yt tyme shal come vnto frō assur vnto stronge cyties strong cytyes vnto ryuer frō one see y• frō one moūtayne y• notwithstandynge y• land must wasted dwell therin frutes theyr owne imaginacions therfore fede thy people thy rod flocke thine heritage dwel desolate wodde maye fedde vpon mount charmel basan galaad afore time maruelous thynges wyll shew exod 14 lyke came egypte thys shall heathen se ashamed power iob • 9 • shall laye theyr hande vpon theyr mouthe stoppe theyr eares gene iii • shall lycke dust lyke serpente wormes earth tremble theyr hole shalbe afrayed lorde god shall feare god thou pard • nest wickednes forgeueste offence remnaunt thyne herytage hē kepeth wrath euer hys delyte haue compassyon iere ix shall turne agayne mercyfull v shall put downe oure wyckednes cast oure sinnes botome see thou shalt kepe thy trueth iacob thy mercy abraham lyke thou hane sworne vnto oure father longe ago ¶ ende prophecye mycheas ❧ boke prophet naum ¶ destruccyon niniue delyueraunce israell capi thys heuy burthen niniue whiche naum elchos dyd wryte sawe deut v b lord gelous god taker vengeaunce lorde wrothfull rom ii lorde taketh vengeaunce enemyes reserueth displeasure aduersaryes rom • exod 34 lord suffreth long greate power inocēt iere xxx b leaueth man fautlesse lorde goeth forth tēpest stormy wether cloudes dust fete whē reproueth see drieth vp turneth al floudes drye lande basan desolate charmel pleasure lybanus wasteth awaye moūtaynes tremble hylles consume syght earth quaketh yee whole world y• dwell therin iere x b •• ay • 4 adaru iii loph iii b maye endure hys wrathe able abyde gtyme displeasure anger taketh lyke fyre harde rockes burst sunder hym full gracyous lorde strong holde tyme trouble knoweth thē put theyr trust hym floude renneth ouer destroyeth place whē darcknesse foloweth styll vpon hys enemyes ye imagin thē y• lord maner tush hath made ende shal come nomore trouble lyke thornes sticke together drye strawe shall dronckardes cōsumed together euē whē full come suche imagin myschefe geue vngracious coū cell agaynst lorde therfore thus sayeth lorde let well prepared yee many yet shal hewen downe pa awaye y• wyll vexe y• vtterly destroy nowe wyl breake rodde frō thy backe burst thy bondes bonder lorde hath geuen commaundement concernynge yt shal come nomore sede thy name • th • carued casten image wyll rote house thy god thy graue shal prepare thou shalt confounded ¶ deseribeth victorye caldees agaynste nynyuytes capi ii beholde esapt 〈◊〉 ▪ rom 〈◊〉 ▪ vpon mountaynes come fete bryngeth good tydinges preached peace iuda kepe thy holy dayes perfourme thy promyses • ial shall come vtterly roted oute scaterer shall come vp agaynst laye sege castell loke thou wel stretes make thy loynes stronge arme thy self al thy myght lorde shal restore agayne glory iacob lyke glory israel destroyer haue brokē thē downe marred wyne braunches shylde hys gyaūtes gly stereth hys men warte clothed purple charettes fyre maketh forward archer wel deckt trimmed charettes rol vpon y• stretes welter hye way loke vpō lyke cressettes fyre go swyftly y• lyghtenyng whē doth warne giaūtes fall theyr araye hastely clīme vp walles yee engins warre prepared ready water porte shal opened kynges palace shal fall quene selfe shall led awaye captiue gentylwemen shal mourne doues grone within hertes • ob • 14 • ▪ soph 〈◊〉 ▪ • ▪ niniue lyke pole full water thē shall fayne fle stand stāde shal crye shall one turne backe awaye wt syluer awaye golde ende tresure ther shalbe multitude al maner costly ornamētes thus must spoyled emptied clene striped hertes may melted awaye knee tremble loynes weake theyr face blacke pot nowe dwellyng lyon pasture lyon whelpes lion liones went whelpes man frayed awaye lyon spoyled ynough hys yonge one deuoured lyonesse fylled dennes praye dwellynge place rodbeb beholde wyll vpon sayeth lorde hostes wyll set fyre vpon thy charettes shall smoke swerde shall deuoure yonge lyon wyl make ende thy spoylyng earth voyce thy messaungers shall nomore herde ¶ fall niniue capi iii wo bloudthrusty cyty whiche full lye robbery wyl leaue rauishing man maye heare scourgynge russhynge noyse wheles cryenge horse rollyng charettes ther horseman get vp naked swerdes glysterynge speares lyeth multytude slayne greate heape deed body ende deed coarses yee mē fall vpō bodyes great manyfolde whordome fayre beutyfull harlot masiresse witch craft yee selleth people thorow whordome naciōs thorowe witch crafte •• 24▪ • bo • n ii b beholde wyll vponesai 47 e • ec xvi saieth lord hoostes wyl put thy clothes ouer thy head maye shewe thy nakednes amonge heathen thy shame amonge kyngdomes wyll cast dyrte vpō y• make abhorted gasynge stocke yee loke vpon shall starte backe saye niniue destroyed wyll haue pytye vpō shall seke one cōforte art thou better thē greate eyte e • ec xxx c alexandria laye water y• water roūde strongly fēced walled y• see ethiopa egypt strēgth y• exceding great aboue mesure aphrica libia helper yet driuen awaye brought captyuyte yonge chyldren smytten downe head euery strete lotte cast y• auncyent men al myghtye men bounde chaynes euen shalt thou also droncken hy • e thy self seke helpe agaynste thyne enemy thy strōge cyties shalbe lyke figetrees ripe figes man shaketh shall fall mouth eater beholde thy people within wemen porte thy lāde shalbe opened vnto thyne enemyes fyre shall deuoure thy barres drawe water nowe agaist y• beseged make vp thy strōg holdes go clay tēpre y• morter make strōge bricke esa x 30 f xxxi b zacha x b yet y• fyre shal cōsume y• swerde shall destroye yee locuste doth shal eate y• vp shal fal heuely vpō y• y• locustes yee ryght heuely shal fal vpon euē y• greshoppers thy marchaūtes haue bene nōbred wt starres heauen nowe shal sprede abrode locustes fle waye thy lordes greshoppers thy captaynes multytude greshoppers whē colde remayne hedge sunne vp fle away mā tel become thy shepherdes slepe kynge assur thy worthyes layed downe thy people scarred abrode vpō mountaynes mā gathereth together agayne thy woūde cannot hyd thy plage sore heare shal clappe handes ouer thou hast alway bene hurte ende prophecye naum ❧ booke prophet abacuk complaynt agaynst labour iob xix tirannyeccle iiii a▪ vyolence power ouergoeth righte lawe toarue peces cā ryght iudgment go forth vngodly set rightuous cause wrōge iudgmēt procedeth actes xiii beholde amonge heathē loke wel wōdre abashed wyl thynge tyme whiche though tolde ye shall beleue lo wyl rayse vp caldees bitter swyfte people shall go wyde y• lande take possessiō dwelling place y• theyr owne grimme boysterous people shal sit iudgment punishe horse swifter cattes mountayne byte sorer deut 28 • y• wolues euenyng horsmen come great heapes farre • le hastely deuour aegle come spoyle commeth capi iii lord whē herde speke afrayed worke y• thou hast taken hāde shalte yu perfourme tyme lord thy tyme cōmeth yu shalt declare thy wrath yu thynckest vpon mercy god commeth theman holy one frō mount phatan selah glory couereth heuens earth ful prayse shine sōne beames lyght go hādes power hyd destruccion goeth hī burnyng cressettes go frō fete 〈◊〉 ix • standeth measureth earth loketh people cōsume away moūtaines worlde fal downe poulder hylles fayne bowe selues goinges euerlastynge sure sawe ye pauilyons morians tētes lāde madiā vexed werynesse wast yu angry lord water thy wrath stoudes thy displeasure see yes whē thou fattest vpon thyne horse thy chare • tꝭ victory thou shewest thy openly lyke y• haddest promysed othe 〈◊〉 46 • vnto trybes selah thou dydst deuyde y• water y• earth mountaynes sawe afrayed water streame went away depe made noyse lyftyng vp thyn hande 〈◊〉 x c sūne moue remayned styl habitacion thine arowes went glisteryng thy speares shyne lyghtnyng 〈◊〉 xi • thou trodest downe lande thyne angre dydest thressh heathen thy displeasure thou camest forth helpe thy people helpe anoī ted thou smotest downe heade house vngodly discoueredst hys foū daciōs euen vnto necke hym selah thou cursest septers captayne mē warre whych come stormy wynde scatre abrode glad may eat vp pore secretly thou makest away thyne horse see euen mudde great water heare body vexed lyppes trible voyce therof bone corrupte afrayed stāde myght rest daye trouble myght go vp vnto people alredy prepared fyg tree shal grene vynes shall beare frute labour y• olyue shalbe 〈◊〉 lost lande shall bring corne th • • hepe shalbe taken y• fold shalbe catel stalles wyll glad lorde wyl reioyce god sauiour psa xviii • lord god strength shall make fete fete hertes sophony sonne christ sonne godoliah sōne amar • ah sonne hezekiah y• tyme 4 r • 〈◊〉 23 iosiah sōne 4 regū ••• amō kyng iuda wyl gather vp al thīges lande sayeth lord wyl gather vp man beast wyl gather vp foules y• ayre fysh see great decaye wycked wyll vtterly destroye men lande sayeth lord wyl stretche myne hāde vpon iuda vpon al dwel ierusalem thus wyl rote remnaūt baal place name 4 24 • deu ••• b remurius prestes yee iere v vpon house coppes worshyp bowe thē selues vnto hoste heauen swere lorde malchom also whiche starte backe frome lorde neyther seke lorde regarde zacha ii styl presence lord god daye lorde hande yee lorde hath prepared slayne offeryng called gestes therto thus shall happen daye lordes slayne offerynge wyl vyset prynces 4 xxv • iere 39 b y• kynges chyldren al weare straunge •• thynge daye also wyll vyset treade ouer thresholde proudly fyl lordes house robbery falshede y• time sayth lorde shalbe herde greate crye 〈…〉 fysh porte howlynge porte great •• thur y• byli •• howle ye dwell myll marchaūt people goue laden wyth syluer roted tyme wyll seke thorow ierusalem wyth lanternes vyset continue theyr dregges saye theyr hertes iere▪ v c de • 2 • c iere 23 tush lord wil nether good euyl goodes shalbe spoyled theyr house layde waste amos v▪ b shal buylde house dwell shall plāte vyneyardes drincke y• wyne therof great ioel ii a▪ day lorde hande herd commeth pace horrible tydinges lordes day shal graunte crye daye daye wrath daye trouble neuynysse daye vtter destrucyon mysery darcke glomyng day cloudy stormy day day noise trōpettes shawmes strong city hie towres wyl bryng people suche vexacion y• shal go lyke blynde mē haue synned agaynst lord blode shalbe shed dust bodyes myre ezec vii nether siluer gold shalbe able delyuere wroth full day lorde dopho 3 b whole lande shalbe cōsumed thorowe fyre hys geiousy shal soue make clene ryddaunce dwell lande ¶ moueth returne god propheryeng vnto one destruccyon delyueraunce capi ii come together gather frowarde people thyng go forth cōcluded tyme passed away y• dust feareful wrath lord come vpon yec day lordes sore dyspleasure come vpon seke lord al ye meke harted vpon earth ye worke noone day accaron shalbe pluckt vp rote wo vnto y• dwell vpon see coost ye murtherous people worde y• lorde shall come vpon canaan thou lāde philistynes wyl destroy shall man dwell see coost shalbe herdemens cotages shepe foldes yee shalbe porcyon remayne house iuda fede therupon house ascalon shal rest towarde nyght lorde theyr god shall vyset thē turne away captyuite esay 〈◊〉 ▪ • iere 4 • • ezec 25 • haue herde y• despyte moab blasphemyes y• chyldren ammon howe haue shamefully intreted people magnifyed selues within border theyr lande therfore truly lyue sayeth lorde hostes god israel moab shalbe sodome ammō gomorra euē dry thorue hedge salt pyttes perpetuall wyldernes resydue folke shal spoyle thē remnaunt people shal haue thē possession zacha▪ • shall happen vnto theyr pryde haue delte shamefully y• lorde hostes people magnified thē selues aboue thē lord shalbe grym vpon thē esay▪ • destroy al goodes y• lande iles heathen shal worshyppe euery man place yee moryās also shal perysh wt swerde yee shall stretche hande ouer north destroy assur • • 14 • niniue shal make desolate dry waste flockes al beastes people shal lye y• myddest pellicans storckes shall abyde vpper postes foules shall syng wyndowes rauens shal syt vpō balckes y• bordes cedre shall ryuen downe proude carelesse cyte sayde herte 4 reg 〈…〉 esay ••• el none made wast y• beastꝭ lye therm goeth mocketh poynteth wyth fynger ¶ agaynst gouerners ierusalem callyng al gentile cōforte resyoue israell capi iii wo abhomynable fylthye cruell cyty wyll heare refourmed trust lorde neyther wyll holde god ruler within roaryng eze x • ii • math▪ 〈◊〉 〈…〉 • • lyon iudges ‡ wolues euenyng leaue nothyng behynde thē tyll y• morowe prophetes lyghte personnes vnfaythfull men prestes vnhalowe sanctuary wronge vnder precence lawe iuste lorde y• doth vnryght amonge thē euery mornyng shewyng lawe clearly ceassed y• vngodly wil lerne asshamed therfore wyll rote thys people destroye theyr wres yee make stretes voyde mā shal goo therin ther cyties shalbe broken downe body shall left dwell anymore sayde vnto thē feare content reformed theyr dwellynge shulde destroyed shulde happen vnto none thynges wherwith shall vyset neuertheles stande vp early folowe fylthines owne ymaginaciōs therfore ye shall watte vpō sayth lorde vntyl tyme y• stand vp determyned gather people brynge kyngdomes together may poure myne anger ye wrothful • autt • dysplesure vpō thē • opho 1 c ye worlde shall cōsumed wt fire gelousi thē wyl clēse y• lippes peple y• may euerychone call vpn name lorde serue hym one shoulder suche haue subdued chyldren also haue scatered abrode shall brynge presentes beyonde water etheopia tyme shalt thou confounded thy ymagynacyons wher thorow thou haddest offended ieremi b wyll take awaye proude booster thyne honour thou shalt triumphe holy hill y• also wyll leaue small poore symple people shall trust name y• lord remnaunt israell shall wyekednes speake lye nether shall disceatful tunge foūde theyr mouthes shalbe fed take theyr rest mā shal make thē afrayed geue thākes daughter syon ioyfull israel reioyce glad thy whole herte daughter ierusalē lorde hath takē awaye thy punyshment turned backe thyne enemyes kynge israell euen lorde hym selfe thou nedest nomore feare mysfortune tyme shalbe sayde ierusalem feare nat syon let nat thyne handes slacke lorde thy god hath power saue hath special pleasure meruelous loue towarde yee reioyseth ouer gladnesse haue bene heuynesse wyll gather together take thy congregacyon shame reprofe hath bene layed vpō shalbe farre frō lo tyme wyll destroye vexe mith 4 b wyll helpe lame gather vp cast awaye yee wyl get prayse honoure al landes haue bene put shame tyme wyl brynge tyme wyl gather wyl get name good reporte amonge people earth turne backe youre captiuite youre eye sayeth y• lorde ¶ ende prophecye sophony ¶ boke prophete aggeus ¶ tyme prophecye aggeus ethartacyon buylde temple agayne capi seconde yeare speaketh lorde hoostes sayeth people doth saye tyme nat yet come buylde vp lordes house spake lorde pr •• hete aggeus sayde iere xxii ye youre selues fynde tyme dwell syled house shall lye wast selues ye nat warme earneth wage putteth broken purse thus sayeth lorde hoostes cōsydre owne wayes hertes get vp mountayne fetch wod buylde vp y• house 3 viii maye acceptable vnto y• may shewe myne honour sayeth y• lorde ye loked much lo come lytle though ye bryng home yet blowe awaye sayeth y• lorde hoostes cor iii b ix • ii cor vi c euen y• house lyeth wast ye renne euery mā vnto owne house wherfore y• heauē forbyden geue dewe earth forbydden geue encrease deut 28 b haue called drouth bothe vpō y• lande vpō moūtaynes vpō corne vpō wyne vpō oyle vpon euery thynge y• grounde egpt sprete shalbe among feare ye thus sayeth lorde hostes 〈…〉 yet wyll shake heauen earth see drye lande yee e •• • lx • wyl moue heathen cōforte al heathen shal come wyl fyll thys house honoure daye nynth moneth seconde yeare kynge darius came worde lorde vnto prophete aggeus sayenge thus sayeth lorde god hoostes aske prestes cōcerninge lawe saye ierem xi b yf one beare holy flesh hys cote lappe lappe touch brede po • age wyne oyle meate shall holy also prestes answered sayde sayd aggeus nowe yf one beynge defyled deed carcase touch shall also vnclene prestes gaue answere sayd le • 〈…〉 nu • 〈…〉 yee shalbe vncleane aggeus answered sayde euen people nacyon sayeth lorde workes theyr handes yee offre vnclene nowe praye considre frō daye forth howe hathe gone afore euer layed one stone vpō another tēple lorde y• ye came corne heape xx bushel scarce ten agg 〈…〉 ye came wyne presse powre l pottes wyne scarce xx smote heate blastynge hayle stone y• labour handes yet none y• wolde olyue tree bene yet vnfrutefull frō thys daye forth shall make prospere moreouer xxiiij daye moneth came worde lorde vnto aggeus agayne sayenge speake zorobabell pryuce iuda saye wyll shake bothe sayeth lorde hoostes thou sōne salachiel seruaunt wyll take sayeth lorde tyme make seale haue chosen sayeth lorde hoostes ¶ ende prophecye aggeus ¶ boke prophete zachary ¶ moueth people returne lorde hath bene sore displeased forfathers saye thou vnto thus sayeth lorde hoostes •• te xxx • • • ala iii b turne vnto sayeth lorde hoostes wyll turne vnto sayeth lorde hoostes iere 44 psal 78 ye nat lyke forfathers vnto prophetes cryed afore tyme sayenge thus sayeth lorde god hoostes • se xiiii •• ob xiii b turne nowe youre euel wayes youre wycked ymagynacyons ••• e 44 wolde nat heare regarde sayeth lorde nowe become youre forefather prophetes yet styll alyue dyd nat wordes statute whiche cōmaunded seruauntes prophetes touch forefather upon gaue answere sayde lyke lorde hoostes deuysed vnto v accordynge oure owne wayes ymagynacyons euen hathe dealte v upon xxiiii daye xi moneth moneth sebat seconde yeare darius came worde lorde vnto zachary sonne barachias sōne addo prophet sayenge sawe nyght lo sat one vpon zacha vi • pora vi redde horse stode styll amonge myrretrees beneth vpon grounde behynde hym redde speckeled whyte horse sayde lrode angell talked sayde vnto wyl shewe man y• stode amonge myrretrees answered sayde whō lorde hathe sente go thorowe worlde answered angell lorde stode amonge myrretrees sayde haue gone thorowe worlde beholde al worlde dwell ease carelesse lordes angell gaue answere sayde lorde hoostes howe longe wylt thou vnmercyful ierusalem cyties iuda iere xxv b xxxi • b • esc • • whō thou hast bene displeased nowe threscore • enne yeares lorde gaue louinge cōfortable answere vnto angel talked angel commoned sayde vnto crye thou speake thus sayeth lorde hoostes exceadinge gelous ouer ierusalē syon sore displeased carelesse heathen lytle angrye dyd theyr best myght destroye therfore thus sayeth lorde zach viii wyll turne agayne mercye towarde ierusalem house shalbe buylded sayeth lorde hoostes yee plommet shalbe layde abrode ierusalem crye also speake thus sayeth lorde hoostes cyties shalbe good prosperite agayne lorde shal yet cōforte siō chose ierusalē lyfte vp myne eyees sawe beholde foure horne sayde vnto angell y• talked answered dan vii horne whiche haue scatered iuda israel ierusalē abrode lorde shewed foure carpenter thē sayde wyl answered sayde horne whiche haue strowed iuda abrode man durst lyfte vp head come fraye thē awaye cast horne gentyls lyfte vp theyr horne ouer y• lande iuda scatre abroade ¶ renewynge ierusalem iuda capi ii lyfte vp myne eye agayne loked beholde ezec 43 • apo • xxi • mā measure lyne hande sayde whether goest thou sayde vnto measure ierusalem maye se howe longe howe broade beholde angell talked wente waye forth went another angel mete hym sayde vnto hym runne speake thys yonge man saye ierusalem shalbe inhabited without wall multytude people catell shalbe therin deu iiii zacha ix • yee selfe sayeth lorde wyl vnto wall fyre roūde wyll behonoured get forth fle frō lande north sayeth lorde ye ierem 23 b haue scatred y• foure wyndes vnder heauen sayeth lorde saue thy selfe syon thou dwellest ye daughter babylon thus sayeth lorde hoostes glorious power hath sent lorde hostes hathe sent glad reioyse daughter syō • lo ex • xxv • •• • 8 c come dwell myddest sayeth lorde tyme shal many heathē cleue lorde shalbe people thus wyl dwell myddest thou shalt knowe lorde hostes hath sent vnto lorde shal haue iuda possession hys parte holy groūde shal chose ierusalē yet agayne sopho let al flesh styl y• lorde rysen hys holy place ¶ lawe hye estate chryste vnder fygure iesua preste prophetye chryste capi iii shewed iesua y• hye preste standynge angel y• lorde psal cix • iiii iude b satan stode ryght hande syste y• lorde sayde vnto satan lorde reproue thou satan yee y• lorde hath chosen ierusalem reproue nat brande takē y• fyre nowe iesua clothed vnclene rayment stode angel answered sayde vnto y• stode hym take awaye y• foule clothes frō vnto hym sayde beholde haue takē away thy synne frō wyl decke y• chaūge raymēt sayd moreouer set fayre myter vpō heade set fayre myter vpō heade put clothes vpō hym angel lorde stode angell lorde testyfyed vnto iesua spake thus sayeth lorde hostes thou wylt walke way kepe watch thou shalt rule house kepe courtes wyl geue place amonge y• stande heare iesua y• hye preste yu thy frendes yt dwell sayth y• lord hoostes take awaye synne lande one daye shall euery man call neyghboure vnder vyne vnder fygge tree sayeth lorde hoostes vysiō golden candelstycke exposiciō therof capi iiii angell y• talked came agayne waked vp man raysed slepe sayde vnto seyst thou sayde haue loked beholde candelstycke gold boll vpon vij lampes therin vpō euery lāpe vij stalkes apo • xi two olyue tree therby one vpon ryght syde boll vpō left syde answered spake angell talked saienge lorde angel talked answered sayde vnto knowest thou sayde lorde answered sayde vnto worde lorde vnto zorobabell sayeng esay • •• neyther thorowe hoost men thorowe strength thorowe sprete sayeth lorde hoostes art thou yu greate mountayne zorobabel thou must made euen shal brynge vp fyrst esay • •• stone man shal crye vnto good lucke good lucke moreouer worde lorde came vnto sayenge phil • handes zorobabel haue layed foūdacion house handes shall also fynyshe deut •• y• ye maye knowe howe y• lorde hoostes hathe sent vnto y• hath bene despysed lytle season shal reioyce whē seyth tynne weyght zorobabels hāde vij eye lordes whiche go thorowe whole world thē answered sayde vnto ij oliue tree vpō y• ryght left syde cādel stike spake moreouer sayde vnto hym two olyue braūches thorowe two goldē pypes emptye thē selues y• golde answered sayde knowest thou sayd lord thē sayde apo • 〈◊〉 • ye two olyue braūches ye stande ruler whole earth ¶ vysyon flyenge boke sygnyfienge curse theues suche abuse name god vysion measure ye signified bryngyng iuda babylō capi v turned lyftinge vp myne eye loked beholde flyenge boke sayde vnto seyst yu answered se flyenge boke xx cubytes longe x cubytes brode sayde vnto curse goeth forth ouer whole earth theues shalbe iudged boke al swearer shalbe iudged accordynge wyll brynge forth sayeth y• lorde hoostes shall come house thefe house falsely sweareth name shall remayne house cōsume tymbre stone therof angel talked went forth sayde vnto lyfte vp thyne eye se thys goeth forth sayde answered thys measure goynge sayde moreouer euen thus ye dwel vpon whole earth loke vpon beholde lyfte vp talēt leade lo womā sat y• myddest measure sayde thys vngodlynes cast myddest measure threwe lompe leade vpon mouth lyfte vp myne eye loked beholde came two wemen wynde theyr wynges wynges lyke wynges storcke lyft vp measure betwyxte earth heauen spake angell talked whyther wyll beare measure sayd vnto lāde gene x b▪ synear buylde thē house whiche prepared measure shall set place ¶ foure charettes descrybeth prosperyte foure kyngdomes capi vi moreouer turned lyftyng vp min eye loked behold came four charettꝭ betwixte ij hylles whiche hilles brasse fyrst charet zacha b apo • vi red horse second charet blacke horse thyrd charet whyte horse fourth charet horse diuers coloures strōg spake sayde vnto angel talked lord angel answered sayde vnto iere iiii b iiij windes heauē come forth stāde y• ruler earth wt blacke horse went lāde north white folowed spekled horse wente forth towarde south horse stronge wente sought go take theyr iourney ouer whole earth sayde get hence go thorowe worlde went thorow worlde cryed vpon spake vnto sayeng beholde go towarde north shall styll wrath north countre worde lord came vnto sayeng take presoners come frō babylon namely heldai tobiah idaia come yu day go house iosiah sōne sophony thē take golde syluer make crownes therof set thē vpon heade iesua sōne iosedeh hye preste speake vnto thus sayeth lorde hostes beholde mā whose name • acha iii b braunche shal sprynge vp psal 127 shal buylde vp temple lord yee euen shall buylde vp temple lord • p 4 b 5 b shall beare prayse shal syt vpon lordes trone haue domynacion psal cx b hebr 5 6 7 8 9▪ 10 preste shall also vpon trone peacable coūcel shalbe betwyxte crownes shalbe temple lorde remembraunce vnto helem tobiah idaiah hen sonne sophony farre shal come buylde temple lorde ye may knowe howe lorde hoostes hath sent vnto thys shall come passe ye wyl herken diligently vnto voyce lorde god ¶ estymacyon fastynge without mercy despysyng charyte obstyna • ye people capi vii happened also fourthe yeare kyng darius worde lord came vnto zachary fourth day ninth moneth called caste • tyme sarasar rogomelech men thē sent vnto bethel pray lord shulde say vnto prestes hous lorde hoostes prophetes shulde wepe • reg 25 b fyfth moneth absteyne haue done nowe certayne yeares came worde lorde hoostes vnto sayenge speake vnto people lande preastes saye ye fasted mourned fyfth iere xli 4 reg 25 b seuenth moneth nowe ixx yeares callyng gentyles capi viii worde lord hostes came vnto sayeng thus sayeth lord hostes great gelousy ouer sion yee haue bene gelous ouer great dyspleasure thus sayeth lorde hostes wyl turne agayne vnto sion wyll dwell myddest ierusalem esay 1 ierusalē shalbe called faythful true cyte hyll lorde hostes yee holy hyll thus sayeth lorde hostes shal yet olde men wemen dwell agayne stretes ierusalem yee go wt staues theyr handes age stretes cyte also shalbe full yong boyes damsel playinge vpon stretes thus sayeth lord hostes yf resydue people thyncke vnpossible dayes mat xix shulde therfore vnpossyble syght sayeth lord hostes thus sayeth lorde hoostes beholde wyl delyuer people frō lāde east west wyll brynge agayne maye dwel ierusalem iere iii f apoc xxi c hebr viii c shalbe people wyl god trueth ryghtuousnesse thus sayeth lorde hostes let handes stronge ye nowe heare wordes mouth y• prophetes dayes foūdacion layed vpon lord hostes house y• temple maye buylded aggeus i▪ • dayes neyther mē catel coulde wīue thyng nether myght man come rest trouble let euery man go gaynst neyghbour neuerthelesse wyl intreate resydue people nomore afore tyme sayeth lorde hoostes shalbeagge • • sede peace vineyarde shal geue frute groūde shal geue increase y• heauēs shal geue dewe shall cause rēnaunt people haue possession shal come passe y• lyke ye curse among y• heathen ye house iuda ye house israell euē wyl delyuer y• ye shalbe blessyng feare let handes stronge thus sayeth lorde hostes lyke ••• ysed punyshe tyme 〈…〉 prouoked 〈◊〉 vnto wrath say • th lorde hostes spared euen • 〈◊〉 shalbe ioy gladnesse prosperous hye feastes vnto house iuda onely loue trueth peace thus sayeth lorde hostes shall yet come people inhabiters many cyties dwel one cyte shal go another sayeng esay ii • ten men maner language gentyles take one iewe hemme hys garment saye wyll go haue hearde ye god among ¶ conuersion gentyles cōmyng chryst syttynge asse capi ix worde lorde shalbe receyued adrach come confusion kynge gaza shal peryshe ascalon shall man dwel straungers shal dwel asdod y• pryde philistynes shal rote 〈◊〉 ▪ 〈◊〉 1 • oy •• x • bloude wyll take away mouth abhominacions amonge teeth thus shalbe left god yee shalbe prince iuda accaron like iebusy wyl cō pase house rounde aboute wt men warre goying fro oppressour come vpon thē haue sene nowe myne eye •• lxii c • xxi •• n xii b reioyse yu greatly daughter syon glad daughter ierusalē lo thy kynge cōmeth vnto euen ryghtuous sauiour lowly symple rideth vpon asse vpon foale asse wil rote charettes frō ephraim horse frō ierusalē batel bowes shalbe destroyed shal gyue ye doctryne peace vnto heathen • al 76 b dominion shall one see floudes endes worlde thou also thorow bloude thy couenaū shalt let thy prisoner ‡ pitte wherin water turne nowe stronge holde ye y• prison • ay xlii • • ix • 8 c long sore deliuered daye bryng worde y• wyl rewarde double agayne iuda haue bent bowe ephraim haue fylled thy sonnes siō wyl rayse vp agaynst grekes make gyauntes swearde lorde god shalbe sene aboue dartes shal go forth lyghtnyng lorde god shal blowe trompet shal come forth storme south lorde hostes shal defende shal cōsume deuoure subdue thē • ha ii •• g 17 f slynge stone shal dryncke rage thorow wyne shalbe filled lyke y• base • horne y• aulter lord god shal delyuer thē day y• flock people y• stone sayntuary shalbe set vp lāde prosperous goodly thyng shal ye corne shal make ye yonge men chereful newe wyne maydens ¶ people moued requyre doctryne trueth lorde lorde promyseth vy •• comforte house israel capi v pray lorde bitymes geue latter rayne • ut 28 b shal lorde make cloudes geue rayne ynoughe al increace felde vayne answere idol sothsayers se lye tel vayne dreames cōforte geue nothynge worth therfore go astraye lyke slocke shepe troubled haue •• ch 13 shepherd wroth ful dispeasure moued shepherdes wyl vyset y• gotes lord hostes wyl graciously vyset flocke house iuda holde thē goodly fayre horse batayle gen xlix b iuda shal come helmet esay 22 nayle batelbowe al prynces together shalbe giaū te whiche batayle treade downe myre vpon stretes shal fyght lord shalbe horsmen shalbe confounded wyl comforte house iuda preserue house ioseph wyll turne also pyte shalbe lyke cast thē lorde theyr god wyl heare ephraim shalbe gyaunt herte shalbe chereful thorow wyne yee child shal se glad herte shall reioyce lorde wyll blowe gather together wyll redeme shal increace increased afore wyll sowe amonge people may thyncke vpon farre coūtrees shal lyue wt theyr chyldren turne agayne wyl bring agayne also lande egypt gather assyrya wyl cary lande galaad libanus shal want nothing shal go vpon y• see trouble smyte y• see waues y• al depe floudes shalbe dryed vp proude bostyng assur shal cast downe scepter esay x ezec 29 egypte shalbe taken awaye wyll comforte lorde maye walcke name sayeth lorde ¶ destruccyon temple care faythfull commytted christ father greuous vysion agaynst ierusalem iuda capi vi open thy dores libanus fyre maye consume thy cedre tree howle ye firre tree cedre fallen yee al poudre wasted away howle • ye oke tree baasan myghtye stronge wodde cut downe men maye shepherdes mourne glory destroyed mē may y• lion whelpes rore y• pride iordane wasted away thus fayeth lorde god fode shepe slaughter whiche shalbe slayne possesse thē yet take synne sell saye lord thācked rych yee owne shepherdes spare therfore wyl nomore spare dwell lande • sayeth lorde lo wyll deliuer people euery mā neighbour hand hande kynge maye smyte lande theyr handes wyll delyuer selfe fed slaughter shepe pore flocke verely toke vnto two staues one called louyng mekenes called wo kepte shepe thre shepherdes destroyed one moneth myght waye neyther delyte sayde wyll fede nomore • po • 〈◊〉 c▪ thyng dyeth let dye wyll perysh let perysh let remnaūt eate euery one flesshe neighbour toke also louyng meke staff brake myght disanul • •• li • couenaūt whiche made people broken day poore symple shepe respecte vnto knewe therby worde lorde sayde vnto yf ye thynke good bryng hyther pryce yf leaue math▪ 27 c wayed downe xxx syluer pēs value prysed lorde sayde vnto cast vnto potter goodly pryce valued toke xxx syluer pen cast potter house lorde brake staf also namely wo might lowse brotherhead betwyxte iuda israell lorde sayde vnto take also y• staffe foolyshe shepherde lo wyll rayse vp shepherde lande shal seke thiges lost care suche go astraye shall heale woūded shall norysh thynge whole shall eate fleshe suche fat teare clawes peces idol shepherd leaueth flocke swerde shal come vpon arme vpō right eye hꝭ arme shalbe clene dryed vp ryght eye shalbe sore blynded ¶ destruc •• buyldynge agayne ierusalē capi xii heuy burthen lorde hath deuysed israell thus sayeth lorde •••• 〈◊〉 c 44 〈◊〉 45 b whiche spred heauens abroade layde foundacyon earth gene •• • gyueth man breath lyfe beholde wyl make ierusalem cuppe surfet vnto people rounde aboute •• cha 14 c yee iuda self also shalbe sege ierusalem tyme wyll make ierusalem heuy stone people al lyfte vp shalbe torne rente people earth shalbe gathered together agaynst ab •• ▪ 〈◊〉 ▪ 〈…〉 ▪ daye sayeth lorde wyll make al horse abashed ryde vpon theyr wyttes wyl opē myne eye vpon house iuda smyte y• horse people blyndnesse prynces iuda shall saye theyr hertes inhabyters ierusalem shal geue cōsolacyon lord hoostes theyr god tyme wyl make y• prince iuda lyke hote burnyng ouen wood lyke cresset fyre among strawe shall consume al people rounde aboute vpon ryght hāde left ierusalem also shal inhabyted agayne namely place ierusalem standeth lorde shall preserue tētes iuda lyke fore tyme glory y• house dauyd glory cytesyns ierusalem shalbe lytle regarded cōparyson glory iuda day shal lorde defende cytesyns ierusalem weakest among shalbe • 〈…〉 ▪ dauid house dauid shalbe lyke god house angell lorde tyme wyll go aboute destroye people come agaynst ierusalem moreouer vpon house dauid vpon cytesyns ierusalem 〈…〉 wyl poure sprete grace prayer y• 〈…〉 shall loke vpō whō haue pearsed shal bewepehi mē mourne onely begotten sonne yee sory mē sory fyrst chylde 〈◊〉 ▪ shall great mournynge ierusalem • 〈…〉 ▪ lyke lamentacion adremnon felde maggadon lande shall wayle euery kynred thē selues kynred house dauid thē selues alone wiues thē selues kinred house 2 〈…〉 ▪ nathā selues ¶ well grace truthe cleue ryddaunce idolatrye false prophetes capi xiii tyme shall house dauyd cytesyns ierusalem haue open 〈…〉 ▪ well washe synne vnclennesse sayeth lorde hostes 〈…〉 ▪ wyll destroye name idoles le lande shal nomore put remembraunce ⚜ false prophetes also vncleane sprete shal take lāde yf prophecie 〈…〉 xiiii • hys owne father mother begat shal say vnto thou shalt dye vpō shepherde vpon prince peple sayeth lord hostes math 26 • mat 14 smyte shepherde shepe shal scatred abrode wyll turne myne hande lytle one shall come passe sayeth lord al lande two partes shalbe roted amos ix b iob x • iii thyrde parte shall remayne therin esaye 43 psa xvii 〈◊〉 46 • • ▪ petri b pro xvii sapi iii eccle ii thyrde parte wyll bringe thorow y• fyre wyl clense thē syluer clensed yee trye thē lyke gold tryed shal call vpō name wyll heare wyl saye people shal saye lorde god ¶ wastynge churche vnder fygure ierusalem kyng dome lorde capi xiiii beholde daye lorde cōmeth thou shalt spoiled robbed wyl gather together heathen fyght ierusalem y• cyte shalbe wonne house spoiled wemē defyled halfe cyte shal go away captiuite resydue people shal caryed cyte shal lorde go forth fight heathē men vse fyght day battel thē shall fete stande vpō y• moūt oliuere lyeth vpon y• east syde ierusalē y• moūt olyuete shall cleue two eastwarde westwarde y• shalbe greate valley halfe moūt shall remoue toward north towarde southe ye shall fle vnto valley hilles valley hilles shal reach vnto asal yee fle shall ye amos lyke ye fled earthquake ī day osiah kyng iuda lorde god shal come sayntes wt day shal lyght colde frost math 24 c shal specyal daye knowen vnto lorde nether daye nyght euenyng tyme shalbe lyght zacha xiii • apoc xxii • tyme shal water lyfe runne frō ierusalem halfe parte towarde east see half towarde vttermost see shall continue somer wynter •••• ▪ • lorde hym selfe shalbe kynge ouer earth yt tyme shall one lord onely name shalbe one mē shal go whole earth vpō felde frō gibea rēmō frō south ierusalē shal set vp ihabyted place frō ben iamyns porte vnto place tyrst port vnto corner porte tower 2 esd • • • 〈◊〉 xxx • • hananeel vnto kynges wyne press shal men dwel shalbe nomore cursinge ierusalē shalbe safely inhabyted shalbe plage wherwith lorde wyl smyte people y• haue fought agaynst ierusalē namely theyr flesh shall cōsume awaye though stāde vpō fete eies shalbe corrupt hole tung shal cōsume theyr mouth daye shall y• lord make greate sedicyon among one man shal take another hande lay handes vpō handes neyghboure zacha xii • ▪ iuda shal fyght also agaynst ierusalem goodꝭ al hethē shalbe gathered together roūde aboute gold syluer great multitu • e clothes shal plage go ouer horse mule camel ass beastes shall host lyke yonder plage euery one y• remayneth al y• peple came ierusalem shal go vp yerely worshippe y• king euen lorde hostes leu xxlii▪ • num 29 • 3 esdr v • 〈◊〉 mac • • kepe thē feast tabernacle loke generacyon vpon earth goeth vp ierusalem worshype kynge euen lorde hostes vpon shal come rayne kynred egypt go vp come shal rayne vpon thē nether shalbe y• plage wher wt lorde wyt smyte heathē y• come vp kepe y• feast tabernacle yee thꝭ shalbe y• sinne plage egipt sine plage al people y• go vp kepe feast tabernacle tyme shal rydyng gere horse holy vnto lorde kettels lordes house shall lyke basēs aulter yee kettels ierusalem iuda shalbe holy vnto lord hostes sleye offeringes shall come take dyght thē tyme shalbe mo cananytes house lorde hostes ende prophecye zachary ❧ booke prophet malachy ¶ complaynt agaynst israel prestes capi heuy burthen whiche lorde sheweth agaynst israel malachy haue loued sayeth lorde yet ye say wheri hast thou loued v gene xxv c esau iacobs brother saieth lorde rom ix iosia▪ 23 yet haue loued iacob hated esau yee haue made hilles wast heritage wildernes dragōs though edom sayde well destroyed wyll go builde vp againe place wasted yet sayeth lorde hostes • b •• • builded brake downe called cursed lande people lord hath euer bene angry withal youre eye haue sene ye selues must confesse yt lord hath brought ye lāde israel great honour exod xx shulde sonne honour father seruaūt master deu 32 father wher mine honour lord wher feared sayeth lorde hostes prestes yt despise name ye say wherin haue despised thy name yt ye offre vnclene bred vpō myne aulter yf ye wyll saye wherin haue offered vnclene thing vnto y• ye say aulter ye lord regarded ye offre ye blynde euyl ye offre lame sycke euyl leuit▪ 22 • eze xliii c yee offre vnto thy prīce shal cōtent accept thy persōne sayeth ye lorde hostes nowe make prayer god may haue mercy vpon v suche thiges haue ye done shal regarde persōnes thīke ye saieth ye lorde hostes yee among y• wyll muche shut dores kindle fyre vpon myne aulter naught gene iiii haue pleasure saieth ye lord hostes esaye b psa iiii • ye meatoffringe wyl accept hāde ‡ ye rising vp ye sunne vnto going downe name great amōg ye gētiles yee euery place shal sacryfyte done clene meatoffring offred vp vnto name name great among ye heathē saith ye lorde hostes ye haue vnhalowed ī ye say ye aulter ye lord regarded thīge set therupon worthy eaten say ye labour trauayle thus haue ye thought scorne saieth lorde hostes offering robbery yee lame sycke ye haue brought ī meat offering shulde accept hāde saieth lord cursed dissēbler hath flocke one yt male maketh vowe offereth spotted one vnto ye lord great kyng sayeth lorde hostes name fearfull among heathen ¶ threatenynges agaynste prestes beinge seducer people capi ii nowe ye prestes cōmaundemente toucheth yf ye wyll heare regard geue glory vnto name saieth lorde hoostes deut▪ 〈…〉 ▪ wyll sende curse vpon wyl curse youre blessynges yee curse wyll yf ye take hede beholde shall corrupte youre sede cast donge face euen donge solempne feastes shall cleue faste vpon ye shall knowe haue sente commaundement vnto 〈…〉 ▪ couenaūt whiche made leui myghte stande sayeth lorde hostes made couenaunt lyfe peace gaue myght stande awe dyd feare name reuerence lawe trueth mouth wyckednesse founde lyppes walked peace equyte dyd turne many one awaye theyr synnes 〈…〉 ▪ prestes lyppes shulde sure knowledge y• men may seke lawe mouth messaunger lorde hostes ye gone clene way haue caused multytude offended lawe deut 〈…〉 ▪ ye haue broken couenaūte leui sayeth lorde hoostes therfore wyl also make despysed reputacyon amonge people ye haue kept wayes haue bene percyall lawe eph iiii • haue one father hath one god made v 〈…〉 vii • 〈…〉 ▪ c doth euery one v thē despyse hys owne brother breake couenaunt father hath iuda offēded yee y• abhomynacyō done israel ierusalē • 〈◊〉 ix •• ui xxi • ▪ iuda hath defi led sāctuary y• lord loued hathe kepte daughter straunge god lorde shal destroy mā doth yee master scoler tabernacle iacob hym y• offreth vp meatoffring vnto lorde hostes haue ye brought thꝭ point agayne aulter lord couered teres wepyng mourning wyll nomore regarde meat offeringe nether wil receaue accept thyng hādes yet ye say wherfore euen wher lord made coue naūt betwixt thy wyfe thy youth thou hast despysed gene ii yet thyne owne companyon maryed wyfe dyd one yet ex cellent spryte dyd one sought sede promysed god therfore loke well spryte let man despyse wyfe youth y• hatest p • nt 24 • 〈◊〉 iii • put awaye saieth y• lorde god israell geue clothynge scorne sayeth lorde hostes loke well youre sprite despise ye greue lorde youre wordes yet ye saye wherwith haue greued ye say euyll good syght god suche please el god punysheth ¶ messaūger lorde iohn baptyst • • aye lorde eliah capi iii beholde math xi b 〈◊〉 • ▪ • luke▪ vii c 〈…〉 ii •• • • • wyl sende messaunger shal prepare way lorde 〈…〉 64 • ye wolde haue shall soone come temple yee euen messaunger couenaunte whome ye long beholde commeth sayeth lorde hostes maye abyde daye hys commynge shall able endure appeareth lyke goldsmythes fyre lyke wasshers sope shall syt hym downe trye clense syluer shall pourge chyldren leui puryfy lyke golde syluer maye brynge meatofferynges vnto lorde ryghteousnesse shall offeryng iuda ierusalem acceptable vnto lorde lyke begynnynge yeares afore tyme wyll come punyshe selfe wyl swyfte witnes agaynst y• witch agaynst aduouterers false swearer yee agaiste wrongously kepe backe hyrelynges dewtye whiche vexe wyddowes offringes • gg • ••• • ▪ therfore ye cursed penury ye dissēble sorte pro 〈◊〉 b brynge euery tithe barne maye meat myne house proue withall sayeth lorde hoostes yf wyll open wyndowes heauen vnto poure hūbly y• lorde hoostes ••• xxi • 〈◊〉 xii • therfore may say proud happy deale vngodlynes set vp tempte god yet escape feare god saye thus one another y• lorde consydereth heareth yee memory boke wryten suche feare lorde remembre name day wyl make saieth lord hostes shalbe mine owne possession wyll fauoure lyke man fauoureth hys owne sonne doth ser uy • e turne therfore consydre difference betwyxte ryghteous vngodly betwixte serueth god hym serueth hym capi iiii psa •• iii • ▪ marcke daye commeth shall burne ouenand proude yee wyckednesse shalbe strawe day come shal burne vp sayeth y• lorde hoostes shal leaue nether rote braunche vnto feare name shall sonne ryghteousnesse aryse health shalbe vnder hys wyngesye shal go forth multyply fat calues ye shall treade downe vngodly psalm b shall lyke ash vnder sol youre fete daye shall make sayeth lorde hoostes remembre lawe moses seruaunte deu 4 v commytted vnto hym oreb israell statute ordynaunces beholde wyl sende mat xi • xvii b elia prophetbefore commyng daye greate fearfull lorde • shal turne hertes fathersluke • • chyldren hertes chyldren theyr father y• come smyte earthe cursynge ❧ ende prophecy malachy consequently al prophetes reader consideracion bokes foūde th • • ebrue tong receaued men folowing called hagriog • apha wōre reade openly comē secret aparte • e neyther founde hebrue • alde tonges haue long bene wrytten lesse happly booke sapiēce wher vp nowe harde repayre amende also receaued taken legyitymate leafull well hebrues whole church hierome wethwe haue separat set asyde may betterin pro loge prouer knowen intent men may knowe • oked witnes ought receued whiche sayde hierome speakyng boke iudith hagiogriphe sayth auctorite therof estemed worthy suffycyent confyrme stablysh thynges lyght disput acyon generally bokes called hagiogripha sayth men maye reade thē edyfying peplebut confirme strengththen doctrine church leaue law call canon c sanctum romana xv distine w • th hys iudgement lyke wyse blose c canones rvi distin sath men reade thē generall though shulde saye generally thorowly alowed without cause haue bene corrup • ch faisy • yed many place appeateth suffycyently eusebius boke called historia ecclesiastica thing easy knowen euenin iiii boke 22 chap dayes • certain poites • namely bokes ••• ce whose second boke hie cōfesseth found ī hebrue▪ meanes wherof become vnto v suspect lesse receaued lyke maner thyrde fourthe boke esdras whiche hierome protesteth thatin 〈…〉 log 〈…〉 wolde haue translated esteamyng thē fordreames iosephus yet hys boke hys autyquy • yes declateth summe matter maner story well boke machabeesin 〈…〉 13 〈…〉 • qu 〈…〉 • ii esdras al though esteame bokes cōpyled frō raygne king artaxerses vnto tyme agiogrtpha wherfore whē thou wylt maynteyne thing certem rēdringe reson thy fayth take heade proceade therin liuing piththy scripture folowyng peter whichi pet 〈…〉 pe 〈…〉 • ii p 〈…〉 sayth speaketh let speake though spake word god saith word god thyng true cert • opened prophetes apostle inspyred holy goost ofi co •• • eph 〈…〉 haue wytnesse moare cleare day lawers hauynge greate desyre confyrme stablyshin 〈◊〉 loge 〈…〉 iechonias • sonne made kynge steade whome kynge egypte putteth setteth brother ioachim ierusalein destroyed sedechis taken capi iosias helde feast easter ierusalem vnto lorde dewe passeouer y• xiiij oay first moneth set prestes also ordre accordyng theyr dayly course arayed long garmentes tēple y• lord spake vnto y• leuites holy minister israell shulde halow thē selues vnto lord set holy arcke lorde house kyng salomon sōne dauid buyl ded sayde ye shal nomore beare arcke vpon shulders serue lord take charge people israel village trybes accordynge kyng dauid kyng israel hath ordayned accordyng salomon sōne hath honorably prepared ye loke ye seruyce tēple accordynge ordring destribucion principal mē whiche appoynted tribe seruiceexod xii • child israel 〈…〉 25 • reg 23 • kyl passeouer prepare offringes brother accordynge commaundement y• lord giuen vnto moses vnto people y• founde iosias gaue xxx shepe lābes kyddes goates iij ox kynge kyngly liberalite gaue vnto y• people accordyng ꝓmysed prestes passeouer gaue ij shepe c ox moreouer iechonias semetas natha nael brethrē hasabias iehiel iosabao gaue thē passeouer v shepe v c bullockes thinges brought passe prestes leuites stode goodly theyr ordre vnleuened bred thorowe tribe ordring principal mē tribe offred vn lord syght people accordyngexod xii b wrytten boke moses rosted easter lābe according thāke offeringes dyght thē kettels pottꝭ set thē people wt good wyl afterwarde thē selues prestes prestes offred fat vntyl tyme expyred leuytes prepared thē selues theyr brethrē chyldrē aaron holy syngers also chyldrē asaph stode ordre accordyng dauyd deuised dyd asaph zachary iouthun appoyuted kyng moreouer porter dore kepers stode dores diligētly none wente standyng seruice theyr brother leuites prepared thē thus al thī ge performed belōged offeryng lord day helde passe ouer offred thank offerynges besyde sacrifyce lorde accordyng commaundement kyng iosias chyldrē israel thē present helde honorable passeouer teast swete bread vij dayes long yee passeouer kepte israel frō tyme y• prophete samuel al kinges israel helde suche easter kyng iosias helde prestes leuites iewes al israel thē y• ierusalē xviij yere raygne iosias passeouer kepte parfecte herte dyd kynge iosyas order al workes lorde thynges wrytten hym tymes paste concernynge synned vngodly agaynste lorde people soughte • ▪ worde lorde vpon israell 4 reg 2 • • 3 pu • • 5 • al actes kynge iosyas pharao kynge egypte wente vp came towarde carmis euphrates iosyas went mete sēt kyng egipt vnto iosias saying haue wt kyng iuda sent lord fyght agaynst y• war vpō euphrates go y• thy waye home agayne al y• hast iosias wolde turne agayne vpon charet vndertoke fyght agaynst herkened vnto worde y• prophete tolde hi mouth god pytched batayle agaynst felde mageddo prince preased kyng iosias sayd kyng vn seruaūtes cary awaye batayle sore woūded immediatly seruaūtes toke away front batayle sat vp vpon ye second charet came ierusalē died buried hꝭ father sepulcre al iewry mourned iosias yee ruler also wyues made lamētacion vnto day done euer styll israel thynges wryten boke story kynges iuda namely actes workes kynge iosias kyngly power maiesty vnderstandyng lawe god dyd yee thinges wryten boke kynges israel iuda 3 reg 33 • 2 pa 2 • people toke iechonias sonne iosias made kynge steade iosias father xxxiij yeare olde raygned ouer israel thre monethes y• kyng egypt put downe yt shulde raygne ierusalem raysed vp taxe people namely c talentes syluer one talente golde kynge egypt also made ioachim brother king iuda ierusalē thē kynges councel kyng selfe za ra ••• brother toke thē caried awaye presoners egypt fyue twentie yeare olde ioachim made kyng lāde iuda ierusalē dyd euyl lord 4 24 nabuchodonosor y• kyng babilō came vp bounde bandes yron caried vnto babylō nabuchodonosor also toke also vessel y• halowed tēple lord al iewels caryed thē vnto babilon brought thē owne tēple babylon vnclennes vngodlynes wrytten ye boke actes kinges ioachim sonne raygned steade made kynge beyng xviij yeare olde raygned thre monethes x dayes ierusalē dyd euyll lord yere nabuchodonosor sent caused brought vnto babylon wt holy vessel lord made sedechias brother kyng iuda ierusalē whē xxj yeare olde raygned xi yeare dyd euyll also syght lorde cared wordes yt spoken vnto hi •• e 36 • prophete ieremy mouth lorde made othe vnto kyng nabuchodonosor forswore hi selfe fel hauig styfneck hert trangressed statute ordinaunces lorde god israel ruler also heades people lord dyd much euyl became vngodly heathen beynge defyled al maner abhominacions yee defiled holy tēple lord ierusalē god theyr father sente messaungers vnto thē turne backe cal agayne frō sine wolde fayne haue spared holy tabernacle sake neuertheles messaū gers derision loke god spake vnto thē ꝓphetes made sport drewe longe tyll lorde wroth people vngodlynes tyl caused kynges y• cal dees come vp whiche slew yonge mē swerde yee euen compasse holy temple spared body neither yong olde nether maden yonge mā delyuered power kinges caldees al holy vessel lorde kynges treasure toke caried vnto babilō ••• • 9 • 〈◊〉 • house lorde wēt vp brent brake downe walles ierusalem set fyre vpon towres destroyed al noble buyldiges brought nought people slayne swearde caryed vn babylon thus became presoners bōde mē kyng babilon tyll delyuered raygned selues ••• 〈…〉 〈…〉 wordes lorde fulfylled whiche promysed mouth prophete ieremy tyl lande rest namely tyme lay waste rest quytnes lxxvij yeares ¶ cyru • gyueth lyeence ••• e returne ierusalem restoreth vessele temple • e letter sende artaxerses whiche ac • use iewes buyldynge cytie buyldyng • r • uen vntyll 11 yeare darius capi ii n • pat 36 • ▪ esdr owe kyng cyrus raygned uer persian lorde wolde perfourme worde promysed mouth prophet ieremy lorde raysed vp sprete cyrus kynge persian caused thys wrytynge proclaymed thorowe whole realme sayinge thus sayeth cyrus kyng persian lorde israel hye lorde hath made kynge lande commaunded buylde hym house ierusalē iewry nowe people lorde wyth hym go vp wyth hym ierusalem dwell rounde aboute place shall helpe whether yt wyth golde wyth syluer wyth gyftes horse necessary catell thynges brought wyth fre wyll house lorde ierusalem principall men trybes vyllages iuda beniamin stode vp dyd prestes also leuites lorde moued go vp buylde house lorde ierusalem helped al maner gold syluer catell also many lyberall gyftes thys dyd many one whose mynde stered vp • esdr • • • kynge cyrus also brought forth vessel ornamentes halowed vnto lorde whyche nabuchodonosor kynge babylō caryed awaye ierusalem consecrated hys idoll ymage deliuered mithrid atus treasurer delyuered salmanasar debyte iewry nōbre two thousande iiij c syluer boulle xxx syluer basens xxx basēs golde ij iiij c vessel syluer thousande besyde vessel gold syluer v viij c lx nōbred vnto salmanasar thē come agayne hym ierusalem captiuite babylon 〈…〉 iiii • nowe y• tyme kynge artaxerses kynge persia men balemus mithridatus sabellius rathimꝰ balthemus semelius scribe dwelt samaria place vnder y• dominiō therof wrote letter vnto kynge artaxerses wherin complayned vnto kynge iewry ierusalem letter made thys maner syr thy seruaūtes rathimus story wryter sabellius scribe iudges courte celosyrya phenyces knowen manifeste oure lorde kyng yt iewes come vp vnto v ierusalem rebellious wicked cytye begynne buylde agayne walles aboute set vp temple new yf cytie walles therof set vp agayne shall onely refuse geue trybutes tax also rebell vtterly agaynste kynge moch take thys hande aboute temple thought reasō thinke scorne shewe vnto oure lorde kynge certyfie hym therof thintent please kinge maye cause sought bokes olde thou shalt fynde soche warning wrytten shalt vnderstande cytie hath way bene rebelyous disobediēt hath subdued kynges cytyes iewes whiche dwell therin haue euer bene rebellyous obstynate vnfaythfull fyghtyng people whiche cause thys cytye wasted wherfore nowe certyfye lorde kynge yt yf thys cytye buylded occupyed agayne ye walles therof set vp new▪ thou canst haue passage celosyria phenices wrote kynge rathimus story wryter balthemus sabelius ye scribe ye officer dweller syria phenices thys maner haue red epistle thou sētest vnto haue commaunded make diligēt search haue founde yt cytie hath euen resysted kynges yt people dysobedient haue caused much warre myghty kynges haue raygned ierusalem whiche also haue raysed vp tax syria phenices wherof haue cō maūded people yt shal nat buylde cytie make nomore proceade forther buyldynge much myght cause warre displeasure vnto kynges nowe rathymus sabellius scribe ruler lāde • e • wrytynge kynge artaxerses gat together came haste ierusalem hoost horsmē muche people fote forbad thē buylde lefte buyldynge temple ierusalem vnto seconde yeare y• raygne darius kynge perseans ¶ dari • maketh feast thre sentenses thre yonge men whiche fyrst declared capi iii kynge darius made greate feast vnto hys seruauntes vnto courte offycers medea persia yee debytes ruler vnder hym india vnto ethiopia hundreth xxvij countres eaten droucken beynge satysfyed gone home agayne darius y• kynge wente chambre layed hym downe slepe awaked thē thre yong mē kepte kynges personne watched body cōmoned amonge thē selues spake one another let euery one v saye thynge loke whose sētence wyser excellent vnto hym shal kynge darius geue great gyftes clothe hym purple shall geue hym vessel golde dryncke clothes golde couerynges shal make hym costely charet brydle golde shall geue hym bonet whyte sylke cheyne golde aboute necke yee shalbe seconde pryncypall nexte vnto kynge datius hys wysdome shalbe called kynges kynsman euery one wrote meaning sealed layed vnder kynges pyllowe sayde kynge aryseth wyll geue hym oure wrytynges loke whose worde kyng chefe lordes iudge wysely spoken shall haue victory one wrote wyne stronge thynge seconde wrote kynge stronger thyrde wrote womē haue yet strength aboue al thynges trueth beareth awaye vyctory nowe kynge rysen vp toke theyr wrytynges delyuered thē vnto hym red sent forth call chefe lordes debytes ruler countrees medea persia set downe councell wryttynges red commaunded call ponge mē yt myght declare theyr meaninges selues mouth sente came kynge sayde vnto shewe v make v vnderstande thynges ye haue wrytten beganne fyrst spekē strength wyne sayde ye men p • xx • wyne meruelous strōge ouercommeth thē y• dryncke disceaueth y• mynde bringeth y• poore man kynge dotage vanyte thus doth also bonde man fre poore ryche taketh awaye theyr vnderstā dynge maketh thē carelesse mery none thē remembreth heuynes dette dewty causeth mā thynke also y• thynge doth honest good remembreth kynge auctoryte ought thynges moreouer men drynckynge forget frendshype brotherly fayth fulnes loue soone dronkē drawe y• swerde wyll fyght whē layed downe frō wyne rysen vp agayne nat tel dyd iudge ye nowe nat wyne y• strongest wolde el take hande suche thynges spoken thys helde tonge ¶ declar •• yon ii last sentence yonge mē propounded chapter whiche laste ••• ye beareth vyctory thynges moste commended alowed durius wryteth letter ruler vnder hym tha • shoulde • yde zo • ba • ell buyldynge ierusalefn capi iiii seconde sayde kyng stronger beganne speake sayenge ye men nat strongest moste excellēte ye cōquere lande see see earth nowe kynge lorde af thynges hath dominion thē loke cōmaundeth done sende men forth warfare go breake downe hylles walles towres slayne sleye men thē selues ouerpasse nat kyinges worde get victory bryng y• kynge spoyle lyke wyse y• medle nat warres fyghtynge tyl grounde reape brynge tribute vnto kynge yf kynge lone commaunde kyll kyll yf cōmaunde forgeue forgeue yf commaunde smyte smyte yf byd dryue awaye dryue awaye yf commaunde buylde buylde yf commaūde breake downe breake downe yf commaūde plante plante commen people ruler obedient vnto hym kynge meane season sytteth hym downe eateth drynketh taketh hys test kepte watch rounde aboute kynge nat one darre get hym waye owne busynes must obediēt vnto kynge worde iudge ye nowe ye mē howe shulde nat go farre aboue vnto men thus obedient whē spokē helde hꝭ tōge thyrde whose name zorobabel whiche spoken wemen trueth began saye maner ye men greate kynge multitude men neyther wyne excelleth hath lordshyp ouer haue wemen borne kynge people rule thinges haue wemen borne thē brought thē vp plāte vynes wherout wyne cōmeth make garmentes men geue honour vnto men without wemē cannot men lyue gather golde syluer precious thynges se faire well fauoured woman leaue together turne eye onely vnto y• woman gape vpon haue desyre vnto thē vnto syluer golde maner precious thynge eene • •• xix • • • • • b ephe v • man leaueth father y• brought hi vp leueth owne naturall countre cleaueth vnto womā yee • eopardeth lyfe womā remembreth nether father mother countre ye must nedes knowe wemen haue dominion ouer doth greue man taketh hys swerde goeth way steale kyll murther sayle vpon see seyth lyon goeth darckenes hath stollen disceyued robbed bryngeth vnto loue agayne man loueth wyfe better father mother yee many one y• renne theyr wyttes become bōdmen theyr wyues sake many one also haue peryshed haue ben slayne haue synned wemen beleue knowe kynge whiche great power al landes stande awe hym man dare laye hande vpon yet dyd se apame daughter great kyng bartacus kynges concubyne sat besyde kynge vpon ryght hande toke crowne head set vpon owne heade smote kyng left hande moreouer kynge loked vpon open mouth laughed vpon laughed also yf toke displeasure hī kynge fayne flatter gyue good wordes tyll gotten fauour agayne ye men wemen stronger greate earth hye heauē doth thinges thē y• kyng y• prince loked one vpon another beganne speake y• trueth ye men wemē stronger▪ greate earth hye heauen swyft course sonne▪ eccle cō paseth heauen roūde fetcheth course agayne owne place one daye excellēt dothe this▪ yee greate trueth stronger al thinges earth calleth vpō trueth heauen prayseth worckes shake tremble vnrightuous thynge wyne vnryghtuous kyng vnryghtuous wemē vnryghtuous al y• chyldren men vnryghtuous yee theyr workes vnryghtuous trueth thē theyr vnryghtuousnes also shall destroyed perysh trueth endureth alway strōgeesaye 〈◊〉 psal 〈◊〉 lyueth cōquereth euermore worlde without ende trueth accepteth personnes putteth differēce betwixt rych poore twyxt myghtye simple doth right vnto euery mā whether euil good men louyngly delte withal workes iudgement vnryghteous thyng strength kyngdome power magtesty euermore blessed thae god trueth helde tong people cryed sayd great trueth aboue sayde kynge vnto aske thou wylt appoynted wrytyng shall geue thou art founde wyser thy companyons thou shalt syt nexte called kynsmā sayd vnto kynge remembre thy promyse vowe whyche thou ha •• vowed promysed daye thou camest y• kyngdome buylde vp ierusalē sende againe al vessel iewels takē away ierusalem whiche cyrus seperated offred babylon wold sende thē agayne thy mynde buylde vp temple whiche edomytes brent ierusalem destroyed chaldee onely kynge thing requyre maiesty desyre aske thou perfourme vowe thou wt thyne owne mouth hast made vnto kynge heauen darius kynge stode vp kyssed hym 2 e •• 2 b 3 esor 6 wrote letter vnto al debites shreues al lordes noble shulde conuey forth thē y• wolde go vp wt buylde ieru salē wrote letter also vnto al y• shreues y• celosiria phenices vnto libanus shuld drawe •• dretre • lybanus vnto ierusalē buylde cytie withall moreouer wrote vnto iewes gone realme iewry ye fredome officer ruler shreue shulde come theyr dores theyr lande conquered shuld fre tributary ye edomites shulde geue ouer city village iewes whiche takē yee shulde yerely geue xx talentes buyldyng tēple vntyll tyme fynyshed dayly halowyng y• brent offerīges commaunded ten talentes yearely also come babylō buylde cytie shulde haue fre lybertie theyr chyldren prestes wrote greatnesse also commaū ded holy garmēt shulde geuē thē wherin ministred wrote commaundemētes shulde geuen leuites vntyll day house fyny shed ierusalem buylded vp commaūded watched cytie shulde haue theyr porcyons wage gaue ouer also al vessel cyrus seperated babylon cyrus geuen commaundemente charged also shulde done sent vnto ierusalem nowe yong mā gone forth turned face towarde ierusalem praysed y• kynge heauen sayde▪ commeth victory cōmeth wysdome clearenesse thy seruaūt blessed art thou hast geuen wysdome wyll prayse lord thou god father toke letter wēt vnto babylon came tolde thys vnto brother babylon praysed god father geuē refreshyng libertye go vp buylde ierusalē tēple wherin name lord called vpon reioysed instrumētes gladnesse seuen dayes longe ¶ returne ierusalem nombred begynne laye foundacyon tēple let meanes enemes buyldynge dryuen space two yeares capi v pryncypall men vyllages chosen trybes kynredes shulde go vp theyr wyues chyldren theyr seruauntes maydens theyr catel substaunce darius kyng sent thē thousande horsmen conuey safely vnto ierusalem theyr brother glad playeng vpon instrumentes syngyng caused go together wt name men whiche wente vp vyllages accordynge trybes preestes sonne phinehes sonne aaron iesus sonne iosedec ioachim sonne math •• zorobabel sonne salathiel kynred dauid y• kinred phares trybe iuda spake wōderfull thynges vnder darius kynge persia seconde yere raigne y• first moneth nisan also iewry came vp turned agayne vnto ierusalem captyuyte nabuchodonosor kynge babylon brought vnto babylon euery man sought hys porcyon agayne iewry hys cytye came zorobabel iesus nehemias saraias ra • laias el •• eu emmanius mardocheus beelserus mechpsa rochor oliorus emonias one theyre prynces nōbre thē accordynge theyr kynredes ruler chyldren phares two thousande hūdreth lxxij chyldren are iij c lvij sonnes anaas iij c lxx prestes sōnes ieddus sonnes euther sonnes el iasib iij c lxxij sonnes en • erus ij c lij sōnes fasurius iij c lvij sonnes carea ij c xxvij leuytes sonnes iesus ca •• hell
