barcus sonnes sarea sonnes coesi sonnes nasit sōnes agista sō ne pedon salomon sonnes sonnes asophot sonnes phazida sōnes cel • sōnes dedon sōnes gaddahel sōnes zapheus sonnes aggia sōnes sacharet sō ne sabathem sonnes saroneth sōnes malsit sonnes ania sonnes sasus sonnes addus sōnes suba sonnes eara sonnes rabotis sonnes phasphat sōnes malmon al ministred saynctuary seruauntes salomon euen iiij c lxxxij folowynge went vp chelmellat thelarsa whose prynees carmelā careth myght shewe forth theyr cyties kynreddes howe israel sōnes dalarus sonnes tuben sonnes nechodaicus prestes executed offyce presthode founde sonnes obia sonnes achisos sonnes addyn whiche maryed one daughter phargelen named alter wrytyng kinred sought register theyr generacion foūde therfore forbyddē execute office y• presthode unto thē sayd nehemias • haras shulde haue porcyon sā ctuary tyll rose vp hye prest well instructe playne clearenes trueth israel besyde seruaūtes maydens xlij c xl seruauntes maydens vij iij c xxxvj syngyng mē syngynge woman two hundreth lxv foure hundreth xxxv camel seuen thousande xxxvi horse two hundreth thousande xiv mule fyue xxv ass theyr heades also ruler tribe whē came ierusalem wo •• e buylde set vp temple god againe place gaue theyr avyl •• e vnto temple treasure seruice ye sāctuary xij poūdes golde fyue thousande syluer hundreth prestes garmentes owelt prestes leuites people went ierusalem countre aboute y• syngers also porter euery one israel owne lande e • • iii seuēth moneth came whē chyldrē israell euery mā busynes came al one cōsent court y• east dore stode iesua sonne iosedec brother prestes zorobabell sōne salathiel brethrē settyng vp aulter offre brent sacrifice vpō writtē lawe moses came people also coūtrees heathen al landes see vp ye aulter place offred sacrifice brent offerynges vnto lorde mornynge helde feast tabernacle 〈◊〉 〈◊〉 • num 〈…〉 commaunded lawe dayly offered accordnge made y• sacrifice appoynted offrīges also sabbathes newe mones holy feastes 1 esdr 3 b al vowed offerynges vnto lorde beganne newe mone vij moneth offre vnto god temple lorde yet buylded gaue vnto y• mason carpenter money meate drinke cherefulnesse unto sidon also tyre gaue carte shulde cary cedre tree libanus toystes beames shuld make shyppes hauen ioppe accordynge appointed ordained cirus kynge persyans second yeare came y• temple god ierusalem eccl 29 b c secōd moneth begāne zorobabel sonne salathiel iesua sonne iosedec brother prestes leuites come vnto ierusalem ot captiuite babylon layed foū dacion temple new mone second moneth y• secōd yere came iewry ierusalē appoynted leuitꝭ aboue xx yere olde vnto seruice lord iesua sonnes brother al leuites stode together perfourmed lawe ordinaunce house lorde prestes stode theyr garmentes trōpettes leuytes sonnes asaph cimbals geuyng thā kes prayses vnto lorde accordyng 1 par 16 b dauyd kynge israel ordayned song dyd syng vnto y• lorde matter psal 135 esay xii • syng vnto lorde gracious goodnes vpon israel endureth foreuer al y• people blew trompettes song loude voyce praysynge lord together rearing vp house y• lord 1 esor 3 came also among prestes leuites ruler elder accordig tribe kynredes sene house afore buyldyng temple greate crye great mournynge many also trōpettes great toy much trōpettes myght well hearde wepyng mournyng cōmen people blewe goodly vpon trō pettes myght harde farre 1 esor 4 came enemy tribe iuda bemamin knowe trompettyng noyse shawmes myght perceyue yt whiche come agayne captyuite wolde buylde temple vp newe vnto lord god israel went zorobabell iesua ruler village sayde vnto shal buylde also lyke wyse haue herde lorde walke maner dayes asbazareth kynge assiria brought v hyther zorobabel iesua ruler village israel sayde vnto mete ye shulde builde temple god wt v selues alone wyll buylde vnto lorde israel lyke 1 esdr 〈…〉 cyrus y• kyng persyās hath cōmaunded v heathen lande layde themselues agaynst yt iewry helde vp y• buylding layed wayt vpon preuely stopped brought thynge forbad buylde hidered yt made thē passage ye buildyng shuld finyshed cōtynued long kynge cyrus lyued put buylding space two yeres vntyl raygne kyng darius ¶ aggeus zachary prophecye buylde temple without let hynderaunce commaundemente darius capi vi notwithstandynge seconde yere raygne darius aggeus zachary sōne addo prophecied vpon iewry ierusalem nameagg 〈…〉 god israel 1 esdr▪ • zorobabell sone salathiell iesua sonne iosedec stode vp beganne buylde house lorde ierusalem prophetes lorde helped tyme came sysennes vnder shreue syrya phenices lande lordes companyons said vnto hath bydden commaunded buylde house make y• rofe al thynges agayne worcke men buylde neuerthelesse elder iewes suche grace lorde wolde letthough prouoked therto buylded styll vntyl kyng▪ darius certifyed therof answered receyued frō letter mē sent vnto king darius maner sysennes vnder shreue syrya phenyces landlordes wt theyr companyons head ruler syrya phenices sende theyr salutacion vnto darius kynge certyfy lorde kinge yt came lāde iewry went ierusalē founde buyldynge went ierusalē founde thē buylding great house god • ple great costely fre stone wt goodly tymbre walles yee make greate haste worcke helpe one another goeth forth prosperously handes great dylygence worship made asked elder commaūded make vp house building dyd intent myght certyfie perfectly write vnto name ruler worke gaue v thys answere seruauntes lord made heauen earth house 3 reg vi hath bene buylded set vp afore tyme great myghty kinge israel father prouoked god vnto wrath synned agaynste god israel • 24 25 iere 39 • ii gaue ouer power nabuchodonosor king babylon kynge caldees whiche brake downe house brent caryed awaye peple presoners vnto babilon • esdr • c neuertheles ye fyrst yeare yt kyng cyrus raygned babylon cyrus ye kynge wrote cō maunded buylde vp thys house agayne holy vessel golde syluer nabuchodonosor caried away ierusalem vnto babylon appropriated vn owne tēple brought cyrꝰforth againe delyuered zorobabel salmanasar vnder shreue commaundynge shulde bringe vessel ierusalem temple begynne y• tyme forthe buylde ye tēple agayne owne place thē salmanasat layed y• foūdacyō ye lordes house ierusalem euer sence haue buylded yet ended therfore kynge yf thou thynckest good let sought lybraries rolles kyng cyrus babylon yf founde theu yt buyldīge house lord ierusalem begon coūcel cō sent king cirus lorde kyng mynded let hym wryte vnto v therof • esd vi c • e iiii cōmaunded kynge darius seke lybraryes egbathanis lytle cyte medea ther founde wrytynge first yeare raygne cyrus king cyrus cōmaunded house ye lorde ierusalē shuld buylded agayne odour made ther cōtynually vnto ye lord whose heygth shalbe x cubites bredeth thre score cubites foure square thre hewen stone wt loft tymbre countre yee wt new loft expense therof geuen house kyng cyrus ornamētes golde syluer nabuchodonosor toke ye house ye lorde ierusalē shalbe set againe ye tēple ierusalem afore sysennes also vnder shreue syria phenices ye prynces cōpanions yt head ruler syria phenices shall medle haue thīge yt place cyrus haue commaunded also yt shal builde house lord whole vp haue ordeined helpe become captiuyte tyl house lord finished tribute taxing yearly raysed vp syria phenices diligently gyue certayne summe offeryng lord deliuered vnto zorobabel offycer ther withal may ordeine ox rammes lambes corne salt wyne oyle cōtinually euery yeare expences esor vi b prestes ierusalem shew made dayly shalbe geuen vnto without delaye y• may offer sacrifice dayly hyest god kynge seruauntes praye theyr lyues let proclamed also euery syde whosoeuer breaketh despyseth cōmaundemēt king shalbe hanged vpon galowes made hꝭ owne good goodes shalbe seasoned vnto ye king lord therfore whose name called vpon rote destroye al kynges peple vndertake vyolence hynder orto deale vnturteously wt house lord ierusalem daryus kynge haue ordeyned thynges shall done dylygence ¶ temple fynyshed dedicate feaste vnleuened brebde holden capi vii sysennes vnder shreues celosyrya phenyces landelordes companyons obeyed thynges kynge daryus ordeyned dylygent holy worckes felowe helper olde ruler iewes worke sanctuary wente forthe prospeted aggeus zachary ꝓphecyed perfourmed thynges thorow y• cōmaundement lord god israel deuyce cyrus darius artaxerses kynges persia thus oure house finished vnto xxiii daye moneth adde ni vi yeare kinge darius chyldren israel prestes leuytes come captyuyte ioyned vnto dyd accordynge written boke moses dedication temple offred hūdred ox two hundred rammes foure hundred lambes twelue goates ye synnes al ye people israel ye nombre trybes israel prestes also leuites stode arayed ye prestly garmētes y• tribe ouer al workes lorde god israell accordynge boke moses porter al dores chyldren israel ye come captyuite helde passeouer fouretene day fyrst moneth prestes leuytes sanctifyed ye came captiuyte sanctyfyed together leuytes sanctyfyed together al came captyuite killed easter lambe theyr brethrē prestes selues chyldren israel came captyuyte escaped frō abhominacyos y• heathen sought y• lorde kepte feast vnleaued bread seuen dayes longe eatyng drynckynge mery lord ye lord turned deuyse kynge assyria comforted theyr handes workes lorde god israel ¶ esdras causeth people assemble come together readeth law kepe feast tabernacle capi viii ano hym esd vii artaxerses kynge persyans raygned wente vnto hym esdras sonne saraias sonne azarias sonne helchiach sonne sallum sonne sadoch sonne achitob sonne amarias sonne azarias sonne boccus sonne abysu sonne phineas sonne eleazar sonne aarō fyrst preste esdras wēte vp babylon good vnderstandynge lawe moses geuē lord god israel taught done dede kyng fauoured dyd hym great worshyppe honour al hys desyres went vp wt also certayn chyldren israel prestes leuites syngers porter mynysters tēple ierusalem seuenthe yeare raygne kynge artaxerses fyfth moneth seuenth yeare y• raygne wēt babylon newe moone v moneth came hye waye ierusalē commaūdement lyke lorde prospered iourney esdras gat greate instruccyon shulde leaue none y• thinges behinde lawe commaūdementes god taught whole israel al ryghtuousnes iudgment came secretary kyng artaxerses delyuered wrytinges come frō artaxerses kynge esdras preste reder lawe ye lord thys copye letter kynge artaxerses sendeth hys gretynge vnto esdras preste reder lawe lorde frendshype good wyll haue ordeyned charged yf eny iewes prestes leuytes realme desyreth cōtent go vnto ierusalem yt maye therfore yf mided beare company let come together go y• lyke content seuen frendes coūcelers se ierusalem iewry kepe thynkes accordynge thou hast lawe lorde brynge gyftes vnto god lord israel frendes haue promysed ierusalem al syluer gold y• countre babylon vnto lorde ierusalem thyng geuen people lordes temple ierusalem yee syluer golde maye gathered ox rammes shepe goates yt belonge thynges may offer sacryfyces vnto ye lorde vpō aulter lorde ierusalem whatsoeuer thou thy brother wyll syluer gold thy mynde accordyng ye cō maundement lord thy god lykewyse wt holy vessel geuen tor y• seruyce y• house y• lord thy god ierusalem thīges soeuer necessary y• worcke temple thy god shal geuen y• kīges tresure loke thou wt thy brother wyl gold syluer wyll lord kyng artaxerses haue commaūded kepers y• treasure syria phenyces y• soeuer esdras preste reder lawe lorde doth wryte shalbe dilygently geuen hym tyl hundred talentes syluer golde lyke maner corne also hundreth measure tyl hū dreth vessel wyne plēteous thynges without nombre let thynges done law god vnto hyest god yt wrath god aryse nat realme kyng sonnes cōmaūde also ye requyre taxe tribute y• prestes leuytes syngers minister tēple writer mā haue auctorite medle thyng agaynst thē esdras set thou iudges arbyters whole lande syria phenices wysdome god learne al ignoraūt lawe god thy lord let al offende agaynst lawe diligently punyshed whether death payne condemned money banyshed sayde esdras wryter 1 esdr 7 blessed god father hath gyuē good minde wyl hert king magnifie house ierusalem hath made accepted sight kyng councell hys frendes noble stedfast mynde accordyng lord god helped chose mē israell go vp wt 1 esdr 8 b y• hedes kynredes house theyr father went vp babylon kyngdome artaxerses sonnes phares gersonius sonnes siemarith amenus sonnes dauid accus sonne cecilia sonnes phares zachary wt turned agayne hundreth fyftye men sonnes captayne moabylon zaraei ij c l men sōnes zachnes iechonias zecholy two hundreth fyftye men sonnes salamasias gotholy lxx sonnes zaphacia zaria mihely hym foure score sōnes iob abdias ieheli hym two hundreth twelue men sonnes ba • ia salimoth y• sonnes iosapha hym hundreth thre score men sōnes beer zachari behei two hundreth viij men sonnes esead iohannes ezecham hūdreth tenne men sonnes adoniram laste theyr name eliphalam sonne gebeil semeias hym lxx men called together water thia pitched tentes thre dayes mustered 1 esdr 8 b sonnes prestes leuites founde none sent vnto eleazar eccelom masmam malobam enaathan samea ioribimathan eunagan zachary mosollamum leders men experyence sente worde shulde come vnto loddeus whiche place treasury commaunded shulde speake vnto loddeus brother treasury sende v men myght execute prestes offyce house lorde god myghty hāde lord god brought vnto v mē good experience among sonnes moolius sonne leui sonne israel sebebiam sonnes hys brethrē asbin anin xviij amonge chyldren sonnes cananeus theyr sonnes xx men serued temple dauid ordeyned y• principall men ministred worcke vnto leuites temple two hundreth twentie men whose name tokened vp wrytynge • esdr cōmaūded fastyng vnto yonge men lorde myght desyre hym prosperous iourney good waye v yee v chyldrē catell layenges awayt durst requyre kyng horsmen fote men conuey v safely agaynst enemyes said vnto king power lorde god shulde wt seke hi wt theyr whole hert therfore besought god oure lord earnestly thynges merciful vnto v herd prayer seperated frō among ruler people prestes temple xij men sebebia asania ten men theire brother wt weied thē gold siluer al prestly ornamentes house god kynge coūcel prynces whole israel geuē weyed gaue hundreth fyfty talētes siluer būdreth talētes siluer vessel hūdreth talentes golde golden vessell seuen tymes twentye vessel metall yee good metal twelue glisteryng golde sayde vnto ye holy vnto lorde uessels holy golde siluer promysed vnto lorde god father dilygente nowe kepe vntyll tyme ye delyuer ruler people preestes leuytes princypall men cyties israel ierusalem chamber house1 esdr 8 god preestes leuytes whiche receyued golde syluer vessel brought ierusalem temple lorde ryuer thyawe brake vp twelueth day fyrst moneth tyll came ierusalem thyrde day past weyed golde syluer delyuered house lord god fourth day vnto marimoth sonne ior prest eleazar sonne phinees iosabdus sonnes iesnet medias sonne banus certaine leuites nōbre weyght weight thē wrytten vp tyme come captiuite offred sacryfyce vnto lord god israel euē twelue ox al israell lxxxvj ramines lxxij shepe xij goates sinne twelue kine thankofferyng al sacrifyce lord kynges cōmyssion delyuered vnto stewardes debytes kynge vndershreues celosyria phenices honoured people temple lorde 1 esdr ix nowe thynges done ruler came vnto sayd generacion israel prince prestes leuites straunge people indweller lande haue put awaye theyr vnclennesse cananites hethytes pheresytes moabites egyptiās edomytes bothe theyr sonnes haue mingled selues daughter holy sede mixte landysh heathen sen begynnyng theyr raygne haue ruler heades bene partaker theyr wyckednesse 1 esdr ix • sone herde thynges immediatly rent holy garmentes pulled heare head beerd sat downe sorowfull heuye al moued thorowe worde lord god israel came vnto yng sorowful wyckednes sat styl full heuynesse vntyl euenynge sacrifice stode vp fastynge hauyng rente clothes holy garment kneled downe vpon knee helde hā de vnto lorde sayde lorde cōfounded ashamed thy fa • e synnes become many vpon heades wyckednesses exalted vnto heauen sen tyme father great synne vnto daye synnes v father brother prestes haue bene delyuered vnto kynges earth swearde captiuite became spoyle confusion shame vnto thys daye nowe lorde god howe great mercy haue gottē • yu hast left v rote name y• place thy sāctuary discouer light house lord god hast geuē v meate tymes minystracyon captiuyte forsakē lord god made kynges persia gracyous fauourable vnto v gaue v vytayles meate yee leue buyld vp temple lord god agayne repayre wasted place syon dwell iewry ierusalem lord shall saye hauynge al thynges possessyon haue broken thy commaundementes thou gauest vn v hādes thy seruauntes ye prophetes sayeng lande ye go vnto geuē herytage haue possession defiled vnclēnes fylthynes heathen wt theyr abhominacion haue poluted al together therfore shal ye ioyne daughter vnto theyr sonnes mary sonnes vnto theyr daughter moreouer ye shall neuer seke make peace thē ye maye increase eate best lād ye maye deuide inheritaunce lande vnto youre child euermore thynge happeneth vnto v commeth wycked worckes great sinnes yet hast thou geuē v soch rote yt come agayne owne lande wycked yt haue broken thy statute cōmaundementes agayne mengled selues vnclennes outlandysh heathen lorde arte y• angrye v wylte thou rote v cleane rote name remayne lord god israel thou art true oure rote endureth yet vnto thys present day beholde synnes stāde 1 〈…〉 esdras wt thys prayer knoledged synne wepynge lyenge stat vpon grounde tēple gathered vnto hym ierusalē greate multitude men wemen yonge mē maydens greate wepyng mournynge cōgregacyon iechonias sōne iehely one chyldren israel cryed sayd vnto esoras haue synned lorde haue maried landysh wemē heathen nowe axt yu ouer israel wyll sweare othe therfore vnto lorde shall put awaye wyues whiche haue taken heathen theyr chyldren lyke appoynted oure fore elder stande vp open thou declare playnely vnto v accordynge lawe lorde matter belongeth vnto wyll helpe quite thy self manly esdras arose toke othe ruler prestes leuytes israel thynges sware ¶ esdras reade lawe people put waye theyr straunge wyues returneth euery man merely vnto hys owne dweyllynge capi ix esdras stode vp frō courte temple without went chamber ionath sōne nasabus • esdr x b remayned dyd eate meat dronke drynke multytude people made proclamacion iewry ierusalem gathered ierusalē captiuite yt soeuer came ierusalem within two thre dayes accordynge iudgement y• olde lordes councel goodes shulde taken hym excluded frō congregacion captyuyte thre dayes trybe iuda beniamin gathered together ierusalem twētyeth daye nynth moneth whole multytude sat trem blynge courte temple wynter esdras arose vp sayde vnto ye haue done vnryghteously ye haue takē outlandysh wiues mariage crease synnes israel nowe knoledge geue prayse vnto lorde god father perfourme wyll departynge heathen lande outlandy wyues cryed whole multytude loude voyce sayd lyke y• hast spoken wyll much y• people many wynter may nat stāde without house agayne thys worke nat thynge yt fynyshed daye two many y• haue synned thynges ordeyne therfore ruler multytude yt dwell v many haue outlandysh wiues y• prestes also iudges euery place may stāde tyme appoynted tyi swage wrath lorde busynes ionathas sonne ezely ozias thecan receaued charge matter bozoramus leius sabatheus helped therto thys stode vp come captyuyte esdras prest chose vnto hym pryncypall men amonge father accordynge theyr name newe mone tenth moneth sat together examen thys matter matter determynynge concernynge men outlandysh wyues vntyl newe mone fyrst moneth prestes myxte selues outlandysh wyues founde 1 esdr x • sonnes iesu sonne iosedec hys brother mazeas eleazar ioribus ioadeus whiche offred selues put awaye theyr wyues offre ramme theyr ignoraunce sonnes semmeri masseas es • elech azarias sōnes fosera limosias hismaen nathanea iussio ieddus talsas leuytes iosabdus semeis colnis caletas fa • tea colnas elionas syngers sanctuary eliarib zackarus porter sallumus tolbanes israel chyldren foro osi remias geddias melchias michilus eleazarus iemmebias bannas chyldrē iolamā chamas • zachari ieizrelus ioddius erimoth elia y• sonnes iathoim eliadas liasamus zochias larimoth sabdis tebedias sonnes zebes iohannes amanias zabdias emineus y• sonnes bannꝰ olāmus maluchus ieddus iasub asabus ierimoth y• sonnes addin naatus moosias caleꝰ raanas mansuas mathathias besel bannꝰ manasses sōnes naue none afeas melchias sameas simon beniamin malchus marras sōnes asom carianeus mathathias ba • nu eliphalach manasses seme • sonnes bauues ieremy moodias abramas ioel baneas peliaas iona marimoth eliasib mathaneus eliasis ozias dielus semediꝰ zambris ioseph sonnes nobeus idelus matha thias sabadꝰ zecheda sedmi iesseus baneas bad taken outlādysh wemen mariage put thē waye theyr chyldren prestes leuites israel dwelt ierusalem thorowout lande newe moone seuenth moneth chyldren israell theyr dwellynges whole multitude came together vpon floore east syde holy porte tēple spake vnto esdras hye preste reader wolde brynge lawe moses whiche geuen lorde god israel esdras hye prest brought y• lawe vnto whole multitude thē mā womā prestes y• myght heare y• lawe ii esd iii • • esdr iii n newe mone y• vii moneth red flore y• holy porte temple frō mornyng early vnto euenynge men wemen applyed theyr mynde vnto lawe esdras prest reader lawe stode vp vpon pulpy • wodde whiche made therfore vpon ryght hande stode hym mathathias samus ananias azarias uria ozechias balsamus upon lefte hande stode faldeus misael malachias abuschas sabus nabadias zachary toke esdras boke whole multytude pryncypall honoure red lawe stode al strayght vpō theyr fete esoras praysed lorde hye god y• almyghty god hostes people answered amen helde vp theyr handes fell downe flat vpō earth praysed lorde iesus eeneas sarebias iaddimus accubus sabbatheus cal •• he azarias ioradus ananias philia leuites lyft handes vpwarde bowed face grounde praysed lorde taught law lord red lawe lord congregacion euery man set vnderstode lawe spoke atharates vnto esdras hye prest reder leuites taught multytude saying thys daye holy vnto lorde hearde lawe wepte edsras sayde 2 esdr • • departe youre waye eate y• best drynke swetest sende gyftes vnto haue nothynge daye holy vnto lorde nat ye sory lorde wyll brynge honoure leuytes shewed openly saynge daye holy ye sory wente theyr waye euery chone dyd eate dryncke mery sente rewardes vnto nothynge y• also myght eate gladnesse excedyngly reioysed thorowe wordes red vnto lawe gathered together ierusalem holde feast accordynge couenaunte lorde god israel ende thryde boke esdras ❧ iiij booke esdras ¶ people reproued theyr vnthanckfulnes god wyll fynde another people yf wyll nat enformed capi seconde booke prophete esd▪ v •• • esdr • • esdras sōne saraias y• sōne azarias sonne helchia sōne sallum sonne sado • y• sonne achitob sonne achia sonne phinees sonne hely sōne amerias sōne azarias sōne maraioth sōne sarahias sōne uzi sonne boccus y• sonne abisu sonne phinees sōne elezar sonne aaron trybe liue presoner lande mades raygne artaxerses kynge persia esay 〈…〉 worde lorde came vnto saying go thy waye people theyr synful dedes theyr chyldren theyr wyckednesses whiche haue done agaynst may tell theyr chylders chyldren sinnes theyr father increased haue forgotten haue offred vnto straunge goddes nat euen brought lande egypt frō house bondage haue prouoked vnto wrath despised councels pull thou hearre thy heade cast euell ouer haue nat bene obediente vnto lawe people without lernynge nourtoure howe longe shall forbeare vnto haue done muche good num 21 iosu 8 10 xii many kynges haue destroyed theyr sake exo xiiii g pharao seruauntes power haue smytten downe slayne nacions haue destroyed roted thē east haue brought two landes people nought euen tyre sydō haue slayne theyr enemyes speake thou therfore vnto sayinge thus sayeth lorde exo xiiii • led thorowe see haue geuen sure stretes sēse begynnynge exo iii b gaue moses youre captayne aaron prest •• xviii exo xiii gaue lyght pyler fyre greate wonder haue done amonge yet haue ye forgotten sayeth lorde thus sayeth almyghte lorde gaue quayles eate tentes youre succoure neuertheles ye murmured ascribed vyctory youre enemyes vnto name yee thys daye ye yet mur moure benefytes y• haue done ye hongrye wyldernes •• 〈◊〉 • dyd ye nat cry vnto saying hast thou brought v wyldernes kyll v bene better v haue serued egypcyans dye thys wyldernesse pytye vpon youre mournynges gaue manna eate ye dyd eate angel foode sapi xvi • num xx b ye thyrstye dyd nat hewe hardestone caused water flowe therout heate couered leaues tree good pleasaunte fat lande gaue cast cananites pheresytes philystines esa v • shall sayeth lorde thus sayeth y• almyghtye lorde ••• xv • whē ye ware wildernes water amorytes beynge thyrst blasphemynge name gaue nat fyre blas phemyes cast tree water made ryuer swete shal vnto iacob thou iuda woldest nat obeye deut 32 • wyll turne another people vnto wyt geue name may kepe statute sayng ye haue forsaken wyl forsake also ye desire gracious vnto shal haue mercy vpon esa • ye call vpo wyll nat heare ye haue defyled youre handes bloude youre fete swyft commyt manstaughter ye haue nat forsaken maner youre owne selues sayeth lorde thus sayeth almyghtye lorde haue nat prayed father sōnes mother daughter norsse yonge babe ye wolde people shulde youre god ye wolde chyldren shulde owne father math 23 gathered together henne gathereth chekens vnder wynges nowe shall vnto shal cast fro face esaye • • lxv ye offre vnto shal turne face solempne feast dayes youre newe moones circumcysyons haue forsake sent vnto seruaūtes prophetes ye haue taken stayne torne theyr bodyes peces whose bloude wyll requere youre handes sayeth lorde thus sayeth almyghty lorde house must desolate wyll caste wynde doth strawe youre chyldrē shall nat fruteful haue despysed commaundement done thynge euell youre house wyl geue vnto people shall come esa • xv • r • ma▪ x • neuer harde shall beleue vnto neuer shewed tokē shall thyng y• cōmaunde thē haue sene prophetes yet shall call theyr synnes remembraunce knowledge reporte vnto grace y• wyl people come whose child reioyse gladnes though haue sene bodely eye yet sprete beleue thing saye nowe brother beholde greate worshyppe se people cōmeth frō east vnto wyl geue dukedom esa xli luke xiii f mat viii abraham isaac iacob oseas amos micheas ioel abdy ionas naum abacu • sophony • aggeus zachary malachy called also angell messenger lorde capi ii synagoge syndeth faute owne chyldrē gentles called thvs sayeth lorde brought thys people bondage gaue commaundementes seruairtes prophetes whiche wholde nat heare despysed counsel mother bare sayeth vnto go youre waye ye chyldren wyddowe forsaken brought vp gladnesse sorowe heuynes haue loste ye haue synned lorde youre god done thynge euell hym shall nowe vnto wyddowe forsaken go youre waye chyldrē aske mercy lorde father call vpon wytnesse ouer mother chyldren whiche wolde kepe couenaunt thou brynge confusyon theyr mother spoyle beare let theyr name scatred abroade amonge heathen let put earth haue thought scorne couenaunte wo vnto assur thou hydest y• vnryghtuous thou wycked people remēbre gene xix • dyd vnto sodome gomorre whose lāde turned pytch asshes euen also wyll vnto heare sayeth y• almyghty lorde thus sayeth lorde vnto esdras tell people yt wyl geue thē kyngdome iesusalem whiche wolde haue geuen vnto israel theyr glory also wyll take vnto geue euerlastynge tabernacle whiche prepared tree lyfe shalbe vnto swete smellynge oyntement shall neyther laboure weery go ye youre waye ye shall receaue praye youre selues fewe dayes yt maye dwel therin nowe kyngdome prepared therfore watche take heauen earth witnesse haue broken euell peace created good lyue sayeth lorde mother embrace thy chyldren brynge thē vp gladnesse make theyr fote fast py • er haue chosen sayeth y• lorde dead wyll rayse vp agayne theyr place brynge graues haue knowen name israell feare nat thou mother chyldren haue chosen sayeth lorde thy helpe shall sende seruauntes esay ieremy whose councel haue sanctifyed prepared twelue tree loded dyuerse frutes many welles flowynge mylke hony seuen moūtaynes whervpon growe rose lylyes wherin wyll fyll chyldren ioye execute iustyce wyddowe iudge fatherles geue poore defende comforteles clothe y• naked heale wounded sycke laugh • lame man scorne defende crepel let blynde come syght clearnes kepe old yonge within thy walles tobi whersoeuer thou fyndest dead take burye shal geue ty • st place resurreccyon holde styll people take thy rest thy quietnes come feade thy chyldren thou good norsse stablysh theyr fete seruauntes haue geuen shall nat one perysh wyl seke thy nōbre vexe nat thy selfe daye trouble heuynes cōmeth shall wepe sorowfull thou shalt mery plenteous heathē shalbe gelous shalbe able nothynge agaynst sayeth lorde handes shall couer thy child shal nat se fyre enerlastyng ioyfull thou mother thy chyldren wyll delyuer sayeth y• lorde remembre thy deed chyldren shall brynge earth shewe mercy vnto mercyfull sayeth lorde almyghty embrace thy chyldren vntyll come shewe mercy vnto welles runne ouer grace shall nat fayle esdras receaued charge lorde vpon mount oreb shulde go vnto israell came vnto israell set naught despised commaundemente lorde therfore saye vnto ye heathē heare vnderstande loke youre shepherde shall geue euerlastynge rest nye hande shall come ende worlde readye rewarde kyngdome euerlastynge lyght shall shyne vpon euermore fle shadowe worlde receaue ioyfulnes glory testifie sauyour openly receaue gyfte geuen glad geuynge thankes vnto hym y• hathe called heauenly kyngdome aryse vp stande faste beholde nombre sealed feast lorde whiche departed shadowe worlde haue receaued gloryous garmentes lorde take thy nombre syon shut vp thy puryfyed whiche haue fulfylled lawe lorde nombre thy chyldren thou longedest fulfylled beseche power lorde thy people whiche haue bene called frō begynnynge maye halowed 〈…〉 esdras sawe vpon mount syon great people coulde nat nombre prysed lorde songes thankesgeuynge myddest yonge man hye stature excellente al vpon euery one theyr heades set crowne euer higher higher whiche marueled greatly asked angel sayd syr answered sayde vnto haue put mortall clothynge put immortal haue testifyed knowledged name god nowe crowned receyue rewarde sayde vnto aungell yonge personne crowneth geueth thē palmes theyr handes answered sayde vnto y• sonne god haue knowledged worlde begāne greately cōmende thē y• stode styfly name lord angel sayd vnto go thy way tell people maner thinges howe greate wonder lorde thy god thou hast sene ¶ wonderous workes whiche god dyd people recited esdras marueleth god suffreth babiloniās▪ haue rule ouer people yet siners also capi iii thyrtyeth yeare fall cytie babylon laye troubled vpon bed thoughtes came vp ouer herte sawe desolacion syon plentuous wealthe dwelte babylon sprete sore moued beganne speake ferefull wordes hyest sayd lorde lord thou spakest begynnyng thou plantedst earth thy selfe alone gauest commaundement vnto people body vnto adā whiche creature thy handes hast brethed brethe lyfe lyued thou leddeste paradyse whiche garden pleasure thy ryght hande plāted euer y• earth made vnto thou gauest commaundemente loue thy way whiche trāsgressed immedyately thou appoyntedst death hym g • neracions hym came nacyons trybes people kynreddes nombre •••• vi • euery people walcked owne wyll dyd nyce thynges thy cōmaundementes despysed •• ne vii • processe tyme thou broughtest water floude vpon dwelte worlde destroyedst lyke death adam y• water floude also neuerthelesse one thē thou leftest namely noe house holde whome came ryghtuous men happened dwelt vpon earth beganne multyplye gotten many chyldren great people begāne vngodly thē fyrste nowe lyued wyckedly gene 12 15 thou dydest chose man frō amonge whose name abraham thou louedst vnto hym onely thou shewedst thy wyl madest euerlasting couenaunt hym promysynge thou woldest neuer forsake sede 〈…〉 vnto thou gauest isaac vnto isaac also thou gauest iacob esau 〈◊〉 iacob thou dydest chose put ba ••• esau iacob became greate multytude happened thou leddest sede egypt 〈…〉 thou broughtest thē vp mounte syon bowyng downe heauens settynge fast earthe mouynge grounde makyng depthes shake troublynge worlde thy glorye went thorowe foure partes fyre earthquake wyndes colde tho • myghtest geue lawe vnto sede iacob diligēce vnto y• generacion israel yet tokest thou away wycked herte y• thy lawe myght brynge forth frute fyrst adam • •• wycked hert transgressed ouercome borne 〈◊〉 〈…〉 thus remayneth wickednes th 〈…〉 herte people wt wycke •••• rote good departed away euyll abode styll tymes passed awaye yeares brought ende 1 〈…〉 dydest thou rayse vp seruaūt called dauid 2 reg thou cōmaū dedst buylde cyte vnto thy name offre vp incense sacryfyce vnto therin done nowe many yeares thē inhabiters cyte forsoke thīges dyd euē adā al generacions done also wicked hert thou gauest thy cyte ouer handes thyne enemyes babylon thē better ryghtuous thy people shall therfore haue domynyon syon came sawe theyr vngodlynes greate wyckednesse coulde nombred • yee soule saw many euyl •• thyrtye yeare herte fayled sawe thou suffredst vngodlynes sparest wicked doe • thyne owne people hast thou roted preserued thyne enemyes hast thou shewed cannot perceyue howe thys happened babylon better syon people knoweth sauynge people israel generacion hath beleued thy couenaūtes iacob yet theyr rewarde appeareth theyr labour hath frute haue gone thorow y• heathen se riche wealthy thyncke vpon thy cōmaūdementes wey thou therfore wyckednesse balaūce also yt dwel worlde shal thy name foūde israel people vpon earth hath sined people hath kept thy cōmaundemētes thou shalt fynde israel name hath kepte thy preceptes people heathen ¶ angell reproueth esoras semed entre profounde iudgementes god capi iiii angel sent vnto whose name urtell gaue answere said thy hert hath takē much vpon ti worlde yu thynkest cō prehende way hyest sayd yee lorde answered sayd sent shew thre wayes set forth thre symylitudes wherof yf thou caust declare one wyll shewe also waye thou desyrest se shall shewe frome whence wycked herte commeth sayde tell lorde sayde vnto go thy way weye weyght fyre measure blaste wynde cal agayne daye past answered sayde man borne able requyrest thou said vnto shulde aske howe depe dwellynges see great water springes vpon firmamēt great water springes begynnynge depe whiche goynges paradyse peraduenture thou woldest saye vnto neuer wente downe yet depe hel neither dyd euer clime vp heauen neuerthelesse nowe haue asked onely fyre wynde day thorow thou hast trauayled thou canst seperated yet canste thou geue answree sayd moreouer vnto thyne owne thinges suche growne vp canst thou knowe howe shuld thy vessel able comprehende waye hyest nowe outwardely corrupte worlde vnderstāde corrupcion euidēt sight saide vnto better shulde lyue wyckednesse suffre knowe wherfore answered sayde wente wod iudi ix • 2 pat • tree toke deuyse sayd come let v go fyght see may depart away v maye make v yet woddes floudes see also lyke maner toke thys deuyse sayde come let v go vp fyght agaynst tree wood yt maye make lande wyder thought deuyce wod vaine nothing worth fyre came consumed wod thought floudes see came likewise naught also sande stode vp stopped thou iudge nowe betwyxte two woldest thou iustyfie whome woldest thou condemne answered sayd uerely folyshe thought haue deuysed grounde geuen vnto wod see also hath place floudes answered sayde thou hast geuen ryght iudgement iudgest thou thyselfe also lyke grounde geuen vnto wod see floudes euen eso •• 〈◊〉 iohan • ▪ • 1 corin •• yt dwell vpon earth may vnderstande nothyng whiche vpon earth dwelleth aboue heauēs may vnderstand thynges y• aboue heauens answered sayd beseche y• lord let haue vnderstandynge mynde curyous thy hye thinges suche dayly medle withall namely wherefore israell blasphemed heathē cause people thou euer hast loued geuen ouer punisshed vngodly nacyons y• lawe father brought naught wrytten couenauntes come none effecte passe away worlde greshoppers life feare worthy optayne mercye wyll vnto name called vpō ouer v thīges haue asked questyon answered sayde thou searchest thou shalt mar •• ile worlde hasteth fast passe awaye cannot comprehende thinges y• promysed rightuous tyme come • iohn v • worlde ful vnryghtuousnes weakenes concernynge thinges wherof thou askest wyll tell euyll sowed destruccion thereof yet come yf euyl nowe sowed turned vpsyde downe yf place euyll sowne passe awaye cannot thyng come sowne good corne euyll sede hathe bene sowne • man begynnyng muche vngodlines hath brought vp vnto tyme muche shall yet brynge forth vntyll come barne pōdre nowe thyself whē corne euyll sede cut downe howe great barne shall fyll answered sayde howe whē shall thinges come passe wherfore yeares fewe euyl answered sayinge hast thou muche vpon hyest thy hastynes aboue vaine thou makest much soules also y• rightuous aske questyon thynges theyr holynes saying • pora 6 b howe long shall hope thys fashyon cōmeth frute barne reward vpon ieremiel y• archangel gaue thē answere sayd euē y• nōbre sedes filled hath weyed y• world balaūce mesure nōbre hath measured y• tyme moueth vntyll y• measure fulfylled thē answered said lord lord al ful sine sake peraduenture yt barne ryghtuous shal fylled sine thē dwel vpon earth answered sayd go thy waye womā chylde aske whē hath fulfylled nyne monethes yf chyldebed may kepe y• birth longer sayd lorde sayde vnto hell secret place soules lyke preuy chambre woman lyke woman trauayleth maketh haste tyme necessyte byrthe hande euen doth haste delyuer commytted vnto loke thou desyrest se shall shewed begynnynge answered sayde haue foūde fauoure thy syght yf possyble yf mete therefore shewe whether come past paste come paste knowe come knowe sayde vnto stande vp vpon ryght syde shall expounde symylitude vnto stode behold whote burnynge ouen wente ouer happened flamme gone smoke vpper hād • went ouer watery cloude sent downe much rayne storme stormy rayne past droppes remayned styll sayde vnto lyke rayne droppes fyre exceadeth smoke euen measure thynges past hath vpperhande wente droppes smoke aboue prayed sayde may lyue thynkest thou vntyll tyme shall happen dayes answered sayde tokēs wherof thou askest may tell parte touchynge thy lyfe may shewe sent therfore ¶ esdras angell comen together capi v neuerthelesse concernynge token marke beholde dayes shall come whiche dwell vppon earth shalbe taken greate nombre waye trueth shalbe hyd land shalbe baren fayth mat 24 • iniquite shal haue vpperhande lyke thou hast sene nowe thou hast herde longe ago y• lande thou seyst haue rule shalt thou shortly se waste yf god graunte lyue thou shalt se thyrde trō pet sūne shal sodenly shyne againe night mone thre time ī day bloude shall droppe wodde stone shall geue voyce people shalbe vnquyete euen shall rule hope dwell vpon earthe foules shall flyt sodomytshe see shall cast fysh make noyse night many shall knowe shall heare voyce therof shalbe cōfusion also many place fyre shalbe oft sent agayne wylde beastes shall go theyr waye menstruous wemen shall beare monstres salt water shall founde sw • te • one frende shal fyght agaynst another shal wyt vnderstandyng hyd put aside īto secrete place shalbe sought many yet foūde • shal vnryghtuousnes voluptuousnes haue vpperhande vpon earth one lāde also shal aske another say ryghtuousnes gone thorowe shall saye tyme shall men hope nothynge optayne shall laboure theyr wayes shall prospere shewe suche token haue leue yf thou wylte praye agayne wepe nowe fast seuen dayes thou shalt heare yet greater thinges awaked fearefulnes went thorowe body mynde feble carefull almost sowned withall angell come talke helde cōforted set vpon fete seconde nyght happened ye salathiel captayne people came vnto saying hast thou bene thy countenaunce heuy knowest thou israel cōmitted vnto lande theyr captiuite eate forsake v y• shepherde leaueth flocke handes wycked wolues sayd vnto hym go thy way fro come nye herde said went way fro fasted seuē dayes mournyng wepyng lyke uriell angel cōmaunded seuē day happened y• thoughtes herte greuous vnto agayne soule receyued sprete vnderstandyng beganne talke moste hyest agayne sayde lorde lord euery wood earth tree therof • thou hast chosen one onely vyneyarde landes whole worlde thou hast chosen one pyt al floures grounde thou hast chosen one lylye depthes see thou hast fylled one ryuer buylded cyties thou hast halowed syon vnto thy selfe al foules created thou hast named one doue catell made thou hast prouyded one shepe amōg multytudes folckes thou hast gotten one people vnto people thou louedst thou gauest law proued nowe lorde haste thou geuen one people ouer vnto many vpon one rote thou hast prepared hast thou seat • ed thy one onely people among many whiche treade downe yee whiche haue euer withstande thy promyses neuer beleued thy couenauntes thoughe thou werest enemye vnto thy people yet shuldest thou punysh thyne owne hādes nowe whē spokē wordes y• angell y• came y• nyght afore sente vnto snyde vnto heare herken thynge say shal tel said speke lorde sayd vnto thou arte sore vexed troubled israel sake louest thou people better thē hym made sayd hym lorde grefe cōpassion haue spoken reines payne euery hour wolde haue experiēce way ye hiest seke parte iudgmēt sayde vnto y• thou mayest sayde wherfore lorde vnto borne mother childbed graue sene misery trouble iacob trauaile people israel sayd vnto nōbre thynges yet come gather together y• droppes ye scatred abroade make floures grene agayne withered opē thyng closed bryng forth wyndes ye shut vp shewe ymage voyce shal declare thyng thou labourest knowe sayde lord lord may knowe thinges hath dwellynge men vnwyse howe may speake thynges wherof thou askest sayde vnto lyke yu cāst none thīges haue spoken euē canst thou fynde iudgement ende y• loue haue promysed vnto people sayd beholde lorde yet art thou nye vnto haue ende shall y• haue bene nowe shall come v sayde vnto wyll lyken iudgemente vnto ryng lyke slackenesse last euen swyftnesse y• fyrste answered sayd couldest thou make haue bene made come one thou myghtest shewe thy iudgemente soner answered sayde creature may haste aboue maker neither may worlde holde thē shalbe created sayde howe hast thou sayde vnto thy seruaunte thou lyuynge maker hast made creature lyuynge creature bare euē might also beare present sayde vnto aske chyldebed womā saye vnto thou bryngest forth chyldren doest thou gether one another praye therfore brynge forthe ten chyldren sayde cannot muste one another sayde vnto euen haue geuē chyldebed vnto earthe y• sowen vpō processe tyme lyke yong chylde may bryng forth y• thinges belong aged euē haue dayned worlde made asked sayd seyng thou hast nowe geuen awaye wyl speake mother thou hast tolde yet yonge nowe draweth nye vnto age answered sayde aske womā beareth chyldren shall tell y• say vntō wherfore thou haste nowe brought forth lyke y• lesse stature shall answere borne youth strēgth one fashyon borne tyme age chyldebed fayleth wise consydre nowe thy selfe howe ye lesse stature yt yt come lesse thē ye creature begynne old haue passed ouer strength youth sayd lord beseche yf haue founde fauoure thy syght shewe thy seruaunt whome doest thou vyset thy creature ¶ angel instructeth esdras geueth hym answere questyons capi vi sayde vnto begynnyng grounde made world stode euer windes blew thondred syghtned euer foundacions paradyse layed fayre floures sene euer mouable power stablished innumerable multitude angel gathered together euer highness ayre lyfted vp afore measure firmament named euer chimneis syon hote present yeres sought euer inuencyons nowe synne put asyde sealed nowe gather fayth treasure dyd consydre pondre thynges made thorowe thorowe none also ended none answered sayde whiche shall partynge asunder tymes shalbe ende fyrst begynnynge folowethe sayd vnto abraham vnto isaac iacob esau borne hym iacobs hande helde fyrste hele esau esau ende world iacob begynnyng foloweth hande man betwyxte hele hande questyon esdras aske thou answered sayde lord lord yf haue founde fauour thy syght besech shewe thy seruaunte ende thy token wherof thou shewedst parte last nyght answered sayde vnto stande vp vpon thy fete heare perfecte voyce sounde shall come greate mocyon place thou standest shall moued therfore whē thou herest wordes afrayed ende shall worde foundacyon earth vnderstand worde therof trembleth quaketh knoweth muste chaunged ende happened y• hearde stode vp vpon fete herkened beholde voyce spake sounde lyke y• sounde many water sayde beholde dayes come wyll begynne drawe nye vyset dwell vpon earth wyll begynne make inquisycion haue hurt equite vnryghtuousnes low estate syon shalbe fulfylled worlde shall vanyshe away shalbe ouersealed wyll token bokes shalbe opened firmament shall se together chyldrē yere olde shall speake voyces wemen chylde shall brynge forth vntymely chyldren thre foure monethes olde shall lyue raysed vp sodēly shall sowen place appeare vnsowen full store house shall sodenly founde emptye trompet shall geue sounde whē euery mā heareth shalbe sodenly afrayed mich vii math x c ye tyme shall frēdes fight one agaynst another lyke enemyes earthe shall stande feare sprynges welles shall stande styll thre houres shall renne whosoeuer remaineth frō thynges haue told shall escape se saluacyon ende worlde men haue receyued shall se haue tasted deathe theyr byrth hert dweller shal chaunged turned another meanynge euyll shalbe put disceyte shalbe quenched fayth shall floryshe corrupcion shalbe ouercome truth hath bene longe without frute shalbe declared happened talked wt loked demurely vpon whome stode wordes sayde vnto come shewe tyme nyght come yf thou wylte praye yet fast seuen dayes agayne shall tell thinges greater thy voyce hearde hyest y• myghtye hathe sene thy ryghtuous dealynge hath sene also thy chastyte thou hast euer sence thy youth therfore hathe sent shewe al thynges saye vnto good comforte feare hast wt tymes paste thyncke vayne thynges make haste latter tymes happened wept agayne fasted seuen dayes lyke maner y• myght fulfyll thre wekes tolde eyght night hert vexed withi agayne begāne speke hyest sprete greately set fyre soule destresse sayd lord thou spakest vnto thy creature frō begynnyng euen fyrst daye saydest • ene let heauen earth made thy worde perfecte worcke sprete darckenesses yet euery syde sylence man voyce yet cōmaunded thou fayre lyght come forth thy treasure thy workes myght appere sene upon seconde daye thou made est sprete firmament commaūdest part sunder make deuysion twixte water one parte myght remayne aboue beneth upon thyrde day thou broughtest passe water gathered seuēth part y• earth sixe partes hast thou dryed vp kepte thyntent mē myght sowe occupye husbandry therin soone thy worde wente forth worcke made immediatly greate innumerable frute many diuerse pleasure desyres tēptacyon floures chaungeable coloure smel done thyrde day gen • • upon iiij daye thou cōmaundedst y• sunne shuld geue shyne mone lyght starres dydest thou set ordre gauest thē charge seruyce euen vnto man made upon fyfth daye thou saydest vnto seuenthe part deut▪ •• water gathered thatgene • shulde brynge forthe diuerse beastes foules fysshes came passe domme water without soule brought forth lyuynge beastes commaundement god people myght prayse thy wonderous worckes dydest thou preserue two soules one thou calledst enoch leuiathan didest seperate one seuenth parte namely water gathered together myght holde bothe unto enoch thou gauest one parte whiche dryed vp thyrde daye shulde dwel part wherin thousande hylles vnto leuiathan thou gauest seuēth part namely y• moyst haste kepte deuoure thou wylte whan upon syxte daye thou gauest cōmaundement vnto earthe shulde brynge forth beastes caxell crepe besydes adam also whome thou madest lorde thy creature hym come people also thou hast chosē specyally vnto thy selfe al haue said nowe spoken lord yt myght shewe howe world made sake people whiche also come adam thou hast said nothyng lyke spetle hast lyckened aboū daunce vnto droppe falleth rofe house nowe lorde heathen haue euer bene reputed nothynge haue begōne lordes ouer v deuour v thy people thou hast called fyrst borne thy onely begotten thy feruente louer geuen theyr handes power yf worlde nowe made sake haue inherytaūce possessyon worlde howe longe shall endure ¶ angell sheweth esdras many thynges come capi vii happened spoken wordes sente vnto angell whiche bene also nightes afore sayd vnto esdras wordes come tell sayd speake lord god sayd vnto see set wyde place might depe greate entraunce narowe small lyke ryuer wolde go see loke vpon rule wente thorow narowe myght come brode item another cytie buylded set vpon brode felde full al goodes entraūce narowe sodayne lyke yf fyre ryght hande depe water lefte onely one strayte path betwixte thē bothe small coulde one man go cyte nowe geuē heyre neuer went thorowe parlous waye wolde receyue enheritaūce sayde lord said euen israel also porcyon theyr sake haue made world adam transgressed statute thyng iudged done thē entraūces worlde made narowe ful sorowe trauayle fewe • euil ful parels labour entraunces fore worlde wide sure brought immortall frute nowe whiche entred worlde maye comprehende strayte vaine thinges muche lesse may cō prehende vnderstande secrete thynges disquietest thou thy self thē seyng thou art corruptyble man woldest thou knowe thou art mortall hast thou receyued thyne herte thynge come present sayd lord lord deute 8 thou hast ordayned thy lawe ryghtuous shulde inherete thīges vnfaythful vngodly shulde perysh neuer thelesse rightuous shal suffre strayte thī ge hope wide haue liued vngodly suffred strayte thynges shall se wyde sayd vnto iudge aboue god none hath vnderstandynge aboue hyest many ye peryshe despyse y• lawe god set god hath geuen strayte cōmaundement come knowe howe shulde lyue yf kept shuld punyshed neuerthelesse obediēt vnto hym spake agaynste hym ymagyned vayne thynges purposed synne sayd moreouer god god regarded hys wayes haue knowen lawe haue despysed denyed hys promyses statute ordynaunces haue bene fayth full stedfaste haue perfourmed hys workes therfore esdras vnto full plenty emptye emptynesse beholde tyme shal come token haue tolde shall come passe bryde shall appeare earth passeth awaye shalbe shewed whosoeuer delyuered frō forsayde euyls shal se wonder sonne iesus shalbe opēly declared remayne shalbe mery foure hundreth yeares yeares shall sonne christ dye al men haue lyfe y• world shalbe turned olde sylence seuen dayes lyke fore iudgementes mā shal remayne seuen dayes world yet waked shalbe raysed vp shal dye corrupte earth shall restore haue slept ī • er shal dust dwel silēce secrete place shal deliuer commytted vnto thē hyest shalbe openly declared vpō seate iudgement mysery shall vanysh away long suffryng shalbe gathered together iudgement shal cōtinue trueth shall remayne fayth shal waxe stronge worcke shall folowe rewarde shall shewed ryghtuousnes shall watch vnryghtuousnesses shall beare rule sayde gene 18 abraham prayed fyrste sodomite exodi • 2 moses y• father sinned wyldernes came israel tyme achas samuel 2 reg 2 • • dauid destruccyon • pa • • 3 • salomon came saynctuary 〈…〉 helias receyued rayne deade myght lyue ezechias people time se •• acherib diuerse lyke maner whiche haue prayed many euē seyng corrupte growen vp wyckednes increased • yg • teous haue prayed y• vngodly wherfore shall nowe also answered sayd thys presente world ende remaineth much honour therefore haue prayed weake daye dome shalbe ende tyme beginnyng immortalite come wherin corrupcion vanished al volupteousnes loused al misbeleue taken away ryghtuousnesse growne veryte spronge vp shall man able saue hym destroyed oppresse hath gotten vyctorye answered sayd first last sayinge bene better haue geuē earth vnto adā el whē geuen kepe hym shuld sinne profite mē nowe present tyme lyue heuinesse death loke punyshment thou adam hast thou done thoughe thou sinned thou art fallen alone come profyte vnto v yf promysed v immortall tyme medle wyth deadly worckes promysed v euerlasting hope selues euyll vayne layed vp v dwellynges health fredome haue lyued euyll worshyppe hiest kept defende whiche haue led paciente lyfe haue walked wycked way shalbe shewed paradyse whose frute endureth euer wherin fredome medycyne shall go haue walcked vnpleasaūt place face whiche haue absteyned shal shyne aboue starres face shall blacke darcke whyle lyued dyd vnryghtuously consydered y• shulde suffre therfore death answered sayde thys consyderacyon thought battayle whiche man hathe vpon earth yf ouer come shall suffre thou haste sayde yf get vyctorye shall receyue thynge saye thys lyfe wherof moyses spake vnto people whyle lyued sayng deut xxx b chose lyfe thou mayst liue neuerthelesse beleued hym neither prophetes hym whiche haue spoken vnto heuynes shulde reach vnto theyr destruccyon lyke ioye come ouer haue suffered selues enfourmed saluacyon aunswered sayde knowe lorde hyest mercyfull hath mercy vpon yet worlde vpon also walcke lawe rom • pacient lōg sufferynge towarde haue synned theyr worckes lyberall geue requyreth great mercy multiplied louing kyndnesses towarde y• present paste whiche come yf multiplye hys mercyes worlde shall made lyuynge y• dwel therin geueth also yf gaue goodnes whiche haue done euyll myght bē eased theyr wyckednes ten thousande parte men shuld made lyuyng yf iudge forgaue healed hys worde wolde destroye multytude stryueth shulde fewe lefte innumerable multitude ¶ esdras prayeth god rather loue vpon owne mercye synnes people capi viii answered sayeng hyest made worlde many worlde come fewe wyll tell symylitude esdras thou askeste earth shall say vnto geueth muche moulde earthen vessel made lytle ye golde cōmeth euen wt worke thys worlde math • ▪ 〈…〉 〈…〉 many created fewe shall saued answered sayde thē swalo vp witte thou soule deuoure vnderstandynge thou art agreed herken geue eare wyllyng prophecy thou hast longer space geuen onely lyue lord wylte thou gyue thy seruaunt leaue may pray thou mayest gyue sede vnto oure herte tyllynge vndestandyng maye cōme frute euery one corrupte beareth state place man may lyue thou art alone al one work manshyppe thy handes lyke thou hast sayd lyke body fashioned mother wōbe thou geuest mē bres thy creature preserued fyre water ix monethes doth thy worke suffre thy creature whiche fashyoned thing preserueth preserued shall kept together whē tyme wombe delyuereth thynge kepte growen thou hast commaūded brestes geue mylcke vnto fruyte thyng created fashyoned may noryshed tyme thou dysposest ordrest thy mercy bringeste vp wt thy righteousnes nurturest thy lawe refourmest thy vnderstandyng mortifiest thy creature makest lyuyng thy worcke seyunge thou destroyest great labour created fashyoned thorowe thy commaundemēt thou couldest lyghtly ordeine also thynge made myght preserued thys speake men generall yu knowest thy people whose sake sory thy inheritaūce whose cause mourne israell wofull iacob whose sake greued therfore begynne pray selfe se fall v euen v dwel vpon earth haue herde swiftnes y• iudge come therfore heare voice vnderstande wordes shall speake thys begynnynge wordes esdras receaued sayde lorde thou dwellest euerlastignesse whose eye lyfte vp ayre whose stoole exceadynge hye whose glory maiesty may comprehended hostes aungels stande trēbling whose kepyng turned wynde fyre whose worde true whose talckynge stedfaste whose commaundement stronge whose ordinaunce fearful whose loke drieth vp depthes whose wrath maketh moū taynes melte awaye whose trueth beareth wytnes heare prayer thy seruaunt marke thyne eares petycyon thy creature whyle lyue wyll speake longe haue vnderstanding wyl answere loke vpon synnes thy people serue trueth haue respecte vnto wicked study heathen desyre kept thy testimonyes sorowes thyncke vpō haue walked fame • ly vpon whiche wyll haue knowen thy feare let thy wyll destroye haue beastly maners loke vpon thē haue clearly taught thy law take thou indignacyō thē worse beastes loue waye put theyr trust thy ryghteousnes glory father haue al sycknes dysease sinnes thou shalt called mercyfull yf thou hast mercy vpon v y• shalt called mercyfull haue worckes righteousnes righteous whiche haue sayed vp many good worckes together shal theyr dedes receaue rewarde man thou shuldest take displeasure corruptible mortal generacyon thou shul dest rough towarde hym 3 pe viii g 2 pat vi f 1 iohn 1 • trueth man amonge borne hath dealte wyckedly among faithful none whiche hath done amysse thys lord thy ryghteousnes thy goodnes shalbe praysed declared yf thou mercyfull vnto rych good worckes answered sayde thinges hast thou spoken right according vnto thy wordes shall wyl verely consydre worckes haue synned death iudgment destruccyon gen iiii wyll reioyce ouer worcke thought ryghteous wyll remēbre also pylgremage holy makynge rewarde lyke haue spoken shal come passe husbande man weth much sede vpon grounde planteth many tree yet alwaye thynge sowne planted al kepte safe nether doth take rote euen thē sowne worlde shall salued answered sayde haue foūde grace let speake like husbande man sede perisheth yf receaue rayne dewe season come much rayne vpō euen perysheth man also created thy handes lyke vnto thyne owne ymage thy selfe whose sake thou hast made al thynges lykened hym vnto husbande man sede wroth v lorde spare thy people haue mercy vpon thyne owne inherytaunce mercyfull vnto thy creature answered sayde thinges present presēte thinges come suche come thou lackeste yet much seynge thou mayest loue creature aboue haue oft time drawne vnto neuer vnryghteous also thou art maruelous y• hieit thou hast humbled thy selfe becommeth haste regarded thyne owne selfe thou art ī honour amōge ryghteous therfore shall great wrechednes mysery come vpō thē latter tyme shall dwell worlde haue walcked greate pryde vnderstande thou thy selfe seke glory lyke vn paradyse opened tre lyfe planted tyme come prepared plenteousnes made ready cytie buylded rest prepared yee perfecte goodnes wysdome rote euel marcked weaknes mothe hyd frō hell flyeth corrupcyon forgetfulnes sorowes vanyshed awaye ende shewed treasure immortalyte therfore aske thou question concernyng multytude thē peryshe haue taken libertye despysed hyeste thought scorne hys lawe forsaken wayes morouer haue troden downe hys ryghteous psa xiiii • sayde theyr herte god yee wyttingly dye lyke thige haue spoken made ready euen thyrst payne prepared hys wyll man shulde come naught created haue defyled name hym made vnthanckful vnto prepared lyfe therfore iudgment hand thiges haue shewed vnto men vnto fewe namely vnto lyke answered sayd beholde lorde nowe hast y• shewed multitude tokēs y• wylt begyn last tyme whē thou hast shewed ¶ esdras hath visyon • vnto hym capi ix answered sayd measure thou y• tyme dylygētly selfe thou seyst one parte token come passe whiche haue tolde shalte thou vnderstande tyme wherin hyest wyll begynne vyset worlde whiche made shall sene earth quake vproare people worlde thē shalt thou well vnderstande hyest spake thinges dayes euen beginnynge lyke made world hath beginning ende ende manyfest euen tymes also y• hyest haue playne begynnynges wonder sygnes ende worcking token euery one shalbe saued shall able escape hys worckes faith wherin ye haue beleued▪ shalbe preserued saide parels shal se sauyoure lande within border haue halowed frō world thē shall carefulnes haue abused wayes y• haue caste thē oute despytefully shal dwell paynes suche theyr lyfe haue receaued benefytes haue knowne haue abhorred lawe whyle yet fredome whē yet open leysure amendemēt conuersyon vnderstode despised y• must knowe death payne therfore thou nomore careful howe vngodly shalbe punished howe ryghteous shal saued whose world whō worlde answered sayde 4 〈…〉 haue talcked speake wyl speake also herafter many mo whiche peryshe thē shalbe saued lyke floude greater droppes answered sayinge lyke felde also sede floures coulours also suche workman also worcke husband man selfe husbandrye also tyme worlde prepared nowe euer worlde made shulde dwell man withstode nowe euery one maker also worlde nowe prepared moneth ceaseth lawe vnsearcheable theyr maners corrupte consydred worlde beholde parell thoughtes come sawe spared greatly haue kepte wynebery grape plante amonge many generacyons let multytude peryshe whiche growne vp vayne let grape wynebery kepte euen plante greate laboure haue made vp neuertheles yf thou wylt take vpon yet seuen dayes mo thou shalt faste go thy waye felde floures house buylded eat onely floures y• felde tast flesh dryncke wyne eate floures onely praye vnto hyest contynually wyll come talke went waye came felde called ardath lyke cō maunded sat amonge floures dyd eat herbes felde meat satisfyed seuen dayes sat vpon grasse herte vexed within lyke afore opened mouth beganne talke hyest sayde lorde thou shewest thy selfe vnto v exod xix 〈…〉 xxiiii deu iiii b thou haste declared opened thy selfe vnto oure father wyldernes place man dwelleth baren place came egygpt thou spakest sayinge heare israel marke wordes yu seade iacob beholde sowe lawe shall bringe frute ye shalbe honoured euer oure father receaued y• lawe kepte obserued thy ordinaunces statute frute thy lawe declared myghte thyne deute 32 f receaeud perished kepte thynge sowen custome grounde receaueth sede see shyp vessell meate drincke perisheth broken wherin thing sowen wherin thynge put thynges also peryshe broken sowen put therin vnto v hath happened haue receyued lawe perysh sinne oure herte whiche also receaued lawe notwithstādyng • saye xl •• mo •• lawe perysheth remayneth hys laboure consydered thinges herte thys maner loked aboute mine eye vpon right syde 4 esdr x sawe woman whiche mourned sore made greate lamentacyon wepte loude voyce clothes rent peces asshes vpon heade let thoughtes go turned vnto sayde wherfore wepest thou art thou sory discomforted sayde vnto syr let bewayle selfe take yet sorow sore vexed mynde brought lowe saide vnto ay • eth y• hath done eny thyng y• tel saide thy hand maid haue bene vnfruteful baren haue husband thyrtie yeares xxx yeares nothynge el daye nyght houres make prayer y• hyest thyrtie yeares god herde thy handmayden loked vpon humylite cōsydred trouble gaue sōne glad husbāde also al neyghbours gaue greate honoure vnto myghtie noryshed hym great trauayle grewe vp came tyme shulde haue wyfe made feast ¶ esdias woman appeareth vnto commen together capi x happened sonne went chamber fell downe dyed ouerthrewe lyghtes neyghbours rose vp cōforte toke rest vnto seconde day night whē rested might comforte rested also rose vp night fled come hyther thꝭ felde thou seyst purposed returne cyte remayne neither eate dryncke continually mourne fast vntyll dye let meditacyons thoughtes fal spake displeasure thou foolysh woman seist thou oure heuynes mournyng happeneth vnto v syon mother wofull sory howe cleane brought downe misery seinge nowe heuynes make oure moue sorowful heuines thou takest one sōne demaūde earthe shall tel ought reason mourne fall many growe vpon begynnyng men borne shal come behold walke almost al destruccyon many shall roted shulde reason make mournynge hath lost great multitude thou art sory one yf thou woldeste saye vnto mournynge lyke y• mournyng earth haue lost frute body whiche bare heuines sorowe earth accordyng maner earth present multitude goeth againe come passe say vnto lyke thou hast borne trauayle sorowe euē earth also frō begining geueth frute vnto man hym y• made therfere withholde thy sorowe heuynes thy selfe hebr xii loke happeneth vnto beare strongly yf thou ludgest marcke ende god righteous good receauest coū celī tyme thou shalt cōmēded therin go thy way cyte thy husbande sayde vnto wyll wyll go cytye heare wyl die commened sayde counceled folowe many falles hath stō good comforte sorowe ierusalem thou se • st sanctuary layed waste oure aulter broken oure temple destroyed oure playenge instrumentes syngyng layed downe thankesgeutnge put sylence myrthis vanyshed awaye lyght oure candelstick quenched arcke couenaūt taken v oure holy thynges defyled name called vpon ouer v dishonoured childrē put shame prestes brente oure leuytes caryed away captiuite oure virgin defyled oure wyues rauished oure ryghteous men spoyled oure chyldren destroyed oure yong men brought bondage oure stronge worthyes become weake syō seale greatest lowsed vp worshyp delyuered handes hate v therfore shake thy great heuynes put awaye multytude sorowes mighty maye mercy full vnto hyeste maye geue rest thy laboure trauayle happened talkynge face dyd shine glyster afrayed mused myght immediatly caste oute greate voyce fearful earth shoke noise woman loked beholde woman appeared vnto nomore cyte builded place shewed frō grounde foundacion afrayed cryed loude voyce sayde uriel angell 4 esd 4 came fyrst hath caused come many consideracyons hye thoughtes myne ende turned corrupcion prayer rebuke speakynge wordes came vnto loked vpon laye one bene deed myne vnderstanding altered toke ryght hande cōforted set vpon fete sayde vnto ayleth thyne vndestanding vexed vnderstandyng thy herte wherfore art thou sory sayd thou hast forsakē haue done 4 e • • ▪ accordynge vnto thy wordes wente folde haue sene thinges able expresse sayd vnto stande vp manly shall geue exortacyon sayd speake lord forsake lest dye vayne haue sene knewe herde knowe shall vnderstandyng disceaued minde nowe beseche thou wylt shewe thy seruaūte wōder answered sayd heare shall enfourme tel wherfore thou art afrayed hyest hath opened many secrete thīges vnto hath sene thy waye ryght thou takest sorowe continually thy people makest greate lamentacyon sion therfore vnderstande visyon whiche thou sawest lytle whyle ago thys maner thou sawest woman mourninge thou hast comforted neuertheles seyst thou lykenes womā nomore thou thoughtest cyte buylded lyke tolde y• fal sonne answere woman thou saweste syon tolde hathe bene thyrtye yeares vnfrutefull baren xxx yeares wherin offerynge made xxx yeares salomon buylded offred bare baren sonne tolde y• noryshed hym laboure dwellyng ierusalem tolde y• sōue dyed whan came chamber fall ierusalem thou sawest lykenesse howe mourned sōne el happened vnto haue shewed y• god seyth thou arte sory thy mynde suffrest thy herte hath shewed clearnesse fayrnes bewtye therfore bad remayne y• felde house builded knew hyest wolde shewe thys vnto therfore commaunded go felde foundacyon buyldynge place hyest wyll shewe cytie shal man buyldyng therfore feare let thyne herte afrayed go thy waye se glorious fayre buyldynge howe greate howe greate thou thynkest measure thyne eye shalte thou heare muche thyne eares maye comprehende thou art blessed aboue many arte called hyest fewe morowe nyght thou shalt remayne shall hyest shewe vysiōs hye thynges whyche wyll vnto dwell vpon earth last dayes slepte y• nyght lyke commaunded ¶ chapter ii next ensuynge entreateth certen vysyons interpretacyons therof capi xi sawe dreame beholde came vp see aegle whiche xii wynges thre heades sawe beholde spred wynges ouer earth wyndes ayre blewe thē put together agayne behelde fethers grewe lytle cōtrary fethers heades rested heade myddest greater thē y• yet rested residue moreouer sawe aegle flewe wynges rayned vpō earth ouer thē dwel vpon earth sawe thinges vnder heauen subiecte vnto hym man spake agaynst hym one creature vpō earth sawe also aegle stode vp vpon hys clawes gaue sounde fethers boyce saynge maner watch together slepe euery man owne place watch tyme let heades preserued last neuertheles sawe voyce wente nat oute hys heades myddest hys body nombred cōtrary fethers holde eyght loked beholde vpon ryght syde arose one fether rayned ouer earth happened raygned ende came place therof appeared nomore nexte folowynge stode vp raygned great tyme happened raygned ende came also lyke fyrst appeared nomore came voyce vnto sayd heare thou haste kepte earth longe thys saye vnto thou begynnest appere nomore shal none atteyne vnto thy tyme arose thyrde raygned afore appeared nomore also went residue one another euery one raygned appered nomore loked beholde inprocesse tyme fethers foloweth set vp vpon ryght syde myght rule also ruled within whyle appeared nomore set vp ruled nat thys loked beholde xij fethers appeared two wynges nomore vpō aegles body two heades rested syxe fethers sawe also syxe fethers parted two remayned vnder heade vpon ryght syde foure continued theyr place loked beholde vnder wynges thought set vp selues haue rule one set vp shortly appeared nomore seconde souer awaye fyrst behelde lo y• two thought also thē selues raygne thought beholde waked one heades rest namely myddest greater two heades thē sawe two heades fylled hym heade turned thē hym dyd eate vp two vnder wynges wolde haue raygned thys heade put whole earth feare bare rule ouer dwelt vpō earth much labour gouernaunce worlde ouer al foules y• haue bene loked beholde heade y• myddest sodenly appeared nomore lyke wynges came two heades whiche ruled vpon earth ouer y• dwell therin behelde lo heade vpon ryght syde deuoured vpon lefte syde herde voyce sayde vnto loke consydre tnynge thou seyest sawe beholde lyon roareth rennynge hastely wod sent man voyce vnto aegle sayd heare thou wyl talke hyest shal saye vnto y• nat thou y• hast y• victory foure beastes whō made ro raygne vpon earth worlde ende time might come thorow the▪ fourtth came ouerwanne beastes paste power ouer worlde great fearfulnes ouer whole cōpasse earth wicked laboure longe tyme • welt vpon earth disceate earth hast thou iudged nat trueth thou hast troubled meke thou haste hurte peaceable quyete thou hast loued lyers destroyed y• dwellynges thē brought forth frute hast cast downe walles dyd y• harme therfore thy wrongeous dealynge blasphemye come vp vnto hyest thy pryde vnto myghty hyest also hath loked vpon proude tymes beholde ended theyr abhomynacyons fulfylled therfore appeare nomore thou aegle thy horrible wynges thy wycked fethers thy vngracyous heades thy synfull clawes thy vayne body earth maye refreshed come agayne selfe delyuered thy vyolence maye hope iudgement mercy hym made capi xii happened y• lyon spake wordes vnto y• aegle sawe beholde heade afore vpper hande appeared nomore nether y• foure wynges appere yt came hym set vp raygne theyr kyngdome small full vproure sawe beholde appered nomore whole body y• aegle brent earth greate feare awaked traunce mynde greate teare sayde vnto sprete lo hast thou geuen y• thou searchest wayes hyest • yet weery minde weake sprete lytle strēgth y• great feare y• receaued nyght therfore wyll nowe beseche • yest y• wil cōforte vnto ende sayde lorde lorde yf haue foūde grate thy syght • yf iustyfyed many yf prayer become vp thy face cōforte shewe •• e thy seruaunte interpretacyon playne difference horrible syght thou mayst perfectly cōforte soule thou haste iudged worthy shewe last tymes sayde vnto interpretacyon syght aegle thou sawest come vp frō see kyngdome danie 7 c whiche sene vysyon thy brother daniel expoūded vnto nowe declare vnto ye beholde dayes come y• shal ryse vp kyngdome vpon earth shalbe feared aboue kyngdomes y• kyngdome shall xij kynges raygne one another seconde shall begynne raygne shall haue tyme twelue twelue wynges signifie thou sawest voyce spake thou sawest go heades frō body betokeneth y• tyme kyngdome shall aryse greate stryuynges shall stande parell fallynge neuertheles shall nat yet fall shalbe set begynnynge eyght vnderwynges y• sawest hange vnto wynges hym betoken y• hym shall aryse eyght kynges whose tyme shalbe smal theyr yeares swyfte two shall beare myddest tyme cōmeth shalbe foure kepte tyme tyme begynneth come maye ended two shalbe kepte vnto ende thou sawest thre heades restynge interpretacyō last shall hyest rayse vp thre kyngdomes cal many agayne thē shall haue domynyon y• earth y• dwell therin wt much labour aboue thē therfore called heades y• aegle y• shal bryng forth wyckednes agayne shal perfourme fynish last thou sawest y• greate heade appeared nomore signifieth ye one thē shal dye vpō bed yet payne two remayne shalbe slayne wt swerde y• swerde y• one shall deuoure last shal fall thorowe y• swerde selfe y• sawest two vnderwynges vpō heade y• y• ryght syde sygnyfyeth y• hyest hathe kepte vnto theyr ende small kyngdome full trouble lyon y• sawest rysinge vp wod roarynge speakyng vnto aegle rebukynge vnryghteousnesse wynde y• hyest hathe kepte theyr wyckednesse vnto ende shall reproue rente asunder shal set thē lyuynge iudgemente shal rebuke resydue people shal delyuer trouble y• preserued ouer mine endes shall make ioyful vntyl cōmynge daye iudgemēt wherof haue spokē vnto frō y• begynninge dreame thou sawest interpretacion thou onely hast bene mete knowe secrete hyest therfore wryte thynges y• thou hast sene boke hyde thē teach thē wyse y• people whose harte thou knowest maye comprehende kepe secretes wayt thou thy self yet seuene dayes mo maye shewed whatsoeuer pleaseth hyest declare vnto wente waye people perceaued seuen dayes past nat come agayne cytie gathered thē together y• least vnto came vnto sayde haue offended • euell haue done agaynst thou forsakest v syttest thys place people thou onely art lefte v grape vyne candel darke place hauen shype preserued frō tempest haue • el aduersite ynough thou muste forsake v nat better v bene brent syon nat better thē dyed wepte wt loude voyce answered sayde good comforte israell nat heuy thou house iacob hyest hath remembraūce myghtie hathe forgotten temptacion haue forsaken neyther departed come thys place praye desolacyon syon myght seke mercy lowe estate youre sāctuary nowe go youre waye home euery man dayes wyll come vnto people went theyr waye cytie lyke • mom • unded remayned styl felde seuen dayes angell bad dyd eate onely floures felde meate herbes dayes capi xiii happened y• seuen dayes dreamed dreame nyght beholde arose wynde frō see moued floude therof loked beholde man stronge increased cloudes heauen turned countenaunce consyder thynges trembled sene vnder hym voyce went hys mouth brent herde hym lyke earth feleth fyre sawe beholde gathered together multitude men nombre foure wyndes heauen fyghte agaynst man came oute see loked beholde graued hym selfe great mountayne flewe vp vpon wolde haue sene border place wherout hyll graued coulde sawe came fyght agaynst hym sore afrayed yet burst fyght neuertheles whē sawe fearsnesse violēce people neyther lyfte vp hys hande helde swerde weapē sawe sente hys mouth bene blast fyre hys lyppes wynde flamme hys tonge cast sparkes stormes myxte together blast fyre wynde flammes greate storme fell russhe vpon people whiche prepared fyght brent vp euerychone innumerable multitude nothyng sene onely dust smoke sawe afrayed afterwarde sawe man come downe moūtayne callynge vnto another peaceable people came muche people vnto hym glad sory bounde caryed broughr forth sycke thorowe great feare waked sayde thou hast shewed thy seruaunte thy wonder begynnynge haste counted worthy thou myghtest receaue prayer shew nowe yet interpretacion dreame thus consydre vnderstandynge wo vnto shal lefte dayes muche wo vnto thē nat left behynde lefte heuynes nowe vnderstāde thynges layed vp latter dayes shal happen vnto lefte behynde therfore come greate parelles many necessity lyke dreames declare yet easier y• suffred hurte come passe awaye cloude worlde nowe se thynges shall happē last answered sayde interpretacion syght shall shewe wyl open vnto thynge y• thou hast required thou hast spoken left behynde thys interpretacyon taketh awaye parell tyme hath kepte self fallen harme haue workes fayth vnto myghtie know thys therfore whiche lefte behynde blessed thē deed meanynge visyon thou sawest man commynge vp ye depe see god hyest hathe kepte great season whiche owne selfe shal delyuer creature shall ordre thē left behynde y• sawest oute mouth came blast wynde fyre storme howe lyft vp nether swerde weapen rushynge destroyed whole multitude came fyght signifieth ye day come whā god wyll delyuer vpon earth traunce mynde shall come vpon dwell earth one shall vndertake fyght agaynste another one cyte another one place agaynst another mat 〈◊〉 • one people agaynst another one realme another commeth passe shall token come shewed thē shall sonne declared yu sawest clyme vp man al people heare voyce euery mā shal theyr owne lande leaue battayll yt haue one agaynste another innumerable multitude shalbe gathered together wyllynge come ouercome hym fyghtynge shall stande vpō toppe mount syō neuerthelesse syon shall come shalbe shewed beynge prepared buylded men lyke thou sawest hyll grauen forth without handes sōne shall rebuke people ye come theyr wyckednes tempest theyr euell ymagynacyons theyr paynes wherwith shalbe punyshed lyckened vnto flamme laboure shall destroye euen lawe whiche compared vnto fyre thou sawest gathered another peaceable people vnto hī ten tribe caryed awaye presoners theyr owne lande 4 17 tyme oseas kynge salmanasar kynge assyria toke presoner caryed ouer water came another lande gaue councell shulde leaue multitude heathen go forth forther countre neuer mankynde dwelt myght kepe theyr statute neuer kepte theyr owne lande entred narowe passage water euphrates god shewed token e • 〈◊〉 iosu • • 〈◊〉 helde styll floude tyll passed ouer thorow ye countre greate waye namely yeare halfe iourney regyon called asareth dwelt vnto latter tyme whē come forth agayne hyest shall holde styl sprenges streame agayne may go thorowe therfore sawest thou multytude peace lefte behynde thy people founde within border nowe destroyeth multytude gathered together shall defende people remayne shall shewe greate wonder sayde lorde lorde shewe wherfore haue sene man cōming vp depe see sayde vnto lyke thou cāst nether seke knowe thynges depe see euen mayest thou se sonne hym tyme daye interpretacyon dreame yu sawest therfore thou onely arte lyghtened thou haste forsaken thyne owne lawe applyed thy dylygence vnto myne sought 3 〈◊〉 thy lyfe hast thou ordred wysdome pro •• •• • haste called vnderstandyng thy mother therfore haue shewed treasure hyest thre dayes wyll shew talke large yee heuy wonderous thynges wyll declare vnto wēt forth felde geuyng prayse thankes greatly vnto god hys wonder whiche dyd tyme gouerneth tyme sat thre dayes ¶ god appereth vnto esdras bush sheweth shall capi xiiii vpon thyrde daye sat vnder oke tree came voyce vnto bush sayde esdras esdras sayde lorde stode vp vpon fete spake vnto exods 〈◊〉 • bush dyd appere vnto moses talked hym people serued egypte sente hym led people egypt brought hym vpō mount syon helde longe season tolde hym wonderous worckes shewed hym secretes tymes ende commaunded hym sayinge wordes shalt thou declare hyde nowe saye vnto thou laye vp thyne herte dreames thou hast sene interpretacions whiche haue shewed thou shalte receyued thou shalt turned remayne councell lyke vntyll tymes ended worlde hath lost youth tymes begynne waxe olde tyme deuided twelue partes ten partes gone redye halfe tenth parte yet remayneth yt half tenth parte therfore prepayre ordre thy house refourme thy people comforte suche trouble tel nowe destruccion let go mortall thoughtes cast awaye burthen man put weake nature laye vp place thoughtes heuy vnto
