haste flyt tymes suche euyl wyckednesse thou hast sene happen shal yet muche worsse mat • 4 2 iohn 2 c weaker worlde tyme shal synne wyckednes increase dwel vpon earth truth fled farre away lesyng harde hāde nowe hasteth vysion come thou hast sene answered sayde beholde lorde wyl go y• hast cōmaunded refourme people present y• shall borne afterwarde wylexhorte rebuke thē thus worlde set darknes owel therin wt lyght thy lawe kyndled man knoweth thynges done y• shall done haue founde grace sēde holy ghost shall wryte al hath bene done world seus begynnyng wryt ten thy lawe mē may fynde path whiche wyll lyue latter dayes may lyue answered sayeng go thy way gather people together say vnto seke fourtye dayes loke thou gather many boxe tree take sarea dabria selemia ecanus asiel fyue redy wrytte swyftely come hyther shall lyght candle vnderstandynge thyne herte whiche shall put tyl thinges perfourmed thou shalt beginne wryt shalt thou declare thynges openly vnto perfecte thynges shalt thou shewe secretly vnto wyse tomorowe houre shalte thou begynne wryte went forth commaunded gathered al people together sayde heare wordes israell oure father begynnynge straungers egygte whence deliuered receyued lawe lyfe deute 4 whiche kepte whiche ye also haue transgressed thys lande lande syon parted amonge lot possesse father ye selues also haue done vnryghtuousnes haue kepte wayes whiche hyest commaunded muche rightuous iudge toke time thyng geuen nowe ye brother amonge therfore yf ye wyll subdue youre owne vnderstandynge refourme youre herte ye shalbe kepte alyue death shall ye optayne mercy death shal iudgemente come shall lyue agayne shal name ryghtuous manifest worckes vngodly shalbe declared let man therfore come vnto aske question fourtye dayes toke fyue men commaū ded wente felde remayned nexte day voyce called sayinge esdras ezech 3 • apoca x open thy mouth drynke geue opened mouth beholde reached ful cuppe ful wt water y• cou • er lyke fyre toke drancke droncke herte vnderstandyng wysdome grew brest sprete kepte remē braunce mouth opened shut nomore hyest gaue vnderstandyng vn fyue men wrote hye thinges nyght vnderstode nyght dyd eate breade spake day helde tong nyght xl dayes wrote two hundreth foure bokes happened fourtye dayes fulfilled hyest spake sayinge fyrste thou hast wrytten speake openly worthy vnworthy maye rede kepe lxx last thou mayst shew onely suche wyse among thy people sprynge vnderstandynge fountayne wysdome streame knowledge dyd ¶ punyshment euyl people shal haue god commaundeth esdras shewe vnto capi xv beholde speake thou eares people y• wordes prophecy whiche wyll put thy mouth saieth lorde cause thē wryten letter trueth feare ymaginaciōs agaynst let vnfaithfulnes thē trouble speake vn faythful shall dye vnfaythfulnes beholde sayeth lorde wyl bryng plage vpon worlde swearde hongre death destruccion wyckednes hath vpper hande earthe theyr shamefull workes fulfylled therfore sayeth lorde wyll holde tonge nomore vnto theyr wyckednesse whiche vngodly nether wyl suffre thē thinges deale wyth wyckedly beholde apoc vi b xix innocente bloude troubled crieth vnto y• soules rightuous complayne continually therfore sayeth lorde wyl surely auenge receyue vnto innocent bloude amonge psal 44 c rom • • c 1 cor 4 b beholde people led flocke shepe slayne wyll suffre nowe dwell egypte wyll brynge thē myghtye hāde stretched arme smyte plage afore wyll destroye lande egypte shall mourne foundacions shal smytten plage punyshment god shall brynge vpon tyll ground • shal mourne theyr sedes shall destroyed thorow blastynge hayle horryble starre wo worth worlde dwell therin swearde theyr destrucyon draweth nye one people shall stande vp fyght agaynst another swerdes hādes men shalbe vnstedfast shal vyolence vnto shal regarde theyr kyng prynces wayes theyr doinges hādlinges theyr power man shall besyre go cyte shal able theyr pryde cyties shalbe brought feate house shall shake men shall afrayed man shall haue pytie vpon hys neyghboure one shall prouoke another vnto batayle spoyle theyr goodes honger bread great trouble beholde gather call together kynges earth vprysyng south east lybanus turne vnto thē restore thinges haue geuen lyke yet daye vnto chosen wyl also recompense thē theyr bosome thus sayeth lorde god ryght hand shal spare synners swerde shall • easse ouer shed innocent bloude vpon earth fire gone wrath hath consumed foū dacious earth sinner like strawe kyndled wo worth synne kepe commaundementes sayeth lorde wyll spare go way ye chyldren frome vyolence defyle saynctuary lord knoweth synne agaynst therfore deliuereth vnto death destruccyon nowe plage come vpon y• worlde ye shall remayne god shall delyuer ye haue synned beholde horryble vysyon commeth easte generacions dragōs shal come people arabes many charettes multitude shall wynde vpon earthe whiche heare ragynge theyr wrath may feare afrayed wylde bore wood shall go great power shal come stande fyghtyng wt shal wast porcyon lande assyrian shall dragon haue vpper hande remembryng byrth shall turne aboute swearynge together greate power persecute shalbe afrayed kepe silence theyr power shall fle one lande assirians shal besege consume one theyr hoste shalbe feare drede stryfe among theyr kynges beholde cloudes easte north vnto south horryble loke vpon full wrath storme shall smyte one vpon another shal smyte great starre vpon earth theyr starre bloude shalbe swerde vnto bely smoke man vnto camel lytter shalbe great ferefulnesse tremblyng vpon earthe se wrath shall afrayed tremblynge shall come vpon shall come greate raynes south northe parte west stormy wynde east shall shut thē vp agayne cloude raysed vp wrath starre cause feare towarde y• east west wynde shalbe destroyed greate cloudes shalbe lyfte vp myghtie cloudes full wrathe starre maye make earth afrayed dwell therin▪ maye poure ouer place horryble starre fyre hayle flyenge sweardes many water feldes may full al ryuers shal breake downe cyties walles moūtaines hylles al tree wood grasse medowes al frute shal go stedfast vnto babylon make afrayed shall come besege starre wrath shall poure vpon shall dust smoke go vp vnto heauen aboute shal bewayle remayne vnder shal seruice vnto haue put feare thou asia ye comfortest thy selfe also vpō hope babylon art worship personne wo vnto thou wretch thou hast made thy selfe lyke vnto hast deckte thy daughter whoredome might triūphe please thy louers whiche haue alwaye desired cōmitte whordome thou hast folowed abhominable cite workes inuencions therfore sayth god wyl sende plage vpō wyddowhode pouerte hōgre warres pestylence wast thy house destruccion death glorye thy power shalbe dryed vp floure whē heate riseth yt sent ouer thou shalt sycke pore wyfe plaged beaten wemē myghtie louer shal able receyue wolde hate sayeth lord thou haddest alwaye slayne chosen exaltynge stroke thy handes sayde ouer theyr death whē thou wast dronken set forth beautie thy countenaunce reward thy whoredome shalbe recompensed thy bosome therfore shalt tho • receyue rewarde lyke thou hast done vnto chosen sayeth lorde euē shall god vnto shal deliuer plage thy chyldren shall dye honger thou shalt fall thorowe swerde thy cyties shalbe broken downe thyne shall perishe swerde felde mountaynes shall dye hongre eate owne flesh dryncke owne bloud hongre bred thyrst water thou vnhappy shalt come thorowe see receyue plage agayne passage shall cast downe slayne cytie shall rote one parte thy lande consume porcyon glory shall treade downe lyke stubble shalbe thy fyre shal consume thy city thy lande thy woode thy frutefull • rees shal burne vp wt fyre thy chyldren shal cary awaye captiue loke y• hast shall spoyle marre bewtye thy face ¶ heathen shalbe punysshed capi xvi wo vnto babylon asia wo vnto egypt syrya gyrde selues wt clothes sack hearre mourne chyldren sory destruccyon hande swerde sente vpon wyll turne backe fyre kyndled among wyl quench plage sēt vnto wyl driue away may man dryue awaye hongrye lion wod maye man quēch fyre stubble whā hath begōne burne may one turne agayne arowe shot strōg archer myghtye lorde sendeth plage wyl driue away fyre kindled gone forth wrath y• wyll quenche shal cast lyghtnynges shal fere shal thōdre shall afrayed lorde shal threaten shall vtterly beaten poulder presence earth quaketh foundacions therof see aryseth vp wt waues depe floudes vnquyete fyshes therof also lord glory power strong ryght hande y• holdeth bowe arowes shoteth sharpe shal mysse begynne shot endes worlde beholde plage sente shall turne agayne tyl come vpon earth fyre kyndled shal put tyll cosume foundacions earth like arowe whiche shot myghtye archer returneth backe warde euen plage shal sent vpon earth shal turne agayne wo wo wil delyuer dayes begynnyng sorowes great mournyng begynnyng darth greate death begynnyng warres power shal stande feare begynnynge euyls shal tremble euery one shal thynges plage come beholde honger plage trouble anguysh sent scourge amendemēt thinges shal turne theyr wyckednesse alway minde full scourge beholde vitailes shalbe good cheape vpon erath shall thinke thē selues good case euen shall myschefe growe vpon earth warres darth great disquietnes many yt dwel vpon earth shal perish honger escape hongre shall swerde destroy deed shalbe cast dong shal mā cōfort earth shalbe wasted city shalbe cast downe shalbe mā left tyl earth sowe tree shal geue frute shal plucke gather grape shall rype shall treade thē place shalbe desolate men y• one man shal desyre se another voyce one whole cytie shalbe ten left two felde shall hyde selues thycke busshes clyffes stone lyke whē remayne thre foure olyues vpon olyue tree oras vyneyard gathered left grape diligentely sought thorowe vyneyarde euen dayes shalbe thre foure left thē search theyr house swerde earth shalbe left waste feldes therof shall waxe olde wayes al pathes shall grow full thornes man shal trauaile thorowe daughter shal mourne hauynge brydegromes wemen shall make lamentacion hauyng husbandes daughter shal mourne hauīg help theyr brydgrome warres shal destroyed theyr husbādes shal perish hongre ye seruauntes lord thynges marke thē beholde worde lorde receyue beleue goddes lord speaketh holde plage drawe nye slacke tarieng lyke trauaylynge woman ix moneth bryngeth forth sonne houre byrthe come houre two thre afore paynes come vpon body chylde cō meth byrth tary twyncke lynge eye euen shall plage slacke come vpon earth worlde shall mourne sorowes shall come vpon euery syde people heare worde make redy batayle euyll euen pylgrems vpon earth 1 cor • selleth let flyeth waye byeth one wyll see whoso occupyeth marchaundyes wynneth buyldeth shall dwell therin soweth one shal reape twysteth vineyarde shall gather grape mary shal get chyldren mary wyddowes therfore psa 〈◊〉 prou 〈…〉 eccle x • labour labour vayne straungers shall reape frutes spoyle goodes ouerthrow house take chyldren captiue captiuite hongre shal get chyldren occupye marchaundies robbery howe longe decke theyr cytyes theyr house theyr possessyons personnes wyll punyshe theyr synnes sayeth lorde lyke whore enuyeth honest woman shall ryghtuousnes hate iniquite decketh selfe shall accuse face cōmeth defendeth whiche shal make inquisicion synne vpon earthe therfore ye lyke thereunto workes therof euer long iniquite shalbe taken away earth rightuousnes shall raygne amonge let symer saye hathe synned cole fyre shall burne vpon head sayeth lord god glory haue synned beholde lord knoweth worckes men ymaginacions thoughtes theyr hertes gene li spake worde let earth made made let heauen made made worde statres made knoweth nō bre searcheth groūde depe treasure therof hathe measured see • conteyneth hath shut see myddest waters▪ worde hath hāged eart • vpō water spredeth heauen • lyke vawte vpō water hath founded deserte drye wyldernes hathe made springes water pole vpon toppe mountaynes floudes myght poure downe frome stony rockes water earth made man put hys herte myddest bodye gaue hym breth lyfe vnderstandyng yee sprete almyghty god made al thynges hath serched grounde secretes earth knoweth ymagynacyons inuencions ye thynke ye sīne wolde hyde synnes therfore hath lorde searched sought youre workes shall bewraye synnes brought forth ye shal ashamed men owne synnes shalbe owne accuser ī day wyll ye howe wyll ye hyde youre synnes god aungels beholde god himselfe iudge feare leue synnes forget vnryghtuousnes medle nomore shal god leade forthe delyuer trouble beholde heate great multitude kyndled ouer shall take awaye certayne fede slayne idol consent vnto thē shalbe derision laughed scorne troden vnder fote vnto place shalbe place nexte cytyes great insurreccyon vpon feare lorde shall lyke mad mē shall spare mā shal spoyle waste suche fere lorde theyr goodes shall take shutte theyr house shal knowen chosen shalbe tryed golde fyre ye beloued sayeth lorde beholde dayes trouble hāde wyll delyuer frō ye afrayed dispayre god captayne kepeth commaundementes preceptes sayeth lorde god let youre synnes weye downe let youre vnryghtuousnesse lyfte vp wo vnto subdued vnto theyr synnes tangled theyr wyckednesse lyke felde hedged busshes path therof couered thornes mā may trauayle thorow taken caste fyre brent ¶ ende iiij boke esdras ❧ ginneth booke tobias ¶ tobias beynge taken prysoner forsaketh lawe truthe mercy charyte tobias maners youth taketh hannah wyfe whome hath sonne named tobias succoureth gabel money fayne flye death dennaherib returne agayne capi tobias try cite nepthali lieth y• hye coūtres galile aboue naason way towarde y• west hauīg cytie sephet vpon lefte syde thoughe taken presonerin dayes salmanasar kyng assyryās neuerthelesse beyng captiuite forsoke waye trueth muche y• soeuer myght ger parted dayly felowes presoners brother kynred thoughe yonger tribe nepthali yet dyd behaue selfe childeshly workes al went y• golden calues ieroboā kyng israel made self alone fled al cōpanies gat ierusalem vnto y• temple lorde worshypped y• lorde god israell faythfully offerynge fyrste frutes tythes thyrde yeare ministred al tythes vnto straungers conuertes suche lyke thinges dyd obserue accordyng law god whē yet yonge mā toke owne tribe wife called anna gat sōne called owne name taught hī youth vp feare god refrayne synne nowe wyfe hys sonne kynred come captiuite vnto cytie niniue tyme al dyd eate meates heathē kept soule neuer defyled theyr meates muche myndeful lorde al herte god gaue fauoure syght salmana far kynge whiche gaue power go wolde lybertie whatsoeuer lyst wente tobias vnto y• preson comforted gaue thē wholsome exortacions whan came rage citie medes hauynge ten talētes syluer thynges kyng honoured sawe among greate company people kynred one gabelus owne tribe beyng necessite gaue hī said weight syluer vnder hand wrytyng longe season salmanasar kynge deed sennaherib hys sonne reigned steade hated chyldren israel tobias went dayly thorowe al kynred comforted thē gaue hys goodes euery one much myght fed hongrie clothed naked buried dead slayne diligently sennaherib kynge came agayne fled iewry tyme god punysshed blasphemy wrath slew many chyldren israel tobias buried body tolde kyng cōmannded fleye toke awaye goodes neuertheles tobias hys sonne hys wyfe fled hys way hyd naked many loued hym xlv dayes kynge slayne owne sonnes came tobias agayne house goodes restored vnto hym ¶ tobias byddeth suche hys frendes feare god ban • quet feaste reproued hys frendes feareth god kyng becommeth blynde permyssyon sufferaunce god hys kynsfolckes mocke hym capi ii thynges vpon solempne day lorde tobias made good feast house sayde vnto sonne go thy way bryng hither tribe suche feare god may make mery v gone came agayne tolde father one chyldren israel lay slayne vpon strete immediately leapte table left feast came fasting deed coarse toke bare preuely house sunne downe might safely burye hym hyd coarse dyd eate hys meate mournyng feare remembrynge wordes lord sayde prophete amos hye feastes shalbe turned sorow heuynesse sunne downe wente waye buryed thē al neyghbours reproued sayeng longe sen commaunded sleye matter hast scarce escaped daunger death buriest thou deed agayne neuertheles tobias fearynge god kyng toke bodyes slayne hyd thē house buried mydnyght happened vpon day buried y• deed wery came home layed downe wall slepte whyle slepe fell downe vpon eye warme dong swalowes nest blinde temptacion dyd god suffre happen vnto hym whiche came myght haue exāple pacience lyke holy iob muche euer fered god hys youth vp kepte commaundementes grudged agaynst god y• plage blyndnes chaunsed vnto remayned stedfast feare god thāked god al dayes lyfe lyke blessed iob derysion kynges euen laughed scorne elder kynsfolckes whiche sayde vnto thy hope thou hast done almes buryed deed tobias rebuked spake saye chyldren holy men loke lyfe whiche god shall geue vnto neuer turne theyr beleue anna hys wyfe wente dayly weeuynge worcke loke lyuynge coulde get labour hādes brought happened y• toke kyd brought home husbande herde crye sayd loke y• stollē restore agayne owner lawful v eate touch thynge theft wyfe angrie sayde thy hope become vayne openly thy almes dedes manyfest suche lyke wordes dyd cast tethe ¶ prayer tobias sara daughter raguel sclaundred father seruaunt prayer fastyng sara also innocēcy chastyte prayer tobias sara herde capi iii tobias toke heuely teares beganne make prayer sayenge lorde thou arte ryghtuous thy iudgementes true yee thy wayes mercy faythfulnes iudgement nowe lorde myndeful take vengeaunce sinnes nether remēbre mysdedes nether misdedes elder haue nat bene obediēt vnto thy commaundementes therfore spoyled brought captiuite death derision shame vnto al naciōs among thou hast scatred v nowe lord thy iudgementes great haue done accordyng thy commaundemētes nether haue walcked innocently nowe lorde deale accordyng thy wyll commaunde sprete receyued peace expedyente dye lyue tyme happened sara daughter raguel rage cytie medes sclaundred one father handmaydes namely shulde haue seuen husbandes whiche sone gone vnto slayne y• deuyll called asmodeus therfore whē reproued maydē faute answered saying god let v neuer se sōne daughter vpon earthe thou kyller thy husbandes wylt thou sleye also thou hast slayne seuen men thys voyce wente sara hye chambre house thre dayes thre nyghtes neither eate drancke cōtinued prayer besought god teares wolde delyuer thys rebuke upon thyrde day chaunced y• made ende prayer praysed lord saying blessed thy name god father whiche thou arte wrothe shewest mercy tyme trouble thou forgeuest synnes call vpon unto lorde turne face vnto lyft vp myne eye beseche lorde lose bondes thys rebuke el take vtterly awaye earthe thou knowest lorde y• neuer desyre vnto man haue kepte soule cleane al vnclenly lust haue kepte company passe theyr tyme sporte neyther haue made self partaker thē walke lyght behauour neuertheles husbāde haue cōsented take pleasure thy feare peraduēture eyther haue bene vnworthy el v • mete thou happly hast kept another husbande thy councel power man whosoeuer loueth serueth ryght sure thys yf lyfe tempted proued standeth • ryeng yf endure pacyence shall haue rewarde hyghly crowned yf trouble god doute shall delyuer hym yf lyfe chastenyng shal haue leue come vnto thy mercy thou hast pleasure dampnacyon storme thou makeste wether fayre styll wepyng heuynes thou geuest greate ioye thy name god israel praysed euer tyme prayer herde sight maiesty hyest god raphael holy angell lorde sent helpe whose prayer came one tyme together god capi iiii ¶ tobias thynckynge dye geueth goodly exhortacyon monycion sonne tobias thought hys prayer herde myght dye called vnto hym sonne tobias sayde vnto sōne heare wordes mouth lay thyne herte foundacion god taketh awaye soule burye thou bodye holde thy mother honour al dayes lyfe thou oughtest remēbre howe great parels suffered wombe also hathe fulfylled tyme lyfe bury beside haue god thy thought dayes thy lyfe beware least tyme thou consente vnto synne lest thou let slyppe cōmaundementes lorde god geue almes thy goodes turne neuer thy face poore shal come passe y• face lorde shall turned awaye mercyfull thy power thou hast much geue plentuously yf thou hast lytle thy diligēce gladly geue litle gatherest y• thy selfe good rewarde day necessyte mercy delyuereth synne death suffreth soule come darkenes great cōfort mercy hie god vnto shewe sonne kepe well whordome syde thy wyfe se faute knowne y• let neuer pryde haue rule thy mynde thy worde pryde beganne destruccyon whosoeuer worketh thinge immediatly geue hire loke thy hired seruaūtes wage remayne ouer night loke thou neuer vnto another man thynge thou woldest another man shulde vnto y• eate thy bred hongrye poore couer naked thy clothes set thy bredde wyne vpon burial righteous▪ thou eate dryncke therof wt synnees aske euer councel wyse alwaye thanckefull vnto god beseche wyll ordre thy wayes y• whatsoeuer y• deuysest takest hand may remayne certyfie also sōne y• thou wast yet babe delyuered ten talētes syluer vnto gabelus rage citie medes hys hande wryttynge haue therfore seke meanes y• mayest come hym receyue sayde weyght syluer geue handwrytyng agayne sonne afraied trueth leade poore lyfe greate good shal haue yt feare god departe synne well ¶ obedyence yonge tobias father whiche sent rage aungell accompanyeth hym iourney capi v answered tobias father sayde father thou hast cō maunded wyl diligently howe shall require money cannot tell neyther bothe knowe token shall geue way thyther neuer knewe father answerd hym sayde haue hande wrytyng thou shewest hym immediately shall paye go thy way get faithful man go hyre thou mayest receyue money whyle yet lyuynge went tobias vpon strete founde fayre yonge man standyng gyrded vp one readye take iourney knewe angell god saluted hym sayde whēce art thou thou good yonge man aunswered chyldren israel tobias sayde vnto hym knowest y• waye ledeth vnto countre medes answered knowe well stretes haue gone oft tymes haue lodged brother gabelꝰ dwelleth rage citye medes whiche lyeth vpon mounte egabthanis tobias sayd vnto praye tary tyl haue tolde father thinges went tobias in▪ tolde father al▪ father maruelled prayed wolde come vnto nowe whē angel came saluted sayd ioye y• foreuer olde tobias sayd ioy haue sit darkenes se light heauē yonge man sayde vnto good cheare god shall helpe shortly tobias sayd vnto canst yu bryng sonne gabelus vnto cytie rage medea y• cōmest agayne shall paye thy hyre aungell sayde vnto shall leade thy sonne brynge agayne thē tobias answered tell praye y• house trybe arte thou angell raphael sayde vnto askest thou kynred hyrelyng sekest thou gyde thy sonne go hym make carefull azarias y• sōne great hananias tobias answered thou art come great kynred praye displesed desyred know thy kynred angel sayde vnto thy sonne shall leade forth safely bryng whole agayne answered tobias sayde wel go way god iourney angel beare company whē prepared thynges y• wolde take wt theyr iourney tobias bad father mother farewel wēte theyr way together nowe gone mother beganne wepe sayde staffe age hast thou taken away sent hym v wolde god money neuer bene whiche thou hast sent hym awaye bene content pouerte thys bene great ryches vnto v saw sōne saide tobias vnto wepe oure sōne shall come v agayne safe sounde thine eye shal se trust good angel god shal beare cōpany ordre wel thynges dothe yt shall come v agayne wt ioye wordes mother left wepyng helde tonge ¶ yonge tobias delyuered fyshe angell angell exhorteth tobias take • ar • wyfe capi vi tobias went hys way dogge folowed hym fyrste nyght abode water tygris wente wash fete behold came forth horrible fyshe deuoure hym tobias afrayed cryed loude voyce sayenge lorde commeth vpon angell sayde vnto take hym gyll drawe hym dyd drewe hym vpon lande fyshe begane leape hys fete sayde aungell vnto hym take bowel thys fyshe herte gall leuer kepe thīges necessary good medecyne tobias dyd rosted fysh toke hym theyr iourney resydue salted much suffycyent tyll came rage cytye medes tobias asked aungell sayde vnto hym praye brother azaria tell wherto thinges good fysh thou hast bydden kepe aungell answered sayde thou layeste pece herte vpon coales smoke therof dryueth awaye maner euyll sprytes whether man woman thence forth shall come nomore vnto thē gall good anointe stryke eye withall blemith shalbe whole tobias sayde vnto hym wylt thou remaine aungel answered sayde nye kynsman thyne one raguell name hath daughter called sara hath nether sonne daughter hys good belongeth vnto thou must mary therfore desyre father shall geue wyfe answered tobias saide vnderstande hath bene maryed vnto seuen husbandes al deed haue herde saye deuell slewe afrayed therfore leste suche thynges happen vnto also whiche yf came pa • se seynge onely sonne father mother shulde bryng theyr age sorowe theyr graues saide ye aungel raphael vnto heare wyll tell deuell hath power namely receaue mariage fashion shut god thē frō theyr hert geue thē selues theyr owne lust euen horse mule haue vnderstāding vpō hath deuel power thou takeste arte come chamber wytholde thy selfe thre dayes geue thy diligence vnto nothyng vnto prayer first nyght rost liuer fysh deuel shalbe dryuen awaye secōde night shalt thou receaued company holy patriarkes thyrde night shalt thou optayne y• blyssyng god whole chyldren shalbe borne thyrde nyght take mayden feare god desyre chyldren fleshly lust sede abraham thou mayest optaine blessynge chyldren ¶ yonge tobias aungell come house raguell requyieth raguels daughter wyfe obtayneth capi vii wente raguell whiche receaued ioyfully raguel loked vpon tobias sayde vnto anna hys wyfe howe lyke thys yong man vnto systers sonne spoken thys sayde whence ye good brother sayde trybe nephthaly captyuyte nyniue sayde raguel vnto know ye brother tobias sayde yee knowe hym well spoken muche good hym aungell sayde vnto raguell tobias whome thou askest thys yonge man father raguell bowed himselfe downe wepte toke hym aboute necke kyssed hym sayde god blessynge haue thou sonne thou arte sonne good verteous man anna wyfe sara hys daughter wepte also whē talked together raguel bad kyll wether make feste prayed syt downe dynner tobias sayd nether eat dryncke thys daye excepte thou fyrste graūt peticion promise geue thy daughter sara raguel herd thꝭ astonied knew happened vnto seuen men ye went vnto beganne feare shulde chaūce vnto also lyke maner whyle stode doute gaue yonge man answere aungel saide vnto feare geue thy daughter vnto man feareth god belōgeth thy daughter wife therfore might none haue sayde raguell doute god hathe accepted prayer teares sight trust caused come vnto y• intent thys daughter myne myghte maryed owne kinred accordynge lawe moses dowte thou wyll geue vnto toke ryght hande hys daughter gaue ryght hand tobias saide god abraham god isaac god iacob ioyne together fulfyll hys blessyng toke letter made wrytyng mariage thē made mery praysed god raguell called anna hys wyfe vnto hym bad prepare another chamber thither brought sara daughter wepte sayde vnto good chere daughter lord heauen geue ioye heuynes thou hast suffred ¶ angel bindeth deuyl tobias exhorteth wife prater pray thre dayes lye together capi viii nowe supped brought yong man thought tobias vpon wordes aungell toke hys bagge pece lyuer fyshe layed vpon hote coales aungell raphaell toke holde deuell sente hym awaye bounde hym wyldernes byer egypt spake tobias vnto vyrgyn sayde sara let v make oure prayer vnto god day morowe ouermorowe thre nyghtes wyll reconcyle ourselues god whan thyrde nyght past shal ioyne together dutye maryage chyldren holy men maye come together heathen knowe god stode vp together besought god earnestly wolde preserue tobias sayde lorde god oure father praysed thou heauen earth see welles floudes thy creature y• therin thou madest adam gene ii moulde earthe gauest eua helper lord thou knowest voluptuousnes y• take thꝭ syster myne wyfe loue chyldren whō thy name blessed euer sara sayde haue mercy vpon v lorde haue mercy vpō v let v come whole sounde together good age aboute y• cocke crowynge happened raguel called seruaūtes wente hym make graue sayde chaunced vnto hym peraduenture vnto seuē mē went vnto made y• graue raguel came agayne hys wyfe sayde vnto sende one thy maydens loke yf deed maye burye hym afore lyght daye sēt mayden se came ye chāber founde whole sounde slepyng together came againe brought good tydinges raguel anna hys wyfe praysed lord sayd praysed y• lorde god israell happened vnto v thought thou haste dealte mercyfully v put awaye frō v enemye persecuted v hast shewed mercy vnto yō der two beloued lorde cause magnify perfectly offre sacryfyce thy prayse theyr health people may knowe thou arte god earthe immediatly raguel commaunded hys seruauntes fyll graue made earth fore lyght bade hys wyfe prepare feaste make redy thynges necessary meate wente waye caused two fat kyne also foure wether slayne meates prepared neyhbours frendes raguel charged tobias remaine hī two wekes good gaue tobias halfe made thys wrytynge halfe whiche remayned shulde fall vnto tobias theyr death ¶ aungel goeth gabellus desyre tobias desyuereth letter receaueth • uonye capi ix tobias called vnto hym aungell whome thought haue bene man sayde vnto hym brother azarias praye herken vnto wordes yf shulde geue selfe thy seruaunte shal deserue thy prouidence neuerthelesse beseche thou wylt take beastes seruauntes go vnto gabelus rage cyte medes deliuer hym hand wrytyng receaue money praye hym come mariage thou knowest thy selfe father doth nombre dayes tary one day long wylbe sory mynd nowe seist thou earnestly raguell hathe requyred cannot saye hym nay toke raphaell foure raguels seruauntes two camel wēte vnto rage cyte medes foūde gabelus gaue hādwrityng receaued money tolde also tobias sonne tobi thynges happened caused come wt hym mariage came house raguel found tobias syttyng table leaped vp kyssed one another gabelus wepte praysed god sayde blessyng god israel haue thou thou art sonne ryght verteous iust man one feareth god geueth great aimes blessyng haue thy wife elder ye may se chyldren childers chyldrē vnto thyrd fourth generaciō sede blessed god israell reygneth worlde without ende sayde amē wēt y• feast y• feare lord helde feast mariage ¶ tobias hys wyfe sadde • riaūc • sonne raguel seudeth agayne tobias hys wyfe capi x whyle yonge tobias made long taryeng reason mariage father full care heuynesse thought shulde cause sonne taryeth longe shulde kept long peraduenture gabelus deade man wyll geue hym money thus begānne sorowfull anna hys wyfe beganne wepe together theyr sōne come againe vnto daye appoynted mother wepte discomfortable teares sayd wo sonne oh ayled v sende awaye straūge coūtre y• lyght eye thou staffe age thou comforte oure lyfe thou hope generacyon seynge thynges y• haue onely ī shuld haue sent away v tobias comforted sayd holde thy tonge dyscomforted oure sonne whole sounde man sente hym faithful ynough neuertheles might wise comforted dayly went loked aboute wente stretes wherby thought shulde come agayne •• yf possyble myght le hym commynge farre raguell sayde vnto hys sonne lawe▪ cary shall sende messaunger vnto thy father tobias tel thou art good health tobias saide vnto hym suce father mother counte euery day hertes sory raguell prayed tobias many wordes wolde wyse heare hym delyuered sara vnto halfe part good seruaūtes handmaydens shepe camel kyne much money sent away hym peace ioye sayde holy aungell lorde iourney bringe forth safe sounde ye may finde al thinges good case elder myne eye may se child afore dye parens embraced daughter kissed let go exhorting honour father mother law loue husbande rule well husholde kepe house good ordre shewe selfe fautelesse ¶ yonge tobias leuing wyfe houshold mydhe waye commeth aungel •• came mother loking sūne 〈…〉 receaued father mother sar • cometh seuen dare •• • r capi xi nowe goyng home ward agayne vpon xi daye came charra whiche lyeth halfe waye towarde niniue aungell sayde brother tobias thou knowest howe thou haste left thy father therfore yf please two wyl go let housholde thy wyfe catell come softe fayrly v tobias content shulde go raphael sayde vnto hym take gall fysh shalbe necessary tobias toke gal wēt theyr waye anna mother tobias sat dayly waye syde vpon toppe hyll whence myght se farre aboute whyle waytynge hys commynge loked farre anone perceaued sonne commynge ranne tolde husbande saying beholde thy sonne commeth raphael sayde vnto tobias soone thou commest house immediatly worshyppe lorde thy god geue thankes vnto hym go thy father kysse hym stryke eye ouer gal fish thou hast brought y• sure eye shal straight waye opened thy father shal se lyght heauen shal reioyce syght y• dog bene theyr iourneye ranne came messenger wagged tayle gladnesse blynde father arose beganne runne stombled hys fete gaue seruaūt hand ranne mete sonne receaued kyssed wyfe begāne wepe ioye nowe worshypped thanked god sat downe toke tobias fyshes gall anoynted hys father eye taried helfe houre beganne blemysh go eye lyke bene whyte skine egge tobias toke drewe hys eye immediatly receaued hys syght praysed god wyfe knewe hym tobias sayde lorde god israell geue praise thanckes thou hast chastened made whole lo nowe se sōne tobias seuen dayes came sara sōnes wyfe also whole soūde housholde catell camel much money hys wyues money receaued gabelꝰ tolde father hys mother al y• benefytes god done hym man led hym achior also nabath tobias sister sōnes came glad reioysed hym reason good god shewed vnto hym space seuē dayes made mery ryght ioyfull euerychone ¶ yonge tobias rechened vnto hys father pleasure aungell dyd hym offred vnto aungell holfe goodes brought hym capi xii tobyas called sonne vnto hym sayde may geue thys holy man wente tobias answered hys father sayde father rewarde shall geue thynge deserue benefytes hath bene gyde brought safe agayne receaued money frō gabelus caused get wyfe droue euyll spryte hath bene occasyon gladnesse father mother delyuered deuoured fyshe hath made se lyght heauen yee haue receaued greate good howe shulde worthely deserue thynges vnto praye father thou wylt desyre yf happly wyll voutch safe take wt hym halfe haue brought father sonne called hym toke asyde beganne praye hym y• wolde cōtent take good worth halfe parte al brought sayde secretly vnto prayse ye god heauen geue thankes vn hym men lyuynge hathe shewed mercy vnto v good hyde kinges secrete shew praise y• worckes god honorable thyng prayer good fastinge mercy better hoorde vp treasure gold mercy delyuereth death clenseth synne causeth fynde euerlasting lyfe synne vnrighteousnes enemyes theyr owne soule wherfore tell truth wyll hyde nothinge thou prayedst teares buryedst deed leftest thy dyner hiddest deed thy house vpon day tyme thou myghtest buryē nyghte offred thy prayer lorde thou wast accept beloued god necessary temtacyon shulde trye hath lord sent heale delyuet sara thy sonnes wyfe euyll spryte raphael aungel one seuen stande god hearde thys sore afrayed trembled fell downe vpon theyr face vnto grounde sayde aungel peace feare haue bene wyll god geue prayse thanckes vnto hym thought dyd g • x ••• ▪ • iudi 〈◊〉 ▪ eat dryncke vse meate inuysyble drincke cannot sene men nowe therfore tyme muste rurne agayne vnto sent ye thanckfull vnto god tel hys wonderous worckes spoken wordes taken awaye theyr syghte sawe hym nomore tell downe flat vpon face space thre houres praysed god rose vp tolde hys wonderous worckes ¶ tobias elder geueth thankes vnto god capi xiii olde tobias opened 〈◊〉 mouthe praysed lorde sayde great art thou lorde euermore thy kigdome worlde without ende thou scourgest healest thou ledest vnto hell bryngest agayne none may escape thyne hande geue thankes vnto lorde ye chyldren israell prayse hym syght heathen amonge heathen whiche knowe hym hathe scatered intent ye shulde shewe forth hys maruelous worckes cause knowe none god almyghtye hathe chastened v mysdedes hys owne mercye sake shall saue v consydre howe hath dealt prayse hym feare drede magnyfye euerlastynge kynge youre worckes wyll praye euen lande captiuyte hath shewed matestye vnto synful people turne therfore ye synners ryghteousnes god ye sure wyll shewe mercy vpon soule wyll reioyse god prayse lorde ye chosen holde y• dayes gladnesse thankfull vnto hym ierusalem thou cytie god lorde hath punyshed workes thyne owne handes prayse lorde thy good thynges geue thankes euerlastynge god may buylde vp tabernacle agayne maye call agayne vnto suche captiuyte thou mayest haue ioye euermore fayre lyght shalte thou shyne endes worlde shall honoure people shall come vnto farre shall brynge gyftes worship lorde thy laude shall haue sanctuary shall call vpon greate name cursed shall despyse blaspheme shalbe condempned blessed shall buylde vp thou shalt reioyse chyldre shalbe blessed gathered together vnto lorde blessed loue glad thy peace prayse thou lorde soule lorde god hathe delyuered hys cytie ierusalem trouble wyll counte selfe happye yf sede remayne se clearnes ierusalem gate ierusalem shalbe buylded saphyre smarage compasse walles precyous stone stretes shalbe paued white marble stone al stretes shal alleluya songe praysed lorde whiche hath exalted kyngdome maye vpon euermore amen tobias made ende hys talkynge ¶ tobias prophecyeth destruction niniue sōme returned raguel alter decesse h • father mother capi xiiii tobias gottē sight agayne lyued xlii▪ yeares sawe chylders chyldren c ii yeare olde dyed buryed honorably niniue sixe fyftye yeares age lost syght eye whē thre score yeare olde gat syght agayne residue lyfe led ioye increased well y• feare god departed 〈◊〉 peace houre hys death called vnto hym hys sonne tobias seuen yonge springaldes hys sōnes chyldren sayde vnto thē destruccyon niniue hande worde lorde fayle oure brother scatred lande israel shal come thyther agayne whole lande hathe bene waste shalbe fylled huose god brent shalbe buylded agayne suche feare god shall returne thyther heathen also shall forsake theyr idol come ierusalem dwel al kynges earth shalbe glad worshyp lorde god israel therfore chyldren heare father serue lorde trueth seke • wyll thynge pleaseth hym commaunde youre chyldren ryght geue almes myndeful god euer thankful vnto hym trueth theyr power heare nowe therfore chyldren abyde daye soeuer ye haue buryed youre mother besyde get hence se wyckednes shall brynge destruccyon ende death mother tobyas departed awaye frō niniue wyfe chyldren childers childrē came agayne hys father mother lawe founde whole good age toke care closed theyr eye heyre vnto al raguels goodes sawe fyfth generacyon chylders childrē whē x • ix yeare age dyed y• feare lorde kynsfolkes buryed posteryte continued good lyfe holy conuersacyon loued accepted bothe god men people lande ¶ ende booke tobias ❧ booke iudith ¶ buyidynge egbathanis vyctory nabuchodonosor agaynste arphaxat messenger nabuchodonosor dyspysed capi arphaxat kyng medes subdued many people vnto dominyon buylded noble stronge cytie called egbathanis walles made offre stone foure squared seuentye cubytes hye thrytye cubytes brode made towres vpon hundreth cubites hye vpon foure corner euery syde twentye fote brode made porte heygth lyke towres kynge trusted mightye host glorious charettes twelfth yeare raygne happened y• nabuchodonosor kynge y• assirians raygned y• great cytye niniue fought agaynste arphaxat ouercame hym great felde called ragau beside euphrates tigris iadason y• felde erioth y• kynge elykes y• kyngdome nabuchodonosor exalted herte lyfte vp sente vnto y• dwelt celicea damascus libanus vnto y• heathen dwelt carmel cedar dwelt galtle ye great felde esdrelon y• samaria beyonde water iordane vnto ierusalem whole lande iesse vnto y• moūtaynes ethiopia unto dyd nabuchodonosor kynge assirians sende messaūgers one consent wolde nat agre vnto sent y• messaungers agayne empty put awaye honour thē nabuchodonosor y• kynge toke indignacyon landes sware troue kyngdome wolde auenged countres ¶ holoferne • sent nabuchodonosor sub due al worlde preparacyon pursute holofernes capi ii thyrtenth yeare kynge nabuchodonosor vpon xxii daye fyrst moneth deuysed courte nabuchodonosor y• kynge assirians wolde detende hym selfe called vnto hym elder captaynes mē warre shewed hys secrete coūsel tolde purpose brynge whole earth vnder domynyon nowe content sayenge nabuchodonosor kynge called holofernes chefe captayne warres sayde vnto hym go thy waye forth agaynste kyngdomes west specially agaynst haue despised cōmaundemēt thou shalt spare realme strōge cyties shalt thou brynge subteccyon vnto holofernes called together al captaynes ruler power assiria mustred soudyers vnto hoste lyke y• kyng commaunded namely hundred twentye thousande fightynge men vpon fote twelue thousande archer vpon horsebacke ordinaūce sent wt inunmerable multytude camel y• hoost well prouyded wyth ox smal catell wythout nombre caused corne prepared al siria host much gold siluer also toke kynges house toke iourneye hoost charettes horsmen archer whō many couered grounde lande lyke greshopers gone past border assyrian came towarde great mountaynes ange lye vpon y• left syde celicia went vp al theyr castels wanne euery stronge holde welthy cytie melothus brake downe spoyled chyldrē tharsis ismaelites laye towarde wyldernes vpon south syde y• lande chelon wente ouer euphrates also came mesopotamia brake downe hye cyties frō broke mambre tyl man come see toke border celicia vnto y• coastes iaphet towarde y• south caryed awaye madiates spoyled theyr goddes whosoeuer withstode hym slewe swerde thys wente downe felde damascus tyme haruest brente vp corne tree caused vynes cut downe feare fell vpon dwelt earth ¶ kynges become wyllyngly subiect holofernes the▪ tyrannye crueltye▪ hym capi iii kynges prynces al cyties landes sent theyr embassytoures namely syrya mesopotamia syria sobal lybia celicia came holofernes sayde let thy wrath ceasse towarde v better v serue y• great kyng nabuchdoonosor lyues subiecte vnto y• shulde dye slayne receaue greater hurte cyties possession al mountaynes hylles feldes great small catel shepe goates horse camel oure goodes housholdes thy power vnder thy subieccyon al together selues also oure chyldren wylbe thyneowne come vnto v peaceable lorde vse oure seruyce thy pleasure came holofernes downe mountaynes horsmen great power conquered stronge fensed city dwelt lande cyties toke stronge men suche mete y• warre helpe hym came feare also vpon countrees indweller cyties prince ruler people together wente forth mete hym came receaued hym honorably garlādes torch daunses tabrettes pypes neuerthelesse though dyd yet myght nat swage rigorious stomack destroyed cyties hewed downe woddes nabuchodonosor kynge cōmaunded hym yt shulde roote goddes lande intent y• myght called taken god y• nacyons whiche holofernes power brought vnder went thorowe syria sabal thorow appamia mesopotamia came • umeans lande gabaa septopoly toke theyr cyties remayned thyrtye dayes wherin caused whole multytude hys hoste gathered together ¶ israel requyred helpe god holofernes f •• praye capi iiii chyldrē israel y• dwelt iewry hearde thys sore afrayed hym came trēblynge feare vpon thē least shuld vnto cytie ierusalem temple lorde y• done cyties theyr temple sent al samaria roūde vnto iericho toke occupyed al toppes mountaynes made fast townes wt walles prepared corne agaynste battayll eliachim also preste wrote vnto dwelte towarde esdrelon lyeth ouer agaynst y• great felde dothaim vnto men myght haue passage vnto shulde take wayes y• mountaynes wherby might waye passage ierusalē shulde holde dilygent watch strayte betwixt mountaynes childrē israel dyd eliachim prest lorde commaunded thē people cryed vnto lorde earnestly humbled theyr soules wt fastynges prayer theyr wyues prestes put hearye clothes layed yong babe temple lorde couered aulter lorde hearye cloth wt one accorde cryed vnto lorde god israel y• theyr chyldren shulde geuen praye theyr wyues spoyle y• theyr cyties shulde layed wast theyr sanctuary shulde vnhalowed shame rebuke vnto y• heathē eliachim hye prest y• lorde went rounde israel spake vnto sayinge ye sure lorde wyll heare youre peticyons yf ye contynue stedfast fastynges prayer syght lorde remēbre moyses seruaūt lorde ouerthrowe amalechites trusted theyr might power theyr hoost theyr shyldes theyr charrettes horsmen wt weapens holy prayer euen shal enemyes israell yf ye continue worke ye haue begonne vpon thys exhortacyon contynued prayer lorde much yt whiche offred brēt sacrifyces vnto lorde offred offringes vnto lorde beynge arayed hearye clothes asshes vpō theyr heades sought god frō theyr whole hert y• wolde vyset hys people israel ¶ holofernes discontent iewes iehior • hewith vnto holofernes • ruelles god done vnto iewes thinge ••• er vnder holofernes angry capi v worde came holofernes prynce y• warres assyryans chyldren israel prepared thē selues make resistaūce stopped y• wayes betwixte y• moūtaynes exceadynge wroth called prynces moab captaynes ammon sayde vnto thē tel people thys kepeth mountaynes howe great theyr cytes theyr power maner hooste haue theyr captaine despyse v dwel east come nat forth mete v myght receaue v peace achior captayne ammonite answered sayd syr yf please heare wyll tell trueth cōcernynge people y• dwel mountaynes shall lye go mouth people generacyō caldees dwelt fyrst mesopotamia wolde folowe y• goddes theyr father lande caldees forsoke coustomes theyr fore father many goddes worshipped one god made heauē earth whiche also cōmaunded thē shulde go frō thence dwel haran nowe came dearth whole lande wente downe egypte dwels gene xv • actes vii exod xii f gala iii c foure hundreth yeares multiplied greatly theyr hoost myght nat nombred kynge egypte oppressed subdued thē buyldynge cyties makynge claye bryck cryed vnto god theyr lorde punished whole lande egypt diuerse plage nowe kynge egypte let thē go theyr waye plage ceassed folowed take bring agayne seruice whyle flyenge awaye god heauen opened see water stode fast vpō bothe sydes wall wente thorowe botome see drye shod place innumerable people egypcyans folowed vpon ouer whelmed y• water remayned nat one tell y• came howe happened thys people passed thorow reed see came wildernes mounte sinai neuer mā myght dwel afore sonne mā neuer rested bytter water made swete myght drynke forty yeares meate heauen soeuer wente without bowe arowe without bukler swerde theyr god fought caused haue vyctory yee man able hurte thys people excepte departed vnfaythfully worshyppynge lorde theyr god ofte worshypped besyde theyr god gaue ouer spoyled slayne put confusion neuerthelesse oft fory departyng worshyppe theyr god god heauen gaue power strength stande theyr enemyes moreouer slewe kynge cananites iebusites pheresites hethites euites amorites y• myghtye hesebon toke theyr landes cyties possession longe synned nat syght theyr god wente wel thē theyr god hateth vnrighteousnesse tymes paste wente waye god geuen shulde walke destroyed dyuerse bataylles many nacyons many caryed awaye presonners vnto straunge countre nowe lately haue turned selues agayne vnto lorde theyr god come together agayne countres scaterd abrode thus haue cōquered mountaynes dwel therin ierusalem theyr sanctuary haue agayne possessyon therfore lorde make dilygent inquysyon yf thys people haue done wyckednesse syght god let v go vp agaynst douteles theyr god shall delyuer thy handes subdue vnto thy power yf people haue displeased theyr god shall nat able withstande theyr god shall defende shall shame worlde nowe achior spoken wordes greate men holofernes wroth amd thought sleye hym sayde one another darre saye chyldren israell able withstande nabuchodhnosor kynge hoost vnwepened people without strength vnderstandynge feates warre achior therfore maye knowe hathe disceaued v wyll go vp mountaynes myghty men taken also shalbe styckte swerde al people maye knowe nabuchodonosor god earth none without hym ¶ achior commytted handes iewes holofernes tyed ••• e lowsed iewes praier people achior comforted iewes capi vi left speakyng holo fernes toke sore indignacyon sayde vnto achior muche thou hast prophecyed vnto v sayeng people israel shalbe defended theyr god wylt shewe god nabuchodonosor yee sley al one man thou also shalt perysh thē thorow swerde assirians israel shal destroyed shalte thou fele nabuchodonosor lorde whole earth shal swerde knyghthode go thorowe thy sydes thou shalt fal downe styckte among wounded israel shalt come thy selfe agayne vtterly destroyed yf thou thinkest thy prophecy true doest thou chaunge thy coloure arte thou afrayed thynkest thou wordes able perfourmed thou mayest know thou shalt fele thynges beholde houre forth wyll sende vnto yonder people punishment swerde haue worthely deserued falleth vpon thou mayest punyshed holofernes cōmaunded seruauntes take achior cary hym vnto bethulia delyuer hym handes chyldren israel holofernes seruauntes toke hym went thorow plaine felde drew nye vnto moū taynes stynge caster came agaynst neuerthelesse gat away syde mountayne bounde achior hande fote tree lefte boūde wythes turned agayne vnto lorde notwithstandynge y• chyldren israell wente downe frō bethulia came vnto lowsed brought bethulia set hym myddest people asked matter y• assirians lefte bounde osias sonne micha tribe symeon charmim also called gothoniel principall ruler tyme nowe achior stode myddest senatours al tolde answere gaue holofernes thyng asked howe holofernes people wolde haue slayne hm sayinge howe holofernes hym selfe wroth commaunded hym cause delyuered vnto israelite ouercame chyldren israell myght cōmaunde achior also put death diuers tormentes sayde god heauen theyr defēder whē achior plainely tolde al thinges al people fel downe vpon face praisyng lord poured theyr praiers together vnto lorde wt general cōplaynt wepyng sayde lorde god heauē earth beholde pryde loke vpon lowlynes cōsydre standeth wt thy saynctes make knowē thou forsakest nat whiche holde fast howe y• thou bryngest thē lowe presume selues make theyr boste theyr owne strength wepynge prayer people whiche made whole daye longe ended comforted achior sayenge god oure father whose power strength thou hast praysed shal rewarde thou shalt rather se theyr destruccyon lorde oure god shall geue seruaūtes thys lybertye god also among v yf please thou wt thyne mayest dwell v nowe oseas ended coūcel toke house made great supper called elder refresshed selues fastynge afterwarde people called together made prayer al nygh • longe congregacion besought god israel helpe ¶ bethulia beseged holofernes people requyteth helpe god bethulia wolde gyue ouer citye wante water prayer people teares lamentacyon capi vii nexte daye holofernes commaunded hys hoste go vp agaynste bethulia hundred twentye thousande fyghtynge men fote two twentye thousande horssemen besyde preparyng wōne came euery syde countrees cityes whiche taken prepared selues vnto battayl agaynst israelite came hyl syde vnto toppe loketh ouer agaynste dothaim place called belma vnto chelmon lyeth towarde esdrelon nowe chyldrē israel saw great multitude assirians fell downe flat vpon groūde strawed asshes vpon theyr heades prayed one accorde god israel wolde shew mercy vpō people toke weapens sat betwixte mountaynes naro place kepte waye day nyght whyle holofernes goynge aboute founde water sprynge whiche south syde conueyed ye cytie cōdite cōmaunded directe another waye cut cōdite sunder welles also farre walles whiche vsed secretely pleasure necessyte wente ammonite y• moabytes vnto holofernes sayd chyldrē israell trust neyther speare arowe kepe defende mountaynes hylles thou mayest ouercome thē therfore without y• strykynge batayle set men kepe welles drawe water shalt thou destroy without swearde least shall feble must fayne geue ouer cytye whiche thynke able wonne muche lyeth mountaynes wordes pleased holofernes well mē warre set hundreth euery well rounde aboute watch endured twentye dayes cisternes water fayled dwelt cyte bethulia whole cyte dryncke ynough one daye people water geuen daylye measure came men wemen yonge personnes chyldren vnto osias sayde one voyce god • udge betwyxte v thou hast dealt euyl v thou woldest speake peaceably kynge assyrian therfore hathe god solde v theyr handes mā helpe v brought downe theyr eye thirst great destruccyon therfore gather nowe together al people cytie maye yelde selues wyllyngely vnto people holofernes better captyue prayse lorde oure lyues slayne peryshe laughed scorne shamed euery man se wyues child dye eye take heauen earth daye recorde god oure father whiche punysshed v accordynge deseruyng synnes gaue warning ye geue vp cyte nowe power holofernes hoste ende maye shorte swearde whiche el shall endure long want water thyrste spoken wordes great wepyng howlyng whole cōgregacion yt euery man cried whole hour long vnto god wt one voyce saying haue synned wt father haue done amyse haue dealte wyckedly thou y• art gracious haue mercy vpon v punysh vnryghtuousnes thyne owne scourge geue ouer y• knowledge vnto people knowe least say amonge heythen god wery thys cryenge wepynge helde theyr tonges osias stode vp watrye eye sayde take good hertes vnto deare brother good cheare let v wayte yet fyue dayes mercye lorde peraduenture shal cut away indignacyon geue glorye vnto hys name yf helpe v fyue dayes paste shall ye haue sayde ¶ vertuous woman iudith whiche reproueth aunci •• • tempted lorde also moueth encorage hertē people sheweth councel agaynst enemyes iewes capi viii happened wordes came eares iudith wyddow whiche daughter merari sonne idox sonne ioseph sōne osia sonne elai sonne iammor sonne iedeon sonne raphoim sonne achitob sōne melchia sonne euam sonne nathania sonne salathiel sonne simeon sonne ruben husband called manasses whyche dyed dayes barlye harueste whyle byndynge sheues together felde heate came vpon heade dyed bethulia cytye buryed besyde father nowe iudyth hys desolate wyddowe thre yeares syxe monethes hygher partes house made selfe preuye chambre dwelt beyinge closed maydens ware smocke hearre fasted al dayes lyfe excepte sabbathes newe mones solempne day people israel kepte fayre beautifull persone husband also left great ryches plentuous housholde great vnmouable possessiōs many catell iudith woman good reporte euery one feared y• lorde greatly body spake euel worde whē iudith herde osias promysed people yt fyfte day wolde giue vp cyte vnto assiriās sent elder chābri charmy came sayde thynge wherin osias hath cōsented god helpe wtin fyue dayes wyll geue ouer cytie assirians ye y• ye tempte lord deuice optayneth mercy god prouoketh hi vnto wrath displeasure wyll ye set mercy lorde tyme appoyute hym day wyll neuerthelesse muche lord pacyente let v rather repent pouryng teares beseching grace god threateneth man neyther wyll prouoked vnto wrath chyldren men therfore let v hertely fall downe serue meke sprete wepynge eye say vnto lorde deale v accordyng owne wyll mercy lyke hert vexed brought lowe thorowe pryde maye conforted thorowe hys grace muche folowe synnes father forsoke theyr god worshypped goddes whiche synne peryshed swearde spoyled brought shame theyr ennemyes v knowe none god onely hym whose comforte let v tary mekenesse shal requyre make inquysicion bloude frome vexacions enemyes shall brynge downe heythen ryse vp v put dyshonoure euen lorde god therfore deare brother seynge ye honorable elder people god vnto people haue respecte vpon lyfe people standeth lyft vp theyr hertes exhortacyon maye call remembraunce howe oure father also tymes past tempted myght proued yf worshypped theyr god ryght ought remembre howe gen xxii father abraham beynge tempted tryed thorowe many trybulacyons founde louer frende god isaac iacob moises al pleased god beyng tryed thorowe many trouble founde stedfast fayth agayne receyued theyr tēptacyons feare god put selues forth vnpaciency murmurynge agaynste god peryshed destroyer slayne serpentes therfore shuld vndertake auenged thyng done vnto v consydre punyshementes farre lesse synnes mysdedes beleuinge also correccyon commeth vnto v seruauntes god amendemente destruccion sayde osias elder vnto iudith thou speakest true man reproue thy wordes pray thou v therfore vnto god thou arte holy woman fearest god iudith sayde vnto seyng ye knowe wordes god proue councell deuyse yf god beseche god y• wyll brynge councel good ende thus haue deuised ye shal stande nyght porte wyll go forthe wt abra mayden praye ye therfore vnto god wyl graciously remēbre people israel wtin fiue dayes ye haue said thynge go hande wtal aske ye question tyl open vnto selfe ye nothīg el pray vnto lorde god osias prince people iuda sayd vnto go thy way peace lorde wt may auēged oure ennemyes wente agayne ¶ prayer iudith vyctory capi ix nowe gone theyr way iudyth wente closet put hearrye smocke strawed asshes vpon heade fell downe lord cryed vnto hym sayinge lorde god father gene 34 • xlix symeon gauest hym swerde defence agaynst enemyes vsed vyolence wylfulnes rauisshed vyrgin put dyshonesty thou gauest theyr wyues pray theyr daughter captiuite al theyr praye spoyle vnto thy seruauntes whyche bare zele vnto helpe wyddowe lorde god beseche thou hast done thynges begynnynge loke thou hast taken hande deuised came euer passe thy wayes prepared thy iudgementes done thy euerlastyng knoweledge loke nowe vpon army assyrian lyke thy pleasure somtime loke vpon host y• egipciās weapened ꝑsecute thy seruaūtꝭ put theyr trust charettes horsmē multitude men warre yu lokedst vpon host castyng thycke darkenes came depe water ouerwhelmed euen lorde let go truste power multitude men warre theyr charettes arowes speares knowe thou onely art god whiche destroyest warres begynnyng thou art lord lift vp thyne arme nowe lyke euer trō begynning thy power brynge power naught cause theyr myght fall thy wrathe make theyr boste wyll vnhalowe defyle thy sanctuary wayst tabernacle thy name cast downe horne thyne aulter theyr swerde bryng passe lorde pryde enemye maye cut downe owne swearde maye takē wt snare eye thou mayest smyte hi lyppes loue geue stedfast minde maye despyse strength may destroye hym thys shall brynge thy name euerlastynge remembraunce yf hande woman ouer throwe hym thy power lord stādeth y• power men neyther hast yu pleasure strength horse neuer proude persone yt pleased prayer y• humble meke hath thy pleasure bene euermore thou god heauens thou maker water lorde creature heare poore woman callynge vpon puttynge truste thy mercy remembre thy couenaunt lorde mynister wordes mouth stablysh deuice hert thy house maye contynue styll holynes heythen maye knowe thou art god none thou ¶ iudish decketh selfe • go holofernes blessynge elder gaue iudith holofernes loue iudith capi x whē left cryeng vnto lord rose vp place lyen flat lord called mayden wente downe house layed hearrye clothe frē put garmne • e wyddowhode wasshed body anoynted selfe precyous thynges▪ swete sauoure broyded platted hearre set hooue vpon head put suche apparell belongeth vnto gladnesse slyppers vpon fete armellettꝭ spā ge earynges fynger rynges deckt selfe wt best aray lorde gaue also specyall beautye fayrenes deckyng selfe done voluptuousnesse pleasure fleshe ryght discrecyon vertue therfore dyd lorde increase bewtye exceadyng amiable welfauoured men eye gaue hyr mayde also botell wyne pot oyle pottage cake bread chese went way nowe whan came porte cytie founde osias elder cytie waytyng whiche whā sawe astonnyed marueled greatly vewty neuerthelesse asked questiō let go saying god father geue grace hys power perfourme al deuyse thy herte y• ierusalē maye reioyce ouer thy name may nōbre holy ryghtuous al y• sayde wt one voyce iudith made prayer vnto lord went porte mayde going downe mountayne happened aboute y• sprynge day spyes assyriās met wt toke saying whence cōmest yu whither goest yu answered daughter hebrues fled knowe yt shal geuē vnto spoyled thought scorne yelde thē selues vnto myght fynde mercy syght therfore haue deuysed selfe maner wyl go prince holofernes tell al secretes wyl shewe may come wynne one man hoste shal perysh whan men hearde wordes considered fayre face astonnyed wondred excellent bewty said vnto thou hast saued thy life fyndynge deuyce yu woldest come downe oure lorde thou sure whan thou commest vnto hym shall intreate well thou shalt please hym herte brought holofernes pauylyon tolde nowe came immediately ouercome taken bewty said seruaūtes wolde despyse people iewes haue fayre wemē shuld reasō fyght agaynst thē whē iudith sawe holofernes syttynge canapy▪ wrought purple sylke golde smaradge precyous stone loked fast vpō hym fell downe vpon earth holofernes seruaūtes toke vp agayne theyr lordes cōmaundement ¶ holofrenes requyreth iudith cause cōming whiche geueth • uttell answere capi x sayde holofernes vnto good chere feare thyne hert neuer hurte man wolde serue nabuchodonosor kynge thy people yf despysed shulde haue lyft vp speare agaynst thē tell nowe cause thou art departed wherfore arte thou come vnto v iudith sayde vnto hym syr vnderstande y• wordes thy hand mayden yf yu wylt wordes thy hād mayden lord shal bryng thy matter prosperous effecte truly nabuchodonosor lord lande lyueth truely power lyueth punishement al men go wrong al mē shal onely subdued vnto thorow beastes also felde obey people speake thy prudent actyuite hath euer bene reported howe thou onely art good myghty al kingdome thy discrecion cōmended landes thyng manyfest also achior spake well knowen thou cō maundest vnto playne surety god wroth wt v reason sinnes yt hath shewed prophetes vnto people theyr synnes wyll delyuer ouer vnto enemy much chyldren israel know haue displesed theyr god sore afrayed suffre greate hongre also want water deade nowe maner moreouer appoynted slaye theyr catell maye dryucke bloude purposed spende al holy ornamentes god hathe forbyddē touche corne wyne oyle seynge nowe thynges playne case must nedes destroyed thy handmayde • perceyued fled lord hath sent vnto shew thynges thy handmayden worshyppe god euen nowe besyde thy handemayden shall go wyll make prayer vnto god shal tell wyll rewarde theyr synne shall come shewe brynge thorowe myddest ierusalē thou shalte haue people israel shepe wythout shepherde shal much one dog barcke agaynst thynges shewed prouydence god much god displeased hath sent tell wordes pleased holofernes seruauntes marueled wysdome sayde one another suche woman vpon earth bewtye discrecyon wordes holofernes sayde vnto god hath done well hath sent hyther thy people y• mayest geue hand •• muche thy promyse good 〈…〉 god perfourme vnto shalbe go 〈…〉 thou shalt excellente great 〈…〉 court nabuchodonosor thy name shalbe spoken lande holofernes cōmaundeth iudith well intreat • sh • desyreth lycen • e go nyght c ••• ō 〈…〉 neth •• ga • set vnto h •• 〈◊〉 to▪ come holofernes banckes cometh holo •••• e 〈◊〉 capi xi cōmaunded go treasure laye charged shulde haue dwellynge appoynted shulde gyuen frome hys table iudith answered hym sayd meate thou haste commaunded geue may eate least dysplease god wyll eate suche haue brought sayde holoferues vnto thynges thou haste brought wyth fayle shal vnto iudith said truely thou lyuest lorde thy hādmayden shall spende thys tyll god haue brought passe hande thinges haue deuysed hys seruauntes brought tent appointed goyng desyred y• myght haue leue go forth nyght day prayer make intercessyon vnto lord cōmaūded holofernes chāberla • ne y• shulde go pleasure pray vnto god thre dayes nyght season went forth valley bethulia wasshed selfe well water wente vp besought lorde god israell wolde prospere waye delyueraunce hys people wente remayned clene tente tyll toke meate euenyng upon fourth daye happened holofernes made supper vnto hys seruaū te sayd vnto uagao chāber • ayne go thy waye councell thys hebruesse may wyllynge consent kepe company shame vnto assyryans woman shulde laugh man scorne come frō hym vnmedled withall went uagao vnto iudith sayd let y• good daughter afraied come lorde may honoured may eate drincke wine mery unto whome iudith answered shulde saye lorde naye whatsoeuer good eye shall loke hys pleasure shall thyncke well done longe lyue stode vp deckte self apparell wente stode holofernes herte whole moued brent desyre towarde holofernes sayd vnto dryncke syt downe mery thou haste founde fauoure sayde iudith syr wyll dryncke mynde meryer daye euer lyfe toke dyd eate drancke y• thinges y• mayden prepared holofernes mery wt drancke wine euer afore lyfe ¶ holofernes slepet •• dronckēne • iudith cut • eth heade • nd goeth ther owne people •• r ••• yued • oy geue thākes vnto god 〈◊〉 theyr deliueraunce iudith speaketh vnto achior maru • leth fe •• e done holofernes capi xiii nowe late nyght seruauntes made haste euery man lodgynge uagao shut chambre dores wente waye ouerladen wyne iudith alone chambre holofernes laye vpon bed droncken verye dronckēnes fel slepe commaunced iudith mayden stande without dore waite iudith stode bed makynge prayer tearess moued lyppes secretely sayde strengthen lorde god israel haue respecte vnto workes hādes houre y• thou mayest set vp thy cyte ierusalem lyke y• haste promysed graūte may perfourme y• thyng haue deuysed thorowe beleue haue spokē thys went bedsteade lowsed swerde hanged vpon drew thē toke holde hearrye locke hys heade sayd strengthen lorde god hour gaue two stroke vpon necke smote head toke canapy away rolled deed body asyde immediatly gather forth delyuered ye head holofernes vnto maidē bad put wallet two wente forth together theyr custome though wolde pray passed host came thorow valey vnto porte cytye iudyth cryed farre vnto watchemē vpon walles opē gate sayde god wt v hath shewed power • israel hearde voyce called elder cite together came • mete lytle great yonge olde thoughte y• shulde haue come sone lyghted candels gathered boute euery • hone wente vp hye place caused sylence proclamed euery man helde hys tonge iudith sayde prayse lord god hath despysed forsaken put trust handmaidē hath perfourmed mercy promysed vnto house israel yee hand thys nyght hath slayne enemye hys people toke forth head holofernes wallet shewed sayinge beholde heade holofernes captayne assyryans thys canapy wherin laye dronckē ne lord god hath slayne h • hande woman truly lorde liueth angell hath kepte goynge thyther remaynyng cōmynge hyther agayne frome thence lord hath suffred hand mayden defyled without fylthines sine hath brought agayne vnto great vyctorye y• escaped ye delyuered geue thankes vnto euerychone gracious mercy endureth euer praysed lorde al together gaue thākes vnto said lorde hath blessed power thorow hath brought enemyes naught ozias chefe ruler y• people israel said vnto blessed art thou daughter lord hye god aboue wemen vpon earth blessed y• lord maker heauen earth hath gyded y• ryght woūde smyte head captayne oure enemyes daye hath made thy name honourable ye thy prayse shal neuer come mouth mē shal alwaye remembre power lorde seying thou hast spared thyne owne self put • eopardy consideryng anguysh trouble thy people hast helped theyr fall god lorde people sayd amen amen achior also called came sayde iudith vnto hym god israel vnto whō yu gauest witnes y• wolde auē ged enemyes euen hath nyght thorow hand smytten y• head vnfaythfull yu mayest se ye beholde y• head holofernes presumptuous pryde despysed y• god people israell threatened wt destruceyō saying whē y• people israel taken shall cause y• also styck • e swerde achior sawe holofernes head fell downe vpō face y• groūde anguyshe feare y• sowned wt y• come agayne hym self fel downe praysed saying blessed art thou thy god al tabernacle iacob people thy name shall prayse god israel ¶ councel iudith achior beynge heathen man turneth god assirians afrayed iewes capi xiiii iudith sayde vnto people▪ brethrē heare styck vp heade vpon walles sūne ariseth take euery man weapē fall vyolently though ye wolde go besyde thē rēne vpon thē vyo • ēce spyes • • entes se thys shall necessyte compelled • le backward rayse vp captayne batayle captaynes come holofernes pa • ylyon fynde y• dead body wrapped y• bloude fearfulnes shall fall vpon whē ye perceyue flye folow thē without al care god shal delyuer vnto destroyed achior seying y• power god whiche shewed vnto y• peple israel fel hꝭ heathenish belefe put trust god let selfe circūcised nōbred amōg people israel posterite vnto daye nowe sone daye styckt vp holofernes heade vpon walles euery man toke weapen wente horryble cry spyes sawe came vnto holofernes tente within tente came hys chamber made greate russhing wake vp thought noyse haue raysed durst one assyrian knocke go open captaynes prince al chefe kyng assyriās host came together sayde vnto chāberlay • e go way wake vp myse crept theyr hole darre prouoke v vnto batayle wente uagao chambre stode bed clapped hys handes thought bene slepynge iudith whē herkened perfectly eares coulde perceyue sterynge wente nyer bed lyfte vp thē sawe ye deed body holofernes lyēge without heade weltred bloud vpon earthe cryed loude voyce wepynge rente clothes went iudithes tent found leapt vnto people sayd one woman y• iewes hath broughte nabuchodonosors people shame lo holofernes lyeth vpon grounde hath heade y• chefe assyrian hoste herde rente theyr clothes fell intollerable feare tremblynge vpon thē myndes sore afrayed excedynge greate crye whole hoste ¶ flyght assyryans ••• su •• israel 〈◊〉 israel becommeth •• che spoyles assyriās iudith praysed ioachim people capi xv al y• host herd y• holofernes headed mynde councell fell soch feare came vpon vndertoke defende thē selues flieng away one spake another hanged downe theyr heades lefte behynde made haste escape hebrues herde hastyng come theyr weapens fled wayes feldes thorow al fo • e pathes dale chyldren israell sawe fled folowed vpon went downe trompettes blowyng makynge greate crye assirians ordre kepte thē selues together fled theyr waye neuerthelesse cyldren israel fel vpō one company ordre discomfited many myght get o • sent messaungers vnto cytyes countrees israel regyons euery cytie sente best men harnes smote swearde tyll came vttemost parte theyr border bethulia came tentes assiriās toke al y• whiche fled left behynde founde great good y• came agayne bethulia frome batayle toke wt suche thinges bene theyrs nōbre catel al costly iewels lowest vnto y• hyest al made • iche spoiles thē ioachim hye preste ierusalē came bethulia elder myght se iudith came vnto begāne al prayse wt one voyce saying yu worshyp cyte ierusalē thou ioy israell yu honoure people yu hast done manly thy herte cōforted yu hast loued clenlynes chastite hast knowen man thyne owne husband therfore hath hande lorde cōforted blessed shalt yu euer al people sayd thyrty dayes coulde people israel scarse gather vp spoyles assirians al belongeth vnto holofernes bene specyally whether gold syluer precious stone clothyng al ornamentes gaue vnto iudith al people reioysed bothe wemen maydens yonge people pypes harpes ¶ • onge iudith vyctory v • c ••• ye • tayned people commeth ierusalem worshyppe prayse god capi xvi songe iudith thys songe vnto lorde begynne vnto lorde vpon tabrettes synge vnto lorde vpon cymbales syng vnto hym new song thankesgeuyng ioyful cal vpon hys name lord destroyeth warres euē lorde name hath pitched tentes myddest people myght delyuer v hande enemyes assur came mountaynes north multytude strength people stopped water brokes theyr horsses couered y• valley purposed haue brent vp lande •• ey yong men wt swearde wolde haue caryed away chyldren vyrgins captiuyte y• almyghtye lorde hyndred hym delyuered hym y• handes woman whiche brought hym confusion theyr myghtye destroyed yonge men y• sonnes tytan slewe hym neyther haue greate gyauntes set selues agaynst hym iudith y• daughter merari fayre beautye hath discou • fited hym brought hym naught layed awaye wyddowes garmente put apparel gladnesse reioysynge chyldren israel anoynted face bounde vp hearre hooue begyle slyppers rauished hys eye bewtie captyuated mynde swerde smote necke persian astonnyed stedfastnes medes boldnes howled armyes assyrian symple appeared drye thyrst sonnes daughter haue pearsed thē thorowe slayne fugytyue chyldren peryshed batayle feare lorde god let v synge songe thankesgeuyng vnto lorde new song prayse wyll synge vnto oure god lorde lord thou arte greate god myghtye power man may ouercome thy creature shulde serue thou spakest worde made thou se • test thy sprete created man withstande thy voyce▪ mountaynes shall moue fo •• ▪dacyons water stony rockes shall melt lyke waxe y• fere shalbe great al thynges wo vnto people • ise vp generacyon almyghtye lorde wyll auenge hym selfe daye iudgement wylhe vyset thē shal geue fire wormes flesh may burne fele euermore thys happened victory al people came ierusalem geue prayse thanckes vnto lorde puryfyed offred theyr brentsacryfyces theyr promysed offrynges iudith offred holofernes weapēs al iewels people geuen canapy toke hys bed hanged vp vnto lorde people ioyful vse thys ioye reason victory iudith endured thre monethes dayes euery man wente home agayne iudith great reputacyon bethulia ryght honorably taken al land israel unto vertue also chastyte ioyned husbande manasses dyed neuer knew man dayes lyfe upon hye solempne dayes wente greate worshyppe dwelt husbā de house hundred fyue yeare left hand maiden fr • dyed buryed besyde husband bethulia al people mourned seuen dayes long lyued none troubled israell many yeares also death daye wherin vyctory gotten solemp • holden rekened iewes nō • er holy dayes yet greatly holden y• iewes euer sēce vnto thꝭ day ¶ ende booke iudyth ❧ reaste chapter boke esther nether founde hebrue chalde ¶ dreame mardocheus ¶ xi chapter latyn mardocheus sonne iair sōne semei sōne cisei y• tribe bē • • iew dwell • ge ī cite susis mā great reputacion excellent amōge al y• kinges court▪ neuertheles one presoners whō nabuchodonosor y• kyng babilō caried away frō ierusalē vnto babilon wt iechonias king iuda secōde yeare y• raigne great artaxerses fyrst daye moneth nisan mardocheus dreme thought herde greate tempest horrible thōderclappes erthquakes great vproure land sawe two great dragon ready fyght one agaynst another theyr crye greate whiche roaryng crye heathen vp fight righteous people day ful darcknes vncleare full trouble anguyshe yee greate fearfulnes lande ryghteous amased feared plage euyl deuised ouer pointe thē selues dye cryed vnto god whyle crienge y• lytle wel grewe great ryuer many water day sūne rose vp againe lowly exalted deuoured gloryous proude mardocheus sene thys dreame awoke mused stedfastly hert god wolde desyred knowe al matter • mynde therupon vntyll night ¶ mardocheus v •••• eth • reason deuysed kyng therfore rewarded hym capi xii tyme dwelt mardocheus bagatha tare kynges courte kynges chāberlaines porter palace hearde deuyce dylygently consydered theyr ymaginaciōs perceaued y• wente a▪bout lay cruel hādes vpō kyng artaxerses certifyed y• king therof caused kynge examen two gelded tormentes graunted put death kinge caused put y• cronicles euerlasting remēbraunce mardocheus wrote vp y• matter kynge commaunded mardocheus shulde remaine court faithfulnes hys gaue rewarde amā sonne amadathu agagite holden great honour reputacion ī kinges court vndertoke hurt mardocheus people two chāberlaines put death ¶ copy letter artaxerses agaist iewes prayer mardocheus capi xiii great king artaxerses raigneth frō iuda vnto ethiopia ouer h • dreth seuen twentye lādes sendeth fredly salutacyon vnto prince debites countrees subiecte vnto hys domynion • e lord ouer many people subdued whole earthe vnto domynyon mynde crueltye wronge exalte self reason power purposed equyte alwaye gentylnes gouerne vnder iurisdiccyon wholy set peceable lyfe therby brynge kyngdome vnto tranquilyte men might safely go thorowe euery syde renue peace agayne al men desyre nowe asked coūcelers thinges might brough good ende one v excellēt wysdome whose good wyl trueth faythfulnes hath oft bene shewed proued whiche also y• princypall next vnto kynge aman name certifyed v al lādes scatred abrode rebellious folke made statute lawes agaynste people haue alwaye despysed proclamed commaundementes kynges thys cause suffred rule shulde contynue put downe seynge perceaue people alone contrary vnto euery man vsyng straūge maner lawes withstande oure statute doinges go aboute stablysh shrewed matter kingdome shuld neuer come good estate stedfastnes therfore haue commaunded appoynted wrytynge shewed vnto amā whiche ordeyned set ouer oure landes pryncypall nexte vnto kynge maner father shal wt theyr wyues chyldren destroyed roted oute swerde theyre enemyes aduersaries shall mercy shewed man spared shalbe done xiiij day mo • leth called adar thys yeare olde also haue euer bene rebellious maye one daye vyolence thrust downe hell intent thys maner oure empyre maye haue peace tranquilite mardocheus thought vpon worckes noble actes lorde made prayer vnto saying lord lorde thou valeaunt almyghty kinge al thinges thy power thou wilt helpe delyuer israel man withstāde let thou hast made heauen earth wonderous thing euer vnder heauē thou art lorde thinges mā resist thy maiestye lord thou knowest thynges thou woteste lorde y• nether malice presūpcion desyre glory y• wolde vowe downe selfe worshyp yonder proude presumpteous amā wolde haue bene contente good wyl yf myght haue done israel good haue kist euē fotsteppes dyd wolde set honour man steade glorye god wolde worship none onely y• lorde thys haue done pryde presūpcyon therfore lord thou god kyng haue mercy vpō thy people ymagin may bring v naught yee minde desyre destroy ouerthrowe people hath euer bene thyne enheritaūce olde despise thy porciō thou hast delyuered brought oute egypte thyne owne selfe heare prayer mercyfull vnto people yu hast chosen herytage vn thy selfe turne oure complainte sorowe ioye may lyue lorde prayse thy name lorde suffre mouthes thē y• prayse destroied people israell lyke maner cryed earnestly coulde vnto lord theyr death destruccyon stode theyr eye ¶ prayer e • delyueraunce au • people capi xiiii quene esther also ī battayl death resorted vnto lorde laied awaye gloryous apparell put garmentes serued sighthynge mournynge steade precyous oyntment scatred asshes dong vpō head body humbled fastynge broughte lowe place wont haue ioy afore filled heare plucte selfe prayed also vnto lorde god israell wordes▪ lorde thou onely art oure kynge helpe desolate woman whiche haue helper mysery destruccyon harde hande fro youth vp haue hetde kinred father y• thou tokest israel amonge people haue oure father theyr fore elder y• shulde thy perpetual inherytaūce loke thou didest promise thē thou hast made good vnto wel lord haue synned therfore hast thou geuen v handes oure enemyes worshypped theyr goddes lorde thou art ryghteous neuertheles satisfieth bitter heuy captiuite oppressed amonge thou hast layed theyr handes vpō handes theyr goddes begynne take awaye ye thynge thou thy mouth hast ordened appoynted destroye thyne inheritaunce shut stoppe mouthe thē prayse quench glory worshippe thy house thine aulter open y• mouthes heathen y• may prayse power vertue goddes magnifye fleshly kynge euer lorde geue thy scepter vnto nothing lest laugh v scorne oure mysery fall turne theyr deuice vpō selues punish hath begonne ouer v set example thyncke vpon v lorde shewe thy selfe vnto v tyme oure distres trouble strength thou kynge goddes thou lorde power geue cloquēt pleasaūt spech mouth lyon turne hys hert y•
