hate oure enemye destroye consent vnto hym deliuer v thy hade helpe thy hand mayde haue defence hel per put onely lorde thou knowest thynges thou wotest yt loue glory worshyp vnryghteous hate abhorre bed vncircum cysed heathen thou knowest necessite hate token preemynence worshyp beare vpō head tyme must shewe selfe sene abhorre vncleane cloth weare quyete alone selfe thou knowest also thy hande mayden haue eaten amans table haue pleasure de lyte kynges feaste haue drōcke wyne drinckoffringes thy hande maiden haue ioy sence daye brought hyther vnto day onely lorde thou god abrahā thou mighty god aboue heare voyce haue none hope delyuer v hand wicked deliuer feare ¶ mardocheus moueth hester go kynge make intercession people performeth hys request capi xv mardocheus also bad hester go vnto kyng praye people countre remembre sayeth dayes thy lowe estate howe thou waste norished vnder hand aman next vnto kynge hath geuen sentence death agaynst v cal thou therfore vpō lorde speake v vnto kynge deliuer v death vpō thyrde daye happened hester layed awaye mournynge garmentes put gloryous apparel deckte selfe goodly called vpon god y• beholder sauioure al thinges toke two maydes vpō one leaned selfe one tender folowed bare y• trayne vesture shyne bewtye made face rose colored similitude face chearfull amiable hert sorowful greate feare wēte thorow al dores stode kyng kynge sat vpon trone hys kingdome clothed goodly aray golde set precyous stone terryble lyfte vp hys face shone clearnes loked grily vpon fel quene downe pale faynt leaned selfe vpon head mayde went neuertheles god turned y• kinges mynde gentle yt leaped oute hys seate feare gat hys armes held vp tyll came selfe againe gaue louing wordes also sayde vnto hester matter thy brother good chere thou shalt dye commaundement toucheth comōs y• come nye helde vp golden rod layde vpon neck embraced frendly sayd talke sayd g • xx •• li l • sawe y• lorde angell god hert troubled feare thy magesty clear nesse excellent wonderful art thou lorde thy face ful amite thus speakyng vnto fel downe agayne fayntnes whiche cause kyng afraied seruauntes comforted ¶ copye letter arthaxerses wherby reuoketh fyrst sende forth capi xvi greate kynge artaxerses whiche raineth iudia vnto ethiopia ouer hundreth xxvij landes sendeth vnto price ruler landes suche loue hys frendly salutacion many y• sondry frendshippes benefytes diuersly done vnto theyr worshyppe euer proude hye mynded vndertake onely hurte oure subiectes plenteous benefytes maye suffre begīne ymagin thing good take onely vnthākfulnes awaye frō men pryde presumpcion vnmyndfull vnthankefull good dedes go aboute escape iudgemente god seyth thinges whiche iudgement hateth punisheth al wyckednes happeneth ofte also whiche set office hyer power vnto busynes cause subiectes committed handled waxe proude defyle selues sheddynge innocēt bloude bryngeth intollerable hurt also false disceatfull wordes lyeng tale disceaue betray innocent goodnes prince nowe profitable good take hede make search therafter consider onely hath happened vnto v olde shamefull vnhonest noysome thinges debites haue taken hande eye therby beware tyme come may make kyngdome quyete peaceable al men myghte tyme drawe chaunge thynge nowe presente oure eye withstande put downe frendly maner tyme nowe aman sonne amadathu macedonian straūger verely persian bloude farre oure goodnes come amonge v aleaunt optained frendship beare towarde people called oure father hye honoure euery man next principal vnto y• king coulde forbeare self frō pryde hath vndertake onely rob v kyngdome lyfe manyfolde disceate also hath desired destroye mardocheus helper preseruer whiche hath done v good thinges innocēt hester lyke partaker oure kyngdome people mynde taken thē oute waye robbed v thē meanes trāslate kingdome persian vnto thē mocedonia fynde iewes accused wicked might destroyed euyll doer vse reasonable right lawes chyldrē hye lyuynge god whome kyngdome v oure progenitours hath bene wel ordred hytherto wherfore letter cōmaundementes put forth aman sonne amadathu ye shall well yf ye holde none effecte set vp inuented thē hangeth susis port kynted god hath thynges power hath rewarded hym hys deseruynge vpon thys ye shall puplysh set vp copy thys letter place iewes may frely without hinderaunce holde selues theyr owne statute maye helped vpon xiij day xij moneth adar maye auenged tyme theyr anguyshe trouble wolde haue oppressed god gouerneth thinges hath turned ioye day chosen people shulde haue peryshed moreouer among hye solēpne dayes y• ye haue ye shall holde thys daye also al gladnesse • ow tyme come thys daye maye remembraūce good al loue prosperite persian remembraunce destruccyon sedycious vnto v cyties landes thys shal horribly peryshe destroyed swerde fyre shall onely nomore inhabyted men abhorred also wylde beastes foules ende reast boke esther ❧ booke wysdome ¶howe ought searche enquyre god • e fynde hym holy goost ought flye backbytynge murmurynge 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 capi sette affeccion vpon ryghteousnesse ye iudges earth haue good opiniō lorde seke hym synglenesse herte wyll founde tempte hym nat appereth vnto suche put theyr truste hym frowarde thoughtes separate god vertue yf alowed reformeth y• vnwyse wysdome shall nat entre frowarde soule dwel body subdued vnto synne holy goost abhorreth fayned nurtoure withdraweth hym selfe thoughtes without vnderstandinge wyckednes hathe vpper hande flyeth frō thence sprete wysdome louynge gentle gracyous wyll haue pleasure hym speaketh euell lyppes god wytnesse hys raynes true searcher herte hearer tonge sprete lorde fylleth rounde compasse worlde vpholdeth thynges hathe knowledge also voyce therfore speaketh vnryghteous thynges hyd nether maye escape iudgemēt reprofe inquisicion shalbe made thoughtes vngodly reprote hys wordes shal come vnto god wickednes shalbe punished eare gelousy heareth thynges noyse grudginges shall hyd therfore beware murmurynge nothynge worth refrayne youre tonge sclaunder worde darcke secrete shall goo naught mouth speaketh lye sleyeth soule seke nat owne death y• erroure youre lyfe destroye youre selues thorow worckes youre awne hādes god hath made death nether hath pleasure destruccyon lyuynge created thinges myght haue theyr beynge yee people earth hathe made shulde haue health shulde destruccyō kyngdome hell shulde vpō earth ryghteousnesse euerlastinge immortall vnryghteousnes bryngeth death neuerthelesse y• vngodly call vnto bothe wordes workes whyle thynke haue frende come naught vngodly confederate take parte worthy death ¶ ymaginacyons desyres wycked • e councell agaynst faythfull capi ii vngodly talke ymagin thus amonge thē selues right tyme lyfe short tedious man gone hathe ioye pleasure neyther knowe man turneth agayne frō death borne naught shal hereafter though neuer bene oure breth smoke oure nosetre • wordes sparke moue oure herte oure body shalbe asshes quenched oure soule shall vanish softe ayre oure lyfe shal passe awaye trace cloude come naught myst dryuen awaye y• beames sonne put downe heate therof oure name also shalbe forgotten lytle lytle man shal haue oure workes remembraunce oure tyme shadowe y• passeth awaye oure ende returnynge fast sealed man cō meth agayne come therfore let v enioye pleasure let v soone vse creature lyke youth let v fyll oure selues good wyne oyntment let floure tyme go v let v crowne selues rose afore withered let fayre medowe lust go thorowe let euery one partake • oure volupteousnes let v leaue token oure pleasure euery place oure porcyon el get nothynge let v oppresse poore ryghteous let v nat spare wyddowe olde man let v nat regarde heades y• graye age let y• lawe vnryghteousnesse oure auctorite thing y• feble nothing worth therfore let v defraude ryghteous • hy oure profet yee cleane contarye oure doynges checketh v offendynge agaynst lawe •• landreth v trangressours al nurtou • maketh boast haue knowledge god yee calleth selfe goddes sonne wrayer thoughtꝭ greueth v also loke vpō lite like men wayes another fashyō counteth v vayne personnes withdraweth hym selfe wayes fylthyues commendeth greatly latter ende iuit maketh hys boast god father let v se yt wordes true let v proue shall come vpon hym shall knowe ende shall haue yf y• true sonne god wyl receaue hym delyuer hym handes enemyes let v examen hym despytefull rebuke aod tormentynge may knowe hys dignite proue pacyence let v condemne hym shameful death lyke hathe spoken shall rewarded suche thynges vngodly ymagin go astraye theyr owne wyckednes hath blynded mystery god vnderstande thē neyther hope rewarde ryghteousnesse regarde worshyp holy soules shall haue god created mā vnde stroied yee y• gene ymage hys owne lyckenesse made hym neuerthelesse thorowe enuye deuell came death worlde holde syde dothe ¶ conseruatyon assurance ryghteous rewarde faythfull capi iii bvt soules ryghteous hande god payne death shall touch syght vnwyse appeared dye theyr ende taken destruccyon waye ryghteous iudged vtter destruceyon rest though suffre payne men yet theyr hope full immbrtalyte punyshed fewe thinges neuerthelesse many thynges shall well rewarded god proueth fyndeth • e hymselfe yee golde fornace dothe trye receaueth 〈…〉 offerynge tyme commeth shalbe loked vpon ryghteous shall shyne y• sparkes renne thorow red busshe shal iudge nacions haue dominion ouer people theyr lorde shall raygne euer • u • theyr trust shall vnderstande trueth suche faythfull wyl agre vnto loue choseu shall haue gyftes peace vngodly shalbe punished according owne ymaginacions haue despised ryghteous forsaken lorde despyseth wysdome uurtoure vnhappye hope suche vayne theyr labour vnfruteful theyr workes vnprofytable theyr wyues vndisercte theyr chyldren vngodly theyr creature cursed blessed rather baren vndefyled hath nat knownethe synfull bed shall haue frute rewarde holy soules blessed gelded hādes hathe wrought vnryghteousnesse ymagined wycked thynges agaynste god vnto shall geuen y• speciall gyfte fayth acceptable porcion y• temple god glorious frute good labour rote wysdome shal neuer fade awaye chyldren aduouterers shall come ende sede vnryghteous bed shall roted though lyue longe yet shall nothynge regarded theyr last age shalbe without honoure yf dye hastely haue hope nether shal spokē daye knowledge horible death ende vnryghteous ¶ chaste generacyon faythfull felicite death ryghteous condemne • yon vnfaythfull capi iiii howe fayre chast generacyō vertue memoriall therof immortal knowen god men present men take example yf go awaye yet desyre waye crowned holden honour wynneth rewarde vndefyled batrayll multitude vngodly chyldren vnprofitable thynges planted whordome shal take depe rote laye fast foundacyon though grene braūches tyme yet shal shaken y• winde stande fast thorowe vehemecye wynde shalbe roted vnparfecte braunches shalbe broken theyr frute shalbe vnprofitable sowre eate ye mete nothynge whyeal y• chyldren borne wicked muste beare recorde wyckednesse agaynste theyr father mother whe asked though ryghteous ouertaken death yet shall rest age honorable thinge neuertheles it▪ standeth onely lenght tyme multytude yeares man wysdome graye hearre vndefyled lyfe olde age pleased god beloued lyued amōge sinner translated 〈…〉 v yee sodenly taken awaye intente wyckednesse shulde alter hys vnderstandyng ypocrysie shulde nat gyle soule craftye bewitthynge lye make good thynges darck vnsted fastnesse also wyckednes bolupteous desyreturne asyde vnderstandyng symple though soone deed yet fulfylled moch tyme hys soule pleaseth god therfore hasted take awaye amonge wycked thys people se vnderstande laye vp suche thynges theyr hertes howe louynge fauoure mercy god vpon hys saynctes hathe respecte vnto hys chosen thus ryghteous deed condē neth vngodly lyuynge youth soone brought ende long lyfe vnrighteous se ende wyse vnderstande god hath deuysed wherfore lorde hathe taken awaye se despise therfore shal god also laugh thē scorne thē selues shall dye without honour yee shame amonge deed euermore without voyce shall burst y• pufte vp remoue frō foūdacyons y• shalbe layed wast vnto hyest shall mourne theyr memoryall shall peryshe beynge afrayed shal remēbre theyr synnes theyr owne wyckeduesse shall bewraye ¶ constantue • ryghteous theyr persecuters hope vnfaythfull vndurable vayne blessednes saynctes godly capi v shall ryghteous stande greate stedfastnesse agaynste suche haue dealt extremely taken awaye theyr labour se shalbe vexed horible feare shall wonder hastynesse sodayne health gronyng dystresse mynd shall saye wythin selues hauynge warde sorowe mournynge anguysh mynde somtyme derisyō iested vpon fooles thought theyr lyfe madnesse theyr ende honoure lo counted amonge chyldren god theyr porcyō amonge sayntes therfore haue erred waye trueth lyght ryghteousnesse hath shyned vnto v sunne vnderstandyng rose nat vp vpō v haue weried selues y• waye wickednesse destruccion tedyous wayes haue gone waye lorde haue knowne good hathe pryde done vnto v profyt hathe pompe ryches brought v thynges passed awaye lyke shadow messaun ger renuyng shyppe passeth ouer waues water gone trace therof cannat founde nether path floudes byrde flyeth thorowe ayre man se token flowen onely heareth noyse wynges beatynge lyght wynde partynge y• ayre thorowe vehemencye goynge flyeth shakynge winges afterwarde token way foūde lyke arowe shorte marck parteth y• ayre ymmediatly commeth together agayne mā knowe wēte thorow euē lyke maner soone borne ganne immediatly drawe oure ende haue shewed token vertue cō sumed oure owne wyckednesse wordes shal haue synned speake hell y• hope vngodly lyke drye thystell floure duste blowen awaye wynde lyke thynne fome scatred abrode storme lyke smoke dispersed wynde remembraunce straunger y• taryeth daye departeth ryghteous shal lyue euermore theyr reward also lorde theyr remembraunce hyest therfore shal receaue glorioꝰ kyngdome bewtyfull crowne lordes hande wt ryght hande shall couer thē hys owne holy arme shall defende gelousy also shal take awaye harnesse shall weapen creature auenged y• enemyes shall put ryghteousnes breast plate take sure iudgement steade helmet inuincible shylde equite shal take hys cruell wrath shall sharpen speare whole compase worlde shall syght hym agaynste vnwyse shall thonder bolies go lyghtenynges come raynebowe cloudes place appoynted y• harde stony indignacion shal fall thycke hayles water see shalbe wroth agaynst floudes shal renne roughly together yee myghty wynde shall stande vp agaynst storme shal scater abrode thus y• vnryghteous dealynge thē shall brynge lande wyldernes wyckednes shall ouerthrowe dwellynges myghty ¶ callynge kynges prynces iudges whiche also exhorted searche wysdome capi vi wysdome better strength man vnderstandyng worthe one stronge heare therfore ye kynges vnderstāoc lerne ye iudges endes earth geue eare ye y• rule multitude delyte much people power geuen lorde strength frō y• hyest whiche shall trye youre workes search youre ymaginacions howe ye officer kyngdome haue nat executed true iudgemēt haue nat kepte lawe ryghteousnes walked wyll god horryble right soone shall appeare vnto harde iudgemēt shal haue y• beare rule mercy gaunted vnto simple auctoryte shalbe sore punished god lorde ouer al shal excepte man personne nether shall stāde awe man greatnesse hathe made smal great careth lyke myghty shall haue sorer punishmente unto therfore ye kynges speake ye way lerne wysdome go amysse y• kepe ryghteousnes shalbe ryghteously iudged lerned ryghteous thinges shal fynde make answere wherfore set youre luste vpon wordes loue shall ye come nurtour wysdome noble thing sene neuer faydeth awaye yee easely loue founde suche seke preuenteth desyre y• maye fyrste shewe selfe vnto thē awaketh vnto tymes shall haue greate trauayle shall fynde syttynge readye hys dores thynke vpon parfecte vnderstāding watcheth shalbe safe soone goeth seking mete sheweth selfe cherefully vnto theyr goinges meteth thē al diligence y• vnfayned desyre refourmaciō begynyng care nurtour loue loue kepynge lawes kepyng lawes perfeccion vncorrupte lyfe vncorrupt lyfe maketh man familier wyth god y• desyre wysdome ledeth kyngdome euerlastynge youre delyte royall seates cepters ye kynges people set youre lust vpō wysdome ye maye raygne euer loue lyght wysdome ye ruler people wysdome howe came vp wyl tel wyl hyde mysteryes god wyl seke begynnynge natiuite brynge y• knowledge lyght wyl kepe backe trueth nether wyll haue cōsumynge enuye man shall partaker wysdome multytude y• wyse welfare y• worlde wyse kynge vpholdynge people receaue nourtoure thorowe wordes shall good ¶ wysdome ought preferred thynges capi vii selfe also mortall man lyke come earthy generacyon hym fyrst made mother wōbe fashyoned flesh y• tyme ten monethes brought together bloude thorowe sede man cōmodyous appetyte slepe borne receaued lyke ayre men fell vpon earth whiche nature cryenge wepynge fyrst wrapped swadlynge clothes brought vp greate care kynge y• hathe begynnynge byrth mē haue one entraunce vnto lyfe one goynge lyke maner wherfore desyred vnderstandinge geuen called sprete wysdome came set kyngdomes royall seates counted ryches nothynge comparyson precious stone cōpared vnto golde small grauell vnto syluer shalbe counted claye sight loued aboue wellfare beautye purposed take lyght lyght cannat quenched good thynges came wt innumerable ryches thorow hādes glad thē wysdome went knew mother al good thynges nowe selfe learned vnfaynedly make men partaker hyde ryches frō man infynite tresure vnto mē vse become partaker loue frendshype god accepted vnto hym gyftes wysdome god hath graunted talke wysely conueniently handle thinges hath gracyously lent ledeth vnto wysdome teacheth vse wysdome ryght hande wordes yee wysdome oure vnderstandynge knowledge oure worckes hath geuen true scyence thynges knowe howe worlde made power elementes begynnynge endynge myddest tymes howe tymes alter one goeth another howe fulfylled course yeare ordinaūces starres nature kyndnes beastes furiousnes beastes power wyndes ymagynacyons men diuersities yong plantes vertues rote al suche thinges secrete loked haue learned worckmaster thynges hath taught wysdome sprete vnderstandynge whiche holy manyfolde one onely sutell courteous discrete quycke vn defyled playne swete louynge thynge good sharpe forbiddeth well gentle kynde stedfast sure fre hauynge vertues circumspecte thynges receyuynge spretes vnderstandynge beynge cleane sharpe wysdome nymbler nymble thynges goeth thorowe attayneth thynges clenues breth power god pure cleane expressynge clearenes almyghtye god therfore vndefiled thyng come vnto bryghtenesse euerlastynge lyght vndefyled myrroure maiesty god ymage hys goodnesse much one maye thynges beyng stedfast selfe renueth amonge people conueyeth selfe holy soules maketh godes frendes prophetes god loueth man hym whome wysdome dwelleth beautyefull sunne geueth lyght starres daye cō pared vnto vpon daye commeth nyght wyckednesse cannot ouercome wysdome foolyshnes maye wt ¶ effecte wysdome capi viii wysdome reacheth one ende another mightely louingly doth ordre al thinges haue loued laboure euen fro youth vp dyd diligēce mary selfe loue vnto beuty hath company god commendeth nobilite yee lorde thynges himselfe loueth scolemay stresse nurtoure god choser hys workes yf mā wolde desyre ryches lyfe rycher wysdome worketh thynges thou wylte saye vnderstandynge worketh amonge thynges worketh wysdome man loue vertue ryghtuousnes let hym laboure wysdome hath great vertues teacheth sobernesse prudence rightuousnes strength thynges men haue nothynge profytable lyfe man desyre muche knowledge tel y• thinges paste discerne thynges come knoweth soteltyes wordes cā expounde darke sentence tell token wonderous thīges euer come passe endes al tymes age purposed thys maner wyll take vnto company comen louyngly doute shall gyue good councell speake comfortablye vnto carefulnes grefe sake shall well honestely taken amonge comens lordes councell thoughe yonge yet shall haue sharpe vnderstandyng shalbe maruelous syght greate men face prynces shal wonder holde tonge shall byde leasure speake shall loke vpon yf talke muche shal lay handes vpon theyr mouth moreouer meanes shall optayne immortalite leaue behinde euerlastynge memoryal amonge come shall set people ordre nacyons shall subdued vnto horrible tyrauntes shalbe afrayed heare amōg multytude shal counted good myghtie battayle come home shal fynde reste cōpany hath bitternes felowshyp hath tedyousnesse myrth ioye nowe consydered thynges selfe pondered herte ioyned vnto wysdome immortalyte greate pleasure haue frendshyp howe worckes handes infynyte ryches howe kepeth company shall wyse talketh wt shall come honoure went aboute sekyng together vnto lad rype wytte good vnderstandynge grewe vnderstandyng came vndefyled body neuerthelesse perceyued coulde kepe selfe chaste excepte god gaue apoynte wysdome also know whose gyft stepped vnto lorde besought whole herte sayde maner ¶ prayer salomon optayne wysdome capi ix god father lorde mercyes thou haste made thynges thy worde ordayned man thorowe thy wysdome shulde haue gene • • domynyon ouer creature whyche thou haste made shulde ordre worlde accordynge equyte ryghtuousnes execute iudgemēt true hert geue wisdome euer thy seate put amonge thy chyldren thy seruaunt sonne thy handmayden feble personne short tyme yonge vnderstandyng iudgemente lawes though man neuer perfecte among chyldren men yet thy wysdome hym shalbe nothyng regarded thou hast chosen kynge vnto thy people iudge thy sonnes daughter thou hast commaunded buylde tēple vpō thy holy mounte aulter cytie wherin thou dwellest lickenesse thy holy tabernacle whyche thou hast prepared begynnynge thy wysdome wyth knoweth thy worckes also thou madest worlde knewe acceptable thy syght ryght thy cōmaundementes sende thy holy heauens frō trone thy maiesty may labour maye knowe acceptable thy syght knoweth vnderstandeth thynges shal lede soberly worckes preserue power shall workes acceptable shall gouerne thy people ryghtuously worthy syt father seate man may know ye councel god thinke wyll god thoughtes mortall men miserable oure forecastes vncertayne mortal vncorruptible body heuy vnto soule early mansyon kepeth downe vnderstandyng museth vpon many thinges uery hardly discerne thynges vpon earth greate laboure haue fynde thynges eye wyll seke grounde thynges done heauen oh lorde haue knowledge thy vnderstandyng meanyng excepte thou geue wysdome sende thy holy ghost aboue • wayes whiche vpon earthe maye refourmed men maye learne thynges pleasaūte vnto preserued thorowe wysdome ¶ delyueraunce righteous commeth wysdome capi x wysdome preserued fyrste man god made father worlde whē created alone brought offence toke hym gene 〈◊〉 • moulde earth gaue hī power rule thynges gene 4 • vnryghtuous went away hys wrath wysdome brotherhed perysshed thorowe wrath murthur agayne whē gene v •• water destroyed whole worlde wysdome preserued ryghtuous thorow poore tre wherof gouerner moreouer whē wyckednesse gotten vpper hande nacions puft vp pryde knew ryghtuous preserued fautlesse vnto god layed vp sure mercye chyldren preserued rightuous gene xix • whē fled frō vngodly e • pyshed tyme y• fyre fell downe vpon v cyties lyke yet thys daye vnfruteful waste smokynge land geueth testimony wyckednesse yee vnrype vntymely frutes growe vpon tree token remembraūce vnfaythfull soule standeth pyler salt al suche regarded wysdome gat onely thys hurte yt knewe thynges whiche good also lefte behinde vnto mē memoriall foolishnes ye thynges wherin synned coulde hyd suche take hede vnto wysdome shal delyuer sorowe gene 2 • ▪ • whē ryghtuous fled brother wrath wysdome led ryght waye shewed kyngdome god gaue hym knowledge holy thinges made rych laboures brought passe thynges wente aboute disceatfulnes defrauded hi stode hym made ryche saued enemyes defended hym disceyuers made hym stronge battayle gaue vyctory myght knowe howe wysdome stronger thynges gent 37 • 〈◊〉 vii b ryghtuous solde forsoke hym delyuered hym synners wente downe wyth hym dongeon fayled hym bandes gent xii • yll broughte hym scepter realme power agaynst oppressed hym▪ theym accused hym declared lyers brought hym perpetual worshyppe exodi b 〈…〉 b deliuered ryghtuous people fautelesse lede nacions oppressed entred soule seruaunt god stode hym wonder tokēs agaynst horrible kinges gaue ryghtuous rewarde labour led thē forth maruelous waye daye tyme shadowe vnto lyght startes nyght season exodi 13 f brought thē thorowe y• reed see caryed thorowe great water drowned theyr enemyes see brought depe rightuous toke spoyles vngodly exod xv praysed thy holy name lorde magnified thy victoryous hande one accorde psa viii math ii c wysdome openeth mouth dōme maketh tonges babe speake ¶ miracle done israel vengeaūce synners great power mercy god capi xi ordred worckes handes holy prophete went thorowe wildernes inhabyted pitched tentes waste deserte stode agaynst enemy wereexod 27 num xx auenged theyr aduersaryes exodi 16 thyrstye called vpon water gyuen thē hye rocke theyre thyrst quenched harde stone thynges thorowe theyr enemyes punished chyldren israell helped theyr nede theyr comforte vnto enemyes thou gauest man bloude steade lyuynge water scarcenesse y• rebuke chyldren slayne thou gauest vnto thyne owne plentuous water vnloked declarynge thyrste tyme howe thou woldest bryng thyne owne vnto honoure sleye aduersaries deute 8 tryed nourtured fatherly mercy knowledged vngodly iudged punished thorowe wrath god hast thou exhorted father proued vnto y• thou hast bene boysterous king layed hard charge condēpned thē whether absent presente theyr punyshment alyke grefe double namely mournynge remē braunce thynges past whē perceyued punishmētes thē good thought vpon lorde wondered ende y• last helde much whome castynge thought scorne obiecte neuerthelesse ryghtuous dyd thyrstye euen lyke thoughtes folyshe also wyckednes sapi xii • rom • • certayne men nowe thorowe errour dyd worshyppe dōme serpentes vayne beastes thou sendedst multitud domme beastes vpon vengeaunce myght knowe y• loke withall man synneth also shal punysshed leuit 26 • 〈…〉 16 iere vii c vnto thy almyghtye hande made worlde naught vnpossyble sende amonge heape beeres wood lyon cruel beastes straunge kynde suche vnknowen spou • e fyre cast smoking breth shote horryble sparkes theyr eye whiche myght onely destroye hurtynge also kyl horyble syght yee wythout beastes might haue bene slayne one winde beyng persecuted owne workes scatered abroade thorowe brethe thy power neuertheles thou hast ordred thinges measure nombre weight thou haste euer great strēgth myght maye wt stande y• power thyne arme lyke smal thyng y• balaūce weyeth worlde y• yee droppe y• mornynge dewe falleth downe vpon earth thou hast mercy vpō al thou hast power al thynges rom ii makest though thou sawest synnes men shulde amende thou louest thynges hatest none thē whō thou hast made neither dydest thou ordayne make thynge euyll wyll myght thyng endure yf thy wyll howe coulde thynge preserued excepte called thou sparest thyne lorde yu louer soules ¶ mercye god towarde synners workes god vnreprouable god gyueth leysoure repent v capi xii lorde howe gracyous swete thy sprete al thingꝭ therfore chastenest yu thē measurably yt go wrong warnest thē concernyng y• thinges wherin offende y• speakest vnto thē lorde exhortest leaue theyr wyckednes put theyr trust y• deut ix xii xviii c olde inhabiters thy holy lande thou myghtest awaye wt thē cōmitted abhominable worckes agaynst witch craft sorcery idolatry slewe theyr owne chyldren wythout mercy dyd eate vp men bowel deuoured bloude yee suche abhominaciōs mysoeleuers offeringes thou slewest father desolate soules handes father y• land whiche thou louest aboue al myght dwellynge chyldren god neuertheles thou sparedst also men sendedst y• forerūners thyne hooste euen hornettes destroye lytle lytle thou wast vnable subdue vngodly vnto rightuous batayle wt cruel beastes one roughe word destroye together exodi 23 deut vii thy mynde dryue lytle lytle geuynge thē tyme place amende knowyng well vnryghtuous nacyon wicked nature y• thought might neuer altered cursed sede frō beginnyng feared man yet hast thou pardoned theyr synnes wyll saye vnto hast thou done wyll stāde agaynst thy iudgemente wyl come thy face auenger vnryghtuous mē wyl blame y• y• people perysh whō yu hast made • petr v none god yu carest al thingꝭ y• thou mayest declare thy iudgemēt vnright darre nether king tyraūt thy syght require accōptes thou hast destroyed muche thou art ryghtuous thy selfe yu ordrest thynges ryghtuouslye io • ix punishest euen hathe deserued punyshed takest straū ger aleaūt lande thy power thy power begynnynge ryghtuousnes thou art lorde thinges therfore art thou gracious vnto al mē thinke y• full strength thou declarest thy power boldly deliuerest thou thē ouer knowe thou lord power iudgest quietly ordrest v great worship thou maiest thou wylte suche workes nowe hast thou taught thy people man also shulde iuste louynge hast made thy chyldren good hope euen thou iudgest thou geuest rowme amende synnes muche thou hast punyshed diligence deliuered enemy thy seruauntes whiche worthy dye thorowe thou gauest tyme place amendement myght turne wyckednes great dyligēce punishest thou thyne owne chyldrē vnto whose father thou hast sworne made couenauntes good promyses thou doest chasten v thou punishest enemyes diuerse wayes intente punyshe shulde remembre thy goodnesse oure selues punyshed put trust thy mercy wherfore men haue lyued ignorauntly vnryghtuously thou hast punyshed thēfore euen thorow y• thynges y• worshypped sap 〈…〉 rom 〈…〉 wente astraye longe waye errour helde beastes euen enemyes despysed goddes lyuinge chyldren vnder standyng therfore hast thou sente scornefull punyshment among thē amonge chyldrē ignoraunce suche wolde refourmed scornes rebuke felt worthy punyshmēt god thynges suffred bare vnpaciently beyng content thē vnwyllyng peryshed thinges yt toke goddes knowledged one true god afore wold know therfore came ende theyr damnacyon vpon ¶ thynges vayne excepte knowledge god idolater idoles mocked capi xiii vayne al men haue knowledge god rom •• good thynges whyche sene knewe hym y• hym selfe euerlastyng neyther toke much regarde workes made knowe craftesman toke fyre winde ayre course starres water toke sunne moone lyghtes heauen rule earth goddes though suche pleasure theyr beuty thought haue bene goddes yet shuld haue knowen howe muche fayrer made maker bewtye hath ordayned thynges yf marueled power worckes shulde haue perceyued therby whiche made thynges myghtyer greatenesse bewty creature maker therof may playnely knowen notwithstandynge lesse blamed seke god wolde fynde hym yet mysse muche go worckes seke thē token regarde holde moche workes sene howbeit wholy excused yf theyr vnderstandyng knowledge great discerne world creature rather fynde lorde therof vnhappye amonge deade theyr hope call goddes whiche workes men handes golde syluer thynge founde connynge similitude beastes vayne stone hath bene made hande olde esay 44 b iere x whā carpēter cutteth downe tree wod pareth barke cōningly wt one ꝑte maketh vessel vsed dresseth meat wt resydue parte y• lefte ꝓfytable nothing croked pece wod full knobbes carueth diligently thorowe vanite according knowledge cōnnyng geueth proporcyon fashyoneth si militude mā maketh like beast straketh ouer redd paynteth loke foule spot casteth coloure vpon maketh conuenient tabernacle setteth wall maketh faste yron prouydynge least happen fall well knowen helpe selfe ymage must necessyte helped goeth offreth goodes vnto chyldren wyfe seketh helpe asketh councell ashamed speake vnto hathe soule health maketh peticion vnto hym sycke lyfe prayeth vnto deed calleth vpō help able helpe selfe sende good iourneye prayeth y• maye go al thynges taketh hande whether optayne thing worcke prayeth vnto hym maner good ¶ detestacyon abhomynacion ymages curse maketh euyls come idolatrye capi xiiii agayne another man purposynge sayle begynnyng take iournye thorowe ragynge see calleth help vnto stocke farre weaker tree beareth hym coueteousnesse moneye hath founde craftesman made hys connynge thy prouydence father gouerneth thynges begynnyng exod 14 b thou hast made awaye see sure path myddest waues declarynge ther thou haste power helpe al thinges yee though man wente see without shyppe neuerthelesse worckes thy wysdome shulde vayne gene vi b thou hast caused arcke made therfore men commytte theyr lyues small pece wodd passyng ouer see shyp saued gene vii y• olde tyme also proude grauntes peryshed whō hope lefte encrease worlde wente shyppe whiche gouerned thorowe thy hande left sede behynde vnto worlde happye y• tree thorowe ryghtuousnes cōmeth cursed ydol made hādes psal 115 135 c baru vi ye made made called god frayle thynge psal vii vngodly hys vngodlynes lyke abhominable vnto god euen worke made also shall punyshed together therefore shall plage come vpon ydols heythen creature god become abhomynacyon temptacyon vnto soules men snare fete vnwyse y• sekynge ydoles begynnynge whordome bryngynge vp thē destruccyon lyfe begynnynge nether shall contynue euer welthy ydelnes men hath founde vpon earthe therfore shal come shortly ende whē father mourned hys sōne y• takē awaye frō made ymage y• haste deed sonne begāne worshyppe god deed mā ordened saruaūtes offre vnto thꝰ processe tyme thorow vngracioꝰ custome erroure kepte lawe tyrauntes cōpelled men violence honour ymages farre men myght worshyppe presently theyr pycture brought frō farre lyke ymage kyng whō wolde honoure intent greate diligence myght worshypp farre thoughe bene present agayne synguler connyng cratesman gaue ignoraunte also great occasyon worshyp ymages workeman wylling pleasure set worcke laboured connynge make ymage best fashyon thorowe beuty worcke comē people disceyued much toke nowe god lytle afore honored man thys erroure man lyfe men eyther serue theyr owne affeccion plesure vnto kinges ascribed vnto stone stockes y• name god ought gyuen vnto man moreouer ynough thē erred knowledge god lyued greate warres ignorauncy many greate plage called peace eyther deut▪ • 8 b iere vii b xix slue theyr owne chyldren offred dyd sacrifice nyght season el helde vn reasonable watch kepte neyther lyfe maryage cleane eyther one slue another death malyciously el greued neyghboure wyth aduoutrye thus al thynges myxte together bloud manslaughter theft dissimulacyon corrupcyon vnfaytfulnesse sedycyon periurye dis quyetynge good men vnthanfulnes defylynge soules chaungynge byrth vnsted fastnesse maryage mysorder aduou trye vnclenesse honourynge abhomynable ymages cause begynnynge ende euyll worshyppe idol eyther mad mery prophecie lye lyue vngodly el lyghtly forsweare selues frr much truste y• idol haue nether soule ner vnderstandynge thoughe sweare falsely yet thynke shall hurte therfore commeth greate plage vpon worthely haue euyll opinion god gyuyng hede vnto idol swearyng vniustly disceyue despysynge rightuousnes theyr swearing vertue plage thē y• sine goeth euer wt offence vngodly ¶ voyce faythfull praysynge mercy god whose grace sake serue idol capi xv yu god art swete long sufferyng true mercy ordrest yu al thinges though synne yet thyne knowe thy strēgth synne sure thou regardest v knowe perfecte ryghtuousnes yee knowe thy ryghtuousnes power rote immortalyte thynge men haue founde thorowe theyr euyll science hath disceyued v payntyng picture vnprofytable labour carued image wt diuerse colour whose syght entysed ignoraunt honoreth loueth pycture deed image hath soule neuertheles loue euyl thiges worthy death y• trust thē y• make loue honoure thē potter also taketh tempereth soft earth laboureth giueth fashion vessel whatsoeuer serueth vse one pece claye maketh cleane vessel seruice cōtrary wherto euery vessel serueth y• knoweth potter hym selfe vayne laboure maketh god claye dothe euen whiche lytle afore made earthe hym selfe within lytle whyle dyeth turneth earth agayne notwithstandyng careth shall labour hys lyfe short stryueth excell gold smythes siluer smythes coper smythes taketh honour make vayne thynges herte asshes hys hope vaine earth life vile clay much knoweth owne maker y• gaue hi soule worke brethed hī breth lyfe coūte lyfe pastyme cōuersacion market men shulde euer gettyng euyl meanes nowe y• earth maketh frayle vessel ymages knoweth hī selfe offēde aboue al y• enemyes thy people holde thē subieccyon vnwise vnhappy exceadynge proude vnto theyr owne soules iudge idol heathen goddes nether haue eye syght se nose smell eares heare fyngers handes grope fete slowe go man made hath borowed sprete fashioned mā make god lyke vnto hym seynge mortall hym selfe mortall maketh vnryghtuous handes hym selfe better worshyppeth helyued though mortall dyd neuer yee worshyppe beastes also miserable compare thinges cannot fele vnto worse yet one beastes syght behold good thing nether haue geuē prayse thanckes vnto god ¶ punyshment idolatrers benefytes done vnto faythfull capi xvi suche thynges haue suffred worthy punyshement thorowe multytude beastes roted steade whiche punyshmentes thou hast gracyously ordred thyne owne people geuen desyre longed newe straunge tayst nume xi • preparynge quales theyr meate intent thynges shewed sent vnto gredy meate myght withdrawen euen frō desyre necessary shorce tyme brought vnto pouertye tasted newe meate requysite without excuse destruccion shulde come vpon vsed tyranny shewe onely vnto enemyes destroyed nume 2 • b cruel woodnesse beastes came vpon peryshed thorow stinges cruel serpentes notwithstandynge thy wrath endured perpetually put feare lytle season myght refourmed hauyng token saluacyon remē bre commaundemēt thy lawe cōuerted healed thynge y• sawe sauiour thou shewedst thyne enemyes thou deliuered trō euyll exodi x whē byttē ▪ wt greshoppers flyes dyed worthy perysh neyther y• teth dragōs venimous wormes ouercame thy chyldrē thy mercy euer thē helped thē therfore punyshed remēbre thy wordes hastely healed agayn lest shuld fal depe forgetfulnes y• myght vse thy helpe nether herbe playster restored thē helth thy word lord healeth thynges yu lord hast power lyfe death deute 32 • regū ii b thou ledest vnto deathes dore bryngest vp agayne mā thorow wickednes slayeth owne soule hys sprete goeth forth turneth agayne neyther may call agayne soule taken awaye possyble eskape thy hande vngodly wolde knowe y• punyshed y• strength thyne arme wyth straunge water hayles raynes persecuted thorowe fyre consumed wonderous thynge fyre myght water whiche quencheth thynges worlde auenger ryghtuous somtyme fyre tame beastes sent punysh vngodly brente shulde se knowe persecuted punyshmente god tyme brent fyre water euery syde myght destroye y• vnrightuous nacion earth exodi 16 • againe thou haste fed thyne owne people wt angel fode sent breade redy heauen without laboure beynge pleasaunt good tast shewe thy ryches swetenesse vnto thy chyldren thou gauest euery one theyr desyre euery mā myght take lyked hym best snowe yse abode vyolence fyre melted myght knowe fyre burnyng hayle rayne destroyed frute enemyes fyre also forgat strength agayne rygh tuous myght noryshed creature serueth whiche art maker fearse punyshyng y• vnryghtuous easy gētle good vnto suche put trust therfore dyd thynges alter tyme obedient vnto thy grace whiche nurse thynges accordynge desyre nede therof thy chyldren lord whō thou louest myght knowe deute 8 math 4 • nature growynge frutes fedeth men thy worde whiche preserueth put theyr truste loke myght destroyed wyth fyre soone warmed wyth lytle sūne beame meltetd y• al mē myght knowe thankes ought geuen vnto sunne ryse thou oughtest worshypped daye springe hope vnthākfull shall melt awaye wynter yse perysshe water necessary ¶ iudgementes god vpon egyptions capi xvii greate rom • • c thy iudgementes lord thy councels expressed therfore men erre wyl refourmed wt thy wysdome exod • x c y• vnryghsuons thought haue thy holy people subieccyon bounde bandes darknes long nyght shut vnder rofe thynkynge escape euerlastynge wysdome whyle thought hyd darckenesse synnes scatred abrode middest y• darke couerynge forgetfulnes put horryble feare wōderously vexed corner wher myght kepe feare sounde came downe vexed yee many terrible straunge vision made afrayed power fyre myght geue lyght nether myght cleare tlammes y• starres lyghtē horrible nyght appeared vnto sodayne fyre verye dredefull sawe nothynge afrayed y• thought thynge whiche sawe fearfull exodi 7 b sorcery enchauntmēt vsed came derysyon proude wysdome brought shame promysed dryue away fearefulnes drede weake soules sicke feare selues y• scorne though none wonder feared thē yet afrayed beastes whiche came vpon hyssyng serpentes much trēblyng swowned sayd sawnot y• ayre whiche man yet may escape heuy thynge man owne conscience beareth recorde wyekednes condempneth hym • vexed wounded conscyence taketh euer cruell thynges hād psal 46 fearefulnes nothyng el declaring man seketh helpe defence answere hym selfe loke much lesse hope within vncertentye matter whiche punyshed y• came myghtye nyght slepe slepe fel vpon vnder aboue somtyme afrayed thorowe feare wonder somtime weake swowned withall hastye sodayne ferfulnes came vpon afterwarde yf fallen kepte shut preson without chaynes dwelt vyllage bene heyrde husbandman suffred intollerable necessyte bounde one cheyne darkenes whether blasynge wynde swete songe byrdes among thycke braunches tree vehemency hastye runnynge water great noyse fallyng downe stone play enge runnynge beastes sawe myghtye noyse roarynge beastes sownde aunswereth agayne hye mountaynes made swowne feare earthe shyned cleare lyght man hyndered labour onely vpon fell heuy nyght ymage dareknesse come vpon yee vnto selues moste heuy horryble darcknes ¶ fyre lyghte israelytes egypte persecucyon faythfull lorde smote fyrste borne egypte synne people wyldernesse aaton stode betwyte lyue deed censoure capi xviii neuertheles thy saynctes great lyght ennemyes herde theyr voyce sawe fygure suffred thynges magnyfied vexed afore hurte nowe thancked besought god myghte dyfference exodi 〈…〉 therfore burnynge pyler fyre lede vnknowne waye thou gaueste sunne fre gyft without hurte reason shulde want lyght put y• preson darcknes whiche kepte thy chyldren captyuyte vncorrupte lyght lawe worlde geuē exodi 〈…〉 thought slaye ba be ryghtuous one beynge layed preserued leader vnto exodi 〈…〉 thou broughtest ye whole multytude chyldren destroyedst myghtye water nyght oure father certyfyed afore knowynge vnto othes geuen credence myght good cheare thus thy people receaued y• health ryghteous vngodly destroyed lyke thou hast hurte enemyes hast thou promoted v whome thou calledest afore ryghteous chyldren good men offred secretly ordred lawe ryghteousnes vnto vnite iust shuld receaue good cuyll lyke maner syngynge prayses vnto father men agayne herde vnconueniēt voyce enemyes pyteous crye chyldren bewayled master seruaunt punyshed lyke maner altogether innumetable died one deathe exod xii c neyther lyuinge sufficient bury deed twyncklynge eye noblest nacion destroyed ofte god helped afore yet wolde make thē beleue destruccyon fyrste borne knowledged people god whyle thynges styll nyght myddest course thy almyghtye worde lorde leapte downe heauen oute thy royall trone rough man warre myddeste lande destroyed sharpe swerde perfourmed theyr strayte commaū dement standynge fyllyng thynges death yee stode vpon earth reached vnto heauen sight euyl dreames vexed sodenly fearfulnesse came vpon vnawares laye one another halfe deed halfe quycke shewed cause hys deathe vysyons vexed shewed thynges afore ignoraunte wherfore peryshed tētacion death touched ryghteous also among multytude wyldernesse insurreccyō thy wrath endured lōge blamelesse man wente hast toke battayll vpō brought forth weapen myny stracyon euen prayer censours reconcylynge set selfe agaynst wrath brought misery ende declaringe chy thy seruaunt ouercame multytude bodely power wyth weapens myght worde sobdued hym vexed hym puttynge remembraunce othe couenaunte made vnto father deed fallen downe heapes one vpō another stode myddest pacified wrath parted y• waye vnto lyuynge exo 28 b c whyem hys longe garment al bewtye foure rowes stone ye glory father grauen thy maiesty wrytten crowne hys heade unto destroyer gaue place afrayed onely temtaciō worthy wrath ¶ deeth egypcyans greate ioye hebrues meate geuen despre preople elementes serut onely wyll god also wyll man capi xix vngodly wrathe came vpon without mercye vnto ende knewe shulde happen vnto howe consented let go sente oute great dylygence wolde repente folowe vpon exo xiiii yet mournynge makynge lamentacyon graues dead deuysed another fooly shenes persecuted theyr flyenge cast afore prayer worthy necessyte also broughte vnto thys ende cleane forgotten thynges happened vnto afore thinge wantinge theyr punyshemente requysyte fulfylled vpon wyth tormentes thy people myghte haue maruelous passage thorowe myght fynde straunge death thē euery creature fashioned againe newe accordinge wyll theyr maker obeyenge thy commaundementes thy chyldren myght kept without hurte cloude ouershadowed theyr tentes ye dry earth appeared afore water y• reed see awaye without unpedimēt great depe became grene felde thorow al people wēte defended thy hand seing thy wonderous maruelous workes horse fed leapte lyke lambes praisynge lord haddest deliuered thē whyethey yet myndefull thynges yt happened whyle dwelt lāde groūde brought flyes steade catell howe ryuer scrauled multytude frogges steade rythes exo • vi c nam xi g last sawe new creacion byrdes tyme diceaued lust desyred delicate meates speakynge theyr appetite quailes came vp vnto see punyshementes came vpon synners without tokēs came passe afore vehemē • ye streames suffred worthely accordyng theyr wyckednesses dealt abhomynably churiyshly wt straūgers receaued vnknowne gestes brought straungers bondage dyd good besyde thynges onely receaued straūgers theyr wylles persecuted also iii iohn b dyd much euyll receaued gladly therfore punished gene xix c blyndnesse lyke couered wt sodayne darcknesse dores ryghteous euery one sought en • rau •• e bys dore thus elementes turned selues lyke one tyme chaunged vpon instrument musycke yet resydue kepe theyr melody maye easely perceaued syght thinges come passe drye lande turned waterye thynge afore sw • mme water wēte vpon drye ground fyre power water contrary hys owne vertue water forgace hys owne kynde quenche agayne flammes noysome beastes hurte flesh went thē neyther melted yse el melteth lightely al thynges hast thou promoted thy people lorde brough honour thou hast despysed thē alway place hast thou stande thē ❧ endeth booke wysdome ❧ booke iesus sonne syrach called latin ecclesiasticus ¶ prologe iesus sonne syrach vnto boke many greate men haue declared wysdome vnto v lawe prophetes folowed whiche thynges israell oughte commended reason doctrine wysdome therfore haue reade shulde onely selues wise thorow serue also wyth teachynge wrytynge graunde father iesus geuen dylygente laboure reade lawe prophetes bokes lefte v oure father well exercysed hymselfe therin purposed also wryte thynge wysdome good maners intent whiche wyllynge learne wyse myghte haue vnderstandynge apte leade good conuersacyon wherfore exhorte receaue louyngly reade diligēce take good worth though wordes eloquent famous oratours thynge yt wrytten hebrue tonge soundeth well translated another speach onely thys boke myne also law prophetes bokes sounde farre otherwise spoken theyr owne language xxxviii yeare came egipt ī tyme prolomy euerges cōtinueo al lyfe gat lybertye reade write many good thinges wherfore thought good necessary bestowe dylygence trauayle interprete thys boke cōsyderyng tyme laboured dyd best perfourme thys boke bringe vnto lyght straungers also dysposed lerne myght apply thē selues vnto good maners lyue accordyng lawe lorde ❧ eccleciasticus ¶ wysdome proceadeth commeth god prayse • feare god righteousnes degre come wysdome capi al wisdome commeth god lord hath bene euer wyth hym al tyme hath nombred sande see droppes y• rayne dayes tyme hathe measured heygth heauen bredth earthe • epnesse see hathe soughte oute grounde goddes wysdome whiche hath bene thinges iii b 〈…〉 iiii • • 8 c • cob 1 • wysdome hath bene thynges 〈…〉 xi c vnderstandynge prudence euerlastynge goddes worde heygth wel wisdome euerlastyng cōmaundementes entraūce unto whome hathe rote wysdome bene declared hath knowen wyt unto whō hath doctrine wisdome bene discouered shewed hath vnderstande y• many folde entraūce one euen hyest maker thynges almyghtye kynge power whome men oughte stande greatly ī awe sytteth vpō trone beynge god domynyon created thorowe holy goost hath sene nōbred measured hath poured oute vpon hys worckes vpon fleshe accordynge hys gyfte geueth rychely vnto thē loue feare lorde worshyppe triumphe gladnesse ioyfull crowne feare lorde maketh mery hert geueth gladnesse ioye longe life feareth lorde shall go well hym last daye death shall blessed loue god honorable wysdome loke vnto appeareth loue se wonderous thinges doth 〈…〉 ixi b • ou • ix • feare lord y• begynnynge wysdome made faythful mother wombe shall go chosen wemen shall knowen ryghteous faythfull feare lorde ryght god seruyce preserueth iustifyeth herte geueth myrth gladnesse feareth y• lord shall happy hath nede cō forte shal blessed feare god wysdome maketh rich bringeth al good filleth whole house gyftes garner treasure feare lord y• crowne wysdome geueth plenteous peace health hath sene nombred giftes god knowledge vnderstanding wysdome hath poured rayne thē helde fast hath brought vnto honour feare lorde rote wysdome braunches longe lyfe treasure wysdome vnderstādinge deuocyon knowledge wysdome abhorred synners feare y• lord dryueth oute synne without feare cānot made righteous wilfull boldnes owne destruccion paciēt man wyl suffre vnto ryme shall haue y• rewarde ioye good vnderstandynge wyll hyde hys wordes tyme many me lippes shal speake hys wysdome treasure wysdome y• declaracyon doctryne synner abhoreth worshippe god sonne yt thou desyre wysdome kepe commaundement god shal geue vnto feare lorde wysdome nurture hath pleasure fayth louynge mekenesse shal fyl treasure therof obstinate vnfaythfull feare lorde come vnto hym double hert ypocryce y• light men take good hede thou speakest marcke well thynges lest y• happen fal bringe thy soule dishonoure god discouer thy secretes cast downe middest congregacyo thou woldest ceceaue teare god thy herte ful faynednes disceace ¶ exhorteth seruaūtes god righteousnes lo • e vnderstandynge • cyence •• exhorteth 〈◊〉 teth god beleue hope loue god •• ither confoundeth forsaketh truste hym curse vpon sotell fearce impacyent herte capi ii sonne mar iiii 2 tim iii • yf thou wylte come seruyce god stande faste ryghteousnesse feare arme thy soule temptacyon setle thyne herte pacyent bowe downe thine eare receaue wordes vnderstandinge shryncke awaye thou art entysed holde fast vpon god ioyne thy selfe vnto suffre thy life may increace last whatsoeuer happeneth vnto y• receaue suffre ī heuynesse pacient thy trouble sapi iii pro xvii lyke golde syluer tryed fyre euen acceptable mē y• fornace aduersite beleue ī god shall helpe ordre thy waye ryght put thy trust hold fast feare grow therin ye feare lord take sure holde mercy shrincke waye ye fal ye feare lord beleue hī rewarde shal emptye ye feare ye lord put trust mercy shall come vnto pleasure ye yt feare ye lord set loue vpon hertes shal lyghtened consydre olde generacions mē ye chyldren marck well p xxxi▪ esa xxvi b euer eny one confounded put hys trust lord euer cōtinued feare forsaken whome dyd euer despyse called faithfully vpō god gracyous mercyfull forgeueth sinnes tyme trouble defender seke hym truthe wo vnto yt hath double hert wycked lippes euyll occupied hādes synner goeth two maner wayes wo vnto y• loose herte put theyr trust god therfore shall defended hym wo vnto thē haue lost pacience forsakē y• ryght wayes turned back frowarde wayes wyll whan lord shall begynne vyset feare lord wyll mistrust worde y• iohn 14 c loue wyll kepe commaundement feare lord wyl seke thinges pleasaunt vnto rom 13 c loue shall fulfyll hys lawe feare lorde wyll prepare theyr hertes humble theyr soules ī sight feare lorde kepe commaūdementes wyll pacient tyl se hym selfe saying • reg 24 c susan better v fal yt handes ye lorde handes men hys mercy
