shall forgeuen ep •• ▪ honoureth mother lyke one y• gathereth treasure together honoureth hꝭ father shall haue ioye owne chyldren maketh prayer shal herde y• honoureth father shal haue long lyfe obedyent lordes sake hys mother shall haue ioye hym feareth lorde honoureth hys father mother doth thē seruyce vnto lorde hym selfe honoure thy father dede worde ī al paciēce thou mayest haue god blessinge hys blessynge shall abyde y• last gen▪ 〈…〉 blessing father buyldeth vp house child mother curse roteth foundacyons reioyse whē thy father reproued honoure vnto shame worshype mās father owne worship father without honoure dishonesty sonne sonne make much thy father hys age greue hym long lyueth vnderstandynge fayle haue pacience hym despise thy strength good dede y• thou shewest vnto thy father shal forgottē thou thy self wanteste shall rewarded thy mother offence thou shalt recompensed good yee shall founded ryghteousnes daye trouble y• shalt remembred synnes also shall melte awaye lyke yse fayre warme water forsaketh father shall come shame defieth mother cursed god sonne perfourme thy worckes wyth louynge mekenesse shalte thou loued aboue men greater thou arte humble thy selfe thynges thou shalt fynde fauoure syght god greate power belongeth onely vnto god honoured lowly p • 〈…〉 prou 〈…〉 seke thynges y• aboue thy capacyte search grounde thinges myghtye loke god hath cōmaunded thinke vpon waye curyous many hys worckes nedeful se thyne eye thynges secret make thou muche search ī superssuous thinges curious many workes many thinges shewed vnto al ready aboue capacite men medlyng wt hath begyled many mā tangled theyr wittes vanyte harde hert shall fare euyll last louethe peryll shall peryshe therm hert goeth two wayes shall prospere froward hert wyll euer worse worsse wycked hert shalbe laden sorowes vn godly sinner wyl heape one sinne vpon another coūcel y• proude hath health plante synne shall roted oute knowen herte hym hath vnderstanding shal perceaue hye thinges good eare wyl gladly herken vnto wisdome herte wyse hath vnderstandynge wyll abstayne synnes increase ī workes righteousnes water quencheth burnynge fyre psal xii mercy reconcileth synnes god hath respecte vnto hym thanckeful thyncketh vpon hym agaynst tyme come falleth shall fynde stronge holde ¶ alme • muste done menkenes studye wysdome frute iudge ought mercyfull exhortacyon eschue euell good capi iiii sōne ••• xv defraude nat poore almes turne away thyne eye hathe nede despise hongrye soule defye nat poore hys necessite greue herte hym helplesse withdrawe nat gyfte nedefull refuse nat prayer one y• trouble turne nat awaye thy face nedy cast nat thyne eye asyde poore euell wyll thou geue hym occasion speake euell y• complayne y• bytternes hys soule prayer shall herde euen y• made shal heare hym curteous vnto company y• poore hūble thy soule vnto elder bowe downe thy head man worshyppe let greue bowe downe thyne eare vnto y• poore paye thy dett geue hym frendly answere mekenesse • en • 14 c delyuer hym suffreth wronge hande oppressour nat faint harted thou syttest iudgement mercyfull vnto fatherlesse father steade housbande vnto theyr mother shalt thou obediēt sonne hyest shal loue thy mother dothe wysdome bretheth lyfe chyldren receaueth seke wyl go thē waye ryghteousnes loueth loueth life seke dilygently shall haue greate ioye kepe shal haue herytage lyfe entreth blessing god y• honour shal y• seruaūtes holy one y• loue beloued god geueth eare vnto shall iudge heathen hathe respecte vnto shall dwele safely beleueth shal haue possessyon generacyō shal endure whē falleth dothe go hym choseth amonge best feare drede temptacyon shall brynge vpon hym trye hym doctryne tyll haue proued thoughtes cōmytte soule vnto shal stablishe bring ryght waye vnto hym make glad man shewe hym secretes heape vpon hym tresures knowledge vnderstandynge ryghteousnes yf go wronge shall forsake geue ouer handes hys enemye sonne make much tyme eschue thinge euell thy lyfe shame saye trueth shame bryngeth synne shame bryngeth worshippe fauoure 〈…〉 accepte person thyne owne wyll thou nat confounded thyne owne decaye shamed thy neyghboure hys aduersyte kepe backe thy counsel whō maye good nether hyde thy wysdome bewty tonge wysdome knowne vnderstandinge knowledge lernyng talkinge wyse stedfastnesse workes righteousnes wyse speake agaynste worde trueth ashamed lye thyne owne ignoraūce shame cōtesse thine erroure submytte thy selfe vnto euery man synne withstande face myghtye stryue y• agaynste streame righteousnes take paynes thy soule trueth stryue thou vnto death god shall fyght agaynst thyne enemyes hasty thy tonge nether slacke negligēt thy workes lyon thyne owne house destroying thy housholde folkes oppressing thē vnder act •• xx g let thyne hande stretched receaue shut thou shuldest geue capi v ¶ • ythc • maye nat put confydence vengeaunce god ought feared repētaunce maye u • slowe trust vnto thy ryches luke • ii • eccle xi • saye tush haue ynough lyfe shal helpe tyme vengaunce temptacyon folowe lust thyne owne herte thy strength saye nat tush howe haue strength wyl brynge vnder workes douties god shall auenge • saye nat haue synned euell hathe happened almyghty paciēt rewarder rom vii • thy synne forgeuen therfore without feare nether heape one synne vpon another eccl • 〈◊〉 saye rush mercy lorde greate shal forgeue synnes neuer many eccle 16 b lyke mercyful goeth wrath also indygnacion cōmeth downe vpon synners make taryenge turne vnto lorde put nat frō day day sodenly shal wrath come tyme vengaunce shall destroye prou 〈◊〉 〈◊〉 exc vii soph • • trust wicked ryches shall helpe day punyshment wrath caried euery wynde go nat euery waye dothe synner hathe double tonge stande fast waye lorde stedfast thy vnderstādyng abyde worde folowe y• worde peace righteousnes gentle heare worde god thou maiest vnderstāde make true answere wysdome iames • • swyft heare slowe pacyent geuynge answere y• hast vnderstādynge shape thy neyghboure answere laye thyne hande vpon thy mouth lest thou trapped vndiscrete worde confounded honour worshyppe 〈◊〉 man wyse talkynge tonge vndiscrese owne destruccion l • u • 〈◊〉 nat preuy accuser longe thou lyuest vse sclaunder thy tonge shame sorowe goeth ouer euel name ouer hym y• double longed y• preuy accuser men shalbe hated enuyed cōfounded se thou iustyfie small greate alyke ¶ propertye synner euell longed 〈◊〉 good councell wyse embraced 〈◊〉 shulde searched profet therof capi vi thy neyghbours enemye thy frende sake euel shall heyre rebuke dishonoure whosoeuer beareth enuye double tonge offendeth rom 〈◊〉 ▪ p ••• •• proude deuyce thyne owne vnderstandyng left thy strēgth hurte foolyshnes left thy leaues wither thy frute destroyed thou left drye tree wyldernes wycked soule destroyeth hym y• hathe maketh hym laughed scorne enemyes bryngeth hym porcyon vngodly eccle • swete worde multiplieth frendes pacifie • h varyaunce thankfull tonge wyll plenteous good man holde frendshyppe many neuertheles haue one counceler thousande yf thou gettest frende deu 1 • • 33 • •••• • ▪ math 〈◊〉 ▪ proue fyrst hastye geue hym credens man frende tyme wyl abyde daye trouble frende turneth enemyt • taketh parte agaynste yf knowe hurt telleth eccl 37 • agayne frēde companyon table • nd daye nede continueth sure frende wyll vnto euen thyne owne selfe deale faythfully thy housholde folke thou suffre trouble aduersyte hydeth hymselfe departe thyne enemyes yee beware thy frendes faythfull frende stronge defence fyndeth suche one fyndeth tresure faythfull frēde hathe peace y• weyght golde syluer nat compared goodnesse fayth faythfull frende medycyne lyfe teare lorde shall fynde hym feareth lorde shall prospere frendes hym selfe shall hys frende also sonne receaue doctryne thy youth vp shalt thou fynde wysdome tyll thou olde go one pl • weth soweth wayte pacyently hir good frutes thou shalt haue lytle laboure worcke thou shalte eate frutes ryght soone howe exceadynge sharpe wysdome vnlerned men vnstedstast body wyll nat remayne unto suche touch stone casteth hym al hast wysdome hym name fewe haue knowledge • knowe abydeth euen vnto apperynge god geue eare sōne receaue doctrine refuse councell put thy fote lynckes math •••• take yocke vpō thy necke bowe downe thy shoulder vnto beare paciently wery bandes come vnto thy whole herte kepe wayes thy power seke shalbe shewed thou haste forsake last thou shalt fynde rest shall turned thy great toye shal fetter stronge defence yocke gloryous rayment bewtye lyfe bandes couplinge together saluacyō yee glorious raymēt thou shalt put crowne toye shalt thou weare sonne yf thou wylt take hede thou shalt haue vnderstandynge yf thou wylt applye thy mynde thou shalt wyse thou wylt bowe downe thyne eare thou shalt receaue doctryne yf thou delyte hearynge thou shalt wyse stande multytude suche elder haue vnderstandynge consente vnto theyr wysdome wich thyne herte eccle 8 y• mayest heare godly sermon worthy sentence eskape nat yf thou seyst man descrete vnderstandynge get soone vnto hym let thy fote treade vpō steppe dores psal • • let thy mynde vpon cōmaundementes god earnestly occupyed lawes shall stablysh thy herte geue wysdome thyne owne desyre ¶ • e must forsake euell yet ••• fy • selues behauiour wyse towarde hys wyfe hys frynde hys chyldren seruaūtes father mother prestes capi vii euell shall ther harme happen vnto departe away thynge wycked mysfortune shall medle sonne sowe euell thynges forowes vnryghteonsnes shalt thou nat reape seuen folde laboure vnto man lordshyppe neyther vnto kynge seate honoure psa 143 eccles 7 • io • 〈◊〉 • u •• 18 b iustifye thy self god knoweth herte desyre reputed wyse presence kynge make labour made iudge excepte thou couldest myghtely put downe wyckednes yf thou shuldest stande awe presence y• myghtye thou shuldest fayle geuynge sentence offende multitude cytye put thy selfe amōge people eccle 12 • bynde two synnes together one synne shalt thou vnpunyshed saye rush god wyll loke vpon multytude oblacions offre hyest god wyll accepte faynte herted thou makest thy prayer nether slack geuing almes laugh man scorne heuynesse soule god seyth thynges 1 reg 2 b brynge downe sett vp agayne accepte lesyng agaynst thy brother nether agaynst thy frende use make maner lye custome therof good make many wordes thou arte amonge elder mat vi y• prayest make nat much bablynge rom xii b let laboxyous worke tedyous vnto nether housbandrye whiche almyghtye hath created make thy boast multitude thy wickednes humble thy selfe euen thyne herte remembre wrath shal belonge taryinge y• vengeaūce flesh y• vngodly fyre worme geue ouer thy frende good thy faithful brother y• best gold departe discrete good woman fallen vnto thy porcyon feare lorde gyft honesty boue golde luke xix • thy seruaunt worketh truly intreate hym euel hyrelinge faythful vnto loue dyscrete seruaūt thyne owne soule defraude libertie nether leaue hym poore man deu 2 • b y• haue catell loke well yf thy profet kepe thē eccle 30 • y• haue sōnes bring vp nourture lernynge holde awe theyr youth vp thou haue daughter kepe theyr body shewe thy face chereful towarde marie thy doughter shalt thou perfourme weyghtie mater geue man vnderstandynge thou haue • wyfe thyne owne mynde forsake • commytte thy selfe hatefull eccles 3 • b • 4 honoure thy father frō thy whole hert forget soroufull trauayle thy mother remembre y• thou wast borne thorowe howe caust thou recompense thynges haue done feare lorde thy soule honoure minysters loue thy maker thy strength deute 12 • • forsake seruauntes feare lorde al thy soule honoure prestes num 18 b geue theyr porcion fyrst frutes increase earth lyke commaunded reconsyle thy selfe thy neglygence wt lytle flock geue shulders appoynted offringes fyrstlynges reache thyne hande vnto poore yt god maye blesse plenteousnes gala vi lyberall vnto men lyuynge •• • yet let good euen deed rom 12 b let thē wepe without comforte mourne wt mourne math 25 let greue vyset sycke shall make beloued whatsoeuer thou takest hāde remembre ende thou shalt neuer amysse ¶ agaynst thy better stryuynge deeth thine enemye maiest thou reioyse delpyse thy neyghbours wordc • wyse capi viii stryue myghtye mā lest thou chaunse fal hys handes math v make varyaunce wt rych man lest happen bringe vp harde quarell againste eccle 3 • golde syluer hathe vndone many man yee euen kertes kynges hathe made fal stryue man full wordes laye styckes vpon hys fyre kepe company vnlerned lest geue thy kynred euel reporte g • lo vi 2 cor 2 b deipyse man turneth hym selfe awaye synne caste hym nat teeth withall remēbre fraile euerychone leu • 19 g thynke scorne man olde age waxe olde also glade death thyne enemye remēbre y• must dye al y• sorte v faine wolde come ioye eccle 6 b despyse y• sermon elder haue vnderstandynge acquaynte thy selfe wt wyse sentēces yu shalt lerne wy dome doctryne vnderstanding howe serue great men without cōplaint go doctryne elder haue lerned theyr father thou shalt lerne vnderstandyng thou mayest make answere tyme nede kyndle coales synners whan thou rebukest lest thou bret fyrie flammes theyr synnes resyst • ace blasphemer laye wayte thy mouth eccle 29 lende vnto myghtter thy selfe thou lendest hym coūte lost surtye aboue thy power yf thou thynke surely paye go lawe iudge wyll iudge accordynge hys owne honoure gene 4 b trauaylle y• waye hym braynelesse lest euell foloweth owne wylfulnes shale thou perysh thorowe foly prou 22 esa iii stryue hym angrie cruell go hym wylderues bloude nothinge hys syght helpe shall murther 〈…〉 xxx ••• take councell fooles loue nothynge thynges please selues make councel straunger thou canst tei wyllcome open thyne herte vnto euery man lest vnthanckfull put reprofe ¶ ieopardyes chastenes eschued olde treade preferred newe glery • rychesse • synners rightwes men shuld bydden gest laboure chefe thinge worcke man wysdome prynce capi ix gelous ouer wyfe thy bosome shewe shrewed poynte wycked doctryne vpō pro 〈…〉 geue power thy lyfe vnto womā lest come thy strength thou cō founded loke vpon woman yt desyrous many men lest thou fall snare use cōpany womā player daunser heare lest thou perysh thorow entysynge beholde mayden thou hurte bewry prou • cast thy mynde vpō harlottes maner thynge leste thou destroye bothe thy selfe thyne herytage go gasynge euery lane cytie nether wandre thou abrode stretes therof • th • ▪ turne awaye thy face frō bewtyfull womā loke vpō fayrnesse many mā hathe peryshed thorowe 〈…〉 iu • 〈…〉 bewtye wemen thorowe desyre kyndled afyre aduouterous woman shalbe trodden vnder fote myre euery one goeth waye many man wonderynge bewtye straunge woman hathe bene cast wordes kyndie fyre syt another man wyfe meanes lye vpō bed make wordes wyne leste thyne herte consente vnto thou thy bloude fall destruccion forsake olde frende neve shall lyke hym newe frēde newe wyne let old thou shalt dryncke hym pleasure desyre honoure ryches syn ner thou knowest destruccyon come vpon hym delite thou thynge vngodly haue pleasure beinge sure vngobly shal acceptēd vntyll theyr graue kepe man hath power sleye nedest thou afrayed deathe yf thou comest vnto hym make faute lest happē take away thy lyfe remembre thou goest myddest snare vpon bul workes thy cytie beware thy neyghboure tye thou canst eccl viii c • xxxvii medle wyse haue vnderstandynge let iust men thy gestes let thy myrth feare god let remembraunce god thy mynde deut vi b xi c let al thy talkynge y• cōmaundementes hiest handes craftesmen shal worckes cōmēded •• iii c shall prince people wysdome talkynge man full wordes perelous cytie rasshe talkyng shalbe abhored ¶ kynges iudges pryde couetousnesse abhored laboure praysed capi x wyse iudge wyl ordre people discrecion man vnderstandynge beareth rule goeth wel •• xxix iudge people self euē offycers loke maner mā ruler cyte suche yt dwell therin also •• ▪ xi • prou 28 b • uz xxix vnwyse kyng destroyeth people wher auctorite men vnderstandynge cytye prospereth power earth hande god iniquyte people abhorred tyme shall set profytable ruler vpon hande god power man vpon scribe shall laye honoure • eui xix remēbre wronge thy neyghboure medle thou vnryghtuous workes pryde hatefull god man wyckednes hethē abhored iere 27 daniel 4 c vnryghtuous dealynge wronge blasphe myes diuers disceyte realme shalbe translated one people another nothyng worse couetous man art thou proude thou earth asshes wycked thynge loue money one hath hys soule sell yet fylthye donge whyle lyueth though phisicion shewe helpe neuer longe yet conclusion goeth maner daye kynge morowe deed man dyeth heyre serpentes beastes wormes begynnynge man pryde fall awaye god hert gone trō hys maker pryde orygynal synne taketh holde therof shall fylled cursynges last shall ouerthrowe hym therfore hath y• lord brought congregacyons wycked dyshonour destroyed vnto ende sapi vi b luk 1 c 14 c 18 b god hath destroyed seates proude prince set vp meke theyr steade god hath wythered rote proude heathen planted lowly amonge gene 29 c god hath ouerthrowen y• lādes heythen destroyed vnto groūde hath caused wyther awaye hath brought thē naught made memorral ceasse earth god hath destroyed name yt proude lefte name ye hūble mīde pryde made mā nether wrothfulnes mēs child sede men yt feareth god shalbe brought honour sede transgresseth cōmaundementes lorde shalbe shamed yt ruler amonge brother holden honour amōg thē regardeth feare lord glory y• ryche honorable poore feare god despyse y• iust pore man magnyfye rych vngodly great iudge myghtye honour yet none greater feareth god prou 17 unto seruaūt yt discrete shal fre seruice 2 reg 12 • wise wel nurtoured wil grudge refourmed ignoraunt body shall come honour proude thy worke dispare tyme aduer syte pro xii b better laboureth hath plē tuousnes al thinges gorge ous wanteth breade sōne kepe thy soule mekenes geue due honour shall iustyfye hym synneth agaynst hym selfe wyll honoure hym dyshonoureth hys owne soule poore honoured hys faythfulnes trueth ryche reputacion goodes ordreth hym selfe honestely pouerte howe moch shal behaue hymselfe honestly ryches ordreth hym selfe vnhonestly ryches muche shall behaue selfe vnhonestly pouerte ¶ prayse humslite outwarde apperaunce • ght iudge heady rashe iuogement ryche without offence thynges rome god al mē brought thyne house capi xi wysdome hym broughte lowe shall lyfte vp hys heade shall make hym syt amonge greate men commende thou man bewtye neither despyse man vtter aperaunce bee small beast amonge foules yet frute exceding swete proude thy rayment actes xii exalte thy selfe daye thy honoure worckes hyest onely wonderfull yee gloryous secrete vnknowen hys worckes many tyrauntes haue bene fayne syt downe vpon earthe • reg • v f • etth vi vnlyckely hathe worne crowne many myghty men haue bene brought lowe honorable haue bene delyuered men hādes deute 13 cō dēne man thou haue tryed matter thou hast made inquisiciō refourme ryghtuously prou 18 c geue sentence yu hast herde cause fyrste let men tell theyr tale stryue matter toucheth thy selfe stande iugement synners sonne medle many matter • xix c 〈…〉 yf thou wylte ryche thou shalt without offence though thou folo • est yu shalt get though y• rēutst thy way afore yet shalt y• escape • rouer • c psa 127 • mā yt laboureth weryeth hym selfe lesse hath agayne man slouthfull hath nede helpe wanteth strength hath greate pour • tye god eye loketh vpon hym good settech hym vp lowe estate iob xlii • lyfteth vp heed many men maruell hym geue honoure vnto god iob c ezech 28 b prosperyte aduersyte lyfe death pouerte rythes come lorde wysdome nurtoure knowledge lawe god loue wayes good hym erroure darknesse made synners exalte selues leuyll waxe olde euyll gyfte god remayneth ryghtuous good wyll shall geue prosperyte euer man ryche lyuing nygardly porcyon rewarde sayeth luke xii▪ c haue gotten rest nowe wyll eate dryncke goodes selfe alone yet consydreth yt tyme draweth nye deathe approcheth yt must leaue thynges vnto men dye hym selfe stande thou fast thy couenaunt exercyse thy selfe therin remayne ye worcke vnto thy age cō tynue workes synners put thy trust god byde thyne estate easy thynge syght god make poore man ryche sodēly blessynge god hasteth reward ryghtuous maketh hys fruytes sone floryshe prospere saye helpeth shall haue yt whyle agayne say haue ynough wante ezech 〈…〉 thou art welfare forgette aduersite goeth well wt haue good hope shall better smal thynge vnto god daye death rewarde euery man accordyng way aduersite hour maketh one forget pleasure mā dyeth workꝭ discouered praise body death man shall knowen chyldren brynge euery man thyne house dysceatfull layeth wayte dyuersly lyke partrych maūde hert proude lyke spye loketh vpon fall neyghbour turneth good vnto euyll sclaundreth y• chosen one sparke made great fyre one disceytfull man bloude increased vngodly man layeth wayte bloude beware y• disceytfull ymagynech wycked thynges brynge perpetuall shame thou takest aleaunt vnto shall destroye vnquyenesse bryue thyne owne wayes ¶ unto ought good ehan •• e ought eschued capi xii thou wylte good knowe thou doest shalte thou greately thanked thy benefytes gala 〈…〉 good vnto ryghtuous thou shalte finde great rewarde though hym yet doute lorde hym selfe shall rewarde standeth good case alwaye occupyed euyl geueth almes hyest hateth synners hath mercy vpon shewe workes repentaunce geue thou vnto suche feare god receyue synner vngodly synners shal recōpence vēgeaūce vnto kepe thē daye wrath geue thou vnto good receyue sinner well vnto hym lowly geue vngodly let bred geuē hym myghtyer thy self therin shalt y• receyue twyse much euyll al good thou doest vnto y• hyghest hateth synners shall rewarde vengeaunce vngodly prosperite frende shal knowen aduersyte enemy shal hyd man wealth greueth enemy heuinesse trouble man shall knowe hys frende truste neuer thyne enemy lyke yron rusteth doth wickednes though make much crout thyng knelynge yet kepe wel thy mynde beware hi set y• neither let hī syt thy right hand lest turne hī get thy place take thy rowme seke thy seate thou y• last remēbre wordes pricked sayinges wyl haue pytie charmer stynged serpēt al come nye beastes euen hym kepeth cōpany wycked man lappeth self synnes season wyl byde wyth yf thou stomble taryeth •••• xi • b enemye swete lippes ymagineth disceyt hart throwe pit ye wepe eies yf may fynde oportunite wyll satisfied bloud aduersyte come vpō y• thou shalt fynde hym fyrst though pretende help yet shall vnder myne shal shake head clappe bādes ouer y• gladnesse whyle maketh many wordes shall dysguyse countenaunce ¶ cō • anyes proude ryche 〈◊〉 eschued loue god lyke cōpany theyr lyfe capi xiii toucheth pytche shalbe fyled famylier proude shall cloth selfe pryde taketh burthen vpon accompanyeth honorable man hym self therfore kepe famyliarite one rycher thy selfe howe agre ketell pot together yf one smytten agaynste shalbe broken ryche dealeth vnryghtuously threateneth y• poore beyng oppressed wrongefully dealt suffreth scarnesse geueth fayre wordes thou protyte vseth yf thou haue nothynge shall forsake long thou hast thyng thyne owne shall good felowe yee shall make bare man sory haue nede shall defraude preuy mocke shall put hope geue al good wordes saye wātest thou thus shall shame meate vntil haue supt cleane vp twyse thryse laste shall laugh scorne afterwarde seyth thou hast nothyng shal forsake shake heade submytte thy selfe vnto god wayte vpon hys hande beware thou bysceyued brought downe thy symplenesse humble thy wysdome least thou art brought lowe yu disceyued thorowe foolyshnes thou called myghtye man absent thy selfe shall call oft preasse thou vnto hym ye thou shut go thou farre least forget withdrawe thy self speach beleue many wordes muche communicacion shall tē pte preuye mocke shall questyon thy secretes vnmercyfull mynde shal marck thy wordes shal spare hurte put y• preson beware take good hede thy self yu walkest parel thy ouerthrowynge nowe thou hearest hys wordes make though thou werest ī dreame wake vp loue god thy lyfe longe call vpon hym thy nede euery beaste loueth lyke euē let euery man loue neyghbour al flesh wyl resorte theyr lyke euery man wyl kepe company hym selfe wolfe agreeth wt lābe doth y• vngodly ryghtuous 2 l •• 〈◊〉 • felowshyp shuld holy mā haue wt dogge howe ryche pore agre together wylde asse lyon pray wyldernes euen poore men meate ryche lyke y• proude may away wt lowlynes euen doth rych abhorre poore riche mā fal frēdes set hī vp agayne y• poore fal leth acquayntaūce forsake rich mā fal errour hath many helper speaketh proude wordes yet men iustify hym yf poore man go wrong punyshed yee though speake wysely yet haue place whē rych mā speaketh euery body holdeth tonge loke sayeth prayse vnto cloudes poore mā speake saye felowe yf amysse shal destroy hī rich good vnto ye hath sinne cōscience pouerte wycked thing mouth vngodly hert man chaūgeth hys countenaūce whether good euyl chereful coūtenaunce tokē good hert el harde thyng knowe thought ¶ offence tonge man vayne thynge happy conepnurth wysdome capi xiiii blessed man yt hathe fallen wt worde mouth pricked wt confrience syune happye hath heuines minde fallen hope becōmeth couerous man nygarde rych shulde nygarde wt golde yt al carefulnes heapeth together vnryghtuously gathereth folckes another mā shall make good chere wt goodes wycked vnto hi selfe shuld good vnto men one haue pleasure goodes nothynge worse whē one diffauoureth hym selfe reward wickednes good doth knowynge therof agaynst wyl last declareth vnryghtuousnes nygarde hath wycked eye turneth away face despiseth hisprou 17 c eccles owne soule eccle xix c xxv c iato iii couetous mās eye hathe neuer ynough porcyon wyckednes vntyll tyme yt wither away haue lost owne soule wycked eye spareth bread scarcenes vpō table sonne good thy selfe thou haste geue lorde hys due offerynges remembre death tarteth howe yt couenaunt graue shewed vnto y• couenaūe thys worlde shal dye death eccles 4 tobi 4 b luka 16 b good vnto thy frende thou dye according thy abylite teache thyne hāde geue vnto pore disapoynted ye good day let porcyon ye good day ouer passe shalt thou leaue thy trauales laboures vnto men deuiding herytage geue take sanctyfye thy soule worke yu rightuousnes thy death hell meate fynde esaye xl 1 pritl • iacobi • b al flesh shall fade away lyke grasse lyke floryshyng leafe grene tree growe cast downe euen generacion flesh bloude one commeth ende another borne transitorye thynges shall fayle last worker therof shall go withall euery thosen worke shall iustified medleth withal shal haue honour therin blessed ye man kepeth wysdome exercyseth selfe vnderstandynge diserecion shall thyncke vpon fore knowledge god cōsydereth wayes wysdome herte hath vnderstandynge secretes goeth one seketh cō tinueth ī wayes loketh wyndowes herkeneth dores taketh rest beside house fasteneth stake walles shall pitch tēte nye vnto hand tent shall good thynges rest euermore shall set chyldrē vnder couering shal dwel vnder braū ches coueryng shall defended frō heate glory shal rest ¶ goodnesse foloweth hym whiche f • raith god god reiecteth casteth syuuer god auetor euyll capi xv feareth god wyll good kepeth lawe shall optayne wysdome honorable mother shall mete hym virgin shall receyue ma • • bred lyfe vnderstandyng shall fede ioh • • • geue water wholso wysdome drinke cōstant shal moued holde fast shall come cō fusion shal bring honour amōg neyghboures myddest y• cō gregacyon shal open mouth y• sprete wisdome vnderstandynge shal fyl hym clothe hym garmēt glory shal heape y• treasure myrth ioye vpon hym geue eueria stynge name herytage foolyth men wyll take holde vpō haue vnderstandynge wyl mete folysh mē shal se farre pryde dysceat men yt go aboute wt lye wyll remēbre her▪ mē trueth shalbe founde shall prospere euē vnto y• beholdyng god prayse semely y• mouth vngodly sent lord god cōmeth wysdome prayse shal stande wysdome god shalbe plentuous faythful mouth lorde shall geue vnto hym saye y• lordes faute yt gone y• shalt thing god hateth saye y• hath caused wrōge hath nede y• vngodly god hateth al abhominacion errour yt feare god wyll loue none 〈…〉 god made man frō begynnynge lefte hāde coūcel gaue commaundemētes preceptes yf y• wylt obserue cōmaūdemētes kepe acceptable faythfulnes euer shall preserue iere ••• hath set water fire y• reach thyn hande vnto thou wylt man lyfe death good euyl loke lyketh shalbe geuen wysdome god greate myghty power beholdeth men contynually eye lorde vpon thē feare hym knoweth worckes man hath commaunded man vngodly nether hath geuen man space synne ¶ vnhappye wycked chyldren man hyde hym selfe frome god exhortacyon receyuynge instruccyon capi xvi delyte thou multitude vngodly chyldre haue pleasure thē yf feare god trust y• theyr lyfe regard theyr labour one sonne feareth god better thousande vngodly better man dye wythout chyldren leaue behynde suche chyldren vngodly one hath vnderstandyng may whole cytie vpholden though vngodly many yet shall wasted thorowe many suche thynges hathe myne eye sene greater thynges haue herde myne eares eccle xxi b congregation vngodly shall fyre burne among vnfaythful people shal y• wrath kyndled gene vi olde giaūtes optayned grace theyr synnes destroied trusting theyr owne strength nether spared thē amonge loth whiche gene xix e straū ger smote abhorred pryde theyr wordes pytie vppon destroyed people stoute synne num 14 • •• xxvi muche ouersawe syxe hū breth thousande gathered themselues together y• hardenesse theyr hert maruell yf one beyng hardnecked shulde fre eccles v mercy wrath wt hym bothe myghtye forgyue poure displeasure lyke hys mercy great euen punyshment also iudgeth man accordyng hys workes vngodly shal escape spoyle long pacience sheweth mercy shal byde behynde mercy shal make place vnto euery man accordyng worthynes workes vnderstandyng pylgremage saye thou wyll hyde selfe frō god wyll thyncke vpon aboue shall knowen greate heape people soule amōge many creature behold heauen yee heauen heauens depe earthe therin shalbe moued hys presence mountaynes hylles foundaryons earth shall shake feare god visiteth thynges dothe herte vnderstande vnderstandeth euery herte vnderstandeth wayes man seyth hys stormes moste parte hys worckes secrete wyll declare worckes hys ryghtuousnes shalbe able abyde couenaunte farre frome tryenge men ende humble herte thyncketh vpon suche thynges vnwyso erronyous man casteth hys mynde vnto foolysshe thynges sonne herken thou vnto learne vnderstandynge marcke wordes thyne herts wyll geue sure doctryne playnely shall instructe marke wordes thyne ryghtuousnes sprete speake wō ders god hath shewed amōg worckes begynnnyng trueth shew knowledge god hath set hys worckes good ordre frome begynnynge parte hath sundered hath garnyshed hys worckes euerlastynge beginnynges accordyng theyr generacyons none hindered another nether dysobediente vnto hys wordes thys god loked vpon earthe fylled hys goodes maner lyuyng beastes hath couered groūde al shall turned vnto earth agayne capi xvii ¶ creacyon man goodnesse god haths done vnto hym aulmes repentaunce god gene • shope man earth made hym hys owne ymage turned hym vnto earthe agayne clothed hym wyth hys owne strength gaue hym nombre dayes certayne tyme yee gaue hym power thynges vpon earthe made flesh stande awe hym domynyon beastes foules gene 〈◊〉 made hym helper lyke vnto hym selfe gaue dyscrecyon tonge eye eares herte vnderstande fylled instruceyon vnderstādynge created thē also knoweledge sprete fylled theyr hertes wyth vnderstāding shewed thē good euyll set eye vpon theyr hertes declarynge vnto hys greate noble worckes shulde prayse hys holy name together reioyse wonder tellynge hys noble actes besyde thys gaue instruccyon lawe lyfeexodi xx deute 4 • and▪ ix heretage made euerlastyng couenaunt shewed hys ryghtuousnesse iudgemētes sawe glory wyth theyr eye theyr eares herde matesty voice sayd vnto beware vnryghtuous thynges gaue euery man also commaundemente concernynge neyghbour theyr w •• yes euer hyd eye rom 1 • hathe set ruler vpon euery people deu • e 4 c x c israel y• lordes porcyon workes y• sunne syght god hys eye alwaye lo kynge vpon theyr wayes theyr vnryghtuousnesses manyfest vnto hym theyr wyckednesses open syght e ••• e 29 b mercy y• man sheweth purse hym grace geuē man preserueth hym aple eye math 25 c last shall awake rewarde euery man vpō heade shall turne together nethermost partes y• earth actes iii c vnto thē wyll repent hath geeuen waye ryghtuousnes suche weake cōforted suffred sendeth porcyon veryte turne vnto lorde forsake thy sine make thy prayer lord lesse offence turne agayne vnto y• lorde forsake thyne vnryghtuousnes vtter enemye abhomynacion learne knowe ryghtuousnes iudgemētes god stād porcyon set forth prayer hie god go porcyon holy worlde suche lyuyng geue thankes vnto god psal vii • esaye 38 wyll prayse lorde hell abyde thou erroure vngodly geue hym thanckes death deade thanckefulnesse peryshed hym nothyng geue thou thanckes thy lyfe yee whyle thou art liuyng whole shalt thou geue thanckes prayse god reioyse mercy great louīg kyndnesse lorde mercyful good nesse vnto suche turne vnto hym thynges may mā sōne mā immortall hath pleasure vanite wyckednes cleare sunne yet shall fayle wycked thynge fleshe bloude hath ymagyned shalbe reproued lord seyth power hye heauē al earth asshes ¶ maruelous worckes god▪ • nysetye wretchednes man agaynst god ought complaynt praye muste contynuallye capi xviii lyueth euermore gene • made thynges together god onely ryghtuous remayneth vyctoryous kynge euer psal ii eccle •• shall able expresse workes wyll seke gron̄ de noble actes shall declare power greatenesse wyll take vpon hym tell mercy wonderous workes lorde may nothynge taken theym nothynge maye put vnto neyther maye grounde founde man hath done hys best muste begyune agayne thyncketh become ende muste go agayne hys laboure man wherto worth good euyll psal ••• nombre mās dayes almost hundreth ye muche lyke droppes rayne vnto see grauell stone comparyson sāde 2 p ••• ▪ yeares y• dayes euerlastynge therfore lord pacient poureth mercye vpon sawe perceyued thoughtes ymaginacyons theyr hert euyll therfore heaped vp hys mercyfull goodnes vpon shewed waye ryghtuousnes mercy mā hath reacheth neygh boure mercy god vpon flesh chasteneth teacheth nurtoureth yee euen shepherde turneth agayne hys flocke dothe receyue chastenyng nurtoure doctryne e ••• 〈◊〉 ▪ mercyful vnto stande awe hys iudgementes sonne thou doest prayest prepare thy soule one tempted god thynke vpon wrathful indingnacyon ye shalbe ende houre vengeaūce ••• le • l whē shal turne away face whe y• hast ynough remēbre tyme hongre thou art rich thinke vpon tyme pouer te scarcenesse mornynge vntyll euenyng tyme chaunged al suche thynges sone done y• syght god wyse man feareth god thynges dayes trāsgressyon kepeth hym selfe •• ne discrete man hath pleasure wysdome findeth maketh much ye haue vnderstanding haue dealt wysely wordes haue vnderstāde truth ryghtuousnes haue sought wyse sē tences iudgemētes 〈…〉 viv 〈…〉 xiii • folowe thy lustꝭ turne frō thyne owne wyll yf y• geuest thy soule desire shal make thin enemy laugh scorne take thy pleasure greate voluptuousnes medle much wtal make great chere thyng thou hast wōne auaūtage lest thou fal pouerte haue nothyng thy purse ¶ wyne whoredome brynge men pouertye▪ thy wordes muste thou vse dyscrecyon difference wysdome god man wherby thou maye • knowe man correc • yon muste vsed without ang • e capi xix labouryng man geuē vnto drō kennes shall rych maketh much smal thiges shall fat lytle litle • ere 19 • wyne wemen • reg ii make wyse men rēnagates put men vnderstandynge reprofe accompanieth aduo • iterers shal become wycked man moches wormes shall haue hym herytage yee shalbe set vp greater example hys soule shalbe roted nōbre • sut 22 c hastye geue credence lyght mynded doth agaynst hym selfe reioyseth wyckednes shalbe punyshed hateth refourmed hys lyfe shalbe shortned abhorreth babling wordes quencheth wyckednesse offendeth agaynst owne soule shall repente reioyseth wyckednesse shall punyshed rehearse wycked churlysh worde twise thou shalt hidered shewe thy secretes nether frende foo y• hast offended tell shall herken vnto marke whē fyndeth oportunite shall hate y• shal alwaye aboute y• eccle 22 b xxvii c y• hast herde worde agaynst thy neyghbour let dead wt sure thou shalte haue harme therby foole trauayleth wt worde lyke womā payned wt bearynge chylde lyke arowe shot dogges thyghe worde fooles hert leui xix math 18 b tell thy frende faute least ignoraunt say haue done yf haue spoken nomore reproue thy neyghbour kepe tong haue spokē say nomore tell thy neyghbour faute oft tymes offēce made geue credēce euery worde man falleth somtyme hys tong hys wyl eccle 14 xxv b iame iii c y• hath offended tong geue thy neyghboure warnyng thou threaten hym geue place vnto lawe lorde feare god wysdome ryght wyse man kepeth y• lawe doctryne wyckednesse wysdome prudence synners good vnderstandyng wyckednes abhominaciō blaspheming wysdome symple man small vnderstandyng feareth god better one y• hath much wysdome trangresseth lawe hyest crafty sotell man wyse vnryghtuous gyftes wresteth open manifest lawe wycked man behaue hym selfe humblye douke heade yet disceauer within hydeth hys • ice mat vi • disguiseth shulde knowen preuenteth though weake y• y• harme yet whē may fynde oportunite shall euyll mā may knowen face one hath vnderstandyng maye percyeued loke countenaunce eccles 31 • man garment laughter goynge declare ¶ correccion repentaunte gyfte wyse man foole ly • age capi xx man eccle 31 reproueth hys neyghboure ofte tymes due season agayne man holdeth hys tonge wyse dyscrete muche better gyue warnynge reproue beare euyll wyll knoweledgeth hym selfe opēly shalbe preserued frō hurt destruccion lyke • gelded man thorowe desyre lust defyleth may den euen hym vseth vyolence vnryghtuousnes law howe good thynge man reproued shewe openly repentaunce shalt thou escape wylfull synne man kepeth silence founde wyse ashamed sayeth hatefull man holdeth hys tonge hath y• vnderstandyng language man kepeth silēce waytyng conuentent tyme eccle iii eccl • 32 wyse man wyll holde hys tonge tyll se oporcunyte want vndyscrete body shall regarde tyme vseth many wordes shall hurte owne soule y• taketh auctoryte vpon hym vnryghtuously shalbe hated man hath oft tymes pro • peryte wicked thinges agayne mā getteth much hath harme losse gyft nothyng worth agayne thece gift whose rewarde double mā getteth fal beyng proude commeth worshyppe lowe estate mā bieth much lytle price must paye seuen folde eccle vi wyse man hys wordes maketh hym selfe loued favour fooles shalbe poured gyfte vnwyse shall good eye seuenfolde eccle 18 c shall geue lytle saye gaue much openeth mouth crieth one cryeth wynd day lendeth morowe asketh agayne suche man hated foole sayth haue frende haue thanke good dedes yee euen y• eat breade speake good oft howe many shall laughed scorne taketh perelous fal suche wordes yf fel vpon grounde euen shal falses wycked mē come hastely mouth hym y• vutaught many vnconuenient vnmete wordes wyse sentcce shal alowed y• mouth fole speaketh due season man synneth hath wherwithal reaste shalbe stinged mā y• destroieth owne soule wt shame ‡ vnwyse body sake destroyeth wt acceptyng personnes shal vndo selfe mā promyseth frende gift shame getteth enemye naught lye wycked shame mā yet shall euer y• mouth vnwise thefe better man y• accustomed lye shal haue destruccyon herytage condicyons lyers vnbonest theyr shame euer wyse man shall brynge hym selfe honour wordes gene 〈◊〉 dan ••• hath vnderitandynge shall set amonge greate men prou 〈◊〉 ••• tylleth hys lande shall encrease hys heape corne worcketh ryghtuousnes shalbe exalted pleaseth great mē shall escape much euyll cost lyke one gathereth stone wynter eccl xv cōgregacion y• vngodly lyke stubble gathered together theyr ende flamme fyre waye vngodly set stone theyr ende hell darcknes paynes kepeth lawe wyll holde fast y• vnderstandyng therof ende feare god wysdome vnderstandyng wise wyll taught good vnwyse man aboundeth wyckednesse bytternesse vnderstandynge knowledge wyse shall flowe lyke water rūneth ouer councel lyke fountayne lyfe herte foole lyke broken vessel kepe wysdome man vnderstandynge beareth wyse worde shal commēde make much yfa voluptuous man heare shall haue pleasure therin cast behynde knowledge vnwyse darke wordes doctrine vnto hath vnderstandynge euen fetter hys fete lyke manicles vpō right hand •••• 19 b fole lifteth vp voyce laughter wyse man shall scarse laugh secretly nourtured wyll stande without foly man stādeth herkenynge dore wyse wyll ashamed lyppes vnwyse wylbe tellynge folyshe thynges wordes suche haue vnderstādyng shalbe weyed balaunce hert foles theyr mouth mouth wyse theyr herte vngodly curseth blasphemer curseth hys owne soule •• euit xix preuy accuser men shal defyle owne soule hated euery mā kepeth tong discrete shal come honour ¶ purgacyon slouthfull foolyshe sonne dauughter must haue dyscrecyon howe ought preach sorowynge vpon deade fole much talked iniuryes wronges brenke frendshypy amytye capi xxii slouthfull body moulded stone cla • e euery man wyl speake hys vysprayse slouthfull body made donge ox euery one toucheth hym muste washe hys handes agayne mysnurtured sonne dishonoure father foolyshe daughter shall lytle regarded wyse daughter herytage vnto husbande commeth dishonesty bringeth father heuynes daughter past shame dishonoureth father husbād vngodly shal regarde shall despyse playeng musicke mete heuines euen correcciō doctrine wysdome euer vn pleasaunt vnto fooles teacheth foole euen one y• gleweth potsharde together one telleth tale hym heareth hym one raiseth mā heuy slepe telleth foole wysdome euen mā speaketh one slepe hath tolde hys tale sayeth matter one dyeth lamentacyon made hym lyght fayleth hym euen let men mourne ouer foole wanteh vnderstanding make lytle wepyng deed come rest lyfe fole worse thē deeth seuen date men mourne deed lamentacion ouer vnwyse vngodly shuld endure dayes theyr lyfe talke much foole go hath vnderstanding beware lest turne y• trauayle thou shalt defyled wt hys synne departe frō thou shalt finde rest shalt drawen back hꝭ folyshnes heuier leade shuld foole called el leade pro • • 7 sand salt lūpe yron easier beare vnwyse folish vngodly mā like y• bande wod bounde together foundacion house cānot lowsed euen wt hert y• stablyshed y• thought councell thought wyse shall neyther feare offended tyme lyke fayre playitred wall wynter house hye building may abyde wynde storme euen foles hert afrayed hys ymagynacion feareth euery thynge cannot endure waueryng hart ymaginacyon fole wyl euer stand awe y• abydeth ithe cōmaundemētes god wyl alway feare nyppeth man eye bryngeth forth teares y• prycketh y• hert bringeth forth meanyng thought casteth stone y• byrdes frayeth thē awaye blasphemeth frēde breaketh frendshyppe though y• drewest sl •• rde thy frende yet dispayre yu mayest come agayne thy frende speake sowrely feare ye maye agreed together agayne except thou blaspheme dysdayne open secretes woūde traytorously thinges shall dryue awaye frende faythfull vnto thy neyghbour hys pouerte thou may est reioyce also hys prosperyte abyde stedfast vnto tune trouble y• matest heyre wyth hym hys heritage like vapour smoke goeth y• ouen fyre euen euyl wordes rebuke threatenynges go bloudsheddyng shamed defende thy trēde wyll hyde face hym though shulde harme whosoeuer heareth shal beware psal 141 b shall set watche mouthe sure seale vpon lyppes y• fal tonge destroy ¶ proper agaynste pryde▪ • echery glotony othrs blasph • wyse communicacion thre ky • de •• ne • hy synnes proceade abuou • ry feare god capi xxiii lorde father gouernoure lyfe leaue theyr magynacyon councell oh let fal reprofe wyll kepe thought scourge doctryne wysdome myne herte spare myne ignoraunce fall wyth lest mine ignoraunces increase myne offence many nombre sinnes exceade leste fall myne enemyes aduersary reioyce lord thou father god lyfe leaue theyr ymaginacyō let haue proude loke turne awaye • olupte ousnes fro take fro lustes body let desyres vnclennes take holde vpō geue ouer vnshamefast obstynate mynde heare ye chyldren wyll geue doctrine howe ye shall ordre mouthe kepeth shal perish thorow lippes hurt thorow wicked worckes synner shall excused thē lyke seruaūt oft punished cannot without fore euen whatsoeuer y• sweare •• nameth god shall clene pourged frō sinne man y• vseth much swearing shalbe filled wt wic kednes plage shall neuer go house begyle hys brother hys faure shalbe vpon hym yf knowledge hys sine maketh doble offēre sweare vayne shall founde ryghteous house shall full plages▪ 〈…〉 wordes y• swearer bryngeth death god graunte founde house iacob feare god eschue lye weltryng synne eph 〈…〉 use thy mouth vnhoneste fylthy talkynge worde synne remembre thy father thy mother whē thou art set among great men lest god forget theyr syght lest thou dotyng thy custome suffre rebuke wyshe haue bene borne curse y• daye thy naryuite • 〈…〉 man ye accustomed wt wordes blasphemy wyll neuer refourmed y• dayes lyfe synne twyse much thyrde bringeth wrath destruccion hote stomack cannot quē ched euen lyke burnynge fyre tyll haue swalowed vp somthing euen vnchast man hath reste hys fleshe tyll haue kyndled fyre bred swete whoremonger wyll leaue tyll haue hys purpose mā breaketh wedlock▪ regardeth hys soule sayeth esa 〈…〉 tush seyth compassed barcknes walles couer nobody seyth whō nede feare hyest wyl remembre synnes vnderstandeth y• hys eye se thynges feare men dryueth awaye feare god hymfor feareth onely eies men consydereth eye lorde much clearer thē sūne beholdig al wayes men grounde depe lokynge euen men hertes secrete place lorde god knewe thynges euer made brought passe also loketh vpon thē al leui 〈…〉 man shalbe openly punished stretes y• cyte shalbe chased abrode lyke yonge horse foale thinketh lest vpō shalbe taken thus shal put shame euery man wolde vnderstāde feare lordand thus shall go also euery wyfe leaueth housbande getteth enherytaūce straūge mariage exod 〈…〉 first hath bene vnfaythfull vnto lawe hyeste secondly hathe forsaken owne housbande thyrdly hath played whore aduoutry gotten chyldren another man shall brought congregacyon chyldren shall loked vpon chyldren shall take rote frute braunches shal brynge forth none shamefull reporte shal leaue behide dishonour shal put remayne shal knowe nothynge better feare god nothyng sweter take hede vnto commaū reioyse middest people cōgrgaeciōs hyeste shall open mouthe triumphe beholdyng power myddeste people shall exalted wondred holy fulnesse multitude chosen shalbe commended amonge blessed shalbe praysed shal say come mouth hyest first borne al creature caused light fayleth aryse heauē couered al earth cloude dwellyng aboue heyth seate piler cloude selfe alone haue gōne rounde aboute haruest thys maketh nourture breake forth light y• water gyhon haruest fyrst hath knowne perfectly nomore shall last seke y• groūd thought fuller see councel profounder greate depe wysdome haue cast prophecye leaue vnto seke wysdome generacions shall neuer fayle vnto holy euerlasting world eccle 33 b behold howe haue laboured self onely seke trueth ¶ thre thinges please god thre hateth nyne thynges suspecte tenth fely malyce woman capi xxv thre thynges spryte fauoureth whiche also alowed bebefore god men gene xiii b vnyte brother ro • xi loue neighbour eccles xi man wyfe agre well together thre thynges whiche soule hateth vtterly abhorre lyfe poore man proude ryche man lyar ge xviii b olde body dotethe vnchaste thou haste gathered nothynge thy youth wylte thou fynde thyne age howe pleasaunt thynge gray headed mē dyscrete ‡ whē y• elder cā geue good coūcel comely thig wysdome vnto aged men yee vnderstandyng councel glorious thing crowne olde men hane much experience feare god theyr worshyppe nyne thynges whiche haue iudged hert happy y• tenth wyll tell forth vnto men tonge man whyle lyueth hathe ioye chyldren seyeth y• fal enemyes well hym dwelleth houswyfe vnderstanding eccle xix c xxiiii •• • c iii c hath fallē tong hath bene fayne serue vnmete hym wel fyndeth faythful frende well talketh wysdome eare heareth hi great fyndeth wysdome knowledge yet aboue y• feareth lord feare god hath set selfe aboue thynges blessed man vnto graunted haue feare god unto whō shal lyckened kepeth fast feare god beginnynge loue begynning fayth cleue faste vnto heuynes hert punyshemēt wyckednes woman goeth aboue al punishmēt plage nothynge comparyson plage hert euen wyckednes nothyng wyckednes woman whatsoeuer happeneth vnto mā nothynge cōparison euyl wyllers vnto al vengeaunce nothynge vengeaunce enemye wycked heade head serpent wrath aboue y• wrath womā pr 〈…〉 wyll rather dwell lyon dragon kepe house wycked wyfe wyckednesse womā chaūgeth face shall moffel countenaūce beare sack shal shew amōge neghbours husbande brought shame among neghbours whē heareth maketh syghe wyckednes lytle wyckednes woman porcion vngodly shall fall vpon lyke clymme vp sandy waye fete aged euen wyfe full wordes styll quyete man eccle • 〈◊〉 〈…〉 〈…〉 〈…〉 loke narowly vpō bewtye womā leste thou prouoked ī desire towarde her▪ wrath woman dishonoure great confusiō woman get mastrey contrary husbande wycked wyfe maketh sory herte heuy countenaunce deed woūde 〈…〉 • 〈…〉 weake hādes feble knee womā husbād better woman came begynnynge synne thorowe deed geue thy water passage lytle nether geue wycked womā wyll walcke thy hande shall confounde syehgt thy enemy cut thy flesh alwaye abuse ¶ p • ap se good womā feare thre thynges fourth ielouze droncken womā two thynges cause sorow thyrde moueth wrath capi xxvi happye man hathe verteous wyfe nombre yeares shalbe dubble honest woman maketh husbande ioyfull man shall fyll y• yeares lyfe peace verteous womā noble gyft whiche shalbe geuen good porcion vnto feare god whether man rych poore may haue euer mery hert chearful countenaunce thre thinges hert feareth face afrayed y• fourth treason cytie sedicious people noisome tonges heuyer thē death one gelous ouer hys wyfe bryngeth payne sorowe vnto herte woman telleth thynges scourge tonge one hathe euell wyfe euen vnylke payre ox muste drawe together •• 16 getteth getteth scorpyon droncken woman great plage cannot couer owne shame whordome woman maye knowen pryde eye eye leddes •• 42 b thy daughter shamefast holde straytly lest abuse herselfe thorowe ouermoche lyberte beware dishonestye eye maruell yf agaynste lyke one yt goeth waye thirstie shall open mouth dryncke euery next water maye get euery hedge shal set downe open quyuer euery arowe louynge wyre reioyseth husbande fedeth bone wisdome woman fewe wordes gyfte god well nurtured myndes maye nothynge compared honest manerly woman gyft aboue gyftes weyght compared vnto mynde rule itselfe lyke sunne aryseth ornament hye heuen lorde vertuous wyfe bewtye house lyke clere lyght vpon y• holy candelsticke bewre y• face vpō honest body 〈…〉 v lyke golden puers vpon sockettes syluer fayre legges vnto woman hath costant mynde perpetual foundaciōs layde vpon whole stonye rocke commaundementes god vpon • e holy woman two thinges grene hert thyrde displeasure come vpō expert man warre suffreth scarsenes • pouerte men vnderstandynge wysdome sert one departeth ryghteousnes vnto synne doth suche lorde hathe prepared vnto swerde two maner thynges whiche thynke herde perylous marchaūt lyghtly kepe hym wronge nether taueruer selfe synne ¶ po • e wolde ryche probacyon man feareth god vnconstantnesse foole •• tretes trende vttred wycked ymagineth euell whiche • turneth vpon hym selfe capi xxvii pouerte haue many one offended seketh ryche turneth eye asyde lyke nayie wall stycketh fast betwyxte two stone euen doth synne sticke betwyxte bye seller holde hym dilygently feare lorde house shall soone ouerthrowen lyke one syfteth fylthynes remayneth syue remayneth vncleane thynge thought man ouen proueth potter vessell •• iii dothe temptacyō trouble trye ryghteous men •• iii tre felde knowen hys frute thought man herte knowne hys wordes prayse man excepte thou haue herde man knowen wordes thou folowest ryghteousnes thou shalt get put vpō fayre garmente thou shalt dwel shal defende euer daye knowledge thou shalt finde sted fastnesse byrdes resorte vnto theyr lyke doth truth turne vnto occupyed withall lyon wayteth praye dothe synners lurke vpon worker wyckednes talkynge hym feareth god nothynge wysdome foole chaūgeth moone thou amonge vndiscrete kepe thy wor •• conuenient tyme amonge suche wyse speake hardely talkynge fooles abhominacion theyr sporte volupteousnesse mysnurtoure eccle • 2 b moch swearynge maketh hearre stande vp striue suche stoppeth eares stryfe proude bloudesheddynge theyr blasphemynge heuy heare eccle 19 • 〈◊〉 xxii discouereth secretes leseth credence fyndeth frende wyl loue thy frende bynde thy selfe faythfulnes hym yf y• bewrayest secretes thou shalt get hym agayne lyke man destroyeth hys enemye also dealeth falsly frendshyp neyghboure lyke one letteth byrde go hande cannot take agayne euen thou yf thou geue ouer thy frende thou canst get againe yee thou canst come farre vnto roo escaped snare soule wounded woundes may bounde vp agayne euell worde maye reconcyled bewrayeth secres frende hope vnto hym proue x b y• wyncketh eye ymageneth cuell man shall take hym thou art present shall hylie commēde prayse thy wordes last shall turne tayle scaūder thy sayenge many thynges haue hated nothynge euell lord himselfe also abhorreth soch one exodi 21 b casteth stone hye shall fall vpon hys awne head smyteth gyle woundeth selfe dyggeth pyt shall fall therin layeth stone ī neghbours waye shall stomble theron layeth snare another shalbe takē self hester 7 b psal 7 • prou 20 c eccles 10 geueth wycked noysome councell shall come vpō hym selfe shal knowe whence proude blaspheme scornefull vengeaunce lurketh lyon reioyse fal ye ryghteous shalbe taken snare anguysh herte shall consume dye anger rygorousnesse two abhominable thynges vngodly hath thē vpō hym ought desyre vengeaūce forgeue office wyces tonge daughter therof capi xxviii • n 32 c rom 12 c seketh vengeaunce shal fynde vengeaunce lorde shall surely kepe hym synnes math 5 b 6 b 18 b forgeue thy neyghboure hurt hath done shall thy synnes forgeuē also whc̄ thou prayest amā beareth hatred agaynst another howe darre desyre forgeuenesse god sheweth mercy man whiche lyke selfe howe darre aske forgeuenesse synnes flesh beareth hatred kepeth wyll intreate synnes remē bre ende let enemyte passe whiche seketh death destruccyon abyde thou commaundementes remēbre commaundement shalt thou rygorous ouer thy neyghboure thyncke vpō couenaunt hyest forgeue thy neyghbours ignoraunce eccle 58 beware stryfe thou shalt make thy synnes fewer angrie man kindleth variaūce vngodly disquyeteth frendes putteth discorde amonge peace prou 26 c wod ye vehement fyre myghtier mē greater wrath lōger strife endureth burneth hastye brawlynge kynleth fyre hastye stryte sheddeth blouoe tonge also beareth false witnesse bryngeth death thou blowe sparke shal burne y• spyt vpon shall go forth ye mouth eccle 〈…〉 sclaūderet dubble tonged cursed many one y• frendes setteth varyaunce thyrde tonge hath disquieted many one dryuen frome one lande another stronge cyties ryche hath broken downe ouerthrowen house greate men strēgth people hath brought downe bene decaye myghtye nacyons thyrde tonge hath cast many honest woman robbed theyr labour herkeneth vnto suche shall neuer fynde rest neuer dwel safely stroke rod maketh yedders stroke tonge smyteth bone sunder many haue peryshed wyth swerde many mo thorowe tonge well hym kepte euyll tonge commeth angre therof draweth yocke suche bounde bandes yock thereof yron bande stele death therof euyll death hell better one suche tonge fyre maye oppresse feare god flamme thereof maye burne thē suche forsake lorde shal fall therein shall burne man shalbe able quenche shall fall vpon lyon deuoure leoparde thou hedgest thy goodes thornes doest thou rather make dores barres thy mouth thou wcyest thy golde syluer doest yu weye thy wordes also vpon y• balance beware y• yu slyde thy tonge fall thyue enemyes y• lay wayte thy fal incurable euen vnto death ¶ howe ought lende oure monye almes faythfull man answerynge hys frende lyberalite hospytalyte capi xxix wyll shewe mercy deut 〈…〉 luce 6 • let lende vnto hys neyghboure able let hym kepe commaundemente lende vnto thy neyghboure tyme nede pay thou thy neyghboure agayne due season kepe thy worde deale faythfully hym thou shalte allwaye fynde thynge necessary haue bene many thynge lent reckened founde made trauayle laboure helped thē whyle receyne anythinge kysse handes suche geue theyr neyghbours good humble theyr voyce shulde paye agayne kepe back geue euell wordes make many excuse reason tyme though able yet geueth scarse y• halfe agayne rekeneth founde yf holde money yet hathe enemye hym vndeserued payeth cursynge rebuke geueth hym euell wordes hys good dede many one glad lende euel feare lese thyng lende yet haue thou pacyence symple withholde mercy hym helpe poore commaundemētes sake let hym go emptie hys necessite lese thy money thy brother neyghbours sake burie vnder stone rusteth corrupteth math 6 • •• ce 12 eim 6 gather thy treasure commaundement hyest shall brynge profyt golde •• 4 b laye vp almes herte poore shall kepe euel dan 4 〈◊〉 12 〈◊〉 x man almes purse shall kepe man fauoure apple eye warde shall aryse paye euery man rewarde vpō heade shal fyght thyne enemyes better chylde gyaunte speare myghtye good honest mā suertie neyghboure wycked personne letteth hym come shame forget frendeshyp thy suertye hathe geuen soule vngodly despyseth good dede hys suertye vnthanckfull ignoraunte leaueth suertie daunger man promeseth neyghboure hathe lost hys honeste shal forsake suertishyppe hathe destroyed many ryche man remoued waues see myghtie people hathe dryuen awaye caused wandre straunge coūtres vngodly man transgressynge commaundemente lorde shall fall euell suertishyppe though force selfe get yet shall fall iudgement helpe thy neyghboure thy power beware thou thy selfe fal dett •• le 39 c chefe thynge kepeth lyfe water bred clothinge lodgynge couer shame better haue poore lyuynge man owne house delicate fare among straūge psal 35 b tim vi b hebre 13 lytle much thou hast holde content withall thou shalt blamed vagabounde myserable lyfe go house house man fremde darre open mouth though one lodged haue meate dryncke yet shal taken vnworthy heare many bytter rough wordes namely thus go thy waye thou straunger prepare table thy selfe fede also thou hast way thou straūger regardeth honoure brother cōmeth house telleth hym necessite house thynges heuy man hath vnder standynge namely forbyddynge house y• lēoer casteth hym teth ¶ correccyon chyldren commodytye health deeth better sorowefull lyfe hydde wysdome ioye sorowe herte capi xxx loueth chylde prou 13 f xxiii • holdeth styll vnder coreccion may haue ioye warde y• grope hys neyghbours dores deut vi teacheth sōne shal haue ioye hym nede ashamed hym amonge hys aquayntaunce whose enfourmeth teacheth sōne greueth enemye frendes maye haue ioye hym though father dye yet though deed hathe left one behynde lyke hym lyfe sawe hym ioye hym sory death neyther ashamed enemyes left behynde auenger enemy good doer vnto frēdes lyfe chyldren shall bynde woundes together herte greued euery crye vntamed horse wylbe harde wanton childe wylbe wylfull thou brynge vp thy sonne delicatly shall make y• afayed yf thou playe shall brynge heuynes laugh lest thou wepe also lest thy teth set edge last eccles 7 c geue liberte youth excuse foly bowe downe hys necke whyle young hyt hym vpon sydes whyle yet chylde lest waxe stubberne geue force shalt thou haue heuynes soule teach thy childe diligent therin lest thy shame better poore beyng whole stronge man ryche haue health health wellfare golde whole body aboue al treasure tyche aboue sounde body ioye aboue ioye herte death better wreched lyfe eternall rest better contynuall syckenes good thyngꝭ y• put close mouth lyke whē meate laied vpō y• graue good doth offerynge vnto idol • e • b cā nether eate tast smel euen chased lorde heareth rewardes iniquytte seyth eye groneth lyke gelded man lyeth wt vyrgin soule comforte thyne hert sorowe heuynes dryue farre frō y• 2 cor 7 b heuynes hath slayne many man bryngeth profyt zele anger shorten y• dayes lyfe carefulnes sorow bring age y• tyme unto mery hert euery thing hath good tast y• eateth ¶ ought geue dilygent hede honesty thē • ake payue gather ryches prayse ryche mā without faute ought fle dronckenesse folowe ••• nt • capi xxxi trauayle carfulnes tim vi • ryches taketh away slepe maketh flesh consume one lyeth taketh care waketh euer vp lyke great sycknes breaketh slepe ryche hathe greate laboure gatheringe ryches together pleasure ryches taketh rest refreshed laboureth prospereth poore though leaue yet begger y• loueth ryches shall iustified foloweth corrupcion shall haue ynough therof eccles • • many one come greate mysfortune reason golde haue founde theyr destruccyon tre fallynge vnto offre vp foolysh fall therin blessed ryche whiche founde without blemysh hathe gone golde hoped money tresures one shal commende call blessed greate thinges dothe amonge people tryed founde parfecte thynges shalbe cō mended praysed myght offende hath offēded coulde euel hathe done therfore shall hys good stablyshed whole cōgregaciō shall declare almesses yf thou syt greate man table open thy mouth wyde vpon make many wordes remembre euel eye shrowe thing created worse wycked eye therfore wepeth euery mās face laye thine hāde vpon euery thing thyne eye seyth stryue hym dyshe math • ponder thy selfe thy neyghboure wolde fayne haue discrete euery poynte eate thynge set manerly becommeth man eate much lest thou abhorred leaue y• fyrst al nurtoure lest thou man maye satisfye may turne thy decaye thou syttest amonge many men reache thyne hande fyrst eccl •• oho well contēt wyse man lytle wyne slepe y• shalt sycke therof fele payne swete whosome slepe shall suche one haue fele inwarde grefe ryseth vp tymes y• morninge well • ase selfe vnsaciable eater slepeth vnquietly hath ache payne body y• felest y• hast eaten moche aryse go thy waye cast thy stomacke take thy rest shall ease thou shalt brynge syckenesse vnto thy body sonne heare despyse last yu shalt fynde haue tolde 〈…〉 thy workes diligent quycke shall sycknes happe vnto y• prou •• liberal dealyng meate many men shall blesse hym prayse hym theyr lyppes sure token hys loue faythfulnes vnfaythful meate whole cytie shal cō playne hym sure experience infidelite wyckednes ephe 〈◊〉 iud • 〈◊〉 thou wyne bybber wyne hath destroied many man fyre proueth herde yron euen doth wyne proue hertes proude droncken prou 〈◊〉 • 〈…〉 • wyne sobrely droncken queckeneth lyfe mā thou drynckest measurably thou shalt temperate lyfe maye continue without wyne • taketh awaye lyfe euen death wyne made frō begynnyng make men glad drōckennes wyne measurably droncken reioysyng soule body measurable dryncke health soule body yf droncken excesse maketh bytternes sorowe vnto mynde dronkennes fylleth mynde foolysh shame ruyne mynysheth strength maketh woundes eccle xx • rebuke thy neyghbour wyne despyse hym myrth geue hym despytefull wordes preasse vpon hym contrary sayinges ¶ discrecyon prayse preacher hearer feare fayth cōfydence god capi xxxii yf thou made ruler •• u • e 17 pryde thy self therin thou one people •• xii b take dylygent care loke well therto thou hast done thy dewtye syt downe thou mayest mery receyue crowne honour talke wysely honestly wysdome becommeth ryght wel hynder musycke speake audyence eccles iii eccle xx • poure forth wysdome tyme importunite lyke car buncle stone shyneth set golde doth songe garnysh wyne feast smaragde set golde swetnesse musycke myrth wyne geue eare styll thy good behauour thou shalte loued thou yonge man speake becōmeth profytable yet scarse thou art twyse asked comprehende muche fewe wordes many thynges one ignoraunt geue eare holde thy tonge withall yf thou amonge men hyer auctoryte desyre compare thy selfe vnto elder speaketh make thou many wordes therin thonder goeth lyghtenynge nurtoure shamefastnes goeth loue fauour stande vp tymes laste get home soone take thy pastyme thou wylt thou euell defye man thynges geue thankes vnto hym y• hath made replenyshed good feareth lorde wyll receyue doctryne get hym tymes shall fynde grace seketh lawe shall fylled withall hym fayned wyll offended therat feare lorde shall fynde iudgement theyr ryghtuousnesse shalbe kyndled lyght vngodly man wyll refourmed help self example purpose man vnderstandynge despyseth good councell wylde proude body hathe feare yee euen whan hath dealt rashly wt another man owne doynges shall rebuke sonne nothyng without aduisement shal repent dede go waye thou mayest fal thou mayest stomble agaynst stone geue thy selfe laborious slyppery waye beware thyne owne chyldren take hede theym thyne owne housholde thy worckes put thy trust god frō thy whole herte kepynge commaundementes beleueth god worde taketh hede commaundementes putteth hys trust lorde shall wante nothynge ¶ delyueraunce hym feareth god answere wyse lytle dyscrecyon foole man hande god earthe hande potter ought dyspose oure selues become subiecte capi xxxiii shall euyll happen vnto hym feareth god tē tacyon lord shall delyuer hym kepe hym frome euyll wyse man hateth lawe ypocryte shyp raging water man vnderstandynge geueth credence vnto lawe god lawe faythfull vnto hym sure matter talke therof fyrst well instruct mayest thou geue answere herre foolysh lyke carte whele thoughtes renne aboute lyke axell tree lyke wylde horse y• neyeth vnder euery one sytteth vpon wt scorneful frend doth one day excell another seyng al y• dayes yeare come sunne wysdome lorde hath parted sunder hath ordayned tymes solempne feastes hath chosē halowed dayes mē made gene ii grounde earthe adam multitude science hath lord sundered made wayes diuerse fashyons hath blessed made much halowed claymed hymselfe thē hath cursed brought thē lowe put theyr estate rom ix • lyke claye potter hande ordrynge therof pleasure men also hāde hym made may geue lyketh hym best 1 corin 6 • agaynste euyll good agaynste death lyfe vngodly agaynst suche fere god behold workes hyest euer two agaynst two one set agaynste another awaked vp last one gathereth haruest giftꝭ god blessinge increased haue fylled wyne presse lyke grape gatherer eccle 24 b behold haue laboured onely selfe al loue nurtoure wysdome heare ye greate men people herken youre eares ye tulers cōgregacyon geue thy sonne wyfe thy brother frēde power ouer whyle thou lyuest geue awaye thy substaū ce good another lest repent thou fayne begge therfore thy selfe longe thou lyuest hast brethe let man chaūge better thy child pray thou shuldest sayne loke theyr hādes thy worckes excellent thy honoure neuer stayned tyme thou shalt ende thy dayes fynysh thy lyfe distribute thyne inheritaū ce fodder whyp burden longed vnto asse meate correccion worke vnto seruaunt thou set thy seruaunt laboure thou shalt fynde rest yf thou let go ydel shall seke libertye yocke whyp bowe downe harde necke tame thou thy euyll seruaunte bondes correccyon sende laboure go ydle ydelnesse brigeth much euyll set worke belongeth vnto becommeth well obediēt binde fete much vnto wyse without discrecyon nothinge eccle vii c thou haue faythful seruaūt let vnto thyne owne soule intreade brother bloude hast y• gotten thou haue seruaunte holde thy selfe thou hast nede thy selfe thou intreatest euyll kepest harde makest hym proude renne awaye thou canst tell waye thou shalt seke ¶ dreames diuinacyons euchauntementes ought confute vayne hope lying prayse feare god dyuers workes men god dothe alowe workes vnfaythfull man capi xxxiiii vnwyse people begile selues vayne disceatful hope fooles truste dreames regardeth dreames lyke hym wyll take holde shadowe folowe wynde euen apperynges dreames face lycknes face cā clensed vncleane trueth spoken lyer sothsayinge wytcrafte sorcery dreamyng vanyte lyke woman trauayleth wt childe hath many fantasy hert visiōs come god set thine herte vpon dreames haue disceaued many man fayled put theyr trust therin lawe shalbe fulfylled without lye wysdome suffyciēt faythful mouth knowledge hath tryed wyse man well instructe vnderstā deth muche y• hath good experience talke wysdome hath experiēce knoweth lytle erreth causeth muche wyckedues y• tryed thinges knoweth foloweth rule full wyckednes yet errour lerned much also yee lerned coulde expresse came oft parell death therouer tyll delyuered thorowe grace god se feare god haue ryght sprete theyr hope stādeth hym helpe thē eye lorde loue feareth lorde stādeth awe man afrayed lorde hope comforte blessed soule feareth lorde whō putteth trust strength p •• • 6 • eye lord haue respecte vnto loue mighty proteccion stronge groūd defēce heate refuge hote none daye succore stumblynge helpe fallynge setteth vp soule lyghteneth eye geueth lyfe blessynge geueth offringe vnrygh tuous good offeringe refused scornefull dealynges vnryghtuous please god lorde theyrs onely y• pacientely abyde hym waye trueth ryghtuousnes hyghest doth alowe gyftes wycked prou x 〈…〉 god hath delyte y• offeringes vngodly nether may synne reconcyled multitude oblacyons bryngeth offerynge goodes poore doth euen one kylleth sōne father eye bred nedefull lyfe poore y• defraudeth hym therof man bloude robbeth hys neyghboure liuyng doth great sine though • e death deut • 4 • eccle 〈…〉 y• defraudeth laborer hyre bloud shedder one buildeth another breaketh downe profyte haue laboure whē one prayeth another curseth whose voyce wyl y•
