chereful eye lord recompenseth geueth seuen tymes muche agayne geue vnryghtuous gyftes suche wyll nat receyue beware wrongeous offringes lord rightuous iudge regarderh mannes personne accepteth personne poore heareth prayer oppressed iudit 4 b despyseth desyre fatherlesse wyddowe poureth prayer hym doth god se teares renne downe chekes wyddowe heareth cōplaynte ouer suche make wepe hyr chekes teares go vp vnto heauē lorde heareth thē doth accepte serueth god pleasure shalbe accepted hys prayer reacheth vnto cloudes ••• iii 〈◊〉 x • prayer y• humbleth sylfe goeth thorow cloudes tyll come nye comforted go waye tyll hyest god haue respecte vnto geue true sentence perfourme iudgement lorde wyll slack cōmynge tary long tyll haue smytten sonder ba ckes vnmercyfull auenged selfe heathē tyl haue taken awaye multytude cruell broken cepter vnryghtuous tyll geue euery man workes rewarde thē doyngꝭ tyl haue deliuered people mayntained cause reioysed thē ī mercy fayre thyng mercy time anguish trouble lyke cloude rayne cō meth tyme drouth ¶ prayer god person faythfull men prayse good woman capi xxxvi haue mercy vpon v lorde thou god thynges haue respecte vnto v shewe v light thy mercyes sende thy feare amonge heathen straū gers seke may knowe god thou maye shewe thy wonderous workes lyfte vp thyne hande ouer outlandy heathen maye learne knowe thy myght power lyke thou arte halowed v brynge passe thou mayest magnyfyed also v may know like knowe none god onely thou lorde renue token chaunge wonderous worckes shew thyne hande thy ryght arme gloryously rayse vp thy indignacyon poure thy wrath take awaye aduersary smyte enemy make tyme short remembre thy couenaunt thy wonderous worckes may praysed let wrath fyre consume thē lyue carelesse let peryshe thy people hurt smyte sunder heade prynces oure enemyes say none gather trybes iacob together agayne y• may knowe howe none god onely thou maye shewe thy wonderous workes thou thy people herytage lyke begyynnynge lord haue merey vpon people hath thy name vpō israel exodi 4 e whō yu hast lyckened fyrst borne sonne mercyfull vnto ierusalem cytie thy sanctuary 1 per 6 g cytie thy rest fyll syon thy vnspeakable vertues thy people thy glorye geue wytnes vnto thy creature thou madest beginnynge rayse vp prophecyes haue bene shewed thy name rewarde thē wayte thy prophetes may founde faythfull lorde heare prayer thy seruaūtes accordyng blessing aaron ouer thy people gyde thou v way ryghteousnes nume 6 whiche dwel vpon earthe maye knowe thou art lorde eternall god whiche euerlastyng bely deuoureth meates yet one meate better another lyke tong tasteth venyson • cor • 2 doth herte vnderstandyng marcke false wordes frowarde hert geueth heuines man experience lifteth hym vp agayne woman receyueth euery man yet one daughter better another fayre wyfe reioyseth husband man loueth nothyng better louynge vertuous wyth husbande lyke men hathe gotten vertuous woman hath goodly possession vnto helpe pyler wherupon resteth hedge y• goodes spoyled huswyfe frendles mourneth lyke credēce geuē robber goeth one cytye anoher man beleued hath nest must turne may abyde nyght ¶ howe man shulde knowe frendes councellers searche company holy man capi xxxvii euery frende sayeth wyll frendely vnto also frend whiche onely frende name remayneth heuynes vnto death companyon frende turned enemye wycked presumpcyon whense art thou spronge vp couer ye earth falshede disceate eccle vi • cō panyon whiche prosperite reioyseth wyth frende tyme trouble taketh parte hym companyon mourneth frende bely sake trouble commeth taketh holde shylde forget thy frende thy mynde thynke vpon hym thy ryches seke councell thy kyns men hyde thy councel frō beare good wyl eccl viii • ix • euery coūceler bryngeth forth coūcell neuertheles counceleth owne profite beware counceller aduysed afore whereto thou wylte vse wyll councel selfe lest cast lot vpō say vnto thy way purpose good warde stāde agaynst loke shall become aske councel suspecteth y• enemy hyde thy councel frō suche hate aske councell woman cō cernyng thinges longeth fearfull fayne herted bodye matter warre marchaunt howe deare wyll cheape thy ware towarde byer sellynge enuyous man thankes geuyng vnmercyfull louyng kyndnes vnhonest man honestye slouthfull workynge hyrelynge whiche hath house profyte wealth ydle bodye wolde gladly heare speake much labour take suche folkes councel dilygent seke councel vertuous man feareth god suche one thou knowest kepte cōmaundementes hath mind thyne owne mynde sory thou stumblest holde thy councel fast thyne hert man faythfull kepe thou thy selfe man mynde sū tyme disposed tell oute seuen watchemen sit aboue hye place lokyng aboute aboue praye y• hyest wyll leade thy waye faythfulnes truthe thy workes aske councel fyrst euer thou doest thyng well aduised foure thynges declare chaunged herte wherout spryngeth euyl good death lyfe masterfull tonge bableth muche man apte well instructe many thynges yet vnprofitable vnto hym selfe man geue wyse prudent councell yet hated continueth begger grate geuē god accepted another robbed wysdome yet wyse vnto selfe frute vnderstandyng commendable mouth wyse man maketh people wyse ye frutes wysdome fayle wyse mā shall plentuously blessed god al se hym shall speake good hym lyfe man standeth nombre dayes ye day israel inumerable wyse man shall optayne fayfulnes credence among hys people name shal perpetuall sonne proue thy soule thy lyfe yf thou se euyll thinge geue vnto cor vi • x • thynges profytable al men nether hath euery soule pleasure euery thynge gredye euery eatyng hastye vpon meates eccle xxx • excesse meates bringeth syckenes glotony cōmeth last vnmeasurable heate thorow surfet haue many one perisshed dyeteth selfe temperatly prolongeth lyfe ¶ physicion syckenes ought pray fynde physycion whiche healeth prayer • ew • pynge deed • du •• wysdome artificer craftesmen capi xxxviii honour phisicion honoure necessite god hath created hī hyest commeth medycine shall receyue gyftes kynge wysdome phisycion bringeth great worshype syght greate men thys worlde shal honorably taken lorde hathe created medycyne earthe wyse wyll abhorre exod xv • reg 4 c bytter water made swete tre men myght learne knowe vertue therof lorde hath geuen men wysdome vnderstandyng might honoured wonderous workes suche doth heale men taketh awaye theyr paynes suche doth apotecarye make con • eccyon yet man perfourme workes lorde cōmeth prosperous welth ouer earth sonne despyse thy sycknes • pat 16 〈◊〉 • 8 praye vnto lorde shall make whole leaue synne order thy handes ryght clense thyne hert frō wyckednes geue swete sauoured offering fyne floure token remembraunce make offerynge fat one geueth fyrste fruytes geue rowme phisycion lorde hath created hym let hym go thou haste nede hym houre maye come sycke maye helped thorowe thē praye vnto lorde maye recouer get helth lyue longer sinneth hys maker shall fall handes phisycion sonne eccle 22 • bryng forth thy teares ouer deade begyn mourne yt thou haddest suffered great harme thy selfe couer body conuenyent maner despyse buryall enforce thy selfe wepe prouoke thy selfe mourne 1 ehe • 4 make lamentacyon expedientlye daye two leest thou euel spoken comforte thy selfe heuynes prou xii xviii eccle xxx heuynes cōmeth death heuynes hert breaketh strength heuynes pouerte greueth herte temptacyon offente take heuynes herte dryue awaye remember last thynges forget turning agayne thou shalte hym good hurt thy selfe remēber iudgment thine also shal lyke wyse vnto yester daye vnto daye 2 reg xii e let remēbraunce y• deed ceasse hys rest comforte thy selfe agayne ouer hym seing spiryte departed hym wysdome scrybe conuenyent tyme rest ceasseth exercyse laboure shall wyse holdeth plough hath plesure proddyng driuyng ox goeth aboute suche workes speake ox setteth hert make forowes dilygent geue kyne foder euery carpenter also workmaster laboureth styl nyght daye carueth graueth cutteth desyre sondry connynge thynges hert ymagineth howe maye cūnyngly cast ymage dilygence also watchyng perfourmeth worke yronsmyth lyke maner hydeth stythye doth dilygence labour yron vapoure fyre brenneth fleshe must fyght hea • fornace noyse hammer soundeth euer eares eye loke styll vpō thynge maketh hath set hys mynde therupon wyll make worke therfore watcheth howe maye set bryngeth ende doth potter syt worke turneth whele aboute fete dilygent careful doynges laboure worke without nomber fashioneth claye arme fete temporeth herte ymagyneth howe maye make pleasaunte dilygence clense ouen hope theyr handes euery one thyncketh cunnynge worke without maye cyties maynteyned inhabited occupied come h • e congregacyon councell people requyred vnderstande couenaunte lawe cannot declare equyte iudgemēt cānot fynd darke sentence thorowe shall creature worlde maynteyned theyr prayer concerneth worke labour connynge ¶ wyse man workes god unto good good thynges profet vnto euell euen good thynges euell capi xxxix applyeth hys mynde vnderstande law god doth diligently seke wysdome old tyme exerciseth selfe prophetes kepeth saynges famous men preseth vnderstandynge darcke sentence wysdome seketh y• mystery secrete sayinges exerciseth self ther continually doth seruice amōge great men appeareth prince goeth straūge countre trauayleth thorowe loke good euyll among men proueth seketh purposeth herte resorte early vnto lord y• made pray hyest god openeth mouth prayer prayeth hys sinnes whē great lorde wyll shalbe fylled y• sprete vnderstandyng may poure wyse sentence geue thanckes vnto lorde hys prayer shall ordre deuice lede knowledge ryght geue vnderstanding secrete thynges shall shewe forth theeccle 44 b science lernynge reioyse couenaunt lawe lord whole congregacyon shall commende wysdome shall neuer put remē braunce shal neuer forgotten name shall continue one generaciō another hys wysdome shalbe spoken amonge people whole congregacyō shal openly declare prayse whyle lyueth hath greater name thousāde besyde death name remayneth vnto hym yet wyll speake mo men vnderstandynge ful moone herken vnto ye holy vertuous chyldren brynge forth frute rose yt plā ted brokes felde geue ye swete smell libanus florysh rose garden synge songe prayse geue thā kes vnto god ouer worckes geue glory honoure vnto lorde shew prayse youre lyppes yee euen • onge lippes harpes playing geuynge thanckes vnto hym saye maner gene • worckes lorde exceadynge good cō maundementes mete conueniente due season mā nede saye tyme conuenient shall sought commaundemēt water wal word mouth water stode styll gene vii b commaundement euery thynge acceptable reconcyled health mynisshed worckes al flessh nothyng hyd eies seyth euerlastyng euerlastynge nothynge wonderfull hye vnto hym man nede saye thys hathe made thynges good vnto man blessynge shall renne ouer streame moysture earth lyke floud water lyke maketh water drouth shal wrath fal vpon heathen osce 14 • rome • • wayes playne ryght vnto iust vngodly stomble good good thinges created begynnyng euyl thynges vngodly eccles 〈◊〉 • al thynges necessary y• lyfe man created frō begynnyng water fyre yron salt meel wheat hony mylke wyne oyle clothyng 1 eim • • thynges created best faythful vn godly shal al thinges turned hurt harme spretes yt created vengeaunce rigorusnes haue fastened theyr tormētes math 〈…〉 tyme ende shal poure strength pacifie wrath hī made thē eccles 〈◊〉 • fire hayle hōgre deth al thinges created vengeaunce teeth wylde noysome beastes scorpion serpētes swerde created also vengeaūce destruccyon vngodly shal glad cō maundementes nede shal ready vpon earthe theyr houre come shall ouerpasse cōmaundement lorde thefore haue taken good corage vnto begynnynge thought put thinges wrytinge leaue thē behynde gene • • workes lord good geueth euery one due season whan nede man nede say worse due seasō al pleasaunt good therfore prayse lord whole hert mouth geue thankes vnto name ¶ many myseryes lyghte mannes lyfe thynges passe awaye fyrme stablyshe fayth remayneth blessynge ryghtuous prerogatyue feare god capi xl great trauayle created men heuy yocke vpon chyldren adam frome daye go theyre mother wombe tyll buryed earth ye mother al thynges namely theyr thoughtes ymaginacyons feare hert councell meditacions longyng desyre day death hiest sytteth vpon glorious seate vnto ye lowest moste symple vpon earth frō hym gorgyously arayed weareth crowne vntyl homely symply clothed nothing wrath zele fearfulnes vnquyetnesse feare death rygorous angre strife nyght one shulde reste slepe vpon bedde slepe chaungeth hys vnderstādynge knowledge lytle nothynge hys rest slepe well daye laboure feareth disquieted vision hert one renneth battayle tyme health awaketh marueleth ye feare nothynge suche thynges happen vnto fleshe man beast seuen folde vngodly moreouer death bloudsheddyng stryfe swearde oppression hongre destruccion punyshment eccle 39 • thynges created agaynst vngodly sake came y• floude also gene vii iii y• ye earth shall turne earth agayne water ebbe agayne see brybes vnryghtuousnes shal put away faythfulnes trueth shall endure euer substaūce goodes y• vngodly shalbe dryed vp syncke awaye water floude shall make sounde lyke great thonder rayne lyke rightuous reioyseth openeth hande shal trāsgressours faynt theyr goodes vanysh cō sume awaye eccle 41 b chyldren vngodly shall optayne many braunches vncleane rote vpō hye rockes shalbe roted grasse water side vpon ryuer banckes frendlynes liberalite increase blessyng god lyke paradyse gardē pleasure mercy also kindnes endureth euer • eym 6 b philip 4 b laboure cōtent man hath swete pleasauntlyfe fynde treasure aboue treasure beget chyldren repaire citie maketh perpetual name honeste woman worthe bothe wyne mynstrelsye reioyse herte loue wysdome aboue bothe pypynge harpynge make swete noyse frendly tonge goeth beyonde thē thyne eye desyreth fauoure bewtye grene sede tyme rather frende companyon come together oportunyte aboue wyfe agreeth husbande one brother helpeth another tyme trouble almes shall delyuer golde syluer fasten fete good councell pleasaunte temporall substaunce strength lyft vp mynde feare lorde feare lord wanteth nothynge nedeth helpe feare lorde pleasaunte garden blessynge nothynge beautyful sonne lede beggers lyfe better dye beg loke another mās table taketh thought owne lyuyng vpholde life fedeth self men meate wyse wel nurtoured man wyl bewarre therof begging swete mouth vnshamefast bely burneth fyre ¶ remembraunce deeth deeth feared cuiffe vpon forsake law god good name fame exhortacyon geue hede vnto wysdome thynges man ought ashamed capi xli deathe howe bytter remembraūce man seketh rest comforte hys substaunce ryches vnto man y• hath nothing vexe hath prosperite thynges yee vnto hī yet able receiue meate death howe acceptable good thy iudgemente vnto nedeful vnto whose strength fayleth last age thynges full care fearefulnes vnto also dispaire hath hope paciēce thou afrayed death remembre haue bene come thys iudgement lorde ouer flesh gene 8 woldest thou agaynste thys pleasure hyest whether ten hundreth thousand yeares death asketh longe one hath lyued chyldrē vngodly abhomynable chyldren kepe cō pany vngodly eccles xl c inheritaunce vngodly chyldren shall come naught theyr posterite shal haue perpetuall shame confusyon chyldren complayne vngodly father hys sake rebuked despysed wo vnto ye vngodly haue forsakē lawe hyest god yf ye borne ye shal borne cursynge yf ye dye curse shal porcyon eccle xi b earthe shall turne earthe agayne go vngodly also curse destruccyon sorowe mē theyre bodye name vngodlye shall put eccl xxii laboure get good name shall contynue su • er thousande greate treasure golde good lyfe hath nomber dayes good name endureth euer eccle xx chyldren kepe wysdome peace wysdome hyd tresur sene profyt man hideth folyshnes better mā hydeth hys wysdome therfore ye turned wordes good thynges alwaye ashamed true fayth must proue measure ashamed whoredome father mother ashamed lesynge prynce men auctoryte synne iudge ruler offence congregacyon people vnryghtuousnesse companyon frende theft thy neyghbours rome b truth god couenaunt ashamed therof ashamed lye thyne elbowes vpon bred ashamed loke vpon harlottes ashamed turne awaye thy face thy frende ashamed take geue ashamed also loke vpon nother man wyfe make many triflyng wordes mayden stande bedsyde ashamed vpbrayde thy frende thou geuest thynge caste hym te • withall ¶ secretes maye opened lawe god must taught doughter woman god knoweth thynges ye euen secretes •• e capi xlii rehearse thynge twyse dysclose wordes thou haste herde secrete shamefast well manered dede shall euery man fauour thynges thou ashamed accepte personne offende namely thynges ashamed lawe god couenaunt iudgement brynge vngodly vngodlynesse vnto ryghtuousnes make hym good man deale faithfully thy neyghbour companyon destrybute herytage vnto thy frendes diligent kepe true measure weyght content whether thou gettest muche lytle deale truelye temporall gooddes byinge sellynge bryng vp chyldren dilygence correcte euell seruaunte kepe thine frō euel wyfe set locke many handes thou delyuerest geuest kepe tell weye wryte vp thy geuynge receyuynge enfourme vnlearned vnwyse aged iudged yonge yf thou dylygente thynges truely thou shalte learned wyse accepted men doughter maketh y• father watch secretly ye carefulnes yt hath taketh away slepe yee ye youth leest shulde ouergrow hī whē hath husband lest shuld hated lest shulde defyled rauyshed vyrginite gotten wt chylde father house cō meth y• man leest behaue selfe right cōtynue vnfruteful eccle 〈◊〉 ▪ • ▪ thy daughter wāton kepe straytly leest cause thyne enemyes laugh y• scorne holy cytie geue euell reporte y• fayne heare thy shame euery man confoūded y• people eccle • • ▪ beholde euery bodyes beautye haue much dwellynge amonge wemen lyke worme moth cometh clothynge doth wyckednesse womengene • ▪ • ▪ better euell man frendely wyfe y• putteth one shame rebuke wyl remember workes lorde declare thyng yt haue sene wordes lorde workes sunne ouerloketh thynges shyne workes full clerenes therof hath lord brought passe sayntes shulde tell hys wunderous workes whiche almyghtie lorde hath stably shed thynges endure glory seketh ground depe hert men knoweth theyr ymaginacion wysdome lord knoweth scyence loketh y• token tyme declareth thynges past come discloseth thynges secrete io • 〈…〉 esay 〈…〉 thought maye escape hym neyther maye worde hyd hym hath garnyshed hye excellent workes wysdome frō euerlastyng euerlastyng unto hym maye nothynge added neyther mynished hath nede also man councel amiable al workꝭ sparke loke vpon lyue endure euer whē soeuer nede al obedient vnto al double one another hath made nothing hath faute blemysh 〈…〉 hath stablyshed goodes euery one maye satysfyed glorye seyth ¶ summe • reacyon worckes god capi xliii glorye heyght • sal v • ii • ▪ fayre cleare fyrmamente bewtye heauen gloryous clearnes sunne appeareth declareth daye goinge oute maruelous worke hyest none burneth earthe maye abyde heate therof kepeth ouen hote▪ • hre tymes dothe sunne burne vpon mountaynes bretheth oute fyrye beames shynethe wyth brightnes blyndeth eye greate lorde made commaundement causeth renne hastely 〈…〉 • mone also conueniente season sheweth tymes tokē tyme 〈…〉 token solēpne feaste taken moone lyght minisheth increaseth againe moneth called moone groweth wonderously chaungynge armye heauē also heygth fyrmamēt heauē geueth cleare gloryous shyne thys clearnes starres bewtyfull apparell heauen apparell lorde lighteneth heygth holy worde contynue theyr ordre one thē fayleth hys watche gene ix loke vpon raynebowe▪ prayse hym made bewtyfull shyne cōpaseth heauen clearnes glory hādes hiest haue bended thorowe hys commaundement maketh snowe fal thonder iudgement smyte hastly thorowe hys commaundement treasure opened cloudes fle foules hys power hath strengthened cloudes broken hayle stone mountaynes melt y• syght wynde bloweth accordynge wyll sounde thonder beateth y• earth doth storme north whyrle wynde also lyghteth downe fethered foule casteth oute spredeth snowe abrode greshoppers destroy falleth downe eye marueleth bewtye whytenesse therof herte afraye y• rayne poureth frost vpon earth lyke salt frosen sharpe y• prycke thystle colde northwynde bloweth harde chrystall commeth water lyghteth downe vpon gatherynges together water putteth water brest plate deuoureth mountaynes burneth wilderness loke grene putteth oute lyke fyre medicine cloude commeth hastely whē dewe commeth vpon heate shal refreshed agayne hys worde stylleth wynde councell setteth depe lord iesus planted sayle ouer see tell parels harmes therof heare oure eares maruell therat straunge wonderous worckes diuerse maner nyce beastes wha • fyshes thorowe hym thynges set good ordre perfourmed hys worde thynges endure speake much sufficiently attayne vnto hym selfe onely perfeccyon wordes shulde prayse lorde al power great hys worckes lorde feared yee greate psa x • vi • ▪ maruelous hys power prayse lorde magnify much ye maye yet doth farre exceade prayse psal • vi • ▪ magnifye hym youre power laboure earnestly yet ye wyse able suffycyētly prayse hym hath sene yt might tell v deute v • ihon • • cā magnifie hym greatly hyd yet greater thinges v haue sene fewe worckes lord hath made thynges geuen wysdome suche feare god capi xliiii ¶ prayse certen holy men▪ hen ••• ▪ noe abr • ha • isaac iacob let v commende noble famous men generacyon fore elder father many gloryous actes hath lorde done shewed hys greate power euer sen begynnynge noble famous men raygned theyr kyngdomes bare excellente rule theyr wysdome vnderstandynge folowed councell shewed prophecyes exodi 18 • ▪ led • ol • ke thorow councel wysdome scribe people wise sentēces founde theyre instruccyon soughte swetenes melody musycke broughte forth pleasaūt sōges scripture ryche also coulde cōforte pacifye dwelt noble honorable men ī theyr generacyōs well reported theyr tymes haue lefte name behynde thē theyr prayse shall alwaye spoken afterwarde whose remembraunce gone gen vii came naughte peryshed though neuer bene became though neuer bene borne yee theyr chyloren also neuertheles louyng men whose ryghteousnesse shall neuer forgotten continue posterite theyr chyldren holy good herytage theyr sede endured fast couenaunt sake shall theyr chyldren sede contynue euer theyre prayse shall neuer put downe theyr bodyes buryed peace name liueth euermore people speake theyre wysdome cōgregaciō cā talke prayse eccl 49 • gene v enoch walked right acceptably lorde therfore translated example amēdement generaciōs gene vi • vii viii noe stedfast righteous man y• time wrath became reconcylynge therfore left remnaunt vnto earth floude came euerlastīg couenaūt made flesh shulde gene ix • perishe nomore wt water abraham gen xvii • greate father many people glory none lyke vnto kepte lawe hyeste came possessyō inherytaunce lande see see ryuer vnto border worlde gen xxvi isaac dyd stablysh couenaunt abraham father sake yee gracious blessing health al mē couenaunt dyd stablysh isaac made reit vpon hym gaue hym presthode people made glorious bewtyfull araye clothed hym garmēt honoure put perfecte ioye vpon gyrded strength deckte hym syde clothes tunycle ouerbody cote also gyrdle roūde made hym mytre plate pure gold grauen ymage holynes famous noble worcke garnyshed pleasaūt loke vpon hī sene faire ornametes behoued alway vse might none put thē onely childrē childers child per petually dayly perfourmed offeriges two tymes leui 〈…〉 moses fylled hys handes anoynted hym holy oyle thys nowe confyrmed hym wyth euerlastinge couenaunt sede dayes heauen namely hys child shulde alway ministre hym perfourme offyce presthode wyshe people good name men lyuynge chose shulde offre incense lorde make odour swete sauoure remembraunce shulde reconcyle people lord wt againe 〈◊〉 xvi • 〈…〉 xxi a▪ mala ii • gaue auctorite also cōmaundemētes couenaūt shulde teach iacob statute testymonyes enfour israell hys lawe 〈◊〉 xvi 〈◊〉 therfore stode vp certayne agaynst hym enuye hym wyldernesse namely dathan abirams side furyous congregacion chore lorde sawe displeased hym hys wrothfull indignacion consumed greate wonder dyd vpon consumed fyre nu xvii b besydes thys made aaron yet honorable glorious gaue hym herytage parted fyrst frutes vnto 〈◊〉 xxv • leuit 24 • unto hym specially appoynted bred sustenaunce prestes dyd eat offrynges y• lorde gaue vnto sede ••• x • b xviii eze • 44 el herytage porcion lāde people lord hym selfe porcyon enherytaunce thyrde noble excellēt man num xv▪ c phinehes y• sonne eleazer pleased god israel zele feare lorde whē people turned backe put hym selfe forth ryght sone y• good wyll pacifye wrath lorde towarde israell therfore couenaūt peace made wt yt shulde principal among ryghteous people posterite shulde haue offyce prsthode euer lyke made couenaūt dauid trybe iuda amonge sonnes onely shulde kyng aaron also se de shulde heritage geue v wysdome hert iudge people righteousnes y• hys goodes shulde come forgetfulnes honoure might endure euer capi xlvi ¶ praise iosue caleb samuell manly stronge battayll iesus sonne naue insteade moses y• prophete geuen captayne people whiche accordinge vnto hys name greate sauyoure vnto elect god punish enemy • ose vp agaynst israel y• israel myght optaine theyr inheritaunce howe greate noble excellent lyft vp hand drewe swerde agaynst cytyes stode manly hym lorde hym selfe brought enemyes iosut xii • num 27 stode sūne styl commaundemente one daye longe two called vpon hyest moste myghtye enemy preassed vpon euery syde lorde herde hym wyth hayle stone smote heytheneshe people myghtely falling downe slewe aduersaryes heathen knewe hoost al defence yt lord hym selfe fought agaynst thē folowed vpō myghtie men thē deut 34 iosue • tyme moses also ca • ch sonne iephune dyd good worcke stode agaynst enemyes wt helde people synne stylled wycked murmuring iosac x c syxe hūdreth thousā denu xxvi g people fote two preserued brige thē ye heritage namely • ande floweth mylcke hony nu xiiii theiosu xiiii c lorde gaue strēgth also vnto caleb remained hym vnto age went vp hye place lāde sede cōquered herytage al chyldrē israel myght se howe good thynge obedient vnto lorde iudges ruler euery one name whose hert went whoryng departed lord forsoke lorde vnfaythfully whose remembraūce hath good reporte yee bone florish place name shal neuer chaūged honoure remayneth styl wt childrē holy mē 1 reg x xvi • samuel prophete beloued lorde god ordayned kyng anoynted prynces ouer people law lorde iudged congregacyon lorde respecte vnto iacob prophete founde diligent hys faythfulnes knowen faythfull wordes reg vii called vpon lord almyghtye enemyes preased vpō euery syde tyme offred y• suckyng lambes lord thōdred frō heauen made voyce herd greate noyse discomfyted prynces tire ruler philistine ii xii laste ende made protestacyon syghte lorde hys anoynted toke neyther substaunce good eny man muche sho man myght accuse hym thys tolde hys ende hande shewed kynge also hys ende deathe earthe lyfte vp hys voice prophecy vngodly people shulde peryshe ¶ prayse nathan dauid salomon capi xlvii afterward time king dauid rose vp prophet called nathā like y• fat taken away offeryng dauid chosen childrē israell toke pastyme lyon kyddes beares lyke lambes 2 reg xii • slewe gyaunte yet yonge toke away rebuke frō people tyme toke stone hys hande smote downe proude goliath wt • inge called vpon hyest lorde whiche gaue strength hys ryghte hande ouerthrewe myghtye gyaunte battyll might set vp horne hys people agayne • xvii f thus brought hym worshpype aboue prynces made hym haue good reporte prayse lorde shulde crowne glory 3 reg 18 b destroyed enemy euery syde roted philystynes hys aduersaryes brake theyr horne sunder lyke broken yet thys daye hys worckes praysed hyest holyest asc • ybed honour vnto hym whole hert dyd prayse y• lorde loued god made2 pa 26 hym 2 reg v b set syngers also aulter theyr tune made swete songes ordeyned kepe holy day worshypfully solempne feastes thorowe whose yeare shulde honorably holden praysynge name lorde syngynge tymes mornynge sanctuary 2 xii lorde toke awaye synnes exalted horne euer gaue hym couenaūt kingdome trone worshipe israell 3 reg iii • hi rose vp wyse sōne called salomon hys sake droue enemyes awaye farre salomō raigned wt peace tyme god gaue rest frō enemyes euery syde yt myghe builde house name prepare sāctuary euer lyke well instructe hys youthe fylled wysdome vnderstandinge water floude couered filled whole lande similitude wyse prudent sentence hys name wente abrode iles peace beloued landes marueled sōges prouerbes similitude peace name lorde god called god israel iii reg gathered golde tynne much syluer leade 〈…〉 moued inordynate loue towarde wemen ouercome affeccyon stayned honoure worshyppe yee hys posteryte defyled also bryngynge wrathe lorde vpon hys chyldren sorowe ioye iii xi • y• kyngdome deuyded ephraim became vnfaythfull vncōstāt kyngdome ii 〈◊〉 • neuertheles god forsoke mercy neyther vtterly destroyed worckes y• shulde leaue posterite y• sede came vpō loued brought vtterly naught gaue yet remnaūte vnto iacob rote vnto dauid hym thus rested salomon father hys sede left behynde hym foolyshnes people one vnder standynge iii 〈◊〉 • euen roboam whiche turned awaye people thorowe councel ieroboam sonne nabat iii 〈◊〉 ▪ • caused israell sinne shewed ephraim y• way vngodlynes much theyr synnes misdedes vpper hand sore last dryuen land yee sought brought vp wyckednes tyll vengeaunce came vppon ¶ prayse eliah elizeas hezekiah esaye capi xlviii stode vp 3 xv • • eliah prophet fyre hys worde brente lyke creshet brought honger vpon hys zele made fewe nombre might away commaundementes lorde thorowe worde lord shut heauen iii 〈◊〉 ▪ • 4 reg • • thre time brought fyre downe thus became eliah honorable wonderous dedes may make boast lyke 3 x •• ▪ • one deed raysed vp deathe ithe worde hyest brought hym oute graue agayne caste downe kinges destroyed honorable theyr seate upon mount syna herde punyshment vpon horeb iudgement vengeaunce prophecyed recōpensynge vnto kynges •• 19 • ordeyned prophetes hym • reg ii c taken vp storme fyre charet horse lorde ordaned reprouynges tyme pacyfye wrath lorde luke • • turne hertes father vnto chyldren set vp trybes iacob agayne blessed saw garnyshed loue lyue lyfe death shall haue name •• reg ii 〈…〉 elia couered y• storme helyseus fylled sprete whyle lyued afrayed prynce man myght ouercome coulde worde disceaue • 13 • death body prophecied • reg b • vii viii dyd wonder lyfe death workes maruelous people amended nether departed frō theyr synnes 4 1 • b tyll caried away presoners lāde scatred abrode countrees ramayned lytle people prynce vnto house dauid howe dyd ryght heaped vp vngodlynes • pa 32 hezekias made cytie stronge conueyed water dygged thorowe stony rocke yron made vp well water syde • 〈…〉 36 • tyme came sennaheryb vp sent rabsakes lyft vp hande agaynste syon defied thē greate pryde trymbled theyr nettes hādes sorowed lyke woman trauaylinge chylde called vpon lorde mercyful lyfte vp theyr handes hym immediatly lorde harde heauen thought nomore vpon theyr sinnes gaue ouer theyr enemyes delyuered hande esay holy prophet • 19 • smote hoost y• assyrian angell destroyed thē hezekias done thynge y• pleased lorde remayned stedfastly waye dauid father esay greate faythful prophet syght god cōmaunded hym • reg xx b • e • 38 b tyme sunne wente backwarde lengthened kinges lyfe ryghte sprete prophecyed • e shulde come passe last suche sorowfull syon gaue cōsolacion wher wt myght cōfort selues euermore shewed thynges y• • come secrete euer came passe ¶ iosiah hezethiah dauid ieremy ezechiel zo • babel iesua nehemiah enoch ioseph capi xlix remēbraunce 4 22 23 2 pat 34 iosias lyke whā apothecary maketh many precious swete smellyng thynges together remembraunce shalbe swete hony mouthes playenge musyck bancket wyne appoynted turne people agayne take awaye abhomynacions vngodly dyrected herte vnto lorde tyme vngodly set vp worshyp god agayne kynges except dauid hezechiah iosiah cōmytted wyckednes euen kynges iuda also forsoke lawe god gaue theyr horne vnto theyr honoure worshyppe also straunge people therfore electe cyt • e y• sanctuary brent fyre 4 25 streates therof laye desolate wast hande ieremy intreated hym euell whiche neuertheles prohpet ordeyned frō hys mother wombe yt myght rote breake iere destroye myght builde vp plant agayne eze • ezechiel sawe glorye lorde vysion shewed vpon y• charet y• cherubins thought vpō enemy y• rayne good vnto suche ordred theyr wayes ryght bone twelue prophetes floryshed theyr place gaue comforte consolatyon vnto iacob delyuered thē faythfully agg ii 1 esor iii 3 esor v howe shall prayse zorobabel whiche rynge rght hande agge • ii • iesus also sōne iosedec men theyr tymes buylded house set vp y• ▪ sanctuary y• lorde agayne prepared euerlasting worshyp 2 esor nehemias waye cō mended 2 esor 7 whiche set vp v walles broken downe made porte barres agayne buylded house newe gene v • eccle 44 b hebre 12 • vpon earth man created like enoch takē vp earth gene 4 • f 4 • • 45 c ioseph lorde hys brother vp holder hys people bone couered kepte seth sem great honoure amonge people adam aboue beastes whan created ¶ symon sonne onias capi l symon 1 • 3 4 sōne onias hye prest lyfe set vp y• house agayne dayes made fast temple heygth temple also founden double buyldinge hye walles tēple dayes welles water flowed exceadynge full see toke care people delyuered frō destruccyon kepte hys cytie made stronge shulde beseged dwelt honoure worshyppe amonge people enlarged intraūce house courte gaue lyght mornynge starre myndest cloudes moone whan full shyned sunne tēple god bryght rayne bowe fayre cloudes florysheth floures rose sprynge yeare lylyes ryuers water lyke braunches vpon mount libanus tyme sommer fyre incense kindled lyke whole ornamēt pure golde set al maner precious stone olyue tree frutefull cipres tree groweth vp hye put garment honoure clothed bewtye went holy aulter garnysh coue rynge sanctuarye toke porcyons prestes hande hym selfe stode herth aulter brother rounde ordre y• braunches cedre tree vpon moūt libanus • stode rounde braunches olyue tree stode al sone aaron glorye oblatiōs lorde theyr handes congregacion israel myght suffycyently perfourme hys setuyce vpon y• aulter garnysh offrynge y• hyest god stretched hande toke drynck offerynge poured wyne poured vpon botome aulter good smel vnto hyest prynce beganne sonnes aaron syng blowe trōpettes make great noyce remembraunce prayse vnto lorde people afrayed fell downe earth vpō theyr face worshyppe lorde theyr god geue thankes almyghty god sunge godly also theyr voyces pleasaunce noyse great house lorde people theyr prayer besought lorde hyest wolde mercyfull tyll honour lorde perfourmed thus ended theyr mynistracyon seruice went downe stretched hys hādes ouer whole multitude people israel shulde geue prayse thankes theyr lyppes vnto lorde reioyse name beganne yet also praye myght openly shewe thankesgeuynge y• hyest namely thus geue prayse thankes pe al vnto lorde god hath euer done noble great thinges hath increased oure dayes mother wombe dealt v accordynge mercy wyll geue v ioyfulnes herte peace tyme israel faythfully kepeth mercy v euermore alwaye delyuereth v due season two maner people abhorre fro hert thyrde hate people syt vpon moūtayne samaria phylystynes foolysh people dwell sichimis iesus sonne sirach eleazarus ierusalem haue tokened vp informacyons documentes wysdome vnderstandynge thys boke poured wysdome herte blessed exercyseth hym selfe therin taketh herte shal wyse euer yf thynges shal strōge al lyght lorde leadeth hym ¶ prayer iesus • ou • e sirach capi li wyll thanke lorde kynge prayse god sauyoure wyll yelde prayse vnto thy name thou arte defender helper haste preserued bodye destruccyon snare traytorous tonges lyppes ocupyed lye thou hast bene helper suche stode vp agaynst hast delyuered multytude thy mercy thy holy name sake thou bast delyuered roarynge prepared thēselues deuoure handes sought lyfe multitude thē troubled went set fyre vpō euery syde brent myddest fyre frō depe hell vnclene tonge lyenge wordes wycked kynge vnryghteous tonge soule shall prayse y• lord vnto death lyfe drewe nye vnto hell downwarde cōpassed round aboute euery syde man helpe loked aboute yf man wolde socoure none thought vpon thy mercy lorde vpon thy actes thou haste done euer olde namely thou delyuerest suche put theyr trust ryddest thē handes heathen thus lyfte vp prayer earth prayed delyueraunce frō death called vpon lorde father lorde wolde leaue without helpe daye trouble tyme proude wyl prayse thy name cōtynually yeldynge honour thankes vnto prayer herde thou sauedest destruccion deliueredest vnryghteous tyme therfore wyll knowledge prayse magnyfye thy name lorde yet yonge euer went astraye desyred wysdome openly prayer came therfore tēple sought vnto y• laste floryshed vnto grape soone type hert reioysed went tote ryght waye yee youth vp sought bowed downe myne eare receaued founde much soome prospered greatly therfore wyl ascrybe glory vnto hym geueth wysdome aduysed wyll gelous cleue vnto thynge good shall confounded soule hache wrestled haue bene dilygent occupyed lyfte vp myne handes hye soule lyghtened thorowe wisdome knowledged folyshnes ordred soule one hert frō begynnynge founde • clennesse therfore shall forsaken herte longed gat good treasure thorowe lorde hath geuen newe tonge wherwith wyll prayse hym esay • v come vnto ye vnlerned dwell house wysdome withdrawe youre selues talke comen thynges youre soules thyrsty opened mouth spake come bye wysdome without money bowe downe necke vnder yocke youre soule shal receaue wysdome harde hande content founde beholde eye eccles vi c howe y• haue lytle laboure yet haue foūde much reast receaue wysdome ye shal haue plenteousnes syluer golde possession let youre mynde reioyse hys mercy ashamed hys prayse worke hys worke tymes shall geue rewarde due tyme ¶ ende boke iesus sonne strach called latyne ecclesiasticus ❧ booke prophete baruch capi ¶ baruch wrote boke durynge captiuyte babylō whiche redde iecontah people iewes sent boke money vnto ierusalē theyr brother intent shulde praye wordes booke whiche wrytten baruch sōne nerias sonne maasias sonne sedechias ye sōne sedeias sonne helchias babylon fyfte yeare seuenth day moneth tyme y• caldees toke ierusalem brent vp fyre baruch dyd rede y• wordes thys booke iechoniah sonne ioac •• kynge iuda myght heare presence people y• come heare booke yee noble kynges sonnes lordes coūcell elder whole people trō lowest vnto hyest dwelt babylō y• water sody whiche whan herde wepte fasted prayed lorde made colleccyon also money accordynge euery man power sent ierusalem vnto ioachim sonne helchia sonne salon prest prestes people whiche ierusalem tyme gotten ornamentes temple lorde taken awaye temple myght brynge agayne lande iuda tenth daye moneth siban namely syluer vessel sedechiah sonne iosiah kynge iuda made nabuchodonosor kynge babylon taken iechomah al prīces lordes people led captyne ierusalem vnto babylon sayd behold haue sent money den xiiii c iere 29 b bye burnt offerynges insence withall make vnleuened bred offre synne vpon aulter lorde god 1 tim 2 b praye prosperyte naburchodonosor kynge babylō welfare balthasar sonne theyr dayes may vpon earth dayes heauen god also maye geue v strength lyghten eye may lyue vnder defence nabuchodo nosor kynge babylon vnder proteccyon balthasar sonne y• maye longe seruyce fynde fauoure theyr syght praye v also vnto lord god haue synned agaynst lorde god vnto thys daye wrath turned yet awaye frō v se y• ye rede boke whiche haue sent vnto rehearced tēple y• lorde vpon hye dayes tyme conuenient thus shal ye saye baru • ii b da •• ix • lorde god ryghteous worthye confusyon shame lyke come passe daye vnto iuda euery one dwelleth ierusalem kynges prince prestes prophetes oure father haue synned lorde god haue put trust geuen hym credence haue obeyed haue herkened vnto y• voyce y• lorde god walke commaundementes gaue v sen daye brought oure forfathers lande egypt vnto present daye haue bene euer amys beleuyng vnfaythful people vnto lorde god destroyng selues vtterly shrynkynge backe shulde heare hys voyce leui 26 deu 28 wherfore come vpō v great plage dyuers curse lyke lorde deuysed moses seruaunt exodi 12 23 14 whiche brought forefather lande egypte geue v lande floweth wt mylck hony lyke se day neuerthelesse haue herkened vnto voyce lorde god accordyng wordes prophetes sente vnto v ruler euery mā folowed owne mynde wycked ymaginacyon offre vnto straunge goddes euell syght lorde oure god ¶ iewes confesse suffre iustly theyr synnes true cōfessyon chrysten iewes desyre haue wrath god turned frō lorde wyll obeye vnto pr • u ••• althoughe beeuel promyseth wyll call agayue people captiuitie geue newe euerlastynge testament capi ii 〈…〉 whiche cause lorde oure god hathe perfourmed hys deuyce wherof certyfyed v oure heades y• ruled ierusalem yee oure kynges oure prynces wyth israel iuda plage hath lorde brought vpon v neuer came passe vnder heauen lyke fulfylled ierusalem deui • 4 〈…〉 acordynge wrytten lawe moses man shulde eate flesh hys owne sonne flesh hys one daughter moreouer hathe delyuered handes kynges rounde v confounded desolate scatred abrode landes nacions thus brought beneth aboue haue sinned lorde god haue bene obediēt vnto voyce 〈…〉 therfore y• lorde god ryghteous father reasō brought oyē shame se daye plage yt come vpon v ready lorde deuysed v yet wolde praye vnto lorde god y• myght euery mā turne frō vngodly wayes lorde hathe caused plage come vpon v ryghteous hys workes hathe cōmaunded v whiche also haue done harkened vnto voyce walke cōmaundemē te lorde geuen vnto v da •• 〈◊〉 lorde god israel thou exo 7 〈◊〉 10 11 1 • xiiii haste brought thy people lande egypte myghtye hande token wondres thy greate power stretched arme hast gotten thy selfe name come passe daye lorde god haue synned haue done wyckedly haue behaued selues vngodly al thy ryghteousnesses turne thy wrath v besech fewe lefte amonge heathen yu hast scatered v 2 pat • ▪ heare prayer lorde peticyons brynge v captiyte thyne owne sake get v fauoure syght whiche haue led v awaye landes may knowe y• thou art lorde god israell hys generacyon calleth vpon thy name lorde loke downe thy holy house vpon v enclyne thyne eare heare v open thine eye lord se v deu • 261 esay 41 • psal 113 1 deed y• gone downe theyr graues whose soules theyr bodyes ascribe vnto y• lorde nether praise ryghteous makyng soule vexed multitude synnes goeth heuely weakely whose eye begynne fayle yee suche soule ascrybeth prayse ryghtuousnesse vnto lorde lorde poure oure prayer requyre mercy thy syght lord oure god godlynesse forefather thou hast sente thy wrath indignacyon vpon v according thou dydest threaten v thy seruaūtes prophetes sayinge •• 27 thus sayeth lorde bowe downe shulders neckes serue y• kyng babylon shall ye remayne styll lande gaue vnto father yf ye wyll thys heare voyce lorde youre god serue kynge babylon shall destroye y• city iuda within ierusalem without wyll also take voyce myrth voyce ioye voyce bridegrome voyce bryde shall mā dwell lande wolde herken vnto thy voyce kyng babylon seruice therfore hast thou perfourmed wordes thou spakest thy seruauntes prophetes namely bone kiges bone oure father shulde translated theyr place lo nowe layde y• heat sonne colde nyght deade greate mysery hunger wyth sweard pestilence clene cast forth temple wherin thy name called vpon thou hast layde waste sethys day wyckednes y• house israell house iuda lorde oure god thou hast intreated v thy goodnes accordynge great louynge mercy thyne lyke thou spakest thy seruaunte moyses day whan thou dydest commaūde hym wryte thy lawe y• chyldren israel saying deute 4 xxviii yf ye wyll herken vnto voyce shal thys greate multytude turned small people wyll scatre abrode notwithstandynge sure folke wyl heare hard necked people lande theyr captiuite shal remembre selues learne knowe lorde theyr god whan geue herte vnderstande eares heare shall prayse lande theyr captiuite thyncke vpō name shall turne theyr harde backes vngodlynes shall remēbre thynges happened vnto theyr forefather whiche synned agaynst wyl brynge agayne laude promised othe vnto father abraham isaac iacob shall lordes yee wyll increase minish thē hebre 8 • zacha 8 b apoc xxi b wyl make another couenaunt suche one shall endure euer namely wyl theyr god shalbe people wyl nomore driue people chyldren israell lande haue geuen ¶ people contynueth theyr prayer beg • nne delyueraunce prayseth wysdome vnto people shewinge greate aduersities came vnto dyspysynge therof onely god fynder wysdome incarnocyon chryste capi iii nowe lorde almyghtye thou god israell oure soule trouble oure sprete vexed cryeth vnto heare vs▪ lorde haue pytie vpon v thou arte mercyfull god gracyous vnto v haue synned thou endurest euer shulde vtterly perysshe lorde almyghtye thou god israel heare prayer ephe ii • deed israelite theyr chyldren whiche haue synned herkened vnto voice lord god cause plage hange vpon v lorde remembre wyckednes forefather thynke vpon thy power name nowe tyme thou arte lorde god lord wyl prayse • ui iii c iere • c 3 • • c thou hast put thy fearenum 14 psal 77 hertes intent shuld call vpon thy name prayse oure captyuyte myght turne frome wyckednesse forefather synned beholde yet daye captyuyte thou hast scatred v abhominacion curse synne psal 79 lyke hathe happened vnto oure father also bycause theyr wyckednesse departynge israel commaundementes lyfe pōdre well thyne eares thou mayest learne wysdome happeneth israell thou art thyne enemyes land thou art waxen olde straūge countre defyled deed art thou become lyke y• go downe theyr graues euē thou hast iere ii b forsakē well wysdome yf thou haddest walekedproue iii y• waye god truely y• shuldest haue remayned styll safe thyne owne lande learne discrecion vertue vnderstādyng thou mayest knowe also frome whence commeth psal xix b xxix • longe lyfe necessary lyuing lyghte eye quyetnes euer founde place came euer hyr treasure prynces heathen become ruled beastes vpō earth theyr pastyme y• foules ayre hoorded vp syluer gold wherin men trust much made ende theyr gatheryng become coyned syluer carefull coulde bryng theyr workes passe coted gone downe hell men come vp theyr steades yonge men haue sene lyght dwelte vpon earth way reformacyon haue knowen vnderstande pathes therof nether haue theyr chyldren receaued yet ryght farre frō hath bene herde lande canaan nether hath 〈◊〉 bene sene theman agarenes sought wysdome whiche earthly lyke marchaū te lande theman connynge also laboure wysdome vnderstandynge waye true wysdome knowe neyther thincke vpon pathes therof israell howe great house god large place possession deute 4 • ier xx • ▪ • psa xx •• • great hathe none ende yee vnmeasurable become famouse gyauntes great body worthy men warre lord chosen nether haue founde waye reformacyon therefore destroted much wysdome perysshed theyr foolyshnesse hathe gone vp heauen take wysdome brought downe frō cloudes hath gone ouer see fynde hath chosen aboue golde brought hyther man knoweth wayes wysdome neyther seke pathes y• woteth thynges knoweth hathe foūde wt hys fore knowledge gene • prepared earth y• begynnynge fylled maner foules beastes iosue • esay 38 • e ••• xi •• sendeth y• lyght goeth calleth agayne obeyeth hym feare starres kepe theyr watche geue theyr lyght yee gladly calleth say wyth chearefulnesse shewe lyghte vnto hym made psal 〈◊〉 deut • •• oure god shall none compared vnto hym hath founde wysdome hath geuen vnto iacob seruaunt israel beloued iohan • 1 io •• • warde dyd shewe hym selfe vpon earthe dwelt amonge men ¶ rewarde kepe lowe punyshement despyse comfortynge people beynge captyn •• complaynte ierusalem vnder fygure thereof churche consolacyon comtortynge capi iiii booke commaundementes god lawe endureth euer kepe shall come lyfe forsake shal come death turne iacob take hold walcke waye thorow bryghtnesse shyne gene thyne honoure another thy worshyppe straunge people israell psa •••• howe happye seyng god hath shewed v suche thinges pleasaunt vnto hym good chere thou people god thou auncient israel • 〈◊〉 〈◊〉 xx • nowe ye solde amonge y• heath • howbeit vtter destruccyon ye prouoked god lord wrath displeasure therfore ye delyuered vnto enemyes ye displeased y• euerlastynge god made offeringe vnto deuels god ye haue forgotten hym brought vp nursse haue ye greued ierusalem whan sawe y• wrath god commynge vpon sayde herken ye dwell aboute syon god hathe brought great heuynes se captiuite people sonnes daughter euerlastyng god wyll bryng vpon ioy norish thē nowe must leaue wepynge sorowe let man reioyce ouer wyddowe forsaken synnes chyldrē desolate euery man departed lawe god wold knowe hys ryghtuousnes walcke way cōmaundementes pathes trueth godlynes lust go ye dweller aboute syon come let v call remembraunce captyuyte y• euerlasting god hath brought vpō sonnes daughter deute 〈◊〉 • iere • • hath brought people vpon frō farre vncurteous people straunge language whiche nether regarde olde pytie yonge haue caryed awaye deare beloued wyddowes leauynge alone desolate chyldlesse ala helpe hath brought plage vpō delyuer also handes enemyes go waye chyldren go youre waye desolate forsaken deute 4 • 〈◊〉 • esa • xxx haue put clothynge peace put vpon sack cloth prayer tyme wyll call vpon hyest good cheare chyldren crye vnto lorde shall delyuer power y• prynces youre enemyes verely haue euer good hope prosperous health yee gladnes come vpon holy one mercy ye shall haue euerlastynge sauyour mournynge wepynge dyd let go fro loye perpetuall gladnesse shall lorde brynge agayne vnto lyke neyghboures syon sawe captiuite god euen shal also se shortly health god shall come great honour euerlastyng worshyppe chyldrē • 〈◊〉 〈◊〉 • suffre paciētly wrathe shall come vpon enemye hath persecuted shortely thou shalte se destruccyon shalte treade vppon hys necke derlynges haue gone rough harde wayes led awaye flocke scatred abroade enemy good comforte chyldren crye vnto lorde led awaye hath yet remēbraūce lyke ye haue bene mynded swarue god esay iv • shall ye nowe endeuour selues x tymes turne agayne seke y• hath brought plage vpō shal bryng euerlasting • oy agayne wt helth take good herte vnto ierusalē whyche gaue ye name exhorteth ••• • b c wycked doer nowe put trouble shal perysh suche haue reioy sed thy fall shalbe punyshed cytyes thy chyldren serue haue caryed awaye thy sonnes shalbe correcte lyke nowe glad thy decaye reioyse thy fall shall mourne owne destrucciō ioye multytude shalbe taken away cheare shalbe turned sorowe fyre shall fall vpon euerlastynge god long endure shalbe inhabyted deuels great season ¶ ierusalem moued vnto gladnes returne • people vnder fygure therof churche capi v ierusalem loke aboute towarde easte beholde loye cō meth vnto god lo thy sonnes thou hast forsaken sea tred abrode come gathered together frome east west reioysynge worde holy one vnto honour god put thy mournyng clothes ierusalem thy sorow decke worshyppe honour cammeth vnto frō god wt euerlastyng glory god shal put garmente ryghtuousnes vpon set crowne euerlasting worshyp vpon thine head vpon y• wyl god declare brightnesse y• vnder heauen yee euerlastyng name shalbe geuen god wt peace ryghtuousnesse honour goddes feare aryse ierusalem stande vp hye loke towarde cast beholde thy chyldren gathered easte vnto west reioyce holy worde hauynge god remembraunce departed fote led away enemyes nowe shall lorde brynge caryed honoure chyldren kyngdome god purposed brynge downe stoute mountaynes yee hye rockes fyll valley make euen wyth grounde israel may dilygent lyue vnto honoure god woddes pleasaunt tree shall ouershadowe israel commaundement god hyther shall god brynge israel ioyfull myrth lyght magestye mercy ryghtuousnesse commeth selfe ¶ copye epystle ieremy sent vnto iewes whiche led awaye presoners kynge babylon wherin certifieth thynge commaunded god capi vi synnes ye haue done agaynst god ye shall iere 〈◊〉 • • led away captyue vnto babylon euen nabuchodonosor kynge babylon whan ye become babylon ye shall remayne many yeares alonge season namely seuen generacions wyl bringe awaye peaceably thence nowe shall ye se babylon goddes golde siluer wod stone borne vpon men shulders cast fearfulnesse heathen loke ye ye afrayed let feare ouer come therfore whan ye se multitude people worshyppyng behynde say ye hertes lorde thou oughtest onely worshypped myne gell also shalbe selfe wyl care yoursoules tibre goddes y• carpenter hath polyshed yee gylted layed ouer syluer yet vaine thinges speake lyke wenche loueth peramours trymly deckte euen made hanged golde crownes golde verely haue goddes vpon theyr heades prestes thēselues take y• golde syluer thē put theyr owne v yee geue vnto harlottes • trymme theyr whore withal agayne take whore decke theyr goddes therwith deute v c yet • iere x goddes deliuer themselues frō ruste mothes haue couered clothynge purple wype theyr face dust temple wherof much among one hath sceptre hys hande thoughe iudge countre yet fley suche offende hym another hath swearde axe hande al neither able defende hym selfe battayle frome murtherers thys ye maye vnderstande goddes therfore se ye neither worshyppe feare lyke vessell man vseth nothynge worth broken euen theyr goddes set vp temple theyr eye full duste thorowe fete come lyke dores shut rounde aboute vpon hym hathe offended kynge deed body kepte besyde graue euen prestes kepe dores barres locke leest theyr goddes spoyled robber set vp candels yee verely many wherof cānot se one euen blockes stande temple sayde serpentes wormes whiche come earthe gnawe theyr hertes eatyng theyr clothes also yet fele theyr face blacke thorow smoke temple oules swalowes byrdes vpon yee cattes runne ouer theyr heades ye maye sure goddes therfore feare golde haue make bewtyfull excepte body dyght theyr rust wyll geue shyne cast īto fourme felt bought money haue breth lyfe within thē sepi 14▪ must borne vpon men shoulder haue fere wherby declare vnto men ntohynge worth psal 114▪ confounded worshyppe yf fall groūde rise vp agayne themselues yee though one helpe vp set ryght yet able stande lone must haue proppes set vnder lyke deed men thynge offred vnto prestes sel abuse yee prestes wyues take therof vnto sycke poore geue nothyng wemen childe menstruous lay handes theyr offringes ye may sure yt goddes therfore ye afrayde thē whence cōmeth called goddes wemen syt goddes syluer golde wodde prestes syt theyr temple hauyng open clothes whose heades beerdes shauen haue nothyng vpon theyr heades toryng crieng vpon goddes men feast one deed prestes also take awaye garmentes ymages decke wyues chyldren whether good euil man vnto thē able recompence neyther set vp kynge put hym downe lyke maner may neither geue ryches rewarde euyl eccle v • though man make vowe vnto thē kepe wyll requyre saue man death neyther delyuer weake myghtye restore blinde man sight helpe man hys nede shewe mercy y• wyddowe good fatherlesse theyr goddes woode stone golde syluer euen stones▪ hewen mountayne worshyppe shalbe confounded howe shulde taken goddes yee howe darre men call goddes thoughe • aldees worshypped hearynge domme could speake yet themselues offre vnto bel wolde fayne haue speake saye coulde fele maye moue whan men come vnderstandyng shal forsake thē goddes haue felynge great sorte wemen gyrde coardes syt stretes burne olyue beryes nowe yf one conueyed awaye lye suche come casteth neghbours y• teth▪ worthely reputed coorde broken euer done vayne loste howe maye thought sayde goddes carpenter golde smythes make nether thyng euen worcke men wyll make yee gold smythes selues make longe contynuaunce howe shulde thynges made goddes uayne therfore thinges yee shame leaue behynde theyr prosperyte soone commeth warre plage vpon prestes ymagyn may hyde themselues howe men thyncke goddes whiche neither may defende thēselues warre delyuer mysfortune seynge wood stone syluer golde people kynges shall knowe herafter vayne thynges yee shalbe openly declared goddes euen workes mēs handes god hath nothinge thē manifest goddes worckes men handes worke god cā set kyng lande geue rayne vnto men gyue sentence matter nether defende land wrong able muche crowe flyeth betwixte heauen earth whan happeneth fyre house goddes wodde syluer golde prestes wyl escape saue thē selues goddes burne balkes therin cannot withstande kynge batayle howe maye thought graunted goddes moreouer goddes wodde stone golde syluer may neyther defende thēselues theues robber yee wycked stronger stripe appparel clothed withall take theyr golde siluer get thē away yet helpe themselues therfore much better mā kyng shewe power el profitable vessell house wherin oweth might haue pleasure yee dore house kepe thynges safe therin vaine god sunne moone al startes▪ seynge gyue theyr shyne lyght obediēt men good whan lyghtnynge glystreth cleare wynde bloweth euery countre whā god cō maundeth cloudes go rounde aboute whole worlde byddē whan fyre sent downe aboue cōmaunded burneth vp hylles woddes▪ goddes lyke one thynges nether bewty nether strength wherfore men shulde thynke▪ saye goddes seyng nether gyue sentence iudgment mē good muche nowe ye sure goddes feare nether speake euyl good kynges shewe token heauē heythen nether shyne sunne geue lyght moone yee vnreasonable beastes better get vnder rofe themselues good ye certyfyed maner meanes goddes therfore feare lyke searcrowe garden herbes kepeth nothynge euen theyr goddes wod syluer gold lyke whyte thorne orcharde euery byrde sytteth vpon yee lyke deed body cast darcke euen goddes wood syluer golde purple scarlet haue vpon soone faydeth awaye ye maye vnderstande goddes yee selues shal consumed last whiche shalbe greate confusion land blessed godlye man hath image worshyppeth none shalbe farre reprofe ¶ ende boke prophete baruch whiche canon hebrue songe thre chyldren whiche put hote brenning ouen cōmen trāslacion readeth song iij chap daniel walked myddest flāme praysynge god magnyfyenge lorde asarias stode vp prayed maner euen myddest fyre opened mouth sayd blessed thou lorde god oure father ryght worthy praysed honoured name thyne euermore thou arte ryghtuous thynges thou hast done v yee faythfull thy worckes thy wayes ryght thy iudgementes true thynges thou haste brought vpon v vpon holy citie father euen ierusalem thou haste executed true iudgmēt yee accordynge ryght equyte hast thou brought chynges vpon v synnes haue offended done wyckedly departyng daniel ix • thynges haue trespaced obeied thy cōmaundementes kepte neyther done y• hast byddē v y• myght ꝓspere • •• ii b wherfore thou hast brought vpon v euery thynge thou hast done v thou hast done true iudgement deliuerynge v hādes enemyes amonge vngodly wycked abhomynacions vnryghtuous kyng yee y• moste frowarde vpō earth nowe maye open oure mouthes become shame reprofe vnto thy seruauntes thē worshyppe yet thy name sake beseche geue v vp euer breke thy couenaunt take awaye thy mercy frō v thy beloued abrahās sake thy seruaūt isaac sake thy holy israel sake whō yu hast spoken promised gene xv • 22 • xxvi b deut • x y• thou woldest multyplye theyr sede starres heauē sande lyeth vpon see shore lorde become lesse people kepte vnder day worlde sinnes y• haue nether prynce duke prophete burnt offeryng sacrilyce oblacyon incence sanctuary neuerthelesse contryte herte humble sprete let v receyued y• maye optayne thy mercy lyke ī burnt offeryng rammes bullockes lyke thousandes fat lambes let oure offerynge thy syght thys daye maye please y• • 〈…〉 rom • 〈◊〉 esaye • rom • • cōfusyon vnto thē y• put trust nowe folowe wyth al herte feare seke thy face put v shame deale v thy louyng kyndnesse accordynge multitude thy mercy delyuer v thy myracles lorde get thy name honoure thy seruauntes euell maye confounded let shamed thorowe thy almyghtye power let theyr strēgth broken may know howe y• thou onely art lorde god honoure worthy thorowe y• worlde kynges seruauntes put ceassed make ouen hote wyth wylde fyre drye strawe pytche fagot • e slame went ouen vpon xlix cubites yee toke away brent vp caldees gat holde vpon besyde ouen angell lorde came downe ouen asarias hys felowes smote flamme fyre ouen made middest ouē bene colde wynde blowynge y• fyre nether touched greued dyd hurte thre one mouth praysed honoured blessed god fornace sayinge • •• • • blessed thou lord god oure father thou art prayse honoure worthy yee magnyfied euermore psal ••• blessed y• holy name thy glory worthy praysed magnyfyed worldes blessed thou holy temple thy glorye aboue thynges thou art praysed ye worthy magnified euer blessed yu trone thy kyngdome aboue y• art worthy well spoken magnified euer blessed thou lokest thorowe 〈◊〉 syttest vpon cherubyns thou art worthy praysed aboue magnyfyed euer blessed thou firmament heauen thou art prayse honour worthy euer al ye workes y• lord speake good lord prayse hym set vp euer psal 〈◊〉 • 〈◊〉 • ye angel lord speake good lorde prayse set hym vp euer ye heauens speake good
