set hym vp euer iere xx • esay 43 hath delyuered v frō y• hel kept v hande death ryd v myddest burnynge flamme saued v euen myddest fyre psa • xvi • • vi geue thākes therfore vnto lord kynde harted mercy endureth euer deuoute men speake ye good lorde euen god goddes prayse hym geue hym thanckes mercy endureth worlde without ende story susā na xiij chapter daniel latin dwelte man babylon called ioachim y• toke wyfe whose name susanna daughter helchia fair woman suche one feared god father mother also godly people taught theyr daughter accordīg lawe moyses nowe ioachim husbāde great rich man fayre orcharde ioyninge vnto house h • resorted iewes comēly mā reputacion among thē yere made two iudges suche lorde speaketh al wyckednesse babylon cōmeth elder iudges whiche seme rule people came ofte ioachims house thyng law came thyther vnto nowe people came agayne noone susanna went husbādes orcharde walcke elder seinge wente daylye walcked burned luste yee almost theyr wyttes caste downe theyr eye shulde se heauen remembre god ryghtuous iudge wounded loue nether durst one shew another grefe shame duest tel ordinate lust wold fayne haue yet layed wayte earnestly daye day myght least haue syght one sayde let v go home forit diner tyme wēt way frō returned agayne came together enquyryng y• matter betwyxte selues yee one tolde y• hys wycked lust appoynted tyme myght take susanna alone happned also y• spyed conuenient tyme went forth walke maner body wyth two maydens thought exodi ii 2 reg xi wasshe selfe gardē hote season one person excepte two elder y• hyd selues beholde sayde maydens go fet oyle sope shut orcharde dore may wash dyd bad shut orchard dore went selues backe dore fet thyng commaūded susanna knewe elder laye hyd within nowe maydens gone forth two elder gat vp ranne vpō saying orcharde dores shut man se v haue lust vnto therfore cōsente vnto v lye wyth v thou wylt shal brynge testymoniall agaynst yonge felo wyth thou hast sente away thy maydēs cause susanna syghed sayde ala trouble euery syde though folow mynde wyll death yf cōsent vnto escape hādes wel better fall hāde dede doynge synne ye syght lorde wyth cryed wyth loude voyce elder also cried agaynst rāne one orchard dore smote open nowe seruauntes house herde erye orchard russhed backe dore se matter elder tolde seruauntes greatly ashamed whyethere neuer reporte made susanna morowe came people ioachim husbande two elder came also full myscheuous ymaginacyon agaynst susanna brynge vnto death spake thus people sende susanna daughter helchias ioachims wyfe imediately sente came wyth father mother chyldrē kynred susanna tender person maruelous fayre face therfore wycked men commaunded take clothes face couered leest might satisfyed buety frendes yee knewe beganne wepe two elder stode vp myddest people leu ••• •• layed theyr handes vpon heade susanna wepte loked vp towarde heauen herte sure toust lord elder sayde walkynge orchard alone thys woman came two maydēs sente away sparred orcharde dores wyth yonge felow whiche hyd came vnto laye v stode corner orcharde sawe wyckednes ranne perceaued medled together could holde stronger thus opened dore gat away taken thys woman asked yonge felowe thys wolde tel v matter wytnesses comen sorte beleued elder iudges people condemned death susāna cryed loude voyce sayd euerlastyng god hebre 4 • thou sercher secretes thou knowest al thynges afore come pa thou wotest haue borne false wytnes agaynste beholde muste dye neuer dyd suche thynges men haue malycyously inuented agaynst lorde herde voyce led forth death lorde raysed vp sprete yonge chylde whose name daniel whiche cryed loude voyce 2 reg • ▪ • 〈◊〉 xx • cleane bloude al people turned towarde hym sayde meane wordes thou hast spoken daniel stode myddest thē sayde ye suche fooles ye chyldren israel ye discerne know truth ye haue condemned daughter israell vnto death know y• trueth wherfore go syt iudgement agayne haue spoken false wytnesse agaynst wherfore people turned agayne al hast elder pryncypall heades sayde vnto come syt downe amonge v shewe v matter seyng god hath geuē greate honoure elder daniel said vnto thē 2 reg 〈◊〉 • put two asyde one another shall heare thē put asunder one frome another called one sayde vnto hym thou olde canckerd earle hast vsed thy wickednesse lōg thyne vngracyous dedes yu hast done afore nowe come lyght thou hast geuen false iudgementes thou hast oppressed innocent letten gyltye go fre yet y• lord sayeth • od 22 〈◊〉 xvii • innocent ryghtuous se thou sley wel thā yf thou hast sene tell vnder tre sawest thou talkyng together answered vnder molbery tree danyel sayde well thou lyest euen vpon thyne head lo messaunger lorde hath receaued sentence cut two put hym asyde called sayde vnto hym thou sede canaan iuda fayrenesse hathe disceaued lust hath subuerted thine hert thus dealte ye afore daughter israel feare consented vnto daughter iuda wolde abyde youre wyckednesse nowe tel thā vnder tree dydest y• take thē speakinge together answered pō granate tree sayde daniel vnto wel thou lyest also euē vpō thine heade messaunger lorde standeth waytyng swerde cut two sleye wyth whole multitude gaue greate shoute praysed god psa xvi • alwaye delyuered put theyr trust hym came vpon two elder whome danyell conuycte wyth theyre owne mouth geuen false witnesse dealte euen lyke wyse wolde haue done theyr neyghboures yee dyd •••• xix 〈◊〉 xix • accordyng lawe moses put thē death thus innocent blende saued daye helthiah hys wyfe praysed god theyr daughter susāna ioachim husbāde kynred y• dishonestye foūde day forth danyel great reputacion syght people king astiages layed father cirus persya reygned hys steade ¶ ende storye susanna ❧ storye bel dragon whiche xiiij chapter daniel latin aniel dyd eate kynges table reuerence aboue al frēdes bavilō yma ge called bel ther spēt vpon euery day xij cake xl shepe syxe greate pottes wyne hym dyd kynge worshyp selfe wente daylye honour daniel worshipped owne god kynge sayde vnty dost thou worshyppe bel answered sayde maye worshyppe thynges made handes deut iiii e v c exodi xx deute vi mat iiii liuing god made heauen earth hath power vpon fleshe kyng sayde vnto hym thinckest thou yt bel lyuynge god seyst y• howe much eateth dryncketh euery daye daniel smyled sayd kyng disceaue thy selfe thys made claye within metall without eccle xxx • neyther eateth euer thynge kynge wroth called hys prestes sayde vnto ye tell thys eateth vp expense ye shall dye yf ye certify bel eateth daniel shall dye hath spoken blasphemy bel daniel said vnto kinge let accordynge thou hast saide prestes bel lxx besyde theyr wyues chyldren kynge wente wyth danyel temple bel bel prestes sayd lo wyll go set thou meate kinge poure wyne shut dore faste seale wyth thyne owne sygnet morow whē thou commest yf thou fyndest bell hathe eaten vp wyl suffre death el danyell hath lyed vpon v prestes thought selues sure ynough vnder altare made preuy entraūce wente euer dyd eate vp gone forth kynge set meates bel daniel cō maunded hys seruauntes brynge asshes syfted thorowe temple kynge myght se wente sparred dore sealyng kynges signet departed nyght came prestes theyr wyues child wōte dyd eate dryncke vp al morning tymes breake daye kynge arose daniel wyth hym kynge sayd daniel seales whole yet answered yet kyng whole soone opened y• dore kyng loked vn aultare cryed loude voice greate art thou bel disceate thē laughed danyel helde y• kynge shulde go said holde pauement marcke well whose totesteppes king saide se fotesteppes men wemen chyldren therfore kynge angrye toke prestes wyues chyldren shewed hym preuy dores came dyd eate vp thyn ge vpō aultare cause kyng slewe thē • rem li g e • xlvi iere l • deliuered bel daniel power destroyed hym hys temple place great dragon babylon worshypped king saide vnto daniel satest thou thys god metal also lo lyueth eateth dricketh thou canst saye y• lyuyng god therfore worshype hym daniel sayde vnto kynge wyll worshyppe lorde god daniel 6 c y• true lyuinge god god lyfe geue leaue kynge shall destroye thys dragon without swearde staffe kynge said geue y• leaue thē daniel toke pitch fatte hearrye wol dyd sethe thē together made lompes therof put dragon mouth dragon burst sonder daniel sayd lo whome ye worshypped babylon herde y• toke greate indingnacyon gathered together agaynst kynge saiynge kynge become iewe hath destroied bel hath siaine dragon put prestes deathe came kyng sayd let v haue daniel el wyll destroy thyne house kynge sawe y• russhed sore vpon hym necessite cōstrained dani vi c delyuered daniel vnto cast liōs denne sixe day y• denne seuen lyōs geue euery daye two bodyes two shepe whiche geuen intēt myght deuoure daniel iewry prophete called abacuc made potage brokē bred depe platter goyng felde bryng reaper angel lorde sayde vnto abacuc go cary meate thou hast babylon vnto daniel lyōs dēne abacuc sayde lorde neuer sawe babylon denne knowe ez •• • ▪ angel lord toke toppe bare hym heare head thorow myghtye wynde set babylon vpon denne abacuc cried saying danyel 3 • ▪ y• seruaunt god haue take y• breakfast god hath sent daniel sayde god hast y• thought vpon well thou neuer saylest loue daniel arose dyd eate angel lorde set abacuc owne place agayne immediatly upon seuenth daye kinge wente bewepe daniel came dēne loked beholde daniel sat ī myddest lyon cryed kyng loude voyce saying great art thou lord god danyel iere 〈◊〉 hest • ▪ ••• ▪ • ▪ drewe hym lyōs dēne dani▪ • ▪ luke▪ • e 〈…〉 ▪ cause destructyō cast thē denne deuoured momēt hys face thꝭ wrote kynge vnto people kynredes tonges dwelt al countrees sayēge peace multiplied commaū demente dominion realme men feare stāde awe daniel god y• lyuīge god endureth euer hys▪ kyngdome abideth vncorrupt hys power euerlastinge cā deliuer saue doth wōders maruelous workes ī heauen ī earth hath saued daniel frō power lyon ¶ ende storye bel ❧ prayer manasses king iuda holden captyue babylon lorde almyghtye god father abrahā isaac iacob rightuous sede haste made heauen earth wt al ornament therof hast ordened see worde thy commaundemēt hast shut vp depe haste sealed thy fearfull laudable name men feare trēble face thy vertue y• anger thy threatenyng importable sinner mercy thy promes greate vnsearcheable thou arte lorde god moste hyghe aboue earth lōg suffryng exceadynge mercyful repentaūt malice mē thou lord thy goodnes hast promysed repentaunce remission synnes thou arte god rightuous hast put repentaunce rightuous abrahā isaac iacob vnto thē haue synned haue sinned aboue nombre sandes see myne iniquytyes multyplyed humbled wyth many bādes yron ther breathynge haue prouoked thyne anger haue done euyll commyttinge abhomynacyons multyplyinge offence bowe knee hert requyring goodnes lord haue synned lorde haue synned knowe myne inyquytye desyre prayer lorde forgeue forgeue destroye myne inyquytyes neyther thou alwayes remēbre myne euylles punysh saue whiche vnworthy thy great mercy wyll prayse euerlastyngly dayes lyfe vertue heuē prayseth vnto belongeth glory worlde oute ende amen ❧ fyrst boke machabees ¶ deathe alexander kyng macedonia antio • hu • taketh kingdome many childrē israel moke couenaūt gētyles antiochus subdueth egypt • ierusalē vnto dominion ierusalē burnt maketh lawes owne forbyddeth kepe goddes lawes ant •• ch •• setteth vp ibol ouer alt • r god capi alexandre sonne philippe kynge macedonia wēt forth lāde cethim slew darius king persyans medes happened y• toke greate warres hand wanne many stronge city slewe many kynges earth going thorow endes worlde gettyng many spoyles people much worlde stode greate awe hym iudi • b therefore proude herte whan gathered myghtye stronge hoost subdued lādes people theyr prince y• became tributary vnto fel syck whē perceaued y• mu • nedes dye called hys noble estate whiche bene brought vp hym chyldren ••• vii • viii • parted hys kyngdome among whyle yet alyue aleāder raygned xii yeare dyed hys death fell kyngdome vnto hys prynces optained euery one hys rowne caused selues crowned kynges dyd theyr chyldrē many yeares much wickednesse increased worlde came y• vngracious rote noble anty • chus sonne antiochus y• king 1 mac • • bene pledge rome raygned c xxxvij yeare empyre grekes dayes wēte israel wycked men moued much people wt theyr councell sayege deu v •• iud •• ▪ let v go make couenaunt heathen y• rounde aboute v 〈…〉 sence departed frō haue much sorow thys deuyce pleased well certayne y• people toke vpon thē go vnto y• kyng gaue thē licence ordinaūce y• heathen 1 〈…〉 set vp open scole ierusalem lawes heathē nomore cyrcum • ised forsoke holy testamente ioyned selues y• heathē • 〈◊〉 •• cleane solde mischefe antiochus begāne mightie hys kyngdome wente optayne y• lande egypt also myght haue domyniō two realmes▪ • •• v▪ upon entred egipt wt stōge hoost wyth charettes elephantes horsmen greate nombre shyppes begaune warre agaīst ptolomy king egipte ptolomy afrayed hym fled many people wounded death thus antiochus wanne many stronge cyties toke awaye great good lande egypte 2 •• v c antiochus smytten egipt turned againe y• c xl •• yeare went towarde israel came vp • • usalē wt myghty people entred proudly sanctuary toke awaye golden altare cādelstycke al ornamentes therof cable shewbred pouring vessel chargers▪ golden spones valie y• crownes golden apparell temple brake downe toke also syiuer golde y• precious iew el secrete treasure founde 〈2 page missing〉 none answere neyther caste one stone made fast theyr preuy place sayde wyll dye innocēcy heauen earth shal testyfie wt v ye put v death wrongeously thus fought agaynste thē vpon y• sabboth slewe men catell theyr wyues theyr chyldren nōbre thousande people mathathias frendes herde mourned ryght sore sayde one another oure brother haue done fyght lyues lawes agaynst heathen shall soner roce v earth concluded among thē selues tyme sayeng whatsoeuer commeth make battayll v vpon sabbath daye wyll fyght agaynst dye oure brother murthured haynouly upon came synagoge iewes vnto stronge men israell suche feruent lawe fled persecucyon came helpe thē stande thē much gathered hoost men slewe wycked doer gelousy vngodly men theyr wrath wycked fled vnto heathen escaped thus mathathias frendes went destroyed aulters circū cysed child yet receaued circūcisyon many founde within costes israel folowed myghtely vpō chyldren pryde acte prospered theyr hādes much kepte lawe agaynste power gentyles kynges gaue ouer theyr domynion vnto wycked doer tyme drewe faste mathathias shulde dye sayde vnto sonnes nowe pryde persecucyon increased nowe tyme destruccion wrathfull dyspleasure wherfore sonnes ye feruent lawe leoparde youre lyues testament youre father call remembraunce actes father dyd theyr tyme shal ye receaue greate honoure euerlastynge name iacob ii rom 4 gene 22 b remembre abraā founde faythful temtacion reckened vnto rightuousnes hebre xi eccle 44 c gene 41 b ioseph tyme trouble kepte cōmaundement made lorde egipt num 25 c eccles 45 • phinehes father feruent y• honour god optayned couenaunt euerlastynge presthode num 27 iosu • iosue fulfyllinge y• worde god made captayne israel num 14 • caleb bare recorde cōgre gacyon receaued heretage 1 reg •• dauid also mercyfull kyndnesse optayned trone euerlastynge kyngdome 4 reg • daut •• elia beyng gelous feruēt lawe taken vp heauen hananias asarias mysael remayned stedfast fayth delyuered fyre lyke maner daui 〈◊〉 • daniel beinge vngyltye saued mouth lyon thus ye maye consydre thorow age sence y• worlde begāneꝭ hebre • whosoeuer put trust god ouer come math • feare ye y• wordes vngodly man esay • 51 • • petri • iacob • ecle • • psal • glory donge wormes day set vp morowe gone turned earth memoryal come naught wherfore sonnes take good hertes vnto quyte youre selues lyke men lawe yf ye chynges commaunded lawe lorde youre god ye shal optayne greate honoure therin beholde knowe brother symon man wysdome se y• ye geue eare vnto hym alwaye shalbe father vnto iudas machabeus hathe euer bene mightye stronge youth vp let captayne ordre battayll y• people thus shal ye brynge vnto al y• fauoure lawe se ye auenge wrōge people recompence heathen agayne applye yourselues whole commaundement lawe gaue blessynge layed father died c xlvi yeare modyn hys sōnes buryed hys father sepulcre israell made greate lamentacyon hym ¶ iudas made ruler ouer iewes kylleth appollonius scran prince syrta confydence iudas towarde god iudas determyneth fyght agaynst lysias antiochus made cuptayne ouer host prayer absteyncts capi iii stode vp iudas machabeus father steade brother helped hym dyd helde wyth hys father fought wyth cherefulnesse israell iudas gat hys people great honoure put brest plate gyaunte arayed selfe wyth hys harnesse defended hoste hys swearde actes lyke lyon lyon whelpe roaringe praye ioseph • cap 85 12 ar • • hepsal • enemye wycked hunted thē • mat 8 • brent vp y• vexed people enemyes fled feare hym y• worker vngodlynes put trouble suche lucke prosperyte hāde greued dyuerse kynges iacob greatly reioysed thorow actes gat selfe great name euer wente thorow cyties iuda destroyenge vngodly thē turnynge awaye wrath israell receauynge oppressed fame went vnto vtter parte earth appollonius prynce syria gathered myghtye greate hoost heathē samaria fight agaynst israell iudas perceaued went forth mete hym fought hym slewe great multitude remnaūt fled toke theyr substaūce iudas also toke appolonius owne swerde fought lyfe longe whē seron prynce siria herde saye y• iudas gathered vnto hym cōgregacyon church faythful sayde wyl get name pray se thorowe y• realme wyl go fyght iudas hym many haue despysed kynges cōmaū dement made hym ready went greate myghtye hoost y• vngodly stande auēged chyldren israell came nye vnto bethoron iudas wēt forth agaynst small company hys people sawe great hoost fore sayde vnto iudas howe able beinge fewe fyght agaynst great multitude strong seinge weery haue fasted thys daye 1 reg 14 iudas sayde smal matter many ouercomed wt fewe yee difference god heauen delyuer great multitude smal cō pany 2 pat 25 b victory battell stādeth y• multitude host y• strēgth commeth heauen beholde come agaynst v presumptnous proude multytude destroye v oure wyues chyldren robbe v wyll fyght lyues lawes lorde hym selfe shal destroye thē face therfore ye afrayed soone spoken wordes leapte sodenly vpon thus seron smytten hoost put flight iudas folowed vpō beyonde bethoron vnto playne felde slayne eyght hundreth men resydue fled lande phylystynes al heathē euery syde afrayed iudas hys brother rumoure hym came vnto kynges eares gentyles coulde tell warres iudas kynge antiochus hearde tidynges angry minde wherfore sente forth gathered hoost whole realme strōge armyes opened hys treasury gaue hys hoost yeares wage hande commaundynge ready tymes neuerthelesse sawe moneye ynoughe treasury thorowe dyscorde persecucyon whiche made lande put downe lawes bene olde tymes hys customes trybutes lāde mynyshed feared able beare costes charge longer haue suche gyftes geue lyberally dyd afore y• kynges hym wherfore heuy mynde thought▪ • mat • go persides take trybutes lande gather moche money lefte lysyas noble man kynges bloude ouerse kynges busyness water euphrates vnto border egypte kepe well sonne antiochus tyll came agayne moreouer gaue half hoost elephantes commytted vnto euery thynge hys mynde concernynge dwelt iuda ierusalem shulde sende army agaynste destroye rote power israell remnaunte ierusalem put theyr memoriall place set straungers inhabyte theyr quarter parte theyr lande amongeioseph ca • li antiq thus kynge toke parte hoost departed frō antioch cytie reame ouer water euphrates hundreth xlvij yeare wente thorowe hye country 2 mat • lysyas chose vnto hym ptolomy sonne doriminus nicanor gorgias myghty men kynges frendes sent xl thousande fote men vii thousand horsmē go lāde iuda destroye kynge commaunded wēre forth wyth power came emuians playne felde whan marchauntes heard rumoure theyr seruauntes toke muche syluer gol •• bye chyldren israel theyr bonde men came vnto also yet •• men warre euery syde syria palestynes nowe iudas brother sawe trouble increased host drewe ney vnto theyr border cōsidering y• kinges wordes cōmaunded vnto people namely shulde vtterly waste destroye thē sayde one another let v redresse decaye oure people let v fyght oure folke sanctuarye congregacyon soone ready gathered fyght praye make supplicacyon vnto god mercy grace • •• h • ierusalem laye voyde bene wildernesse went man sanctuary troden downe al • aūtes kepte y• castel habytacyon heathen myrth iacob tak • away y• pipe harpe gone frō amonge israelytes gathered thē gether came maspha ierusalem maspha place • reg 7 b prayed afore tyme israel fasted daye put sackclothes vpon • ast asshes vpon theyr heades tente theyr clothes layde forth bokes lawe wherout heathen sought lykenesse theyr ymages brought prestes ornamentes fyrstlinges tythes set also num 6 absteyners whiche fulfylled theyr dayes god cryed loude voyce towarde heauen sayinge shall whyther shall cary awaye thy sanctuary troden downe defyled thy prestes come heuynesse dyshonour beholde heathen come together destroye v thou knowest thynges ymagine agaynste v howe maye stande except thou god oure helpe blewe trōpette also loude voyce iudas ordened exod • 28 captaynes ouer people ouer thousandes ouer hundredes ouer • yfrye ouer ten suche buylded thē house maryed wyues planted vyneyardes fearfull cōma •• ed thē euery mā go home agayne accordynge deu • xx • iudi 7 lawe hoost remoued pytched vpon southsyde emmaus iudas sayde arme selues stronge chyldren make ready agaynst morowe mournynge ye maye fyght people agreed together destroye
