come nye iewes hoost laye slaye sodenly nowe men kepte cast • co •• eyers thē arose iudas smyte chefe principal kynges hoost emmaus army yet come together meane season came gorgias nyght iudas tentes founde man sought mountaynes thought bene fled awaye hym daye iudas shewed hym selfe felde thre thousande men onely nether harnesse swardes theyr myndes syde sawe heathen myghtye well harnessed theyr hors •• ē aboute well experte feates warre sayde iudas mē hym feare ye multitude afrayed theyr vyolente runnynge remēbre howe oure father delyue • ed exod • 4 reed see pharao folowed vpon greate hoost euen let v also crye nowe towarde heauen lorde shall haue mercy vpon v remembre couenaunt father yee destroye hoost oure face daye heathen shall knowe god hym selfe whiche delyuereth saueth israell heathen left vp theyr eye sawe commynge agaynst went theyr tentes battayll iudas blewe vp trōpettes 2 •• ac •• buckled together heathen discomfyted fled ouer playne felde hynmost slayne folowed vpō vnto assaremoth feldes idumea towarde azot iam •• slayne vpon thre thousande men iudas turned agayne wyth hys hoste sayde vnto people gredy spoyles haue yet batayle fyght gorgias hoste v mountaynes stande ye fast agaynst enemyes ouer come may ye safely take spoyles iudas speakynge wordes beholde appeared one parte thē vpō mounte whan gorgyas sawe hys partye fled tentes brent vp smoke myght vnder stande done perceyuing sore afrayed sawe also iudas host feld redy strike batta • le fled euer • chone lande heathen iudas turned agayne spoyle tentes gat muche golde syluer precious stone purple greate ryches thus went home songe psalme thankesgeuynge praysed god heauen p • 〈◊〉 psa 118 gracyous hys mercy endureth euer israel great victory daye nowe al heathen escaped came tolde lysias euery thynge happened wherfore lisias sore afrayed greued hys minde israel gottē misfortune wold shuld neyther kynge cōmaūded nexte yeare folowynge gathered lysias thre score thousande chosen mē fote fyue thousāde horsmen fyght agaynst came iewry pytched tētes bethoron iudas came agaynst ten thousande men whē sawe great myghtye hoste made hys prayer sayde blessed thou sauiour israell • reg 17 g whyche dyddest destroy violent power gyaunt hande thy seruaunte dauyd • reg 14 b gauest hoste heythen hande ionathas sonne saul hys weapen bearer put thys hoste nowe hande thy people israell let confounded theyr multytude horsmen make afrayed discomforte boldnes strēgth maye moued thorow destruccion cast downe thorow swearde thy louers shall knowe thy name prayse wyth thankesgeuyng stroke battayl wer slayne lysyas hoste fyue thousande men lysias seynge discomfitynge hys men manlynesse iewes howe ready either • yue dye lyke men went vnto antyoche chose men warre whan gathered together myght come agayne iewry sayde iudas brother beholde enemyes discomfited let v nowe go vp clense▪ repayre sanctuary •• mac • upon thys hoste gathered together wente vp mounte syon nowe whan sawe sāctuary layed waste y• aulter defyled dores brēt vp shrubbes growynge courtes lyke wod vpon mountaynes yee y• prestes celles broken downe rente clothes made great lamentacion caste asshes vpon heades fell downe flat grounde made greate noyse wyth trompettes cryed towarde heauen iudas appoynted certayne men fyght agaynst castel tyll clensed sanctuary chose prestes y• vndefyled suche pleasure lawe god clensed sanctuary bare oute defyled stone vncleane place muche aulter burnt offeringes vnhalowed toke aduysemente myght wt thought beste destroy least shuld happen thē shame heythen defyled therfore brake downe stone layed vp vpon mountayne house cōuenient place tyl came prophete shewe shulde done wyth erod 〈◊〉 • ut 27 • io •• 8 g toke whole stone accordige y• lawe buylded newe aulter suche one made vp y• sanctuary within without halowed house courtes made newe ornamentes brought candelstycke aulter incense table temple incense layed vpon aulter lyghted lampes whiche vpon candelstycke y• myght burne temple set shewbred vpon table hanged vp vayle set vp temple afore •• mac x vpon xxv daye ix moneth whiche called moneth ca •• eu cxl viij yere rose vp tymes mornynge sacryfyce accordyng lawe vpon newe burnte offerynge aulter made tyme season heythen defyled day set vp agayne songes pypes harpes cymbales people fell vpon face worshyppyng thanckyng god heauen whiche geuen vyctorye 3 par 7 b kepte dedicacion aulter vii • dayes offrynge burnt sacrifyces thākofferynges gladnesse deckte temple also crownes shyldes gold halowed porte celles hāged dores vpō thē thꝰ great gladnes amonge people blasphemy heythen put away iudas brother whole congregacion israel ordeyned y• tyme dedicacionsiohan x c aulter shulde kept season yeare yeare space vii • dayes xxv day moneth casieu wyth myrth gladnes y• tyme buylded vp mount syon hye walles stronge towres roūde aboute lest gentile shuld come treade downe dyd afore therfore iudas set men warre kepe made stronge defende • math • 6 c thsura people myght haue refuge agaynst edomytes capi v ¶ iud • vaynquyshed heathen go aboute destroye israel holpen brother simon iona th • ouerthroweth cytie ephron denyed hym passage thorowe happened also whan heythen rounde herd howe aulter sāctuary set vp ī olde estate displeased sore wherefore thought destroy y• generacion iacob y• among thē moche y• begāne sley persecute certayne people io • p • ap xii lib xii iudas fought agaynste chyldrenezec x •• • ▪ xxxv ii • x • esau • dumia agaynst whiche arabathane dwelte rounde aboute israelite slewe spoyled greate multitude thought also vpon malyce vnfaythfulnes chyldren bean howe snare stoppe vnto people layed wayte hye waye wherfore shut vp towres came vnto destroyed vtterly brent vp theyr towres wyth afterwarde wente agaynste chyldren ammon wherof founde myghtye power greate multitude people timothy captayne stroke many battayles whyche dystroyed slayne wanne gazer cytie wyth townes belongynge therto turned agayne iewry heathen also galaad gathered thē together agaynst israelite quarter • ey • thē fled castell dathemā sente letter vnto iudas brother sayinge heythen gathered agaynst v euery syde destroye v nowe make redy come lay sege castell wherunto sled timothy captayne hoste come therfore delyuer v handes greate multitude v slayne al readye yee brother y• tubin slayne destroyed wel nye thousāde mē wyues theyr chyldren theyr goodes haue enemyes led away captiue whyle letter yet readynge beholde came messaungers galile rente clothes whiche tolde euen tydynges sayde ptolomais tyrus sydon gathered agaynst galilee fylled enemyes destroye israell 2 ••• ▪ iudas people herde came together great congregacion deuyse myght theyr brother trouble beseged theyr enemyes iudas sayd vnto simō brother chose certayne men go deliuer thy brethrē galile brother ionathas wyll go galaadithim left iosephus sonne zachary azarias captaynes people kepe remnaunt host iewry commaunded sayinge take ouersyght thys people se yt ye make warre agaynst heythen vntyll tyme come agayne vnto simon gaue thre thousande men go galile iudas hym selfe eyght thousande galaadithim wente symeon galile stroke dyuers batayles y• heythen whō discomfyted folowed vpō vnto y• porte ptolomais slayne heythen almoste thre thousande men toke spoyles caryed awaye israelite galilee arbatis wyth theyr wyues theyr chyldren brought iewry wyth greate gladnesse iudas machabeus also brother ionathas went ouer iordane trauayled iij dayes iourney wyldernesse nebuthees met receiued louingly tolde euery thyng happened vnto theyr brother galaadithim many beseged barasa bosor al • mi casphor mageth carnaim stronge walled myghtye greate cyties kepte city galaad also morow apoynted bryng host vnto city take winne one daye iudas hoste turned al haste wyldernesse warde bosor wanne cytie slewe male swearde toke theyr goodes set fyre vpon cytie nyght toke iourneye thence came castell tymes mornynge loked vp beholde innumerable people bearynge ladder instrumētes warre take castell ouercome iudas sawe battayll beganne noyse therof wente vp range heauen greate crye cytie sayd vnto host fyght daye youre brother came behynde enemyes thre companyes blewe vp trompettes cryed prayer god soone timothes hoste perceyued y• machabeus fled hym slewe downe ryght sore kylled thē daye almost eyght thousande men departed iudas vnto maspha layed sege vnto wanne slewe male spoyled set fyre vpon thence went toke casbon mageth bosor cyties galaad 2 mat x gathered timothy another hoste whiche pitched tentes raphon beyonde water iudas also sent spye hoste brought worde agayne saying heythen roūde aboute v gathered vnto hym hoste greate yee haue hyred arabian helpe haue pytched tentes beyonde water ready come fyght agaynst iudas wēt mete timothy sayde vnto captaynes hoste iudas hys hooste come nye ryuer yf go ouer fyrst shall able withstande whyche wyl stronge v yf dare come ouer pytch tent besyde water wyl go ouer shalbe strōg ynough agaynst nowe soone iudas came y• ryuer appoynted certayne scrybes people commaunded sayinge se ye leaue none behynde vpon syde ryuer let euery mā come battayle wente first ouer vnto people hym heythen dyscomfyted let weapens fall rāne tēple carnaim whiche cytie iudas wanne brente temple wyth carnaim subdued myght withstāde iudas iudas gathered israelitꝭ galaadithim lest vnto moste wyth theyr wyues theyr chyldren great hoost come land israel 2 mac 1 •• came vnto ephrō myghtye great stronge cytie laye waye coulde go • nether ryght hande lefte must go thorowe neuertheles yt y• cytie wolde let go thorowe walled vp porte wt stone iudas sent vnto thē wt peaceable wordes sayinge let v passe thorow lande yt may go owne countre shal body harme wyl onely go thorowe fote wolde let wherfore iudas commaunded proclamacyon made thorowe hoste euery man shulde kepe ordre dyd best lyke valeaunt men iudas beseged y• cytie daye nyght wanne slewe many male destroyed citie spoyled wente thorowe cytie ouer yt slayne went ouer iordane plaine feld betsan iudas helped forward yt came behinde gaue people good exhortacion al way thorow tyl come lande iuda thus wēt vp vnto mount syon offred myrth • pa • 20 thākesgeuynge none slayne came home agayne peaceably nowe tyme iudas ionathas lande galaad symon brother galilee ptolomays iosephus sōne zachary asaryas captaynes hearing actes done • attales stroken sayde let v get v name also go fyght agaynste heathen rounde aboute v gaue theyr hoste commaundement wente towarde iamnya came gorgyas men cytie fyght agaynst iosephus also asary chased vnto y• border iewrye slayne daye people israel ij men great misery amonge y• people mat v b obedient vnto iudas brother thought shulde quyte thē selnes manfully neuertheles came sede men israell helped men iudas greatly commended syght israell heythen euer theyr name herde vpō people came vnto byddyng welcome wente iudas forth wyth hys brother fought agaynst chyldren esau lande y• lyeth towarde south wanne cytie hebron townēs lye besyde walles towres rounde aboute brente vp remoued go lāde philistine wente thorowe samaria tyme many prestes slayne battayle whiche wylfully without aduysemente wente fyght get thē honoure iudas came azot y• philistine lāde deuti vi brake downe aulters bren • e ymages idol spoyled city came lande iuda ¶ antiochus wyllyng take cyti • elynas pray • ••• • way 〈◊〉 telleth syckenesse dyeth sonne anti • ch • 〈◊〉 • •• kynge •• g • tower sion eu •• tor cōm •• h iewrye great armye boldnes e •• az • r capi vi kyng antiochus trauayled thorow hye countrees herde y• elymas persia noble plentuous citie syluer golde riche tēple clothes cote armour shyldes golde whiche alexander sōne philippe kyng macedonia raygned fyrst greke londe lefte behynde hym wherfore wente aboute take citie spoyle able citesīs warned fought wt fled departed greate heuynesse came agayne babylon moreouer came one whyche brought hym tidynges persyde ioseph 〈◊〉 xiii li xii entiq hoostes whiche lande iuda dryuen away lysias wente forth fyrst wyth great power dryuen away iewes howe y• wōne victory gotten great goodes hostes y• peryshed howe broken downe abhomynacion matha iii c iiii whiche set vp vponi math 〈…〉 altare ierusalem fenced sāctuary withe hye walles lyke afore yee bethsura cyte also chaunced kyng herde wordes afrayed greued sore wherfore layed downe vpon bed fell sycke sorowe al happened deuysed contynued longe grefe euermore saw must nedes dye therfore sent hys frendes sayde vnto slepe gone fro myne eye sorowe vexacion herte haue cōsidre mynde greate aduersite come vnto floudes heuynesse whiche come afore tyme mery greatly set reason power agayne consyderyng euyl haue done ierusalem whence toke ryches golde syluer sent fetche away inhabytoures iewry without reason knowe trouble come vpon cause beholde must dye wyth great sorowe straūge lande called one philippe frende made ruler realme gaue hym crowne roabe ryng y• shuld take sōne antiochus vnto brynge hym vp tyll myght raygne selfe ii ••• 〈◊〉 • 〈…〉 kyng antiochus dyed cxlix yere lysias knewe kynge deed ordayned antiochus sone iose 〈…〉 〈◊〉 li • 1 •• 〈…〉 whō brought vp raygne hys father steade called hym eupator nowe castell ierusalem kepte iewes rounde aboute sanctuary sought euer styll harme strengthenynge heythen wherfore iudas thought destroye thē called people together myght laye sege vnto thē came together cl yeare beseged layinge forth theyr ordinaunce instrumētes warre certaine seged wente forth vnto vngodly men israel ioyned selues also went vnto kynge sayinge howe longe wyll thou punysh auenge oure brother haue euer bene mynded thy father seruyce walke statute obeye commaundementes therfore oure people fell v whersoeuer founde v slewe spoyled inherytaunce haue onely medled wyth v coūtrees beholde thys daye besegyng castel ierusalem math • 〈◊〉 g haue made vp strong holde bethsura thou doest preuente ryght sone wyl thou shalte able ouercome • math • 〈◊〉 y• kynge herde thys angrye called hys frendes captaynes hys fote men hys horseman together hyred men warre also realmes iles y• see whiche came vnto hym nōbre hys hoste hundreth thousande fote men twēty thousande horsmen xxxij elephātes well exercised battayle came thorowe idumea vnto bethsura andi math iiii 〈◊〉 xi • beseged longe season made dyuerse instrumētes warre agaynste ye iewes came brent thē fought lyke men departed iudas frō castel ierusalē remoued host toward bethzacaran ouer agaynst kynges army kynge arose daye brought power hys hoste way bethzacaran hoostes made thē redy y• battayl blowyng trōpettes prouoke elephantes fight shewed sappe reed grape molberies deuyded elephātes among host y• euery elephant stode men well harnessed helmettes stele vpon theyr heades ye vnto euery one y• elephātes also ordained • c horsmen best wayted elephāt goyng euer wente departed euery elephant couered strong tower wod wherupon xxxij valeaunt men weapens fyght within man iude rule beest remnaunt horsmen set vpon side two partes trompettes prouoke hoste stere vp suche slow armye whē sunne shone vpon theyr shyldes golde stele mountaynes glistred agayne bryght cressettes fyre kynges host also deuided one parte vpon hye mountaynes lowe beneth went takynge good hede kepynge theyr ordre dwelt lande afrayed noyse theyr hoost multitude wēt forth weapens smote together hoost great myghty iudas also hoost entred battayle slewe vj c men kinges army nowe eleasar y• sonne saura dyd se one y• elephantes deckt wt kynges badge godly beest thought y• kynge shuld vpon ieoparde self deliuer people get hym perpetuall name wherfore ranne wyth corage vnto elephāte y• myddest hoost smytyng downe bothe sydes slewe many aboute wente elephantes fete gat hym vnder hym slewe fell elephant downe vpon hī died iudas also men seing y• power kyng myghtye vyolēce host departed frō kynges armye wente vp agaynst thē towarde ierusalem pytched tētes iewry besyde mount syon moreouer kyng toke tr • se machab • iiii • vi 〈◊〉 mat x • • • xv bethsura came cyte vytailes within lāde laye vntylled kynge toke bethsura set mē kepe turned hooste place sanctuary layed siege great whyle made al maner ordinaunce handbowes fyrye dartes rackettes caste stone scorpion shut arowes slinges iewes also made ordynaunce agaynst fought longe season cytie vytayles seuenth yeare warres heythen y• remayned iewrye eaten vp stoare sanctuary fewe mē lefte▪ y• hungre came vpon thē scatred abroade euery man hys owne place lysyas hearde phylyppe 2 mat 6 • whō antiochus kynge whyle yet lyuyng ordayned brynge vp antiochus sonne myght kynge come agayne persia medea kynges hoost thought optayne kyngdome gat kynge al haste captaynes hoste sayde decrease dayly vytayles small agayne place laye sege vnto strōg oure parte se realme let v agree men take truce wyth theyr people graunte lyue theyr lawe dyd afore greued thynges agaynst v haue despysed theyr lawe kynge prynces content sente vnto make peace receyued king prince made othe vnto thē came castell kynge wente vp mounte syon sawe place well fenced brake othe made commaunded destroye wall rounde aboute departed haste returned vnto antioche founde philyppe hauynge dominion cytie fought agaynst toke cytie agayne handes ¶ demetrius raygned kylled antiochus lysyas troubleth chyldren israel thorowe coū cell certayne wycked personnes prayer prestes agaynste nicanor iudas kylleth nicanor made hys prayer capi vii c •• yere came demetrius sōne seleucus citiē rome small cōpany men vnto cytie see caste bare rule chaunced yt came antioche cyte progenitours host toke antiochus lisias brynge vnto hym tolde hym sayde let se theyr face hoste put death nowe demetrius set vpon trone hys kyngdome came vnto wicked vngodly mē israell whose captayne alcimus wolde haue bene made hye preste men accused y• people israel vnto kynge sayinge iudas brother haue slayne thy frēdes dryuen v oure owne lāde wherfore sende man thou geuest credēce may go se destruccyon whiche hath done vnto v kynges lande let punished frendes fauourers kynge chose bachides frende hys man greate power realme beyonde greate water faythfull vnto kynge sente se destruccyon iudas done wycked alcimus made hym hye preste commaunded hym auēnged chyldren israel stode vp came greate hooste lande iuda sendynge messenger iudas brother speakynge vnto wyth peaceable wordes vnder disceyte 1 math b therfore iudas people beleued theyr sayinge sawe come wyth great hoste came scribe together vnto alcimus bachides trustynge best vnto fyrste assideans requyred peace sayinge alcimus preste come sede aarō disceyue v gaue louynge wordes swore vnto sayde wyll harme neither frēdes beleued daye toke lx men slewe accordynge wordes wrytten psal 79 • haue caste fleshe thy saynetes shed bloude roūde aboute ierusalem mā ye wolde bury came greate feare drede amonge people sayinge neither trueth ryghtuousnesse thē haue broken appoyntmente othe made bachides remoued hoste ierusalem pytched hys tente betzecha sent forth toke many forsaken hym slewe many people also caste greate pyt commytted lande vnto alcimus lefte men warre wyth hym helpe hym bachydes selfe went vnto kynge thus alcimus defended hye presthode al suche vexed israel resorted vnto hym muche optayned lande iuda dyd muche euyll vnto israelite nowe iudas sawe mischefe alcimus cōpany done yee heythen selues vnto israelite went forth rounde aboute border iewrye punysshed vnfaithful rennagates came coūtre alcimus sawe iudas people gotten vpperhande able abide went agayne kyng sayde worste coulde kyng sent nicanor one chefe prynces whiche bare euyl wyll vnto israel commaunded hym shulde vtterly destroye people 2 mat 〈◊〉 • nicanor came ierusalem great hoste sent vnto iudas hys brother wyth frendely wordes vnder disceyte sayinge shall warre betwyxte wyll come wyth fewe men se howe ye frēdshype upon thys came vnto iudas saluted one another peaceably y• enemyes appoynted take iudas vyolence neuertheles tolde iudas came vnto hym vnder disceyte wherfore gat hym awaye wold se hys face nicanor perceyued councell bewrayed went fight agaynste iudas besyde carpharsamala slayne nicanors hoste v men resydue sled vnto castell dauyd came nicanor vp vnto mount syon prestes elder people wente forth salute peaceably shewe burnt sacrifice offered kynge laughed people scorne moked defyled offeringes spake disdaynedly yee swore wroth sayenge 2 mar 14 • iudas hoste delyuered nowe hādes soone euer come agayne fare well shall burne vp thys house wyth wente greate angre prestes came stode aulter temple wepynge sayinge 2 para 3 c 3 regū 8 • esap 56 b muche thou lorde haste chosen house thy name myght called vpō therin shulde math 21 b house prayer peticion thy people avenged man host let thē slayne sweard remembre ye blasphemy suffre contynue longer nicanor gone ierusalem pytched hys tente bethoron hoste met hym syria iudas came adarsa thre thousande men made prayer vnto god sayinge lorde esay 37 • 2 mat 8 xv 4 19 g messenger kynge senacherib blaphemed angel wēte forth slewe hundreth foure score fyue thousāde euen destroy thou thys hoste v daye y• people maye knowe howe hath blasphemed thy sanctuary punysh hym accordyng hys malyciousnesse hoostes stroke y• felde thyrtene daye moneth februar •• adar nicanors hoste discomfyted 2 mat 15 selfe fyrste slayne battayle nicanors men warre sawe kylled cast awaye weapens fled iewes folowed vpon whole dayes iourney adazer vnto gazara blowynge trōpettes makynge tokēs iewes came forth y• townes aboute blewe theyr horne vpō turned agaynste thus slayne one lefte toke substaūce pray smote nicanors heed hys ryght hande 2 mat 14 • whiche helde vp proudly brought hanged vp afore ierusalem wherfore people excedyngly reioysed passed ouer day greate gladnesse iudas ordeyned y• daye namely thyrtynth daye moneth adar shulde kepte myrth euery yere thus lande iuda rest lytle whyle ¶ iudas consyderynge power godly polly • • romaynes maketh peace • ceypt romaync • sent vnto iewee capi viii iudas herde also fame romaynes myghtye baleaunte men greable thingꝭ y• requyred make peace al men come vnto doughtye men strēgth besydes tolde hym battayles noble actes whiche dyd galatia howe conquered brought vnder trybute greate thynges done spayne howe theyr wysdome sober behauour wonne mynes syluer golde optayned lande place farre howe discomfyted slayne downe kynges came vppon vttermost parte earth howe people gaue trybute uery yeare howe slayne ouercome philip perses kynges cethim mo battayle whiche brought theyre ordynaunce agaynst howe discomfyted great antyochus kyng asia wolde nedes fyghte wyth theym hauynge hundreth twentye elephātes horssemen charettes great hooste howe toke hym selfe alyue ordeyned hym suche shulde raygne hym paye greate trybute • math • • yee fynde good suretyes pledge besydes thys howe taken india medium lydia hys beste landes geuen kynge eumenus agayne howe perceyuyng grekes commynge vexe sente agaynst captayne hooste whiche gaue battayle slewe many led awaye theyr wyues chyldren captiue spoyled toke possession lande destroyed theyr stronge holdes subdued theyr bondemen vnto thys daye moreouer howe kyngdomes iles whyche somtyme wtstode destroyed thē broughte vnder theyr domynyon helped euer theyr owne frendes confederate conquered king dome farre nye • whosoeuer herde renowne afrayed thē whō wold help theyr kyngdomes raygned whō lyked thē raygne put hī downe howe come greate preemynence hauynge kynge among nether man clothed purple magnified thorow ordayned selues parlamēt wher sat thre hundreth twenty sena tour dayly vpon councell dyspatche euer busynesse people kepe good ordre euery yeare chose mayre haue gouernaunce theyr land euery man obedyent neyther euyll wyll discencion among iudas chose eupolemus sonne ihon sonne iacob iason sonne eleazar sent vnto rome make frendshyppe bonde loue myght take bondage ye grekes ye iewes sawe ye grekes wolde subdue kyngdome israel went vnto rome greate iourney came ye perlamente sayd iudas machabeus brethrē people iewes hath sent v vnto make bonde frendshyppe peace ye note v louers frendes matter pleased ye romaine ryght well wherfore wrytten vp romaynes made wrytyng table brasse sente ierusalem myght haue memoryall peace bond frēdshyp maner god saue romaynes people iewes see lande kepe swearde enemy euermore come fyrst warre vpō romaine frēdes thorow al dominion ye people iewes shall help tyme requyreth wt al hertes also shal neither gyue sende vnto theyr enemy vytayles weapens money shyppes fulfyl charge romaynes pleasure take nothyng therfore agayne yf people ye iewes happē fyrst haue warre romaynes shall stand good wyll accordyng tyme wyll suffre neyther shal geue vnto iewes enemy vitayles weapēs money shippes thus romaynes contēt shal fulfyll theyr charge without disceit according article romaynes made bonde iewes nowe article sayde yf party wyl put take thyng frō thē shall consent whatsoeuer adde vnto thē take shall stande fast touchynge euyl kyng demetrius hath done vnto iewes haue wrytten vnto sayinge wherfore layest thou thy heuy yocke vpon iewes frendes louers make cōplaynte againe vnto v shall defende fyght see lande ¶ death nycanor demetrius sendeth armye agaynste iudas iudas slayne ionathas put ste • de hys brother stryte betwene ionathas bachydes al • ymus • ken palsye dyeth bachydes returneth agayne vnto kyng cōmeth vpon ionathas coūt • certayne wycked personnes ouercome truce ionathas bachydes capi ix meane season whē demetrius herde 1 〈…〉 iosep 17 lib 〈◊〉 nicanor hys hoste slayne felde proseded sende bachides alcimus agayne iewry right winge host wt thē went forth way yt ledeth vnto galgala pytched tentes mesaloth arbellus wanne cytie slewe muche people ye fyrste moneth ye clij yeare brought theyr hoste ierusalem rose vp came berea wt xx fotemen ii horsmen nowe iudas pytched hys tentes laysa thre thousande chosen mē sawe multitude army great sore afraied many conueyed selues hoste muche abode mo eyght hundred men iudas sawe hoste fayled yt must nedes fyght brake hys herte tyme gather togyther wherfore man extreme trouble neuerthelesse sayde vnto remayned hym let v go agaynste oure enemyes peraduenture shalbe able fyght wolde haue stopped hym sayinge shall able therfore let v nowe saue lyues turne agayne brother wyll fyght agaynst thē fewe iudas sayde god forbyd yt shulde fle wherfore yf oure tyme come let v dye manfully brother let v stayne oure honoure hoost remoued tentes stode horssmen deuyded two partes sling caster archer wente hoost mightye mē formost felde bachides hym selfe ryght wyng battayll hooste drewe nye two partes blewe trompertes iudas • yde blew trōpettes also earth shoke noise hoostes stroke felde morowe tyl nyght whē iudas sawe bachides hoost strō gest ryght syde toke hym hardye men brake right wynge ordre folowed vpō vnto mount azot whē y• left wing sawe y• right syde discomfyte persecuted iudas wt sore battaylle many slayne wōded party iudas also self kylled rē naunt fled ionathas symon toke iudas theyr brother buried father sepulchre cyte moden people israel made great lamentacyon nym mourned longe salenge ala thys worthy shulde slayne deliuered people israel thynges perteyninge battailes iudas noble actes dyd hys worthynesse wrytten many ioseph 〈◊〉 • lib 13 death iudas wycked men came vp al coastes israel arose worcke vngodlines dayes greate dearthe lande countre gaue ouer selues vnto bachides bachydes chose wycked men made lo • de land sought made search iudas frēdes • nd brought vnto bachides auēged self vpō great despyte came great trouble israel sen tyme prophere sene came iudas frendes together sayde vnto ionathas much thy brother iudas deed ther none like go forth cur enemy agaist bachides suche aduersaryes vnto oure people wherfore thys daye chose hym oure prince captayne ordre oure battaille ionathas toke gouernaunce vpon hym tyme ruled isteade brother iudas bachides gat knowledge therof sought sley hym ionathas symon brother perceauynge sled wildernes • hec • al theyr company pytched theyr tentes water pole asphar bachydes vnderstode came ouer iordane al host vpon y• sabbath day ionathas sēt hys brother ihon captayne people pray frendes nabuthites wolde lende ordiuaunce much chyldren iambry came madaba toke ihon al wente waye withal came worde vnto ionathas simō brother chyldren iambry made greate mariage brought bride frō madaba wyth greate pompe daughter one noblest prince canaan wherfore remembred bloude ihon brother wete vp hid selues vnder shadowe moūtayne lift vp eye loked beholde much great repayre brydegrome came forth▪ frendes hys brother met thē tympanyes instrumētes musicke many weapēs ionathas hym rose oute theyr lourkynge place agaynst slewe many remnaut fled moū taynes toke substaunce thus maryage turned morninge noyse melody lamentacyon auenged bloude theyre brother turned agayne vnto iordane bachides hearynge thys came vnto border iordane great power vpon y• sabbath day ionathas sayd hys companye let v get vp fyght agayne enemy stādeth v daye tyme paste beholde oure enemyes waye water iordane vpon one syde v bankes fennes woddes side place v departe vnto • para x • mat 4 b wherfore crie nowe vnto heauen ye maye deliuered frō power enemy stroke y• battaille ionathas stretched hādes smite bachy de fled bacwarde ionathas wyth hym leapte iordane swymmed ouer iordane vnto hym staine bachides side daye thousande men therfore bachydes hys hoost turned againe ierusalem builte vp castels strong holdes iewrye iericho emaus bethoron bethell thamnata phara topo wt hye walles porte locke set mē kepe might vse theyr malyce vpon israell walled vp cytye bethsurah gazarah castell prouided thē mē vitayles toke also chefest men sonnes countre pledge put castel ierusalem kepte afterwarde hundred fyftye thre yeare secōde moneth alcimus cōmaū ded walles inmost sanctuary shuld destroyed buyldīges prophetes also began destroye thē thynges yt wēte aboute hindered smyttē pal sey mouth shut coulde speake cōmaūde hys house concernyng busynesse thus dyed alcimus greate misery tyme whē bachides sawe alcimꝰ dead turned agayne kyng ye lāde reast two yeares vngodly men helde councel saieng behold ionathas cōpany ease dwell without care wherfore let v bringe bachides hyther shall take al one nyght wente gaue bachydes councell arose come greate hoost snet letter preuely adherentes iewry take ionathas wt might gotten knowledge deuice ionathas toke fyfty men countre ryngleaders thē slewe ionathas simō theyr company departed vnto cyte bethbessen lyeth wildernes repayred y• decay therof made strōg bachydes knewe thys gathered hys hoost sent worde iewry came layed sege bethbessen fought agaynst long season made instrumētes warre ionathas left brother simō ye cytie wente forth selfe coūtre came certayne nōbre slewe odares brethrē child phaseron tentes begāne stronge increase power symon hys companye wente cytye brent vp instrumentes warre fought agaynst bachides discōfyted hym bachides sore vexed councel trauayl vaine wherfore wroth wycked men gaue hym councell come lande slewe many purposed company go awaye hys owne countre wherof whē ionathas knowledge sent embassytours vnto hym make peace wt hym shuld delyuer presonners agayne whiche bachides consented gladly dyd according desyre yee made othe shulde neuer harme al dayes life restored vnto hym al presonners taken lande iuda turned wente hys way hys owne lāde nether proceded come vnto ye border iuda thus israell warre ionathas dwelt machemas began gouerne ye people destroyed y• vngodly mē israel ¶ demetrius desyreth haue peace ionathas alexander moueth warre agaynste demetrius demetrius slayne frendshippe ptolomeus alexander capi x hundred thre score yeare came alexander sonne noble antiochusiosep • ▪ ii 〈…〉 toke ptolomays whose cytezyns receaued hym rayghned kynge demetrius herde therof gathered exceadynge great hoost wente agaynste hym fyght wherfore demetrius sēt letter vnto ionathas louyng wordes praysed hym greatly sayd wil first make peace wt binde hī selfe alexander v el shall remēbre y• euyl yt haue done hī brother people gaue ionathas leue gather host make weapens cōfederate wt commaūded pledge īthe castell deliuered vnto hym came ionathas ierusalem red letter audience al people castel therfore sore afraied herde kyng geuen hym licence gather hoost thus pledge delyuered vnto ionathas whiche restored thē parētes ionathas also dwelt ierusalem beganne buylde vp repayre citie commaunding worckmen wall mount sion round aboute fre stone stronge holde dyd ye heathen yt castels bachides made vp fled euery man lefte place went owne coūtre bethsura remayned certayne ye iewes forsakē lawe commaundementes god bethsura refuge nowe kyng alexander herde promyses demetrius made vnto ionathas whē tolde battels noble actes whiche hys brother done greate trauayles taken saide shal fynde suche man well wyll make frende confederat upon wrote lettre vnto wordes kynge alexander saluteth brother ionathas haue herd ye thou art valeaūt man mete frende wherfore thys daye ordeyne hye preste thy people called kynges frende upon sēt hym purple clothynge crowne golde thou mayeste consydre oure profyt kepe frendshyppe towarde v seueth moneth hundred thre score yeare vpō solempne feaste day ye tabernacle ionathas put ye holy raymente vpon hym gathered hoost made many weapēs whē demetrius herde maruelous sory sayde ala haue done alexander hath preuēted v gettyng y• frendshyppe iewes hys owne defence yet wyll wryte louyngly vnto also yee promyse dygnites rewardes maye syde wherupō wrote vnto thē wordes kinge de metrius sendeth greting vnto yt people ye iewes ye haue kepte couenaūt towarde v continued frendship enclining enemy glad herde therof wherfore remayne styll faythfull v shall wel recompense y• thinges yt ye haue done oure partye shall release many charge geue rewardes dyscharge al ye iewes frō tribute forgeue customes salt release y• crowne tax thyrde parte sede half ye frute tree myne owne dewtye leaue frō daye forth yt shal taken lande iuda thre city added ther vnto samaria galylee frome thys daye forthe euermore ierusalē also al thinges belongyng therto shalbe holy fre yee ye tythes trybutes shall pertayne vnto power ye castell ierusalē remyt geue vnto hye prest may set ī mē shal chose kepe frely delyuer al iewes presonners thorow al realme euery one thē shalbe fre frō payinge trybute yee euen catell solempne feastes sabbathes new moones dayes appoynted thre dayes feast shall fre iewes realme man shall haue power thynge moue busynesse thē maner cause shall thyrtye thousande also iewes wrytten vp kynges hoost haue wage payed men warre kinges shulde haue shalbe ordeyned certayne kepe kynges strong holdes yee shalbe set ouer kinges busynesse maye faithfully deale iewes also shall haue prynces theyr owne walcke theyr owne lawes kynge hath commaunded lande iuda thre cyties fallen vnto iewry countre samarya galtiee shalbe taken iewry vnder one nether subtecte straunge lord hye preste prolomais lande perteynynge therto geue vnto sanctuary ierusalem necessary expences holy thinges moreouer wyll geue euery yeare fyftene thousand sycles syluer kīges cheker pertayneth vnto y• worcke temple yee loke remayneth yt oure matter hande tymes past haue pated y• shal geue vnto also besydes al thys fyue thousand sycles toke yearly rente sanctuary shall belong vnto prestes seruyce item whosoeuer fle vnto temple ierusalem within liberty therof fallen kynges daunger maner busynes shall pardoned ye goodes haue reaime shalbe fre buyldyng also repayring worcke sanctuary expense shall geuen kynges checker yee makynge walles rounde aboute ierusalem breaking downe olde settinge vp strong holdes iewry shal costes charge begeuen kynges checker • mat 7 ionathas people hearde wordes gaue credence vnto neyther receaued remembred greate wyckednesse done vnto israell sore vexed wherfore agreed vnto alexander prynce dealte frendly wyth stode hym alwaye ioseph • v lib xiii gathered kynge alexander greate hoost brought hys armye agaynste demetrius two kynges stroke bataylle together demetrius hoost iled alexander folowed fell vpon myghtye sore felde contynuynge tyll sonne wente downe demetrius slayne daye alexandre sente ambassitoures vnto ptolomy kyng egypte wyth wordes sayenge muche come agayne reaime let trone progenytours haue gotten domynyon ouercomed demetrius conquered lande stryken felde hym haue dysconfyted hoost syt trone hys kyngdome let v nowe make frēoshippe together geue thy daughter wyfe shall thy sonne lawe geue rewardes great dygnyte ptolomy kyng gaue answere sayenge happy daye wherin thou arte come agayne lande thy progenytours set trone theyr kyngdome nowe wyll fulfyll thy wrytynge mete ptolomais maye se one another may mary daughter vnto accordinge thy desyre ptolomy wente egypte wyth hys daughter cleopatra came vnto ptolomays clxij yeare kinge alexander met hym gaue alexander daughter cleopatra maried ptolomais greate worshyppe lyke maner kynges thē wrote kyng alexander vnto ionathas shulde come mete hym wente honorably vnto ptolomais mete two kynges gaue greate presentes golde siluer founde fauoure syght came together agaist ionathas certayne wycked men vn gracyous persones israel makyng com playntes kyng regarded thē ionathas kynge commaunded take hys garmentes clothe purple dyd yt kinge appoynted hym syt hym sayde vnto hys prince go hym ye middest cytye make proclamacion man complayne matter mā trouble hym eny maner cause happened hys accuser sawe worshyppe proclamed hym clothed purple sled euerychone kynge made much hym wrote hym amonge hys chefe frendes made hym duke partaker hys domynyon iosep • ▪ c • 〈…〉 thus ionathas wente agayne ierusalē peace gladnes clxv yeare came demetriꝰ sōne demetrius creta hys father lande wherof alexander herde tel ryght sory retourned vnto antioche demetrius chose 〈…〉 appollonyus gouernaunce celosyrya hys captayne gathered greate hoost came vnto iamnta sente word vnto ionathas hye prest sayeng darteste yu withstand v thy self alone laughed scorne shamed thou prouedst thy strēgth agaynst v moū taynes nowe therfore yf thou trust este thine owe strēght come downe v ye plaine felde let v proue strēgth together thou shalt fynde haue vale aunt men warre shalt knowe stande saye fote able stande oure face thy father haue bene twise chased theyr owne lāde nowe wylt yu able abyde great hoost horssinē fotemē y• feld nether rocke stone place fle vnto ionathas herd wordes appolloniꝰ moued hys mynde wherfore chose tenne thousande mē went oute ierusalem symon hys brother met helpe pitched tentes ioppa ye cytie kepte hym forth ioppa holde appollonius ionathas laied sege cyte feare let hym ionathas wanne ioppa appollonius hearinge toke thre thousande horssmen greate hoost fote wente though wold go azotus came immediatly plaine felde many horssmen put hys trust thē ionathas folowed vpon azotus strocke battayll appolloniꝰ left thousande horsmē behynde thē priuely y• tētes ionathas knewe ye suche wayte layed behynde went rounde aboute enemyes hoost shot dartes ye people frō morninge ye euenynge ionathas people kepte theyr ordre commaunded enemyes horse euer labourynge brought symon forth hys hoost set agaynste fote men horsmen weery ready dyscomfited fled scatred felde gat thē azotus came temple dagon theyr idoll yt myght saue theyr lyues ionathas set fyre vpon azotus al cyties rounde aboute toke theyr goodes • ▪ • xi brent vp temple dagon fled thus slayne brent well nye viij men ionathas remoued hoost frō thence brought thē ascalon men cytie came forth met hym great worshyp went ionathas hoost gayne ierusalem great substaunce good kynge alexander herde thynges thought ionathas worshype sent hym colar golde ye vse geuē vnto suche kynges nexte bloude gaue also cytie accaron landes belongynge therto possessyon capi xi ¶ dissencion betwyre ptolomes alexan̄der sōne •• deeth alexan • der demetrius taygneth deeth ptolom • u syon besegid ionathas de netriu • seinge • resisted sēdeth armye 〈…〉 pho moueth •••• chns demetr • u de •• nu desiuered suciour ianathas hys dcly g • r • unce meaketh hys couenau •• made kynge egypte gathered • hoost lyke sande ye lyeth vpon ye sce • bore many shippes io • rphus 〈◊〉 7 lib 13 went aboute thor • dysceate obtayne ye kyngdome alexander ioyne vnto hys owne realm • e upon toke hys iourney siri • letten ye cyties mē came forth mete hym kynge alexander commaunded father lawe nowe whē ptolomy entred cytie lefte men warre kepe thys dyd thorowe cyties came azotus mat x c shewed temple dagon azotus brent vp thynges destroyed deed bodyes caste aborde graues made ye waye syde suche slayne ye felde tolde kynge ye ionathas done thinges ye intēt might get hym euell wyll kynge sayde worde therto ionathas met kynge great honoure ioppa saluted one another toke theyr rest ionathas gone wt kyng vnto y• water called eleutherus turned agayne ierusalem ptolomy gotten yt domynyon cyties vnto selencia vpō yt see coast ymagyning wycked councels agaynste alexander sent ambassitours vnto demetrius saying come let v make bonde betwyxte v shall geue daughter alexander hathe thou shalt raygne thy father kyngdome repeute gaue alexander daughter goeth sley thus sclaundreth alexander wolde haue realme thus toke daughter frō gaue vnto demetrius forsoke alexander malice openly knowen ptolomy came antioch set two crownes vpō owne heade crowne egypt asia meane season kynge alexander cilicia dwelt place rebelled agaynst alexander herde came warre agaynst kyng ptolomy brought forth hoost met hi mighty power chased away fled alexander araby defē ded kynge ptolomys honoure incrased zabdiel y• arabian smote alexādets heade sent vnto ptolomy thyrde day dyed kynge ptolomy selfe sett stronge holdes stayne cyties demetrius raygned hundred seuen syxtie yeare ye sametyme gathered ionathas thē iewry laye sege vnto ye castel ierusalē made many instrumētes warre agaynst thē wente certayne vngodly personnes hated theyr owne people vnto king demetrius tolde hym ionathas seged y• castel herde angrie immediatly came vnto ptolomeus wrote vnto ionathas yt shulde laye sege castel come speake y• haste neuertheles ionathas herde commaunded besege chose also certayne y• elder 〈2 page missing〉 arius kynge sparcians sendeth gretynge vnto omas hye prest foūde wrytynge sparcians iewes brother come generacyō abraham nowe much come oure knowledge ye shall well wryte vnto v youre prosperite v haue wrytten oure mynde vnto oure catell goodes thynges haue commaūded shewed vnto ionathas herde demetrius prynces come forth fyght agaynste hym wt greater hoost afore wente ierusalem met lande hemath gaue space come owne coūtre sent spyes vnto theyr tentes whiche came agayne tolde hym y• appoynted come vpon nyght season wherfore whē sunne gone downe ionathas cōmaunded men watch nyght ready wt weapens fyght set watchman rounde aboute hoost aduersaryes herde y• ionathas ready men battayll feared afrayed theyr hertes kyndled fyres theyr tentes brake vp gat thē awaye neuerthelesse ionathas hys company knewe tyl mornynge sawe fyres burnynge ionathas folowed vpon myght ouertake gone ouer water eleutherus ionathas departed vnto arabian whiche called zabadei slewe thē toke theyr goodes proceaded also came vnto damascus went thorowe al yt countre simō brother toke iourney came ascalon next strong holdes departynge vnto ioppa wanne herde y• wolde stande demetrius partye wherfore set mē warre cytie kepe came iona thas home agayne called elder people together deuysed thē buylde vp stronge holdes iewry walles ierusalē set vp hye wal betwixte castell cytie separate frō cytie yt myght alone men shulde neyther bye sell upon thys came together buylde vp cytie muche wall vpō broke westsyde called caphecah fallen downe repaired simō set vp adiadath sephelah made strōge settynge porte locke vpō nowe • •• sapn •• xxix •• tryphon purposed raygne asya crowned sleye kynge antiochus afrayed ionathas wolde suffre hym fyght agaynst wherfore went aboute take ionathas kyll hym departed came vnto bethsan went ionathas forth agaynste hym battayll fourtye thousande chosen men came vnto bethsan also triphon sawe ionathas came greate hoost destroye afrayed therfore receaued hym honorably commended hym vnto hys frendes gaue rewardes commaunded men warre obediēt vnto hym selfe sayde vnto ionathas haste thou caused people take suche trauayle seynge warre betwixt vs▪ therfore sende home agayne chose certayne men wayte vpon come thou ptolomais wyl geue stronge holdes men warre theyr offycers must departe onely cause commynge sonathas beleued dyd sayde puttynge awaye hoost whiche went lāde iuda kept iij hym wher sene ij galilee one went hym selfe nowe soone ionathas entred ptolamais cytesyns sparred gate cytie toke hym slewe swearde came hym sent triphon hoost fote men horsmen galilee greate playne felde destroye ionathas company knewe ionathas taken slayne wayted vpon hym toke councell together came forth ready battayll whiche folowed vpon sawe matter lyfe turned backe agayne went lande iuda peaceably bewayled ionathas hym ryght sore israell made greate lamentacyon heathen rounde aboute thē sought destroye sayde nowe haue captayne man helpe therfore let v ouercome rote theyr name amonge men ¶ ionathas w •• tak • symon chosen captayne triphon •••••• hy • ch • lo •• monn • redempeyon ionathan hylleth hym chyldren graue • ionathas triphon kylleth antiochus possesseth 〈…〉 truce symon symon wy •••• h e • z • 〈◊〉 possesseth tower syon maketh sonne 〈…〉 capi xiii nowe simō herde yt triphon gathered great host come y• lande iuda destroye sawe people greate fearfulnes care came vp ierusalē gathered people together gaue thē exhortaciō saying ye knowe great battayls brethrē father house haue strikē law y• sāctuary maner trouble haue lene thorow occasion wherof • • • 6 c ix b xiii b al brother slayne israel sake left alone nowe let spare myne owne life maner trouble better thē brethrē wyl auēge people sanctuary chyldren oure wyues tor heythen gathered together destroy v malyce wordes hertes people kyndled together cryed wt loude voyce saying thou shalt captayne steade iudas ionathas thy brethrē ordre y• battayle whatsoeuer y• cō maūdest v shal gathered al mē warre making hast • yn •• h al walles ierusalē whiche made stronge roūde sent ionathas y• •• e absalomus wt fresh hoste vnto ioppa droue thē y• castel remayned hi self triphon also remoued frō ptolomais great army come lāde iuda ionathas inwarde simō pytched tentes ad dꝰ playne felde triphon knewe symon stode vp steade brother ionathas wolde warre hi sent messē gers vnto hi saying haue kept ionathas thy brother money y• owyng kinges accōpt concernynge busynesse hàde wherfore sēde c talētes syluer • two sō ne suretye lette forth shall forsake v shall sende hym agayne neuertheles symon knewe dissēbled wordes yet cōmaūded money chyldren deliuered vnto hi lest shulde greater enemye agaynst people israel say sent money chyldren therfore ionathas deed simon sent child hundreth talentes dissembled wold let ionathas go afterwarde came triphon lande destroye wente rounde aboute waye ledeth vnto ador soeuer wente thyther went simon hꝭ host also yt castell sent messsaūgers vnto triphō shulde make hast come wyl dernes sende thē vytayles triphō made redy al horsmē come night neuertheles gret snow came galaadith • whē drewe nye baschama slewe ionathas sonnes turned go home owne lande sente simon fet brother deed coarse buried modin father cyte al israel beway • ed wt great lamētacion mourned ••• ery longe simon made vpō sepulcre father brethrē buylding hye loke vnto fre stone behynde set vp seuē pillers one agaynst another father mother foure brethrē set great pillers roūde aboute armes vpon thē perpetuall memory carued shippes besyde armes might sene mē saylyng see sepulcre whiche made modin stādeth yet vnto daye ioseph ca x 〈◊〉 xii • triphon went walke yonge kyng antiochus slew trayterously raygned steade crowned selte kynge asia dyd muche euyl lande symon also buylte vy castels iewry makynge thē stronge hye towres great walles▪ porte locke layed vp vytayles strong holdes symon chose certayne mē sent thē kynge demetrius desyre hym wolde discharge lāde al bōdage triphon spoiled fore▪ wherupō demetrius kyng answered hi wrote vnto maner demetrius kynge sendeth gretynge vnto symon hye preste frende elder people iewes golden crowne precious stone ye sente vnto v haue receyued redye make stedfast peace yee wryte vnto offycers release concernynge thynges wherin made fre appoyntment make shalbe • yrme stable stronge holdes ye haue buylded shall youre owne ouersyghte fawte commytted vnto thys daye forge ue crowne care hat ye ought v also trioute ierusalem shal nowe cry •••• ▪ loke mete among court let wrytten vp maye peace betwyxte v thus yocke heythen takē israel hundreth seuentyeth yeare people iewes beganne write theyr letter actes thꝭ maner 1 mac 14 fyrst yeare symon hye prest prynce iewes dayes wēt simon vnto gaza beseged roūde aboute set vp dinaūce warre wāne towre whiche toke gat towrelept cite whiche great feare muche people cytie rēt clothes clymmed vp vpon walles wt theyr wyues chyldren besechynge symon one sayinge rewarde v wyckednes gracious vnto v shal seruyce simon pitye wolde fyght nomore agaynst put thē cytie caused house wherein ymages clensed entred cytie psalmes prayse gyuynge thanckes vnto lorde cast abhominaciōs cytie set suche men kepte law god made cyte stronge buylded dwellyng place selfe nowe castel ierusalē kept straytely coulde come forth coūtre might nether bie sell hungrye many famished death somuch besought simō one wt whiche graūted put thence clensed castel fylthynesse vpō xxiij daye secōde moneth c lxxj yere entred īto wt thankesgyuyng braunches palme tree harpes crowdes cymbales lute syngynge psalmes songes prayse vnto god great enemy israel ouercome symon ordayned day shulde kepte euery yeare gladnesse made stronge hyl temple besyde castell dwelte hym selfe company simon also perceyuyng ihon sonne myghtye man armes made captayne al hostes caused dwel gaza ¶ demetrius ouercome arsaces symon beyng captayne great quycenesse israel couenaunt frendshyppe romaynes people sparta renued capi xiiii clxxij yeare gathered kynge demetrius host departed vnto medium get hym helpe fyght agaynste triphon nowe arsaces kynge persia medea herde demetrius entred wt border sent one prynces take alyue brynge hym vnto hym went slewe▪ demetrius hoste toke selfe brought arsaces whiche kept hī inwarde al lāde iuda rest longe symō lyued sought wealth people therfore glad haue theyr ruler worshype alway symon wāne cytie ioppa also hauē towne made entraūce iles see enlarged border hꝭ people cōquered lāde gathered vp many people prisoner dominion gaza bethsura castel whiche clensed frō fylthynes man resisted hī euery mā tylled groūde peace lande iuda tree gaue theyr frute encreace elder sat iudgement toke theyr deuice wealth lande yonge men put worshyp harnesse vpon prouyded vytayles cyties made goodly stronge holdes thē fame worshyp spoken vnto ende worlde 〈…〉 3 〈…〉 made peace thorow lande israel ful myrth ioy euery man sat vnder vyne fygg tree mā fray away none lāde fyght thē kynges ouercome helped aduersite amonge people diligēt se law kept vngodly wicked toke away set vp sanctuary encreased holy vessel temple romaynes sparcyans gotten worde ionathas deed ryght sory herde simon brother made hie prest steade howe wonne lande agayne cyties wrote vnto table brasse renue frēdshyp bonde loue whiche made afore iudas ionathas hys brethrē • mat xii • whiche wrytynges red congregacyon ierusalem copye letter sparcians sent senatours c • tesins sparta sence gretyng vnto simō great prest elder preestes people iewes brethrē ambassytours sent vn people certifyed v worshyp honoure prosperous wealth glad theyr cōmyng haue wrytten earande whiche spake councell people namely numenius sonne antiochus antipater sōne iason iewes embassitours come vnto v renue olde frendship v upon people cōsented men shulde honorably intreated copy theyr earande shulde wryten speciall bookes people perpetual memory vnto sparcians yee shulde sende copy vnto symon great preste dyd simon sēde numeniꝰ vnto rome golden shylde thousāde poūde weight cōfyrme y• frēdshyp wt thē romaynes vnderstode sayde thāckes shal recōpēce againe vnto simon chyldrē hath stablished brethreē ouercome y• enemy israel wherfore graunted hī fre al wrote y• iewes ī table brasse nayled vnto pyllers vpō mounte syon copy wrytynges xviij day moneth august elul y• clxxij yere thirde yere symō y• hye prest great cōgregaciō prestes ruler people elder y• coūtre asatame wordes openly declared much much warre land therfore simon sonne matathias come chyldren iareb brother put selues parell resysted enemy people y• theyr sanctuary lawe myght mayntayned dyd theyr people great worshype ionathas lyke maner gouerned people bene hye preste dyed lyeth buried besyde elder wold theyr enemyes haue troden holy thynges vnder fote destroyed lande vtterly waysted sanctuary symon withstode fought people spēt much owne money weapened valeaunt men hys people gaue wage made stronge cyties iuda bethsura lyeth vpon border iewry ordynasice enemy laye somtyme set iewes kepe made fast ioppa also lieth vpō see gaza bordreth vpon azotus y• enemy dwelt afore set iewes kepe whatsoeuer mete subduyng aduersaryes y• layed therin nowe whē people sawe noble actes simō worshyp purposed thē godly behauour faythfulnes kept vnto thē sought al wayes y• wealth people dyd al thꝭ therfore chose hi prince hye prest tyme ꝓspered wel hi yt heythen take lāde also whiche citie dauid ierusalēm castel wēt defyled al thinges aboute sāctuary great harme vnto clēlynes symon put men iewes defence lande cytie set vp walles ierusalem kyng demetrius cōfyrmed hi hye presthode made hi hꝭ frēde dyd hi great worshyp herd romaynes called iewes frendes louers brethrē honorably receyued simōs embassitours iewes preestes cōsented yt shulde theyr prince hye prest perpetually tyl god raysed vp true ꝓphete y• shuld captaine care sāctuary set officer vpō worckes therof ouer y• lāde ouer weapēs ouer house defence make prouision holy thinges obeyed euery mā wrytynges lande made name yt shuld clothed purple gol • e shuld lawful none people prestes breake thynges wt stande wordes cal cōgregacion lande without shulde clothed purple weare colar gold disobeyed brake ordinaunce y• shulde punyshed people consented alowe simon accordynge wordes symon also himselfe toke vpon hym cōtent hye prest captayne prince iewes prestes gouerne commaunded make wrytynge table brasse fasten vnto compasse sanctuary open place lay vp copy treasury symon poste rite myght haue ¶ antiochus maketh couenaunt frendshyppe symon tryphon persecuted romaynee wryte letter vnto kynges nacyons defence iewes antiochus refusynge helpe symon sente hym breaketh couenaunt capi xv moreouer kyng antiochus sonne demetrius sente letter frō iles see vnto symon hye preste prynce iewes people cōtaynynge wordes anttochus y• kyng sendeth gre tyng vnto symon hye prest people iewes muche certayne wycked mē haue gotten y• kyngdome oure ꝓgenitors purposed chalēge y• real agayne restore olde estate wherfore haue gathered great host made shippes warre y• may go thorowe coūtre auenged thē haue de stroyed lande wasted many city realme therfore make y• fre also frō al tribute wherof al k • ge proge nitours haue discharged frō custouies frō haue released y• whatsoeuer ye gyue leaue smyte money thyne owne wtin thy lande ierusalē wil holy fre al wepens house defence y• haste buylded kepest thyn hādes shalbe thine wher thynge shalbe owynge vnto kyng forgeue tyme forth euermore haue optayned kyngedome shal thy people temple great worshyp y• honoure shalbe knowē thorow whole worlde clxxiiij yeare went antiochus father lāde al mē warre came together vnto hi y• fewe lette wt criphon kyng antiochꝰ folowed vpon fled vnto dora whiche lyeth see syde sawe y• myschefe cōmyng vnto hoste forsaken came antiochus vnto dora hundreth twentye thousande men armes vpon fote eyght thousande horsmen cōpased citte rounde aboute shippes came see thus vexed cytie lande water muche suffred man go meane season came 1 math • 〈◊〉 • numenius bene wt cite rome hauing letter writtē vnto kyngꝭ ꝓuyncies wherin cōtayned wordes lucius consul rome sēdeth gretyng vnto ptolomy kyng embassitours iewes frēdes sent frō simon hye prest people iewes came vnto v renue old frē shyp bōde loue brought shylde gold weing thousāde poūde cōtēt receyue wherfore thought good wryte vnto kynges prouyncies harme take parte agaynst cyties countrees nether mayntene enemy agaynst thē wycked personnes therfore fled countre vnto delyuer thē vnto symon hye preste may punysh accordyng theyr owne lawe wordes wrote romaynes also vnto demetrius kynge attaius araba arsaces al regiōs sāsanes thē sparta delo mido ciciō carea samos pamphilia lycia alicarnassū rhodes faselis coo sida arado gortina gnydū cypre cyren euery lettre sēt copye simon hye prest people iewes antiochus y• kyng brought hoste vnto dora y• secōde tyme take made diuers ordinaūces warre kepte triphō y• shulde come forth sent symon antiochus two thousāde chosen men help wt gold syluer plentuous geere neuerthelesse wolde receyue thē brake al couenaunt made wt simon atore wt drewe selfe sēt athenobius also frende vnto simō reason wt saying ye wt holde fro ioppa gaza castel y• ierusalē city realme whose border ye haue destroied done great euyl lāde hauyng dominaciō many place kyngdome wherfore delyuer y• city ye haue take wt y• trybutes place y• ye haue rule vpon without y• border iewry orels geue v c talentes siluer yee harme ye haue done y• cyties trybutes fyne hundreth talētes shal come fyght agaynst athenobiꝰ kynges frēde came ierusalē sawe great worshyp honour symō golde siluer great plēty ornamentes marueled tolde symon y• king cōmaūded hi answered symon sayd vnto hi •••• •••• v haue nether takē men lādes wthold thē onely father heritage enemy vnrightuously possession certayne tyme herytage oure father haue chalenged processe tyme y• cōplanest cōcerning ioppa gaza gret harme people lāde yet wyl gyue c taletes neuertheles athenobius answered hi one word curned agayne wrothfully vnto kyng tolde al wordes great dignite symon al y• se • ie king angry meane tyme fled triphō shyp vnto orthosaida kyng made cēdebens captayne see coast gaue hi host fote men horsmen cōmaundyng hym remoue host towarde iewry buylde vp y• cyte cedron make vp porte warre people iewes y• king selfe folowed vpon triphō cendebeus came vnto iamnia begāue vexe people treade downe iewry take y• people presoners sley buylde vp • • 16 b cedron let horsmen men warre mygnt come forth go thorowe stretes iewry lyke kyng cōmaunded hym ¶ cendebeus captayne antiochus hooste put flyght sonnes symon ptolomeus 〈◊〉 •• bus hylleth symon two sonnes bancket ihon kylleth lye wayte lyfe capi xvi came thon vp • 13 • gaza told symon father cenoebeꝰ done among people upon called simo • two eldest sōnes iubas ihon said vnto brother father house haue euer frō youth vp vnto daye foughten agaynste enemyes israel god gaue v good fortune delyuer israel oft tymes muche olde ye insteade brother go forth fyght people help god chose xx fightyng men coū tre horsmen also whiche wente forth agaynst cendebeus rested modin mornynge arose went playne feide beholde myghtye great host came agaynst bothe fote men horsmen nowe water broke betwyxt ihon remoued host towarde sawe people afrayed go ouer water broke went ouer fyrst selfe men seinge folowed hym ihon set horimen fote men ordre one y• enemyes horsmen many blew vp prestes trōpettes cendebeus fled host wherof many slayue remnaunt gat theyr strong holde iudas also ihons brother wounded tyme ihon folowed styl vpon enemyes tyll came cedrō • • 15 • whiche buylded enemyes fled also vnto towres feldes azotus dyd ihon burne vp thus slayne • men ihon turned agayne peaceably iewry felde iericho ptolomy sonne abobus made captayne whiche aboundaunce syluer golde maried daughter simō hye prest waxed proude mynde thought conquere lande ymagenyng falshed agaynst symon sone destroye symon goyng aboute thorowe cyties countre iewry caring came downe iericho matathias iudas sonnes clxxvij yere xj moneth called ianuary sabat ptolomy sonne abobus receiued disceyte stronge house hys called doch buylded made bancket symon sonnes mery dronken well ptolomy stode vp men hyd toke weapens entred bancket house slewe symon hys two sonnes certayne seruaunces suche great vnfaythfulnesse dyd ptolomy israel recōpensed euyl good wrote ptolomy vnto kynge antiochus requyryng shulde sende hym host helpe shulde de lyuer hym lanoe cyties trybuces sent • e •• also gaza take ihon w • ot • 〈◊〉 captaynes come hym 〈◊〉 • hul • e gyue syiuer golde rewardes ierusalem sent take 〈◊〉 sanctuary ranne one tolde ihon gaza father brother slayne howe ptolomy ha • se • slepe hym also iohn herde sore frō time forth •• hye prest hys father ❧ ende fyrste booke machabees eee v seconde booke machabees ¶ epystle iewes dwelt ierusalem sente vnto dwelt egypt wherin exhorte geue thankes death antiochus fyre hyd pyt prayer nehemias capi brother iewes ierusalem lande iewry wysh vnto brother iewes thorowe egypte good fortune health peace god gracious vnto thyncke vpon couenaunt made abraham isaac iacob faythfull seruaū te deut xxx • gyue herte ye may loue serue hym yee perfourme wyll whole herte wyll • g mynde open hertes lawe commaundementes sende peace heare prayer one wt neuer forsake tyme trouble prayer tyme demetrius raygned • clxix yeare iewes wrote vnto trouble vyolēce came vnto v yeares iason departed holy lande kyngdome brēt vp porte shed innocent bloude made prayer vnto y• lord herd offred lyghted cādels settyng forth cake bred leui 23 • nowe come ye vnto feast tabernacle moneth nouember casieu the▪ clxxxvii • yeare people ierusalem iewry councell iudas hym selfe sent wholesome salutacyon vnto aristobolus kynge ptolomys maister came generacyō annoynted prestes iewes egypte muche god hath delyuered v greate parels thancke hym hyghlye resysted myghty kynge brought men perses heapes fyght agaynste v holye citie persis namely captayne greate host peryshed temple naneas beynge disceyued thorowe deuyse naneas prestꝭ purposed haue dwelt antiochus hys frendes came thy • hec receyue muche moneye dowry naneas prestes layed forth moneye entred smal company cōpasse temple shut temple nowe whē antiochus entred openyng preuye intraunce tēple prestes stoned captayne death hewed peces hym smote theyr heades threw al thynges god praysed whiche hath delyuered wycked handes nowe purposed kepe puryficacyon temple vpō xxv daye moneth ca • le • thought necessarye certifye therof ye also myght 〈◊〉 num 〈◊〉 3 〈◊〉 kepe tabernacle feast day day fyre geuen v whē nehemias offred set vp y• temple aulter tyme father led away vnto persis prestes sought honour god toke fyre preuely aulter hyd valley depe dry pyt therin kepte place vnknowē euery man nowe many yeares whē pleased god nehemy shuld sent kynge persia 〈◊〉 〈◊〉 • x ••• sent chylders chyldrē prestes whiche hyd fyre seke tolde v founde fyre thycke water commāunded drawe vp bryng hym offringes withal sacrifice layed ordred prest nehemias commaunded sprynkle wod water thys done tyme come sūne shone whiche afore hyd cloude great fyre kyndled muche euery man marueled nowe prestes prayed whyle sacryfyce makynge ionathas prayed fyrst gaue answere nehemias prayer maner lorde god maker al thinges y• feareful stronge thou ryghteous mercyful y• art onely gracious kyng onely liberall onely iust almyghtye euerlastynge thou delyuerest israel trouble thou hast chosen father halowed receyue offeryng whole people israel preserue thyne ownē porcion halowe gather together scarred abrode v delyuer vnder heythens bondage loke vpō despised abhorred heythen maye knowe se howe thou art oure god punyshe oppresse proudely put v dishonoure set thy people agayne thy holy place deu • 〈◊〉 ▪ lyke moyses hath spoken prestes songe psalmes thanckesgeuyng longe sacrifice endured nowe sacrifice brente nehemias commaunded greate stone sprynckled resydue water 〈◊〉 vi 〈◊〉 18 18 • 〈◊〉 48 • whiche done kyndled flamine also consumed thorowe lyght shyned aulter matter knowen tolde kynge persia place prestes whiche led awaye hyd fyre appeared water insteade fyre nehemias hys company puryfied sacrifice wythall kynge consyderynge ponderynge matter diligētly made tē ple proue thynge done founde dede gaue prestes many gyftes dyuers rewardes yee toke hys owne hand gaue thē nehemias called ye place nephthar whiche much saye clensynge many men call nephi ¶ howe ieremy hydde tabernacle arche aulter hyl v bokes iason cont • • ed one capi ii founde also wrytinges ieremy prophete cōmaunded caried away take fire • • • sayd afore iere 29 b 〈◊〉 vi • cōmauded thē also shulde forget law cōmaundemē te lord shulde erre theyr mindes se image siluer golde theyr ornamentes thinges cōmaunded exhorted yt shulde let law god go hertes wrytten also howe prophete commaundement god charged take tabernacle arcke wyth went forth vnto moūtayne moyses clymed vp deut 34 sawe herytage god ieremy came founde open caue wherin layed tabernacle arke y• aulter incense stopped hole came certaine men together also folowyng hym marcke place coulde fynde whiche ieremye perceyued reproued saynge place shalbe vnknowen vntyll tyme god gather people together agayne receyue thē vnto mercy shal god shewe thiges maiestye lorde shall appeare 〈◊〉 〈◊〉 • • 〈◊〉 8 • y• cloude also lyke shewed vnto moyses lyke salomon desyred ye place might sanctifyed shewed beynge wyse man handled honorably wysely offerynge vnto god halowynge temple fynisshed leuit ix lyke whē moses prayed vnto lorde fyre came downe heauē consumed burntofferynge euen prayed salomon also 2 pat 7 fyre came downe heauen cōsumed burnt offerynge moyses sayd siofferynge eaten therfore consumed lyke maner salomon kepte dedycacion halowyng eyght dayes annotacions wrytynges r • de nehemias ieremy thynges put also made lybrary gathered countrees bokes prophetes dauyd epystles kynges presentes euen iudas also loke lerned experyence warre suche thynges hathe happened vnto v gathered together haue v ye nowe desyre haue sende body fetch thē vnto aboute celebrate puryf • cacyon haue written vnto therfore ye shall wel yf ye kepe dayes hope also god whiche delyuered hys people gaue thē al herytage kingdome presthode sanctuary deut xxx • promysed lawe shall shortly haue mercy vpon v gather v together vnder heauen holy place hath saued v great parels hath clensed place concernynge iudas machabeus brother puryfycacyon greate temple dedycacion aulter yee warres concerne noble antio chus • • vi eupator sonne y• shynynges came downe heauen vpon manfully defended iewes thoughe fewe yet defended whole lande droue awaye enemyes host recouered agayne tēple spoken thorowe worlde delyuered cytye doynge theyr best lawe lord whiche put downe myght • ranquylyte restored agayne vnto lorde mercyfull vnto touchynge iason also cyren haue vndertaken compendiously bryng one bok • thinges comprehended hym fyue consyderynge multitude bokes howe harde shulde thē wold medle wt story actes dyuers matter haue vnder takē cōprehend story y• disposed rede myght haue pleasure pastyme therin diligēt thinges myght better thinke vpō yee whosoeuer rede myght haue profyte therby neuertheles selues haue medled matter shortnyng haue taken smal labour great diligē ce watchīges trauayle lyke make feast wolde fayne men pleasure euē also many mēs sake wel cōtent take labour may shortly cōprehende thinges men haue truly wrytten yt buyldeth house newe muste prouyde many thynges y• whole buyldynge paynteth afterwarde seketh onely comly mete cō ueniēt garnysh withall euen also lyke maner begynneth wryte story y• fyrst must vnderstandyng gather matter together set wordes ordre diligently seke euery parte afterwarde wyl shorten vseth wordes toucheth matter y• largiest let thys sufficient prologe nowe wyll begynne shewe matter foolyshe thyng make longe prologe short storye selfe ¶ • honoure done vnto temple kynges gentyles symon vtter teth treasure temple heliodorus sent take awaye strycken god healed prayer •• capi iii tyme holy cytie inhabited al peace wealth lawes yet well kepte ordayned • ia hie prest godly mē enemy wyckednes came therto • math 1 • euen kynges prī ce selues dyd place great worshyp garnyshed temple great gyftes muche seleueus kynge asia owne rente bare al coastes belongyng seruice offrynges • ••• iii simon tribe ben iamin ruler temple laboured worke mischefe cyte hie preste resysted neuerthelesse myght ouercome onias gat 2 mat iii b appollon • u y• sonne thersa chefe lord celosyria phenices tolde hym y• treasury ierusalem ful innumerable money comō goodes whiche belonged vnto offerynges exceadyng great also yee howe possible y• myght come vnder kynges power nowe appolonius shewed kynge money tolde hym king called heliodorus hys stewarde sent commaundement bring hym money immediatly heliodorus toke iourney vnder coloure thoughe wolde go thorowe celosyrya phenices viset city purpose fulfyll kynges pleasure came ierusalem louyngly receyued hye preste cyte tolde determyned cōcernynge money shewed cause cōmyn • asked also yf dede y• hye prest told yt money layed vp vpholdyng wyddowes father lesse chyldrē howe certayne belōged vnto hyrcanus tobias noble mā al money y• wycked simō bewraied iiij c talentes syluer ij c golde ye vnpossibell men meanynge disceyued layed vp theyr money place temple worshippe thorowe y• whole worlde y• mayntaynaū ce honoure vnto heliodorus answered kynge commaunded hym wyse brynge money daye appoynted heliodorus entred temple ordre matter small feare thorowe y• whole cytie prestes fell downe aulter theyr vestymentes called vnto heauen vpon ero • •• made lawe conceruynge stuffe geuen kepe shulde safely preserued cō mytte vnto kepyng loked hye preste face▪ wolde haue greued herte countenaunce chaungynge hys coloure declared inwarde sorowe mynde mā heuynesse body feare wher loked vpon might perceiue grefe hert people also came house heapes vnto comō praier place like come confusion wemē came together thorowe stretes hearrye clothes theyr brestes vyrgyns also kept rāne • ia walles loked wyndowes yee helde vp theyr handes towarde heauen prayed myserable thynge loke vpō comen people hye prest beinge trouble besought almyghty god goodes commytted vnto myghte kepte whole y• delyuered thē vnto theyr kepynge neuertheles thyng heliodorus determyned perfourmed place hym selfe personally beynge treasury wyth hys men warre y• spryte almyghty god shewed selfe openly al presumed obeye helyodorus fell thorow power god great fearfulnesse drede • •• x • 〈◊〉 xi • appeared vnto horse wt terrible man sytting vpon hym deckce goodly araye horse smote heliodorus wt hys fore fete nowe sat vpon horse harnesse golde vpon hym moreouer appeared 〈◊〉 fayre beutyfull yōge men goodly aray stode scourged hym side gaue hym many strypes without ceassinge • •• v • fel heliodorus sodēly vnto grounde toke vp beinge compased aboute wyth great darcknesse bare hym oute vpon bere thus came wyth many runner men warre sayde treasury borne man myght helpe power god manyfest knowne laye styll domme also power god destitute hope lyfe praysed lord shewed power vpō place tēple lytie afore full feare trouble thorow reuelacyon almightie lorde fylled wyth ioye gladnesse thē certaine heliodorus frēdes praied onias hast wolde call vpon god graūte lyfe geuynge vp goost hye prest considered matter lest kyng shuld suspecte iewes done heliodorus euyll offred health offrynge hie prest opteined hys peticion yonge men y• clothyng appeared stode besyde heliodorus saying thancke onias hye prest y• lord •••• 27 • sake hath graūted y• thy lyfe therfore seyng y• god hath scourged geue hym prayse thākes shewe euery man might power whē spokē wordes appeared nomore heliodorus offered vnto god made great vowes vnto graūted lyfe thācked onias toke host went agayne kynge testified vnto euery man great worckes god y• sene eye whē kinge asked heliodorus mete sent yet agayne ierusalem sayde yf thou hast enemy aduersary vnto thy realme sende thyther thou shalt haue punished escape wt lyfe y• place doute speciall power worcking god y• dwelleth ī heauē visiteth wealth whole multitude sawe possible lyue peace nether simon leaue fro folyshnesse except y• kige dyd loke therto deeth seleucus antiochus whiche called y• noble toke y• kyngdome iason brother • ia gotten y• superiorite begāne immediatly drawe k ••• mē custome heathen put downe y• thynges y• iewes set vp loue iohn y• father eupolemtus sent ambassytour vnto rome make y• bōde frē • shippe loue put downe iewes liberty y• iewes set vp wycked statute durst make fighting scole vnder y• castel set fayre yōge mē lerne maners whore brothel beginning heathenysh straunge cōuersacion brought thorow vngracious vnhearde wickednesse iason shulde called prest vngodly persōne much prestes occupied seruyse aulter despised y• tēple regarded offriges yee gaue dilig • ce lerne fight wrastle lepe daūce put y• stone setting honour father lyked glory grekes best al stroue perlously gredy folow statute yee theyr lust al thinges lyke afore theyr enemy destroyer howbeit wickedly agaist law god shal escape vnpunished shal speke time olimpiades sportes played tirus king self bebeing present vngracious iason sent wycked men bearing ierusalem nowe called antiochians iij c drachma syluer offeryng hercules caried desyred vnder fashiō though shulde haue bene offred bestowed v neuertheles yt sent sent intent shulde offred vnto hercules yt present geuen makynge shippes appollonius y• sōne nesteus sēt egipt noble mē king ptolomy phylometor antiochus perceued put medlyng realme sought owne profite departed thēce came ioppa ierusalē honorably receued iasō cite brought wt torche lyght greate prayse turned host vnto phenyces iij yere iason sent menelaus y• foresayde simōs brother 〈◊〉 •• pt • u • 〈◊〉 〈◊〉 beare money vnto y• kyng brynge hym answere necessary matter praysed kyng magnifying power turned y• presthod vnto self layinge vp iij c talentes syluer iason whē gotten cōmanndemetes frō king came hauing nothing becōmeth prest bearyng stomacke cruel tyraūt y• wrath wylde brute beest • • 4 c thē iason disceued • 〈◊〉 owne brother seynge selfe begyled also fayne fle lande amnionites menelaus gat dominiō money ꝓmysed vnto ye kyng dyd nothing therin sostratus ruler castell requyred sostratus y• mā gathered customes wherfore called y• kinge thus menelaus put presthode lysimachus brother came steade sostratus also made lord cypr •• happened meane season tharsians mallaciās made insurreceiō geuen present vnto kyng antiochus cōcubyne came kyng haste styll againe pacifye matter leauyng andronicus debyte one mete therfore menelaus supposing gotten ryght couenyent tyme stole certayne vessel golde temple gaue andronicus present solde tirus city therby onias knew suerty reproued kepte santuary beside daphenis lyeth antioche wherfore menelaus gat hi andronicus prayed y• woldslay onias whā came onias counceled hi craftely come sanctuary geuyng hāde othe suspect hym slew onias without regarde ryghtuousnesse whiche cause iewes nacyōs also toke indignacyon displeased vnryghtuous death godly man kynge come agayne cilicia iewes certaine grekes wente vnto complayninge y• vnryghtuous death onias yee antio chus hym selfe sory hys mynde onias pitied wepte remembrynge hys sobernesse manerly behauoure wherfore kyndled hys minde cōmaūded andronicus striped purple clothing led thorow cite yee y• vngracious man slayne place cōmitted wickednes vpō onias thus lorde rewarded hym punishmēt deserued lysymachus done many wycked dedes temple thorowe councel manelaus voice came abrode multitude gathered together agaynst lysimachus caryed nowe much golde people arose ful displeasure lysymachus armed • ii vnthriftes defende certaine tira • beyng theyr captayne growen bothe age woodnesse people vnderstode purpose lysymachus gat stone good strong clubbes cast ash vpō listmachus thus many thē woūded beynge slayne al chased awaye wycked churchrobber hym selfe killed beside treasury matter therfore kepte courte agaynst manelaus kynge came tirus made cōplaite vnto hym menelaus concernynge busynesse ambassytours thre menelaus wēt promysed ptolomy geue hym much money yf wolde perswade y• king ptolomy wēt king courte set coole hym brought hym ye mynde much ye discharged menelaus accusacyons withstandynge cause myschefe poore men yf tolde theyr cause yee scithiās shuld haue bene iudged innocent condemned death thus soone punyshed whiche folowed vpon matter cite people holy vessel wherfore tyrus toke indignacion •• cied thē honorably thorow couecousnes power manelaus remayned styl auethorite increasing malyce hurt cytesyns ¶ signes toh ••• sene ierusalem ende offēce • asan puri • • • n • ochus iewes • poy • • g • temple capi v tyme antiochus made hi ready go agayne egipt sene ierusale xl dayes long horsmen running fro ayre whithe raiment golde speares sene also whole hoostes men weapened horse running ordre came together howe helde forth theyr shyldes howe harnessed men drewe theyr sweardes shote dartes shyne golde weapens sene maner armure wherfore euery man prayed token might turne good nowe gone forth false rumour though antiochus bene deed iason toke mē came sodenly vpon cytye cytesyns ran vnto walles laste cytye taken manelaus fled castell iason spared hys owne cytesyns slaughter nether consydered greate euel destroye yt prosperite owne kynsmen dyd one gotten victory enemy frendes al gat y• superiorite last receaued cōfusyō malice • • 4 • led againe lyke vagabunde lande ammonytes finally rewarde wickednesse accused aretha kynge arabiās much fa • e fle frō cyte cite despised euery mā forsaker lawes abhomynable persōne last open enemy hys owne natural countre cytesyns dryuen egypte thus afore put many owne natyue land perished home self wēt lacedemon thinckyng haue gotten succour reason kinred afore casten many one vnburyed throwen hym selfe man mournynge hym putting • hys graue nether enioyned buryall straunger nether partaker hys father sepulcre nowe thys done kyng suspecte iewes wolde haue fallen fro hym wherfore came greate dyspleasure egypte • • h • • toke ye cytie vyolence cōmaunded • warre also yt shuld kyl • spare sley downe wt stode climed vp vpō house thus great slaughter yong men oldemen wemen child virgines iii dayes slayne lxxx xl put preson lesse sold yet content wt durst go moste holy temple menelaus traytour y• lawes hys owne
