capi vi long sent king messaunger antioche compel iewes altre ordinaūces y• father law god defile tēple ierusalē call tēple iupiter olimpius shuld ī gazarim dwel place iupiter herberous wicked sedicion vn godly heuy vpon people tēple full voluptuousnes bibbynge bollynge heathen rybaudes harlottes together wemen wente holy place bare laufull aulter also full vnlaufull thynges lawe forbyddeth laye vpon sabbothes kepte y• solēpne feastes lande regarded playne durst mā knowne iewe y• day kinges byrth cōpelled parforce offre y• feast bachus kept constrayned garlandes yuye go aboute y• honoure bachus morouer thorow coūcel ptolomi went cōmaūdement y• next city heathen yt shuld intreate iewes lyke maner namely cōpel sacrifice lawes gentile wolde put death apyteous thing se ij wemen accused haue circumcised theyr sonnes led roūde aboute cyte babe hā gyng brestes cast downe headlīges ouer walles crepte dennes kepte sabboth accused vnto phylyppe brent fyre feare god kepte commaūdement styfly wolde defende selues beseche reade thys boke refuse falles aduersite iudge y• thinges happened destrue cyō chastenyng people god suffreth synners lōge folow owne mynde shortly punysheth pro • 〈◊〉 tokē greate louynge kyndnes thys grace haue god people suffreth v lōg sine vnpunished like nacyons day iudgment cō meth maye punysh fulnes theyr synnes sinne correcteth v neuer withdraweth mercy v though punysh aduersyte yet doth neuer forsake people let thꝭ haue spoken wt wordes warnyng exhortacyon y• heathen wyll come declarynge y• matter eleazar one y• principall scrybes aged man wel fauored conute naunce constrained gape open mouth lou •• x •• eate swynes fleshe desyryng rather dye gloriously lyue shame offred selfe wyllyngly y• martyrdome saw y• must nedes go toke paciētly poynte wyth hym selfe wolde cōsente vnlauful thynge pleasure lyfe y• stode beyng moued pyte ryght olde frend shyppe mā toke hym asyde pryuely prayed hym wolde let suche flesh brought hym lauful eate make countenaunce though eaten flesh sacrifyce lyke kyng cōmaunded might delyuered frō death olde frendshype man shewed hym kyndnes beganne cōsydre hys discrete honorable age hꝭ noble worshypful stock nowe y• hys youth vp bene honest good cōuersacyon yee howe constantly kept ordinaunces lawes cōmaūded god wherfore gaue answere sayd yet rather fyrst layde ī graue 〈◊〉 • • becōmeth myne age sayde wyse dissē ble wherby many yonge personnes myght thynke eleazar beyng • xxx yeare olde x nowe gone straunge lyfe thorow myne ypocrisy lytle tyme transytory lyfe myght disceaued meanes also shulde defyle myne age make abhomynable though nowe deliuered frō tormētes mē yet shulde escape y• hand almyghty 〈◊〉 god nether alyue deed wherfore wil dye māfully becōmeth myne age wherby maye peraduenture leaue exā ple stedfastnes suche yonge yf wt readye mynde māfully dye honest death moste worthy holy lawes sayde wordes immediatly drawē tormente nowe y• led mylde lytle afore beganne take displeasure y• wordes yt sayd thought spokē thē hye mynde whē mariyrdome mourned sayde thou lorde whiche haste holy knowlege knowest openly yt myght delyuered frō death suffre sore paynes body ī minde wel cōtent suffee thē feare thus thys mādyed leauinge y• memorial death exāple vnto yong men vnto y• people stedfast manly ¶ punishmēt the▪ vii brother • mother capi vii happened also vij brother theyr mother taken cōpelled kynge 〈◊〉 xi • agaynst lawe eate swynes flesh namely wt scourge • er • ren whyppes one whiche sayde sekest thou requirest thou v v readye rather suffre death offede lawes god father kynge angrye • ad heate cauldron brasen pottes whiche made hote immediatly cōmaunded tonge hym spake fyrst cut put y• skynne ouer head pare edge handes fete yee y• syght hys mother brethrē nowe cleane marred cōmaunded fyre made whyle breath hym fryed caudron bene longe payned brother theyr mother exhorted dye manfully sayeng lorde god shall regarde trueth • comforte v lyke moses testifyeth • ut 32 c declareth songe sayenge wyll haue compassyon hys seruauntes fyrst deed thys maner brought secōde haue derysyon pulled skynne wt heare ouer heade asked yf wold eat • swynes flesh payned mēbres also thorow bodye answered boldly sayde wyll tormented like fyrst • euen geuyng vp y• gost sayde thou vngracious personne puttest v nowe death y• kyng worlde shall rayse v vp dye hys lawes y• resurreceiō euerlastyng lyfe th • rde derysyon whē requyred put tonge right soone holdyng forth hys bandes manfully spake wt stedfast fayth haue heauē nowe lawe god despyse thē trust yt shall receaue thē hym agayne much yt kynge marueled yong man boldnesse nothynge regarded paynes nowe deed also vexed fourth tornementes lyke maner nowe hys death sayde better y• beynge put death men haue hope trust god shall rayse v vp agayne iohn v c thou shalt haue resurreccyon lyfe spoken fyfth tormented hym thē loked vnto kyng sayd thou hast power among men thou art mortal man also th • self thou wylt thynke god hathe forsaken oure generacion • yde tary styl whyle thou shalt se great power god howe wyl punysh thy sede hym brought syxte beynge poynte death sayde disceaued kynge suffre owne sake haue offē ded god therfore meruelous thinges shewed vpon v thynke thou whiche takest hande stryue agaynste god thou shalt escape vnpunyshed excellent mother worthy well reported remembraūce sawe seuen sonnes dye one day suffred paciently hope god yee exhorted euery one thē especyall boldly stedfastly perfyte wysdome wakynge vp wyuysh thought manly stomacke sayde vnto tel ye came wōbe nether gaue breth soule lyfe y• ioyned mēbres youre bodyes together maker worlde whiche fashyoned byrth man beganne thynges euen also owne mercy shall geue breath lyfe agayne lyke ye nowe regarde youre owne selues hys lawes sake nowe thought antyochus despysed hym therfore let go reproues beganne exhorte yongest sōne yet lefte onely wordes swore vnto hym othe shulde make hym ryche welthy man yf wolde forsake lawes hys father yee shulde geue hym soeuer necessarye hym yonge man wolde moued thynges called hys mother counceled saue sonnes lyfe exhorted many wordes promysed hym shulde speake vnto sonne turned vnto hym laughynge cruell tyraunte scorne spake bolde voyce sonne haue pytie vpō bare ix monethes wombe gaue sucke noryshed brought vp vnto thys age beseche sonne loke vpon heauē earth therin consydre god made man generacyō nought shalt thou feare hang man suffre death stedfastly lyke thy brother haue done y• maye receaue againe mercy thy brother whyle yet speakynge wordes yonge man sayde loke ye wherfore ye tary wyll obeye kynges cōmaundement 〈…〉 〈…〉 lawe god gaue v moses thou ymagyneste myschefe agaynste iewes thou shalte escape hande god suffre thynges oure synnes though god angry v lytle whyle oure chastenynge reformacyon yet shall one agayne seruaūtes thou shameful moste abhomynable personne pryde thy selfe thorowe vayne hope beynge malycyous vpon seruauntes god thou hast yet escaped iudgement god whiche almyghtye seyth thynges brother haue suffred lytle payne nowe vnder couenaū • euerlastynge lyfe thorowe iudgement god thou shalt punyshed righte ously thy pryde lyke brother haue done offce soule body lawes oure father callynge vpon god wyll soone mercyfull vnto oure people yee payne punyshmēt • 〈…〉 make graunte god nowe brother wrath almyghtye god ende whiche ryghteously fallen vpon oure people kynge beynge kyndled anger cruell vpon hym vpon toke indygnacyon lyghtly regarded thys yonge man dyed vndefyled put trust styll lorde last al sōnes mother put death also let nowe ynough spoken concernynge offrynges extreme cruelnesse ¶ iudas gathereth together hys hoost nicanor sent agaynst iudas iudas exhorteth hys soudyars cōstantnes nicanor ouer come iewes geue thākes haue put theyr enemyes flyght dyuidynge spoyles vnto fatherles vnto wydowes nicanor flyeth vnto antiochus capi viii iudas machabeus hym wente pryuely y• townes called theyr kynsfolkes frendes together toke vnto suche contynued yet fayth lawe iewes brought forth vt men called vpon lorde wolde haue eye vnto people whiche trodden downe euery man gracyous vnto temple defyled vngodly haue cōpassyon vpon destruccyon cytie whiche shortly lyke layed waste heare voyce bloude cryed vnto hym remēbre moste vnryghteous deathes yonge innocent chyldren y• blasphemyes also done vnto name punysh • ii nowe machabeus gathered multitude together mightye heathen wrath lorde turned mercy fel vpō y• townes cyties vnwares brent toke commodious place slew many enemyes specyally made suche chase nyght muche hys manlynesse spoken euery phylippe sawe man increased lytle lytle y• matter prospered wt part wrote vnto ptolomy captayne celosyria phenices helpe kynges busynes sent nycanor patroclyma • 3 • speciall frende al halt gaue comen sorte heathen lesse xx harnessed men rote y• whole generacyon iewes hauynge helpe hym one gorgias man warre matter cōcernynge battayls great experiēce nicanor ornened also tribute romaynes shuld haue geuen vnto kinge captyuyte iewes namely ij talētes immediatly sent y• cyties see coast requyrynge bye iewes theyr seruauntes bonde men promisynge sell thē lxxx ten one talente considered y• wrath almyghtye god come vpon hym iudas knewe tolde iewes y• wt nicanors cōming nowe fearfull trustynge vnto ryghteousnes god fled theyr waye y• remayned came together besought lorde delyuer thē wycked nicanor solde thē euer came nye though wolde theyr sake yet couenaūt yt made father called vpon holy glorius name mat v b machabeus called men together namely vj exhortynge agree vnto theyr enemyes deut 20 pa • xx c nether afrayed y• multitude theyr aduersaries cōmynge vuryghteously fyght manly cōsyderynge reprofe y• done y• holy place without cause howe despysed oppressed cytie yee destroyed lawes father 〈◊〉 17 psal xix b sayde trust theyr weapens boldnesse oure confidēce y• almighty lorde whiche twyncklyng eye may destroye y• come agaynst v al worlde exhorted thē also call remēbraūce helpe y• god shewed vnto theyr father 4 reg 19 g esaye 37 1 • 7 c whē perished c lxxxv sennacherib people battayll babylon agaynst gallacyans howe al macedonian yt came helpe thē stode feare vj slew c xx thorow helpe yt geuen thē frō heauen wherby also receaued many benefytes thorowe wordes mē toke good hertes vnto ready dye lawe countre set vpon euery company captayne one owne brother symon ioseph ionathas geuynge eche one xv c men caused esdras also reade holy boke vnto thē geue token helpe god • • hym selfe beynge captayne fore front battayll buckled nicanor god theyr helpe much y• slewe aboue ix men conpelled parte nicanors hoost fle woūded feable thus toke money came bye thē folowed vpon thē euery syde y• tyme came vpon thē returned sabbath therfore folowed nomore vpon thē toke theyr weapens spoyles kepte sabbath geuynge thākes vnto y• lorde whiche delyuered daye shewed mercy sabboth nume 31 1 reg xxx e deut 2 • b distributed spoyles sycke fatherlesse wyddowes resydue selues theyrs done made generall prayer besought mercyfull lorde one seruauntes also timotheus bachides fought slewe xx wanne hye strōge holdes deuyded mo spoyles euer geuynge equal porcyon vnto y• sycke father le wyddowes aged person dylygently gathered theyr weapens together layed cō ueniente place remnaunt spoy le brought ierusalem slewe also phylarches y• wycked personne timotheus vexed many iewes helde thankesgeuyng ierusalem vyctorye brente 〈2 page missing〉 refuge whiche gyuer prosperyte strength vyctory manly stomake whiche captayne warre battayl beyng greate 4 reg 6 • •• • xi appered vnto enemyes frō heauen v men vpō horsbacks brydels golde ledyng iewes two hauyng machabe u betwyxt thē kept hī safe euery syde weapens shot dartes lyght nynges vpō enemy thorow confounded blyndnesse sore afraied yt fell downe staine fore men xx v c vi c horsmen timotheus hi selfe fled vnto gazar stronge holde wherin cereas captayne machabeus company layed sege cherefully iiij dayes nowe y• within trustynge strength y• place cursed bāued excedinge ly made great crakyng wycked wordes neuerthelesse vpon fyft daye mornyng xx yong men machabeus cōpa ny beyng set fyre mindes y• blasphemy came māfully vnto wal bolde stomackes cōpanions clymmed vp vpon towres vndertakyng set fyre vpon porte burne blasphemous personnes quycke two dayes destroyng castell whiche founde timotheus crept corner kylled hi slew cereas brother like maner wt appollo phanes host y• horsmen came agaist iewes thynckyng wynne cytie make habitacion heythen ••••• 〈…〉 temple wolde haue house lucre lyke goddes house heythen sell prestes offyce euery yeare consyderynge power god wylde mynde esay ••• trustyng y• multitude fote men thousandes hors men lxxx elephantes came iewry bethsura castell defence lyinge narowe place v furlonges ierusalem wāne nowe machabe u cōpany knewe stronge holdes taken 〈…〉 fell prayer wepyng teares lord people lyke maner besought hī wolde send good angell delyuer israel machabeus hym selfe fyrst made ready battayl exhortyng ieoparde selues helpe brother goynge forth ierusalem together redy wyllyng mynde • 〈…〉 appeared vpon horsbacke man whyte clothynge wyth harnesse golde shakyng speare praysed lorde together shewed mercy comforted myndes muche ready onely fyght men cruel beastes yee runne thorowe walles yron thus went wyllyngly hauynge helper frō heauen lord mercyful vnto thē fell myghtely vpon enemyes lyke lyon brought downe xi fote men xvj c horsmen put al y• nyght many beyng wounded gat away naked yee lisias selfe fayne fle shamefully escape neuerthelesse y• man without vnderstanding cōsydered hī selfe power mynished pondred howe iewes •• yng defended helpe almighty god able ouercome wherfore sent worde promysed y• wolde consent al thynges reasonable make kyng frende prayer lisias machabeus agreed seking thynges comen wealth whatsoeuer machabeus wrote vnto lysias concernynge iewes kynge graunted letter wrytten vnto iewes frō lysias contaynyng wordes lysias sendeth gretynge people iewes thou absalon sent delyuered wrytynges requyred fulfyl thynges cōcerning theyr earande therfore loke might graunted certifyed kynge therof soeuer cōuement agreed therto ye nowe wyll faythful matter shall endeuour selfe hereafter also good concernynge thynges euery article therof haue cōmitted messaungers sēt vnto comen fare ye well hundreth xlviij yeare xxiiij day moneth discorinthius kinges lettre cōtayned wordes kyng antiochus sendeth gretyng vnto brother lysias muche father • • 〈◊〉 b nowe deade oure wyll oure realine lyue wythout insurreccion euery man diligēt owne matter vnderstand also y• iewes wold consent father brought vnto custome gentyles styfly kepe owne statute whiche cause requyre v also let remayne styll theyr owne lawes wherfore oure mynde y• people shalbe rest haue concluded determyned also restore temple againe may lyue accordyng vse custome theyr fore father thou shalt v pleasure therfore yf thou sēde vnto thē agre certifyed minde may good loke theyr owne wealth letter kynge wrote vnto y• iewes kynge antiochus sendeth gretynge vnto councell y• people y• iewes ye fare well haue desyre v good health menelaus came tolde v howe y• youre desyre come downe youre people whyche v wherfore wyll come gyue fre liberte vnto xxx daye moneth apryl may vse meates iewes theyr owne lawes lyke fore none bp maner way haue harme thynges dene ignoraunce menelaus haue sent vnto shall comen large fare ye wel cxlviij yeare xv day moneth apryl romaynes also sent letter contaynynge wordes quyntus memin • u titus manilius embassitours romaynes sende gretynge vnto people iewes loke lysyas kynges kynsman hath graunted graunt also conceryng thynges whyche referred vnto kynge sende ther spede pondre matter diligently amonge selues may casth beste youre prefyte muste departe nowe vnto antioche therfore wryte shortly agayne y• may knowe mynde fare well hundreth xiviij yere fyftenth daye moneth apryll ¶ timotheus troubleth iewes wyther dede iepites agaynst iewes iudas auenged 〈◊〉 setteth fyre gate 〈…〉 pursure iewes agaynst tymothy tymothy taken 〈…〉 go vnhurte iudas pursueth gorgyas iudas sacryfyes deade sheweth hope resur •••• yon capi xii couenauntes • e lysias went vnto kynge iewes tylled grounde timotheus appollonius sonne • eme • ieromy demophon proude 〈◊〉 ca • captayne cipers thatsay place wold let lyue rest peace ioppa also euen shamefull dede prayed iewes y• dwelt amonge go wyth wyues chyldren shyppes whiche prepared dyd though ought thē euyl wyl much gone forth general proclamacyon thorow cyte peace consented therto suspecte nothyng gone forth depe drowned lesse two hundreth iudas knew cruelte shewed vnto people commaunded hī make ready exhortyng cal vpon god ryghtuous iudge went forth agaynst murtherers hys brother set fyre hauē nyght brente vp shyppes escaped fyre slewe swearde done thys departed though wolde come agayne rote ioppa gottē worde iānites mynded lyke maner vnto y• iewes dwelt amonge thē came vpon iamnites nyght set fyre hauen wyth shyppes lyght fyre sene ierusalem vpon ij c xl furlonges nowe gone thence ix furlonges iourney towarde tymotheus v mē fote v c horsmē arabian fought wt y• battel earnest prospered iudas thorowe helpe god resydue arabian ouercome besought iudas one wt promysed gyue certaine pasture hī good thī ge iudas thynking shuld dede profytable concernynge many thynges promysed peace wherupon shoke handes departed tentes iudas wente also vnto cytie whiche faste kepte brydges fensed roūde aboute walles dyuerse kyndes people dwellynge therin called caspin within put suche truste strength walles stoare vitayles slacker ī theyr doynges cursynge reuylynge iudas wt blasphemyes speakynge suche wordes becommeth machabeus callynge vpon greate prynce worlde whiche without battayle rāmes ordinaūce warre dyd iosue vi c cast downe walles iericho tyme iosue fell māfully vpon walles toke cytie thorowe helpe lorde made exceadynge greate slaughter much y• lake two furlonges brode laye therby semed flowe wyth bloude slayne departed thence vij c fourlonges came taraca vnto iewes called tubianei timotheus coulde get one matter dispatched departed thence lefte certayne men stronge holde dositheus sosipater captaynes machabeus stewe y• timotheus lefte house defence euen x men machabeus prepared hym vj men y• aboute set ordre companyes went forth agaynst timotheus c xx men fote ij v c horsmen timotheus knowledge iudas cōmynge sent y• woman child baggage vnto castel called carnion coulde wōne hard come vnto wayes place narow iudas cōpany came first syght y• enemyes smytten wyth feare thorowe presence god whyche seyth thynges muche y• fleyng one another rather dyscōfyted theyr owne people iudi vi • 1 reg • 2 pa • • ▪ woūded wt y• stroke owne sweardes iudas also earnest folowynge vpon punishyng vngodly slewe xxx mē thē timotheus also hym selfe fel hādes dositheus sosipater whō besought many teares let hym go life many iewes father brethrē prison put hī death myght dysapoynted promysed faythfully delyuer agayne according cōdiciō made let go without harme health brother iudas slayne xxv went carmon y• chased away slayne enemy remoued hoste towarde math • ephrom strong cytie wherin dwelt many diuerse people heythen stronge yong men kepte walles defendyng myghtely cytie much ordynaū ce prouision dartes iudas cōpany called vpon almyghtye god whiche wyth power breaketh strength enemyes wāne cytie slewe xxv thē y• within frō thence wente cytie scithyans whiche lyeth vi c furlonges ierusalē iewes whiche citie testyfied cytesyns dealte louyngely yee intreated kyndely tyme aduersyte iudas company gaue thanckes desyrynge frēdly styll vnto came ierusalem hye feaste wekes beynge hande feast pentecost went forth agaynste gorgias gouernoure idumea wyth iij men fote iiij c horsmen met together chaunsed fewe y• iewes slayne dositheus one y• bachenors mighty horsmā toke holde gorgias wolde haue takē hī quycke horsman thracia fell vpon hym smote arme y• gorgias escaped fled moresa nowe y• gorgias syde foughten longe weary iudas called vpō lorde wolde helper captayne felde wyth beganue wyth manly voice take vp song prayse cry muche y• made enemyes afrayed gorgias mē warre toke flyght iudas gathered host came y• cite odolla seuenth day came vpō clēsed selues custome kept sabboth place vpon day folowyng iudas cōpany came take vp bodyes thē slaine bury father graues nowe vnder cote certayne iewes slayne foūde iewels taken tēple frō idol deut vii • • osu vii iamniters whiche thyng forbydden iewes law euery man saw yt cause wherfore slaine euery mā gaue thanckes vnto y• lorde hys ryghtuous iudgment opened y• thing hyd fell downe also vnto prayer besought god yt fawte made might put remē braūce besydes iudas exhorted y• people earnestly kepe selues synne much sawe theyr eye y• men slaine offēce gathered euery one certaine much y• brought together two thousande drachma syluer sent vnto ierusalē myght sacryfice offred misdede place dyd wel ryght consyderacion pondering y• lyfe tyme yf thought slayne dyd yet lyue bene superfluous vaine make vow sacryfice y• deed muche saw y• dye ī fauour beleue god good rest ioy thought good honorable recō cylyng slayne offence myght forgeuen ¶ cōming enpater iewrye deth menel mo▪ machabeus goynge fyght eupater moneth soudrats vnto prayer kylleth xiiii woman tētes antiochus robocus betraier iewes taken antiochus retayneth frendshipe iewes capi xiii y• cxlix yeare gat mat vi iudas knowlege y• antiochus eupater cōming great power iewry lisias stewarde ruler matter hym hauing c x men fote v horsmen xxij elephātes iii c charettes menelaus also ioyned himselfe great disceat spake faire kīge good y• coūcre thought haue bene made great mā auctoryte y• kyng kinges moued antiochus mynde agaynst thys vngodly personne lysias infourmed kyng ii mat 4 • thys menelaus cause myschefe king commaunded take maner put vnto death place also place tower l cubites hye heapped asshes aboue made men might loke downe euery syde kinge cōmaunded shameful person cast among asshes one cause vngraciousnes reason vnthrift shuld dye death buried done much mischefe vnto aulter god whose fyre asshes holy therfore ryght y• hym selfe also shulde destroyed wyth asshes y• kynge wood hys mynde came shewe self cruell vnto iewes hys father whiche iudas perceaued 2 mat 19 • cōmaūded people cal vpon y• lorde night day wold helpe thē also lyke done alwaye afrayed put theyr lawe theyr naturall countre holy temple suffre people lytle afore beganne recouer subdued agayne blasphemous nacions done thys together besought lord mercy wepynge fastynge thre dayes longe flat vpon groūde iudas exhorted make selues ready elder together deuised go forth first theyre people afore kynge brought hys hoost iewry afore beseged cytie cōmytte matter vnto god wherfore ascrybed power thynges vnto god maker y• worlde exhorting people fyght māfully yee euen vnto death lawes temple cyte theyr owne natyue countre defende eytesins set host modyn gaue also token victory god chosyng mālyest yonge men wente night kynges pauylyō slewe hoost xiiii men 1 mac vi f greatest elephantes wyth sat vpon thus brought greate feare rumour amōge tētes theyr enemyes thynges wente prosperously thē departed breake day god deyng theyr helper defender whē kynge perceaued manlynesse iewes went take ye strōge place craft remoued hooste • mat xi • vnto bethsura whiche well kepte house defence iewes chaced away hurte disconfyted iudas sent vnto thē thynges necessary ye iewes host also one rhodocus tolde enemy secretes sought whē gottē put preson ye king comen bethsura toke truce departed stroke battayl wyth iudas ouercame vnderstode phylyp left ouerseer business antioch begāne rebel astōnyed mynde yt yelded selfe iewes made othe whatsoeuer thought ryght whē reconcyled wt thē offred made much ye tēple gaue greate gyftes vnto enbraced machabeus makynge captayne gouernour frō ptolomais vnto garenes neuerthelesse came ptolomays ye people cytie content bonde frendshype afraied wolde breake couenaūt wente lysias vp seate enfourmed people shewed thē cause pacifyed thē came agayne antioche thys matter cōcernyng kynges iourney returne ¶ mocyon lord demetrins sēdeth nicanor kil iewes nicanor maketh cōpare • iewes yet breaketh mocyon king nicanor cōmaūdeth r • aia takē boldnes razia capi xiiii thre yeares iudas infourmed demetrius sōne seleucus come vp wt greate power shyppes thorowe hauen tripoli take certayne commodyous place coū tree antiochus captayne lysias alcimus bene hye prest wylfully defyled self ye tyme myxtyng seing meanes could helped haue intraūce y• aultare came king demetrius hūdreth one fyftye yeare presentyng vnto hym crowne golde palme olyue tree men thought belōged temple daye helde tong gotten oportunyte madnesse demetrius called hym coūcel asked hym thinges coūcels iewes leaned vnto answered iewes y• called assidei whose captayne iudas machabeus maintaine warres make insurreceyons wyl let realme inpeace beynge depryued father honoure meane hye presthode come hyther partly faithful vnto kynge partly sought profyt cytesyns oure people thorow wickednesse litle troubled wherfore beseche kynge consydre thynges dylygently make prouysion ye lande people according kindnesse thou hast offred vnto thē lōge iudas hath vpperhāde possible men lyue peace spoken wordes frendes also hauynge euyll wyll iudas set kynge demetrius fyre agaynste hī • •• ▪ • ▪ immediatly sent nicanor ruler elephātes captayne iewrye cōmaundinge take iudas selfe alyue staye thē make alcimus hye prest ye great tēple heathen whiche fled oute iewry frō iudas came nicanor flockes thinckynge harme decay iewes theyr welfare nowe iewes herde nicanors commynge gatheryng together heathē spr • ckled thē selues earth 2 •• 〈◊〉 sought hym whiche made hys people euer defended hys owne porcion euydēt token wolde preserue styll commaundemēt captayne remoued thence came towne called dessason symō iudas brother fel ī hāde wt nicanor thorow ye sodayne commyng enemyes afrayed neuertheles nicanor hearynge manlynes wyth iudas bolde stomackes fyght theyr naturall countre durst proue matter wyth bloudsheddynge wherfore sent possidonius theodocius mathias geue take peace taken long aduisement vpō captaine shewed vnto multytude agreed one minde haue peace appointed day sit vpon mater quyecly amonge selues stole also brought set forth neuerthelesse iudas commaūded certaine men armes wayte co • enient place lest shulde sodenly aryse euyl thorow enemyes cōmoned reasonably together nycanor whyle abode ierusalē ordred selfe vnreasonably sent away people yt gathered together loued iudas euer hert fauoured prayed also take wyfe brīge forth child maryed lyued ī rest led comen lyfe alcimus p • eceauyng ye loue betwyxte agreed together came demetrius told nycanor taken straūge matter ī hāde ordened iudas enemy ye realme kīges successour king sore displeased thorowe ye wycked accusacions whiche alcimus made nicanor prouoked wrote vnto nycanor saying angrie frēdship agremēt whiche made wt machabeus neuertheles cōmaūded hī al hast shuld take machabeus presoner sēde antioche letter nicanor sene • ꝭ wyttes ende sore greued yt shuld breke thynges wherin agreed specially seing machabeus ye mā yt neuer dyd harme myght wt stande kyng sought oportunyte fulfyl cōmaundemēt withstādinge machabeus sawe y• nicanor beganne churlysh vnto yt intreated hī rughly thē wont perceaued yt vnkyndnes came good therfore gathered fewe hys men wythdrew selfe frō nicanor knewe yt machabeus bad manfully preuented came y• great holy tē ple cōmaūded prestes doinge vsual offringes delyuer y• mā whē sware yt could tel ye mā whō sought stretched hāde • ▪ mat 7 • made othe saying ye wyl delyuer iudas captyue shal remoue tēple god ī ye plaine felde shall breake downe aulter cōsecrate tēple vnto bachus wordes departed thē prestes lyft vp hā de towarde heauē sought hym yt euer ye defēder people saying thou lord al hast nede nothynge woldest yt tēple thy habitacion shulde amōge v therfore mooste holy lorde kepe thys house euer vndefyled • mat 4 • • 〈◊〉 x lately clensed nowe accused vnto nicanor one razi • alderman ierusalē louer whole • p ••• man good reporte y• kynde hert yt bare vnto people called father ye iewes mā oft tymes whē iewes mynded kepe thē selues vndefiled defēded delyuered thē cō tent stedfastly spende body hys lyfe people nicanor wyllyng declare y• hate yt bare iewes set fyue hundreth men warre take hym thought yf gat hym shulde brynge iewes great decay nowe people beganne rush hꝭ house breake dores set fyre beynge nowe taken wolde haue defended selfe hys swearde chosynge rather dye manfully yelde selfe wicked doer noble stocke rather haue bene put extreme cruelte withstanding tyme myssed hys stroke hast multytude • el inviolētly betwixte dores ranne boldly wall cast selfe downe manfully among heape gaue • e place fall fel vpon hys bely neuerthelesse whyle yet breth wythin kyndled mynde whyle bloude gusshed exceadīgly sore woūded ranne thorow myddest people gat hym toppe rocke bloude nowe gone toke owne bowel hādes threw thē vpon ye people callyng vpō ye lord lyfe spryte rewarde agayne died ¶ nicanor goeth aboute come vpon iudas 〈◊〉 day blasphemy nicanor machabeus expoū dyng vnto iewes visyō ••• deneth theyr h • ries prayer machabeus host nicanor one ouercome▪ machabeus commaunoeth h •• handes • u • tonge geuen vnto fowles capi xv nowe • •• 7 • nicanor knewe ye iudas countre samaria thought wt al power stryke felde wt vpon sabboth daye neuertheles iewes yt cōpelled go wt sayde cruelly vnkyndly halow sabboth daye worshype hym seyth thynges thys yet saide vngracyous personne 3 reg xx • myghty one heauē cōmaūded sabboth daye kepte sayde yee lyuynge god myghtye lorde heauen exod xx • commaunded seuenth daye kept sayd mighty vpō earth commaūde arme themselues perfourme kynges busynesse notwtstādyng myght haue purpose nicanor deuysed great pride ouercome iudas bring away vyctory machabeus euer fast confydence perfect hope god wolde helpe exhorted people afrayed cōming heathen alway remēbre helpe bene shewed vnto thē frō heauē yee sure also almyghtye god wolde geue vyctory spake vnto law prophetes putting thē remēbraūce battayls striken afore made good corage theyr harte plucte vp shewed also disceatfulnesse heathen wolde kepe couenaūt othe thus weapened nat wyth armoure shylde speare wt wholsome wordes exhortacyōs shewed thē dreame also wherthorow made al glad whiche thys thought sawe onias whiche bene hye prest vertuous louing man sad honest cōuersacion wel spoken one bene exercysed godlynes chylde holdyng vp handes towarde heauen praying people ther apeared vnto hī another man aged honorable glorious onias sayde louer brother people israell praieth much people al ye holy cite ieremy prophet god thought also ieremy helde ryght hāde gaue vnto iudas swearde gold saying take thꝭ holy swear • gyft frō god wherwith thou shalt smyte downe enemyes people israel wel cōforted thorow wordes iudas toke corage vnto yōgemen determyned theyr myndes fyghte byde styfly much yt ī thīges toke hande boldnesse shewed ye holy cytie temple parell toke care theyr wyues chyldren brethrē kynsfolckes againe 〈◊〉 careful fight nowe al hope iudgmēt matter hāde enemyes drew nye host beyng set ī aray ye elephātes horsmen euery one stā dyng hys place machabeus consydered cōming multytude ye ordynaunce diuerse weapēs cruelnes ye beestes helde vp handes towarde heauen calling vpon lord yt doth wōders • para 14 iudi vii b geueth n •• 〈◊〉 〈◊〉 multytude weapon power host please according owne wyl therfore hys prayer sayde wordes lorde 4 〈◊〉 〈◊〉 〈◊〉 〈◊〉 ii 〈◊〉 thou y• dyddest sende thyne angell tyme ez • kyah kyng iuda hoste sennaherib slewest hūdreth foure score fiue thousāde sende also thy good angell v lord heauens fearfulnesse drede thy myghtye arme come thy holy people blaspheme maye afrayed made ende wordes thē nicanor wyth hym drewe nye wyth shawmes sōges iudas copany praier callynge vpon god theyr handes smote wt theyr hertes prayed vnto lorde slewe lesse xxxv mē thorow present helpe god gloriously comforted left turning againe wt ioy vnderstode nicanor hym selfe slayne gaue great shoute crye praysynge almighty lord wt loude voyce iudas euer ready spende body lyfe hꝭ cyte • īs cōmaūded smyte nycanors heade arme hande brought ierusalē came called al people prestes ye aulter castel shewed thē nicanors head wicked hāde presūtuously holden vp agaīst ye tēple god caused ye tong also ye vngodly nicanor cut ī litle peces cast ye foules cruel mās hāde hāged vp tēple euery mā gaue thākes vnto lord saing blessed yt hath kept place vndefyled nicanors head hāged vp vpon hie castell euydent playne token helpe god agreed al together kepe ye day holy namely xiij day ye moneth adar y• siriās language called nexte day mardocheus dauid vnto captiuite babilon fourtene generacions captiuite babilon vnto chryst x • iii generacyons byrthe iesus chryst wyse ✚ mother mary maryed ioseph came dwel togyther founde chylde holy goost ioseph husbande bycause ryghteous • wolde put shame mynded priuely departe whyle thus thought beholde angell lorde appeared vnto hym slepe sayenge ioseph thou sonne dauid feare take vnto mary thy wyfe whiche conceyued cometh holy goost shall brynge forth sonne thou shalt cal name philip ii b • ctes iiii b iesus shall saue people thyr synnes done myght fulfyl led whiche spoken lorde prophet sayenge esai • ii c behold mayde shal chylde shall brynge forth sonne shal call name emanuel yf man interprete asmoche saye god v ⊢ ioseph soone awoke slepe dyd angell lorde bydden hym toke wyfe vnto hym knewe tyll brought forth luke • • ☞ fyrst begotten sonne called name iesus ¶ tyme place chrystes byrth wyse men offer theyr presente • chryst fleeth egypt yonge chyldren sleyne chryst turneth gal • le capi ii ✚ iesus borne bethleem citye iury tyme herode kyng behold came wysemen east iurusalem sayenge borne kynge iues▪ haue sene nu xxiii • • sterre east come worshyp hym herode kynge herde thynges troubled al citye ierusalem hym gathered cheyfe preestes scrybes people togyther demaunded chryst shulde borne sayde vnto hym bethleem iury thus wrytten prophet ☞ mith • • • thou bethleem land iuda arte least amonge prynces iuda iohsi vii • shall come vnto captayne shall gouerne people israell herode priuely called wysemen enquyred diligently▪ tyme sterre appeared bad go bethleem sayde go youre waye thyther searche dilygently chylde ye haue found bryng worde agayne maye come worshyp hym also ✚ herde kynge departed lo sterre sawe east went tyll came stode ouer place wherin chylde sawe sterre excedynge glad went house founde chylde mary mother psal 72 b • sai lx • fell downe flat worshypped hym opened theyr treasure offered vnto hym gyftes golde frankynsence myrte warned god slepe shulde go agayne herode returned theyr owne countrey another waye ⊢ departed beholde angel lorde appeared ioseph slepe sayeng aryse take chyld mother flee egypt thou tyll brynge worde wyll come passe herode shal seke chylde destroye hym awoke toke chylde mother nyght departed egypte vnto death herode might fulfylled whiche spoken lorde prophet sayeng osee xi • nu xxiiii e egypt haue called sonne herode sawe mocked wyse men excedynge wroth sent forth men warre slue chyldren bethleem coostes many two yere olde vnder accordynge tyme diligently knowen wyse men fulfylled whiche spoken prophet ieremy sayde rama voyce herde •••• xxxi c lamentacyon wepynge great mournynge rachell wepynge chyldren wolde conforted ☞ bycause ⊢ herode deade behold ✚ angell lorde appeared slepe ioseph egypte sayenge aryse take chylde mother go lande israell exodi iiii • deade sought chyldes lyfe arose toke chyld mother came lande israel herde archelaus dyd reygne iury rowme father herode afrayde go thyther notwithstandynge warned god slepe turned asyde partyes galile went dwelte citye called nazareth myght fulfylled whiche spoken prophettes shall called nazarite ⊢ ¶ baptym preachynge offyce iohn̄ chryst baptysed hym iordane capi iii ✚ dayes came iohn̄ marke • luke iii • iohn̄ iii baptyst preachyng wylnernesse iury sayenge mat iiii • ☞ repente lyfe past kyngdome heuen hande iohn̄ b whome prophet esay spake whiche sayeth esai x • voyce cryer wyldernesse prepare ye waye lorde make pathes streyght iohn̄ garment camel heer 4 18 b gyrdell skyn aboute loynes marke • meate locustes reg 14 wylde hony went hym ierusalem iury regyon rounde aboute iordane baptysed hym iordan confessyng theyr synnes ⊢ ✚ sawe many pharises saduces come baptyme sayde vnto luke iii • ▪ generacyon vypers hath taught flee vengeaunce come bryng forth therfore frutes longe repentaunce soch mynde ye wold say within yourselues haue abraham father saye vnto god able brynge passe stone shal ryse vp chyldren vnto abraham euen nowe also put vnto rote tree mat vii • luke iii b euery tree whiche bryngeth forth good fruyte hewen downe cast fyre baptise water marke • luke iii c iohn̄ vnto repentaūce shall come myghtyer whose shoe worthy beare shall baptyse holy gooste fyre luke iii whose fan hand wyll pourge floore gather wheat barne wyl burne chaffe vnquencheable fyre ⊢ ✚ cometh iesus galile iordane vnto iohn̄ marke • baptysed hym iohn̄ forbad hym saynge haue nede baptised comest thou iesus answered sayde vnto hym let nowe thus becometh v fulfyll ryghtewysenesse suffered iesus baptised came streyght waye water lo marke • luke iii d▪ iohn̄ • heuen open vnto sawe spiryte god descendynge lyke doue lyghtynge vpon hym lo came voyce heuen sayenge esai xiii • mat xvii b mathe b luke iii ii p ••• • beloued sonne whome well pleased▪ ⊢ ¶ chryst fasteth tempted calleth peter androwe iames iohn̄ healeth sycke capi iiii ✚ iesus mathe b luke iiii b led awaye spiryte wyldernesse tempted deuyll fasted xl dayes xl nyghtes last hūgred tempter came sayde yf thou son god cōmaund stone made bread answered sayd wrytten deute • • ▪ luke iiii depi xvi e man shall lyue breade euery worde procedeth mouth god deuyl taketh hym vp holy citye setteth hym pynacle temple sayeth vnto hym yf thou sonne god cast thy selfe downe headlyng wrytten psal 92 • shall gyue angel charge ouer theyr handes shall holde vp leest tyme thou dasshe thy fote agaynst stone iesus sayde hym wrytten agayne deute vi • luke iiii b thou shalte tempt lorde thy god agayne deuyll taketh hym vp excedyng hygh moūtayne sheweth kyngdomes worlde glory sayeth vnto hym wyll gyue yf thou wylt fall downe worshyp sayeth iesus vnto hym auoyde satan wryten deute vi c x luke iiii b reg vii▪ thou shalte worshyp lorde thy god shalt thou serue deuyl leaueth hym behold mark b angel came minystred vnto hym ⊢ ✚ iesus herde marke b iohn taken departed galile lefte nazareth went dwelte capernaum whiche citye vpon see coost border zabulon neptalim myght fulfylled whiche spoken esay prophet sayenge esai ix lande zabulon nephtalim waye see beyonde iordane galile gentyls people whiche sat darkenesse shadowe death sawe great lyght whiche sat regyon shadow death lyght spronge vp tyme iesus began math iii marke preache saye mark math iii▪ repent kyngdome heuen hande ⊢ ✚ mar b iesus walked see galilee sawe two brother simon whiche called peter andrewe brother castyng net see fysshers sayeth vnto folowe wyll make ❀ become iere xvi b ezech 47 b fysshers men streyght waye lefte nettes folowed hym gone forth thence sawe two brother iames son zebede iohn̄ brother shyp zebede theyr father mendynge theyr nettes called immediatly luke v b lette shyp theyr father folowed hym ⊢ ✚ iesus went aboute galile teachynge theyr synagoges preachynge gospell kyngdom healynge al maner sycknesse maner dysease amonge people fame spred abrode thorowout siria brought vnto sycke people taken dyuers dyseases grypynges possessed deuyls whiche lunatyke palsey healed folowed hym great multitude people galile ⊢ ten cityes ierusalem iury regyons lye beyond iordane ¶ chapyter nexte folowyng conteyned excellent louyng sermon chryst moūe whiche sermon heye openeth vnderstandynge lawe • • th chupiter specially preacheth viii bearitudes blessynges manslaughter wrath anger aduoutrey 〈◊〉 〈◊〉 ferynge wronge loue euen towarde • man enemyes capi v sawe people went vp mountayne see discyples came hym opened mouth taught sayenge luke vi blessed poore spiryte theyrs kyngdome heuen esai 66 • blessed mourne shall receyue comforte blessed meke shall receyue inherytaunce earth blessed whiche iere xxx • hunger thyrst ryghtwysenesse shall satisfyed blessed mercyfull shall obteyne mercy blessed pure herte shall se god blessed peace maker shall called chyldren god blessed whiche suffer persecucyon ryghtwysenesse sake theyrs kyngdome heuen peter 〈◊〉 iii c • iiii blessed ye men reuyle pesecutē shal falsely saye al maner euyll sayenges agaynst sake actes v • reioyse glad great rewarde heuen ⊢ persecuted prophettes whiche ✚ ye salte earth mark ix luke xiii leu iii ii yf salte haue lost saltnesse shalbe seasoned therwith thence forth good nothynge cast troden downe men ye lyght world citye set hyll hyd mar iii • luke • xi • neyther men lyght candell put vnder busshell candelstycke gyueth lyght vnto al house let youre lyght shyne men ••••• ii • maye se good workes glorify father whiche heuen ⊢ ✚ thynke come destroye law prophettes come destroye • th 〈◊〉 • fulfyll truely say vnto • e 〈◊〉 • xl • tyll heuen earth passe one iote one tytle lawe shall scape tyll fulfylled whosoeuer therfore breaketh • • b • 38 b one least cōmaundementes teacheth men shall called leaste kyngdome heuen whosoeuer doeth teacheth shalbe called great kyngdome heuen ⊢ ✚ saye vnto excepte ryghteousnes excede ryghteousnes scrybes pharises ye enter kyngdom heuen ye haue herde sayde vnto olde tyme •• 〈◊〉 c 〈◊〉 • • c • 8 thou shalt kyll whosoeuer kylleth shall daunger iudgement saye vnto whosoeuer angrye brother vnaduysedly shall daunger iudgement whosoeuer sayth vnto brother ☞ racha shal daunger coūsayle whosoeuer sayeth thou foole shall daunger hell fyre therfore yf thou offerest thy gyfte aulter remēbrest thy brother hath ought agaynst leaue thyne offerynge aulter • iii • go thy waye fyrst reconcyled thy brother come offer thy gyfte ⊢ ✚ • xii • agre thyne aduersary quycklye whyles thou arte waye hym leest anye tyme aduersarye delyuer iudge iudge delyuer mynyster thou cast pryson uerely saye vnto thou shalte come thence tyll thou haue payed vttermooste farthynge ye haue herde sayd olde tyme ••• • xiii • thou shalt cōmyt aduoutrye say vnto 〈◊〉 • xxi • whosoeuer loketh another man wyfe luste hath cōmytted aduoutrye redy herte • 〈◊〉 • yf thy ryght eye hynder ☞ plucke hym cast hym better vnto one thy member perysshe thy hole body shulde cast hell yf thy ryght hande hynder cut hym caste hym better vnto one thy member perysshe thy body shulde cast hell ⊢ sayde whosoeuer putteth awaye wyfe •• • • • let hym gyue letter deuorcement math 〈◊〉 marke • • say vnto soeuer dothe put awaye wyfe excepte forninacyon causeth breake matrymony whosoeuer maryeth deuorsed cōmytteth aduoutrye agayne ye haue herde howe sayde olde tyme leuiti 〈◊〉 • thou shalte forsweare thy selfe shalte perfourme vnto lorde thynges thou swearest iames v v saye vnto sweare neyther heuen esai 66 • mat xxiii • goddꝭ seate earth fote stole neyther ierusalem citye great kynge neyther shalt thou sweare thy heade bycause thou canst make one heere whyte blacke cōmunicacion shalbe yea yea nay nay soeuer added cōmeth euyll ye haue herde sayde exodi x •• • deut xix leuiti 24 eye eye toth toth saye vnto ye ☞ resyst euyll luke v • • soeuer gyueth blow ryght cheke turne hym also yf man wyll sue lawe take waye thy cote let hym haue thy cloke also whosoeuer wyll compell go myle go twayne gyue asketh hym wolde borow turne thou awaye ✚ ye haue herde sayde leuti x •• • mat xxii • thou shalt loue thyne neyghbour hate thyne enemye say vnto loue enemyes rom 〈◊〉 • blesse curse leuit xix good hate praye whiche hurte persecute ye maye chyldren father whiche heuen maketh sonne aryse euyll good sendeth rayne iust vniuste luke vi • yf loue whiche loue rewarde haue ye publican also euen yf ye make moch brother onlye singuler thyng ye also publican lyke wyse leuit xix ye shal therfore perfyte euen father heuen perfyte ⊢ ¶ almesse prayer fastynge forbyddeth carefulnes worldly thynges capi vi ✚ take hede ye giue almesse syght men intent ye wolde sene el ye haue rewarde father whiche heuen therfore thou gyuest thyne almesse let trompettes blowen ypocrytes synagoges stretes praysed men uerely saye vnto haue theyr rewarde thou wylte gyue almesse let thy lefte hande knowe thy ryght hande doth thyne almesse maye secrete thy father seeth secrete shal rewarde openly ⊢ thou prayest 3 reg 18 c esai xxix thou shalt ypocrytes vse stand prayeng synagoges cornors stretes may sene men uerely saye vnto haue theyr rewarde thou prayest 4 reg 4 f enter thy chamber thou hast shut thy dore praye thy father whiche secrete thy father whiche seeth secrete shall rewarde openly ye pray esai • bable moch heathen thynke wyll come passe shall herde theyr moch bablynges sake ye therfore lyke vnto rom 8 youre father knoweth thyngꝭ ye haue nede ye aske maner therfore praye ye luke xi father whiche arte heuen halowed thy name thy kyngdom come thy wyll done well earth heuen gyue v daye dayly bread forgyue v oure ☞ dettes forgyue oure detters leade v temptacion delyuer v euyll thyne kyngdome power glorye foreuer amen therfore mat viii mark xi yf ye forgyue men theyr trespass heuēly father shal forgyue ❀ trespass yf ye wyll forgyue men theyr trespass shal father forgyue trespass ✚ moreouer esai 58 mat ix b iere xvii b ye fast sad ypocrites disfigure theyr face maye appeare vnto men fast uerely saye vnto haue theyr rewarde thou thou fastest anoynt thyne heade washe thy face appeare vnto men howe thou fastest vnto thy father whiche secrete thy father seeth secrete shal rewarde openly laye vp youre selues treasure vpon earth rust moth dothe corrupte theues breake steale luke x • eccle xxii b laye vp treasure heuen neyther rust moth dothe corrupte theues breake thorowe steale youre treasure wyll herte also ⊢ luke xi c lyght body eye wherfore yf thyne eye syngle thy body shalbe ful lyght yf thyne eye wycked al thy body shall full darkenesse wherfore yf lyght darkenesse howe great darkenesse ✚ luke xvi c man serue two maysters eyther shall hate one loue el leane one despise ye serue god mammon therfore say vnto luke xii c psal • v 1 peter v c careful lyfe ye shal eate dryncke yet body rayment ye shall put lyfe worth meate body value rayment beholde foules ayer sowe neyther reape cary barnes heuenly father fedeth ye moche better luke xii whiche takynge carefull thought adde one cubyt vnto stature care ye raymente consydre lilyes felde howe growe laboure neyther spynne yet saye vnto euen salomon royalte arayed lyke vnto one wherfore yf god clothe grasse felde whiche though stande daye morowe cast fournace shal moch ye lytie fayth therfore take thought sayenge shal eate shal drynke wher shall clothed al thynges gentyls seke heuenly father knoweth ye haue nede thynges rather seke ye fyrst kyngdome god ryght wyse •• else therof al thynges shall minystred vnto ⊢ care morowe morowe daye shall care selfe sufficient vnto daye trauayle therof ¶ forbyddeth folysshe rasshe iudgement reproueth ypocrisye exhorteth vnto prayer warneth beware false prophet wylleth hearer worde doer capi vii luke v • • urge ye iudged ❀ condemne ye shall condemned rom ii ye iudge shall ye iudged luke vi • luke vi • measure ye meate shall men measure luke vi • seest thou thy brother eye cō syderest beame thyne owne eye howe sayest thou thy brother brother suffer wyll plucke thyne eye behold beame thyne owne eye thou ypocrite fyrste cast beame thyne owne eye shalte thou se clearly plucke thy brother eye gyue ye whiche holy vnto dogges neyther cast ye pearles swyne lest treade vnder theyr feete turne agaynst rent aske shall gyuen • ere xxix c iohn̄ 16 f luke xi b seke ye shall fynde knocke shall opened vnto whosoeuer asketh receyueth whosoeuer seketh fyndeth hym knocketh shall opened man amonge whiche yf sonne aske breade wyll offer hym stone yf aske fysshe wyl profer hym serpente yf ye ye euyll gyue chyldren good gyftes howe moche shall youre father whiche heuen gyue good thynges yf ye aske hym therfore eccle 31 b tobi • iii • luke vi e whatsoeuer ye wold men shulde ye euen also lawe prophettes luke xiii e enter strayte gate wyde gate brode waye leadeth destruccion many whiche go therat strayte gate narowe waye whiche leadeth vnto lyfe fewe fynde ✚ det • xiii iohn̄ 4 beware false prophettes whiche come shepes clothyng inwardly rauenyng wolues ye shall know theyr fruytes luke vi g men gather grape thornes fyggꝭ thystels euen euery good tree bryngeth forth good fruytes corrupte tre bryngeth forth euyll frutes math xii • good tree cannot brynge forth bad fruyte neyther bad tree brynge forth good fruytes meth iii b luke iii b euery tre bryngeth forth good fruyte hewen downe cast fyre wherfore theyr fruytes ye shall knowe euery one sayeth vnto mat 25 b luke vi g x •••• e lorde lorde shall enter kyngdom heuen dothe wyl father whiche heuen ❀ shall enter kyngdome heuen ⊢ many wyll saye daye lorde lorde haue prophesyed thorowe thy name act •• xix • thorowe thy name haue cast deuyls done many miracle thorowe thy name wyll knowledge vnto neuer knewe psal vi b▪ luke xiii departe ye worke iniquite whosoeuer heareth wordes doth wyll lyken hym vnto wyse man whiche luke vi • buylte house vpon rocke shower rayne descended floodes came wyndes blew bet vpon house fell bycause groūded rocke euery one heareth wordes iames b dothe shalbe lykened vnto folysh man whiche buylte house vpon sande shower ••• 13 b rayne descended floodes came wyndes blewe bet vpon house fell greate fall came passe iesus ended sayenges people astonyed doctryne marke • • luke • • • taught one hauynge power scrybes ❀ pharyses ¶ chryst clenseth leper healeth captaynes seruaunt many dyseases helpeth peter mother inlawe stylleth see wynde dryueth deuyls possessed swyne capi viii ✚ come downe moū tayne moch people folowed hym beholde luke v e marke • came leper worshypped hym saynge mayster yf thou wylt thou canst make cleane iesus put forth hande touched hym sayenge wyl thou cleane immedyatly leprosye clensed iesus sayeth vnto hym se thou tell man leuiti 14 • go shew selfe preest offer gyfte moses cōmaunded offered wytnesse vnto ⊢ ✚ iesus entred luke vii iohn̄ iiii • capernaum came vnto hym ☞ centurion besought sayenge mayster seruaunt lyeth home sycke palsye greuouslye payned iesus sayeth come vnto hym wyll heale hym centurion answered sayde syr worthy thou shuldest come vnder rofe psal 〈…〉 speake worde seruaunt shall healed also selfe man subiecte auctoryte another haue souldyers vnder saye man go goeth come cōmeth seruaunt doeth iesus herde wordes maruey led sayde folowed hym uerely saye vnto haue founde greate fayth israell saye vnto luke xiii • esai xli • many shall come east west shal rest abraham isaac iacob kyngdome heuen chyldren kyngdom shalbe cast vtter darkenesse shalbe wepynge guasshynge deeth iesus sayde vnto centurion go thy waye thou byleuest vnto seruaunt healed selfe houre ⊢ marke • • luke iiii • iesus come peter house sawe wyues mother lyenge bed sycke feuer touched hande feuer lefte arose minystred vnto euenyng drue brought vn many possessed deuyls caste spirytes worde healed sycke myght fulfylled whiche spoken esay prophet sayeth psal •• ii v pe • ii toke hym infirmityes bare syckenesses iesus sawe moche people aboute hym cōmaunded shulde go vnto syde water certayne scrybe come sayde vnto hym luke ix g mayster wyll folow whyther soeuer thou goest iesus sayeth vnto hym fox haue hole byrdes ayre haue nestes sonne man hath rest heade nombre disciple sayde vnto hym luke ix g mayster suffre fyrst go bury father iesus sayde vnto hym folowe let deade butye theyr deade▪ ✚ entred shyp disciple folowed hym beholde mat iiii luke viii c arose great tempest see moch shyp couered waues slepe disciple came hym awoke sayenge mayster saue v perysshe sayeth vnto ye fearfull ye lytell fayth arose iob xxvi psal cvii c rebuked wyndes see folowed great calme men marueyled sayenge maner man wyndes see obey hym ⊢ marke v luke viii come syde countrey gergesites met hym two possessed deuyls came graues measure fearce man myght go waye beholde cryed oute sayenge math v iesu thou sonne god luke viii xii • vi • haue arte thou come hyther tourmente v tyme good waye mat viii • heerde many swyne fedynge deuyls besought hym sayenge thou cast v suffre v go way heerde swyne sayde vnto go wayes went departed heerde swyne beholde hole heerde fwyne caryed headlynge see perysshed water kept fled wente theyr wayes citye tolde euery thynge fortuned vnto possessed deuyls beholde hole citye came mete iesus sawe hym 〈◊〉 xv • besought hym wolde departe oute theyr coostes ¶ healeth palsye calleth mathew custome answereth disciple healeth woman bloody yssue helpeth iairus doughter gyueth two blynde men theyr syght maketh dombe mā speake dryueth deuyll capi ix ✚ entred also shyppe passed ouer came owne citye beholde mark 〈◊〉 luke v brought hym man sycke palsye lyenge bed iesus sawe fayth sayde vnto sicke palsye sonne good cheare thy synnes forgyuen beholde certayne scrybes sayde within selues man blasphemeth iesus sawe theyr thoughtes sayde wherfore thynke ye euyll youre hertes whyther easyer saye thy synnes forgyuen saye aryse walke ye maye knowe sonne man hath power forgyue synnes earth sayeth vnto sycke palsye actes iii b 〈◊〉 f math 〈◊〉 b luke v c iohn̄ • • aryse take vp thy bed go vnto thyne house arose departed house people sawe meruayled glorified god gyuen suche power vnto men ⊢ ✚ iesus passed forth thence sawe man named mathewe syttynge receyte custome sayeth vnto hym folowe arose folowed hym came passe iesus sat meate house beholde many publican also synners came sat downe iesus disciple pharises sawe sayd vnto disciple eateth mayster publican synners iesus herde sayde vnto stronge nede phisician sycke go ye rather learne meaneth ose • vi e math xii • wyl haue mercy sacrifice come call ryghteous synners repentaunce ⊢ ✚ came disciple iohn̄ vnto hym sayeng math vi b mark ii • luke v • pharises fast parte thy disciple fast iesus sayde vnto brydegromes chyldren mourne longe brydegrome dayes wyll come brydegrome shal taken shall fast man putteth pece newe cloth olde garment taketh awaye pece garment rent made worse neyther men put newe wyne olde bottels el bottels breake wyne runneth bottels perysshe put newe wyne newe bottels bothe saued togyther ⊢ ✚ whyle thus spake vnto mark v luke viii • beholde came certayne ruler worshypped hym sayenge doughter euen nowe deceased come laye thy hande vpon shall lyue iesus arose folowed dyd disciple marke v c luke viii • leuiti xv • beholde woman whiche dyseased yssue blood twelue yeres came behynde hym touched hemme vesture sayd within selfe yf may touche euen vesture shalbe safe iesus turned hym aboute saw sayd doughter good comforte thy fayth hath made safe womā made hole euen tyme ⊢ marke v luke viii g iesus came ruler house saw mynstrels people makynge noyse sayd vnto get hence mayde dead iohn̄ xi b slepeth laughed hym scorne people put forth wente toke hande ❀ sayd damsel aryse damsel arose noyse went abrode lande iesus departed thence two blynde men folowed hym cryenge saynge thou sonne dauid haue mercy v come house blynde came hym iesus sayth vnto byleue ye able say vnto hym lorde byleue touched theyr eye sayenge math 8 b accordynge fayth vnto theyr eye opened iesus charged sayenge se man knowe departed spred abrode name lande wente oute beholde mat vii luke xi b brought hym dombe man possessed deuyl deuyl cast dombe spake peple merueyled saynge neuer sene israel pharises sayde math xii b mark iii b luke xi b casteth deuyls thorowe prynce deuyls mar vi • iesus went aboute cityes townes teachynge theyr synagoges preachynge glad tydynges kyngdome healynge euery sycknes euery dysease amonge people sawe people mar vi moued wt compassyon bycause destitute scattered abrode euē shepe hauynge shepherde sayth vnto disciple luke x • haruest truely plenteous labourer fewe pray ye therfore lorde haruest wyll sende labourer entre ye go rather lost shepe house israel go preache sayenge kyngdome heuen hande heale sycke clense leper rayse deade cast deuyls actes x • frely ye haue receyued gyue frely mat 〈◊〉 luke ••• possesse gold syluer ☞ brasse purse yet scryp towarde iourney neyther two cote neyther shoe yet rodde timo •• workeman worthy meate soeuer citye towne ye shall come enquyre worthy abyde tyll ye go
