israel tyll sonne man come luke vi • discyple aboue mayster seruaunt aboue lorde ynough disciple mayster seruaunt lorde haue called lorde house beelzebub howe moche shall call housholde feare therfore mat • ii • • luke viii • • xii nothynge close shall opened nothyng hyd shal knowen tell darkenesse speake ye lyghte ye heare eare preache ye house toppes luke xii feare ye whiche kyll body able kyl soule rather feare hym able destroy soule body hell two lytell sparowes solde farthynge one shall lyght grounde wtout father yea euen al heeres head nombred feare ye therfore ye value many sparowes mat viii luke ix • and▪ xii • euery one therfore shal knowledge men wyl knowlege also father heuen soeuer shall denye men hym wyll also denye father whiche heuen thynke luke xii g come sende peace erth came sende peace swerde come set man varyaunce miche 7 agaynst father doughter agaynst mother doughter lawe agaynst mother law man foe shall owne hausholde luke xiiii c loueth father mother worthy loueth sonne doughter worthye taketh crosse foloweth worthy mat xvi mat viii luke xii▪ b fyndeth lyfe shall lose loseth lyfe sake shal fynde luke ix • iohn̄ xiii c receyueth receyueth receyueth receyueth hym sent • reg 18 b receyueth prophet name prophet shal receyue prophetꝭ rewarde receyueth ryghteous man name ryghteous man shall receyue ryghteous mannes rewarde mark ix • soeuer shall gyue vnto one lytell one drynke cup colde water onely name disciple verely say vnto shall lose rewarde ¶ iohn̄ bapiyst sendeth disciple vnto christ capi xi came passe iesus made ende cōmaundyng twelue disciple departed thence teache preache theyr cityes ✚ iohn̄ beynge pryson herde wordes christ sent two disciple sayde vnto hym arte thou shall come loke iesus answered sayde vnto go shewe iohn̄ agayne ye haue herde sene esa xxx blynde receyue theyr syghte lame walke leper clensed deafe heare deade reysed vp poore esai • xi receyue glad tydynges gospell happy offended luke xi • departed iesus began say vnto people concernynge iohn̄ went ye wyldernes se reede shaken wynd went ye se man clothed softe rayment beholde weare softe clothyng kynges house wente ye se prophet uerely say vnto prophet wrytten mala • ii▪ • marke • • beholde sende messenger thy face whiche shall prepare thy way ⊢ ✚ uerely saye vnto amonge borne woman arose greater iohn̄ baptyst notwithstandynge ☞ lesse kyngdome heuen greater dayes iohn̄ baptyst vntyll day kyngdom heuen suffreth violence violent plucke vnto luke xvi al prophettes lawe selfe prophesyed ☞ vnto iohn̄ yf ye wyll receyue mala iii luke b iohn̄ • helyas whiche come hath eares heare let hym heare ⊢ luke vi • • whervnto shall lyken generacyon lyke vnto chyldren whiche syt market place call vnto theyr felowes saye haue pyped vnto ye haue daunsed haue mourned vnto ye haue sorowed iohn̄ came neyther catynge drynkynge ye saye hathe deuyll sonne man came eatynge drynkynge saye beholde glutton vnmeasurable drynker wyne frende vnto publican synners wysdome iustified chyldren ✚ luke x • began vpbrayde cityes whiche moost myracles done bycause repented theyr synnes wo vnto chorasin wo vnto bethsaida yf myracles shewed bene done citye tyre sidon repented theyr synnes long agone sacke cloth asshes neuerthelesse say vnto shall easyer tyre sidon daye iudgement thou capernaum whiche • ete lyfte vp vnto heuen shalte broughte downe hell yf myracles haue bene done bene shewed zodom remayned vntyll daye neuerthelesse saye vnto shall easyer lande zodom day iudgement thē ⊢ ✚ tyme iesus answered sayd thanke father lorde heuen earth bycause thou hast hyd thynges wyse prudent hast shewed vnto babe verely father euen thy good pleasure meth 2 • luke x iohn̄ • • thynges gyuē ouer vnto father iohn̄ 7 viii • man knoweth sonne father neyther knoweth man father saue sonne soeuer sonne wyll open hym come vnto ye laboure laden wyll ease eccle vi take yocke vpon learne meke lowly herte ye shall fynde rest vnto soules yocke easy • iohn̄ v • burden lyght ⊢ ¶ disciple plucke ••• e corne chryst healeth dryed hande helpeth possessed blynde dombe sheweth brother syster mother capi xii tyme iesus went sabboth dayes marke • thorowe corne disciple hungred began deu xxiii plucke eares corne eate pharises sawe sayd vn hym beholde thy disciple lawfull ❀ vpon sabboth day sayd vnto haue ye red dauid dyd hungred hym • reg xxi howe entred house god dyd eate shewe breades whiche lawfull hym eate neyther whiche hym onely preestes haue ye red lawe sabboth dayes preestes temple breake sabboth blamelesse say vnto place one greater temple wherfore yf ye wyst meaneth •••• vi • mark ix • requyre mercy sacrifice ye wolde haue condemned innocentes ⊢ sonne man also lorde euen sabboth day departed thence mat iii • luke v • • went synagoge holde man hande dryed vp asked hym sayenge luke 〈◊〉 ▪ • lawful heale vpon sabboth dayes myght accuse hym sayd vn whiche wyll shall haue deu xxii • shepe yf fall pyt sabboth day wyll take lyfte howe moche man better shepe wherfore lawfull good dede sabboth dayes sayth man stretche forthe thy hande stretched forthe restored vnto helth lyke ✚ math 〈◊〉 iohn̄ x • xi • pharises went helde counsel agaynst hym howe myght destroy hym iesus knewe departed thence moche people folowed hym healed charged shulde make hym knowen myghte fulfylled whiche spoken esay prophet whiche sayeth esai x ••• ▪ • beholde chylde haue chosen beloued soule delyteth wyll put spirite vpon hym shall shewe iudgement gentyls shall stryue crye neyther shall man heare voyce stretes brosed reed shal breake smokyng flaxe shall quenche tyll sende forth iudgement vnto victorye name shall gentyls trust ⊢ luke 〈◊〉 • brought hym blynde dombe man vexed deuyll healed hym moch blynd dombe spake sawe people amased sayde sonne dauid math • • mark 〈◊〉 luke xi • pharises herde sayd felow dryueth deuyls none otherwyse helpe belzebub cheyfe deuyls iesus knew theyr thoughtꝭ sayd vnto euery kyngdome deuyded agaynst selfe shall brought nought euery citye house deuyded agaynst selfe shall stande yf satan caste satan deuyded agaynst hymselfe shall kyngdome endure also yf helpe belzebub cast oute deuyls whose helpe chyldren cast therfore shal iudgꝭ yf cast deuyls spirite god kyngdome god come vn el luke xi • howe one entre stronge mannes house spoyle iuels excepte fyrst bynde stronge man spoyle house ✚ agaynst gathereth scattereth abrode wherfore saye vnto maner synne blasphemye shall forgyuen vnto men math iii luke xii blasphemye agaynst spirite shal forgyuen vnto men regū ii • soeuer speaketh worde agaynst sonne man shall forgyuen hym whosoeuer speaketh agaynste holy goost shal forgyuen hym neyther worlde worlde come mat vii • eyther make tree good fruyte good el make tree euyll fruyte euyll luke vi • tree knowen fruyte generacyon vypers howe ye speake good thynges ye selues euyl psal x • b luke vi g aboundaūce herte mouth speaketh good mā good treasure herte bryngeth forthe good thynges euyll man euyl treasure bryngeth forth euyl thynges say vnto euery ydle worde men shall haue spoken shal gyue accountes daye iudgement • regū • luke xix b thy wordes thou shalte iustified thy wordꝭ thou shalte condemned ⊢ ✚ certayne scribe pharises asked hym sayenge mat viii b luke xi b mayster wyll se sygne answered sayd mat xvi • euyll aduouterous generacion mar viii • luke ii iohn̄ vi ionas ii seketh sygne shall sygne gyuen sygne prophet ionas ionas ii ionas thre dayes thre nyghtes whale belly shall sonne man thre dayes thre nyghtes herte earth men niniue shall ryse iudgement nacion condemne bycause ionas iii c amended preachynge ionas beholde one greater ionas • regū x ii pat 〈◊〉 luke xi quene south shall ryse iudgement generacion shal condemne came vttermost partes world heare wysdome salomon beholde place one greater salomon luke xi vncleane spirite gone man walketh thorowout drye place sekyng rest fyndeth none thē sayth wyll returne house whence came come fyndeth emptye swepte garnysshed goeth taketh vnto hym seuen spirites worse hym selfe entreth dwelleth ii pet ii hebru vi ende man worse begynnynge euen shal also vnto froward generacion whyle yet talked people mark iii luke viii • behold mother brother stode without desyryng speake hym one sayd vnto hym beholde mark iii luke v • c thy mother thy brother stande without desyrynge speake answered sayde vnto hym tolde hym mother brethrē stretched forth hande towarde disciple sayde iohn̄ xv • beholde mother brother whosoeuer doth wyll father heuen brother syster mother ⊢ ¶ parable • ede tare mustarde • ede leuen treasure hyd felde pearles net capi xiii daye wente iesus oute house mat iiii • sat see syde moche peple gathered togither vnto greatly went sat shyp peple stode shore spake many thyngꝭ similitude saynge beholde sower went forthe sowe sowed scedes fell wayes syde foules came deuoured vp fell vpon stony place moche earth anone sprang vp bicause depenes earth sonne vp caught heate bicause rote wythered away agayne fell amonge thornes thornes sprange vp chooked fell good grounde broughte forth fruyte hūdred folde si • ty folde thirtye folde soeuer hathe eares heare let hym heare disciple came sayd vnto hym speakest thou parable answered sayd vnto mat iiii • luke viii • gyuen vnto knowe secretes kyngdome heuen gyuen math 25▪ • mat iiii c luke vii • • soeuer hath hym shal gyuē shal haue aboundaunce soeuer hath hym shall taken away euē also hath therfore speake similitude seynge se hearynge heare neyther vnderstande fulfylled prophecye esasas▪ sayth esai vi • mat iiii • luke viii b iohn̄ xii • • •• 28 • rom xi b eares ye shall heare shall vnderstande seynge ye shall se shall perceyue peples hertꝭ wared grosse theyr eares dull hearynge theyr eye haue closed leest tyme shulde se theyr eye heare theyr care shulde vnderstande theyr herte conuerted also myght heale luke x blessed youre eye se eares heare uerely saye vnto • peter many prophettes ryghteous men haue desyred se thynges whiche ye se haue sene heare thynges whiche ye heare haue herde mat iiii b luke viii • heare ye therfore similitude sower whē one heareth worde kyngdom vnderstandeth cometh euyll man taketh awaye sowē hert sowen waye syde receyued seede whiche cast stonye place heareth worde anone ioy receyueth yet hath rote hym selfe dureth season tribulacyon persecucyon happeneth bycause worde falleth also receyued seede thornes heareth worde care worlde deceytefulnes ryches choke vp worde made vnfruytful receyueth sede good grounde heareth worde vnderstandeth also beareth fruyte bryngeth forth hundred folde syxtye folde thyrtye folde similitude put forth vnto sayenge ✚ mat iiii • kyngdom heuen lykened vnto man whiche sowed good seede felde whyle men slepte enemy came sowed tare amonge wheate went way blade spronge vp brought forthe fruyte appeared tare also seruaū te housholder came sayde vnto hym syr dydest thou sow good seede thy felde whence hath tare sayd vnto enuyous man hath done seruauntes sayde vnto hym wylte thou go wede vp sayde nay lest whyle ye gather vp tare ye plucke vp also wheate let bothe growe togyther vntyll haruest tyme haruest wyll saye vnto reaper gather ye fyrst tare bynde togyther sheaues burnt gather wheate barne ⊢ ✚ parable put forth vnto sayenge mat iiii • luke xiii kyngdome heuen lyke vnto grayne mustarde seede mā toke sowed felde least seedes growen greatest amonge herbes tree byrdes ayre come make theyr nestes braunches therof similitute spake vnto luke 〈◊〉 kyngdome heuen lyke vnto leuē whiche woman taketh hydeth thre peckes meele tyl leuened mat 〈◊〉 thynges spake iesus vnto people similitude without parable spake nothyng vnto myght fulfylled whiche spoken prophet sayth psal 〈◊〉 wyll open mouth parable wyl speake forth thynges haue bene kepte secrete frome begynnynge worlde ⊢ people sent away came iesus house mat 〈◊〉 ✚ disciple came vnto hym sayenge declare vn v parable tare felde answered sayd vnto soweth good seed sonne man felde worlde chyldren kyngdome good seed tare child wicked enemy soweth deuyll haruest ende worlde reaper angel euē tare therfore gathered burnt fyre shal ende world •••• 〈◊〉 sonne man shall sende forthe angel shall gather kyngdome thynges offende iniquite shall cast fournace fyre shall waylyng gnasshyng teeth 〈◊〉 sapi 〈◊〉 ▪ 〈◊〉 shal righteous shyne son kyngdom theyr father euer hath eares heare let hym heare ⊢ ✚ agayne kyngdome heuen lyke vnto treasure hyd felde whiche man hath founde hyd ioy therof goeth selleth al hath byeth felde agayne kyngdom heuen lyke vnto merchaunt man sekyng goodly pearles whē foūde one precious pearle went solde bought agayne kyngdom heuen lyke vnto net cast see gathered kynde ❀ offysshes ful mē drewe land sat downe gathered good vessel cast bad away shall ende worlde angel shall come seuer bad among good shall cast fournace fyre mat 〈◊〉 xx •• shalbe waylyng gnasshynge teeth iesus sayth vnto haue ye vnderstande thynges saye vnto hym yea lorde sayde vnto therfore euery ••• taught vnto kyngdom heuen lyke vnto man housholder bryngeth forth treasure thynges new olde ⊢ came passe iesus finyshed similitudꝭ •• ••• departed thence came owne countrey taught theyr synagogꝭ moch ••• iiii • astonyed sayd whence cometh wysdome power vnto hym ••• iiii • 〈◊〉 vi • carpenter sonne mother called mary brother iames io symon iudas systers v whence hath al thynges offended hym iesus sayde vnto ••• vi • •• ke iiii •• h • v f prophet without honoure saue owne countrey owne house dyd many myracles bycause theyr vnbylefe ¶ iohn̄ taken beheaded chryst fedeth fyue thousande men fyue loues two fysshes appeareth nyght vnto disciple vpon see capi xiiii tyme • •• v • • ••• e▪ ix • herode tetrarcha herde fame iesu sayd vnto seruaūtes iohn̄ baptyst rysen deade therfore myracles wrought hym herode • •• vi • •• ke iii taken iohn̄ bounde hym put hym pryson bycause herodias brother philip wyfe iohn̄ sayd vnto hym • • iii 18 • lawfull haue wolde haue put hym death feared people • • xxi b bycause counted hym prophet herodes 〈◊〉 x • • byrth day kepte doughter herodias daūsed pleased herode •••• v • • wherfore promised othe wold gyue soeuer wolde aske beynge instructe mother sayde gyue iohn̄ baptystes heade platter kynge sory neuerthelesse othes sake whiche sat table cōmaūded gyuen sent tourmentours beheaded iohn̄ pryson heade brought platter gyuen damsell brought mother disciple came toke vp body buryed wente tolde iesus iesus herde •• vi luke ix b iohn̄ vii • departed thence shyp vnto deserte place way peple herde therof folowed fote lefte cityes iesus went forth sawe moche people moued mercy towarde healed sycke euen drewe disciple came hym sayenge deserte place houre nowe past let people departe may go townes bye vytayles iesus sayde vnto haue nede go awaye gyue ye eate say vnto hym haue v loues two fysshes sayde brynge hyther cōmaunded peple syt downe grasse toke v loues • fysshes lyft vp eye towarde heuen ☞ blessed whē broken gaue loues disciple disciple gaue people dyd eate suffysed gathered vp fragmentꝭ remayned xii baskettes full dyd eate aboute fyue thousande men besyde woman chyldren •• vi • iohn̄ vi b streyght waye iesus made disciple get vp shyp go hym vnto syde whyle sente people away people sent awaye luke vi • went vp mountayne praye alone nyght come hym selfe alone shyp nowe myddes see tost waues cōtrary wynde fourth watche nyght iesus went vnto walkyng see discyples saw hym walkyng see troubled sayenge spyryte cryed feare streyght waye iesus spake vnto sayenge good cheare afrayde peter answered hym sayd lorde yf thou byd come vnto water sayd come peter come downe shyppe walked water go iesus sawe moghtye wynde afrayde whē began synke cryed sayenge lorde saue immediatly iesus stretched forth hande caught hym sayde vnto hym thou lytell fayth wherfore dydest thou doute • vi • come shyp wynde ceased shyp came worshypped hym sayenge trueth thou arte son god gone ouer came lande genesereth men place knowledge hym sent messenger countrey rounde aboute coost brought vnto hym sycke besought hym myght touch hemme vesture onely many touched made safe ¶ chryst excuseth discyples rebuketh scrybes pharyses transgressynge cōmaundement god thorow theyr owne tradicyons thynge goeth mouth defyleth man delyuereth woman ••• ye • boughter healeth multitude seuen loues lytle fysshes fedeth foure thousande men besyde woman chyldren capi xv ✚ • vii came iesus scribe pharises whiche come ierusalem sayenge thy disciple transgresse tradicions elder wasshe theyr handes eate bread answered sayd vnto ye also transgresse cōmaundement god bycause owne tradicion god cōmaundeth sayenge erod • 〈◊〉 • mar vii b honour father mother curseth father mother let hym dye death ye saye euery one shall saye father mother ☞ erodi xxi • deute v b ephe vi gyfte euer shulde haue come turned vnto thy profyte shall honoure father mother thus haue ye made cōmaundement god none effecte bycause owne tradicion ypocrites ful wel dyd esaye prophesye sayenge esai x • ix • • 33 • ▪ mar vii • people draweth nygh vnto theyr mouth honoureth lippes howbeit theyr hertes farre vayne serue teachynge doctrine preceptes men called people hym sayd vnto heare vnderstande goeth mouthe defyleth man whiche cometh mouth defyleth man came disciple sayde vnto hym knowest thou pharises offended saynge answered sayde euery plante whiche heuenly father hath planted shall plucked vp rootes let alone blynde leader blynde blynde leade blynde bothe shall fall dytche answered peter sayde vnto hym declare vnto v parable iesus sayde ye also yet without vnderstandyng ye yet vnderstande whatsoeuer entreth mouth goeth belly cast draught thynges whiche procede mouthe come forth herte defyle man herte procede euyll thoughtes murder breakyng wedlocke hooredoms theftes false wytnesse blasphemyes thynges whiche defyle mā take meate vnwashed handes defyleth man ⊢ ✚ iesus wente thence departed coostes tyre sydon beholde woman canaan whiche came coostes cryed vnto hym sayenge haue mercy lorde thou sonne dauid doughter pyteously vexed deuyl answered nothynge disciple came besought hym sayenge sende awaye cryeth v answered sayde sent 〈…〉 vnto lost shepe house israel came worshypped hym saynge lord helpe answered sayd mete take chyldrens beade cast dogges answered sayd trueth lorde doggꝭ eate crommes whiche fall theyr maysters table iesus answered sayde vnto woman great thy fayth vnto euen thou wylte doughter made hole euen tyme ⊢ iesus went awaye thence came nygh vnto see galile wente vp mountayne sat downe moche people came vnto hym bryngynge lame blynde deafe maymed many cast downe iesus feete esa 〈◊〉 healed moche people wondred sawe dombe speake maymed hoole lame walke blynde se glorified god israel math▪ • ▪ iesus called disciple vnto sayd haue compassyon people bycause contynue wt nowe iii dayes haue nothyng eate wyll let departe fastyng lest mysse cary waye disciple saye vnto hym whence shulde get moche breade wyldernes suffise great multitude iesus say vnto howe many loues haue ye say math▪ 〈◊〉 seuen lytell fysshes cōmaunded people syt downe grounde toke seuen loues fysshes gyuen thankes brake gaue discipiples disciple gaue people dyd eate suffysed toke vp brokē meat lefte seuen baskettes full yet dyd eate foure thousande men besyde woman chyldren sent away people toke shyp came partyes magdala ¶ pharys •• require token iesus warneth disciple pharises doctrine cōfessyon petet keyes heuen faythfull must bea • e crosse chryst capi xvi mat vili b iohn̄ vi lu • e xi pharises also saduces came tempted hym desyred hym wolde shewe sygne heuen answered sayd vnto begynneth drawe toward luke xii • euen ye say wyl fayre wether skye red mornyng wyll fowle wether daye skye glowmynge red ye ypocrites ye discerne outwarde appearaūce skye ye discerne sygnes tymes 〈◊〉 xii c froward aduouterous nacyō requireth 〈◊〉 8 b 〈◊〉 xi 〈◊〉 vi sygne shall sygne gyuen vnto sygne •• ii prophet ionas lefte departed disciple come othersyde water forgotten take breade iesus sayd vn 〈◊〉 xii take hede beware ☞ leuen pharises saduces thought selues sayeng haue taken breade v iesus vnderstode sayde vnto ye lytle fayth take ye thought wt selues bycause ye haue brought breade ye yet perceyue neyther remember fyue loues 〈◊〉 14 • fyue men howe many baskettes toke ye vp 〈◊〉 x • neyther seuen loues foure thousande men howe many baskettes toke ye vp howe happeneth ye vnderstande spake vnto concernynge breade ye shulde beware leuen pharises saduces vnderstode howe beware leuen bread doctryne pharyses saduces ✚ iesus came coostes citye whiche called cesarea philippi asked disciple sayenge 〈◊〉 vlli • 〈◊〉 ix • whome men saye sonne man sayde saye thou arte iohn̄ baptist elyas ieremias one nombre prophettes sayeth vnto whome saye ye simon peter answered sayde 〈◊〉 ix • 〈◊〉 vi g thou arte chryst son liuynge god iesus answered sayde vnto hym happy arte thou simon son ionas flesshe bloode hath opened vnto 〈◊〉 vi father whiche heuen say also vnto thou arte peter vpon 〈◊〉 x rocke wyl buylde congregacion gate 〈…〉 hell shall preuayle agaynst wyll gyue vnto keyes kyngdome heuen •• th▪ • 8 • whatsoeuer thou byndest earth shalbe bound heuen whatsoeuer thou losest earth shalbe losed heuen ⊢ charged discyples shulde tell man iesus chryste 〈◊〉 viii 〈◊〉 • ▪ • tyme forth began iesus shewe vnto disciple howe must go vnto ierusalem suffer many thyngꝭ elder hygh preestes scrybes must kylled raysed agayne thyrde day▪ petet taken hym asyde began rebuke sayeng mayster fauer thy selfe shal happen vnto turned aboute sayd vnto peter go satan thou hyndrest thou souourest thynges god men sayde iesus vnto disciple man wyl folowe let hym forsake himselfe take vp crosse folow math x • mathe 〈◊〉 luke▪ • • iohn̄ vi • wyl saue lyfe shal lose agayne doth lose lyfe sake shall fynde doth profet man yf wyn hole world lose owne soule shall man gyue redeme soule agayne withall sonne man shall come glorye father angle rom • • mark • luke ix • shall rewarde euery man accordyng dedes uerely saye vnto standynge shal taste death tyll se son man come kyngdome ¶ transfiguratyon chryst heale •• luna • yke payeth trybute capi xvii ✚ marke 〈◊〉 ▪ • luke ix • syre dayes iesus taketh peter iames iohn̄ brother bryngeth vp hygh mountayne waye transfygured actes • • face dyd shyne son clothes whyte lyght beholde appeared vnto moses elia talkyng hym answered peter sayde vnto iesus lorde good beynge v yf thou wylte let v make thre tabernacle one one moses one elia whyle yet spake beholde bryght cloude shadowed beholde came voyce cloude whiche sayde math iii • and▪ x •• • beloued son esa xiii de • xviii • delyte marke • 〈◊〉 heare disciple herde thynges fell theyr face fore afrayde iesus came touched sayde aryse afrayde lyfte vp theyr eye sawe man saue iesus onely mark 〈◊〉 • came downe mountayne iesus charged sayenge shew vision man vntyll son man rysen agayne deade ⊢ ✚ disciple asked sayenge say scrybes elia must fyrst come iesus answered sayde vnto mala iii▪ elia truely shall fyrst come restore thyngꝭ saye vnto math xi b elia come redye knewe hym haue done vnto hym whatsoeuer lusted lykewyse shall also son man suffer discyples vnderstode spake vnto iohn̄ baptyst whē come people came hym certayne man knelyng downe hym sayeng mayster haue mercy son lunatyke sore vexed oft tymes falleth fyre ofte water math ix f luke ix e brought hym thy disciple coulde heale iesus answered sayd faythles croked naciō howe longe shall howe longe shall suffer bryng hym hyther iesus rebuked deuyl departed hym chylde healed euen ryme ⊢ mark ix came disciple iesus secretly sayde could cast hym iesus sayd vnto thē bycause vnbylefe verely say vnto luke 17 • yf ye haue fayth grayne musterde seede ye shall saye vnto mountayne remoue hence yōder place shall remoue neyther shall thynge vnpossible vnto kynde goeth prayer fastyng whyle occupyed galile iesus sayde vnto mat xvi • •• xx • mar v •• ix • x • luke ix • wyll come passe son man shall betrayed handes men shall kyll hym thyrde daye shall ryse agayne excedyng sorye ✚ come citye capernaum vse receyue trybute money came peter sayd doth mayster paye tribute sayeth yea whē come house iesus preuented sayeng thynkest thou simon kyngꝭ earth take trybute toll theyr chyldren straūgers peter sayeth vnto straūgers iesus sayeth vnto chyldren fre withstandyng lest shuld offende go thou see cast angle take fysh fyrst cometh vp whē thou hast opened mouth thou shalt fynde pece xx pen take gyue vnto ⊢ teacheth disciple humble haemeles auoyde occasion • • uyll one forgyue anothers offence capi xviii ✚ tyme came disciple vn iesus sayeng mark •• g luke ix f greatest kyngdome heuen iesus called chylde vnto hym set hym myddes sayde uerely say vnto mathe x h luk xviii excepte ye turne become pet ii • chyldren ye shall enter kyngdome heuen whosoeuer therfore humbleth hym selfe chylde greatest kyngdome heuen receyueth chyld name receyueth mark •• • luke xv • dothe offende one lytle one whiche byleue better hym milstone hanged necke drowned depth see wo vnto world bycause offense corin xi▪ • necessary offence come wo vnto man offence cometh wherfore math v e mathe ix f yf thy hande thy fote hynder cut hym cast better enter lyfe halt maymed rather thou shuldest hauyng two handes fete cast euerlastynge fyre yf thyne eye offende plucke hym caste frō better enter lyfe one eye rather hauyng two eye cast hell fyre take hede ye despyse one lytle one saye vnto heuen theyr angel alwayes beholde face father heuen ⊢ sonne man come saue lost howe thynke ye luke xv • man haue hundred shepe one gone astray doth leaue nynty nyne mountayn goth seketh gone astraye yf happen fynde verely say vnto reioyseth shepe nyntye nyne whiche went astray euen wyll youre father heuen one lytle one shuld peryshe ✚ moreouer luke xvii • leuit iix • eccle xix b yf thy brother trespasse agaynst go tell hym faute bytwene hym alone yf heare thou hast wonne thy brother yf heare take yet wt one two deut xix • 〈◊〉 cori 13 • hebr • x • mouth two thre wytnesses euery matter may stablyshed heare tell vnto cōgregacion heare cōgregacyō lee hym vnto heathen man publican uerely saye vnto math x • whatsoeuer ye bynde earth shall bounde heuen euer ye lose earth shall losed heuen agayne say vnto yf ii agre earth vpon maner thynge soeuer desyre shal haue father whiche heuen two thre gathered togyther name myddꝭ came peter sayde lorde howe ofte shall forgyue brother yf syn agaynst tyll seuen tymes iesus sayeth vnto hym saye vnto vntyll seuen tymes seuentye tymes seuentymes ⊢ ✚ therfore kyngdome heuen lykened vnto certayne man kynge wolde take accountes seruauntes begon reken one brought vnto hym whiche ought hym x m▪ talentes asmoch able paye lorde cōmaunded hym solde wyfe chyldren payment made seruaunt fell downe besought hym sayenge syr haue pacience wyll paye lorde pitye seruaunt losed hym forgaue hym det seruaunt went founde one felowes ought hym hundred penny layde handes hym toke hym throte sayenge pay thou owest felow fell downe besought hym sayenge haue pacience wyll paye wolde wente cast hym pryson tyll shulde paye det felowes sawe done sory came tolde vnto theyr lorde al happened lorde called hym sayd vnto hym thou vngracious seruaunt forgaue det whē thou desyredst shuldest thou also haue compassion thy felow euen pitye lorde wroth deliuered hym saylers tyll shulde paye due vnto hym iamea ii • math vi • mark xi • lykewyse shall heuenly father also vnto yf ye hertes forgiue euery one brother theyr trespass ⊢ ¶ chryst gyueth answere concernynge maryage •• acheth carefull loue worldly ryched capi xix came passe •••• x • iesus finysshed sayenges gatte hym galile came coostes iury beyonde iordan moch people folowed hym healed pharises also came vnto hym temtyng hym sayenge vnto hym lawful man make deuorcement▪ wyfe maner cause answered sayde vnto haue ye red howe whiche made man begynnyng •••• xii ephesi v g • ▪ cori vi • made man woman sayd cause shall man leaue father mother shall cleue vnto wyfe twayne shal one flesshe wherfore nowe twayne one fleshe let man therfore put sunder whiche god hath coupled togyther saye vnto hym dyd moses cōmaunde gyue testimonyall deuorcement put awaye sayde vnto moses bycause hardnesse hertes deut 〈◊〉 • iere iii mala ii suffered put awaye wyues begynnynge math v e marke x b luke xvi • say vnto whosoeuer putteth awaye wyfe except fornicacyon marieth another breaketh wedlocke maryeth whiche deuorced dothe cōmyt aduoutrye discyples saye vnto hym yf matter bytwene man wyfe good marry sayde vnto men comprehend sayenge sa ••• 〈◊〉 • saue whome gyuen ☞ chaste whiche borne theyr mother wombe chast made chaste men chaste whiche haue made selues chaste kyngdome heuens sake comprehende let hym comprehende marke x • luk xviii • brought vnto hym yonge chyldren shuld put handes praye disciple r •••• ked iesus sayde vnto suffre chyldren forbyd come vnto soche kyngdome heuen put handes departed thence beholde one came sayde vnto hym marke x • luke 〈◊〉 good mayster good thynge shall maye haue eternall lyfe sayde vnto hym ☞ callest thou good p • l • xi • ▪ none good one god yf thou wylte entre lyfe kepe cōmaundementes sayeth vnto iesus sayd exodi xx • deute v b thou shalte cōmyt manslaughter thou shalte commyt aduoutrye thou shalte steale thou shalte beare false wytnesse honoure father mother rom xii • • galat v • thou shalt loue thyne neyghbour thy selfe yonge man sayeth vnto hym thynges haue kepte youth vp lacke yet iesus sayde vnto hym yf thou wylte perfyte marke • • luke xii • go sell thou hast gyue poore thou shalt haue treasure heuen come folow yong man herde sayenge went awaye sorye greate possession iesus sayde vnto discyples uerely saye vnto marke • • luk xviii • shall hard ryche enter kyngdom heuen agayne saye vnto easyer camell go eye nedle thē ryche enter kyngdome god disciple herde excedyngly amased sayenge saued iesus behelde sayde vnto men vnpossyble zacha viii b god thynges possyble ✚ answered peter sayd vnto hym beholde marke x luk xviii • haue forsaken folowed shal haue therfore iesus sayde vnto verely say vnto sonne man shall syt seate maiestye ye haue folowed regeneracyon luke xxii c shall syt also vpon xii seates iudge xii trybes israell deute 33 b euery one forsaketh house brother systers father mother wyfe chyldren landes name sake iob xiii c shall receyue hundred folde shal heryte euerlastyng lyfe ⊢ math xx luke xiii • many fyrst shall last last shalbe fyrst ¶ chryst teacheth similytude god dettour vnto man teacheth disciple lowly gyueth two blynde men theyr syght capi xx ✚ kyngdome heuen lyke vnto man housholder went early mornyng hyre labourer vineyard agrement made labourer peny daye sent vyneyearde went thyrd houre saw standyng ydel market place sayd vnto go ye also vyneyearde whatsoeuer ryght wyll gyue went theyr waye agayne went syxte nynthe houre dyd lykewyse eleuenth houre went founde standynge ydell sayde vnto stande ye al daye ydel saye vnto bycause man hath hyred v sayeth vnto go ye also vineyearde whatsoeuer ryght shal ye receyue euen come lorde vineyarde sayeth vnto stewarde call labourer gyue theyr hyre begynnynge laste vntyll fyrst dyd come came aboute eleuenth houre receyued euery man peny fyrst came also supposed shuld haue receyued lykewyse receyued euerye man peny receyued murmured agaynst good man house sayenge last haue wrought one houre thou hast made equall vnto v whiche haue borne burden heate day answered vnto one sayde frende wronge dydest thou agre peny take thyne go thy waye wyll gyue vnto last euen vnto lawfull lysteth myne owne goodes thyne eye euyll bycause good mat xix marke • • luke xiii • last shall fyrst fyrst shall last many called chosen ⊢ ✚ iesus goynge vp ierusalem toke xii discyples asyde waye sayde vnto •• ix • beholde go vp ierusalem son man shal betrayed vnto cheyfe preestes vnto scrybes shall condemne hym death shall delyuer hym gentyls mocked scourged crucifyed thyrd day shall ryse agayne ✚ marke x • came hym mother zebedes chyldren sonnes worshyppyng hym desyryng certayne thyng hym sayeth vnto wylte thou sayde vnto hym graunt two sonnes maye syt one ryght hande lefte thy kyngdome iesus answered sayd ☞ ye wote ye aske ye able drynke cup shall drynke baptised baptyme baptised say vnto hym sayde vnto ye shall drynke dede cup baptised baptym baptised syt ryght hand lefte myne gyue shal chaunce vnto mat xxv • prepared father ⊢ marke x • whē ten herde disdayned ii brother iesus called vnto hym sayd luke xxii • ye know prynces nacions haue dominion ouer greate men exercyse auctoryte vpon shall amonge whosoeuer wyll greate amonge let hym minister wyll cheyf amonge let seruaunt euen mathe • • son man came ministred vnto minister gyue lyfe redemciō many ⊢ marke • • luke xviii departed ierico moch peple folowed beholde two blynde men syttyng way syde herde iesus passed cryed sayenge lorde thou son dauid haue mercy v peple rebuked bycause shulde holde theyr peace cryed sayeng haue mercy v lorde thou sonne dauid iesus stode styll called sayde wyll ye shal vnto saye vnto lorde eye maye opened iesus cōpassion touched theyr eye immediatly theyr eye receyued syght folowed hym ¶ rydeth ierusalem dryueth marchauntes temple curseth fygge tree rebuketh pharises similitude two sonnes husband men slewe soche sent vnto capi xxi ✚ math ix luke xix • drewe nygh vnto ierusalem come bethphage vnto mounte oliuete sent iesus two disciple sayeng vnto go towne lyeth ouer agaynst anone ye shall fynde asse bounde colte loose brynge vnto yf man saye ought vnto saye ye lorde hath nede streyght waye wyll let go done myght fulfylled spoken prophet sayenge esai lxii zacha ix b iohn̄ xii • tell ye doughter sion beholde thy kynge cometh vnto meke sittynge vpon asse colte fole asse vsed yocke disciple went dyd iesus cōmaunded brought asse colte put theyr clothes set theron many people spred theyr garmentes way cut downe braunches tree strawed waye moreouer people went came cryed sayenge hosanna son dauid luke xix f iohn̄ xii b psal 118 • blessed cometh name lorde mar xi b ☞ hosanna hyest ⊢ ✚ come ierusalem citye moued sayenge people sayde iesus mat xiiii prophet nazareth citye galile luke xix g iesus went temple god cast al solde bought temple ouerthrewe table money chaungers seates solde doues sayde vnto wrytten3 reg 18 esai lvi c house shall called house prayer ye haue made iere vii c den theues blynde halte came hym temple healed cheyf preestes scrybes sawe wonder dyd chyldren cryeng temple sayenge hosanna son dauid disdayned sayde vnto hym heatest thou say iesus sayeth vnto haue ye neuer red psal viii mouth babe suckelynges thou hast ordeyned prayse left went citye iohn̄ 8 bethanie abydyng ⊢ math xi c mornyng returned citye agayne hungred whē spyed luke xiii b fyg • waye came found nothyng theron leaues sayde vnto neuer fruyte growe hence forwardes anone fygge tree wethered away disciple saw marueyled sayenge howe soone fygge tree wethered away iesus answered sayde vnto uerely saye vnto mat xvii • luke xvii yf ye haue fayth dout ye shall onely happened vnto fygge tree also yf ye shall saye vnto mountayne remoue cast thy selfe see shal done math xi • iohn̄ 14 • xv b xvi • thyngꝭ whatsoeuer ye aske prayer yf ye byleue ye shall receyue ✚ math xi • luke xx come temple cheyfe preestes elder people came vnto hym teachynge sayde exodi ii c actes iiii • vii • auctorite doest thou thynges gaue power iesus answered sayd vnto also wyl aske certayne thyng yf ye tell lykewyse wyll tell auctorite thyngꝭ baptyme iohn̄ whence heuen men thought amonge selues sayenge yf say heuen wyll say vnto v dyd ye bileue yf shal saye men feare people mat • iiii men holde iohn̄ prophet answered vnto iesus sayd tell sayd vnto neyther tell auctoryte thyngꝭ ⊢ say ye ✚ man two sonnes came fyrst sayde son go worke daye vineyarde answered sayd wyll afterwarde repented went came seconde sayd lykewyse answered sayde wyll syr went whyther twayne dyd wyll father saye vnto hym fyrst iesus sayeth vnto verely saye vnto publican harlottes go kyngdome god math iii • iohn̄ came vnto waye ryghtwysenes ye byleued hym publican harlottꝭ byleued hym ye ye sene moued afterward repentaūce ye myght haue byleued hym ⊢ ✚ herken another similitude gene • x • esai v • iere xii c math xii • luke xx • certayne man housholder whiche planted vineyarde hedged rounde aboute made wynepresse buylte tower let husbandman went straunge countrey tyme fruyte drewe neare sent seruauntes husbandman might receyue fruytes husbandman caughte seruauntes bet one kylled another stoned another agayne sent seruauntꝭ mo fyrst dyd vnto lykewyse last sent vnto owne sonne sayeng wyll stande awe sonne husbandman sawe sonne sayde amonge selues gene 37 b heyre come let v kyll hym let v enioye inheritaunce caught hym thrust hym vineyearde slewe hym lorde therfore vineyarde cometh wyll vnto husbandman sayde vnto hym asmoch euyll wyll cruellye destroye wyll let vineyard husbande men shall delyuer hym fruyte due season iesus sayeth vnto dyd ye neuer rede scryptures psal 118 c • xii • luke xx c •• tro iiii b • pet ii b stone whiche buylders refused become heade corner lordes doynge merueylous oure eye therfore saye vnto kyngdom god shal taken gyuen nacyon shall bryng forth fruytes therof •• cha xii • whosoeuer falleth stone shalbe broken peces deute 〈◊〉 • whomsoeuer falleth shall grynde hym cheyfe preestes pharises herde parable perceyued spake iohfi vii • went laye handes hym mark xi c luke xix g 〈◊〉 xx • feared peple bycause toke hym prophet ⊢ iesus answered spake vnto agayne parable sayde ¶ maryage hynges sonne trybute gyuen emperoure chryst confuteth op •• yon saduces cōcernynge resurreccyon answereth sery vnto questyon capi xxii ✚ kyngdome heuen lyke vntoluk xii •• • man kynge whiche made mariage son sent forth seruauntes cal bydden weddyng wold come agayne sent fyrth seruauntes sayenge tell whiche bydden beholde haue prepared dyner myne ox fatlynges kylled thynges redy come vnto mariage made lyght went theyr wayes one farme place marchaundyse remenaunt toke seruauntes intreated shamefully slewe kynge herde therof wroth sent forth men wat destroyed murtherers burnt vp theyr citye sayd seruauntes maryage dede prepared hydden worthy go ye therfore hygh wayes many ye fynde byd mariage seruauntes went hygh wayes gathered togyther many coulde fynde good bad weddynge fournyshed gestes kyng came se gestes spyed man whiche esal 〈◊〉 • weddynge garment sayde vnto hym frende howe camest thou hyther hauynge weddyng garment euen spechlesse sayd kyng minysters take bynde hym hand foote cast vtter darkenesse mat xx •• xxv • shall wepynge gnasshyng teethe many called fewe chosen ⊢ ✚ mat 〈◊〉 • went pharises toke counsayle might tangle hym wordes sent vnto hym theyr discyples herodꝭ seruauntꝭ sayeng luke 〈◊〉 • mayster knowe thou arte true teachest way god truly neyther carest thou man thou regardest outward appearaunce men tell v therfore howe thynkest thou lawfull tribute gyuen vnto cesar iesus perceyuynge theyr wyckednesse sayde tempte ye ye apocrites shewe tribute money toke hym peny sayd vnto whose ymage superscrypcion saye vnto hym cesars sayd vnto mat 〈◊〉 •• 〈◊〉 • gyue therfore vnto cesar thynges whiche cesars vnto god thynges god ⊢ herde wordes marueyled left hym went theyr way mat x •• • luke xx • actes 23 b day came hym saduces saye resurrection asked hym sayenge mayster moses sayd deut xxv • yf man dye hauynge chylde brother shulde marry wyfe rayse vp seede vnto brother v vii brother fyrst maryed wyfe deceysed without yssue lefte wyfe vnto brother lyke wyse second thyrd vnto seuenth laste womā dyed also therfore resurrectiō whose wyfe shall seuen iesus answered sayd vnto ye erre knowyng scryptures power god resurrection neyther marry maryed angel heuen touchyng resurrection dead haue ye red spoken vnto god whiche sayethexodi iii • mark xii • luke xx • god abrahā god isaac god iacob god god deade lyuyng▪ peple herde astonyed doctryne ✚ pharises herde put saduces silence came togyther one doctour lawe asked hym questiō temtyng hym sayeng mayster great cōmaūdement lawe iesus sayde vnto hym thou shalte deute vi b loue lorde thy god wt thy herte thy soule al thy mynde fyrst great cōmaundement seconde lyke vnto leuit xix math v g mark xii c rom xiii • galat v b iames ii • thou shalte loue thyne neyghbour thy selfe two cōmaundementes hange lawe prophetes whyle pharises gathered togyther iesus asked sayenge thynke ye chryst whose son say vnto hym sonne dauid sayd vnto math▪ x •• dothe dauid ☞ spiryte cal hym lorde sayenge lorde sayde vnto lorde psal • x • syt thou ryght hande tyll make thyne enemeys thy foote stole yf dauid called hym lorde howe son man able answere hym thynge neyther durst man day forth aske hym mo question ⊢ ¶ chryst tryeth wo pharyses scrybes ypocrytes prophesyeth destruccyon ierusalem capi xxiii ✚ spake iesus people disciple sayeng deu xvii b scribe pharises sye moses seate therfore soeuer byd obserue obserue ye theyr workes say esal x luke xi f yea bynd togyther heuye burden greuous borne laye mennes shoulder selues wyl heaue one theyr fyngers theyr workꝭ intent maye sene men set abrode theyr ☞ philateries make large border theyr garmentes loue vppermost seates feastes syt chefe place counsel gretynges market called men▪ rabbi iames • • ye called rabbi one mayster euen chryst ye brother call man father vpon earth one father whiche heuen neyther ye called maysters one mayster euen chryst greatest amonge shall youre seruaunt luke xiiii • xviii • whosoeuer exalteth hym selfe shall brought low hūbleth hym selfe shall exalted ⊢ wo vnto scribe pharises ye ypocrites ye shutte vp kyngdom heuen men luke xi g ye neyther go selues neyther suffer ye come enter wo vnto scribe pharises ye law iudgement mercy fayth ought ye haue • e l •• ue vndone ye blynde gydes • whiche strayne goat swalowe camell wo vnto scribe pharises ye ypocrites ye make cleane vtter syde cup platter within full brybery excesse thou blynde pharise clense fyrst whiche within cup platter syde maye cleane also luke xi • wo vnto scribe pharises ye ypocrites ye lyke vnto paynted sepulcres whiche dede appeare beautiful outward within full deade mennes bone fyithynes euen ye also outwarde ye appeare ryghteous vnto men within ye full faynednesse iniquite luke x • • wo vnto scribe pharises ye ypocrites ye barachias ii pa 24 f whome ye slewe bytwene temple aulter uerely saye vnto thynges shall come vpon generacion luke xiii g ierusalem ierusalem thou kyllest prophettes stonest whiche sent vnto howe often wolde 4 esdra • c haue gathered thy chyldren togyther euen henne gathereth chyckens vnder wynges ye wolde beholde psal ix f youre house lefte vnto desolate saye vnto ye shal se hence forth tyll ye saye psal 118 luke xix f blessed cometh name lorde ⊢ ¶ chryst sheweth disciple destruceyon temple inde worlde token latter doyes warueth wake worlde shall sodeyuly peryshe capi xxiiii iesus went departed temple math iii luke xxi • discyples came shewe hym buyldynges temple iesus sayde vnto se ye thynges uerely say vnto luke xxi shall lefte one stone vpon shall destroyed sat vpon mounte oliuete disciple came vnto secretly sayeng tell v whē shall thyngꝭ shalbe token thy comynge ende worlde iesus answered sayde vnto collos ii b ephesi v b take hede man deceyue many shall come name sayeng chryst shall deceyue many ye shall heare warres tydyngꝭ warres troubled ❀ thynges must come passe ende yet 4 esd 13 c nacion shall ryse agaynst nacyon tealme agaynste realme shalbe pestilence hunger earthquake place begynnynges sorowes math x h mat xiii b luke xxi c iohn̄ 16 shall put trouble shall kyll ye shal hated nacions name sake shall many offended shall betraye one another shall hate one many false prophettes shall aryse shall deceyue many 4 esd 14 b bycause iniquite shall haue vpper hande loue many shall abate math x c endureth ende shalbe safe mat xiii b gospell kyngdome shall preached worlde wytnes vnto nacions shall ende come mat xiii • luke xx •• ye therfore shal se abhominacion desolacion spoken dani ix • daniell prophet stande holy place redeth let hym vn derstande let iury • lee moūtaynes let hym house toppe come downe fet thyng house neyther let felde returne backe fetche clothes wo shall dayes wt chylde gyue sucke pray ye flyght ☞ wynter neyther sabboth day shall great tribulacions dani xii • suche synce begyn̄yng world tyme shall yea except dayes shulde shortened shuld ☞ fleshe saued chosen sake dayes shalbe shortened mat xiii • luke xvii • yf man saye vnto lo chryst byleue shal aryse false chrystes false prophettes ii thess ii • deut xiii • shall shewe greate miracle wonder moch yf possible verye electe shulde deceyued beholde haue tolde wherfore yf say vnto beholde deserte go ye forth beholde secrete place byleue lyghtnynge cometh east appeareth west shall comynge son man iob xxxi • • luk xvii • soeuer dead carkas euen thyther wyl egles also gathered togyther immediatly mat xiii • luke 〈◊〉 • ioell ii • tribulacions dayes shall son darkened moone shall gyue lyght sterres shal fal heuen power heuen shalbe moued shall appeare token son man heuen shall kynreds earth mourne shall se actes • sonne man cō myng cloudes heuen power great glorie dani 〈◊〉 • • thes 4 • shall sende angel great voyce trompet shall gather togyther chosen foure wyndes euen hyghest partes heuen vntyll endes therof mat xiii • luke xxi • lerne similitude fygge tree draūce yet tender leaues spronge ye knowe sōmer nygh lykewyse ye ye se thynges ye sure neare euen dores uerely saye vnto generacion shall passe tyll thyngꝭ fulfylled esal ii b heuen earth shal passe esai 〈◊〉 • math v c wordꝭ shal passe daye houre actes • knoweth man angel heuen father gene vii b luke xvii f dayes noe shal also comyng sonne man dayes wente floode dyd eate drynke marry maryed euen vntyll day noe entred shyp knewe tyll floode came toke al away shal also comyng sonne man shall two felde one receyued refused luk xvii g two woman shal gryndyng myll one receyued refused ❀ tvvo bed one shall receyued refused mat xxv b mar xiii luke xii e watche therfore ye knowe houre lorde wyl come yet sure yf good man house knew houre reue xvi c thefe wold come wolde surely watche suffre house brokē vp therfore ye also redy suche houre ye thynke wyll sonne man come fayth full wyse seruaunt lorde hath made ruler ouer housholde gyue meate season blessed seruaunte lorde cometh shal fynde doynge uerely saye vnto shall make hym ruler ouer goodes yf euyll seruaunt say herte lorde wyl longe comynge begyn smyte felowes yea eate drynke dronken seruauntes lorde shall come daye loketh hym houre ware shall hewe hym peces gyue hym porcion ypocrites shall wepynge gnasshyng teeth ¶ ten virgyns talentes delyuered seruauntes generall iudgement capi xxv ✚ shal kyngdom heuen lyke vnto ten virgin toke theyr lampes went mete bryde grome ❀ bride fyue foolysshe fyue wyse foolyshe toke theyr lampes toke none oyle wyse toke oyle theyr vessel lampes also whyle bryde grome taried slombred slept euen mydnyght crye made beholde brydegrome cometh go mete hym thē virgin arose prepared theyr lampes foolyshe sayd vnto wyse gyue v oyle lampes gone wyse answered saynge lest ther ynough v go ye rather sell bye selues whyle wente bye hrydegrome came redy wente hym mariage gate shut vp afterwarde came also virgyns sayeng math vii • lorde lorde open v answered sayd verely say vnto knowe mat xxiiii mar xiii luke xii • watche therfore ye know neyther day yet houre wher sonne man shall come ⊢ ✚ mat xiii luke xix b lykewyse certayne man redye take iourney straunge countrey called seruauntes delyuered vnto goodes vnto one gaue v talentꝭ ii one euery man habilite streyght way departed receyued v talentes went occupied wan fyue talentes lykewyse also receyued ii gayned ii receyued one went dygged earth hyd lordes money longe season lorde seruauntes came rekened receyued v talentes came broughte v talentes sayenge syr thou delyueredst fyue talentes beholde haue gayned v talentes mo lorde sayd vnto hym well thou good faythfull seruaunt thou hast bene faythfull ouer fewe thynges wyll make ruler ouer many thynges enter thou ioy thy lorde also receyued two talentes came sayd syr thou delyueredst vnto two talentes beholde haue two talentes lorde sayd vnto hym well good faythfull seruaunt thou hast bene faythful ouer fewe thyngꝭ wyll make ruler ouer many thynges entre thou ioy thy lorde ⊢ whiche receyued one talent came sayde syr knowe thou arte harde man reapyng thou hast sowen gathering thou hast strawed therfore afrayde went hyd thy talent earth lo thou hast thyne lorde answered sayd vnto hym thou euyll slowthfull seruaunt thou knewest reape sowed gather haue strawed thou oughtest therfore haue delyuered money exchaungers comyng shulde haue receyued myne owne wt vaūtage take therfore talent gyue vnto hym hath ten talentes mat xiii c mar iiii • ☞ vnto euery one hath shalbe gyuen shall haue aboundaunce hath hym shal taken away euē hath cast vnprofitable seruaunt vtter darkenesse mat xii • • • x •• shall wepynge gnasshynge teethe ✚ •• sonne man cometh glorie al holy angel hym shall syt vpon seate glorie hym shall gathered nacions e • ech • 34 shall separate one shepeheerde deuydeth shepe frō gootes shall set shepe ryght hande gootes lefte thē shal kynge say shalbe ryght hand come ye blessed father inherite kyngdom math tx prepared begynnyng worlde e • lviii b e • e xviii hungred ye gaue meate thyrstie ye gaue drynke harbourlesse ye toke naked ye clothed eccle vii sicke ye visited • • mo pryson ye came vnto shall ryghteous answere hym sayenge lorde sawe hungred fed thirstie gaue drynke sawe harbourles toke naked clothed saw sycke pryson came vnto kyng shall answere saye vnto verely say vnto moch ye haue done vnto one least th • se brother ye haue done shal say also vnto shalbe lefte hand psal vi b mat vi • lu •• •• ii f departe ye cursed hym sayenge lorde whē sawe hungred thirst harbourlesse naked sycke prison dyd minister vnto shall answere sayenge uerely say vnto moche prou • iii c x • ii ye dyd one least ye dyd iohn̄ v g shall go euerlastyng payne ryghteous lyfe eternall ⊢ ¶ magdalen anoynteth christ eate easter lamde supper lorde christ prayeth garden iudas terrayeth hym peter smote •••• care christ accused false wytnesses peter denyeth hym capi xxvi came passe iesus finisshed al sayenges sayd vnto disciple ✚ mat xiii luke x • ii ye knowe two dayes shalbe easter son man shall delyuered ouer crucified iohn̄ xi • assembled togyther cheyfe preestes scribe elder peple vnto palace hygh preest whiche called cayphas helde counsell▪ myght take iesus subteltie kyll hym sayde holy day lest vproute amonge people mat 14 • iohn̄ xii • iesus bethany house symon leper came vnto hym woman luke vi • • hauyng alabaster boxe precious oyntment powred head sat borde disciple saw indignacion sayeng wherto serueth waste oyntment myght haue bene well solde gyuen poore iesus vnderstode sayd vnto trouble ye wamā hath wrought ☞ good worke vpon deut xv • ye haue poore alwayes shall ye haue alwayes hath cast oyntment body dyd burye uerely say vnto soeuer gospell shal preached world shal also hath done tolde memoryall mat 14 b luke • xii iohn̄ •••• one twelue whiche called iudas iscarioth wente vnto cheyfe preestes sayde vnto wyll ye gyue wyll delyuer hym vnto appoynted vnto hym thyrtie peces syluer frō tyme forth sought oportunite betray hym mat 14 b luke xxii • fyrst day swete bread disciple came iesus sayenge vnto hym wylt thou prepare eate ☞ passeouer sayd go citye suche man saye vnto hym mayster sayeth tyme hande wyll kepe myne easter disciple disciple dyd iesus appoynted made redy passecuer mat •• iii e luke xxii b euen come sat downe twelue dyd eate sayd uerely say vnto iohn̄ xiii • one shall betraye excedyng forowfull began euery one say vnto lorde swered sayd dyppeth hand dysshe shall betray psal xli • sonne man truely gothe wrytten hym wo vnto man sonne man betrayed bene good man yf bene borne iudas whiche betrayed hym answered sayde mayster sayde vnto hym thou hast sayde eatyng iesus toke brende gyuen thankꝭ brake gaue disciple sayd lo • •• e luke xxii b mat 14 • take eate body toke cup thanked gaue sayenge drynke ye bloode whiche newe testament shed many remyssyon synnes saye vnto wyll drynke hence forth fruyte vyne tree vntyll daye shall drinke newe father kyngdome mat xiiii • sayd grace went vnto mount oliuete sayeth iesus vnto ye shall offended bycause nyght wrytten 〈…〉 13 •• xiiii wyl smyte shepeheerde shepe flocke shal scattered abrode rysen agayne wyll go galile peter answered sayde vnto hym mat xiiii luke xxii though men offended bycause yet wyll offended iesus sayd vnto hym uerely say vnto nyght cocke crowe yu shalte denye thryse peter sayde vnto hym yea though shulde dye yet wyl deny likewyse also sayd al disciple mark 14 came iesus vnto farme place whiche called gethsemane sayde vnto disciple syt ye whyle go praye yonder toke hym peter two sonnes zebede began waxe sorowfull heuye sayde iesus vnto mat 14 iohn̄ xii • soule heuye euen vnto death tary ye watche went lytell fell flat face prayed sayenge father yf possyble luke xxii mat xiiii let cup passe neuerthelesse wyl thou wylt came vnto disciple founde slepe sayeth vnto peter coulde ye watche wt one houre watch pray ye enter temptacyon gala b c spirite wyllynge flesshe weyke mat xiiii c went away agayn prayed sayenge father yf cup maye passe away excepte drynke thy wyll fulfylled came found slepe agayn theyr eye heuy left went agayne prayed thyrde tyme sayenge wordes cometh disciple sayeth vnto slepe nowe take rest beholde houre hande son man betrayed handes synners ryse let v goynge behold hande dothe betray whyle yet spake lo iudas one themat xiiii • luke xxii • nombre twelue came hym great multitude swerdes staues sent cheyfe preestes elder peple betrayed hym gaue token sayenge euer kysse holde hym fast forthwith came iesus sayde hayle mayster kyssed iesus sayd vnto frende wherfore arte thou come came layde handes iesus toke hym beholde one whiche iesus stretched hande drewe swerde stroke seruaunte hyghe preest smote eare sayde iesus vnto put vp thy swerde sheeth gene ix • iohn̄ • reue xiii e ez • h • • ☞ take swerde shall peryshe swerde thynkest thou pray father shal gyue ❀ euen novve xii ☞ l • gions angel howe shall scripture fulfylled lu xxiiii must houre sayd iesus multitude mat xiiii luk xxii ye come vnto swerdꝭ staues take sat dayly teachynge temple ye toke psal xix xxi done scripture prophettes myght ful fylled mat xiiii luke xxii iohn̄ 18 • disciple forsoke hym fled toke iesus led hym cayphas hygh preest scribe elder assembled peter folowed hym farre vnto hygh preestes palace went 〈◊〉 sat wt seruauntes se ende mat xi •• actes vi theyf preestes elder counsell sought false wytnesse agaynst iesus put hym death founde none yea whē many false wytnesses came yet founde none last came two false wytnesses sayde felowe sayde mat xi • • iohn̄ ii able destroy temple god buylde agayn thre dayes mat xiiii • cheyfe preest arose sayde vnto hym answerest thou nothynge beare wytnesse agaynst iesus helde peace mat xiiii • cheyfe preest answered sayde vnto hym charge lyuyng god thou tel v whyther thou chryst sonne god iesus sayeth vnto hym thou hast sayde neuerthelesse saye vnto mat • iiii • luke xxii • shall ye se sonne man syttyng ryght hande power comyng cloudꝭ skye mat 14 • hygh preest rent clothes say enge hath spoken blasphemye nede mo wytnesses beholde nowe ye haue herde blasphemye thynke ye answered sayde worthy dye esai • • dyd spyt face bufferted fystes smote hym face palme theyr handꝭ sayenge tell v thou christ smote peter sat without palace damsel came hym sayeng thou also wast iesus galile denyed al sayeng wote thou sayest gone porche wenche sawe hym sayd vnto felowe also iesus nazareth agayne denyed othe sayenge knowe man whyle came vnto hym stode sayd vnto peter mat 14 • luke xxii f iohn̄ 18 c surely thou arte euen one thy speache wrayeth began curse sweare knewe man immediately math 2 • c cocke crew peter remembred worde iesu sayd vnto cocke crowe thou shalte denye thryse went wepte bytterly capi xxvii ¶ christ delyuered vnto pilate iudas hangeth hym self christ crucified amonge theues dyeth buryed watche men kepe graue mornynge come cheyfe preestes elder people helde counsell agaynst iesus put hym death brought hym bound psal ii mat iv luk xxiii iohn̄ 18 c delyuered •••• iii c hym vnto poncius pilate debite iudas whiche betrayed hym seynge cōdemned repented hym selfe brought agayne thyrtie plate syluer cheyfe preestes elder sayenge haue synned betrayeng innocent bloode sayde v se thou cast downe syluet plate temple departed ii 17 actes • went hanged hym selfe cheyfe preestes toke syluer plate sayde lawfull put treasure bycause pryce bloode toke counsell bought potter felde bury straungers wherfore felde called ❀ haceldema felde bloode vntyll daye fulfylled whiche spokē ☞ ieremy prophet sayeng zacha xi c toke thyrtie syluer plate pryce hym valued bought chyldren israell gaue potter felde lorde appoynted mat xv luke 23 iohn̄ 18 f iesus stode debite debite asked hym sayenge art thou kyng iues iesus sayeth vnto hym thou sayest accused cheyf preestes elder answered nothynge sayeth pilate vnto hym hearest thou howe many wytnesses laye agaynst esai iiii c answered hym neuer worde moch debite marueyled greatly mat 〈◊〉 • feast debite wonte dedelyuer vnto people prysoner whome wolde desyre notable prysoner called barrabas therfore gathered togyther pilate sayd mat 〈◊〉 • iohn̄ 〈◊〉 • ther wyl ye gyue loose vnto barrabas iesus called chryst knewe enuye delyuered hym set downe gyue iudgement wyfe sent vnto hym sayenge haue thou nothyng iust man haue suffered many thynges daye slepe bycause hym math 〈◊〉 • luke xx •• • cheyfe preestꝭ elder persuaded peple shulde aske barrabas destroy iesus debite answered sayde vnto whyther twayne wyll ye let loose vnto sayde actes iii • barrabas pilate sayde vnto mat xv • shall iesus whiche called chryste sayde vnto hym let hym crucified debite sayde euyll hath done cryed sayenge let hym crucified pylate sawe coulde preuayle nothynge busynes made toke water wasshed handes people sayenge innocent bloode iust persone ye shal se answered people sayd actes v • bloode v chyldren mat xv • luk xxiii • let barrabas lose vnto scourged iesus delyuered hym crucified mat xv • souldiours debite toke iesus comen hall gathered vnto hym company stryped hym put hym purple robe platted crowne thornes put vpon heade reede ryght hande bowed knee hym mocked hym sayeng nayle kynge iues spyt vpon toke reede smote head mocked hym toke robe hym agayne put owne rayment hym led hym awaye crucifie hym came mat xv • luk xxiii • founde mā cyren named symon hym compelled beare crosse mat xv • iohn̄ xix • came vnto place whiche called golgotha say place deade men sculles gaue hym vyneger drinke mengled wt gal whē tasted therof wolde drinke whē crucified parted garmentes cast lotte might fulfylled luk xxiii esai iiii • two theues crucified hym one ryght hande lefte math xv c luke xxiii f passed reuyled hym wagynge theyr heades sayeng thou destroyedst temple god dydest buylde thre dayes saue thy selfe sapi ii thou sonne god come downe crosse lykewyse also hygh preestes mockynge hym scribe elder sayde saued hym selfe saue kynge israel let hym nowe come downe crosse wyll byleue hym psal xxii b trusted god let hym delyuer hym nowe yf wyll haue hym sayde son god theues also crucified hym cast teeth mark xv c luke xxiii f syxte houre darkenes ouer lande vnto nynth houre aboute nynth houre iesus cryed loude voyce sayenge eli eli lamasabachthani saye mark xv c psal xxii god god hast thou forsaken stode herde sayde man calleth elia streyghte waye mar xv iohn̄ xix f one ran toke sponge fylled full vyneger put teede gaue hym drynke sayde let let v se whyther elia wyll come delyuer hym iesus cryed agayne loude voyce yelded vp goost beholde mat xv luke xxv f vayle temple dyd rent two partes top bottom earthe dyd quake stone rent graues open many bodyes sayntes whiche slepte arose went graues resurreccion came holy citye appeared vnto many mat xv luke xxiii • centurion hym watchynge iesus sawe earth quake thynges whiche happened feared greatly sayenge truely sonne god mat xv luk xxiii g many woman beholdynge hym farre folowed iesus galile ministryng vnto hym amonge whiche mary magdalen mary mother iames io mother zebedes chyldren euen come mat xv luk xxiii g iohn̄ xix g came ryche man aramathia named ioseph whiche also iesus disciple wente pilate begged body iesus pilate cōmaunded body delyuered ioseph taken body wrapped cleane lynnen cloth layd new tombe hewen euen rocke rolled great stone dore sepulcre departed mar xv mary magdalen mary syttyng ouer wyll aryse agayne cō maunde therfore sepulcre made sure vntyll thirde daye lest disciple come steale hym away say vnto people rysen deade laste errour shal worse thē fyrst pilate sayd vnto ye haue luke 〈◊〉 • departed quycklye sepulcre feare greate ioye dyd runne brynge disciple worde went tell disciple beholde iesus met sayenge hayle came helde hym feete worshypped hym sayde iesus vnto afrayde mountayne iesus appoynted sawe hym worshypped hym douted iesus came spake vnto sayeng math xi • iohn̄ 17 • power gyuen vnto heuen earth • xvi • go ye therfore teache nacions baptisyng name father sonne zebede iohn̄ brother also ship mendyng theyr nettes anone called lefte theyr father zebede shyp hyred seruauntes folowed hym mat iiii • came capernaum streyght way sabboth dayes entred synagoge taughte astonyed learnynge mat vii • luke •• • taughte one auctoryte scribe mat vii • luke 〈…〉 theyr synagoge man vexed vncleane spirite cryed sayenge ala haue thou iesus nazareth arte thou come sayenge thynge newe doctrine auctorite cōmaunded foule spirites obeyed hym immediatly fame spred abrode throughout region borderynge galile forthwith come synagoge mat viii • luke iiii • entred house symon andrew iames iohn̄ simon mother lawe lay sycke feuer anone tel hym came toke hande lyft vp immedyatly feuer forsoke ministred vnto euen son downe brought vnto hym dyseased vexed deuyls citye gathered togyther dore healed many sycke dyuers disease luke iiii g math iii • cast many deuyls suffered deuyls speake bycause knewe hym mornynge early iesus rysen vp departed wente solitarye place leper hym besechynge hym knelynge downe sayeng vnto hym yf thou wylt thou caust make clene iesus compassyon hym put forth hande touched hym sayth vnto hym wyll thou cleane soone spoken immediatly leprosye departed hym sent hym away forthwith sayth vnto hym • vii • se thou say nothynge man get hence shewe thy selfe preest offer thy clensynge thynges moses cōmaunded wytnesse vnto assone departed began tell many thynges publysshe sayenge moch iesus coulde openly enter citye without deserte place came hym euery quarter ¶ healeth mā palsye calleth leui customer • ateth open synners excuseth disciple capi ii fewe dayes also entred capernaum agayne noysed house anon many gathered togyther moche nowe rowme receyue moch dore preached worde vnto math 〈◊〉 • luke v came vnto hym bryngynge one sycke palsye whiche borne foure men coulde come nygh vnto hym prease vncouered roofe house broken vp rofe dyd coordes let downe bed wherin sycke palsye lay iesus sawe theyr fayth sayde vnto sycke palsye luke v • sonne thy synnes forgyuen certayne scribe syttynge thynkynge theyr hertes dothe speake blasphemyes esai xliii • xli •• • forgyue synnes god onely immediatly iesus perceyued spirite thought within selues sayeth vnto thynke ye suche thynges hertes whyther easyer saye sycke palsye thy synnes forgyuen say aryse take vp thy bed walke ye may knowe sonne man hath power earth forgyue synnes spake vnto sycke palsye saye vnto math ix • luke v • iohn̄ v • aryse take vp thy bed get hence vnto thyne owne house immediatly arose toke vp bed went forth moche amased glorified god sayenge neuer sawe fassyon math • x • went agayne • ned see al people resorted vnto hym taught iesus passed sawe l • u • sonne alphene syttynge receyte custome sayde vnto hym folowe arose folowed hym came passe iesus sat meate house many publican synners sat also togyther meate iesus disciple many folowed scribe pharises hym eate publican synners sayde vnto disciple howe happeneth eateth drinketh publican synners iesus herde sayde vnto hole haue nede phisician sycke tim • • • came call ryghteous synners repentaunce math 〈◊〉 • luke v • disciple iohn̄ pharises dyd fast come say vnto hym disciple iohn̄ pharises fast thy disciple fast iesus sayd vnto chyldren weddynge fast whyle brydegrome longe haue brydegrome fast dayes wyl come whē brydgrome shalbe taken away shal fast dayes man also soweth pece new cloth vn olde garment el taketh awaye new pece therof olde rent worse man powreth newe wyne olde bottels el new wyne doth brast bottels wyne runneth oute bottels marred newe wyne must put newe bottels math xii luke vi chaunsed ❀ agayne went thorowe corne feldes sabboth dayes disciple began way plucke eares corue pharises sayd vnto behold sabboth dayes whiche lawfull sayde vnto haue ye neuer red dauid dyd nede hungred hym • reg xxi b nowe wente house god dayes ☞ abiathar hygh preest dyd eate shewbreade lawfull eate preestes onely gaue also whiche hym sayd vnto sabboth made man man sabboth therfore son man lorde also sabboth ¶ helpeth man dryed hande choseth aposties casteth vncleane spirite whiche pharisea ascribe vnto deuyll brother syster mother chryst capi iii entred agayne synagoge man math xii luke vi wethered hande watched hym whyther wold heale hym sabboth daye myght accuse hym sayd vnto man wethered hande aryse stande myddes sayeth vnto whyther lawfull good sabboth dayes euyl saue lyfe kyll helde theyr peace loked rounde anger mournyng blyndnes theyr hertes sayth man math xii b luke vi b stretch forth thyne hande stretched • reg 13 b hande restored euen hole ⊢ frome iurye ierusalem idumea beyonde iordane mat iiii luke vi c iohn vi dwelled aboute tyre sidon great multitude men whē herde thynges dyd came vnto hym iesus cōmaunded disciple shyp shulde wayte hym bycause people leest shulde thronge hym healed many moche preased vpon hym touche many plage vncleane spirites sawe hym fel downe hym cryed sayenge thou arte sonne god straytely charged shulde
