name peter called iames sonne zebede iohn̄ iames brother gaue name boanarges say sonnes thonder andrewe philip bad thylmewe mathew thomas iames son alphene thaddeus simon canaan iudas iscarioth whiche also betrayed hym came house people assembled togyther agayne leysure moche eate breade belonged vnto herde went laye handes vpon hym sayde mad scribe came downe ierusalem sayde hath belzebub math ix • xii b luke xi b hy cheyfe deuyll casteth deuyls called vnto hym sayd vnto parable nowe satan dryue satan yf realme deuyded agaynst selfe realme endure yf house deuyded agaynst selfe house contynue yf satan make insurreccyon agaynst hym selfe deuided contynue hath ende man enter strong mannes house take awaye goodes excepte fyrst bynde strong man spoyle house uerely say vnto synnes shall forgyuen vnto mennes chyldren blasphemy wherwith euer haue blasphemed math xii c luke xii • speaketh blasphemye agaynst holy goost hath neuer forgyuenesse daunger eternall damnacyon sayde hath vncleane spirite mat xii • luke viii • came also mother brother stode without sent vnto hym cal hym oute people sat aboute hym sayd vnto hym beholde thy mother thy ☞ brother seke without answered sayenge mother brother loked rounde aboute disciple whiche sat compasse aboute hym sayd beholde mother brother soeuer dothe wyll god brother syster mother ¶ parable sower chryst stylleth tempest see whiche obeyed hym capi iiii ✚ began agayne teache see syde gathered togyther vnto hym moch people greatly entred shyp mat xiii sat see peple see syde shore taught many thynges parable sayde vnto doctryne herken beholde luk viii went sower sowe fortuned sowed fell way syde foules ayre came deuoured vp fell stony grounde moch earth immediatly sprange vp bycause depth earth soone sonne vp caught heate bycause rotynge wethered away fell amonge thornes thornes grewe vp choked gaue fruyte fell vpon good ground dyd yelde fruyte sprang vp grewe brought forth thyrtye folde syxtye folde hundred folde sayde vnto hath eares heare let hym heare ⊢ alone aboute hym twelue asked parable sayd vnto mat xiii b luke viii b gyuen knowe mystery kyngdome god vnto without al thynges happen parable se may se discerne heare esai vi c mat xiii b luke viii b iohn̄ xii f actes 28 f rom xi • may heare vnderstand lest tyme shulde turne theyr spn̄es shulde forgyuen sayd vnto knowe ye parable howe wyll ye know parable mat xiii c luk viii v sower soweth worde wherof rehearsed waye syde worde sowen heare satan cometh immediatly taketh away worde sowen theyr hertes likewyse receyue seede stony ground whiche heare worde receyue gladnesse yet haue tote selues endure tyme anone trouble persecucion aryseth wordes sake fall immediatly also receyue seede thornes soche heare worde care worlde deceytfulnesse ryches lustes thynges entre choke worde made vnfruytfull haue receyued seede good grounde soche heare worde receyue one corne doth bryng forth thyrtye sixtye hundred sayde vnto math v • luk viii c xi e candle lyghted put vnder busshell vnder table lyghted put candelstycke math x c luke viii xii nothyng preuy shall opened neyther hath ben secret shal come abrode yf man haue eares heare let hym heare sayde vnto take hede ye heare mat vii luke vi f measure ye meate shall men measure vnto agayne vnto heare shall gyuen mat xiii b luke viii • xix • vnto hym hath shall gyuen hym hath shall taken awaye euen whiche hath sayde kyngdome god euen mat xiii yf man shulde sowe seede grounde shulde slepe ryse vy nyght daye seede shulde sprynge growe vp whyle aware earth bryngeth forth fruyte selfe fyrste blade eare full come eare fruyte brought forth anone thrusteth syckle bycause haruest come sayd vnto shall lyken kyngdome god comparyson shall compare mat • iii • luke xiii lyke grayne mustarde seede sowen earth lesse seedes earth sowen groweth vp greater herbes beareth great braunches foules ayre may make theyr nestes vnder shadowe mat xiii • many soche parable spake word vnto myght heare without parable spake nothynge vnto alone expounded thynges disciple daye euen come sayde vnto let v passe ouer vnto syde lefte people toke hym euen shyp also hym shyppes mat xiii • arosemat viii c luke viii c great storme wynde waues dashed shyp ful sterne slepe pelowe awaked hym sayde vnto hym mayster carest thou perysshe rose vp rebuked wynde sayde vnto see peace styll wynde ceased folowed greate calme sayde vnto ye fearfull howe happeneth ye haue fayth 〈2 page missing〉 people spyed departed many knewe hym ran foote thyther cityes came thyther came togyther vnto iesus went saw moch people math ix xiiii b cōpassion bycause ezech 34 lyke shepe hauynge shepherde began teach many thynges mat xiiii b luke • x • iohn̄ vi day nowe far spent discyples came vnto hym sayenge deserte place tyme farre passed let departe may go countrey rounde aboute townes bye breade haue nothynge eate answered sayde vnto gyue ye eate sayd vnto hym shall go two hundred peny worth breade gyue eate sayde vnto mat viii howe many looues haue ye go loke searched sayde fyue two fysshes commaunded make syt downe companyes vpon grene grasse sat downe arowe arowe hundred fyftyes taken fyue looues two fysshes loked vp heuen ☞ blessed brake looues gaue discyples set two fysshes deuyded amonge dyd eate satisfyed toke vp twelue baskettes full therof fysshes dyd eate aboute fyue thousande men mat xiiii • streyght waye caused discyples go shyp go ouer see vnto bethsayda whyle sent awaye people mat xiiii c iohn vi b soone sent awaye departed mountayne praye ✚ euen come shyp myddes see alone lande sawe troubled rowyng wynde contrary vnto aboute fourth watche nyght came vnto walkyng vpō see wolde haue passed sawe hym walkyng vpon see supposed ben spiryte cryed sawe hym afrayde anone talked sayd vnto good cheare afrayde mat xiiii c went vp vnto shyp wynde ceased sore amased selues beyond measure meruayled remembred looues bycause theyr herte blynded ouer water came lande genezareth drue vp hauen assoone come shyppe streyght waye knewe hym ran forth al regyon rounde aboute began cary aboute beddes sycke herde whyther soeuer entred townes cityes vyllages layde sycke folkes stretes prayed hym myght touch hemme vesture many touched hym safe ⊢ ¶ disciple eate vnwasshen handes commaundement god transgressed man tradicyons woman syrophenissa sabboth capi vii math xv • pharyses came togyther vnto hym dyuerse scribe came ierusalem sawe certayne dyscyples eate breade comen saye vnwasshen handes complayned pharyses iues excepte wasshe theyr handes ofte eate obseruynge tradycyons elder come frō market excepte washe eate many thynges whiche haue taken vpō obserue wasshynge cuppes crus brasen vessel table asked hym pharyses scrybes walke thy discyples accordynge custome ordeyned elder eate breade vnwasshen handes answered sayd vnto well prophesyed esaias ypocrytes wrytten esai xx •• math xv • people honoureth theyr lyppes theyr herte far howbeit vayne serue teachyng doctrynes cōmaundementes men ye laye cōmaundement god aparte obserue cōstitucyons men wasshynge crus cuppes many soche lyke thynges ye sayde vnto well ye cast syde cōmaundement god maynteyne owne constitucyons exod •• • deute v b ephe xi moses sayde honour thy father thy mother exo xx b leuiti xx b proue xx c curseth father mother let hym dye death ye saye man shall saye father mother corban whiche ☞ gyfte soeuer cō meth fro shall thy prophet ye suffre hym moore ought father mother make worde god none effecte owne constitucyon whiche ye haue ordeyned many soch thynges ye called people vnto hym sayde vnto herken vnto euery one vnderstande math xv • nothynge man defyle hym entreth hym thynges whiche procede man defyle man yf man haue eares heare let hym heare came house awaye people disciple asked hym similitude sayd vnto ye also greatlye without vnderstandynge ye yet perceyue soeuer thynge without entreth man defyle hym bycause entreth herte bely goeth draught pourgynge meates sayde cōmeth man defyleth man frō within euen herte men procede euyl thoughtes aduoutrye nicacyō murther theft couetousnes fraude deceyte vnclennesse wycked eye blasphemyes pryde folyshnesse euyll thynges come within defyle man math xv c thence rose went border tyre sydon entred house wolde man shuld haue knowen coulde hyd certayne woman whose doughter foule spiryte soone herde hym came fell feete woman greke nacion syrophenicia besought hym wold cast deuyll doughter iesus sayde vnto let chyldren fyrst fed mete take chyldrens breade cast vnto whelpes answered sayde vnto hym euen lorde math xv c neuerthelesse whelpes also eate vnder table chyldrens crommes sayde vnto sayenge go thy way deuyll gone thy doughter come home house founde deuyl departed doughter lyenge bed ✚ departed agayne coostes tyre sydon came vnto see galile thorowe myddes coostes ten cityes math xv brought vnto hym one deafe impedyment speche prayed hym put hande vpon hym taken hym asyde people put fyngers eares dyd spyt touched tongue loked vp heuen syghed sayde vnto hym ephata saye opened streyght waye eares opened strynge tongue losed spake playne math ix andmarke cōmaunded shulde tell man forbad moch greate deale publysshed sayenge hath done thynges well hath made deafe heare dombe speake ⊢ ¶ miracle seuen loues pharises aske sygne leuen pharyses blynde receyueth syght capi viii ✚ dayes math xv verye greate companye nothynge eate iesus called dyscyples hym sayde vnto haue compassion people bycause haue nowe ben thre dayes haue nothynge eate yf sende awaye fastyng theyr owne house shall faynte waye esai 〈◊〉 tobi xii • • dyuerse came farre discyples answered hym shulde man haue breade wyldernesse satysfye asked howe mano looues haue ye sayde seuen cōmaunded peple syt downe grounde toke seuen looues gyuen thankes brake gaue discyples set dyd set people fewe small fysshes blessed cōmaunded also set dyd eate suffysed toke vp broken meare lefte seuen baskettes full dyd eate aboute foure thousande sent awaye anone entred shyppe discyples came partyes dalmanutha mat xvi • luke xi iohn̄ vi pharyses came forth began dyspute hym sekyng hym sygne heuen temptyng syghed spiryte sayeth doth generacyon seke sygne uerely saye vnto shall sygne gyuen vnto generacyon lefte went shyppe agayne departed ouer water forgotten take bread neyther shyppe one loofe charged sayenge ✚ mat xvi b luke xii • • take hede beware leuen pharises leuen herode reasoned amonge selues sayenge haue breade iesus knewe sayeth vnto take ye thought bycause ye hsue breade perceyue ye yet neyther vnderstande haue ye herte yet blynded haue ye eye se haue ye eares heare ye also remembre mat xiiii c brake fyue looues amonge fyue thousand men howe many baskettes ful broken meate toke ye vp saye vnto hym twelue math xv brake vii amonge foure thousande howe many baskettes leauynges broken meate toke ye vp sayde seuen sayde vnto howe happeneth ye vnderstande ✚ came bethsayda brought blynde man vnto hym desyred hym touche hym caught blynde hande led hym towne whē spyt eye put handes vpon hym asked hym yf sawe ought loked vp sayde se men perceyue walke tree put handes agayne vpon eye made se restored sawe euery man clearly sent hym home house sayenge neyther go towne tell towne ⊢ math 16 c luke ix c iesus went discyples townes longe citye called cesarea philippi waye asked disciple sayeng vnto men saye answered saye thou arte iohn̄ baptyst saye elyas agayne saye thou arte one nombre prophettꝭ sayeth vnto whome say ye peter answereth sayeth vnto hym mat xvi c luke • • iohn̄ vi g thou arte chryst charged shulde tel man hym began teach mat xvi c xx c luke ix c howe sonne man muste suffer many thyngꝭ reproued elder hygh preestes scrybes kylled thre dayes aryse agayne spake sayenge openly peter toke hym asyde began chyde hym turned aboute loked discyples rebuked peter sayeng go satan thou sauerest thynges god thynges men mat xvi luke ix c x • iii f called people vnto hym discyples also sayd vnto whosoeuer wyll folowe let hym forsake hym selfe take vp crosse folowe soeuer wyll saue lyfe shall lose soeuer shall lose lyfe sake gospel shall saue shall profette man yf wynne worlde loose owne soule shall man gyue redeme soule withall agayne math • • luke xii • soeuer therfore shall shamed wordes aduouterous synfull generacyon hym also shall sonne man ashamed cometh glorye father holye angel ¶ transfiguracyon • una • yhe healed disputacyon shulde greatest offence forbydden capi ix sayde vnto uerely saye mat xvi • luke ix • amonge stande whiche shall taste death tyll haue sene kyngdome god come power math 17 • luke ix • syxe dayes iesus taketh peter iames iohn̄ leadeth vp hygh mountayne waye alone transfygured rayment dyd shyne became verye whyte euen snowe whyte fuller make vpon earth apeared vnto elia moses talked iesu peter answered sayeth iesu mayster good beynge v let v make also thre tabernacle one one moses one elyas wyst sayd afrayde cloude shadowed voyce came cloude sayeng math 〈◊〉 • xvii • luke ii • • • • marke • • esai lii • beloued sonne heare sodenly loked round aboute saw man iesus math 17 • marke • came downe hyll charged shulde tel man thynges sene tyl son man rysen death agayne kepte sayenge demaunded one another rysynge death agayne shulde meane asked hym sayenge saye scrybes elyas muste fyrst come answered sayde vnto mala ••• ii • elyas verely commeth fyrste restoreth thynges son man esai liii • wrytten hym shall suffer many thynges set nought saye vnto elia come haue done vnto hym soeuer wolde wrytten hym came discyples sawe moche people aboute scrybes disputyng streyght waye people behelde hym amased ran hym saluted hym asked scrybes dyspute ye amonge ✚ mat xvii c luke ix c one companye answered sayde mayster haue brought vnto sonne whiche hath dombe spiryte soeuer taketh hym teareth hym fometh gnassheth teethe pyneth away spake thy disciple shulde caste hym coulde answereth hym sayeth faythlesse nacyon howe long shall longe shall suffer brynge hym vnto brought hym vnto hym assoone spiryte sawe hym tare hym fell downe groūde walo wyng fomynge asked father howe longe ago synce hapned hym sayde chylde ofte tymes hath caste hym fyre water destroy yf thou canst thyng haue mercy v helpe v iesus sayd vnto hym yf thou couldest byleue mat xvii thynges possyble hym byleueth streyght waye father chylde cryed teares sayenge lorde byleue helpe thou myne vnbylefe iesus sawe people came runnyng togyther vnto hym rebuked foule spirite sayeng vnto hym thou dombe deafe spiryte charge come hym entre nomore spiryte cryed rent hym sore came hym one ben deade moch many sayde deade iesus caught hande lyfte hym vp rose come house mat xvii discyples asked hym secretly coulde cast hym sayd vnto kynd come forth nothyng prayer fastyng ⊢ ✚ departed thense toke theyr iourney thorowe galile wolde man shulde knowe taught discyples sayde vnto mat xvii luke ix • son man shall delyuered handes men shall kyll hym kylled shall aryse agayne thyrde daye wyste sayde afrayde aske hym came capernaum come house asked ye disputed amonge youre selues waye helde theyr peace waye reasoned amonge selues shulde cheyfest set downe called twelue hym sayde vnto yf man desyre fyrst shall laste seruaunt math 18 • luke ix f toke chylde set hym myddꝭ taken hym armes sayde vnto whosoeuer receyueth soche chylde name receyueth whosoeuer receyueth receyueth hym sent ⊢ iohn̄ answered hym saynge ✚ mayster sawe one cast deuyls thy name foloweth v forbad hym bycause foloweth v iesus sayde forbyd hym cor • xii man yf myracle name lyghtly speake euyl agaynst v parte math x whosoeuer shall name gyue cup water dryncke cause ye belonge chryst verely saye vnto shall lose rewarde math • 8 soeuer shall offende one lytell one byleue better yf mylstone hanged necke caste see math 18 • wherfore ☞ yf thy hande hynder cut better entre lyfe maymed hauynge two handes go hell fyre neuer shall quenched esai 〈◊〉 • theyr worme dyeth fyre goeth oute yf thy foote hynderaunce vnto cut better go halte lyfe hauynge two feete cast hell fyre neuer shall quenched theyr worme dyeth fyre goeth math v • yf thyne eye hynder plucke better go kyngdom god one eye hauynge two eye cast hell fyre theyr worme dyeth fyre goeth ⊢ ☞ euery man shall salted fyre leuiti ii euery sacrifyce shall seasoned salte math v b luk xiiii g salte good yf salte vn sauery shall ye season therwith haue salte youre selues haue peace among youre selues one another ¶ deuorcement ryche man questyoneth chryst sonnes zebede ba • thimens blynde man capi x ✚ rose thence math xix • went coostes iurye regyon beyonde iordane people resorted vnto hym fresshe wont taught agayne pharyses came asked hym lauful man put away wyfe proue hym answered sayd vnto deute 24 math xix • dyd moses byd sayde moses suffered wryte testymonyall deuorsement put away iesus answered sayde vnto hardnesse herte wrote precepte vnto fyrst creacyon gene god made man woman therfore cori vi mat xix gene ii ephe v g shall man leaue father mother byde wyfe twayne shalbe one fleshe twayne one fleshe therfore god hath coupled togyther let man seperate house discyples asked hym agayne matter sayeth vnto math v • xix luke xvi whosoeuer putteth awaye wyfe maryeth another breaketh wedlocke towarde yf woman forsake husband maryed another cōmytted aduontrye ⊢ mat xix b luk xviii brought chyldren hym shulde touch disciple rebuked brought iesus sawe displeased sayde vnto suffer chyldren come vnto forbyd soche kyngdome god uerely saye vnto whosoeuer doth receyue kyngdome god math 18 • luk • xvii chylde shall enter therin taken vp armes put handes vpon blessed ⊢ ✚ gone forth waye came one runnynge kneled hym asked hym mat 〈◊〉 b luke 18 good mayster shall maye enheryt eternall lyfe iesus sayde vnto hym callest thou good man good one god thou knowest commaundementes breake matrymony kyll steale beare false wytnesse defraude man honour thy father mother answered sayde vnto hym mayster haue obserued frō youth iesus behelde hym fauoured hym sayde vnto hym one thynge thou lackest math xix • b luke 18 go thy waye ☞ sell thou haste gyue poore thou shalte haue treasure heuen come folow ⊢ take vp crosse vpon thy shoulder dyscōforted bycause sayenge went awaye mournyng great possessyons iesus looked rounde aboute sayde vnto discyples math xix c luke • 8 e howe vneasye shall haue money entre kyngdome god disciple astonyed wordes iesus answereth agayne sayeth vnto chyldren howe harde truste money entre kyngdome god easyer camell go thorowe eye nedle ryche entre kyngdom god astonyed measure sayenge bytwene selues saued iesus loked vpon sayde men vnpossyble god ••• h • vi •• god thynges possyble peter began saye vnto hym lo math 〈◊〉 luke ••• haue forsaken al haue folowed iesus answered sayde uerely saye vnto man hath forsaken house brother systers father mother wyfe chyldren landes sake gospel shal receyue hundred folde nowe lyfe house brother systers mother chyldren landes persecucions worlde come eternal lyfe math ii • luke x ••• many fyrste shall laste last fyrst waye goynge vp ierusalem iesus wente amased folowed afrayde iesus toke twelue agayne began tell thynges shulde happen vnto hym math xvi • xvii c 〈◊〉 luke xv • xv • ▪ • beholde go vp ierusalem sonne man shall delyuered vnto hygh preestes vnto scrybes shall condempne hym death shal delyuer hym gentyls shall mocke hym scourge hym spytte vpon hym kyll hym thyrde daye shall ryse agayne math x • ▪ • iames iohn̄ sonnes zebede came vnto hym sayenge mayster wolde thou shuldest v soeuer desyre sayde vnto wolde ye shuld sayd vnto hym graunte vnto v maye sytte one thy ryght hande thy lefte hande thy glorye iesus sayde vnto ye wore ye aske ye drynke cup drynke baptysed baptyme baptysed sayde vnto iesus sayde vnto ye shall dede drynke cuppe drynke baptyme baptysed shall ye baptysed syt ryght hande lefte hande myne gyue shal happen vnto whome prepared math xx ten herde began disdayne iames iohn̄ iesus called hym sayde vnto ye knowe math xx luke xxii • whiche sene beare rule amonge people reygne lordes ouer greate amonge exercyse anctorite vpon neuerthelesse shall amonge soeuer wyll great amonge shall minister soeuer wyll cheyfe shal seruaunt math xx sonne man also came ministred vnto minister gyue lyfe redempcion many came ierico math • x luk xviii g went cuye ierico disciple great nombre people blynde barthimeus son thimeus sat hygh wayes syde beggynge herde iesus nazareth began crye saye iesus thou sonne dauid haue mercy many rebuked hym shulde holde peace cryed greate deale thou sonne dauid haue mercy iesus stode styll commaunded hym called called blynde sayenge vnto hym good comforte aryse calleth threwe awaye cloke arose came iesus iesus answered sayde vnto hym wylte thou vnto blynde sayde vnto hym mayster myght se iesus sayde vnto hym go thy way thy fayth hath saued immediatly receyued syght folowed iesus waye ¶ christ rydeth ierusalem fygge tree dryeth vp dyer seller cast temple▪ pharised questyon chryst capi xi whē came nygh ierusalem vnto bethphage bethanie besydesmat xxi luke xix c mount olyuete sendeth forthe two disciple sayeth vnto go youre waye towne ouer agaynst soone ye entred ye shall fynde colte bounde whereon neuer man sat lose hym brynge hym hyther yf man saye vnto ye saye ye lorde hath nede hym streyght waye wyll sende hym hither went theyr way founde colte tyed dore without place two wayes met losed hym dyuers stode sayde vnto iohn̄ xii b ye losynge colte sayd vnto euen iesus cōmaunded let go brought colte iesus cast theyr garmentes hym sat vpon hym many spred theyr garmentes waye cut downe braunches thē tree strawed way went folowed cryed sayenge hosanna psal •• 8 mat xxi b luke xix • iohn̄ xii b blessed commeth name lorde blessed kyngdome cometh name hym lorde father dauid hosanna highest lorde entred ierusalem temple loked rounde aboute vpon thynges nowe euentyde come wente oute vnto bethany twelue mat xxi b morowe come oute frome bethany hungred spyed fygge tree farre hauynge leaues came se yf myghte fynde thynge theron came sounde nothynge leaues tyme fygges yet iesus answered sayde vnto fygge tree neuer man care fruyte hereafter whyle worlde standeth disciple herde it▪ came ierusalem hesus went temple began mat xxi b luke xi • iohn̄ ii • caste oute solde bought temple ouerthrewe table money chaungers stole solde doues wolde suffre man shulde cary vessell thorowe temple taught sayenge vnto esai ii e 3 regū 8 • iere vii • wrytten house shall called house prayer vnto nacyons ye haue made den theues scribe hygh preestes herde sought howe destroye hym mat xxi • feared hym bycause people meruayled doctryne euen come iesus wente citye mat xxi luke xiii b mornynge passed sawe fygge tree dryed vp • • e peter remembred sayde vnto hym mayster beholde fygge tree thou cursedst wethered away iesus answered sayde vnto haue confidence god ✚ uerelye saye vnto whosoeuer shall saye vnto mountayne remoue cast thy selfe see shall doute herte shall byleue thynges whiche sayeth shall come passe soeuer sayeth shall haue therfore say vnto mat xxi c iohn̄ ▪ • 4 b thynges soeuer ye desyre ye pray byleue ye receyue ye shall haue ye stande pray math vi b xviii forgyue yf ye haue ought agaynst mā father also whiche heuen maye forgyue youre trespass came agayne ierusalem luke 〈◊〉 math • 1 • walked temple came vnto hym hygh preestes scribe elder saye vnto hym auctorite doest thou thynges gaue auctorite thynges iesus answered sayde vnto wyl also aske certayne thyng answere ye wyll tell auctoryte thynges baptyme iohsi whyther heuen men answere thought selues sayenge yf say frō heuen wyll say dyd ye byleue hym yf sayd men feared people mē counted iohn̄ prophet answered sayde vnto iesu tell iesus answered sayde vnto neyther wyll tel auctorite thynges ⊢ ¶ vyneyarde let gyue cesar belongeth to▪ cesar saduces doctoure lawe ypocrites must eschued offerynge poore wydowe capi xii began speake vnto parable certayne man planted esai v iere xii c mat xxi luke xx b iohsi • x c vyneyarde compassed aboute wt hedge ordeyned wyne presse buylt toure let hyre vnto husbande men went straunge countrey tyme come sent husbande men seruaunt myght receyue husbandman fruyte vyneyarde caught hym bet hym sent hym away agayne emptye ouer sent vnto seruaunte hym caste stone brake heade sent hym away agayne al reuyled agayne sent hym kylled many beatynge kyllynge yet one byloued sonne sent also last vnto sayenge wyll feare sonne math xxi husbande men sayde amongest selues heyre come gene 37 luke xx c let v kyll hym enheritaunce shall oures toke hym kylled hym cast hym vyneyarde shall therfore lorde vyneyarde shal come destroy husbande men let vyneyarde vnto haue ye red scripture psal 〈◊〉 • math x ••• actes 〈◊〉 • stone whiche buylders dyd refuse become cheyfe stone corner lordes doynge meruaylous eye wente aboute also take hym feared people knewe spoken parable agaynst lefte hym went theyr waye mat xx •• ▪ • luke xx • sent vnto hym certayne pharises herodes seruauntes take wordes assoone come sayd vnto mayster know thou art true carest man thou consyderest outward apperaūce men teachest way god truely lawfull pay tribute cesar ought gyue ought gyue vnderstode theyr simulacyon sayde vnto tempte ye brynge peny may se brought sayeth vnto whose ymage superscripcyon sayde vnto hym cesars iesus answered sayde vnto math 17 • xxii • rom xiii▪ • gyue cesar thynges belonge cesar god thynges whiche perteyne god meruayled hym came also vnto hym saducesmat xxii • luke xx • actes 23 b whiche say resurreccyon asked hym sayenge mayster deu 25 b moses wrote vnto v yf man brother dye leaue wyfe behynde hym leaue chyldren brother shulde take wyfe reyse vp seede vnto brother seuen brethrē fyrst toke wyfe dyed lefte seede behynde hym seconde toke dyed neyther left seed thyrde lykewyse seuen lefte seede behynde last al wyfe dyed also resurreccion therfore shall ryse agayne whose wyfe shal seuen wyfe iesus answered sayd vnto ye therfore erre bycause ye vnderstand scripture neyther power god shall ryse agayne frome death neyther marry maryed angel whiche heuen touchynge deade ryse agayne haue ye red booke moses howe busshe god spake vnto sayenge exodi iii b mat xxii b luke x f god abraham god isaac god iacob god deade god lyuynge ye therfore greatly dcceyued mat xxii came one scrybes herde dysputynge togyther perceyued answered well asked hym whiche fyrst cōmaundementes iesus answered fyrst al cōmaundementes heare israel deut vi mat xxii lorde oure god lorde onely thou shalt loue lorde thy god thy herte thy soule thy mynde al thy strength fyrst cōmaundement seconde lyke vnto leu • ti xix math v c mat xxii b rom xiii c calath v c iames ii b thou shalte loue thy neyghboure thy selfe none commaundement greater scrybe sayde vnto hym well mayster thou hast sayde trueth one god none loue hym herte mynde soule al strength loue man neyghboure hym selfe greater thynge burnt offerynges sacrifice iesus sawe answered discretly sayd vnto hym thou art farre kyngdom god man durste aske hym questyon iesus answered sayd teachyng temple say ye scribe christ son dauid dauid hym selfe enspired holy goost sayd mat xxii psal • x • lorde sayd lorde syt ryght hande tyll make thyne enemyes thy fote • ole dauid hym selfe calleth lorde son moche peple herde hym gladly sayd vnto doctrine beware scribe whiche math 23 luke xx • loue go longe clothynge loue salutacyons market place cheyfe seates congregacyons vppermost rowmes feastꝭ whiche deuoure wydowes house vnder pretence make longe prayer shall receyue greater damnacyon ✚ iesus sat ouer agaynst treasurye behelde luke xxi howe people put money treasurye many ryche cast moche came certayne poore wydowe threwe two mytes whiche make farthynge called vnto hym disciple sayeth vnto uerely saye vnto poore wydowe hath cast al whiche haue cast treasurye dyd cast theyr superfluyte pouerte dyd cast euen lyuynge ⊢ ¶ ende worlde day houre 〈◊〉 vnknowen capi xiii ✚ went themple one disciple sayde vnto hym maystermat xxiii • luke xxi se stone buyldynges iesus answered sayd vnto hym seest thou great buyldynges shall lefte one stone vpon shall throwen downe sat mounte olyuete ouer agaynst temple peter iames iohn̄ andrew asked hym secretly tell v whē shal thynges sygne thynges shall fulfylled iesus answered began say mat ••• ii • luke xxi b take hede lest man deceyue many shall come name sayenge chryst shall deceyue many ye shall heare warres tydynges warres ye troubled suche thynges must nedes ende yet shall nacion aryse agaynst nacion kyngdome agaynst kyngdome shall earth quake quarter famyshment shall trouble begynnyng sorowes iohn̄ xvi take ye hede selues math x b luke xxi c iohn̄ xvi shall bryng vp counsel sinagoges ye shalbe beaten yea shalbe brought ruler kynges sake testimoniall vnto mat xxiiii b gospell must fyrst publysshed among al nacions math x • leade present take ye thought neyther ymagyn hande ye shall saye soeuer gyuen houre speake ye speake holy goost brother shall delyuer vp brother death father son chyldrē shall ryse agaynst theyr father mother shall put death ye shalbe hated al men name sake endureth vnto ende shall safe mat x • iiii luke xxi danie ix • ouer ye se abhominacyon desolacion wherof spokē daniel prophet stande ought let hym redeth vnderstande let iurie flee mountaynes let hym house top go downe house neyther entre therin fetche thing house let hym felde turne backe agayne vnto thynges lefte behynde hym take clothes hym wo shalbe thē chyld gyue sucke dayes praye ye flyght wynter shall dayes suche tribulacyon begynnyge creature god created vnto tyme neyther shall excepte lorde shulde shorten dayes flesshe shulde saued electes sake whome hath chosen hath shortened dayes math 24 b luk xvii • yf man say lo christ lo byleue false christes false prophettes shall ryse shall shewe myracles wonder deceyue yf possyble euen electe take ye hede beholde haue shewed thynges io • ii c math 24 c luke xxi c moreouer dayes tribulacion sonne shall waxe darke moone shall gyue lyght sterres heuen shall fal power whiche heuen shall moue dani • ii c shall se sonne man comyng cloudes great power glorye shall sende angel shall gather togyther electe foure wyndes ende earth vttermost parte heuen math 24 luke xxi f learne similitude fygge tree braunche yet tender hathe brought forth leaues ye know somer neare ye lyke maner ye se thynges come passe vnderstande nygh euen dores uerely say vnto generacion shall passe tyll thynges done heuen earth shal passe wordes shall passe day tyme knoweth man angel whiche heuen ☞ neyther sonne hym selfe saue father onely math 24 luke xxi c take hede watche praye ye knowe tyme mā gone straunge countrey hath lefte house gyuen substaunce seruauntes euery man worke andmat xxv b luke xix b cōmaunded porter watche watche ye therfore ye knowe mayster house wyll come euen mydnyght whyther cocke crowynge dawnynge leest yf come sodeynly fynde slepyng say vnto saye vnto watche ¶ mary magdalen anoynteth christ easter lambe eaten christ taken peter denyeth hym many thynges dem •• ded christ capi xiiii ✚ two dayes easter dayes swete breade math 26 luke xxii hygh preestes scribe sought howe myght take hym crafte put death sayde feast day lest busynes aryse among people mat xx ••• iohn̄ xi • whē bethania house simon leper euen sat meate came woman hauynge alabaster boxe oyntmente called narde pure costly brake boxe powred heade contente within selues sayde neded waste oyntment myghte haue ben solde ccc penny haue bene gyuen vnto poore grudged agaynst iesus sayde let alone trouble ye hath done good worke deute xv • ye haue poore alwayes soeuer ye wyll ye maye good haue ye alwayes hath done coulde came beforehande anoynt body buryenge uerely say vnto soeuer gospell shall preached thorowout hole worlde also hath done shall rehersed remembraunce mat xx ••• luke 〈…〉 iohn̄ xiii • iudas iscarioth one twelue went away vnto hygh preestes betray hym vnto herde glad promysed wolde gyue hym money sought howe myghte conuentently betray hym mat xxvi b luke xxii • fyrst day swete bread whē offred ☞ passouer disciple saye vnto hym wylte thou go prepare thou mayste eate passeouer sendeth forth two disciple sayeth vnto go ye citye shal mete man bearynge pytcher water folowe hym whyther soeuer goeth say ye good man house mayster sayeth geste cambre shal eate passeouer disciple wyll shewe great parloure paued prepared make redy v disciple went forth came citye founde sayde vnto made redy passeouer mat xxvi b luke xxii euentyde came twelue sat borde dyd eate iesus sayd uerely say vnto iohn̄ xiii • one eateth shall betray began sory say hym one one sayd answered sayde vnto one twelue euen dyppeth platter sonne mā truely goeth wrytten hym wo man son man betrayed good man yf neuer bene borne dyd eate iesus toke breade math 26 c luke xxii b • corin xi e gyuen thankes brake gaue sayde take eate body toke cup gyuen thankes toke dranke sayde vnto bloode newe testament whiche shed many uerely saye vnto wyll drynke fruyte vyne vntyll daye drynke newe kyngdom god math 26 c sayd grace went mount olyuete iesus sayeth vnto ye shall offended bycause nyght wrytten •• ba xiii c math 26 c luke xxii iohn̄ xiii wyll smyte shepeheerde shepe shall scattered rysen agayne wyl go galile peter sayd vnto hym though al men offended yet wyl iesus sayeth vnto hym uerelye saye vnto daye euen nyght cocke crowe twyse thou shalte denye thre tymes spake vehemently yf shulde dye wyll denye lykewyse also sayde math 26 came place named gethsemani sayth disciple syt ye whyle go asyde praye taketh hym peter iames iohn̄ began waxe abasshed agonye sayeth vnto math 26 iohn̄ xii soule heuy euen vnto death tary ye watche went forth lytel fel downe flat grounde prayed yf possyble houre myghte passe hym sayd math 26 luke xxii abba father thynges possyble vnto take away cup neuerthelesse wyll thou wylte done came founde slepynge sayeth peter simon slepest thou couldest thou watche one houre watche ye praye lest ye entre temptacyon spirite trulye redy flesshe weyke math 26 agayne went asyde prayed spake wordes returned founde slepe agayne theyr eye heuye neyther wyst answere hym came thirde tyme sayde vnto slepe henceforth take ease ynough houre come beholde sonne mā betrayed handes synners ryse vp let v go lo betrayeth hande math 26 luke xxii e immediatly whyle yet spake cometh iudas whiche one twelue great nombre people swerdes staues hygh preestes scribe elder betrayed hym gyuen general token sayenge soeuer kysse take hym leade hym awaye warely soone come goeth streyghte waye hym sayeth vnto mayster mayster kyssed hym layde theyr handꝭ hym toke hym one stode drue swerde smote seruaunt hygh preest cur care iesus answered sayd vnto math • 6 8 luke xxii • ye come vnto thefe swerdꝭ staues take dayly wt temple teachynge ye toke thynges come passe scripture shulde fulfylled math 26 • luke xxii • iohn̄ xviii al forsoke hym ran away folowed hym certayne yong man clothed lynnen vpon bare yonge men caughte hym lefte lynnen garment fled naked math 26 f luke xxii f iohn̄ 18 • l • iesus away hyghest preest hym came hygh preestes elder scribe peter folowed hym greate way euen tyl come palace hyghe preest sat 〈…〉 warmed hym selfe fyre math 26 • actes 〈◊〉 hygh preestes counsell sought wytnes agaynst iesus put hym death founde none many bare false wytnesse agaynst theyr wytnesses agreed togyther arose cer • ayn brought false wytnes agaynst hym sayeng • e hym saye mat xxvi • iohn̄ ii wyll destroy temple made handes within thre dayes wyl buylde made without handꝭ yet theyr wytnesses agreed togyther mat xxvi f hygh preest stode vp amongest asked iesus sayenge answerest thou nothynge howe beare wytnesse agaynst helde peace answered nothynge agayne mat xxvi f hyghest preest asked hym sayde vnto hym arte thou christ son blessed iesus sayde mat xxvi • luke x • ii g iohn̄ v • g ye shal se sonne man syttyng ryght hande power comynge cloudes heuen hygh preest rent clothes sayde nede wytnesses ye haue herde blasphemye thynke ye al condemned hym worthy death began spyt hym couer face beate fystes say vnto hym arede seruauntꝭ buffetted hym face peter byneth palace came one wench hyghest preest math 26 g luke xxii f iohn̄ 18 c sawe peter warmyng hym selfe loketh hym sayeth wast thou also iesus nazareth denyed sayenge knowe hym neyther wote thou sayest went porche cocke crewe damsel sawe hym began agayne say stode one denyed agayn anone stode sayde agayne peter surely thou arte one thou art galile thy speache agreeth therto began curse swere sayenge know mā ye speake agayne math 26 g luke xxii g cocke crewe peter remembred worde iesus sayd vnto hym cocke crowe twyse thou shalte denye thre tymes began wepe ¶ passyon death buryall chryst capi xv anone downyng mat 27 luk xxiii iohn̄ 18 c hygh preestes helde counsell elder scribe hole congregacion bounde iesus led hym away delyuered hym pilate pilate asked hym arte thou kynge iues answered sayd vnto thou sayest hygh preestes accused hym many thyngꝭ pilate asked hym agayne sayeng math 27 b luk xxiii b answerest thou nothyng beholde howe many thynges lay vnto thy charge iesus yet answered nothynge pilate meruayled feast pilate dyd delyuer vnto prysoner soeuer wolde desyre one named barrabas lay bounde made insurreccyon cōmytted murther people called vnto hym began desyre hym wolde accordynge euer done vnto pilate answered sayenge wyll ye let loose vnto kyng iues knew hygh preestes deliuered enuy high preestꝭ moued people shulde rather delyuer barrabas vnto pilate answered agayne sayde vnto math 27 b luke xxiii b wyll ye vnto hym ye call kyng iues cryed agayne crucifie hym pilate sayd vnto euyll hath done cryed feruently crucifie hym pilate wyllyng content people math 27 b let loose barrabas vnto delyuered vp iesus scourged hym crucified souldioures led hym away comen hall called togyther hole multitude clothed hym purple platted crowne thornes crowned hym withall began salute hym hayle kyng iues smote hym head reede dyd spyt vpon hym bowed theyr knee worshypped hym whē mocked hym toke purple put owne clothes hym led hym crucifie hym compelled one passed called simon cyrene father alexander rufus whiche came felde beare crosse mat garmentes castynge lotte vpon euery mā shulde take aboute thyrde houre crucifyed hym tytle cause wrytten kyng iues mat 27 • luk xxiii • crucified hym two theues one ryghte hande lefte scripture fulfylled whiche sayeth esai li • • mat 27 • counted amonge wycked mat 27 • luk xx •• • wente rayled hym waggynge theyr heades sayeng wretche thou destroyest temple buyldest thre dayes saue thy selfe 〈◊〉 xxiii g also woman good waye beholdynge hym amonge • xxvii g mary magdalen mary mother iames lytel io mary salome 〈◊〉 viii whiche also galile folowed hym ministred vnto hym many womē whiche came vp hym vnto ierusalem nowe euen come bycause day preparyng goeth sabboth • xxvii g luk • xiii g iohn̄ xix g ioseph citye aramathia noble counsellour whiche also loked kyngdome god came went boldely vnto pilate begged body iesu pilate meruayled alredy deade called vnto hym centurion asked hym whyther bene whyle dead whē knew truth centurion gaue body ioseph bought lynnen clothe toke hym downe wrapped hym lynnen clothe layde hym sepulcre hewen rocke rolled stone dore sepulcre luk xxiii c mary magdalen mary io beholde layde ⊢ ¶ christ rysen agayne appeareth apostle cōmytteth preachynge gospell capi xvi ✚ sabboth past mary magdalen mary iacobe salome bought swete odoures myght come anoynt hym math 28 luke 24 iohn̄ xx early mornyng ☞ fyrst day sabboth came vnto sepulcre sonne rysen sayde amonge selues shall rolle v awaye stone dore sepulere whē loked sawe stone rolled away great one went sepulere sawe yong man syttynge ryght syde clothed long whyte garment afrayde math 28 luke 24 sayeth vnto afrayde ye seke iesus nazareth whiche crucified rysen beholde place put hym go youre waye tell disciple peter goth galile shall ye se hym sayde vnto ⊢ mat 28 luke 24 went quyckely fled sepulcre trembled amased neyther sayd thynge man afrayde ✚ iesus rysen early fyrste day sabboth luke 24 • appeared fyrste mary magdalen whome cast seuen deuyls wente tolde hym mourned wepte herde lyue appeared vnto byleued luke 24 • appeared vnto two straunge fygure walked went coūtrey went tolde remenaunt byleued also ⊢ ✚ afterwarde appeared vnto eleuen sat meate cast theyr teeth theyr vnbylefe hardnesse herte bycause byleued whiche sene rysen agayne deade sayd vnto math 28 • go ye worlde preache gospell ☞ creature byleueth baptised shall saued ☞ byleueth shal damned token shall folowe byleue actes viii • xvi b 〈◊〉 c name shal cast deuyls 〈…〉 b shall speake newe tongue shal luke c • xviii • dryue away serpentꝭ yf drynke deadly thynge shall hurte shall laye theyr handes sycke▪ shall recouer lorde spoken vnto lu xxiiii • ec • e • receyued heuen ryght hande god went forth preached euery lorde workyng hebru ii • confyrmynge worde myracles folowynge ¶ endeth gospell saynt marke ¶ gospell saynt luke moche manye haue taken hande set forth declaracion thynges whiche moost surely byleued amonge v euen delyuered vnto v whiche begynnynge sawe theyr eye minister thynges declared determined also soone searched diligently thynges begynnyng thē wolde wryte vnto good theophilus thou mightest know certente thynges wherof thou haste bene enfourmed ¶ concepcion byrth iohn̄ baptist concepcion christ thankfull songes mary zachori capi primo dayes herode kyng iurye certayne preest named zacharias para xxv b course abia wyfe doughters aaron name elizabeth ryghteous god walked lawes ordynaunces lorde man coulde fynde fawte chyld bycause elizabeth ba • eyn nowe wel stryken age came passe zacharye executed preestes office god course came accordyng custome preestes offyce lot fell burne insence exod xx • b hebru ix b went temple lorde hoole multitude people prayer whyle insence burnyng appeared vnto hym angell lorde standyng ryght syde aulter insence zacharias sawe hym abasshed feare came hym angell sayde vnto hym feare zachary thy prayer herde thy wife elizabeth shall beare sonne thou shalte call name iohn̄ thou shalte haue ioye gladnes many shall reioyce byrth shalbe great syght lorde shall neyther drynke wyne strong drynke shalbe fylled holy goost euen frō mother wombe many chyldren israell shall turne theyr lorde god shall go hym spirite power math xi v elia ☞ turne hertes father chyldren vnbyleuers wysdom iust men make redy perfyte people lorde zacharias sayd vnto angell token shall knowe gene xvii • xviii b olde wyfe well stryken yeres angell answered sayde vnto hym gabriell stande presence god sent speake vnto shew glad tydyngꝭ beholde shall come passe thou shalt dombe able speake vntyll day thynges perfourmed bycause thou byleu • dst wordes whiche shalbe • ufylled theyr season peple wayted zacharias meruayled tarted temple whē came coulde speake vnto perceyued sene visiō temple beckened vnto remayned spechlesse ✚ fortuned soone dayes offyce departed owne house dayes wyfe elizabeth conceyued hyd selfe fyue monethes sayeng wyse hath god delte dayes wherin hath loked take rebuke amonge men vi moneth angel gabriell sent god vnto citye galile named nazareth virgyn spoused man whose name ioseph house dauid virgin name mary angell went vnto sayd hayle full grace lorde blessed arte thou among woman saw hym abasshed sayeng cast mynde maner salutacion shulde angel sayd vnto feare mary thou haste founde grace god beholde esai vi • thou shalte conceyue thy wombe beare sonne math • • luke 〈◊〉 • shalt call name iesus shalbe great shall called sonne hyghest lorde god shall gyue vnto hym seate father dauid esai ix • shal reygne ouer house iacob euer deut 〈◊〉 • mich •••• kyngdome shall none ende sayd mary vnto angell howe shall seynge conceyued sonne age syxte moneth whiche called bareyne zacha 8 • math 〈◊〉 • mathe x • god shal nothyng vnpossyble mary sayd beholde hande mayden lorde vnto accordyng thy worde ⊢ angell departed ✚ mary arose dayes went mountaynes haste ☞ citye iurye entred house zachary saluted elizabeth fortuned whē elizabeth herde salutacion mary babe sprange wombe elizabeth fylled holy goost cryed loude voyce sayde blessed arte thou amonge woman blessed fruyte thy wombe whence hapneth mother lorde shuld come lo assone voyce thy salutacyon sounded myne eares babe sprange wombe ioye blessed arte thou haste byleued thynges shalbe performed tolde lorde mary sayde esai • xi soule magnifyeth lorde spiryte hath reioysed god sauyoure ⊢ hath loked lowe degre hande mayden lo nowe henseforth shall generacions cal blessed bicause myghtye hath done greate thynges holy name mercye feare hym generacion generacion hath shewed strength arme hath scattered proude ymaginacyō theyr herte regū ii b ecclesi x c hath put downe myghtye frō theyr seates exalted lowe degre hath fylled hungrye good thynges sent awaye ryche emptye hath helped seruaunt israell remembraūce mercye •••• xxii c euen promysed oure father abraham seede euer mary abode aboute iii monethes returned agayne owne house ✚ elizabethes tyme came shulde deliuered brought forth sonne neyghbours cosyns herde howe lorde shewed great mercy vpō reioysed fortuned eyght day came gene 17 b xxi leuiti xii • circumcise chylde called name zacharias n • father mother answered sayd shall called iohn̄ sayde vnto none thy kynred named name made lynage dauid taxed mary spoused wyfe chylde fortuned whyle tyme come shulde delyuered brought forth ☞ fyrst begotten sonne wrapped hym swadlynge clothes layde hym maūger bycause rowme ynne region shepeheerdes watchyng kepyng theyr flocke nyght loo angell lorde stode harde bryghtnesse lorde shone rounde aboute sore afrayde angell sayde vnto afrayde beholde brynge tydynges greate ioye shall come people vnto borne day citye dauid sauyoure whiche chryst lorde take sygne ye shall fynde chylde wrapped swadlynge clothes layde maunger streyght waye angell multitude heuenly souldyers praysynge god sayenge glorye god hygh peace earth vnto men ☞ good wyll ⊢ fortuned soone angel gone awaye heuen ✚ shepheerdes sayd one another let v go nowe euen vnto bethleem se thynge heare say happened lorde hath shewed vnto v came haste founde mary ioseph babe layde maunger whē sene publysshed abrode sayenge whiche tolde chylde herde wondered thynges whiche tolde shepheerdes mary kepte sayenges pondered herte shepheerdes returned praysyng laudynge god thynges herde sene euen tolde vnto ⊢ ✚ eyght daye come chylde shuld gene 17 b circumcysed math • • name called iesus luke • whiche named angell people israell ⊢ ✚ father mother meruayled thynges spoken hym simeon blessed sayde vnto mary mother beholde chylde set fall vprysyng agayne many israell sygne whiche spoken agaynst moreouer ☞ swerde shall pearce thy soule ☞ thoughtes many hertes maye opened prophettysse one anna doughter phanuell trybe aser whiche greate age lyued husbande seuen yeares virginite ben wydowe aboute foure score easter ✚ xii yere olde went vp ierusalē custome feast day fulfylled dayes returned home chylde iesus abode styll ierusalem father mother knewe supposyng haue ben cōpany came dayes iourney sought hym among theyr kynsfolke acquayntaunce founde hym went backe agayne ierusalem sought hym fortuned thre dayes founde hym temple syttynge myddes doctours hearynge posyng mat 〈◊〉 xlii g marke • • luke • iii▪ • herde hym astonyed vnderstandynge answer sawe hym marueyled mother sayd vnto hym son hast thou thus delte vs▪ beholde thy father haue sought sorowynge sayde vnto howe ye sought wyst ye muste go aboute father busynesse luke ix • xvi •• • vnderstode sayeng spake vnto went downe wt came nazareth obedient vnto mother kept al sayengꝭ togyther herte iesus prospered wysdome age fauour god men ⊢ ¶ preachynge baptyme prysonment iohn̄ baptym chryst rehersall generacyon father capi iii ✚ fyfteneth yere reygne tiberius emperoure poncius pylate beynge leyfienaunt iury luk xx ••• herode beynge ☞ tetrach galile brother philip tetrach • uria regyon traeonites lisaniath tetrach abilyne anna cayphas hygh preestes worde lorde came vnto iohn̄ sonne zacharias wyldernesse came coostes aboute iordane preachyng math iii marke • iohn̄ baptyme repentaunce remyssyon synnes wrytten booke wordes esaias prophet sayeng esai xl math lii marke • iohn̄ c voyce cryer wyldernes prepare ye waye lorde make patthes streyght euery valey shall fylled euery mountayne hyll shall brought low thyngꝭ croked shalbe made streyght rough wayes shall made playne fleshe shall se ☞ saluation god ⊢ sayde people come forth baptysed hym math • ii b ye generacyon vypers hath taught flee wrath come brynge forth therfore due fruytes repentaunce begyn saye within selues haue abraham father say vnto god able stoones rayse vp chyldren vnto abraham also axe laydevn rote tree math lil b vii • euery tree therfore whiche bryngeth forth good fruyte bewen downe cast fyre people asked hym sayenge actes ii • • shal answereth sayeth vnto hath two cootes let hym parte hym hath none hath meate let hym lykewyse came publican also baptysed sayde vnto hym mayster shall sayd vnto requyre appoynted vnto souldyours lykewyse demaūded hym sayeng shal sayd vnto hurte man neyther trouble man wrongfully content wage people doute al men mused theyr hertes iohn̄ whyther chryst iohn̄ answered sayde vnto math iii b mathe • iohn̄ • baptyse water one stronger shall come whose shoo latchet worthy vnlose shal baptyse holy goost fyre math iii • hath fanne hande wyll pourge floore gather corne barne chaffe wyll burne fyre neuer shall quenched many thynges exhortacyon preached vnto people mat 14 • math vi c herode tetrach rebuked hym herodias brother philyppes wyfe euyls herode dyd added layde iohn̄ pryson fortuned people receyued baptyme math iii • marke • iohn̄ • • iesus baptysed dyd praye heuen opened holy goost came downe bodely shappe lyke doue vpon hym voyce came heuen whiche sayde esai xlii • thou arte beloued son delyte iesus hym selfe began aboute thyrtye yeare age mat xiii • mar iiii • luke li •• • iohn̄ vi c supposed sonne ioseph whiche sonne hely whiche sonne mathat whiche sonne leui whiche whiche sonne god ¶ iesus led wyldernesse fasteth tyme temptacyon ouercometh deuyll goeth galile preacheth nazareth capernaum iues despyse hym deuyls knowledge hym cometh peter house healeth mother lawe doeth great miracle capi iiii iesus beynge full holy goost returned iordane mat iiii marke b led ☞ spiryte wyldernesse xl dayes tempted deuyll dayes dyd cate nothynge ended afterwarde hungred deuyll sayde vnto hym yf thou sonne god cōmaunde stone bread iesus answered hym sayenge wrytten deute • mat iiii man shall lyue breade euery worde god deuyll toke hym hygh moūtayne shewed hym kyngdoms worlde euen twyncklynge eye deuyll sayde vnto hym power wyll gyue euery whyt glorye delyuered vnto soeuer wyll gyue yf thou therfore wylt fall downe worshyp shall thyne iesus answered sayde vnto hym hence satan wrytten deute vi • x mat xiii • thou shalte worshyp lorde thy god hym onely shalt thou serue caryed hym ierusalem set pynacle temple sayde vnto hym yf thou son god cast thy selfe downe frō hence wrytten psal 〈◊〉 mat iiii • shall gyue angel charge ouer kepe theyr handes shall beare vp thou dasshe thy foote agaynst stoone iesus answered sayde vnto hym sayde deute vi • mat iiii • thou shalt tempte lorde thy god soone temtacyon ended deuyll departed hym season ✚ iesus returned power spiryte galile went fame hym thorowe regyon taught theyr synagoges cōmended men mat xiii • math vi • came nazareth nursed custom went synagoge sabboth daye stode vp rede delyueted vnto hym boke prophet esaias ii e • • • opened boke founde place wrytten esai lxi • spiryte lorde vpon bycause hath anoynted preache gospell poore hath sent heale broken harted preach delyucraunce captyue syght blynde frely set liberte brosed preach acceptable yere lorde closed boke gaue agayne minyster sat downe eye synagoge fastened hym began saye vnto daye scrypture fulfylled eares bare hym wytnes mat vii • mark • luke ii • wondered gracyous wordes whiche proceded mouth ⊢ sayd iosephs sonne sayd vnto ye wyll vtterly saye vnto prouerbe phisician heale thy selfe ✚ soeuer haue herde done capernaum likewyse thyne owne countrey sayde verely saye vnto mat xiii • mat vi • prophet accepted owne countrey tell trueth 3 regū 7 • iames v many wydowes israell dayes elia heuen shutte thre yeares syxe monethes greate famysshment lande vnto none elia sent saue sarepta vesydes sidon vnto woman wydowe 4 reg v many leper israell tyme eliseus prophet noone clensed sauynge naaman siryan synagoge herde thynges fylled wrath rose vp thrust hym citye led hym euen vnto edge hyll wheron theyr citye buylte myght cast hym downe headlynge departed went waye euen thorow myddes ⊢ ✚ came downe capernaum citye galile taught sabboth dayes math vii xiii g marke c astonyed doctryne preachynge power mathe c synagoge man whiche vncleane spiryte deuyll cryed loude voyce sayenge let alone hast thou v thou iesus nazareth arte thou come destroye v know thou arte euen holy god iesus rebuked hym sayeng holde thy peace come hym deuyll throwen myddes came hym hurte hym feare came spake amonge selues sayenge maner thyng auctorite power cōmaundeth foule spirytes come fame hym spred abrode euery place countrey rounde aboute ⊢ ✚ mat viii b mathe c rysen vp come synagoge entred simon house simon mother lawe taken greate feuer made intercession hym stode ouer rebuked feuer feuer lefte immedyatly arose mynystred vnto hym sonne downe sycke taken wt dyuers dyseases brought vnto hym layde handes euery one healed marke iii deuyls also came many cryenge sayenge thou arte chryst sonne god rebuked suffered speake knewe chryst soone daye departed went desert place people sought came hym kepte hym shulde departe frō sayd vnto must preach kyngdom god cityes also ⊢ therfore sent preached synagoges galile ¶ chryst preacheth shyppe disciple forsake folowe hym cleuseth leper healeth man palsye calleth mathew customer eateth open synners capi v ✚ came passe peple preased vpon hym heare worde god stode lake genezareth mat iiii • sawe two shyppes stande lake syde fysshermen gone wasshyng theyr nettes entred one shyppes whiche perteyned simon prayed wold thrust lytle lande sat downe taught people shyp lefte speakynge sayde vnto simon launche depe let slyppe nettes make draught simon answered sayde vnto hym mayster haue laboured nyght haue taken nothynge neuerthelesse thy cōmaundement wyll lose forth ne • te done inclosed greate multytude fysshes theyr net brake beckened theyr felowes whiche shyp shulde come helpe came fylled shyppes soncke agayne simō peter saw fel downe iesus knee sayenge lorde go synfull man astonyed wt hym draught fysshes taken also iames iohn̄ sonnes zebede parteners simon iesus sayde vnto simon feare frō hence forth thou shalte catche men brought shyppes lande mat iiii forsoke folowed hym ⊢ mat viii • marke • fortuned certayne citye beholde man full leprosy spyed iesus fell flat face besought hym sayenge lorde yf thou wylte thou canst make cleane stretched forth hande touched hym sayenge wyll thou cleane immediately leprosy departed frō hym charged hym shulde tell man go sayeth leui xiiii • shewe thy selfe preest offer thy clensynge accordyng moses cōmaunded wytnesse vnto moch went fame abrode hym moche people came togyther heare healed hym theyr infyrmytyes kepte hym waye wyldernes gaue hym selfe prayer ✚ happened certayne daye taught theyr sat pharyses doctours lawe whiche come townes galile iurye ierusalem power lorde present heale math ix math ii beholde men brought bed man whiche taken palsie sought meanes bryng hym laye hym hym whē coulde fynde syde myght brynge hym bycause prease went vp toppe house let hym downe thorowe • ylynge bed euen myddes iesus sawe theyr fayth sayde vnto hym man thy synnes forgyuen scrybes pharyses began thynke sayenge felowe whiche speaketh blasphe mye math ii • esai xiiii • x 〈…〉 forgyue syfies god iesus perceyued theyr thoughtes answered sayde vnto thynke ye youre hertes whyther easyer saye thy synnꝭ forgyuen say ryse vp walke math ix actes iii ix f ye maye knowe sonne man hath power forgyue syfies earth sayde vnto sycke palsye saye vnto aryse take vp thy bed go vnto thy house immediatly rose vp toke vp bed wheron laye departed owne house praysynge god amased gaue glorye vnto god fylled feare sayenge haue sene straunge thynges daye ⊢ math ix mark ii band went forth sawe publican named leui syttynge receyte custome sayde vnto hym folowe lefte rose vp folowed hym leui made hym greate feaste owne house greate company publican sat meate math ix • math ii b luke vii c xv scrybes pharyses murmured agaynste discyples sayenge ye eate drynke publycans syfiers iesus answered sayde vnto hole nede phisician sycke came call ryghteous synners repentaunce sayde vnto hym math ix b marke ii c discyples iohn̄ faste often praye disciple pharyses also thyne eate drynke sayde vnto math ix b marke ii c ye make chyldren weddynge faste whyle brydegrome dayes wyll come brydegrome also shall taken awaye shall fast dayes spake also vnto similytude man putteth pece newe garment olde vesture yf breaketh newe pece taken newe agreeth olde man poureth newe wyne olde bottels yf new wyne wyll brast bottels run selfe bottels shall peryshe new wyne must put newe bottels bothe preserued man also drynketh olde wyne streyght waye awaye newe sayeth olde better ¶ excuseth disciple plucke eares corne healeth man wethered bande choseth twelue apostle maketh • w ••• sermon • eacheth good euyll capi vi happened ☞ pryncypall sabboth went math 〈…〉 mark •• thorow corne felde discyples plucked eares corne dyd eate rubbed theyr handes certayne pharises sayde vnto ye whiche lawfull sabboth dayes iesus answered sayd rig xx • haue ye red dauid dyd whē hym selfe hungred whiche hym went house god dyd take eate reg xxi • shewe breade gaue also hym whiche lawfull eate forthe exod xxv • preestes sayde vnto sonne man lorde also sabboth daye ✚ mat xii • mark •••• fortuned another sabboth also entred synagoge taught man whose ryght hande dryed vp scrybes pharyses watched hym whyther wolde heale sabboth daye might fynde accuse hym knew theyr thoughtes sayde man whiche wethered hande ryse vp stand forth myddes arose stode forth sayde iesus vnto wyll aske questyon whyther lawfull sabboth dayes good euyll saue one lyfe destroye behelde compasse sayde vnto man stretche forth thyn hande dyd 3 reg xiii • mat xii • mat • ii • hand restored agayne hoole fylled madnesse cōmuned togyther among selues myght iesu ⊢ fortuned dayes mat xiiii • went mountayne pray contynued nyght prayer god soone daye called dyscyples math x mark iii b chose twelue whome also called apostle simon also named peter andrewe brother iames iohn̄ philip bartelmewe mathewe thomas iames sonne alpheus symon called zelotes iudas iames sonne iudas iscarioth traytoure ✚ came downe stode playne felde companye discyples mat iiii mark iii greate multytude people iurye ierusalem see cooste mat iiii 〈…〉 vi tyre sydon whiche came heare hym healed theyr dyseases vexed foule spirytes healed people preased touche hym went vertue hym healed lyfte vp eye vpon discyples sayde math v blessed ☞ ye poore kyngdome god blessed ye hunger nowe ye shall satisfyed blessed ye wepe nowe ye shall laugh blessed shal ye whē men hate thrust theyr companye rayle abhorre youre name euyll thynge sonne mannes sake reioyse ye daye glad beholde rewarde great heuen ⊢ thus dyd theyr father vnto prophettes •• o vi ☞ wo vnto riche ye haue consolacyon wo vnto full ye shall hunger wo vnto nowe laugh ye shall wayle wepe wo vnto whē men prayse dyd theyr father false prophettꝭ saye vnto whiche heare loue youre enemyes good hate blesse curse pray whiche wrongfullye trouble vnto hym smyteth one cheke offer also math v ••• hym taketh awaye thy gowne forbyd take thy coote also gyue euery man asketh hym taketh awaye thy goodes aske agayne mat vii b eccles 32 b tobi iiii c ye wolde men shulde ye also lyke wyse mark v • yf ye loue loue thanke haue ye synners also loue theyr louers yf ye good good thanke haue ye synners also euen yf ye lende whome ye hope receyue thanke haue ye synners also lende synners receyue soche lyke agayne loue ye youre enemyes good lende lokynge nothynge agayne youre rewarde shall great ye shall chyldren hyghest kynde vnto vnkynde euyll ✚ ye therfore mercyfull youre father also mercyfull math vii iudge ye shall iudged condempne ye shall condempned forgyue ye shall forgyuen proue xi gyue shall gyuen vnto good measure pressed downe shaken togyther rūnynge ouer shal men gyue youre bosom mat vii • mat iiii c measure ye mete withall shall men mete agayne put forth similytude vnto mat xv • blynde leade blynde bothe fall dytche math • c iohn̄ xiii disciple aboue mayster euery man shalbe perfyte euen mayster math vii • seest thou mote thy brother eye consyderest beame thyne owne eye eyther howe cannest thou say thy brother brother let pull moote thyne eye whē thou seest beame thyne owne eye thou ypocryte caste beame thyne owne eye fyrste shalt thou se perfytly pull mote thy brother eye ⊢ math xii • good tree bryngeth forth euyll fruyte neyther euyl tre bryngeth forth good fruyte euery tree knowen fruyte thornꝭ men gather fygges busshes gather grape good man good treasure herte bryngeth forth whiche good euyll man oute euyll treasure herte bryngeth forth whiche euyll math xii • psal xi • aboundance herte mouth speaketh call ye math vii b xxv • lorde lorde byd whosoeuer cōmeth heareth sayengꝭ doth wyll shewe whome lyke mat vii iames • • lyke man whiche buylte house dygged depe layde foundacion rocke water arose floode bet vpon house coulde moue grounded vpon rocke heareth doth lyke man without foundacyon buylte house vpon earth agaynst whiche floode dyd beate fell immediatly fall house greate ¶ healeth captaynes setuaunt rayseth wydowes sonne enfourmeth disciple whome iohn̄ baptyst sente vnto hym cōmendeth iohn̄ reproueth iues eateth bha • ise woman wassheth feete • ear • lor • yueth synnes capi vii ended sayenges audyence people mat viii iohn̄ iiii • entred capernaū certayne centurion seruaunte whiche deare vnto hym laye sycke parell death herde iesu sent vnto hym elder iues besechynge hym wolde come heale seruaunte came iesus besought hym instantly sayenge worthy thou shul dest hym loueth nacyon hath buylte v synagoge iesus went nowe farre house centurion sente frendes vnto hym sayenge vnto hym mat viii lorde trouble thy selfe worthy thou shuldest enter vnder rofe wherfore thought selfe worthy come vnto saye thou worde seruaūt shall hoole also man set vnder power haue vnder souldyers saye vnto one go goeth other▪ come cōmeth seruaunt doeth iesus herde marueyled hym turned hym aboute sayde people folowed hym saye vnto haue founde great fayth israell sent turned backe home agayne founde seruaunt hole ven sycke ✚ fortuned went citye whiche called naim many disciple went hym moch people came nygh gate citye beholde deade man caryed whiche onely sonne mother wydowe moche people citye lorde sawe cō passyon sayd vnto wepe came nygh touched coffyn bare hym stode styll sayde yonge man say vnto aryse deade sat vp began speake 3 xvii 4 reg 4 f actes xx c delyuered hym mother came feare gaue glorye vnto god sayenge iohn̄ iiii • vi b great prophet rysen vp amonge v god hath visyted people ⊢ ✚ rumour hym went forth throughout al iury throughout region lye round discyples iohn̄ shewed hym al thynges math • iohn̄ called vnto hym two discyples sente iesus sayenge art thou shulde come shal loke nother men come vnto hym sayde iohn̄ baptyste sent v vnto sayenge art thou shuld come shall wayte houre cured many theyr infyrmytes plage euyll spirytes vnto many blynde gaue syght answered sayde vnto go youre wayes brynge worde agayne iohn̄ thynges ye haue sene herde howe esai • 5 • • xi • blyndese halte go leper clensed deafe heare deade ryse agayne poore glad tydyngꝭ preached happy offended math xi • messenger iohn̄ departed began speake people concernynge iohn̄ went ye wyldernesse se reede shaken wende wente ye se man clothed softe rayment beholde whiche gorgeously apparelled lyue delycatly kynges courtes went ye forth se prophete yea saye prophet whome wrytten math xi • mathe 〈◊〉 mala iii • beholde sende ☞ myne angell thy face shall prepare thy waye saye vnto among woman chyldren greater prophet iohn baptyste neuerthelesse lesse kyngdome god greater ⊢ people publycans herde hym ☞ iustifyed god baptysed baptyme iohn pharyses lawyer despysed counsayle god agaynst selues baptised hym lorde sayde math xi • wherunto shall lyken men ge neracyon thynge lyke lyke vnto chyldren syttynge market place cryenge one sayenge haue • yped vnto ye haue daūsed haue mourned ye haue wepte iohn baptyste came neyther math iii • eatynge breade drynkynge wyne ye saye hath deuyll sonne man come eateth drynketh ye saye beholde glotonous man vnmeasurable drynker wyne frende publican synners ☞ wysdome iustifyed chyldren ✚ one pharises desyred hym wolde eate hym wente pharises house sat downe meate mat • x vi mat xiiii iohn̄ xi beholde woman citie whiche synner soone knew iesus sat meate pharises house brought alabaster box oyntment stode fete behynde hym wepynge began wasshe fete teares dyd wype heeres heade kyssed feete anoynted oyntment pharise whiche bydden hym sawe spake within hym selfe sayenge yf man prophet wold surely knowe maner woman toucheth hym synner iesus answered sayd vnto hym simon haue somwhat saye vnto sayde mayster saye certayne lender two detters one ought fyue hūdred penny fyftye nothynge paye forgaue bothe tell therfore wyll loue hym simon answered sayde suppose forgaue sayde vnto hym thou hast truely iudged turned woman sayd vnto symon seest thou woman entred thyne house thou gauest water fete hath wasshed feets teares wyped heeres heade thou gauest kysse synce tyme came hath ceased kysse feete myne heade oyle thou dydest anoynt hath anoynted feete oyntment wherfore saye vnto many synnes forgyuen loued moche whome lesse forgyuen doth lesse loue sayde vnto thy synnes forgyuen sat meate began say selues whiche forgyueth synnes also sayde womā mathe v c thy fayth hath saued go peace ⊢ ¶ chryst apostle goeth towne towne preacheth weth parable seede telleth mother brother stylleth ragynge see delyuireth possessed dryueth deuyls heerde swyne helpeth sycke woman iairus doughter capi viii fortuned afterwarde selfe also wente throughue cityes townes preachynge shewynge kyngdom god twelue hym also ••• xxiii certayne woman healed euyll spirites infirmites mary whiche called magdalen oute wente seuen deuyls ioanna wyfe chusa herodes stewarde susanna many whiche ministred vnto hym theyr substaunce ✚ moche people gathered togyther come hym cityes spake similitude mat xiii • mar iiii sower went sow seede sowed fell way syde troden downe foules ayre deuoured vp fell stone soone sprong vp wethered away bycause lacked moystnesse fell amonge thornes thornes sprang vp choked fell good ground sprang vp bare fruyte c folde sayd thynges cryed hath eares heare let hym heare mat xiii • mar iiii • disciple asked hym saynge maner similitude sayde vnto gyuen knowe secretes kyngdom god parable se shulde se esai ci • mar xiii • mar iiii • iohn̄ xii f actes • 8 f rom xi • whē heare shulde vnderstande parable mat xi •• • mar iiii • seed worde god besyde waye heare cometh deuyll taketh away worde theyr hertꝭ lest shuld byleue saued stone whiche heare receyue worde ioye haue n • rootes whyle byleue tyme temptacyon go awaye fel among thornes whiche haue herde go forth choked care ryches voluptuous lyuynge brynge forth fruyte fell good grounde whiche pure good herte heare worde kepe brynge forthe fruyte thorowe pacience ⊢ math v • mar 〈◊〉 • and▪ xi • man lyghteth candel couereth vessel putteth vnder table setteth candelstycke whiche enter may se lyght math • • mark 〈◊〉 • luke xii • thyng secrete shall come abrode neyther thyng hyd shall knowen come lyght take hede therfore howe ye heare soeuer hath hym shall gyuen mat ••• • • xxv • mar ••• • luke xix soeuer hath frome hym shal taken euen whiche supposeth hath mat xii mar • • came hym mother brother coulde come hym prease tolde hym sayd thy mother thy brother stande wolde se answered sayd vnto mother brother whiche heare worde god ✚ chaunced certayne day went shyp disciple also sayde vnto let v go ouer vnto syde lake laūched forth sayled fel slepe math viii c mar iiii arose storme wynde lake fylled water ieoperdy came hym awoke hym sayenge mayster mayster loste arose rebuked wynde tempest water ceased waxed calme sayd vnto fayth feared wondred among selues sayenge thynke ye cōmaundeth wyndes water obey hym ⊢ math viii mark v sayled vnto region gederenites whiche ouer agaynst galile wente lande met hym citye certayne man whiche deuyl longe tyme ware clothes neyther abode house graues sawe iesus cryed fell downe hym lowde voyce sayde math viii mark v haue iesus thou sonne god moost hyghest beseche tourment cōmaunded foule spirite come man ofte tymes caught hym bound cheynes kepte fetter brake bondes caryed fende wyldernesse iesus asked hym sayenge thy name sayde legion bycause many deuyls entred besought hym wolde cōmaunde go depe heerde many swyne fedynge hyll besought hym wold suffre enter suffred went deuyls man entred swyne heerde ran headlynge violence lake choked heerdmen sawe chaunced fled tolde citye village came se done came iesus founde man deuyls departed syttynge feete iesus clothed ryght mynde afrayde also sawe tolde meanes possessed deuyll healed multitude gederenites besoughte hym wolde departe taken greate feare math viii mark v b gat hym vp shyppe returned backe agayne man deuyls departed besought hym myght hym iesus sent hym away sayenge go home agayne thyne owne house shewe thynges soeuer god hathe done went way preached thorowout citye thynges soeuer iesus done vnto hym fortuned whē iesus come agayne people receyued hym wayted hym math • marke • beholde came man named iairus ruler synagoge fel downe iesus fete prayenge hym wolde come house one doughter onely vpon twelue yere age lay dyenge went people thronged hym math • marke • woman hauyng yssue blood twelue yeres whiche spente substaunce vpon phisicians neyther coulde holpen came behynde hym touched hemme garment immediatly yssue bloode staunched iesus sayde touched euery man denyed peter hym sayd mayster people thruste vexe sayest thou touched iesus sayde body hath touched perceyue vertue gone woman sawe hyd came tremblyng fell fete tolde hym people cause touched hym howe healed immediatly sayd vnto doughter good comforte math 〈◊〉 • marke •• thy fayth hath saued go peace whyle yet spake came one ruler synagoges house whiche sayde hym thy doughter deade disease mayster iesus herde worde answered father damsell math 〈◊〉 • mark • • feare byleue onely shalbe made hoole came house suffred mā go hym saue peter iames iohn̄ father mother mayden euery body wepte sorowed sayde wepe damsell deade iohn̄ xi • slepeth laughed hym scorne knowynge deade thrust oute caught hande cryed sayenge mayde aryse spirite came agayne arose streyghte waye commaunded gyue meate father mother astonyed warned shulde tell man done ¶ sendeth xii apostle preace rode heareth 〈◊〉 hym fedeth fyue thousande men fyue looues two fysshes disciple confesse hym sonne god transfigureth hym selfe vpon mount delyuereth possessed teacheth disciple lowly desyre vengeaunce reproueth capi ix ✚ iesus called math x b mark iii • vi b luke vi c twelue togyther gaue power auctorite ouer deuyls myght heale disease sent preach kyngdom god math vi • heale sycke sayd vnto take nothynge iourney neyther staffe scrip neyther bread math x neyther money neyther haue two cootes mark vi b mat x b soeuer house ye enter abyde thence departe soeuer wyll receyue whē ye go citie shake dust youre feete testimony agaynst departed wente thorowe townes preachynge gospell healynge euery ⊢ mat xiii mark vi b herode tetrarch herde done hym doubted bycause sayde iohn̄ rysen agayne death elia appeared one olde prophet rysen agayne herode sayde iohn̄ haue beheaded heare suche thynges desyred se hym apostle returned tolde hym done mat xiiii b mark vi iohn̄ vi toke wente asyde solitarye place nygh vnto citie called bethsaida people knewe folowed hym receyued spake vnto kyngdome god healed nede healed day began weare away came twelue sayde vnto hym sende people away may go townes nexte village lodge get meate place wyldernesse sayde vnto gyue ye eate sayde haue mo fyue looues two fysshes excepte shuld go bye meate people aboute fyue thousande men sayd disciple cause syt downe fyfties company dyd made al syt downe toke fyue looues two fysshes loked vp heuen blessed brake gaue disciple set people al dyd eate satisfied taken vp remayned twelue baskettes full broken meate mat xvi c marke 8 c fortuned alone prayeng disciple hym asked sayenge mat xvi c mar viiii c say people answered sayde iohn̄ baptyst say elia saye one olde prophettes rysen sayde vnto saye ye symon peter answered sayde mat xvi c iohn̄ vi g thou arte christ god warned cōmaunded shulde tell mā thynge sayeng math 18 c xx c marke 8 • x • x c luke 17 • xviii f son man must suffre many thynges reproued elder hygh preestes scribe sleyne ryse agayne thyrde day sayde yf man wyll come let hym denye hym selfe take vp crosse dayly folowe mat xvi • iohn̄ 〈◊〉 • luke 17 g ☞ soeuer wyll saue lyfe shal lose soeuer doth lose lyfe sake shall saue aduauntageth man yf wynne hoole world loose hym selfe run damage hym selfe math x • mar viii • luke xii • ashamed wordes hym shall sonne man ashamed cometh maiestye maiestye father holy angel tell trueth math xvi mark viii c ☞ standyng whiche shall taste death tyll se kyngdome god mat xvii mark ix c fortuned eyght dayes sayenges toke peter iohn̄ iames wente vp mountayne pray prayed fassyon countenaunce chaunged garment whyte shone beholde talked hym two men moses elia appeared maiestye spake departynge whiche shulde ende ierusalem peter hym heuy slepe awoke sawe maiestye two men standyng hym mat xvii • mark ix • chaunced departed frome hym peter sayde vnto iesus mayster good beynge v let v make also thre tabernacle one one moses one elia wyst sayde whyle thus spake came cloude ouershadowed feared come cloude came voyce cloude sayenge ii peter f • deare son mat xvii • marke • • luke iii • deut 〈◊〉 6 heare soone voyce past iesus founde alone kepte close tolde mā dayes thynges whiche sene mat xvii • math ix b chaunsed nexte day came downe hyll moche peple met hym beholde mā company cryed sayenge mayster beseche beholde son haue se spirite taketh hym sodeynly cryeth ❀ knocketh teareth hym fometh agayne moche payne departeth hym hath rent hym mat xvii c math ix c besought thy disciple cast hym oute coulde iesus answered sayd faythlesse croked nacion long shall shall suffre brynge thy sonne hyther yet comynge fende rent hym tare hym iesus rebuked vncleane spirite healed chylde delyuered hym father mathe c luke iiii amased myghtye power god wondred euery one thynges whiche dyd sayd vnto disciple let sayengꝭ synke downe youre eares wyll come passe math xvi c mar viii luke ix c sonne man shal delyuered handes men luke ii g xviii f wyst worde mente hyd vnderstode feared aske hym sayenge entred thoughte amonge whiche shulde greatest iesus perceyued thought theyr hertes math 18 mark ix c luke 18 toke chylde set hym harde hym sayde vnto soeuer receyueth chylde name receyueth math x luke x c iohn̄ xiii c soeuer receyueth receyueth hym sent least amonge shal great iohn̄ answered sayde mayster sawe one castynge oute deuyls thy name forbad hym bycause folowed v iesus sayde vnto hym nume xi g forbyd ye hym agaynst v v fortuned tyme come shulde receyued vp set face go ierusalem sent messenger hym wente entred citye samaritan make redye hym wolde receyue hym bycause face though wolde go mennes lyues saue went towne ✚ chaunsed walkyng way certayne man sayd vnto hym mat 〈…〉 wyll folowe whyther soeuer thou wylt go iesus sayd vnto hym fox haue hole byrdes ayre haue nestes son man hath laye heade sayde vnto folowe sayde lorde suffre fyrst go burye father iesus sayde vnto hym ☞ leuiii 〈…〉 let deade burye theyr deade go thou preache kyngdome god sayd lorde 3 reg x • wyll folow let
