• beholde sende forth lambes amonge wolues beare wallet neyther scryppe shoe ☞ 4 reg 4 • salute man waye math • • luke ix • actes xiii • soeuer house ye entre fyrste saye peace house yf sonne peace youre peace shall rest vpon hym yf shall returne agayne house tarye styll eatynge drynkynge suche gyue labourer worthy rewarde ⊢ go house house soeuer citye ye entre receyue eate suche thyngꝭ set heale sycke therin say vnto kyngdom god come nygh vpon math x • soeuer citye ye enter receyue go wayes stretes saye euen dust youre citye whiche cleueth v wype agaynst notwithstandynge ye sure kyngdom god come nygh vpon saye vnto shal easyer day zodome citye math xi c wo vnto chorazin wo vnto bethsaida yf myracles ben done tyre sidon whiche haue bene done great whyle go repented theyr synnes syttynge heere clothe asshes neuertheles shal easyer tyre sidon iudgement thou capernaum whiche arte exalted heuen shalte thrust downe hel mathe x iohn̄ xiii c heareth heareth despyseth despyseth despyseth despyseth hym sent seuentye turned agayne ioye sayenge lorde euen deuyls subdued v thorow thy name sayd vnto esai xiiii c ••• e xii c sawe satan bene lyghtnyng fallynge downe heuen mar xvi actes 28 b beholde gyue vnto power treade serpentes scorpion ouer maner power enemye nothynge shall hurte neuertheles reioyce spirites subdued vnto reioyce ph •• iiii leue 17 b name wrytten heuen houre reioysed iesus holy goost sayd thanke father math xi lorde heuen earth thou haste hyd thyngꝭ wyse prudent hast opened vnto babe euen father pleased mat • xvi b 28 thynges gyuen father mat xi iohn̄ vii viii c man knoweth sonne father father saue sonne sonne wyll shewe hym turned disciple sayde secretly ✚ mat xiii c happy eye whiche se thynges ye se tell many prophettes kynges haue desyred se thynges ye se haue sene heare thynges whiche ye heare haue hearde beholde certayne lawyer stode vp tempted hym say enge mat xxii mayster shall enherite eternall lyfe sayde vnto hym wrytten law redest thou answered sayde deuit vi mat xxii mark xii c loue lorde thy god al thy herte thy soule al thy strength thy mynde thy neyghboure thy selfe sayde vnto hym thou hast answered ryght thou shalte lyue wyllynge iustifie hym selfe sayde vnto iesus neyghboure iesus answered sayde certayne man descended ierusalem iericho fell among theues robbed hym ray ment wounded hym departed leauynge hym halfe deade chaunced came downe certayne preest waye sawe hym passed lykewyse leuite wente nygh place came loked hym passed certayne samaritane iourneyed came vnto hym whē sawe hym compassyon hym went bounde vp woundes powred oyle wyne set hym owne beast brought hym comen inne made prouision hym morowe departed toke two penny gaue hoost sayd vnto hym take cure souer thou spendest come agayne wyl recompence nowe thre thynkest thou neygh boure vnto hym fell among theues sayde showed mercy sayde iesus vnto hym go thou lykewyse ⊢ ✚ fortuned went entred certayne towne certayne womā named martha receyued house womon syster called mary whiche also sat iesus feete herde worde martha combred aboute moche seruyng stode sayd lorde doest thou care syster hath lefte serue alone byd therfore helpe iesus answered sayde vnto martha martha thou arte carefull troubled aboute many thynges uerely ☞ one nedefull mary hath chosen good parte whiche shall taken away ⊢ ¶ teacheth disciple pray dryueth deuyl rebuketh blasphemous pharises requ • sygnes token eateth pharise reprometh ypocrisy pharises scrybes ypocrytes capi xi fortuned prayenge certayne place ceased one disciple sayde vnto hym lorde teache v praye iohn̄ also taught disciple sayde vnto ye pray say math vi • father arte heuen halowed thy name thy kyngdom come thy wyll fulfylled euen earth also heuē dayly bread gyue day forgyue v synnes euen gyue euery mā trespasseth v leede v temptacyon delyuer v frō euyll sayde vnto ✚ yf shall haue frende shall go hym mydnight say vnto hym frende lende thre looues frende myne come way haue nothyng set hym within answere saye trouble dore shut chyldren chamber ryse gyue saye vnto though wyll aryse gyue hym bycause frende yet bycause importunite wyll aryse gyue hym many nedeth say vnto mat vii iohn̄ xvi f iames aske shall gyuen seke ye shal fynde knocke shall opened vnto ☞ euery one asketh receyueth seketh fyndeth hym knocketh shall opened son shall aske bread father wyll gyue hym stone yf aske fysshe wyll fysshe gyue hym serpent yf aske egge wyll offer hym scorpion ye beyng euyl gyue good gyftes vnto chyldren howe moche shall father heuen gyue holy spirite desyre hym ⊢ ✚ math ix mar vii castyng deuyll dombe caste deuyll dombe spake people wondred sayde math ix mar iii casteth oute deuyls thorowe belzebub cheyfe deuyls tempted hym requyred hym sygne heuen knowynge theyr thoughtes sayd vnto euery kyngdome deuyded agaynst selfe desolate one house doth fall vpon satan also deuyded agaynst hym selfe howe shall kyngdome endure bycause ye say cast deuyls thorowe belzebub helpe belzebub cast deuyls whose helpe chyldrē cast therfore shal iudges yf fynger god caste oute deuyls doubte kyngdome god come vpon math xii b stronge man armed watcheth house thynges possesseth peace stronger thē cometh vpon hym ouercometh hym taketh hym harnesse wherin trusted deuideth goodes agaynst gathereth scattereth abrode mat xii vncleane spirite gone mā walketh drye place sekyng rest fyndeth none sayeth wyll returne agayne vnto house whence came cometh fyndeth swepte garnyshed goeth taketh seuen spirites worse hym selfe enter dwell ende man worse beginnyng fortuned spake thynges certayne woman company lyfte vp voyce sayd vnto happy wombe bare pappes whiche gaue sucke sayd yea happy heare worde god kepe ⊢ people gathered thycke togyther began saye euyll nacyon math • mark • seke sygne shall sygne gyuen sygne ionas prohet ioh • • iona • ionas sygne niniuites shall also son man nacyon 3 •• • ii pa •• math •• quene southe shall ryse iudgement men nacyon condemne came frō vttermost partes earth wysdome salomon beholde greater salomon men niniue shall ryse iudgement nacion shall condemne broughte repentaunce preachynge ionas beholde greater thē ionas ✚ math 〈◊〉 mat 〈◊〉 luke v • man lyghteth candell putteth preuy place neyther vnder busshell candelstycke whiche come may se lyght math •• lyght body eye therfore thyne eye syngle thy body also shalbe full lyght yf thyne eye euyll thy body also shall full darknesse take hede therfore lyght whiche darknesse thy body therfore cleare hauyng parte darke shall full lyght euen candell doeth lyght bryghtnesse ⊢ spake certayne pharise besought hym dyne hym iesus wente sat downe meate pharyse sawe meruayled fyrst washed dyner lorde sayde vnto hym math •• nowe ye pharyses make cleane syde cup platter youre inwarde parte ful •• uenyng wyckednesse ye fooles dyd made whiche without make whiche within also neuerthelesse esai 5 • ☞ gyue almesse ye haue beholde thynges cleane vnto math 〈◊〉 • wo vnto pharyses ye tythe mynte rewe maner herbes passe ouer iudgement loue god oughte ye haue done yet leaue vndone mat xxiii • wo vnto pharyses ye loue vppermoost seates synagoges gretynges market wo vnto scribe pharises ye ypocrites ye graues appere men walke ouer ware answered one lawyer sayd vnto hym mayster thus sayenge thou puttest v rebuke also sayd 〈◊〉 x 〈◊〉 xxiii b wo vnto also ye lawyer ye lade men burden able beare ye youre selues touche packes one fyngers wo vnto 〈◊〉 xxiii ye buylde sepulcres prophettes youre father kylled truely ye beare wytnes ye alowe dedꝭ father kylled ye buylde theyr sepuleres therfore sayd wysdom god 〈◊〉 xxiii wyll sende prophettes apostle shall persecute bloode al prophettes whiche shed begynnyng worlde may requyred generacyon bloode gene iiii b • pat 24 f abell vnto bloode zachary whiche perysshed bytwene aulter temple uerely saye vnto shalbe requyred nacyon wo vnto lawyer ye haue taken awaye keye knowledge ye entred selues came ye forbad thus spake vnto lawyer pharises began waxe busye aboute hym capciously aske hym many thynges layenge wayte hym sekyng catche thynge mothe wherby myght accuse hym ¶ leuen • haris • chryst conforteth disciple agaynst persecucyo • warneth beware courtousnesse similitude certayne ryche man wyll haue hang vpon carthly thynges watche redy agaynst comynge capi xii gathered togyther innumerable multitude people moche trode one began say vnto disciple fyrst mat • xvi b mat viii b beware leuen pharises whiche ypocrisye math x c mat • ii • c • uke viii c nothynge couered shal vncouered neyther hyd shal knowen math x c luke viii b thynges ye haue spoken darknes shalbe herde lyght whiche ye haue spoken eare euen secrete place shall preached top house math x • mat xiii b saye vnto frendes afrayde kyll body haue wyll shewe whome ye shal feare feare hym hath kylled hath power cast hel yea say vnto feare hym fyue sparowes bought two farthynges one forgotten god also euen heeres heade nombred feare therfore ye value many sparowes saye vnto math x • euery one soeuer confesseth men hym shall sonne man knowledge also angel god denyeth men shall denyed angel god math xii • math iii soeuer speaketh worde ☞ agaynst son man shall forgyuen hym math xii • luke xii • vnto hym plasphemeth holy goost shall forgyuen bryng vnto synagoges vnto ruler offycers take ye thoughte howe thynge ye shal answere ye shal speake holy goost shall teache houre ye ought saye ✚ one company sayde vnto hym mayster speake brother deuyde enheritaunce sayd vnto hym man made iudge deuyder ouer sayde vnto take hede beware couetousnes mannes lyfe standeth aboundaunce thynges whiche possesseth put forth similitude vnto sayenge grounde certayne ryche man brought forth plentyfull fruytes thought within hym selfe sayenge shall bycause haue rowme bestowe fruytꝭ sayde wyll wyll destroye barnes buylde greater therin wyll gather goodes growen vnto wyll saye vnto soule soule ecclesi xi • thou hast moche goodꝭ layde vp stoore many yeres take thyne ease eate drynke mery god sayde vnto hym iere xvii • thou fole nyght wyl fetche awaye thy soule agayne psal 29 b whose shall thynges whiche thou hast prouyded hym gathereth ryches hym selfe ryche towarde god spake vnto disciple therfore say vnto math vi 1 peter v • take thought lyfe ye shall eate neyther body ye shall put lyfe meate body rayment consyder rauens neyther sowe repe neyther haue storehouse barne god fedeth ⊢ howe moche ye better fethered foules math vi takyng thought adde stature one cubit ye able thynge whiche leasi take ye thought remenaunt consyder lylyes howe growe laboure spyn yet say vnto salomon al royalte clothed lyke one god clothe grasse day felde morow cast fournace moche wyll clothe ye lytell fayth aske ye ye shal eate ye shal drynke neyther clyme ye vp hygh suche thynges heathen peple worlde seke youre father knoweth ye haue nede suche thynges wherfore math vi c • •• vi b eccle 2 • b proue 23 • seke ye kyngdome god thynges shall ministred vnto ✚ feare lytell flocke youre father pleasure gyue kyngdome math xix c marke x x ☞ sell ye haue gyue almesse prepare bagges whiche waxe olde euen treasure fayleth beuē thefe cometh neyther moth corrupteth youre treasure wyll herte also ephe vi c • peter c let youre loynes gyrde aboute youre lyghtes burnynge ❀ handes ye selues lyke vnto men wayte theyr lorde wyll returne weddynge cometh knocketh may open vnto immediatly happy seruauntes lorde cometh shall fynde wakynge clerely saye vnto shall gyrde hym selfe make syt downe meate walke minister vnto yf come seconde watche yea yf come thyrde watche fynde happy seruauntes vnderstand yf good mā house knew houre thefe wolde come wolde surely watche suffre house broken vp math 24 • nd▪ xxv mar xiii • ye therfore redy also sonne man wyll come houre ye thynke ⊢ peter sayde vnto hym mat 24 mar xiii • mayster tellest thou similitude v men lorde sayde saythfull wyse stewarde lorde shall make ruler ouer housholde gyue theyr dutye meate due season • eue xvi c happy seruaunt lorde cometh shall fynde doynge trueth say vnto wyll make hym ruler ouer hath yf seruaunt saye herte mat 24 lorde wyll deferre comynge shall begyn smyte seruauntes maydens eate drynke dronken lorde seruaunt wyl come day thynketh houre ware wyll hewe hym peces gyue hym rewarde vnbyleuers 〈◊〉 ▪ • seruaunt knew maysters wyll prepared hym selfe neyther dyd accordyng wyll shalbe beaten many strypes knewe dyd cōmyt thynges worthy strypes shall beaten fewe strypes vnto soeuer moche gyuen hym shalbe moche requyred men haue cōmytted moche hym wyll aske more▪ come sende fyre earth desyre alredy kyndled notwithstandyng must math • ▪ baptised wt baptyme payned tyll ended math • suppose ye come sende peace earth tell nay rather deuysyon henceforth shall fyue one house deuyded thre agaynst two two agaynst thre father shall dedeuyded agaynst sonne sonne agaynst father mother agaynst doughter doughter agaynst mother mother lawe agaynst doughter lawe doughter law agaynst mother lawe sayde also people mat xxii ye se cloude ryse west streyght waye ye saye cometh showre whēye se south wynd blow ye say wyll hote cometh passe ye ypocrytes ye discerne outwarde apperaunce skye earth howe happeneth ye skyl tyme yea iudge ye selues • hat ryght math • ▪ • ▪ proue • ▪ • ▪ thou goest •• yne aduersary ruler thou arte way gyue diligence thou mayst delyuered frome hym leest brynge iudge iudge delyuer taylour taylour cast pryson tel thou shalt departe thence tyl thou haue made good vttermost myte ¶ galyleans pylate slewe dyed syloe similitude fygge tree chryst healeth sycke woman parable mustarde seede leuen▪ entre hyngdom chryst reproueth herode ierusalem capi xiii present season certayne men shewed hym galilean whose bloode pylate mengled theyr owne sacrifice iesus answered sayde vnto suppose ye actes v f galilean greater synners galyleans bycause suffred suche punysshment tell naye excepte ye repente ye shall lykewyse perysshe xviii vpon whiche toure syloe fell slewe thynke ye synners aboue men dwelte ierusalem tell naye excepte ye repent ye shall lykewyse perysshe ✚ tolde also similytude certayne man mat xxi b fygge tree planted vyneyearde came sought fruyte theron founde noone sayde dresser vyneyearde beholde thre yeare haue come sought fruyte fygge tre fynde none cut downe combreth grounde answered sayde vnto hym lorde let alone yeare also tyll dygge rounde aboute donge se whyther wyll beare fruyte yf beare shalte thou cut downe taught one theyr synagoges sabboth dayes beholde woman whiche spiryte infirmyte xviii yeres bowed togyther coulde wyse lyfte vp heade iesus sawe called hym sayde vnto woman thou arte delyuered thy disease layde handes immediatly made streyght glorifyed god ruler synagoge answered indygnacyon bycause iesus healed sabboth daye sayde vnto people syx dayes men ought worke come ye may healed sabboth daye lorde answered hym sayde thou ypocryte doth euery one sabboth day 〈◊〉 x •••• lose oxe asse stall leade water ought doughter abraham whome satan hath bound lo xviii yeares losed bonde sabboth daye thus sayde al aduersaryes ashamed people reioysed al excellent dedes done hym ⊢ sayde kyngdome god lyke wherto shall compare mat xvi mat • iii • lyke grayne mustarde seede whiche man toke sowed garden grewe waxed great tre foules ayre made nestes braunches agayne sayde wherunto shall lyken kyngdome god mat •• ii • lyke leuen whiche •• ue 〈◊〉 woman toke hyd thre peckes meale tyll leuened went cityes townes teachyng iourneyenge towardes ierusalem sayde one vnto hym lorde fewe saued sayde vnto stryue math vii • ▪ enter strayte gate many saye vnto wyll seke enterin shall able good man house rysen vp hath shut dore ye begyn stande without knocke dore sayenge lorde lorde opon vnto v answere say vnto know whence ye shall ye begyn saye haue eaten dronken thy presence thou hast taught stretes shall saye tell know whence ye departe ye worke iniquite shall wepynge▪ gnasshynge teeth ye shall se abraham isaac iacob prophettes kyngdome god ye selues thrust mat vi •• ▪ • shall come east west north south shall sytdowne kyngdom god behold mat xix • ▪ xx b marke x • last shalbe fyrst fyrst whiche shall last daye came certayne pharyses sayde vnto hym get waye departe hence herode wyll kyll sayde vnto go ye tell fore beholde caste deuyls heale people daye morowe thyrde daye make ende neuerthelesse muste walke daye morowe daye folowynge prophet perysshe saue ierusalem mat xxiii • ierusalē ierusalem kyllest prophettes stonest sent ofte wolde haue gathered thy chyldren togyther byrde doth gather yonge vnder wynges ye wolde beholde youre habitacyon lefte vnto desolate tell ye shall se vntyll tyme come ye shall saye math xxi b luke xix • iohn̄ x • • psal x •• • blessed cōmeth name lorde ¶ iesus eateth pharyses healeth dropsye vpō sabboth teacheth lowly telleth great supper warneth wyll folow hym lay theyr accomptes wyll cost salte earth capi xiiii ✚ chaunsed went house one cheyfe pharyses ☞ eate breade sabboth daye watched hym beholde certayne man hym whiche dropsye iesus answered spake vnto laweyers pharyses sayenge math xi • • math iii • luke vi • ▪ lawfull heale sabboth day helde theyr peace toke hym healed hym let hym go▪ answered sayenge whiche shall haue pro xxiii deu xxii math xii asse oxe fallen pyt wyll streyght waye pull sabboth day coulde answere hym agayne thynges put forth also similytude gestes marked howe preased hyghest rowmes sayde vnto thou arte bydden man weddyng syt downe hyghest rowme lest honorable man thou bydden hym bad come saye gyue man rowme thou begynne shame take lowest rowme rather thou arte bydden go syt lowest rowme bad cōmeth may say vnto proue 25 frende syt vp hygher shalt thou haue worshyp presence syt meat mat xxiii b luke 18 c whosoeuer exalteth selfe shalbe brought lowe humbled hym selfe shall exalted ⊢ sayde also hym desyred hym dyner ✚ thou makest dyner supper call thy frendes thy brother neyther thy kynsmen thy ryche neyghbours lest also byd agayne recompence made thou makest feast call poore feble lame blynde thou shalte happye recōpence thou shalte recompensed resurrection iuste men one sat meate also herde thynges sayd vnto hym happye eateth breade kyngdom god ⊢ sayde vnto hym ✚ mat xxii ••• e xix b certayne man ordeyned greate supper bad many sent seruaunt supper tyme saye bydden come thynges redy atonce began make excuse fyrst sayd vnto hym haue bought ferme must nedes go se praye haue excused sayde haue bought fyue yoke ox go proue praye haue excused sayde haue maryed wyfe therfore come seruaunt returned brought mayster word agayne therof good man house dyspleased sayde seruaunt go nuyckly stretes quarter citye bryng hyther poore feble halte blynde seruaunt sayd lorde done thou haste cōmaunded yet rowme lorde sayde seruaunt go vnto hygh wayes hedge gene xix • compell come house maye fylled saye vnto none men whiche bydden shall tast supper ⊢ went great company returned sayde vnto ✚ math • • luke • x • yf man come ☞ hate father mother wyfe chyldren brother systers yea owne lyfe also discyple whosoeuer doth beare crosse come discyple whiche dysposed buylde toure sytteth downe counteth coste whyther haue sufficient performe lest hath layde foundacyon able performe beholde begyn mocke hym sayenge man began buylde able make ende kynge goynge make battayle agaynste kynge sytteth downe fyrst casteth mynde whyther able ten thousande mete hym cōmeth agaynst hym twenty thousande el whyle yet great way sendeth ambassadours desyreth peace lykewyse whosoeuer forsaketh hath discyple ⊢ math v • luke ix • salte good yf salte haue lost saltnesse shall seasoned therwith neyther good lande yet donge hyll men cast dores hath eares heare let hym heare ¶ louynge mercy god openly set forth parable hundred shepe sonne lost capi xv ✚ resorted vnto hym math 〈◊〉 mark 〈◊〉 luke v • publycans synners heare hym pharyses scrybes murmured sayenge receyueth synners eateth put forth parable vnto sayenge mat xviii • man hauynge hundred shepe yf loose one doth leaue nynty nyne wyldernesse go whiche lost vntyll fynde hath founde layeth shoulder ioye soone cometh home calleth togyther louers neyghbours sayenge vnto reioyse haue founde shepe whiche loste saye vnto lykewyse ioye shal heuen ouer one synner repenteth ouer nynty nyne iust person whiche nede repentaunce eyther woman hauynge ten grotes yf lose one doth lyght candell swepe house seke dilygently tyll fynde hath founde calleth louers neyghbours togyther sayeng reioyse haue found grote whiche lost lykewyse saye vnto shall ioye presence angel god ouer one synner luke v f repenteth ⊢ ✚ sayde certayne man two sonnes yonger sayde vnto father father gyue porcion goodes belongeth deuyded vnto substaūce longe yonger son gathered togyther toke iourney far countrey proue 29 wasted goodes ryotous lyuynge spent arose greate derth al lande began lacke went came citezyn countrey sent hym farme kepe swyne wold fayne haue fylled bely coddes swyne dyd eate man gaue vnto hym came hym selfe sayde howe many hyred seruauntes father haue breade ynough peryshe hunger wyll aryse go father wyll say vnto hym father haue synned agaynst heuen worthye called thy sonne make one thy hyred seruauntes arose came father iob xiii e psal 32 yet greate waye father sawe hym compassyon ran fel necke kyssed hym sonne sayde vnto hym father haue synned agaynst heuen thy syght worthy called thy sonne father sayde seruauntes brynge forth best garment put hym put rynge hande shoe fete brynge hyther fat calfe kyll let v cate mery son deade alyue agayne loste founde began mery elder brother felde came drewe nygh house herde mynstrelsy daunsynge called one seruauntes asked thynges ment sayde vnto hym thy brother come thy father hath kylled fat calfe bycause hath receyued hym saue sounde angrye wolde go came father entreated hym answered sayd father lo many yeares haue done seruyce neyther brake tyme thy commaundement yet gauest thou neuer kyd make mery frendes assoone thy sonne come deuoured thy goodes harlottes thou hast pleasure kylled fat calfe sayd vnto hym sonne thou arte euer al haue thyne mete shulde make merye glad thy brother dead alyue agayne loste founde ⊢ ¶ parable wycked mammon one tytle god law shall perysshe ryche man poore lazarus capi xvi sayde also vnto discyples ✚ certayne ryche man whiche stewarde accused vnto hym wasted goodes called hym sayd vnto hym howe heare gyue accomptes thy stewardeshyppe thou mayste longer stewarde stewarde sayde within hym selfe shall mayster taketh awaye stewardeshyppe dygge begge ashamed wote put stewardshyp maye receyue theyr house called maysters detters togyther sayde vnto fyrst moche owest thou vnto mayster sayde hūdred tonne oyle sayd vnto hym take thy byll syt downe quyckly wryte fyftye sayde howe moche owest thou sayde hundred quarter wheate sayde vnto hym take thy byll wryte foure scoore lorde cōmended vniust steward bicause done wysely chyldren worlde theyr nacion wyser chyldren lyght saye vnto make frendes vnryghteous ☞ mammon ye shall haue nede maye receyue euerlastynge habitacyons ⊢ ✚ faythfull whiche least faythfull also moche vnryghteous least vnryghteous also moche yf ye haue bene faythfull vnryghteous māmon wyll byleue whiche true▪ yf ye haue ben faythfull man 〈2 page missing〉 kepte youth vp iesus herde sayd vnto hym yet lackest thou one thynge ☞ math xix c mathe x c sell al thou hast dystrybute vnto poore thou shalt haue treasure heuen come folowe herde sory ryche iesus sawe sorye sayde math xix • mathe x c defycultye shall haue money enter kyngdom god easyer camell go nedles eye ryche man enter kyngdom god herde sayde saued sayde math viii b thynges whiche vnpossyble men possyble god peter sayde math xix • • 〈◊〉 lo haue forsaken folowed sayd vnto uerely saye vnto man hath forsaken house eyther father mother eyther brother wyfe chyldren kyngdome goddes sake whiche shal receyue moche worlde worlde come lyfe euerlastynge ✚ iesus toke vnto hym twelue sayde vnto mat xvii mar viii • x x • luke ix • xvii • beholde go vp ierusalem shall fulfylled wrytten prophettes sonne man shall delyuered vnto gentyls shall mocked despytefullye entreated spytted haue scourged hym wyll put hym death math xvi b xvii b mark ix thyrde daye shall ryse agayne luke ii g ix f vnderstode none thynges sayenge hyd perceyued thyngꝭ whiche spoken math xx b mark x came passe come nygh vnto hierico certayne blynde man sat waye syde beggynge herde people passe asked ment sayde vnto hym iesus nazareth passed cryed sayeng iesu thou son dauid haue mercy whiche went rebuked hym shulde holde peace cryed moch marke x • thou son dauid haue mercy iesus stode styll commaunded hym brought vnto hym come neare asked hym sayenge wylte thou vnto sayd lorde maye receyue syght iesus sayde vnto hym receyue thy syght thy fayth hath saued immedyatly receyued syght folowed hym praysynge god peple sawe gaue prayse vnto god ⊢ ¶ • atheus ten seruauntes talentes deliuered chryst rydeth ierusalem wepeth ouer capi xix ✚ entred went ierico beholde man named zacheus whiche ruler amonge publican ryche also sought meanes se iesus shulde coulde prease bycause lytle stature ran clymed vp wylde fygge tree se hym come waye iesus came place loked vp sawe hym sayde vnto hym zache come downe daye muste abyde thy house came downe hastelye 〈◊〉 〈◊〉 receyued hym ioyfully sawe grudged sayenge gone tary man synner zache stode forth sayd vnto lorde beholde lorde halfe goodꝭ gyue poore yf haue done man wronge restore hym foure folde iesus sayde vnto hym daye health happened vnto house bycause also become ☞ chylde abraham math xv • sonne man come seke saue whiche loste ⊢ herde thynges added therto parable bycause nygh ierusalem bycause thought kyngdome god shulde shortly appeare sayde therfore ✚ math 〈◊〉 • mat xi • certayne noble man went farre countrey receyue hym kyngdome come agayne called ten seruauntes delyuered ten pounde sayenge vnto occupye tyl come citizen hated hym sent message hym sayenge wyll haue man reygne ouer v came passe receyued kyngdome returned commaunded seruauntes called vnto hym whome gyuen money wete howe moch euery man done came fyrste sayenge lorde thy pounde hath gayned ten pounde sayde vnto hym mat xxv • well thou good seruaunt bycause thou hast ben faythful lytle thyng haue thou auctorite ouer ten cityes came sayenge lorde thy pounde hath made fyue pounde sayd thou also ruler ouer fyue cityes came sayenge lorde beholde thy pounde whiche haue kepte napkyn feared bycause thou arte strayte man y• takest vp thou laydest downe rea • est thou dyddest sowe sayeth vnto hym • regū c math xii thyne owne mouth wyll iudge thou euyl seruaūt knewest thou strayte man takynge vp layde downe reapyng dyd sowe wherfore gauest thou money banke commynge myght haue requyred myne owne vauntage sayde vnto stoode take hym pounde gyue hym hath ten pound sayde vnto hym lorde hath ten pounde saye vnto mat xiii b xxv • mat iiii c luke viii c vnto euery one whiche hath shall gyuen ❀ shal haue aboundaunce hym hath shall taken awaye euen whiche hath moreouer myne enemyes whiche wolde shulde reygne ouer brynge hyther sley math xxi mark xi thus spoken proceded forth takynge iourney go vp ierusalem ⊢ math xxi • mark xi fortuned come nygh bethphage bethany besydes mounte whiche called oliuete sent two discyples sayenge go ye town • whiche ouer agaynst whiche soone ye come ye shall fynde ass colte tyed wheron yet neuer man sat loose hym brynge hym hyther yf man aske ye loose hym thus shall ye saye vnto hym lorde hath nede therof sent went theyr waye found euen sayde vnto losyng colte owner therof sayd vnto loose ye colte▪ sayd lorde hath nede hym brought hym iesus cast theyr rayment colte set iesus theron went spred theyr clothes waye nowe come nygh goynge downe mounte oliuete hole multitude discyples began reioyce prayse god loude voyce myracles sene sayenge scrybes came togyther elder spake vnto hym sayenge math xxii c mark xi • tell v auctorite doest thou thynges eyther gaue auctorite iesus answered sayd vnto also wyll aske one thynge answere baptyme teachest waye god truely lawfull v giue tribute vnto cesar perceyued theyr craftynesse sayd vnto mat xxii • mat xii • tempte ye shewe peny whose ymage superscrypcyon hath answered sayd cesars sayd vnto gyue vnto cesar thynges belonge vnto cesar god thynges pertayne vnto god coulde reproue sayenge people meruayled answere helde theyr peace mat xxii • mat xii b came hym certayne saduces actes 23 b whiche denye resurrection asked hym sayenge deu xxv b mayster moses wrote vnto v yf mannes brother dye hauynge wyfe dye without chyldren brother shulde take wyfe rayse vp seede vnto brother therfore seuen brother fyrst toke wyfe dyed without chyldren seconde toke dyed chyldelesse thyrde toke lykewyse residue seuen lefte chyldren behynde dyed laste woman dyed also nowe resurrectiō whose wyfe shall seuen wyfe iesus answered sayde vnto chyldren worlde marry wyues marryed whiche shall counted worthy worlde resurrection dead marry wyues neyther marryed yet dye equall vnto angel iohn̄ 〈…〉 • iii • cōstrayned sayenge abyde v draweth towarde nyght daye farre past went tary ••• xv b▪ came passe sat meate toke breade blessed brake gaue theyr eye opened knew hym vanysshed theyr syght sayd thoughtes aryse hertes beholde handes fete euen selfe handle se spirite hath fleshe bone ye se haue whē thus spoken shewed handes fete whyle yet byleued ioy wondred sayd vnto iohn̄ xx • • haue ye meate offered hym pece broyled fysshe hony combe▪ toke dyd eate sayd vnto mat xvi • ▪ wordes whiche spake vnto whyle yet must nedes fulfylled whiche wrytten lawe moses prophettes psalmes 〈…〉 17 • chryst howe became man testymony iohn̄ callyng andrewe peter c capi primo ✚ begynnynge worde worde god god worde beginnyng god genesis prouer 8 thynges made without made thynge made iohn̄ 14 b lyfe lyfe iohn̄ vi • b and▪ ix lyght men lyght shyneth darkenes darkenes comprehended sent god man whose name iohn̄ came wytnes beare wytnes lyght al men hym myght byleue iohn̄ v ☞ lyght sent beare wytnes lyghte lyght true lyghte whiche lyghteth euery man cometh worlde worlde world made hym worlde knew came among owne owne receyued hym many receyued hym esai lvi b osee b rom b gala • gaue power sonnes god euen byleued name whiche borne bloode wyll flesshe yet wyl man god worde became flesshe dwelte amonge v mat 27 • peter c iohn̄ sawe glory glory onely begotten sonne father full grace trueth ⊢ ✚ math iii b marke iohn̄ beareth wytnes hym cryeth sayenge whome spake though came went collos ii b fulnes haue al receyued euen ☞ grace grace lawe gyuē moses grace trueth came iesus chryst grods 33 • iohn̄ 4 b ☞ man hath sene god tyme onely begotten sonne bosome father hath declared hym ⊢ ✚ iohn̄ v recorde iohn̄ iues sent preestes leuites ierusalem aske hym arte thou confessed denyed sayd playnly chryst asked hym math xi • arte thou elia sayeth ☞ deut 18 c arte thou prophet answered thē sayd vnto hym arte thou maye gyue answere sent v sayest thou thy selfe sayd math • marke luke •• voyce cryer wyldernes make streyght way lorde esai xi▪ sayd prophet esaias whiche sent pharises asked hym sayd vnto hym baptisest thou yf thou chryst elia neyther prophet iohn̄ answered sayenge math▪ • marke luke 〈◊〉 • te •• baptyse water standeth one amonge whō ye knowe though came whose shoo latchet worthy vnlose thynges done bethabara beyonde iordan iohn̄ • and▪ x • iohn̄ dyd baptyse ⊢ ✚ nexte day iohn̄ seeth iesus commynge vnto hym sayeth esai 〈◊〉 lor • ▪ • ▪ beholde lambe god whiche taketh away synne worlde sayde cometh man whiche went knewe hym shulde declared israel therfore come baptysyng water math▪ 〈◊〉 marke • luke 〈◊〉 • iohn̄ bare recorde sayenge sawe spirite descende heuen lyke vnto doue abode vpon hym knew sent baptyse water sayde vnto vpon whome thou shalte se spirite descende tary styl hym baptyseth holy goost sawe bare recorde sonne god ⊢ nexte day iohn̄ stode agayne two disciple behelde iesus walked sayeth beholde lambe god two disciple herde hym speake folowed iesus iesus turned aboute sawe folowe hym sayeth vnto seke ye sayde vnto hym rabbi whiche saye yf one interprete mayster dwellest thou sayeth vnto come se came sawe dwelte abode hym daye aboute tenth houre one two herde iohn̄ speake folowed hym andrewe symon peter brother founde brother symon fyrst sayeth vnto hym haue founde messias whiche interpretacyon anoynted brought hym iesus iesus behelde hym sayde thou arte mat xvi • symon sonne ionas thou shalte called cephas whiche interpretacyon stone day folowynge iesus wolde go galile founde philip sayeth vnto hym folowe iohn̄ xii • philip bethsaida citye andrewe peter philip founde nathanael sayeth vnto hym haue founde hym 〈◊〉 iii c • x • i▪ c moses lawe 〈◊〉 18 • 〈◊〉 ▪ vii c prophettes dyd wryte iesus sonne ioseph nazareth nathanaell sayde vnto hym 〈◊〉 vii c good thyng come nazareth philip sayeth vnto hym come se iesus sawe nathanaell comynge hym sayeth hym beholde ryght israelyte whome gyle nathanaell sayeth vnto hym whence knowest thou iesus answered sayd vnto hym philip called thou wast vnder fygge tree sawe nathanael answered sayd vnto hym rabbi thou art euen sonne god thou arte kynge israel iesus answered sayd vnto hym bycause sayde vnto sawe vnder fygge tree thou byleuest thou shalte se greater thyngꝭ sayeth vnto hym uerely verely say vnto hereafter shall ye se heuen open angel god ascendynge descendyng ouer sonne man ¶ chryst turneth water wyne dryueth byers seller temple capi ii ✚ thyrd day mariage cana citye galile mother iesus iesus called disciple vnto maryage wyne fayled mother iesus sayth vnto haue wyne iesus sayth vnto woman luka ii • haue myne houre yet come mother sayeth vnto minister soeuer sayeth vnto standyng vi waterpot • e stone maner purifieng iues conteynynge two thre fyrkyns pece iesus sayeth vnto fyll water pottes water fylled vp brym sayeth vnto drawe nowe beare vnto gouernoure feaste bare ruler feast tasted water turned vnto wyne knew whence minister whiche drue water knew calleth brydegrome sayth vn hym euery mā begynnyng doth set forth good wyne ☞ men dronke worse thou hast kept good wyne vntyll nowe begynnyng myracles dyd iesus cana galile shewed glory disciple byleued hym ⊢ mat iiii b marke b luke iiii went downe capernaum mother brother disciple contynued many dayes ✚ mat xxi • marke xi c luke xix • iues easter euen hande iesus went vp ierusalem found syttynge temple solde ox shepe doues chaungers money made scourge small coordes droue temple shepe ox powred chaungers money ouerthrew table sayd vnto solde doues haue thyngꝭ hence make father house house marchaundyse disciple remēbred wryten psal 79 b zele thyne house hath euen eaten answered iues sayd vnto hym token shewest thou vnto v seynge thou doest thynges iesus answered sayd vnto mat xvi f mar xi •• f destroy temple thre dayes wyll teare vp sayde iues xlvi yeres temple buyldyng wylt thou reare vp thre dayes spake temple body soone therfore rysen death agayne disciple remembred thus sayd byleued scripture wordes whiche iesus sayde ierusalem easter feast daye many byleued name sawe myracles whiche dyd iesus dyd commyt hym selfe vnto bycause knewe men neded mā shulde testifie hym iere xvii reuels knewe man ⊢ ¶ cōmunicacyon chryst ni • ddem • doctrine baptym iohn̄ wytnes teareth christ capi iii man pharises named nicodemus ruler iues iohn̄ vii • came iesus nyght sayd vnto hym rabbi knowe thou arte teacher come god man coulde suche myracles thou doest excepte god hym iesus answered sayde vnto hym uerely verely say vnto excepte man borne aboue se kyngdome god nicodemus sayeth vnto hym ☞ howe man borne olde enter mother wombe borne agayne iesus answered iohn̄ iiii • vii titū • ii • uerely verely say vnto excepte mā borne water spirite enter kyngdome god rom • whiche borne flesshe flesshe whiche borne spirite spirite meruayle thou sayde ye must borne aboue wynde bloweth lysteth thou hearest sounde therof ecclesi xi canst tell whence cometh whyther goeth euery one borne spirite nycodemus answered sayd vnto howe thynges iesus answered sayde vnto hym arte thou mayster israel knowest thynges uerely verely saye vnto speake knowe testifie haue sene ye receyue wytnesse haue tolde earthly thynges ye byleue shall ye byleue yf tell heuenly thynges ephe iiii man ascendeth vp heuen came downe frome heuen euen sonne man whiche heuen nume xxi • moses lyfte vp serpent wyldernesse euen must son man lyfte vp soeuer byleueth hym peryshe haue eternall lyfe ⊢ ✚ rom v god loued worlde gaue onely begotten son soeuer byleueth hym shuld perisshe haue euerlastyng lyfe luke xix • god sent son worlde condemne worlde ☞ worlde hym myght saued byleueth hym condemned byleueth condemned redy bycause hath byleued name onely begotten son god condemnacyon iohn̄ • • nd xii • lyght come worlde men loued darkenesse lyght bycause theyr dedes euyll ephe v b euery one euyll doeth hateth lyght neyther cometh lyght leest dedes shulde reproued doth truth cometh lyght dedes maye knowen howe wrought god ⊢ thynges came iesus disciple lande iurye taryed ☞ iohn̄ iiii math iii marke luke iii baptysed iohn̄ also baptised enan besyde salim bycause moche water came baptysed mat iiii b iohn̄ yet cast pryson ✚ arose questyon bytwene iohn̄s disciple iues aboute purifienge came vnto iohn̄ sayd vnto hym rabbi beyonde iordan thou barest wytnes beholde baptiseth iohn̄ iiii men come hym iohn̄ answered sayd man receyue nothynge excepte gyuen hym heuen ye youre selues wytnesses iohn̄ b howe sayde chryst sente hym hath bryde brydegrome frende brydegrome whiche standeth heareth hym reioyseth greatly bycause bryde gromes voyce ioye therfore fulled must encreace must decreace cometh hygh aboue al earth earthly speaketh earth cometh heuen aboue al hath sene herde testifieth man receyueth testimonye hath receyued testimonye rom • xi • ☞ hath set seale god true god hath sent speaketh wordes god esai • xi • ☞ god gyueth spirite measure vnto hym father loueth sonne math xi • luke x hath gyuen thynges hande iohn̄ vi • iohn̄ •• byleueth sonne hath euerlastynge lyfe byleueth sonne shall se lyfe wrath god abydeth hym ⊢ ¶ louynge cōmunicacyon christ woman samaria welles syds healeth ruler son capi iiii soone lorde knewe howe pharises herde iesus made baptised mo disciple iohn̄ though iesus hym selfe baptised disciple mat ii • lefte iuery departed agayne galile must nedes go thorowe samaria ✚ came citye samaria called sichar besydes possessyon gene 48 • iacob gaue sonne ioseph iacobs well iesus beynge werye iourney sat thus well aboute syxte houre came womā samaria drawe water iesus sayth vnto gyue drynke disciple gone awaye vnto towne bye meate sayeth woman samaria vnto hym howe thou beyng iue askest drynke whiche samaritane 4 re 〈◊〉 iohn̄ • • iues medle samaritan iesus answered sayde vnto yf thou knewest gyfte god sayeth gyue drynke thou woldest haue asked hym wolde haue gyuen ie • e ii • iohn̄ vii • water lyfe womā sayeth vnto hym syr thou hast nothyng drawe well depe whence hast thou water lyfe arte thou greater father iacob gaue v well hym selfe dranke therof chyldren cattell iesus answered sayde vnto soeuer drynketh water shal thyrst agayne ☞ soeuer drynketh water shal gyue hym shal neuer thyrst water shall gyue hym shall hym well water spryngynge vp euerlastyng lyfe woman sayeth vnto hym syr gyue water thyrst neyther come hyther draw iesus sayeth vnto go call thy husbande come hyther woman answered sayde vnto hym haue husbande iesus sayde vnto thou hast well sayde haue husbande thou haste fyue husbandes whome thou nowe hast thy husband saydest thou truely woman sayeth vnto hym luke vii b syr perceyue thou arte prophet father worshypped mountayne 3 reg ix ii para 7 c ye say ierusalem place men ought worshyp iesus sayeth vnto woman byleue houre commeth ye shall neyther mountayne yet ierusalem worshyppe father ye worshyppe ye wote knowe worshyp exodi xxi • saluacion cōmeth iues houre cōmeth nowe true worshyppers shall worshyp father rom spiryte trueth soche father also requireth worshyppe • corin iii • god spiryte worshyp must worshyp hym spiryte trueth woman sayeth vnto hym wote messias shall come whiche called chryst come wyl tel v althynges iesus sayeth vnto mat xxii • mat xiii • luke xxii • iohn̄ ix • nd x c speake vnto immediatly came disciple meruayled talked woman yet man sayde meanest thou talkest thou woman left waterpot went waye citye sayeth men come se man whiche tolde thynges euer dyd chryst went citye came vnto hym meane whyle disciple prayed hym sayenge mayster eate sayde vnto haue meate eate ye know therfore sayde disciple among selues hath man brought hym ought eate iesus sayeth vnto meate wyll hym sent fynisshe worke saye ye yet foure monethes cōmeth haruest beholde say vnto lyfte vp eye loke regyons whyte redy vnto haruest math ix b luke x reapeth receyueth reward gathereth fruyte vnto lyfe eternall bothe soweth reapeth myght reioyse togyther herein sayenge true one soweth reapeth sent reape wheron ye bestowed labour men laboured ye entred theyr labour many samaritan citye byleued hym sayenge woman whiche testified tolde euer dyd samaritan come vnto hym besought hym wolde tary abode two dayes many mo byleued bycause owne wordes sayde vnto woman byleue bicause thy sayenge ioh xvii b haue herde hym selues knowe euen chryst sauyoure worlde ⊢ two dayes departed thence went awaye galile mat xiii g math vi luke ••• • iesus hymselfe testified prophet hath noone honour owne countrey soone come galile galilean receyued sene al thynges dyd ierusalem daye feaste went also vnto feaste daye iesus came agayne cana galile iohn̄ ii turned water wyne ✚ certayne ruler mat viii luke vii whose soune sycke capernaum soone herde iesus come iurye galile went vnto hym besought hym wolde come downe heale sonne euen poynt death sayd iesus vnto hym excepte ye se sygnes wonder ye wyl byleue ruler sayeth vnto hym syr come downe euer sonne dye iesus sayeth vnto hym go thy waye thy son lyueth man byleued worde iesus spoken vnto hym went waye nowe goynge downe seruauntes met hym tolde hym sayenge thy sonne lyueth enquired houre whē began amende sayde vnto yester daye seuenth houre feuer lefte hym father knewe houre whiche iesus sayde vnto hym thy sonne lyueth actes 18 • byleued housholde ⊢ agayne seconde myracle iesus dyd come iuery galile ¶ healeth man sycke eyght thyrtye yeare iues accuse hym answereth hym selfe reproueth 〈2 page missing〉 sayde vnto lorde euer gyue v breade iesus sayde vnto breade lyfe commeth shall hunger byleueth shall neuer thyrst ⊢ sayde vnto ye also haue sene yet ye byleue father gyueth shall come hym cōmeth cast waye came downe heuen luke xxii e wyll wyll whiche hath sent father wyll hath sent whiche hath gyuen shall loose nothyng rayse vp agayne last day wyll hym sent euery one whiche seeth son iohn̄ v • byleueth hym haue euerlastynge lyfe wyll rayse hym vp last day iues murmured hym bycause sayd bread lyfe came downe heuen sayde mat xiii • mark vi • iesus soune ioseph whose father mother knowe howe sayeth came downe heuen iesus answered sayde vnto murmur amonge selues ✚ ☞ iohn̄ vii • man come except father whiche hath sent drawe hym wyll rayse hym vp laste daye wrytten prophettes esai iiiii • iohn̄ ii shall taught god euery man therfore hath herde hath lerned father cōmeth vnto erodi 33 drut iiii iuditū vi • • iii iohn̄ c • ioh iiii b man hath sene father saue whiche god hath sene father uerely verely say vnto putteth trust hath euerlastynge lyfe breade lyfe father dyd eate manna wyldernesse dead bread whiche cōmeth downe frō heuen man maye eate therof dye lyuyng bread came downe heuen yf man eate breade shall lyue euer luke xxii breade wyll gyue flesshe whiche wyll gyue lyfe worlde ⊢ iues therfore stroue amonge themselues sayenge howe felowe gyue v flesshe eate iesus sayde vnto ✚ uerely verely say vnto ☞ excepte ye eate flesshe sonne man drynk bloode ye haue lyfe eateth flesshe drynketh bloode hath eternal lyfe wyll rayse hym vp last daye ✚ flesshe meate dede bloode drynke dede eateth flesshe drynketh bloode dwelleth hym liuyng father hath sent lyue father euen eateth shall lyue meanes bread whiche came downe frō heuen father dyd eate man na deade eateth bread shall lyue euer ⊢ thynges sayde synagoge taught capernaum many therfore discyples herde sayd harde sayeng abyde hearyng iesus knewe hym selfe disciple murmured sayde vnto doth offende yf ye shall se son man ascende vp thyther spiryte quyckeneth flesshe profyteth nothynge wordes speake vnto spiryte lyfe bileue iesus knew begynnyng whiche byleued shulde betraye hym sayde therfore sayd vnto iohn̄ vii • man come vnto except gyuen vnto hym father tyme many disciple went backe forsoke hym walked hym sayde iesus twelue wyll ye also go awaye simon peter answered hym lorde whome shal go thou haste wordes eternall lyfe mat xvi • mar viii • luke • • iohn̄ xi • byleue sure thou arte chryst sonne lyuynge god iesus answereth haue chosen twelue luke xxii • iohn̄ xiii • one deuyll spake iudas iscariot sonne simon shulde betraye hym beynge one twelue ¶ iesus cometh ierusalem least teacheth iues reproueth dyuerse opinyons hym amonge people pharyses rebuke offycers bycause haue brought hym chyde nicodemus takynge parte capi vii thynges iesus went galile wolde go aboute iurye bycause iues sought kyll hym iues leui • xxiii • num xix b 3 esora v • ii mata v feast tabernacle hande brother therfore sayde vnto hym get hence go iury thy discyples also maye se thy workes thou doest man doeth thynge secret hym selfe seketh knowen openly yf thou soch thynges shewe thy selfe worlde brother byleued hym iesus sayde vnto tyme yet come tyme alwaye redy worlde hate iohn̄ xv hateth bycause •• stifye workes therof euyl go ye vp vnto feast wyll go vp yet vnto feast tyme yet full come sayd wordes vnto abode styl ga lile soone brother come went also vp vnto feast open ly preuely sought hym iues feast sayde iohn̄ xi f moth murmurynge hym among people sayde mat xxi iohn̄ iiii • vi c good sayde naye deceyueth people howbeit iohn̄ xii f man spake openly hym feare iues ⊢ ✚ nowe halfe feast done iesus went vp temple taught iues meruayled sayenge howe knoweth scryptures seyng neuer lerned iesus answered sayd doctryne myne sent yf man wyll obedyent vnto wyll shall know doctryne whyther god whyther speake selfe speaketh hym selfe seketh owne prayse seketh prayse sent hym true vnryghtwysenesse hym exodi xx deute v dyd moses gyue lawe yet none kepeth lawe go ye kyll people answered sayd thou hast deuyll goeth aboute kyll iesus answered sayde vnto iohn̄ v haue done one worke ye meruayle moses therfore gaue vnto circumsicion bycause moses eene xvii b father yet ye sabboth daye circumcise man yf man sabboth daye receyue circumsicion without breakyng lawe moses disdayne ye bycause haue made man euery whyt hole sabboth daye leuiti xi • • dcute c proue 24 e iudge vtter appearaunce iudge ryghteous iuogement sayde ierusalem go aboute kyll • spea keth boldly saye nothynge hym ruler knowe dede chryst howbeit mat xiii g mark vi iohn̄ vi c knowe man whence chryste cometh man knoweth whence cryed iesus temple taught sayeng ye knowe whence ye knowe come selfe sente true whome ye knowe knowe hym ❀ yf saye knovv shalbe lyer lyke vnto knovv hym hym hath sent mark xi c luke xi • g xx▪ • xxii • sought take hym man layde handes hym bycause houre yet come iohn̄ 8 many people byleued hym ⊢ sayd chryst cometh wyl mo myracles man hath doone pharyses herde people murmured soche thynges concernynge hym ✚ pharises hygh preestes mat xxii • mark xii • luke xx sent minister take hym sayd iesus vnto yet lytell whyle go vnto hym sent ye shall seke shall fynde iohn̄ viii c xiii • thyther ye come sayde iues among selues whyther wyll go shall fynde hym wyll go amonge gentyls whiche scattered abrode teache gentyls maner sayenge sayde ye shall seke shal fynde thyther ye come last day great day feast iesus stode cryed saynge esai • yf man chyrst let hym come vnto drynke byleueth sayeth scrypture belly shal flowe ryuers water lyfe spake spiryte whiche byleue hym shulde receyue ⊢ holy goost yet bicause iesus yet glorifyed ✚ many peple therfore herde sayenge sayde iohn̄ 〈◊〉 c v b luke vii • trueth prophet sayd mat xxi b chryst sayd shall chryst come galyle • r • e v • math ii • sayeth scrypture chryst shall come seede dauid towne bethleem dauid dissencyon amonge people bycause hym wolde haue taken hym man layde handꝭ hym thē came minysters hygh preestes pharyses sayde vnto haue ye brought hym minysters answered neuer man spake man doeth answered pharyses ye also disceyued doeth ruler pharyses byleue comon people whiche knowe lawe cursed nicodemus sayeth vnto iohn̄ iii • came iesus nyght one doth law iudge man heare hym knowe hath done answered sayde vnto hym arte thou also galile search loke galile aryseth prophette euery man went vnto owne house ⊢ ¶ woman taken aduoutrye chryst delyuereth fredom suche folowe chryst accuse haue deuyll within hym go aboute stone hym capi viii ✚ iesus went mat xxi • mark xi luke xix c vnto mounte olyuete early mornynge came agayne temple people came vn hym sat downe taught scrybes pharises brought vn woman taken aduoutrye set myddes saye vnto hym mayster woman taken aduoutrye euen dede doynge luke xx b moses lawe commaunded v soch shulde stoned sayest thou sayde tempte hym myght accuse hym iesus stouped fynger wrote ground contynued askyng hym lyfte hym selfe vp sayde vnto let hym among without syn cast fyrst stone agayne stouped downe wrote grounde soone herde went one one begynnyng eldest iesus lefte alone woman standynge myddes iesus lyfte vp hym selfe saw man woman sayd vnto woman thyne accuser hath man condemned sayde man lorde iesus sayde neyther condempnethe go iohn̄ v • synne ⊢ ✚ spake iesus agayne vnto sayenge iohn̄ • • x • • xii • lyght worlde foloweth doth walke darknes shall haue lyght lyfe pharyses therfore sayde vnto hym thou bearest recorde thy selfe thy recorde true iesus answered sayde vnto though beare recorde selfe yet recorde true knowe whence came whyther go ye tell whence come whyther go ye iudge fleshe ☞ iudge man yf iudge iudgemet true alone father sent num 35 • deut 17 • xix math 18 c ii cori 13 timo v c hebrue x c also wryttē lawe testimony two men true one beareth wytnesse selfe father sent beareth wytnes sayde vnto hym thy father iesus answered ye neyther know yet father yf ye knowen ye shuld haue knowen father also wordes spake iesus treasurye taught temple man layde handes hym math v • • houre yet come ⊢ sayde iesus agayne vnto ✚ go way iohn̄ v •• • xiii • ye shall seke shal dye synnes whyther go thyther ye come sayde iues wyll kyll hym selfe bycause sayeth whyther go thyther ye come sayde vnto ye beneath aboue ye world worlde sayde therfore vnto ye shall dye synnes mat xv • • iohn̄ • ii • yf ye byleue ye shall dye synnes sayd vnto hym arte thou iesus sayeth vnto euen thynge speake vnto haue many thynges saye iudge yea sent true iohn̄ 14 • speake worlde thynges haue herde howbeit vnderstode spake father sayde iesus vnto ye haue lyfte vp hygh sonne man shall ye knowe nothyng selfe iohn̄ ii • x • iii b father hath taught euen speake thynges sent father hath lefte alone alwayes thynges please hym ⊢ spake wordes iohn̄ vii many byleued hym ✚ sayde iesus iues whiche byleued yf ye continue worde ye verye disciple ye shall knowe trueth trueth shall make free answered hym abraham seede neuer bonde man howe sayest thou ye shalbe made rome vi • viii • free iesus answered verely verely saye vnto rome v • c ii petr 〈◊〉 • soeuer cōmytteth synne seruaunt synne seruaunt abydeth house euer sonne abydeth euer yf sonne therfore shall make free ye free dede knowe ye abraham seede ye seke meanes kyll bycause worde hath place speake whiche haue seene father ye whiche ye haue seene father answered sayde vnto hym abraham father iesus sayeth vnto yf ye abraham chyldren ye wolde dedes abraham nowe ye go aboute kyll man hath tolde trueth whiche haue herde god dyd abraham ye dedes father sayde hym borne fornicaciō haue one father euen god iesus sayde vnto yf god youre father truely ye wolde loue proceded forth came god neyther came selfe sent ye knowe speche euen bycause ye abyde hearynge worde ye youre father deuyll lustes father wyll ye serue gene iii iohn̄ iii murtherer begynnynge abode trueth bycause theyr trueth hym speaketh lye speaketh owne lyer father thynge bycause tell trueth therfore ye byleue ✚ whiche rebuketh synne yf say trueth ye bileue iohn̄ x • god heareth goddes wordes ye therfore heare bycause ye god answered iues sayd vnto hym saye well thou arte samaritane iohn̄ x haste deuyll iesus answered haue deuyll honour father ye haue dishonoured seke myne owne prayse one seketh iudgeth uerely verely saye vnto yf man kepe sayenge shall neuer se death sayd iues vnto hym nowe know thou haste deuyll abraham deade prophettes thou sayest yf man kepe sayenge shal neuer tast death arte thou greater oure father abraham dead prophettes dead whome makest thou thy selfe iesus answered yf honoure selfe myne honoure nothynge father honoureth whiche ye saye youre god yet ye haue knowen hym knowe hym yf saye knowe hym shall lyer lyke vnto knowe hym kepe sayenge youre father abraham glad se daye gene 17 xxii sawe retoysed sayde iues vnto hym thou arte yet l yeare olde haste thou sene abraham iesus sayde vnto uerely verely saye vnto ere abraham borne e • odi iii iohn̄ x f tooke vp stoones caste hym iesus hyd hym selfeluke iiii e went temple ⊢ ¶ chryst maketh man se borne blynde capi ix ✚ iesus passed sawe man whiche blynde byrth disciple asked hym sayenge mayster dyd synne man father mother borne blynd iesus answered neyther hath man synned yet father mother workes god shulde shewed hym must worke workes hym sent whyle daye nyght cōmeth whē man worke longe worlde iohn̄ • vi •• b 〈◊〉 • lyght worlde soone thus spoken spatte grounde made claye spytle rubbed claye eye blynde sayde vnto hym go wasshe poole esai viii b syloe whiche interpretacyō moche saye sent went way therfore wasshed came agayne seynge neyghbours sene hym howe begger sayde sat begged sayde agayne saybe ❀ lyke hym hym selfe sayde euen therfore sayde vnto hym howe thyne eye opened answered sayde man called iesus made claye anoynted myne eye sayde vnto go pole silot wasshe went wasshed receyued syght sayde vnto hym sayde tell brought pharises lytel blynd math xii marke ii luke vii iohn̄ v b vii • sabboth day iesus made claye opened eye agayne pharises also asked hym receyued syght sayd vnto put claye vpon myne eye wasshed se therfore sayde pharyses man god bycause kepeth sabboth daye sayde iohn̄ vi • • x howe man synner soche myracles stryfe monge spake vnto blynde man agayne sayest thou hym bycause hath opened thyne eye sayde iohn̄ vii • prophet iues dyd byleue man howe ben blynde receyued syght vntyll called father mother hym receyued syght asked sayenge sonne whome ye saye borne blynde howe doth nowe se father mother answered sayde knowe sonne borne blynde meanes nowe seeth tell hath opened eye tell olde ynough aske hym let hym answeare hym selfe soche wordes spake father mother bycause feared iues iues conspyred alredye yf man dyd cōfesse chryst iohn̄ vii • shulde excommunicate sinagoge therfore sayde father mother olde ynough aske hym agayne called man blynde sayde vnto hym gyue god prayse knowe man synner answered therfore sayde whyther syn̄er tell one thyng sure blynde nowe se sayde hym agayne dyd howe opened thyne eye answered agayne tolde ere whyle ye dyd heare wherfore wolde ye heare agayne wyl ye also disciple rated sayde thou disciple moses disciple sure god spake vnto moses felowe knowe whence man answered sayde vnto merueylous thynge ye wote whence yet hath opened myne eye sure ☞ god heareth synners yf man worshypper god obedient vnto wyll hym heareth synce worlde began herde man opened eye one borne blynde yf man god coulde haue done nothyng answered sayde vnto hym thou arte togyther borne synne dost thou teache v caste hym iesus herde excommunicate hym founde hym sayde vnto hym doest thou bileue son god answered sayde lorde myght byleue hym iesus sayde vnto hym thou haste sene hym iohn̄ iiii • talketh sayde lorde byleue worshypped hym ⊢ iesus sayde vnto hym ☞ come vnto iudgement worlde whiche se myght se se myght made blynde pharises whiche hym herde wordes sayde vnto hym blynde also iesus sayde vnto iohn̄ xv ☞ yf ye blynde ye shulde haue synne nowe ye snye se therfore youre synne remayneth ¶ chryst true shepheerde dore sheper telleth trueth therfore iues take vp slone • cast hym call preachynge blasphemye go aboute take hym capi x ✚ verely verely say vnto entreth bye dore shepefolde climmeth vp way thefe robber entreth bye dore shepheerde shepe hym porter openeth shepe heare voyce prouet • calleth owne shepe bye name leadeth hath sent forth owne shepe goeth shepe folowe hym knowe voyce straunger wyll folowe wyl fley knowe voyce straungers prouerbe spake iesus vnto vnderstode thyngꝭ whiche spake vnto sayd iesus vnto agayne uerely verely saye vnto iohn̄ 14 • dore shepe euen many came theues murtherers shepe dyd heare dore yf man enter shall safe shall go fynde pasture thefe cōmeth steale kyll destroy come might haue lyfe myght haue aboundantly ⊢ ✚ ezeche 〈◊〉 miche v • good shepheerde ☞ good shepheerde gyueth lyfe shepe hyred seruaunt whiche shepherd nether shepe owne seeth wolfe cōmyng leaueth shepe fleeth wolfe catcheth scattereth shepe hyred seruaunt fleeth bycause hyred seruaunt careth shepe good shepheerde ii tim ii • knowe shepe knowen myne math xi luke x father knoweth euen knowe also father marke x • gyue lyfe shepe shepe haue folde also must bryng shall heare voyce ☞ shalbe one folde one shepheerd ⊢ therfore doth father loue bycause put lyfe myght take agayn man taketh frō put away selfe haue power put frō haue power take agayne cōmaūdement haue receyued father dyssencyon therfore agayne amonge iues sayengꝭ many sayde math ix xii b marh iii b luke xi b iohn̄ viii • hath deuyll mad heare ye hym sayde iohn̄ 7 g wordꝭ hym hath deuyl deuyl open eye blynde ✚ ierusalem feaste ☞ dedicacion wynter iesus walked temple euen • regū 6 • uen iii b v c salomon porche came iues rounde aboute hym sayd vnto hym howe long doest thou make v doute yf thou christ tel v playnly iesus answered told ye byleue workes father name beare wytnesse ye byleue bycause ye shepe sayde vnto iohn̄ viii f shepe heare voyce know folowe gyue vnto eternall lyfe shall neuer perysshe neyther shall man plucke hande father gaue greater man able take father hande iohn̄ xiiii xvii c father one iohn̄ vii • g iues agayne toke vp stone stone hym withall iesus answered many good workes haue shewed father ye stone iues answered hym sayenge thy good workes sake stone iohn̄ v thy blasphemy bycause thou beyng man makest thy selfe god iesus answered wrytten law exod xxii psal 82 sayd yeare goddes yf called goddes vn worde god spoken scripture broken concernynge hym father hath sanctified sent worlde ye say blaspheme math 26 f mar xiiii g luke xxii g bycause sayd sonne god iohn̄ ix xv yf workes father byleue yf yf ye byleue byleue workes ye maye knowe byleue father hym ⊢ mat xxi b iohn̄ vii g agayne went aboute take hym escaped theyr hande went awaye agayne beyond iordā place iohn̄ iohn̄ baptised abode many resorted vnto hym sayde iohn̄ dyd myracle iohn̄ iii thynges iohn̄ spake man true many byleued hym ¶ chryst reyseth lazarus death hygh preestes pharises gather counsell agaynst hym getteth hym waye capi xi ✚ certayne man sycke named lazarus bethania towne mary syster martha mary luke vii f whiche anoynted iesus oyntment wyped fete heere whose brother lazarus sycke therfore systers sent vnto hym sayenge lorde beholde y• louest sycke iesus herde sayd infirmite vnto death prayse god son god iohn̄ ix • myght praysed reason iesus loued martha syster lazarus herde therfore sycke abode two dayes styll place sayde disciple let v go iuery agayne disciple sayde vnto hym mayster iues lately iohn̄ vii viii g ix • sought stone wylte thou go thyther agayne iesus answered twelue houres daye yf man walke daye stombleth bycause •• th lyght worlde yf man walke nyght stombleth bycause lyghte hym sayde sayde vnto oure frende lazarus math ix c math v luke viii g slepeth go wake hym oute slepe sayde disciple lorde yf slepe shall well ynough beit iesus spake death thought spoken natural slepe thē sayd iesus vnto playnly lazarus deade glad youre sake bycause ye maye byleue neuerthelesse let v go vnto hym sayde iohn̄ xx f thomas whiche called didimus vnto disciple let v also go maye dye hym went iesus founde lyne graue foure dayes alredy bethanye nygh vnto ierusalem aboute fyftene furlonges many iues came martha mary comforte ouer theyr brother martha soone herde iesus comynge went met hym mary sat styll house ✚ sayd martha vnto iesus lorde iohn̄ xi yf thou haddest bene brother dyed neuerthelesse nowe knowe soeuer thou askest god god wyll gyue iesus sayeth vnto thy brother shal ryse agayne martha sayeth vnto hym knowe shall ryse agayne resurreccyon last day iesus sayeth vnto resurreccyon iohn̄ • xiiii life iohn̄ u • b rom b aba • u • ii hebrue x g byleueth yea though deade yet shall lyue ☞ soeuer lyueth byleueth shall neuer dye byleuest thou sayde vnto hym yea lorde byleue thou arte chryst sonne god whiche shulde come worlde ⊢ assoone sayd went way called mary syster secretly sayenge mayster come calleth assoone herde arose quickely came vnto hym iesus yet come towne place martha met hym iues whiche house comforted sawe mary arose vp hastely went oute folowed sayenge goeth vnto graue wepe mary come iesus sawe hym cometh nygh vnto fete sayeth vnto hym lorde iohn̄ xi c yf thou haddest bene brother bene deade iesus therfore sawe wepe iues also wepynge came groned spirite troubled hym selfe sayd haue ye layde hym saye vnto hym lorde come se luke xix • iesus wepte sayd iues beholde howe loued hym saydcoulde iohn̄ ix b opened eye blynde haue made also man shulde haue dyed iesus therfore agayne groned hym selfe came graue caue stone layde iesus sayde take ye aways stone martha syster hym deade sayd vnto hym lorde tyme stynketh hath bene dead foure dayes iesus sayeth vnto sayd vnto yf thou dydest byleue thou shuldest se glory god toke awaye stone place bene dead layde iesus lyfte vp eye sayde father thanke thou hast herde howbeit knewe thou hearest alwayes iohn̄ xii bycause people whiche stande sayde maye byleue thou hast sent thus spoken cryed loude voyce lazarus come forth iohn̄ v e deade came forth bound hand fote graue clothes face bound napkin iesus sayth vnto loose hym let hym go many iues whiche came mary sene thynges iesus dyd iohn̄ vii f byleued hym ⊢ went theyr wayes pharises tolde iesus done math 26 mar xiiii luke xxii ✚ gathered hygh preestes pharises couusell sayde actes iii • • man doeth many myracles yf let hym scape thus men wyll byleue hym romaynes shall come take awaye bothe rowme people one named cayphas beyng hygh preest yere sayde vnto ye perceyue nothyng consyder iohn̄ 18 b expedient v one man dye people people perysshe spake hym selfe beynge hygh preest yere prophesied iesus shulde dye people people onely shulde gather togyther one chyldren god scattered abrode math 16 mar •••• frome daye forth toke counsell togyther put hym death iesus therfore walked openly amonge iues went waye thence vnto countrey nygh wyldernesse citye called ephraim contynued disciple math 2 • • mat xiii • luke xx •• iues easter nygh hande many wente countrey vp ierusalem easter purifie selues thē sought iesus spake amonge selues stode temple iohn̄ 〈◊〉 • thynke ye seynge cometh feast daye hygh preestes pharises iohn̄ •• gyuen cōmaundement yf man knew shulde shewe myght take hym ⊢ ¶ mary anoynteth christes fete iudas murmureth christ • r cuseth rydeth ierusalem capi xii ✚ iesus syxe dayes easter came bethany lazarus bene dead reysed death made supper martha serued lazarus one sat table hym mat xvi • mar xiii • • luke xxii • toke mary pounde oyntment called nardus perfite precious anoynted iesus fete wyped fete heere house fylled odoure oyntment luke vii • sayde one disciple euen iudas iscarioth symons sonne whiche afterwarde betrayed oyntment solde thre hundred penny gyuē poore sayde cared poore bycause thefe math 26 • mar xiiii • bagge bare whiche wasiohn̄ xiii gyuen sayde iesus let alone agaynst day burieng hath kepte poore alwayes shall ye haue wt haue ye alway moche people iues therfore knowlege came iesus sake onely might se lazarus also iohn̄ xi b reysed death hygh preestes helde counsell myght put lazarus death also bycause sake many iues went away byleued iesus ⊢ mat xxi • mark xi • nexte day moche people come feast herde iesus shulde come ierusalem toke braunches palme tree went forth mete hym cryed hosanna psal 11 • luke xix f blessed name lorde cometh kynge israel iesus got yong asse sat theron wrytten psal ixii • tha xi b iohn̄ xii r feare doughter syon beholde thy kynge cometh syttynge ass colte thynges vnderstode disciple fyrst iesus glorified thē remembred soche thynges wrytten hym soche thynges done vnto peple hym called lazarus graue reysed death bare recorde therfore met hym people also bycause hearde done soche myracle pharises therfore sayde among selues perceyue ye preuayle nothyng beholde ❀all hole worlde goeth hym 3 regā • • actes viii e ii pet vi f certayne grekes amonge came worshyp feast came therfore phylip whiche bethsaida citye galile desyred hym sayenge syr wolde fayne se iesus philip came tolde andrew agayne andrew philip tolde iesus iesus answered sayeng iohn̄ xiii xvi houre come son man must glorified ✚ uerely verely say vnto • sal • iii •• • xv e excepte wheate corne fall grounde dye abydeth alone yf dye bryngeth forthe moche fruyte math x luke xvi met vi •• luke xii b loueth lyfe shal destroy ☞ hateth lyfe worlde shal kepe vnto lyfe eternal yf man minister vnto let hym folowe ioh xiiii xvii shal also minister yf man minister vnto hym wyll father honoure ⊢ nowe soule troubled shal saye father delyuer houre therfore came vnto houre father glorifie thy name came voyce heuen sayeng haue glorified wyll glorifie agayne people therfore stode herde sayde signifienge death shulde dye people answered hym haue herde lawe psal 〈◊〉 • esai ix b dani vii mithe v chryst abydeth euer howe sayest thou son man must lyfte vp son man iesus sayde vnto yet lytel whyle lyght ephesi v • walke whyle ye haue lygh leest darkenes come walketh also darke woteth whyther goeth whyle ye haue lyght byleue lyght ye may chyldren lyght ⊢ thynges spake iesus departed hyd hym selfe though done many myracles yet byleued hym sayeng esaias prophet myghte fulfylled whiche spake esai liii • rom x c lorde shall byleue sayeng arme lorde declared therfore coulde leue bycause esaias sayeth agayn esai vi mat xiii b mar iiii b luke viii b actes 28 f hath blynded theyr eye hardened theyr herte shulde se theyr eye lest shuld vnderstand theyr herte shulde conuerted shulde heale soche thynges sayde esaias sawe glory spake hym neuerthelesse among cheyfe ruler also many byleued hym bycause pharises wolde knowen iohn̄ • • lest shulde excōmunicate iohn̄ v • loued prayse men prayse god iesus cryed sayde byleueth byleueth hym sent seeth seeth hym sent ✚ come lyght world soeuer byleueth shulde abyde darknes yf man heare wordes byleue iudge hym iohn̄ • • iii c • viii • came math xi • xxiii luke x iohn̄ iii father gyuen al thynges handes come god wente god arose supper layde asyde vpper garmentes taken towell gyrded hym selfe powred water basyn began wasshe disciple feete wype towell wherwith gyrded came symon peter peter sayde vnto hym lorde doest thou wasshe fete iesus answered sayd vnto hym thou wotest nowe thou shalte knowe peter sayeth vnto hym thou shalte neuer wasshe fete iesus answered hym yf wasshe thou hast part symon peter sayeth vnto hym lorde fete also handes head iesus sayeth hym wasshed nedeth saue washe feete clene euery whyt ye clene iohn̄ vi g al knew shulde betray hym therfore sayde ye cleane wasshed theyr fete receyued clothes set downe sayd vnto agayne wote ye haue done ye call mayster lorde ye saye well lorde mayster haue washed fete ye also ought wasshe one others feete ephess v • peter ii haue gyuen ensample ye shulde haue done ⊢ uerely verely say vnto math x c luke v • f iohn̄ xv e seruaunt greater mayster neyther messenger
