loued father wyll loue hym wyll shewe myne owne selfe hym •••• xv iudas sayeth vn hym iudas iscarioth lorde done thou wylte shewe thy selfe vnto v vnto worlde iesus answered sayd vnto hym yf man loue wyll kepe sayenges father wyll loue hym wyll come vnto hym dwell hym loueth kepeth sayenges worde ye heare▪ myne father sent thynges haue spoken vnto beynge yet present comforter holy goost iohn̄ xv xvi b 〈◊〉 ii father wyl sende name shall teache thynges brynge thynges remembraunce soeuer haue sayde vnto peace leaue peace gyue vnto worlde gyueth gyue vnto let hertes greued neyther feare ye haue herde howe sayde vnto go come agayne vnto ye loued ye wolde verely reioyce bycause sayde go vnto father father greater iohn̄ xiii c xvi nowe haue shewed come come passe ye myght bileue hereafter wyl talke many wordes vnto prynce worlde cometh hath noughtiohn̄ xii e xvi b worlde may knowe loue father father gaue commaundement euen ⊢ aryse let v go hence ¶ true vyne husbande man braunches doctryne loue swete cōfort agaynst persecucyon capi xv ✚ eccle 24 • true vyne father husbande man euery braunche beareth fruyte wyll take awaye euery braunche beareth fruyte wyl pourge maye brynge forthe fruyte iohn̄ xiii b acte • xv b nowe ye cleane thorow wordes whiche haue spoken vnto abyde braunche beare fruyte selfe excepte abyde vyne ye excepte ye abyde vyne ye braunches abydeth hym bryngeth forth moche fruyte without ye nothynge man abyde cast forth braunche wethered men gather cast fyre burne math xxi c mark 〈◊〉 iohn̄ 16 f iames • iohn̄ iii • ye abide wordes abyde aske ye wyll shall done ⊢ herein father glorified ye beare moche fruyte become disciple father hath loued euen haue also loued cōtinue ye loue ye kepe cōmaundementes ye shall abyde loue euen haue kepte father commaundementes abyde leue thyngꝭ haue spoken vnto ioy myght remayne youre ioye myght full ✚ iohn̄ xiii iohn̄ iii cōmaundement ye loue togyther haue loued greater loue hath man man bestowe lyfe frendes ye frendes yf ye soeuer cōmaunde henceforth call seruauntes seruaunt knoweth lorde doeth haue called frendes thynges haue herde father haue opened ye haue chosen haue chosen ordeyned go bryng forth fruyte fruyte shulde remayne soeuer ye aske father name may gyue ⊢ ✚ commaunde ye loue togyther worlde hate ye knowe hated hated ye worlde worlde wolde loue owne howbeit bycause ye worlde haue chosen oute worlde therfore iohn̄ 17 c worlde hateth remember worde sayde vnto seruaunt greater lorde math x • luke xii • marke x c haue persecuted wyll also persecute haue kepte sayeng wyl kepe youres also iohn̄ xvi • thynges wyll vnto name sake bycause haue knowen hym sent come spoken vnto shuld haue synne nowe haue nothynge cloke theyr synne withall hateth hateth father also yf done amonge workes whiche none man dyd shuld haue synne nowe haue sene hated onely also father happeneth sayenge myght fulfylled wrytten theyr lawe psal 35 • lxix hated without cause ⊢ ✚ conforter come iohn̄ • 4 xvi b actes ii • wyll sende vnto father euen spirite trueth whiche procedeth father shall testifie ☞ ye shal beare wytnesse also bycause ye haue bene begynnynge capi xvi ¶ consolacyon agaynst trouble prayer herde thorowe chryst thynges haue sayde vnto bycause ye shulde offended math x b mar xiii b luke xxi • shall excommunicate yea tyme shall come actes ix soeuer kylleth wyll thynke doeth god seruyce iohn̄ xv suche thynges wyll vnto bycause haue knowen father neyther yet thynges haue tolde tyme come ye may remember tolde ⊢ thynges sayd vnto beginnyng bycause present ✚ nowe go waye hym sent none asketh whyther go bycause haue sayde suche thynges vnto hertes full sorowe neuerthelesse tell trueth expedient go awaye yf go awaye comforter wyll come vnto yf departe ioh • xiiii xv b actes ii▪ wyl sende hym vnto come wyll rebuke worlde synne ryghteousnes iudgement synne bycause byleue ryghteousnesse bycause go father ye shal se iudgement bycause iohn̄ xii • prynce worlde iudged alredy haue yet many thynges saye vnto ye beare awaye nowe howbeit come whiche spirite trueth wyl leade al trueth shall speake hym selfe euer shall heare shall speake wyll shewe thynges come shall glorifie shall receyue myne shall shewe vnto math 〈◊〉 xxviii • luke x • iohn̄ iii • thynges father hath myne therfore sayd vnto shall take myne shewe vnto ⊢ ✚ iohn̄ vii • whyle ye shall se agayne whyle ye shall se go father sayde disciple bytwene themselues sayth vnto v whyle ye shal se agayne whyle ye shall se go father sayd therfore sayth whyle tell sayeth iesus perceyued wolde aske sayde vnto ye enquyre bytwene selues bycause sayde whyle ye shall se agayne whyle ye shall se uerely verely say vnto ye shall wepe lament contrary wyse worlde shall reioyse ye shall sorow iohn̄ 〈◊〉 • sorowe shall turned ioye woman trauayleth hath sorowe bycause houre come soone delyuered chyld remembreth anguysshe ioy man borne worlde ye nowe therfore haue sorowe wyll se agayne hertes shall reioyse ioye shall man take ⊢ day shal ye aske questyon ✚ uerely verely say vnto mat vii • xxi c luke xi • mark xi iames iohn̄ 14 • xv b soeuer ye shall aske father name wyll gyue hytherto haue ye asked nothynge name aske ye shall receyue ioy may full thynges haue spoken vnto prouerbes tyme wyll come shall speake mat x ••• • prouerbes shall shewe playnly father day shall ye aske name say wyll speake vnto father father hymselfe loueth bycause ye haue loued haue byleued came frō god went father came worlde agayne leaue worlde iohn̄ xx go father disciple sayde vnto hym lo nowe talkest thou playnly speakest prouerbe nowe sure iohn̄ xxi e thou knowest thynges nedest man shulde aske questyon therfore byleue thou camest god ⊢ iesus answered nowe ye byleue •••• xiii • mat xxvi c mat xiiii c beholde houre draweth nyghe alredy come ye shall scattered euery man owne shall leaue alone yet alone iohn̄ 14 b father wordes haue spoken vnto ye myghte haue peace worlde shall ye haue tribulacyon good cheare haue ouercome worlde ¶ moost harty louynge prayer chryst vnto father suche receyue trueth capi xvii ✚ wordes spake iesus lyfte vp eye heuen sayd father iohn̄ • 3 houre come glorifie thy sonne thy sonne also maye glorifie thou hast gyuen hym power ouer flesshe shulde gyue eternal lyfe many thou hast gyuen hym • iohn̄ • • lyfe eternall myght knowe onely true god iesus chryst thou hast sent haue glorified earth iohn̄ xix f haue finisshed worke whiche thou gauest nowe glorifie thou father thyne owne selfe glorye worlde haue declared thy name vnto men thou gauest oute worlde thyne thou gauest haue kepte thy worde nowe haue knowen thynges soeuer thou haste gyuen haue gyuen vnto wordes whiche thou gauest haue receyued haue knowen surely came frō haue byleued thou dydest sende praye ☞ pray • iohn̄ ii e worlde esai▪ viii▪ b whiche thou hast gyuen thyne myne thyne thyne myne glorified nowe worlde worlde come ⊢ ✚ holy father kepe thorowe thyne owne name whiche thou hast gyuen also maye one whyle worlde kepte thy name iohn̄ 1 • • thou gauest haue kepte none lost lost th • lde psal • ix scripture myght fulfylled nowe come wordes speake worlde myght haue ioye full haue gyuen thy worde iohn̄ xv • sap • ii worlde hath hated bycause worlde euen also worlde desyre thou shuldest take world math vi b luke xi thou kepe euyll worlde also worlde sanctifie thorowe thy trueth thy worde trueth thou dyddest sende worlde euen haue also sent world theyr sake sanctifie selfe also myght sanctified thorowe trueth neuerthelesse praye alone also whiche shal byleue thorowe theyr preachynge maye gala • ii one thou father arte also maye one v worlde maye byleue thou hast sent glory whiche thou gauest haue gyuen maye one also one thou may made perfyte one worlde maye knowe thou hast sent hast loued thou hast loued father wyll whiche thou hast gyuen iohn̄ x •• ▪ and▪ xi • ii may se glory thou hast gyuen thou louedst makynge worlde •• 〈◊〉 luke x ryghteous father worlde also hathe knowen haue knowen haue knowen thou hast sent haue declared vnto name wyll declare loue wherwith thou hast loued maye ⊢ ¶ chryst betrayed wordes mouth smyte offycers grounde peter smyteth malchus care iesus brought anna cayphas pylate capi xviii iesus spoken wordes mat 2 • mat xi ••• luke xx • went forth disciple ouer broke cedron garden whiche entred disciple iudas also whiche bytrayed hym knewe place iesus ofte tymes resorted thyther disciple iudas receyued bande men minister hygh preestes pharises came thyther lanterus fyrebrandes weapon iesus knowyng al thynges shulde come hym went forth sayde vnto seke ye answered hym iesus nazareth iesus sayeth vnto iudas also whiche betrayed hym stode soone sayde vnto went bakwarde fell grounde thē asked agayne seke ye sayd iesus nazareth iesus answered haue tolde ye seke therfore let go theyr way sayenge myght fulfylled whiche spake iohn̄ 17 b whiche thou gauest haue lost one symon peter hauynge swerde drewe smote hygh preestes seruaunt cut ryght eare seruauntes name malchus therfore sayeth iesus vnto peter eene ix mat xxvi • put vp thy swerde sheathe shall drynke cup whiche father hath gyuen company captayne minister iues toke iesus bounde hym led hym away anna fyrst father lawe vnto cayphas whiche hygh preest yere cayphas whiche gaue counsell iues iohn̄ xi • expedient one man shulde dye people math xxv mar xiiii f luke xxii f symon peter folowed iesus dyd dyscyple dyscyple knowen vnto hygh preest wente iesus palace high preest peter stode dore without wente dyscyple whiche knowen vnto hygh preest spake damsell kepte dore brought peter sayde damsell kepte dore vnto peter arte thou also one mannes disciple sayd seruauntes minister stode whiche made fyre cole colde warmed selues peter also stode amonge warmed hym • xiiii f • 〈◊〉 xxii g hygh preest asked iesus disciple doctrine iesus answered hym spake openly worlde euer taught synagoge▪ temple whyther iues resorte secrete haue sayd nothyng askest thou aske herde haue sayde vnto beholde tel sayd thus spoken one minister whiche stode smote iesus face sayenge actes 23 • answerest thou hygh preest iesus answered hym haue euyll spoken beare wytnesse euyll yf haue well spoken ☞ smytest thou anna sent hym bounde vnto cayphas hygh preest symon peter stode warmed hym selfe sayd vnto hym art thou also one disciple denyed sayd one seruauntes hygh preestes cosyn whose eare peter smote sayde vnto hym dyd se garden hym iohn̄ xiii peter therfore denyed agayne immediatly cocke crewe mat 17 • mark xv • luk xxiii • led iesus cayphas hall iugement mornyng selues went iudgement hall ☞ lest shulde defyled myght eate passeouer pylate wente vnto sayde accusacyon brynge ye agaynst man answered sayde vnto hym euyldoer wolde haue delyuered hym vnto sayde pylate vnto take ye hym iudge hym owne lawe iues therfore sayd vnto hym lawfull v put man death ☞ wordes iesus myght fulfylled math xx • whiche spake sygnyfyenge death shulde dye mat xxvii • mark xv luke 2 • • pylate entred iudgement hall agayne called iesus sayde vnto hym arte thou kynge iues iesus answered sayest thou thy selfe dyd tell pilate answered iue thyne owne nacyon hygh preestes haue delyuered vnto haste thou done iesus answered kyngdom worlde kyngdom worlde wolde minister surely fyght shulde delyuered iues nowe 〈◊〉 vi • kyngdome hence pylate therfore sayde vnto hym arte thou kynge iesus answered thou sayest kynge cause borne cause came worlde shulde beare wytnesse vnto trueth al trueth heare voyce pylate sayde vnto hym thynge trueth sayde wente oute agayne vnto iues sayeth vnto mat xxvii mark xv luke xxiii▪ fynde hym cause ye haue custome shulde delyuer one loose easter wyll ye loose vnto kynge iues cryed agayne sayenge actes iii c hym barrabas barrabas murtherer ¶ chryste crucifyed▪ cōmitteth mother vnto iohn̄ dyeth turyed capi xix pilate toke iesus therfore scourged hym math 27 c mar xv b souldyers wounde crowne thornes put heade dyd hym purple garment ❀ came vnto hym sayde hayle kynge iues smote hym face pylate went forth agayne sayde vnto behold bryng hym forth ye maye knowe fynde faute hym came iesus forth wearynge crowne thorne robe purple sayeth vnto beholde man math 27 c math xv luk xxiii hygh preestes therfore minysters sawe hym cryed sayenge crucifye crucifye hym pilate sayeth vnto take ye hym crucifye hym fynde cause hym iues answered hym haue leui xxi ii c lawe lawe ought dye bycause iohn̄ v b made hym selfe sonne god pylate herde sayenge afrayde wente agayne iudgement hall sayeth vnto▪ iesus whence arte thou iesus gaue hym none answere sayde pilate vnto speakest thou vnto knowest thou haue power crucifye haue power loose iesus answered thou couldest haue power agaynst sapi vi iohn̄ iii rom xiii excepte gyuen aboue therfore deliuered vnto hath syn math 26 math xv c luke xxiii • frō thence forth sought pilate meanes loose hym iues cryed sayenge yf thou let hym go thou arte cesars frende acte xvii b whosoeuer maketh hym selfe kynge agaynst cesar pilate herde sayeng brought iesus forth sat downe gyue sentence place called pauement hebrue tongue gabbatha preparynge daye easter aboute syxte houre sayeth vnto iues holde kynge cryed awaye hym awaye hym crucifye hym pilate sayeth vnto shal crucify kyng hyghe preestes answered haue kynge cesar math 27 • math xv c luke xxiii e deliuered hym vnto crucifyed toke iesus led hym away bare crosse went forth place called place dead men sculles hebrue golgotha crucifyed hym two hym eyther syde one iesus myddes 〈◊〉 xiii • pilate wrote tytle put themat 27 b mat xv▪ c luk xx ••• • crosse wrytynge iesus nazareth kynge iues tytle red many iues place iesus crucifyed nygh citye wrytten hebrue greke latyn sayde hyghe preestes iues pilate wryte kynge iues sayde kynge iues pilate answered haue wrytten haue wrytten souldyers math 27 • mark xv • luke xxiii • crucifyed iesus toke garmentes made foure partes euery souldyer parte also cote cote without seame wrought vpon throughout sayde therfore amonge selues let v deuyde cast lotte shall haue scrypture myght fulfylled sayenge psal xxii parted rayment amonge coote dyd cast lotte souldyers dyd soch thynges dede stode crosse iesus mother mother syster mary wyfe cleophas mary magdalene iesus therfore sawe mother discyple standyng iohn̄ xiii • whome loued sayeth vnto mother woman beholde thy sonne sayde discyple beholde thy mother frō houre discyple toke owne thynges iesus knowyng thynges nowe performed psal lxix • scrypture myght fulfylled sayeth thyrst stode vessell full byneger math 27 • mark xv • therfore fylled sponge vyneger wounde aboute yscope put mouth soone iesus receyued vyneger sayde iohn̄ 17 • finyshed bowed heade gaue vp gooste iues therfore bycause preparyng sabboth bodyes shulde remayne vpon crosse sabboth daye sabboth day hyghe daye besought pilate▪ theyr legges myght broken myght taken downe came souldyers brake legges fyrst crucifyed hym came iesus sawe deade alredy brake legges one souldyers speare thrust hym syde forthwith came blood water sawe bare recorde recorde true knoweth sayeth true ye myght byleue also thynges done scrypture shuld fulfylled exodi xii g num • ix b ye shall breake bone hym agayne scrypture sayeth ze • h • xii • shall loke hym pearsed math 26 • mar xv luk xxiii • ioseph aramathia whiche disciple iesus secretly feare iues besought pilate myght take downe body iesus pilate gaue hym licence ❀ came therfore toke body iesus came also nicodemus whiche begynnyng came iesus nyght brought myre aloe myngled togyther hundred pounde weyght toke body iesus wounde lynnen clothes odour maner iues burye place crucified garden garden newe sepulchre wherin neuer man layde layde iesus therfore bycause prepatynge sabboth iues sepulchre nygh hande ⊢ ¶ resurteceyon chryst appeareth mary magdalene discyples theyr great comforte capi xx ✚ fyrst daye sabbothes came mary magdalene early yet darke vnto sepulchre sawe stone taken awaye graue ran came simon peter disciple math 28 mar xvi luk xxiiii whome iesus loued andiohn̄ xiii • xix e • xxi • sayeth vnto haue taken awaye lorde graue tell haue layde hym peter therfore went forth disciple came vnto sepulcre ran togyther disciple dyd run peter came fyrst sepulcre stouped downe sawe lynnen clothes lyenge yet went lu xxiiii came simon peter folowynge hym wente sepulcre sawe lynnen clothes lye napkyn aboute heade lyenge lynnen clothes wrapped togyther place selfe went also disciple whiche came fyrst sepulchre ☞ sawe byleued yet knewe psal xvi b actes • b xiii • xvii f scrypture shulde ryse agayne death ⊢ discyples went awaye agayne vnto theyr owne home ✚ lu xxiiii mary stode without sepulchre wepyng wept bowed selfe sepulchre seeth two angel clothed whyte syttynge one heade feete layde body iesus sayde vnto woman wepest thou sayeth vnto haue taken awaye lorde wote haue layde hym thus sayd turned selfe backe sawe iesus standynge knewe iesus iesus sayeth vnto woman • wepest thou whome sekest thou supposyng ben gardener sayeth vnto hym syr yf thou haue borne hym hence tell thou haste layde hym wyll fetch hym iesus sayeth vnto mary turned selfe sayde vnto hym rabboni whiche saye mayster iesus sayeth vnto ☞ touche yet ascended father go psal xxii • hebru il • brother saye vnto iohn̄ 16 • 〈◊〉 xxiiii • ascende vnto father father god youre god 〈◊〉 xxiiii • mary magdalene came tolde discyples sene lorde spoken soche thynges vnto ⊢ ✚ lu xxiiii daye nyght fyrste daye sabbothes dores shut disciple assembled togyther feare iues came iesus stode myddes sayeth vnto peace vnto sayde shewed vnto handes syde iohn̄ xvi disciple glad whē sawe lorde sayde iesus agayne peace vnto father esai •• math xi • luke • ii • • iohn̄ xvii • sent euen sende also sayde wordes breethed sayeth vnto receyue holy gooste whosoeuers synnes ye remytte remytted vnto whosoeuers synnes ye retayne retayned ⊢ ✚ iohn̄ xi b thomas one twelue called didimus whē iesus came discyples therfore sayde vnto hym haue sene lorde sayde vnto excepte se handes prynt nayles put fynger prynte nayles thrust hande syde wyll byleue eyght dayes agayne discyples within thomas came iesus dores shut stoode myddes sayde peace vnto sayd thomas bryng thy fynger hyther se handes reache hyther thy hande thrust syde faythlesse leuynge thomas answered sayde vnto hym lorde god iesus sayeth vnto hym thomas bycause thou hast sene thou hast byleued blessed haue sene yet haue byleued ⊢ iohn̄ xxi g many sygnes truely dyd iesus presence discyples whiche wrytten boke wrytten ye myght byleue iesus chryste sonne god byleuynge ye myght haue lyfe name ¶ appeareth disciple agayne see tyberias cōmaundeth peter earnestly fede shepe capi xxi ✚ afterwarde dyd iesus shewe hym selfe agayne see tyberias wyse shewed hym selfe togyther symon peter thomas whiche called didimus iohn̄ f nathanaell cana galile sonnes zebedei two discyples simon peter sayeth vnto wyll go fysshynge saye vnto hym also wyl go went theyr waye entred shyp immedyatly nyght caught nothynge mornynge nowe come iesus stoode shore neuerthelesse discyples knewe iesus iesus sayeth vnto chyldren haue ye meate answered hym sayeth vnto luke v caste net ryght syde shyp ye shall fynde cast therfore anone able drawe multitude fysshes sayde discyple iohn̄ xiii c xix e whome iesus loued vnto peter lorde simon peter herde lorde gyrde coote vnto hym naked sprange see discyples came shyp farre lande two hundred cubytes drewe net fysshes soone come lande sawe hoote cole fysshe layde theron breade iesus sayeth vnto luk xxii • f brynge fysshe ye haue nowe caught symon peter went vp drue net lande full greate fysshes hundred lii • al many yet net broken iesus sayeth vnto come dyne none discyples durste aske hym arte thou knewe lorde iesus came toke breade gaue fysshe lykewyse nowe thyrde tyme iesus appeared discyples rysen agayne death ⊢ dyned iesus sayeth simon peter symon ioanna louest thou sayd vnto hym yea lorde thou knowest loue sayeth vnto hym fede lambes sayeth hym agayne seconde tyme symon ioanna louest thou sayeth vnto yea lorde thou knowest loue sayde vnto hym feede shepe sayde vnto hym thyrd tyme symon ioanna louest thou peter sory bycause sayde vnto hym thyrde tyme louest thou sayde vnto hym lorde thou iohn̄ xvi • knowest thynges thou knowest loue iesus sayeth vnto hym feede shepe uerely verely saye vnto thou waste yonge thou gyrdedst thy selfe walkedst whyther thou woldest thou arte olde iohn̄ xiii actes xii thou shalte stretche forth thyne handes shall gyrde leade whyther thou woldest spake signifyenge death shulde glorify god spoken sayeth vnto hym ✚ folowe peter turned aboute sawe disciple iohn̄ xiii • xix • • 〈◊〉 • whome iesus loued folowynge whiche also leaned brest supper sayde lorde whiche betrayeth peter therfore sawe hym sayeth iesus lorde shall heare iesus sayeth vnto hym yf wyll haue hym tary tyll come folowe thou wente sayenge abrode among brother discyple shulde dye yet iesus sayde hym shall dye yf wyll tary tyl come discyple whiche testifyeth thynges wrote thynges knowe testimony true ⊢ iohn̄ x • • also many thynges whiche iesus dyd whiche yf shulde wrytten euery one suppose worlde coulde conteyne bookes shulde wrytten ¶ endeth gospell saynt iohn̄ ❧ actes apostle ¶ asce • syon chryst mathias chosen steade iudas capi primo ✚ former treatyse deare theophylus haue spoken iesus began teach vntyll daye whiche taken vp holy goost gyuen cōmaūde mentes vnto apostle chosen also iohn̄ xx •• xxi c shewed hym selfe alyue passion many token appearynge vnto fourtye dayes speakynge kyngdome god gathered togyther lu xxiiii g commaunded shulde departe ierusalem wayte promesse father iohn̄ iiii xv xvi v wherof sayeth ye haue herde iohn̄ e actes math iii know tymes season whiche father hath put owne power lu xxiiii g actes • ye shall ceyue power holy goost come vpon actes ii • iohn̄ xv ye shall wytnesses vnto onely ierusalem also iurye samary euen vnto worldes ende spoken thynges whyle behelde mat xvi lu xxi ii taken vp hygh cloude receyued hym vp theyr syght whyle loked stedfastlye vp towarde heuen went beholde two men stode whyte apparell also sayd ye men galile stand ye gasynge vp heuen iesus whiche taken vp heuen dani vii math 24 • xxv mat xiii e luke xvii e and▪ xxi e reuela b shall come euen ye haue sene hym go heuen ⊢ returned forth theyr lotte lot fel mathias coū ted eleuen apostle ⊢ capi ii ✚ ¶ comynge holy goost sermon peter congregacyon ierusalem encrease faythfull deut xvi • luke xxiii • fyftye dayes come ende one accorde gyther one place sodeynly came sounde heuen ben commynge myghtye wynde fylled al house sat appeared vnto clouen tongue lyke ben fyre sat vpon eche one actes iiii • xi • al fylled holy goost began speake tongue euen spiryte gaue vtteraunce dwellynge ierusalme iues deuoute men euery nacyon vnder heuen noysed aboute multitude came togither astonyed bicause euery man herde speake owne language wondred meruayled sayenge among selues beholde whiche speake galile howe heare euery man owne tongue wherin borne parthian medes elamytes inhabiters mesopotamia iurye capadocia ponthus asia phrygia phamphilia egypt partyes libia whiche besyde syren straungers rome ieues ☞ math 24 b proselites grekes arabian haue herde speake oure owne tongue greate workes god ⊢ amased wondred sayeng one meaneth mocked sayeng men full newe wyne ✚ peter stepped forth eleuen lyft vp voyce sayd vnto ye men iuiye ye dwell ierusalem knowen vnto youre eares heare wordes dronken ye suppose seynge thyrde houre daye spoken prophet ioh • l shall laste dayes sayeth god spityte wyl power vpon al flesh iohell ii g son̄es doughters shall prophesy yonge men shall se visyons olde men shall dreame dreames seruauntes hande maydens wyll power spiryte dayes shall prophesye math 27 e 〈◊〉 xxiii f wyl shewe wonder heuen aboue token earth beneath bloode fyre vapour smoke sonne shal turned darkenesse moone bloode great notable daye lorde come shal come passe rom x whosoeuer shall cal name lorde shall saued ⊢ ✚ ye men israel heare wordes iesus nazareth man approued god amonge myracles wonder sygnes whiche god dyd hym myddes ye youre selues knowe hym haue ye taken handes vnrighteous person delyuered determinat counsayle foreknowledge god haue crucifyed sleyne hym whome god hath reysed vp loosed sorowes death bycause vnpossible shulde holden dauid speaketh hym psal x • c forehande sawe god alwayes ryght hande shulde moued therfore dyd herte reioyse tongue glad moreouer also flesshe shall rest hope bycause thou wylt leaue soule hell neyther wylte thou suffre thyne holye se corrupcion thou hast shewed wayes lyfe thou shalt make full ioye thy countenaunce ye men brother let frely speake vnto patriarke dauid 3 regū ii • dead buryed sepulchre remayneth v vnto daye therfore seynge prophet knewe god sworne othe hym chryst concernynge flesshe shulde come fruyte loynes shulde syt seate knowynge spake resurreccion chryst soule shulde lefte hell neyther flesshe shulde se corrupcyon iesus hath god reysed vp actes wherof wytnesses synce nowe ryght hande god exalted hath receyued father promesse holy goost hath shed forth ❀ gyfte whiche ye nowe se heare dauid ascended heuen sayeth psal 〈◊〉 • mat xxi • • lorde sayde lorde syt thou ryght hande vntyll make thy foe thy fore stoole therfore let house israell knowe suretye god hath made iesus whome ye haue crucifyed lorde chryst herde prycked theyr hertes sayde vnto peter vnto apostle ye men brother luke iii b shall peter sayde vnto repent synnes baptysed euery one name iesus chryst remissyon syn̄es ye shal receyue gyfte holye goost promesse made vnto youre chyldren farre euen many lorde god shall call many wordes bare wytnesse exhorted sayenge saue youre selues vntowarde generacyon gladlye receyued preachyng baptised day added vnto aboute thre thousande soules contynued apostle doctrine felowshyppe breakynge breade prayer feare came ouer euery soule many wonder sygnes shewed apostle ❀ ierusalem great feare came vpon men byleued kept selues togyther thynges comen solde theyr possessyons goodes parted men euery man nede continued dayly one accorde temple brake breade house house dyd eate theyr meate togyther gladnes synglenes herte praysynge god fauour people lorde added congregacyon dayly soche shulde saued ¶ halte restored fecte peter preacheth chryst vnto people capi iii ✚ peter iohn̄ wente vp togyther temple nynth houre prayer certayne man halte frō mother wombe brought whome layde daylye gate temple called bewtyful aske almesse entred temple sawe peter iohn̄ wolde go temple desyred receyue almesse peter fastened eye hym iohn̄ sayde loke v gaue hede vnto trustynge receyue thyng sayde peter syluer gold haue none soch haue gyue name iesus chryste nazareth math ix • ryse vp walke toke hym ryght hande lyfte hym vp immediatly feete ancle bone receyued strength sprange stode walked entred temple walkynge leapynge praysyng god people sawe hym walke prayse god knewe hym whiche sat begged bewtyfull gate temple wondered sore astonyed happened vnto hym halte whiche healed helde peter iohn peple ran amased vnto 3 reg vi • iohn̄ x • actes v c porche called salamons peter sawe answered vnto people ✚ ye men israell meruayle ye loke ye v though oure owne power strength made man go god abraham isaac iacob god oure father hath glorified sonne iesus whome ye delyuered math • 7 mat x • • luk xxiii • denyed presence pylate iudged hym losed ye denyed holye iuste math 27 c iohn̄ 18 • desyred murtherer gyuen kylled lorde lyfe whome god hath raysed death wytnesses name fayth name hathe made man sounde ye se knowe fayth hym hath gyuen hym health presence nowe brother wote ignoraunce ye dyd dyd also ruler god shewed mouth al prophetꝭ howe chryste shulde suffer hath thus wyse fulfylled let math 〈◊〉 repent therfore conuerte syn̄es maye done away ✚ tyme refresshynge cōmeth whiche shall haue presence lorde god shall sende hym preached vnto wytte iesus chryst whiche must receyue heuen vntyl tyme thynges whiche god hath spoken mouth holy prophettes synce worlde began restored agayne moses truly sayde vnto father deut 〈◊〉 artes vii • prophet shall lorde god rayse vp vnto euen youre brother lyke vnto hym shall ye heare thynges whatsoeuer shall saye vnto tyme wyll come euery soule whiche wyll heare prophet shall destroyed amonge people prophettes also samuell thence forth many haue spoken haue lykewyse tolde dayes ye chyldren prophettes couenaunt whiche god made vnto oure father sayenge abraham reue xii • xiii • euen thy seed shal kynreds earth blessed fyrst god reysed vp sonne iesus vnto sente hym blesse euerye one shulde turne wyckednesse ⊢ ¶ apostle taken brought counsell forbyden preache turne prayer obedyent vnto god vnto men capi iiii spake vnto peple preestes ruler temple sadduces came vpon takynge greuously taught people preached iesus resurrection frō death layde handes put holde vntyll nexte daye nowe euentyde howbeit many herde wordes byleued nombre men aboute fyue chaunsed morowe theyr ruler elder scrybes anna cheyfe preest cayphas iohn̄ alexander many kyured hygh preestes gathered togyther ierusalē set asked erobi ii c math xxi c artes vii power name haue ye done ✚ peter full holy gooft sayd vnto ye ruler peple elder israell yf day examined good dede haue done sycke mā meanes made hole knowen vnto people israell name math c philip ii b iesus chryst nazareth whome ye crucifyed whome god reysed agayne death euen hym doth man stande present hole math xxi b mat xii luke xx c stone whiche cast asyde buylders become cheyfe corner neyther saluacyon math • c philip 〈◊〉 b amonge men vnder heuen gyuen none name wherin must saued ⊢ sawe boldnes peter iohn vnderstode vnlerned laye men meruayled knewe bene iesu beholdynge also man whiche healed standynge coulde saye agaynst cōmaunded go syde counsell counselled amonge selues sayenge iohn̄ xi • shall men manyfest sygne done openly knowen dwell ierusalem denye noysed amonge people let v threaten charge speake hence forth man name called actes v g cōmaunded wyse shulde speake teache name iesu peter iohn̄ answered sayde vnto whyther ryght syght god herken vnto god iudge ye speake whiche haue sene herde threatened let go founde nothynge howe punysshe bycause people men praysed god bycause actes iii b whiche done man aboue fourtye yere olde whome myracle healyng shewed assone let go came theyr felowes shewed hygh preestes elder sayde herde lyfte vp theyr voyces god one accorde sayde lorde thou arte god hast made heuen earth see ❀ holy goost mouth thy seruaunt dauid ❀ father hast sayd psalm ii • dyd hethen rage people ymagen vayne thynges kynges earth stode vp ruler came togither agaynst lorde agaynste anoynted trueth agayust thy holye chylde iesus whome thou hast anoynted rode also poncius pilate gentyls people israel gathered selues togyther ❀ citye doo whatsoeuer thy hande thy counsayle determyned done nowe lorde beholde theyr threatenynges graunt vn thy seruauntes confydence maye speake thy worde thou stretche forth thyne hande healyng sygnes wonder done name thy holy chylde iesus soone prayed actes xvi • place moued assembled togyther actes ii xix b fylled holy goost spake worde god boldly ✚ multitude byleued actes 〈◊〉 • • b one herte one soule neyther sayde anye ought thyngꝭ possessed owne thynges comon greate power gaue apostle wytnesse resurrection lorde iesu great grace neyther amonge lacked many possessers landes house solde brought pryce thynges solde layde downe apostle fete distribueyon made vnto euery man accordyng nede ⊢ actes • • io whiche also called apostle barnabas saye son consolacy beynge leuyte countrey cipers lande solde layd pryer downe apostle fete ¶ desemblynge ananias saphirs punysshed miracle done apostle taken angell god bryngeth oute pryson brought counsell sentence gamaliell apostle • et reioyse trouble capi v certayne man named ananias saphyra wyfe solde possession kepte awaye parte pryce wyfe also beynge counsayle brought certayne parte layde downe apostle feete peter sayde ananias howe satan hath fylled thyne hert thou shuldest lye vnto holye goost kepe awaye parte pryce lande perteyned vnto onely▪ solde thyne owne power haste thou conceyued thynge thyne herte thou haste lyed vnto men vnto god ananias herde wordes fell downe gaue vp gooste greate feare came al herde thynges yonge men rose vp put hym aparte caryed hym buryed hym fortuned aboute space thre houres wyfe came ignoraunt whiche done peter sayde vnto tell solde ye lande moch sayde yea moche peter sayde vnto haue ye agreed togyther tempte spiryte lorde beholde feete whiche haue buryed thy husbande dore shall cary fel downe streyght waye feete yelded vp goost yonge men came founde deade caryed buryed husbande great feare came al congregacyon many herde handes apostle mar xvi many sygnes wonder shewed amonge people togyther one accorde 3 reg vi iohn̄ x • ••• e iii • salomon porche durst man ioyne hym selfe neuerthelesse people magnifyed nō bre byleued lorde bothe men woman grewe moche brought sycke streetes layde beddes couch least waye shadowe peter came myght shadowe ❀ myght deliuered theyr infyrmytyes came also multytude cityes roūd aboute vnto ierusalem bryngynge sycke folkes whiche vexed vncleane spirytes healed euery one actes iiii cheyfe preest rose vp hym secte saduces full indygnacyon layde handes apostle put comon pryson •• e • xii •• xvi▪ f angell lorde nyght opened pryson dores brought forth sayd go stand speake temple people al wordes lyfe herde entred temple early mornynge taught cheyfe preest came called counsell togyther elder chyldren israell sent men pryson fetche minysters came founde pryson returned tolde sayenge pryson truely founde shutte dilygence kepers standynge without dores opened founde man within cheyfe preest ruler temple hyghe preestes herde thynges douted wherevnto wolde growe came one shewed beholde men ye put pryson stande temple teache people wente ruler temple minysters brought without violence feared people lest shulde haue bene stoned brought set counsayle cheyfe preest asked sayenge actes iiii • dyd straytely cōmaunde ye shulde teache name beholde ye haue fylled ierusalem youre doctryne intende brynge math 27 • man bloode vpon v peter apostle answered sayde actes iiii • ought obey god men god oure father raysed vp iesus ye slewe hanged • e hym hath god lyfte vp ryght hande ruler sauyoure gyue repentaunce israel forgyuenes synnes recordes thynges saye also holy goost whome god hath gyuen obey hym herde claue sunder sought meanes sley stoode vp one counsayle pharysey named actes xxii • gamaliell doctour lawe reputacyon amonge people cō maunded apostle go asyde lytell space sayd vnto ye men israel take hede selues ye entende touchynge men dayes rose vp one thudas bostynge hym selfe whome resorted nombre men aboute iiii hundred fleyne byleued hym scattered abrode brought nought mā one iudas luke xiii • galile dayes trybute drew away moch people hym also perysshed euen many herkened hym scattered abrode nowe say vnto refrayne selues men let lone yf counsell worke men wyll come nought yf god ye destroye leest haply ye founde stryue agaynste god hym agreed called apostle bet acte • iiii cōmaunded shulde speake name iesu let go departed counsell math v reioy synge counted worthy suffer rebuke name dayly temple euery house ceased teach preache iesus chryst ¶ mynysters deacon ordeyned congregacyon seruyce necessary thynges body apostle may wayte onely vpon worde god steuen accused capi vi dayes nombre disciple grewe arose grudge amonge grekes agaynst hebrues bycause theyr wydowes despysed ☞ dayly ministracion twelue called multitude disciple togyther sayde mete shulde leaue worde god serue table wherfore brother loke ye among seuen men 1 timo 3 c honest reporte full holy goost wysdome may commyt busynesse wyll gyue selues contynually prayer ministracyon worde sayeng pleased hole multitude chose steuen man full fayth holy goost philip procotus nicanor timon permenas • e • ela ii • nocholas conuerte antioche set apostle prayed rome 27 1 timo 4 • timo layd theyr handes worde god encreased nombre disciple multiplied ierusalem greatly great company preestes obedient fayth ✚ steuen full fayth power dyd great wonder myracles among people arose certayne synagoge whiche called synagoge libertine syrenites alexandria celicia asia disputyng steuen luke xxi c coulde resyst wysdome spirite math • • spake ⊢ sent men whiche sayde haue herde speake blasphemous wordes agaynst moses agaynst god moued people elder scribe came vpon hym caught brought hym counsell brought forth false wytnesses whiche sayde mā ceaseth speake blasphemous wordes agaynst holy place law herde hym say iesus nazareth shal destroy place shall chaunge ordinaunces whiche moses gaue v sat counsell loked stedfastly hym saw face bene face angell ¶ steuen maketh answere accusacyon rebuketh styffe necked iu •• stoned vnto death capi vii sayd cheyfe preest euen sayde ye men brother father herken god glorye appered vnto father abraham mesopotamia dwelte charran sayd vnto hym gene xii • get thy countrey thy kynred come lande whiche shall shewe came lande chaldey dwelt charran thence father deade broughte hym lande whiche ye nowe dwell gaue hym none enheritan̄ce bredth fote gene xii x • ii c xvii xxvi promysed wolde gyue hym possesse seed hym yet chylde god verely spake wyse gene xv c▪ seed shulde soiourne straunge lande shulde kepe bondage exodi xii • iudith v gala iii c entreate euyll iiiii c yeres nacyon shall bondage wyll iudge sayde god shal come forth serue place gene xvii • gaue hym couenaunt circumcision gene x • begat isaac cyrcumcised hym viii day gen xxvi c isaac begat iacob gene • xi • iacob begat xii patriarkes gene 37 f sapien x c patriarkes hauyng indygnacion folde ioseph egypte god wt hym delyuered hym aduersities gaue hym fauour wysdome syght pharao kynge egypte gene xi made hym gouernour ouer egypte ouer housholde gene xi • came derthe ouer lande egypte canaan great affliccyon father founde sustenaunce iacob herde corne egypte sent oure father fyrst gene x • v • seconde tyme ioseph knowen brother iosephs kynred made knowen vnto pharao sent ioseph message caused father brought kyn thre score xv ☞ soules iacob descended egypt gen xiv • gene xiix dyed father caried ouer sichem layde sepulcre gen xx • ii • abraham bought money sonnes emor ☞ son sichem tyme promesse drewe nygh whiche god sworne abrahā exodi ii psal • v people grew multiplied egypt tyll kynge arose whiche knewe ioseph delt subtelly kynred euyll entreated father made cast oute theyr yonge chyldren shulde remayne lyue erodi ii hebrue xi e tyme moses borne acceptable vnto god nourysshed vp father house thre monethes cast pharoes doughter toke hym vp nourysshed hym vp owne sonne moses lerned maner wysdom egypcyans myghtye dedes wordes full fourtye yere olde came herte visite brother chyldren israel sawe one suffre wronge defended hym auenged quarell harme done vnto hym smote egypcian supposed brethrē wolde haue vnderstand god hande shuld delyuer vnderstode nexte daye shewed hym selfe vnto stroue wolde haue set one agayne sayenge syrs ye brother hurte ye one dyd neyghboure wronge thrust hym away sayenge gene xix b exodi ii math xii c actes iiii • made ruler iudge ouer v wylte thou kyl thou dydest egypcyan yesterday exodi ii c fled moses sayeng straunger lande madian begat two sonnes exodi iii fourtye yeres expired appeared hym wyldernesse mounte sinay angell lorde flambe fyre busshe moses saw wondred syght drewe nere beholde voyce lorde came vnto hym exodi iii b mat xxii • mark xii c luke xx • god thy father god abraham god isaac god iacob moses trembled durste beholde sayde lorde hym iosua v • put thy shoe thy fete place thou standest holy grounde haue perfytely sene affliccyon people whiche egypte haue herde theyr grenynge come downe delyuer nowe come wyll sende egypte moses forsoke sayeng exodi ii c made ruler iudge dyd god sende ruler delyuerer handes angell whiche appeared hym busshe broughte shewynge wonder sygnes egypte reed see wyldernesse fourtye yeres moses whiche sayde vnto chyldren israell prophet shall lorde god rayse vp vnto brethrē lyke vnto hymexodi xix gala iii shall ye heare de •• xviii • actes iii • cōgregacyon wyldernesse angell whiche spake hym mount sinay father man receyued worde lyfe gyue vnto v whome oure father wolde obeye cast theyr hertes turned backe agayne egypte sayenge vnto aaron make v goddꝭ goexodi 32 • v moses brought v lande egypte wote become hym made calfe dayes offered sacrifice vnto ymage reioysed ouer workes theyr owne handes god turned hym selfe rome l gaue vp shulde worshyp hoost skye wrytten boke prophettes amoe v iere vii • ye house israell gaue ye sacrifice meate offerynges space fourtye yeres wyldernesse ye toke vnto tabernacle ☞ moloch sterre god rempham fygures whiche ye made worshyp wyll translate beyonde babylon oure father tabernacle wytnesse wyldernes appoynted speakyng vnto moses exodi 〈◊〉 • hebr 〈◊〉 • shulde make accordyng fassyon sene whiche tabernacle also oure father came iosua iii • brought iosua possessyon gentyls god draue face oure father vnto tyme dauid psal 29 • whiche founde fauour god wolde fayne haue founde tabernacle god iacob 3 reg vi • salomon buylte hym house actes 〈◊〉 howbeit hyghest dwelleth temple made handes sayeth prophet esa •• vi • 3 reg • 8 c li pat viii heuen seate earth fote stole house wyll ye buylde sayeth lorde whiche place rest hath hand made thynges ye styffe necked vncircumcysed hertes eares ☞ ye haue alwayes resysted holy goost deuit ix youre father dyd ye whiche prophettes haue youre father persecuted haue sleyne whiche shewed comynge iust whome ye haue nowe betrayed murthered ye also haue receyued lawe iohn̄ vii b minystracyon angel actes xv b haue kepte ✚ herde thynges theyr hertes claue sonder gnasshed hym theyr teethe beynge full holye goost loked vp stedfastly eye heuen sawe glorye god iesus standynge ryght hande god sayd beholde se heuens open sonne man standyng ryght hande god gaue shoute loude voyce psal 58 stopped theyr eares ran vpon hym atonce cast hym oute citye stoned hym wytnesses layde downe theyr clothes yong mannes feete whose name saull stoned seuen callynge sayenge lorde iesu 3 reg xxi receyue spiryte kneled downe cryed loude voyce lorde psal 31 • laye synne theyr charge andluke xxiii • thus spoken fell slepe ⊢ ¶ saull persecuteth chrysten apostle fattered abrode philyp cometh samaria sy • non magus baptysed dissembleth philyp baptyseth chamberlayne capi viii ✚ saull • • te xxii consented vnto death tyme great persecucyon agaynste congregacyon whiche ierusalem math x • ••• • xi g scattered abrode thorowe regyons iury samaria excepte apostle deuout men dressed steuen made great lamen tacyon ouer hym sauil •• • ix xxii •• ori xv b galat • • made hauocke congregacyon entred euerye house drue bothe men woman thrust prison therfore scattered abrode wente euery preachynge worde god ✚ came philyp citye samaria preached chryste vnto peple gaue hede vnto thynges whiche philyp spake one accorde hearynge seynge miracle dyd mat xvi vncleane spirites cryenge loude voyce came many possessed many taken palsyes many halted healed great ioye citye certayne man called simō tyme citye vsed witchecrafte bewytched people samaria sayenge man coulde great thynges regarded least greatest sayenge man power god called great hym set moche bycause longe tyme bewytched sorceryes assoone gaue credence philyps preachynge kyngdom god name iesus chryste baptysed bothe men woman symon hym selfe byleued also baptysed cōtynued philyp wondred beholdynge miracle sygnes whiche shewed ✚ apostle whiche ierusalem herde saye samaria receyued worde god sent vnto peter iohsi come downe prayed myght receyue holy goost yet come noone baptysed onely name chryste iesu actes vi • xiii • aimo • v b nume 27 b ii timo • layde handꝭ receyued holy ghost ⊢ symon sawe thorowe layinge apostle handꝭ holy goost gyuen offered money sayenge gyue also power whome soeuer put handes maye receyue holy goost peter sayde vnto hym thy money perysshe bycause thou haste thought math x • gyfte god maye obteyned money thou hast neyther parte felowshyp busynes thy herte ryght syght god repent therfore thy wyekednes praye god thought thyne herte maye forgyuen perceyue thou arte ful bytter gall wrapped iniquite answered symon sayde erodl • rama 8 b 3 • e iiii • luke xxi • praye ye lorde none thynges whiche ye haue spoken fall testifyed preached worde god returned towarde ierusalem preached gospell many cityes samaritan ✚ angell lorde spake vnto philip sayenge aryse go towarde south vnto waye goeth downe ierusalem vnto citye gaza whiche deserte arose went beholde man ethiopia chamber layne great auctorite candace quene ethiophians rule al treasure 3 reg vii • iohn̄ xii • came ierusalem worshyppe returned home agayne syttyng charet red esaye prophet spiryte sayde vnto philip go neare ioyne thy selfe yonder charet philip ran hym herde hym rede prophet esay sayde understandest thou thou redest sayd except gyde desyred philip wolde come vp syt hym tenoure scripture whiche red esai liii c led shepe sleyne lyke lambe dombe sherer opened mouth ☞ bycause humblenesse estemed shall declare generacon lyfe taken earth chamberlayne answered philip sayde praye speaketh prophet hym selfe man philip opened mouth began scripture preached vnto hym iesus went theyr waye came vnto certayne water chamberlayne sayd se water actes x g doth let baptised philip sayd vnto hym thou byleue thyne herte thou mayst answered sayde byleue iesus chryst sonne god cōmaunded charet stande styll went downe water bothe philip also chamberlayne baptised assoone come water spirite lord caught awaye philip chamberlayne sawe hym went way reioysyng philip founde azotus walked thorowout coūtrey preachyng cityes tyll came cesarea ⊢ ¶ paull conuerted confoundeth iues peter reyseth tabitha capi ix ✚ saul yet brethynge threatnynges slaughter agaynst disciple lorde went vnto hygh preest desyred hym letter cary damasco synagoges acte viii xxii xxvi b • corī xv b gala c yf founde way whyther men woman myght bryng bounde vnto ierusalem iourneyed fortuned come nygh damasco sodenly shyned round hym lyght heuen fell earth herde voyce sayenge hym actes xxii v saul saul persecutest thou sayde arte thou lorde lorde sayd iesus thou persecutest harde kycke agaynst pryckꝭ tremblynge astonyed sayde lorde luke iii • actes ii f xxvi f wylte thou haue lorde sayd vnto hym aryse go citye shall tolde thou must men whiche iourneyed hym stode amased hearyng voyce seyng man saul arose frome earth opened eye sawe man led hym hande brought hym damasco thre dayes without syght neyther dyd eate drinke certayne disciple damasco named ananias hym sayd lorde vision ananias sayd beholde lorde lorde sayd vnto hym aryse go strete whiche called streyghte seke house iudas one called saul actes 〈◊〉 • xxii • tharsus beholde prayeth hath sene vision man named ananias comynge hym puttynge handes hym myght receyue syght ananias answered lorde haue herde many man actes 8 • xxii xxvi • corī xv b galat • • moche euyl hath done thy sayntes ierusalem hath auctoryte hygh preestes bynde call thy name lorde sayd vnto hym go thy way chosen vessel vnto beare name gentyls kynges chyldren israel wyll shewe hym howe great thynges actes • xi • ii corī 〈◊〉 • must suffre name sake actes xxi • ananias went way entred house put hande hym sayde brother saul lorde appeared vnto waye thou camest hath sent thou myghtest receyue thy syght fylled holy goost immediatly fell eye bene scale receyued syght arose baptysed receyued meate comforted saul certayne dayes disciple whiche damasco streyght way preached chryst synagoges sonne god herde hym amased sayde spoyled called name ierusalem came hyther entent myght brynge bounde vnto hygh preestes saul encreased strength cō founded iues dwelte damasco affyrmynge chryst ⊢ good whyle iues toke counsell togyther kyll hym theyr layynge awayte knowen saull watched gate day nyght kyl hym •• corī xii regū xii c discyples toke hym nyght put hym walle let hym downe basket saul come ierusalem assayde couple hym selfe disciple afrayd hym beleued discyple barnabas toke hym brought hym apostle declared howe sene lorde way spoken hym done boldly damasco name iesu conuersacion ierusalem speakyng boldely name lorde iesu spake disputed agaynst grekes wente aboute sley hym whiche brother knewe actes xxi • brought cesarea sent hym forth tharsus congregacyon rest thorowout al iuery galile samary edified walked feare lorde multiplied comforte holy goost chaunsed peter walked thorowout quarter came also sayntes whiche dwelte lydda founde certayne man named eneas kepte bed viii yeres sycke palsye peter sayde vnto hym eneas lorde iesus chryste make hole aryse make thy bed math ix math li b luke v c iohn̄ v • actes iii b arose immediatly dwelte lydda assaron sawe hym turned lorde ioppa certayne woman disciple named tabitha whiche interpretacion called dorcas ful good workes almesse dedes whiche dyd chaunsed dayes sycke dyed wasshed layde chamber moche lydda nygh ioppa disciple herde peter sent vnto hym two men desyrynge hym wolde greued come vnto peter arose came come brought chā ber wydowes stode roūde aboute hym wepynge shewyng cootes garmentes whiche dorcas made whyle peter put al forth kneled downe prayed turned hym body sayde tabitha • xvi • reg iiii f luke vii • aryse opened eye sawe peter sat vp gaue hande lyfte vp whē called sayntes wydowes shewed alyue knowen thorowout al ioppa many byleued lorde fortuned taryed many dayes ioppa one simon tanner ¶ visyon peter sawe howe sente cornelius heathen also receyue spirite baptysed capi x ✚ certayne man cesarea called cornelius captayne soul diours italy deuoute man one feared god al housholde gaue moche almesse peple prayed god alwaye sawe vision euidently aboute nynth houre daye angell god comyng hym sayenge vnto hym cornelius loked hym afrayde sayde lorde sayd vnto hym thy prayer thy almesses come vp remembraūceeccles 35 • god nowe sende men ioppa call one symon whose syrname peter lodgeth one simon tanner whose house see syde shal tel thou oughtest angell whiche spake vnto hym departed called two housholde seruauntes deuout souldiour wayted hym tolde matter sente ioppa morowe wente theyr iourney drewe nygh vnto citye peter went vp math vi • 4 reg iiii • vpon top house praye aboute vi houre waxed hungred wolde haue eaten whyle made redy fel traunce saw heuen opened certayn vessel came downe vnto hym bene great shere knyt foure corner let downe earth wherin leuiti xi • deu xiiii • maner foure foted beastꝭ earth vermyn wormes foules ayre came voyce hym ryse peter kyl eate peter sayd lorde haue neuer eaten thynge comon vncleane voyce spake vnto hym agayne seconde tyme math xv • rom xiiii c god hathe clensed call thou comon done thryse vessel receyued vp agayne heuen whyle peter also mused hym selfe vision whiche sene ment beholde men sent cornelius made enquyraunce symons house stode dore called one asked whyther simon whiche syrnamed peter lodged whyle peter thought vision spirite sayd vnto hym beholde men seke aryse therfore get downe go doute haue sent peter went downe men sent vnto hym cornelius sayde beholde ye seke cause wherfore ye come sayde cornelius captayne iust man one feareth god good reporte amonge people iues warned holy angell sende house heare wordes called gene xix lodged morowe peter wente awaye actes xi b certayn brother ioppa accompanyed hym thyrde daye entred cesarea cornelius wayted called togyther kynsmen specyall frendes chaunsed peter come cornelius met fel downe feete worshypped hym peter toke hym vp sayenge stande vp actes x •• ii c reue xix • xxii c selfe also man talked hym came founde many come togyther sayd vnto ye know deut vii vnlawful thyng man iue company come vnto alyent god hath shewed shulde cal man comon vnclene therfore came vnto without delay soone sent aske therfore entente haue ye sent cornelius sayde day nowe iiii dayes aboute houre sat fastynge nynth houre prayed myne house beholde man stode bryght clothyng sayd cornelius thy prayer herde thyn almes dedes remembraūce syght god sende men therfore go ioppa call symon whose syrname peter lodged house one symon tanner see syde whiche soone come shal speake vnto sent immediatly thou hast well done thou arte come nowe therfore present god heare thynges cōmaunded vn god peter opened mouth sayd trueth perceyue ii par • ix c rom ii b ephe vi b lollos iii eccle 35 b respecte persones god esa • vi b people feareth hym worketh ryghteousnesse accepted hym ye knowe preachynge god sente vnto chyldren israel preachyng peace iesus chryst lorde ouer al thyn ge ✚ whiche preachynge publysshed thorowout iuery mat •• ii • began galile baptyme whiche iohn̄ preached howe esai lxi luke iiii c god anoynted iesus nazareth holy goost power iesus wente aboute doynge good healynge oppressed deuyll god hym wytnesses althynges dyd lande iues ierusalem slue hanged tree hym god reysed vp thyrde day shewed hym openly al people vnto v wytnesses chosen fore god entente whiche dyd eate drynke hym arose luk xxlii • iohn̄ xx • • death ✚ mat 〈◊〉 • mar xv • • cōmaunded v preache vnto people testifie whiche ordeyned god iudge quycke deade hym gyue esai iiii • prophettes wytnesse thorowe name souer byleueth hym shal receyue remyssion synnes ⊢ whyle peter yet spake wordes actes v ••• • holy goost fell whiche herde preachynge circumcision whiche byleued astonyed many came peter bycause gentyls also shed oute gyfte holy goost herd speake wt tongue magnifie god answered peter actes vli • • man forbyd water shuld baptysed whiche haue receyued holy goost wel commaunded baptysed name lorde ⊢ prayed hym tary fewe dayes ¶ peter sheweth cause wherfore went heathen barnab paull preache vnto heathen ababus prophesyeth derth come capi xi apostle brother iuery herde hethen also receyued worde god peter come vp ierusalem circumcisyon contended agaynst hym sayeng deut vii • thou wentest men vncircumcised dydest eate peter rehersed matter begynnynge expounded order vnto sayenge actes x citye ioppa prayenge traunce sawe vision certayne vessell descende bene great shete let downe heuen foure corner came whiche whē fastened myne eye considered sawe leuiti xi • deut xii •• • foure foted beastes earth vermen wormes foules ayre herde boyce syenge vnto aryse peter sley eate sayde lorde nothynge comon vncleane hathe tyme entred mouth voyce answered agayne frome heuen counte thou thynges comon whiche god hath clensed done thre tymes al taken vp agayne heuen beholde immediatly thre men alredye come house sent cesarea vnto spirite sayde vnto shulde go without doutyng moreouer actes x syxe brother accompanyed entred man house shewed v howe sene angell house whiche stode sayde hym sende men ioppa call symon whose syrname peter shal tel wordes wherby thou al thy house shalbe saued began preache holy goost fell actes ii dyd v begynnyng came remembraunce howe lorde sayde iohn̄ •• ues • iohn̄ baptysed water ye shall baptysed holy goost moche god gaue lyke giftes dyd vnto v whē byleued lorde iesus christ shulde haue withstande god herde helde theyr peace glorified god sayenge hath god also gentyls graunted repenta unce vnto lyfe actes viii also scattered abrode thorowe affliccion arose steuen walked thorowout vnto phenices cypers antioche preachyng worde man vnto iues onely men cypers cyren come antioche spake vnto grekes preached lorde iesus hande lorde great nombre byleued turned vnto lorde tydynges thyngꝭ came vnto eares congregacyon whiche ierusalem sent forth barnabas shulde go vnto antioche came sene grace god glad actes xiii • exhorted purpose herte wolde contynuallye cleue vnto lorde good man full holy goost fayth moche people added vnto lorde departed barnabas tarsus seke saul founde hym brought hym vnto antioche chaunsed hole yere theyr conuersacyon congregacyon taught moche people moche disciple antioche fyrst called christen actes xxi b dayes came prophettes citye ierusalem vnto antioche stode vp one named agabus signified spirite shulde greate derthe thorowoute worlde whiche came passe emperour claudius dayes disciple euery man accordynge abilite purposed sende cori xvi ii corī 8 ix succoure vnto brother whiche dwelte iuery whiche thynge also dyd sente elder handes barnabas saul ¶ herode persecuteth christen hylleth iames putteth peter pryson lorde delyuereth angel shamefull death herode capi xii ✚ tyme herode kyng stretched forth handes vexe certayne congregacyon kylled mat iiii xvii iames brother iohn̄ swerd bycause sawe pleased iues proceded toke peter also dayes swete breade caught hym put hym pryson also delyuered hym foure qua • ernions souldiours kepte entendynge easter bryng hym forth peple peter kepte pryson prayer made without ceasynge congregacyon vnto god hym herode wolde haue brought hym vnto peple nyght slepte peter bytwene • souldyours bounde two cheynes kepers dore kepte pryson beholde actes v • angel lorde present lyght shyned habitacyon smote peter syde styrred hym vp sayenge aryse vp quicklye cheynes fell frō handes angel sayd vnto hym gyrde thy selfe bynde thy ☞ sandales dyd sayeth vnto hym cast thy garment aboute folowe came folowed hym wyst trueth whiche done angell thought sene vision past fyrst seconde watch came vnto yron gate leadeth vnto citye actes v xvi f▪ whiche opened owne accorde went passed officer saying men trouble cytie seige iewes preach ordinaūces lawful v receaue neyther obserue seinge romayns people rāne thē officer rent theyr clothes cōmaūded thē • cori xi f beaten wt roddes beaten thē sore cast thē preson cōmaūdinge tayler preson kepe thē diligētly whiche receaued suche cōmaūdemēt thrust thē inner presō made theyr fete fast stockes mydnight paul sylas prayed lauded god presoners hearde thē sodenly great erathquake y• foūdacion preson shakē actes v • xii • immediatly dores opened euery mānes bandes losed keper y• presō waked slepe sawe preson dores open drue swearde wolde haue kylled selfe supposinge presoners bene fledde paul cryed loude voyce saying thy selfe harme heare called lyght sprange cam trēblyng vnto paul fel downe fete paul sylas brough thē sayde syrs luke 〈◊〉 actes 〈◊〉 〈◊〉 • must saued sayde ihon vi beleue lorde iesus yu shalt saued thy housholde preached vnto hi worde y• lorde yt house toke thē houre nyght wasshed haue sēt worde lose therfore get hence go peace sayde paule vnto thē haue beaten v openly vncondemned romayns haue cast v presō nowe wolde sende v awaye preuely naye uerely let thē come thē selues fet v minister tolde wordes vnto y• officer feared whē hearde y• romaynes met viii • cam besought brought thē desyred thē departe cytie went y• preson entred house lydia sene brother cōforted departed ¶ paule commeth thessalonica iewes set cytie • r • paule capeth commeth • te • s▪ preached true vnknowen god capi xvii made theyr iourney thorowe amphilopis appolonia came sayde preached act lx vii • • thē beleued came companyed paule sylas deuoute grekes great multitude chefe wemē fewe iewes beleued dignacion toke vnto thē euyl men whiche vagabūdes gathered cōpany set al citie roare made assaute vnto y• house iasō sought bring thē y• people whē foūde thē drue iason certaine brethrē vnto heades citie cry trouble world come hither also whō iason hath giuē worshypping ymages disputed smagoge wt iewes wyth deuout person maket dayly wt thē came vnto hi chaūce certayne philosopher epicure stoyckꝭ disputed hi whiche sayde wyll babler say sayd semeth tidiges briger new deuils preached vnto thē iesus resurreccion toke hym brought hi marce strete sayig may knowe newe doctrine wherof thou spekest thou bryngest straunge tydinges eares wolde know therfore thinges meane athenian straungers gaue thē selues nothing el eyther tell heare newe thyng paul stode middes marce strete sayde ye men athens perceyue y• thigꝭ ye supersticious passed beheld vii • esa lxvi 3 reg 8 c dwelleth tēples made wt handes nether worshypped men hādes though neded thing seing hi self da • vi c gene il b giueth life breth men euery hath made one blode al naciōs men dwel al y• face earth hath assigned long time also endes inhabitaciō ye shulde seke god might fele fynde though farre frō euery one v lyue moue haue beinge certayne owne poetes sayd also generaciō asmuch ☞ generacion god ought thincke godhead lyke vnto golde siluer stone grauen crafte ymagmation man ro •• • • tyme ignoraūce god regarded luke 24 • biddeth al men euery repēt bicause hath appoynted day wyl iudge world wt ryghtuousnes man whō hath apoynted hath offered fayth al men raysed death herde resurreccyon frō death mocked sayde wyll heare agayne matter paule departed frō among thē howbeit certayne men claue vnto hi beleued • among y• whiche diomsius senatoure woman named demaris ¶ paule preached corinthum contynuing yere halfe goeth agayne syrta▪ commeth ephesus
