haue muche people citie cō tinued yeare sixe mouethes taught worde god gallio ruler coūtre aca • iewes made insurreccion▪ one accord agaynst paul brought iudgement seate saying felow coū celeth men worshyp god contrary lawe whā paul open mouth gallio said vnto iewes yf matter wrōge euyl dede oye iewes reason wolde shulde heare yf question wordes name lawe loke ye selues wyl iudge suche matter draue seate al grekes toke sostenes chefe ruler synagoge smote iudges seate gallio cared none thynges paule taried yet good whyle toke leaue brother sayled thence ciria priscilla aquila accōpanying ☞ num vi b shore head cenchrea vowe came ephesus left thē selfe entred synagoge reasoned iewes desyred • ary lōger tyme cōsented bad fare wel saying must nedes feast cōmeth ierusalem wyl returne agayne vnto hebre vi ia • •• • yf god wyll departed ephesus whan come vnto cesarea ascēded vp saluted congregacyon departed vnto antioche whē taryed whyle departed went ouer countre galacia phrigia ordre strengthyng discyples certayne iewe named corin • • • ii • xvi • appollos borne alexandria came ephesus eloquent man mighty scripture informed waye lorde spake feruently spirit taught diligently thinges lord knewe baptyme iohn onely began speake boldly synagoge whō priscilla aquila herde toke vnto expoūded vnto way god perfectly disposed go acaia brother wrote exhortynge dyscyples receyue hym whiche whā come helped much beleued thorowe grace ouer came iewes myghtely openly shewyng scripture iesus christ xii mē baptised ephesus miracle done paul demecriꝰ moueth • diciō cite capi xix fortuned apollo corinthum paul passed thorow vpper costes came ephesus founde certayne disciple said vnto haue ye receyued holy ghost sēce ye beleued sayde vnto haue herde whether ther holy ghost sayde vnto wher ye baptised said ☞ iohns baptyme sayd paul 〈…〉 〈…〉 iohn verely baptised baptyme repentaunce saying vnto people shulde beleue whiche shulde come christ iesus herde baptised name lorde iesu whan paule 〈…〉 layde haudes vpon 〈…〉 holy ghost came 〈…〉 spake tonges prophesyed men twelue went sinagoge behaued selfe boldly space thre monethes disputyng gyuyng exhortacions kyngdome god ⊢ diuers waxed hard herted beleued spake euyl way lord multitude departed seperated disciple disputed daily scole one called tirānus cōtynued space two yeares al dwelt asia hearde worde lorde iesu iewes grekes godmar 16 actes • • wrought special myracles handes paul body brought vnto sicke napkis partlettes disease departed frō andmat 17 • euyl spirites went certayne vagab • nde iewes exorcistes toke vpon cal ouer whiche euyll spirites name lord iesus sayige adiure bymath 7 • iesu whō paul preacheth seuen sōnes one sceua iewe chefe y• prestes whiche dyd euyll spirite answered sayd iesus know paul knowe ye man euyll spirit ranne ouercame preuailed thē yt fledde house naked wounded knowen iewes grekes also dwelt ephesus feare came name lorde iesus magnified many beleued came marke • • cōfessed shewed workꝭ many thē vsed curtoꝰ craftes brought bokꝭ burned thē mē coūted price thē foūde l siluerlingꝭ mightely grewe y• worde god preuayled thiges ended paul purposed y• spirit whā passed ouer macedonia achaia go ierusalē saying haue bene must also se rome sēt macedonia two thē yt ministred vnto hī euen timotheus erastus hī self remayned asia season tyme arose lytel aboute waye certayne man named demetrius siluer smyth made syluer shrynes diana lytle beneficial vnto craftes men whō called togyther wt workman lyke occupacion sayde syrs ye know craft actes xvi haue auaūtage moreouer ye se • alone ephesus almost thorow al asia paul hath perswaded turned away much people saying psal • xv • goddes whiche made handes onely oure craft cōmeth parell set nought also tēple great goddesse diana shuld despised magnyficēce shulde destroyed asia worlde worshyppeth herd sayinges full wrath cryed sayinge great diana ephesiās al cite rore rushed comē hal wt one assent caught gaius aristarcus mē macedonia paul cōpaniōs whē paul wolde haue entred vnto people y• disciple suffered certayne chefe asia frēdes sent vn desyringe yt wolde preace comē hal therfore cryed one thyng another congregacion al quiet parte knewe wherfore come togyther cōpany drue forth alexāder iewes thrustyng hi forwardes alexander actes 21 • beckened wt hande wolde haue gyuen y• people answere whē knew iewe arose shoute almost space two houres al men cry great diana ephesian whē towne clarke ceased people sayd ye men ephesus mā knoweth howe cytie y• ephesian worshipper great god desse diana ☞ ymage came heauen seinge nomā sayth agaynst ye ought cōtēt nothyng rashly ye haue brought hyther men nether robber church yet despisers youre goddesse wherfore yf demetrius craftes men hym haue matter agaynst mā law opē ruler let accuse one another yf ye go aboute thyng shalbe determined lawful congregacion • eopardy accused dayes vproure asmuch cause wherby may gyue reckenyng concourse people thus spoken let congregacion depart ¶ paul goeth macedonia grece troa • raysed vp deade body ephesus calleth elder congregacyon togyther commy ••• th kepynge god flocke vnto warneth false teacher ••• keth prayer departeth shyppe capi xx rage ceased paule called disciple vnto toke leaue thē departed go macedonia gone ouer party giuen thē long exhortacion came grece abode iij monethes iewes layde wayte sa • e syria purposed returne thorowe macedonia accōpanyed ito asia sop • ter berrea thessalonia aristarcus secūdus gayus derba timotheus asia tychicus actes 〈◊〉 f • tim 4 • trophimus goynge taried v troas sayled away philippos dayes swete breade came vnto troas fyue dayes abode seuen dayes vpō one saboth dayes whā y• disciple came togyther breke breed paul preached vnto redy depart morow continued preaching vnto mydnyght many lyghtes chambre gathered togither sat wyndow certayne yonge man named euticus beyng fallē depe slepe paul preaching ouercome slepe fell downe thyrd lofte takē vp deed whan paule went downe fel him3 reg 7 4 reg 4 f luke 7 c actes ix g embrased sayd make nothyng lyfe whē come vp agayne broken bread eaten talcked long whyle euen tyll mornyng last departed brought yong man alyue lytell comforted went afore shyp lowsed vnto asson receyue paule appointed wolde selfe go fote come togither asson toke came mytilnes sayled thence came nexte daye ouer agaynst chios nexte day aryued samos taried • rogylon nexte daye came myleton paule determined sayle ouer ephesus wold spende tyme ī asia hasted yf possyble kepe ierusalem daye pentecost myleton sent messaungers ephesus called elder congregacyon whyche come hym sayde vnto ye know fyrst daye came asia maner haue bene ceasons seruynge lorde humblenes mynde many teares temptacions whiche happened vnto layinges awayt iewes wold kepe backe nothynge profytable vnto shewe teache opē ly thorowe euery house wytnessing iues also grekes luke 24 • repentaūce toward god ye fayth toward lord iesus beholde go bounde spirit vnto ierusalem knowing thinges shal come actes 21 • holy ghost wytnesseth euery cytie sayinge bandes trouble abyde none thinges moue ii tim ii b nether lyfe dere vn selfe might fulfyl course wt ioye ministracion ⚜ worde whiche haue receyued lord iesu testifye gospel grace god nowe beholde sure y• hēceforth ye al thorowe haue gone preching kīgdome god shal se fate wherfore take recorde thys daye pure bloude men haue spared labour haue shewed councell god take hede therfore vnto selues flocke among holy ghost hath made ouerfears rule congregacion god hath purchased bloude tim 4 • 2 tim 3 • ii petr 2 • 3 • iudit • • sure departynge shall greuous wolues entre amōg sparyng flocke moreouer owne selues shal men aryse speakyng peruerse thīges drawe disciple thē therfore awake remēbre space iii yeares ceased warne euery one nyght day teares brethrē commende god worde grace able builde farther gyue inheritaūce amonge whiche sanctified eccl xlvi reg 12 • haue desyred man syluer golde vesture yee ye selues knowe 2 co • xi xii gene iii e 1 corin • b 2 tessa 3 b hādes haue ministred vnto necessity haue shewed thynges howe laborynge ye ought receiue weake remēbre wordes lord iesu sayd blessed gyue receyue thus spokē kneled downe actes xxi • prayed wepte sore fel paul necke kyssed hym sorowyng moste wordes spake shulde se hys face nomore conuayed hym vnto shyppe ¶ paul iorney shyppe phyllyppe euangelyst agabus prophete whiche warned paule go ierusalem remayned stedfast purpose taken temple capi xxi whan chaunsed laū ched forth departed thē came straight course vnto choo • day folowyng vnto rhodes frō thence vnto patara whā got ten shippe wold sayle vnto phenices went aborde set forth whan cyprus begāne appeare vnto v lefte left hāde sayled vnto siria came vnto tyre shyppe vnladed burthen founde brother taryed seuen dayes tolde paule thorowe spirite actes xx • shulde go vp ierusalem dayes ended departed went waye brought v oure waye wyth wyues chyldren tyll come cytie kneled downe shore actes 20 • prayed takē leue one another toke shyppe returned home agayne full ended course tyre went downe ptolomaida saluted brother abode one day nexte day paul cōpany departed came vnto cesarea entred house actes vi viii philyp euangelist one seuen abode man foure daughter virgin whiche dyd • oil ii g prophesy taryed good mayny dayes came certayne prophete iury named agabus come vnto v toke paul gyrdell boūde fete hādes sayde thus sayth holy ghost actes ix e 2 lo • ii • • shal iewes ierusalē bid man oweth gyrdel shal delyuer hādes gentyls herde bothe place sought wold go vp ierusalem paul answered sayd ye weping vexynge myne herte redy bounde onely also dye ierusalem name lorde iesu coulde turne hys mynde ceased sayinge math vi b wyll lorde fulfylled dayes toke vp burthen went vp ierusalem actes ix e went wyth v also certayne dysciples cesarea brought one • ason ciprus olde dysciple shuld lodge come ierusalem brother receyued v gladly morowe paule went v vnto iames elder came togyther saluted told ordre thynges god wrought amonge gentyls mynystracyon herde gloryfyed lorde sayde vnto thou feest brother howe many thousande iewes whiche beleue al ernest folowers ouer law informed y• teachest iewes whiche among gentyls forsake moses sayd ought circumcyse theyr chyldren nether lyue customes therfore multitude must nedes come togither shal thou art come therfore saye • um vi haue foure men haue vow take purify thy selfe thē cost thē may shaue heades shal knowe thynges haue herde concernyng nothyng thou thy self also walckest kepest lawe touchynge gentyls beleue actes xv • haue wrytten concluded obserue thyng saue onely kepe thē selues thynges offered ydolles bloude strangled fornicacion nexte day paul toke men actes • 4 purifyed selfe entred temple declarynge obserued dayes purificaciō vntyll offerynge shulde offered euery one whan seuen dayes almost ended iewes whyche asia sawe hym temple moued al people layde handes cryinge men israell helpe man teacheth men euery agaynste people lawe thys place hath also brought grekes temple hath polluted thys holy place sene hym one cytie actes 20 • • tim 4 trophimus ephesiā supposed paul brought temple al cytie moued people swarmed togyther toke paul drue temple forth dores shut wente aboute kyl hym tidinges came vnto hye captayne soudyers al ierusalem moued whiche immediately toke souldyers vnder captaynes ranne downe vnto thē whē sawe vpper captayne souldyers lefte smityng paul captayne came nere toke commaunded bounde two chaynes demaūded done cryed one thyng another amonge people coulde knowe certayntye rage commaunded hym caryed castle whan came vnto staire fortuned borne souldyers vyolence people multytude people folowed cryinge awaye hym whan paul begāne caryed castle sayde vnto hye captayne may speake vnto sayd canst thou speake greke art thou egypcyan whiche dayes madest vproure leddest wildernes iiij thousande men murtherers paul said mā iew actes ix b xxii tharsus citie cicill citisin vyle cyte beseche y• suffre speke vnto people whē giuen lycēc • paul stode steppe actes xix b beckned wt hande vnto people whan made gret sylence spake vnto thē hebrue tong saying ¶ paul answereth iewes scourg • layde pryson agayne capi xxii men brother father heare ye myne answere make vnto herde spake ebrue tong kept silēce sayeth verely man whiche iewe borne actes ix b xxi g tharsus cite cicyl neuerthelesse yet brought vp thys cytie fete gamaliel informed diligently lawe father feruēt mynded god ward ye al day actes 5 • persecuted waye vnto theactes 8 1 • 26 b cori 15 b gōla ii b deth byndyng deliuering prison men wemen chefe prest doth bere wytnes estate elder whome also receyued letter vnto brother went damasco brynge bounde vnto ierulem punyshed fortuned made iorney come nye vnto damasco aboute none sodenly shone heuen gret lyghte rounde aboute fell vnto earth herde voyce saying vnto actes ix • saul saul persecutest thou answered art thou lord sayd vnto iesus nazareth thou persecutest wyth sawe verely lyght afrayed herde voyce hym spake wyth saide shal lorde lorde sayde vnto aryse go damasco shalbe tolde thynges apointed sawe nothyng brightnes light led hand came damasco 〈…〉 ix c one ananias perfecte man pertaynynge lawe hauynge good reporte al iewes whych dwelt came vnto stode sayde vnto brother savle receyue thy syght houre receaued syghte sawe hym sayde god father hath ordayned thou shuldest knowe hys wyll se thynge ryghtefull shuldest heare voyce hys mouthe thou shalte hys wytnesse vnto men thynges whyche thou haste sene herde nowe taryest thou aryse baptysed wasshe awaye thy synnes rome x • callynge name lorde fortuned come agayne ierusalem prayed temple traunce sawe hym saying vnto make hast get quyckely ierusalem wyl receyue thy wytnes thou berest sayde lorde knowe prysoned bet euery synagoge thē beleued act • viii • bloude thy wytnesse steuen shed also stode consented vnto death kept raiment slewe sayde vnto depart actes xiii • gala • wyll sende farre hence vnto gentyles gaue hym audyence vnto thys worde lyfte vp theyre voyces sayde away wyth suche felowe earthe reason shulde lyue cryed caste theyr clothes thrue duste ayre captayne commaunded hym broughte castle bad shulde scourged examined might knowe wherefore cryed hym whan bounde hym thonges paule sayde vnto centurion stode lawefull scourge man romayne vncondemned centurion heard wente told vpper captayne saying intendest thou man ⚜ cytezen rome vpper captayne came sayd vnto tell art thou romayne sayd yee captayne answered great optayned fredome paul sayd fre borne strayght way departed whiche shulde haue examined hye captayne also afrayed knewe romayne bound hym y• morowe wolde haue knowen certayntie wherfore accused iewes losed hym frome hys bondes commaunded hye preestes al coūsel come togyther actes xxii brought paul forth set ¶ paule commeth councell debate aryseth amonge people capytayne delyuereth hym god comforteth hym capi xxiii paul behelde coūcel sayd men brother actes 24 b haue liued al good cōscience god vntyl day hye prest ananias cōmaunded stode smyte mouth sayd paul vnto hī god shal smyte yu paynted wal deut 18 syttest yu iudgest lawe cōmaūdest smiten contrary law yt stode sayde iohn 17 reuylest yu goddes hye preste sayd paul wyst brother hye prest wryten thou shalt • xo xxii curse ruler thy people whē paul perceyued yt one part saduces pharises cried coūcel men brother • hil iii pharisey sōne pharisey • de xxiii • • 26 b hope resurrecyon death iudged sayde arose debate bytwene pharises saduces multitude deuyded • al xxii • mar xii b luke xx c saduces say resurreccion neyther angel spirit phariseys graunt arose great cry whā thé scribe pharisyes part arose stroue sayig finde none euyl man though spirit angel hath appered let v stryue agaynst god arose great debate captayne fearynge least paul shulde haue bene pluckt asondre commaunded souldiers go downe take among brynge hym castel 〈…〉 xvl b • nd xviii c actes 27 nyght folowynge god stode hym sayde good cheare paule thou hast testified ierusalē ‡ must thou beare wytnes also rome whan daye certayne iewes gathered selues togyther made vowe sayinge wolde neyther eate dryncke tyll kylled paul mo fourtye men whyche made conspiracion came chefe prestes elder sayde haue boūde selues vowe wyl eate nothyng vntyl haue slayne paule nowe therfore gyue ye knowledge vpper captayne councel bryng hym forth vnto v morowe though wolde know thynge perfectly hī euer come nere redy kyll paul systers sonne herde laying awayt went entred castle tolde paul paul called one vnder captaynes vnto said bryng yonge man vnto hye capytayne hath certayne thyng shewe hym toke brought hym hye captayne sayd paul prysoner called vnto hym prayed bryng thys yong man vnto hath certayne matter shewe hye captaine toke hand went way asked hym thou hast tel sayd iewes determyned desyre thou woldest brynge forth paul morow coūcell thoughe wolde enquyre somwhat perfectly folowe thou myndes lye wayte hym mo fourty men haue bounde thē selues vowe wyll neyther eate dryncke tyll haue kylled hym redy loke thou shuldest promes vpper captayne let yonge man departe charged hym sayinge • thou tel man thou hast shewed thinges called vnto two vnder captaynes saying make redy ii c soudiers go cesarea horsin • threscore ten speare men two hundreth thyrde houre nyght delyuer beastꝭ may ser paul bring safe vnto felix hye debitie⚜ dyd feare lest happly iewes shulde take hym awaye kyll hym hym self shuld afterward blamed though wolde take money wrote letter maner claudious lysias vnto mighty ruler felix sendeth gretynge actes xx f thys man taken iewes shuld haue bene kylled came wyth soudiers reskued perceaued romayne wold haue knowen cause wherfore accused actes 22 g brought hym forth councell perceyued accused questyons theyr lawe actes xx • gylty thynge worthye death bondes shewed howe iewes layde wayre sent strayght way gaue cōmaundemente hys accusets ye thīges whiche haue agaynst hym shulde tel y• fare wel foudiers cōmaūded thē toke paule brought hī nyght antipa • ra morow left horsmen go wyth hī returned vnto castle whē came cesarea deliuered epystle debite p̄sented paul also hī whē y• debite red lettre asked coūtre whē vnderstode yt celicia deut 17 • wyl said whē thine accuser come also cōmaūded kept herodes iudgement hall ¶ paul accused felix answereth selfe capi xxiiii fyue dayes ananias actes xxv b y• hye prest descended wt elder certayne oratour named tartullus enformed y• debite agaynst paule paul called forth tartullus begāne accuse hī saying seing y• liue gret quietnes meanes many good thinges done vnto nacion thorowe thy prouidence y• allowe euer plaes noble felix thankes notwithstandyng tedious vnto pray thou woldest v thy curtesy wordes haue founde mā pestilent felow mouer debate vnto al iewes y• whole world mayntayner ⚜ sedycyon secte nazarites whyche hath also enforsed pollute tēple actes xxi • toke wolde haue iudged accordyng lawe hye captaine lysias came vpon v great violence toke away hādes cōmaundyng accuser come vnto whō y• mayst thou wilt inquire know certayntie al thinges wherof accuse hī iewes lykewyse affirmed sayinge thinges euen paul y• debite hī self beckened vnto hym y• shulde speake answered quyet mynde answere self asmuch understād y• thou hast bene many yeres iudge vnto people y• thou mayst know y• yet xij day sēce went vp ierusalē worshyp actes xxv b 28 neyther foūde y• temple disputyng wt mā either raysyng vp y• people nether y• sinagoges y• cyte nether cā proue thinges wherof accuse confesse vnto y• way whiche cal heresy worshyp y• god father beleuyng al thīges whiche writtē law prophetes haue hope towardes god y• math 〈◊〉 ▪ resurreccion dead whych selues loke also shall lust vniust therfore acte •••• study haue alway clere conscience towarde god towarde men many yeres came roman actes x •• brought almes people offriges ⚜ vowes founde purified temple nether wt multitude yet vnquietnes ⚜and toke cryed sayinge away enemye certayne iewes asia whiche ought presēt y• accuse yf ought el let say yf haue foūde eyull doying whyl stāde y• coūcel except one voyce y• cryed stā dyng among thē actes 23 4 resurreccion death iudged day whē felix herd thiges deferde thē knewe well y• way sayd lisias captaine come downe wyl know y• vtmost matter iere 3 • • 〈◊〉 2 • • cōmaūded vnder captayne kepe paul let hī haue rest shulde forbyd none acquaynctaūce ministre vnto come vnto certayne dayes felix came wyfe drucilla iewesse called forth paul herd fayth toward christe preached ryghtuousnes tēperaūce iudgement come felix trembled answered go thy way thys tyme haue conuenient season wyl sende hoped also money shulde haue bene gyuen paul myght lose wherfore called oft •• er comened two yere festus porcious came felix roume felix willyng shew iewes pleasureact xxv left paul prison bounde ¶ iewes accuse paule festus appealeth vnto emperour sent vnto rome capi xxv whē festus receyued y• office thre dayes ascended frō • esare • • n ierusalē enformed hī hie prestꝭ chefe iewes paul sought desyred fauour agaynst hī y• wolde sende hī ierusalem laide awayt hī way kyl festus answered y• paul shuld kept cesarea y• self wolde shortly depart thyther let therfore sayd among able come downe v accuse hym yf ther faute man taryed among ten dayes wente downe vnto cesatea nexte daye sate downe iudgement seate commaunded paul brought forth come y• iewes come ierusalem stode aboute hym layde many greuous cōplaintes paul coulde proue long answered hym selfe act xxiiii • and▪ • 8 b nether lawe iewes nether agaynst tēple yet agaynst cesar offended thynge festus acte xxiii • wyllyng iewes pleasure answered paul sayde wylte thou go vp ierusalem iudged thinges sayde paul stande cesars iudgement seate ought iudged iewes haue harme done thou wel knowest haue hurte commytted thynge worthy deeth refuse dye none thynges accuse man may deliuer appeale vnto cesar spake festus delyueracyon answered thou hast appealed vnto cesar vnto cesar shalt thou go certayne dayes kynge agrippa bernice came vnto▪ cesarea salute festus bene good ceasō festus rehersed paul cause vnto king saying actes 24 f ther certaine mā lefte preson felix came ierusalem actes 24 • • ye prestes elder iewes enfourmed desyred haue iudgement agaynste answered maner y• romayns fauoure delyuer man shuld perysshe accused haue accusats hym haue lycence answere self concernynge cryme layde agaynst therfore come hyther delay morow sate geue iudgementee commaunded man brought forth agaynst whē accuser stode vp actes 23 • brought none accusaciō suche thinges supposed certayne question owne supersticyon one iesus whiche deed paul affirmed aliue douted maner questiōs asked whether wolde go ierusalem iudged matter whē paul appealed kept vn knowledge cesar cōmaūded kept tyll myght send cesar agrippa sayde vnto festus wolde also heare mā selfe morowe sayde thou shalt heare hym morowe whē agrippa come bernyce greate pompe entred coū cel house captaynes chefe men cyte festus commaundement paul brought forth festus sayd kyng agrippa ye men whiche heare present v ye se man aboute whō multytude iewes haue intreted ierusalē also cry ought lyue lenger yet founde nothynge worthy deeth commytted neuerthelesse seynge hath appealed cesar haue determyned send whome haue certayne thyng write vnto lord wherfore haue brought vnto specyally vnto kinge agryppa examynacyon myght haue sumwhat wryte thīcketh vnreasonable sende presoner shewe cause layde agaynst ¶ kynge agryppa heareth paule whiche telleth hym hy • callyng begynnynge capi xxvi agrippa sayd vnto paul thou art permytted speake thy selfe paul stretched forth hande answered selfe thinke selfe happy kyng agrippa shall answere daye thynges wherof accused iewes namely thou art experte customes questyons whiche among iewes wherfore beseche heare pacyētly liuing haue led chylde whiche fyrst among myne owne nacion ierusalem knowe iewes whiche knewe begynnynge yf wolde testyfye phili iii • straytest secte relygion lyued pharisey stāde actes 23 • xxiiii • xxviii • iudged hope promes made god vnto oure father vnto promes oure xij trybes instantly seruyng god daye night hope come whiche hope sake kynge agrippa accused iewes shulde thought thyng incredyble vnto god shuld rayse againe deed also verelyactes 8 • 〈◊〉 • xxii • cor • xv • gala • c thought selfe ought many contrary thynges clene agaynste name iesus nazareth thyng also dyd ieresalem many saynctes dyd shut vp preson receaued auctoryte hye prestes put deeth gaue sentence punysshed ofte euery synagoge cōpelled blaspheme yet mad vpon persecuted euen vnto straunge cite whiche thīges went damasco au • toryte lycence hye prestes euen mydday king sawe way light heauen aboue bryghtnes sonne shyne rounde whiche iorneyed al fallen erthe hearde voyce speakyng vnto saying hebrue tonge artes 9 • xx •• b saul saul persecutest thou harde kicke agaynste pryckes sayde art thou lorde sayde iesus thou persecutest ryse stand vpon thy fete haue apered vnto thys purpose make mynyster wytnes thinges thou hast sene thynges whyche wyll appere vnto delyuering frō people gentils vnto nowe sende open theyr eye maye turne darcknes lyghte power satan vnto god may receaue forgeuenes sinnes inheritaunce amonge sanctifyed fayth towarde wherfore kynge agryppa disobedient vnto heauenly vision shewed fyrst vnto damasco ierusalem thorowe oute coastes iewry gētyls shulde repent turne god workes become repent thys cause iewes caught temple went kyl seyng therfore haue obtayned helpe god contynue vnto day witnessyng smal greate sayinge none thynges prophetes moses dyd saye shuld come christe shulde suffer shuld first shuld ryse frō deeth shuld shewe lyght vnto people gentyls thus spake hym selfe fest u sayde loude voyce paul thou act besyde thy selfe much learning doth make mad paul sayde mad deare festus speake wordes trueth sobernes kyng knoweth thynges speake frely neither thinke thynges hydden hym thyng done corner kynge agrippa beleuest thou prophetes wote wel thou beleuest agrypa sayde vnto paul sumwhat thou bringest mynde become christen paul sayde wolde god onely thou also heare day somwhat onely altogether except bondes thus spoken kynge rose vp debite bernice sate goue aparte talked betwene selues saying mā doeth nothyng worthy deeth bondes sayde agrippa vnto festus thys man myght haue bene let loose yf appealed vnto cesar ¶ paul • hppeth toward rome iulyus captayne intrenteth hym curteously • ▪ last suffer shyp wrake capi xxvii whan concluded shuld sayle italy delyuered bothe paul certayne presoners vnto one named iulius vnder captayne cesars soudiars entred ship adramicium loosed lande apointed sayle coastes asia▪ one collo 4 2 aristarcus macedonia coūtre thessalonia v next day came sidon iulius •• e 30 〈◊〉 •••• 〈◊〉 • courteously entreated paule gaue hym lyberte go vnto hys frendes refresshe selfe whan launched fron • thence sayled harde cypers wyndes contracye whan sayled ouer see cylycya pamphilia came myra lycya vnder captayne founde shippe alexādria ready sayled italy put v therin sailed slowly many dayes scace come ouer agaynste guydon winde stode v sayled herde coastes cādy ouer agaynst salmo muche worcke sayled beyonde came vnto place called faire hauēs nye wherunto cytye lasea▪ muche tyme spente whan sayling nowe ieoperdous also ouerlōge fasted paul put thē remembrance sayde vnto syrs perceaue thys vyage wyll wyth hurte muche damage ladinge ship onely also oure lyues neuerthe lesse vnder captayne beleued gouerner master shyppe thinges spoken paul hauen cōmodious wynter many toke counsell departe thence meanes might attaine phenices wynter whiche hauen candy lyeth towarde southwest northwest wynde south wynde blewe supposynge obtayne purpose loosed vnto asson sayled past candy long arose agaynst purpose flawe wynd oute northeast shyppe caught could resist winde let go draue wether caried yle whyche named clauda much worke come bote whiche toke vp vsed helpe made fast ship fearyng lest shulde fal ☞ sirtes let downe vessell caryed nexte daye tossed wyth exceadynge tēpest lyghtened shyp thyrde day cast oure owne handes takiyng shippe last neyther sōne starres many dayes appearch small tempest laye vpon v hope shuld escape takē away long abstynence paul stode forth myddes sayde syrs ye shuld haue barkened haue loosed cādy neyther haue brought vnto v harme losse nowe exhorte good chere shal losse man lyfe amonge saue ship onely stode nyght angell god whose serue saying feare paul 〈…〉 25 • thou must brought cesar lo god hath geuen sayle wherfore syrs good chere beleue god shalbe euen tolde must cast 〈…〉 2 • • certaine ylonde fourtenth nyght come saylyng abria miduyght shypmen demed appeared coūtre vnto sounded founde xx feddoms gone litel soū ded againe founde xv feddōs fearynge leste shulde haue fallen rocke cast iiij ancres sterne wysshed day shipmen sle shyp whan let downe vote see vnder conlour though wold haue cast • ar forship paul sayde vnto vnder captayne soudiers excepte abyde shyp ye cānot sate soudiers cut rope bote let fal awaye whan daye began appeare paul besought take meat saying fourtenth day ye haue taryed contynued fastyng receauing nothīge al wherfore pray take meat thꝭ dout health math • luke 12 • ▪ shal heet fal heed thus spokē toke breed math v • • viii • tu • 4 • gaue thākes god presence al broken begāne eate good cheare also toke meat al together shyp two hundred thre score sixtene soules eaten ynough lightened ship cast oute y• wheate see daye knew lande speed certaine hauen wyth bancke whyche mynded yf possible thrust shyp taken vp ancres cōmytted selues vnto see loused rudder bondes hoysed vp mayne sayle wynde drue lāde whan chaunced place see bothe sydes thrust ship foreparte stucke fast moued hinder parte brake violence waues soudyars con̄ cel kyl presoners lest thē swome shuld runne away vnder captayne wyllynge saue paule kepte theyr purpose commaunded could swym shulde caste selues fyrste see scape lande commaunded go bordes broken peces ship came passe escaped safe lande ¶ vyper hurteth paul hanne healeth pu • lyu • father preacheth chryst rome capi xxviii scaped knewe act xxvii • yle called milete people countre shewed v lytel kyndnes kindled fyre receaued v euery one present rayne colde paul gathered bondell styckes layde thē fyre came vyper heat lept hys hāde men countre sawe beast hange hys hande sayde amonge selues man must nedes mortherer though haue escaped see yet vengaūce suffreth lyue •• • ke vyper fyre •• • vi • 〈◊〉 x • felt harme howbeit wayted shulde haue swol • e fallen downe deed sodenly loked greate whyle sawe harme come hym chaunged theyr myndes sayde actes xiii b god▪ quarter londes man yle whose name publius whiche receaued v lodged v thre dayes curteously fortuned father publius laye sycke feuer bloudy flyxe paul entred praide laide hādes healeth thys done also disease yle came healed whiche also dyd v greate honour departed laded v thynges necessary thre monethes departed ship alexandry wyntred yle whose badge ☞ castor pollux came cyracusa taryed thre dayes thēce fet cōpasse came regium one day south wynde blewe came nexte day putiolus founde brother desyred tary wyth seuen dayes came rome thence brother hearde v came mete v apiphorum thre tauernes paule sawe thancked god wexed bolde came rome vnder captayne delyuered presoners chefe captayne host paule suffred dwell hym selfe soudyer kept hym thre dayes paul called chefe iewes together come sayde vnto men brother though act • 3 • xxv b haue committed nothing agaynst people lawes elder acte xxiii c yet delyuered presoner ierusalem hādes romains examyned wold haue let go ther cause death iewes spake contrary constrayned appeale vnto cesar ought accuse people thys cause haue called euen se speake acte xxiii b xxiiii e xx vi b hope israel bounde wt cheyne sayd vnto neyther receaued letter iewry pertaynyng vnto neyther came brother shewed spake harme wyll heare thou thynckest concernynge secte knowe luke •• euery spoken agaynst appoynted hym daye came many hym hys lodgyng exposided testified kingdom god preached vnto iesus lawe moses oute prophetes euen mornynge nyght acte 〈…〉 beleued thynges spoken beleued agreed amonge selues departed paule spoken one worde well spake holy goost esay prophet vnto father sayinge e • 〈◊〉 mat 〈…〉 mat 〈◊〉 luk 〈◊〉 iohn 〈…〉 go vnto thys people saye wyth youre eares shall ye heare shal vnderstande wyth youre eye shall ye se perceaue hert people wexed grose theyr eares haue luste heare theyr eye haue closed lest shuld se eye heare wt eares vnderstande hertes shuld cōuerted shulde heale knowen therfore vnto thys saluacyon god sente gentyls shall heare sayde wordes iewes departed great despycyons among selues paule dwelt two yeares full hys lodginge receaued came vnto preachyng kigdome god teachynge thynges whiche concerne lorde iesus confydence man forbydding ¶ endeth actes apostle ❧ epistle apostle saynt paule romaynes ¶ paule declareth hys loue towarde romaynes sheweth gospell frute therof rebu keth •• astlynce heathen capi ✚ paule seruaunt iesus christe called offyce apostle actes 13 • put part y• gospell god deut 18 c actes iii • nd vii e whiche promysed afore hys prophetes holy scriptutures sonne borne ⚜ vnto hym math • im ii b seed dauid flesh hathe bene declared sonne god power sprere sanctyfyeth sence tyme iesus chryste oure lorde rose agayne deeth 〈◊〉 ix b haue receaued grace apostle shyp obedience myght geuen vnto fayth name amonge heathen whose nombre called iesu chryste ⊢ rome beloued god called hys sonne ceasynge make mencyon alwayes philip •• • prayer besechynge meane last tyme prosperous iorney wyll god myght fortune come vnto longe se myght bestowe amōge spyritual gyfte strength withall myght haue consolacyon together cōmen faith whiche bothe ye haue wolde ye shulde knowe brother howe haue often tymes purposed come vnto 〈◊〉 16 b haue bene let hytherto haue frute also amonge amonge ryghtewesnes god opened ☞ frō fayth fayth wrytten aha • ue • gala iii • hebre x g iust shal lyue fayth y• wrath god apeareth heauen agaynste vngodlynes vnryghtewesnes men whiche withholde trueth vnryghtewesnes seynge actes 17 f whiche may knowen god manifest amonge god hath shewed vnto thē actes • 4 e hebre xi yee inuisyble thinges saye eternall power godhed sene much vnderstande psal xi • workes creacyon worlde without excuse knewe god glorified god nether thankfull wexed full vanity theyr ymagynacyons deute 1 • • theyr folysh herte blynded counted selues wyse became fooles psal •• 6 • •• r • ii e turned glory immortal god vnto ymage made onely similitude mortal man also byrdes foure foted eze xiiii b beastes crepynge beastes wherfore god gaue vp vnto theyr hertes iustes vnclennes defyle theyr owne body among thē selues turned trueth vnto lye worshypped serued thinges made hym made blessed euer amen wherfore god gaue vp vnto shamfull lustes leuit 18 • euen theyr wemen dyd chaunge naturall vse whiche agaynste nature lyke wyse also men left natural vse woman brent theyr lustes one another leuit▪ 〈◊〉 ▪ • ▪ mē men wrought filthynes receaued selues rewarde theyr erroure accordynge▪ regarded knowe god • te • vii • euen god delyuered vp vnto lewde mynde shuld thinges whiche comly beinge ful al vnrightteousnesse fornicacion wyckednes coueteousnes malycyousnes full enuye murther debate disseȳte euyll cōdicyoned whysperers backbyters hater god doer wronge proude boaster bringers vp euyll thynges disobedyent father mother without vnderstandynge couenaunte breaker vnlouynge trace breaker vnmerciful men though knewe ryghtewesnes god ⚜ consydred nat howe cōmyt suche thynges worthy deeth ⚜ osee vii also ⚜ whyche haue pleasure ¶ rebuketh iewes whiche touchynge synne lyke heathen capi ii therfore art thou inexcusable man whosoeuer thou mat vii ☞ iudgest wherin thou iudgest another 2 reg 12 • thou condemnest thy selfe thou iudgest doest euen selfe thynges sure iudgement god accordynge trueth agaynst thē cōmyt luch thynges thynkest thou thou man iudgest suche thynges doest euen thy selfe thou shalt escape iudgement god ether despysest thou ryches affyrme saye let v euyll good may come therof whose damnacyon iuste better wyse haue ready proued howe bothe iewes gentyls vnder synne wrytten psal 14 • 2 • none ryghteous one none vnderstādeth none whiche beleueth iesus ⊢ thy reioysynge excluded lawe workes naye lawe fayth therfore holde 〈…〉 ii • man iustyfyed fayth without dedes lawe god iewes onely also god gentyles yes euen gentyls also god whiche iustyfyeth circumcysyon fayth vncircumcysyon thorowe fayth destroye y• lawe thorow fayth god forbyd rather mayntayne lawe ¶ declareth example abraham fayeth iustyfyeth lawe workes therof capi hym ryghtewesnes hym worketh rewarde reckned fauoure dutye ☞ hym y• worketh beleueth hym iustyfieth vngodly fayth counted rightewesnes ⚜ accordynge purpose grace god euē dauid descrybeth blessedfulnes mā vnto whō god imputeth rightewesnes without dedes p •• 32 • blessed whose vnryghtewesnesse forgeuen whose synnes couered blessed y• mā lorde wyll impute synne came blessednes vpon vncyrcumcysyon vpon cyrcumcysyon also saye fayth rekened abraham ryghtewesnes howe rekened whan circumcisyon whan vncircūcision gene xv • tyme circumcision yet vncircumcised receaued gen xvii • sygne circumcisyon seale ryghtewesnes fayth whiche yet beynge vncircumcised shulde father beleue thought circūcysed ryghtewesnes myght imputed also myght father circumcisyon vnto onely whiche came circumsised vnto also walke steppe fayth father abraham tyme circumcisyon promes shuld heyre worlde happened abraham seed thorowe lawe thorow ryghtewesnes fayth gala iii • yf law heyres thē fayth vayne promes none effecte lawe causeth wrath lawe transgressyon therfore fayth inheritaunce geuen myght come fauoure promes myght sure ☞ seed thē onely whiche lawe also whiche fayth abraham esay 51 y• father v al ▪as wrytten gene 17 haue made father many nacyōs euen god beleued whiche restored deed vnto lyfe calleth thynges though whiche abraham contrary hope beleued hope shulde gene 17 gene xv b father many nacyons accordyng spoken ‡ euen shall thy sede ⚜ starres heauen sande see faynted fayth yet consydered owne bodye whiche nowe deed euen almoste hundred yeare olde nether yet sata paste chyldeberynge stackered promes god thorow vnbelefe became stronge fayth gaue god prayse beynge full certyfyed promysed able also make good therfore reckened hym ryghtewesnes rom xv • neuertheles wrytten hym onely reckened ryghtewesnes also v shalbe coūted ryghtewesnes y• beleue rayseth vp iesus lorde deeth whiche delyuered oure synnes rose agayne iustifye v ¶ power fayth hope loue howe death god shed abrode oure hertes holy goost whiche geuen vnto v ephe ii co • 1 ii • whē yet weake accordynge tyme christe dyed v whiche vngodly yet scace wyll man dye ryghtewis man parauēture good man durste man dye ✚ ihon iii • 1 iohn • b god setteth loue towarde v seyng whyle yet synners ⚜ according tyme christ dyed v much thē seyng iustifyed hꝭ blode shall saued frō wrath thorowe hym yf enemyes reconcyled god deeth sonne moche seynge reconcyled shalbe preserued lyfe also ioye god meanes lorde iesus chryst haue nowe optayned attonment wherfore one man synne entred worlde 〈◊〉 〈◊〉 deeth meanes synne euen deeth also wente ouer men muche men synned euen vnto lawe sinne worlde synne imputed whan lawe neuerthelesse deeth raygned adam moyses euen ouer also synned lyke transgressyon dyd adam ☞ beareth similitude hym come gyfte lyke synne yf thorowe synne one many deed much plenteous vpon many grace god gyfte grace ioh • ▪ • ☞ geuen one man iesus christ gyfte ouer one synne deeth came thorowe one synne one synned damnacyon came oue synne vnto condemnacyon gyfte came iustify frō many sinnes yf synne one deeth raygned meanes one much whiche receaue aboundāce grace gyfte ryghtewesnes shal raygne lyfe y• meanes one saye iesus christe ✚ lyke wyse synne one sprange vp euell men condemnacyon euen ryghteousnes one spryngeth good vpon men ryghteousnes lyfe one mannes dysobedience many became synners obedience one shal many made ryghteous gal • • • lawe meane tyme entred synne shulde encreace neuerthelater aboundaunce synne plenteousnes grace synne raygned vnto deeth euen myght grace raygne thorowe ryghtewesnes vnto eternal lyfe help iesu chryste ⊢ ¶ muche delyuered thorowe christe synne muste fassy selues lyue serua • te god owne iustes vnlykely rewarde ryghteousnesse synne capi vi shall saye shall contynue sinne maye aboundaunce grace god forbyd howe shall deed touchynge synne lyue longer therin ✚ knowe ye •• l • iii • ollo ii b whiche baptysed iesu chryste baptysed dye hym buryed wyth baptime dye lykewyse chryst raysed vp death glorye father euen ephe 4 • also shuld walke newe lyfe yf graft death lyke vnto hym euen shal partaker resurreccyon knowynge olde man crucyfyed hym also bodye synne myght vtterly destroyed hence forth shulde seruauntes vnto synne deade iustyfyed synne wherfore 〈◊〉 ii b yf deade wt christ beleue shall also lyue hym knowyng chryste beynge raysed death apoca dyeth death hath power ouer hym touchynge dyed dyed concernynge synne touchynge lyueth lyueth vnto god lykewyse consydre ye also ye deade touchynge synne alyue vnto god thorowe iesus christe lord ⊢ let synne raygne therfore youre mortall bodye ye shulde therunto obey lustes neyther geue ye membres instrumētes vnryghtuousnes vnto synne gyue ouer selues vnto god deade alyue geue ouer member instrumentes ryghtuousnes vnto god let synne haue power ouer ☞ ye vnder lawe vnder grace shall synne vnder law vnder grace god forbyd ✚ knowe ye howe • bon • • ii petr soeuer ye commit youre selues seruauntes obey seruaūtes ye whō ye obey whether synne vnto death obediēce vnto rightuousnes god thā ked thoughe ye seruauntes synne ye haue yet obeyed hert vnto rule doctryne ye brought vnto iho viii rom 8 ye made fre synne become seruauntes ryghtuousnes ⊢ ✚ speake grosly infyrmitie fleshe ye haue gyuen member seruauntes vnclennes iniquitye one iniquitye another euen nowe gyue ouer member seruauntes vnto ryghtuousnes ye maye sanctyfied ye seruaūtes sine ye vnder rightuousnes frute ye thynges wherof ye nowe shamed ende thinges death nowe ye desyuered frome synne made y• seruaūtes god haue youre fruyte sanctifyed ende uerlastynge lyfe rewarde synne isgene ii • rom v • death eternal lyfe gyft god thorowe iesus christe lorde ¶ chryste hath deliuered v lawe death • ani sheweth flesshe outward man calleth lawe membres capi vii know ye brethrē speake y• know lawe howe law hath power ouer man longe endureth cor vii • woman whiche subieccyon man bounde lawe man longe lyueth yf man dead loosed lawe man math v • yf whyle man liueth couple selfe another man shalbe counted wedlocke breaker yf man deade fre lawe husbande wedlocke breaker though couple selfe another man euen ye also brother dead cō cernyng lawe body chryst ye shulde coupled another meane rysen agayne death shulde bryng forth frute vnto god fleshe iustes synne whiche steryd vp lawe raygned mēbers bryng forth frute vnto death nowe delyuered lawe deade vnto wherunto bondage shulde serue new conuersacion spyryte olde conuersacyon letter shal say law sinne god forbyd neuertheles rom v e gala 〈◊〉 • knewe • ine law knowen lust mente excepte lawe sayde exodi xx e deute v • thou shalte lust synne toke occasyon meanes commaundement wrought maner concupyscence verely without law sinne deade lyued without lawe whē commaundement came synne reuyued deade commaundemente whyche ordayned vnto lyfe founde vnto occasyon death synne toke occasyon meanes commaundemente dysceaued flewe wherforei timo b gala iii c lawe holy commaundement holy iust good whiche good made death vnto god forbyd naye synne synne myght appeare good worcke death synne cōmaundement myght measure synfull knowe lawe spiritual carnall ☞ esay 〈◊〉 ▪ • solde vnder synne ☞ alowe wold hate nowe whiche wolde consent vnto lawe good nowe synne dwelleth know saye flesshe dwellethgene vi • good thynge wyll presente fynde meanes perfourme whiche good good wolde • euyl whiche wold yf wolde synne dwelleth fynde lawe wolde good euyll presente wyth delyte lawe god inwarde man se another lawe member rebellynge agaynste lawe mynde subduyng vn lawe synne whyche member wretched man shall delyuer thys bodye subdued vnto death thanke god thorowe iesus christ lorde mynde serue lawe god fleshe thorowe iesus christe hath made ihon 8 rom vi fre lawe synne death hebre 7 c lawe could much weake fleshe perfourmed god luke xx b ihon 〈◊〉 b sent sonne symylitude synful flesshe ☞ synne damned synne flesshe ryghtuousnes lawe myght fulfylled v whyche walke flesshe spyryte carnall carnally minded • ut spiritual ghostly mynded carnally mynded death spiritually mynded lyfe peace ⊢ flesshy mynde enemite agaynste god obedyente lawe god neyther ☞ flesshe please god ye flesshe spiryte yf spirite god dwell mā haue spirite christ none christe body dead synne spiryte lyfe ryghtuousnesse sake wherfore yf spirite hym raysed vp iesus deathe dwell euen raysed vp christe death shall quycken mortall bodyes spirite dwelleth ✚ therfore brother detters fleshe lyue flesshe yf ye lyue flesshe ye pleasure god ⊢ ✚ know thynges worke best vnto loue god whiche also called purpose whiche knewe also ordayned shuld lyke fashyoned vnto shape hys sonne myght fyrste begotten sonne amonge many brother ouer appoynted also called ☞ hath called thē also iustyfied iustyfied thē also gloryfyed shal say thinges num • 4 b luke xx b yf god side agaynst v spared owne sonne ihon iii • • loy • iii gaue v al howe shulde gyue v thinges also shall lay thynge charge goddes chosen god iustyfyeth condempne christe whyche dyed yee rather whyche rysen agayne whiche also ryght hande god maketh intercessyon v canscyence also bearyng wytnes holy ghoste haue great heuynesse contynual sorowe hert exodi 32 • haue wyshed selfe cursed christ brother kynsmen pertaynyng flesshe whiche israelite whome partayneth adopcyon ⚜ chyldren glory couenauntes rom 3 • lawe gyuen seruyce god promise whose also father whome concernyge flesshe christe came whiche god thynges praysed euer amen speake thynges thought wordes god take none effect rom 〈◊〉 • israelytes whyche israel neither al chyldren straight way sede abraham gene xxi b isaac shall thy sede called say iohan • • rom 〈◊〉 • whiche chyldren flesshe child god chyldren promesse counted sede worde promes gene 1 • • aboute tyme wyl come sara shal haue sonne onely also rebecca wt chylde one euen father isaac er chyldren borne neither done good neither bad purpose god eleccyon might stāde sayde vnto reason workes caller gene 25 • elder shall serue yonger wrytten iacob haue loued esau haue hated shall say vnrightuousnes god god forbyd sayeth moises exodi 〈◊〉 wyl shew mercy soeuer shew mercy wyl haue compassyon whomsoeuer haue compassion lyeth man wyll cunnynge mercye god scripture sayeth vnto pharao exod ix euen thys purpose haue stered vp shewe power name myghte declared thorowe al worlde hath mereye wyl wyll maketh harde herted thou wylte say vnto blameth v yet hath bene ableesay xiv • • ne 〈◊〉 • e • 〈◊〉 ▪ 〈◊〉 • 〈◊〉 x ••• • ▪ resyst wyll man ar • e thou whiche disputest god▪ shall worke say worke man hast thou made fashyon hath potter power ouer clay euē • ōpe make one vessel vnto honoure another vn dyshonoure euen god wyllyng shew wrath make power knowen suffered wyth longe pacyence vessel wrathe ordayned dampnacyon declare ryches glorye vessel mercye whiche prepared vnto glorye also called iewes onely also gentyls sayeth also ose • wyll call themose • 〈◊〉 • 〈◊〉 〈◊〉 • people whiche people beloued whiche beloued haue optained mercy yhat optayned mercy shal come passe place sayd vnto ye people shall called chyldren lyuyng god fre haue e • 55 • droncke one spyrit body one member many fo • e saye hande y• body therfore body yf eare saye eye body therfore body body eye herynge heryng smellynge nowe hathe god set mēbers euery endeuour selues please hym mat xxv • rom 14 • must appere iudgement seate chryste euery man may receyue worckes bodye accordynge hath done whether good bad ✚ seyng knowe howe lorde feared fare fayre wyth men knowen well ynough vnto god trust also knowē conscience prayse selues agayne vnto gyue occasyon reioyce v ye may haue agaynst thē reioyce face herte yf feruent god feruent yf kepe measure cause kepe measure y• loue christ cōstrayneth v bycause thus iudge yf one dyed deade 2 ti • v c dyed whych lyue shuld hence forth lyue vnto selues vnto whych dyed rose agayne ⊢ wherfore hence forth vnto hath commytted v preachyng attonement nowe messenger rowme christ euē though god dyd beseche thorowe v praye christes stede ye reconcyled vnto god esay liii b rom • • made ☞ synne v whiche knewe synne meanes shulde ryghtuousnesse whiche god alowed ¶ exhortacyon receyue word god thankefulnesse amendement lyfe dyligence paule gospell howe warneth exchewe company heythen capi vi also helper exhort ye receyue grace god vayne sayeth esay xlix c haue herde tyme accepted day saluacion haue suckered beholde nowe accepted tyme beholde nowe day saluacyon let v gyue occasyon euyl offyce founde faute al thinges let v behaue selues • cori 4 minister god much paciēce affliccyons necessyties anguyshes strypes presonmē te strytes laboures watchīges fastinges purenes knowledge lōge suffryng kyndnes holy ghoste loue vnfaynedly word truth power god armour ryghtuousnes ryght hande lefte honoure dishonour euyl report good reporte disceyuers yet true vnknowen yet knowē dying behold lyue chastned killed sorowing yet alway mery pore yet make many ryche hauyng nothyng yet possessyng al thynges ye corinthian mouth opē vnto hert made large ye strayte v strayte youre owne bowel promyse vnto lyke reward vnto chyldren set selues large ✚ deute 7 • beare ye yocke vnbeleuers fellyshyp hath ryghtuousnes vnryghtuousnes company hath lyght wyth dackenesse math 8 concorde hath christe wyth beliall eyther parte hath beleueth infydell howe agreeth temple god ymages ye • corin 3 b 〈◊〉 vi temple lyuynge god sayde god exodi 29 • leuit 26 • ezech 37 • wyll dwell amonge walcke among wyll god shall people wherfore esay lii • come among seperate selues sayth lorde touche none vncleane thyng wyll receyue wil father vnto ye shalbe sonnes daughter sayth lorde almyghty ¶ • e exhorteth receyue promyses god thā kefully corynthyans commanded • •• 〈◊〉 〈◊〉 loue towarde paule capi vii seynge haue suche promyses de rely beloued let v clense selues frō fylthynes flesshe spyryte growe vp full holynes feare god understande v haue hurte man haue corrupte man haue defraudyd man speake condemne haue shewed ye hertes dye liue bolde ouer reioyse greatly fylled wyth comforte excedynge ioyouse oure trybu lacion come macedonia actes 16 • flesshe rest troubled euery syde outwarde fyghting inward fere neuerthelesse 1 cori god comforteth absecte comforted v commynge titus hys commynge onely also consolacyon receyued tolde v desyre wepyng feruent mynde reioysed thoughe made sory wt letter repent though dyd repent perceyue epistle made sory though season nowe reioyce ye sory ye sorowed ye repented ye sorowed godly nothynge ye hurte v godly sorowe causeth repentaunce vnto saluacyon repēted cōtrary wyse eccle 30 8 worldly sorowe causeth death beholde dylygence godly sorowe ye toke hathe wrought yee caused cleare selues caused indignacyon caused feare caused desyre caused emutacyon caused punyshement al thynges ye haue shewed youre selues ye cleare matter wherfore thoughe wrote vnto dyd cause done hurt nether cause hurt good mīde v myght appeare among syght god therfore cōforted ye comforted yee excedyngely ioyed ioy tytus hys spiryt refresshed therfore ashamed though bosted selfe hī al thīges spake vnto true euen bosting made vnto titus foūde true inwarde affeccyon aboundaunt towarde remembreth obedience al howe feare trēblyng ye receyued hym reioyse maye bolde ouer thinges ¶ putteth remembraunce helpe pore saintes ierusalem accordynge macedonian dyd capi viii certyfie brother grace god whiche gyuen congregacions macedonia howe aboundaunce reioysynge tryed wt muche tribulacyon though excedynge poore yet haue gyuen excedyng rychely synglenes theyr power bere recorde ye beyōde theyr power willyng owne accorde prayed v great instaūce wold receyue benefyte suffre partaker wyth actes xi • cor xvi • 〈◊〉 cor ix rom xv ministring sanctes dyd loked gaue selues fyrste lorde vnto v wyll god coulde desyre tytus accomplyshe benyuolence amonge also euen begonne nowe therfore ye ryche al party fayth worde knoweledge feruentnes loue whyche ye haue v euen se ye plentuous beniuolence also saye commaundyng feruentnes alowe vntaynednesse youre loue towarde men ye knowe lyberalyte lorde iesus christ though rom x • ryche yet sake became poore ye thorowe pouertye myght made ryche gyue councel hereto expe • tent whiche beganne onely also wyl yere agoo nowe therfore performe thynge whiche ye begāne redynes wyl euen ye may performe dede pet iiii • proue iii b mat xii ye haue luke xxi yf first wyllyng mynde accepted accordynge man hath accordynge hath mynde set ease ye brought combraunce egalnes tyme aboūdance may sucker lack theyr aboundaunce may supplye lacke may equalite agreynge written ex • xvi • muche aboundaunce lytle neuerthelesse thankes vnto god put good mīde hert titus accepted request ye rather well wyllynge owne accorde came vnto haue sēt brother whose laude gospel thorowe al cō gregacions onely also chosen congregcions felowe v iourney concernyng beniuolēce mynistred v vnto prayse lorde stere vp prōpte mynde exchewe mā shulde rebuke v plentuous distribucyon rom xii c ministred v ⚜ glory lorde make prouision honest thinges onely syght lorde also syght men haue sent thē brother haue ofte tymes proued dyligent many thynges nowe much dilygent great confidence haue • hathe caused partely titus sake whiche felowe helper cōcernyng partely bicause whiche oure brother messēgers congregacions glory christ wherfore shewe ye vnto profe loue 〈◊〉 ii • boastyng syght congregacions ¶ chapyter dothe dyd chapyter goyng moueth helpe poore brother ierusalem capi ix actes xi • cori 16 • ii cori 8 • rom 〈◊〉 • mynystryng saynctes superfluous wrytre vnto knowe redynes youre mynde wherof boast selfe vnto macedonia achaia prepared yere ago ensāple hath prouoked many neuerthelesse yet haue sent brother lest oure boastyng whiche make shulde vayne behalfe ye haue sayde maye prepare selues lest peraduenture yf macedonia come wyth fynde vnprepared saye ye shulde ashamed matter boasting wherfore thought necessary exhorte brother come hande vnto prepare good blessynge promysed afore myghte ready blessinge defraudyng ✚ yet saye whiche soweth lytell shall reepe lytell prou xi b gala vi soweth plenteously shal reepe plenteously leteuery man accordynge hath purposed hys herte groudgyngly necessyte exo xxv 〈◊〉 xxxv • 〈…〉 〈◊〉 • god loueth chearfull geuer god able make ryche grace ye thynges hauing sufficient vnto vtmoste maye ryche vnto manner good worcke wrytten psa xxii b hathe sparsed abroade hathe geuen poore rightewesnes remayneth euer mynystreth seed vnto sower mynyster breed also fode multyplye seed increace frutes youre ryghtwesnes ⊢ partes ye maye made ryche ☞ synglenes causeth thorowe v thankes geuen vnto god office mistracyon onely supplyeth nede saynctes also aboundaunt thys laudable ministryng thankes myght geuen god many prayse god obedience youre consenting gospel christ youre singlenes distrybutynge men theyr prayer whiche longe aboundaunte grace god thanckes vnto god hys vnspekeable gy • ce ¶ • ou • h hath false apostle defendeth auctoryte callynge capi x paule selfe beseche mekenes softnes christ present among reputacion bolde towarde beyng absent besech nede bold presente wyth confydence wyth supposed haue bene bolde agaynste whiche repute v though walcked carnally though walke flesshe yet warre fleshly ephe vi • weapens warrefare carnal thinges thing mighty god cast downe stronge holdes wherwith ouerthrow councels euery hye thynge exalteth selfe agaynste knowledge god brynge captyuyte ymagynacyon obedyence chryste ready take vengeaunce al disobedyence obedience fulfilled loke ye thinges vtter apperaunce man trust selfe christes let consydre againe hī selfe chrystes euen christes though boast selfe auctorite whiche lorde hath geuen v 2 cor xiii edyfye destroye shal shame lest shuld seme though wēt make afraid wyth letter epystles sayth sore stronge bodyly presence weake hys speache rude let thyncke wise wordes letter absent suche dedes present cannot fynde oure hertes make oure selues nombre compare oure selues whyche prayse selues neuerthelesse whyle measure selues wyth selues compare selues selues vnderstande nought wyll reioyce aboue measure according measure rule god hath distributed vnto v measure reache euen vnto stretche selues beyonde measure though reached vnto euen also haue come gospell chryste boast selues measure men labour yee hope wyl come passe youre faythe increased among shal magnyfyed accordynge oure measure largely shall preache gospell regyons whyche beyonde boaste thynges whyche onother man measure prepared already let reioyseth reioyse lorde praiseth hym selfe alowed whome lorde prayseth ¶ paul vnder sufferaunce cominendeth selfe defendeth auctoryte agaynst false prophetes capi xi wolde god ye coulde haue suffred lytell folyshnes yee ye also forbeare gelous ouer godly gelousy haue coupled one man make chast vyrgyn christe feare leste come passe serpente geue iii • begyled eue thorowe hys su • teltye euen 〈2 page missing〉 ❧ epistle sayncte paul apostle vnto galathyans ¶ paule raised vp deathe brother unto congregacyons galacia rom cori • ii cori • grace wyth peace god father oure lorde iesus chryste whyche gaue hym selfe oure sinnes delyuer v present euyll worlde accordinge wyll god oure father whome praise euer euer amen maruayle ye sone turned christ called grace vnto another gospell nothynge el whiche trouble ••••• xv intende peruerte gospell chryste speake vnto men vnto god go aboute please men iob xxxi yf hytherto studied please men seruaunt chryst ✚ certifye brother gospel preached maner men neyther receaued lerned man reuelacion iesus chryste ye haue heard conuersacyon tyme paste iewes waye howe beyonde measure acte viii ix xxii xxvi b • cori x • • persecuted congregacion god spoyled preuayled iewes way aboue many cōpaniōs myne owne nacion phili iii beyng feruent mayntener tradicions elder pleosed god seperated mother wombe actes ix • called hereunto grace declare hys sonne shuld preache hym among heathen immediatly commened matter wyth mat x •• • flesshe bloude neyther returned ierusalem whiche apostels wente wayes arabia came agayne vnto damasco thre yeare returned ierusalem se peter abode wyth hym xv dayes apostle sawe none saue iames lordes brother thynges whyche wryte vnto beholde god lye act • xxii • came coastes siria cilicia vnknowen touchinge person vnto congregacions iewrye chryste hearde onely persecuted v tyme paste nowe preacheth faythe destroyed gloryfyed god ⊢ ¶ withstandeth peter face proueth lawe circumcision necessary saluacion capi ii xiiij yeres therafter wente vp agayne ierusalem actes x • • barnabas toke titus went vp also reuelacyon commened gospel preache amonge gentyls specially wyth whyche counted chefe leest shulde runne runne vayne also titus whiche though greke yet compelled circumcysed incommers beinge false brother came preuely spy lybertye whiche haue chryste iesus myght brynge v bondage whome gaue rowme tyme concernynge brought insubieccyon trueth gospel myght continue whiche semed somwhat tyme passed maketh matter • pat x • x • rom ii • actes x • ephe 6 • collo iii • eccle • 5 • god loketh outwarde apperaunce man neuertheles semed great added nothinge contrary wyse sawe gospell ouer vncyrcumcysion commytted vnto gospell ouer circumcysyon commytted vnto peter myghtye peter apostleshyppe ouer cyrcumcysyon myghtye amonge gentyles perceaued grace geuen vnto iames cephas iohn semed pyllers gaue barnabas ryght handes feloshippe shulde apostle amonge heathen circumcisyon onely shulde remember poore •••• xi 〈◊〉 cori ix wherin also diligent peter come antioche withstode opēly worthy blamed yet y• certayne came iames dyd eate gentyls come withdrue seperated selfe fearynge thē whiche circumcysyon iewes dissembled well muche barnabas also brought theyr simulacyon sawe went ryght waye trueth gospel sayde vnto peter yf thou beynge iewe lyuest maner gentyls iewes causest yu gentyls lyue iewes whiche philip 3 〈…〉 iii c iewes nature synners gentyls knowe mā ‡ iustified dedes lawe fayth iesus christe haue beleued iesus chryste myght iustifyed fayth chryste dedes lawe dedes lawe flesshe shall iustifyed whyll seke made ryghtewes christ selues founde sinner christ y• minister synne god forbyd yf buylde agayne thynges whiche destroyed▪ make selfe trespaser ☞ thorowe lawe haue bene deed lawe might lyue vnto god crucifyed wt christe yet lyue neuerthelesse nowe nat chryste lyueth lyfe whiche nowe lyue flesshe lyue fayth sōne god ephes v • whiche loued gaue hym selfe despyce grace god 〈…〉 4 c yf ryghtewesnes come lawe chryste dyed vayne ¶ rebuketh vnstedfastnesse galathyans shewynge vnparfectnesse lawe declareth neuerthelesse geuen nought capi iii oye folysshe galathyans hathe bewitched ye shulde beleue trueth whō iesus christe described eye amōge crucifyed wolde learne whether ye receaued spirit dedes lawe prechynge fayth ye vnwyse ye haue begone spyryte ye nowe ende flesshe many thinges ye haue suffred vaine yf also vayne moreouer ministreth spyrite worketh myracles amonge doth thorowe dedes lawe prachyng fayth gene xv • rom 4 iacob 〈◊〉 euen abraham beleued god asscrybed hī ryghtewesnes ye knowe therfore whiche fayth leuit •• • iust shall lyue fayth lawe fayth ez▪ x • • rom x • mā fulfylleth thinges contayned lawe shall lyue thē christ hath delyuered v frō curse lawe muche made curse v wrytten deu xx •• • cursed euery one hāgeth tree blessynge abraham myght come gentyls thorowe iesus christ ye myght receaue promes spirit thorowe fayth brother spake maner mē though man testament yet man despyseth addeth thynge ther yf alowed ✚ abraham seed promyses made sayth seedes many thy seed one christ saye lawe whiche beganne warde beyonde gene xv • exodi xii f iudith v b actes vii foure c thyrtye yeares doth disanul testamente confermed afore god vnto chryste warde make promes none effecte rom iiii c yf inheritaunce come lawe commeth nowe promes god gaue vnto abraham promes wherfore thē serueth y• foundacions worlde layde shuld holy without blame thorowe loue ordeyned v thorow iesus christ heyres vnto selfe accordynge good pleasure hys wyll prayse glorye grace hath made v accepted thorow beloued collo • haue redempcyon thorowe bloude euen forgeuenes synnes accordynge ryches hys grace wher hathe ministred vnto v aboundantly wysdome prudence hathe opened vnto v mystery hys wyll accordynge hys good pleasure whiche purposed hym selfe haue declared gala iiii tyme ful come myght set vp thynges perfectly chryste bothe thynges whiche heuen thynges earth euen hym made heyres therto wrought christe raysed deed psal ix • set hym hys ryght hande heauenly thynges aboue dani vii rule power myght domynyon aboue euery name named worlde onely also worlde come psal viii b hebre ii • 1 cori x • • hathe put al thynges vnder fete hathe made hym aboue thynges ephes v • collo c heed congregacyon whiche hys body fulnes hym fylleth ¶ paul sheweth maner people theyr conuersyon nowe chryste amonge al oure conuersacyon also tyme past lustes oure flesshe fulfylled lustes oure flesshe fulfylled wyll flesshe mynde ☞ nature chyldren wrath euen well god rych mercy great loue wherwith loued v euen whē deed synnes quickened v together chryst e • ay 25 garce ye saued raysed v vp together hym made v sytte together amonge heauen christe iesu tyme come myght shewe y• exceadynge ryches hys grace kyndnes v warde thorow chryst iesu grace ye made safe thorowe fayth youre selues gyfte god cōmeth workes lest mā shuld boast selfe worckmanshyppe created christ iesu vnto • • u good workes whych god ordayned shulde walke wherfore remēbre ye beyng tyme passed gentyls flesshe called phil iii •• lio ii b vncircumcysyon whiche called circumcision flesshe whiche circumcisyon made handes remembre say tyme ye without christe beyng al • ātes frō cōmē welth israel straungers frō testamentes promes hope without god worlde nowe meanes christ iesu ye whiche somtyme farre made nye bloude christ peace whiche hath made one hathe broken downe wall stoppe bitwene v hath also put awaye thorowe hys flesshe ☞ cause hatred euen lawe commaundemē te cōtayned law wrytten make • wane one newe man hym selfe makyng peace reconcile vnto god one body thorow crosse slew hatred thereby came preached peace whiche farre ny • thorow hī haue entraū ce one spirite vnto father ✚ nowe therfore ye straungers foreners cytesyns sayntes housholde god bylt vpon thei • • b •• ay 〈◊〉 actes iiii b foundacion apostle prophetes rom ix • psal 〈◊〉 • mat xxi actes iiii • petr ii b iesus christ selfe beynge head corner stone buyldyng soeuer coupled togyther groweth vnto holy temple lorde ye also buylt togyther habitacion god thorow ⚜ holy ghost ⊢ ¶ sheweth cause hys presonmente desyreth saynte trouble prayeth god make stedfast spirit capi iii thys • ause paule prysoner iesus christ heythen ye haue hearde ministracyon grace god • eo xiii gyuen ward forgala b reuelacyon shewed mystery vnto wrote afore fewe wordes wherby ye reade ye may vnderstande knowledge mystery christ whiche mistery tymes passed opened vnto sōnes men nowe declared vnto holy apostle prophetes spyrit gentyls shulde inheritours also body partaker promes christ meanes gospell wherof made mynyster accordynge gyfte grace god whiche gyuen vnto workyng power unto thei cori xv • least al saynctes grace gyuen shulde preache amonge gentylles vnsearcheable ryches chryste make al men se felowshyppe mysterye whyche frome begynnyng worlde hath bene hyd god whych made al thynges thorow iesus chryste intente nowe vnto ruler power heauenly thynges might knowen congregacion manyfold wysdome god accordyng eternall purpose whiche wrought christ iesu lord haue boldnesse entraūce confydence whiche fayth ✚ wherfore desyre ye faynt trybulaciōs collo • suffre sake whiche youre prayse cause bowe knee vnto father lorde iesus christ whiche father ouer called father heauen earth wolde graunt accordynge ryches hys glorye ye may strengthed myght spirite inner man christ may dwell hertes fayth ye beyng roted groūded loue myght able comprehende wyth saynctes bredth length deepth heyth knowe excellente loue knowledge christ ye myght fulfylled al fulnes whiche commeth god unto hym able excedynge aboūdantly aboue al aske thinke accordyng power worketh v prayse cōgregacyon iesꝰ christ thoroweout generacyons tyme tyme amen ¶ exhorteth vnto mekenes laye asyde olde conuersacyon gredy lustes walcke newe lyfe capi iiii therfore whyche prysonner lordes exhorte • co▪ 7 ye walke worthy vocacyon wherwith ye called lowlynes mekenes wyth humblenes mynde forbearynge one another thorowe loue diligent kepe vnite spirite thorow bonde peace beynge one body one spirite euen ye called one hope callynge let one lorde one fayth one baptyme one god father whyche aboue al thorow al ⊢ ✚ rom xii • cori xii unto euery one v gyuen grace accordynge measure gyfte christ wherfore sayeth psal 〈◊〉 • whan went vp hye ledde captiuitye captyue gaue gyftes vnto men ascended meaneth also descended fyrste lowest partes earth ihon iii • descēded euen also ascended vp aboue heauens fulfyl al thynges made • cori xii d▪ math x • 〈◊〉 〈◊〉 • apostle prophetes euangelystes shepherdes teacher edifying saynctes worke ministracyon euen edifying body chryst tyll al come vnyte fayth knowledge sonne god vnto perfecte man vnto measure full perfecte age chryste ⊢ hence forth shulde chyldren •• • ii b waueryng caried euery wynde doctryne wylynes men thorowe craftynes wherby laye wayte v deceyue v let v folowe trueth loue thynges growe hym ephes • • • •• llo • whiche heade euen christ yf body coupled knet togyther thorowe euery ioynt wherwith rom xii b • • •• xii • one mynistreth another accordynge operacyon euery parte hath measure increseth body vnto edifying self thorowe loue ✚ say therfore testyfye thorow lord ye hence forth walke rom • • • • p ••• 4 • gentylles walcke vanyte mynde blynded vnderstandyng beyng farre godly lyfe meanes ignorancy blyndnes theyr hertes whiche beyng past repentaunce haue gyuen selues ouer vnto wantōnes worke maner vnclennes euen gredines ye haue learned christ ye haue hearde haue bene taught truth iesu concernynge conuersacyon tyme past laye olde man whych corrupte accordynge deceauable lustes ⊢ ✚ renued also spirite mynde rom 6 collo iii put new man god shapen rightuousnes true holynes wherefore l • uit 19 c put awaye lyinge speake euery man trueth vnto hys neyghboure muche member one another ☞ psal ii •• • angrye synne let sōne go downe vpon wrath neyther giue place vnto backbiter leuit xix • let hym stole steale nomore • tessa • • let rather labour handes thyng whiche good may giue vnto nedeth ⊢ let fylthy communicacion procede mouth whiche good edyfy withal oft nede may mynyster grace vnto hearer greue ye holy spiryte god rom • • • 〈◊〉 • • • • ye sealed vnto daye redempcyon let bytternes fearsnesse wrath rorynge cursed speakyng put awaye malycyousnes ye curteous one another mercyful forgeuyng one another euen god christes sake hath forgeuen ¶ exhorteth vnto loue warneth ware al vnclennesse teacheth howe woman shuld obey ryghtuousnes trueth ⊢ accepte whyche pleasynge vnto lorde haue felowshyppe wyth vnfruytefull workes darckenes rather rebuke shame euen name thynges whiche done thē secret al thinges rebuked lyghte manyfest whatsoeuer manifest light wherfore sayeth awake thou slepest stande vp death christ shal gyue lyght ✚ take hede therefore howe ye walcke • irc •• spectly vnwise wyse mē auoydynge occasyon dayes euyll wherfore ye vnwyse vnderstande wyl lorde droncke wyne wherin excesse fylled spirite speakyng vnto youre selues psal 33 • ollo iii c psalmes hymnes spiritual songes syngyng making melodie lord hertes gyuyng thankes alwayes al thynges vnto god father name oure lorde iesus christ submyttyng selues one another feare god ⊢ ye wemē submyt selues vnto owne husbandes vnto lorde gene ii husbāde wiues head euē christ • cori xi • 〈◊〉 • • head congregacion ministreth saluacion vnto body therfore congregacion subieccyon christ lyke wyse let wemē also subieccion husbandes thynges ye husbādes loue wyues euē christ also loued cōgregacion gaue selfe sanctyfye clensed fountayne water thorowe worde make vnto selfe gloryous congregaciō without spot wrynckle thyng shulde holy without blame ought men loue wyues owne bodyes loueth wyfe loueth mā euer yet hated owne flesshe norysheth cheryssheth euē lorde doth congregacion mēbers body hys flesshe bone gene ii •• 〈◊〉 • marke • • • cori 〈◊〉 • 〈◊〉 • • cause shall man leue father mother shalbe ioyned vnto wyfe two shalbe made one flesshe great secrete speake christ congregacion neuerthelesse ye euery one loue wyfe euen informacion lorde ye seruaūtes obedyent vnto thē bodely maisters feare tremblyng euen synglenes youre herte vnto christe doynge seruyce vnto eye▪ go please men seruauntes christ doyng wyl god herte wt good wyl seruyng lorde men knowyng soeuer good thīg man doth shall receyue agayne god whether bōde fre ye maisters euen thynges vnto thē puttyng away threatninges knowyng master also heauen •• p tichicus deare brother faythfull mynyster lorde shall shewe al thynges haue sent vnto purpose ye myght knowe case stande ye myght comforte hertes peace vnto brother loue wyth fayth god father lord iesus christ grace whiche loue lorde iesus christ vnfaynedly amen ¶ sente rome vnto ephesyans tichicus ❧ epystle saynte paule apostle phyllippians ¶ exhorteth increase loue knowledge experyence godly thynges capi paule timothe seruaūtꝭ iesu christ al saynctes christ iesu whiche philippos byshops deacon grace vnto peace god father lorde iesus christ ✚ thancke god wyth remembraunce rom b collo wayes al prayer pray gladnes ye come fellowshyppe gospel fyrst daye vnto nowe ✚ surely certyfyed whiche hath begōne good worke shall perfourme vntyll day iesus christ becommeth iudge haue herte forasmuch ye cōpanyons grace euen bondes defendyng stably shynge gospell god recorde howe greately longe herte rote iesus christe ephe thys praye loue maye increace yet knowledge vnderstandynge ye may accept thinges excellent ye may pure suche hurte mānes conscyence vntyl day christ beyng filled frute ryghtuousnes frute cōmeth iesus christ vnto glory prayse god ⊢ wolde ye shulde vnderstand brother thynges happened vnto chaūced vnto great furtheraunce gospell bandes christ manifest thorowe iudgement hal al place muche many brother lorde beynge encoraged thorowe bādes dare boldly speake worde without fere preache christe enuye stryfe good wyl one parte preacheth chryste stryfe sincerely supposyng adde aduersyte bandes agayne yt preache loue know set defende gospel christ preached maner waye whether occasion true meanyng glad therof ye wyl glad knowe thys shall chaunce saluacyon ii corin • thorowe prayer mynystrynge spirite iesu christ according expectacion hope nothynge shalbe ashamed wyth boldenesse wayes euen nowe also christ shalbe magnyfyed body whether thorow lyfe thorowe death christ lyfe death auauntage chaunce lyue fleshe thyng frutefull worcke shal chose wote cōstrayned two thynges ii cori v • vesyre loosed christ much better neuerthelesse abyde flesshe nedefull sure shall abyde cōtinue furtheraunce ioye youre fayth reioysyng may aboundant thorowe iesus christ commyng agayne onely let conuersacyon ephe iiii becommeth gospell christ whether come se el absente maye yet condycyon ye cō tynue one spirite one soule labourynge mayntayne fayth gospell nothynge fearyng aduersaries cause perdycion saluacyon god vnto gyuen christ onely ye shulde beleue hym also suffre sake hauyng euen fight ye sawe nowe heare ¶ exhorteth vnyte brotherly loue beware stryfe vayne glory sure ensample sayeth chryst capi ii therfore consolacyon christ yf comforte loue yf fellyshyp spirite yf compassyon mercy fulfyll ye ioye ye lyke mynded hauynge one loue beyng one accord one mynde nothynge done thorowe stryfe vayne glory mekenes mynde let euery man esteme another better hym selfe corin x • 13 b loke ye euery man owne thynges euery man thinges men ✚ let mynde also christe iesu whyche whā shape god thought robbery equal wt god neuertheles made selfe reputacion takyng shape seruaūt hebre v • became lyke vnto men foūde apparell man hūbled selfe became obedyent vnto death euen death crosse wherfore god also hath exalted hye gyuen name aboue al name math • name iesus rom 14 • esay 45 • euery knee shulde bowe thynges heauen thinges earth thynges vnder earth tonges shulde confesse iesus christ actes 2 • rom 14 b lorde vnto prayse god father ⊢ wherfore derely beloued ye haue alwayes obeyed presente onely much myne absence euen worcke youre owne saluacyon feare tremblynge ii corin 3 b god whiche worketh wyll also dede euen good wyl 1 petr 4 • thynge without murmurynge dysputynge • petr • b ye maye suche man cōplayne vnfayned sonnes god without rebuke middes croked peruerse nacyon amonge se ye shyne lyghtes worlde holdynge fast worde lyfe maye ii corin c tessa ii c reioise day christ haue runne vaine nether haue laboured vayne yee though offred vp vpon offerynge sacrifice fayth reioyce reioyce cause also ye reioyce reioyce trust lorde iesus actes xvi sende timotheus shortly vnto 1 tessa 3 b also maye good comforte knowe case ye stande haue man lyke mynded whych pure affeccyon wyll care youre matter seke theyr owne thinges iesus christꝭ ye knowe proffe howe sonne father hath bestowed hys seruyce gospel hym therfore hope sende assone knowe howe wyl go trust lord also selfe shall come shortly supposed necessary soude brother epaphroditus vnto companyon labour felowe soudyer youre apostle whyche also mynystreth vnto nede longed al full heuynes ye hearde saye bene sycke dout sycke much nye vnto death god mercy hym hym onely also least shulde haue sorowe vpon sorowe sent hym therfore dylygentlye ye se ye may reioyce againe may lesse sorowefull receyue hym therfore lord gladnes rom xv • tessa v c make muche suche worcke christe went farre nye vnto death regarded life fulfyll whiche lackyng part towarde ¶ warneth beware false teacher calleth dogges enemyes christe reproueth mannes owne ryghtuousnes capi iii ouer brethen reioyce ye lorde greueth wryte one thynge often sure thynge beware dogges beware euyll worker beware dissencion rom ii eph • ii c circumcision serue god ihon iiii c rom • spirit reioyce christ iesu haue cōfydēce flesshe though myght also reioyce fleshe yf man thinketh hath wherof myght trust fleshe • haue circūcised eyght day kynred israel trybe beniamin ii 〈…〉 ebrue borne ebrues 〈…〉 cō cernynge lawe pharisaye concernyng feruentnes persecuted cōgregacyon touchyng ryghtuousnes lawe vnrebukable math 13 • thynges vauntage vnto counted losse chrystes sake yee thynke thynges losse excellencye knowledge christe iesu lorde haue counted al thyng loste iudge vyle may wynne christ founde hym hauynge myne owne ryghtuousnes lawe whiche thorowe fayth christe euen ryghtuousnes whiche cōmeth god thorow fayth may knowe vertue resurreccion fellowshyp passion cōformable vnto death yf meanes myght attayne vnto resurreccyon deade haue attayned vnto al redy redy perfecte folowe yf may cōprehende wherin comprehended christ iesu brother coūte selfe haue gotten yet one thing say forget thinges whiche behynde endeuoure selfe vnto thynges accordyng marke appoynted preace rewarde hye callyng god thorow christ iesu let v therfore many perfect thus wyse mynded yf ye wyse mynded god shall open also vnto neuerthelesse vnto haue attayned vnto let v procede one rule may one accorde ✚ corin 4 c x brother folowers togither loke whiche walcke euen ye haue v ensāple many walke haue tolde often tel wepynge enemyes crosse christ whose ende damnacion rom 16 • whose bely god glory shame whiche worldly mynded cō uersacion heauē whence loke sauiour euen lord iesus christ whiche shal cor xv g chaunge vyle bodye may make like vnto glorious body accordig workyng wherby able also subdue al thynges vnto selfe ⊢ saluteth certayne exhorteth honest conuersacyon thanketh prouisyon made beynge pryson capi iiii therfore brother derely beloued longed ioy crowne cōtinu lord ye beloued praye euodias besech smtiches one accord lord yee besech faithful yock felowe helpe
