careful nothing prayer supplicacion let peticions manifest vnto god wyth geuyng thankes peace god whiche passeth vnderstandyng kepe youre hertes myndes thorowe christ iesu furthermore brother whatsoeuer thyn ge true whatsoeuer thyngꝭ honest whatsoeuer thynges iuste whatsoeuer thynges pare whatsoeuer thynges conuenyent whatsoeuer thynges honest reporte yf vertue yf prayse lernyng haue ye minde ye haue lerned receyued herde also sene thynges god peace shalbe wyth reioyse lord greatly last youre care reuyued agayne wherin ye also carefull ye lacked oportunite speake necessite haue lerned whatsoeuer estate tim • therwith content lowe hye euery al thynges instructed ful hongry haue plenty suffre nebe al thynges thorow christ strengneth notwithstandyng ye haue wel done ye bare part tribulacyon ye philippos knowe also gynnynge gospell departed macedonia cōgregacion bare part concernynge geuynge receyuynge ye onely thessalonica ye sente afterwarde agayne vnto necessyte desyre gyftes desyre aboūdant frute parte neuertheles receyued al haue plentye euē fylled recey ned epaphrodytus thynges whyche sent frō odoure swete smell rom est • hebre 13 c sacrifice accepted pleasaunt god god shall supplye youre nede thorowe hys gloryous ryches iesu chryst unto god oure father prayse euermore amē salute al saynctes christ iesu brother grete al saynctes salute moste hys gloryous power vnto pacyence longe sufferyng ioyfulnes ⊢ geuyng thākes vnto father hath made v mete partaker inheritaunce sayntes lyght hath delyuered v power derknes hath translated v kyngdome preeminence pleased father shulde fulnes • wel hym 〈…〉 reconcyle al thyng vnto hym self set peace thorow bloud crosse thynges heauen thinges earth rom v ephe ii collo ii • somtyme farre enemyes myndes set euyll worckes hath nowe yet reconcyled body hys flesshe thorow death make holy vnblameable faute owne syght yf ye contynue grounded stablysshed fayth moued awaye hope gospell wherof ye haue herde howe preached amonge cratures vnder heauen wherof paule made mynister nowe ioy ii cori suffrynges ephe iii • fulfyl whiche behynde passyons christ flesshe bodyes sake congregacyon wherof made minyster accordyng ordinaunce god ordynaunce gyuen vnto warde fulfyll worde god ephe iii b mystery hath bene hyd sence worlde beganne sence begynnyng generacyons math xi ii cori 2 c ephe opened sainctes god wolde make knowen glorious rich mistery amonge gentyls whiche ryches christ hope glory preach warnyng men teachynge men wysdome make men perfect christ iesu wherin also laboure stryue euen farforth strength worketh myghtely ¶ greate care paule toke congregacyons eruorteth thē sted fast christe ware 〈◊〉 teacher worldely wysdome descrybeth • 〈◊〉 prophetes capi ii wolde ye knewe howe great care haue laodicia many haue sene person flesshe hertes myght comforted whan knet togyther loue al rich full vnderstādyng know mystery god father chryste hyd al treasure wysdome knowledge ephe v • ▪ say worlde christ dwelleth fulnes god head bodely ye •• plete whiche head al rule power whō also ye rom ii ephes ii c collo ii b circūcysed circūcisyd whych done without handes asmuch ye haue put synful body flesshe thorow circūcision chryst rom vi gala iii ye buried thorow bap tyme ye also rysen agayne tho rowe fayth wrought operacy god whiche raysed death rom v ephe ii collo c ye whā ye dead thorow synne thorowe vncyrcumcysion youre flesshe hath guyckened hym hath forgyuen v trespaces ⊢ hathe put hāde wrytyng v contayned law wrytten hath taken way hath faste ned crosse hath gene iii c luke xi c ihon xii c spoyled rule power hath made shewe openly hath tryumphed ouer owne person let man therfore trouble cōscyen ce aboute meate dryncke pece holy daye newe mone saboth dayes debr • 8 x whiche shaddowes thīges come body christ let man make shot wronge marcke hūblenes holynes angel thynges neuer sawe beyng causelesse puft vp fleshly mynde holdeth head wherof al body ioyn te couple receyueth norysshment knet together increaseth increasyng commeth god wherfore yf ye dead christ fromgala iiii b ordinaūces world though ye yet lyued world ye led tradicions touche tast handle whiche al peryshe thorowe abuse commaundementes doctrynes men thynges outwardly haue symilitude wysdome superstycion humblenes hurting body flesshe worshyppe vnto nede therof ¶ putteth remembraunce spirytuall resurreccyon laye asyde maner corrupte lyuyng frutefull godlynisie vertue sheweth degree duetye capi iii ✚ ye rysen agayne chryste seke thiges aboue christe sytteth ephes hebre x c xii • ryght hande god set youre affeccyon thinges aboue thynges whiche earth ye dead lyfe hyd christ god soeuer chryste lyfe shal shewe selfe shall ye also appere glory ⊢ ☞ mortyfie therfore earthy membres fornycacion vnclennes vnnaturall lust euyll coucupyscence couetousnes worshyppyng ydoles thynges sake wrathe god vseth come chyldren vnbelefe ephe ii amonge ye walcked somtyme ye lyued nowe put ye philip ephes collo alwaye makynge mencion prayer without ceasynge call remembraunce worcke faithe laboure te 4 loue ye haue contynued hope • tim oure lorde iesus christe syght god oure father ✚ knowe brother beloued god howe ye electe oure gospell came vnto cori ii worde onely also power holy gooste much certayntye thes ii • ye knowe maner behaued selues among youre sake ye became folowers v lorde receauynge worde muche afliccyon ioye holy goost ye ensample beleue macedonia achaia sounded worde lorde macedonia achaia onely youre faythe also whiche ye haue vnto god spred selfe abroade quarter nedeth v speake thynge selues shewe maner entryng vnto ye tourned god ymages serue lyuynge true god loke hys sone actes b heauen whome raysed deeth ⊢ euen iesus delyuereth v ihon iii b wrath come capi ii ¶ putteth mynde godly conuersacyon led among preached gospell vnto thanketh god receaue hys worde frutefully excuseth absence ye youre selues thes b brother knowe oure entraunce vnto howe vayne euen suffred actes xvi c shamefull entreated philippos ye knowe bolde oure god speake vnto gospel god z ••• xv • • muche striuing exhortacyon bringe erroure yet vnclennes neyther gyle alowed god gospol shulde commytted vnto v euen speake gala b please men god whiche tryeth oure hertes neyther led oure connersacy tyme flatterynge wordes ye knowe neyther occasyon coueteousnes philip • god recorde neyther sought prayse men neyther yet myghte haue bene auctoryte apostels chryst tender amonge euen norsse cherissheth chyldren affeccyoned towarde oure good wyll haue dealte vnto gospell god onely also oure owne soules ye deare vnto v ✚ ye remember brother oure laboure trauayle ze ••• 〈◊〉 g • tessa • b • lori • x c laboured daye nyght wolde chargeable vnto preached vnto gospell god ye wytnesses god holyly iustly vnblameably behaued oute selues amonge beleued ye know howe bare suche affeceyon vnto euery one father doth vnto chyldren exhortynge comfortyng besechynge ye wolde walcke worthy god whiche hath called vnto hys kyngdome glory cause thanke god also without ceassynge ye receaued v worde wherwith ye learned know god ye receaued worde man euen dede worde god worketh also beleue ⊢ ye brother became folowers congregacyons god iewry christ iesu ye haue suffered lyke thynges youre kynsmen oure selues haue suffered iewes whiche kylled lord iesus owue prophetes euen haue persecuted v god please contrary men hyuder v shulde speake vnto gentyles myght saued fulfyll theyr synnes alwaye luhe xxi • wrathe god come euen vtmost much brother kept season concernynge bodyly presence herte enforced se personally great desyre therfore wolde haue corne vnto paul agayne dani x • satan stode v oure hope toye crowne reioysynge▪ ii corin • • viii • ye presence lorde iesus chryste hys commynge yes ye oure glorye ioye weth howe greatly reioysed timothe tolde theyr fayth loue capi iii wherfore sence coulde lenger forbeare thought good remayne atacte xvii • athens alone 2 tim iii c ye youre selues knowe euen apointed vnto tolde shuld suffre tribulacyon euen came passe ye knowe thys cause coulde lenger beare sente myght haue knowledge youre faith leste meanes tempter tempted lest labour bene bestowed vayne nowe lately timothe cau • e vnto v declared v fayth loue howe ye haue good remembraunce v alwayes desyrynge se v also desyre se therfore brother receaued consolacion oure aduersite necessyte fayth nowe alyue yf ye stande stedfast lorde thanckes recompence god agayne ouer ioye ioye youre sake oure god prayinge nyght daye exceadingly myght se presently myght fulfyll thynges whiche lackynge vnto youre fayth god selfe oure father lorde iesus chryste shall gyde oure iorney vnto lorde also shall increace make slowe ouer loue one towarde another towarde men euen towarde maye make youre hertes stable vnblameable holynesse god oure father commynge oure lorde iesus christ hys saynctes ¶ exhorteth •••• fastnesse hepe • luc • tio • synne vnclenly good workes 1 lo 〈◊〉 g let woman learne sylence subieceyon suffre woman teach neyther vsurpe auctoryte ouer man sylence adam fyrst fourmed eue adam also deceaued woman deceaued subdued transgressyon notwithstandynge thorowe bearynge chyldren shalbe saued yf contynue fayth loue holynes discrecyon ¶ maner man bysshoppe prest ought proper ••• also requ • red deacon mynyster capi iii thys true saying man desyre offyce bysshoppe desyreth honest worke bysshoppe therfore must blamels husbande one wyfe dilygent sober discrete keper hospitalyte apte teache geuen ouer much wyne fyghter gredy fylthy lucre getle abhorrynge fyghtynge abortyng coueteousnes one ruleth wel owne house one hath chyldren subieccyon reuerence yf mā cannot rule owne house howe shall care congracion god may yonge scoler lest swel fail iudgement y• euel speaker must also haue good reporte lest fal rebuke snare euell speaker lykewyse must mynysters •• e vi • honest double tonged geuen vnto muche wyne neyther gredy fylthy lucre holdynge mystery fayth pure conscyence let fyrst proued let mynyster man able reproue euen muste theyr wyues honest euell speaker sober faythfull thynges let deacon husbandes one wyfe succh rule theyr chyldren wel theyr owne houshouldes math • • mynyster well get themselues good degre greately bextye fayth whiche christe iesu thynges write vnto y• trusting come shortely vnto yf destruccyon coueteousnes money rote euel whyle lusted erred frō sayth tauglyd thē selues many sorowes thou man god flye suche thynges folowe ryghtewesnes godlynes fayth loue pacyence • eakenes fyght poncius pylate wytnessed good witnessyng y• kepe cōmaūdement without spotte vurebukeable vntyll apperynge oure lorde iesus christ •••• xvii • and▪ x • x • whiche appearyng tyme shall shewe blessed christ iesu good thynge whiche committed thy kepyng hold fast thorow holy ghost whiche dwelleth v y• knowest howe al asia turned sorte phigelus hermogenes lorde gyue mercye vnto housholde onesiphorus oft refresshed math 25 • rom • • ashamed cheyne rome sought diligētly foūde lord graūt vnto may fynde mercy lord day many thinges ministred vnto ephesus thou knowest wel ¶ lyke fyrste chapter exhorteth hym constant trouble suffre manly abyde faste wholsome doctryne lorde iesus christ capi ii thou therfore sōne strong grace thorow christ iesu thynges thou haste herde many wytnesses commytte thou • itus • b▪ faythful men shalbe apt teach also thou therfore suffre afflyccyons good soudier iesu christ man warreth entāglith self worldly busynes maye please hath chosen soudier whiche christ iesu eternal glory true sayinge rom vi b yf dead wt hym shall also lyue hym rom 8 • paciente shal also raygne wyth hym luke xii b rom iii • denye hym also shall denye v beleue num 23▪ c lawer apollo iorney diligently nothyng lackyng vnto thē let oures also learne excell good workes farforth nede requyreth vnfrutefull al y• wt salute grete thē loue v fayth grace al amen ¶ wrytten nicopolis cytie macedonia ¶ reioyseth heare fayth loue philemon desyreth forgyue setuaunt onesimus louyngly receyue agayne ❧ epystle paule vnto philemon paule prysonner iesu christ brother timothe unto philemon beloued helper beloued appia archippus oure felow soudier congregacion thy house • corin li cori gala grace vnto peace god father lorde iesus christe thanke god makyng mēcyon alwayes prayer heare thy loue fayth thou hast toward lorde iesu towarde sayntes fellishyppe thy fayth frutefull knowledge euery good ⚜ worke towarde iesus christ haue great ioy consolacion thy loue brother saintes hertes comforted wherfore though might bold ī christ cōmaūde y• thy dewtye yet loues sake rather beseche though euē olde paul presoner iesu christ beseche sonne collo 〈◊〉 onesimus whō haue begottē bōdes tyme passed y• vnprofitable ꝓfitable whō haue sent home againe thou therfore receyue hī say mine owne vowel whō wolde fayne haue retayned wt y• ī thy stead myght haue ministred vnto y• bondes gospell neuerthelesse without thy mynde wolde nothing good thou doest shuld necessyte willyngly happly therfore departed season thou shuldest receyue euer seruaūt aboue seruaūt euen brother beloued specially much vnto fleshe also lord thou coūt therfore felowe receyue selfe haue done hurt oweth ought y• lay charge paul haue written myne owne hande wyl recompence say thou owest vnto euē thyne owne self also euē brother let enioy lorde cō forte vowel lord trustynge thyne obediēce wrote vnto knowyng thou wylt also say moreouer prepare lodgīg trust y• thorow helpe prayer shalbe gyuen vnto salute epaphras felowe prisoner christ iesu marcus aristarcus demas lucas helper grace lord iesu christ spirite amen ¶ sente frome rome onesymus seruaunte ❧ epystle saynt paule apostle vnto hebrues ¶ god deal louyngely olde tyme sendyng prophetes much mercy hath shewed v sent v owne sonne excellent glory iesus christ al thynges lyke hys father capi god tyme paste diuersly many wayes spake vnto y• father prophetꝭ last dayes hath spokē vnto v owne sonne hath made heyre thynges collo • c whome also made worlde • api 7 • whiche sonne beynge bryghtnes glory ymage substaunce rulynge thynges worde hys power hath hys owne persone pourged oure synnes sytteth ryghte hande maiestye hye beyng moche excellent angel hath inherytaunce obteyned excellent name vnto whiche angel sayde tyme psal ii actes xiii c thou arte sonne daye haue begotten agayne • reg vii • wyll father shalbe sonne agayne bryngeth fyrste begotten sonne worlde sayth psal 97 let al angel god worship vnto angel sayth psal 114 maketh hys angel spirytes hys minysters flamme fyre vnto sonne sayth psal 45 b thy seate god shalbe euer euer scepter thy kingdome right scepter thou hast loued rightuousnes hated iniquytie wherfore god euen thy god hath anoynted oyle gladnes aboue thy felowes psal c • b thou lorde beginnyng hast layde foundacyon earth heauens workes thy hādes shall peryshe thou endurest shal wexe olde also doth garment vesture shalt thou chaūge shalbe chaunged thou art euē thy yeres shal fayle ⊢ unto whych angel sayde tyme psal ix math 22 • cori xv syt ryght hāde tyll make thyne enemyes thy fote stole al ministring spirites sent minister sakꝭ shalbe heyres saluacyon ¶ exhorteth v obedient vnto 〈◊〉 lawe whiche christe hath gyuen v offended infyrmytie lowe degre christ necessary sake shulde take suche au vmble state vpon hym myght lyke vnto brother capi ii wherfore oughte gyue hede thinges spoken vnto v lest tyme perysh yf worde whiche spoken angel stedfast euery transgressyon disobedience receyued iust recompence reward howe shall escape yf despyse great saluacion whyche first began preached lorde hym selfe confyrmed vnto v warde thē hearde • xvi god bearyng wytnes therto sygnes • ets also diuers miracle gyftes holy ghost accordyng owne wyll vnto angel hath subdued worlde come wherof speake one certayne place wytnessed saying psal viii 144 • mā thou art myndfull sōne man thou visitest hym thou madest lytle lower angel thou hast crowned honour glory psal viii • • cor x • • hast set aboue worckes thy handes thou hast put al thynges subieccyon vnder fete put al thynges vnder left nothyng put vnder hym neuerthelesse se yet thynges subdued vnto made lesse angel se iesus whych crowned wyth glory honour suffryng deth grace god shulde cast death men became thinges al thynges brought many sonnes vnto glory y• shulde make lorde saluacion perfecte thorowe affliccions sanctifieth whyche sanctifyed one whych cause sake asshamed call brother sayinge wyll declare thy name vnto psal •• il • ihon xx brother myddes congregacyon wyll prayse agayne wyll put trust agayne beholde chyldren god hath gyuen much chyldrē partetakers flesshe bloude also selfe lyke wyse toke parte wyth thorowe death myght expell hym lord shyppe ouer death say deuyl myght delyuer thorow feare death lyfe tyme subdued vnto bondage place taketh angel sede abraham taketh wherfore al thinges became made like vnto brethrē myght mercyfull faythfull hye preste thynges concernynge god pourge people synnes fortuned selfe tempted able sucker also tempted ¶ reqyureth v obedient vnto word christ worth ceremoniall lawe moses punishment suche wyl nedes hatden herted capi iii therfore holy brother partaker celestyall callyng consyder embassadour hye preste oure professyon chryst iesus bowe faythful vnto hym put hym offyce euen moses house loke howe moch honour hath buylded house hath house selfe moche honoure counted worthie moses euery house buylded man ordayned thynges god moyses verely faythfull house minister beare wytnes thynges whiche spoken afterwarde christ sōne hath rule ouer house whose house hol de fast confydence rom v reioysynge hope vnto ende wherfore holy ghost sayth day yf ye wyll heare voyce harden hertes ☞ prouokynge daye temptacion wildernes father tēpted prouoked sawe workes xl yeare wherfore greued generacyon sayde alway erre hertes verely haue knowen wayes sware wrath shall entre rest take hede brother least tyme froward hert subiecte vnto vnbelefe shulde departe lyuynge god exhorte ye one another dayly whyle called daye lest hard harted thorow disceytfulnesse synne made partaker christ yf kepe sure vnto ende ☞ begining substaunce long said day ye wyl voice hardē hertes prouoking whē herd dyd prouoke al come egypt moises wt despleased xl yeres despleased wt thē y• synned whose carkases vuerthrowē deserte whō sware y• shulde entre rest vnto thē obediēte se yt coulde entre vnbelefe ¶ sabboth rest christen punysshemente vnbeleuers nature worde god capi iiii let v feare therfore lest sakyng promes entryng rest shuld seme tyme haue bene disapointed vnto v declared aswel vnto thē profyteth herd word herd coupled fayth whyche haue beleued entre ito rest said euen haue sworne wrathe shall entre rest spake verely longe workes made fon̄daciō worlde layde spake certayne place seuenth day wyse gine • • god dyd rest seuenth daye worckes place agayne shall entre rest seynge therfore foloweth muste entre therinto fyrst preached entre therin vnbelefes sake appoynteth certayne daye long tyme saying dauid rehearsed daye yf ye wyll heare hys voyce harden hertes • iosue giuen rest wolde afterward haue spoken another day remayneth therfore yet arest people god entred rest hath ☞ ceased also hys owne worckes god dyd hys let v study therfore entre rest lest mā faule ensample vnbelefe worde god quycke myghty operacion sharper two edged swearde entreth euen vnto diuidyng sonder soule sprete iointes mary dyscerner thoughtes intentes herte neither creature manifest syght thynges naked open vnto eye speake seynge haue great hye prest entred heauen euen iesus sonne god let v holde profession ⚜ hope haue hie prest cannot haue compassion infirmyties philip ii al poyntes tempted lyke yet synne let v therfore go boldely vnto exodi 25 b seate grace may obtayne mercy find grace helpe tyme nede ¶ chryst hye preste seate grace excellent hye prestes olde lawe capi v ✚ euery hye prest taken amonge men ordayned men thynges pertaynynge god leuiti ix b offre gyftes sacryfyces synne whyche haue compassion ignoraunte way muche hym selfe also compased infirmitie infirmity sake bounde offre synnes wel selfe people man taketh honour vnto selfe called god aaron euen christ also glorified hiself made hye prest sayd vnto psal ii b actes 23 c hebre b thou art sonne daye haue begottē glorified sayth also another place psal ix b thou arte prest euer ordre melchisedech ⊢ whiche date flesh whan offred vp prayer supplicacions wt strong cry teares vnto able saue death heard hꝭ reuerēce though sōne ⚜ god yet lerned obedience thinges suffered beynge parfecte cause eternal saluacyon vnto obeyed called god hye prest order melchisedech wherfore wold speake many thinges harde vttered seynge ye dull hearyng cōcerning time ye ought teacher yet haue ye nede agayne teache fyrste pryncyples worde god become ☞ haue nede 1 co •• iii mylcke stronge meate euery man fed mylke inexperte worde rhghtuousnes babe stronge meate belongeth thē partecte euē reason vse haue wittes exercised discerne good euyl ¶ goeth thynge beganne latter ende tyf • c chapyter exhorteth faynt • stedfast pacyent much • god sure promesse capi vi therfore leuynge doctryne pertayneth begynnyng christen men let v go forth vnto perfeccyon laynge agayne foundacion repentaū ce deade worckes fayth toward god baptysynges doctryne layinge handes resurreccion death eternall iudgement wyl actes iiii • xvii • god permitte ☞ whiche lyghted haue tasted heauenly gyfte become partaker holy ghost haue tasted good worde god power world come math 12 ii petri ii hebre x b yf fall awaye conceruyng selues crucyfie sonne god fressh make mocke hym shulde renued agayne repentaunce earth whiche dryncketh rayne commeth oft vpon bryngeth forth herbes mete dresse receyueth blessynge god grounde whiche beareth thornes brears reproued nye vnto cursynge whose ende burned neuerthelesse deare frendes trust se bettter thynges whych accompany saluacion thoughe thus speake god vnryghtuous math 25 • shulde forget youre worke laboure procedeth loue whyche loue ye shewe hys name whyche haue ministred vnto saintes yet ministre yee desyre euery one shew diligence fui stablishynge hope euen vnto ende ye faynt folowers thē thorow fayth pacience receyue enherytaū ce promysse god made promes abrahā bycause none greater sweare geni xli c sware hym self saying surely wyl blesse multyply dede taried paciētly enioyed promes men verely sweare hym greater selues exodi 22 • othe confyrme thynge ende stryfe god wyllynge aboundauntly shewe vnto beyres promes stablenes hys counsayle added othe two immutable thynges whyche vnpossible god shulde lye myght haue strong consolaciō hitherto haue sled hold fast y• hope set v whych hope holde ancre soule sure stedfast hopealso entreth ito thynges whiche within vayle fore tūners v entred euen iesus made hebre 8 hye prest euer order melchysedech ¶ compareth presthode christe vnto melchisedech farre excellent capi vii melchisedech kynge gene 14 salem beyng prest hye god met abraham returned agayne slaughter kynges blessed also abraham gaue tythes al thinges fyrst called interpretacyō kyng ryghtuousnes kynge salem say king peace without father without mother without kynne hath neither begynnynge dayes neyther yet ende lyfe likened vnto sonne god contynueth preste euer consyder man vnto also patriarke abrahā gaue tythes spoyles verely nume 18 1 per 31 b chyldren leui receyue offyce prestes haue cōmaundement take accordyng lawe tythes people saye brother yee thoughe spronge loines abraham whose kin red counted amonge receyued tythes abrahā blessed promyses man denyeth lesse receiueth blessing hi greater mē dye receyue tithe receyued tithe whō witnessed liueth saye trueth leui selfe also vseth receyue tithe payed tythes abrahā yet loynes father whā melchisedech met abrahā rom ii gala iii c therfore perfeccion came presthod leuitꝭ vnder presthod people receyued lawe neded furthermore another prest shuld ryse called order melchisedech order aaron yf presthod translated necessitie must lawe translated also thynges spokē pertayne vnto another trybe neuer man serued aulter euydente oure lorde spronge math • trybe iuda whiche trybe spake moyses nothyng concernyng presthode yet euident thinge yf similytude melchisedech aryse another preste made law carnall commaundemente power endelesse lyfe thys maner doth testyfye psal 110 b hebre 4 c thou ar • preste foreuer order melchisedech ☞ commaundement wente afore disanulled weakenes vnprofytablenes ▪ lawe brought nothynge perfeccion introduccyō better hope whiche drawe nye vnto god therfore better hope thyng done without othe prestes made wtout othe preste wt othe sayde vnto rom 8 gala iii c lorde sware wyl repentpsal 110 • thou art prest euer order melchisedech cause iesus stablysher better testament amonge many made prestes suffred endure reason death man endureth euer hath euerlastīg prest hode wherfore able also euer saue vttemost come vnto god seynge euer liueth timo 2 • iohn 2 • make intercession v hye preste became v haue holy harmlesse vndefiled seperate frō synners made hyer heauen nedeth dayly yonder hye prestes leuit ix b offer vp sacrifice fyrst owne synnes people synnes dyd offred vp self hebre v lawe maketh men prestes haue infirmitie worde othe came sē ce lawe maketh sōne prest perfecte euermore capi viii ¶ offyce chryste worthy preestes offyce olde lawe whyche vnperfecte therefore abrogate thinges haue spoken pyth hebre vi x c haue suche hye preste sytteth ryght hande seate maiesty heauen mynister holy thynges true tabernacle whiche god pyght man euery hye prest ordayned offre gyftes sacryfices wherfore necessitie ye thys man haue also offre preste yf earth prestꝭ accordyng law offre gyftes serue vnto ensample collo ii • hebre x • shadow heuenly thinges euē answere god gyuen vnto moyses finysh tabernacle erod 〈…〉 actes vii f take hede sayd thou make al thiges according patrone shewed mount nowe hath optayned presthode much excellent mediator better testamente whyche confyrmed better promyses yf fyrst testament bene faute coulde haue bene founde shulde place haue bene sought seconde rebukyng sayth vnto ier • • xxi f beholde dayes come sayth lorde wyll fynysshe vpon house israell vpon house iuda newe testamente lyke testamente made father day toke handes leade lande egypte contynued testamente regarded sayeth lorde testamente wyll make wyth house israel dayes sayth lord wyl put lawes theyr myndes theyr hertes wyl write wilbe theyr god shalbe people shall teach euery man hys neyghboure euery man hys brother sayinge knowe lorde shall knowe leaste moste wylbe mercyfull ouer vnrightewesnes theyr sinnes theyr iniquytyes wyll thyncke vpon nomore sayth newe testament hath worne olde worne wexed old redy banishe awaye capi ix ¶ proffyte • worthynesse olde testament surre newe excelleth olde testament verely ordynaunces seruynges god wordly holynes ✚ exod xxv fore tabernacle made wherin light table shewe breed called holy within seconde vayle tabernacle whiche called holyest golden senser arcke testament ouerlaide rounde wyth golde wherin golden pot exo xvi g manna leu xvii aaron rodde sprong exodi xi • table testament ouer arcke cherubyns glory shadowynge seate grace whyche thinges cānot speake particularly thinges thus ordeined prestes went wayes fyrst tabernacle whiche executed seruyce holy thinges seconde went hye prest alone exo xxx b euery yeare wyth bloude leui xvi b whiche offered selfe ignorauntes people wherwith holy goost thys sygnyfyed waye holy thynges yet opened whyle yet fyrste tabernacle standynge whiche symilytude tyme present whiche offered gyftes sacrifyces coulde make mynyster parfecte pertayning conscyence wyth onely meates drinckes diuers wasshinges iustifyinges flesshe whiche ordeyned vntyll tyme reformacyon ✚ hebre vi 〈◊〉 viii b christ beynge hye prest good thynges come came greater parfecte tabernacle made handes saye thys buyldynge neyther bloude goates calues petri hys owne bloude entred holy place founde eternall redemcion ⊢ yf • eui xvi • bloud ox gotes asshes yonge cowe sprynckled puryfyeth vnclene touchynge puryfyinge flesshe howe much shal bloude christ thorowe eternal spyrite offered selfe without spot god pourge youre conscience deed worckes serue lyuinge god thys cause 〈…〉 • mediator newe testamēt thorow death chaunsed redempcyon transgression vnder first testamēt whyche called myght receaue promes eternall inherytaunce ⊢ wher testamente must also necessyte death hym maketh testament testament taketh auctoryte men deed yet value long maketh testament alyue cause also neyther fyrst testament ordeyned without bloude moses declared commaundement people accordynge lawe toke bloude calues goates water purple wolle ysope sprynckled bothe boke people sayinge exod 14 b bloud testamēt god hathe appointed vnto moreouer sprinckled tabernacle bloud also ministringe vessel almost al thynges lawe purged bloud wyth sheadynge bloude remyssyon nede similytude heauenly thynges puryfyed thinges heauenly thinges selues puryfyed better sacrifyces actes vii • xvi • christe entred holy place made handes symilitudes true thinges entred heauen 1 iohn ii • appeare nowe syght god v offer hymself often •••• xvi • hye prest entreth holy place euery yeare wyth straunge bloude muste haue often suffered sence worlde began nowe ende worlde hathe appeared put synne flyght offeringe vp hym selfe apoynted vnto men shall dye commeth iudgemente rom v b 1 pet iii euen chryste offered take awaye synnes many vnto loke hym shall appeare agayne without syue vnto saluacyon ¶ olde lawe power clense awaye synne chryst dyd offerynge body al exhortacyon receaue goodnes god thanckfully pacyence stedfaste fayth capi x lawe hauynge collo ii • heb viii • shadowe good thynges come fasshyon thynges selues neuer sacryfices whiche offer yeare yeare contynually make commers therunto perfayte wolde thē sacryfyces haue ceased haue bene offered offerer purged shuld haue conscience synnes neuertheles sacrifice mencyon made synnes euery yeare leui xvi c bloud ox goates take awaye synnes wherfore cōmeth world sayth psal xi b sacrifyce offerynge thou woldest haue bodye haste thou ordeyned burnt offeriges also synne hast thou alowed sayde lo begynnynge booke written shulde thy wyll god aboue sayeth sacryfyce offeryng burnt sacrifyces sinne offerynges thou woldeste haue neyther hast thou alowed thē yet offered law sayd lo thy wyll god taketh awaye fyrst stablysshe latter wyl sanctifyed offeringe vp body iesu christ euery prest ready dayly ministring offring ofte tymes one maner oblacyon whiche neuer take awaye synnes mā hathe offered one sacryfyce synnes set downe euer ephes collo▪ iii • hebre b xii ryghte hande god hence forth tarieth tyll foe made forestole one offering hath made perfecte euer sanctyfyed holy goost himselfe also beareth v recorde euen tolde testamēt wyll make vnto dayes sayeth lorde wyll put lawes theyr herte theyr mindes wyl write sine iniquity wyl remember nomore remyssyon thynges nomore offerynge synne seinge therfore brother meanes bloude iesu iohn x xiiii rom v hebre ix b haue lyberty enter holy place newe liuing way hath prepared v vayle say flesshe seing also haue hye prest ruler ouer house god let v drawe nye true herte sure fayth sprynckeled hertes euyll conscience wesshed body pure water let v kepe profession hope wtout waueryng faythful promysed let v cōsider one another intēt maye prouoke vnto loue good worckes forsakynge fellyshyppe haue among selues maner let v exhorte one another muche ye se day draweth nye mat xii hebre vi ii petr ii yf sinne wilfully haue receaued knowledge trueth remaineth nomore sacrifice sinnes fearfull loking iudgemēt violēt fyre shall deuoure aduersaries despyseth moses lawe dyeth without mercy deu xix • math 18▪ • 2 cor • 13 • vnder two thre wytnesses much sorer suppose ye shall punisshed treadeth vnder fote sonne god counteth bloude testamente wherwith sanctifyed vnholy thynge doth dishonoure spyryte grace knowe hym hath sayde deute 32 psal • 4 • rom xii belongeth vnto take vengeaunce wyll recompence sayth lorde agayne lorde shall iudge people fearfull thynge fal handes lyuynge god call remembraunce dayes passed whiche ye receaued lyght ye endured greate fight aduersities partly whyle men wondred gased shame trybulacyon done vnto partly whyle yee became cōpanyons passed tyme ye became partaker also y• afflyccyōs happened thorow bondes toke worth spoylynge goodes gladnes knowing selues howe ye haue heauen better enduring substaūce caste awaye therfore youre confidence hath great recompence rewarde ye haue nede pacyence ye haue done wyl god ye myght receaue promes yet lytell whyle shall come wyl come wyl tary ab •••• 2 rom i▪ c gala iii b iust shall lyue fayth yf withdrawe selfe soule shal haue pleasure hym withdrawe oure selues vnto dampnacyon partayne vnto fayth wynnyng soule ¶ fayth commendacyon sted fast beleue father olde tyme capi xi faythe sure confydence thynges hoped certayntye thynges sene elder obtayned good reporte thorowe fayth vnderstande gene worlde ordeined worde god thinges whith sene made thynges actes xiii c rom 1 c sene gene iiii faythe abel offered vnto god plenteous sacryfyce cayn whiche obteyned wytnes ryghteous god testyfyinge hys gyftes whiche also beynge condempned worlde became heyre ryghtwesnes whyche accordynge fayth fayth gene xii actes vii abraham called obeyed go place whiche shulde afterwarde receaue inheritaunce went knowynge whether shulde go therfore howe endured speakyng agaynst hym synners leste ye shulde weryed faynt youre myndes ye haue yet resysted vnto bloud striuing sinne haue forgotten exhortacion speaketh vnto vnto chyldren sonne despyse thou chastening lord neither faynte thou art rebuked hym lorde loueth chasteneth yee scourgeth euery sonne receaueth ye endure chastening god offereth selfe vnto vnto sonnes sōne father chasteneth ye vnder correccyon wherof al partaker ye bastardes sonnes therfore seing haue father flessh corrected v gaue thē reuerēce shal much rather subteccion vnto father spiritual giftes lyue verely fewe day n •• tred v owne pleasure nur treth v profit intent maye mynister holynes vnto v maner chastising presēt tyme semeth ioyous greuous neuerthelesse afterwarde bryngeth quyet frute ryghtwesnes vnto whyche exercised therby stretch forth therfore hādes let downe weake knee se ye haue strayght steppe vnto youre fete lest haltynge turne oute waye yee let rather healed folowe peace al men holines without man shall se lorde loke man destitute grace god leste rote bytternes sprynge vp trouble therby many defyled fornicator vncleane person esau esay 〈◊〉 • one mease meate sold byrthryght ye knowe afterwarde wolde inherytaunce haue optayned blessing put fonnde place repentaunce thoughgene • 7 • gene • 5 • sought teares ye come vnto exod xix b moūt touched vnto burning fire sayth yet sygnifyeth remouynge awaye thynges shaken thynges whych haue ended course thinges shaken maye remayne wherfore yf receaue kyngdome moued haue grace wherby maye serue god maye please hym wyth epistel saynct iames ¶ exhorteth reioyce▪ trouble thankfully receaue worde god true religion deuociō capi iames seruaunt god lorde iesus christ sendeth gretynge twelue trybes scatered abroade ✚ brother countie excedyng ioye whē ye fall dyuers temp tacyons knowinge iob xxii sapi iiii rom v • trying youre fayth gendreth pacyence let paciēce haue parfect worke ye may perfecte sounde lackynge nothynge lacke wysdome aob xviii • eccle vii • math xii luke xi b let hym aske geueth euen god geueth men indifferently castech mā teeth shalbe geuen hym let hym aske fayth wauer douteth lyke waue see whych tost wyndes caryed violence nether let man thinke shall receaue thing lorde waueryng mynded man vnstable al wayes let brother lowe degre reioyce whan exalted agayne let hym rych reioyce whā made lowe esayi 〈◊〉 b eccle 14 b 1 petri euen flower grasse shall passe awaye sonne ryseth heat grasse wydereth flowre falleth awaye beautye fassyon peryssheth euen shall ryche man perysshe wayes happy man endureth tempta cyon tryed shall receaue crowne lyfe whiche lorde hathe promysed loue hym ⊢ let man saye tempted tempted god gene xxii god cannot tempte vnto euell tempteth man euery man tempted whan drawne awaye entysed owne concupiscence iust hath conceaued bryngeth forth synne synne synysshed bryngeth forth deeth erre deare brethrē 1 cor iiii b ✚ euery good gyfte euery parfayt gyft aboue cōmeth downe father lyghtes variabienes nether chaunged vnto darcknes ihon 〈◊〉 owne wyll begat v worde trueth shulde fyrst frutes creature wherfore deare brother p • xvii eccle v let euery mā swyfte heare slowe speake slowe wrath wrath man worketh ryghteous god rom 13 • ollo • ii wherfore laye parte fylthynes superstuyte malicyousnes receaue mekenes worde graffed whiche able saue youre soules ⊢ ✚ rom • b math v se ye doaers worde hearets onely deceauynge youre owneselues luke xi g yf mā heare y• worde declareth hys workes lyke vnto mā beholoyng bodely face glasse assone hath loked himselfe goeth waye forgetteth immediatly fassyon mat v •• whoso loketh y• parfayt lawe libertye continueth therin yf forgetful hearer doar worke shalbe happye dede mā among seme denoute refrayneth tonge deceaueth owne herte mannes deuocion vayne pure deuocyon vndefyled god father y vysyt fatherlesse widdowes aduersyte kepe hym selfe vnspotted worlde ⊢ ¶ byddeth haue respect persones boast fayth dedes capi ii brother esteme fayth lorde iesus christ lorde glory leui xix c respecte person ther come youre company man wearinge golden rynge clothed goodly aparell ther come also poore mā vyle raymēt ye haue respecte weareth gaye clothyng saye vnto hym syt yu good place saye vnto poore stande thou syt vnder • ote stole ye parcyal youre selues haue iudged euyll thoughtes harken deare beloued brother hath god chosen y• poore worlde ryche sayth heyres kyngdome promysed loue hyme ye haue despysed poore ryche men execute •• rannye vpon drawe iudgemēt seates speake euell y• good name called vpon ouer ye fulfyll royall lawe accordyng scripture leui xix mat xxii mark x • c rom xii •• • ga •• v b thou shalt loue thyne neyghboure thy selfe ye well yt ye regarde one person another ye commyt synne rebuked lawe transgressours whosoeuer shall kepe whole lawe math v c yet fayle one poynte gyltie al sayd thou shalt c • myt adulterye sayde also thou shalt kyll though thou none adulterye yet yf thou kyll yu art become transgressor lawe speake ye shalbe iudged lawe lybertye shall haue iudgement without mercy math 18 b sheweth mercy mercy reioyseth agaynste iudgement ⊢ auayleth brother though mā saye hath • ayth yf hathe dedes sayth saue brother syster naked destitute dayly • ode one saye vnto thē depart peace▪ god sede warmnes fode notwithstandynge ye geue thē thynges whiche nedfull body shal helpe euen fayth yf haue dedes deed selfe mā wyll saye yu hast fayth haue dedes shewe thy fayth thy dedes wyl shewe y• fayth dedes beleuest yu ther one god thou doest well deuyls also beleue tremble wylt thou vnderstande thou vayne mā fayth without dedes deed abraham oure father iustifyed thorow workes gen xxii b offred isaac sonne vpon aulter thou seest howe fayth wrought hys dedes thorugh dedes fayth made parfecte scripture fulfylled sayth gene xv b rom 〈◊〉 g • l • iii abraham beleued god reputed vnto hym ryghtewesnes called frende god ✚ ye se howe dedes man iustifyed fayth onely lyke wyse also raab harlot iustifyed thorowe workes iosu ii receaued messenger sent thē another waye body without spirit deed euen fayth without workes deed also ⊢ ¶ good euell commeth thorowe tonge dutye su • belerned difference betwyxte wysdome gospell wysdome worlde capi iii brother math 23 • euery mā master knowynge howe shal receaue greater damnacion many thinges synne pro xvii man synne worce perfecte man able also tame body beholde put byttes horse mouthes y• may obeye v turne body beholde also shyppes thought greate dryuen fearce wyndes yet turned smal helme whyther soeuer violēce gouerner wyll euen tonge syctel member also boasteth great thynges beholde howe great thynge lyttell fyre kyndleth tonge fyre euen worlde wyckednes tonge set amonge oure membres defyleth whole body setteth fyre y• haue nature selfe set fyre euen hell nature beastes byrdes serpentes thynges see meked tamed nature mā tonge man tame vnruely euyll full deedly poyson therwith blesse god father therwith curse gene whiche made ⚜ ymage symilitude god one mouth proceadeth blessinge cursyng brethrē thynges ought nat dothe fountayn sende forth one place swete water bytter also fygge tree brother beare olyue bertes eyther vyne beare fygges fountayne geue bothe salt water fresshe also man wyse endued knowledge amonge let hym shewe workes good conuersacyon mekenes wysdome yf ye haue bytter enuyeng stryfe herte reioyce nether lyars agaynst trueth wysdome dissendeth frō aboue earthy natural dyuelysshe wher enuyenge stryfe vnstablenes maner euyl workes wysdome y• frō aboue fyrst pure peasable gentle easy entreated full mercy good frutes iudgynge without simulacyon yee frute rightewesnes sowen peace mayntayne peace capi iiii ¶ warre fyghtynge cōmeth voluptcousnesse frendshype worlde enimyte god▪ 〈◊〉 • acyon 〈◊〉 sclaunder vany • e thys lyke whence cōmeth warre fyghtynge amonge come hence euē lustes fyght mēbres ye lust haue ye enuye haue indignacyon cannot obtayne ye fyght warre ye haue ye aske ye aske receaue ye aske mys • e euen consume vpon iustes ye aduouterars wemē breke matrimonye knowe ye howe y• g • iath b 1 ihon ii c frēdshype worlde enemyte wt god whosoeuer therfore wylbe frēde yt worlde made enemy god ether ye thinke ye ye scripture saith vayne spirit yt dwelleth v lusteth euen cōtrary enuy geueth grace wherfore sayth god resisteth proude geueth grace vnto lowlye submit selues therfore god 〈◊〉 v b resyst y• deuyll wyll flye drawe nye god wyll drawenye clēfe hādes ye synners pourge hettes ye wauerynge mynded suffre affliccions mourne wepe let youre laughter turned mournyng ioye heuynes pe •• v humble youre selues y• sight y• lorde shal lyft vp backbyte one another drethren y• backbyteth brother iudgeth brother backbyteth lawe iudgeth lawe yf thou iudge lawe thou obseruer lawe iudge one lawe geuer iudge whiche able saue destroye rome 14 art thou iudgest another go nowe ye saye eze xviii luke xii b todaye tomorowe let v go cytie contynue yeare bye sell wynne yet cannot ye tell shall happen ye morowe thinge lyfe euen vapour apereth lytel time vanyssheth waye ye ought saye •• xviii c hebre vi • yf lord wyll yf lyue let v yt ye reioyce boastynges soch reioysynge y euyll therfore luke xii hym yt knoweth good doth yt hym synne ¶ threteneth wycked ryche men exhorteth vnto pacyence beware swerynge one knoweledge • autes another one praye another one laboure brynge another trueth capi v go nowe ye ryche men wepe howle youre wretchednes shal come vpon youre ryches corrupte garmentes motheaten gold syluer cankered rust shalbe wytnes vnto shall eat youre flesshe fyre ye haue heaped treasuere gether ⚜ euē wrath selues youre last dayes beholde leui xi • • deut 24 c tobi iiii c hyre labourer whiche haue reaped downe feldes whiche hyre kept backe fraude cryeth cryes whyche haue reaped entred ye eares lorde sabbaoth ye haue lyued pleasure earthe bene wantan ye haue norysshed youre hertes ☞ daye slaughter ye haue cōdempned kylled iust hathe resysted ✚ paciēt therfore brother vnto cōmynge lorde beholde husbāde man wayteth precyous frute earth hathe longe pacyence ther vpon vntyll receaue early latter rayne ye also pacient therfore settle hertes commynge lorde draweth nye grudge one agaynst another brother lest ye damned beholde iudge stādeth dore take brother prophetes ensample sufferynge aduersytie pacience whiche spake name lorde ⊢ beholde math v counte happy endure ye haue harde pacyence iob haue knowen ende lorde made lorde petyfull mercyfull aboue thynges brother math v f sweare not▪ nether heauē nether erth nether othe let yee yee youre naye naye lest ye fall ypocrisy vexed let hym praye mery let hym synge psalmes diseased amonge let call elder congregacyon let praye ouer • vi b anoynte oyle name lorde prayer fayth shall saue sycke lorde shal rayse vp yf haue cōmytted synnes shalbe forgeuen ✚ knowledge youre fautes one another praye one another ye may healed feruent prayer ryghteous man auayleth muche helyas man mortall euen prayed prayer myght rayne 3 reg 17 • luke 〈◊〉 • rayned earth space thre yeares syx monethes prayed agayne heauen gaue rayne earth brought forth frute brother yf erre trueth another conuerte let knowe whiche conuerteth synner frō goynge straye waye shall saue soule deeth shal hyde multytude synnes ¶ ende epystle saynte iames ❧ fyrst epistle honour kynge ephe vi co • iii 1 • • eitū ii • math v seruaūtes obey master wt feare onely yf good courteoꝰ also though froward thāk worthy ⊢ yf mā cōsciēce towarde god cudure grefe suffre wronge ensample ye shulde folow hys steppe dyd synne neyther gyle foūd mouth reuyled reuyled agayne suffered threatned cōmytted vengeaunce iudgeth ryghtuously mat viii • esaya 53 owne self bare sine body proued tyre whiche thyng crye though strasige thing happened vnto reioyce much yeare partaker christes passion hys glory appeareth ye may mery glad ye rayled vpon name christ happy ye glory spiryt god resteth vpō part euil spokē pact glorified se none punysshed murtherer thefe euil doer busy body mēs matter mā suffre christen man let ashamed let hi glorifie god ••• behalfe tyme come iudgement afflyccions christ also partaker glory shalbe opened actes xx • fede ye christꝭ flocke asmuch lyeth takynge ouersyght thē cōpelled therto wyllyngly ⚜ godly sorte y• desyre fylthy lucre good mynde 2 corin • e though ye lordes ouer parish 1 ti • 4 titus ii b ye ensāple y• flocke • tim ii • good wyl whē chefe sheperd shal appere ye shall receyue 2 cori 9 2 tim • • incorruptible crowne glory marcus sonne rom xvi • co xvi grete ye one another wyth kysse loue peace al christ iesu amen ❧ seconde epistle saynte peter ¶ muche power god hath gyuen v thynges ••• taynyng vnto lyfe exhorteth v make tallynge knowen good wor • kes frutes fayth maketh men • yon owne death capi symon peter seruaunt apostle iesus christe thē whyche haue optayned lyke precyous fayth wt v thorowe ryghtnousnesse god sauiour iesus christ 1 p ••• grace vnto peace multi plyed thorow knowledge god iesus lorde accordynge godly power hath geuen vnto v al thynges pertayne vnto lyfe godlynes thorowe knowledge hi hath called v glory vertue whyche gyuen vnto v excellent moste greate promyses meanes therof ye myght ihon • e collo • partaker godly nature yf ye flye y• corrupcyon worldly lust hereunto giue diligence fayth mynyster vertu vertu knowledge 1 corin • knowledge temperaunce temperaū ce pacience pacience godlynes godlynes brotherly kyndnes brotherly kidnes loue yf thynges amonge plētuous wyl make ye neyther shalbe ydle vnfruytefull knowledge lord iesus christ lacketh thynges blynde gropeth way hāde hath forgotten pourged hys olde synnes wherfore brother gyue dilygēce make callyng eleccyō sure ⚜ good worckes yf ye thingꝭ ye shal neuer fal yee meanes entryng shal ministred vnto aboū dasitly y• euerlastyng kingdome lord sauiour iesus christ wherfore wyll neglygēt put alwayes remēbraunce suche thynges though ye know selues stablyshed present trueth standynge thyncke mete longe tabernacle stere vp put tyng remembraunce much sure shortly muste put thys tabernacle 2 cori v euen oure lorde iesus christ shewed wyll euer also gyue dylygence ye maye haue wher wyth stere vp remembraunce thynges departynge ✚ haue folowed dysceytfull fable opened vnto power commynge oure lorde iesus chryst ihon xxi eye sawe maiestye euen verely receyued god father honour glory came suche voyce hym excellent glorye 1 ihon • thys ismat 17 b iii mathe • luke iii▪ • dere beloued sonne haue delyte voyce hearde come heauen whan wyth hym holy mounte haue also ryght sure worde prophecye wherunto yf ye take hede vnto 2 cori 4 • lyght shineth darcke place ye well vntyll day dawne day starre aryse hertes ⊢ ye fyrste knowe thys prophecye scripture hath pryuate interpretacyon scripture came neuer wyll mā holy men god spake moued holy ghost ¶ prophecyeth false teacher sheweth theyr punyshemente capi ii false prophetꝭ also amonge people euen actis • 〈◊〉 1 tim 4 2 〈◊〉 • 2 〈◊〉 〈◊〉 •• ther shalbe false techers amōg priuely shal bring damnable sectes euen denyeng lord hath bought thē bryng vpon thē selues swyft dānacion many shall folowe damnable wayes waye trueth shal euyl spoken thorow couetousnes shall wyth sayned wordes make marchaūdise whose iudgemet nowe farre damnacyon slepeth yf god spared angel sined cast downe hell dely • ed chaynes darckenes ⚜ punyshed kept vnto iudgemēt neither spared olde worlde saued gene 7 • • eyght preacher ryghtuousnes brought floud vpon world vngodly turned city zodom gomor asshes ouerthre damned made ensample vnto shulde lyue vngodly iust gene 〈◊〉 • lot vexed wyth vnclenly cōuersacyon wycked delyuered beyng ryghtuous dwellynge among seynge hearyng vexed rightuous soule frō daye day wyth theyr vnlawfull dedes iob xv • 1 cor •• x • lorde knoweth delyuer vn godly temptacyon reserue vniust vnto day iudgement punyshed chefely walke flesshe lust vnclennes despyse auctoryte presūptuous stubborne feare speake euyl excell worshyp angel whiche greater power might receyue y• lorde raylyng iudgment thē selues brute beastes naturally brought forth takē destroyed speake euyl thynges vnderstande shal perysh owne destruccion receyue rewarde vnryghtuousnes coūt pleasure lyue delycyously season spottes fylthynes lyue pleasure owne disceyuable wayes feastynge hauynge eye ful aduoutry cannot cease synne begylyng vnstable soules hertes haue exercysed wyth couetousnes cursed chyldren whyche haue forsaken ryght waye gone astraye folowyng num 22 • way balā sōne b • whiche loued rewarde vnryghtuousnes rebuked iniquytie tame dome beast speakynge wyth mannes voyce forbade madnesse prophete welles wythout water cloudes caried tēpest whō myst darckenes reserued euer haue spoken great swellynge wordes vanitie enuse thorow iustes voluptuousnes flesshe thē cleane escaped euen thē lyue errour whyle promes lybertye thē selues bōd seruaū te corrupcyon iude man ouercome vnto y• brought bondage iohn 8 rom vi c yf haue escaped fylthynes world thorow knowledge lord sauyour iesus christ yet rāgled againe therin prou • r xxi dogge turned vomet agayne sow washed turned agayne walowyng myer ¶ day lord whose long tarying saluacion capi iii thys seconde epistle nowe wryte vnto dearely beloued wherwyth stere vp perdicion vngodly mē derely beloued ignoraūt thys one thynge howe psal 〈…〉 one daye lord thousand yeare thousande yeare one day lorde hath promysed slacke mē count slacknes pacient v warde asmuch wolde haue man lost wyll receyue al men repentaunce neuerthelesse 〈…〉 day lord wyll come thefe nyght whyche daye heauens shal passe away maner tēpest elemētes shal melt wyth heat earth also workes therin shal burne seyng al thynges shall peryshe maner person ought ye holy conuersacion godlynes lokyng hastyng vnto commyng daye god heauens shall perysh fyre elementes shal melt wyth heate apo •• xxi neuertheles accordyng promes loke newe heauen new earth wherin dwelleth rightousnes wherfore derely beloued seying ye loke thinges deligēt ye may founde hym peace wythout sporte vndefyled suppose longe suffrynge lord saluacyon euen dearely beloued brother paule also accordyng wysdome gyuen vnto hym hath wrytten vnto ye almoste euery epistle speakyng suche thynges among many thinges harde vnderstāde vnlearned vnstable peruert also scripture vnto owne destruccion ye therfore beloued seynge ye warned afore hād beware least ye wyth men also plucked awaye thorowe errour wycked fall owne sted fastnes grow grace knowledge oure lorde sauyoure iesvs chryste glory nowe euer amen ❧ fyrste epistle saynte iohn apostle ¶ true wytnesse euerla stynge worde god bloude chryst purga • yon synne man wytho ut synne capi whiche begynnyng whiche haue hearde whiche haue sene wt eye whiche haue loked vpō hādes haue hādled worde lyfe lyfe appered haue sene bere wytnes shewe vnto youmath 17 • eternall lyfe wt father appered vnto v whiche haue sene herd declare vnto y• ye also may haue fellishyp wt v felly shyp may father sō ne iesus christ writ vnto ye may reioyce ioy may full tydinges haue hearde declare vnto god lyght derkenes al say haue felowshyp hym walcke darkenes lye truth ☞ yf walcke lyght euen lyght haue felowshyp wt 〈◊〉 〈◊〉 • apoca • b bloude iesus christe hys sonne clenseth v synnes 3 reg 〈◊〉 3 par vi g say haue sinne de ceyue ourselues trueth v iob xiii • psal 〈◊〉 and▪ 〈◊〉 • luke xv • knowledge synnes faythful iust forgiue v sinnes clense v vnryghtuousnes haue synned make hym lyer word v ¶ chryst aduocate true loue howe tryed capi ii ✚ lyttel child thinges write vnto ye sinne yf mā sine haue aduocate wt father iesꝰ christ rightuous op tayneth grace synnes sin ne onely also sine al ye world ✚ hereby sure yt know hī yfihon 13 • kepe cōmaūdementes sayth know kepeth cōmaundemē te lyer verite whoso kepeth worde hi loue god perfect dede hereby know y• sayth bydeth hym ought walke euen walcked ⊢ brother wryte newe commaundement vnto olde commaundemēt ye haue frō begynuynge olde commaundement worde ye haue hearde begynnyng agayne new commaundemēt wryte vn true true also derkenes past true lyght shyueth ⊢ sayeth lyght yet hateth hys brother darcknes euen vntyl time loueth hys brother abydeth lyght none occasyon euyll hym • en •• xix • hateth brother darkenes walketh darcknes cānot tel whither goeth yt darckenes hath blynded hys eye babe wryte vnto yt synnes forgyuē name sake wryte vnto father howe ye haue knowen beginning wryte vnto yonge men howe ye haue ouercome yt wycked wryte vnto lytel chyldren yt ye haue knowen father haue wryttē vnto father howe ye haue knowen hym begynnyng haue wryttē vnto yonge men howe ye strong worde god abideth ye haue ouercome wycked se ye loue notiob xvii • worlde neyther thynges worlde man loue world loue father hym worlde lust fleshe lust eye pryde lyfe father worlde worlde passeth waye lust therof fulfylleth wyll god abideth euer lytel chyldren last tyme ye haue heard antichrist shall come euen many begoune autichristes redy wherby knowe yt last tyme actes 〈◊〉 went frō v v yt bene v wolde dout haue cōtynued wt v myght appeare v neuertheles ye haue oyntmēt hī y• holy ye know thynges ✚ haue writtē vnto though ye knew truth though ye knew know also y• lye cōmeth truth lier denieth iesus christe antechriste denyeth father sonne whosoeuer denieth sōne hath father ⚜ knowlegeth sonne hath father also let therfore abyde whyche ye hearde begynnyng whych ye heard begynnyng shal remayne ye also shal contynue sonne father promes hath promysed v euen eternall lyfe ⊢ thinges haue wrytten vnto concernyng disceiue anoyntyng whych ye haue receyued hym dwelleth ye nede man teache butesay 54 • ho • v c anointyng teacheth al thinges true lye hath taught euen byde therin babe abyde shal appere may bolde made ashamed hym commynge ye knowe ryghtuous know also yt euery one whych doth ryghtuousnes borne hym ¶ synguler loue god towards v howe agayne ought loue one another capi iii behold loue father hath shewed v shuld called luke xx • iohn • • dede sōnes god cause ye world knoweth bycause knoweth hī derely beloued sōnes god yet doth appere shalbe know shall appere shalbe lyke shal se hi euery mā hath thys hope pourgeth euen also pure whosoeuer commytteth synne commytteth vnryghtuousnes also synne vurightuousnes ye knowe appered take awaye synnes synne many byde hym synne whosoeuer synneth hath sene hym neyther knowen hym babe let man deceyue ryghtuousnes ryghtuous euen ryghtuous committeth sinnegene iii • iohn v ••• • deuyll deuyll synneth sence begynnyng purpose appeared sonne god lowse workes deuyll whosoeuer borne god synneth sede remayneth hym sine borne god chyldren god knowen chyldren deuyl whosoeuer doth righteousnes god nether loueth brother thys tydynges ye hearde begynnyng ye shuld loue one another asgene iiii b cayn whych wi ked slew brother wherfore ile owne workꝭ euyl brother good ✚ maruayle brethrē though ye world hate know translated death vnto life loue brethrē leuit xi • loueth brother abydeth death whosoeuer hateth brother man 〈◊〉 ye knowe man •• • hath eternal lyfe abydyng hereby perceyue loue bicause gaue lyfe v ought gyue liues brother whoso hath thys worldes good deute 15 b seyth hys brother haue nede shutteth vp compassyon howe dwelleth loue god babe let v loue worde neither tong dede verite ⊢ hereby know verite quyet hertes yf hert condēpne vs▪ god greater hert knoweth thinges derely beloued yf herte condempne v haue trust god warde math 7 〈◊〉 c ihon xv b xv • iaco soeuer aske receyue bycause kepe cōmaundementes thinges pleasyng syght • ihon • c iohn xii▪ • commaundement beleue name hys sonne iesus christ loue one another gaue cōmaū dement kepeth cōmaundementes dwelleth hereby know abideth v euē spirit hath geuen v ¶ difference spirites howe spirite god may knowen spirit errour loue god neyghboures capi iiii dearely beloued ‡ belue euery spycyt proue spirrites whether god mat vii • deute 〈◊〉 • mat 24 • • 〈◊〉 〈◊〉 • luke 21 • many false prophetes gone worlde hereby shall ye knowe spirite god euery spirite confesseth iesus chryst come flesshe god euery spirit coufesseth iesus chryste come fleshe god spirit antichrist whō ye haue herd shulde come euen al redy worlde lyttel chyldren ye god haue ouercome greater worlde worlde therfore speake worlde worlde heareth god knoweth god heareth v y• god hereth v hereby knowe spirite verite spiryte errour derely beloued begottē sonne world might liue thorow herein loue y• loued god loued v sente sonne make agrement sinnes derely beloued yf god loued v ought also loue one another exodi 33 iudit v • xiii deute 4 iohn c vi • man hath sene god tyme loue one another god dwelleth v loue perfect v hereby knowe y• dwell v hath giuē v spiryte haue sene testyfie father sente sonne sauiour world whosoeuer confesseth iesus sōne god hī dwelleth god god haue knowē beleued loue god hath v god loue dwelleth loue dwelleth god god hym herein loue ꝑfect v shuld haue trust day iudgement euen world feare loue perfecte loue casteth feare feare hath paynfulnes y• feareth perfecte loue loue hym loued v fyrste man saye loue god yet hate brother lyer howe loueth hys brother hath sene loue god hath sene thys commaundement haue whyche loueth god shulde loue brother also ⊢ ¶ loue god kepe commoundementes fayth ouercommeth worlde euerlastyng life • sonne god sonne vnto death capi v whosoeuer beleueth iesus christ borne god euery one loueth whych begat loueth hym also whyche begotten ihon 14 • know loue chyldren god loue god kepe commaundementes loue god kepe cōmaundementes math ii cōmaundemētes greuous ✚ al borne god ouercōmeth worlde • cor xv • vyctory ouercōmeth world euē fayth ouercōmeth world whiche beleueth iesus sonne god iesus christ came water bloude water onely water bloud spirite beareth wytnes spirite trueth ⚜ thre whiche beare recorde heauen father worde holy ghost thre one thre whiche beare recorde ⚜ earth spirit water bloude thre one receyue wytnes mē wytnes god greater thꝭ witnes god ⚜ greater whiche testyfieth sonne beleueth sonne god hath wytnes hym selfe ⊢ beleueth god hath made lyar beleued recorde god gaue sōne record god hath gyuen vnto v eternal lyfe life sōne hath sōne hath lyfe hath sonne god hath lyfe thynges haue wryttē vnto beleue name sonne god ye maye knowe howe ye haue eternal life ye may beleue name sōne god thys trust haue math 7 xxi c math xi luke 〈◊〉 b ihon 14 b xv b xvi f iacobi • ihon 3 yf aske thyng accordyng wyl heareth v yf knowe heare v soeuer aske know haue petycyons desyre hym mā se brother sine synne vnto death let aske shal gyue hym lyfe thē synne vnto death ther synne vnto death say y• mā shuld pray al vnryghtuousnes sine synne vnto death knowe whosoeuer borne god synneth begotten god kepeth hym selfe wicked toucheth hym knowe god worlde al togyther set wyckednes knowe sonne god come hath geuen v minde know hym whiche true hym true throughe hys sonne iesus chryste god eternall lyfe babe kepe youre selues ymages amen wryteth vnto certayne lady reioyseth chyldren walcke trueth exhorteth vnto lowe warneth thē beware dysceauers denye iosus chryste came flessh prayeth contynue doctrine christ haue nothing brynge thye lernynge ❧ seconde epystle sayncte ihon elder electe lady chyldren whome loue trueth onely also y• hath knowē trueth truthes sake dwelleth v shall v euer v shall grace mercye peace god father lorde iesus christ sonne father trueth loue reioysed greatly founde thy chyldren walkynge trueth haue receaued commaundement father nowe beseche lady though wrote newe cōmaundement vnto whiche haue begynnynge shulde ihon 14 c • ihon v loue one another thys loue shulde walke hys commaundement commaundement ye haue hearde beginning ye shuld walke many deceauers entred worlde whiche confesse iesus christ come flessh deceauer antichrist loke selues loose haue wrought may haue ful rewarde whosoeuer transgresseth bydeth doctryne chryste hath god endureth doctryne chryste hathe father sonne come vnto bryng learnyng hym receaue house neyther byd hym god spede byddeth hym god spede partaker hꝭ euyldedes ⚜ beholde haue tolde ye shulde ashamed day lorde many thynges wryte vnto neuerthelesse wolde wryte paper inke trust come vnto speake mouth mouth oure ioye may ful sonnes thy electe sister grete amen ¶ glad gayus well • eth trueth exhorteth souyng vnto poore chrysten theyr perseruryon sheweth vnkynde dealinge • otrophes adn good reporte demetrius ❧ thyrde epystle saynct ihon elder vnto beloued gayus whome loue trueth beloued wyssh thinges thou prosperedste faredst wel euen thy soule prospereth reioysed greatly brother came testified trueth howe thou walckeste trueth haue greater ioye heare howe sonnes walcke veritye beloued thou doest faythfully soeuer thou doeste brother straungers beare wytnes thy loue congregacion brother yf thou brynge wardes theyr iorney godly sorte thou shalt well hys name sake wente forthe toke nothyng gentyls therfore ought receaue suche myght helper trueth wrote vnto congregacion diotrephes whiche loueth haue preempnence amonge receaueth v wherfore yf come wyll declare dedes dothe iestyuge v malycyous wordes neyther ther content onely hym selfe receaueth brother also forbyddeth wolde thrusteth oute congregacyon beloued folowe euyll good doeth well god doeth euyll seyth god demetrius hathe good reporte men trueth selfe yee selues also beare recorde yeknowe oure recorde true many thynges wryte wyl inke penne wryte vnto trust shal shortly se shal speake mouthe mouthe peace vnto louers salute grete louers name ¶ rebuketh beyng blynded theyr owne • ust •• ▪ resyst trueth may knowe • better sayeth suche synne beastly agaynste nature despise ruler c exhorteth v edyfy one another praye holy gooste contynue loue loke commynge lorde one helpe another fyre ❧ epystle saynte iude iudas seruaunt iesus christ brother iames called sanctified god father preserued iesu chryste mercy vnto peace loue multyplyed beloued gaue dylygence wryte vnto commen saluacyon nedefull wryte vnto exhorte ye shulde contynually laboure faythe whiche geuen vnto sayntes certayne vngodly men craftely crept written afore tyme vnto suche iudgement turne grace god vnto wantannes denye god whiche onely lorde lorde iesus christ mynde therfore put remembraunce much ye knowe howe lorde delyuered people egypt destroied whyche afterwarde beleued angel also kept first estate lefte theyr owne habytacyon hath reserued euerlastynge chaynes vnder darkenes vnto iudgement great day gene xix • euen sodom gomor cytyes aboute whiche lyke maner defyled selues fornicacyon folowed ☞ straunge flesshe set forthe ensample suffre payne eternall fyre lykewyse beynge disceaued dreames defyle flesshe despise ruler speake euyll auctoryte yet michaell archangell stroue agaynste deuyll dysputed body moses durst geue ray lynge sentence sayde lorde rebuke speake euyll thynges whiche knowe thynges know naturally beastes without reason tho thinges corrupte themselues wo vnto haue folowed waye gene iiii b nu xvi c cayn vtterly geuen errouce balan lukers sake ‡ perisshe treason core spottes kindnes feast together withoute feare fedinge themselues cloudes without water caryed wides tree without frute gatherynge tyme twyse deed plucked vp rote ragynge waues see fomynge theyr owne shame wandrynge starres whome reserued myste darckenes euer enoch seuenth adam prophesyed sayinge apoca i▪ b esay iii c beholde lorde shall come thousandes saynctes geue iudgement al men rebuke al vngodly among theyr vngodly dedes haue vngodly commytted theyr cruell speakynges whiche vngodly synners haue spoken agaynst hym murmurer complayners walkynge theyr owne lustes whose mouthes speake proude thynges haue men greate reuerence auauntage ye beloued remember wordes whyche spoken apostels oure lorde iesus christ howe tolde actes xx • 1 tim 4 8 2 tim 3 • 2 petr 〈◊〉 • iii • shulde begylers last tyme whyche shulde walcke theyr owne vngodly lustes maker sectes fleshlye hauynge spyryte ye de • lye beloued edyfye youre selues youre mo • e holy faythe prayinge holy goost kepe youre selues loue god lokynge mercy oure lorde iesus chryste vnto eternall lyfe haue compassion separatynge saue wyth feare pullynge fyre ⚜ haue compassyon hate fylthy vesture flesshe unto able kepe fre sinne present fautlesse presence glorye ioye ⚜ commynge lorde iesu christ god sauyoure thorowe iesus chryst lorde onely wyse glorye maieste domynion power ⚜ al worldes nowe euer amen ❧ reuelacyon saynte ihon dyuyne ¶ happy heare worde god kepe wryteth seuen congregacyons asi • hys seruaūt ihon vare recorde worde god testymonye iesus chryst thynges sawe happye readeth heare wordes prophesye kepe thynges wrytten therin tyme hande iohn seuen congregacions asia grace vnto peace frō whiche come seuen spirites trone iesu christ faythfull wytnes fyrst begotten deed lorde ouer kinges earth unto hebre xi • petr 〈◊〉 • ihon • b loued v wesshed v oure synnes owne bloude ⊢ made v kynges prestes vnto god hys father glory dominion euermore amen math 24 c 〈◊〉 x • v c • n 〈◊〉 beholde cōmeth cloudes al eye shall se also pearsed hym kynredes earth shal wayle ⚜ ouer hym euen amen alpha omega begynnynge endynge sayeth lorde almyghty whyche come iohn youre brother companion tribulacyon kyngdome paciēce iesu chryst yle called pathmos worde god wytnessing iesu christ spirite sonday herde behynde great voyce bene trompe sayinge alpha omega fyrste laste thou seyst wryte boke sende vnto seuen cōgregacions asia vnto ephesus vnto smi • na vnto pergamos vnto thiatira vnto sardis vnto philadelphia vnto laodieia turned backe se voyce spake turned sawe seuen golden cādelstickes myddes seuen candelstirkes one lyke vnto sonne man clathed lynnen garment downe fete gyrde pappes golde gyrdle heed heares whyte white woll snowe hys eye flame fyre hys fete lyke vnto brasse thoughe brent fornace voyce sounde many water hys ryghte hande v •• starres hys mouthe wente sharpe two edged swearde •• vii face shone euen sonne hys strength sawe fel fole euen deed layde hys ryghte hande vpon saying vnto feare esa 44 b fyrst last lyue deed beholde rom vi b alyue euermore haue keyes hell deeth wryte therfore thynges whyche thou hast leue thynges whiche thinges must fulfylled hereafter mystery vi • starres whiche thou sawest right hande vi • golden candelstyckes vi • starres congregacyon ephesus wryte thynges sayeth holdeth seuen starres hys ryght hande walcketh myddes seuen golden candelstickes know thy worckes thy labour thy pacyence howe thou cannest forbeare whiche euyll haste examyned whyche saye apostle hast foūde lyars hast suffred hast pacyence name sake haste labored haste faynted neuertheles haue sumwhat thou hast lefte thy fyrste loue remember therfore whence thou arte fallen repent fyrst worckes elles wyll come vnto shortly wyll remoue thy cādelsticke place except thou repent thou hast thou hatest dedes actes • ▪ 〈◊〉 ▪ nicolaitans dedes also hate let hym hath eares heare spirite sayth vnto congregacions hym ouercō meth •••• • • wyll gyue eate tree lyfe whyche myddes paradyse god vnto angel congregacyon smyrna wryte thynges sayth fyrst laste whyche deed lyue knowe thy workes tribulacyon pouerte thou art ryche knowe the▪ blasphemy whyche call selues iewes congregacyon sathan feare none thynges thou shalt suffre beholde deuyl shal cast preson tempte ye shall haue trybulacyon ten dayes faythfull vnto deeth wyll geue crowne lyfe let hym hathe eares heare spyryte sayth congregacyons ouercommeth shall hurte seconde deeth messenger congregacion pergamos wryte thys sayth whiche hath sharpe swearde wyth two edge knowe thy worckes thou dwellest euen sathans seat thou kepest name hast denyed faythe dayes antipas faythfull wytnes myne slayne amonge sathan dwelleth haue fewe thynges agaynste thou hast maintaine doctrine balam •• 〈◊〉 ▪ c whiche taught balake put occasyon synne chyldren israell shulde eate meate dedicate vnto ydoles commyt fornicacyon euen hast thou maintayne doctryne nycolaytans thyng hate cōuerted el wyll come vnto shortly wyll fyght agaynste swearde mouth let hym hath eares heare spirite saith vnto cōgregacyons hym ouercōmeth wyll geue eate manna hyd wyll geue hym whyte stone stone newe name wrytten man knoweth sauynge receaueth vnto messenger congregacion thiatira write sayth sone god hath eye lyke vnto flamme fyre hys fete lyke brasse knowe thy worckes thy loue seruyce fayth thy pacyēce thy dedes mo last fyrst notwithstandynge haue fewe thynges agaynst thou sufferest woman3 16 • 4 reg x iesabel called selfe prophetise teach deceaue seruaūtes make commyt fornicacyon eate meates offered vp vnto ydols gaue space repente fornycacyon repented beholde wyll cast bed commyt fornycacyon great aduersyte excepte turne theyr deades wyl kyl chyldren deeth congregacyōs shal knowe iere 27 • searcheth reynes hertes wyll geue vnto euery one acordynge vnto hys worckes unto saye vnto thiatira many haue lernynge whyche haue knowen de • ne sathan saye wyl put vpon none burthen whiche ye haue already holde fast tyll come whosoeuer ouercommeth kepeth worckes vnto ende hym wyll geue power ouer nacions psal 〈◊〉 b shal rule rodde yron vessel potter shall broken sheuers euen receaued father wyll gyue hym mornynge starre let hym hath eares heare spirite sayth congregacyons ¶ instrueteth thou lyuest thou art deed awake strength thynges remayne redy dye haue foude thy workes perfaycte ⚜ god remember therfore howe thou hast receaued hearde holde faste repent 1 v • 2 pet iii • thou shall watche wyll come 〈◊〉 thou shalte knowe houre wyll come vpon thou hast fewe name sardys haue defyled theyr garmentes shall walcke whyte worthy ouercō meth shalbe thus clothed whyte araye wyl put name boke lyfe wyll confesse hys name father hys angel let hym hath eares heare spirite saith vnto congregacyons wryte vnto angell congregacyon phyladelphia sayth holy true hath keye dauid esa xx • • iob x •• • whyche openeth man shutteth shutteth man openeth know thy worckes beholde haue set open dore man shut thou hast lytell strength hast kept sayinges hast denyed name beholde make cōgregacyon sathan whiche call selues iewes lye eeholde wyll make shall come worshyppe thy fete shall knowe haue loued thou hast kept wordes pacience therfore wyll kepe houre temptacyon wyll come vpō worlde tempte dwell vpon earth beholde come shortely holde whiche thou haste man take awaye thy crowne hym ouercommeth wyll make pyller temple god shall go nomore wyll wryte vpon name god name cytye god newe ierusalem whiche commeth downe heauen frō god wyl wryte vpon hym newe name let hym hathe heares heare spirite sayeth vnto congregacyons vnto messenger congragacyon whiche laodicia wryte sayth amen faythful true wytues begynnynge creature god knowe thy workes thou acte neyther colde hotte wolde thou colde hotte thou art betwene nether colde hote wyl spewe mouth thou sayest ryche increasyd goodes haue nede nothynge knowest howe yu art wreched miserable poore blynde nakyd councel bye golde tryed tyre y• mayest ryche whyte rayment thou mayst •• cori • clothed thy filthy nakednes appere anoynte thyne eye wt eye salue thou mayest se proue ii b 〈◊〉 xi • • many loue rebuke chastē feruent therfore repente beholde stande dore knocke mā heare voyce open dore wyll come hym wyll suppe hym hym ouercōmeth wyll graunte syt seate euen ouercam haue sytten father seate lette hym hathe eares heare spirit sayth vnto • angregacyons ¶ seeth heauen open sente one syttynge vpon it▪ but▪ xx • ii • seates with▪ xxi •• •• ders syt ••• g vpon thē foure beastes praysing god daye nyght capi iiii a✚fter loked beholde dore open heauen fyrst voyce whiche hearde trompet talkynge wt whiche sayde come vp hyther wyll shewe thinges whiche muste fulfylled immediatly spirit behold seate set heauen one sate seate sat loke vpon lyke vnto iasper stone sardine stone rayne bowe seate syght lyke emeralde aboute seate xxiiij seates vpō seates xxiiij elder syttyng clothed whyte rayment theyr heades crownes golde seate proceded lyghtnynges thondringes voyces ther seuen lampes fyre burnynge seate seuē spirites god ye seate ther see glasse lyke vnto cristall myddes seate roūde seate foure beastes ful eye behynde fyrst beast lyke lyon seconde beast lyke calfe thyrde beast face man fourth beast lyke flyinge egle foure beastes eche one thē v • wynges hym full eye within rest daye nether nyght sayinge esa •• vi • holy holy holy lorde god almyghtye whiche come beastes gaue glory honour thankes y• sat seate lyueth euer euer xx •••• elder fell downe hī yt sat trone worshypped hym lyueth euer euer ⊢ cast theyr crownes ye trone sayinge thou arte worthy lorde ⚜ god receaue glory honoure power y• haste created thynges thy wylles sake created ¶ seeth lambe openynge boke therfore foure beastes xx • •• elder angel praise lambe hym worshyppe capi v sawe ryght hāde hym ye sat trone boke wrytten backsyde sealed wt seuen seales sawe stronge angell whiche preached wt lowde voyce worthy open boke lose seales therof man heauen earth neyther vnder earth able open boke neyther loke theron wepte much man founde worthy opē reade boke nether loke theron one elder sayde vnto wepe beholde lyon trybe iuda rote dauid hathe obtayned open boke lose seuen seales therof behelde lo myddes seate foure beastes myddes elder stode lābe though bene kylled hauynge seuen horne seuen eye seuē spirites god sent worlde came toke boke ryght hande hym sate vpon seate whē takē boke foure beastes xxiiij elder fell downe lābe hauing euery one thē harpes golden vialles full odour whiche prayer saynctes songe newe songe saying yu art worthy take boke open seales therof thou waste kylled hast redemed v thy bloude al kynredes tōges people nacions hast made v vnto god kynges prestes shall raygne earth behelde herde voyce many angel trone oboute beastes elder hearde thousand thousandes saying wt lowde voyce worthy lambe kylled receaue power ryches wysdome strength honour glory blessynge creature whiche heauen earth vnder earth see yt herde sayinge blessyng honour glory power vn hym sytteth vpon seate vnto lambe euermore foure bestes sayde amē xxiiij elder fell vpō theyr face worshypped hym lyueth euermore ¶ lambe openeth vi seal many thynges folowe openyng • therof capi vi sawe lambe opened one seales herde one foure bestes saye noyse thonder come se sawe behelde whyte horsse sat bowe crowne geuen vnto hym went forth cōquerynge ouercome opened seconde scale herde secōde beste saye come se wēt another horsse red power geuē sat theron take peace frō earth shuld kyll one another esay 27 • ther geuen vnto greate swearde opened thyrde seale herde thyrde •••• e saye come se behelde lo blacke hors y• sate payre balance hāde harde voyce y• middes y• foure bestes saye measure peny thre measure barly peny oyle wyne se yu hurt opened y• fourth seale herde voyce fourth beste saye come se loked behold pale horsse name sate hym deeth hell folowed hym power geuen vnto thē ouer fourth part earth kyll wt swearde honger deeth commeth vermen earth whē opened fyft seale sawe vnder aultre iob xxii • soules thē kylled worde god testimony whiche cryed lowde voyce sayinge howe longe • aryest yu lorde holy true iudge auenge bloud thē dwell y• earth lōge whyte garmētes geuē vnto euery one sayde vnto thē shulde rest yet lytle season vntyll nombre theyr felowes brother shulde kylled fulfylled behelde opened syxte seale lo greate earth quake sunne blacke sacke clouth made heere mone waxed al euen bloud starres heauen fel vnto erth euē fygge tree casteth fygges shaken myghtye wynde heauen vanyshed awaye scroll rolled together mountaynes yles moued theyr place kynges earth great men rych men chefe captaynes myghtye men euery bondman euerye free man hyd selues dennes rockes hylles dsec • • luk xxiii sayde hylles rockes fall v hyde v presence sytteth seate frō wrath lambe great daye wrath come able endure ¶ seeth seruaūtes god sealed theyr forheades nacyo •• people whiche though suffre trouble yet lambe feo ••• • e • eth fountaynes lyuynge water god shall wype awaye
